examples.ch: 你认为电影是一种娱乐还是一种表演艺术？
examples.en: Do you regard film as entertainment or as an art?

examples.ch: 她正在修一门表演艺术课。
examples.en: She is doing a course in the performing arts.

defines.trans_en: a skill or special ability

examples.ch: 会话技巧
examples.en: the art of conversation

examples.ch: 想让他出门交际可得好好动动脑筋。
examples.en: Getting him to go out is quite an art (= needs special skill).

phrases.trans_ch: （绘画、表演、舞蹈、音乐等的总称）艺术
phrases.trans_en: the making or showing or performance of painting, acting, dancing, and music

examples.ch: 政府需要拨更多的资金来扶持艺术。
examples.en: More government money is needed for the arts.

examples.ch: 公众对艺术的兴趣
examples.en: public interest in the arts

phrases.trans_en: subjects, such as history, languages, and literature, that are not scientific subjects

examples.ch: 上学时，我很擅长文科，但是理科却无可救药。
examples.en: At school I was quite good at arts, but hopeless at science.

examples.ch: 儿童应该接受文理兼顾的均衡完善的教育。
examples.en: Children should be given a well-balanced education in both the arts and the sciences.

examples.ch: 文科毕业生／学位
examples.en: arts graduates/degrees

defines.trans_ch: （在旧式英语中）be的现在时态单数第二人称
defines.trans_en: in the past, the second person singular of the present tense of "be"

examples.ch: 你是（相当于you are）
examples.en: thou art (= you are)

defines.trans_ch: （报纸或杂志上的）文章，报道;论文
defines.trans_en: a piece of writing on a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine, or on the internet

examples.ch: 昨天报纸上登了一篇关于素食主义的有趣文章。
examples.en: There was an interesting article on vegetarianism in the paper yesterday.

defines.trans_en: any of the English words "a", "an", and "the", or words in other languages that do the same job as these

defines.trans_ch: （尤指同一类的或在一起的数个中的一件）物品，物件;物品的一件
defines.trans_en: a particular thing, especially one that is one of several things of a similar type or in the same place

examples.ch: 建议房客不要将任何贵重物品放在旅馆房间里。
examples.en: Guests are advised not to leave any articles of value in their hotel rooms.

examples.ch: 有人在河边发现了一件衣服。
examples.en: An article of clothing was found near the river.

examples.ch: 几件家具
examples.en: articles of furniture

defines.trans_en: a separate part in a written document such as a legal agreement

examples.ch: 东德和西德按照波恩宪法第23条实现了统一。
examples.en: East and West Germany united under article 23 of the Bonn constitution.

phrases.trans_ch: 在律师事务所当见习生，当见习律师
phrases.trans_en: to be working in a law office while training to be a lawyer

defines.trans_ch: 艺术家;美术家;画家;雕塑家
defines.trans_en: someone who paints, draws, or makes sculptures

examples.ch: 莫奈是我最喜欢的画家之一。
examples.en: Monet is one of my favourite artists.

defines.trans_ch: 高手;大师;技艺高超的人
defines.trans_en: someone who creates things with great skill and imagination

examples.ch: 他称她为20世纪最伟大的电影艺术家之一。
examples.en: He described her as one of the greatest film artists of the 20th century.

defines.trans_en: used in comparisons to refer to the degree of something

examples.ch: 她很快就会和她母亲一样高了。
examples.en: She'll soon be as tall as her mother.

examples.ch: 我跑得没你快。
examples.en: I can't run as fast as you.

examples.ch: 像婴儿一样娇嫩的肌肤
examples.en: skin as soft as a baby's

examples.ch: 这个不如以前好了。
examples.en: It's not as good as it used to be.

defines.trans_en: used to describe the purpose or quality of someone or something

examples.ch: 她是名服务员。
examples.en: She works as a waitress.

examples.ch: 这可以用作对他不利的证据。
examples.en: It could be used as evidence against him.

examples.ch: 这个消息让我们都很震惊。
examples.en: The news came as quite a shock to us.

examples.ch: 这话我只是当玩笑讲的。
examples.en: I meant it as a joke.

defines.trans_en: because

examples.ch: 因为天色已晚，我决定找家旅馆投宿。
examples.en: As it was getting late, I decided to book into a hotel.

examples.ch: 你可以第一个去，因为你年纪最大。
examples.en: You can go first as you're the oldest.

defines.trans_en: during the time that

examples.ch: 我进楼时看到了他。
examples.en: I saw him as I was coming into the building.

examples.ch: 随着年龄的增长，他变得愈发有魅力。
examples.en: He gets more attractive as he gets older.

defines.trans_en: in the same way

examples.ch: 他离婚了，（完全）重蹈了多年前他父母婚姻破裂的覆辙。
examples.en: He got divorced, (just) as his parents had done years before.

examples.ch: 像往年一样，今年的票卖得很快。
examples.en: This year, as in previous years, tickets sold very quickly.

examples.ch: 一如他以前的电影，他最新影片中的特效也非常精彩。
examples.en: As with his earlier movies, the special effects in his latest film are brilliant.

examples.ch: 就像经常发生在儿童身上的情况一样，医生赶到时，埃米的病情彻底好转了。
examples.en: As is often the case with children, Amy was completely better by the time the doctor arrived.

examples.ch: 正如我刚才所说的，我认为这个提议需要进一步考虑。
examples.en: As I was just saying, I think the proposal needs further consideration.

examples.ch: 以我对他的了解，我无法相信他会做这样的事。
examples.en: Knowing him as I do, I can't believe he would do such a thing.

defines.trans_en: although

examples.ch: 尽管他很生气，可还是忍不住笑了。
examples.en: Angry as he was, he couldn't help smiling.

defines.trans_en: to put a question to someone, or to request an answer from someone

examples.ch: 她问了我一个问题。
examples.en: She asked me a question.

examples.ch: 她问了一个有关威尔士历史的问题。
examples.en: She asked a question about Welsh history.

examples.ch: 她问我有关威尔士历史的问题。
examples.en: She asked me about Welsh history.

examples.ch: 她问了有关威尔士历史的问题。
examples.en: She asked about Welsh history.

examples.ch: 我不知道火车什么时候开，问问列车长是否知道。
examples.en: I've no idea what time the train leaves. Ask the guard whether he knows.

examples.ch: 我问了问列车长火车的离站时间。
examples.en: I asked the guard the time of the train's departure.

examples.ch: 我问了问火车什么时候开。
examples.en: I asked when the train would leave.

examples.ch: “火车什么时候开？”我问道。
examples.en: "What time does the train leave?" I asked.

defines.trans_en: to speak or write to someone saying that you want them to do something, to give you something, or to allow you to do something

examples.ch: 如果有需要帮忙的地方，请尽管说。
examples.en: If you need any help, please don't hesitate to ask.

examples.ch: 她问（经理）自己是否可以提早离开去接孩子。
examples.en: She asked (her manager) if/whether she could leave early to pick up the kids.

examples.ch: 我要求见我的会计师。
examples.en: I asked to see my accountant.

examples.ch: 你应该（向你的会计师）征求财务方面的建议。
examples.en: You should ask (your accountant) for some financial advice.

examples.ch: 你应该让你的会计师给你一些财务方面的建议。
examples.en: You should ask your accountant to give you some financial advice.

examples.ch: 你可以帮我个忙吗？
examples.en: Can I ask you a favour?/formal Can I ask a favour of you?

examples.ch: 我遇到一个财务方面的问题，想听听你的建议／意见。
examples.en: I'd like to ask your advice/opinion on a financial matter.

examples.ch: 你必须征得许可方能离开。
examples.en: You have to ask permission to leave.

examples.ch: 我们要求凡有质量问题的货物都装回原包装内退回。
examples.en: We ask that any faulty goods be returned in their original packaging.

examples.ch: 律师要求允许她的当事人打个电话。
examples.en: The solicitor asked that her client be allowed to make a phone call.

defines.trans_en: to request or invite someone to go somewhere with you or to come to your home

examples.ch: 我已经邀请了戴维参加聚会。
examples.en: I've asked David to the party.

examples.ch: 我已经邀请了戴维来参加聚会。
examples.en: I've asked David to come to the party.

examples.ch: “你去参加缪里尔的聚会吗？”“不，我没有接到邀请。”
examples.en: "Are you going to Muriel's party?" "No, I haven't been asked."

examples.ch: 豪尔赫邀请我们下星期五共进晚餐。
examples.en: Jorge has asked us over for dinner next Friday.

examples.ch: 伊恩请我们下周五去吃晚饭。
examples.en: Ian's asked us round to/for dinner next Friday.

examples.ch: 实际上他们请我们过去呆上整个周末。
examples.en: In fact they've asked us to stay for the whole weekend.

defines.trans_en: to expect or demand something

examples.ch: 格雷格的房子要价25万英镑。
examples.en: Greg's asking (= expecting to be paid) £250,000 for his house.

examples.ch: 他对我的要求太过分了——我不能总在那里帮他吧。
examples.en: He asks too much of me - I can't always be there to help him.

examples.ch: 如果你的老板想让你晚上加班，周末也工作，那就太过分了。
examples.en: It's asking a lot when your boss wants you to work weekends as well as evenings.

phrases.trans_en: to consider something carefully

examples.ch: 她应当好好想想为什么好像没有人喜欢她。
examples.en: She needs to ask herself why nobody seems to like her.

defines.trans_en: someone who helps someone else to do a job

examples.ch: 行政／办公室助理
examples.en: an administrative/office assistant

examples.ch: 助理编辑／经理
examples.en: an assistant editor/manager

defines.trans_en: someone who works in a shop, selling goods to customers and giving advice about the goods sold in the shop

examples.ch: 售货员／店员
examples.en: a sales/shop assistant

defines.trans_ch: （表示地点或位置）在…里;在…上;在…旁
defines.trans_en: used to show an exact position or particular place

examples.ch: 我们会在入口处跟你碰头。
examples.en: We'll meet you at the entrance.

examples.ch: 电影开头的那一段精彩极了。
examples.en: That bit at the beginning of the film was brilliant.

examples.ch: 她坐在角落的一张桌子旁。
examples.en: She's sitting at the table in the corner.

examples.ch: 她在楼梯顶端站着。
examples.en: She was standing at the top of the stairs.

examples.ch: 这只狗过来趴在我的脚边。
examples.en: The dog came and lay down at (= next to) my feet.

examples.ch: 有人敲门。
examples.en: There's someone at the door (= someone is outside and wants to come in).

examples.ch: 我们下午去看了场足球比赛。
examples.en: We spent the afternoon at a football match.

examples.ch: 我在大学度过了3年美好的时光。
examples.en: I enjoyed my three years at university.

examples.ch: 我打电话给她，但是她出去吃午饭了。
examples.en: I called her but she was at lunch (= away, eating her lunch).

defines.trans_ch: （表示确切或某一时间）在…时刻;在…期间;在…岁时
defines.trans_en: used to show an exact or a particular time

examples.ch: 今天下午两点半有个会。
examples.en: There's a meeting at 2.30 this afternoon.

examples.ch: 吃午饭的时候你有空吗？
examples.en: Are you free at lunchtime?

examples.ch: 理论上说，妇女到了50岁仍可以生育。
examples.en: In theory, women can still have children at the age of 50.

examples.ch: 在一天中，这些钟每隔一段时间就会准时鸣响。
examples.en: The bells ring at regular intervals through the day.

examples.ch: 这家公司从未做过任何违法的事情。
examples.en: At no time/point did the company do anything illegal.

examples.ch: 我现在很忙，你过一会儿再打回来行吗？
examples.en: I'm busy at the moment (= now) - can you call back later?

examples.ch: 真可惜那次我不在，没有见到你——那时我在国外呢。
examples.en: It's a shame I wasn't here to meet you - I was overseas at the time (= then).

defines.trans_en: in the direction of

examples.ch: 她对我微笑了一下。
examples.en: She smiled at me.

examples.ch: 我们驱车经过时，他们朝我们挥手。
examples.en: They waved at us as we drove by.

examples.ch: 她瞄准目标。
examples.en: She aimed at the target.

examples.ch: “看看我！看看我！”那个小女孩叫道。
examples.en: "Look at me! Look at me!" called the little girl.

examples.ch: 他老是冲着孩子们大喊大叫。
examples.en: He's always shouting at the children.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指感觉是）由于，因为，作为对…的反应
defines.trans_en: used to show the cause of something, especially a feeling

examples.ch: 我们听到这个消息很吃惊。
examples.en: We were surprised at the news.

examples.ch: 想到这种前景，我激动不已。
examples.en: I was quite excited at the prospect.

examples.ch: 为什么我讲了笑话，从来就没人笑呢？
examples.en: Why does no one ever laugh at my jokes?

defines.trans_en: used to show the activity in which someone's ability is being judged

examples.ch: 我从来都不太擅长体育运动。
examples.en: I was never very good at sports.

examples.ch: 他很善于跟人打交道。
examples.en: He's very good at getting on with people.

examples.ch: 她办什么事情都没有条理，简直不可救药。
examples.en: She's hopeless at organizing things.

defines.trans_en: the @ symbol that joins the name of a person or a department in an organization to a domain name to make an email address

examples.ch: “你的电邮地址是什么？”“是 dictionary@cambridge.org。”
examples.en: "What's your email address?" "It's dictionary at cambridge dot org."

defines.trans_ch: （表示价格、温度、比率、速度等）以，达
defines.trans_en: used to show a price, temperature, rate, speed, etc.

examples.ch: 那么一双鞋要150美元，我才不会买！
examples.en: I'm not going to buy those shoes at $150!

examples.ch: 通货膨胀率达到5%。
examples.en: Inflation is running at 5 percent.

examples.ch: 当警察发现他时，他正以120英里的时速行驶。
examples.en: He was driving at 120 mph when the police spotted him.

defines.trans_ch: （用于财务记录中表示某一项目的价格、比率等的）符号@
defines.trans_en: used in financial records to show the price, rate, etc. of a particular thing or of each of a number of things on a list

examples.ch: 50件，每件4.75英镑

defines.trans_ch: （表示状态、状况或连续的活动）处于;从事于;忙于
defines.trans_en: used to show a state, condition, or continuous activity

examples.ch: 处于战争状态的国家
examples.en: a country at war

examples.ch: 玩耍的孩子们
examples.en: children at play

defines.trans_ch: （表示地点或位置）在…里;在…上;在…旁
defines.trans_en: used to show an exact position or particular place

examples.ch: 我们会在入口处跟你碰头。
examples.en: We'll meet you at the entrance.

examples.ch: 电影开头的那一段精彩极了。
examples.en: That bit at the beginning of the film was brilliant.

examples.ch: 她坐在角落的一张桌子旁。
examples.en: She's sitting at the table in the corner.

examples.ch: 她在楼梯顶端站着。
examples.en: She was standing at the top of the stairs.

examples.ch: 这只狗过来趴在我的脚边。
examples.en: The dog came and lay down at (= next to) my feet.

examples.ch: 有人敲门。
examples.en: There's someone at the door (= someone is outside and wants to come in).

examples.ch: 我们下午去看了场足球比赛。
examples.en: We spent the afternoon at a football match.

examples.ch: 我在大学度过了3年美好的时光。
examples.en: I enjoyed my three years at university.

examples.ch: 我打电话给她，但是她出去吃午饭了。
examples.en: I called her but she was at lunch (= away, eating her lunch).

defines.trans_ch: （表示确切或某一时间）在…时刻;在…期间;在…岁时
defines.trans_en: used to show an exact or a particular time

examples.ch: 今天下午两点半有个会。
examples.en: There's a meeting at 2.30 this afternoon.

examples.ch: 吃午饭的时候你有空吗？
examples.en: Are you free at lunchtime?

examples.ch: 理论上说，妇女到了50岁仍可以生育。
examples.en: In theory, women can still have children at the age of 50.

examples.ch: 在一天中，这些钟每隔一段时间就会准时鸣响。
examples.en: The bells ring at regular intervals through the day.

examples.ch: 这家公司从未做过任何违法的事情。
examples.en: At no time/point did the company do anything illegal.

examples.ch: 我现在很忙，你过一会儿再打回来行吗？
examples.en: I'm busy at the moment (= now) - can you call back later?

examples.ch: 真可惜那次我不在，没有见到你——那时我在国外呢。
examples.en: It's a shame I wasn't here to meet you - I was overseas at the time (= then).

defines.trans_en: in the direction of

examples.ch: 她对我微笑了一下。
examples.en: She smiled at me.

examples.ch: 我们驱车经过时，他们朝我们挥手。
examples.en: They waved at us as we drove by.

examples.ch: 她瞄准目标。
examples.en: She aimed at the target.

examples.ch: “看看我！看看我！”那个小女孩叫道。
examples.en: "Look at me! Look at me!" called the little girl.

examples.ch: 他老是冲着孩子们大喊大叫。
examples.en: He's always shouting at the children.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指感觉是）由于，因为，作为对…的反应
defines.trans_en: used to show the cause of something, especially a feeling

examples.ch: 我们听到这个消息很吃惊。
examples.en: We were surprised at the news.

examples.ch: 想到这种前景，我激动不已。
examples.en: I was quite excited at the prospect.

examples.ch: 为什么我讲了笑话，从来就没人笑呢？
examples.en: Why does no one ever laugh at my jokes?

defines.trans_en: used to show the activity in which someone's ability is being judged

examples.ch: 我从来都不太擅长体育运动。
examples.en: I was never very good at sports.

examples.ch: 他很善于跟人打交道。
examples.en: He's very good at getting on with people.

examples.ch: 她办什么事情都没有条理，简直不可救药。
examples.en: She's hopeless at organizing things.

defines.trans_en: the @ symbol that joins the name of a person or a department in an organization to a domain name to make an email address

examples.ch: “你的电邮地址是什么？”“是 dictionary@cambridge.org。”
examples.en: "What's your email address?" "It's dictionary at cambridge dot org."

defines.trans_ch: （表示价格、温度、比率、速度等）以，达
defines.trans_en: used to show a price, temperature, rate, speed, etc.

examples.ch: 那么一双鞋要150美元，我才不会买！
examples.en: I'm not going to buy those shoes at $150!

examples.ch: 通货膨胀率达到5%。
examples.en: Inflation is running at 5 percent.

examples.ch: 当警察发现他时，他正以120英里的时速行驶。
examples.en: He was driving at 120 mph when the police spotted him.

defines.trans_ch: （用于财务记录中表示某一项目的价格、比率等的）符号@
defines.trans_en: used in financial records to show the price, rate, etc. of a particular thing or of each of a number of things on a list

examples.ch: 50件，每件4.75英镑

defines.trans_ch: （表示状态、状况或连续的活动）处于;从事于;忙于
defines.trans_en: used to show a state, condition, or continuous activity

examples.ch: 处于战争状态的国家
examples.en: a country at war

examples.ch: 玩耍的孩子们
examples.en: children at play

defines.trans_ch: （用于否定句和疑问句，表示强调）根本，无论如何，丝毫，一点儿
defines.trans_en: (used to make negatives and questions stronger) in any way or of any type

examples.ch: 他一点儿东西都没吃。
examples.en: He's had no food at all.

examples.ch: 最近我身体糟透了。
examples.en: I haven't been at all well recently.

examples.ch: 抱歉，我没有任何可说的。
examples.en: I'm afraid I have nothing at all to say.

examples.ch: 对于她的死因，有任何疑点没有？
examples.en: Is there any uncertainty at all about the way she died?

examples.ch: 你没工作，不用去上班，还起床干什么呢？
examples.en: Why bother getting up at all when you don't have a job to go to?

defines.trans_ch: 姑母;姨母;婶婶;伯母;舅母
defines.trans_en: the sister of someone's father or mother, or the wife of someone's uncle or aunt

examples.ch: 我有一个姑妈在澳大利亚。
examples.en: I have an aunt in Australia.

examples.ch: 这是我姑妈卡米尔。
examples.en: This is my Aunt Camille.

examples.ch: 爱丽丝姨母，您要喝点儿茶吗?
examples.en: Do you want some tea, Aunt Alice?

defines.trans_en: the season of the year between summer and winter, lasting from September to November north of the equator and from March to May south of the equator, when fruits and crops become ready to eat and are picked, and leaves fall

examples.ch: 我们喜欢在秋天出游，那时游人较少。
examples.en: We like to travel in (the) autumn when there are fewer tourists.

examples.ch: 去年秋天我们去了德国。
examples.en: Last autumn we went to Germany.

examples.ch: 今年秋天到目前气候都很温和。
examples.en: It's been a very mild autumn.

examples.ch: 秋天的色彩／落叶
examples.en: autumn colours/leaves

examples.ch: 秋日/夜
examples.en: an autumn day/evening

defines.trans_ch: 去（或在）别处；向另一方向；向一边
defines.trans_en: somewhere else, or to or in a different place, position, or situation

examples.ch: 沃森女士度假去了，要到周末才能回来。
examples.en: Ms Watson is away on holiday until the end of the week.

examples.ch: 离他远点。
examples.en: Keep/Stay away from him.

examples.ch: 走开，别管我！
examples.en: Just go away and leave me alone!

examples.ch: 这场面太可怕了，我不得不移开视线。
examples.en: The sight was so horrible that I had to look/turn away.

examples.ch: 最近爆发的洪水把人行桥冲垮了。
examples.en: The recent flood has swept away the footbridge.

examples.ch: 我已把所有的旧衣服都捐给了慈善机构。
examples.en: I've given away all my old clothes to charity.

examples.ch: 你的汉堡是在店里吃还是带走？
examples.en: Would you like your burger to eat in or take away?

defines.trans_en: at a distance (of or from here)

examples.ch: 车站离这儿有多远？
examples.en: How far away is the station?

examples.ch: 从这儿到办公室开车去要半小时。
examples.en: The office is a half-hour drive away.

examples.ch: 我们两人的住处相隔5公里。
examples.en: We live five kilometres away from each other.

examples.ch: 离开城市，生活清静多了。
examples.en: Life's so much quieter away from the city.

examples.ch: 哦，远着呢。
examples.en: Oh, it's miles away (= a long distance from here).

defines.trans_ch: 在老地方；在适当的地方；放到，放进（尤指封闭的空间）
defines.trans_en: in or into the usual or a suitable place, especially one that can be closed

examples.ch: 你把冰激凌放到冰箱里好吗？
examples.en: Would you put the ice cream away in the freezer?

examples.ch: 我爷爷奶奶在一个旧鞋盒子里藏了800英镑。
examples.en: My grandparents had £800 hidden away in an old shoe box.

defines.trans_en: gradually until mostly or completely gone

examples.ch: 雪已完全融化了。
examples.en: All the snow had melted away.

examples.ch: 随着街上的游行队伍渐渐远去，音乐声也渐渐听不见了。
examples.en: The music faded away as the procession moved slowly up the street.

examples.ch: 我们过去常常在我姑母的乡间农舍中度周末。
examples.en: We used to while away (= spend) the weekends at my aunt's house in the country.

examples.ch: 我们跳舞跳了个通宵。
examples.en: We danced the night away (= until the night was over).

defines.trans_en: in the future

examples.ch: 再有一周就要考英语了，可我还没有开始复习呢。
examples.en: My English exam's only a week away and I haven't even started to prepare.

defines.trans_ch: 连续不断地;一直;劲头十足地
defines.trans_en: continuously or repeatedly, or in a busy way

examples.ch: 考试结束时我还在拼命写个不停。
examples.en: I was still writing away when the exam finished.

examples.ch: 克里斯在花园里一刻不停地干了一整天。
examples.en: Chris has been working away in the garden all day.

examples.ch: 我们一直坐在后面聊天，没有听到他说什么。
examples.en: We were chatting away at the back and didn't hear what he said.

defines.trans_ch: （比赛）客场的，在对方场地举行的
defines.trans_en: An away match or game is played at an opposing team's sports ground.

examples.ch: 我们输了客场的那场比赛，但是在主场的两场比赛都赢了。
examples.en: We lost the away game but won both home games.

examples.ch: 埃弗顿队公布了新款黄蓝相间条纹客场比赛服。
examples.en: Everton unveiled their new yellow-and-blue away strip (= clothing worn by a team at away games).

defines.trans_ch: （尤指尚未学会走路或说话的）婴儿，婴孩
defines.trans_en: a very young child, especially one that has not yet begun to walk or talk

examples.ch: 新生儿
examples.en: a newborn baby

examples.ch: 6周大的婴儿
examples.en: a six-week-old baby

examples.ch: 男婴
examples.en: a baby boy

examples.ch: 婴儿服装
examples.en: baby clothes

examples.ch: 婴儿食品
examples.en: baby food

examples.ch: 桑德拉在5月29日生了孩子。
examples.en: Sandra had a baby (= gave birth to it) on 29 May.

examples.ch: 欧文是全家年龄最小的。
examples.en: Owen is the baby (= the youngest person) of the family.

defines.trans_en: a very young animal

examples.ch: 幼象／小猴子
examples.en: a baby elephant/monkey

defines.trans_en: an adult or especially an older child who is crying or behaving like a child

examples.ch: 不至于那么疼——别像个孩子似的！
examples.en: It didn't hurt that much - don't be such a baby!

defines.trans_ch: 宝贝（对妻子、丈夫、情人等的称呼）
defines.trans_en: a word you can use when you are talking to someone you love such as your wife, husband, partner, etc.

examples.ch: 啊，宝贝，我爱你。
examples.en: Oh baby, I love you.

defines.trans_ch: （某人特别的或专门的）任务，差事；责任
defines.trans_en: Someone's baby is something that they have a special interest in and responsibility for.

examples.ch: 我对这个项目不怎么了解——那是菲利普负责的。
examples.en: I don't know much about the project - it's Philip's baby.

phrases.trans_en: a type of vegetable that is specially grown to stay small

defines.trans_ch: 把…当婴儿看待；对…娇生惯养
defines.trans_en: to treat an older child as if he or she were a much younger child

examples.ch: 男孩们现在一个10岁，一个12岁，不希望妈妈把他们当婴儿看待。
examples.en: The boys were now ten and twelve and didn't want their mother to baby them.

defines.trans_ch: 在原处；回到原处；恢复原状；返回；回到以前
defines.trans_en: in, into, or towards a previous place or condition, or an earlier time

examples.ch: 剪刀用完后记着要放回去。
examples.en: When you take the scissors, remember to put them back.

examples.ch: 他留了张便条，上面写着“出去一下，马上回来”。
examples.en: He left a note saying "Gone out. Back soon."

examples.ch: 她去巴西呆了两年，现在回来了。
examples.en: She went to Brazil for two years, but now she's back (= has returned).

examples.ch: 他向后看了看，发现他们正跟着他。
examples.en: He looked back (= looked behind him) and saw they were following him.

examples.ch: 看着以前的照片，她想起了许多往事。
examples.en: Looking at her old photographs brought back (= made her remember) a lot of memories.

examples.ch: 我被雷雨惊醒后，再也无法入睡。
examples.en: I was woken by a thunderstorm, and I couldn't get back to sleep (= could not sleep again).

examples.ch: 我们最后一次见到洛厄尔是早在1月的时候。
examples.en: The last time we saw Lowell was back (= at an earlier time) in January.

examples.ch: 这个传统可追溯到16世纪。
examples.en: This tradition dates back to (= to the earlier time of) the 16th century.

defines.trans_en: in return

examples.ch: 如果他打我，我就要还手。
examples.en: If he hits me, I'll hit him back.

examples.ch: 她那样说你，你不会就此算了吧？
examples.en: You're not just going to let her say those things about you without fighting back, are you?

defines.trans_en: in reply

examples.ch: 我现在很忙——我回头给你打过去好吗？
examples.en: I'm busy at the moment - can I call you back?

examples.ch: 我几个月前给唐娜写过信，但她还没有回信。
examples.en: I wrote to Donna several months ago, but she hasn't written back yet.

defines.trans_en: further away in distance

examples.ch: 如果把桌子往后推，靠着墙，就会腾出更多的空间。
examples.en: If we push the table back against the wall, we'll have more room.

examples.ch: “退后！”他大叫着，“不要再靠近了！”
examples.en: "Keep back!" he shouted, "Don't come any closer!"

examples.ch: 他向后靠坐在沙发上。
examples.en: He sat back on the sofa.

examples.ch: 她仰起头，大笑不止。
examples.en: She threw back her head and laughed uproariously.

examples.ch: 那座房子远离公路。
examples.en: The house is set back from the street.

defines.trans_en: the inside or outside part of an object, vehicle, building, etc. that is furthest from the front

examples.ch: 他在信封背面匆匆记下了她的名字。
examples.en: He jotted her name down on the back of an envelope.

examples.ch: 我在衣柜的最里边找到了我的网球拍。
examples.en: I found my tennis racket at the back of the cupboard.

examples.ch: 我们坐在公共汽车的后部。
examples.en: We sat at the back of the bus.

examples.ch: 我们的座位正好就在剧院的后排。
examples.en: Our seats were right at the back of the auditorium.

examples.ch: 特德在屋后。
examples.en: Ted was out/round the back (= in the area behind the house)."

examples.ch: 房后有个漂亮的花园。
examples.en: There is a beautiful garden at the back of (= behind) the house.

examples.ch: 如果前门没人应答，就去后门。
examples.en: If there's no reply at the front door, come round the back.

examples.ch: 他把夹克搭在椅背上。
examples.en: He put his jacket on the back of his chair (= the part of the chair that you put your back against when you sit on it).

defines.trans_en: the part of your body that is opposite to the front, from your shoulders to your bottom

examples.ch: 我背疼。
examples.en: I have a bad back.

examples.ch: 睡太软的床会对背部有害。
examples.en: Sleeping on a bed that is too soft can be bad for your back.

examples.ch: 他仰面躺着，眼睛盯着天花板。
examples.en: He lay on his back, staring at the ceiling.

examples.ch: 她穿衣服时我转过身去。
examples.en: I turned my back (= turned around so that I could not see) while she dressed.

examples.ch: 她搬箱子时背部严重扭伤。
examples.en: She put her back out (= caused a serious injury to her back) lifting a box.

defines.trans_en: (in some sports, such as football) one of the players in a team who try to stop players from the other team from scoring goals, rather than trying to score goals himself or herself

phrases.trans_en: close together and facing in opposite directions

examples.ch: 办公室里摆满了电脑，我们只好背靠背坐着，排成长排。
examples.en: The office was full of computers, and we had to sit back to back in long rows.

phrases.trans_en: happening one after another, without interruption

examples.ch: 短暂休息过后，接下来是3首滚石乐队经典歌曲连放。
examples.en: Coming up after the break, three Rolling Stones classics back to back.

phrases.trans_en: with the back part of something where the front should be

examples.ch: 你的套头衫前后穿反了。
examples.en: You've put your jumper on back to front.

phrases.trans_en: the side of your hand that has hair growing on it

defines.trans_en: to give support to someone or something with money or words

examples.ch: 管理层拒不支持我们的提议。
examples.en: The management has refused to back our proposals.

defines.trans_en: to risk money by saying that you think a horse, team, etc. will win a race, game, or competition in order to win more money if they do

examples.ch: 我投注的那匹马得了最后一名。
examples.en: The horse I backed came in last.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) move backwards

examples.ch: 安倒车时撞上了车库大门，于是她从此再也不开车了。
examples.en: Ann gave up driving when she backed the car into the garage door.

examples.ch: 请你把车往后倒几英尺让我把车开出车道，好吗？
examples.en: Please could you back your car up a few feet so that I can get mine out of the driveway?

defines.trans_ch: 给某物加背衬使其更加坚固或厚实
defines.trans_en: to cover the back of something with a material, often to make it stronger or thicker

examples.ch: 这种料子的里衬很厚实。
examples.en: The material is backed with a heavy lining.

defines.trans_en: at or near the back of something

examples.ch: 她从后门离开了那座房子。
examples.en: She left the house by the back door.

examples.ch: 小汽车的后座可以折起来。
examples.en: The back seat of the car folds down.

defines.trans_en: paid after the end of a period of time when it should have been paid

examples.ch: 他们拖欠了员工几千镑工资。
examples.en: They owe the staff several thousand in back pay.

examples.ch: 预期未交的房租/税款
examples.en: back rent/taxes

defines.trans_ch: 坏的，不好的；令人不悦的
defines.trans_en: unpleasant and causing difficulties or harm

examples.ch: 我们的假期全被坏天气给破坏了。
examples.en: Our holiday was spoiled by bad weather.

examples.ch: 我们刚刚得到了一些很不好的消息。
examples.en: We've just had some very bad news.

examples.ch: 我昨晚没有睡好。
examples.en: I had a very bad night (= did not sleep well) last night.

examples.ch: 小心——他心情不好。
examples.en: Watch out - he's in a bad mood (= being unpleasant to everyone).

examples.ch: 她这人输不起。
examples.en: She's just a bad loser (= she is unpleasant when she loses).

examples.ch: 该公司最近在媒体上的负面新闻很多。
examples.en: The company has been getting a lot of bad publicity (= negative things have been written or said about it) recently.

examples.ch: 排队的人太多，我不想等了。
examples.en: The lines were so bad (= unpleasantly long) that I didn't bother waiting.

examples.ch: 现在公司的财务状况看来很不好。
examples.en: The company's financial situation is looking pretty bad at the moment.

examples.ch: 暴风雨造成的破坏远远没有我们原来想象的那样可怕。
examples.en: The damage caused by the storm was nowhere near as/nothing like as bad (= not as serious) as we'd feared it might be.

examples.ch: 吸二手烟对身体有害。
examples.en: Breathing in other people's cigarette smoke is bad for you (= has a harmful effect on your health).

examples.ch: 我现在不方便跟你通话。我过会儿给你回电话好吗？
examples.en: This is a bad (= not convenient or suitable) time for me to talk. Can I call you back later?

defines.trans_ch: 劣质的，很差的;不可接受的
defines.trans_en: of low quality, or not acceptable

examples.ch: 这名水管工的维修工作干得很糟。
examples.en: The plumber did a bad job on the repairs.

examples.ch: 公司目前的困境是因为运气不好还是决策错误造成的？
examples.en: Are the company's current difficulties a result of bad (= harmful) luck or bad (= of low quality) judgment?

examples.ch: 他有一些很不好的习惯。
examples.en: He has some very bad habits.

examples.ch: 在世界上某些地区，用左手取食物会被认为是失礼的行为。
examples.en: In some parts of the world, it is considered bad manners to pick up food with the left hand.

examples.ch: 他因行为不端被学校开除了。
examples.en: He was sent home from school for bad behaviour.

examples.ch: 那句话很不雅，对吧？
examples.en: That remark was in pretty bad taste, wasn't it?

examples.ch: 我厨艺很差。
examples.en: I'm very bad at cooking (= cannot do it very well).

defines.trans_en: (of people or actions) evil or morally unacceptable

examples.ch: 世界上有许多坏人。
examples.en: There are a lot of bad people in the world.

examples.ch: 他有缺点，但还不是坏人。
examples.en: He has his faults but he's not a bad person.

defines.trans_en: causing or experiencing pain

examples.ch: 她的腿那么疼，上不了那么多台阶！
examples.en: She can't walk up all those steps, not with her bad leg!

examples.ch: 咳得厉害
examples.en: a bad cough

defines.trans_en: harmful to eat because of being decayed

examples.ch: 我们最好趁鸡肉还没有变质赶快把它吃了。
examples.en: We'd better eat this chicken before it goes bad.

defines.trans_ch: 邪恶的本质；道德败坏的本质
defines.trans_en: the quality of being evil or morally unacceptable

examples.ch: 每个人都有正邪两面性。
examples.en: There is goodness and badness in everyone.

phrases.trans_en: fairly good or satisfactory

examples.ch: “最近怎么样？”“还行，谢谢。”
examples.en: "How are things?" "Not too bad, thanks."

phrases.trans_en: very good

examples.ch: 他是他那个年龄段中最好的——很不错，对吧？
examples.en: He was best in his age group - not bad, eh?

phrases.trans_ch: 感到羞愧;感到抱歉;感到难过
phrases.trans_en: to feel ashamed and sorry

examples.ch: 得知自己伤害了她，我感到很难受。
examples.en: Knowing that I hurt her makes me feel really bad.

examples.ch: 让他们失望了我感到很难过。
examples.en: I feel bad about letting them down.

phrases.trans_en: If a situation goes from bad to worse, it was difficult and unpleasant, and is becoming even more so.

examples.ch: 情况现在变得更糟了。
examples.en: Things have gone from bad to worse.

defines.trans_en: things or events that are not good or that are morally wrong

examples.ch: 她总是只能看到人们不好的一面。
examples.en: She only ever sees the bad in people.

defines.trans_ch: 邪恶的本质；道德败坏的本质
defines.trans_en: the quality of being evil or morally unacceptable

examples.ch: 每个人都有正邪两面性。
examples.en: There is goodness and badness in everyone.

defines.trans_en: informal for badly (= very much)

examples.ch: 他非常需要这笔钱。
examples.en: He needs the money real bad.

examples.ch: 我的手臂疼得厉害。
examples.en: My arm hurts so bad.

defines.trans_en: a soft container made out of paper or thin plastic, or a stronger container made of leather, plastic, or other material, usually with a handle, in which you carry personal things or clothes or other things that you need for travelling

examples.ch: 纸／塑料袋
examples.en: a paper/plastic bag

examples.ch: 购物袋
examples.en: a shopping bag (= a bag in which shopping is carried)

examples.ch: 一袋苹果／坚果
examples.en: a bag of apples/nuts

examples.ch: 不要一次就把整袋糖吃完。
examples.en: Don't eat that whole bag of (= the amount the bag contains) sweets at once.

examples.ch: 我甚至还没有把东西装包呢。
examples.en: I hadn't even packed my bags (= put the things I need in suitcases/bags).

defines.trans_ch: （侮辱性语言）（尤指年纪大的）丑妇
defines.trans_en: a rude and insulting name for a woman, especially an older one

examples.ch: 又蠢又丑的老太婆！
examples.en: Silly old bag!

phrases.trans_en: dark, loose, or swollen skin under your eyes because of tiredness or old age
trousers with a wide and loose style

examples.ch: 灯笼裤
examples.en: Oxford bags

defines.trans_en: to put something in a bag

examples.ch: 要我帮你把西红柿装进袋里吗？
examples.en: Shall I bag (up) those tomatoes for you?

defines.trans_en: to get something before other people have a chance to take it

examples.ch: 如果你先到就帮我们占几个好位子，行吗？
examples.en: Bag us some decent seats/Bag some decent seats for us if you get there first, won't you?

defines.trans_en: to win sth, especially a prize

examples.ch: 博彩公司看好他最有希望获得一项奥斯卡奖。
examples.en: He's the bookies' favourite to bag an Oscar.

examples.ch: 他十分渴望这个赛季第五次把胜利收入囊中。
examples.en: He is eager to bag his fifth victory of the season.

defines.trans_en: to hunt and kill an animal or bird
to reach the top of a mountain

examples.ch: 我们一天之内登上了三座山峰。
examples.en: We bagged three summits in one day.

defines.trans_en: to hang loosely like a bag

examples.ch: 我讨厌这条裤子，后面松松垮垮的。
examples.en: I hate these trousers - they bag (out) at the back.

defines.trans_en: to not use something that you have, and use something else instead

examples.ch: 把那件灰色的毛衣收起来，穿件颜色鲜艳一些的。
examples.en: Bag that old gray sweater, and wear something more colorful.

defines.trans_en: to criticize or laugh at someone or something in an unkind way

examples.ch: 别批评她了——她在尽力而为。
examples.en: Stop bagging her (out) - she's doing her best.

defines.trans_en: any object in the shape of a sphere, especially one used as a toy by children or in various sports such as tennis and football

examples.ch: 沙滩球／高尔夫球／网球
examples.en: a beach/golf/tennis ball

examples.ch: 尽量集中精力，只想着击球。
examples.en: Just try to concentrate on hitting the ball.

examples.ch: 小猫蜷缩成一团。
examples.en: The kitten curled itself into a ball (= the shape of a ball).

defines.trans_en: a long piece of thread that has been rolled into a ball

examples.ch: 线团／毛线团
examples.en: a ball of string/wool

defines.trans_en: the rounded part of your foot or thumb where the toes join the foot and the thumb joins the hand
in football, a pass from one player to another

examples.ch: 朗接坎贝尔一记妙传，绕过守门员进球。
examples.en: Long picked up a great ball from Campbell and rounded the keeper to score.

defines.trans_en: in baseball, a ball that is thrown to the batter but that the batter does not try to hit because it is outside the hitting area
any game that involves throwing and catching a ball

examples.ch: 孩子们在外面打球。
examples.en: The kids were outside playing ball.

examples.ch: 我喜欢观看大学联赛/职业联赛。
examples.en: I like watching college/pro ball.

defines.trans_en: a large formal occasion where people dance

examples.ch: 去年你参加夏日舞会了吗？
examples.en: Did you go to the Summer Ball last year?

defines.trans_en: to make something form a closed round shape

examples.ch: 她握紧拳头，指甲深深陷入手掌中。
examples.en: She balled her fists so her nails dug deep into her palms.

defines.trans_en: (of a man) to have sex with someone
a long, curved fruit with a yellow skin and soft, sweet, white flesh inside

examples.ch: 一串香蕉
examples.en: a bunch of bananas

examples.ch: 香蕉奶昔
examples.en: banana milkshake

defines.trans_en: a group of musicians who play modern music together

examples.ch: 爵士／摇滚乐队
examples.en: a jazz/rock band

examples.ch: 披头士乐队大概是世界上最有名的乐队。
examples.en: The Beatles were probably the most famous band in the world.

defines.trans_en: a thin, flat piece of cloth, elastic, metal, or other material put around something, or a long, narrow piece of colour, light, etc. that is different from what surrounds it

examples.ch: 腕带
examples.en: a wrist band

examples.ch: 红丝带
examples.en: a red silk band

examples.ch: 窄窄的一片草地把温室和菜地隔开了。
examples.en: A narrow band of grass separated the greenhouse from the vegetable garden.

defines.trans_en: a particular range of values, numbers, etc.

examples.ch: 该方案是为15岁至20岁年龄段的年轻人设计的。
examples.en: The scheme is devised for young people in the 15–20 age band.

defines.trans_en: a group of people who share the same interests or beliefs, or who have joined together for a special purpose

examples.ch: 前总统仍然有一小群支持者。
examples.en: The former president still has a small band of supporters.

phrases.trans_en: a group of young men or women who perform popular songs together and dance as a group

examples.ch: 他90年代成名于“男孩地带”这一少男组合，后来单独发展，获得了巨大的成功。
examples.en: He made his name in the 90s boy band Boyzone, before going on to a highly successful solo career.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指在动物身上）套环，戴上环套
defines.trans_en: to put a band on something, especially an animal

examples.ch: 我们给鸟腿上戴上环套，以便将来可以辨识出它们。
examples.en: We banded the birds (= put bands around their legs) so that we could identify them later.

defines.trans_en: an organization where people and businesses can invest or borrow money, change it to foreign money, etc., or a building where these services are offered

examples.ch: 大型银行被指责剥削小企业。
examples.en: The big banks have been accused of exploiting small firms.

examples.ch: 我得利用午饭时间去趟银行。
examples.en: I need to go to the bank at lunchtime.

examples.ch: 为了创办自己的公司我不得不从银行借款。
examples.en: I had to take out a bank loan to start my own business.

defines.trans_en: In gambling, the bank is money that belongs to the owner and can be won by the players.
sloping raised land, especially along the sides of a river

examples.ch: 当我们到达对岸时，船正在快速下沉。
examples.en: By the time we reached the opposite bank, the boat was sinking fast.

examples.ch: 这些花通常开在河堤上和溪流附近。
examples.en: These flowers generally grow on river banks and near streams.

defines.trans_en: a pile or mass of earth, clouds, etc.

examples.ch: 天际隐约出现一大片黑云。
examples.en: A dark bank of cloud loomed on the horizon.

defines.trans_ch: 一排，一列，一组（尤指机器或机器零件）
defines.trans_en: a row of similar things, especially machines or parts of machines

examples.ch: 一排开关
examples.en: a bank of switches

defines.trans_en: A bank of something, such as blood or human organs for medical use, is a place that stores these things for later use.

examples.ch: 血库
examples.en: a blood bank

examples.ch: 精子库
examples.en: a sperm bank

defines.trans_ch: 把钱存入银行，在某银行存款
defines.trans_en: to keep your money in a particular bank, or to put money into a bank

examples.ch: 我过去常把钱存在劳埃德银行。
examples.en: I used to bank with Lloyd's.

defines.trans_en: to win or earn a particular amount of money

examples.ch: 那天她赚了500英镑的小费！
examples.en: She banked £500 in tips that day!

defines.trans_en: (of an aircraft) to fly with one wing higher than the other when turning

examples.ch: 我们感觉到飞机转向时倾斜得很厉害。
examples.en: We felt the plane bank steeply as it changed direction.

defines.trans_en: to collect in or form into a mass, or to make something do this

examples.ch: 雪堆积在园子的角落里。
examples.en: The snow had banked up in the corner of the garden.

examples.ch: 我们把炉火封好，这样就可以整晚不灭。
examples.en: We banked up the fire (= put more coal on it) to keep it burning all night.

defines.trans_en: a metal frame on which meat, fish, or vegetables are cooked outdoors over a fire

examples.ch: 一定要提前足够时间点火，准备好烤肉架。
examples.en: Make sure you light the barbecue in plenty of time.

defines.trans_en: a meal that is prepared and eaten outdoors using such a frame, often during a party

examples.ch: 他做了一些色拉跟烤肉一起吃。
examples.en: He made some salads to have with the barbecue.

defines.trans_en: a party held outdoors, during which food is cooked on a barbecue

examples.ch: 我们星期天有一个烤肉聚会¬——希望你能参加。
examples.en: We're having a barbecue on Saturday - I hope you can come.

defines.trans_en: meat, usually pork, cooked slowly on a metal frame in a container filled with smoke, and served in a barbecue sauce
to cook food on a barbecue

examples.ch: 他们的传统香肠烤得非常好吃。
examples.en: Their traditional sausages are delicious grilled or barbecued.

defines.trans_en: to cook food on a barbecue

examples.ch: 他们的传统香肠烤得非常好吃。
examples.en: Their traditional sausages are delicious grilled or barbecued.

defines.trans_en: (the ball used in) a game played especially in North America by two teams of nine players, in which a player hits a ball with a bat (= stick) and tries to run around four bases on a large field before the other team returns the ball

examples.ch: 杰克不像别的孩子，他从不打棒球。
examples.en: Jake never played baseball like the other kids.

examples.ch: 他的运动包里有一个棒球和几支球棒。
examples.en: He had a baseball and a couple of bats in his sports bag.

defines.trans_en: (a ball used in) a game played by two teams of five players who score points by throwing a large ball through an open net hanging from a metal ring
a long plastic, metal, or ceramic container that is filled with water so that you can sit or lie in it to wash your whole body
the activity of washing yourself or someone else in a bath

examples.ch: 苏珊娜每天晚上都要美美地泡个热水澡。
examples.en: Susannah has a long hot bath every evening.

examples.ch: 我今天早上洗了个澡。
examples.en: I took a bath this morning.

examples.ch: 沐浴油
examples.en: bath oil

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a bathroom when describing a home

examples.ch: 有4间卧室和2间浴室的房子
examples.en: a four-bedroom two-bath house

defines.trans_en: a health treatment

examples.ch: 泥浴／温泉浴
examples.en: mud/thermal baths

defines.trans_en: any container holding liquid

examples.ch: 鸟澡盆
examples.en: a bird bath

phrases.trans_en: to fill a bath with water for washing

examples.ch: 你把湿衣服脱了，我帮你给浴缸放水。
examples.en: I'll run you a bath while you take off those wet clothes.

phrases.trans_ch: 公共游泳池（同 swimming bath）
phrases.trans_en:
→ 
swimming baths UK old-fashioned
a public place where people went in the past to have a hot bath

defines.trans_en: to wash in a bath or to wash someone in a bath

examples.ch: 她每天早晨都洗澡。
examples.en: She baths every morning.

examples.ch: 我通常在晚上给孩子们洗澡。
examples.en: I usually bath the kids in the evening.

defines.trans_en: a room with a bath and/or shower and often a toilet

examples.ch: 这座房子有四间卧室和两个洗澡间。
examples.en: The house has four bedrooms and two bathrooms.

defines.trans_en: a room with a toilet in it

examples.ch: 厕所在哪儿？
examples.en: Where's the bathroom?

defines.trans_ch: （用来说明人、事物或状态，表示性质、状态、工作等）
defines.trans_en: used to say something about a person, thing, or state, to show a permanent or temporary quality, state, job, etc.

examples.ch: 他很富有。
examples.en: He is rich.

examples.ch: 今天天冷。
examples.en: It's cold today.

examples.ch: 我叫安迪。
examples.en: I'm Andy.

examples.ch: 现在到此结束。
examples.en: That's all for now.

examples.ch: 你长大后想做什么？
examples.en: What do you want to be (= what job do you want to do) when you grow up?

examples.ch: 这些书每本3美元。
examples.en: These books are (= cost) $3 each.

examples.ch: 她怕黑，总是开着灯睡觉。
examples.en: Being afraid of the dark, she always slept with the light on.

examples.ch: 他自己从未生过病，所以听到别人的病情时并不怎么同情。
examples.en: Never having been ill himself, he wasn't a sympathetic listener.

examples.ch: 安静！
examples.en: Be quiet!

examples.ch: 问题在于要决定干什么。
examples.en: The problem is deciding what to do.

examples.ch: 最困难的就是找代替者。
examples.en: The hardest part will be to find a replacement.

examples.ch: 大家普遍认为她应该被辞退。
examples.en: The general feeling is that she should be asked to leave.

examples.ch: 并不是我不喜欢她，只是我们看法很少相同！
examples.en: It's not that I don't like her - it's just that we rarely agree on anything!

defines.trans_en: used to show the position of a person or thing in space or time

examples.ch: 食品已经摆在桌上了。
examples.en: The food was already on the table.

examples.ch: 那儿有人吗？
examples.en: Is anyone there?

examples.ch: 会议将于下周二召开。
examples.en: The meeting is now (= will happen) next Tuesday.

examples.ch: 我的汤里有根头发。
examples.en: There's a hair in my soup.

defines.trans_en: used to show what something is made of

examples.ch: 这个盘子是纯金的吗？
examples.en: Is this plate pure gold?

defines.trans_en: used to say that someone should or must do something

examples.ch: 你要坐在角落里，保持安静。
examples.en: You're to sit in the corner and keep quiet.

examples.ch: 妈妈告诉他们不准在河边玩。
examples.en: Their mother said they were not to (= not allowed to) play near the river.

examples.ch: 没有钱了——我们该怎么办？
examples.en: There's no money left - what are we to do?

defines.trans_en: used to show that something will happen in the future

examples.ch: 我们春天将去澳大利亚。
examples.en: We are to (= we are going to) visit Australia in the spring.

examples.ch: 她此后再也没有见过她的弟弟。
examples.en: She was never to see (= she never saw) her brother again.

defines.trans_ch: （用于条件句中，表示可能）万一，假如
defines.trans_en: used in conditional sentences to say what might happen

examples.ch: 如果我拒绝，他们会很气恼的。
examples.en: If I were to refuse they'd be very annoyed.

examples.ch: 倘若我拒绝，他们会很气恼的。
examples.en: Were I to refuse they'd be very annoyed.

defines.trans_en: used to say what can happen

examples.ch: 现在去市美术馆可以看到现代版画展。
examples.en: The exhibition of modern prints is currently to be seen at the City Gallery.

defines.trans_en: to exist or live

examples.ch: 这种苦难绝不应该存在。
examples.en: Such terrible suffering should never be.

examples.ch: 当信件到他们手上时，他们的姐姐已经去世了。
examples.en: By the time the letter reached them their sister had ceased to be (= had died).

defines.trans_ch: （与动词的现在分词连用，表示动作正在进行）正在，在
defines.trans_en: used with the present participle of other verbs to describe actions that are or were still continuing

examples.ch: 我还在吃饭。
examples.en: I'm still eating.

examples.ch: 她在学习，将来想当律师。
examples.en: She's studying to be a lawyer.

examples.ch: 观众显然不喜欢这个节目。
examples.en: The audience clearly wasn't enjoying the show.

examples.ch: 你总是在抱怨。
examples.en: You're always complaining.

examples.ch: 我将于周二回来。
examples.en: I'll be coming back (= I plan to come back) on Tuesday.

defines.trans_ch: （与动词的过去分词连用，表示被动）被
defines.trans_en: used with the past participle of other verbs to form the passive

examples.ch: 我倒是想去，但没有受到邀请。
examples.en: I'd like to go but I haven't been asked.

examples.ch: 闹事者被力劝赶快离开。
examples.en: Troublemakers are encouraged to leave.

examples.ch: 警察发现了一具尸体。
examples.en: A body has been discovered by the police.

defines.trans_en: an area of sand or small stones near the sea or another area of water such as a lake

examples.ch: 我们在海滩度过了一整天。
examples.en: We spent the day on the beach.

examples.ch: 海滨咖啡馆
examples.en: a beach café

examples.ch: 沙滩浴巾
examples.en: a beach towel

defines.trans_en: to pull or force a boat, etc. out of the water onto the land

examples.ch: 船已经被拖到了海滩上的礁石附近。
examples.en: The boat had been beached near the rocks.

defines.trans_en: to accept, tolerate, or endure something, especially something unpleasant

examples.ch: 当时压力一定很大，但她挺过来了。
examples.en: The strain must have been enormous but she bore it well.

examples.ch: 现在告诉我吧！我等不及了！
examples.en: Tell me now! I can't bear the suspense!

examples.ch: 是你作出的决定——如果出了差错你必须承担责任。
examples.en: It's your decision - you have to bear the responsibility if things go wrong.

examples.ch: 他不忍看见狗那么痛苦。
examples.en: He couldn't bear to see the dog in pain.

examples.ch: 我受不了闲极无聊的日子。
examples.en: I can't bear being bored.

defines.trans_en: to have or continue to have something

examples.ch: 他们的宝宝长得非常像他爷爷。
examples.en: Their baby bears a strong resemblance to its grandfather.

examples.ch: 上面刻有他名字的石匾被砸得粉碎。
examples.en: The stone plaque bearing his name was smashed to pieces.

examples.ch: 展品中有洛基·马西亚诺签过名的拳击手套。
examples.en: On display were boxing gloves that bore Rocky Marciano's signature.

examples.ch: 我并不怨恨他们。
examples.en: I don't bear them any ill feeling (= I do not continue to be angry with or dislike them).

examples.ch: 谢谢你的忠告，我会谨记在心的。
examples.en: Thank you for your advice - I'll bear it in mind (= I will remember and consider it).

defines.trans_en: to hold or support something

examples.ch: 椅子太不结实了，她一坐上去就散架了。
examples.en: The chair, too fragile to bear her weight, collapsed.

defines.trans_en: to give birth to young, or (of a tree or plant) to give or produce fruit or flowers

examples.ch: 她到30岁时已经生了6个孩子。
examples.en: She had borne six children by the time she was 30.

examples.ch: 当妻子生了个小孩时，他掩饰不住内心的喜悦。
examples.en: When his wife bore him a child he could not hide his delight.

examples.ch: 大多数动物都在春天产崽儿。
examples.en: Most animals bear their young in the spring.

examples.ch: 他们种的梨树从来没有结过梨。
examples.en: The pear tree they planted has never borne fruit.

defines.trans_en: to carry and move something to a place

examples.ch: 圣诞节时，全家人带着礼物来到那幢房子。
examples.en: At Christmas the family all arrive at the house bearing gifts.

examples.ch: 许多服务员端着一盘盘饮料进入房间。
examples.en: Countless waiters bore trays of drinks into the room.

examples.ch: 冰激凌车的叮当声随风飘进了办公室。
examples.en: The sound of the ice cream van was borne into the office on the wind.

defines.trans_en: to change direction slightly so that you are going in a particular direction

examples.ch: 这条小路沿着海岸线延伸了几英里，然后转向内陆。
examples.en: The path followed the coastline for several miles, then bore inland.

examples.ch: 经过教堂后，继续向左／右。
examples.en: After you go past the church keep bearing left/right.

phrases.trans_en: to be too unpleasant or frightening to think about

examples.ch: “假如她车开得再快一点儿会怎么样？”“简直不敢想象。”
examples.en: "What if she'd been driving faster?" "It doesn't bear thinking about."

phrases.trans_en: to say you know from your own experience that something happened or is true

examples.ch: 她亲眼见证了他的耐心和勤奋。
examples.en: She bore witness to his patience and diligence.

phrases.trans_en: If something bears testimony to a fact, it proves that it is true.

examples.ch: 这座铁桥证明了那个时代的技术发展水平。
examples.en: The iron bridge bears testimony to the skills developed in that era.

phrases.trans_en: to lie

defines.trans_en: a large, strong wild mammal with a thick fur coat that lives especially in colder parts of Europe, Asia, and North America

examples.ch: 棕熊／黑熊
examples.en: a brown/black bear

examples.ch: 幼熊
examples.en: a bear cub (= young bear)

defines.trans_ch: （年龄较大、身材魁梧且多毛的）同性恋男人
defines.trans_en: an older gay man who is large and has a lot of hair on his body

defines.trans_ch: （股市中）做空头者;（对行情）看跌的人
defines.trans_en: a person who sells shares when prices are expected to fall, in order to make a profit by buying them back again at a lower price
very attractive

examples.ch: 美女
examples.en: a beautiful woman

examples.ch: 美得惊人的景色
examples.en: breathtakingly beautiful scenery

examples.ch: 她穿着一身漂亮的连衣裙。
examples.en: She was wearing a beautiful dress.

defines.trans_en: very pleasant

examples.ch: 一首优美的曲子
examples.en: a beautiful piece of music

examples.ch: 极好的天气
examples.en: beautiful weather

defines.trans_en: very kind

examples.ch: 你帮助了那些可怜的孩子，是爱心之举呀。
examples.en: You did a beautiful thing in helping those poor children.

defines.trans_en: for the reason that

examples.ch: “你为什么做这事？”“因为卡洛斯叫我去做的。”
examples.en: "Why did you do it?" "Because Carlos told me to".

examples.ch: 我们不能参加朱莉娅的聚会，因为那个周末我们要外出。
examples.en: We can't go to Julia's party because we're going away that weekend.

examples.ch: 我今晚把裙子借给你，但并不意味着你任何时候想借就可以借的。
examples.en: Just because I'm lending you my dress for tonight doesn't mean you can borrow it whenever you want to.

examples.ch: 最近我们没有见过你，你是不是外出了？
examples.en: Where've you been, because (= the reason I am asking is that) we haven't seen you recently?

defines.trans_en: to start to be

examples.ch: 我越来越怀疑他的动机。
examples.en: I was becoming increasingly suspicious of his motives.

examples.ch: 天气越来越冷了，所以我们就燃起了火。
examples.en: It was becoming cold, so we lit the fire.

examples.ch: 戒烟后，他发福了，而且老爱发火。
examples.en: After giving up smoking, he became fat and irritable.

examples.ch: 玛格丽特·撒切尔于1979年成为英国第一位女首相。
examples.en: Margaret Thatcher became the UK's first woman prime minister in 1979.

examples.ch: 他刚刚当上爸爸。
examples.en: He has just become a father.

defines.trans_en: to cause someone to look attractive, or to be suitable for someone

examples.ch: 那个颜色很适合你。
examples.en: That colour really becomes you.

defines.trans_en: a large, rectangular piece of furniture, often with four legs, used for sleeping on

examples.ch: 他住的房间里只有两把椅子、一张床和一个桌子。
examples.en: He lived in a room with only two chairs, a bed, and a table.

examples.ch: 星期六早上他喜欢在床上吃早饭。
examples.en: He likes to have breakfast in bed on a Saturday morning.

examples.ch: 今天她直到吃午饭时才起床。
examples.en: She didn't get out of bed till lunchtime today.

examples.ch: 我累极了——我要上床睡觉了。
examples.en: I'm exhausted - I'm going to bed (= going to get into a bed in order to sleep).

examples.ch: 我总是晚上7点半就打发孩子们上床睡觉。
examples.en: I always put the children to bed (= make certain that they get into a bed and are comfortable there ready for going to sleep) at 7.30 p.m.

defines.trans_en: the bottom of something, or something that serves as a base

examples.ch: 海底生活着许多奇异的植物和鱼类。
examples.en: Many strange plants and fish live on the sea bed.

examples.ch: 铁路建在硬石地基上。
examples.en: The railway was built on a bed of solid rock.

defines.trans_en: a piece of ground used for growing plants outside

examples.ch: 他们院子里有一些很漂亮的花坛。
examples.en: They have some beautiful flower beds in their garden.

phrases.trans_en: to make a bed neat after you have slept in it
a pile of one type of food on which other food is arranged as a meal

examples.ch: 底下铺了一层米饭的烤蔬菜
examples.en: roasted vegetables on a bed of rice

defines.trans_ch: 把…安置在基础上；嵌；埋置
defines.trans_en: to put something firmly into a substance or into the ground

examples.ch: 这些柱子必须稳稳地埋插在混凝土中。
examples.en: The posts should be firmly bedded in concrete.

defines.trans_en: to have sex with someone

defines.trans_ch: 教育学士（Bachelor of Education的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for Bachelor of Education: a degree taken by some teachers, or a person who has this degree
a room used for sleeping in

examples.ch: 我们家有3间卧室。
examples.en: Our home has three bedrooms.

examples.ch: 主卧室
examples.en: the master bedroom (= the main bedroom in a house)

examples.ch: 你可以睡在客房里。
examples.en: You can stay in the spare bedroom.

examples.ch: 我们刚刚给卧室买了一些新家具。
examples.en: We've just bought some new bedroom furniture.

defines.trans_ch: 有关性爱的；男女性爱的
defines.trans_en: relating to sexual activity

examples.ch: 剧中的性爱场面让我爸爸感到尴尬。
examples.en: My dad was embarrassed by the bedroom scenes in the play.

examples.ch: 他有一双色迷迷的眼睛。
examples.en: He has bedroom eyes (= looks as if he is interested in sex).

defines.trans_en: at or during a time earlier than (the thing mentioned)

examples.ch: 饭前应该洗手。
examples.en: You should always wash your hands before meals.

examples.ch: 走前他和每个人都告了别。
examples.en: Before leaving he said goodbye to each of them.

examples.ch: 她总是黎明前就起床了。
examples.en: She's always up before dawn.

examples.ch: 他还没走到门前她就迅速关上了门。
examples.en: Before he could reach the door, she quickly closed it.

examples.ch: 趁我们还未作决定，还有人想说什么吗？
examples.en: Before we make a decision, does anyone want to say anything else?

examples.ch: 她得给看门人小费，好让他帮她提箱子。
examples.en: She had to give the doorman a tip before he would help her with her suitcases (= he would not do it until she had given him a tip).

defines.trans_en: until (the event mentioned)

examples.ch: 警察一小时后才赶到。
examples.en: It was an hour before the police arrived.

defines.trans_en: in the past

examples.ch: 他说他以前从没见过她。
examples.en: He said he had never seen her before.

examples.ch: 我感觉好像以前来过这儿。
examples.en: I feel as though I've been here before.

defines.trans_en: in front of

examples.ch: 在英语字母表中，K排在L前面。
examples.en: The letter K comes before L in the English alphabet.

examples.ch: 许多母亲都把孩子的需要置于自己的需要之前。
examples.en: Many mothers put their children's needs before their own.

examples.ch: 我们有整个周末的时间——做些什么呢？
examples.en: We have the whole weekend before us - what do you want to do?

examples.ch: 他在满屋子人面前站起来向她求婚。
examples.en: He stood up before a whole roomful of people, and asked her to marry him.

defines.trans_en: If a place is before another place, you will arrive at it first when you are travelling towards the second place.

examples.ch: 公共汽车站就在学校前面一点。
examples.en: The bus stop is just before the school.

defines.trans_en: If something is before someone or before a group of people, it will be formally considered or examined by that person or group.

examples.ch: 委员会正在考虑我们打算降低10%开支的建议。
examples.en: The proposal before the committee is that we try and reduce our spending by ten percent.

examples.ch: 这些人昨天出庭了。
examples.en: The men appeared before the judge yesterday.

defines.trans_en: to start to happen or exist

examples.ch: 音乐会什么时候开始？
examples.en: What time does the concert begin?

examples.ch: 这座桥5年前开始建造，到现在为止估计成本已经翻了一番。
examples.en: The bridge was begun five years ago and the estimated cost has already doubled.

examples.ch: 他们要看的电影7点开场。
examples.en: The film they want to watch begins at seven.

examples.ch: 会议开场很不错，可后来出了问题。
examples.en: The meeting began promisingly, but then things started to go wrong.

defines.trans_en: to start to do something

examples.ch: 我6个月前就开始读这本书，但似乎总也读不完。
examples.en: I began the book six months ago, but I can't seem to finish it.

examples.ch: 珍妮刚开始学开车。
examples.en: Jane has just begun learning to drive.

examples.ch: 如果你想学一种乐器，从简单的开始或许是个好主意。
examples.en: If you want to learn to play a musical instrument, it might be a good idea to begin on something simple.

examples.ch: 等了半小时后，她开始生气了。
examples.en: After waiting for half an hour she was beginning to get angry.

examples.ch: 我有很多话要跟你说，不知从何谈起。
examples.en: I have so much to tell you, I don't know where to begin.

defines.trans_en: to start speaking

examples.ch: “唉，”他开始说，“这事我真是不知道该怎么样跟你说。”
examples.en: "Well," he began. "I don't quite know how to tell you this."

defines.trans_en: to have something as the first part

examples.ch: 单词 cat 以字母 c 开头。
examples.en: The word "cat" begins with the letter "c".

defines.trans_en: a person who is starting to do something or learn something for the first time

examples.ch: 这门柔道课程是专为初学者开设的。
examples.en: This judo class is for beginners only.

defines.trans_en: at the back (of)

examples.ch: 朝后看！
examples.en: Look behind you!

examples.ch: 我把大衣挂在门后了。
examples.en: I hung my coat behind the door.

examples.ch: 亚历克斯带头，我紧随其后。
examples.en: Alex led, and I followed along behind.

examples.ch: 比赛中不管怎样努力，她总是落在其他游泳选手的后面。
examples.en: As hard as she tried, she always fell behind the other swimmers in the races.

examples.ch: 我知道她在用微笑掩饰着内心的忧伤。
examples.en: I knew that behind (= hidden by) her smile was sadness.

defines.trans_en: in the place where someone or something was before

examples.ch: 发现自己把包落下了，我很气恼。
examples.en: I was annoyed to discover that I'd left my bag behind.

examples.ch: 晚会结束后，一些客人留下来帮助收拾打扫。
examples.en: After the party a few people stayed behind to help clean up.

defines.trans_en: slower or later than someone else, or than you should be

examples.ch: 老妇人迟迟未交房租。
examples.en: The old woman was behind with (= late paying) the rent.

defines.trans_en: responsible for or the cause of

examples.ch: 他疑惑为何邻居的态度突然友好起来。
examples.en: He wondered what was behind his neighbour's sudden friendliness.

examples.ch: 居里夫人使整个化学领域发生了巨变。
examples.en: Marie Curie was the woman behind enormous changes in the science of chemistry.

defines.trans_en: the part of the body on which a person sits

examples.ch: 他绊了一跤，一屁股摔在地上。
examples.en: He tripped and fell on his behind.

examples.ch: 你为何不起来干点儿什么！
examples.en: Why don't you get off your behind (= stand up) and do something!

defines.trans_en: to think that something is true, correct, or real

examples.ch: 奇怪的是，当我们告诉他们曾有火星人来访时，居然没人相信。
examples.en: Strangely, no one believed us when we told them we'd been visited by a creature from Mars.

examples.ch: 他相信孩子们出生时智商是一样的。
examples.en: He believes that all children are born with equal intelligence.

examples.ch: 我相信她明天会到的。
examples.en: She's arriving tomorrow, I believe.

examples.ch: “她一个人来吗？”“我想不是的／是的。”
examples.en: "Is she coming alone?" "We believe not/so (= we think she is not/is)."

examples.ch: 我相信她是世界上最好的小提琴家。
examples.en: I believe her to be the finest violinist in the world.

examples.ch: 机组人员全部失踪，据信都已遇难。
examples.en: All the crew are missing, believed dead.

phrases.text: not believe a word of it
phrases.trans_en: to not believe that something is true

examples.ch: 他告诉我她只是个普通朋友而已，可我根本就不信！
examples.en: He told me she was just a friend, but I don't believe a word of it!

phrases.trans_en: said when telling someone about something that is true, although it seems unlikely

examples.ch: 他在楼上做功课，信不信由你。
examples.en: He's upstairs doing his homework, believe it or not.

phrases.trans_en: said when emphasizing that something is true

examples.ch: 相信我，我是被吓着了！
examples.en: Believe me, I was scared !

phrases.text: if you believe that, you'll believe anything!
phrases.trans_ch: （用于强调）根本不可能是真的
phrases.trans_en: something that you say to emphasize that something is obviously not true

examples.ch: 他说前面的车向后撞了他。这根本就是胡说！
examples.en: He said the car in front backed into him, and if you believe that, you'll believe anything!

phrases.trans_en: to pretend or imagine

examples.ch: 我们假扮海盗吧。
examples.en: Let's make believe (that) we're pirates.

defines.trans_en: to be in the right place or a suitable place

examples.ch: 这张桌子应该放在客厅里。
examples.en: This table belongs in the sitting room.

examples.ch: 这些匙应放在哪儿？
examples.en: Where do these spoons belong?

examples.ch: 这些报纸应该和其他的放在一起。
examples.en: These papers belong with the others.

defines.trans_en: to feel happy or comfortable in a situation

examples.ch: 在剑桥呆了3年以后，我终于找到了归属感。
examples.en: After three years in Cambridge, I finally feel as if I belong here.

defines.trans_ch: 在较低处；在某平面之下；（位置）低于
defines.trans_en: in a lower position (than), under

examples.ch: 从摩天大楼顶上往下看，下面的汽车小得像昆虫一样。
examples.en: From the top of the skyscraper the cars below us looked like insects.

examples.ch: 作者的名字登在标题之下。
examples.en: The author's name was printed below the title.

examples.ch: 关于这一点的详细说明请看下文。
examples.en: For further information on this subject, see below (= lower on the page or later in the book).

examples.ch: 船长去下层甲板了。
examples.en: The ship's captain went below (= to the lower, covered part of the ship).

examples.ch: 你通常穿露膝裙还是过膝裙？
examples.en: Do you usually wear your skirts above or below the knee?

examples.ch: 她有三名下属。
examples.en: She has three people working below her (= people to whom she gives orders).

defines.trans_en: less than a particular amount or level

examples.ch: 他们有3个不到4岁的孩子。
examples.en: They have three children below the age of (= younger than) four.

examples.ch: 最近一段时间他的英语成绩一直低于平均水平。
examples.en: His marks in English have been below average for some time now.

examples.ch: 最近气温已经降到零下了。
examples.en: The temperature has fallen below freezing (= has been less than 0°C) recently.

examples.ch: 昨晚只有零下10度。
examples.en: Last night it was ten degrees below (zero) (= minus ten degrees).

defines.trans_en: a strip of leather or material worn around the waist to support clothes or for decoration

examples.ch: 她把腰带束紧。
examples.en: She fastened her belt tightly around her waist.

examples.ch: 他吃得太多，不得不把腰带放松几个扣。
examples.en: He had eaten so much that he had to loosen his belt a couple of notches.

defines.trans_en: a flat strip of material in a machine that moves along continuously to keep another part turning, or to keep objects on it moving along

examples.ch: 风扇皮带
examples.en: a fan belt

examples.ch: 传送带
examples.en: a conveyor belt

defines.trans_en: an area, usually just outside a city, where a particular group of people live, such as the commuter belt and the stockbroker belt, or an area that is known for a particular characteristic, such as the cotton belt (= an area where cotton is grown)
a hard hit or punch

examples.ch: 对准下巴的猛击
examples.en: a belt on the jaw

defines.trans_en: (especially of a vehicle) to travel with great speed

examples.ch: 那辆车一路疾驶。
examples.en: The car was belting along/down the road.

defines.trans_en: to hit someone or something hard, especially with violence

examples.ch: 他朝他的脸上猛击一拳。
examples.en: He belted him in the face.

defines.trans_en: to tie something with a belt

examples.ch: 我束紧了外套的腰带。
examples.en: I belted my coat tightly.

defines.trans_en: in or into the space that separates two places, people, or objects

examples.ch: 此城镇位于罗马和佛罗伦萨的中间。
examples.en: The town lies halfway between Rome and Florence.

examples.ch: 站在两个大人之间的是个小孩。
examples.en: Standing between the two adults was a small child.

examples.ch: 她在停放的车子间挤来挤去，最后跑到了马路上。
examples.en: She squeezed between the parked cars and ran out into the road.

examples.ch: 一条狭窄的小路从两幢房子之间穿过。
examples.en: There were two houses with a narrow path in between.

defines.trans_en: If something is between two amounts, it is greater than the first amount but smaller than the second.

examples.ch: 她的体重在55公斤到60公斤之间。
examples.en: She weighs between 55 and 60 kilograms.

examples.ch: 比赛是为6岁至12岁的孩子而设的。
examples.en: The competition is open to children between six and twelve years of age.

examples.ch: 这间屋子不是极冷就是极热，从来都没有不冷不热的时候。
examples.en: The room was either extremely cold or hot, never anything in between (= in the middle).

defines.trans_en: in the period of time that separates two different times or events

examples.ch: 你不应该吃零食。
examples.en: You shouldn't eat between meals.

examples.ch: 课间有10分钟的休息时间。
examples.en: There is a break of ten minutes between classes.

examples.ch: 办公室午饭时间关闭，时间从12点半到1点半。
examples.en: The office is closed for lunch between 12.30 and 1.30.

examples.ch: 他泣不成声，呜咽着向他们诉说所发生的一切。
examples.en: In between sobs, he managed to tell them what had happened.

examples.ch: 他每个月都去看望父母，有时候去得更频繁一些。
examples.en: He visits his parents every month and sometimes in between.

defines.trans_ch: 在（两个或两个以上的人或事）之间
defines.trans_en: among two or more people or things

examples.ch: 那笔钱被平均分配给几个有价值的项目。
examples.en: The money was divided equally between several worthy causes.

examples.ch: 我们4个人分享了两瓶酒。
examples.en: We drank two bottles of wine between the four of us.

examples.ch: 在过去的一年里，两国之间的贸易额急剧增加。
examples.en: Trade between the two countries (= their trade with each other) has increased sharply in the past year.

examples.ch: 卡罗琳和她的母亲之间有许多相似之处。
examples.en: There is a great deal of similarity between Caroline and her mother (= they are very similar).

defines.trans_ch: （讨论、争论或比赛）发生在…之间
defines.trans_en: A discussion, argument, or game between two or more people or groups of people involves both people or groups.

examples.ch: 工会和资方的谈判已经破裂。
examples.en: The negotiations between the union and management have broken down.

examples.ch: 这两所学校之间的竞争一直很激烈。
examples.en: There has always been a fierce rivalry between the two schools.

examples.ch: 今晚的比赛在新奥尔良圣徒队和洛杉矶公羊队之间举行。
examples.en: Tonight's game is between the New Orleans Saints and the St. Louis Rams.

defines.trans_en: If you choose between two things, you choose one thing or the other.

defines.trans_en: connecting two or more places, things, or people

examples.ch: 调查表明哮喘病与大气污染有关。
examples.en: The survey shows a link between asthma and air pollution.

defines.trans_en: from one place to another

defines.trans_en: separating two places or things

examples.en: The wall between East and West Berlin came down in 1989.

examples.en: The RSPCA is a respected body working for animal welfare.

examples.en: There is a large body of people who are unaware of their basic rights.

examples.ch: 查茨沃斯高中的学生团体为该慈善机构筹集了5千美元。
examples.en: Chatsworth High School’s student body raised $5,000 for the charity.

defines.trans_en: a large amount of something

examples.ch: 有越来越多的证据支持他们的说法。
examples.en: There is a growing body of evidence to support their claim.

examples.ch: 她收集了大量有关这个主题的信息。
examples.en: She collected a huge body of information on the subject.

examples.ch: 很多人反对作任何变动。
examples.en: A substantial body of opinion (= a large group of people with the same opinion) is opposed to any change.

defines.trans_en: A body of water is a large area of water, such as a lake.
a separate object or mass

examples.ch: 每天都测量这两个天体在太空中的距离。
examples.en: The distance between the two bodies in space was measured daily.

defines.trans_en: a strong or thick quality

examples.ch: 这种波尔多葡萄酒味道浓郁香醇。
examples.en: This Bordeaux has plenty of body (= strong flavour).

examples.ch: 护发素能使你的头发更浓密。
examples.en: Conditioner can give your hair more body.

phrases.trans_ch: （以正式或官方的方式）全体一致地;一起地
phrases.trans_en: If people do something in a body, they do it together as a group, in an official way.

examples.ch: 清洁工一起去找经理投诉。
examples.en: The cleaning staff went in a body to the manager to complain.

phrases.trans_en: the main part of a book, article, etc.

examples.ch: 我认为本书最有趣的部分不在正文中，而在书后的注释中。
examples.en: I thought the most interesting details in the book were not in the body of the text, but in the notes at the end.

phrases.trans_en: the main part of a large building

examples.ch: 进入大教堂的主体部分
examples.en: to enter the body of the cathedral

defines.trans_en: to reach, or cause something to reach, the temperature at which a liquid starts to turn into a gas

examples.ch: 液态氮在很低的温度下就会达到沸点。
examples.en: Liquid nitrogen boils at a very low temperature.

examples.ch: 她被开水烫伤了。
examples.en: She scalded herself on some boiling water.

examples.ch: 如果你喂婴儿水喝，必须先把水烧开。
examples.en: If you give water to a small baby to drink, you have to boil it first.

defines.trans_en: to heat a container, especially one used for cooking, until the liquid in it starts to turn into a gas

examples.ch: 锅烧开了。
examples.en: The pan's boiling.

examples.ch: 你能给我烧壶水吗？
examples.en: Could you boil the kettle for me?

defines.trans_en: to cook food by putting it in water that is boiling

examples.ch: 晚饭我煮了些土豆。
examples.en: I've boiled some potatoes for dinner.

examples.ch: 煮熟的胡萝卜
examples.en: boiled carrots

defines.trans_en: to wash clothes in a container of very hot water
to be extremely angry

examples.ch: 他怒不可遏。
examples.en: He was boiling with rage.

phrases.trans_en: If a container or food boils dry, all the liquid in the container in which the food was cooking turns to gas.

defines.trans_en: a painful swelling on the skin that is filled with pus (= thick, yellow liquid)
the act of washing or cooking something in very hot water

phrases.trans_en: the state of boiling

examples.ch: 先把水烧开，再加入意大利面。
examples.en: Bring the water to the boil, then add the pasta.

examples.ch: 先把水烧开，再加入意大利面。
examples.en: Bring the water to a boil, then add the pasta.

examples.ch: 先将汤煮沸，然后关小火。
examples.en: Let the liquid come to a/the boil and then reduce the heat.

defines.trans_en: a written text that can be published in printed or electronic form

examples.ch: 你最近读到了什么好书吗？
examples.en: Have you read any good books recently?

examples.ch: 他刚出版了一本新书。
examples.en: He has a new book out (= published).

examples.ch: 她写了一本关于汽车保养的书。
examples.en: She wrote a book on car maintenance.

defines.trans_en: a set of pages that have been fastened together inside a cover to be read or written in

examples.ch: 硬封面/软封面书（精装/简装书）
examples.en: a hardback/paperback book

examples.ch: 我随身带了本书在飞机上看。
examples.en: I took a book with me to read on the plane.

examples.ch: 他把所有的开销都记在随身带着的一个小本子上。
examples.en: He writes all his expenses in a little book he carries with him.

defines.trans_en: one of the parts that a very long book, such as the Bible, is divided into

examples.ch: 《约伯记》
examples.en: the book of Job

defines.trans_ch: 簿册;（装订成册的）票据簿
defines.trans_en: a number of one type of thing fastened together flat inside a cover

examples.ch: 一封邮票／一本票据／一纸板火柴
examples.en: a book of stamps/tickets/matches

defines.trans_en: the situation in which a bookmaker accepts and pays out amounts of money that are risked on a particular result

examples.ch: 他们已经就下届世界杯赛的结果开设了赌局。
examples.en: They've already opened/started a book on the result of the next World Cup.

phrases.trans_en: the written records of money that a business has spent or received

examples.ch: 年终时会计要复核公司的账册。
examples.en: At the end of the year, the accountant goes over (= checks) the books.

examples.ch: 与以前相比现在管理一所学校更像是在经营一家企业——从法律上讲我们必须保证收支平衡。
examples.en: Running a school is much more of a business than it used to be, - by law we have to balance our books.

defines.trans_en: to arrange to have a seat, room, performer, etc. at a particular time in the future

examples.ch: 我已经为我们订了两张《卡门》的票。
examples.en: I've booked us two tickets to see "Carmen"/I've booked two tickets for us to see "Carmen".

examples.ch: 她已在他们最喜欢的餐厅预订了四人桌。
examples.en: She'd booked a table for four at their favourite restaurant.

examples.ch: 威尔预订了飞往洛杉矶的晚班客机的座位。
examples.en: Will booked a seat on the evening flight to Los Angeles.

examples.ch: 有人建议我们若想有房间住就早点预订。
examples.en: We were advised to book early if we wanted to get a room.

examples.ch: 他们为婚礼预约了一个爵士乐队。
examples.en: They booked a jazz band for their wedding.

examples.ch: 旅馆／饭店／剧院已预订满了。
examples.en: The hotel/restaurant/theatre is fully booked (up) (= all the rooms/tables/tickets have been taken).

examples.ch: 我很想去，但我周末之前的时间已排满了。
examples.en: I'd like to go but I'm booked up (= I have arranged to do other things) until the weekend.

defines.trans_ch: （警方）将…记录在案;（裁判）记名警告
defines.trans_en: If a police officer, referee, etc. books someone, they write down the person's name in an official record because they have done something wrong.

examples.ch: 足球比赛中，球员若受到两次警告就会被罚下场。
examples.en: A football player who is booked twice in a game is sent off the field.

examples.ch: 我奶奶上周因超速行驶被警方记录在案。
examples.en: My grandmother was booked for speeding last week.

defines.trans_en: a shelf in a bookcase
a shop or website where books are sold
a type of shoe that covers the whole foot and the lower part of the leg

examples.ch: 步行靴，远足靴
examples.en: walking boots

examples.ch: 马靴
examples.en: riding boots

defines.trans_en: a covered space at the back of a car, for storing things in

examples.ch: 我总是在汽车后备箱里放一条毯子和一个工具箱以备急用。
examples.en: I always keep a blanket and a toolkit in the boot for emergencies.

examples.ch: 被偷的物品在她汽车后备箱里发现了。
examples.en: Stolen goods were found in the boot of her car.

defines.trans_en: a kick with the foot

examples.ch: 他猛地踢了球一脚。
examples.en: He gave the ball a good boot.

defines.trans_ch: （惩罚违章停车的）车轮固定夹
defines.trans_en: a metal device attached to the wheel of an illegally parked car that will only be removed when the owner pays an amount of money

phrases.trans_ch: 解雇，开除（通常指因犯错误或表现差而失去工作）
phrases.trans_en: the situation in which your job is taken away from you, usually because you have done something wrong or badly

examples.ch: 她因为从收银机里偷钱而被解雇了。
examples.en: She got the boot for stealing money from the cash register.

examples.ch: 威廉斯已经被开除出队了。
examples.en: Williams has been given the boot from the team.

defines.trans_en: to kick someone or something hard with the foot

examples.ch: 他们猛踢他的头部。
examples.en: They booted him in the head.

defines.trans_en: When a computer boots (up), it becomes ready for use by getting the necessary information into its memory, and when you boot (up) a computer, you cause it to do this.

defines.trans_ch: 感到无聊的;感到厌烦的
defines.trans_en: feeling unhappy because something is not interesting or because you have nothing to do

examples.ch: 那是一个阴冷而潮湿的日子，孩子们都很无聊。
examples.en: It was a cold, wet day and the children were bored.

examples.ch: 每天都做同样的事他感到很厌倦。
examples.en: He was getting bored with/of doing the same thing every day.

defines.trans_en: not interesting or exciting

examples.ch: 她觉得歌剧很乏味。
examples.en: She finds opera boring.

examples.ch: 坐在飞机上没东西可读真是无聊。
examples.en: It's boring to sit on the plane with nothing to read.

examples.ch: 枯燥的讲座
examples.en: a boring lecture

examples.ch: 这部电影非常乏味，我都睡着了。
examples.en: The movie was so boring I fell asleep.

defines.trans_en: having started life in a particular way

examples.ch: 出生即为艾滋病携带者的婴儿在不断增加。
examples.en: The toll of babies born with AIDS is rising.

examples.ch: 史蒂维·旺德先天失明。
examples.en: Stevie Wonder was born blind.

defines.trans_en: If an idea is born, it starts to exist.

phrases.trans_en: to come out of a mother's body, and start to exist

examples.ch: 她生于1950年。
examples.en: She was born in 1950.

examples.ch: 我们看到小羊羔降生。
examples.en: We saw a lamb being born.

examples.ch: 黛安娜生于贵族之家。
examples.en: Diana was born into an aristocratic family.

examples.ch: 安出生于特拉华州并在那儿长大。
examples.en: Ann was born and brought up in Delaware.

phrases.trans_en: existing as the result of something

examples.ch: 迫于情势，她平生出一股勇气，拿起枪向他冲去。
examples.en: With a courage born of necessity, she seized the gun and ran at him.

defines.trans_en: having a natural ability or liking

examples.ch: 天生的作家／运动员
examples.en: a born writer/athlete

examples.ch: 我感到我天生擅长照料动物。
examples.en: I felt born to take care of animals.

defines.trans_en: born in the way, place, or order mentioned

examples.ch: 新生儿
examples.en: newborn

examples.ch: 本·奥克利是出生于尼日利亚的诗人和小说家。
examples.en: Ben Okri is a Nigerian-born poet and novelist.

examples.ch: 长子
examples.en: the first-born son

defines.trans_en: to get or receive something from someone with the intention of giving it back after a period of time

examples.ch: 我不得不从监考人员那里借了一支笔考试。
examples.en: I had to borrow a pen from the invigilator to do the exam.

examples.ch: 我可以从你那里借100镑下周还吗？
examples.en: Can I borrow £100 off you until next week?

examples.ch: 她过去常借钱不还。
examples.en: She used to borrow money and not bother to pay it back.

examples.ch: 他从图书馆里借了一本小说。
examples.en: He borrowed a novel from the library.

defines.trans_en: to take money from a bank or other financial organization and pay it back over a period of time

examples.ch: 像那时众多的公司一样，我们不得不靠大量借贷维持生存。
examples.en: Like so many companies at that time, we had to borrow heavily to survive.

examples.ch: 我们总是能从银行贷出些钱来。
examples.en: We could always borrow some money from the bank.

defines.trans_en: to take and use a word or idea from another language or piece of work

examples.ch: 英语从法语中借用了大量的词汇。
examples.en: English has borrowed many words from French.

defines.trans_en: to put a number into a different column when doing subtraction
a person, organization, etc. that borrows

examples.ch: 银行在招徕新的借款人。
examples.en: Banks are encouraging new borrowers.

defines.trans_en: a person, organization, etc. that borrows

examples.ch: 银行在招徕新的借款人。
examples.en: Banks are encouraging new borrowers.

defines.trans_en: the person who is in charge of an organization and who tells others what to do

examples.ch: 她曾是一家大型跨国公司的老板。
examples.en: She was the boss of a large international company.

examples.ch: 我开办了公司，现在自己当老板。
examples.en: I started up my own business and now I'm my own boss (= I work for myself and no one tells me what to do).

examples.ch: 你们家谁做主？
examples.en: Who's the boss (= the person who makes all the important decisions) in your house?

defines.trans_en: a raised rounded decoration, such as on a shield or a ceiling

defines.trans_ch: 对…发号施令;把…差来遣去
defines.trans_en: to tell someone what to do all the time

examples.ch: 但愿他不再把我差来遣去的。
examples.en: I wish he'd stop bossing me around/about.

defines.trans_en: very good or excellent

examples.ch: 那场聚会棒极了。
examples.en: It was a boss party.

defines.trans_en: (referring to) two people or things together

examples.ch: 我的父母都是教师。
examples.en: Both my parents are teachers.

examples.ch: 他们有两个子女，两人都住在国外。
examples.en: They have two children, both of whom live abroad.

examples.ch: 她写过两部小说，都被拍成了电视连续剧。
