examples.en: She has written two novels, both of which have been made into television series.

examples.ch: 迈克和吉姆都是红头发。
examples.en: Both Mike and Jim have red hair/Mike and Jim both have red hair.

examples.ch: 他们两人我都爱。
examples.en: I loved them both/I loved both of them.

examples.ch: 这两项提议共同的问题是都太不切合实际了。
examples.en: The problem with both of these proposals is that they are hopelessly impractical.

examples.ch: 我们两人都受到邀请了，还是只有你一人？
examples.en: Are both of us invited, or just you?

examples.ch: 你要牛奶还是糖，还是两个都要？
examples.en: Would you like milk or sugar or both?

examples.ch: 男人和女人都投诉过这个广告。
examples.en: Both men and women have complained about the advertisement.

examples.ch: 我感到既高兴又伤心。
examples.en: I felt both happy and sad at the same time.

examples.ch: 我觉得听取争论双方的意见是很重要的。
examples.en: I think it's important to listen to both sides of the argument.

examples.ch: 改善儿童保育设施对男女都会有好处，不仅仅是女性受益。
examples.en: Improved childcare facilities would benefit both sexes, not just women.

examples.ch: 我驾照考试没有通过，因为我没有始终用双手握方向盘。
examples.en: I failed my driving test because I didn't keep both hands on the steering wheel.

defines.trans_en: a container for liquids, usually made of glass or plastic, with a narrow neck

examples.ch: 牛奶瓶
examples.en: a milk bottle

examples.ch: 酒瓶
examples.en: a wine bottle

examples.ch: 一瓶啤酒／威士忌
examples.en: a bottle of beer/whisky

examples.ch: 塑料瓶比玻璃瓶轻。
examples.en: Plastic bottles are lighter than glass ones.

defines.trans_ch: （婴儿）奶瓶;奶瓶中的牛奶（或其他流质食物）
defines.trans_en: a special container with a rubber top for giving milk and other drinks to a baby

examples.ch: 婴儿醒来时用奶瓶给她喂奶。
examples.en: Give the baby her bottle when she wakes up.

examples.ch: 大多数医疗专家认为，母乳喂养比喂奶粉好。
examples.en: Most medical experts believe that breastfeeding is better than bottle-feeding.

defines.trans_en: courage or willingness to take risks

examples.ch: 做她所做的事需要极大的勇气。
examples.en: It took a lot of bottle to do what she did.

defines.trans_en: to put something into bottles or jars

examples.ch: 葡萄酒在葡萄园装瓶。
examples.en: The wine is bottled at the vineyard.

examples.ch: 把水果装瓶，就是把新鲜的水果装入特制的容器里。
examples.en: To bottle fruit you put fresh fruit into special containers.

phrases.trans_en: to not do something because you are frightened; to fail at something because you are frightened

examples.ch: 他本来应该罚点球的，可是退缩了。
examples.en: He should have taken the penalty but he bottled it.

defines.trans_en: the lowest part of something

examples.ch: 他站在楼梯的最下面抬头叫我。
examples.en: He stood at the bottom of the stairs and called up to me.

examples.ch: 补充信息见这一页的最下面。
examples.en: Extra information will be found at the bottom of the page.

examples.ch: 船已经沉到了海底。
examples.en: The ship had sunk to the bottom of the sea/the sea bottom.

examples.ch: 上学时，爱因斯坦是班上最后一名。
examples.en: At school, Einstein was (at the) bottom of (= the least successful student in) his class.

examples.ch: 宾馆的经理是30年前从最底层的搬运工开始做起的。
examples.en: The manager of the hotel started at the bottom (= in one of the least important jobs) 30 years ago, as a porter.

examples.ch: 通常情况是富人越来越富，社会底层的人却原地不动。
examples.en: The rich usually get richer, while the people at the bottom (= at the lowest position in society) stay there.

defines.trans_en: the farthest part of something

examples.ch: 他的脚从床尾伸了出去。
examples.en: His feet stuck out from the bottom of the bed.

examples.ch: 他们住在我们这条街的另一端。
examples.en: They live at the bottom of our street (= the other end of the street from us).

defines.trans_en: the part of your body that you sit on

examples.ch: 她摔了一跤，一屁股坐到了地上。
examples.en: She slipped and fell on her bottom.

phrases.trans_en: the lower part of a piece of clothing that consists of two parts

examples.ch: 我找到了我的比基尼泳裤，但找不到上半身。
examples.en: I've found my bikini bottoms but not my top.

examples.ch: 你看见我的睡裤了吗？
examples.en: Have you seen my pyjama bottoms anywhere?

defines.trans_en: a round container that is open at the top and is deep enough to hold fruit, sugar, etc.

examples.ch: 汤碗／麦片粥碗／色拉钵／糖钵
examples.en: a soup/cereal/salad/sugar bowl

examples.ch: 一碗汤／米饭／粥
examples.en: a bowl of soup/rice/porridge

examples.ch: 她每天早上吃一碗麦片粥。
examples.en: She eats a bowl (= the contents of a bowl) of cereal every morning.

examples.ch: 将面粉和发酵粉筛进搅拌钵里。
examples.en: Sift the flour and baking powder into a mixing bowl.

examples.ch: 将脏碟子放进洗碗盆好了，我一会儿再洗。
examples.en: Just put the dirty dishes in the washing-up bowl, and I'll do them later.

defines.trans_en: the rounded inside part of something

examples.ch: 抽水马桶破裂了，污迹斑斑，四周墙上到处都是霉点。
examples.en: The toilet bowl was cracked and stained, and the walls were covered in mould.

defines.trans_ch: 圆形运动场;圆形露天剧场
defines.trans_en: a large bowl-shaped building or structure, used for important sports events or musical performances

examples.ch: 好莱坞露天剧场
examples.en: the Hollywood Bowl

defines.trans_ch: （草地滚木球戏中所用的）木球;（保龄球运动中所用的）圆球
defines.trans_en: a large ball used in the game of bowls
(in the US) a special game of American football usually played after the season has finished

phrases.trans_en: a game played either outside on smooth grass or inside on an artificial surface, in which the players roll a large black or brown ball as close as possible to a smaller white ball

examples.ch: 草地滚球是英国最流行的运动之一。
examples.en: Bowls is one of the most popular sports in the UK .

defines.trans_en: to roll a ball along a smooth surface during a game of bowls or bowling
to throw a ball towards a batsman (= the player who hits the ball) using a vertical circular movement of the arm while running

examples.ch: 投了一小时球后普林格尔累了。
examples.en: Pringle was tired after bowling for an hour.

defines.trans_en: a square or rectangular container with stiff sides and sometimes a lid

examples.ch: 纸板箱
examples.en: a cardboard box

examples.ch: 雪茄烟盒
examples.en: a cigar box

examples.ch: 火柴盒
examples.en: a matchbox

defines.trans_ch: 一箱（或一盒、一匣）的容量
defines.trans_en: a box and its contents, or just the contents of a box

examples.ch: 一盒火柴
examples.en: a box of matches

examples.ch: 他吃了整整一盒巧克力。
examples.en: He ate a whole box of chocolates.

defines.trans_en: a piece of hard plastic worn by men to protect their sex organs when playing a sport

defines.trans_ch: （表格上的）方框，方格；（体育场、道路等上）以线标出的特定区域
defines.trans_en: any square or rectangular space on a form, sports field, road, etc., separated from the main area by lines

examples.ch: 如果你需要更多的信息，请在这个方框内打钩。
examples.en: If you would like more information, put an X in the box.

defines.trans_ch: （足球场上的）罚球区，禁区（同 penalty area）
defines.trans_en:
→ 
penalty area

defines.trans_ch: （前方通畅时方可驶入的）路口方形黄线区域
defines.trans_en: a place where two roads cross, marked with a square of yellow lines painted in the centre, that you can drive over only when the road in front is clear
a small space with walls

examples.ch: 陪审团席／公用电话亭
examples.en: a jury/phone box

examples.ch: 他们的新房子非常小。
examples.en: Their new house is just a box (= very small).

defines.trans_en: a small area with seats that is separate from the other seats in a theatre or at the side of a sports field

examples.ch: 你能看见王室专用包厢里的查尔斯王子吗？
examples.en: Can you see Prince Charles in the royal box?

defines.trans_en: a box with a number in a post office to which your letters can be sent and from which you can collect them
a small evergreen tree (= one that never loses its leaves) with small, shiny leaves

phrases.trans_en: television

examples.ch: 今晚的电视没有什么值得一看的。
examples.en: There's nothing worth watching on the box tonight.

defines.trans_en: to fight someone in the sport of boxing

examples.ch: 他以前每个周末都打拳击。
examples.en: He used to box every weekend.

examples.ch: 我曾和一些最好的拳击手较量过。
examples.en: I've boxed (against) some of the best.

defines.trans_ch: 把…装箱，把…置于箱（或盒子）内
defines.trans_en: to put something in a box

examples.ch: 我把一些衣服和书装进箱子里准备捐给慈善机构。
examples.en: I boxed up some clothes and books to donate to charity.

defines.trans_en: a male child or, more generally, a male of any age

examples.ch: 十几岁的男孩
examples.en: a teenage/adolescent boy

examples.ch: 我爸爸小时候常常要走3英里路去上学。
examples.en: As a young boy, my father used to walk three miles to school.

examples.ch: 你真是个调皮的男孩！
examples.en: You've been a very naughty boy!

examples.ch: 他们的小儿子病得很重。
examples.en: Their little boy (= their young son) is very sick.

examples.ch: 好了，孩子们，安静下来！
examples.en: All right, boys and girls, settle down!

phrases.trans_en: a group of male friends

examples.ch: 他以前周五晚上喜欢与哥们儿在一起。
examples.en: He used to like spending Friday nights with the boys.

phrases.trans_ch: （对本国士兵的昵称）子弟兵，士兵们
phrases.trans_en: an approving way of speaking about your country's soldiers

examples.ch: 我们不应该忘记那些远离家乡在外服役的子弟兵们。
examples.en: We must not forget our boys serving far from home.

phrases.trans_en: a typical male

examples.ch: 他踢足球，喝啤酒，总的说来是典型的男人作为。
examples.en: He plays baseball, drinks a lot of beer and generally acts like one of the boys.

defines.trans_en: used to express excitement, worry, disappointment, etc. or to emphasize something

examples.ch: 好家伙，那可真棒！
examples.en: Boy, that was good!

defines.trans_en: a device that makes a vehicle go slower or stop, or a pedal, bar, or handle that makes this device work

examples.ch: 她的自行车没有车闸。
examples.en: She had no brakes on her bicycle.

examples.ch: 司机突然踩了刹车。
examples.en: The driver suddenly put on his brakes.

examples.ch: 我赶忙踩刹车，可已经来不及了。
examples.en: I slammed on (= quickly used) the brakes, but it was too late.

examples.ch: 我们所有的新车型都有防抱死刹车。
examples.en: All our new models have anti-lock brakes.

phrases.trans_en: the loud, unpleasant noise of a car suddenly stopping

examples.ch: 突然间，我们听到一声尖锐的刹车声，看到一辆车猛然转向去闪避一辆自行车。
examples.en: Suddenly we heard a screech of brakes and saw the car swerve to miss the bicycle.

defines.trans_en: to make a vehicle go slower or stop, using its brake or brakes

examples.ch: 路面有冰时要慢慢刹车。
examples.en: When it's icy, brake gently.

examples.ch: 他总是开得飞快，然后在最后一刻再猛地刹车。
examples.en: He would drive very fast and brake hard/sharply at the last minute.

defines.trans_en: a food made from flour, water, and usually yeast, mixed together and baked

examples.ch: 一片面包
examples.en: a slice of bread

examples.ch: 一条面包
examples.en: a loaf of bread

examples.ch: 白／黑面包
examples.en: white/brown bread

examples.ch: 全麦面包
examples.en: wholemeal (US whole -wheat) bread

examples.ch: 切片面包
examples.en: sliced bread

examples.ch: 这面包是新鲜的／变味了。
examples.en: This bread is fresh/stale.

examples.ch: 你自己烤面包吗？
examples.en: Do you bake your own bread?

defines.trans_ch: 破碎，破裂；打破；打断；损坏，弄坏
defines.trans_en: to (cause something to) separate suddenly or violently into two or more pieces, or to (cause something to) stop working by being damaged

examples.ch: 碟子掉到地上摔碎了。
examples.en: The dish fell to the floor and broke.

examples.ch: 查尔斯老是打碎东西。
examples.en: Charles is always breaking things.

examples.ch: 她摔断了胳膊。
examples.en: She fell and broke her arm (= broke the bone in her arm).

examples.ch: 我把花瓶掉在地上摔碎了。
examples.en: I dropped the vase and it broke into pieces.

examples.ch: 我想我弄坏了你的电话。
examples.en: I think I've broken your phone.

examples.ch: 我把它捡了起来，可手柄断了。
examples.en: I picked it up and the handle broke off.

examples.ch: 我们听见玻璃破碎的声音。
examples.en: We heard the sound of breaking glass.

defines.trans_en: to destroy or end something, or to come to an end

examples.ch: 最后终于有人开口打破了沉默。
examples.en: Eventually someone spoke, breaking the silence.

examples.ch: 她大笑起来，打破了紧张气氛。
examples.en: She laughed and that broke the tension.

examples.ch: 敌人无法破译密码。
examples.en: The enemy were unable to break the code (= understand it and so make it useless).

examples.ch: 外面的工人被调进来以结束罢工。
examples.en: Outside workers were brought in in an attempt to break (= end) the strike.

defines.trans_en: to fail to keep a law, rule, or promise

examples.ch: 他不知道自己的行为是犯法的。
examples.en: He didn't know he was breaking the law (= doing something illegal).

examples.ch: 她违背了对我的诺言。
examples.en: She broke her promise/word to me (= did not do what she promised she would).

defines.trans_en: to (cause something to) divide into two or more parts or groups

examples.ch: 这些酶在胃中分解食物。
examples.en: These enzymes break down food in the stomach (= cause food to separate into smaller pieces).

examples.ch: 我叫她把日常开支细分为食品、旅行和个人花销。
examples.en: I asked her to break her expenses down into food, travel and personal costs.

defines.trans_en: to interrupt or to stop something for a short period

examples.ch: 我们通常12点半休息吃午饭。
examples.en: We usually break for lunch at 12.30.

examples.ch: 我需要做点什么来打发打字工作的单调。
examples.en: I needed something to break the monotony of my typing job.

examples.ch: 电话铃响了，打断了我的注意。
examples.en: The phone rang, breaking my concentration.

examples.ch: 他们决定在新加坡稍作停留。
examples.en: They decided to break their journey in Singapore.

defines.trans_en: to go somewhere or do something by force

examples.ch: 他威胁要砸门进来。
examples.en: He threatened to break the door down (= enter using force).

examples.ch: 那匹马想从马厩里挣脱出去。
examples.en: The horse tried to break free from its stable.

examples.ch: 暴风雨中船脱开了缆绳。
examples.en: In the storm the boat broke loose from its moorings.

examples.ch: 盗贼撬开保险箱偷走了钻石。
examples.en: The thieves broke the safe open and stole the diamonds.

examples.ch: 警方强行制止了打斗。
examples.en: The police broke up the fight (= ended it forcefully).

examples.ch: 她用力挣脱了他的手，跑开了。
examples.en: She broke his grip and ran away.

defines.trans_ch: （使）（自控能力、信心、意志等）崩溃
defines.trans_en: to lose your confidence, determination, or ability to control yourself, or to make someone do this

examples.ch: 他觉得她在压力之下会崩溃的。
examples.en: He thought she would break under the strain.

examples.ch: 他们企图使他失去自控，但他顶住了。
examples.en: They tried to break his will (= make him lose his control) but he resisted.

defines.trans_en: to become known or to make something become known

examples.ch: 丑闻曝光后，首席执行官立刻辞职了。
examples.en: When the scandal broke (= came to the public's attention), the CEO resigned immediately.

examples.ch: 是当地的报纸首先披露了这件事。
examples.en: It was the local newspaper that first broke the story (= told the public).

defines.trans_en: (of waves) to reach and move over the beach, hit a cliff or wall, etc.

examples.ch: 一个大浪打在岸边／冲上了轮船。
examples.en: A huge wave broke on/against the shore/over the boat.

defines.trans_en: (of the weather) to change suddenly and usually become worse

examples.ch: 天气预报说炎热的天气将在今天发生骤变。
examples.en: The forecast is for the hot weather to break today.

defines.trans_en: (of a storm) to start suddenly

examples.ch: 我们抵达时正是风暴突起之时。
examples.en: We arrived just as a storm was breaking.

defines.trans_en: When a boy's voice breaks it begins to sound like a man's.

examples.ch: 他是13岁的时候变嗓的。
examples.en: His voice broke when he was 13.

defines.trans_en: If someone's voice breaks, it changes because of strong emotions.

examples.ch: 当她苦苦哀求让她的孩子回来时激动得嗓音都变了调。
examples.en: Her voice was breaking with emotion as she pleaded for her child's return.

defines.trans_en: If a football team breaks, it gets the ball in its own half and attacks quickly into the opposing team's half.

examples.ch: 蓝队（切尔西队）快速反击，打了狼队（伍尔弗汉普顿流浪队）一个措手不及。
examples.en: Blues broke quickly, catching Wolves on the back foot.

phrases.trans_en: to do something better than the best known speed, time, number, etc. previously achieved

examples.ch: 她打破了5000米的纪录。
examples.en: She broke the record for the 5,000 metres.

phrases.trans_en: When dawn or day breaks, the sun starts to appear in the sky early in the morning.

examples.ch: 城市上空，天光破晓。
examples.en: Dawn broke over the city.

phrases.trans_en: (in tennis) to win a game in which another player is serving (= hitting the ball first)

examples.ch: 纳达尔在第二盘中破了契利奇的发球局。
examples.en: Nadal broke Cilic's serve in the second set.

defines.trans_en: an interruption

examples.ch: 雨终于停了，我们都出来了。
examples.en: Finally there was a break in the rain and we went out.

defines.trans_en: the short period of advertisements between television programmes

examples.ch: 下次插播广告时我去给大家泡杯茶。
examples.en: I'll make us a cup of tea in the next break.

defines.trans_ch: 休息；（用茶点的）休息时间
defines.trans_en: a short period of rest, when food or drink is sometimes eaten

examples.ch: 喝咖啡的休息时间
examples.en: a coffee break

examples.ch: 茶歇
examples.en: a tea break

examples.ch: 午／晚餐时间
examples.en: a lunch/dinner break

examples.ch: 我们三点半再休息一次。
examples.en: We'll take another break at 3.30.

examples.ch: 他们连续工作了一个晚上。
examples.en: They worked through the night without a break.

examples.ch: 你通常上午／下午中间休息吗？
examples.en: Do you usually take a morning/afternoon break?

defines.trans_en: the regular time in the middle of the morning or afternoon, for school students to talk or play, and sometimes have food or drink

examples.ch: 我们课间休息时在谈论这事。
examples.en: We were talking about it at break.

defines.trans_ch: （中断工作或日常活动的）休息时间;假期
defines.trans_en: a time away from work or your regular activity, or a holiday

examples.ch: 请两个星期的假吧——你需要休息。
examples.en: Take a couple of weeks off - you need a break.

examples.ch: 今年的圣诞假期有多长？
examples.en: How long is the Christmas break this year?

examples.ch: 我们决定在巴黎停留一下／休春假／休寒假／度周末。
examples.en: We decided to have a short/spring/winter/weekend break in Paris.

examples.ch: 我将在圣诞节休假期间看你的报告。
examples.en: I'll read your report over (= during) the Christmas break.

examples.ch: 我需要休息一段时间，不打字。
examples.en: I need a break from typing.

defines.trans_en: an opportunity for improving a situation, especially one that happens unexpectedly

examples.ch: 她在斯皮尔伯格执导的影片中得到了一个角色，她的机会来了。
examples.en: Her big break came when she was offered a role in a Spielberg movie.

defines.trans_en: a place where something has broken

examples.ch: 管子上有道裂缝。
examples.en: There's a break in the pipe.

defines.trans_en: the end of a relationship, connection, or way of doing something

examples.ch: 他们决定不给女儿起名为简，这违背了家族传统。
examples.en: Their decision to not name their daughter Jane was a break with family tradition.

defines.trans_en: in tennis, a game won by the player who was not serving (= hitting the ball first)

examples.ch: 穆雷必须再破对方一个发球局才能赢。
examples.en: Murray must get another break (of serve) to win.

defines.trans_ch: （斯诺克和台球中的）一杆得分，一次连续得分
defines.trans_en: in snooker and billiards, the number of points that a player gets during one turn at hitting the balls
in football, an occasion when a defending team gains possession of the ball in its own half and attacks quickly into the opposing team's half

phrases.trans_ch: 给…一些休息时间;让…有机会搁下日常的活动或工作
phrases.trans_en: to allow someone some time away from their work or regular activities

examples.ch: 每周五我都负责照看孩子，好给她一点休息的时间。
examples.en: I babysit every Friday to give her a break.

phrases.trans_en: to stop criticizing or annoying someone, or behaving in an unpleasant way

examples.ch: 饶了她吧——她还只是个孩子，况且她并无恶意。
examples.en: Give her a break - she's only a child and she didn't mean any harm.

phrases.trans_ch: 与…结束关系（尤指不再住在一起）;改变（一贯的行为）
phrases.trans_en: to stop having a close relationship with someone, especially stop living with them , or to change a course of action that you have had for a long time

examples.ch: 那份工作你已干了多年了——是时候改变一下了。
examples.en: You've been in your job for years - it's time you made a break.

examples.ch: 结束一段感情最好是彻底一刀两断。
examples.en: When a relationship ends, it's often best to make a clean/complete break (= suddenly and completely stop seeing each other).

phrases.trans_en: to escape from/towards somewhere or something, often by force

examples.ch: 几年前一群犯人越狱逃跑了。
examples.en: A group of prisoners made a break from the jail a few years back.

examples.ch: 那只猫向门口跑去。
examples.en: The cat made a break for the door.

examples.ch: 他一放开我，我马上就遛了。
examples.en: When he let go, I made a break for it (= escaped quickly).

phrases.trans_en: the time when the sun rises in the morning

examples.ch: 我们破晓时分出发。
examples.en: We set out at break of day.

defines.trans_en: a meal eaten in the morning as the first meal of the day

examples.ch: 你早餐想吃什么?
examples.en: What do you want for breakfast?

examples.ch: 简从来不吃早饭。
examples.en: Jane never eats breakfast.

examples.ch: 她早饭后不久就到了。
examples.en: She arrived shortly after breakfast.

examples.ch: 食堂8点半到10点供应早餐。
examples.en: Breakfast is served in the dining room from 8.30 till 10.00.

examples.ch: 周六我喜欢在床上吃早饭。
examples.en: I love to eat breakfast in bed on Saturdays.

defines.trans_en: to eat breakfast

examples.ch: 她通常独自一人吃早饭。
examples.en: She usually breakfasts alone.

examples.ch: 他们早饭匆忙吃了点烤面包片，喝了点茶。
examples.en: They breakfasted hurriedly on coffee and toast (= ate coffee and toast for breakfast).

defines.trans_en: a structure that is built over a river, road, or railway to allow people and vehicles to cross from one side to the other

examples.ch: 我们开车驶过大桥。
examples.en: We drove across/over the bridge.

examples.ch: 布鲁克林大桥
examples.en: the Brooklyn Bridge

defines.trans_en: something that makes it easier to make a change from one situation to another

examples.ch: 兼职工作可以作为从不工作过渡到全职工作的桥梁。
examples.en: Part-time work can provide a bridge between staying at home and working full-time.

defines.trans_en: the raised part of a ship on which the captain and other officers stand and from where they control the movement of the ship
the top part of the nose, between the eyes, or (on a pair of glasses) the piece that is supported by the top part of the nose

examples.ch: 那一拳正好打在他的鼻梁上。
examples.en: The blow caught him right on the bridge of his nose.

defines.trans_en: a card game for four players who play in pairs

defines.trans_ch: 齿桥（装于真牙上以固定假牙的架子）
defines.trans_en: a piece of material that contains one or more artificial teeth and is kept in place by being fastened to the natural teeth
a small piece of wood over which the strings are stretched on a musical instrument such as a guitar or violin
to make the difference or division between two things smaller or less severe

examples.ch: 我们必须消除劳资双方的鸿沟。
examples.en: We must bridge the gap between employees and management.

defines.trans_en: to build a bridge over or across something

examples.ch: 在河流的最窄处架起了桥。
examples.en: The river had been bridged at its narrowest point.

defines.trans_ch: 颇有才气的，聪颖的;技艺高超的
defines.trans_en: extremely intelligent or skilled

examples.ch: 她母亲是一位才华横溢的科学家。
examples.en: Her mother was a brilliant scientist.

examples.ch: 他的表演非常出色。
examples.en: He gave a brilliant performance.

examples.ch: 这个想法太高明了。
examples.en: The idea was quite brilliant.

examples.ch: 她似乎前途灿烂。
examples.en: She seemed to have a brilliant career ahead of her (= was likely to be extremely successful).

defines.trans_ch: 光明的，明亮的;（颜色）鲜艳的
defines.trans_en: full of light, shining, or bright in colour

examples.ch: 天空晴朗无云，一片蔚蓝。
examples.en: The sky was a brilliant, cloudless blue.

examples.ch: 明亮的灯光晃花了我的眼睛。
examples.en: I was dazzled by a brilliant light.

defines.trans_en: very good

examples.ch: “你喜欢这部电影吗?”“我觉得它非常棒。”
examples.en: "Did you like the film?" "I thought it was brilliant."

examples.ch: 她极富幽默感。
examples.en: She's got a brilliant sense of humour.

examples.ch: 噢，太棒了！我的包裹到了。
examples.en: Oh, brilliant! My parcel's arrived.

defines.trans_en: to take or carry someone or something to a place or a person, or in the direction of the person speaking

examples.ch: “我要不要带点东西参加聚会?”“噢，带瓶酒就行。”
examples.en: "Shall I bring anything to the party?" "Oh, just a bottle."

examples.ch: 把那把刀递给我。
examples.en: Bring me that knife/Bring that knife to me.

examples.ch: 你能帮我把买的东西拿进屋里吗？
examples.en: Can you help me bring in the shopping (= take it into the house)?

examples.ch: 警方带了几个人回警局问话。
examples.en: The police brought several men in for questioning (= took them to the police station because they might have been involved in a crime).

examples.ch: 他们来看我们时总是把狗带来。
examples.en: When they visit us they always bring their dog with them.

defines.trans_en: to cause, result in, or produce a state or condition

examples.ch: 这些年来她给我们带来了很多快乐。
examples.en: She's brought us so much happiness over the years.

examples.ch: 爆炸将整座建筑物夷为平地。
examples.en: The explosion brought the whole building crashing to the ground.

examples.ch: 有几棵树被暴风雨刮倒了。
examples.en: Several trees were brought down (= made to fall) by the storm.

examples.ch: 工厂的倒闭使那个镇陷入了贫困。
examples.en: The closure of the factory brought poverty to the town (= resulted in it becoming poor).

examples.ch: 把水烧开。
examples.en: Bring the water to the boil (= make it start boiling).

examples.ch: 她突然中止了面试。
examples.en: She suddenly brought the interview to an end.

examples.ch: 她的悲惨故事惹得我伤心落泪。
examples.en: Her tragic story brought tears to my eyes (= made me cry).

examples.ch: 这些难民将来会怎样呢？
examples.en: What will the future bring for these refugees?

defines.trans_en: to make or begin as part of an official legal process

examples.ch: 他因斗殴被捕，但警方决定不予起诉。
examples.en: He was arrested for fighting, but the police have decided not to bring charges.

phrases.trans_en: to cause someone to come to a particular place or thing

examples.ch: 这个话题让我谈到了讨论的第二部分。
examples.en: This subject brings me to the second part of the discussion.

examples.ch: 什么风把你吹到迈阿密来了？
examples.en: What brings you (= why have you come) to Miami?

defines.trans_en: a man or boy with the same parents as another person

examples.ch: 你有兄弟姐妹吗？
examples.en: Do you have any brothers and sisters?

examples.ch: 我有3个兄弟和1个妹妹。
examples.en: I have three brothers and a sister.

examples.ch: 约翰尼是我的弟弟／哥哥／大哥／小弟弟。
examples.en: Johnny is my younger/older/big/baby/little brother.

examples.ch: 我哥哥住在华盛顿。
examples.en: My brother lives in Washington.

defines.trans_en: a man who is a member of the same group as you or who shares an interest with you or has a similar way of thinking to you

examples.ch: 弟兄们，团结起来，共同抵抗这不公平的法律！
examples.en: "Let us unite, brothers and fight this unjust law!"

defines.trans_ch: （有时用于黑人男性间的称呼）老弟，老兄
defines.trans_en: sometimes used by a black man to address or refer to another black man

defines.trans_ch: （同一宗教组织的）男性教友，修士
defines.trans_en: used as the title of a man, such as a monk, who belongs to a religious organization

examples.ch: 迈克尔修士和约翰修士进行了深入的交谈。
examples.en: Brother Michael and Brother John were deep in conversation.

examples.ch: 上帝保佑你，教士。
examples.en: Bless you, Brother.

defines.trans_en: the colour of chocolate or soil

examples.ch: 深褐色／浅褐色
examples.en: dark/light brown

defines.trans_en: to make food brown by cooking it

examples.ch: 加西红柿之前先把洋葱炒至略呈褐色。
examples.en: Lightly brown the onion before adding the tomatoes.

examples.ch: 把肉炒成褐色再加蔬菜。
examples.en: Allow the meat to brown before adding the vegetables.

defines.trans_en: to make something by putting bricks or other materials together

examples.ch: 他们正在河边建新房子。
examples.en: They're building new houses by the river.

examples.ch: 鸟儿们在树上筑巢。
examples.en: The birds built their nest in the tree.

examples.ch: 这些老房子是用石头砌的。
examples.en: These old houses are built (= made) of stone.

examples.ch: 承包商开始在离城镇不远的废弃土地上建房。
examples.en: Contractors have started building on waste land near the town.

defines.trans_en: to create and develop something over a long period of time

examples.ch: 我们想为孩子创造更美好的未来。
examples.en: We want to build a better future for our children.

defines.trans_en: the size and shape of a person's body

examples.ch: 她身材苗条，一头黑色的短发。
examples.en: She was of slim build with short, dark hair.

defines.trans_en: a structure with walls and a roof, such as a house or factory

examples.ch: 一度空荡荡的地方现在布满了建筑物。
examples.en: The once-empty site was now covered with buildings.

defines.trans_en: the process or business of making structures such as houses or factories

examples.ch: 建筑造价
examples.en: building costs

examples.ch: 在开餐馆以前他做建筑生意起家。
examples.en: He started off in the building trade before opening his own restaurant.

defines.trans_ch: 汉堡包;（汉堡式的）夹心饼
defines.trans_en: meat or other food pressed into a round, flat shape and fried

examples.ch: 一份汉堡包和薯条
examples.en: a burger and fries

examples.ch: 汉堡包
examples.en: a hamburger

examples.ch: 蔬菜夹心饼
examples.en: a veggie burger

defines.trans_ch: （把…）烧坏;（使）烧伤;（使）烧毁;（使）晒伤;（使）烫伤
defines.trans_en: to be hurt, damaged, or destroyed by fire or extreme heat, or to cause this to happen

examples.ch: 他在大火中严重烧伤。
examples.en: He was badly burned in the blaze.

examples.ch: 她烧掉了他的旧日情书。
examples.en: She burned his old love letters.

examples.ch: 白兰地喝下去后我感到喉咙里火辣辣的。
examples.en: The brandy burned (= felt too hot on) my throat.

examples.ch: 到加勒比海的第一天，乔西就晒伤了。
examples.en: On her first day in the Caribbean Josie was badly burned (= her skin became red and painful from too much sun).

examples.ch: 白皮肤的人很容易晒伤。
examples.en: Fair-skinned people burn easily in the sun.

examples.ch: 由于未能逃脱，有6个人在大楼里被活活烧死。
examples.en: Unable to escape, six people were burned alive/burned to death (= died by burning) in the building.

examples.ch: 蔬菜烧焦了。
examples.en: The vegetables were burned to a crisp (= badly burned).

defines.trans_en: to cause emotional pain or damage to someone
to be on fire, or to produce flames

examples.ch: 木头湿了，烧不着。
examples.en: The wood was wet and would not burn.

examples.ch: 我们无助地看着房子在燃烧。
examples.en: Helplessly we watched our house burning.

examples.ch: 壁炉里火烧得正旺。
examples.en: A fire was burning brightly in the fireplace.

defines.trans_en: to produce light

examples.ch: 我看见了她窗口的灯光。
examples.en: I saw a light burning in her window.

defines.trans_en: If your face burns, it feels very hot.

examples.ch: 他因尴尬／羞愧／愤怒而感到脸上发烫。
examples.en: His face burned with embarrassment/shame/anger.

defines.trans_en: to want to do something very much

examples.ch: 她迫不及待想把她的消息告诉我们。
examples.en: She was burning to tell us her news.

defines.trans_ch: 把（信息、音乐、图片等）复制（到光盘上）;刻录
defines.trans_en: to copy information, recorded music, images, etc. onto a CD

examples.ch: 把你最喜欢的歌曲或重要的文件刻录到光盘上。
examples.en: Burn your favourite songs or your important files onto CDs.

phrases.trans_en: to kill someone by tying the person to a post and burning them
to completely destroy a building by fire

examples.ch: 这幢建筑10年前被烧毁了。
examples.en: The building was burned to the ground ten years ago.

defines.trans_ch: 烧伤（的痕迹）;烫伤（的痕迹）
defines.trans_en: a place where fire or heat has hurt or damaged something

examples.ch: 一名营救人员在爆炸中身上多处严重烧伤。
examples.en: One rescue worker caught in the explosion sustained severe burns.

examples.ch: 我注意到地毯上有烟头烫出的痕迹。
examples.en: I noticed a cigarette burn in the carpet.

defines.trans_en: a small stream

defines.trans_ch: （带幽默的嘲讽用语。）真惨！糗大了！
defines.trans_en: an insult or criticism, usually a clever and funny one

examples.ch: 她说你对她来说太老了？噢，糗大了！
examples.en: She said you were too old for her? Ooh, burn!

defines.trans_en: a large vehicle in which people are driven from one place to another

examples.ch: 如果你想看风景，应该乘公共汽车去。
examples.en: You should take the bus/go by bus (= travel by bus) if you want to see the sights.

defines.trans_ch: （计算机中的）总线，其不同输出线路向计算机各部件传送数据
defines.trans_en: a set of wires in a computer along which information can be sent to and from other parts of the computer
to take people somewhere by bus

examples.ch: 示威者乘车从全国各地来参加抗议集会。
examples.en: Demonstrators were bussed in from all parts of the state to attend the protest rally.

defines.trans_en: to take children by bus to school in another area every day
the activity of buying and selling goods and services

examples.ch: 我哥哥经商。
examples.en: My brother's in business.

examples.ch: 他做冷冻食品生意。
examples.en: He's in the frozen food business.

examples.ch: 我们公司与海外客户的生意往来很多。
examples.en: Our firm does a lot of business with overseas customers.

examples.ch: 最后他们找到了一个他们觉得可以与其愉快合作的顾问。
examples.en: Eventually they found a consultant they felt they could do business with (= with whom they could work well).

examples.ch: 目前在该地区经营的公司比以往任何时候都少。
examples.en: Currently, there are fewer firms in business (= operating) in the area than ever before.

examples.ch: 这项新的税收将导致许多小企业倒闭。
examples.en: This new tax will put a lot of small firms out of business (= they will stop operating).

examples.ch: 她自己开办公司提供管理咨询服务。
examples.en: She set up in business (= started her own company) as a management consultant.

defines.trans_en: a particular company that buys and sells goods and services

examples.ch: 兄弟俩开了家服装零售商店。
examples.en: The two brothers established/set up/started up a clothes retailing business.

examples.ch: 她经营自己的印刷公司。
examples.en: She runs her own printing business.

examples.ch: 他们向家族公司投入了许多金钱。
examples.en: They put a lot of money into the family business.

defines.trans_en: work that you do to earn money

examples.ch: 我在巴尔的摩出差。
examples.en: I'm in Baltimore on business.

examples.ch: 商务会面
examples.en: a business appointment

defines.trans_en: the amount of work done or the number of goods or services sold by a company or organization

examples.ch: 生意兴隆。
examples.en: Business is good/brisk/booming/flourishing (= I'm selling a lot).

examples.ch: 生意清淡。
examples.en: Business is bad/slack/quiet (= I'm not selling much).

examples.ch: 现在生意怎么样？
examples.en: How is business (= are you selling much) at the moment?

defines.trans_ch: 状况;事，事情;事务;重要事件
defines.trans_en: a situation or activity, often one that you are giving your opinion about

examples.ch: 筹划一趟出国旅行是件很费时的事。
examples.en: Arranging a trip abroad is a time-consuming business.

examples.ch: 这些谋杀是非常可怕的事。
examples.en: These killings are a horrible business.

examples.ch: 我觉得核查每月账目是我的责任。
examples.en: I make it my business (= I feel it is my particular duty) to check the monthly accounts.

examples.ch: 我们还有一些未了结的事务需要讨论。
examples.en: We have some unfinished business to discuss (= we still have something important to discuss).

defines.trans_en: the things that you do or the matters that relate only to you

examples.ch: 我开始填表格。
examples.en: I started on the business of filling out the form.

examples.ch: 她如何生活是她自己的事。
examples.en: What she does with her life is her business.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指公司高层的）商界人士;实业家
defines.trans_en: a man who works in business, especially one who has a high position in a company

examples.ch: 在成为作家之前，他是一位成功的实业家。
examples.en: He was a successful businessman before becoming a writer.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指公司高层的）商界女性;女实业家
defines.trans_en: a woman who works in business, especially one who has a high position in a company

examples.ch: 她是个不错／精明的实业家。
examples.en: She's a good/shrewd businesswoman.

defines.trans_en: a place where buses start and end their routes

defines.trans_ch: 公共汽车站，公共汽车停靠站
defines.trans_en: a place, usually with a pole with a sign, where a bus stops to allow passengers to get on and off
If you are busy, you are working hard, or giving your attention to a particular thing.

examples.ch: 妈妈在厨房里忙着呢。
examples.en: Mum was busy in the kitchen.

examples.ch: 孩子们在忙着做家庭作业。
examples.en: The kids are busy with their homework.

examples.ch: 她在忙着写婚礼请柬。
examples.en: She's busy writing out the wedding invitations.

examples.ch: 我有很多工作，够你忙活的。
examples.en: I've got plenty of jobs to keep you busy.

examples.ch: 他忙着说话没有注意到我们进来。
examples.en: He was too busy talking to notice us come in.

defines.trans_en: A busy place is full of activity or people.

examples.ch: 繁忙的餐馆
examples.en: a busy restaurant

examples.ch: 他们的房子临近热闹的马路。
examples.en: Their house is near a very busy road.

defines.trans_en: In a busy period, you have a lot of things to do.

examples.ch: 我未来的一周会很忙。
examples.en: I have a busy week ahead of me.

examples.ch: 你忙了一天了。
examples.en: You've had a busy day.

defines.trans_en: If a phone line is busy, someone is using it.

examples.ch: 我试过给你打电话，可是电话占线。
examples.en: I tried calling you but the line was busy.

defines.trans_ch: 繁琐的，杂乱的；使人眼花缭乱的
defines.trans_en: having too much decoration or too many colours

examples.ch: 对我来说，这件夹克太花哨了——我喜欢简单一点的。
examples.en: The jacket was a bit too busy for my tastes - I'd prefer something plainer.

phrases.trans_en: to make the time pass by doing something

examples.ch: 我整理书桌来打发时间。
examples.en: I busied myself with tidying up my desk.

defines.trans_en: used to introduce an added statement, usually something that is different from what you have said before

examples.ch: 她工作很努力，但缺乏想象力。
examples.en: She's very hard-working but not very imaginative.

examples.ch: 这并不是恶意而为，只是由于无知。
examples.en: This is not caused by evil, but by simple ignorance.

examples.ch: 这出戏还可以，但也不是多好——我看过更好的。
examples.en: The play's good, but not that good - I've seen better.

examples.ch: 对不起，我觉得你不能说她是故意那么做的。
examples.en: I'm sorry, but I think you're wrong when you say she did it deliberately.

examples.ch: 叫我老古董好了，反正我喜欢手写的信。
examples.en: Call me old-fashioned, but I like handwritten letters.

examples.ch: 我可以理解他很不快乐，但自杀有点太极端了吧！
examples.en: I can understand his unhappiness. But to attempt suicide!

examples.ch: “她说她要走。”“可是为什么呢?”
examples.en: "She said she's leaving." "But why?"

examples.ch: 你可以邀请基思参加聚会，但请不要邀请他的那个朋友。
examples.en: You can invite Keith to the party, but please don't ask that friend of his.

examples.ch: 我们不应该抱怨问题，而是应该帮助解决问题。
examples.en: We must not complain about the problem, but (= instead we must) help to put it right.

examples.ch: 她不是画家而是作家。
examples.en: She's not a painter but a writer (= she is a writer, not a painter).

examples.ch: 她不仅是画家而且是作家。
examples.en: She's not only a painter but also a writer (= she is both).

examples.ch: 他说他没去过那儿，不过他那么说也不奇怪。
examples.en: He said he hadn't been there, but then (= it is not surprising that) he would say that.

examples.ch: 我认为这不假，不过我并非专家。
examples.en: I think it's true, but then (= it should be understood that), I'm no expert.

defines.trans_en: except

examples.ch: 最后，除了一个人外，他们都答应来参加他的生日聚会。
examples.en: Eventually, all but one of them promised to come to his birthday party.

examples.ch: 他一点也不粗暴。
examples.en: He's anything but violent (= not violent in any way).

examples.ch: 要不是有你的警告，我早就把汽车撞坏了。
examples.en: I would have crashed the car but for your warning.

examples.ch: 这是这部系列剧的倒数第二集。
examples.en: This is the last episode but one (= one before the last) of the series.

examples.ch: 她是那种只知道抱怨的客人。
examples.en: She's one of those guests who does nothing but complain.

examples.ch: 这辆汽车哪儿都有毛病——老是坏！
examples.en: This car has been nothing but trouble - it's always breaking down!

defines.trans_en: used to give force to a statement

examples.ch: 每个人，请注意是每个人，都必须到。
examples.en: Everyone, but everyone, will be there.

defines.trans_en: only; just

examples.ch: 她只是个小女孩！
examples.en: She's but a young girl!

phrases.trans_ch: 没有“但是”可言;没有商量的余地
phrases.trans_en: used to emphasize that something will happen even if the person you are talking to does not want it to

examples.ch: 我们明天要去看望你的婶婶，一定要去，没有商量的余地。
examples.en: We're going to visit your aunt tomorrow and there'll be no buts about it.

defines.trans_en: a pale yellow solid food containing a lot of fat that is made from cream and is spread on bread or used in cooking

examples.ch: 我们吃的是可以涂黄油和果酱的烤饼。
examples.en: We were served scones with butter and jam.

examples.ch: 吃些黄油面包片吧。
examples.en: Have some bread and butter (= bread spread with butter).

examples.ch: 黄油盘
examples.en: a butter dish

defines.trans_en: to spread butter on something
to get something by paying money for it

examples.ch: 她最终存够了买一辆小汽车的钱。
examples.en: Eventually she had saved enough money to buy a small car.

examples.ch: 他给母亲买了些花。
examples.en: He bought his mother some flowers/He bought some flowers for his mother.

examples.ch: 这个季节购物的人比较多，所以价格高。
examples.en: There are more people buying at this time of the year so prices are high.

examples.ch: 成立该公司为的是代表投资者买卖股票。
examples.en: The company was set up to buy and sell shares on behalf of investors.

examples.ch: 我的相机是从一个朋友处买的。
examples.en: I bought my camera from a friend of mine.

defines.trans_en: to believe that something is true

examples.ch: 她决不会相信你迷路的谎话！
examples.en: She'll never buy that story about you getting lost!

phrases.trans_en: to pay someone or do something for someone, so that that person does not tell anyone something that they know about and that you want to remain secret

examples.ch: 为了封住她的嘴我们该怎么办？
examples.en: What will we have to do to buy her silence?

phrases.trans_en: to be worth/not be worth the price

examples.ch: 这件夹克真合算，才200英镑。
examples.en: This jacket is a really good buy, at £200.

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示动作的施动者）被，由
defines.trans_en: used to show the person or thing that does something

examples.ch: 那辆摩托车由一个秃顶的小个子男人驾驶。
examples.en: The motorcycle was driven by a tiny bald man.

examples.ch: 我们对她所说的事感到很惊讶。
examples.en: We were amazed by what she told us.

examples.ch: 我在读契诃夫写的一些短篇小说。
examples.en: I'm reading some short stories (written) by Chekhov.

examples.ch: 这本书是由一位著名作家翻译的。
examples.en: The book was translated by a well-known author.

examples.ch: 我被他声音中的怒气吓坏了。
examples.en: I felt frightened by the anger in his voice.

defines.trans_en: used to show how something is done

examples.ch: 他们乘火车／开汽车在欧洲旅行。
examples.en: They travelled across Europe by train/car.

examples.ch: 所有装饰都是她一人做的。
examples.en: She did the decorating (all) by herself (= alone, without help from anyone).

examples.ch: 我们是从前门进去的。
examples.en: We went in by (= through) the front door.

examples.ch: 你想拿现金还是支票？
examples.en: Do you want to be paid in cash or by cheque?

examples.ch: 他通过听收音机来学习英语。
examples.en: He learned English by listening to the radio.

examples.ch: 突然，她抓住了他的手臂。
examples.en: Suddenly, she grabbed him by the arm (= took hold of this part of his body).

examples.ch: 我拒绝遵守他们的规矩。
examples.en: I refuse to live by (= following) their rules.

defines.trans_en: near or at the side of

examples.ch: 一个小孩闷闷不乐地站在她身边。
examples.en: A small child stood sullenly by her side.

examples.ch: 他想让她一直呆在自己身边。
examples.en: He wanted to keep her close by him always.

examples.ch: 那个女警察没说一句话就从他们身边走过去了。
examples.en: The policewoman walked by (= past) them without saying a word.

defines.trans_en: not later than; at or before

examples.ch: 她答应过5点前回来。
examples.en: She had promised to be back by five o'clock.

examples.ch: 申请必须在31号之前到达才会被接受。
examples.en: The application must be in by the 31st to be accepted.

examples.ch: 等我到达火车站时，火车已经开走了。
examples.en: By the time I got to the station the train had already gone.

defines.trans_en: used to show measurements or amounts

examples.ch: 我们办公室的面积为12乘10米。
examples.en: Our office floor space measured twelve metres by ten (= was twelve metres in one direction and ten in the other).

examples.ch: 他们的工资上涨了15%。
examples.en: Their wages were increased by 15 percent.

examples.ch: 自由职业者按小时领取报酬。
examples.en: Freelance workers are paid by the hour (= for every hour they work).

examples.ch: 这些电话已经售出几千台。
examples.en: These phones have sold by the thousand (= several thousand have been sold).

defines.trans_en: during

examples.ch: 我们昼伏夜行。
examples.en: We travelled by night and rested by day.

phrases.text: minute by minute/hour by hour/day by day, etc.
phrases.trans_ch: 随着每分钟（每小时，每天，等）的过去
phrases.trans_en: used to say that something increases or changes with every minute, hour, day, etc. that passes

examples.ch: 随着每分钟的过去，飓风造成的死亡人数一直在增加。
examples.en: The death toll from the hurricane was climbing minute by minute/by the minute.

examples.ch: 随着每个月的过去，这项活动的声誉一直在下跌。
examples.en: The credibility of the campaign has deterioriated month by month/by the month.

phrases.trans_ch: 每分钟（每小时等）的（变化）
phrases.trans_en: describing or showing what happens every minute, hour, etc.

examples.ch: 事件的详细时间线
examples.en: a minute-by-minute timeline of the incident

examples.ch: 这本书详述了每一星期他父亲疾病的恶化过程。
examples.en: The book paints a detailed, week-by-week portrait of his father's illness.

phrases.trans_en: used when describing someone's character, job, etc.

examples.ch: 她本性是那种乐观开朗、积极向上的人。
examples.en: She is, by nature, a sunny, positive kind of person.

examples.ch: 他的职业是水暖工。
examples.en: He's a plumber by trade.

examples.ch: 她的职业是律师。
examples.en: She was, by profession, a lawyer.

phrases.trans_en: If something is all right/fine by someone, they agree that it can happen.

examples.ch: “我想晚点去。”“我没意见。”
examples.en: "I'd rather go later." "That's fine by me."

examples.ch: 如果你不反对的话，我想现在走。
examples.en: If it's all right by you, I'd like to leave now.

defines.trans_en: at the side of or (in distance or time) past

examples.ch: 那个女警察没说一句话就走过去了。
examples.en: The policewoman walked by without saying a word.

examples.ch: 下次你路过的时候干吗不进来喝杯咖啡呢？
examples.en: Why don't you call in for a cup of coffee next time you're passing by?

examples.ch: 岁月飞逝。
examples.en: The years flew by.

defines.trans_ch: （一般不供应酒类的）小餐馆，小饭馆，咖啡馆
defines.trans_en: a restaurant where simple and usually quite cheap meals are served

examples.ch: 街角有个小咖啡馆，那儿卖的咖啡很棒。
examples.en: There's a little café on the corner that serves very good coffee.

defines.trans_en: a small shop

defines.trans_ch: （一般不供应酒类的）小餐馆，小饭馆，咖啡馆
defines.trans_en: a restaurant where simple and usually quite cheap meals are served

examples.ch: 街角有个小咖啡馆，那儿卖的咖啡很棒。
examples.en: There's a little café on the corner that serves very good coffee.

defines.trans_en: a small shop
a sweet food made with a mixture of flour, eggs, fat, and sugar

examples.ch: 你想来块／片／些蛋糕吗？
examples.en: Would you like a piece of/a slice of/some cake?

examples.ch: 巧克力／海绵蛋糕
examples.en: chocolate/sponge cake

examples.ch: 生日／圣诞蛋糕
examples.en: a birthday/Christmas cake

examples.ch: 奶油蛋糕
examples.en: cream cakes

examples.ch: 他做／烤了个美味的蛋糕。
examples.en: He made/baked a delicious cake.

defines.trans_en: a small flat object made by pressing together a soft substance

examples.ch: 鱼／土豆饼
examples.en: fish/potato cakes

examples.ch: 一块肥皂
examples.en: a cake of soap

defines.trans_ch: （用会变干的东西厚厚地）覆盖;（使）结块;凝结
defines.trans_en: to cover something or someone thickly with a substance that then dries out

examples.ch: 这些男人身上积了一层层污垢。
examples.en: The men were caked in layers of filth and grime.

examples.ch: 粘着泥块的靴子
examples.en: boots caked with mud

defines.trans_en: to give someone or something a name, or to know or address someone by a particular name

examples.ch: 他们给双胞胎取名为爱德华和托马斯。
examples.en: They've called the twins Edward and Thomas.

examples.ch: 我们昨晚在电影里看到的那个演员叫什么名字？
examples.en: What's that actor called that we saw in the film last night?

examples.ch: 他的真名叫乔纳森，但他们总是叫他“约翰尼”。
examples.en: His real name is Jonathan, but they've always called him Johnny.

examples.ch: 她的新小说叫什么名字？
examples.en: What's her new novel called?

examples.ch: 我希望他不要老是叫我“亲爱的”——太居高临下了！
examples.en: I wish he wouldn't keep calling me "dear" - it's so patronizing!

defines.trans_en: to use a phone to talk to someone

examples.ch: 昨晚你不在时，他（给你）打过电话。
examples.en: He called (you) last night when you were out.

examples.ch: 今天早上她打电话到我的办公室，我们简短地闲聊了会儿。
examples.en: She called (me) this morning at the office and we had a brief chat.

examples.ch: 我一早上都在打电话，可是没打通。
examples.en: I've been calling all morning but I can't get through.

examples.ch: 你觉得我们应该报警吗？
examples.en: Do you think we should call the police?

defines.trans_en: to consider someone or something to be

examples.ch: 他认识很多人，但他称之为亲密朋友的只有一两个。
examples.en: He knows a lot of people, but only one or two that he'd call close friends.

examples.ch: 一个三明治和一片生菜叶——我可不把那叫一顿饭！
examples.en: One sandwich and a lettuce leaf - I don't call that a meal!

examples.ch: 我没说你在撒谎——我只是提醒一下，你误解了实际情形。
examples.en: I'm not calling you a liar - I'm just suggesting that you misunderstood the facts of the situation.

defines.trans_en: to say something in a loud voice, especially in order to attract someone's attention, or (of animals) to make a loud, high sound, especially to another animal

examples.ch: 人群中有人大声叫（出）他的名字。
examples.en: Someone in the crowd called (out) his name.

examples.ch: 是你在叫吗？
examples.en: Did you call?

examples.ch: “嗨，你！到这儿来！”她叫道。
examples.en: "Hey, you! Come over here!" she called.

examples.ch: 乌鸫呼唤它的配偶。
examples.en: The blackbird called to its mate.

defines.trans_en: to ask someone to come to you

examples.ch: 她把我叫到了她坐着的地方。
examples.en: She called me over to where she was sitting.

examples.ch: 我让卧室门开着，以防孩子们晚上叫我。
examples.en: I keep the bedroom door open in case the children call (for) me in the night.

examples.ch: 我今早被叫去参加一个紧急会议。
examples.en: I was called to an emergency meeting this morning.

examples.ch: 在学校时，她总是被叫到校长办公室去。
examples.en: At school she was always being called into the headteacher's office.

defines.trans_en: to visit someone, especially for a short time

examples.ch: 今天上午我们出去的时候电工一定来过了——门垫上留了张字条。
examples.en: The electrician must have called (round) this morning when we were out - there's a note on the door mat.

defines.trans_en: to decide officially to have a particular event or take particular action

examples.ch: 总经理决定召开会议商讨工资标准。
examples.en: The managing director has called a meeting to discuss pay levels.

examples.ch: 报纸预言首相将宣布在春季举行大选。
examples.en: The papers are predicting that the prime minister will call an election in the spring.

examples.ch: 如果管理层不同意他们的要求，预计工会将发动罢工。
examples.en: It's reckoned that the unions will call a strike if management will not agree to their demands.

examples.ch: 因为下大雨，他们不得不中止了比赛。
examples.en: They had to call a halt to (= end) the match because of the heavy rain.

phrases.trans_en: If a person, especially a child, calls someone names, he or she addresses that person with a name that is intended to be offensive.

examples.ch: 汤姆担心如果他在学校戴眼镜会被其他孩子取笑。
examples.en: Tom's worried that if he wears glasses at school the other children will call him names.

phrases.trans_en: to make a phone call that is paid for by the person who receives it
to consider something as belonging to you

examples.ch: 我不奢望特别气派的东西——我只想拥有一个属于我自己的地方。
examples.en: I don't aspire to anything very grand - I just want a place I can call my own.

phrases.trans_ch: 要求（会场）安静下来，要求别吵
phrases.trans_en: to ask people in a meeting to stop talking so that the meeting can continue

examples.ch: 她要求会场安静下来。
examples.en: She called for order/called the meeting to order.

defines.trans_en: the act of using the phone

examples.ch: 昨晚我接到了一位大学老友的电话。
examples.en: I got a call from an old college friend last night.

examples.ch: 如果有我的电话，你能在电话边记一下吗？
examples.en: If there are any calls for me, could you write them down next to the phone?

examples.ch: 我正要打几个电话。
examples.en: I've just got a couple of calls to make.

examples.ch: 为粉刷房子的事你打电话找的那个油漆工——他给你回过电话了吗？
examples.en: That decorator you called about painting the house - did he ever return your call?

examples.ch: 广播电台接到很多电话，投诉那个节目用语污秽。
examples.en: The radio station received a lot of calls complaining about the show's bad language.

examples.ch: 6点之前，拨打电话按高峰费率收费。
examples.en: Before six o'clock, calls are charged at peak rate.

defines.trans_ch: 叫声;呼喊，呼叫;（动物的）鸣叫声
defines.trans_en: the sound an animal makes or the sound of someone shouting something

examples.ch: 鲸的叫声很特别。
examples.en: The whale has a very distinctive call.

examples.ch: 她能听到从燃烧的大楼里传出的呼救声。
examples.en: She could hear calls for help from inside the burning building.

examples.ch: 我会在隔壁房间，需要帮助就叫我。
examples.en: I'll be in the next room, so give me a call if you need any help.

defines.trans_en: the fact of people wanting or needing a particular thing

examples.ch: 现在人们对毛皮大衣的需求量不大。
examples.en: There's not much call for fur coats these days.

examples.ch: 我的确认为没有必要说那样的话，小姐！
examples.en: I certainly don't think there's any call for that sort of language, young lady!

defines.trans_en: a demand for something to happen

examples.ch: 迄今为止管理层一直无视工会对加强安全规章的呼吁。
examples.en: Management have so far ignored the union's calls for stricter safety regulations.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指正式的）短暂拜访;（通常指医疗从业者的）出诊
defines.trans_en: a short visit, especially an official one made by someone whose job is connected with health

examples.ch: 苏厄德医生今天上午出诊去了。
examples.en: Doctor Seward is out on a call this morning.

examples.ch: 护士今天下午有几次出诊。
examples.en: The nurse has got a few calls to make this afternoon.

examples.ch: 我想这个周末去拜访一位老朋友。
examples.en: I thought I'd pay a call on (= visit) an old friend of mine this weekend.

defines.trans_en: a decision

examples.ch: 尽管做这个决定很难，但我最终还是打算辞职。
examples.en: It was a tough call, but eventually I decided to give up my job.

examples.ch: 增加投资？这该由你来决定——毕竟你是付款人。
examples.en: More investment? That's got to be your call - you're the one that's paying!

defines.trans_en: a large animal with a long neck, that lives in the desert and has one or two humps (= large raised areas of flesh) on its back
a soft, pale brown cloth made from wool and used to make coats
a device for taking photographs or making films or television programmes

examples.ch: 我去葡萄牙时忘了带相机，所以我一张照片都没能拍。
examples.en: I forgot to take my camera with me to Portugal, so I couldn't take any photos.

examples.ch: 电视摄制组向全世界播放了这一事件。
examples.en: Television camera crews broadcast the event all round the world.

examples.ch: 据说爱玛丽莲‧梦露非常上镜。
examples.en: It was said of Marilyn Monroe that the camera loved her (= that she looked very attractive on film and in photographs).

phrases.trans_en: appearing on a section of video

examples.ch: 他们粗暴打人的场景被拍了下来。
examples.en: They were caught on camera as they brutally attacked a man.

defines.trans_en: a place where people stay in tents or other temporary structures

examples.ch: 我们在湖边扎了营。
examples.en: We pitched/set up camp (= put up our tents) by the lakeside.

defines.trans_ch: 临时居住地，暂时滞留地
defines.trans_en: an area where people are kept temporarily for a particular reason

examples.ch: 劳改／战俘／难民营
examples.en: a labour/prison/refugee camp

defines.trans_en: a place where soldiers stay when they are training or fighting a war

examples.ch: 军营
examples.en: an army camp

defines.trans_ch: 阵营，阵线（尤指政治组织）
defines.trans_en: a group of people who share an opinion, especially a political one

examples.ch: 支持独立的阵营要求举行全民公投。
examples.en: The pro-independence camp are demanding a referendum.

examples.ch: 该党在这项立法上很鲜明地分为两大阵营。
examples.en: The party is divided into two distinct camps over the legislation.

defines.trans_en: to put up a tent and stay in it for a short while, for example while on holiday

examples.ch: 我们在山脚的一处低坡上扎了营。
examples.en: We camped on one of the lower slopes of the mountain.

defines.trans_en: to put a group of tents or temporary shelters in one place, or to put someone in a group of tents or temporary shelters

examples.ch: 军队驻扎在离首都仅仅25英里的地方。
examples.en: Troops were camped only 25 miles from the capital.

defines.trans_ch: （男子）女里女气的，同性恋似的
defines.trans_en: (of a man) behaving and dressing in a way that some people think is typical of a gay man

examples.ch: 那个特别女子气、嗓音尖尖、走路可笑的男演员叫什么？
examples.en: What's the name of that amazingly camp actor with the high voice and a funny walk?

defines.trans_en: using bright colours, loud sounds, unusual behaviour, etc. in a humorous way

examples.ch: 他们的演出总是花里胡哨，极其夸张。
examples.en: Their shows are always incredibly camp and flamboyant.

defines.trans_ch: 度假营地;野营地，宿营地
defines.trans_en: a piece of land where people on holiday can camp, usually with toilets and places for washing

examples.ch: 度假营地坐落在海滩旁边一个美丽的地方。
examples.en: The campsite is in a beautiful location next to the beach.

defines.trans_ch: 露营帐篷位，帐篷搭建地
defines.trans_en: a place for one tent at a place where people stay in tents

examples.ch: 我们的帐篷太大了，他们向我们收了两个帐篷位的费用。
examples.en: Our tent was so large that they charged us for two campsites.

defines.trans_en: to be able to

examples.ch: 你会开车吗？
examples.en: Can you drive?

examples.ch: 她会讲4门语言。
examples.en: She can speak four languages.

examples.ch: 你从这么远的距离能看清楚那标牌上的东西吗？
examples.en: Can you read that sign from this distance?

examples.ch: 医生们在竭尽所能，可是她仍然不能正常呼吸。
examples.en: The doctors are doing all that they can, but she's still not breathing properly.

examples.ch: 尽力而为吧——我知道情况不理想。
examples.en: Do the best you can - I realize the circumstances are not ideal.

examples.ch: 如果聚会很糟，我们总还可以离开。
examples.en: If the party is awful, we can always leave (= that would be one possible solution to our problem).

examples.ch: “她对此确实很生气。”“你能怪她吗？”
examples.en: "She's really furious about it." "Can you blame her (= I'm not surprised)?"

defines.trans_en: to be allowed to

examples.ch: 约翰，我能用你的自行车吗？
examples.en: Can I use your bike, John?

examples.ch: 你们可以把车停在那边。
examples.en: You can park over there.

examples.ch: 吃完蔬菜你就可以吃块蛋糕！
examples.en: You can have a piece of cake after you've eaten your vegetables!

defines.trans_en: sometimes used to tell someone angrily to do something

examples.ch: 索菲，如果你对你妹妹还这么凶，就上床睡觉去！
examples.en: If you carry on being horrible to your sister, Sophie, you can just go to bed!

defines.trans_en: used to request something

examples.ch: 如果你见到布雷特，能告诉他我下周末在伦敦吗？
examples.en: If you see Brett, can you tell him I'm in town next weekend?

examples.ch: 请你别发出那么大声音好吗？我正在工作。
examples.en: Can you make a little less noise, please? I'm trying to work.

defines.trans_en: used to express possibility

examples.ch: 你可以在当地的报刊销售店买到邮票。
examples.en: You can get stamps from the local newsagents.

examples.ch: 在脏水里洗澡会得严重的皮肤病。
examples.en: You can get very nasty skin diseases from bathing in dirty water.

examples.ch: 吸烟可能会导致癌症。
examples.en: Smoking can cause cancer.

examples.ch: 住公寓噪音会很成问题。
examples.en: Noise can be quite a problem when you're living in a flat.

examples.ch: 有时候他很烦人。
examples.en: He can be really annoying at times (= he is sometimes very annoying).

defines.trans_ch: （用于礼貌地提出帮忙）可以，能
defines.trans_en: used in polite offers of help

examples.ch: 我帮您拎那些包好吗？
examples.en: Can I help you with those bags?

examples.ch: 恐怕弗格森女士已经离开办公室了。我能帮什么忙吗？
examples.en: I'm afraid Ms Ferguson has already left the office. Can I be of any help?

phrases.trans_en: used to say that you can and will do something

examples.ch: “请你帮我把这封信寄了，好吗？”“行。”
examples.en: "Will you mail this letter for me, please?" "Can do."

examples.ch: “今天我需要你去接孩子。”“抱歉，不行。”
examples.en: "I need you to pick up the kids today." "Sorry, no can do (= no I can't)."

defines.trans_en: a closed metal container, especially cylinder-shaped, in which some types of drink and food are sold

examples.ch: 一罐汤／豆
examples.en: a can of soup/beans

defines.trans_en: the amount of food or drink that is contained in a can

examples.ch: 做这道菜需要一罐金枪鱼。
examples.en: You'll need a can of tuna for this recipe.

defines.trans_en: a metal container, especially one with a lid, handle, and shaped opening for pouring

examples.ch: 油罐
examples.en: an oil can

examples.ch: 一桶油漆
examples.en: a can of paint

phrases.trans_en:
→ 
headphones

examples.ch: 我当时戴着耳机，所以什么也没听见。
examples.en: I was wearing cans so I didn't hear anything.

phrases.trans_en: informal for prison

examples.ch: 他因持枪抢劫而蹲了10年大牢。
examples.en: He spent ten years in the can for armed robbery.

phrases.trans_en: informal for toilet

defines.trans_en: to put food and drink into a closed metal container without air

examples.ch: 他在一家罐装水果的工厂工作。
examples.en: He works in a factory where they can fruit.

defines.trans_en: to stop doing something or making noise

examples.ch: 嗨，别吵了，行吗？我要睡觉呢。
examples.en: Hey, can it, would you? I'm trying to sleep.

defines.trans_en: a long, thin stretch of water that is artificially made either for boats to travel along or for taking water from one area to another

examples.ch: 巴拿马运河是连接大西洋和太平洋至关重要的航道。
examples.en: The Panama Canal provides a crucial shipping link between the Atlantic and Pacific oceans.

defines.trans_en: a narrow tube through which air, fluid, or other substances can pass

examples.ch: 消化道是食物进入身体，固体废物排出身体的通道。
examples.en: The alimentary canal is the path by which food enters the body, and solid waste is passed out.

defines.trans_en: a road vehicle with an engine, four wheels, and seats for a small number of people

examples.ch: 他们没有汽车。
examples.en: They don't have a car.

examples.ch: 你把车停在哪儿了？
examples.en: Where did you park your car?

examples.ch: 开车更快点。
examples.en: It's quicker by car.

examples.ch: 汽车追逐／车祸／汽车厂
examples.en: a car chase/accident/factory

defines.trans_en: a part of a train used for a special purpose

examples.ch: 餐车／卧铺车厢
examples.en: a restaurant/sleeping car

defines.trans_en: any of the separate parts of a train in which the passengers sit

examples.ch: 火车车厢
examples.en: a railroad car

defines.trans_en: a part of a train that is used for carrying goods or animals

examples.ch: 成百上千的难民被赶进运牛的货车里，开始了10小时令人筋疲力尽的行程。
examples.en: Hundreds of refugees were herded into cattle cars for the gruelling ten-hour journey.

defines.trans_ch: （显示个人信息的）卡片；银行卡；通行证
defines.trans_en: a small, rectangular piece of card or plastic, often with your signature, photograph, or other information proving who you are, that allows you to do something, such as make a payment, get money from a bank, or enter a particular place

examples.ch: 我没带现金——可以用（信用／记账）卡支付吗？
examples.en: I don't have any cash - can I put this on (= pay using) my (credit/charge) card?

examples.ch: 许多商店不收支票，除非你带了支票保付卡。
examples.en: A lot of shops won't accept cheques unless you have a cheque card with you.

examples.ch: 银行现在关门了，不过我可以用我的（自动提款）卡取些钱。
examples.en: The bank's closed now, but I can get some money out with my (cash) card.

examples.ch: 我没有打电话所需的零钱，不过（电话）卡我倒是有一张，如果能用得上的话。
examples.en: I don't have any change for the phone but I do have a (phone) card, if that's of any use.

examples.ch: 通常必须在门口出示你的（会员）卡。
examples.en: You usually have to show your (membership) card at the door.

defines.trans_en: one of a set of 52 small rectangular pieces of stiff paper each with a number and one of four signs printed on it, used in games

examples.ch: 晚饭后，特德拿出了一副纸牌。
examples.en: After dinner, Ted got out a pack of cards

examples.ch: 约翰在发牌前先洗了牌。
examples.en: John shuffled (= mixed up) the cards before he dealt them (out) (= gave them to the players).

examples.ch: 惠斯特牌是我最喜欢玩的纸牌游戏。
examples.en: Whist is my favourite card game.

examples.ch: 牌桌
examples.en: a card table

defines.trans_en: a rectangular piece of stiff paper, folded in half, with a picture on the front and often a message printed inside, sent on a special occasion

examples.ch: 周年纪念／祝愿康复卡
examples.en: anniversary/get-well cards

examples.ch: 周四是史蒂夫的生日——我得给他寄张卡。
examples.en: It's Steve's birthday on Thursday - I must send him a card.

defines.trans_en:
a 
postcard
a small, rectangular piece of stiff paper with information printed on it, especially a person's job title, business address, and phone number

examples.ch: 来，我给你张我的名片吧。
examples.en: Here, let me give you my (business) card.

defines.trans_en: (a piece of) thick stiff paper
a thin plate inside a computer that contains very small electronic circuits and controls certain operations of the computer

examples.ch: 显卡／声卡
examples.en: a graphics/sound card

defines.trans_en: a funny or strange person

examples.ch: 帕特里克，你可真是个活宝！
examples.en: You're such a card, Patrick!

phrases.trans_en: any of a range of games played with cards, such as poker, whist, and bridge

examples.ch: 我向来都不擅长玩纸牌游戏。
examples.en: I've never been much good at cards.

examples.ch: 我们玩纸牌游戏好吗？
examples.en: Shall we have a game of/play cards?

defines.trans_ch: 要求出示身份证件（以确认年龄）
defines.trans_en: to ask someone to show you a document, especially an identity card, in order to prove how old they are
the job or series of jobs that you do during your working life, especially if you continue to get better jobs and earn more money

examples.ch: 他希望当一名警察。
examples.en: He's hoping for a career in the police force/as a police officer.

examples.ch: 等退休的时候，他可以回顾自己光辉灿烂的职业生涯。
examples.en: When he retires he will be able to look back over a brilliant career (= a working life that has been very successful).

examples.ch: 如果你能在事业的阶梯上再攀登几级然后再去休假生小孩，那样会好一些。
examples.en: It helps if you can move a few rungs up the career ladder before taking time off to have a baby.

examples.ch: 我接受了这份新工作，因为我觉得它的职业前景更好。
examples.en: I took this new job because I felt that the career prospects were much better.

examples.ch: 朱迪丝事业心很强。
examples.en: Judith is very career-minded/-oriented (= gives a lot of attention to her job).

defines.trans_en: (especially of a vehicle) to move fast and in a way that is out of control

examples.ch: 长途汽车冲下山坡，撞到了土埂上。
examples.en: The coach careered down a slope and collided with a bank.

defines.trans_en: giving a lot of attention to what you are doing so that you do not have an accident, make a mistake, or damage something

examples.ch: 小心玻璃杯。
examples.en: Be careful with the glasses.

examples.ch: 要注意把热锅放在合适的地方。
examples.en: Be careful where you put that hot pan.

examples.ch: 过马路时要注意向两边看。
examples.en: Be careful to look both ways when you cross the road.

examples.ch: 迈克尔工作起来很细心。
examples.en: Michael is a very careful worker.

examples.ch: 仔细考虑了你的建议后，我很遗憾地告诉你我们不能接受。
examples.en: After careful consideration of your proposal, I regret to say that we are unable to accept it.

examples.ch: 他心情很糟，所以跟他说话要当心。
examples.en: He's in a really foul temper so be careful (about/of) what you say to him.

defines.trans_en: (a shaped piece of) thick material used for covering floors

examples.ch: 我们刚在卧室里铺了新地毯。
examples.en: We've just had a new carpet fitted/laid in our bedroom.

examples.ch: 我们的卧室的地毯是按面积定做的。
examples.en: We've got fitted (= cut to fit exactly) carpets in the bedrooms.

defines.trans_en: a layer of something that covers the ground

examples.ch: 一层积雪
examples.en: a carpet of snow

examples.ch: 我们的草坪上开满了雏菊。
examples.en: Our lawn is a carpet of daisies.

defines.trans_en: to cover something with carpet

examples.ch: 我们需要将楼梯铺上地毯。
examples.en: We need to carpet the stairs.

defines.trans_en: to severely criticize someone who has made a mistake

phrases.trans_en: to be covered with something

examples.ch: 春天，这儿遍地都是蓝钟花。
examples.en: In spring this area is carpeted with bluebells.

defines.trans_en: a long pointed orange root eaten as a vegetable

defines.trans_ch: （为鼓励而给的）好处，甜头，奖赏
defines.trans_en: something that is offered to someone in order to encourage them to do something
to hold something or someone with your hands, arms, or on your back and transport it, him, or her from one place to another

examples.ch: 要我帮你背包吗？
examples.en: Would you like me to carry your bag for you?

examples.ch: 她将疲惫的孩子抱上楼去睡觉。
examples.en: She carried her tired child upstairs to bed.

examples.ch: 这些书太沉了，我搬不动。
examples.en: These books are too heavy for me to carry.

examples.ch: 我们只有一只小手提箱，所以能拎着它登机。
examples.en: We only had a small suitcase, so we were able to carry it onto the plane.

examples.ch: 罗布森在下半场比赛中腿部受伤，只好被抬到场外。
examples.en: Robson injured his leg in the second half of the match and had to be carried off.

examples.ch: 小偷打碎了商店的橱窗，拿走了价值几千英镑的珠宝。
examples.en: Thieves broke the shop window and carried off (= removed) jewellery worth thousands of pounds.

defines.trans_en: to move someone or something from one place to another

examples.ch: 出事的公共汽车当时正送孩子们去上学。
examples.en: The bus that was involved in the accident was carrying children to school.

examples.ch: 布鲁克林大桥横跨东河，连接布鲁克林与曼哈顿的交通运输。
examples.en: The Brooklyn Bridge carries traffic across the East River from Brooklyn to Manhattan.

examples.ch: 警方认为尸体是顺河漂下来的。
examples.en: Police think that the body was carried down the river (= was transported by the flow of the river).

examples.ch: 地下电缆将电力输送到该市各个地区。
examples.en: Underground cables carry electricity to all parts of the city.

examples.ch: 白天扔在海滩上的垃圾晚上被潮汐卷走了。
examples.en: Rubbish left on the beach during the day is carried away (= removed) at night by the tide.

defines.trans_en: to have something with you all the time

examples.ch: 英国警察通常不带枪。
examples.en: Police officers in Britain do not usually carry guns.

examples.ch: 他将永远铭记那次事故。
examples.en: He will carry the memory of the accident with him (= will remember the accident) for ever.

defines.trans_en: to have something as a part, quality, or result

examples.ch: 所有的香烟盒上都印有政府的健康警告。
examples.en: All cigarette packets carry a government health warning.

examples.ch: 我们的汽车有12个月的保修期。
examples.en: Our cars carry a twelve-month guarantee.

examples.ch: 他的发言很有说服力，我只好赞同。
examples.en: His speech carried so much conviction that I had to agree with him.

examples.ch: 在有些国家，谋杀要被判死刑。
examples.en: In some countries, murder carries the death penalty.

examples.ch: 恐怕我的意见不会对我的老板产生任何影响。
examples.en: I'm afraid my opinion doesn't carry any weight with (= influence) my boss.

examples.ch: 售货员说他们不经销运动服装。
examples.en: The salesclerk said they didn't carry (= have a supply of) sportswear.

defines.trans_en: to take something from one person or thing and give it to another person or thing

examples.ch: 疟疾是一种由蚊子传播的疾病。
examples.en: Malaria is a disease carried by mosquitoes.

defines.trans_en: to support the weight of something without moving or breaking

examples.ch: 大教堂的屋顶重量由两排柱子支撑。
examples.en: The weight of the cathedral roof is carried by two rows of pillars.

defines.trans_en: to support, keep in operation, or make a success

examples.ch: 我们再也养不起不尽力工作的人了。
examples.en: We can no longer afford to carry people who don't work as hard as they should.

examples.ch: 幸运的是，他们有一位很具实力的男演员担纲，他撑起了整个剧。
examples.en: Luckily they had a very strong actor in the main part and he managed to carry the whole play (= make a success of it through his own performance).

defines.trans_ch: 获得（支持、同意或同情等）
defines.trans_en: to win the support, agreement, or sympathy of a group of people

examples.ch: 管理层重组公司的计划不会成功，除非他们能赢得全体员工的支持。
examples.en: The bosses' plans to reorganize the company won't succeed unless they can carry the workforce with them.

defines.trans_en: to give approval, especially by voting

examples.ch: 该动议／提议／决议／法案以210票对160票获得通过。
examples.en: The motion/proposal/resolution/bill was carried by 210 votes to 160.

defines.trans_en: (of a newspaper or radio or television broadcast) to contain particular information

examples.ch: 今早的报纸都在头版刊登了相同的报道。
examples.en: This morning's newspapers all carry the same story on their front page.

defines.trans_en: to be able to reach or travel a particular distance

examples.ch: 爆炸声传出数英里。
examples.en: The sound of the explosion carried for miles.

examples.ch: 球高高飞上天，落在了栅栏的另一边。
examples.en: The ball carried high into the air and landed the other side of the fence.

defines.trans_en: to develop or continue something

examples.ch: 列宁通过付诸实践发展了马克思的思想。
examples.en: Lenin carried Marx's ideas a stage further by putting them into practice.

examples.ch: 如果我们继续讨论并得出合乎逻辑的结论，就会认识到进一步投资是不明智的。
examples.en: If we carry this argument to its logical conclusion, we realize that further investment is not a good idea.

examples.ch: 她整洁得过头了。
examples.en: She carries tidiness to extremes/to its limits (= she is too tidy).

examples.ch: 我们必须到此结束了，但在下一次会议上，我们可继续今天的讨论。
examples.en: We must end here, but we can carry today's discussion forward at our next meeting.

examples.ch: 他总是把玩笑开得很过头。
examples.en: He always carries his jokes too far (= he continues making jokes when he should have stopped).

defines.trans_en: to put a number into another column when doing addition
to be pregnant with a child

examples.ch: 得知她怀了双胞胎，大家很吃惊。
examples.en: It was quite a shock to learn that she was carrying twins.

examples.ch: 我怀乔希的时候体形很笨重。
examples.en: I was enormous when I was carrying Josh.

defines.trans_en: in American football, to carry the ball forward across the field, gaining an advantage for your team

examples.ch: 每个跑卫都想持球冲锋。
examples.en: Every running back wants to carry the ball.

examples.ch: 约翰逊冲球26次，总码数为202码。
examples.en: Johnson carried 26 times for 202 yards.

phrases.trans_en: to move your body in a particular way

examples.ch: 你从她的举手投足间可以看出她是个舞蹈演员。
examples.en: You can tell she's a dancer from the way that she carries herself.

defines.trans_en: the act of carrying a gun

examples.ch: 警察日常携带的武器应是耐用和易于清洁的。
examples.en: For daily carry by officers, weapons should be durable and easy to clean.

defines.trans_en: in American football, an occasion when a player carries the ball forward across the field, gaining an advantage for his or her team

examples.ch: 持球进攻时获得的码数为“冲球码数”。
examples.en: The yards gained on a carry are referred to as "rushing yards".

examples.ch: 他目前为职业生涯中拥有最多冲球次数的记录保持人。
examples.en: He currently holds the record for the most career carries.

defines.trans_en: relating to the carrying of a gun

examples.ch: 在纽约，基本上不可能拿到携枪证。
examples.en: Basically, it's impossible to get a carry permit in New York.

examples.ch: 伊利诺伊州曾是美国唯二两个没有就携枪许可立法的州的一个。
examples.en: Illinois one of only two states without a carry law.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指报刊中与政治有关的）漫画，讽刺画
defines.trans_en: a drawing, especially in a newspaper or magazine, that tells a joke or makes a humorous political criticism
in art, a drawing made especially in preparation for a painting
a TV programme or short film, usually a funny one, made using characters and images that are drawn rather than real

examples.ch: 电视台在星期六早晨播放儿童动画片。
examples.en: The TV shows kids' cartoons on Saturday mornings.

defines.trans_en: money in the form of notes and coins, rather than cheques or credit cards

examples.ch: 你身上有现金吗？
examples.en: Do you have any cash on you?

examples.ch: 你是刷信用卡还是付现金？
examples.en: Will you pay by credit card or in cash?

examples.ch: 他说他要先拿到预付现金才肯干活。
examples.en: He says he wants cash in advance before he'll do the job.

examples.ch: 眼下我手头有点紧。
examples.en: I'm a bit short of/strapped for cash (= I do not have much money) at the moment.

defines.trans_en: to exchange a cheque, etc. for cash

examples.ch: 你能帮我兑张支票吗？
examples.en: Would you cash a cheque for me?

defines.trans_en: a large strong building, built in the past by a ruler or important person to protect the people inside from attack

informal for
rook
in chess, to make a special move that puts your king in a more protected place at the side of the board
a small animal with fur, four legs, a tail, and claws, usually kept as a pet or for catching mice
any member of the group of animals similar to the cat, such as the lion

examples.ch: 猫科动物
examples.en: the cat family

defines.trans_en: to take hold of something, especially something that is moving through the air

examples.ch: 我在玻璃杯落地之前接住了它。
examples.en: I managed to catch the glass before it hit the ground.

examples.ch: 我们看到老鹰从空中猛扑下去抓捕猎物。
examples.en: We saw the eagle swoop from the sky to catch its prey.

examples.ch: 我们的狗从我身边跑过，我没抓住，让它跑出了屋子。
examples.en: Our dog ran past me and out of the house before I could catch it.

examples.ch: 他一把抓住了我的胳膊。
examples.en: He caught hold of my arm.

examples.ch: 我们把平底锅放在地上接屋顶漏下的水。
examples.en: We placed saucepans on the floor to catch (= collect) the drops of water coming through the roof.

examples.ch: 击球手击出的球被接住了。
examples.en: The batsman was caught (out) (= someone in the other team caught the ball when he hit it).

defines.trans_en: to find and stop a person or animal that is trying to escape

examples.ch: 警方面临着很大的压力，要尽早抓获恐怖分子。
examples.en: Great pressure was put on the police to catch the terrorists as soon as possible.

examples.ch: 两名武装分子企图在夜间越境时被抓获。
examples.en: Two armed men were caught trying to cross the frontier at night.

examples.ch: 那天他们很高兴，因为抓到了很多鱼。
examples.en: They were happy because they had caught a lot of fish that day.

examples.ch: 看得出你现在很忙，一会儿再跟你说。
examples.en: I can see you're busy right now, so I'll catch you (= speak to you) later.

defines.trans_en: to discover, see, or realize something, especially someone doing something wrong

examples.ch: 她看他过去的情书时被他撞见了。
examples.en: He caught her reading his old love letters.

examples.ch: 要是能及时发现病毒，大多数患者都可以治愈。
examples.en: If the virus is caught (= discovered) in time, most patients can be successfully treated.

examples.ch: 我在人群中看到／瞥见一个穿红色外套的人。
examples.en: I caught sight of/caught a glimpse of (= saw for a moment) a red coat in the crowd.

defines.trans_ch: 赶，乘，搭乘（飞机、火车、公共汽车等）
defines.trans_en: to travel or be able to travel on an aircraft, train, bus, etc.

examples.ch: 他总是乘上午10点30分的那班火车上班。
examples.en: He always catches the 10.30 a.m. train to work.

examples.ch: 她担心到得太晚，赶不上回家的末班车。
examples.en: She was worried that she'd arrive too late to catch the last bus home.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指因感染细菌或病毒）患（病），染（疾）
defines.trans_en: to get an illness, especially one caused by bacteria or a virus

examples.ch: 他度假时患了感冒。
examples.en: He caught a cold on holiday.

examples.ch: 上学期许多在校的孩子得了麻疹。
examples.en: A lot of children in the school caught measles last term.

defines.trans_en: to stick somewhere, or to make something stick somewhere

examples.ch: 我的夹克衫的袖子钩在了门把手上，给扯破了。
examples.en: The sleeve of my jacket (got) caught on the door handle and ripped.

examples.ch: 她的头发缠在了吹风机上。
examples.en: Her hair got caught (up) in her hairdryer.

defines.trans_en: to manage to be in time to see or do something

examples.ch: 为了看到节目的开头，我就稍微早了一点回家。
examples.en: I went home early to catch the beginning of the programme.

examples.ch: 要是你想赶得上寄信，就得赶紧了。
examples.en: You'll have to run if you want to catch the post (= send a letter before the post has been collected).

defines.trans_en: to manage to hear something

examples.ch: 这么吵，我听不清播音员在说什么。
examples.en: I couldn't catch what the announcer said, with all the other noise going on.

defines.trans_en: to hit something, especially without intending to

examples.ch: 他摔倒的时候头撞到了桌子边。
examples.en: His head caught the edge of the table as he fell.

examples.ch: 医疗队陷入了敌军的交叉火力中。
examples.en: Medical teams were caught in the crossfire of the opposing armies.

defines.trans_en: to begin to burn

examples.ch: 木头太湿，点不着。
examples.en: This wood's too wet, the fire won't catch.

phrases.text: catch sb's attention, imagination, interest, etc.
phrases.trans_ch: 引起…的注意（想象，兴趣等）
phrases.trans_en: to make someone notice something and feel interested

examples.ch: 一艘出海的船吸引了他的注意。
examples.en: A ship out at sea caught his attention.

examples.ch: 她的照片引起了我的遐想。
examples.en: Her pictures caught my imagination.

phrases.trans_ch: （尤指在需要的时候）没有，缺乏
phrases.trans_en: to not have something, especially when it is needed

examples.ch: 他喜欢家里备些饼干。
examples.en: He doesn't like to be caught without any biscuits in the house.

phrases.text: you won't catch sb doing sth
phrases.trans_en: said to mean that you will certainly not see someone doing a particular thing or in a particular place

examples.ch: 别指望我4点以后工作。
examples.en: You won't catch me at work after four o'clock.

examples.ch: 卡拉不可能在便宜的餐馆吃饭，不可能的。
examples.en: You won't catch Carla eating in a cheap restaurant, oh no.

phrases.trans_en: to become involved in something, often without wanting to

examples.ch: 他们在争论，不知怎地把我给卷了进去。
examples.en: They were having an argument and somehow I got caught up in it.

phrases.trans_ch: 屏住呼吸;（跑步或运动后）调整呼吸
phrases.trans_en: to stop breathing for a moment, or to begin to breathe correctly again after running or other exercise

examples.ch: 我只好坐下喘口气。
examples.en: I had to sit down and catch my breath.

phrases.trans_en: If you have caught the sun, the sun has made your skin a slightly darker brown or red colour.

examples.ch: 你脖子后面晒黑了。
examples.en: You've caught the sun on the back of your neck.

phrases.trans_ch: 被光照射;在光照下闪闪发亮
phrases.trans_en: If something catches the light, a light shines on it and makes it look shiny.
to start burning

examples.ch: 昨晚工厂失火，原因尚不清楚。
examples.en: For reasons which are not yet known, the factory caught fire late yesterday evening.

defines.trans_ch: 隐藏的问题；暗藏的不利因素
defines.trans_en: a hidden problem or disadvantage

examples.ch: 免费食物？这么好的事，不像是真的。这里面有什么蹊跷？
examples.en: Free food? It sounds too good to be true. What's the catch?

defines.trans_en: an amount of fish caught

examples.ch: 渔夫们不满意当天的收获。
examples.en: The fishermen were disappointed with their catch that day.

defines.trans_en: a person who is considered to be very suitable for a relationship

examples.ch: 她的新男朋友和她不太般配，是吧？
examples.en: Her new boyfriend's not much of a catch really, is he?

defines.trans_en: a small device on a door, window, bag, etc. that keeps it fastened
a feeling of stiffness in part of your body

examples.ch: 冬天的时候她会说自己关节僵硬。
examples.en: She would complain of catch in the joints during winter.

defines.trans_ch: （一个教区内的）总教堂，大教堂
defines.trans_en: a very large, usually stone, building for Christian worship. It is the largest and most important church of a diocese.

examples.ch: 索尔兹伯里大教堂
examples.en: Salisbury Cathedral

defines.trans_ch: 激光唱片，光盘（compact disc的缩写）
defines.trans_en:
