abbreviation for
compact disc : a small plastic disk with a shiny surface on which information, especially high-quality sound, is recorded
a machine that is used for playing music CDs
a unit of money worth 0.01 of a dollar, or a coin with this value

examples.ch: 打一个电话要花大约25美分。
examples.en: A call will cost you around 25 cents.

examples.ch: 在外币兑换方面，英镑兑美元汇率上升了两美分。
examples.en: On the foreign exchanges the pound rose two cents against the dollar.

defines.trans_en: a unit of money worth 0.01 of a euro
the middle point or part

examples.ch: 屋子中央有张大桌子。
examples.en: There was a large table in the centre of the room.

examples.ch: 市中心
examples.en: the town centre

defines.trans_en: a place or building, especially one where a particular activity happens

examples.ch: 体育／休闲／保健中心
examples.en: a sports/leisure/health centre

examples.ch: 园艺／购物中心
examples.en: a garden/shopping centre

examples.ch: 将会拨款在这一领域建立出色的研究中心。
examples.en: Grants will be given to establish centres of excellence (= places where a particular activity is done extremely well) in this field of research.

phrases.trans_ch: 关注的中心；瞩目的焦点
phrases.trans_en: the person or thing that everyone is most interested in and pays most attention to

examples.ch: 她不论走到哪里都是众人瞩目的焦点。
examples.en: She's the centre of attention everywhere she goes.

phrases.text: be at the centre of sth
phrases.trans_ch: 处于…的焦点；处于…的中心
phrases.trans_en: to be most involved in a situation

examples.ch: 马克处于争论的风口浪尖上。
examples.en: Mark was at the centre of the argument.

examples.ch: 一位社会工作者处于这起丑闻的漩涡之中。
examples.en: A social worker was at the centre of the scandal.

defines.trans_en: in politics, the people in a group who hold opinions that are not extreme but are between two opposites

examples.ch: 人们知道他的政治观点属于中间偏左／右。
examples.en: His political views are known to be left of/right of centre.

examples.ch: 中左派（政党）
examples.en: a centre left party

defines.trans_en: to put something in the middle of an area

examples.ch: 把这份文件中的所有标题居中。
examples.en: Centre (= put at equal distances from the left and right sides of the page) all the headings in this document.

defines.trans_en: a unit of length equal to 0.01 of a metre
a period of 100 years

examples.ch: 一百多年来市中心几乎没有变化。
examples.en: The city centre has scarcely changed in over a century.

examples.ch: 这座雕塑一定有好几百年历史了。
examples.en: This sculpture must be centuries old.

examples.ch: 她的从医生涯长达半个世纪。
examples.en: Her medical career spanned half a century.

defines.trans_en: a period of 100 years counted from what is believed to be the year of the birth of Jesus Christ

examples.ch: 罗马建于公元前8世纪。
examples.en: Rome was founded in the eighth century BC (= before Christ).

examples.ch: 他是研究15世纪意大利艺术的专家。
examples.en: He's an expert on 15th-century Italian art.

defines.trans_en: a score of 100 runs in cricket

phrases.trans_en: the time when one century ends and another begins

examples.ch: 这座博物馆在世纪之交重新开放。
examples.en: The museum reopened at the turn of the century.

defines.trans_ch: 肯定的，无疑的；有把握的；确定的
defines.trans_en: having no doubt or knowing exactly that something is true, or known to be true, correct, exact, or effective

examples.ch: 你敢肯定你给他们的号码没错吗？
examples.en: Are you absolutely certain (that) you gave them the right number?

examples.ch: 我确信你做得对。
examples.en: I feel certain (that) you're doing the right thing.

examples.ch: 你应该确保大家都能听懂指令。
examples.en: You should make certain (that) everyone understands the instructions.

examples.ch: 警方似乎确信他们会查出这起袭击事件的责任人。
examples.en: The police seem certain (that) they will find the people responsible for the attack.

examples.ch: 我不能确定这要花费多少钱。
examples.en: I'm not certain how much it will cost.

examples.ch: 他对袭击他的人的身份很肯定。
examples.en: He was quite certain about/of his attacker's identity.

examples.ch: 有一点是肯定的——她不会心甘情愿地辞职。
examples.en: One thing is certain - she won't resign willingly.

defines.trans_ch: 不可避免地，必然地；极可能地
defines.trans_en: impossible to avoid or extremely likely

examples.ch: 人口激增必然会引起大范围的饥荒。
examples.en: The population explosion is certain to cause widespread famine.

examples.ch: 限制石油生产的协议签订后油价必然会上涨。
examples.en: Oil prices are certain to rise following the agreement to limit production.

examples.ch: 凭他这么用功，一定会通过考试的。
examples.en: After all his hard work, he's certain to pass his exams.

examples.ch: 这支球队看上去几乎准能赢得比赛。
examples.en: The team looks almost certain to win the match.

examples.ch: 几乎可以肯定她会赢得金牌。
examples.en: It is virtually certain (that) she will win the gold medal.

examples.ch: 即便双方都同意停火，又怎么能确保他们不会出尔反尔呢？
examples.en: Even if a ceasefire can be agreed, how can they make certain (that) neither side breaks it?

examples.ch: 癌症患者不再像从前那样面临着必死的命运了。
examples.en: Cancer sufferers no longer face certain death as they once did.

examples.ch: 这一丑闻将意味着该党在选举中必败无疑。
examples.en: This scandal will mean certain defeat for the party in the election.

defines.trans_en: named but neither famous nor known well

examples.ch: 我今天和一位叫乔治‧迈克尔的人共进了午餐——我得说明一下，不是那个乔治‧迈克尔。
examples.en: I had lunch today with a certain George Michael - not the George Michael, I should explain.

defines.trans_en: limited

examples.ch: 在一定程度上我还是喜欢现代艺术的，可是不喜欢太实验性的东西。
examples.en: I like modern art to a certain extent/degree, but I don't like the really experimental stuff.

phrases.trans_en: to know or say something without doubt

examples.ch: 我不能肯定她是否会来。
examples.en: I don't know for certain if she's coming.

examples.ch: 我说不准我在那儿会呆多久。
examples.en: I can't say for certain how long I'll be there.

defines.trans_ch: （没有指明或描述的）某，某个，某些
defines.trans_en: particular but not named or described

examples.ch: 我们作出这样的决定是有一定原因的，这些原因仍得保密。
examples.en: We have certain reasons for our decision, which have to remain confidential.

examples.ch: 你是否认为在某些情况下战争是正当的？
examples.en: Do you think war is justifiable in certain circumstances?

examples.ch: 听众中某些人可能会对我要说的话有异议。
examples.en: Certain members of the audience may disagree with what I'm about to say.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于名词之前，用于表示难以描述或估算的）某一个，某一种
phrases.trans_en: used before a noun when it is difficult to describe something exactly or give its exact amount

examples.ch: 这首歌有某种感染力，可是我说不出到底是什么。
examples.en: The song has a certain appeal, but I'm not sure what it is.

defines.trans_en: some

examples.ch: 有些候选人离通常的标准差得很远，但其他一些确实很出色。
examples.en: Certain of the candidates were well below the usual standard, but others were very good indeed.

defines.trans_ch: （用于肯定的答复或强调）当然，毫无疑问，确实，肯定
defines.trans_en: used to reply completely or to emphasize something and show that there is no doubt about it

examples.ch: 她确实有个朋友叫马克，不过我不知道他是不是她男友。
examples.en: She certainly had a friend called Mark, but I don't know whether he was her boyfriend.

examples.ch: “这实在是个难题。”“是呀，确实不容易。”
examples.en: "This is rather a difficult question." "Yes, it's certainly not easy."

examples.ch: “你认为应当给教育拨更多经费吗?”“当然啦！”
examples.en: "Do you think more money should be given to education?" "Certainly!"

examples.ch: “你是不是把我们的结婚纪念日给忘了?”“当然没有！我已经在米歇尔餐厅预订了今晚的桌位。”
examples.en: "Had you forgotten about our anniversary?" "Certainly not! I've reserved a table at Michel's restaurant for this evening."

defines.trans_ch: （用于对请求表示强烈同意或不同意）当然，行
defines.trans_en: used when agreeing or disagreeing strongly to a request

examples.ch: “你能借给我10英镑吗？”“当然可以。”
examples.en: "Could you lend me £10?" "Certainly."

examples.ch: “你是不是从我钱包里拿钱了?”“绝对没有！”
examples.en: "Did you take any money out of my purse?" "Certainly not!"

defines.trans_ch: 必然地;很有可能发生地
defines.trans_en: very likely to happen

examples.ch: 如果民意调查准确无误，她定会赢得这场选举。
examples.en: She will certainly win the election if the opinion polls are accurate.

defines.trans_en: a seat for one person that has a back, usually four legs, and sometimes two arms
(the official position of) a person in charge of a meeting, official group or organization

examples.ch: 谁将主持下一次会议？
examples.en: Who will take the chair at the next meeting?

examples.ch: 所有问题都应当向主席提出。
examples.en: All questions should be addressed to the chair.

examples.ch: 她是当地一家学校的校董会主席。
examples.en: She is the chair of the board of governors at a local school.

defines.trans_en: (the position of) the person in charge of a college or university department

examples.ch: 他在二十世纪初被任命为剑桥大学物理系主任。
examples.en: He was appointed to the Chair of Physics at Cambridge in the early 20th century.

phrases.trans_ch: （用以处决罪犯的）电椅（the electric chair的非正式说法）
phrases.trans_en:
informal for
the electric chair

defines.trans_en: to be the person in charge of a meeting, etc.

examples.ch: 你愿意主持明天的会议吗？
examples.en: Would you like to chair tomorrow's meeting?

defines.trans_en: to exchange one thing for another thing, especially of a similar type

examples.ch: 她刚换了工作。
examples.en: She's just changed jobs.

examples.ch: 我们换个话题吧。
examples.en: Let's change the subject (= talk about something different).

defines.trans_en: to make or become different

examples.ch: 我几乎认不出她了——她变化太大了。
examples.en: I almost didn't recognize her - she'd changed so much.

examples.ch: 20年过去了，情况已经变了。
examples.en: That was 20 years ago and things have changed since then.

examples.ch: 什么也没有改变，不是吗——我走了两年，办公室看起来仍然是老样子。
examples.en: Nothing changes, does it - I've been away two years and the office still looks exactly the same.

examples.ch: 过去几年里人们的饮食习惯改变了许多。
examples.en: People have changed their diets a lot over the past few years.

examples.ch: 我打算改变一下发型。
examples.en: I'm going to change my hairstyle.

defines.trans_ch: （将购买的东西拿回店里去）换，交换
defines.trans_en: to take something you have bought back to a shop and exchange it for something else

examples.ch: 我不得不把买来的裤子拿回去换了条大些的。
examples.en: I had to change those trousers I bought for (= take them back to the shop in order to get) a bigger pair.

defines.trans_ch: 换乘，转乘（火车、公共汽车等）
defines.trans_en: to get off a train, bus, etc. and catch another in order to continue a journey

examples.ch: 到那里我得换乘两次（火车）。
examples.en: I had to change (trains) twice to get there.

examples.ch: 在彼得伯勒换车去约克。
examples.en: Change at Peterborough for York.

defines.trans_en: to get or give money in exchange for money, either because you want it in smaller units, or because you want the same value in foreign money

examples.ch: 请问你能把一张10英镑换开（换成两张5英镑）吗？
examples.en: Could you change a £10 note (for two fives), please?

examples.ch: 你能为我换开一张5英镑的纸币吗？
examples.en: Could you change a £5 note for me?

examples.ch: 我需要把手头的美元换成英镑。
examples.en: I need to change my dollars for/into English money.

defines.trans_en: to remove one set of clothes and put a different set on yourself or a young child, especially a baby, or to remove dirty sheets from a bed and put clean ones on it

examples.ch: 你不用换衣服——这样看上去就很好。
examples.en: You don't need to change - you look great as you are.

examples.ch: 我要换一身更漂亮点的衣服。
examples.en: I'll just change into (= get dressed in) something a bit smarter.

examples.ch: 给我5分钟换下工作服就跟你出去。
examples.en: Give me five minutes to change out of (= remove) my work clothes and I'll come out with you.

examples.ch: 你觉得他多久换一次衬衣？
examples.en: How often do you think he changes his shirt?

examples.ch: 你能给婴儿换一下尿布吗？
examples.en: Could you change the baby (= the baby's nappy)?

examples.ch: 我把客房的床单换过了。
examples.en: I've changed the sheets/the bed (= the sheets on the bed) in the guest room.

defines.trans_en: When the wind or the tide (= the rise and fall of the sea) changes, it starts to move in a different direction.

examples.ch: 潮水开始改向了。
examples.en: The tide is starting to change.

defines.trans_en: to put a vehicle into a different gear, usually in order to change the speed at which it is moving

examples.ch: 换挡
examples.en: to change gear

examples.ch: 我换到了第4挡。
examples.en: I changed into fourth (gear).

examples.ch: 转弯要换到低挡。
examples.en: Change down to go round the corner.

phrases.trans_en: to form a new opinion or make a new decision about something that is different from your old one

examples.ch: 要是你改变主意今晚不来了，给我打个电话就行。
examples.en: If you change your mind about coming tonight, just give me a call.

examples.ch: 我第一次见到他时并不喜欢他，可是现在已经改变了看法。
examples.en: When I first met him I didn't like him but I've changed my mind.

phrases.trans_en: to improve

examples.ch: 她自从开始新工作后态度确实变好了。
examples.en: Her attitude has definitely changed for the better since she started this new job.

phrases.trans_en: to improve the bad parts of your behaviour

examples.ch: 要是他想继续在这儿住下去，就得改改样子，学着干净整洁一点。
examples.en: If he wants to carry on living here, he's going to have to change his ways and learn to be a bit less messy.

defines.trans_en: the act of becoming different, or the result of something becoming different

examples.ch: 要是情况有了什么变化请告诉我。
examples.en: Let me know if there's any change in the situation.

examples.ch: 我们生活在一个大变革的时代。
examples.en: We're living in a time of great change.

examples.ch: 我们需要换个政府。
examples.en: We need a change of government.

examples.ch: 生活方式的改变
examples.en: a change in lifestyle

examples.ch: 他们已对房子作了很多变动。
examples.en: They've made a lot of changes to the house.

examples.ch: 新的管理层会进行根本的／彻底的／大范围的变革。
examples.en: The new management will make fundamental/radical/sweeping changes (= do things in a very different way).

defines.trans_ch: （令人愉快或有趣的）改进，改变
defines.trans_en: something that is pleasant or interesting because it is unusual or new

examples.ch: 看到她笑了，真好。
examples.en: It's nice to see her smile for a change.

examples.ch: “我们到花园里吃饭好吗?”“为什么不呢——这样会很新鲜。”
examples.en: "Shall we we eat in the garden?" "Why not - it'll make a change."

examples.ch: 我们的车总是红色的——该换一换了！
examples.en: We've always had a red car - it's time we had a change!

defines.trans_en: money in the form of coins rather than notes

examples.ch: 她给了我5欧元的硬币。
examples.en: She gave me €5 in change.

examples.ch: 我爸爸以前口袋里总是装着许多硬币。
examples.en: My dad always used to carry a lot of loose/small change (= coins) in his pocket.

defines.trans_en: smaller units of money given in exchange for larger units of the same amount

examples.ch: 你能换开20美元的钞票吗？
examples.en: Do you have change for a 20-dollar bill?

defines.trans_en: the money that is returned to someone who has paid for something that costs less than the amount that they gave

examples.ch: 我想你找错我钱了。
examples.en: I think you've given me the wrong change.

defines.trans_en: the action of putting on different clothes

examples.ch: 上电视前，她迅速换了套衣服。
examples.en: She did a quick change before going on TV.

defines.trans_en: the action of getting off a train, bus, etc. and catching another in order to continue a journey

examples.ch: 我讨厌频频换车的旅程。
examples.en: I hate journeys where you've got a lot of changes.

phrases.trans_en: a new situation

examples.ch: 她在同一家公司已经干了好多年了，觉得需要换个环境，所以申请了一份舞台监督的工作。
examples.en: She'd been with the same company for too many years and felt she needed a change of scene, so she applied for a job as a stage manager.

phrases.trans_en: a set of clothes as well as the ones that you are wearing

examples.ch: 你要是在外面过夜，就需要带一套换洗的衣服。
examples.en: You'll need a change of clothes if you're staying overnight.

defines.trans_en: a television station

examples.ch: 有线／地面／卫星频道
examples.en: a cable/terrestrial/satellite channel

examples.ch: 音乐／电影／新闻／购物／体育频道
examples.en: a music/movie/news/shopping/sports channel

examples.ch: 四频道的新闻
examples.en: the news on Channel 4

examples.ch: 她换到另一个频道看足球赛。
examples.en: She switched/turned to another channel to watch football.

defines.trans_ch: （水或其他液体流通的）管道，渠道;航道
defines.trans_en: a passage for water or other liquids to flow along, or a part of a river or other area of water that is deep and wide enough to provide a route for ships to travel along

examples.ch: 在这片平坦的农田上遍布着排水／灌溉渠。
examples.en: There are drainage/irrigation channels all over this flat agricultural land.

examples.ch: 所有船只都必须通过这条狭窄的航道。
examples.en: The boats all have to pass through this narrow channel.

defines.trans_en: a way of communicating with people or getting something done

examples.ch: 我们必须打开两国之间的交流渠道。
examples.en: We must open the channels of communication between the two countries.

examples.ch: 政府寻求一切外交／官方渠道以使人质获释。
examples.en: The government pursued every diplomatic/official channel to free the hostages.

examples.ch: 应当通过适当的／正常的渠道进行投诉。
examples.en: Complaints should be made through the proper/usual channels.

defines.trans_ch: （提供产品、信息等的）渠道，方法
defines.trans_en: a way of making a product, information, etc. available

examples.ch: 保险公司通过包括银行在内的各种渠道销售其产品。
examples.en: The insurer sells its products through a variety of distribution channels, including banks.

defines.trans_ch: （机场或港口检查旅客行李的）通道
defines.trans_en: a route or way out of an airport or port where travellers' bags are examined

examples.ch: 如果你没有东西要申报，就走绿色通道。
examples.en: If you have nothing to declare, go through the green channel.

examples.ch: 有商品要报税——走红色通道。
examples.en: Goods to declare - use the red channel.

phrases.trans_en: the area of sea that separates England from France

examples.ch: 我们将进行一次横渡英吉利海峡的一日游。
examples.en: We're going to have a day-trip across the Channel.

examples.ch: 我们用横渡英吉利海峡的渡船把汽车运到了法国。
examples.en: We took the car to France overnight on a (cross-)channel ferry.

defines.trans_en: to direct something into a particular place or situation

examples.ch: 修造了沟渠把水引离建筑物。
examples.en: Ditches were constructed to channel water away from the buildings.

examples.ch: 要是她能把那些精力都倾注到有用的事情上就好了。
examples.en: If she could only channel all that energy into something useful.

examples.ch: 大笔经费投入到了那个领域的研究中。
examples.en: A lot of money has been channelled into research in that particular field.

defines.trans_en: to behave like or copy another person, so that you almost seem to be that other person

examples.ch: 这支乐队身着60年代的服装，似乎是在模仿甲壳虫乐队。
examples.en: The band were dressed in 1960s outfits and seemed to be channelling the Beatles.

defines.trans_en: to talk to someone in a friendly informal way

examples.ch: 她会花上几个小时跟朋友电话聊天。
examples.en: She spends hours on the phone chatting to her friends.

examples.ch: 我们正在聊上个周末做了些什么。
examples.en: We were just chatting about what we did last weekend.

examples.ch: 每次我走进去都会发现他俩正聊得起劲。
examples.en: Whenever I walk in, I always find the two of them chatting away (= talking eagerly).

defines.trans_en: to take part in a discussion that involves sending messages over the internet, by smartphone, etc.

examples.ch: 使用这个应用程序免费在世界任何地方聊天和发送照片。
examples.en: Use the app to chat and send photos free from anywhere in the world.

defines.trans_en: a friendly, informal conversation

examples.ch: 为什么你不给我打个电话，我们好好聊一聊呢？
examples.en: Why don't you give me a call and we'll have a chat?

examples.ch: 今天我和老板随便聊了一下可能涨工资的事。
examples.en: I had a chat with my boss today about a possible salary increase.

examples.ch: 那不过是普通的闲聊。
examples.en: It was the usual idle chat (= conversation about unimportant things).

defines.trans_ch: （在网络上或通过电话）发短信（聊天）
defines.trans_en: a discussion that involves sending messages over the internet, by phone, using a messaging service, etc.

examples.ch: 怎么才能开始群聊？
examples.en: How do I start a group chat?

defines.trans_en: costing little money or less than is usual or expected

examples.ch: 我在最后一刻买到了一张便宜的机票。
examples.en: I got a cheap flight at the last minute.

examples.ch: 超市里的食物通常要便宜些。
examples.en: Food is usually cheaper in supermarkets.

examples.ch: 儿童和老人可以享受廉价火车票。
examples.en: Children and the elderly are entitled to cheap train tickets.

examples.ch: 这个计划实施起来简单又省钱。
examples.en: The system is simple and cheap to operate.

examples.ch: 在人们大批失业的时候，有大量廉价劳动力供雇主选用。
examples.en: During times of mass unemployment, there's a pool of cheap labour for employers to draw from.

examples.ch: 战争期间，人命变得很不值钱。
examples.en: In a war, human life becomes very cheap (= seems to be of little value).

defines.trans_en: If a shop or restaurant is cheap, it charges low prices.

examples.ch: 我去城里收费最便宜的那家理发店理发。
examples.en: I go to the cheapest hairdresser's in town.

defines.trans_en: used to describe goods that are both low in quality and low in price

examples.ch: 我买了些便宜的劣质葡萄酒烧菜用。
examples.en: I bought some cheap wine for cooking with.

examples.ch: 他买了双便宜鞋，两个月之后就全破了。
examples.en: He bought some cheap shoes that fell apart after a couple of months.

defines.trans_en: unwilling to spend money

examples.ch: 他真小气，居然连张生日卡都没给我买。
examples.en: He's so cheap he didn't even buy me a card for my birthday.

defines.trans_en: If you describe the way a person is dressed as cheap, you mean that it is very obvious that they are trying to sexually attract other people.
unpleasant and unkind

examples.ch: 希望你别再对我的朋友们开那种低级玩笑了。
examples.en: I wish you'd stop making cheap jokes about my friends.

phrases.trans_en: cheap but good or enjoyable

examples.ch: 街角处有家饭店，那里的饭菜价廉物美。
examples.en: There's a restaurant round the corner that serves cheap and cheerful food.

phrases.trans_en: If you get goods on the cheap, you get them for a low price, often from someone you know who works in the company or business that produces them.
costing little and of very bad quality

defines.trans_en: for little money or for less than is usual

examples.ch: 我在大减价的时候买到了几双便宜鞋。
examples.en: I got some shoes cheap in the sale.

examples.ch: 市场上有些椅子在廉价出售。
examples.en: There were some chairs in the market going cheap (= they were not expensive).

defines.trans_en: to make certain that something or someone is correct, safe, or suitable by examining it, him, or her quickly

examples.ch: 你每次开车长途旅行前都应当检查一下油箱、水箱和轮胎。
examples.en: You should always check your oil, water, and tyres before taking your car on a long trip.

examples.ch: 海关人员让我们停了下来，检查我们的包里有没有烟酒。
examples.en: Customs stopped us and checked (= searched) our bags for alcohol and cigarettes.

examples.ch: 我做完考卷后检查答案有没有错误。
examples.en: After I'd finished the exam, I checked my answers for mistakes.

examples.ch: 下星期医生会来检查你恢复得怎么样。
examples.en: The doctor will call next week to check on your progress.

examples.ch: 我每过几天就去看望我们年迈的邻居，看他是否一切都好。
examples.en: I check on (= visits) our elderly neighbour every few days to make sure that he's alright.

examples.ch: 离开家前我总要检查一下，看窗户是否都已关好。
examples.en: I always check (that) I've shut the windows before I leave the house.

examples.ch: 他离开这幢房子前又把所有的门都检查了一遍。
examples.en: He double-checked all the doors (= checked them all twice) before leaving the house.

defines.trans_en: to find out about something

examples.ch: 我昨天给他们打了电话，核实他们什么时候到达。
examples.en: I called them yesterday to check when they were arriving.

examples.ch: 要是你离修理厂不远，能去看一下车是否修好了吗？
examples.en: If you're near the garage, could you check to see (= ask) if the car's ready?

examples.ch: 如果你不清楚自己的合法权利，我可以去请教律师。
examples.en: If you're unsure of your legal rights, I would check with (= ask) a lawyer.

defines.trans_en: to stop someone from doing or saying something, or to prevent something from increasing or continuing

examples.ch: 为了控制疾病的蔓延，他们开始给孩子们注射疫苗。
examples.en: They have begun to vaccinate children in an attempt to check the spread of the disease.

defines.trans_en: to give your bags to airport employees to be put on a plane for you, rather than carrying them on and off the plane yourself

defines.trans_en: in the game of chess, to put the other player's king under direct attack, so that he or she is forced to defend against the attack in the next move

US spelling of 
cheque UK
an examination of something in order to make certain that it is correct or the way it should be

a 
bill  in a restaurant, etc.

examples.en: He is one of our greatest classical actors.

defines.trans_en: used to describe something that is attractive because it has a simple, traditional style

examples.ch: 我喜欢他服装设计中简洁典雅的线条。
examples.en: I love the classical lines of his dress designs.

defines.trans_ch: 和古希腊和古罗马文化相关的
defines.trans_en: belonging to or relating to the culture of ancient Rome and Greece

examples.ch: 古希腊和古罗马文化世界
examples.en: the classical world

examples.ch: 古希腊和古罗马文学
examples.en: classical literature

defines.trans_en: someone who is in the same class as you at school
a room in a school or college where groups of students are taught

phrases.trans_en: being taught by a teacher

examples.ch: 学习计算机的学生每周有两天在计算机室上机，四天在教室上课。
examples.en: Students learning computer studies spend two days each week in a computer lab and four days in the classroom.

phrases.trans_en: teaching classes of students in school or college

examples.ch: 学校里也没有晋升制度，所以老师在整个教学生涯中都要授课。
examples.en: There are also no promotions within the school, so that teachers remain in the classroom throughout their careers.

defines.trans_en: not dirty

examples.ch: 干净的白衬衫
examples.en: a clean white shirt

examples.ch: 清洁的空气／水
examples.en: clean air/water

examples.ch: 饭前一定要把手洗干净。
examples.en: Make sure your hands are clean before you have your dinner.

examples.ch: 医院必须保持一尘不染，干干净净。
examples.en: Hospitals need to be kept spotlessly (= extremely) clean.

defines.trans_ch: 诚实的;公正的;光明正大的;清白的
defines.trans_en: honest or fair, or showing that you have not done anything illegal

examples.ch: 公正的比赛／竞赛
examples.en: a good clean fight/contest

examples.ch: 法官在宣判时考虑到了被告没有前科。
examples.en: The judge took the defendant's clean record (= the absence of previous involvement in crime) into account when passing sentence.

examples.ch: 我开车一直都无违章记录。
examples.en: I've always had a clean driving licence.

examples.ch: 那个阻截真是干净利落。
examples.en: It was a clean tackle.

defines.trans_ch: 清白的；没有私藏（或携带）毒品的；没有赃物的
defines.trans_en: not doing anything illegal, or not having or carrying illegal drugs or stolen goods

examples.ch: 警察昨夜搜查了皮特，可是未搜出他有任何违禁品。
examples.en: The police busted Pete last night, but he was clean.

defines.trans_en: morally acceptable

examples.ch: 这完全是个正派纯洁的玩笑。
examples.en: It's all good, clean fun.

examples.ch: 生活清白的
examples.en: clean living

defines.trans_ch: 不猥亵的，不下流的;无色情的
defines.trans_en: not about sex

examples.ch: 你脑子里难道就没有点正经的笑话么？
examples.en: Can't you think of any clean jokes?

defines.trans_ch: 边缘整齐的；平滑的；流线型的；简洁流畅的
defines.trans_en: having no rough edges, and smooth, straight, or equally balanced

examples.ch: 我摔断了腿，不过医生说断口很整齐，应该很快就会长好。
examples.en: I've broken my leg, but the doctor says that it's a clean break, so it should heal easily.

examples.ch: 皮特森干净利落的一击将球直接击出边界。
examples.en: A good clean hit from Pietersen sent the ball straight out to the boundary.

examples.ch: 他喜欢这辆车简洁流畅的线条。
examples.en: What he liked about the car was its clean lines.

examples.ch: 我想切得整整齐齐，可是刀子不够锋利。
examples.en: I tried to make a clean cut, but the knife wasn't sharp enough.

defines.trans_en: complete

examples.ch: 要是我们一刀两断，对双方都好。
examples.en: It's better for both of us if we make a clean break (of it) (= end our relationship completely).

examples.ch: 萨拉说自己需要和过去彻底决裂。
examples.en: Sara says she needs a clean break with the past.

examples.ch: 人们期望新首相对政府进行大换班。
examples.en: The new prime minister is expected to make a clean sweep (= a complete change) of the government.

defines.trans_ch: 未写过的;未用过的;空白的
defines.trans_en: When something you write on is clean, there is nothing on it or it is not yet used.

examples.ch: 拿一张白纸来。
examples.en: Take a clean sheet of paper.

defines.trans_ch: 把…弄干净;打扫;清洁;清洗
defines.trans_en: to remove dirt from something

examples.ch: 今天上午我要擦窗户。
examples.en: I'm going to clean the windows this morning.

examples.ch: 每次饭后你都应当清洁牙齿。
examples.en: You should always clean your teeth after meals.

examples.ch: 你把门上的指纹擦掉，好吗？
examples.en: Would you clean the fingermarks from/off the door?

examples.ch: 他叫她帮忙打扫马厩。
examples.en: He asked her to help him clean out the stables.

defines.trans_en: to become clean

examples.ch: 这地毯不太好清洗。
examples.en: This carpet doesn't clean very well.

examples.ch: 我希望我衬衫上的这些血迹能洗掉。
examples.en: I hope these bloodstains will clean off my shirt.

defines.trans_ch: 清除（鱼或动物）的内脏（以备烹饪）
defines.trans_en: to prepare a fish or an animal killed for food by removing the inside parts of it that are not eaten
when something is cleaned

examples.ch: 这些窗户需要彻底擦洗一遍。
examples.en: These windows need a really thorough clean.

defines.trans_en: completely

examples.ch: 昨晚我本来应该跟露西见面的，结果我忘得一干二净。
examples.en: I clean forgot that I was supposed to be meeting Lucy last night.

examples.ch: 他欺骗顾客多年，还一点事都没有。
examples.en: He's been cheating his customers for years, and getting clean away with it.

examples.ch: 子弹穿透了他的肩膀。
examples.en: The bullet went clean through his shoulder.

defines.trans_ch: 明白的;清楚的;易懂的;清晰的
defines.trans_en: easy to understand, hear, read, or see

examples.ch: 清楚易懂的说明／指示
examples.en: clear instructions/directions

examples.ch: 我们能把声音再调清晰一点吗？
examples.en: Can we make the sound any clearer?

examples.ch: 我们的新电视图像十分清晰。
examples.en: Our new television has a very clear picture.

defines.trans_ch: 确定的；无可置疑的；明白无误的；明显的
defines.trans_en: certain, having no doubt, or obvious

examples.ch: 他根本不清楚自己想过怎样的生活。
examples.en: He isn't at all clear about what he wants to do with his life.

examples.ch: 我很快明白过来我不适合当老师。
examples.en: It is rapidly becoming clear (to me) (that) I'm not suited to being a teacher.

examples.ch: 不知这次罢工会持续多久。
examples.en: It isn't clear how long the strike will go on for.

examples.ch: 这明显是一起贪腐案。
examples.en: It's a clear case of corruption.

examples.ch: 你的立场已经十分明确了。
examples.en: You've made your position quite clear (= there is no doubt about what you think).

defines.trans_ch: 晴朗的;纯净的;透明的;清澈的
defines.trans_en: pure or easy to see through, with no marks or areas that are less transparent

examples.ch: 透明的玻璃
examples.en: clear glass

examples.ch: 湖水清澈见底。
examples.en: The water in the lake is so clear that you can see the bottom.

examples.ch: 沙漠上明朗的天空中可以看到数以百计的星星。
examples.en: We could see hundreds of stars in the clear desert sky.

examples.ch: 她肤色光洁美丽。
examples.en: She has a beautifully clear skin/complexion (= with no marks or spots).

examples.ch: 预计今后几天天气会持续晴朗。
examples.en: The weather is expected to remain clear for the next few days.

examples.ch: 天气晴朗的时候，从这里可以看到层层山峦。
examples.en: You can see the mountains from here on a clear day.

defines.trans_en: used to describe a pleasant, pure sound

examples.ch: 清亮的笛声
examples.en: the clear sound of the flute

defines.trans_en: used to describe something that you remember easily

examples.ch: 我清楚地记得小时候去爷爷的农场时的情形。
examples.en: I have clear memories of visiting my grandfather's farm as a child.

defines.trans_ch: 无遮盖的;无阻碍的;畅通的
defines.trans_en: not covered or blocked by anything

examples.ch: 从酒店的窗口我们可以一览无余地看到大海。
examples.en: We have a clear view of the ocean from our hotel window.

examples.ch: 因为交通顺畅，所以路上走得很快。
examples.en: The journey was quite quick because the road was clear (= there was not much traffic on it).

examples.ch: 每天工作结束时，我总是喜欢把案头收拾得干干净净。
examples.en: I always like to leave my desk clear (= with no work on it) at the end of the day.

defines.trans_ch: 不忙的，空闲的；没有安排的
defines.trans_en: not busy or filled by any planned activity

examples.ch: 下星期我只有周二下午有空。
examples.en: The only time I have clear next week is Tuesday afternoon.

examples.ch: 我们有整整两周时间来完成装修。
examples.en: We've got two clear (= whole) weeks in which to finish the decorating.

defines.trans_en: without being or feeling guilty

examples.ch: 问心无愧
examples.en: to have a clear conscience

defines.trans_ch: 头脑清醒的;思维清晰的;思维敏捷的
defines.trans_en: free from confusion; able to think quickly and well

examples.ch: 玛丽擅长作决断，因为她思维清晰。
examples.en: Marie is good at making decisions because she's a very clear thinker.

defines.trans_en: without problems or difficulties

examples.ch: 这是他生平第一次偿清了债务。
examples.en: This is the first time in his life that he's been clear of (= without) debt.

defines.trans_en: used to describe an amount of money that is left after all necessary payments have been made

examples.ch: 学校的夏季义卖会净赚了1500英镑。
examples.en: The school summer fair made a clear profit of £1,500.

examples.ch: 比尔每星期净赚400美元。
examples.en: Bill earns a clear $400 a week/earns $400 a week clear.

defines.trans_en: not touching something, or away from something

examples.ch: 只有一位骑手利落地跨过了最高的障碍物。
examples.en: Only one competitor made a clear jump of the highest fence (= jumped over it without touching it).

examples.ch: 等我们离开大路后就停车野餐。
examples.en: When we're clear of the main road, we'll stop for our picnic.

phrases.trans_ch: （强调刚说的话或表达自己的权威）我讲清楚了吗？听明白我的意思了吗?
phrases.trans_en: something you say in order to emphasize what you have just said, or to express your authority

examples.ch: 我不会再容忍这样的行为了。我的话你明白吗？
examples.en: I will not tolerate this behaviour any longer. Do I make myself clear?

defines.trans_ch: 移走;清除;清理;清扫;疏通
defines.trans_en: to remove or get rid of whatever is blocking or filling something, or to stop being blocked or full

examples.ch: 事故发生后，用了好几个小时来清理道路。
examples.en: It took several hours to clear the road after the accident.

examples.ch: 你要是去收拾桌子，我就去煮咖啡。
examples.en: I'll make the coffee if you'll clear the table.

examples.ch: 用了这种鼻腔喷剂，你的鼻塞就会好一点。
examples.en: If you use this nasal spray, your nose should clear.

examples.ch: 我姑妈过世后，我们安排清理了她的房间。
examples.en: After my aunt died, we arranged for her house to be cleared (= for the furniture to be removed from it).

examples.ch: 按这个键可以清除电脑屏幕上的文档和图片。
examples.en: If you press this key, the computer screen will clear (= the text and pictures will be removed from it).

examples.ch: 现在商店都在搞特价促销来清理夏季库存。
examples.en: Shops are currently holding sales to clear their summer stock (= get rid of goods by selling them cheaply).

examples.ch: 保罗帮助那位上了年纪的邻居清扫她家门前路上的积雪。
examples.en: Paul helped his elderly neighbour by clearing her path of snow/clearing snow from her path.

examples.ch: 把你的东西从沙发上拿走好吗？
examples.en: Could you clear your things off/from the sofa?

examples.ch: 我总是完成手头的工作才下班。
examples.en: I never leave work until I've cleared my in-tray (= have finished the work that needs to be done).

defines.trans_en: to prove that someone is not guilty of something that they were accused of

examples.ch: 在被监禁多年之后，这些人终于洗清了罪名，证明与爆炸事件无关。
examples.en: After many years in prison, the men were finally cleared of the bombings.

defines.trans_en: to give official permission for something

examples.ch: 议会不顾当地居民的反对，批准了建新超市的计划。
examples.en: Despite local opposition, the plans for the new supermarket have been cleared by the council.

examples.ch: 女士们先生们，飞机已得到空中管制的起飞许可。
examples.en: Ladies and gentlemen, air-traffic control has now cleared the plane for take-off.

examples.ch: 我不知道今晚能否拿到车——我得征得母亲的同意。
examples.en: I don't know if I can get the car tonight - I'll have to clear it with Mum.

defines.trans_en: to satisfy the official conditions of something

examples.ch: 进入该国必须先通过海关检查。
examples.en: Before you can enter the country, you have to clear customs.

defines.trans_en: to become or make something pure or easy to see through

examples.ch: 孩子们喜欢搅动池底的淤泥，然后看着水重新慢慢变清。
examples.en: The children enjoyed stirring the mud at the bottom of the pond, then watching the water slowly clear again.

examples.ch: 更健康的饮食，你的皮肤就会变光洁的。
examples.en: Your skin would clear (= become free of spots) if you had a healthier diet.

examples.ch: 雷雨过后，天放晴了。
examples.en: After the thunderstorm, the sky cleared (= stopped being cloudy).

examples.ch: 到正午时分雾有望散去。
examples.en: The fog is expected to have cleared (away) (= gone) by midday.

defines.trans_ch: 使头脑清醒；使思维清晰
defines.trans_en: to make your mind free from confusion so that you can think quickly and well

examples.ch: 我需要呼吸点新鲜空气来清醒一下头脑。
examples.en: I need to get some fresh air to clear my head (= to make me able to think well).

defines.trans_ch: （支付各种费用后）净剩下，纯收入为
defines.trans_en: to have an amount of money left from your earnings after any necessary payments, charges, taxes, etc.

examples.ch: 比尔每星期净赚200美元。
examples.en: Bill clears $200 a week.

defines.trans_en: to (cause a cheque to) go from one bank to another through a central organization, so that money can be paid to the person it is owed to

examples.ch: 支票过户一般需要4到5个工作日。
examples.en: It usually takes four to five working days for a cheque to clear.

defines.trans_en: to jump or go over something without touching it

examples.ch: 马腾空越过篱笆，还高出了好几英寸。
examples.en: The horse cleared the fence with inches to spare.

phrases.trans_en: to give a small cough

examples.ch: 她讲话前紧张地清了清嗓子。
examples.en: She cleared her throat nervously before she began to speak.

phrases.text: clear your debts/clear yourself of debts
phrases.trans_en: to pay back all the money that you owe

defines.trans_en: not touching, or away from

examples.ch: 请站得离门远一点。
examples.en: Stand clear of the doors, please.

examples.ch: 千万不要贴着路缘停车。
examples.en: Make sure you park clear of the kerb.

examples.ch: 孩子们能从火灾中幸存下来，多亏了一位邻居把他们拉出火场。
examples.en: The children were saved from the fire only because a neighbour pulled them clear.

phrases.trans_en: to avoid something or someone

examples.ch: 父母告诫他不要惹麻烦。
examples.en: His parents warned him to steer clear of trouble.

defines.trans_en: having or showing the ability to learn and understand things quickly and easily

examples.ch: 朱迪向来不是很聪明，可是她很用功。
examples.en: Judy has never been very clever, but she tries hard.

examples.ch: 菲奥纳很擅长物理。
examples.en: Fiona is very clever at physics.

examples.ch: 查利有个妙计可以使我们摆脱现在的困境。
examples.en: Charlie has a clever idea/plan for getting us out of our present difficulties.

defines.trans_en: skilful

examples.ch: 我妈妈手很巧。
examples.en: My mother is very clever with her hands.

defines.trans_en: well-designed

examples.ch: 我有个设计巧妙的开罐器。
examples.en: I've got a clever little gadget for opening jars.

defines.trans_en: showing intelligence, but not sincere, polite, or serious

examples.ch: 别跟我油嘴滑舌了，小姐。
examples.en: That's enough clever talk, young lady.

defines.trans_en: to carry out a computer operation by pressing a button on the mouse or keyboard

examples.ch: 如果你想打开一个文件，双击该文件图标。
examples.en: If you want to open a file, click twice on the icon for it.

examples.ch: 选中了你想要的文件，用鼠标点击“打开”方框。
examples.en: When you have selected the file you want, click the "Open" box.

defines.trans_ch: （使）发出短而尖的声音;（使）发出咔嗒声
defines.trans_en: to make a short, sharp sound, or to make something do this

examples.ch: 门在她身后咔嗒一声关上了。
examples.en: The door clicked shut behind her.

examples.ch: 你能听到咔嗒咔嗒的怪声吗？
examples.en: Can you hear that strange clicking noise?

examples.ch: 保罗打了个响指叫侍者。
examples.en: Paul clicked his fingers (= moved his thumb against his middle finger to make a short sharp sound) to attract the waiter's attention.

examples.ch: 士兵们立正时脚后跟咔嚓一声碰在一起。
examples.en: Soldiers click their heels (= bring them sharply together) when they stand to attention.

defines.trans_en: to become friendly or popular

examples.ch: 莉兹和我一见如故。
examples.en: Liz and I really clicked the first time we met.

examples.ch: 尚无迹象表明新日间肥皂剧受到电视观众的欢迎。
examples.en: The new daytime soap opera has yet to show signs that it's clicking with the television audience.

defines.trans_en: to be understood, or become clear suddenly

examples.ch: 突然一切都清楚了，我意识到自己在哪里见过他了。
examples.en: Suddenly everything clicked and I realized where I'd met him.

examples.ch: 当他谈起自己的学校生活时，我突然想起来我曾经在哪儿见过他了。
examples.en: As he talked about his schooldays, it suddenly clicked where I had met him before.

examples.ch: 所以，你最后终于明白你必须给自己找份工作，是吗？
examples.en: So it's finally clicked that you're going to have to get yourself a job, has it?

examples.ch: 在戏的最后一幕，一切都真相大白了。
examples.en: In the last act of the play, everything clicks into place.

defines.trans_en: a short, sharp sound

examples.ch: 士兵敬礼的时候脚后跟咔嚓一声并拢。
examples.en: The soldier gave a click of his heels as he saluted.

defines.trans_en: a speech sound made by sucking air quickly into the mouth, but not into the lungs, using the tongue or lips

examples.ch: 咔嗒音可以在几种南部非洲语言中听到。
examples.en: Clicks are found in several southern African languages.

defines.trans_en: the act of pressing a button on the mouse (= small control device) of a computer to operate it

phrases.trans_ch: 一键之遥（指很容易从计算机、特别是互联网上获得）
phrases.trans_en: If something is (just) a click away, it is very easy to get on your computer, especially from the Internet.

examples.ch: 所有的参考资料都在计算机数据库中，不过一键之遥。
examples.en: All reference materials are just a click away in the computer databases.

defines.trans_en: to go up, or to go towards the top of something

examples.ch: 飞机迅速爬升到3万英尺的高度。
examples.en: The plane climbed quickly to a height of 30,000 feet.

examples.ch: 出了村庄，这条路沿着山坡陡然向上。
examples.en: As it leaves the village, the road climbs steeply up the mountain.

examples.ch: 太阳升得更高了。
examples.en: The sun climbed higher in the sky.

defines.trans_en: to use your legs, or your legs and hands, to go up or onto the top of something

examples.ch: 爬楼梯／登山
examples.en: to climb the stairs/mountain

examples.ch: 我讨厌爬梯子。
examples.en: I hate climbing ladders.

examples.ch: 下周末我们要去苏格兰爬山。
examples.en: We're going climbing (= climbing mountains as a sport) in Scotland next weekend.

defines.trans_en: If a price, number, or amount climbs, it increases.

examples.ch: 过去几年里我们的成本增长很快。
examples.en: Our costs have climbed rapidly in the last few years.

defines.trans_ch: 提高社会地位，向上爬；晋升
defines.trans_en: to move into a higher social position, or to improve your position at work

examples.ch: 他很快攀上了事业巅峰。
examples.en: He quickly climbed to the top of his profession.

defines.trans_en: to move into or out of a small space awkwardly or with difficulty or effort

examples.ch: 他们爬上卡车开走了。
examples.en: They climbed into the truck and drove away.

examples.ch: 我们没法让汤姆呆在婴儿床里不往外爬。
examples.en: We can't stop Tom climbing out of his cot.

defines.trans_en: to grow upwards

examples.ch: 我们房子的墙上爬满了常春藤。
examples.en: There's masses of ivy climbing up/over the walls of our house.

defines.trans_en: an act or process of climbing

examples.ch: 爬山以后我们累坏了。
examples.en: We were very tired after our climb.

examples.ch: 下山比上山用的时间更长。
examples.en: The climb down the mountain took longer than the climb up.

examples.ch: 今年，我已爬过3次山了。
examples.en: I've made three climbs so far this year.

examples.ch: 她很快就上台掌权了。
examples.en: Her climb to power has been very rapid.

defines.trans_en: a place or object to be climbed

examples.ch: 艾格尔山的北坡很难攀登。
examples.en: The north face of the Eiger is a very difficult climb.

defines.trans_en: a device for measuring and showing time, usually found in or on a building and not worn by a person

examples.ch: 我们家的壁炉架上有一只老式钟表。
examples.en: We have an antique clock on our mantelpiece.

examples.ch: 市政厅的大钟指向了9点。
examples.en: The town-hall clock says (= shows that the time is) nine o'clock.

examples.ch: 我觉得厨房的钟表快／慢了。
examples.en: I think the kitchen clock is fast/slow (= is showing a later/earlier time than it should).

examples.ch: 时钟敲响12点。
examples.en: The clock began to strike twelve.

examples.ch: 她根据收音机上的报时信号对表。
examples.en: She set her clock (= put it to the right time) by the time signal on the radio.

phrases.trans_ch: （按照官方时间）把时钟拨慢一小时
phrases.trans_en: to change the time on your clocks to an hour earlier, at an officially chosen time of year

examples.ch: 今晚别忘了把钟拨慢一小时。
examples.en: Don't forget to turn the clocks back tonight.

phrases.trans_ch: （按照官方时间）把时钟拨快一小时
phrases.trans_en: to change the time on your clocks to an hour later, at an officially chosen time of year
a speedometer (= a device that measures speed)

examples.ch: 速度表上显示我的车速只有每小时30英里。
examples.en: I was only doing 30 mph on the clock.

phrases.trans_en: a milometer (= a device for recording distance travelled)

examples.ch: 根据里程表，我的车才跑了1万英里。
examples.en: My car's only got 10,000 miles on the clock.

defines.trans_en: to take a particular time exactly to do or complete something

examples.ch: 他100米跑了10秒。
examples.en: He clocked ten seconds in the 100 metres (= he ran it in ten seconds).

defines.trans_ch: 显示，达到（某一速度或里程）
defines.trans_en: to show or reach a particular speed or distance on a measuring device

examples.ch: 警察测出他在限速每小时50英里的地区开到了时速80英里。
examples.en: The police clocked him doing 80 mph in a 50 mph area.

examples.ch: 吉姆的车不到两年跑了4万英里。
examples.en: Jim's car has clocked (up) (= travelled) 40,000 miles in less than two years.

defines.trans_ch: 打，揍，击（尤指头部或脸部）
defines.trans_en: to hit someone, especially on the head or face

examples.ch: 这时，另一个家伙转过身来揍了他一顿。
examples.en: Then the other guy turned round and clocked him one (= hit him).

defines.trans_en: to (cause something to) change from being open to not being open

examples.ch: 请关上门／窗，好吗？
examples.en: Could you close the door/window please?

examples.ch: 闭上眼睛——我有份惊喜给你。
examples.en: Close your eyes - I've got a surprise for you.

defines.trans_ch: （商店或餐馆）关门，不营业，打烊;（公共场所）不开放
defines.trans_en: When a shop, restaurant, or public place closes, people cannot go into it.

examples.ch: 银行关门了，所以我取不了钱。
examples.en: The banks had closed (to customers) so I couldn't get any money out.

examples.ch: 博物馆5点半闭馆。
examples.en: The museum closes at 5.30.

examples.ch: 我们喝不上酒了！已经打烊了。
examples.en: We can't get a drink! It's after closing time.

defines.trans_en: to (cause something to) end

examples.ch: 这部戏以男女主人公的惨死而告终。
examples.en: The play closed with the tragic death of both hero and heroine.

examples.ch: 她以简短的讲话结束了会议。
examples.en: She closed the meeting with a short speech.

examples.ch: 英镑在一天交易结束时收盘价为1.47美元。
examples.en: The pound closed at (= was worth) $1.47 at the end of the day's trading.

defines.trans_ch: （使）（生意或组织）倒闭;关闭（使）（业务）停止
defines.trans_en: to (cause a business, organization, or business arrangement to) stop operating

examples.ch: 我一到伦敦就把那个银行账户撤销了。
examples.en: I closed that bank account when I came to London.

examples.ch: 这家工厂十几年前就关闭了。
examples.en: The factory closed over ten years ago.

phrases.trans_en: to make a successful business arrangement with someone

examples.ch: 我们与一家大超市做成了一笔交易。
examples.en: We closed a deal with a major supermarket.

defines.trans_en: the end of something, or the time when you end it

examples.ch: 我尽力使这次谈话快点结束。
examples.en: I tried to bring the conversation to a close.

examples.ch: “先生们，我们这次会议就到此为止吧，”主席说。
examples.en: "Let's draw this meeting to a close, gentlemen," said the chairman.

defines.trans_ch: （通常通向私人住宅的）街道，死巷，死胡同
defines.trans_en: a road, usually with private houses, that vehicles can only enter from one end

examples.ch: 他住在巴克巷83号。
examples.en: He lives at 83 Barker Close.

defines.trans_en: having direct family connections or shared beliefs, support, and sympathy

examples.ch: 葬礼上没有多少人——只有一些至亲。
examples.en: There weren't many people at the funeral - just close family/relatives.

examples.ch: 这个政党令人担忧，因为他们同恐怖组织有密切联系。
examples.en: They're a worrying political party because of their close links/ties with terrorist groups.

examples.ch: 在婴儿出生后的头几个月，母婴之间有一种非常亲密的纽带联系。
examples.en: In those early months, there's a very close bond between mother and child.

examples.ch: 邻里关系密切的社区
examples.en: a close community

defines.trans_ch: 亲密的;亲近的;联系紧密的
defines.trans_en: People who are close know each other very well and like each other a lot, or who see and talk to each other a lot.

examples.ch: 米拉是我的一位密友。
examples.en: Mira is one of my closest friends.

examples.ch: 她和父亲的关系不好，可是和母亲的关系非常亲近。
examples.en: Her relationship isn't good with her father, but she's very close to her mother.

examples.ch: 这些年，哥哥和我的关系亲密多了。
examples.en: My brother and I have become much closer over the years.

defines.trans_en: looking at or listening to someone or something very carefully

examples.ch: 警察密切关注着局势。
examples.en: Police are paying close attention to the situation.

examples.ch: 更仔细地看看这张照片。
examples.en: Take a closer look at this photograph.

defines.trans_en: unwilling to talk about things to other people

examples.ch: 他对自己的过去守口如瓶——好像要隐瞒什么。
examples.en: He's so close about his past - it seems like he's hiding something.

defines.trans_ch: 封闭的;密不透风的;闷热的
defines.trans_en: used to describe weather or air conditions in which it is difficult to breathe and it is uncomfortably warm

examples.ch: 我能开窗吗？这里太闷了。
examples.en: Can I open the window? It's very close in here.

defines.trans_ch: （空间或时间上）接近的（地），靠近的（地）
defines.trans_en: not far in position or time

examples.ch: 罗西，别靠那条狗太近。
examples.en: Don't get too close to that dog, Rosie.

examples.ch: 我讨厌别人站得离我太近。
examples.en: I hate people standing too close to me.

examples.ch: 随着圣诞节临近，商店里越来越拥挤。
examples.en: As Christmas gets closer, the shops get more and more crowded.

examples.ch: 埃玛看起来要哭了。
examples.en: Emma looked close to tears (= almost going to cry).

defines.trans_ch: 接近的，只有细微差别的
defines.trans_en: having only a small difference

examples.ch: 选举结果非常接近，他们不得不重新投票。
examples.en: The election results were so close they had to vote again.

examples.ch: 他跑了第二名，不过差距很小。
examples.en: He came second in the race, but it was very close.

examples.ch: 两个最小的男孩年龄很接近，看上去就像双胞胎。
examples.en: The youngest boys are so close in age they look like twins.

examples.ch: 两个孩子长得都很像他们的父亲。
examples.en: Both children bear a very close resemblance to their father.

phrases.trans_en: near

examples.ch: 我们去拜访一下米兰达，好吗？你知道的，她就住在附近。
examples.en: Shall we call in on Miranda? You know she lives quite close by.

phrases.trans_en: almost

examples.ch: 我想现在有将近300万失业人口。
examples.en: I think there are close on three million unemployed at present.

defines.trans_en: not open

examples.ch: 把门关上可能就不会有那么强的穿堂风了。
examples.en: It might be less draughty if the door were closed.

defines.trans_en: not open for business

examples.ch: 所有的商店都关门了，所以我们什么吃的也买不到。
examples.en: All the shops were closed, so we couldn't buy any food.

defines.trans_en: finished and therefore not able to be discussed any more

examples.ch: “这件事到此为止，”校长说道。
examples.en: "The matter is closed," said the headteacher.

defines.trans_ch: 僵化的，不接受新思想的;闭关排外的
defines.trans_en: not wanting to accept new ideas, people, customs, etc.

examples.ch: 你脑子太僵化了。
examples.en: You have such a closed mind.

examples.ch: 这部小说的背景是排外的银行界。
examples.en: The setting of the novel is the closed world of banking.

defines.trans_en: things such as dresses and trousers that you wear to cover, protect, or decorate your body

examples.ch: 她通常穿着很入时／随意。
examples.en: She usually wears smart/casual clothes.

examples.ch: 我正打算把衣服穿上。
examples.en: I'm just putting my clothes on.

examples.ch: 脱下衣服进浴缸。
examples.en: Take your clothes off and get in the bath.

examples.ch: 名牌服装
examples.en: designer clothes

examples.ch: 服装店
examples.en: a clothes shop

defines.trans_en: a grey or white mass in the sky, made up of very small floating drops of water

examples.ch: 你看天边那些云是雨云吗？
examples.en: Do you think those are rain clouds on the horizon?

examples.ch: 天空一片湛蓝——万里无云。
examples.en: The sky was a perfect blue - not a cloud in sight.

examples.ch: 天边阴云密布。
examples.en: Dark clouds massed on the horizon.

examples.ch: 云层太厚，我们什么也看不见。
examples.en: There was so much cloud, we couldn't see anything.

defines.trans_ch: 一团（尘土、烟雾等）;云状物
defines.trans_en: a mass of something such as dust or smoke that looks like a cloud

examples.ch: 在东方的地平线上，着火的储油罐冒出的浓烟弥漫在天际。
examples.en: On the eastern horizon, a huge cloud of smoke from burning oil tanks stretched across the sky.

examples.ch: 催泪瓦斯的第一团烟雾刚散尽，射击就开始了。
examples.en: The initial cloud of tear gas had hardly cleared before shots were fired.

phrases.trans_en: a computer network where files and programs can be stored, especially the internet

examples.ch: 所有的照片都存在网络云里，而不是硬盘上。
examples.en: All the photographs are kept on the cloud rather than on hard drives.

defines.trans_en: If something transparent clouds, or if something clouds it, it becomes difficult to see through.

defines.trans_ch: 使迷惑;使不清楚;使难以理解
defines.trans_en: to make someone confused, or make something more difficult to understand

examples.ch: 等到要他解释衣领上的口红印时，他才意识到当时酒喝得太多，什么都记不清了。
examples.en: When it came to explaining the lipstick on his collar, he found that drink had clouded (= confused) his memory.

defines.trans_en: with clouds

examples.ch: 阴沉的天空／阴天
examples.en: a cloudy sky/day

examples.ch: 苏格兰将会转阴，并伴有寒冷的阵雨。
examples.en: Scotland will be cloudy with wintry showers.

defines.trans_en: not transparent

examples.ch: 那种啤酒有云雾状白浊，呈棕色。
examples.en: The beer was cloudy and dark.

defines.trans_en: an entertainer who wears funny clothes, has a painted face, and makes people laugh by performing tricks and behaving in a silly way

defines.trans_ch: （常指故意）出洋相的人；愚蠢可笑的人
defines.trans_en: someone who behaves in a silly way, often intentionally
to act stupidly, often to make other people laugh

examples.ch: 由于没有人管，班上的学生扔书本，扮鬼脸，简直胡闹成一片。
examples.en: Left alone, the class threw books, pulled faces, and generally clowned around.

defines.trans_en: an organization of people with a common purpose or interest, who meet regularly and take part in shared activities

examples.ch: 我刚参加了当地的高尔夫球／壁球／网球俱乐部。
examples.en: I've just joined the local golf/squash/tennis club.

examples.ch: 来访者必须有会员陪同。
examples.en: Visitors must be accompanied by club members.

defines.trans_en: a team

examples.ch: 黄鹂队今年的表现令人振奋。
examples.en: The Orioles are an exciting club this year.

examples.ch: 斯多克港足球俱乐部
examples.en: Stockport County Football Club

defines.trans_en: a building in which a club meets
a place that people go to in order to dance and drink in the evening

examples.ch: 我去了那家新开的夜总会。
examples.en: I went to that new club that's just opened.

defines.trans_en: a long, thin stick used in golf to hit the ball

examples.ch: 一套高尔夫球棒
examples.en: a set of golf clubs

defines.trans_en: a heavy stick used as a weapon
a playing card from the suit of clubs

examples.ch: 现在，如果你手里有梅花，就必须出。
examples.en: Now you have to play a club if you have one.

phrases.trans_en: one of the four suits in playing cards, represented by a symbol with three round leaves

examples.ch: 三张梅花牌／梅花K
examples.en: the three/King of clubs

defines.trans_en: to beat a person or an animal, usually repeatedly, with a heavy stick or object

examples.ch: 他头上挨了一棍。
examples.en: He was clubbed over the head.

examples.ch: 接着短吻鳄被乱棒打死。
examples.en: The alligators are then clubbed to death.

defines.trans_ch: 教练;辅导老师;私人教师;家庭教师
defines.trans_en: someone whose job is to teach people to improve at a sport, skill, or school subject

examples.ch: 网球教练／数学辅导老师
examples.en: a tennis/maths coach

defines.trans_en: someone whose job is to train and organize a sports team

examples.ch: 加斯·波耶特被任命为总教练。
examples.en: Gus Poyet was appointed as head coach.

defines.trans_en: a long motor vehicle with comfortable seats, used to take groups of people on journeys

examples.ch: 我们要坐大巴去机场。
examples.en: We're going to the airport by coach.

examples.ch: 乘长途汽车旅行
examples.en: a coach trip

defines.trans_ch: （老式）四轮大马车（现主要用于官方或皇家典礼中）
defines.trans_en: an old-fashioned carriage pulled by horses, now used mainly in official or royal ceremonies
any of the separate parts of a train in which the passengeras sit

defines.trans_ch: 乘坐（飞机）经济舱；乘坐（火车）普通车厢（同 coach class）
defines.trans_en:
→ 
coach class

defines.trans_ch: 训练;培训;指导;（尤指私人）辅导
defines.trans_en: to give special classes in sports or a school subject, especially privately, to one person or a small group

examples.ch: 她辅导学生法语，通常是准备考试的学生。
examples.en: She coaches students in French, usually for exams.

defines.trans_en: to train and organize a sports team

examples.ch: 上一赛季他在蓝魔队执教。
examples.en: He coached the Blue Devils during their last championship season.

defines.trans_en: the cheapest type of seats on a plane or train

examples.ch: 即便是公司的主管大多数时候也都坐经济舱。
examples.en: Even the company's director flies coach most of the time.

defines.trans_ch: （通常指保暖的）外套，外衣，大衣
defines.trans_en: an outer piece of clothing with sleeves that is worn over other clothes, usually for warmth

examples.ch: 扣好外套，乔，不然你会冻坏的。
examples.en: Do your coat up, Joe, or you'll freeze.

examples.ch: 我们需要在这扇门后安个衣钩。
examples.en: We need a coat hook on the back of this door.

defines.trans_en: used as a combining form

examples.ch: 大衣
examples.en: an overcoat

examples.ch: 雨衣
examples.en: a raincoat

defines.trans_en: the hair, wool, or fur covering an animal

examples.ch: 厚厚的／光滑的／乱蓬蓬缠在一起的皮毛
examples.en: a thick/glossy/matted coat

defines.trans_ch: 涂上的一层；覆盖上的一层，外加的一层
defines.trans_en: a layer of a substance, especially paint, that covers something

examples.ch: 我要给墙快速上一层漆。
examples.en: I'll give the walls a quick coat of paint.

examples.ch: 两层清漆
examples.en: two coats of varnish

defines.trans_ch: 给…涂上一层;使覆盖上一层，外加一层
defines.trans_en: to cover something with a layer of a particular substance

examples.ch: 饼干放凉后，在上面涂上一层融化的巧克力。
examples.en: When the biscuits are cool, you coat them in/with melted chocolate.

defines.trans_en: a dark brown powder with a strong flavour and smell that is made by crushing coffee beans, or a hot drink made from this powder

examples.ch: 不含咖啡因的咖啡
examples.en: decaffeinated coffee

examples.ch: 现磨／速溶咖啡
examples.en: fresh/instant coffee

examples.ch: 一杯咖啡
examples.en: a cup of coffee

examples.ch: 你去买东西时买点咖啡好吗？
examples.en: Would you get some coffee when you go shopping?

examples.ch: 要是咖啡喝得太多，我会睡不着觉。
examples.en: If I drink too much coffee, I can't sleep.

examples.ch: 我给你来杯咖啡吧？
examples.en: Can I get you a coffee (= cup of coffee)?

examples.ch: 请给我来杯不加牛奶的咖啡。
examples.en: I'd like a black coffee (= a cup of coffee without milk), please.

examples.ch: 你喝咖啡要加奶吗？
examples.en: Do you take (= drink) your coffee white (= with milk)?

defines.trans_ch: （尤指相对于体温而言）冷的，寒冷的，温度低的
defines.trans_en: at a low temperature, especially when compared to the temperature of the human body, and not hot, or warm

examples.ch: 冷天／寒冷的房子
examples.en: a cold day/house

examples.ch: 冰冷的食物／凉水
examples.en: cold food/water

examples.ch: 冰凉的手
examples.en: cold hands

examples.ch: 寒冷的天气
examples.en: cold weather

examples.ch: 我的双脚冰凉。
examples.en: My feet are so cold.

examples.ch: 今天冷极了。
examples.en: It's freezing cold today.

examples.ch: 如果不穿外套你会觉得冷的。
examples.en: You'll feel cold if you don't wear a coat.

defines.trans_en: not showing kindness, love, or emotion and not friendly

examples.ch: 他握手时很冷淡，眼睛毫无生气。
examples.en: His handshake was cold, and his eyes lifeless.

examples.ch: 他凝视着她冷漠的蓝眼晴。
examples.en: He stared into her cold, blue eyes.

examples.ch: 置身这个城市里冷漠、面无笑容的居民之中，她永远不会感到受欢迎。
examples.en: She would never feel welcome in this city with its cold, unsmiling inhabitants.

examples.ch: 这所学校是个冷冰冰、毫无亲切感的地方。
examples.en: The school was a cold, unwelcoming place.

defines.trans_en: a common infection, especially in the nose and throat, that often causes a cough, a slight fever, and sometimes some pain in the muscles

examples.ch: 我着凉了。
examples.en: I've got a cold.

examples.ch: 她在学校感冒了。
examples.en: She caught a cold at school.

examples.ch: 别靠近我——我得了重感冒。
examples.en: Don't come near me - I've got a stinking/streaming cold (= extremely bad cold).

defines.trans_en: cold weather or temperatures

examples.ch: 外面冷，别站在那儿，进来暖和暖和。
examples.en: Don't stand out there in the cold, come in here and get warm.

examples.ch: 老年人往往比年轻人怕冷。
examples.en: Old people tend to feel the cold (= feel uncomfortable in cold temperatures) more than the young.

examples.ch: 我的脚冻麻了。
examples.en: My feet were numb with cold.

defines.trans_en: one of a group of people who work together

examples.ch: 今晚我们要招待卡罗尔的几位同事。
examples.en: We're entertaining some colleagues of Carol's tonight.

defines.trans_en: to get and keep things of one type such as stamps or coins as a hobby

examples.ch: 她收藏玩具娃娃。
examples.en: She collects dolls.

examples.ch: 那你是从什么时候开始收集古董玻璃制品的？
examples.en: So when did you start collecting antique glass?

defines.trans_en: to go to a place and bring someone or something away from it

examples.ch: 你的鞋子星期四会修好，到时可以来取。
examples.en: Your shoes will be repaired and ready for you to collect on Thursday.

examples.ch: 我会去车站接你。
examples.en: I'll collect you from the station.

defines.trans_en: to bring something together from different places or over a period of time

examples.ch: 聚会后我把房屋各处的瓶子都收在一起。
examples.en: After the party I collected (up) bottles from various parts of the house.

examples.ch: 这些瓷器摆在那儿只会招灰尘。
examples.en: These china ornaments just collect dust.

defines.trans_en: to ask people to give you money for something, for example a charity

examples.ch: 我们正在为无家可归的人士募捐。
examples.en: We're collecting (money) for the homeless.

defines.trans_en: to take money such as taxes, rents, etc.

examples.ch: 一月份州政府收取的税金为120万美元。
examples.en: The state collected about $1.2 million in taxes in January.

defines.trans_en: to come together from different places or over a period of time

examples.ch: 一大群记者聚集在首相府前。
examples.en: A large crowd of reporters collected outside the prime minister's house.

examples.ch: 雨水收集在花园里的大桶里。
examples.en: Rainwater collects in the barrel in the garden.

phrases.trans_ch: （尤指在震惊、惊讶或大笑后）镇定下来，定神，集中思想
phrases.trans_en: to get control of your feelings and thoughts, especially after shock, surprise, or laughter

examples.ch: 他的话惊得我目瞪口呆，我定了定神才答上话。
examples.en: I was so stunned by what he'd said I had to collect myself before I could reply.

defines.trans_ch: （某些基督教仪式上的）短祷文
defines.trans_en: a short prayer that is said during some Christian religious ceremonies
When you call collect or make a collect phone call, the person you call pays for the call.

examples.ch: 我想打一个对方付费的电话。
examples.en: I'd like to make a collect call.

examples.ch: 她给我打了电话，由我付话费。
examples.en: She called me collect.

defines.trans_en: a university where you can study for an undergraduate (= first) degree

examples.ch: 我跟我丈夫是上大学的时候认识的。
examples.en: I met my husband when we were in college.

examples.ch: 他们想要自己的孩子去上大学。
examples.en: They want their kids to go to (= study at) college.

examples.ch: 大学学生/教授/毕业生
examples.en: a college student/professor/graduate

defines.trans_ch: 学院;职业学校;技术学校;高等专科学校
defines.trans_en: any place for specialized education after the age of 16 where people study or train to get knowledge and/or skills

examples.ch: 师范学院
examples.en: a teacher training college

examples.ch: 文秘专科学校
examples.en: a secretarial college

examples.ch: 海军学校
examples.en: a Naval college

examples.ch: 她在艺术学院学习。
examples.en: She's at art college.

examples.ch: 预科学校
examples.en: a sixth form college

defines.trans_en: one of the separate and named parts into which some universities are divided

examples.ch: 剑桥大学国王学院
examples.en: King's College, Cambridge

examples.ch: 我就读于纽约大学的文理学院。
examples.en: I attended the College of Arts and Sciences at New York University.

examples.ch: 剑桥大学有一些非常优美古雅的学院大楼。
examples.en: Cambridge has some very fine old colleges (= college buildings).

defines.trans_ch: 公学，学校（用于英国和澳大利亚某些私立学校的名称）
defines.trans_en: in Britain and Australia, used in the names of some schools for children, especially private schools (= where education is paid for by parents)

examples.ch: 切尔滕纳姆女子公学
examples.en: Cheltenham Ladies' College

defines.trans_en: a group of people with a particular job, purpose, duty, or power who are organized into a group for sharing ideas, making decisions, etc.

examples.ch: 皇家医科／护理学会
examples.en: the Royal College of Medicine/Nursing

defines.trans_en: red, blue, green, yellow, etc.

examples.ch: 你最喜欢什么颜色？
examples.en: What's your favourite colour?

examples.ch: 她穿得很鲜艳。
examples.en: She wears a lot of bright colours.

examples.ch: 你的眼睛是什么颜色的？
examples.en: What colour are your eyes?

examples.ch: 这件衬衫有其他颜色的吗？
examples.en: Does the shirt come in any other colour?

examples.ch: 我喜欢浓重的宝石色，如紫色、蓝色和绿色。
examples.en: I like rich jewel colours, such as purple, blue, and green.

examples.ch: 照片是彩色的还是黑白的？
examples.en: Are the photos in colour or black and white?

defines.trans_en: the pleasant effect of a bright colour or of a lot of colours together

examples.ch: 我觉得我们这个房间需要增加一点色彩。
examples.en: I think we need a bit of colour in this room.

examples.ch: 红色和黄色的辣椒给酱汁添加了一点色彩。
examples.en: Red and yellow peppers give a little colour to the sauce.

examples.ch: 整个花园五彩缤纷。
examples.en: The whole garden was ablaze with/a riot of colour (= full of different bright colours).

defines.trans_en: a substance, such as a paint or dye, that you add to something to give it a particular colour

examples.ch: 我把新买的绿色衬衫往热水中一泡，颜色就褪掉了。
examples.en: I put my new green shirt in a hot wash and the colour ran (= the colour came out of the material).

defines.trans_en: a pink colour in someone's face, often showing good health or showing feelings such as embarrassment or excitement

examples.ch: 散散步使你的气色好看些了。
examples.en: That walk has put some colour in your cheeks.

examples.ch: 我注意到她得知这消息后脸色煞白。
examples.en: I watched the colour drain from her face as she heard the news.

examples.ch: 她面色红润。
examples.en: She has a high colour (= the natural colour of her face is red).

defines.trans_en: interesting or exciting qualities or details

examples.ch: 我们给你的故事加了一些本土色彩。
examples.en: We added your story for a bit of local colour.

examples.ch: 迈克尔的到场使那晚的活动有所增色。
examples.en: Michael was there so that added a bit of colour to the evening's proceedings.

defines.trans_en: the natural colour of a person's skin which shows which race they belong to

examples.ch: 她觉得没能得到那份工作是因为自己的肤色。
examples.en: She felt she had not been given the job because of her colour.

examples.ch: 基于肤色的歧视是不应该的。
examples.en: There should be no discrimination on the grounds of colour.

phrases.trans_ch: 有色人种（用来形容自己）
phrases.trans_en: used to describe people who are not white

examples.ch: 我们需要保护有色人种的权利。
examples.en: We need to protect the rights of people of colour.

phrases.trans_ch: （中学或大学授予入选运动队者的）徽章
phrases.trans_en: (at school, college, or university) an honour given to people who have been chosen for a sports team, often represented by a special symbol on a shirt or tie

examples.ch: 她在学期末被选入曲棍球队。
examples.en: She was awarded her colours for hockey/her hockey colours at the end of term.

phrases.trans_en: the official flag of a country, ship, or military group

examples.ch: 军团旗
examples.en: regimental colours

defines.trans_en: Colour television, photography, or printing shows things in all their colours, not just in black and white.
to become a particular colour, or to make something a particular colour

examples.ch: 你觉得他染发了吗？
examples.en: Do you think he colours his hair?

examples.ch: 他画了一颗心并把它涂成红色。
examples.en: He drew a heart and coloured it red.

examples.ch: 将洋葱煎至变色。
examples.en: Fry the onions till they start to colour.

defines.trans_en: to become red in the face because you are embarrassed
If something colours your opinion of something, it influences your opinion in a negative way.

examples.ch: 我对婚姻的观点肯定受到了我父母离婚一事的影响。
examples.en: I'm sure my views on marriage are coloured by my parents' divorce.

examples.ch: 我努力不让自己的判断因为那一事件而带上偏见。
examples.en: I'm trying not to let my judgment be coloured by that one incident.

defines.trans_en: a flat piece of plastic, wood, or metal with a thin row of long, narrow parts along one side, used to tidy and arrange your hair
a small comb-shaped object that women put in their hair to hold their hair away from their face or for decoration
a soft, red, growth on a chicken's head
to tidy your hair using a comb

examples.ch: 她梳好头发，抹了点口红。
examples.en: She combed her hair and put on some lipstick.

examples.ch: 我一直想把她头发上的结梳开。
examples.en: I've been trying to comb out (= remove using a comb) the knots in her hair.

defines.trans_en: to search a place or an area very carefully in order to find something

examples.ch: 警方为了寻找证据搜遍了整个地区。
examples.en: The police combed the whole area for evidence.

examples.ch: 调查人员在残骸中认真搜寻。
examples.en: Investigators combed through the wreckage.

defines.trans_en: to move or travel towards the speaker or with the speaker

examples.ch: 你跟我来吗？
examples.en: Are you coming with me?

examples.ch: 来了辆轿车！
examples.en: There's a car coming!

examples.ch: 你能来参加我的聚会吗？
examples.en: Can you come to my party?

examples.ch: 亚当来了。
examples.en: Here comes Adam.

examples.ch: 她特地从500公里外赶来，是为了今晚和我们在一起。
examples.en: She's come 500 km (= has travelled 500 km) to be here with us tonight.

examples.ch: 你如果有机会到都柏林，一定要来我们家坐坐。
examples.en: If you're ever in Dublin, come and visit us.

examples.ch: 我们是开车来的。
examples.en: We came by car.

examples.ch: 你父亲4点来接你。
examples.en: Your father will come for (= to collect) you at four o'clock.

examples.ch: 向前来一点儿，站在线上。
examples.en: Come forward a bit and stand on the line.

examples.ch: 我直接从机场过来的。
examples.en: I've come straight from the airport.

examples.ch: 门开后一位护士走了进来。
examples.en: The door opened and a nurse came into the room.

examples.ch: 今天下午有人要来修锅炉。
examples.en: A man's coming to mend the boiler this afternoon.

examples.ch: 他向我走来时，我看得出他一直在哭。
examples.en: As he came towards me, I could see he'd been crying.

examples.ch: 他以为我们在摘他的苹果，所以拿了根棍子来追我们。
examples.en: He thought we'd been picking his apples and came after (= chased) us with a stick.

examples.ch: 我一倒下，他就冲了过来。
examples.en: He came rushing over when I fell.

defines.trans_en: to move or travel in the direction of the person being spoken to

examples.ch: “萨尔，好了吗？”“就来。”
examples.en: "Sal, are you ready?" "Coming."

examples.ch: 要是你愿意，我开车来接你。
examples.en: I'll come and pick you up in the car if you like.

examples.ch: 我是来取你的人口普查表的。
examples.en: I've come for (= come to get) your census form.

examples.ch: 我是来抄煤气表的。
examples.en: I've come to read the gas meter.

defines.trans_en: to get to a particular place

examples.ch: 她来了没有？
examples.en: Has she come yet?

examples.ch: 邮件什么时候送来？
examples.en: When does the post come?

examples.ch: 他乘坐的火车还没进站吗？
examples.en: Hasn't his train come in yet?

defines.trans_en: to leave a place

examples.ch: 我不得不早早离开聚会。
examples.en: I had to come away from the party early.

examples.ch: 警察看着他走出那所房子。
examples.en: The police watched him come out of the house.

defines.trans_en: to change or develop so as to be in a different position or condition

examples.ch: 那些画都得（从墙上）拿下来。
examples.en: Those pictures will have to come down (= be removed from the wall).

examples.ch: 他拉了一下把手，它就掉下来了。
examples.en: He pulled the knob and it just came off (in his hand).

examples.ch: 你从那匹马上摔下来多少次了？
examples.en: How many times have you come off that horse?

examples.ch: 他面部被击中以后，掉了两颗牙齿。
examples.en: Two of his teeth came out after he got hit in the face.

examples.ch: 你能把瓶塞拔出来吗？
examples.en: Can you get this cork to come out of the bottle?

examples.ch: 暖气什么时候来？
examples.en: When does the heating come on (= start working)?

examples.ch: 后面有一根电线松了。
examples.en: A wire has come loose at the back.

examples.ch: 门不知怎么就开了。
examples.en: The door came open for no apparent reason.

defines.trans_en: to happen

examples.ch: 春天来得早。
examples.en: Spring has come early.

examples.ch: 公告来得不是时候。
examples.en: The announcement came at a bad time.

examples.ch: 她的辞职很让人意外。
examples.en: Her resignation came as quite a shock.

examples.ch: 到周一早上你就会后悔不该整晚熬夜。
examples.en: Come Monday morning (= when it is Monday morning) you'll regret staying up all night.

examples.ch: 恐怕那样的日子一去不复返了。
examples.en: I'm afraid those days are gone and they'll never come again.

defines.trans_en: to exist or be available

examples.ch: 这些裤子有别的颜色的吗？
examples.en: Do these trousers come in any other colour?

examples.ch: 跑步的人形形色色——有胖有瘦，有高有矮。
examples.en: Runners come in all shapes and sizes - fat and thin, short and tall.

examples.ch: 这个可爱的洋娃娃配有毯子和奶瓶。
examples.en: This cuddly baby doll comes with her own blanket and bottle.

examples.ch: 这是市面上最好的太阳镜，只是价格不菲。
examples.en: They're the best sunglasses you can buy, but they don't come cheap (= they are expensive).

defines.trans_en: to have an orgasm

phrases.trans_en: to have or achieve a particular position in a race, competition, list, etc.

examples.ch: 她在百米赛跑中得了第二。
examples.en: She came second (US came in second) in the 100 metres.

examples.ch: 在英语字母表中，Z排在Y之后。
examples.en: Z comes after Y in the alphabet.

examples.ch: 爱德华之后的国王是谁？
examples.en: Which king came after Edward?

examples.ch: 4月在5月之前。
examples.en: April comes before May.

examples.ch: 我知道这首歌的第一节歌词，但接下来的就不清楚了。
examples.en: I know the first verse of the song, but I don't know what comes next.

phrases.trans_en: to start to do something

examples.ch: 经过这几个月的时间，我开始喜欢上她了。
examples.en: I've come to like her over the months.

examples.ch: 它以前是用来装纸袋的，但渐渐地就被用来装杂志了。
examples.en: It used to hold paper bags, but gradually came to be used for magazines.

examples.ch: 那个短语怎么会变成这种意思？
examples.en: How did that phrase come to mean (= develop so that it means) that?

defines.trans_en: semen  (= the liquid containing sperm)

defines.trans_ch: （家具和衣服）舒适的，舒服的，令人惬意的
defines.trans_en: Comfortable furniture and clothes provide a pleasant feeling and do not give you any physical problems.

examples.ch: 舒适的床／沙发
examples.en: a comfortable bed/sofa

examples.ch: 舒服的鞋子／裤子
examples.en: comfortable shoes/trousers

defines.trans_ch: 舒服的；舒坦的；轻松自在的
defines.trans_en: relaxed and free from pain

examples.ch: 你觉得舒服吗？还是要我把暖气调低点？
examples.en: Are you comfortable or shall I turn the heat down?

examples.ch: 穿高跟鞋我觉得不舒服。
examples.en: I don't feel comfortable in high heels.

examples.ch: 请坐，别拘束。
examples.en: Do sit down and make yourself comfortable.

defines.trans_ch: （医院的病人或伤者）感觉不太疼的
defines.trans_en: If an ill or injured person in hospital is comfortable, they are is not feeling too much pain.
If you are comfortable with a situation, you are not worried about it.

examples.ch: 要把她一个人留下来，我可不放心。
examples.en: I'm not comfortable with the idea of leaving her on her own.

defines.trans_en: having enough money for a good standard of living

examples.ch: 他们算不上特别富有，但还算富足。
examples.en: They're not fabulously rich or anything, but they're quite comfortable.

defines.trans_ch: （在比赛中）轻松的，轻而易举的
defines.trans_en: If you win a game or competition by a comfortable amount, you win easily.

examples.ch: 轻松领先／取胜
examples.en: a comfortable lead/victory

defines.trans_en: an organization that sells goods or services in order to make money

examples.ch: 他在一家软件公司工作。
examples.en: He works for a software company/a company that makes software.

examples.ch: 我在达根公司工作。
examples.en: I work for Duggan and Company.

examples.ch: 禁止吸烟是公司的规定。
examples.en: No smoking is company policy.

defines.trans_en: the fact of being with a person or people, or the person or people you are with

examples.ch: 有他陪伴我感到很愉快。
examples.en: I just enjoy his company.

examples.ch: 旅途漫漫，我感谢有他作伴。
examples.en: It was a long trip and I was grateful for his company.

examples.ch: 我喜欢独处。
examples.en: I enjoy my own company (= I like being alone).

examples.ch: 我和两位老师结伴而行，一直到了伊斯坦布尔。
examples.en: I travelled in the company of (= with) two teachers as far as Istanbul.

examples.ch: 当着他人的面，我觉得你最好不要提起那件事。
examples.en: I'd rather you didn't mention it when we're in company (= with other people).

examples.ch: 我不知道你这儿有人。
examples.en: I didn't realize you had company (= were with someone/people).

examples.ch: 在我离家期间，玛戈到我家来住了1个星期，给我母亲作伴。
examples.en: Margot came to stay for a week as company for my mother while I was away.

examples.ch: 她慢慢地沿着海滨散步，独自一人沉思着。
examples.en: With only her thoughts for company (= being alone), she walked slowly along the beach.

defines.trans_en: a group of actors, singers, or dancers who perform together

examples.ch: 她是皇家国立剧团的演员。
examples.en: She's in the National Theatre Company.

examples.ch: 我想对导演、编舞及剧团其他成员的大力支持表示感谢。
examples.en: I'd like to thank the director, the choreographer and the other members of the company for being so supportive.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指军队中营下辖的）连，连队
defines.trans_en: a large group of soldiers. especially a division of a battalion
an organized group of young women who are Guides

examples.ch: 我表姐和我加入了同一支女童子军大队。
examples.en: My cousin and I joined the same Guide company.

phrases.trans_en: to be pleasant and entertaining to be with

examples.ch: 你会喜欢罗茜的——她是个好伙伴。
examples.en: You'll like Rosie - she's good company.

phrases.trans_ch: 为了有个伴儿，为了不冷清
phrases.trans_en: If you do something for company, you do it to make you feel as if you are not alone.

examples.ch: 我一般会开着收音机，为的是有伴儿。
examples.en: I usually have the radio on for company.

phrases.trans_en: to stay with someone so that they are not alone

examples.ch: 火车到来之前我会一直陪着你。
examples.en: I'll keep you company till the train comes.

defines.trans_en: a situation in which someone is trying to win something or be more successful than someone else

examples.ch: 求职的竞争非常激烈。
examples.en: Competition for jobs is intense.

examples.ch: 计算机公司间的竞争很激烈。
examples.en: There's a lot of competition between computer companies.

examples.ch: 两家公司相互竞争。
examples.en: The two companies are in competition with each other.

examples.ch: 进入那所学校要经过激烈的竞争。
examples.en: There's fierce competition to get into that school.

examples.ch: 来自国外的竞争使他们的销售额有所下降。
examples.en: Foreign competition (= similar products from other countries) had reduced their sales.

examples.ch: 你为什么要嫉妒她？她根本不是你的对手！
examples.en: Why are you jealous of her? She's no competition!

defines.trans_en: an organized event in which people try to win a prize by being the best, fastest, etc.

examples.ch: 游泳／国际象棋比赛
examples.en: a swimming/chess competition

examples.ch: 她参加了纵横填字比赛。
examples.en: She's entered a crossword competition.

examples.ch: 你不必吃得这么快！又不是比赛。
examples.en: You don't need to eat so quickly! It's not a competition.

phrases.trans_en: the person or people you are trying to be better than

examples.ch: 跑道上的对手看起来很厉害，她的心不禁一沉。
examples.en: The competition on the track looked fierce and her heart sank.

defines.trans_en: an electronic machine that is used for storing, organizing, and finding words, numbers, and pictures, for doing calculations, and for controlling other machines

examples.ch: 个人／家用电脑
examples.en: a personal/home computer

examples.ch: 我们所有顾客的订单都是用电脑来处理的。
examples.en: All our customer orders are handled by computer.

examples.ch: 我们把自己所有的记录都输入了电脑。
examples.en: We've put all our records on computer.

examples.ch: 电脑软件／硬件
examples.en: computer software/hardware

examples.ch: 电脑制图
examples.en: computer graphics

examples.ch: 电脑程序
examples.en: a computer program

defines.trans_en: a performance of music by one or more musicians or singers

examples.ch: 流行／古典音乐会
examples.en: a pop/classical concert

examples.ch: 学校音乐会
examples.en: a school concert

defines.trans_en: the act of congratulating someone

examples.ch: 他发去贺信，祝贺她选举获胜。
examples.en: He sent her a note of congratulation on her election victory.

phrases.trans_en: something that you say when you want to congratulate someone

examples.ch: “我拿到那个工作了。”“是吗？祝贺你！”
examples.en: "I got the job." "Did you? Congratulations!"

examples.ch: 恭喜你们订婚了！
examples.en: Congratulations on your engagement!

defines.trans_en: (a) talk between two or more people in which thoughts, feelings, and ideas are expressed, questions are asked and answered, or news and information is exchanged

examples.ch: 她跟搬到楼上的那个家伙进行了一次奇怪的交谈。
examples.en: She had a strange conversation with the man who moved in upstairs.

examples.ch: 周围这么吵根本无法谈话！
examples.en: It's impossible to hold/carry on a conversation with all this noise going on!

examples.ch: 我跟你叔叔挺有兴趣地攀谈起来。
examples.en: I struck up (= started) an interesting conversation with your uncle.

examples.ch: 由于电视的缘故，许多人变得不善于与他人交谈了。
examples.en: Because of television, many people have lost the art of conversation (= talking to each other).

examples.ch: 每次在社交场合跟老板在一起，两分钟过后我们好像就无话可说了。
examples.en: Whenever I'm in a social situation with my boss, we seem to run out of conversation (= things to say to each other) after two minutes!

defines.trans_en: When you cook food, you prepare it to be eaten by heating it in a particular way, such as baking or boiling, and when food cooks, it is heated until it is ready to eat.

examples.ch: 我不常做肉吃。
examples.en: I don't cook meat very often.

examples.ch: 他给我们准备了一顿丰盛的饭菜。
examples.en: He cooked us a huge dinner./He cooked a huge dinner for us.

examples.ch: 先把鱼煮半个小时再加入酒。
examples.en: Let the fish cook for half an hour before you add the wine.

defines.trans_en: someone who prepares and cooks food

examples.ch: 她是位很出色的厨师。
examples.en: She's a wonderful cook.

defines.trans_en: a large box-shaped device that is used to cook and heat food, either by putting the food inside or by putting it on the top

examples.ch: 煤气灶／电灶
examples.en: a gas/electric cooker

defines.trans_ch: 烹饪用的苹果（一种大苹果，味很酸）（同 cooking apple）
defines.trans_en:
a 
cooking apple
slightly cold

examples.ch: 凉水
examples.en: cool water

examples.ch: 冷天
