examples.en: cool weather

defines.trans_en: slightly cold in a pleasant way

examples.ch: 那是个凉爽的夜晚。
examples.en: It was a lovely cool evening.

examples.ch: 这么热的天你怎么看上去会这么凉快？
examples.en: How do you manage to look so cool in this hot weather?

defines.trans_en: used to describe a temperature that is slightly too cold

examples.ch: 这儿有点凉，是不是？我想关上窗户。
examples.en: It's a bit cool in here, isn't it? I think I'll close the window.

defines.trans_en: calm and not worried or frightened; not influenced by strong feeling of any kind

examples.ch: 我们打破窗户时他十分冷静，既没大喊大叫也没发脾气。
examples.en: He was very cool when we broke the window, and didn't shout or get mad.

examples.ch: 保持镇静。
examples.en: Stay/Keep cool (= do not become angry or excited).

defines.trans_ch: （颜色）冷色调的，给人凉爽感觉的
defines.trans_en: Cool colours, such as blue or green, make you feel calm and relaxed.

examples.ch: 卧室漆成了清爽的蓝色。
examples.en: The bedroom was painted a lovely cool blue.

defines.trans_ch: 不友好的;冷淡的;冷漠的
defines.trans_en: unfriendly or not showing kindness or interest in something or someone

examples.ch: 她对我显然很冷淡。
examples.en: She was decidedly cool towards me.

examples.ch: 我今晚受到了冷遇。你觉得我做错了什么？
examples.en: I got a rather cool reception/welcome this evening. What do you think I've done wrong?

defines.trans_en: fashionable or attractive

examples.ch: 安吉有副很酷的新太阳镜。
examples.en: Angie's got some cool new sunglasses.

examples.ch: 我知道戴上这顶帽子看起来不会很时髦，可是它能遮挡刺眼的阳光。
examples.en: I know it won't look very cool, but this hat will keep the sun out of your eyes.

phrases.trans_ch: 乐于接受（某一情况或建议）
phrases.trans_en: to be happy to accept a situation or suggestion

examples.ch: 是，我们可以晚点走——我没意见。
examples.en: Yeah, we could leave later - I'm cool with that.

defines.trans_ch: 好极了（的），棒极了（的），顶呱呱（的）
defines.trans_en: excellent; very good

examples.ch: “音乐会怎么样？”“棒极了！”
examples.en: "So how was the concert?" "It was cool!"

examples.ch: “你想和我们一起去吗？”“噢，太好了！”
examples.en: "Do you want to come with us?" "Yeah, cool!"

defines.trans_en: a person's ability to stay calm and not become angry or excited

examples.ch: 保持冷静
examples.en: keep your cool

examples.ch: 当了解到发生了什么事情的时候他完全失去了冷静。
examples.en: He really lost his cool when he heard about what happened.

phrases.trans_en: the pleasant, slightly cold temperature of a place

examples.ch: 他喜欢清晨的凉意。
examples.en: He loved the cool of the early morning.

examples.ch: 她避开下午的阳光走到阴凉处。
examples.en: She left the afternoon sun for the cool of the shade.

defines.trans_en: to become or cause something to become slightly colder

examples.ch: 把蛋糕冷却1小时后再切。
examples.en: Leave the cake to cool for an hour before cutting it.

examples.ch: 他脱掉鞋晾一晾出汗的脚。
examples.en: He took off his shoes to cool his sweaty feet.

defines.trans_ch: （感情）冷静下来，平静下来，冷淡下来
defines.trans_en: If a feeling cools or cools off, it starts to become less strong.

examples.ch: 一开始他们爱得死去活来，但我觉得现在开始冷淡下来了。
examples.en: They were completely in love in the beginning, but I think it's starting to cool off now.

examples.ch: 他们对该项目的兴趣似乎在下降。
examples.en: Their interest in the project seems to be cooling.

defines.trans_en: If the economy, a business, etc. cools or cools off, it grows less fast than before.

examples.ch: 股市在上周达到新高以后上升速度放缓。
examples.en: The stock market has cooled off after hitting new highs last week.

defines.trans_en: the point, area, or line that is formed by the meeting of two lines, surfaces, roads, etc.

examples.ch: 你转弯时开得太快！
examples.en: You go around corners too fast when you're driving!

examples.ch: 街角处有个邮筒。
examples.en: There's a postbox on the corner (= the place where the street crosses another).

examples.ch: 点击屏幕右下方的图标。
examples.en: Click the icon in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen.

examples.ch: 我的腿撞到桌角上，起了一块淤青。
examples.en: I have a bruise where I hit my leg on the corner of the table.

examples.ch: 他们就住在附近——所以我们常看见他们。
examples.en: They live just around/round the corner (= very close although not in the same road) - so we see them all the time.

defines.trans_ch: 角落，冷僻处；边远处；隐蔽的地方
defines.trans_en: a part of a larger area, often somewhere quiet or far away

examples.ch: 他们住在苏格兰一个边远的角落，离最近的商店也有几十英里。
examples.en: They live in a remote corner of Scotland, miles from the nearest store.

defines.trans_en: a kick in football or a shot in hockey that is taken from the corner of the playing area
If a vehicle corners well, badly, etc., it drives around corners in the stated way.

examples.ch: 这辆车马力强劲，但转弯性能欠佳。
examples.en: It's a powerful car, but it doesn't corner well.

defines.trans_ch: 将（人或动物）逼入困境;使陷入绝境，使走投无路
defines.trans_en: to force a person or an animal into a place or situation from which they cannot easily escape

examples.ch: 一旦警察把她困在地下室里，她便束手就擒了。
examples.en: Once the police had cornered her in the basement, she gave herself up.

defines.trans_en: in agreement with the true facts or with what is generally accepted

examples.ch: 正确答案
examples.en: a correct answer

examples.ch: “那个拼写对吗？”“不知道——查查词典吧。”
examples.en: "Is that the correct spelling?" "I don't know - look it up in a dictionary."

examples.ch: 把他们说成学生不确切。
examples.en: It's not correct to describe them as "students".

examples.ch: “你叫安杰拉·布莱克？”“没错。”
examples.en: "Your name is Angela Black?" "That is correct."

defines.trans_en: taking or showing great care to behave or speak in a way that is generally accepted and approved of

examples.ch: 他穿着／谈吐／举止很得体，是不是？
examples.en: He's very correct in his dress/speech/manner, isn't he?

defines.trans_en: to show or tell someone that something is wrong and to make it right

examples.ch: 学生们说老师纠正他们的发音错误会对他们很有帮助。
examples.en: Students said it was helpful if the teacher corrected their pronunciation.

examples.ch: 我有30份家庭作业要阅改。
examples.en: I have 30 homework assignments to correct.

defines.trans_en: If a medical treatment corrects a particular condition, it cures the condition or makes it easier to manage.

examples.ch: 矫正视力的眼镜
examples.en: glasses to correct poor vision

examples.ch: 矫正不良坐姿的椅子
examples.en: a chair that corrects bad posture

phrases.text: correct me if I'm wrong but...
phrases.trans_ch: 如果我没说错的话（委婉地表示不同意）
phrases.trans_en: said as a polite and slightly formal way of disagreeing with someone

examples.ch: 如果我没记错的话，我想我们是把会议安排在了12月12日。
examples.en: Correct me if I'm wrong, but I think we arranged the meeting for the 12 December.

defines.trans_en: the amount of money needed to buy, do, or make something

examples.ch: 买电脑时通常免费附送软件。
examples.en: When you buy a new computer, you usually get software included at no extra cost (= for no additional money).

examples.ch: 对许多家庭来说，要支付孩子学费双职薪水必不可少。
examples.en: In most families, two salaries are essential to cover the cost of (= pay for) raising a family.

examples.ch: 这家连锁超市宣布其所有鲜肉和冷冻肉降价销售。
examples.en: The supermarket chain announced that it was cutting the cost (= reducing the price) of all its fresh and frozen meat.

examples.ch: 大多数人都难以承受医疗保健费用的上涨。
examples.en: It's difficult for most people to deal with the rising cost of (= increasing price of) healthcare.

examples.ch: 我能以成本价买到残损商品。
examples.en: I was able to buy the damaged goods at cost (= for only the amount of money needed to produce or get the goods, without any extra money added for profit).

defines.trans_en: something that is given, needed, or lost in order to get a particular thing

examples.ch: 我们本打算自己漆房子，可是考虑到既费时又费力，还是决定请油漆工来做。
examples.en: We were going to paint the house ourselves, but when we considered the cost in time and effort, we decided to get a painter to do it for us.

examples.ch: 司机避开了在他车前乱跑的小孩，可自己却受了伤。
examples.en: The driver managed not to hit the child who ran in front of his car, but only at the cost of injuring himself.

examples.ch: 她最终得到了想要的那份工作，可是个人付出的代价很大。
examples.en: She has finally got the job she wanted, but at great personal cost (= she has had to give up other things that were important to her).

examples.ch: 不值得和葆拉发生争执，因为我已有过教训。
examples.en: It's not worth getting into an argument with Paula, as I learned to my cost (= from my unpleasant experience of having done so).

phrases.trans_en: the amount of money needed for a business or to do a particular job

examples.ch: 我们需要削减广告支出。
examples.en: We need to cut our advertising costs.

examples.ch: 这项建筑工程的成本预算大大超出100万英镑。
examples.en: The estimated costs of the building project are well over £1 million.

defines.trans_en: If something costs an amount of money, you must pay that amount to buy or do it.

examples.ch: “这本书多少钱？”“25英镑。”
examples.en: "How much does this book cost?" "It costs £25."

examples.ch: 在悉尼的这一地区买栋房子要花很多钱。
examples.en: It costs a lot to buy a house in this part of Sydney.

examples.ch: 这趟旅游要花去你1000美元。
examples.en: The trip will cost you $1,000.

defines.trans_en: to calculate the future cost of something

examples.ch: 老板让我计算出新围栏和大门的材料费用。
examples.en: My boss asked me to cost the materials for the new fence and gate.

examples.ch: 你的方案好好计算过成本吗？
examples.en: Has your plan been properly costed (out)?

defines.trans_ch: 使付出代价；使丧失；使牺牲
defines.trans_en: to cause someone to lose or destroy something valuable

examples.ch: 酒后驾车会付出生命的代价。
examples.en: Drinking and driving costs lives (= can cause accidents in which people die).

examples.ch: 婚外情葬送了他的婚姻。
examples.en: His affairs cost him his marriage (= his marriage ended because of them).

defines.trans_ch: （某国或某一历史时期或适合某种活动的）服装
defines.trans_en: the set of clothes typical of a particular country or period of history, or suitable for a particular activity

examples.ch: 歌手们经常穿古装出演莫扎特的歌剧。
examples.en: Singers performing Mozart's operas often dress in/wear historical costume.

examples.ch: 走在队伍前头的舞蹈演员身着色彩绚丽、制作考究的服装。
examples.en: The dancers leading the procession were in colourful and elaborate costumes.

examples.ch: 该店有很多漂亮的比基尼和其他泳装可供选购。
examples.en: The shop has a good selection of bikinis and bathing/swimming costumes.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指聚会或娱乐活动中穿的）化装服
defines.trans_en: a set of clothes worn in order to look like someone or something else, especially for a party or as part of an entertainment

examples.ch: 我们的主人穿着小丑服。
examples.en: Our host was wearing a clown costume.

examples.ch: 孩子们都是万圣节打扮。
examples.en: The children were dressed in Halloween costumes.

defines.trans_ch: （can 的过去式，表示能够或允许）能，可以
defines.trans_en: past simple of "can", used to talk about what someone or something was able or allowed to do

examples.ch: 我年轻时，一通宵不睡觉都不觉得累。
examples.en: When I was younger I could stay up all night and not get tired.

examples.ch: 太吵了，我们连自己说话都听不见。
examples.en: It was so noisy that we couldn't hear ourselves speak.

examples.ch: 你说过我们完成家庭作业后可以看电视。
examples.en: You said we could watch TV when we finished our homework.

examples.ch: 我们询问这台计算机能否上网。
examples.en: We asked if the computer could access the internet.

defines.trans_ch: （礼貌地请求许可，比用can更加有礼貌）可以，能
defines.trans_en: used as a more polite form of "can" when asking for permission

examples.ch: 我可以和戴维斯先生通话吗？
examples.en: Could I speak to Mr Davis, please?

examples.ch: 对不起，我可以讲几句话吗？
examples.en: Excuse me, could I just say something?

defines.trans_ch: （礼貌地请求提供某物或做某事，比用can更加有礼貌）能，可以
defines.trans_en: used as a more polite form of "can" when asking someone to provide something or do something

examples.ch: 你能借我5英镑吗？
examples.en: Could you lend me £5?

examples.ch: 你能把音乐声调低一点吗？
examples.en: Could you turn that music down a little, please?

defines.trans_ch: （尤用于表示微小或不确定的可能性）可以，能，也许
defines.trans_en: used to express possibility, especially slight or uncertain possibility

examples.ch: 许多犯罪活动是可以防止的。
examples.en: A lot of crime could be prevented.

examples.ch: 她现在随时会到。
examples.en: She could arrive anytime now.

examples.ch: 这种新药可能是攻克癌症过程中迈出的重要一步。
examples.en: This new drug could be an important step in the fight against cancer.

examples.ch: 留心那根棍子——你差点打到你妹妹！
examples.en: Be careful with that stick - you could have hit your sister!

defines.trans_en: used for making a suggestion

examples.ch: 要是你愿意，明天我们下班后可以去喝上一杯。
examples.en: We could go out for a drink after work tomorrow, if you want.

examples.ch: 你随时可以给苏茜打电话，看看她能否帮你照看孩子。
examples.en: You could always call Susie and see if she will babysit.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指生气地对某人表示不满）应该
defines.trans_en: used for saying, especially angrily, what you think someone else should do

examples.ch: 喂，你应该表现得热心一点！
examples.en: Well, you could try to look a little more enthusiastic!

examples.ch: 我等了你很久——你应该提前说一声你不来！
examples.en: I waited ages for you - you could have said that you weren't coming!

defines.trans_en: an area of land that has its own government, army, etc.

examples.ch: 欧洲最大的国家是哪个？
examples.en: What is the largest country in Europe?

examples.ch: 斯里兰卡是我的祖国，但最近5年我一直住在比利时。
examples.en: Sri Lanka is my native country, but I've been living in Belgium for the past five years.

examples.ch: 该国东部气候比较凉爽。
examples.en: The climate is cooler in the east of the country.

defines.trans_en: land that is not in towns, cities, or industrial areas and is either used for farming or left in its natural condition

examples.ch: 他住在乡下某个地方。
examples.en: He lives out in the country somewhere.

examples.ch: 与城里相比，你更愿意住乡下吗？
examples.en: Would you prefer to live in the country instead of a town?

examples.ch: 乡村生活并不总是像城镇居民想象的那样宁静。
examples.en: Country life isn't always as peaceful as city-dwellers think.

examples.ch: 穿越乡村完全避开主干道往往会走得更快。
examples.en: It's often quicker to travel across country and avoid the major roads completely.

defines.trans_en: an area of land considered in relation to a particular feature

examples.ch: 埃文河畔斯特拉特福是莎士比亚故乡的首府。
examples.en: Stratford-upon-Avon is the capital of Shakespeare country.

examples.ch: 空荡荡的公路使这个地区成为骑自行车的好场所。
examples.en: The empty roads make this area good cycling country.

defines.trans_ch: （美国西部和南部的）乡村音乐
defines.trans_en:
short form of 
country music

phrases.trans_en: all the people who live in a country

examples.ch: 全国人民庆祝和平条约的签订。
examples.en: The whole country celebrated the signing of the peace treaty.

defines.trans_en: land not in towns, cities, or industrial areas, that is either used for farming or left in its natural condition

examples.ch: 那周围的乡村很美。
examples.en: The countryside around there is beautiful.

examples.ch: 那所官邸占地90英亩，坐落在未遭破坏的美丽乡村。
examples.en: The mansion is set in 90 acres of beautiful, unspoiled countryside.

examples.ch: 每年夏天成千上万的人涌向乡村。
examples.en: Every summer thousands of people flock to the countryside.

defines.trans_en: a set of classes or a plan of study on a particular subject, usually leading to an exam or qualification

examples.ch: 下星期他们要出去上实习课。
examples.en: They're going away on a training course next week.

examples.ch: 退休后我想修一门写作课。
examples.en: I'd like to do (US take) a writing course when I retire.

examples.ch: 蒂姆在纽卡斯尔大学修了为期3年的语言学课程。
examples.en: Tim did a three-year course in linguistics at Newcastle.

defines.trans_ch: 竞赛场地;球场;跑道;泳道
defines.trans_en: an area of land or water used for a sports event

examples.ch: 高尔夫球场／越野赛赛场
examples.en: a golf course/cross-country course

defines.trans_en: the often gradual development of something, or the way something happens, or a way of doing something

examples.ch: 丑闻对选举进程有影响吗？
examples.en: Did the scandal have any effect on the course of the election?

examples.ch: 面试表明他并不适合这份工作。
examples.en: In the course of (= during) the interview it became clear that he was not the right person for the job.

examples.ch: 在这种情况下采取什么样的措施才合适呢？
examples.en: What would be an appropriate course (of action) in such a situation?

examples.ch: 如果对手增加广告投入，我们也只得奉陪。
examples.en: If our rivals are spending more on advertising, we'll have to follow the same course.

examples.ch: 被告还被指控企图妨碍司法公正。
examples.en: The defendants are also accused of attempting to pervert the course of justice.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指飞机、航天器或轮船的）航向，航道，路线;（河流的）流向，水道
defines.trans_en: the direction in which a vehicle, especially an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship, moves, or the path along which a river flows

examples.ch: 飞行员改变航向避免了一起碰撞事故。
examples.en: The pilot avoided a collision by changing course.

examples.ch: 河流改道会严重危害整个流域的环境。
examples.en: Changing the course of the river would cause serious environmental damage to the whole valley.

examples.ch: 莉兹发言后辩论方向完全改变了。
examples.en: The debate completely changed course after Liz made her speech.

defines.trans_en: a part of a meal that is served separately from the other parts

examples.ch: 四道菜的午餐
examples.en: a four-course lunch

examples.ch: 传统的英国主菜由肉加土豆及其他蔬菜组成。
examples.en: A traditional British main course consists of a meat dish with potatoes and other vegetables.

defines.trans_en: a fixed number of regular medical treatments

examples.ch: 医生让我接受了一个疗程的抗生素治疗。
examples.en: My doctor's put me on a course of antibiotics.

examples.ch: 腿骨折后她需要一个为期6个月的理疗疗程。
examples.en: She needed a six-month course of physiotherapy after she broke her leg.

defines.trans_en: a continuous horizontal layer of bricks or other building material

phrases.trans_ch: 经过一段时间;最后;终有一天
phrases.trans_en: after a period of time

examples.ch: 我想他们总有一天会打算要孩子的。
examples.en: I assume they plan to have children in the course of time.

phrases.trans_en: gradually

examples.ch: 渐渐地，我学会了接受自己残疾的现实。
examples.en: With the course of time, I've learned to live with my disability.

phrases.trans_ch: 可能发生的；可能如愿以偿的
phrases.trans_en: likely to happen, or likely to succeed as planned

examples.ch: 由于经济衰退，我们可能要创失业率的新纪录了。
examples.en: Because of the recession, we're on course for/to have record unemployment levels.

defines.trans_en: to flow quickly or in large amounts

examples.ch: 泪水从他的脸颊滚落。
examples.en: Tears were coursing down his cheeks.

examples.ch: 她冲过终点时你几乎听得到血液在她血管里流动的声音。
examples.en: You could almost hear the blood coursing through her veins as she passed the finishing line.

examples.ch: 一股新的理想主义浪潮正席卷我们的学校。
examples.en: A new wave of idealism is coursing through our schools.

defines.trans_ch: 堂（或表）兄弟;堂（或表）姐妹;远房亲戚
defines.trans_en: a child of a person's aunt or uncle, or, more generally, a distant (= not close) relation

examples.ch: 我嫂子和我差不多同时生了孩子，因此这对表兄妹年纪相仿。
examples.en: My brother's wife and I both had babies around the same time, so the cousins are very close in age.

examples.ch: 我们家许多多年未见的远房亲戚赶来参加姐姐的婚礼。
examples.en: Many of our distant cousins, whom we hadn't seen for years, came to my sister's wedding.

defines.trans_ch: （具有相似渊源的）兄弟民族（或国家）的人
defines.trans_en: a member of a group of people with similar origins

examples.ch: 我们美国人得到欧洲兄弟的许多帮助。
examples.en: We Americans owe a great deal to our European cousins.

defines.trans_en: a large female farm animal kept to produce meat and milk

examples.ch: 奶牛
examples.en: a dairy cow

defines.trans_en: a large female adult mammal such as an elephant, a whale, or a seal

examples.ch: 母象
examples.en: a cow elephant

defines.trans_en: an unkind or unpleasant woman

examples.ch: 你这个蠢婆娘！
examples.en: You stupid cow!

defines.trans_en: something difficult or unpleasant

examples.ch: 真是令人难受的一天。
examples.en: It's been a cow of a day.

defines.trans_ch: （以威胁或暴力）使害怕，吓唬，恐吓
defines.trans_en: to frighten someone into doing something, using threats or violence

examples.ch: 抗议者拒绝向军队低头。
examples.en: The protesters refused to be cowed into submission by the army.

defines.trans_en: the thick, yellowish-white liquid that forms on the top of milk

examples.ch: 加奶油的草莓
examples.en: strawberries and cream

examples.ch: 你的咖啡要加奶油吗？
examples.en: Do you like cream in your coffee?

examples.ch: 奶油蛋糕
examples.en: a cream cake (= cake with cream in it)

defines.trans_en: the colour of cream
a soft substance that you rub into your skin

examples.ch: 面霜／护手霜
examples.en: face/hand cream

examples.ch: 润肤霜
examples.en: moisturizing cream

examples.ch: 抹点防晒霜保护脸部。
examples.en: Put some sun cream on to protect your face.

defines.trans_en: a type of sweet that is soft inside

examples.ch: 巧克力／薄荷奶油夹心糖
examples.en: chocolate/peppermint creams

defines.trans_en: a thick liquid used for cleaning things

examples.ch: 乳液清洁剂
examples.en: cream cleaner

phrases.text: cream of mushroom, tomato, etc. soup
phrases.trans_en: soup that has been made into a smooth thick liquid and usually has cream in it

defines.trans_ch: 奶油色的，淡黄色的，米黄色的
defines.trans_en: having a yellowish-white colour

examples.ch: 淡黄色的衬衫
examples.en: a cream shirt

defines.trans_en: to make food into a smooth, thick liquid

examples.ch: 将奶油和糖混合起来搅成糊状。
examples.en: Cream the butter and sugar together.

defines.trans_en: a small plastic card that can be used as a method of payment, the money being taken from you at a later time
to go across from one side of something to the other

examples.ch: 这里不适宜横穿马路。
examples.en: It's not a good place to cross the road.

examples.ch: 过马路前先要左右看看。
examples.en: Look both ways before you cross over (= cross the road).

examples.ch: 过桥后右拐。
examples.en: Cross the bridge and turn right.

examples.ch: 他们穿越阿尔巴尼亚进入了希腊。
examples.en: They crossed from Albania into Greece.

defines.trans_en: to annoy someone by not doing or saying what they want

examples.ch: 如果我是你就不会跟他作对，除非不想活了。
examples.en: I wouldn't cross him if I were you, not if you value your life.

defines.trans_en: If you cross a plant or animal with another of a different type, you cause them to breed together in order to produce a new variety (= type of plant or animal).
in some sports, to hit, kick, or throw the ball across the playing area to another player, not forwards or backwards

examples.ch: 他把球横传给布莱梅，可是不知怎么的布莱梅两米外射门却没有射中。
examples.en: He crossed (the ball) to Bremer, who somehow failed to score from two metres out.

defines.trans_ch: 在（支票中间）上画两道线（表示需要转入银行账户）
defines.trans_en: to draw two lines across the middle of a cheque to show that it needs to be paid into a bank account

examples.ch: 划线支票，转账支票
examples.en: a crossed cheque

phrases.trans_en: If something crosses your mind, you think of it.

examples.ch: 昨天我突然想起你一定缺人手。
examples.en: It crossed my mind yesterday that you must be short of staff.

examples.ch: 我从没想过她可能会不高兴。
examples.en: It never once crossed my mind that she might be unhappy.

phrases.trans_en: to put one of your arms, fingers, or legs over the top of the other

examples.ch: 她坐下跷起了二郎腿。
examples.en: She sat down and crossed her legs.

phrases.trans_en: When Catholics and some other types of Christians cross themselves, they move their hand down and then across their face or chest, making the shape of a cross.

defines.trans_en: a written mark (x or +) formed by two lines going across each other. The mark x is usually used to show where something is, or that something has not been written correctly.

an object made of one long upright piece of wood, with a smaller piece across it near the top. In the past, people were tied or fastened with nails to crosses as a punishment and left hanging on them until they died.

defines.trans_ch: （象征基督教的）十字架，十字形物件
defines.trans_en: an object in the shape of a cross that people were killed on, used as a symbol of Christianity

examples.ch: 耶稣基督死在十字架上。
examples.en: Christ died on the Cross.

examples.ch: 她脖子上戴着一个金十字架。
examples.en: She wears a gold cross around her neck.

examples.ch: 牧师对着尸体在胸前画了个十字。
examples.en: The priest made the sign of the cross (= moved his or her hand down and then across the chest) over the dead bodies.

defines.trans_en: a medal in the shape of a cross

examples.ch: 在英国，维多利亚十字勋章授给那些在战争中表现英勇的人。
examples.en: In Britain, the Victoria Cross is awarded for acts of great bravery during wartime.

defines.trans_en: a mixture of two different things that have been combined to produce something new

examples.ch: 警犬往往是寻回犬和德国牧羊犬杂交的后代。
examples.en: Police dogs are often a cross between a retriever and a German Shepherd.

defines.trans_en: in some sports, a kick, hit, or throw of the ball that goes from one side of the playing area to the other, not forwards or backwards

examples.ch: 他接贝利一记精妙横传，一甩头把球送入了网窝。
examples.en: He headed the ball into the net, after a great cross from Pele.

defines.trans_en: annoyed or angry

examples.ch: 要是我把厨房搞得乱七八糟，我爸爸会生（我）气的。
examples.en: My Dad gets cross (with me) if I leave the kitchen in a mess.

defines.trans_en: across

examples.ch: 跨国的
examples.en: cross-border

defines.trans_ch: 由不同群体或学科组成的
defines.trans_en: including different groups or subjects

examples.ch: 跨党派讨论
examples.en: cross-party discussions

defines.trans_ch: 十字路口；交叉口；岔口，岔道；交汇处
defines.trans_en: a place where something such as a road, river, etc. can be crossed safely, or a place where a road and a railway meet and cross each other

examples.ch: 边境口岸／河流渡口
examples.en: a border/river crossing

defines.trans_ch: 跨海旅程，横渡海洋的旅程
defines.trans_en: a journey across a large area of water, from one side to the other

examples.ch: 我们渡海时风急浪大——我吐了3次。
examples.en: It was a really rough crossing - I threw up three times.

defines.trans_en: a place where two roads meet and cross each other
a large group of people who have come together

examples.ch: 大约有15000人出席了音乐会。
examples.en: A crowd of about 15,000 attended the concert.

defines.trans_ch: （有共同爱好的）一帮朋友，一伙人，一群人
defines.trans_en: a group of friends or a group of people with similar interests

examples.ch: 她常和一群朋友结伴外出。
examples.en: She goes around with a friendly crowd.

examples.ch: “那儿都有谁?”“噢，还是往常那伙人。”
examples.en: "Who was there?" "Oh, the usual crowd."

defines.trans_en: to make someone feel uncomfortable by standing too close to them or by watching them all the time

examples.ch: 我需要些时间把这活干好，所以别总盯着我。
examples.en: I need some time to do this work properly, so don't crowd me.

defines.trans_en: If a place is crowded, it is full of people.

examples.ch: 到10点钟酒吧里已挤满了人。
examples.en: By ten o'clock the bar was crowded.

defines.trans_en: to produce tears as the result of a strong emotion, such as unhappiness or pain

examples.ch: 我能听见隔壁房间有人在哭。
examples.en: I could hear someone crying in the next room.

examples.ch: “好啦，好啦，别哭了，”她说道。
examples.en: "There, there, don't cry," she said.

examples.ch: 我们都大笑起来，直到笑出了眼泪。
examples.en: We all laughed until we cried.

examples.ch: 收到来信，她流下了痛苦的泪水。
examples.en: She cried bitter tears when she got the letter.

examples.ch: 得知儿子安然无恙，他喜极而泣。
examples.en: He cried for joy when he heard that his son had been found alive and well.

defines.trans_en: to call out loudly

examples.ch: “当心！”她叫道。
examples.en: "Watch out!" she cried.

phrases.trans_en: to cry for a long time until you start to sleep

defines.trans_en: a loud, high sound that expresses an emotion

examples.ch: 绝望的叫喊声
examples.en: a cry of despair

defines.trans_en: a shout made to attract people's attention

examples.ch: 他们被隔壁房间里传来的“着火了”的叫声惊醒了。
examples.en: They were wakened by cries of "Fire!" from the next room.

defines.trans_en: the noise that a bird or animal makes

examples.ch: 老鹰的叫声
examples.en: an eagle's cry

defines.trans_en: a period of crying

examples.ch: “哭吧，好好哭一场吧，”他抚摸着她的头发说道。
examples.en: "It's all right, have a good cry," he said, stroking her hair.

defines.trans_en: a small, round container, often with a handle, used for drinking tea, coffee, etc.

examples.ch: 一副杯碟
examples.en: a cup and saucer

examples.ch: 塑料／纸杯
examples.en: a plastic/paper cup

examples.ch: 咖啡杯／茶杯
examples.en: a coffee cup/teacup

defines.trans_en: a container that holds slightly under a quarter of a litre of liquid, used for measuring when cooking
a specially designed cup, usually with two handles and often made of silver, given as a prize in a sports competition or in a game or match in which the winner receives such a cup

examples.ch: 这奖杯是希拉参加学校的壁球锦标赛获得的。
examples.en: Sheila won this cup in the school squash championship.

examples.ch: 戴维斯杯是一项重大的网球锦标赛。
examples.en: The Davis Cup is an important championship.

defines.trans_en: a bowl-shaped container

examples.ch: 盛蛋杯
examples.en: an egg cup

defines.trans_en: one of the two parts that support the breasts in a woman's bra (= piece of underwear)

examples.ch: “你戴多大尺寸的胸罩？”“C罩杯。”
examples.en: "What size bra do you wear?" "I wear a C cup."

defines.trans_ch: （男子运动时穿的）塑料护罩，下体护身
defines.trans_en: a curved piece of hard plastic that is worn by men while playing sports to protect their outer sex organs
a mixture of several types of drink, often including one that is alcoholic, often drunk at parties and usually served from a bowl

examples.ch: 草莓／苹果酒
examples.en: a strawberry/cider cup

defines.trans_en: to hold your hands in the shape of a cup, often around something

examples.ch: 她双手合起轻轻捧着受伤的小鸟。
examples.en: She gently cupped the small injured bird in her hands.

defines.trans_ch: 原发部位不明癌（carcinoma of uncertain primary origin的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for carcinoma of uncertain primary origin: the situation when cancer is found in one or more places in the body but the place where it started is unknown
a piece of furniture or a small part of a room with a door or doors behind which there is space for storing things, usually on shelves

examples.ch: 厨房碗柜
examples.en: a kitchen cupboard

examples.ch: 内置壁橱
examples.en: a built-in cupboard

examples.ch: 你的新居有很多壁柜吗？
examples.en: Is there plenty of cupboard space (= are there many cupboards) in your new house?

defines.trans_en: a piece of material, especially cloth, that hangs across a window or opening to make a room or part of a room dark or private

examples.ch: 厚厚的窗帘挡住了阳光。
examples.en: Heavy curtains blocked out the sunlight.

examples.ch: 拉窗帘
examples.en: to draw (= open or close) the curtains

defines.trans_en: a thick layer of something that makes it difficult to see anything behind it

examples.ch: 透过密密的雨帘／浓浓的烟雾，他们什么也看不到。
examples.en: They could see nothing through the curtain of rain/smoke.

defines.trans_en: the large screen of heavy material in a theatre that separates the stage from the area where people are watching
a person who buys goods or a service

examples.ch: 满意的顾客
examples.en: a satisfied customer

examples.ch: 威尔逊太太是我们的一位老主顾。
examples.en: Mrs Wilson is one of our regular customers.

defines.trans_en: to break the surface of something, or to divide or make something smaller, using a sharp tool, especially a knife

examples.ch: 切一片面包
examples.en: to cut a slice of bread

examples.ch: 我被那片玻璃／那把小刀割伤了（手）。
examples.en: I cut myself/my hand on that glass/with that knife.

examples.ch: 把肉切成小片。
examples.en: Cut the meat up into small pieces.

examples.ch: 这把刀不好切，不够锋利。
examples.en: This knife doesn't cut very well.

examples.ch: 你在哪儿理的发？
examples.en: Where did you have your hair cut?

examples.ch: 消防员们不得不动用特殊器械切开汽车，救出受困的司机。
examples.en: Firefighters had to cut the trapped driver loose/free (= cut the metal to allow the driver to get out of the car) using special equipment.

examples.ch: 他从秋千上摔下来，头上割了道口子。
examples.en: He fell off the swing and cut his head open (= got a deep cut in his head).

examples.ch: 他把蛋糕切成6块，分给孩子每人1块。
examples.en: He cut the cake in/into six (pieces) and gave each child a slice.

defines.trans_en: to make something shorter, lower, smaller, etc.

examples.ch: 降低价格／成本
examples.en: to cut prices/costs

examples.ch: 缩短加班时间／降低工资
examples.en: to cut overtime/wages

defines.trans_en: to remove something from something else

examples.ch: 该影片电视剧版中的性爱镜头都给剪掉了。
examples.en: The sex scenes had been cut out of the TV version of the film.

defines.trans_en: to not go, especially to a place where you should be

examples.ch: 你儿子一直在逃学。
examples.en: Your son has been cutting classes.

defines.trans_en: to stop or interrupt something

examples.ch: 关上引擎／马达
examples.en: to cut an engine/a motor

examples.ch: “停！”导演喊道。
examples.en: "Cut! (= stop filming!)" shouted the director.

defines.trans_en: to go through or across a place, especially in order to get somewhere quickly

examples.ch: 抄近道穿过走廊
examples.en: to cut through a passage

defines.trans_en: to choose a playing card by dividing a pile of cards into two parts

examples.ch: 谁来切牌？
examples.en: Who's going to cut the cards?

defines.trans_en: to record music or speech on a record

examples.ch: 滚石乐队的首张唱片是何时录制的？
examples.en: When did the Stones cut their first record?

phrases.trans_ch: （计算机文件中文字或图片的）剪贴
phrases.trans_en: to move words or pictures from one place to another in a computer document

phrases.text: cut sb out of your will
phrases.trans_en: to decide not to leave someone any of your money or possessions when you die
to stop someone from talking before they have finished what they were saying

examples.ch: 他开始解释，可是她打断了他的话。
examples.en: He started to explain, but she cut him short.

phrases.trans_en: used to tell someone to stop talking or stop behaving in an annoying way

examples.ch: 停下！你那些无聊的东西我受够了。
examples.en: Just cut it out! I've had enough of your time wasting.

phrases.trans_en: (of a baby) to grow a new tooth

examples.ch: 这个婴儿正在长牙，难怪她哭个没完。
examples.en: The baby's cutting a tooth. That's why she's crying.

phrases.trans_en: to fail to keep to your own side of the road when going round a corner

defines.trans_en: an injury made when the skin is cut with something sharp

examples.ch: 一道深深的伤痕
examples.en: a deep cut

defines.trans_en: a piece of meat cut from a particular part of an animal

examples.ch: 牛腰肉是牛肉中最贵的。
examples.en: Sirloin is the most expensive cut of beef.

defines.trans_en: the shape into which something is cut

examples.ch: 我不喜欢这条牛仔裤的款式。
examples.en: I don't like the cut of these jeans.

defines.trans_en: a reduction in the number, amount, or rate of something

examples.ch: 花销的削减／利率的降低／医院候诊名单的缩短
examples.en: a cut in expenditure/interest rates/hospital waiting lists

defines.trans_en: the act of removing a part from a book, film, etc., or a part that is removed

examples.ch: 这部电影里有些非常暴力的场面，因此在电视上播映时做了些删剪。
examples.en: The movie contains some very violent scenes, so some cuts were made when it was shown on TV.

defines.trans_en: a share of something, usually money

examples.ch: 我什么时候能拿到我那份钱？
examples.en: When am I going to get my cut?

defines.trans_ch: （从山中开凿出的）通道铁路，河床
defines.trans_en: a deep, narrow passage made through a hill for a road, railway, or canal

phrases.trans_en: reductions in public spending

examples.ch: 学生和工人们上街游行抗议削减公共开支。
examples.en: Students and workers were out on the streets protesting against the cuts.

defines.trans_en: a bicycle
a group of events that happen in a particular order, one following the other, and are often repeated

examples.ch: 蛾的生命周期
examples.en: the life cycle of a moth

defines.trans_en: one in a series of movements that a machine performs

examples.ch: 洗衣机脱水程序
examples.en: the washing machine's spin cycle

defines.trans_ch: （表现相同人物或思想的）全套剧目，组诗
defines.trans_en: a group of plays, poems, songs, etc. written by one person and connected with each other by dealing with the same characters or ideas

examples.ch: 这几部连台戏连续几晚都在上演，这只是其中一部。
examples.en: It's one in a cycle of plays that are being performed on successive evenings.

defines.trans_en: to ride a bicycle
a father

examples.ch: 爸，今天晚上聚会后你能不能接我回家？
examples.en: Can you pick me up from the party tonight, Dad?

examples.ch: 很高兴昨天晚上在音乐会上见到你爸妈。
examples.en: It was great to see your mum and dad at the concert last night.

defines.trans_en: happening on or relating to every day

examples.ch: 药片日服两次。
examples.en: Take the tablets twice daily.

examples.ch: 锻炼已经成为我日常生活的一部分。
examples.en: Exercise has become part of my daily routine.

examples.ch: 我们每天都要对工作电脑文件进行备份。
examples.en: We back up our computer files at work on a daily basis.

examples.ch: 她正盼着早日退休，不用再天天在办公室里受煎熬。
examples.en: She's looking forward to retiring and ending the daily grind (= hard, boring work or duty) of working in an office.

defines.trans_ch: （受雇打扫别人家房屋的）清洁工，佣人
defines.trans_en: a person who is employed to clean someone else's home
to move the body and feet to music

examples.ch: 我们跳了一夜的舞。
examples.en: We danced all night.

examples.ch: 我们去夜总会跳舞了。
examples.en: We went dancing at a club.

examples.ch: 你喜欢伴着哪种曲子跳舞？
examples.en: What kind of music do you like dancing to?

examples.ch: 昨晚舞会上她在和谁跳舞？
examples.en: Who was she dancing with at the party last night?

examples.ch: 你会跳探戈舞吗？
examples.en: Can you dance the tango?

examples.ch: 我们放上音乐，跳了一晚上的舞。
examples.en: We played our music and danced the night away.

defines.trans_en: to move quickly and lightly

examples.ch: 黄水仙在微风中轻轻舞动。
examples.en: The daffodils were dancing in the breeze.

examples.ch: 她注视着水面上的粼粼波光。
examples.en: She watched the sunlight dancing on the water.

defines.trans_en: a particular series of movements that you perform to music or the type of music that is connected with it

examples.ch: 乐队演奏了一支舒缓的舞曲。
examples.en: The band played a slow dance.

defines.trans_en: a social occasion where people dance, especially a formal occasion in a large room

examples.ch: 他们要举办一场期末餐舞会。
examples.en: They're having an end-of-term dinner-dance.

defines.trans_en: the act of moving your feet and body to music

examples.ch: 我们跳了一支舞。
examples.en: We had a dance.

examples.ch: 新娘的父亲在婚礼上跟新娘跳第一支舞。
examples.en: The bride's father gets the first dance at the wedding.

examples.ch: 舞蹈课
examples.en: a dance class

defines.trans_en: the art of performing dances, especially as a form of entertainment

examples.ch: 演员们载歌载舞演绎了那个故事。
examples.en: The performers tell the story through song and dance.

examples.en: She watched the sunlight dancing on the water.

examples.ch: 乐队演奏了一支舒缓的舞曲。
examples.en: The band played a slow dance.

defines.trans_en: a social occasion where people dance, especially a formal occasion in a large room

examples.ch: 他们要举办一场期末餐舞会。

examples.ch: 新娘的父亲在婚礼上跟新娘跳第一支舞。

examples.ch: 演员们载歌载舞演绎了那个故事。

defines.trans_en: the possibility of harm or death to someone

examples.ch: 危险！别进来！
examples.en: Danger! Keep out!

examples.ch: 他的车开得太快了，当时我真的觉得自己会有生命危险。
examples.en: He drove so fast that I really felt my life was in danger.

examples.ch: 医生们说他已经度过危险期了。
examples.en: The doctors say he is now out of danger (= is not expected to die although he has been extremely sick).

examples.ch: 攀岩的种种危险
examples.en: the dangers of rock-climbing

defines.trans_en: something or someone that may harm you

examples.ch: 结冰的路面对司机来说是种威胁。
examples.en: Icy roads are a danger to drivers.

examples.ch: 法官说他对社会构成了威胁。
examples.en: The judge described him as a danger to society.

phrases.trans_en: the possibility that something bad will happen

examples.ch: 如果在聚会上有可能看见加里，那我就不去了。
examples.en: If there's any danger of seeing Gary at the party, I'm not going.

examples.ch: 如果他再这样下去，就有可能失去工作。
examples.en: If he carries on like this he's in danger of losing his job.

defines.trans_ch: 危险的，有威胁的;不安全的
defines.trans_en: A dangerous person, animal, thing, or activity could harm you.

examples.ch: 危险化学品
examples.en: dangerous chemicals

examples.ch: 那些人携带武器，太危险了。
examples.en: The men are armed and dangerous.

examples.ch: 他的父母不让他打冰球，因为他们认为太危险。
examples.en: His parents won't let him play ice hockey because they think it's too dangerous.

examples.ch: 超剂量服药是很危险的。
examples.en: It's dangerous to take more than the recommended dose.

defines.trans_en: with little or no light

examples.ch: 光线太暗，看不清楚。
examples.en: It was too dark to see much.

examples.ch: 夏季天什么时候黑？
examples.en: What time does it get dark in the summer?

examples.ch: 我们的卧室原来很暗，后来装了一个大点的窗户才好些。
examples.en: Our bedroom was very dark until we put a larger window in.

defines.trans_en: nearer to black than white in colour

examples.ch: 深蓝／暗绿色
examples.en: dark blue/green

examples.ch: 乌云
examples.en: dark clouds

examples.ch: 她长着一头黑发。
examples.en: She has dark hair.

examples.ch: 他个头高高的，深色头发，长得很英俊。
examples.en: He was tall, dark (= with black/brown hair) and handsome.

defines.trans_en: sad and without hope

examples.ch: 丈夫突然去世后她就开始生活在伤心绝望之中。
examples.en: Her husband's sudden death was the start of a dark chapter in her life.

examples.ch: 这份环境报告中对地球未来的预测很不乐观。
examples.en: This environmental report contains more dark predictions about the future of the earth.

defines.trans_ch: 邪恶的，阴险的;有威胁的
defines.trans_en: evil or threatening

examples.ch: 他的性格中有更阴暗的一面。
examples.en: There's a darker side to his character.

defines.trans_en: secret or hidden

examples.ch: 我刚刚升了职，别告诉任何人——我现在还不想让大家知道。
examples.en: I've just been promoted, but keep it dark - I don't want everyone to know just yet.

phrases.trans_en: the fact of there being no light somewhere

examples.ch: 猫在暗处也看得见东西。
examples.en: Cats can see in the dark.

examples.ch: 我一直都怕黑。
examples.en: I've always been afraid of the dark.

phrases.trans_en: before/after the sun has gone down

examples.ch: 天黑后出去不安全。
examples.en: It isn't safe to leave the house after dark.

examples.ch: 我想在天黑前赶到家里。
examples.en: I want to be home before dark.

defines.trans_en: a numbered day in a month, often given with a combination of the name of the day, the month, and the year

examples.ch: 今天几号？
examples.en: What's the date (today)?/What date is it?/What's today's date?

examples.ch: 今天是6月11号。
examples.en: Today's date is 11 June (the eleventh of June).

examples.ch: 今天是6月11号。
examples.en: Today's date is June 11 (June the eleventh).

examples.ch: 你的出生日期是哪一天？
examples.en: What is your date of birth?

examples.ch: 申请截止日期为本月底。
examples.en: The closing date for applications is the end of this month.

examples.ch: 我们定好晚些时候再会面。
examples.en: We agreed to meet again at a later date.

examples.ch: 我想定下我们下次会面的日期。
examples.en: I'd like to fix a date for our next meeting.

examples.ch: 我已与她说好了见面谈房子的日期。
examples.en: I made a date (= agreed a date and time) to see her about the house.

defines.trans_en: a particular year

examples.ch: 硬币上的年份是1789年。
examples.en: The date on the coin is 1789.

examples.ch: 阿尔伯特‧爱因斯坦生于1879年，卒于1955年。
examples.en: Albert Einstein's dates are 1879 to 1955 (= he was born in 1879 and died in 1955).

defines.trans_en: a month and a year

examples.ch: 本证书的失效日期为2017年8月
examples.en: The expiry (US expiration) date of this certificate is August 2017.

defines.trans_en: a social meeting planned before it happens, especially one between two people who have or might have a romantic relationship

examples.ch: 他把她约了出去。
examples.en: He asked her out on a date.

examples.ch: 她今晚有一个朝思暮想的约会。
examples.en: She has a hot date (= an exciting meeting) tonight.

defines.trans_en: a person you have a romantic meeting with

examples.ch: 你约了谁去参加舞会？
examples.en: Who's your date for the prom?

defines.trans_en: a performance

examples.ch: 他们刚刚结束了欧洲巡回表演，一共演了75场，可谓筋疲力尽。
examples.en: They've just finished an exhausting 75-date European tour.

defines.trans_en: the sweet fruit of various types of palm tree

defines.trans_ch: 在…上写上日子，在…上标明日期
defines.trans_en: to write the day's date on something you have written or made

examples.ch: 谢谢你8月30日的来信。
examples.en: Thank you for your letter dated 30 August.

defines.trans_ch: 确定…的年代，推算…形成的时间
defines.trans_en: to say how long something has existed or when it was made

examples.ch: 考古学家无法确定这些化石的生成年代。
examples.en: Archaeologists have been unable to date these fossils.

examples.ch: 古玩经销商推算那个花瓶的制造年代为1734年。
examples.en: An antique dealer had dated the vase at (= said that it was made in) 1734.

defines.trans_en: to regularly spend time with someone you have a romantic relationship with

examples.ch: 他们谈了5年恋爱才结婚。
examples.en: They dated for five years before they got married.

examples.ch: 你和尼基谈恋爱有多久了？
examples.en: How long have you been dating Nicky?

defines.trans_en: to stop being fashionable or become old-fashioned

examples.ch: 和另外一些电影相比，詹姆斯‧邦德系列电影中有一些很快就过时了。
examples.en: Some James Bond films have dated more than others.

defines.trans_ch: 表明…的年龄;揭示…的年代
defines.trans_en: to show the age of a person or thing

examples.ch: 我还能记得观看首次登月电视直播的情景，由此可以看出我的年纪。
examples.en: I can remember watching live TV coverage of the first lunar landing, so that dates me (= shows how old I am).

defines.trans_en: your female child

examples.ch: 莉兹和菲尔有1个女儿和3个儿子。
examples.en: Liz and Phil have a daughter and three sons.

defines.trans_en: a period of 24 hours, especially from twelve o'clock one night to twelve o'clock the next night

examples.ch: 一月份有31天。
examples.en: January has 31 days.

examples.ch: 一周的7天
examples.en: the days of the week

examples.ch: 他每天跑5英里。
examples.en: He runs five miles every day.

examples.ch: 我们花了几乎一天的时间才到这儿。
examples.en: It took us almost a day to get here.

examples.ch: 我前天见到他了。
examples.en: I saw him the day before yesterday.

examples.ch: 我们后天离开。
examples.en: We leave the day after tomorrow.

examples.ch: 人们最后一次见到他是在5天以前，那时他还活着。
examples.en: He was last seen alive five days ago.

examples.ch: 他们好些日子没露面了。
examples.en: They haven't been seen for days (= for several days).

examples.ch: 过几天我会见到帕特。
examples.en: I'll be seeing Pat in a few days/in a few days' time.

examples.ch: 你今天过得好吗？
examples.en: How's your day been? (= Have you enjoyed today?)

examples.ch: 祝你今天过得愉快！
examples.en: Have a nice day!

examples.ch: 我得睡觉了——我明天有很重要的事。
examples.en: I must get some sleep - I've got a big day (= an important day) tomorrow.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to the period in 24 hours when it is naturally light

examples.ch: 阳光明媚的一天
examples.en: a bright sunny day

examples.ch: 今天下了一整天的雨。
examples.en: It rained all day.

examples.ch: 这些动物昼伏夜出。
examples.en: These animals sleep during the day and hunt at night.

defines.trans_en: the time that you usually spend at work or at school

examples.ch: 正常工作日
examples.en: a normal working day

examples.ch: 我每天工作7小时。
examples.en: I work a seven-hour day.

examples.ch: 为了满足需求，我们将不得不每周工作6天。
examples.en: We're having to work a six-day week to cope with demand.

phrases.trans_en: a day when you do not have to work or do something that you normally do

examples.ch: 我周四不在——那天我休息。
examples.en: I won't be in on Thursday - it's my day off.

examples.ch: 她下星期休假三天。
examples.en: She's taking three days off next week.

phrases.trans_en: a few days ago

examples.ch: 前几天我不是还在邮局见过你吗？
examples.en: Didn't I see you in the post office the other day?

phrases.trans_en: used to talk about the present time, in comparison with the past

examples.ch: 现在素食很流行。
examples.en: Vegetarianism is very popular these days.

phrases.trans_en: in the past

examples.ch: 过去人们写信要多得多。
examples.en: In those days people used to write a lot more letters.

phrases.trans_ch: 很快，过不了多久;（尤指）就这几天
phrases.trans_en: very soon, especially within the next few days

examples.ch: 就这几天婴儿就要出生了。
examples.en: The baby's due any day now.

phrases.trans_en: when it is naturally light

examples.ch: 我喜欢白天旅行。
examples.en: I prefer travelling by day.

phrases.trans_en: repeatedly, every day

examples.ch: 同样的问题每天都要出现。
examples.en: The same problems keep coming up day after day.

phrases.trans_en: all the time

examples.ch: 无论白天晚上你在房间里都会听到车辆的嘈杂声。
examples.en: You can hear the traffic from your room day and night.

phrases.trans_en: every day, or more and more as each day passes

examples.ch: 他的身体日渐虚弱。
examples.en: Day by day he became weaker.

phrases.trans_en: If something changes (from) day to day, it changes often.

examples.ch: 这种疾病的症状每天都会发生变化。
examples.en: The symptoms of the disease change from day to day.

phrases.text: from one day to the next
phrases.trans_ch: 一天又一天（表示不知道未来会怎样），过一天算一天
phrases.trans_en: before each day happens

examples.ch: 我从来不知道第二天会是什么样。
examples.en: I never know what I’ll be doing from one day to the next.

phrases.trans_en: a period in history

examples.ch: 没有电子邮件的时候人们是怎样交流的？
examples.en: How did people communicate in the days before email?

phrases.trans_en: up to and including the present moment

examples.ch: 到现在也没人知道他到底出了什么事。
examples.en: To this day nobody knows what happened to him.

defines.trans_en: not now living

examples.ch: 到现在她已经去世20年了。
examples.en: She's been dead for 20 years now.

examples.ch: 那位摩托车手被送到医院时已经死亡。
examples.en: The motorcyclist was dead on arrival at the hospital.

examples.ch: 他在家门外被人开枪打死了。
examples.en: He was shot dead (= killed by shooting) outside his home.

defines.trans_ch: （身体局部）失去知觉的，麻木的
defines.trans_en: If a part of your body is dead, you cannot feel it.

examples.ch: 我盘腿坐了很久，结果右腿都麻木了。
examples.en: I've been sitting with my legs crossed for so long, my right leg has gone dead.

defines.trans_en: If glasses and bottles that were previously full are dead, they are now empty.
In some sports, if a ball is dead, it is outside the area of play.
If a place is dead, it is too quiet and nothing interesting happens there.

examples.ch: 市中心白天相当热闹，晚上却死气沉沉。
examples.en: The city centre is quite lively during the day, but it's totally dead at night.

defines.trans_en: If a piece of equipment is dead, it is not working.

examples.ch: 没电的电池
examples.en: a dead battery

examples.ch: 电话突然不能用了。
examples.en: The phone suddenly went dead.

defines.trans_en: complete(ly)

examples.ch: 乐队指挥等观众们完全静下来后才开始演出。
examples.en: The conductor waited for dead silence before commencing the performance.

examples.ch: 邮局就在前面。
examples.en: The post office is dead (= straight) ahead.

examples.ch: 瞄准靶子的正中心。
examples.en: Aim for the dead (= exact) centre of the target.

examples.ch: 我总是尽量按时到达。
examples.en: I always try to arrive dead (= exactly) on time.

defines.trans_en: very

examples.ch: 这次考试太容易了。
examples.en: The exam was dead easy.

examples.ch: 我饿极了。
examples.en: I'm dead hungry.

examples.ch: “那部电影怎么样？”“棒极了！”
examples.en: "How was the film?" "It was dead good."

phrases.trans_en: to be completely opposed to something

examples.ch: 他坚决反对住在城里。
examples.en: He's dead set against living in the city.

examples.ch: 你不可能改变他的想法——他坚决不同意这个计划。
examples.en: You won't be able to change his mind - he's dead against the plan.

phrases.trans_en: to be very determined to do or have something

examples.ch: 玛莎一心想要一辆新自行车。
examples.en: Martha's dead set on having a new bike.

phrases.trans_en: dead people

examples.ch: 死者中有3名儿童。
examples.en: Three children were among the dead.

examples.ch: 人们呼吁停火以便幸存者能够掩埋他们死去的亲人。
examples.en: A ceasefire has been called to allow the survivors to bury their dead.

defines.trans_en: loved or liked very much

examples.ch: 她是一位非常亲密的朋友。
examples.en: She was a very dear friend.

examples.ch: 他是我非常亲近的人。
examples.en: He was very dear to me.

examples.ch: 这个地方对我来讲非常亲切——我们曾到这里度过蜜月。
examples.en: This place is very dear to me - we came here on our honeymoon.

examples.ch: 多么可爱的小猫啊！
examples.en: What a dear (= very attractive) little kitten!

examples.ch: 我亲爱的吉娜——见到你真是太好了！
examples.en: My dear Gina - how nice to see you!

defines.trans_ch: （用于信的开头作问候语）亲爱的，尊敬的
defines.trans_en: used at the beginning of a letter to greet the person you are writing to

examples.ch: 亲爱的克里／爸爸妈妈／史密斯女士／尊敬的先生
examples.en: Dear Kerry/Mum and Dad/Ms Smith/Sir

defines.trans_en: costing too much

examples.ch: 这儿的饭菜不错，就是太贵。
examples.en: The food was good but very dear.

defines.trans_ch: 天哪（表示恼怒、失望、伤心、吃惊等）
defines.trans_en: used in expressions of anger, disappointment, sadness, or surprise

examples.ch: 哦，天哪！我又把钥匙弄丢了。
examples.en: Oh dear! I've lost my keys again.

examples.ch: 天哪，已经4点半了，我说过我5点前要到家的！
examples.en: Dear me, it's already 4.30 and I said I'd be home by 5.00!

examples.ch: 天哪，真是太乱了！
examples.en: Dearie me, what a mess!

defines.trans_ch: 善良的人，和善之人，好人
defines.trans_en: a kind person

examples.ch: 安妮可真是个大好人——这周她每天早上都把早饭送到我的床边。
examples.en: Annie's such a dear - she's brought me breakfast in bed every morning this week.

defines.trans_ch: 亲爱的（亲切友好的称呼，不用于男子之间）
defines.trans_en: used to address someone you love or are being friendly to, not used between men

examples.ch: 亲爱的，这是你的收据。
examples.en: Here's your receipt, dear.

examples.ch: 亲爱的，你想喝一杯吗？
examples.en: Would you like a drink, dear?

examples.ch: 亲爱的，见到你真是太好了。
examples.en: Lovely to see you, my dear.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指仔细考虑后）决定，决断，确定
defines.trans_en: to choose something, especially after thinking carefully about several possibilities

examples.ch: 他们必须在下周五前作出决定。
examples.en: They have to decide by next Friday.

examples.ch: 我不在乎给我们哪个——你来决定吧。
examples.en: It doesn't matter to me which one we have - you decide.

examples.ch: 最后我们决定去剧院。
examples.en: In the end, we decided to go to the theatre.

examples.ch: 她决定去印度。
examples.en: She decided (that) she would travel to India.

examples.ch: 我不知道该怎么办。
examples.en: I can't decide what to do.

examples.ch: 他决定不了要不要把它买下来。
examples.en: He can't decide whether to buy it.

examples.ch: 委员会决定选用最经济的方案。
examples.en: The committee decided in favour of (= made a formal judgment to choose) the cheapest option.

defines.trans_ch: 决定（事情的结果），导致…的结果
defines.trans_en: to be the reason or situation that makes a particular result happen

examples.ch: 天气状况决定了网球赛的结果。
examples.en: The weather decided the outcome of the tennis match.

examples.ch: 蒂姆的失误导致了那场比赛的失败。
examples.en: Tim's mistake decided the game (= caused him to lose).

defines.trans_en: (an) amount or level of something

examples.ch: 这项工作对技术的要求很高。
examples.en: This job demands a high degree of skill.

examples.ch: 毫无疑问，他是无辜的。
examples.en: There isn't the slightest degree of doubt that he's innocent.

examples.ch: 我必须警告你这里面有一定的危险。
examples.en: I have to warn you that there's a degree of (= some) danger involved in this.

examples.ch: 恐怖袭击的次数已经到了骇人的程度。
examples.en: The number of terrorist attacks has increased to a terrifying degree.

examples.ch: 她说的有一定的真实性。
examples.en: There was some degree of truth in what she said.

examples.ch: 你认为我们的服务还有多大的改进空间？
examples.en: To what degree do you think we will be providing a better service?

examples.ch: “那可真是太糟糕了。”“只是程度不同而已。”
examples.en: "That's really bad." "Well, it's all a matter/question of degree (= there are other things better and other things worse)."

defines.trans_ch: 度，度数（尤指温度或角度的度量单位，通常在数字后用符号°来表示）
defines.trans_en: any of various units of measurement, especially of temperature or angles, usually shown by the symbol ° written after a number

examples.ch: 3度之差
examples.en: a difference of three degrees

examples.ch: 水在212华氏度，即100摄氏度沸腾。
examples.en: Water boils at 212° Fahrenheit and 100° Celsius/Centigrade.

examples.ch: 直角为90度。
examples.en: A right angle is an angle of 90°.

examples.ch: 纽约位于北纬41度、西经74度。
examples.en: New York is on a latitude of 41°N and a longitude of 74°W.

defines.trans_en: a course of study at a college or university, or the qualification given to a student after he or she has completed his or her studies

examples.ch: 她获得了爱丁堡大学的物理学学位。
examples.en: She has a physics degree/a degree in physics from Edinburgh.

examples.ch: 她获得了耶鲁大学历史学专业的学士／硕士学位。
examples.en: She has a bachelor's/master's degree in history from Yale.

examples.ch: “你在约克大学学的什么课程？”“地理学。”
examples.en: "What degree did you do at York?" "Geography."

defines.trans_ch: …度，…级（与序数词并用，表示某事物的严重性）
defines.trans_en: used with an ordinal number to show how serious something is

examples.ch: 她的腿部受到一度／二度／三度烧伤。
examples.en: She suffered first-/second-/third-degree (= least serious/serious/very serious) burns on her legs.

examples.ch: 他被指控犯有一级谋杀罪。
examples.en: He's being charged with first-degree (= the most serious type of) murder.

defines.trans_en: to make something happen at a later time than originally planned or expected

examples.ch: 我乘坐的飞机延误了1个小时。
examples.en: My plane was delayed by an hour.

examples.ch: 大雪迫使比赛延迟开始。
examples.en: Heavy snow delayed the start of the game.

examples.ch: 我认为我们应该等到明年再决定这件事。
examples.en: I think we should delay deciding about this until next year.

defines.trans_en: to cause someone or something to be slow or late

examples.ch: 由于交通的原因我被耽搁了。
examples.en: I was delayed by traffic.

defines.trans_en: to not act quickly or immediately

examples.ch: 现在你如果不赶快行动就可能会失去机会。
examples.en: If you delay now, the opportunity might be lost.

defines.trans_ch: 延迟，延误，延期;延迟（或延误）的时间
defines.trans_en: the situation in which you have to wait longer than expected for something to happen, or the time that you have to wait

examples.ch: 这种情况需要立即处理。
examples.en: This situation needs to be tackled without delay.

examples.ch: 由于这起事故，预计在高速公路上会出现长时间的交通延误。
examples.en: Long delays are predicted on the motorway because of the accident.

examples.ch: 该书的出版延期了。
examples.en: There has been a delay in the book's publication.

defines.trans_en: a person whose job is treating people's teeth

examples.ch: 你每年至少应该请牙科医生检查两次牙齿。
examples.en: You should have your teeth checked by a dentist at least twice a year.

phrases.trans_en: the place where a dentist carries out their job

examples.ch: 周五我得去看牙。
examples.en: I've got to go to the dentist's on Friday.

defines.trans_ch: （组织或机构中的）部，系，处，科，室
defines.trans_en: a part of an organization such as a school, business, or government that deals with a particular area of study or work

examples.ch: 化学系
examples.en: the chemistry department/the department of chemistry

examples.ch: 本周销售部将举办圣诞晚会。
examples.en: The sales department is/are having a Christmas party this week.

examples.ch: 健康与社会保障部
examples.en: the Department of Health and Social Security

defines.trans_en: to say or write what someone or something is like

examples.ch: 你能描述一下袭击你的人的样子吗？
examples.en: Could you describe your attacker?

examples.ch: 他详细地描述了那幅油画的内容。
examples.en: He described the painting in detail.

examples.ch: 让我来（给你）讲讲事情的经过吧。
examples.en: Let me describe (to you) how it happened.

examples.ch: 她说加利很害羞。
examples.en: She described Gary as shy.

defines.trans_en: If you describe a shape, you draw it or move in a direction that follows the line of it.

examples.ch: 他用圆规画了一个圆。
examples.en: He used compasses to describe a circle.

defines.trans_ch: （常指带抽屉的）书桌，办公桌，写字台
defines.trans_en: a type of table that you can work at, often one with drawers

examples.ch: 办公桌／课桌
examples.en: an office/school desk

examples.ch: 她坐在书桌前写信。
examples.en: She sat at her desk writing letters.

examples.ch: 他的办公桌上有一摞文件。
examples.en: He had a pile of papers on his desk.

examples.ch: 这份报告是今天早上送到我这里来的。
examples.en: The report arrived on/landed on/reached my desk (= I received it) this morning.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指酒店或机场的）服务台，问询处
defines.trans_en: a place, often with a counter (= a long flat narrow surface) especially in a hotel or airport, where you can get information or service

examples.ch: 登机服务台／问讯处／接待处
examples.en: a check-in/information/reception desk

defines.trans_ch: （报纸或广播公司负责某一类新闻的）办公处，部，室，组
defines.trans_en: an office that deals with a particular type of news for a newspaper or broadcasting company

examples.ch: 国际／体育部
examples.en: the foreign/sports desk

examples.ch: 现在我们来听听旅行部的苏带来的新闻。
examples.en: Now let's hear from Sue at our travel desk.

defines.trans_en: a book in which you record your thoughts or feelings or what has happened each day

examples.ch: 安妮‧弗兰克在躲匿期间坚持写日记。
examples.en: While in hiding, Anne Frank kept a diary.

defines.trans_en: a book with a separate space or page for each day, in which you write down your future arrangements, meetings, etc.

examples.ch: 别忘了在日程簿上标出开会的日期。
examples.en: Don't forget to write/enter the date of the meeting in your diary.

defines.trans_en: a book that contains a list of words in alphabetical order and that explains their meanings, or gives a word for them in another language; a similar product for use on a computer

examples.ch: 法英／英法词典
examples.en: a French-English/English-French dictionary

examples.ch: 双语／单语字典
examples.en: a bilingual/monolingual dictionary

examples.ch: 要确定单词的拼法就查字典。
examples.en: To check how a word is spelled, look it up in a dictionary.

defines.trans_en: a book that gives information about a particular subject, in which the entries (= words or phrases) are given in alphabetical order

examples.ch: 人名／科技词典
examples.en: a biographical/science dictionary

examples.ch: 引语词典
examples.en: a dictionary of quotations

defines.trans_en: to stop living or existing, either suddenly or slowly

examples.ch: 12人在此次事故中丧生。
examples.en: Twelve people died in the accident.

examples.ch: 她死于饥饿／癌症／心脏病／伤病。
examples.en: She died of/from hunger/cancer/a heart attack/her injuries.

examples.ch: 愿为信念而死的人称得上是勇敢者。
examples.en: It is a brave person who will die for their beliefs.

examples.ch: 我愿在睡梦中死去。
examples.en: I would like to die in my sleep (= while I am sleeping).

examples.ch: 很多人害怕死亡。
examples.en: Many people have a fear of dying.

examples.ch: 我们的爱将永不消逝。
examples.en: Our love will never die.

examples.ch: 她不会告诉任何人——这个秘密会烂在她的肚子里。
examples.en: She will not tell anyone - the secret will die with her.

defines.trans_ch: （通常因为没有电而）停止运转，报废
defines.trans_en: If a machine, battery, or phone dies, it stops working, usually because it has no power.

examples.ch: 那台发动机刚好报废在我们手里。
examples.en: The engine just died on us.

examples.ch: 对不起，我没有回你的短信，我的电话没有电了。
examples.en: I'm sorry I didn't reply to your text - my phone died.

phrases.trans_en: to die naturally, violently, etc.

examples.ch: 他死于非命。
examples.en: He died a violent death.

examples.ch: 我祖母寿终正寝，这是她所希望的结局。
examples.en: My grandmother died a natural death (= did not die of illness or because she was killed), as she would have wanted.

defines.trans_en: a shaped piece or mould (= hollow container) made of metal or other hard material, used to shape or put a pattern on metal or plastic
a small cube (= object with six equal square sides) with a different number of spots on each side, used in games involving chance
the way in which two or more things which you are comparing are not the same

examples.ch: 猿和猴有什么区别？
examples.en: What's the difference between an ape and a monkey?

examples.ch: 这两件东西在质量方面有明显的差别吗？
examples.en: Is there any significant difference in quality between these two items?

defines.trans_en: a disagreement

examples.ch: 几个星期前他们发生过一次激烈的争吵，不过现在他们的分歧已经消除了。
examples.en: They had a terrible argument a few weeks ago, but now they've settled/resolved their differences.

defines.trans_en: the amount by which one thing is different from another

examples.ch: 年龄差距/价格差异/温度不同
examples.en: a(n) age/price/temperature difference

examples.ch: 他们年龄相差很大。
examples.en: There's a big difference in age between them.

examples.ch: 他们之间差八岁。
examples.en: There's a difference of eight years between them.

phrases.trans_en: to improve a situation (a lot)

examples.ch: 锻炼会极大地改善你的健康状况。
examples.en: Exercise can make a big difference to your state of health.

examples.ch: 贴上一些新壁纸后这个地方变得焕然一新了。
examples.en: Putting up some new wallpaper has made all the difference to the place.

phrases.trans_en: to not change a situation in any way

examples.ch: 你如果愿意可以再去问他，但结果还是一样——他还会说不。
examples.en: You can ask him again if you want, but it won't make any difference - he'll still say no.

examples.ch: 不管你把这些植物放在什么位置结果都一样，它们在这种土壤里成活不了。
examples.en: It makes no difference where you put the plants - they won't grow in this soil.

phrases.trans_ch: 与众不同，不同寻常，别具一格，更胜一筹
phrases.trans_en: used to say that something is unusual, and more interesting or better than other things of the same type

examples.ch: 试试新的克里梅蒂——不同寻常的冰激凌。
examples.en: Try new Cremetti - the ice cream with a difference.

phrases.trans_en: to disagree

examples.ch: 他们在孩子的教育问题上意见不一。
examples.en: They had a difference of opinion about/over their child's education.

defines.trans_ch: 不同的，不一样的，有差别的
defines.trans_en: not the same

examples.ch: 她似乎每天都穿不一样的衣服。
examples.en: She seems to wear something different every day.

examples.ch: 他现在上了大学，与以前不一样了。
examples.en: He's different now that he's been to college.

examples.ch: 这周我们在读另一本书。
examples.en: We're reading a different book this week.

examples.ch: 埃米莉与她姐姐截然不同。
examples.en: Emily is very/completely/entirely different from her sister.

examples.ch: 埃米莉和她姐姐完全不同。
examples.en: Emily and her sister are completely different.

examples.ch: 细菌有很多不同的种类。
examples.en: There are many different types/kinds of bacteria.

defines.trans_ch: 不同寻常的，另类的；品位差的
defines.trans_en: used when you think someone or something is unusual or shows bad judgment

examples.ch: 我觉得你那双紫色鞋子怎么样？当然很另类啦。
examples.en: What do I think of your purple shoes? Well, they're certainly different.

defines.trans_en: needing skill or effort

examples.ch: 难题／艰难的选择／艰巨的任务／难学的语言
examples.en: a difficult problem/choice/task/language

examples.ch: 证明他们有罪将非常困难。
examples.en: It will be very difficult to prove that they are guilty.

examples.ch: 有很多因素使女性难以进入美国商界的上层。
examples.en: Many things make it difficult for women to reach the top in US business.

examples.ch: 单亲家长生活非常艰辛。
examples.en: It is extremely difficult being a single parent.

defines.trans_ch: 不友好的；难以接近的；难对付的；没教养的
defines.trans_en: not friendly, easy to deal with, or behaving well

examples.ch: 那位经理很难对付。
examples.en: The manager is difficult to deal with/a difficult person to deal with.

examples.ch: 他妻子是个难以接近的人。
examples.en: His wife is a very difficult woman.

examples.ch: 孩子们，不要这样没规矩！
examples.en: Please children, don't be so difficult!

defines.trans_ch: （用一串分别代表信号正负的数字1和0来记录或存储信息）数字的
defines.trans_en: recording or storing information as series of the numbers 1 and 0, to show that a signal is present or absent

examples.ch: 数字信息
examples.en: digital data

defines.trans_ch: （采用或与数字信号和计算机技术相关）数码的，数字的
defines.trans_en: using or relating to digital signals and computer technology

examples.ch: 数码录制品
examples.en: a digital recording

examples.ch: 数码相机
examples.en: a digital camera

examples.ch: 数字电视
examples.en: digital TV

defines.trans_ch: （用电子影像显示信息）数字式的
defines.trans_en: showing information in the form of an electronic image

examples.ch: 数字钟／显示器
examples.en: a digital clock/display

examples.ch: 数字手表
examples.en: a digital watch

defines.trans_en: a room in which meals are eaten

defines.trans_ch: 正餐（通常指晚餐，在英国有时指午餐）
defines.trans_en: the main meal of the day, usually the meal you eat in the evening but sometimes, in Britain, the meal eaten in the middle of the day

examples.ch: 我们正在吃晚餐。
examples.en: We were just having (our) dinner.

examples.ch: 星期六我们请了一些朋友来吃晚饭。
examples.en: We had some friends over for dinner on Saturday.

examples.ch: 浪漫的烛光晚餐
examples.en: a romantic candlelit dinner

defines.trans_en: a formal social occasion in the evening at which a meal is served

examples.ch: 他们举行晚宴来庆祝他退休。
examples.en: They held a dinner to celebrate his retirement.

examples.ch: 慈善／社交晚宴
examples.en: a charity/society dinner

defines.trans_en: a type of reptile that became extinct about 65,000,000 years ago. There were many different types of dinosaur, some of which were extremely large.

defines.trans_ch: 老古董（指过时的人或物）
defines.trans_en: an old-fashioned person or thing that people no longer consider to be useful

examples.ch: 这种计算机有点过时了，不是吗？
examples.en: This computer's a dinosaur, isn't it?

defines.trans_en: a document given by a college or university to show that you have passed a particular exam or finished your studies

examples.ch: 商学文凭
examples.en: a diploma in business studies

examples.ch: 高中毕业证书
examples.en: a high school diploma

defines.trans_en: not clean

examples.ch: 她的脸很脏，还留有泪痕。
examples.en: Her face was dirty and tear-stained.

defines.trans_ch: 不公平的;欺骗的;卑鄙的
defines.trans_en: unfair, dishonest, or unkind

examples.ch: 她捉弄我说黛安娜要开一个聚会，而实际上并没有这回事。
examples.en: She played a dirty trick on me by telling me Diane was having a party when she wasn't.

examples.ch: 那是卑鄙的谎言！
examples.en: That's a dirty lie!

defines.trans_en: used to describe something that is connected with sex, in a way that many people think is offensive

examples.ch: 色情杂志／电影／笑话
examples.en: a dirty magazine/movie/joke

examples.ch: 你的想法太下流了！
examples.en: You have a really dirty mind!

phrases.trans_en: very great/big

examples.ch: 那座老电站很是煞风景。
examples.en: The old power station's nothing but a dirty great blot on the landscape.

defines.trans_en: to make something dirty

examples.ch: 别坐在地板上——会弄脏你的裙子的。
examples.en: Don't sit on the floor - you might dirty your dress.

defines.trans_ch: 迪斯科舞会;迪斯科舞厅
defines.trans_en: an event where people dance to modern recorded music for entertainment, or a place where this often happens

examples.ch: 迪斯科舞厅的灯光设备
examples.en: disco lights

defines.trans_en: a type of music, popular in the 1970s, that people dance to in a nightclub
a reduction in the usual price

examples.ch: 你如果多买几本他们通常会给你打折。
examples.en: They usually give you a discount if you buy multiple copies.

examples.ch: 他们给旅行的学生提供10%的折扣。
examples.en: They offer a ten percent discount on travel for students.

defines.trans_en: to decide that something or someone is not worth considering or giving attention

examples.ch: 你不应该排除他回来的可能性。
examples.en: You shouldn't discount the possibility of him coming back.

defines.trans_en: to reduce the price of something

examples.ch: 打折货物／折扣率
examples.en: discounted goods/rates

defines.trans_en: a container, flatter than a bowl and sometimes with a lid, from which food can be served or which can be used for cooking

examples.ch: 可用于烤箱的盘子
examples.en: an oven-proof dish

defines.trans_en: food prepared in a particular way as part of a meal

examples.ch: 用鸡肉做的菜／素菜
examples.en: a chicken/vegetarian dish

defines.trans_en: a sexually attractive person

examples.ch: 他太帅了——非常性感！
examples.en: He's gorgeous - what a dish!

phrases.trans_en: all the plates, glasses, knives, forks, etc. that have been used during a meal

examples.ch: 你洗完餐具没有？
examples.en: Have you done/washed the dishes?

phrases.trans_en: to tell people unpleasant or shocking personal information about someone

examples.ch: 为了一大笔钱，她同意揭前夫的短。
examples.en: She agreed to dish the dirt on her ex-husband for a large fee.

defines.trans_ch: （与另一动词连用构成疑问句和否定句，包括表示禁止的命令，有时因文体原因亦可用于肯定句）
defines.trans_en: used with another verb to form questions and negative sentences, including negative orders, and sometimes in affirmative sentences for reasons of style

examples.ch: 你在哪里上班？
examples.en: Where do you work?

examples.ch: 你为什么那么做？
examples.en: Why did you do that?

examples.ch: 我们周五为什么不一起吃午饭呢？
examples.en: Why don't we have lunch together on Friday?

examples.ch: 这些天马修是不是有些见老？
examples.en: Doesn't Matthew look old these days?

examples.ch: “你没发现她耳聋吗？”“没有。”／“当然发现了。”
examples.en: "Didn't you realize she was deaf?" "No I didn't."/"Of course I did."

examples.ch: 我不仅和她说了话，而且还得到了她的亲笔签名。
examples.en: Not only did I speak to her, I even got her autograph!

examples.ch: 我从没听到过如此可怕的噪音。
examples.en: Never did I hear such a terrible noise.

examples.ch: （你）别和我这样说话！
examples.en: Don't (you) speak to me like that!

examples.ch: 这件事我们不要再争了。
examples.en: Don't let's argue about it (= let's not argue about it).

examples.ch: 她说话的声音太小，我几乎听不到。
examples.en: So quietly did she speak (= she spoke so quietly) that I could scarcely hear her.

examples.ch: 他还不知道呢，下周末我们要飞往日内瓦去给他庆祝生日。
examples.en: Little does he know (= he knows nothing about it), but we're flying to Geneva next weekend to celebrate his birthday.

examples.ch: “我要两个巧克力棒和一份冰激凌。”“你现在就要／真的要吗？”
examples.en: "I want two chocolate bars and an ice cream." "Do you now/indeed? (= that is surprising or unreasonable)."

defines.trans_ch: （在用来确认信息的疑问句中代替主要动词）
defines.trans_en: used instead of the main verb in questions that are added to the end of a sentence to check information

examples.ch: 晚餐会上你和他见过面，对不对？
examples.en: You met him at our party, didn't you?

examples.ch: 你没理解这个问题，是吗？
examples.en: You don't understand the question, do you?

defines.trans_ch: （在表示惊奇的疑问句中代替主要动词）
defines.trans_en: used instead of the main verb in questions that are added to the end of a sentence as a way of expressing surprise

examples.ch: 苏珊娜和梅终于结婚了，是吗？
examples.en: So Susannah and May finally got married, did they?

defines.trans_ch: （用于避免动词或动词短语的重复）
defines.trans_en: used to avoid repeating a verb or verb phrase

examples.ch: 她跑得比他快多了。
examples.en: She runs much faster than he does.

examples.ch: 玛丽亚看起来比过去健康了许多。
examples.en: Maria looks much healthier than she did.

examples.ch: “我不喜欢酷热的天气。”“我也是。”
examples.en: "I don't like intense heat." "Neither/Nor do I."

examples.ch: “我讨厌炎热的天气。”“我也是。”
examples.en: "I hate intense heat." "So do I."

examples.ch: “你忘了拿雨伞。”“还真是，这些天我有些健忘。”
examples.en: "You left your umbrella." "So I did. I'm so forgetful these days."

examples.ch: “你介意收拾一下厨房吗？”“我已经收拾过了。”
examples.en: "Would you mind tidying up the kitchen?" "I already have done."

examples.ch: “我可以加入你们吗？”“请吧！”
examples.en: "May I join you?" "Please do!"

examples.ch: “谁说的？”“我。”
examples.en: "Who said that?" "I did."

examples.ch: “蒂丽日语说得很流利。”“真的吗？”
examples.en: "Tilly speaks fluent Japanese." "Does she really?"

examples.ch: “我本想今天请一天假不上学了。”“哦，那可不行！”
examples.en: "I thought I'd take a day off school today." "Oh no you don't (= I'm not going to let you do that)!"

defines.trans_en: used to give extra force to the main verb

examples.ch: “我能在这儿买些邮票吗？”“我们这里确实卖邮票，但现在没货。”
examples.en: "Can I buy stamps here?" "Well, we do sell them, but we don't have any at the moment."

examples.ch: 赶快闭嘴吧，乔治娅，赶紧写作业吧。
examples.en: Do shut up, Georgia, and get on with your homework.

examples.ch: 务必写信告诉我你的情况。
examples.en: Do write and let me know how you're getting on.

examples.ch: 亚历克斯常做饭，他比我做的次数多得多。
examples.en: He cooks a lot does Alex. He does far more than me.

defines.trans_en: to perform, take part in, or achieve something

examples.ch: 那么做真是太愚蠢了。
examples.en: That was a really stupid thing to do.

examples.ch: 这周末你准备干什么？
examples.en: What are you doing over the weekend?

examples.ch: 我们现在唯一能做的就是坐观事态发展。
examples.en: The only thing we can do now is wait and see what happens.

examples.ch: 为什么让你去见校长？你又干了什么事？
examples.en: Why were you sent to see the headmaster? What have you done now?

examples.ch: 为什么让你去见校长？你又干了什么事？
examples.en: Why were you sent to the principal's office? What did you do now?

examples.ch: 你自己应该能做到。
examples.en: You should be able to do it by yourself/on your own.

examples.ch: 你对她都做了些什么？
examples.en: What have you done (= made happen) to her?

examples.ch: 你对她都做了些什么？
examples.en: What did you do (= make happen) to her?

examples.ch: 凌晨两点钟你（到底）在图书馆做什么？
examples.en: What (on earth) were you doing in the library (= why were you there) at two o'clock in the morning?

examples.ch: 这些玩具放在这里做什么？
examples.en: What are these toys doing here? (= Why are they here?)

examples.ch: 你做什么工作？
examples.en: What do you do (for a living)? (= What is your job?)

examples.ch: 我能为您做些什么？
examples.en: What can I do for you? (= How can I help you?)

examples.ch: 你把我的外套弄哪儿去了?
examples.en: What have you done with (= where have you put) my coat?

examples.ch: 你把我的外套弄哪儿去了?
examples.en: What did you do with (= where did you put) my coat?

examples.ch: 自从退休以后，她一直都不知道该干些什么。
examples.en: She just hasn't known what to do with herself (= how to keep herself busy) since she retired.

defines.trans_en: to act or take action

examples.ch: 别再和我争辩了，达里尔，让你干什么你就干什么！
examples.en: Stop arguing with me, Daryl, and do as you're told!

examples.ch: 她让我不要问任何问题，只管像她那样去干就行了。
examples.en: She told me not to ask any questions, just to do as she did.

examples.ch: “我去找警察不对吗？”“哦，不，我肯定你干的没错。”
examples.en: "Was it wrong of me to go to the police?" "Oh no, I'm sure you did right/did the right thing."

examples.ch: 在这件事上听听专业人士的意见会大有裨益。
examples.en: You'd do well to take some professional advice on this matter.

defines.trans_en: to deal with or be responsible for something

examples.ch: 露西娅将负责这部校园剧的宣传工作。
examples.en: Lucia is going to do the publicity for the school play.

examples.ch: 一旦他们提出棘手的问题，就让我来负责回答。
examples.en: If they ask any awkward questions, just let me do the talking.

defines.trans_en: to study a subject

examples.ch: 黛安娜在大学读的是人类学。
examples.en: Diane did anthropology at university.

defines.trans_en: to solve or find the answer to something

examples.ch: 玩智力游戏
examples.en: to do a puzzle

examples.ch: 我从来不会玩填字游戏。
examples.en: I've never been able to do crosswords.

defines.trans_en: to make, produce, or create something

examples.ch: 今晚我不能出去——我得把历史课的论文写出来。
examples.en: I can't go out tonight - I've got to do my history paper.

examples.ch: 你能把这份报告给我复印20份吗？
examples.en: Can you do me 20 photocopies of this report/do 20 photocopies of this report for me?

defines.trans_en: If you say that you have done with something or someone, or have done performing a particular action, you mean that you have finished what you were doing with something or someone, or what you were saying to someone, or that you have finished the action.

examples.ch: 你用完剪刀了吗？
examples.en: Have you done with those scissors yet?

examples.ch: 你去哪儿？我跟你还没说完呢。
examples.en: Where are you going? I haven't done with you yet (= I am still talking to you).

examples.ch: 我跟你还没说完呢。
examples.en: I haven't done talking to you yet.

defines.trans_en: to clean something, or make something look neat and attractive

examples.ch: 我做了晚饭，所以你来洗碗吧。
examples.en: I cooked the dinner so you can do (= wash) the dishes.

examples.ch: 做头发／化妆／修指甲
examples.en: do your hair/make-up/nails

examples.ch: 今天下午我要打扫一下客厅。
examples.en: I want to do (= clean) the living room this afternoon.

defines.trans_en: to arrange something

examples.ch: 你把那些花儿插得真漂亮。
examples.en: You've done those flowers beautifully.

examples.ch: 这里有人会打领结吗？
examples.en: Can anyone here do (= tie) bow-ties?

defines.trans_ch: 行进过（一段路程）；以…速度行进
defines.trans_en: to travel a particular distance or to travel at a particular speed

examples.ch: 这是一辆旧车，已经跑了8万多英里。
examples.en: It's an old car and it's done over 80,000 miles.

examples.ch: 我的新车1加仑汽油能跑50英里。
examples.en: My new car does 50 miles to the gallon (= uses one gallon of fuel to travel 50 miles)

examples.ch: 他以每小時80英里的速度行驶，被抓住了。
examples.en: He was caught doing 80 miles an hour.

defines.trans_en: to complete a journey

examples.ch: 我们用5小时走完了到波士顿的路程。
examples.en: We did the journey to Boston in five hours.

defines.trans_en: to be acceptable, suitable, or enough

examples.ch: 这个房间行吗？还是你想要个带淋浴的房间？
examples.en: Will this room do or would you prefer one with a shower?

examples.ch: 这种行为根本不能接受。
examples.en: This kind of behaviour just won't do.

examples.ch: 不可以批评父母。
examples.en: It doesn't do to criticize your parents.

examples.ch: 我没有葡萄柚汁，但有一些橙汁。（你）要吗？
examples.en: I don't have any grapefruit juice, but I've got some orange juice. Will that do (you)?

examples.ch: “那些土豆够吗?你还要吗？”“我要那些就够了，谢谢。”
examples.en: "Is that enough potato, or would you like some more?" "That'll do (= be enough for) me, thanks."

defines.trans_en: to provide or sell something, or to cause someone to have something

examples.ch: 现在他们正在搞特价优惠，花两件的价钱可以买三件。
examples.en: They are doing a special offer - three for the price of two.

examples.ch: 除了飞行以外你们提供旅游保险吗？
examples.en: Do you do travel insurance as well as flights?

examples.ch: 这家酒馆只在午饭时提供食物，晚饭时没有。
examples.en: The bar only does food at lunchtimes, not in the evenings.

defines.trans_en: to cook or prepare food

examples.ch: 谁为你的聚会准备食品？
examples.en: Who's doing the food for your party?

examples.ch: 我来给你做点炒鸡蛋。
examples.en: I'll do you some scrambled eggs.

defines.trans_ch: 进展；继续保持；设法做到
defines.trans_en: to develop or continue with the stated amount of success

examples.ch: 玛丽在新的工作岗位上干得／在新学校里学得怎么样？
examples.en: How is Mary doing in her new job/school?

examples.ch: 产妇和新生儿目前都状况良好。
examples.en: Both the new mother and her baby are doing very well.

examples.ch: 今年你的玫瑰长得好吗？
examples.en: Are your roses doing all right this year?

examples.ch: 由于目前的经济形势，很多小企业都处于惨淡经营的状态。
examples.en: Many small businesses are doing badly because of the economic situation.

examples.ch: 我折旧贴换新车的交易很划算——他们给我的旧车出了个好价钱。
examples.en: I did pretty well when I traded in my car - they gave me a good price for it.

examples.ch: 亚历克莎得到这样一份高薪的工作，干得真不错。
examples.en: Alexa has done well for herself (= has achieved great personal success), getting such a highly paid job.

defines.trans_en: to perform a play or to play the part of a character

examples.ch: 期末孩子们要演一出剧。
examples.en: The children are doing a play at the end of term.

examples.ch: 她扮演过莎士比亚戏剧中除麦克白夫人以外的所有重要角色。
examples.en: She's done all the important Shakespearean roles except for Lady Macbeth.

examples.ch: 我希望她不要像海伦那样结婚6个月就离婚。
examples.en: I hope she doesn't do a Helen (= do what Helen did) and get divorced six months after her wedding.

defines.trans_en: to visit the interesting places in a town or country, or to look around an interesting place

examples.ch: 我们在法国时没能去尼斯游览。
examples.en: We didn't get to do Nice when we were in France.

defines.trans_en: to enter a building illegally and steal from it

examples.ch: 我们外出时家中失窃了。
examples.en: Our house was done while we were away.

defines.trans_en: to cheat someone

examples.ch: 那辆旧自行车花了50美元！你上当了！
examples.en: $50 for that old bike! You've been done!

examples.ch: 他那辆汽车骗了我1000英镑。
