examples.en: He did me for a thousand quid for that car.

defines.trans_en: to spend time in prison

examples.ch: 他因参与抢劫坐了3年牢。
examples.en: He did three years for his part in the robbery.

examples.ch: 如果不小心你还会再进监狱。
examples.en: If you're not careful you'll end up doing time again.

defines.trans_en: to punish someone

examples.ch: 你如果再跟我捣乱，我可要好好治治你了。
examples.en: If you mess with me again, I'll do you good and proper.

examples.ch: 昨晚回家时，我超速驾驶被警察截住了。
examples.en: I got done (= stopped by the police) for speeding on my way home last night.

defines.trans_en: to take an illegal drug

examples.ch: 你服用海洛因有多久了？
examples.en: How long have you been doing heroin?

examples.ch: 我不吸毒。
examples.en: I don't do drugs.

phrases.trans_en: to take action to deal with something

examples.ch: 这是全球性的问题——个人能为此做些什么？
examples.en: It's a global problem - what can individuals do about it?

phrases.trans_en: to treat someone well or badly
connected with

examples.ch: “为什么你要跟我谈话？”“因为这涉及到一起对你工作的投诉。”
examples.en: "Why did you want to talk to me?" "Well, it's to do with a complaint that's been made about your work."

examples.ch: “可是我没有钱了。”“那和这件事有什么关系？你还是不应该不打招呼就把我的钱包拿走呀。”
examples.en: "But I didn't have any money." "What does that have to do with it? You still shouldn't have taken my wallet without asking me."

examples.ch: 自从他因酒后驾车被捕后，她就拒绝与他（再）有任何联系。
examples.en: She refused to have anything (more) to do with him after he was arrested for drinking and driving.

examples.ch: 我今天看见你儿子抽烟了，我觉得应该把这件事告诉你。”“你还是管好自己的事吧！我儿子做什么和你一点关系都没有！”
examples.en: "I thought I should tell you I saw your son smoking today." "Mind your own business! What my son does has nothing to do with you!"

phrases.trans_en: to be happening

examples.ch: 晚上这座城镇很无聊——从来都没有什么事情发生。
examples.en: This town is so boring in the evening - there's never anything doing.

defines.trans_en: a way of treating people

examples.ch: 经理没有任何特权——在这家公司里我们讲究人人平等。
examples.en: There are no special privileges for the managers - we believe in fair dos all round (= equal treatment for everyone) in this company.

examples.ch: 一个所谓的发达国家竟然无法为所有国民提供住所，这太糟糕了。
examples.en: It's a poor do (= a bad/unfair situation) when a so-called developed country can't even provide homes for all its citizens.

defines.trans_en: a party or other social event

examples.ch: 科林过50岁生日的时候要办个小聚会。
examples.en: Colin's having a bit of a do for his 50th birthday.

examples.ch: 那是一次来宾们相互都不认识的社交活动。
examples.en: It was one of those dos where nobody really knew each other.

defines.trans_en:
a 
hairdo old-fashioned

defines.trans_ch: 哆（大调音阶的第一个音）
defines.trans_en: the first note of the sol-fa musical scale

examples.ch: 请给我唱下哆音好吗？
examples.en: Would you sing me a do, please?

defines.trans_en: a person with a medical degree whose job is to treat people who are ill or hurt

examples.ch: 医生开了一些药。
examples.en: The doctor prescribed some medication.

examples.ch: 你咳嗽应该找医生看看。
examples.en: You should see a doctor about that cough.

examples.ch: 早上好，史密斯大夫／大夫。
examples.en: Good morning, Doctor Smith/Doctor.

defines.trans_en: a person who has the highest degree (= qualification) from a college or university

phrases.trans_en: the place where a doctor works

examples.ch: 今天上午他去诊所体检。
examples.en: He went to the doctor's this morning for a check-up.

defines.trans_en: to change a document in order to deceive people

examples.ch: 他被发现向法庭提供了篡改过的证据。
examples.en: He was found to have provided the court with doctored evidence.

defines.trans_en: to secretly put a harmful or poisonous substance into food or drink

examples.ch: 厨房里发现了几瓶掺了老鼠药的柠檬汁。
examples.en: Bottles of lemonade doctored with rat poison were discovered in the kitchen.

defines.trans_en: to remove the sexual organs of an animal in order to prevent it from producing young

defines.trans_ch: （尤指当作宠物或用来打猎、看护的）狗，犬
defines.trans_en: a common animal with four legs, especially kept by people as a pet or to hunt or guard things

examples.ch: 我的宠物狗
examples.en: my pet dog

examples.ch: 野狗
examples.en: wild dogs

examples.ch: 狗粮
examples.en: dog food

examples.ch: 我们可以听到远处的狗叫声。
examples.en: We could hear dogs barking in the distance.

defines.trans_ch: 讨厌的家伙，惹人烦的家伙;失信者
defines.trans_en: a man who is unpleasant or not to be trusted

examples.ch: 这个无赖，他想偷我的钱。
examples.en: He tried to steal my money, the dirty dog.

defines.trans_en: a woman who is not attractive
to follow someone closely and continuously

examples.ch: 记者们跟着他让他回答问题。
examples.en: Reporters dogged him for answers.

defines.trans_en: to cause difficulties

examples.ch: 技术问题从旅行一开始就一直困扰着我们。
examples.en: Technical problems dogged our trip from the outset.

defines.trans_ch: （美国、加拿大、澳大利亚、新西兰等国的货币单位）元
defines.trans_en: the standard unit of money used in the US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, and other countries

examples.ch: 我能借10元吗？
examples.en: Can I borrow $10?

examples.ch: 一元等于一百分。
examples.en: There are one hundred cents in a dollar.

examples.ch: 你可以用欧元或美元支付。
examples.en: You can pay in euros or in US dollars.

examples.ch: 那个手提箱里装满了钞票。
examples.en: The suitcase was full of dollar bills.

phrases.trans_ch: 美元币值（用于与其他国家货币币值作比较时）
phrases.trans_en: the value of the US dollar, used in comparing the values of different types of money from around the world

examples.ch: 在今天的金融市场上，美元对英镑的比价出现了上涨／下跌。
examples.en: In the financial markets today, the dollar rose against/fell against (= was worth more than/less than) the pound.

defines.trans_en: a sea mammal that is large, smooth, and grey, with a long, pointed mouth
a flat object that is used to close the entrance of something such as a room or building, or the entrance itself

examples.ch: 前门
examples.en: the front door

examples.ch: 后门
examples.en: the back door

examples.ch: 车门
examples.en: a car door

examples.ch: 推拉门
examples.en: a sliding door

examples.ch: 他卧室的门上了锁。
examples.en: The door to his bedroom was locked.

examples.ch: 我们能听到有人在敲门。
examples.en: We could hear someone knocking at/on the door.

examples.ch: 请把门打开／关上好吗？
examples.en: Could you open/close/shut the door, please?

examples.ch: 她让我去开门。
examples.en: She asked me to answer the door (= go and open it for someone).

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a house or other building

examples.ch: 萨姆就住在与我们相隔几户（远／以北／以南）的房子里。
examples.en: Sam only lives a few doors (away/up/down) from us.

examples.ch: 住在（我们）隔壁房子里的人不太友好。
examples.en: The people next door (to us) (= living in the house next to us) aren't very friendly.

phrases.trans_en: to work at the entrance of a building, collecting tickets or preventing particular people from entering
outside in the open air

defines.trans_en: a very small round mark

examples.ch: 这个句子末尾的句号是一个小圆点。
examples.en: The full stop at the end of this sentence is a dot.

examples.ch: 她的蓝裙子上有一些白色小圆点。
examples.en: Her skirt was blue with white dots.

defines.trans_ch: （互联网、电子邮件地址或某些计算机文件所使用的句号的口语形式）点
defines.trans_en: the spoken form of a full stop in an internet or email address, or some computer files

examples.ch: 那个网址是什么? 「www.cambridge.org。」
examples.en: "What's the web address?" "www dot cambridge dot org".

defines.trans_en: the short sounds or short flashes of light used with dashes when sending messages in Morse (code)
to put a dot or dots on something

examples.ch: 你的笔迹很难辨认，因为你在字母 I 上面不加点。
examples.en: Your handwriting is hard to read because you don't dot your i's.

defines.trans_en: to be spread across an area, or to spread many similar things across an area

examples.ch: 我们的办事处在该地区星罗棋布。
examples.en: We have offices dotted around/all over the region.

examples.ch: 这一地区有很多漂亮的教堂。
examples.en: The area is dotted with beautiful churches.

defines.trans_en: twice the size, amount, price, etc., or consisting of two similar things together

examples.ch: 我点了一杯双份的浓缩咖啡。
examples.en: I ordered a double espresso (= two standard amounts in one cup).

examples.ch: 穿过那道对开门，然后向左转。
examples.en: Go through the double doors and turn left.

examples.ch: 单词 cool 的中间有两个字母 o。
examples.en: The word "cool" has a double "o" in the middle.

examples.ch: 他说的每句话都有双重含义。
examples.en: Everything he says has a double meaning (= has two possible meanings).

examples.ch: 这种镇痛药具有双倍功效。
examples.en: This painkiller is double strength (= has twice the normal amount of medicine).

examples.ch: 萨比哈的电话号码是331577。
examples.en: Sabiha's phone number is double three, one, five, double seven (= 331577).

defines.trans_en: A double flower or plant is a flower with more than the usual number of petals.

examples.ch: 重瓣樱草花
examples.en: a double primrose

defines.trans_ch: 一模一样的人；极相像的人
defines.trans_en: a person who looks exactly the same as someone else

examples.ch: 嘿，托尼，上周我在一次聚会上遇到一个长得和你一模一样的人。
examples.en: Hey, Tony, I met someone at a party last week who was your double.

defines.trans_ch: （足球比赛）双料冠军（即在同一赛季赢得两项重要比赛的冠军头衔）
defines.trans_en: an occasion when a football team wins two major competitions in a single season

examples.ch: 谁是第一支赢得双料冠军的英格兰球队？
examples.en: Which was the first team to do the double in English football?

defines.trans_en: in baseball, a hit that allows the batter (= person who hits the ball) to reach second base

phrases.trans_en: a game of tennis or a similar sport between two teams of two people

examples.ch: 男子／女子／混合双打
examples.en: men's/women's/mixed doubles

examples.ch: 谁在今年温布尔登网球赛中获得了男子双打冠军？
examples.en: Who won the men's doubles at Wimbledon this year?

defines.trans_en: to become twice as much or as many, or to make something twice as much or many

examples.ch: 政府计划在25年内使高校在校生人数翻一番。
examples.en: The government aims to double the number of students in higher education within 25 years.

examples.ch: 自从引进新技术后，公司的利润增加了一倍。
examples.en: Company profits have doubled since the introduction of new technology.

defines.trans_en: something that is twice the amount, size, strength, etc. of something else

examples.ch: 上星期我买这条裤子花了两倍的价钱。
examples.en: I paid double (= twice as much) for those trousers last week.

examples.ch: 与几年前相比，电器类商品的价格几乎翻了一番。
examples.en: Electrical goods are almost double the price they were a few years ago.

examples.ch: “你想再来一杯威士忌吗？”“好的，来个双份量的。”
examples.en: "Would you like another whisky?" "Yes. Make it a double (= two standard amounts in one glass)."

defines.trans_en: in two parts or layers

examples.ch: 把毯子叠成两层，这样你就不会冷了。
examples.en: Fold the blanket double (= so that it is in two layers) and then you won't be cold.

examples.ch: 由于几十年来长期在地里劳作，他们的腰都累弯了。
examples.en: They were bent double (= their heads and shoulders were bent forward and down) from decades of work in the fields.

phrases.trans_ch: （通常指因醉酒或疾病导致视力）出现重影
phrases.trans_en: to have a problem with your eyes so that you see two of everything, usually because you are drunk or ill

examples.ch: 我的眼前开始出现重影，然后就晕了过去。
examples.en: I started seeing double, then I fainted.

defines.trans_en: in or towards a low or lower position, from a higher one

examples.ch: 这部电梯是向下开的吗？
examples.en: Is this lift going down?

examples.ch: 别朝下看！你会头晕的。
examples.en: Don't look down! You'll get dizzy.

examples.ch: 太阳要落下去了，天很快就要黑了。
examples.en: The sun's going down and it'll be dark soon.

examples.ch: 太空舱落入了海里。
examples.en: The space capsule came down in the ocean.

examples.ch: 我弯下腰朝床底下看了看。
examples.en: I bent down to look under the bed.

defines.trans_en: moving from above and onto a surface

examples.ch: 我正准备坐下看电视的时候，电话铃响了。
examples.en: Just as I was sitting down to watch TV, the phone rang.

examples.ch: 你为什么不在沙发上躺一会儿呢？
examples.en: Why don't you lie down on the sofa for a while?

examples.ch: 这个箱子确实很重——我们把它放下（搁到地板上）歇一会儿好吗?
examples.en: This box is really heavy - can we put it down (on the floor) for a minute?

examples.ch: 你这个傻丫头，马上从桌子上下来！
examples.en: Get down off that table immediately!

examples.ch: 恐怖分子强迫大家面朝下趴在地板上。
examples.en: The terrorists forced everybody to lie face down (= with the front part of the body below) on the floor.

defines.trans_en: firmly in place or into position

examples.ch: 我把松动的地板块放回去用钉子钉牢。
examples.en: I put the loose floorboard back and nailed it down.

examples.ch: 他把我的胳膊按在我身体的两侧。
examples.en: He held my arms down by my sides.

defines.trans_ch: （水平等）由高到低地；（数量等）由大到小地；（情况等）由复杂变简单地
defines.trans_en: in or towards a lower level, a smaller amount, or a simpler state

examples.ch: 通货膨胀率终于下降了。
examples.en: The rate of inflation is finally going down.

examples.ch: 把电视机的声音关小一点——实在太吵了！
examples.en: Turn the TV down - it's way too loud!

examples.ch: 护士把我扭伤的脚踝抱起来以控制肿胀。
examples.en: The nurse bandaged my sprained ankle to keep the swelling down (= to limit the swelling).

examples.ch: 如果你等上几个月，价格就会降下来。
examples.en: If you wait a few months, the price will come down.

examples.ch: 半场结束时克里夫兰骑士队落后20分。
examples.en: The Cavaliers were 20 points down (= losing by 20 points) at half-time.

examples.ch: 这所学校的学生人数从去年的500人降到了410人。
examples.en: The number of students at this school has gone down from 500 last year to 410.

defines.trans_en: If you burn, cut, or knock something or someone down, you cause it, him, or her to fall to the ground, usually damaged, destroyed, or injured.

examples.ch: 许多年以前这座房子就被烧毁了。
examples.en: The house burned down many years ago.

examples.ch: 为了修建新公路，不得不将这些树砍掉。
examples.en: These trees will have to be cut down to make way for the new road.

examples.ch: 她被车撞倒后当即死亡。
examples.en: She was knocked down by a car and killed instantly.

defines.trans_en: in writing or on paper

examples.ch: 我现在要写下来以免忘了。
examples.en: I'll write it down now so I won't forget.

examples.ch: 你有书面的东西吗？还是只是口头协议？
examples.en: Do you have it down in writing/on paper, or was it just a verbal agreement?

examples.ch: 我已经记下了你们每人要3张票。
examples.en: I've got/put you down for (= have written that you want) three tickets each.

examples.ch: 警官们正在记录证人的姓名。
examples.en: The police officers were taking down the names of witnesses.

defines.trans_en: used, especially with prepositions, to emphasize that a place is at some distance from you or from somewhere considered to be central

examples.ch: 下班后我会到俱乐部找你。
examples.en: I'll meet you down at the gym after work.

examples.ch: 他在港湾那边有一座房子。
examples.en: He has a house down by the harbour.

examples.ch: 我要去商店买些牛奶。
examples.en: I'm going down to the shop to buy some milk.

defines.trans_en: in or towards the south

examples.ch: 南方要暖和许多。
examples.en: It's much warmer down (in the) south.

examples.ch: 我父母住在南方的佛罗里达，但他们每年夏天都要来芝加哥。
examples.en: My parents live down in Florida, but they come up to Chicago every summer.

examples.ch: 我们要南下搬到伦敦去了。
examples.en: We're moving down to London.

defines.trans_ch: 传下去（地），传给下一代（地）
defines.trans_en: from an older person to a younger one

examples.ch: 这条项链已经传了7代人了。
examples.en: The necklace has been passed/handed down through seven generations.

examples.ch: 这些神话从史前一直流传至今。
examples.en: These myths have come down to us from prehistoric times.

defines.trans_en: inside your stomach

examples.ch: 喝点热汤你就会感觉舒服一些。
examples.en: You'll feel better once you've got some hot soup down you.

examples.ch: 什么食物他吃了就吐，因此他的身体变得越来越虚弱了。
examples.en: He's getting weak because he can't keep anything down.

defines.trans_en: at the time of buying

examples.ch: 我付给他1000英镑，其余货款分期支付。
examples.en: I gave him $1,000 down, and paid the rest in instalments.

defines.trans_en: in or towards a low or lower position, from a higher one

examples.ch: 我顺着山坡滑了下来。
examples.en: I slid down the hill.

examples.ch: 爱子在楼梯上滑了一跤，腕部骨折了。
examples.en: Aikiko fell down some stairs and broke her wrist.

defines.trans_en: along

examples.ch: 我们沿着高速公路一直开到了亚特兰大。
examples.en: We drove down the highway as far as Atlanta.

examples.ch: 她的办公室在走廊那头的右侧。
examples.en: Her office is down the corridor on the right.

examples.ch: 他们沿着这条河驾船驶向大海。
examples.en: They sailed the boat down the river (= towards the sea).

defines.trans_en: to

examples.ch: 我和同伴去了酒吧。
examples.en: I went down the pub with my mates.

defines.trans_en: to cause something or someone to fall to the ground

examples.ch: 我们用导弹击落了3架敌机。
examples.en: We downed three enemy planes with our missiles.

examples.ch: 冰暴在整个地区击倒树木，刮落电线。
examples.en: The ice storm has downed trees and power lines all over the region.

defines.trans_ch: 一口气吃下;一口气喝下
defines.trans_en: to eat or drink something quickly

examples.ch: 我一杯啤酒还没喝完，他就已经一口气喝下四杯了。
examples.en: He'd downed four beers before I'd finished one.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指在比赛中）打败，击败，战胜
defines.trans_en: to defeat someone, especially in sport

examples.ch: 扬基队以7-0的比分打败了红袜队。
examples.en: The Yankees downed the Red Sox 7–0.

defines.trans_ch: 不高兴的;情绪低落的，提不起精神的
defines.trans_en: unhappy; unable to feel excited or energetic about anything

examples.ch: 自从丈夫去世后她一直抑郁寡欢。
examples.en: She's been really down since her husband left.

examples.ch: 这周我有点情绪低落。
examples.en: I've been (feeling) a little bit down this week.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指计算机等机器或系统）停止运转
defines.trans_en: (of a system or machine, especially a computer) not in operation or not working, usually only for a limited period of time

examples.ch: 网络将停止运行1小时以进行日常维护。
examples.en: The network will be down for an hour for routine maintenance.

examples.ch: 整个系统都停止运行了。
examples.en: The whole system's gone down.

defines.trans_en: small soft feathers, especially those from a young bird

examples.ch: 鹅／鸭绒
examples.en: goose/duck down

examples.ch: 羽绒上衣／枕头／睡袋
examples.en: a down jacket/pillow/sleeping bag (= a jacket/pillow/sleeping bag filled with down)

defines.trans_en: very soft thin hair
a county (= an area with its own local government) in the southeast of Northern Ireland

examples.ch: 就在几周前，汤米去唐郡的纽里看望了彼得。
examples.en: Tommy visited Peter in Newry, County Down, just a few weeks ago.

examples.ch: 他娶了个女孩，来自他成长的故乡--唐郡镇。
examples.en: He married a girl from the Co Down town where he grew up.

phrases.trans_en: to dislike someone, often unfairly

examples.ch: 你为什么不喜欢他？我觉得他非常不错。
examples.en: Why do you have a down on him? I think he seems really nice.

defines.trans_en: at or towards the end or the lower or worse part

examples.ch: 朝山下
examples.en: downhill

examples.ch: 顺流而下
examples.en: downriver

examples.ch: 低端的
examples.en: down-market

examples.ch: 不利方面
examples.en: the downside

defines.trans_ch: （尤指从因特网或较大型计算机上）下载
defines.trans_en: to copy or move programs or information into a computer's memory, especially from the internet or a larger computer
a computer program or information that has been or can be copied into a computer's memory

examples.ch: 免费下载
examples.en: a free download

defines.trans_en: the act or process of copying programs or information into a computer's memory

examples.ch: 我们所有的产品都在网站上供用户下载。
examples.en: All of our products are available for download on our website.

defines.trans_ch: 朝楼下，在楼下（尤指底层）
defines.trans_en: to or on a lower floor of a building, especially the ground floor

examples.ch: 我下楼去接电话。
examples.en: I went downstairs to answer the phone.

defines.trans_en: the lower floor of a building, especially the ground floor

examples.ch: 我们昨天把楼上粉刷完了，但是楼下还没有完工。
examples.en: We finished painting upstairs yesterday, but the downstairs still needs some work.

examples.ch: 楼下乱七八糟的。
examples.en: The downstairs was a mess.

defines.trans_en: a large, frightening imaginary animal, often represented with wings, a long tail, and fire coming out of its mouth
any of various types of large lizard
an unfriendly and frightening woman

examples.ch: 她真是个老恶婆。
examples.en: She's a real old dragon.

defines.trans_en: to make a picture of something or someone with a pencil or pen

examples.ch: 乔纳森的画画得相当棒。
examples.en: Jonathan can draw very well.

examples.ch: 孩子们画了自己的家人。
examples.en: The children drew pictures of their families.

examples.ch: 在本页的底部画一条线。
examples.en: Draw a line at the bottom of the page.

defines.trans_en: to attract attention or interest

examples.ch: 他很擅长演讲，总能吸引大批的听众。
examples.en: He's an excellent speaker who always draws a crowd.

examples.ch: 我可以请你看一看议程的第3项内容吗？
examples.en: Could I draw your attention to item number three on the agenda?

examples.ch: 他穿那些滑稽的衣服就是想吸引人们的注意吗？
examples.en: Does he wear those ridiculous clothes to draw attention to himself?

defines.trans_en: to make or show a comparison between things

examples.ch: 你不能拿这两个案子相比较——因为它们完全不同。
examples.en: You can't really draw a comparison between the two cases - they're completely different.

examples.ch: 有时很难明确区分不同单词的含义。
examples.en: It's sometimes very difficult to draw a clear distinction between the meanings of different words.

defines.trans_en: to move in a particular direction, especially in a vehicle

examples.ch: 火车慢慢开进车站。
examples.en: The train slowly drew into the station/drew in.

examples.ch: 当我们来到那辆黑色汽车跟前的时候，我突然发现开车的是我以前的男朋友。
examples.en: As we drew alongside (= reached) the black car, I suddenly recognized my ex-boyfriend at the wheel.

examples.ch: 在100米决赛中蒙哥马利和格林并驾齐驱，但却一直未能超过他。
examples.en: Montgomery drew level with Greene in the 100 metres final, but never passed him.

defines.trans_en: If something draws a reaction, people react in the stated way.

examples.ch: 昨晚她在参议院的讲话引起了人们的愤怒。
examples.en: Her speech last night in the Senate drew an angry response.

defines.trans_en: to pull or direct something in a particular direction

examples.ch: 她在肩膀处把外衣拉紧。
examples.en: She drew her coat tightly around her shoulders.

examples.ch: 人们看到裁判把那名运动员带到一边和他说了些什么。
examples.en: The crowd watched as the referee drew the player aside/to one side and spoke to him.

defines.trans_en: to choose a number, card, etc. from several numbers, cards, etc. without first seeing it, in a competition or a game

examples.ch: 发牌时我得到两张 A 牌，后来我又抽到了一张。
examples.en: I was dealt two aces, and I drew a third.

defines.trans_ch: 拿出，拔出，抽出（尤指武器）
defines.trans_en: to take something out of a container or your pocket, especially a weapon

examples.ch: 突然他拿出一把枪／刀抵住我的喉咙。
examples.en: Suddenly he drew a gun/knife and held it to my throat.

defines.trans_ch: 使（尤指血液）流出，使渗出
defines.trans_en: to cause a substance, especially blood, to come out of a body

examples.ch: 他把我咬得都出血了。
examples.en: He bit me so hard that it drew blood.

defines.trans_en: to get a feeling, idea, etc. from something or someone

examples.ch: 他去世时很安详，为此她感到欣慰。
examples.en: She drew comfort from the fact that he died peacefully.

defines.trans_en: to take air or smoke into your lungs

examples.ch: 她深吸一口气然后猛地跳入水中。
examples.en: She drew a deep breath and plunged into the water.

defines.trans_en: to finish a game with the same number of points as the other person or team

examples.ch: 考文垂队在半决赛中以1:1与曼联队战平。
examples.en: Coventry drew 1–1 with United in the semifinal.

defines.trans_en: to get money from a bank, account, etc. so that you can use it

examples.ch: 我从账户中取了些钱给我们作旅费。
examples.en: I drew some money out of my account to pay for our trip.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指从雇主或政府那里）定期领取（一定数额的钱）
defines.trans_en: to receive money regularly, especially as an employee or from the government

examples.ch: 他领取养老金已经10年了。
examples.en: He's been drawing a pension for ten years.

phrases.trans_en: to attract someone's attention

examples.ch: 她的注意力立即被吧台旁站着的一位高个头的金发男子吸引住了。
examples.en: Her eyes were immediately drawn to the tall blond man standing at the bar.

phrases.trans_en: to consider the facts of a situation and make a decision about what is true, correct, likely to happen, etc.

examples.ch: 我常看见他们在一起，所以认为他们是夫妻。
examples.en: I'd seen them together so often, I drew the logical conclusion that they were husband and wife.

phrases.trans_en: to become nearer in space or time

examples.ch: 随着圣诞节的临近，商店开始变得拥挤不堪。
examples.en: As Christmas draws nearer, the big stores start to get unbearably crowded.

examples.ch: 等她走近一些后我才发现我认识她。
examples.en: As she drew closer, I realized that I knew her.

phrases.trans_en: to gradually finish

examples.ch: 晚会即将结束的时候人们开始去拿自己的外套。
examples.en: As the evening drew to a close, people started reaching for their coats.

phrases.trans_en: to pull curtains so that they are either together or apart

defines.trans_en: someone or something that a lot of people are interested in

examples.ch: 我们需要一个深受大家喜欢的人到场，以吸引人们花钱买票。
examples.en: We need someone at the event who'll be a big draw and attract the paying public.

defines.trans_en: a situation in which each team in a game has equal points and neither side wins

examples.ch: 结果是平局。
examples.en: The result was a draw.

defines.trans_en: a competition that is decided by choosing a particular ticket or number by chance
the act of making a picture with a pencil or pen, or a picture made in this way

examples.ch: 罗西喜欢画画。
examples.en: Rosie loves drawing.

examples.ch: 她送了我一幅很漂亮的画，上面画着一匹马。
examples.en: She gave me a beautiful drawing of a horse.

defines.trans_en: a series of events or images that happen in your mind when you are sleeping

examples.ch: 好／噩梦
examples.en: a good/bad dream

examples.ch: 反复出现的梦境
examples.en: a recurring dream

examples.ch: 昨晚我梦见了你，那个梦非常奇怪。
examples.en: I had a very strange dream about you last night.

examples.ch: 保罗梦见自己彩票中了奖。
examples.en: Paul had a dream that he won the lottery.

defines.trans_en: something that you want to happen very much but that is not very likely

examples.ch: 学习飞行一直是我的梦想。
examples.en: It's always been my dream to have flying lessons.

examples.ch: 赢得了那些钱，终于美梦成真了。
examples.en: Winning all that money was a dream come true.

phrases.trans_en: the best that you can imagine

examples.ch: 参加我们超级棒的竞赛，赢得您梦想中的房子！
examples.en: Win the house of your dreams in our fantastic competition!

phrases.trans_en: the perfect house, job, etc., that you want more than any other

defines.trans_en: to experience events and images in your mind while you are sleeping

examples.ch: 昨晚你梦见什么了？
examples.en: What did you dream about last night?

examples.ch: 我常梦见自己在飞。
examples.en: I often dream about/of flying.

examples.ch: 我梦见自己要生小孩了。
examples.en: I dreamed that I was having a baby.

defines.trans_en: to imagine that you have heard, done, or seen something when you have not

examples.ch: 你说了今晚要去吗，还是只是我的想象？
examples.en: Did you say that you were going tonight or did I dream it?

examples.ch: 我以为自己买了一些上光剂而现在似乎并没有——这一定是我自己的想象。
examples.en: I thought I'd bought some polish and it seems I haven't - I must have been dreaming.

defines.trans_en: to imagine something that you would like to happen

examples.ch: 我梦想着生活在热带岛屿上。
examples.en: I dream of living on a tropical island.

examples.ch: 他做梦也没有想过有一天他会成为总统。
examples.en: He never dreamed that one day he would become president.

phrases.trans_en: used to tell someone that what they are hoping for is not likely to happen or to be true

examples.ch: “你瞧着，我只要冲她眨眨眼，她就会过来。”“做梦去吧，戴夫。”
examples.en: "Watch. All I have to do is wink at her, and she'll come over here." "Dream on, Dave!"

defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing for women or girls that covers the top half of the body and hangs down over the legs

examples.ch: 长／短裙
examples.en: a long/short dress

examples.ch: 婚纱
examples.en: a wedding dress

defines.trans_ch: （尤指适用于某种场合的）服装
defines.trans_en: used, especially in combination, to refer to clothes of a particular type, especially those worn in particular situations

examples.ch: 女王身着礼服盛装主持仪式。
examples.en: The king, in full ceremonial dress, presided over the ceremony.

defines.trans_ch: 穿衣服;给（尤指小孩）穿衣服
defines.trans_en: to put clothes on yourself or someone else, especially a child

examples.ch: 我做早饭时丈夫给儿子们穿衣服。
examples.en: My husband dresses the boys while I make breakfast.

examples.ch: 因为走得很早他只好摸黑穿上衣服。
examples.en: He left very early and had to dress in the dark.

defines.trans_en: to wear a particular type of clothes

examples.ch: 我上班必须穿西装打领带。
examples.en: I have to dress in a suit and tie for work.

examples.ch: 帕特里夏总穿黑色衣服。
examples.en: Patricia always dresses in black (= wears black clothes).

defines.trans_en: to add a liquid, especially a mixture of oil and vinegar, to a salad for extra flavour

examples.ch: 加有调味料的色拉
examples.en: a dressed salad

defines.trans_en: to prepare meat, chicken, fish, or crab so it can be eaten

examples.ch: 经过加工的整只螃蟹
examples.en: a whole dressed crab

defines.trans_en: to treat an injury by cleaning it and putting medicine or a covering on it to protect it

examples.ch: 马上清洗包扎伤口。
examples.en: Clean and dress the wound immediately.

defines.trans_en: to decorate a shop window, usually with an arrangement of goods

examples.ch: 为了迎接圣诞节，他们正在布置商店橱窗。
examples.en: They're dressing the store's windows for Christmas.

phrases.trans_en: to put on formal clothes for a meal

examples.ch: 去那家酒店赴宴要着正装。
examples.en: It's the type of hotel where you're expected to dress for dinner.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to men's suits, shirts, or other clothes of the type that are worn at formal occasions

examples.ch: 白色的正装衬衫和领结
examples.en: a white dress shirt and bow tie

defines.trans_en: (an amount of) liquid that is taken into the body through the mouth

examples.ch: 你想喝点儿水／茶／果汁吗？
examples.en: Would you like a drink of water/tea/juice?

examples.ch: 他们已经两天没吃没喝了。
examples.en: They'd had no food or drink for two days.

defines.trans_en: alcoholic liquid

examples.ch: 我们有没有时间喝杯酒？
examples.en: Do we have time for a quick drink?

examples.ch: 该轮到谁请喝酒了？
examples.en: Whose turn is it to buy the drinks?

examples.ch: 聚会上我们的酒不够喝了。
examples.en: We ran out of drink at the party.

phrases.trans_en: a party at which you have drinks, especially alcoholic drinks

examples.ch: 周六来参加酒会吧。
examples.en: Come for drinks on Saturday.

examples.ch: 一个同事下周就要离开了，我们将给他开一个小型酒会。
examples.en: We're having a small drinks party for one of our colleagues who's leaving next week.

defines.trans_en: to take liquid into the body through the mouth

examples.ch: 他喝了3杯水。
examples.en: He drank three glasses of water.

examples.ch: 动物们下到那个水坑去喝水。
examples.en: The animals came down to the waterhole to drink.

defines.trans_en: to drink alcohol

examples.ch: “你要一杯葡萄酒吗？”“不，谢谢，我不喝酒。”
examples.en: "Would you like a glass of wine?" "No thanks, I don't drink."

examples.ch: 怀孕期间我滴酒未沾。
examples.en: I didn't drink at all while I was pregnant.

defines.trans_en: to move or travel on land in a motor vehicle, especially as the person controlling the vehicle's movement

examples.ch: 我在学开车。
examples.en: I'm learning to drive.

examples.ch: “你乘火车去吗？”“不，我开车去。”
examples.en: "Are you going by train?" "No, I'm driving."

examples.ch: 她开一辆红色跑车。
examples.en: She drives a red sports car.

examples.ch: 星期二他们要开车去芝加哥。
examples.en: They're driving to Chicago on Tuesday.

examples.ch: 我们看见他们的车在房子外面，然后就开车往前走／过去／离开了。
examples.en: We saw their car outside the house and drove on/past/away.

examples.ch: 我开车送女儿上学。
examples.en: I drove my daughter to school.

defines.trans_en: to force someone or something to go somewhere or do something

examples.ch: 他们用狗把羊赶进圈里。
examples.en: They used dogs to drive the sheep into a pen.

examples.ch: 一根柱子被砸进了那棵树旁边的地里。
examples.en: A post had been driven (= hit hard) into the ground near the tree.

examples.ch: 到年底时大部分占领军都被赶出了这个城市。
examples.en: By the end of the year, most of the occupying troops had been driven from the city.

examples.ch: 最终是他的暴力行为让她离开了家。
examples.en: In the end, it was his violent behaviour that drove her to leave home.

defines.trans_en: to force someone or something into a particular state, often an unpleasant one

examples.ch: 在历史的进程中，爱情曾经迫使男人和女人做出荒谬极端的事情。
examples.en: In the course of history, love has driven men and women to strange extremes.

examples.ch: 近期的一系列事件在十年中第二次使经济陷入严重衰退。
examples.en: Recent events have driven the stock market to lows not seen in ten years.

defines.trans_en: to provide the power to keep a machine working, or to make something happen

examples.ch: 发动机驱动车轮。
examples.en: The engine drives the wheels.

examples.ch: 水驱动涡轮机发电。
examples.en: Water drives the turbines that produce electricity.

defines.trans_en: If you drive a ball, especially in golf or baseball, you hit it hard so that it travels a long way.

examples.ch: 斯莱特沿着球道奋力击球。
examples.en: Slater drove the ball down the fairway.

phrases.trans_en: the crime of operating a motor vehicle after having drunk more alcohol than you are legally allowed to

examples.ch: 史密斯已被捕并被指控酒后驾驶。
examples.en: Smith was arrested and charged with DWI.

phrases.trans_en: to make someone extremely annoyed

examples.ch: 上周我婆婆一直和我们住在一起，她快把我给逼疯了。
examples.en: My mother-in-law has been staying with us this past week and she's driving me crazy.

examples.ch: 地板上到处都是他扔的脏衣服，真要把我给气疯了。
examples.en: He leaves dirty clothes all over the floor and it's driving me mad.

phrases.trans_en: to make you very excited, especially sexually

examples.ch: 当他的手指掠过我的头发时，我兴奋极了！
examples.en: When he runs his fingers through my hair, it drives me wild!

defines.trans_ch: （尤用于沿途有房屋的道路名称）路，大道
defines.trans_en: used in the names of some roads, especially roads containing houses

examples.ch: 枫树路12号
examples.en: 12 Maple Drive

defines.trans_en: a short private road that leads from a public road to a house or garage

examples.ch: 我把车停在私人车道上。
examples.en: I parked in the drive.

defines.trans_en: a planned effort to achieve something

examples.ch: 最新的宣传材料只是征兵运动的一部分。
examples.en: The latest promotional material is all part of a recruitment drive.

examples.ch: 现在我打算勤俭节约，所以正在尽量控制花销。
examples.en: I'm meant to be on an economy drive at the moment, so I'm trying not to spend too much.

defines.trans_en: a device for storing computer information

examples.ch: 软／硬盘驱动器
examples.en: a hard drive

examples.ch: DVD驱动器
examples.en: a DVD drive

examples.ch: CD驱动器
examples.en: a CD drive

defines.trans_en: a journey by car

examples.ch: 从奥克兰到惠灵顿开车要走很长时间。
examples.en: It's a long drive from Auckland to Wellington.

examples.ch: 我们下午开车去兜风好吗?
examples.en: Shall we go for a drive this afternoon?

defines.trans_en: the system used to power a vehicle

examples.ch: 左／右座驾驶的汽车
examples.en: a car with left-hand/right-hand drive (= in which the driver sits in the seat on the left/right).

examples.ch: 四轮驱动的车辆
examples.en: a four-wheel drive vehicle

defines.trans_en: energy and determination to achieve things

examples.ch: 我们在寻找有干劲、有抱负的人。
examples.en: We are looking for someone with drive and ambition.

examples.ch: 他有取得成功的决心。
examples.en: He has the drive to succeed.

examples.ch: 人到晚年性欲往往会逐步减退。
examples.en: Later on in life the sex drive tends to diminish.

defines.trans_ch: （体育运动中，尤其高尔夫球或棒球的）大力击球
defines.trans_en: (in sport, especially golf or baseball) a powerful hit that sends a ball a long way
a musical instrument, especially one made from a skin stretched over the end of a hollow tube or bowl, played by hitting with the hand or a stick

examples.ch: 大／小／定音鼓
examples.en: a bass/snare/kettle drum

examples.ch: 他们随着鼓点翩翩起舞。
examples.en: They danced to the beat of the drums (= sound of the drums being hit).

defines.trans_en: a large tube-like container

examples.ch: 油桶
examples.en: an oil drum

examples.ch: 5加仑的塑料桶
examples.en: a five-gallon plastic drum

examples.ch: 一桶放射性废料
examples.en: a drum of radioactive waste

defines.trans_en: the hollow metal cylinder in a washing machine into which clothes and other things are put for washing
to hit a surface regularly and make a sound like a drum, or to make something do this

examples.ch: 她不耐烦地用手指敲打桌子。
examples.en: She drummed her fingers impatiently on the table.

examples.ch: 雨点打在屋顶上，发出很大的声响。
examples.en: The rain drummed loudly on the roof.

defines.trans_en: used to describe something that has no water or other liquid in, on, or around it

examples.ch: 我把他的湿裤子挂在暖气片上了，但现在还没干呢。
examples.en: I hung his wet trousers on the radiator, but they're not dry yet.

examples.ch: 这些植物适宜在干旱的土壤里／气候条件下生长。
examples.en: These plants grow well in dry soil/a dry climate.

examples.ch: 这个蛋糕有点干——估计是让我给烤过头了。
examples.en: This cake's a bit dry - I think I left it in the oven for too long.

defines.trans_en: used to describe weather or periods of time when no rain falls

examples.ch: 如果明天不下雨，我就剪草。
examples.en: If it's dry tomorrow I'll cut the grass.

examples.ch: 这应该是惬意、明媚、无雨的一天。
examples.en: It should be a nice, sunny, dry day.

defines.trans_en: Dry hair or skin does not have enough of the natural oils that make it soft and smooth.

examples.ch: 适用于干性发质的洗发水
examples.en: a shampoo for dry hair

defines.trans_en: Dry bread is plain, without butter, jam, etc.

examples.ch: 他们只给了我一块没有黄油的面包和一个苹果。
examples.en: All I was offered was a piece of dry bread and an apple!

defines.trans_en: If a book, talk, subject, etc. is dry, it is not interesting.
without alcoholic drinks

examples.ch: 不喝酒的婚礼
examples.en: a dry wedding

examples.ch: 无酒精酒吧
examples.en: a dry bar

examples.ch: 禁酒的州
examples.en: a dry state (= a place that does not allow alcohol)

defines.trans_ch: （葡萄酒等酒精饮料）无甜味的，干的
defines.trans_en: If wine or other alcoholic drinks are dry, they do not taste sweet.

examples.ch: 干苹果／马提尼／雪利／葡萄酒
examples.en: dry cider/martini/sherry/wine

examples.ch: 总的来讲，我更喜欢干葡萄酒，不喜欢甜葡萄酒。
examples.en: On the whole, I like dry wine better than sweet.

defines.trans_ch: 不形于色的，不露声色的
defines.trans_en: Dry humour is very funny in a way that is clever and not obvious.

examples.ch: 不露声色的幽默感
examples.en: a dry sense of humour

examples.ch: 不形于色的诙谐
examples.en: a dry wit

phrases.trans_en: If a river or other area of water runs dry, the water gradually disappears from it.

examples.ch: 到这个时候所有的井都已经干枯了。
examples.en: By this time all the wells had run dry.

phrases.trans_ch: 干爽的地方，干燥的地方
phrases.trans_en: a place where the conditions are not wet, especially when compared to somewhere where the conditions are wet

examples.ch: 你都湿透了——快到干的地方来。
examples.en: You're soaked - come into the dry.

defines.trans_en: to become dry, or to make something become dry

examples.ch: 明天油漆会干吗？
examples.en: Will this paint dry by tomorrow?

examples.ch: 把衣服挂起来晾干。
examples.en: Hang the clothes up to dry.

examples.ch: 水果在阳光照射下变得干巴巴的。
examples.en: The fruit is dried in the sun.

phrases.trans_en: to dry plates, knives, forks, etc. after they have been washed

defines.trans_en: from the beginning to the end of a particular period

examples.ch: 他们夜里干活儿，白天睡觉。
examples.en: They work during the night and sleep by day.

examples.ch: 在第二次世界大战期间航空技术有了长足的发展。
examples.en: There were huge advances in aviation technology during the Second World War.

defines.trans_en: at some time between the beginning and the end of a period

examples.ch: 夜里我醒了好几次。
examples.en: I woke up several times during the night.

defines.trans_ch: DVD光盘（digital versatile disc 或 digital video disc的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for digital versatile disc or digital video disc: a disc used for storing and playing music, films, or information

examples.ch: 我买了一张《欢乐满人间》的DVD影碟，打算在圣诞节期间看。
examples.en: I got a DVD of "Mary Poppins" for Christmas.

examples.ch: 有没有这部电影的DVD光盘？
examples.en: Is the movie available on DVD?

examples.ch: DVD光驱／播放机
examples.en: a DVD drive/player

defines.trans_ch: （两个或两个以上物或人中的）每个，各，各自
defines.trans_en: every thing, person, etc. in a group of two or more, considered separately

examples.ch: 奔跑时，你的一只脚在另一只脚着地之前就离开了地面。
examples.en: When you run, each foot leaves the ground before the other comes down.

examples.ch: 有五种传单——请每样拿一份。
examples.en: There are five leaflets - please take one of each.

examples.ch: 这些公司都各自资助一个当地的慈善组织。
examples.en: Each of the companies supports a local charity.

examples.ch: 每一种花的色彩和气味都各不相同。
examples.en: Each and every one of the flowers has its own colour and smell.

examples.ch: 我们大家都想住那间带阳台的卧室，所以只好扔硬币来决定。
examples.en: We each (= every one of us) wanted the bedroom with the balcony, so we tossed a coin to decide.

examples.ch: 账单共计79英镑，大约每人摊10英镑。
examples.en: The bill comes to £79, so that's about £10 each.

phrases.trans_ch: （用来表示人各有不同的爱好）人各不同;各有所好
phrases.trans_en: used to say that everyone likes different things

examples.ch: 你竟然喜欢现代爵士乐，真的？真是各有所好。
examples.en: You actually like modern jazz, do you? Each to their own.

phrases.trans_ch: （下注的马得前三名即赢的）一注三赢
phrases.trans_en: If you put an amount of money each way on a horse race, you will win money if the horse you have chosen comes first, second, or third.

defines.trans_en: either of the two organs, one on each side of the head, by which people or animals hear sounds, or the piece of skin and tissue outside the head connected to this organ

examples.ch: 我左耳听力不是太好。
examples.en: The hearing in my left ear's not so good.

examples.ch: 她俯过身去，贴着他的耳朵小声说了些什么。
examples.en: She leaned over and whispered something in his ear.

defines.trans_en: the flower part of a plant like a grass, such as wheat, that later contains the grains that are used as food

examples.ch: 玉米穗
examples.en: an ear of corn

defines.trans_ch: 早期的，初期的;在早期，在初期;提早（的），提前（的）
defines.trans_en: near the beginning of a period of time, or before the usual, expected, or planned time

examples.ch: 如果提前完成你可以回家。
examples.en: If you finish early you can go home.

examples.ch: 如果早一点到，你就会有更多的时间。
examples.en: If you arrived earlier, you'd have more time.

examples.ch: 每次去参加面试，我都喜欢提前一会儿到。
examples.en: I like being a little early for interviews.

examples.ch: 他们在开赛不久就进了两个球。
examples.en: They scored two goals early (on) in the game.

examples.ch: 我讨厌（早晨）不得不早起。
examples.en: I hate having to get up early (in the morning).

examples.ch: 我要早睡。
examples.en: I'm going to have an early night (= go to sleep before my usual time).

examples.ch: 她是一位生活在15世纪初期的诗人。
examples.en: She was a poet living in the early 15th century.

examples.ch: 他早在3岁时就学会认字了。
examples.en: He learned to read at the early age of three.

examples.ch: 现在种胡萝卜还太早，不是吗？
examples.en: It's a little early to be sowing carrot seeds, isn't it?

examples.ch: 亨利·福特是早期汽车制造业的先驱。
examples.en: Henry Ford was a pioneer during the early days/years of car manufacture.

examples.ch: 我最早的记忆是被带着看我们的新家。
examples.en: My earliest (= first) memory is of being shown around our new house.

examples.ch: 这些是我最初尝试雕塑创作时的一些习作。
examples.en: These are some of my early (= first) attempts at sculpture.

examples.ch: 这是我刚做好不久的一道菜。
examples.en: Here's a dish I prepared earlier (= I made a short time ago).

defines.trans_ch: 早开的（花卉）;早熟的(蔬菜)
defines.trans_en: Early flowers and vegetables are ones that are ready early in the year, before most other ones.

phrases.trans_en: used after a date or time to show that something will not happen before then

examples.ch: 我太忙了，最早也得到4点才能见你。
examples.en: I'm very busy, so I won't be with you till four o'clock at the earliest.

defines.trans_en: to receive money as payment for work that you do

examples.ch: 我一年挣8万美元。
examples.en: I earn $80,000 a year.

examples.ch: 如果你不介意的话，能告诉我你挣多少钱吗？
examples.en: How much do you earn, if you don't mind me asking?

examples.ch: 你不能指望靠画画来维持生计。
examples.en: You can't expect to earn a living (= be paid enough money to live on) from your painting.

examples.ch: 咖啡出口每年给巴西带来的收入达数百万英镑。／巴西通过出口咖啡每年收入达数百万英镑。
examples.en: Coffee exports earn (= give) Brazil many millions of dollars a year./Brazil earns many millions of dollars a year from coffee exports.

defines.trans_en: to get something that you deserve

examples.ch: 这半年可真是够辛苦的，我觉得我也该休息几周了。
examples.en: It's been a tough six months and I feel I've earned a few weeks off.

defines.trans_en: the direction from which the sun rises in the morning, opposite to the west, or the part of an area or country that is in this direction

examples.ch: 罗盘上的四个方位点是北、南、东和西。
examples.en: The points of the compass are north, south, east, and west.

examples.ch: 哪边是东啊？
examples.en: Which way is east?

examples.ch: 除了东部外，这个国家大部分地区都是农村。
examples.en: Most of the country, except the east, is rural.

examples.ch: 她的家在法国东部。
examples.en: Her home is in the east of France.

examples.ch: 从地图上看，这个村子位于距此以东约10公里的地方。
examples.en: According to the map, the village lies about ten kilometres to the east of here.

phrases.trans_ch: （尤指亚洲东部和南部地区）亚洲国家，东方国家
phrases.trans_en: Asia, especially its eastern and southern parts

examples.ch: 她在东方——主要是中国——度过了童年。
examples.en: She spent her childhood in the East - mostly in China.

phrases.trans_ch: （20世纪90年代前的）东欧共产主义国家，东方集团
phrases.trans_en: those countries in Europe that had communist governments before the 1990s

examples.ch: 共产主义在东欧的瓦解永久性地改变了东方集团与西方集团之间的关系。
examples.en: The collapse of Communism changed East-West relations for ever.

defines.trans_en: in or forming the east part of something

examples.ch: 剑桥位于东英格兰。
examples.en: Cambridge is in East Anglia.

examples.ch: 清真寺的整面东墙上是一幅漂亮的镶嵌画。
examples.en: The east wall of the mosque is covered with a beautiful mosaic.

phrases.trans_en: a wind coming from the east

defines.trans_en: towards the east

examples.ch: 我们再向东开几英里，然后转弯向南。
examples.en: We'll drive east for a few more miles, then turn south.

examples.ch: 他们是第一批到达此山脉以东地区的人。
examples.en: They were the first people to travel east of the mountains (= into the area beyond and to the east of the mountains).

examples.ch: 我们向正东方向走了两公里。
examples.en: We walked due (= directly) east for two kilometres.

examples.ch: 花园朝东，所以上午我们可以享受到阳光。
examples.en: The garden faces east, so we'll get the morning sun.

defines.trans_en: needing little effort

examples.ch: 容易的考试
examples.en: an easy exam

examples.ch: 会面定在10点是不是对你更方便一点儿？
examples.en: Would a ten o'clock appointment be easier for you?

examples.ch: 不难看出他为何会那么受欢迎。
examples.en: It's easy to see why he's so popular.

examples.ch: 她平易近人，跟她很容易谈得来。
examples.en: She's very easy to talk to.

examples.ch: 对我们来说，最简单的做法莫过于坐火车回家。
examples.en: The easiest thing to do would be for us to take the train home.

examples.ch: 为人父母，殊非易事。
examples.en: It isn't easy being a parent.

examples.ch: 要跻身电影业可不是件容易的事。
examples.en: Getting into the movie business is no easy matter.

examples.ch: 他那副从容自如的潇洒风度倒是让我信不过。
examples.en: I don't trust that easy (= relaxed) charm of his.

examples.ch: 我的车每小时能跑250公里，小菜一碟。
examples.en: My car can do 250 kph, easy.

defines.trans_en: comfortable or calm; free from worry, pain, etc.

examples.ch: 他们两个都退休了，一起到了巴哈马群岛过安逸生活去了。
examples.en: They both retired and went off to lead an easy life in the Bahamas.

examples.ch: 把他一个人留在家里一整天，我可不放心。
examples.en: I don't feel easy about leaving him alone in the house all day.

examples.ch: 收割结束了，我可以安心地／心安理得地放松一下了。
examples.en: With the harvest finished, I was able to relax with an easy mind/conscience.

defines.trans_en: to put or take food into the mouth, chew it (= crush it with the teeth), and swallow it

examples.ch: 你吃肉吗？
examples.en: Do you eat meat?

examples.ch: 我感冒时没有食欲。
examples.en: When I've got a cold, I don't feel like eating.

examples.ch: 我们通常在7点前后吃饭。
examples.en: We usually eat (= have a meal) at about seven o'clock.

defines.trans_en: the oval object with a hard shell that is produced by female birds, especially chickens, eaten as food

examples.ch: 煮得老的／嫩的鸡蛋
examples.en: a hard-boiled/soft-boiled egg

examples.ch: 鸡蛋你想怎样吃？是吃煎的还是煮的？
examples.en: How do you like your eggs - fried or boiled?

defines.trans_en: an object that is made in the shape of a bird's egg

examples.ch: 巧克力蛋／大理石球
examples.en: a chocolate/marble egg

defines.trans_en: an oval object, often with a hard shell, that is produced by female birds and particular reptiles and insects, and contains a baby animal that comes out when it is developed

examples.ch: 杜鹃将卵产在别的鸟的巢里。
examples.en: The cuckoo lays her egg in another bird's nest.

examples.ch: 14天后，卵孵化了。
examples.en: After fourteen days the eggs hatch.

defines.trans_en: a cell produced by a woman or female animal from which a baby can develop if it combines with a male sex cell

examples.ch: 同卵双胞胎是由一个受精卵分裂发育而来的。
examples.en: Identical twins develop from a single fertilized egg that then splits into two.

defines.trans_en: using electricity for power

examples.ch: 电热毯／电动汽车／电水壶／电灯
examples.en: an electric blanket/car/kettle/light

defines.trans_en: relating to electricity

examples.ch: 我们7月的电费是115美元。
examples.en: Our electric bill for July was $115.

defines.trans_ch: 令人激动的，令人兴奋的;高度刺激的
defines.trans_en: very exciting and producing strong feelings

examples.ch: 扣人心弦的演出
examples.en: an electric performance

defines.trans_en: electricity

examples.ch: 你交多少气费和电费？
examples.en: How much do you pay for gas and electric?

defines.trans_en: a form of energy that can be produced in several ways and that provides power to devices that create light, heat, etc.

examples.ch: 电已被断掉了。
examples.en: The electricity has been turned off.

examples.ch: 发电公司
examples.en: an electricity generating company

examples.ch: 电动／电热供暖
examples.en: powered/heated by electricity

examples.ch: 电费
examples.en: an electricity bill

defines.trans_en: a very large grey mammal that has a trunk (= long nose) with which it can pick things up

defines.trans_ch: （用于以 any-，every-，no- 和 some- 开头的词后面，或用于 how，what，where，who，why 之后，但不用于 which 之后）其他，另外，别的
defines.trans_en: used after words beginning with any-, every-, no-, and some-, or after how, what, where, who, why, but not which, to mean 'other', 'another', 'different', 'extra'

examples.ch: 除了你其他人都同意了。
examples.en: Everybody else has (= all the other people have) agreed except for you.

examples.ch: 如果这个行不通，试试别的。
examples.en: If it doesn't work, try something else (= something different).

examples.ch: 趁他们还没有让我们再去拜访别人，我们还是走吧。
examples.en: Let's go before they ask us to visit anyone else (= another person).

examples.ch: 这不是我的包，肯定是别人的。
examples.en: It's not my bag. It must be someone else's (= it must belong to another person).

examples.ch: 书不在这儿，我该再到哪儿去看看呢？
examples.en: The book isn't here. Where else (= in what other place) should I look?

examples.ch: 他来是为了见你，他还能有什么别的目的？
examples.en: He came to see you. Why else (= for what other reason) would he come?

examples.ch: 我对他们道了谢，然后就不知道该说些什么了。
examples.en: After I'd thanked them I didn't know what else (= what other things) to say.

defines.trans_en: the system for using computers to send messages over the internet

examples.ch: 你可以通过电子邮件或者传真联系我们。
examples.en: You can contact us by email or fax.

examples.ch: 你的电子邮件地址是什么？
examples.en: What's your email address?

defines.trans_en: a message or document sent using this system

examples.ch: 我上周收到丹妮尔的一封电子邮件。
examples.en: I got an email from Danielle last week.

defines.trans_en: to send an email to someone

examples.ch: 有空给我发电子邮件。
examples.en: Email me when you've got time.

examples.ch: 他把通讯录用电子邮件发给你了吗？
examples.en: Has he emailed you that list of addresses yet?

defines.trans_en: not containing any things or people

examples.ch: 空房／空无一人的街道
examples.en: an empty house/street

examples.ch: 我把这些空瓶子拿去回收吧？
examples.en: Shall I take the empty bottles for recycling?

examples.ch: 火车到达伦敦的时候，车内已经没有乘客了。
examples.en: The train was empty (= there were no passengers) by the time it reached London.

defines.trans_ch: 无诚意的;空洞的;无意义的
defines.trans_en: not sincere or without any real meaning

examples.ch: 虚张声势的威胁／虚夸之词
examples.en: empty threats/rhetoric

examples.ch: 这些许诺只不过是些空头支票。
examples.en: They're just empty promises.

defines.trans_ch: 空虚的；无目标的，无意义的；百无聊赖的
defines.trans_en: without purpose or interest

examples.ch: 他说自从妻子去世后他的生活就完全没有了意义。
examples.en: He says his life has been completely empty since his wife died.

examples.ch: 我感到空虚，就像自己的一部分已经死去。
examples.en: I felt empty, like a part of me had died.

defines.trans_en: to remove everything from inside something

examples.ch: 我把壁橱腾空，把我的东西放进那个外出过夜用的黑色旅行袋里。
examples.en: I emptied the closet and put my belongings into the black overnight case.

examples.ch: 你把衣兜掏空好不好？
examples.en: Would you mind emptying (out) your pockets?

examples.ch: 把汤都倒进煮锅中，慢火煨10分钟。
examples.en: Empty the soup into a saucepan and simmer gently for ten minutes.

examples.ch: 她一饮而尽，然后又叫了一杯。
examples.en: She quickly emptied her glass (= drank its contents) and ordered another drink.

defines.trans_en: to become empty

examples.ch: 战斗爆发后，这个地方很快就没人了。
examples.en: The place emptied pretty quickly when the fight started.

defines.trans_en: an empty bottle or other container, especially one that contained drink

examples.ch: 不要忘了回收空瓶子。
examples.en: Don't forget to recycle the empties.

defines.trans_en: the part of a place or thing that is furthest away from the centre

examples.ch: 这根电缆应该一端有插头，另一端有插座。
examples.en: This cable should have a plug at one end and a socket at the other.

examples.ch: 我们搬钢琴时把钢琴末端部分碰坏了。
examples.en: We damaged the end of the piano when we moved it.

examples.ch: 到队尾排着去，像别人一样按顺序等着。
examples.en: Get to the end of the queue and wait your turn like everyone else.

examples.ch: 我们家是从左边倒数第三户。
examples.en: Our house is the third from the end on the left.

examples.ch: 电脑竖着放安全吗？
examples.en: Is it safe to stand the computer on (its) end?

defines.trans_en: the final part of something such as a period of time, activity, or story

examples.ch: 我总是习惯在一天工作结束的时候把办公桌上的东西都收起来。
examples.en: I always like to leave my desk clear at the end of the day.

examples.ch: 电影结尾比我预想的刺激多了。
examples.en: The end of the play was much more exciting than I'd expected.

examples.ch: 毫无疑问，最近这次受伤意味着她的网球运动生涯已到了尽头。
examples.en: This latest injury must surely mean that her tennis career is now at an end (= finished).

examples.ch: 声明称，如果恐怖分子的要求得不到满足，暴力就不会结束。
examples.en: The statement said there would be no end to the violence until the terrorists' demands were met.

defines.trans_en: polite word for death

examples.ch: 她临终时，我们都守在她的床边。
examples.en: We were all by her bedside when the end finally came.

examples.ch: 他在与警方的枪战中丧命。
examples.en: He met his end (= died) in a shoot-out with the police.

defines.trans_en: either of the two halves of the field in some sports

examples.ch: 两队在上半场结束时交换场地，这样对任何一方都公平。
examples.en: The teams change ends at half-time so that neither side has an unfair advantage.

defines.trans_en: one of the two players in American football who begin play furthest from the ball
a small part of something that is left after most of it has been used

examples.ch: 她利用零头布料做被子。
examples.en: She makes quilts out of fabric bolt ends.

examples.ch: 地板上都是烟头。
examples.en: The floor was covered in cigarette ends.

defines.trans_en: an aim, intention, or purpose

examples.ch: 你心中有没有一个明确的目标？
examples.en: Do you have a particular end in mind?

defines.trans_ch: （和某类活动或人相关的）部分，方面
defines.trans_en: the parts of a task or process connected with one particular type of activity or person

examples.ch: 里克更多参与的是财务方面的事务。
examples.en: Rick's more involved with the financial end of things.

phrases.trans_en: to make something finish

examples.ch: 在付款问题上达成一致之后，他结束了会面。
examples.en: Having agreed upon the matter of payment, he brought the interview to an end.

phrases.trans_en: finally, after something has been thought about or discussed a lot

examples.ch: 我们一直打算要去瑞士，可最后却去了奥地利。
examples.en: We were thinking about going to Switzerland, but in the end we went to Austria.

phrases.text: for hours, days, etc. on end
phrases.trans_en: for hours, days, etc. without stopping

examples.ch: 他过去常把自己锁在卧室里一呆就是几个小时，不跟任何人说话。
examples.en: He used to lock himself in his bedroom for hours on end and refuse to talk to anyone.

phrases.trans_en: to finish

examples.ch: 每个人都希望战争尽快结束。
examples.en: Everyone wishes the war would come to an end soon.

phrases.trans_en: in order to achieve this aim

examples.ch: 他想让理科学生也对文科产生兴趣，为此他星期天下午在自己家中开文学课。
examples.en: He wanted science students to take an interest in the arts, and to this end he ran literature classes at his home on Sunday afternoons.

phrases.text: sb's end of the bargain, deal, etc.
phrases.trans_ch: （某人）份內的事情；（某人的）职责范围
phrases.trans_en: the area of activity for which someone is responsible

examples.ch: 我们把我们自己份內的事情做好了——看看他们能不能管好自己的事。
examples.en: We've kept our end of the deal - let's see if they keep theirs.

defines.trans_en: to finish or stop, or to make something finish or stop

examples.ch: 你的会议预计什么时候结束？
examples.en: When is your meeting due to end?

examples.ch: 她的辞职为数月来人们对她未来的种种揣测画上了句号。
examples.en: Her resignation ends months of speculation about her future.

examples.ch: 他们的婚姻在1991年走到了尽头。
examples.en: Their marriage ended in 1991.

examples.ch: 比赛以平局告终。
examples.en: The game ended in a draw.

examples.ch: 我想以我第一张专辑里的一首歌来结束演出。
examples.en: I'd like to end with a song from my first album.

examples.ch: 她以乐观的口吻结束了演讲。
examples.en: She ended her speech on an optimistic note.

defines.trans_en: a machine that uses the energy from liquid fuel or steam to produce movement

examples.ch: 喷气式发动机
examples.en: a jet engine

examples.ch: 汽车发动机
examples.en: a car engine

examples.ch: 我的汽车发动机最近老出问题。
examples.en: My car's been having engine trouble recently.

defines.trans_en: the part of a railway train that pulls it along

defines.trans_ch: 动力，推动力（常指经济动力）
defines.trans_en: something that provides power, often economic power, for other things

examples.ch: 英国在十九世纪的大部分时期都堪称世界工厂和经济发展引擎。
examples.en: For much of the 19th century Britain was the workshop of the world and the engine of economic growth.

defines.trans_ch: 工程师;工程（或机械）设计人员
defines.trans_en: a person whose job is to design or build machines, engines, or electrical equipment, or things such as roads, railways, or bridges, using scientific principles

examples.ch: 土木工程师
examples.en: a civil engineer

examples.ch: 机械／结构工程师
examples.en: a mechanical/structural engineer

examples.ch: 软件工程师
examples.en: a software engineer

defines.trans_ch: 机修工;技师;技工;机械师
defines.trans_en: a person whose job is to repair or control machines, engines, or electrical equipment

examples.ch: 电脑工程师
examples.en: a computer engineer

examples.ch: 修理工明天上午来修我们的电话。
examples.en: The engineer is coming to repair our phone tomorrow morning.

defines.trans_en: a train driver

defines.trans_ch: （尤指为自己的利益）密谋策划，精心安排
defines.trans_en: to arrange cleverly and often secretly for something to happen, especially something that is to your advantage

examples.ch: 左翼集团密谋策划了一场反军政府的政变。
examples.en: Left-wing groups engineered a coup against the military government.

examples.ch: 我正在尽力谋划，好让他们见面。
examples.en: I'm trying to engineer a meeting between them.

defines.trans_en: to design and build something using scientific principles
to get pleasure from something

examples.ch: 我真的很喜欢那部电影／那本书／那场音乐会／那次聚会／那顿饭。
examples.en: I really enjoyed that movie/book/concert/party/meal.

examples.ch: 我想去旅游，因为我愿意结识不同的人，见识没去过的地方。
examples.en: I want to travel because I enjoy meeting people and seeing new places.

defines.trans_en: to have something good or lucky

examples.ch: 虽然都86岁高龄了，他身体依然很健康。
examples.en: Even though he's 86, he enjoys excellent health.

phrases.trans_ch: 过得愉快;感到快乐;玩得痛快
phrases.trans_en: to get pleasure from the situation that you are in

examples.ch: 我觉得玛丽在学校不是太开心。
examples.en: I don't think Marie is enjoying herself very much at school.

examples.ch: 快过来，你们怎么不跳舞啊？痛痛快快地跳吧！
examples.en: Come on, why aren't you dancing? Enjoy yourselves!

phrases.trans_en: something you say to someone when you have given that person something and you want them to enjoy it

examples.ch: 这是您的饮料。请慢用！
examples.en: Here are your drinks. Enjoy!

defines.trans_en: as much as is necessary; in the amount or to the degree needed

examples.ch: 甜点够大家吃吗？
examples.en: Is there enough dessert/Are there enough desserts for everyone?

examples.ch: 每个班25本教材，应该够了。
examples.en: There are 25 textbooks per class. That should be enough.

examples.ch: 你（吃）饱了吗？
examples.en: Have you had enough (to eat)?

examples.ch: 我的艺术造诣足以使我看到一幅杰作就能辩认出来。
examples.en: I know enough about art to recognize a masterpiece when I see one.

examples.ch: 他个头够高，不用踩椅子就可以换灯泡。
examples.en: He's tall enough to change the bulb without getting on a chair.

defines.trans_en: as much as or more than is wanted

examples.ch: 即使不再给我加活，目前的工作也够我应付一阵的了。
examples.en: I've got enough work to do at the moment, without being given any more.

examples.ch: 在他公司呆上半小时就能让人烦透了！
examples.en: Half an hour in his company is quite enough!

examples.ch: 别闹了，你已经弄得一团糟了。
examples.en: Stop. You've made enough of a (= a lot of) mess already.

examples.ch: 你已经喝多了。
examples.en: You've drunk more than enough (= too much) already.

examples.ch: 我已经看／听够了。
examples.en: I've seen/heard enough now (= I do not want to see/hear any more).

examples.ch: 我已经听够了你的借口。
examples.en: I've had enough of your excuses (= I want them to stop).

examples.ch: 够了！我不想再讨论这个了。
examples.en: Enough of this! I don't want to discuss it any more.

examples.ch: 够了！（不要了！）
examples.en: Enough already! (= No more!)

phrases.trans_en: something you say when you want something to stop

examples.ch: 行了行了，我不想再跟你争了。
examples.en: Enough is enough - I don't want to argue with you any more.

phrases.trans_en: something you say to tell someone that you understand what they have said and that there is no need to say any more

examples.ch: “得有人向她说明一下情况。”“已经说得够多了。”
examples.en: "Someone has to explain the situation to her." "Enough said."

phrases.trans_ch: 受够了；烦透了；再也无法忍受了
phrases.trans_en: to want something to stop because it is annoying you

examples.ch: 我受够了——我要回家了。
examples.en: I've had enough - I'm going home.

phrases.trans_ch: 不要那样，够了（用于制止不好的行为）
phrases.trans_en: used to tell someone to stop behaving badly

examples.ch: 够了，彼得。把那些玩具还回去，听话。
examples.en: That's enough, Peter. Give those toys back, please.

defines.trans_ch: （用于形容词、副词或动词后）足够地
defines.trans_en: used after an adjective, adverb, or verb to mean to the necessary degree

examples.ch: 水够热吗？
examples.en: Is the water hot enough yet?

examples.ch: 我认为做这类工作他经验不是太足。
examples.en: I don't think he's really experienced enough for this sort of job.

examples.ch: 她跟我说这是崭新的，我也真够傻，竟然信了她。
examples.en: She told me it was brand new and I was stupid enough to believe her.

examples.ch: 你可以帮我把包拎到楼上吗？
examples.en: Would you be good enough to take my suitcase upstairs for me?

defines.trans_ch: 很，十分（用于形容词、副词后）
defines.trans_en: used after an adjective or adverb to mean quite

examples.ch: 他够坏的了，可他哥哥比他还要坏得多。
examples.en: He's bad enough, but his brother is far worse.

examples.ch: 她离开都6个月了，可奇怪的是，她男朋友好像并没有因此不开心。
examples.en: She's gone away for six months, but strangely/oddly/funnily enough (= surprisingly), her boyfriend doesn't seem too unhappy about it.

defines.trans_en: to come or go into a particular place

examples.ch: 警察从侧门进入（这座大楼）。
examples.en: The police entered (the building) through/by the side door.

examples.ch: 药物进入血液后你就会开始感到困倦。
examples.en: You will begin to feel sleepy as the drug enters the bloodstream.

defines.trans_ch: （为…）报名参加（竞赛、考试等）；安排…参加
defines.trans_en: to be included in a competition, race, or exam, or to arrange for someone else to do this

examples.ch: 两个人都已报名参加下个月在巴黎举行的100米短跑比赛。
examples.en: Both men have been entered for/in the 100 metres in Paris next month.

examples.ch: 三家公司都加入了开发这套新系统的竞争。
examples.en: All three companies have entered the race to develop a new system.

examples.ch: 你要参加摄影比赛吗？
examples.en: Are you going to enter the photography competition?

defines.trans_en: to put information into a computer, book, or document

examples.ch: 你必须输入密码才能进入数据库。
examples.en: You have to enter a password to access the database.

defines.trans_en: to make a particular type of statement officially

examples.ch: 犯人提出无罪抗辩。
examples.en: The prisoner entered a plea of not guilty.

defines.trans_ch: 成为…的一员，加入；开始从事
defines.trans_en: to become a member of a particular organization, or to start working in a particular type of job

examples.ch: 道蒂女士在银行业工作了几年后开始从政／成为议员。
examples.en: Ms Doughty entered politics/Parliament after a career in banking.

defines.trans_en: to begin a period of time

examples.ch: 工程就要进入最后的阶段。
examples.en: The project is entering its final stages.

examples.ch: 暴力活动现已进入第三周。
examples.en: The violence is now entering its third week.

defines.trans_en: the key on a computer keyboard that is used to say that the words or numbers on the screen are correct, or to say that an instruction should be performed, or to move down a line on the screen

examples.ch: 把光标移到“新建文件”处然后按回车键。
examples.en: Move the cursor to where it says "New File" and press enter.

defines.trans_en: a door, gate, etc. by which you can enter a building or place

examples.ch: 有两个入口，一个在前面，另一个在后面。
examples.en: There are two entrances - one at the front and one around the back.

defines.trans_en: the act of coming onto a stage, by an actor or dancer

examples.ch: 在第二幕，他身披金袍上场，光彩炫目。
examples.en: He makes a spectacular entrance in act two draped in a gold sheet.

defines.trans_en: the act of a person coming into a room in an ordinary situation, although often because there is something noticeable about it

examples.ch: 她进来时我注意到了，因为她在门口滑了一跤。
examples.en: I noticed her entrance because she slipped and fell in the doorway.

defines.trans_en: the right to enter a place

examples.ch: 管理部门保留拒绝他人入内的权利。
examples.en: The management reserve the right to refuse entrance.

defines.trans_en: Someone or something that entrances you is so beautiful or interesting that you cannot stop listening to or watching him, her, or it.

examples.ch: 他那些附有精美插图的书吸引了上百万的读者。
examples.en: He has entranced millions of people with his beautifully illustrated books.

defines.trans_en: a flat, usually square or rectangular, paper container for a letter
the unit of money used in most European Union countries

examples.ch: 你通常能找到70欧元住一晚的旅馆房间。
examples.en: You can usually find a hotel for €70 a night.

examples.ch: 我需要把英镑换成欧元。
examples.en: I need to change my pounds into euros.

examples.ch: 一张20欧元的纸币
examples.en: a 20-euro note

phrases.trans_ch: 欧元币值（用于与其他国家货币币值作比较时）
phrases.trans_en: the value of the euro, used in comparing the values of different types of money from around the world

examples.ch: 今天欧元对英镑贬值/升值了。
examples.en: The euro fell/rose against (= was worth less/more compared to) the pound today.

defines.trans_en: relating to the European Union

examples.ch: 欧盟选举
examples.en: the Euro elections

examples.ch: 欧洲议会议员
examples.en: a Euro-MP (= a Member of the European Parliament)

defines.trans_en: relating to Europe

examples.ch: 欧洲流行音乐
examples.en: Europop (= modern, young people's music from Europe)

defines.trans_ch: （用来表示令人惊讶、不同寻常、出乎意料或极端的事物）甚至，连，即使
defines.trans_en: used to show that something is surprising, unusual, unexpected, or extreme

examples.ch: 我甚至连它在哪里都不知道。
examples.en: I don't even know where it is.

examples.ch: 我认识的所有人都喜欢熏肉的味道——即使迈克都不例外，他可是个素食主义者呀。
examples.en: Everyone I know likes the smell of bacon - even Mike does and he's a vegetarian.

examples.ch: 我们都准时到达——就连平时做事一向拖拖拉拉的克里斯都没迟到。
examples.en: We were all on time - even Chris and he's usually late for everything.

examples.ch: 这是项非常艰巨的工作——甚至可能要花一年时间才能完成。
examples.en: It's a very difficult job - it might even take a year to finish it.

examples.ch: “我从来不哭。”“就连把自己伤得很厉害的时候也不哭吗？”
examples.en: "I never cry." "Not even when you hurt yourself really badly?"

examples.ch: 即使你有一大堆精巧的电子装置，要写出一首能走红的歌还是需要一些音乐才能。
examples.en: Even with a load of electronic gadgetry, you still need some musical ability to write a successful song.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调比较）甚至更，愈加，还
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize a comparison

examples.ch: 未来36小时，天气将更加寒冷，更大范围地区将出现阵雪。
examples.en: The next 36 hours will be even colder with snow showers becoming more widespread.

examples.ch: 英镑任何幅度的贬值都将会使得保持低通胀水平更加困难。
examples.en: Any devaluation of the pound would make it even more difficult to keep inflation low.

defines.trans_ch: （用于引出更准确或更详细的说法）甚至可以说，更确切地说，其实
defines.trans_en: used when you want to be more exact or detailed about something you have just said

examples.ch: 我觉得他的一些习惯很是令人不悦，甚至可以说是令人作呕。
examples.en: I find some of his habits somewhat unpleasant, disgusting even.

examples.ch: 她对我一直都很好，有时甚至还很慷慨。
examples.en: She has always been very kind to me, even generous on occasion.

phrases.trans_en: at the same time as

examples.ch: 我试图和他理论，可是我刚一开口解释所发生的事情，他就起身要走。
examples.en: I tried to reason with him, but even as I started to explain what had happened he stood up to leave.

phrases.trans_en: used to say that if something is the case or not, the result is the same

examples.ch: 即使乘出租车去，你还是赶不上火车。
examples.en: Even if you take a taxi, you'll still miss your train.

phrases.trans_ch: 尽管这样／那样;虽然情况如此／是那样
phrases.trans_en: despite something

examples.ch: 我一直在不停地想，但尽管如此，我还是无法相信自己怎会如此幸运，竟能在事故中死里逃生。
examples.en: I've thought about it so much, but even now I can't believe how lucky I was to survive the accident.

examples.ch: 我非常清楚地告诉了吉姆怎么做，但尽管如此，他还是把事情弄得一团糟。
examples.en: I gave Jim very clear instructions, but even then he managed to make a mess of it.

phrases.trans_en: despite what has just been said

examples.ch: 我头疼得要命，但尽管如此我还是去了音乐会。
examples.en: I had a terrible headache, but even so I went to the concert.

examples.ch: 立即降低利率或许会对经济小有促进，但即使如此，经济复苏无论如何都将是非常缓慢的。
examples.en: An immediate interest cut might give a small boost to the economy. Even so, any recovery is likely to be very slow.

phrases.trans_en: although

examples.ch: 尽管他年仅16岁就辍学了，但最终还是当上了首相。
examples.en: Even though he left school at 16, he still managed to become prime minister.

defines.trans_ch: 平坦的，平滑的；处于同一平面的
defines.trans_en: flat and smooth, or on the same level

examples.ch: 因为地板不平，我们重新铺了一次。
examples.en: We resurfaced the floor because it wasn't even.

defines.trans_ch: 平稳的；均匀的；变化不大的
defines.trans_en: continuous or regular

examples.ch: 你应该尽量保持平稳的工作速度，而不是一天优哉游哉，第二天就忙得不可开交。
examples.en: You should try to work at an even rate instead of taking it easy one day and working flat out the next.

defines.trans_en: equal or equally balanced

examples.ch: 双方打得都很精彩——这是场势均力敌的比赛。
examples.en: Both sides played well - it was a very even contest.

examples.ch: 天气预报说今晚发生雷暴天气的概率是50%。
examples.en: The weather forecast said that there's an even chance of thunderstorms tonight (= that it is equally likely that there will or will not be storms).

defines.trans_ch: （发生与不发生的）机会相等的；（正反的）可能性参半的
defines.trans_en: equally likely to happen as to not happen

examples.ch: 她获得这份工作的可能性约为50%。
examples.en: The chances of her getting the job are about evens.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a situation in which you risk money on something where the risk is equally balanced, and will pay back twice the amount of money that is paid if it is successful

examples.ch: 同额赌注
examples.en: an even bet

examples.ch: 要是我下注的话，我就以同额赌注押联队。
examples.en: If I were betting I'd take even money on United.

defines.trans_en: forming a whole number that can be divided exactly by two

examples.ch: 6是偶数，7是奇数。
examples.en: 6 is an even number and 7 is an odd number.

defines.trans_en: to make two things equal

examples.ch: 希拉获得过化学奖学金，现在她弟弟获得了经济学奖学金，和她旗鼓相当了。
examples.en: Sheila was awarded a scholarship in chemistry, and now her brother has evened the score with a scholarship in economics.

examples.ch: 威士忌酒行业现正在积极活动，争取实现不同酒类按相同标准收税。
examples.en: The whisky industry is campaigning for the taxes on different alcoholic drinks to be evened up.

defines.trans_en: the part of the day between the end of the afternoon and night

examples.ch: 寒冷的夜晚
examples.en: a chilly evening

examples.ch: 我在一家饭店工作，每周只有一个晚上歇班。
examples.en: I work in a restaurant and only get one evening off a week.

examples.ch: 多谢你让我度过了一个如此美妙的夜晚。
examples.en: Thank you for such an enjoyable evening.

examples.ch: 我总是在星期五晚上去看电影。
examples.en: I always go to see a movie on Friday evenings.

examples.ch: 每到晚上，我喜欢放松一下。
examples.en: In the evenings, I like to relax.

examples.ch: 今晚我要加班。
examples.en: I'm working late this evening.

examples.ch: 明天晚上你要做什么？
examples.en: What are you doing tomorrow evening?

examples.ch: 傍晚大雨倾盆而下，几乎下了一整夜。
examples.en: It poured down all evening and most of the night as well.

examples.ch: 你晚上通常几点到家？
examples.en: What time do you usually get home in the evening?

defines.trans_en: a friendly way of greeting someone when you meet them in the evening

examples.ch: 晚上好，汤姆！你今天晚上去哪里？
examples.en: Evening, Tom! Where are you off to this evening?

defines.trans_en: at any time

examples.ch: 这儿晚上从来没发生过什么事儿。
examples.en: Nothing ever happens here in the evening.

examples.ch: 你去过伦敦吗？
examples.en: Have you ever been to London?

examples.ch: 无论什么时候你到了里约，一定要给我打个电话。
examples.en: If you're ever/If ever you're in Rio, do give me a call.

examples.ch: 他几乎从不刷盘子，也难得打扫一次卫生。
examples.en: He hardly ever (= almost never) washes the dishes and he rarely, if ever, (= probably never) does any cleaning.

examples.ch: 只要电视上播出詹姆斯‧邦德电影，我从不错过。
examples.en: When there's a James Bond movie on TV, I never ever miss it.

examples.ch: 这项和平条约确实值得庆祝。
examples.en: If ever there was a cause for celebration, this peace treaty was it.

examples.ch: 这气味更加难闻了。
examples.en: The smell is worse than ever.

examples.ch: 我觉得她很有名，但我的朋友中竟然从来没人听说过她。
examples.en: I thought she was famous, but none of my friends have ever heard of her.

defines.trans_en: continuously

examples.ch: 曼彻斯特联队在杯赛中的成绩越来越引人注目。
examples.en: United's record in cup competitions grows ever more impressive.

examples.ch: 加大对公共交通的投资或许可以遏制对私车日益增长的需求。
examples.en: The ever-increasing demand for private cars could be halted by more investment in public transport.

examples.ch: 核毁灭是个永久存在的威胁。
examples.en: Nuclear devastation was an ever-present threat.

examples.ch: 苏珊娜和盖伊搬到了乡下，此后一直在那里过着幸福的生活。
examples.en: Susan and Guy moved to the country, where they lived happily ever after.

defines.trans_en: used for emphasizing an adjective

examples.ch: 管弦乐队将于明晚在艾伯特音乐厅举行最后一次演出。
examples.en: The orchestra is to perform its last ever concert/last concert ever tomorrow night at the Albert Hall.

examples.ch: 昨天这家公司宣布其利润首次出现下跌。
examples.en: Yesterday the company announced its first ever fall in profits.

examples.ch: 她以前跑得多快啊！
examples.en: Was she ever a fast runner! (= She was a very fast runner!)

examples.ch: “你盼望休假吗？”“每时每刻都盼着！”
examples.en: "Are you looking forward to your vacation?" "Am I ever!" (= Yes, very much!)

defines.trans_ch: （用于疑问句中强调疑问词）究竟，到底
defines.trans_en: in questions, used to emphasize the question word

examples.ch: 他到底是怎么应付过去的？
examples.en: How ever did he manage that?

examples.ch: 你究竟对他做了什么？
examples.en: What ever have you done to him?

examples.ch: 有人要去伤害她究竟是为什么？
examples.en: Why ever would anyone/Why would anyone ever want to hurt her?

phrases.text: better, bigger, more, etc. than ever
phrases.trans_ch: 比以前任何时候都好／大／多（等等）
phrases.trans_en: better, bigger, etc. than at any time before

examples.ch: 现在我们的教育开支之大是前所未有的。
examples.en: We are spending more than ever on education.

phrases.text: as big, fast, good, etc. as ever
phrases.trans_ch: 像往常一样大／快／好（等等）
phrases.trans_en: as big, fast, etc. as at any time before

examples.ch: 这些饭店的饭菜仍像往常一样美味可口，而且也没有涨价。
examples.en: The restaurants are as good as ever and no more expensive.

phrases.trans_en: continuously since that time

examples.ch: 他离婚后一直很消沉。
examples.en: He's been depressed ever since he got divorced.

phrases.trans_en: in the same way as always

examples.ch: 像往常一样，我又是最后一个知道的。
examples.en: As ever, I was the last to find out.

phrases.trans_ch: （熟人之间通信时用于书信末尾署名前的套语）你永远的朋友
phrases.trans_en: used at the end of a letter as a way of saying goodbye to someone you know well

examples.ch: 你永远的朋友，伊冯。
examples.en: Yours ever, Yvonne.

phrases.trans_en: very/a very

examples.ch: 她貌美至极。
examples.en: She's ever so pretty.

examples.ch: 她是个很漂亮的女孩。
examples.en: She's ever such a pretty girl.

defines.trans_ch: （3个或3个以上的人或事物组成的群体中的）每一个，每个；全部，整体
defines.trans_en: used when referring to all the members of a group of three or more

examples.ch: 警方想就盗窃案件与每位员工面谈。
examples.en: The police want to interview every employee about the theft.

examples.ch: 这个节目将在周一至周五每天上午9点到10点播出。
examples.en: The show will be broadcast every weekday morning between 9.00 and 10.00.

examples.ch: 除了星期天我们每天都开门营业。
examples.en: We're open every day except Sunday.

examples.ch: 这个星期每天晚上我都外出。
examples.en: I've been out every night this week.

examples.ch: 每次我去伦敦都碰上塞车。
examples.en: Every time I go to London I get caught in a traffic jam.

examples.ch: 每售出1瓶就会有10便士捐给慈善机构。
examples.en: Ten pence is donated to charity for every bottle sold.

examples.ch: 这些画也许看上去像真的，可实际上全都是赝品。
examples.en: These paintings may look like the real thing, but (each and) every one of them is a fake.

examples.ch: 那鲑鱼肉很贵，一定要全吃了，一点儿都不要剩。
examples.en: That salmon was very expensive so make sure you eat up every (single) bit.

defines.trans_ch: （表示有规律地重复发生）每，每隔，每…之中
defines.trans_en: used to show that something is repeated regularly

examples.ch: 计算机每秒钟能进行数百万次的运算。
examples.en: Computers can perform millions of calculations every second.

examples.ch: 在这座城市，每4分钟就有1辆汽车被盗。
examples.en: Every four minutes a car is stolen in this city.

examples.ch: 在美国每天有25人被手枪射杀。
examples.en: Every day in the US 25 people are murdered with handguns.

examples.ch: 我们每走几公里就能在路边看到一辆被焚毁的吉普车或卡车。
examples.en: Every few kilometres we passed a burned out jeep or truck at the side of the road.

examples.ch: 会议每隔一年／两年召开一次。
examples.en: The conference takes place every other/second year.

defines.trans_ch: 最好的；最大的；最有可能的
defines.trans_en: the greatest possible or that can be imagined

examples.ch: 我衷心祝愿你在新的工作中取得最大成功／在新家里日子过得幸福美满。
examples.en: I'd like to wish you every success in your new job/happiness in your new home.

examples.ch: 她失业了，家也没了，完全有理由伤心。
examples.en: She has every reason to be unhappy after losing her job and her home.

examples.ch: 你当时完全有机会去投诉。
examples.en: You had every opportunity to make a complaint.

examples.ch: 正在尽最大努力把平民的伤亡降到最低限度。
examples.en: Every effort is being made to minimize civilian casualties.

examples.ch: 她完全有权利为自己的巨大成就而感到自豪。
examples.en: She has every right to be proud of her tremendous achievements.

phrases.trans_en: equally as

examples.ch: 在人们心目中，这场战争的反对者和支持者都是一样爱国的。
examples.en: Opponents of the war are considered every bit as patriotic as supporters.

phrases.trans_en: every

examples.ch: 我们掌握绝大多数人的情况，但要把所有的逃税者都一一查出来是不可能的。
examples.en: We catch the majority of people, but hunting down every last tax evader is impossible.

phrases.trans_en: in all directions

examples.ch: 狂风大作，球被吹得四下乱跑，比赛无法正常进行。
examples.en: The game was hindered by a fierce wind that swept the ball every which way.

phrases.trans_ch: 无论从哪方面看；在各方面
phrases.trans_en: in all ways

examples.ch: 无论从哪方面来看，这部片子都是一部电影杰作。
examples.en: This movie is in every way a masterpiece of cinematography.

phrases.trans_en: all the things that you need or want

examples.ch: 将有一位助手到场来照顾你的一切需求。
examples.en: There'll be an assistant there to see to your every need.

phrases.trans_en: sometimes but not often

examples.ch: 他们偶尔会聚在一起喝杯啤酒。
examples.en: Every now and again/then they'll have a beer together.

phrases.trans_en: sometimes but not often

examples.ch: 偶尔我也到高档餐厅犒劳自己一下。
examples.en: Every so often I treat myself to a meal in an expensive restaurant.

defines.trans_en:
→ 
everyone
every person

examples.ch: 想去参加晚宴的人请在周五下午前通知我好吗？
examples.en: Would everyone who wishes to attend the dinner let me know by Friday afternoon?

examples.ch: 对什么是养育孩子的最佳方式，每个人都有自己的看法。
examples.en: Everyone has their own ideas about the best way to bring up children.

examples.ch: 除了简，所有人都给了我回复。
examples.en: I've received replies from everybody but Jane.

examples.ch: 每个人都要承担一些卫生保健费用，这个原则你赞同吗？
examples.en: Do you agree with the principle that everyone should pay something towards the cost of health care?

examples.ch: 大家都知道是谁偷的，但都不敢跟别人说。
examples.en: Everyone knows who stole it, but they're all afraid to tell anyone.

examples.ch: 事故牵涉到的每个人都被警方盘问过。
examples.en: Everyone involved in the accident has been questioned by the police.

examples.ch: 各位，再会——下周见。
examples.en: Goodbye, everybody - I'll see you next week.

examples.ch: 对不起，你得和其他人一样等着，按顺序来。
examples.en: I'm sorry, but you'll just have to wait your turn like everybody else.

defines.trans_en: all things

examples.ch: 你不能什么事都怪他。
examples.en: You can't blame him for everything.

examples.ch: 他迷上了布兰妮·斯皮尔斯，只要跟她有关的东西他统统收藏。
examples.en: He's obsessed with Britney Spears and collects anything and everything connected with her.

examples.ch: 简已经有3次对吉姆不忠的行为了，但尽管如此，他仍然爱她。
examples.en: Jane's been unfaithful to Jim three times, but he still loves her in spite of everything.

examples.ch: 金钱不是万能的。
examples.en: Money isn't everything (= the most important thing).

examples.ch: 对他来说，孩子就是他生命的全部。
examples.en: His children are everything to him (= the most important part of his life).

examples.ch: 你一直在哭吗？一切还好吧？
examples.en: Have you been crying? Is everything all right?

examples.ch: 窃贼把东西洗劫一空。
examples.en: The thieves took everything.

examples.ch: 我们竭尽全力挽救她的生命，可还是无力回天。
examples.en: We did everything we could to save her but she died.
