examples.ch: 我们将采取一切必要的措施将杀人凶手绳之以法。
examples.en: We shall do everything necessary to bring the murderer to justice.

examples.ch: 新房子及其他相关事情让他们忙得不可开交。
examples.en: They're very busy with their new house and everything (= all the things connected with it).

defines.trans_en: to, at, or in all places or the whole of a place

examples.ch: 他去哪儿他的孩子们就跟到哪儿。
examples.en: His children go everywhere with him.

examples.ch: 冬天，到处都是灰蒙蒙的，令人压抑。
examples.en: Everywhere looks so grey and depressing in winter.

examples.ch: 我到处找我的钥匙。
examples.en: I looked everywhere for my keys.

examples.ch: 无论在哪里任何有理智的人都会对这种暴行义愤填膺。
examples.en: Reasonable people everywhere will be outraged by this atrocity.

examples.ch: 由于其他地方都已客满，我们不得不在城里最脏的旅馆住了下来。
examples.en: We had to stay in the sleaziest hotel in town because everywhere else (= all other places) was fully booked.

defines.trans_en: the act of looking at or considering something carefully in order to discover something

examples.ch: 尸检
examples.en: a post-mortem examination

examples.ch: 在加入养老金计划之前，我不得不进行了一次体检。
examples.en: I had to have/undergo a medical examination when I joined the pension scheme.

examples.ch: 仍在对该证据进行调查。
examples.en: The evidence is still under examination (= being examined).

examples.ch: 一开始我以为是油漆，可是仔细一看我才意识到那是干了的血迹。
examples.en: I thought it was paint at first, but on closer examination I realized it was dried blood.

defines.trans_en: an exam
a test of a student's knowledge or skill in a particular subject

examples.ch: 美国学生在参加地理考试的学生中名列第四。
examples.en: American students ranked fourth in those taking the geography exam.

examples.ch: 我物理考试没及格，但化学考试通过了。
examples.en: I failed my physics exam, but I passed chemistry.

examples.ch: 试卷
examples.en: an examination paper

examples.ch: 考试成绩
examples.en: exam results

defines.trans_en: something that is typical of the group of things that it is a member of

examples.ch: 你能不能举个例子说明一下你刚才提到的那些进展情况？
examples.en: Could you give me an example of the improvements you have mentioned?

examples.ch: 这幅画是她非常出色的代表作。
examples.en: This painting is a marvellous example of her work.

defines.trans_en: a way of helping someone to understand something by showing them how it is used

examples.ch: 首先仔细研究一下例题，然后试着做下一页的习题。
examples.en: Study the examples first of all, then attempt the exercises on the next page.

defines.trans_en: a person or a way of behaving that is considered suitable to be copied

examples.ch: 他是班上其他同学的好榜样。
examples.en: He's a very good example to the rest of the class.

examples.ch: 他决定效法其父，学习法律。
examples.en: He's decided to follow the example of his father and study law.

defines.trans_en: a punishment that is intended to warn others against doing the thing that is being punished, or a person who receives such a punishment

examples.ch: 为了以儆效尤，法官在法律许可的范围内对他作出了最重的量刑。
examples.en: The judge made an example of him and gave him the maximum possible sentence.

phrases.trans_en: used when giving an example of the type of thing you mean

examples.ch: 举手之劳就可以使办公室更加环保，比如，使用再生纸。
examples.en: Offices can easily become more environmentally-friendly by, for example, using recycled paper.

defines.trans_ch: 卓越的；优秀的；杰出的；极好的
defines.trans_en: extremely good

examples.ch: 这食物美味极了。
examples.en: The food was excellent.

examples.ch: 她的汽车车况非常好。
examples.en: Her car is in excellent condition.

examples.ch: 对于借款人来说，利率降低是个好消息。
examples.en: The fall in interest rates is excellent news for borrowers.

examples.ch: “我们的销售额连续3年一路上升。”“好极了！”
examples.en: "Our sales are up for the third year in a row." "Excellent." (= I'm extremely pleased.)

defines.trans_en: not including; but not

examples.ch: 博物馆除周一外每天都开放。
examples.en: The museum is open daily except Monday(s).

examples.ch: 政府除了保持高利率外，几乎没有其他的选择。
examples.en: The government has few options except to keep interest rates high.

examples.ch: 除了厨房，别的房间都很凉爽安静。
examples.en: It's cool and quiet everywhere except in the kitchen.

examples.ch: 除了萨莉，大家都在那儿。
examples.en: Everyone was there except for Sally.

examples.ch: 除了壁炉外，再没有什么地方可以表明这幢房子的历史了。
examples.en: There is nothing to indicate the building's past, except (for) the fireplace.

defines.trans_en: physical activity that you do to make your body strong and healthy

examples.ch: 我最喜欢的锻炼方式是游泳。
examples.en: Swimming is my favourite form of exercise.

examples.ch: 你真的应该多进行体育锻炼。
examples.en: You really should take more exercise.

examples.ch: 大多数时候我做锻炼腹肌的运动。
examples.en: I do stomach exercises most days.

defines.trans_en: an action or actions intended to improve something or make something happen

examples.ch: 来自8个国家的海军军舰将参加在太平洋举行的军事演习，以提高其作战效率。
examples.en: Ships from eight navies will be taking part in an exercise in the Pacific to improve their efficiency in combat.

examples.ch: 大声朗读几遍演讲稿，将会有助于你发挥。
examples.en: It would be a useful exercise for you to say the speech aloud several times.

examples.ch: 公共关系方面的演练
examples.en: an exercise in public relations

defines.trans_en: a short piece of written work that you do to practise something you are learning

examples.ch: 该书每一章的后面都有练习题。
examples.en: The book has exercises at the end of every chapter.

defines.trans_en: the use of something

examples.ch: 保持克制可能是件很难的事。
examples.en: The exercise of restraint may well be difficult.

phrases.trans_en: a ceremony that includes speeches and usually traditional music or activities

examples.ch: 毕业典礼
examples.en: graduation exercises

defines.trans_en: to do physical activities to make your body strong and healthy

examples.ch: 她几乎每天晚上都去锻炼，通常是跑步。
examples.en: She exercises most evenings usually by running.

examples.ch: 健身房里做的健身运动能使所有主要肌群都得到锻炼。
examples.en: A work-out in the gym will exercise all the major muscle groups.

defines.trans_en: If you exercise an animal, you make it walk or run so that it stays strong and healthy.

examples.ch: 他已经退休了，下午的时间大都花在了遛狗上。
examples.en: Now he's retired he spends most afternoons exercising his dogs.

defines.trans_en: to use something

examples.ch: 在选举中，我通过拒不投票的方式来行使我的民主权利。
examples.en: I exercised my democratic right by not voting in the election.

examples.ch: 处理放射性物质时要时刻小心谨慎。
examples.en: Always exercise caution when handling radioactive substances.

examples.ch: 我们已经决定行使合同赋予的买卖选择权，买下我们现在租住的房子。
examples.en: We've decided to exercise the option (= use the part of a legal agreement) to buy the house we now lease.

defines.trans_en: feeling very happy and enthusiastic

examples.ch: 要去度假了你是不是很兴奋啊？
examples.en: Are you getting excited about your holiday?

examples.ch: 一群人怀着激动的心情等待着歌星的到来。
examples.en: An excited crowd waited for the singer to arrive.

defines.trans_ch: 令人兴奋的;使人激动的;刺激的
defines.trans_en: making you feel excited

examples.ch: 扣人心弦的电影／电影配乐
examples.en: an exciting movie/soundtrack

examples.ch: 你要去非洲？真是太刺激了！
examples.en: You're going to Africa? How exciting!

examples.ch: 这的确是一场扣人心弦的比赛。
examples.en: It was a really exciting match.

defines.trans_en: to forgive someone

examples.ch: 我来晚了，请原谅——公共汽车晚点了。
examples.en: Please excuse me for arriving late - the bus was delayed.

examples.ch: 无论如何那种行为都是不可原谅的。
examples.en: Nothing can excuse that sort of behaviour.

examples.ch: 这家公司竟这样执行制度，这种行为无论赔多少钱都不能宽恕。
examples.en: No amount of financial recompense can excuse the way in which the company carried out its policy.

examples.ch: 我们无法原谅他犯下的这些罪行。
examples.en: We cannot excuse him for these crimes.

examples.ch: 我的膝盖仍然很疼，因此我向老师请假看能否不参加曲棍球训练。
examples.en: I asked the teacher if I could be excused from (= allowed not to do) hockey practice as my knee still hurt.

examples.ch: 请原谅，我不能继续出席会议了——我刚接到一个电话，有急事需要我马上处理。
examples.en: Please excuse me from (= allow me to miss) the rest of the meeting - I've just received a phone call that requires my immediate attention.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于礼貌地引起他人、尤其是陌生人的注意）劳驾，打扰
phrases.trans_en: a polite way of attracting someone's attention, especially of someone you do not know

examples.ch: 打扰一下，请问这辆公共汽车去牛津大街吗？
examples.en: Excuse me, does this bus go to Oxford Street?

phrases.trans_ch: （用于礼貌地请求别人让路）借光，劳驾，对不起
phrases.trans_en: used to politely ask someone to move so that you can walk past them

examples.ch: 劳驾，请让我过一下。
examples.en: Excuse me, can I just get past?

phrases.trans_en: used to tell someone politely that you are leaving

examples.ch: 抱歉，失陪一会儿，我马上就回来。
examples.en: Excuse me a moment, I'll be with you shortly.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于无意做了某事后致歉）对不起
phrases.trans_en: used to say sorry for something you have done by accident

examples.ch: 我坐了你的座位吗？太对不起了。
examples.en: Did I take your seat? Do excuse me.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于表示异议）请原谅，对不起
phrases.trans_en: said before disagreeing with someone

examples.ch: 请原谅，但你是不是忘记了些什么？
examples.en: Excuse me but aren't you forgetting something?

phrases.trans_ch: （用于没听清楚某事礼貌地请别人重复）对不起，请再说一遍
phrases.trans_en: used to politely ask someone to repeat something they have said because you have not heard it

defines.trans_en: a reason that you give to explain why you did something wrong

examples.ch: 他迟到最好有正当的理由。
examples.en: He'd better have a good excuse for being late.

examples.ch: 据我所知，他从来没有缺席过会议——我敢肯定他不来是有原因的。
examples.en: I've never known him to miss a meeting - I'm sure he'll have an excuse.

examples.ch: 根本没什么借口为那种行为开脱。
examples.en: There's no excuse for that sort of behaviour.

defines.trans_en: a false reason that you give to explain why you do something

examples.ch: 她只是找个借口给他打电话罢了。
examples.en: She was just looking for an excuse to call him.

examples.ch: 只要能去度假，找任何借口都行！
examples.en: Any excuse for a holiday!

phrases.trans_ch: 因为不能到场表示歉意
phrases.trans_en: to explain why you cannot be present somewhere

examples.ch: 我不能参加周五的会议了，请代我致歉。
examples.en: Please make my excuses at the meeting on Friday.

phrases.trans_en: to give false reasons why you cannot do something

examples.ch: 你总是找种种借口不来帮我。
examples.en: You're always making excuses for not helping me.

defines.trans_en: an event at which objects such as paintings are shown to the public, a situation in which someone shows a particular skill or quality to the public, or the act of showing these things

examples.ch: 这些照片将一直展出到月底。
examples.en: The photographs will be on exhibition until the end of the month.

examples.ch: 市艺术美术馆正在举行一场新的雕塑作品展。
examples.en: There's a new exhibition of sculpture on at the city gallery.

examples.ch: 这个运动员的第三次试跳，也是获胜的那一跳，充分展示了他的技巧和体能。
examples.en: The athlete's third, and winning, jump was an exhibition of skill and strength.

defines.trans_ch: （建筑物或大型交通工具的）出口，安全门;（尤指演员）退场
defines.trans_en: the door through which you might leave a building or large vehicle, or the act of leaving something, especially a theatre stage

examples.ch: 消防出口
examples.en: a fire exit (= a door you can escape through if there is a fire)

examples.ch: 紧急出口
examples.en: an emergency exit

examples.ch: 他看到埃玛匆匆而来又匆匆离去。
examples.en: He saw Emma arrive and made a quick exit.

examples.ch: 在观众热烈的掌声中，她退场走下舞台。
examples.en: She made her exit from the stage to rapturous applause.

defines.trans_en: a smaller road used to leave a main road

examples.ch: 从达克斯福德出口驶出高速公路。
examples.en: Come off the motorway at the Duxford exit.

defines.trans_ch: 离开（建筑物或大型交通工具）
defines.trans_en: to leave a building or large vehicle

examples.ch: 趁没人看到，我赶快离开了。
examples.en: I exited quickly before anyone could see me.

examples.ch: 请从侧门离开剧场。
examples.en: Please exit the theatre by the side doors.

defines.trans_en: to end a computer program that you are using

examples.ch: 你必须退出这个程序，才能打开另一个。
examples.en: You have to exit the program before starting another.

defines.trans_ch: 昂贵的；花钱多的；价格高的
defines.trans_en: costing a lot of money

examples.ch: 劳斯莱斯汽车价格昂贵。
examples.en: Rolls Royces are very expensive.

examples.ch: 大房子维护费用很高。
examples.en: Big houses are expensive to maintain.

examples.ch: 她喜欢昂贵的东西。
examples.en: She has expensive tastes (= she likes things that cost a lot of money).

defines.trans_en: to make something clear or easy to understand by describing or giving information about it

examples.ch: 如果你有什么不懂的地方，我会很乐意为你讲解。
examples.en: If there's anything you don't understand, I'll be happy to explain.

examples.ch: 老师向孩子们说明规则。
examples.en: The teacher explained the rules to the children.

examples.ch: 导游给我们讲解了大教堂的位置。
examples.en: Our guide explained where the cathedral was.

examples.ch: 他解释了这台机器的工作原理。
examples.en: He explained how the machine worked.

examples.ch: 你能否解释一下你迟到这么久的原因？
examples.en: Please could you explain why you're so late.

examples.ch: 她解释说她要去和妹妹一起住。
examples.en: She explained that she was going to stay with her sister.

examples.ch: “一定有人误碰了按钮，”一位官员解释说。
examples.en: "Someone must have hit the wrong button," an official explained.

examples.ch: 莫莉请求老师能否讲得更清楚些。
examples.en: Molly asked the teacher if she could explain herself a little more clearly (= say more clearly what she meant).

examples.ch: 还没有人能解释事故的原因。
examples.en: No one has been able to explain (= give the reason for) the accident.

phrases.trans_ch: 为自己的行为作出说明（或解释）
phrases.trans_en: to give reasons for your behaviour

examples.ch: 他一连3天没有回家，所以我要他解释一下怎么回事儿。
examples.en: He hadn't been home for three days so I asked him to explain himself.

defines.trans_en: to search and discover (about something)

examples.ch: 探索太空
examples.en: to explore space

examples.ch: 探索农村地区，步行是最好的方法。
examples.en: The best way to explore the countryside is on foot.

examples.ch: 孩子们到树林里观察大自然去了。
examples.en: The children have gone exploring in the woods.

defines.trans_en: to think or talk about something in order to find out more about it

examples.ch: 让我们进一步探讨一下这个问题／计划。
examples.en: Let's explore this issue/idea more fully.

defines.trans_en: someone who travels to places where no one has ever been in order to find out what is there

examples.ch: 麦哲伦是16世纪著名的探险家。
examples.en: Magellan was a famous 16th-century explorer.

defines.trans_en: added to what is normal

examples.ch: 如果还需要其他的帮助，尽管给我打电话。
examples.en: If you need any extra help, just call me.

examples.ch: 近来他每天都加班两个小时。
examples.en: Recently he's been working an extra two hours a day.

examples.ch: 这个价格包括路费和住宿费，但是餐费要另付。
examples.en: The price includes travel and accommodation but meals are extra (= there is an additional charge for meals).

defines.trans_en: more

examples.ch: 她上夜班会有额外补贴。
examples.en: They pay her extra to work nights.

examples.ch: 本来我们谈好了价格，但是后来他们想再加10英镑。
examples.en: We agreed on a price but afterwards they wanted £10 extra.

examples.ch: 我在那篇文章上格外下功夫。
examples.en: I worked extra hard (= more than usual) on that essay.

defines.trans_ch: 另外付费即可额外得到的东西
defines.trans_en: something that you can get with something else if you pay a little more money

examples.ch: 购买这款汽车，就可以选择搭配一款额外收费的天窗。
examples.en: A sunroof is an optional extra on this model of the car.

defines.trans_ch: （电影中的）临时演员，群众演员
defines.trans_en: a person in a film who does not have a speaking part and who is usually part of the scene, for example, in a crowd

defines.trans_ch: 额外得分（板球中一队在另一队发球犯规时所得的分数）
defines.trans_en: a point given to one cricket team if the other team makes an illegal mistake when bowling
outside or in addition to

examples.ch: 外星人
examples.en: extraterrestrial beings (= imaginary creatures which come from outside the planet Earth)

examples.ch: 婚外恋
examples.en: an extramarital affair (= a sexual relationship of a married person with someone other than their husband or wife)

examples.ch: 课外活动
examples.en: extracurricular activities (= activities which are not part of the usual school or college course)

defines.trans_en: the front of the head, where the eyes, nose, and mouth are

examples.ch: 她长着一张瘦长的脸。
examples.en: She has a long, thin face.

examples.ch: 她一脸困惑不解。
examples.en: She had a puzzled expression on her face.

defines.trans_en: an expression on someone's face

examples.ch: 迎接我的是一张张笑脸。
examples.en: I was greeted by smiling faces.

examples.ch: 我从他的脸上看出他并不高兴。
examples.en: I could see from his face he was unhappy.

defines.trans_en: the front or surface of an object

examples.ch: 山的北坡
examples.en: the north face of a mountain

examples.ch: 建筑物的西侧
examples.en: the west face of the building

defines.trans_en: the front of a clock or watch that has the numbers or marks that show what time it is

examples.ch: 有罗马数字的手表表盘
examples.en: a watch face with Roman numerals

defines.trans_en: the respect and honour of others

examples.ch: 他觉得承认错误会丢面子。
examples.en: He thinks he would lose face if he admitted the mistake.

examples.ch: 为了尽量挽回面子，她谎称那时在海外。
examples.en: She tried to save face by inventing a story about being overseas at the time.

phrases.trans_en: to make a strange expression with your face, for example to show that you do not like someone or something

examples.ch: 我正做着各种鬼脸逗宝宝乐。
examples.en: I was making silly faces to get the baby to laugh.

examples.ch: “这太难喝了，”汤姆一脸苦相地看着杯子说道。
examples.en: "This tastes horrible," said Tom, pulling a face at his glass.

defines.trans_ch: 面对，面临，必须对付（难题）
defines.trans_en: If you face a problem, or a problem faces you, you have to deal with it.

examples.ch: 这是身为职业妇女的母亲们面临的众多难题之一。
examples.en: This is one of the many problems faced by working mothers.

examples.ch: 旅客可能会长时间滞留。
examples.en: Passengers could face long delays.

examples.ch: 你眼下面临一项艰难的抉择。
examples.en: You're faced with a very difficult choice there.

defines.trans_en: to accept that something unpleasant is true and start to deal with the situation

examples.ch: 我觉得菲尔必须承认她不再爱他这一事实。
examples.en: I think Phil has to face the fact that she no longer loves him.

examples.ch: 我们必须正视现实——我们根本没有足够的钱。
examples.en: We have to face facts here - we simply don't have enough money.

examples.ch: 他命不久矣却拒不正视现实。
examples.en: He's dying but he refuses to face the truth.

defines.trans_ch: 面对，应对（不想见到的人）
defines.trans_en: to deal with someone when the situation between you is difficult

examples.ch: 她心存侥幸，希望他找不到她，可是她知道早晚有一天要面对他的。
examples.en: She half hoped he would not find her, though she knew she would have to face him sooner or later.

defines.trans_en: to turn or be turned towards something physically; to be opposite something

examples.ch: 阳台面对大海。
examples.en: The balcony faced towards the sea.

examples.ch: 我们的公寓朝南。
examples.en: Our apartment faces south.

examples.ch: 他们的房子隔街相望。
examples.en: Their houses face each other across the street.

defines.trans_ch: （在建筑物表面）覆盖，抹盖，贴上
defines.trans_en: If you face a building, you put an extra layer in front of what is already there.

examples.ch: 这栋房子是木质的，但表面砌上了砖。
examples.en: The house was built of wood but faced in/with brick.

phrases.trans_en: to not want to do or deal with something unpleasant

examples.ch: 我可受不了再爬一遍那些台阶。
examples.en: I can't face walking up all those steps again.

examples.ch: 我知道我必须告诉她，可我就是没法这么做。
examples.en: I know I've got to tell her but I can't face it.

defines.trans_en: a building or set of buildings where large amounts of goods are made using machines

examples.ch: 汽车／制鞋／纺织厂
examples.en: a car/shoe/textile factory

examples.ch: 工厂工人／经理
examples.en: a factory worker/manager

defines.trans_en: someone who admires and supports a person, sport, sports team, etc.

examples.ch: 超过15 000名利物浦队球迷周六到现场观看了比赛。
examples.en: More than 15,000 Liverpool fans attended Saturday's game.

examples.ch: 他是个超级乡村音乐迷。
examples.en: He's a great fan of country music.

examples.ch: 很高兴见到您——我非常喜欢您的作品。
examples.en: I'm pleased to meet you - I'm a big fan of your work.

defines.trans_en: an electric device with blades that turn quickly, used to move the air around

examples.ch: 没有空调，只有一个屋顶吊扇在缓慢转动。
examples.en: There was no air conditioning, just a ceiling fan turning slowly.

defines.trans_en: an object made of folded paper or other material that you wave with your hand in order to move the air around

examples.ch: 很多西班牙妇女现在仍然在炎热的夏季使用扇子让自己凉快。
examples.en: Fans are still used by many Spanish women during their hot summer as a means of keeping cool.

defines.trans_en: to wave a fan, or something that acts as a fan, in front of your face

examples.ch: 车里太热，我试着用地图给自己扇凉。
examples.en: It was so hot in the car that I tried to fan myself with the road map.

examples.ch: 她坐下来，开始冲着脸扇凉。
examples.en: She sat down and began fanning her face.

defines.trans_en: to blow air at a fire to make it burn more strongly
to encourage bad emotions or behaviour to get worse

examples.ch: 煽动暴力／激起仇恨
examples.en: to fan the violence/hatred

examples.ch: 报纸故意煽动公众对失业的恐惧心理。
examples.en: The newspapers deliberately fanned the public's fears of losing their jobs.

defines.trans_en: to not succeed in what you are trying to achieve or are expected to do

examples.ch: 她搬到伦敦，希望找做模特的工作，但没找到。
examples.en: She moved to London in the hope of finding work as a model, but failed.

examples.ch: 这种种植西红柿的方法屡试不爽。
examples.en: This method of growing tomatoes never fails.

examples.ch: 他未能打破纪录。
examples.en: He failed in his attempt to break the record.

examples.ch: 今年她未能进入温布尔登网球赛决赛。
examples.en: She failed to reach the Wimbledon Final this year.

examples.ch: 双方均不愿让步意味着会谈注定要失败。
examples.en: The reluctance of either side to compromise means that the talks are doomed to (= will certainly) fail.

defines.trans_en: to be unsuccessful, or to judge that someone has been unsuccessful, in a test or exam

examples.ch: 我通过了历史考试，但化学考试没及格。
examples.en: I passed in history but failed in chemistry.

examples.ch: 我通过了历史考试，但化学考试没及格。
examples.en: I passed history but failed chemistry.

examples.ch: 许多人首次驾驶执照考试都通不过。
examples.en: A lot of people fail their driving test the first time.

examples.ch: 她肯定自己考试通不过。
examples.en: She was sure she was going to fail.

examples.ch: 主考人给了他不及格，因为他没有答够规定的题数。
examples.en: The examiners failed him because he hadn't answered enough questions.

defines.trans_en: to not do something that you should do

examples.ch: 他未能准时到达。
examples.en: He failed to arrive on time.

examples.ch: 员工们得到加薪的承诺，可是钱却没有到位。
examples.en: The staff had been promised a rise, but the money failed to (= did not) materialize.

examples.ch: 你不可能不被这部影片打动。
examples.en: You couldn't fail to be (= it is impossible that you would not be) affected by the movie.

examples.ch: 我如果不把这个项目涉及的风险告诉你，就是失职
examples.en: I'd be failing in my duty if I didn't tell you about the risks involved in the project.

defines.trans_en: to become weaker or stop working completely

examples.ch: 如果视力衰退，我就得放弃这份工作。
examples.en: If my eyesight fails, I'll have to stop doing this job.

examples.ch: 刹车失灵，汽车撞到了树上。
examples.en: The brakes failed and the car crashed into a tree.

examples.ch: 滔滔不绝地讲了两个钟头之后，她的声音开始嘶哑了。
examples.en: After talking non-stop for two hours, her voice started to fail.

examples.ch: 老人奄奄一息。
examples.en: The old man was failing fast (= he was dying).

defines.trans_en: If a business fails, it is unable to continue because of money problems.
to not help someone when you are expected to do so

examples.ch: 她最需要他的时候，他却辜负了她。
examples.en: He failed her in her moment of need.

examples.ch: 当我往下看，看到自己要跳多远时，就泄了气。
examples.en: When I looked down and saw how far I had to jump, my courage failed me (= I felt very frightened).

phrases.trans_en: if none of our plans succeed

examples.ch: 如果其他的都行不通，我们总是可以呆在家里看电视。
examples.en: If all else fails, we can always stay in and watch TV.

phrases.trans_en: used when you do not accept something

examples.ch: 我不懂为什么你星期六不能工作。
examples.en: I fail to see why you can't work on a Saturday.

defines.trans_en: an unsuccessful result in a course, test, or exam

examples.ch: 约翰考试3门及格，4门不及格。
examples.en: John got three passes and four fails in his exams.

defines.trans_en: something that has been done very badly or gone completely wrong; a failure

examples.ch: 我做的薄煎饼太失败了。
examples.en: My pancakes were an epic fail (= completely unsuccessful).

examples.ch: 每次我一打开邮件这个软件就停止运行。太糟糕了！
examples.en: The software crashes every time I open an email. What a fail.

phrases.trans_en: If you do something without fail, you always do it.

examples.ch: 我每周一和周三必定去健身房。
examples.en: I go to the gym every Monday and Wednesday, without fail.

phrases.trans_en: used to tell someone that they must do something

examples.ch: 9点钟务必到那里。
examples.en: Be there at nine o'clock, without fail.

defines.trans_ch: 合理的；公平的；公正的；平等待人的
defines.trans_en: treating someone in a way that is right or reasonable, or treating a group of people equally and not allowing personal opinions to influence your judgment

examples.ch: 公正的审判
examples.en: a fair trial

examples.ch: 为什么我要做所有的打扫工作？这不公平！
examples.en: Why should I have to do all the cleaning? It's not fair!

examples.ch: 所有的工作都让乔做，这对他不公平！
examples.en: It's not fair on Joe (= it is not right) to make him do all the work!

examples.ch: 允许她去，却不许我去，这不公平！
examples.en: It's not fair that she's allowed to go and I'm not!

examples.ch: 把一切都怪在我头上，这不公平！
examples.en: It's not fair to blame me for everything!

examples.ch: 她对所有的员工都一视同仁。
examples.en: She's scrupulously fair with all her employees (= she treats them all equally).

examples.ch: 她声称她的文章是对公众利益问题提出的公正合理的意见。
examples.en: She claims her article was a fair comment on (= a reasonable thing to say about) a matter of public interest.

examples.ch: 他提议如果我做饭，他就打扫卫生，这似乎挺公平合理的。
examples.en: He offered to do all the cleaning if I did all the cooking, which seemed like a fair (= reasonable) deal.

defines.trans_en: If something is fair, it is reasonable and is what you expect or deserve.

examples.ch: 我觉得她的报价是合理的。
examples.en: I thought it was a fair price that she was offering.

examples.ch: 我愿意做我应该承担的那份工作。
examples.en: I'm willing to do my fair (= equal) share of the work.

examples.ch: 工人们想要的只是对他们的工作来说合理的报酬。
examples.en: All the workers want is a fair wage for the work that they do.

defines.trans_en: If a game or competition is fair, it is done according to the rules.

examples.ch: 这是一场公平的拳击赛。
examples.en: It was a fair fight.

defines.trans_ch: （皮肤）白皙的;（头发）浅黄的，金色的
defines.trans_en: (of skin) pale, or (of hair) pale yellow or gold

examples.ch: 她金发碧眼。
examples.en: She's got fair hair and blue eyes.

examples.ch: 白皙的肤色
examples.en: a fair complexion

examples.ch: 我姐姐是黑发，哥哥是金发。
examples.en: My sister has dark hair but my brother's fair (= he has fair hair).

examples.ch: 他有一头浅色头发。
examples.en: He's fair-haired.

examples.ch: 我们全家人皮肤都很白。
examples.en: All my family are fair-skinned.

defines.trans_en: quite large

examples.ch: 这周我们这里下了不少雨。
examples.en: We've had a fair amount of rain this week.

examples.ch: 我们已经有相当多的求职者。
examples.en: We've had a fair number of applicants.

examples.ch: 这是一座不小的花园。
examples.en: It's a fair-sized garden.

examples.ch: 我们已经走了很长的路，但是还要走很久。
examples.en: We've come a long way, but there's still a fair way (= quite a long distance) to go.

defines.trans_en: neither very good nor very bad

examples.ch: 影片被评为优、良、中、差四等。
examples.en: Films are rated on a scale of poor, fair, good and excellent.

examples.ch: 我理科成绩还算过得去，但我从来都不喜欢理科。
examples.en: I was fair at science but it was never my thing.

defines.trans_ch: （想法、猜测或机会）相当好的，不错的
defines.trans_en: (of an idea, guess, or chance) good, but not excellent

examples.ch: 我想我很了解你想要什么。
examples.en: I think I've got a fair idea of (= I understand reasonably well) what you want.

examples.ch: 她获胜的可能性相当大。
examples.en: She's got a fair chance of winning (= there is a reasonable chance that she will win).

defines.trans_en: (of weather) pleasant and dry

examples.ch: 天气预报说次日天晴。
examples.en: Fair weather was forecast for the following day.

defines.trans_en: (of a woman) beautiful

examples.ch: 美丽的少女
examples.en: a fair maiden

phrases.trans_ch: 只有…才合理；只有…才正确
phrases.trans_en: it is the right way to treat someone and what they deserve

examples.ch: 我认为应该告诉你一声，已经有300多人应聘这份工作了。
examples.en: I think it's only fair to tell you that we have had over 300 applications for this job.

phrases.trans_en: it is true to say

examples.ch: 我觉得说你工作做得比我少是合乎实情的。
examples.en: I think it's fair to say (that) you've done less of the work than I have.

phrases.trans_en: considering everything that has an effect on a situation, so that a fair judgment can be made

examples.ch: 他工作干得很糟糕，但是说句公道话，我给他的时间非常少。
examples.en: He's done the job badly but, to be fair, I gave him very little time to do it.

phrases.trans_en: something you say to show that you understand why someone has done or said something

examples.ch: “令我感到不快的是他太没礼貌了。”“说得没错。”
examples.en: "I'm just annoyed with him because he's behaved so badly." "Fair enough."

phrases.trans_en: something that you say when you want someone to behave reasonably or treat you the same as other people

examples.ch: 得了吧，轮到我了。公正一点！
examples.en: Come on, it's my turn. Fair's fair!

phrases.trans_en: an opportunity to explain something or give your opinions, without other people trying to influence the situation

examples.ch: 他觉得在法庭上没有得到公正的申辩机会。
examples.en: He didn't think that he got a fair hearing in court.

phrases.trans_en: in an honest way and without any doubt

examples.ch: 这场比赛我们赢得光明正大。
examples.en: We won the match fair and square.

phrases.trans_en: If you hit someone fair and square on a particular part of their body, you hit that person hard, exactly on that part.

examples.ch: 他不偏不倚正打中我的鼻子。
examples.en: He hit me fair and square on the nose.

defines.trans_en: a large public event where goods are bought and sold, usually from tables that have been specially arranged for the event, and where there is often entertainment

examples.ch: 我在当地的手工艺品集市上买了个木制色拉碗。
examples.en: I bought a wooden salad bowl at the local craft fair.

defines.trans_en: an outside event where you can ride on large machines for pleasure and play games to win prizes

defines.trans_ch: 商品展销会，商品交易会
defines.trans_en: a large show at which people who work in a particular industry meet, and sell and advertise their products

examples.ch: 书展／古玩交易会／玩具展销会
examples.en: a book/antiques/toy fair

examples.ch: 商品交易会
examples.en: a trade fair

defines.trans_en: a public event in the countryside where farm animals and farm products are sold

examples.ch: 县／州农畜产品集市
examples.en: a county/state fair

examples.ch: 牲畜／农产品集市
examples.en: a cattle/agricultural fair

defines.trans_en: a public event, often held outside, where you can take part in competitions and buy small things and food, often organized to collect money for a particular purpose

examples.ch: 学校游乐会
examples.en: the school fair

defines.trans_en: to suddenly go down onto the ground or towards the ground without intending to or by accident

examples.ch: 小路很陡，当心别摔倒。
examples.en: The path's very steep, so be careful you don't fall.

examples.ch: 他重重跌倒，摔断了腿。
examples.en: He fell badly and broke his leg.

examples.ch: 运动员必须学会跌倒时不伤到自己。
examples.en: Athletes have to learn how to fall without hurting themselves.

examples.ch: 那匹马在跳跃第一道障碍物时就摔倒了。
examples.en: The horse fell at the first fence.

examples.ch: 我跌下楼梯，后背受了伤。
examples.en: I fell down the stairs and injured my back.

examples.ch: 这件物体似乎是从很高的地方落下来的。
examples.en: The object appeared to have fallen from a great height.

examples.ch: 这里的水很深，别掉进去了！
examples.en: The water's deep here, so don't fall in!

examples.ch: 她滑了一下，摔倒在冰上。
examples.en: She slipped and fell on the ice.

examples.ch: 他掉进了河里，需要救援。
examples.en: He fell into the river and had to be rescued.

examples.ch: 我从自行车上掉下来，摔坏了膝盖。
examples.en: I fell off my bike and scraped my knee.

examples.ch: 他从窗户探身出去，差一点摔下去了。
examples.en: He was leaning out of the window and almost fell out.

examples.ch: 她跌到公共汽车下面，当场被轧死了。
examples.en: She fell under a bus and was killed instantly.

examples.ch: 她跌进了5米深的沟底。
examples.en: She fell five metres to the bottom of the ravine.

examples.ch: 他在攀登马特峰时摔死了。
examples.en: He fell to his death climbing the Matterhorn.

defines.trans_en: to become lower in size, amount, or strength

examples.ch: 由于经济衰退，对新车的需求减少了。
examples.en: Demand for new cars has fallen due to the recession.

examples.ch: 这一年中他的工作水平下降了。
examples.en: The standard of his work has fallen during the year.

examples.ch: 今年国有企业的工资预计下降15%。
examples.en: Salaries in the public sector are expected to fall by 15 percent this year.

examples.ch: 气温可能一夜间突降到零度以下。
examples.en: The temperature could fall below zero overnight.

examples.ch: 平均气温下降了10度。
examples.en: Average temperatures fell by ten degrees.

examples.ch: 英镑对美元的汇率下跌到历史最低水平。
examples.en: The pound has fallen to its lowest-ever level against the dollar.

examples.ch: 老师一走进来，孩子们便压低了声音小声讲话。
examples.en: When the teacher walked in, the children's voices fell to a whisper (= they became very quiet).

examples.ch: 本周股价骤跌。
examples.en: Share prices fell sharply this week.

defines.trans_en: to come down onto the ground or from a high position to a lower position

examples.ch: 雪持续下了一整天。
examples.en: The snow had been falling steadily all day.

examples.ch: 十月了，树叶开始掉落。
examples.en: It was October and the leaves had started to fall.

examples.ch: 她筋疲力尽，倒在床上。
examples.en: She fell into bed, completely exhausted.

examples.ch: 一颗炸弹落在教堂上，把教堂炸毁了。
examples.en: A bomb fell on the church and destroyed it.

examples.ch: 一颗巨大的流星陨落到地球上，落在沙漠中央。
examples.en: A huge meteor fell to Earth in the middle of the desert.

examples.ch: 他挨打时求饶了。
examples.en: He begged for mercy as the blows fell on him (= as he was being hit).

defines.trans_en: When the curtain falls in the theatre, it comes down because the play or performance has ended.

examples.ch: 演出结束时观众们仍在大笑。
examples.en: The audience was still laughing as the curtain fell.

defines.trans_ch: 属于（某一群体、学科或领域）
defines.trans_en: to belong to a particular group, subject, or area

examples.ch: 这种材料分为3类。
examples.en: The material falls into three categories.

examples.ch: 纪律方面的事不是我负责的。
examples.en: Matters of discipline fall outside my area of responsibility.

defines.trans_en: to change to a particular condition from a different one

examples.ch: 他喝完红酒总是会睡着。
examples.en: He always falls asleep after drinking red wine.

examples.ch: 她突然病倒了。
examples.en: She suddenly fell ill.

examples.ch: 碰巧翻开书上关于威尼斯的那一页。
examples.en: The book fell open (= opened by chance) at a picture of Venice.

examples.ch: 在控枪问题上，总统奇怪地变得十分沉默。
examples.en: The president has fallen strangely silent on the issue of gun control.

examples.ch: 你的房租每月1号须缴付。
examples.en: Your rent falls due (= must be paid) on the first of the month.

examples.ch: 听到这个消息，他们沉默了。
examples.en: Silence fell on the group of men (= they became silent) as they received the news.

examples.ch: 她开始受到一名高年级学生的影响。
examples.en: She fell under the influence of (= began to be influenced by) an older student.

defines.trans_en: to be beaten or defeated

examples.ch: 在军事政变中总统被推翻。
examples.en: The president fell from power during the military coup.

examples.ch: 失去中间党派支持之后，这届政府最终垮台了。
examples.en: The government finally fell after losing the support of the centre parties.

defines.trans_en: If a place falls in a war or an election, an enemy army or a different political party gets control of it.

examples.ch: 罗马在公元455年被汪达尔人攻陷。
examples.en: Rome fell to the Vandals in AD 455.

examples.ch: 在保守党主导10年之后，这个选区在上届选举中落入了工党手中。
examples.en: The constituency fell to Labour at the last election, after ten years of Conservative rule.

defines.trans_en: If soldiers fall while fighting, they are killed.

examples.ch: 为保卫这座城市，许多勇士战死了。
examples.en: Many brave men fell in the fight to save the city.

examples.ch: 战争中他目睹了许多战友的阵亡。
examples.en: During the war, he saw many of his comrades fall in battle.

defines.trans_en: In cricket, when a wicket falls, the turn of the player who is hitting the ball ends.

examples.ch: 在22次连续投球中，10名击球手被淘汰出局。
examples.en: Ten wickets fell in 22 overs.

defines.trans_en: to come at a particular time or happen in a particular place

examples.ch: 今年的复活节来得迟。
examples.en: Easter falls late this year.

examples.ch: 今年我的生日在星期五。
examples.en: My birthday will fall on a Friday this year.

examples.ch: 我们返回营地时夜幕已经降临。
examples.en: Night/Darkness had fallen by the time we got back to the camp.

examples.ch: table这个词的重音落在第一个音节上。
examples.en: In the word "table", the accent falls on the first syllable.

examples.ch: 财政部尚未决定削减哪些开支。
examples.en: The Treasury has still not decided where the cuts will fall.

defines.trans_en: to hang down loosely

examples.ch: 男孩的金色卷发垂在肩上。
examples.en: The boy's hair fell around his shoulders in golden curls.

examples.ch: 面纱几乎垂到她的腰际。
examples.en: The veil fell almost to her waist.

phrases.trans_en: to fall and land with your face down

examples.ch: 可怜的凯茜脸朝下跌进了泥里。
examples.en: Poor Kathy fell flat on her face in the mud.

phrases.trans_en: to go down on your knees to show respect

examples.ch: 人们都跪了下来，开始祈祷。
examples.en: The people all fell to their knees and began to pray.

phrases.trans_ch: 脸色变阴沉／情绪变低落
phrases.trans_en: If your face falls, you suddenly look unhappy or disappointed, and if your spirits fall, you suddenly feel unhappy or disappointed.

examples.ch: 一看到还要走的路程距离，他立刻情绪低落起来。
examples.en: His spirits fell when he saw the distance he still had to go.

examples.ch: 看到考试成绩，她的脸阴沉下来。
examples.en: As she read her exam results, her face fell.

defines.trans_ch: （规模、数量或力量的）减少，降低
defines.trans_en: the fact of the size, amount, or strength of something getting lower

examples.ch: 汽油价格的下跌／失业率的降低
examples.en: a fall in the price of petrol/the unemployment rate

examples.ch: 我们能听见另一间屋里忽高忽低的讲话声。
examples.en: We could hear the rise and fall of voices in the other room.

examples.ch: 上届选举时，该党的支持率下跌了。
examples.en: There was a fall in support for the party at the last election.

defines.trans_en: the season after summer and before winter, when fruits and crops become ready to eat and the leaves fall off the trees

examples.ch: 我秋天开始上大学。
examples.en: I'm starting college in the fall.

examples.ch: 我们明年秋天回纽约。
examples.en: Next fall we'll be back in New York.

examples.ch: 一个秋日/秋天的清晨
examples.en: a fall day/morning

examples.ch: 秋日的色彩/秋叶
examples.en: fall colours/foliage

defines.trans_en: the act of falling down to the ground, usually without intending to or by accident

examples.ch: 他重重跌了一跤，伤了脊背。
examples.en: He had/took a nasty fall and hurt his back.

examples.ch: 柏林墙的倒塌
examples.en: the fall of the Berlin Wall (= when the Berlin Wall was destroyed)

defines.trans_en: an amount of something that moves down onto the ground or from a higher position to a lower position

examples.ch: 一场大雪
examples.en: a heavy fall of snow

defines.trans_en: the fact of being defeated or losing your power

examples.ch: 罗马的陷落
examples.en: the fall of Rome

examples.ch: 总统垮台后，军队控制了这座城市。
examples.en: The army took control of the city after the president's fall from power.

phrases.trans_en: often used in place names to mean a very wide waterfall, often made of many separate waterfalls

examples.ch: 尼亚加拉瀑布
examples.en: Niagara Falls

defines.trans_en: a group of people who are related to each other, such as a mother, a father, and their children

examples.ch: 隔壁新搬来一户人家。
examples.en: A new family has/have moved in next door.

examples.ch: 我来自一个大家庭，有三个兄弟，两个姐妹。
examples.en: I come from a large family - I have three brothers and two sisters.

examples.ch: 他没有任何亲人。
examples.en: He doesn't have any family.

examples.ch: 他是美国人，但他的祖籍是爱尔兰。
examples.en: He's American but his family (= relatives in the past) come/comes from Ireland.

examples.ch: 这部电影是很棒的家庭娱乐片。
examples.en: This movie is good family entertainment (= something that can be enjoyed by parents and children together).

examples.ch: 你对家庭生活还满意吗？
examples.en: How do you like family life (= being married, having children, etc.)?

defines.trans_en: the children of a family

examples.ch: 在事业与家庭之间，女人不应该只能选择其一。
examples.en: Women shouldn't have to choose between career and family (= having children).

examples.ch: 保罗和安娜期待着不久能生个小孩。
examples.en: Paul and Ana are hoping to start a family (= have children) soon.

examples.ch: 我们很小的时候爸爸就去世了，因此是妈妈一个人拉扯大了孩子。
examples.en: My dad died when we were small so my mum raised the family on her own.

defines.trans_en: a pair of adult animals and their babies

examples.ch: 我们的花园里住着一窝松鼠。
examples.en: We've got a family of squirrels living in our garden.

defines.trans_en: a large group of related types of animal or plant

examples.ch: 狮子属猫科。
examples.en: The lion is a member of the cat family.

defines.trans_en: known and recognized by many people

examples.ch: 著名的女演员／建筑
examples.en: a famous actress/building

examples.ch: 玛丽‧居里以其对科学的贡献而享有盛名。
examples.en: Marie Curie is famous for her contribution to science.

examples.ch: 以夜生活闻名的城市
examples.en: a city famous for its nightlife

defines.trans_en: at, to, or from a great distance in space or time

examples.ch: 从澳大利亚到新西兰有多远？
examples.en: How far is it from Australia to New Zealand?

examples.ch: 火车站远吗？
examples.en: Is the station far away?

examples.ch: 她住处离这儿不远。
examples.en: She doesn't live far from here.

examples.ch: 他觉得自己孤独寂寞，远离家乡。
examples.en: He felt lonely and far from home.

examples.ch: 有朝一日，也许是遥远的将来的某一天，你会为你的所作所为后悔的。
examples.en: One day, perhaps far in/into the future, you'll regret what you've done.

defines.trans_en: very much

examples.ch: 这部车比咱们那部旧的好多了。
examples.en: This car is far better than our old one.

examples.ch: 这花费远远超出了我的承受能力。
examples.en: It cost far more (money) than I could afford.

examples.ch: 他太爱发脾气了。
examples.en: He loses his temper far too often.

examples.ch: 去剧院看戏也比看录像好太多了。
examples.en: I'd far rather/sooner go to the theatre than watch a DVD.

phrases.trans_en: used to say what you think is true, although you do not know all the facts

examples.ch: 据我所知，他今天不来。
examples.en: He isn't coming today, as far as I know.

phrases.trans_en: used to say what your personal opinion is about something

examples.ch: 就我而言，她什么时候想来都可以。
examples.en: She can come whenever she likes, as far as I'm concerned.

phrases.text: as/so far as I can tell
phrases.trans_en: used to say what you have noticed or understood

examples.ch: 依我看，一直都没有变化。
examples.en: There's been no change, as far as I can tell.

phrases.text: far be it from/for me to
phrases.trans_ch: 我绝不想（绝不会、绝不敢等）
phrases.trans_en: I certainly would not

examples.ch: 我决不敢告诉你该如何生活。
examples.en: Far be it from me to tell you how to run your life.

phrases.trans_en: certainly not something

examples.ch: 形势还远未明朗。
examples.en: The situation is far from clear.

phrases.trans_en: used to describe something that is almost the opposite of something else

examples.ch: 她坚称，情况非但不容易，相反从各个方面来说都是一段很困难的时期。
examples.en: She insisted that, far from being easy, it would be a difficult period for all concerned.

phrases.trans_en: certainly not

examples.ch: 他并不英俊——完全算不上。
examples.en: He's not handsome - far from it.

phrases.trans_en: from a large number of places

examples.ch: 人们从各地前来参观这所房子。
examples.en: People came from far and wide to see the house.

phrases.text: go so far as to do sth
phrases.trans_en: to be willing to do something that is extreme

examples.ch: 挺好的，但是我不会极端到说棒极了。
examples.en: It's good, but I wouldn't go so far as to say that it's great.

phrases.trans_en: until now

examples.ch: 到目前为止，我们已经赚了32000英镑。
examples.en: So far we've made £32,000.

phrases.trans_ch: 到目前为止，一切还算顺利
phrases.trans_en: used to say that an activity has gone well until now

examples.ch: 我找到了一听豆子。到现在为止一切还不错。但罐头起子在哪儿呢？
examples.en: I've found a tin of beans. So far so good, but where is the tin opener?

phrases.trans_en: by a great amount

examples.ch: 他们是班里最最优秀的学生。
examples.en: They are by far the best students in the class.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to something that is not near, or the part of something that is most distant from the centre or from you

examples.ch: 车站不远——我们可以很轻松地走过去。
examples.en: The station isn't far - we could easily walk there.

examples.ch: 孩子们跑向房间的另一头／尽头的角落。
examples.en: The children ran to the far side/corner of the room.

phrases.trans_en: used to refer to political groups whose opinions are very extreme

examples.ch: 极左派的支持者
examples.en: supporters of the far left

defines.trans_en: an area of land, together with a house and buildings, used for growing crops and/or keeping animals as a business

examples.ch: 乳牛场
examples.en: a dairy farm

examples.ch: 农场的牲畜
examples.en: farm animals

examples.ch: 新鲜农产品
examples.en: fresh farm produce

examples.ch: 农场工人
examples.en: farm workers

examples.ch: 她的夏天在农场劳作中度过了。
examples.en: She spent the summer working on a farm.

defines.trans_en: a place where a particular type of animal is kept in large numbers in order to be sold

examples.ch: 养羊场／养鱼场
examples.en: a sheep/fish farm

defines.trans_en: to use land for growing crops and/or keeping animals as a business

examples.ch: 斯坦福德家族已在这片土地上耕作逾100年了。
examples.en: The Stamfords have farmed this land for over a hundred years.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指服装、发式、妆容的）流行款式，时兴式样
defines.trans_en: a style that is popular at a particular time, especially in clothes, hair, make-up, etc.

examples.ch: 男士又时兴留长发了。
examples.en: Long hair is back in fashion for men.

examples.ch: 皮草大衣已经过时了。
examples.en: Fur coats have gone out of fashion.

examples.ch: 以运动和时尚为主题的节目
examples.en: a programme with features on sport and fashion

examples.ch: 她总是穿着最新款式的服装。
examples.en: She always wears the latest fashions.

defines.trans_en: a way of doing things

examples.ch: 叛军行事残忍。
examples.en: The rebel army behaved in a brutal fashion.

phrases.trans_en: to do what is popular at the time

phrases.text: like it's going out of fashion
phrases.trans_en: If you use something like it's going out of fashion, you use large amounts of it very quickly.

examples.ch: 埃玛花钱如流水。
examples.en: Emma spends money like it's going out of fashion.

phrases.trans_en: If you can do something after a fashion, you can do it, but not well.

examples.ch: 我会做饭，但做得不太好。
examples.en: I can cook, after a fashion.

defines.trans_en: to make something using your hands

examples.ch: 他用报纸给自己做了一顶帽子。
examples.en: He fashioned a hat for himself from/out of newspaper.

defines.trans_en: moving or happening quickly, or able to move or happen quickly

examples.ch: 速度快的汽车
examples.en: fast cars

examples.ch: 速度快的游泳者
examples.en: a fast swimmer

examples.ch: 计算机的速度在不断提升。
examples.en: Computers are getting faster all the time.

examples.ch: 到伦敦的快车需时不到一小时。
examples.en: The fast train (= one that stops at fewer stations and travels quickly) to London takes less than an hour.

defines.trans_en: If your watch or clock is fast, it shows a time that is later than the correct time.
used to refer to photographic film that allows you to take pictures when there is not much light or when things are moving quickly
without moral principles

examples.ch: 一群生活放荡的人
examples.en: a fast crowd

examples.ch: 淫妇
examples.en: a fast woman

defines.trans_en: If the colour of a piece of clothing is fast, the colour does not come out of the cloth when it is washed.

phrases.trans_ch: 快速激烈的，充满速度与激情的
phrases.trans_en: used to describe something that is full of speed and excitement

examples.ch: 这不是一部轻松的电影——它节奏很快，扣人心弦。
examples.en: It's not a relaxing movie - it's pretty fast and furious.

defines.trans_en: quickly

examples.ch: 事故是因恶劣环境下驾驶速度过快造成的。
examples.en: The accident was caused by people driving too fast in bad conditions.

examples.ch: 你必须迅速行动。
examples.en: You'll have to act fast.

examples.ch: 儿童出版是一个发展迅速的行业。
examples.en: Children's publishing is a fast-growing business.

defines.trans_en: firmly fixed

examples.ch: 胶水凝固了，我的手被牢牢粘住。
examples.en: The glue had set and my hand was stuck fast.

examples.ch: 他想逃走，但是她紧紧抓住了他。
examples.en: He tried to get away, but she held him fast.

defines.trans_en: a period of time when you eat no food

examples.ch: 数百名犯人开始绝食，抗议监狱条件太差。
examples.en: Hundreds of prisoners began a fast in protest about prison conditions.

defines.trans_en: to eat no food for a period of time

examples.ch: 他出于健康考虑每周禁食一天。
examples.en: One day a week he fasts for health reasons.

defines.trans_en: hot food such as hamburgers that is quick to cook or is already cooked and is therefore served very quickly in a restaurant
having a lot of flesh on the body

examples.ch: 与大多数女性一样，她觉得自己很胖。
examples.en: Like most women, she thinks she's fat.

examples.ch: 我讨厌自己的粗大腿。
examples.en: I hate my fat thighs.

examples.ch: 他总是在吃，但从来不长胖。
examples.en: He eats all the time but he never gets fat.

defines.trans_en: thick or large

examples.ch: 他递给我一个厚厚的信封，里面装满了钱。
examples.en: He passed me a fat envelope full of money.

examples.ch: 一些矿泉水生产商获得了丰厚的利润。
examples.en: Some producers of mineral water have made fat profits.

defines.trans_en: used in some phrases to mean very little or none

examples.ch: 你一点儿用都没有！
examples.en: A fat lot of use you are! (= You are not useful in any way.)

examples.ch: 他知道那让我心烦意乱，但他根本不关心。
examples.en: He knows it upsets me, but a fat lot he cares (= he doesn't care).

defines.trans_en: the substance under the skin of humans and animals that stores energy and keeps them warm

examples.ch: 身体脂肪
examples.en: body fat

examples.ch: 女性有一层皮下脂肪，使她们比男性更耐寒。
examples.en: Women have a layer of subcutaneous fat (= fat under the skin), which provides them with better insulation than men.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指用于烹饪的）动物油，植物油
defines.trans_en: a solid or liquid substance from animals or plants and used especially in cooking

examples.ch: 本产品不含动物油脂。
examples.en: This product contains no animal fat.

examples.ch: 植物油
examples.en: vegetable fats

defines.trans_en: a male parent

examples.ch: 我父亲每周六带我去看足球赛。
examples.en: My father took me to watch the football every Saturday.

examples.ch: 孩子们的父亲到学校来接他们。
examples.en: The children's father came to pick them up from school.

examples.ch: 我可以走了吗，爸爸？
examples.en: Please may I go, Father?

defines.trans_ch: （尤指天主教或东正教的）神父
defines.trans_en: (the title of) a Christian priest, especially a Roman Catholic or Orthodox priest

examples.ch: 奥赖利神父
examples.en: Father O'Reilly

examples.ch: 您要布道吗，神父？
examples.en: Are you giving a sermon, Father?

defines.trans_en: a name for the Christian God

examples.ch: 上帝
examples.en: God the Father

examples.ch: 我们的天父…
examples.en: Our Father, who art in heaven...

defines.trans_en: to become the father of a child by making a woman pregnant

examples.ch: 他是3个孩子的父亲。
examples.en: He's fathered three children.

defines.trans_en: best liked or most enjoyed

examples.ch: “你最喜欢甚么颜色？”“绿色。”
examples.en: "What's your favourite colour?" "Green."

examples.ch: 我最喜欢的餐馆／书／歌曲
examples.en: my favourite restaurant/book/song

phrases.trans_ch: 最不喜欢的；特别不喜欢的
phrases.trans_en: liked or enjoyed the least

examples.ch: 打扫厕所是我最不喜欢的工作。
examples.en: Cleaning the toilets is my least favourite job.

defines.trans_ch: 最喜欢的东西;特别喜爱的东西
defines.trans_en: a thing that someone likes best or enjoys most

examples.ch: 你真聪明，买了带巧克力颗粒的饼干——这是我的最爱。
examples.en: How clever of you to buy chocolate chip cookies - they're my favourites.

defines.trans_en: a person who is treated with special kindness by someone in authority

examples.ch: 老师的宠儿
examples.en: the teacher's favourite

defines.trans_ch: 最有希望获胜的人（或动物）;比赛中最被看好的人（或动物）
defines.trans_en: the person or animal most people expect to win a race or competition

examples.ch: 巨金被认为最有希望在埃普索姆赛马会中获得两英里赛的冠军。
examples.en: Great Gold is the favourite in the 2.00 race at Epsom.

examples.ch: 巴西队是今年世界杯赛的夺冠热门。
examples.en: Brazil are favourites to win this year's World Cup.

defines.trans_en: to experience something physical or emotional

examples.ch: “你感觉如何？”“不算太糟，但我还是有点轻微的头痛。”
examples.en: "How are you feeling?" "Not too bad, but I've still got a slight headache."

examples.ch: 你觉得搬到另外一座城市去怎么样？
examples.en: How would you feel about moving to a different city?

examples.ch: 手术后他仍感觉有点虚弱。
examples.en: He's still feeling a little weak after his operation.

examples.ch: 我的眼睛真的很痛。
examples.en: My eyes feel really sore.

examples.ch: 理查德开车时，我总是觉得不安全。
examples.en: I never feel safe when Richard is driving.

examples.ch: 她一辈子从未觉得这么开心过。
examples.en: Never in her life had she felt so happy.

examples.ch: 过了一会儿，我开始觉得手提箱沉起来。
examples.en: My suitcase began to feel really heavy after a while.

examples.ch: 我觉得自己是个十足的傻瓜。
examples.en: I felt like (= thought that I was) a complete idiot/such a fool.

examples.ch: 她感觉到脖颈上他热辣辣的气息。
examples.en: She felt his hot breath on her neck.

examples.ch: 我能感觉到汗水顺着后背淌下来。
examples.en: I could feel the sweat trickling down my back.

examples.ch: 到正午时，我们确实觉得热了。
examples.en: By midday, we were really feeling (= suffering from) the heat.

defines.trans_en: to have a particular opinion about or attitude towards something

examples.ch: 我认为我应该尽更大的力来帮助她。
examples.en: I feel (that) I should be doing more to help her.

examples.ch: 他总是觉得自己不如兄弟们。
examples.en: He had always felt himself (to be) inferior to his brothers.

examples.ch: 您对此很有意见吗？
examples.en: Do you feel very strongly (= have strong opinions) about this?

examples.ch: 我确信自己是对的。
examples.en: I feel certain I'm right.

defines.trans_en: to touch something in order to discover something about it

examples.ch: 摸摸我的手有多冷！
examples.en: Just feel how cold my hands are!

examples.ch: 他轻轻抚摸着婴儿柔软的脸颊。
examples.en: He gently felt the softness of the baby's cheek.

examples.ch: 我在包里摸索着找钥匙。
examples.en: I was feeling (around) (= searching with my hand) in my bag for the keys.

phrases.trans_en: to have a wish for something, or to want to do something, at a particular moment

examples.ch: 我想（去）游泳。
examples.en: I feel like (going for) a swim.

examples.ch: 我想喝一杯美味的冰柠檬汁。
examples.en: I feel like (having) a nice cool glass of lemonade.

examples.ch: “你去做有氧健身操吗？”“不，我今天不想去。”
examples.en: "Are you coming to aerobics?" "No, I don't feel like it today."

phrases.trans_en: to want to do something that you do not do

examples.ch: 他这么无礼，我真想掴他的脸。
examples.en: He was so rude I felt like slapping his face.

phrases.trans_en: to get cold quicker and more often than most people

examples.ch: 人上了年纪，往往会更怕冷。
examples.en: As you get older, you tend to feel the cold more.

phrases.trans_en: to not feel any pain

examples.ch: “疼吗？”“一点也不疼，什么感觉也没有。”
examples.en: "Did it hurt?" "Not at all - I didn't feel a thing."

defines.trans_en: the way that something feels

examples.ch: 她喜欢丝绸贴着皮肤的感觉。
examples.en: She loved the feel of silk against her skin.

defines.trans_en: the action of touching something

examples.ch: 那件衬衫是丝绸的吗？哦，让我摸一摸吧！
examples.en: Is that shirt silk? Ooh, let me have a feel!

defines.trans_ch: （场所或情况给人的）感受，气氛；特质
defines.trans_en: the character of a place or situation

examples.ch: 我喜欢这种装饰，有西班牙风情。
examples.en: I like the decoration - it's got a Spanish feel to it.

examples.ch: 这个地方有种神秘感。
examples.en: There was a feel of mystery about the place.

examples.ch: 我们在那里逗留的时间太短了，没有真正领悟到那儿的特质。
examples.en: We were there for such a short time, we didn't really get the feel of (= get to know) the place.

phrases.trans_ch: （尤指在某学科或活动方面的）理解力，领悟力
phrases.trans_en: a natural understanding or ability, especially in a subject or activity

examples.ch: 她的语感很好。
examples.en: She has a real feel for language.

examples.ch: 我尝试过学钢琴，但是从来就没怎么入门。
examples.en: I tried learning the piano, but I never had much of a feel for it.

phrases.trans_en: to learn how to do something, usually a new activity

examples.ch: 你一旦学会了，用鼠标是很容易的。
examples.en: Once you get the feel of it, using a mouse is easy.

defines.trans_en: a special day or period, usually in memory of a religious event, with its own social activities, food, or ceremonies

examples.ch: 犹太教／基督教／印度教节日
examples.en: a Jewish/Christian/Hindu festival

defines.trans_en: an organized set of special events, such as musical performances

examples.ch: 民间音乐／流行音乐／摇滚音乐节
examples.en: a folk/pop/rock festival

examples.ch: 新奥尔良爵士乐节每年春天举行。
examples.en: The New Orleans Jazz Festival is held every year in the spring.

examples.ch: 戛纳电影节
examples.en: the Cannes Film Festival

defines.trans_ch: （用于 quite a few, a good few 等表达方式中） 许多，很多，大量
defines.trans_en: used in expressions such as "quite a few" to mean "quite a large number"

examples.ch: 我知道很多人也遇到了同样的问题。
examples.en: I know quite a few people who have had the same problem.

examples.ch: 俱乐部里的很多人都不满20岁，但是也有很多人已经过了20岁。
examples.en: Lots of people at the club are under 20, but there are quite a few who aren't.

phrases.trans_en: some, or a small number of something

examples.ch: 我需要到城里买几样东西。
examples.en: I need to get a few things in town.

examples.ch: 聚会上剩了一些蛋糕。
examples.en: There are a few slices of cake left over from the party.

examples.ch: 我们的这台新计算机一直有一些问题。
examples.en: We've been having a few problems with the new computer.

examples.ch: 如果你的车里装不下所有的袋子，可以在我的车里放几个。
examples.en: If you can't fit all the bags in your car, I can take a few in mine.

examples.ch: “你要多少土豆？”“哦，几个就够了，谢谢。”
examples.en: "How many potatoes do you want?" "Oh, just a few, please."

defines.trans_en: a small number or not many

examples.ch: 只有那么几个人去参加了聚会，真令人尴尬。
examples.en: It was embarrassing how few people attended the party.

examples.ch: 他是为数不多的几个我能信任的人之一。
examples.en: He is among the few people I can trust.

examples.ch: 没有几个人能付得起那样的价格。
examples.en: Very few people can afford to pay those prices.

examples.ch: 这些孩子中没有几个会读写。
examples.en: Few of the children can read or write yet.

examples.ch: 这个世界上没有多少比好好洗个澡更让我感到享受的事了。
examples.en: Few things in this world give me more pleasure than a long bath.

examples.ch: 我们很少接到投诉。
examples.en: We get few complaints.

examples.ch: 根据调查，仅有10%的人对自己的工作感到满意。
examples.en: According to the survey, as few as ten percent of us are happy with our jobs.

examples.ch: 这个计划没什么益处。
examples.en: The benefits of the planned changes are few.

phrases.trans_en: a smaller number

examples.ch: 现在吸烟的人比以往少了。
examples.en: Fewer people smoke these days than used to.

examples.ch: 我们接到的投诉比预计的少很多。
examples.en: We received far fewer complaints than expected.

examples.ch: 如今野生虎类还不到3500只。
examples.en: Fewer than 3,500 tigers are left in the wild today.

phrases.trans_en: not happening or existing very often

examples.ch: 既舒适又价格合理的公寓少之又少。
examples.en: Apartments that are both comfortable and reasonably priced are few and far between.

defines.trans_en: an area of land, used for growing crops or keeping animals, usually surrounded by a fence

examples.ch: 我们驱车经过快要成熟的麦田。
examples.en: We drove past fields of ripening wheat.

examples.ch: 奶牛全都站在牧场的一角。
examples.en: The cows were all standing in one corner of the field.

defines.trans_en: an area, usually covered with grass, used for playing sports

examples.ch: 学校操场/运动场
examples.en: the school playing/sports field

examples.ch: 足球／曲棍球／橄榄球场
examples.en: a football/hockey/rugby field

defines.trans_en: an area of activity or interest

examples.ch: 历史／科学／医学领域
examples.en: the field of history/science/medicine

examples.ch: 你还在干老本行吗？
examples.en: Are you still in the same field (= are you doing the same type of work)?

defines.trans_ch: （参加比赛或活动的）全体运动员，全体人员
defines.trans_en: all the competitors taking part in a race or activity

examples.ch: 比赛开始时有11匹马，但有两匹马摔倒了。
examples.en: The race started with a field of eleven, but two horses fell.

examples.ch: 今天下午我们阵容强大。
examples.en: We have a strong field this afternoon.

examples.ch: 琼斯率先到达终点。
examples.en: Jones finished ahead of the field.

defines.trans_en: a division of a database (= a collection of similar information on a computer) that contains a particular type of information, such as names or numbers

phrases.trans_en: a place where you are working or studying in real situations, rather than from an office, laboratory, etc.

examples.ch: 我和一位最近刚从现场归来的援救人员谈过。
examples.en: I spoke to an aid worker who had recently returned from the field.

phrases.trans_en: to go onto the field at the start of a game

examples.ch: 爱尔兰队进场时欢声大作。
examples.en: There were loud cheers as the Irish team took the field.

phrases.trans_en: to be something you do not know much about

examples.ch: 编程真的不是我的专长，你最好问问菲尔。
examples.en: Programming really isn't my field - you'd better ask Phil.

defines.trans_ch: （板球或棒球运动中）接（球），截（球）;守（球），任守方
defines.trans_en: to catch or pick up the ball after it has been hit in a game such as cricket or baseball, and to try to prevent the other team from scoring

examples.ch: 他稳稳地接住了球。
examples.en: He fielded the ball well.

examples.ch: 我们队先作守方。
examples.en: Our team is fielding first.

defines.trans_en: to avoid answering a question directly

examples.ch: 他非常巧妙地回答了几个尴尬的问题。
examples.en: He fielded some awkward questions very skilfully.

defines.trans_ch: 使参加活动（或比赛）;组织参加
defines.trans_en: to have or produce a team of people to take part in an activity or event

examples.ch: 公司组建了一个专家团去参加会议。
examples.en: The company fielded a group of experts to take part in the conference.

defines.trans_ch: （有某种天然物质的）大片地方，…田
defines.trans_en: an area of land containing a particular natural substance

examples.ch: 油田
examples.en: an oilfield

examples.ch: 煤田
examples.en: a coalfield

defines.trans_ch: （使）充满，（使）装满，（使）注满；占据；布满
defines.trans_en: to make or become full; to use empty space

examples.ch: 我往桶里注满了水。
examples.en: I filled the bucket with water.

examples.ch: 我能听见往蓄水池里注水的声音。
examples.en: I could hear the tank filling.

examples.ch: 她靠看电视打发大部分时间。
examples.en: She filled most of her time watching TV.

examples.ch: 房间里充满了欢声笑语。
examples.en: Happy sounds filled the room (= could be heard everywhere in the room).

defines.trans_en: to put a substance into an empty space

examples.ch: 粉刷之前先把所有的裂缝用灰泥填满。
examples.en: Before painting, fill (in) all the cracks in the plaster.

examples.ch: 这些蛋糕是奶油夹心的。
examples.en: These cakes are filled with cream.

examples.ch: 该产品显然填补了市场的需求／空白。
examples.en: The product clearly filled a need/gap in the market.

defines.trans_en: to make someone have a particular feeling

examples.ch: 一想到这一点我心中就充满恐惧。
examples.en: The thought of it fills me with (= makes me feel) dread.

defines.trans_en: to put a substance into a hole in a tooth to repair it

examples.ch: 你应该把那个牙洞补上。
examples.en: You should get that cavity filled.

defines.trans_en: to give a job or position to someone

examples.ch: 很抱歉，这个工作／职位／空缺已经有人充任了。
examples.en: I'm sorry, the job/post/vacancy has already been filled.

examples.ch: 我们更想找个应届大学毕业生来做这份工作。
examples.en: We would prefer to fill the position with (= give it to) a recent graduate.

defines.trans_en: someone's fill is as much as they want or can deal with

examples.ch: 他只花了几分钟时间就吃饱了／喝够了。
examples.en: He took only a few minutes to eat/drink his fill.

examples.ch: 我已经听够了他粗鲁无礼的言论。
examples.en: I'd had my fill of his rude remarks.

defines.trans_en: a series of moving pictures, usually shown in a cinema or on television and often telling a story

examples.ch: 你最喜欢哪部电影？
examples.en: What's your favourite film?

examples.ch: 我们带孩子们去看了场电影。
examples.en: We took the children to (see) a film.

examples.ch: 她曾长期从事电影业。
examples.en: She had a long career in films/film (= the business of making films).

examples.ch: 影星／影评人
examples.en: a film star/critic

examples.ch: 电影业
examples.en: the film industry

examples.ch: 电影制作人
examples.en: a film-maker

examples.ch: 她最后一部电影是在南美的外景地拍摄的。
examples.en: Her last film was shot (= made) on location in South America.

examples.ch: 我讨厌看电影时有人讲话。
examples.en: I hate people talking while I'm watching a film.

examples.ch: 你今晚想去看电影吗？
examples.en: Would you like to go and see a film tonight?

defines.trans_en: (a length of) dark plastic-like material that can record images as photographs or as a moving picture

examples.ch: 一卷胶片
examples.en: a roll of film

examples.ch: 可拍24张照片的／16毫米的／高感光胶卷
examples.en: a 24 exposure/16 mm/high-speed film

examples.ch: 一个过路人用胶片拍下了这一事件。
examples.en: A passer-by recorded the incident on film.

examples.ch: 我要去药房冲洗胶卷。
examples.en: I'm getting my film developed at the chemist's.

defines.trans_en: a thin layer of something on a surface

examples.ch: 薄薄的一层灰／油／油脂
examples.en: a film of dust/oil/grease

examples.ch: 一层轻烟
examples.en: a film of smoke

defines.trans_en: to record moving pictures with a camera, usually to make a film for television or the cinema

examples.ch: 大多数场景是在摄影棚里拍摄的。
examples.en: Most of the scenes were filmed in a studio.

examples.ch: 他们在西班牙拍摄了一周。
examples.en: They filmed for a week in Spain.

defines.trans_ch: （偶然）发现，碰上；找到，寻得；找出，查明
defines.trans_en: to discover, especially where a thing or person is, either unexpectedly or by searching, or to discover where to get or how to achieve something

examples.ch: 我刚在口袋里找到了一张10英镑的钞票。
examples.en: I've just found a ten-pound note in my pocket.

examples.ch: 我找不到安德鲁的电话号码。
examples.en: I couldn't find Andrew's phone number.

examples.ch: 你会发现刀叉在左手边的抽屉里。
examples.en: You'll find the knives and forks in the left-hand drawer.

examples.ch: 研究者们希望能找到治愈这种疾病的方法。
examples.en: Researchers are hoping to find a cure for the disease.

examples.ch: 他找到地方住了吗？
examples.en: Has he found himself a place to live yet?

examples.ch: 人们发现她时，她已不省人事而且血流不止。
examples.en: She was found unconscious and bleeding.

examples.ch: 这一研究发现已婚男人的寿命要比未婚男人长。
examples.en: The study found that men who were married lived longer than those who were not.

examples.ch: 你认为他们能找到办法给这个地区带来和平吗？
examples.en: Do you think they'll ever find a way of bringing peace to the region?

examples.ch: 我们眼下正想尽办法凑钱缴房租。
examples.en: We're really struggling to find (= get) enough money to pay the rent.

examples.ch: 在遭受丈夫多年的虐待之后，她终于鼓起勇气离开了他。
examples.en: After years of abuse from her husband, she eventually found the courage to leave him.

examples.ch: 我希望自己能挤出时间多看一点书。
examples.en: I wish I could find (the) time to do more reading.

defines.trans_en: to realize that something exists or has happened

examples.ch: 我们回到家时发现猫已经产崽了。
examples.en: We came home to find (that) the cat had had kittens.

examples.ch: 我发现自己轻轻松松就能游1英里。
examples.en: I found (that) I could easily swim a mile.

defines.trans_en: to think or feel a particular way about someone or something

examples.ch: 你是否发觉和克莱夫讲话有些困难？
examples.en: Do you find John difficult to talk to?

examples.ch: 我觉得他这个人不好相处。
examples.en: I don't find him an easy person to get on with.

examples.ch: 她感到很难开口谈论自己的问题。
examples.en: She doesn't find it easy to talk about her problems.

examples.ch: 我感到城市生活压力很大。
examples.en: I find living in the city very stressful.

defines.trans_en: to make a judgment in a law court

examples.ch: 陪审团一致裁定对他的谋杀指控罪名成立／不成立。
examples.en: In a unanimous verdict, the jury found him guilty/not guilty of the murder.

phrases.trans_en: to exist or be present somewhere

examples.ch: 许多动植物种类只在热带雨林中才有。
examples.en: Many plant and animal species are found only in the rainforests.

examples.ch: 柑橘类水果富含维生素C。
examples.en: Vitamin C is found in citrus fruit.

phrases.trans_en: to get somewhere you are trying to reach

examples.ch: 我有一张地图，可还是找不到回酒店的路。
examples.en: I had a map but I still couldn't find my way back to the hotel.

phrases.trans_en: to criticize someone or something

examples.ch: 她总是挑剔他的工作方式。
examples.en: She's always finding fault with the way he works.

phrases.trans_ch: （不知不觉地）发现自己处于…中（或在…处，做…事）
phrases.trans_en: to realize that you are in a particular situation or place, or doing a particular thing, when you did not intend to

examples.ch: 如果他继续这样行事，他会发现自己一个朋友都没有了。
examples.en: He'll find himself with no friends at all if he carries on behaving this way.

examples.ch: 我们在火车上睡着了，醒来时发现已经到了加来。
examples.en: We fell asleep on the train and woke up to find ourselves in Calais.

phrases.trans_en: If you go somewhere or do something to find yourself, you go there or do it to discover your true character.

examples.ch: 为了寻找真正的自我，西蒙在印度的一处静修所呆了整整一年。
examples.en: Simon spent a year in an ashram in India to find himself.

defines.trans_ch: 发现物；被发现的人（尤指有价值或有用者）
defines.trans_en: a good or valuable thing or a special person that has been discovered but was not known about before

examples.ch: 这家咖啡馆真不错——我完全不知道这附近还有这么一个地方。
examples.en: This café's quite a find - I had no idea there was anywhere like it around here.

examples.ch: 近期发现的一些文物正在当地的博物馆展出。
examples.en: A recent find of ancient artefacts is on display at the local museum.

defines.trans_ch: 好的;足够好的;健康的，身体好的
defines.trans_en: good or good enough; healthy and well

examples.ch: 我昨晚感觉很不舒服，但今天早上就好了。
examples.en: I felt terrible last night but I feel fine this morning.

examples.ch: 这些公寓很小，一个人住正合适。
examples.en: The apartments are very small, which is fine for one person.

examples.ch: “你没事吧？”“我没什么事，谢谢。”
examples.en: "Are you all right?" "Everything's just fine, thanks."

examples.ch: “我8点到你家来。”“好的，到时见。”
examples.en: "I'll come to your place at eight." "Fine. See you then."

defines.trans_en: excellent or much better than average

examples.ch: 美酒佳肴的供应商
examples.en: purveyors of fine wines and gourmet food

examples.ch: 巴黎奥塞美术馆拥有世界上最棒的印象派画作馆藏。
examples.en: The world's finest collection of Impressionist paintings is housed in the Musée d'Orsay in Paris.

examples.ch: 这栋建筑是同类建筑中最杰出的代表。
examples.en: This building is the finest example of its type.

defines.trans_en: very thin or in very small pieces or drops

examples.ch: 婴儿满头的金色细发。
examples.en: The baby's head was covered in fine blond hair.

examples.ch: 火山爆发给整个镇子覆盖了一层细细的火山灰。
examples.en: The eruption had covered the town with a fine layer of ash.

examples.ch: 用唇线笔沿着上嘴唇的中线细细地画上一道。
examples.en: Apply a fine line of highlighter along the middle of your top lip.

examples.ch: 她继承了母亲清秀的面容。
examples.en: She has inherited her mother's fine (= delicate and beautiful) features.

defines.trans_en: very exact and delicate, or needing to be done, treated, or considered very carefully

examples.ch: 我大致上理解她在说些什么，但是有一些具体的细节／问题没有弄明白。
examples.en: I understood in general what she was talking about, but some of the finer details/points were beyond me.

defines.trans_en: sunny and dry

examples.ch: 天气预报说今天天气晴朗干燥。
examples.en: The forecast said it would be fine and dry today.

defines.trans_en: bad or not convenient

examples.ch: 你的父亲为你做了这一切之后，你居然说出这种混账话来！
examples.en: That's a fine (= very unpleasant) thing to say about your father after all he's done for you!

examples.ch: 在那个时候扔下我们走了，他可真是会挑时间。
examples.en: He picked a fine time to leave us.

defines.trans_en: an amount of money that has to be paid as a punishment for not obeying a rule or law

examples.ch: 违者最高可罚1000美元。
examples.en: The maximum penalty for the offence is a $1,000 fine.

examples.ch: 如果被判有罪，等待他的将是6个月的监禁和巨额罚款。
examples.en: If found guilty, he faces six months in jail and a heavy (= severe) fine.

defines.trans_en: to charge someone an amount of money as a punishment for not obeying a rule or law

examples.ch: 超速驾车的司机会被罚以重金。
examples.en: Drivers who exceed the speed limit can expect to be fined heavily.

examples.ch: 他因为有威胁恐吓行为而被罚100英镑。
examples.en: They fined him £100 for using threatening behaviour.

defines.trans_en: in a satisfactory way

examples.ch: “借你500美元够吗？”“足够了。”
examples.en: "Will a loan of $500 be sufficient?" "That will suit me fine."

examples.ch: 它昨天还好好的。
examples.en: It was working fine yesterday.

defines.trans_en: to complete something or come to the end of an activity

examples.ch: 我做完作业后会给你打电话的。
examples.en: I'll call you when I've finished my homework.

examples.ch: 完成调查问卷后请将其放进盒子里。
examples.en: Please place your questionnaire in the box when you're finished.

examples.ch: 她以自己第一张专辑中的一首歌作为（音乐会的）收尾。
examples.en: She finished (the concert) with a song from her first album.

examples.ch: 她在决赛中获得了第二名。
examples.en: She finished second (= in second place) in the finals.

examples.ch: 你看完那本杂志了吗？
examples.en: Have you finished reading that magazine?

examples.ch: 房子连一半都没有完工，他们就已经没钱了。
examples.en: They've already run out of money and the building isn't even half-finished (= half of it has not been completed).

defines.trans_en: to end

examples.ch: 会议应该在4点左右结束。
examples.en: The meeting should finish around four o'clock.

examples.ch: 这部剧以一场婚礼结束。
examples.en: The play finishes with a wedding.

defines.trans_en: to eat, drink, or use something completely so that none remains

examples.ch: 一定要让她把饭都吃完了。
examples.en: Make sure she finishes her dinner.

examples.ch: 他喝完饮料就离开了。
examples.en: He finished his drink and left.

examples.ch: 我们昨晚把馅饼全吃光了。
examples.en: We finished (= ate all of) the pie last night.

defines.trans_ch: 给（木制器具）上最后一道漆;给…最后抛光
defines.trans_en: If you finish something made of wood, you give it a last covering of paint, polish, or varnish so that it is ready to be used.

defines.trans_ch: （比赛的）结果，结束；（某事的）最后阶段（或部分）
defines.trans_en: the end of a race, or the last part of something

examples.ch: 比分接近的比赛结果
examples.en: a close finish

examples.ch: 他们对比赛的最后部分进行了慢动作回放。
examples.en: They replayed the finish in slow motion.

defines.trans_en: the condition of the surface of a material such as wood

examples.ch: 瞧瞧那架钢琴漂亮光泽的表面。
examples.en: Look at the beautiful shiny finish on that piano.

defines.trans_en: the last covering of varnish, polish, or paint, that is put onto something

examples.ch: 即使是最后一道清漆也会使木头的颜色发生轻微的改变。
examples.en: Even a clear finish will alter the colour of wood slightly.

defines.trans_en: (material that is in) the state of burning that produces flames that send out heat and light, and might produce smoke

examples.ch: 动物通常都怕火。
examples.en: Animals are usually afraid of fire.

examples.ch: 这场火灾是由小孩们玩火柴引起的。
examples.en: The fire was started by children playing with matches.

examples.ch: 40个人帮忙扑灭了大火。
examples.en: 40 people helped to put out (= stop) the fire.

examples.ch: 图书馆在火灾中严重受损。
examples.en: The library was badly damaged in the fire.

examples.ch: 每年有多少座历史建筑毁于大火？
examples.en: How many historic buildings are damaged by fire each year?

examples.ch: 房子着火时，她被救了出来。
examples.en: She had to be rescued when her house caught (US caught on) fire (= started to burn).

defines.trans_en: a small controlled fire that is used for heating or cooking

examples.ch: 这里面真冷，我把炉火点起来好吗？
examples.en: It's very cold in here - should I light a fire?

examples.ch: 我们在海滩上生了堆火。
examples.en: We built a fire on the beach.

examples.ch: 我们搭起了帐篷，点起了一小堆火。
examples.en: We put up our tents and made a small fire.

defines.trans_en: a gas or electric heater that is used to warm up a room

examples.ch: 煤气取暖器／电暖器
examples.en: a gas/electric fire

examples.ch: 你冷的话就把取暖器打开。
examples.en: If you're cold just put the fire on.

defines.trans_en: the shooting of guns or other weapons

examples.ch: 警察向抗议者开了火。
examples.en: The police opened fire on (= started shooting at) the protesters.

examples.ch: 下达了停止射击的命令。
examples.en: The command was given to cease fire (= stop shooting).

examples.ch: 这座城市昨晚遭到了反政府武装炮火的攻击。
examples.en: The city came under fire from anti-government forces last night.

defines.trans_ch: 极度兴奋；极为激动；狂热
defines.trans_en: strong emotion

examples.ch: 她演讲中饱含的激情鼓舞了每一个人。
examples.en: The fire in her speech inspired everyone.

phrases.trans_en: If something is on fire, it is burning when it should not be.

examples.ch: 如果你家着了火，而你只能抢救出一样东西，你会拿什么呢？
examples.en: If your home was on fire and you could save only one thing, what would it be?

defines.trans_ch: 开火，开（枪）;放（箭）;发射（导弹）
defines.trans_en: to cause a weapon to shoot bullets, arrows, or missiles

examples.ch: 他朝天鸣枪。
examples.en: He fired his gun into the air.

examples.ch: 有人开始向我们射击。
examples.en: Someone started firing at us.

examples.ch: 在没有任何警示的情况下他开始朝人群开枪。
examples.en: Without warning he started firing into the crowd.

examples.ch: 我只有在心里企盼着他会停止射击。
examples.en: I just prayed that he would stop firing.

examples.ch: 大使否认向境外发射了任何导弹。
examples.en: The ambassador denied that any missiles had been fired across the border.

defines.trans_ch: 连珠炮似地提出（问题）;猛烈地发出（抨击）
defines.trans_en: to direct a series of questions or criticisms at someone

examples.ch: 整整两个小时，记者们连珠炮似地向我发问。
examples.en: The journalists were firing questions at me for two whole hours.

examples.ch: “我想问你几个关于你童年的问题。” “你问吧！”
examples.en: "I'd like to ask you some questions about your childhood." "Fire away!" (= You can start asking them now.)

defines.trans_en: to remove someone from their job, either because they have done something wrong or badly, or as a way of saving the cost of employing them

examples.ch: 她因偷雇主的东西时当场被抓而遭解雇。
examples.en: She was fired after she was caught stealing from her employer.

examples.ch: 他因为表现不佳丢掉了他薪资16.5万美元的工作。
examples.en: He was fired from his $165,000 job for poor performance.

examples.ch: 她刚刚被炒，丢掉了这家报纸主编的职位。
examples.en: She has just been fired as editor of the newspaper.

examples.ch: 该公司将裁员500人以减少雇员人数。
examples.en: The company is reducing its workforce by firing 500 employees.

defines.trans_en: to cause a strong emotion in someone

examples.ch: 我有过一位出色的英语老师，在我很小的时候就激起了我对文学的热情。
examples.en: I had a brilliant English teacher who fired me with enthusiasm for literature at an early age.

examples.ch: 这些关于宝藏和失落的城市的传闻让他们浮想联翩。
examples.en: Talk of treasure and lost cities had fired their imaginations.

defines.trans_en: to heat objects made of clay in a kiln (= a special oven) so that they become hard

defines.trans_ch: 第一（的）;首先;最初;首要（的）
defines.trans_en: (a person or thing) coming before all others in order, time, amount, quality, or importance

examples.ch: 这是我第一次到纽约。
examples.en: This is my first visit to New York.

examples.ch: 我对他一见钟情。
examples.en: I fell in love with him the first time I saw him.

examples.ch: 考试开始的头几分钟我总是很紧张。
examples.en: I'm always nervous for the first few minutes of an exam.

examples.ch: 今天是（8月）1号。
examples.en: Today is the first (of August).

phrases.trans_en: in or at the beginning (of a series of events)

examples.ch: 这条长裤洗过后缩水了，但是它原本就不够大。
examples.en: The trousers shrank when I washed them, but they weren't really big enough in the first place.

examples.ch: 谢天谢地他没受伤，但是他原本就不应该到那儿去。
examples.en: Thankfully, he wasn't hurt, but he never should have been there in the first place.

phrases.trans_en: as the first attempt or effort

examples.ch: 询问职位事宜应该首先咨询人事经理。
examples.en: Enquiries about the post should be addressed in the first instance to the personnel manager.

phrases.trans_en: at the earliest time in the day

examples.ch: 他说明天一大早他会回电话的。
examples.en: He said he'd call back first thing tomorrow.

defines.trans_en: before all others in order, time, amount, quality, or importance

examples.ch: 汤姆在比赛中获得第一。
examples.en: Tom came first in the race.

examples.ch: 谁先完成的？
examples.en: Who finished first?

examples.ch: 你如果先到家，能喂一下猫吗？
examples.en: If you get home first, can you feed the cat?

defines.trans_en: for the first time

examples.ch: 你们初次见面是什么时候？
examples.en: When did you first meet each other?

examples.ch: 我最初加入时，这家公司还很小。
examples.en: The company was still very small when I first joined.

defines.trans_ch: 首先（用于想说或想写的一连串事物的开头）
defines.trans_en: used at the beginning of a list of things you want to say or write

examples.ch: 首先，我要感谢我的父母。
examples.en: First, I want to thank my parents.

examples.ch: 首先，我想问你几个问题。
examples.en: First (of all) (= before anything else), I'd like to ask you a few questions.

examples.ch: 首先，我来介绍一下自己。
examples.en: First off (= before anything else), let me introduce myself.

defines.trans_ch: 第一个（做某事的）人;头一件（发生或提及的）事
defines.trans_en: the first person or thing to do or be something, or the first person or thing mentioned

examples.ch: 她是第一批抵达的人之一。
examples.en: She was one of the first to arrive.

examples.ch: 他非常愿意承认，他的成功很大程度上归功于他帅气的外表。
examples.en: He is the first (= very willing) to admit that much of his success is due to his good looks.

examples.ch: 今晚播放有关癌症的三部纪录片中的第一部。
examples.en: Tonight sees the first of three documentaries about cancer.

defines.trans_ch: 从未有过的事，开创先例的事
defines.trans_en: something that has never happened or been done before

examples.ch: 这种外科手术新技术在这家医院是首次应用。
examples.en: This new surgical technique is a first for (= has never been done before in) the hospital.

defines.trans_ch: （英国大学学位）最高成绩，优等成绩
defines.trans_en: the best possible undergraduate university degree you can get in the UK and some other countries

examples.ch: 她从纽卡斯尔大学毕业，获英语一级优等学位。
examples.en: She has a first in English from Newcastle University.

defines.trans_en: (in a vehicle) the gear used when starting to drive forward or when driving up a steep hill

→ 
first base

phrases.trans_en: from the beginning

examples.ch: 我从一开始就反对那项提议。
examples.en: I've opposed the proposal from the very first.

defines.trans_en: an animal that lives in water, is covered with scales, and breathes by taking water in through its mouth, or the flesh of these animals eaten as food

examples.ch: 池塘里有几条大鱼。
examples.en: Several large fish live in the pond.

examples.ch: 桑杰伊捉到的鱼是我见过最大的。
examples.en: Sanjay caught the biggest fish I've ever seen.

examples.ch: 我不喜欢吃鱼。
