examples.ch: 一棵生菜
examples.en: a head of lettuce

defines.trans_en: the layer of white bubbles on top of beer after it has been poured
the upper part of a river, where it begins
the top part of a spot when it contains pus (= yellow liquid)
the part of a tape or video recorder (= machine for recording sound or pictures) that touches the tape to record and play music, speech, etc.
the main part of the phrase, to which the other parts are related

phrases.trans_en: a boy or girl who often represents his or her school on formal occasions

phrases.trans_ch: 硬币有人头像的一面，硬币正面
phrases.trans_en: the side of a coin that has a picture of someone's head on it

defines.trans_en: to go in a particular direction

examples.ch: 她叫我回来的时候我正朝屋外走。
examples.en: I was heading out of the room when she called me back.

examples.ch: 我们在前往库马西的途中卡车抛锚了。
examples.en: We were heading towards Kumasi when our truck broke down.

examples.ch: 他径直朝冰箱走去。
examples.en: He headed straight for (= went towards) the fridge.

examples.ch: 我想我们应该在天黑之前回去／家。
examples.en: I think we ought to head back/home (= return to where we started) now, before it gets too dark.

defines.trans_en: to be in charge of a group or organization

examples.ch: 她主管英国的主要旅行社之一。
examples.en: She heads one of Britain's leading travel firms.

examples.ch: 霍索恩法官被选中率领这个小组调查有关虐待的指控。
examples.en: Judge Hawthorne was chosen to head the team investigating the allegations of abuse.

defines.trans_en: to be at the front or top of something

examples.ch: 女王的马车行进在队伍的前头。
examples.en: The royal carriage headed the procession.

examples.ch: 乔的名字排在候选人名单的最前面。
examples.en: Jo's name headed the list of candidates.

defines.trans_en: to hit a ball with your head

examples.ch: 欧文把球顶进了网窝。
examples.en: Rooney headed the ball into the back of the net.

defines.trans_en: a person with a particular strong interest or addiction

examples.ch: 对强效可卡因上瘾的人
examples.en: a crack-head (= someone who depends on the drug crack)

defines.trans_en: the condition of the body and the degree to which it is free from illness, or the state of being well

examples.ch: 身体好／不好
examples.en: to be in good/poor health

examples.ch: 经常锻炼对你的身体有好处。
examples.en: Regular exercise is good for your health.

examples.ch: 我因健康之故而不得不戒酒。
examples.en: I had to give up drinking for health reasons.

examples.ch: 他因为身体不好而辞去了工作。
examples.en: He gave up work because of ill health.

defines.trans_ch: （组织或系统的）运行状况，运转状况
defines.trans_en: the condition of something that changes or develops, such as an organization or system

examples.ch: 企业的财务状况
examples.en: the financial health of the business

defines.trans_en: strong and well

examples.ch: 她是个正常健康的孩子。
examples.en: She's a normal, healthy child.

examples.ch: 他看上去还算健康。
examples.en: He looks healthy enough.

defines.trans_en: showing that you are strong and well

examples.ch: 散步使她面色健康红润。
examples.en: The walk had given her a healthy glow.

examples.ch: 好胃口
examples.en: a healthy appetite

defines.trans_en: good for your health

examples.ch: 健康饮食
examples.en: a healthy diet

examples.ch: 有益于健康的散步
examples.en: a good, healthy walk

defines.trans_en: successful and strong

examples.ch: 繁荣的经济
examples.en: a healthy economy

defines.trans_en: normal and showing good judgment

examples.ch: 对权威并不为过的轻视
examples.en: a healthy disrespect for authority

defines.trans_en: to receive or become conscious of a sound using your ears

examples.ch: 她听到外面一阵嘈杂。
examples.en: She heard a noise outside.

examples.ch: 我祖父上了年纪，耳朵听不太清楚。
examples.en: My grandfather is getting old and can't hear very well.

examples.ch: 你得说大声点，我听不见你。
examples.en: You'll have to speak up, I can't hear you.

examples.ch: 我听见有人喊我的名字。
examples.en: I heard/I could hear someone calling my name.

examples.ch: 8点钟的时候，简听见他出去了。
examples.en: At eight o'clock Jane heard him go out.

defines.trans_en: to be told information about something

examples.ch: 你听说那条新闻了吗？
examples.en: Have you heard the news?

examples.ch: 如果你在星期五之前还没听到消息，那就当我不来了。
examples.en: If you haven't heard by Friday, assume I'm not coming.

examples.ch: 你听说发生的事了吗？
examples.en: Have you heard what's happened?

examples.ch: 我听说你要离开。
examples.en: I hear (that) you're leaving.

defines.trans_en: to listen to someone or something with great attention or officially in court

examples.ch: 今天上午我在广播中听到一个非常有趣的节目。
examples.en: I heard a really interesting programme on the radio this morning.

examples.ch: 去年夏天我在卡内基音乐厅聆听了这个交响乐团的演奏。
examples.en: I heard the orchestra play at Carnegie Hall last summer.

examples.ch: 一群听众聚集起来听他讲话。
examples.en: An audience gathered to hear him speak.

examples.ch: 主啊，听我们的祈祷。
examples.en: Lord, hear our prayers.

examples.ch: 高等法院将审理这个案子。
examples.en: The case will be heard (= officially listened to) by the High Court.

defines.trans_en: the organ in your chest that sends the blood around your body

examples.ch: 他的心脏不太好。
examples.en: He's got a weak/bad heart (= his heart is not healthy).

examples.ch: 伊莎贝尔因为恐惧而心跳加快。
examples.en: Isabel's heart was beating fast with fright.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a person's character, or the place within a person where feelings or emotions are considered to come from

examples.ch: 她心地善良。
examples.en: She has a good heart (= she is a kind person).

examples.ch: 我爱你，我的爱是发自肺腑的。
examples.en: I love you, and I mean it from the bottom of my heart (= very sincerely).

examples.ch: 我深爱着你。
examples.en: I love you with all my heart (= very much).

examples.ch: 他说永远都不结婚，可是碰到她后他改变了主意。
examples.en: He said he'd never marry but he had a change of heart (= his feelings changed) when he met her.

examples.ch: 她非常关心无家可归者的问题。
examples.en: Homelessness is a subject very close/dear to her heart (= is very important to her and she has strong feelings about it).

examples.ch: 他为了另一个女人离开了她，这让她的心都碎了。
examples.en: He broke her heart (= made her very sad) when he left her for another woman.

examples.ch: 看见他如此不高兴，我心里十分难过。
examples.en: It breaks my heart (= makes me feel very sad) to see him so unhappy.

examples.ch: 他们说他死于忧伤过度。
examples.en: They say he died of a broken heart (= because he was so sad).

examples.ch: 看到那些孩子如此快乐，我很开心。
examples.en: It does my heart good (= makes me very happy) to see those children so happy.

examples.ch: 电话铃响了，他的心兴奋得怦怦直跳。
examples.en: His heart leaped (= he suddenly felt very excited and happy) when the phone rang.

defines.trans_en: the central or most important part

examples.ch: 示威者将游行穿过首都的中心地区。
examples.en: The demonstrators will march through the heart of the capital.

examples.ch: 争议的焦点就是边界问题。
examples.en: A disagreement about boundaries is at the heart of the dispute.

examples.ch: 让我们考虑一下最关键的事情。
examples.en: Let's get to the heart of the matter.

defines.trans_en: the firm central part of a vegetable, especially one with a lot of leaves

examples.ch: 洋蓟心
examples.en: artichoke hearts

examples.ch: 生菜心
examples.en: the heart of a lettuce

defines.trans_en: courage, determination, or hope

examples.ch: 你做得很好——不要灰心。
examples.en: You're doing really well - don't lose heart now.

examples.ch: 振作起来——事情会好转的。
examples.en: Take heart - things can only get better.

defines.trans_en: a shape, consisting of two half circles next to each other at the top and a V shape at the bottom, often coloured pink or red and used to represent love
a playing card from the suit of hearts

examples.ch: 在这个游戏中，红心牌可压住梅花牌。
examples.en: In this game, a heart beats a club.

phrases.trans_en: one of the four suits in playing cards, represented by a red heart shape

examples.ch: 红心七／A
examples.en: the seven/ace of hearts

defines.trans_en: used to say that you like someone or something very much

examples.ch: 我非常喜欢纽约。
examples.en: I heart New York.

defines.trans_en: the system that keeps a building warm

examples.ch: 暖气开着吗？
examples.en: Is the heating on?

defines.trans_en: weighing a lot, and needing effort to move or lift

examples.ch: 沉重的设备
examples.en: heavy equipment

examples.ch: 繁重的工作／费力的搬运活儿
examples.en: heavy work/lifting

examples.ch: 那个箱子有多重？
examples.en: How heavy is that box? (= How much does it weigh?)

defines.trans_ch: （尤指不愉快的事物）剧烈的，大量的
defines.trans_en: (especially of something unpleasant) of very or especially great force, amount, or degree

examples.ch: 当头重击
examples.en: a heavy blow to the head

examples.ch: 激战
examples.en: heavy fighting

examples.ch: 繁忙的交通
examples.en: heavy traffic

examples.ch: 大雨／大雪
examples.en: heavy rain/snow

examples.ch: 烟瘾／酒瘾极大的人
examples.en: a heavy smoker/drinker

examples.ch: 睡觉很沉的人
examples.en: a heavy sleeper

defines.trans_en: thick, strong, solid, or strongly made

examples.ch: 厚实的冬大衣
examples.en: a heavy winter coat

examples.ch: 难消化的饭菜
examples.en: a heavy meal (= a large amount of solid food)

examples.ch: 五大三粗的汉子
examples.en: a big man with heavy features

defines.trans_en: Heavy soil is thick and difficult to dig or walk through.
thick, solid-looking, and not delicate

examples.ch: 太阳消失在厚厚的云层背后。
examples.en: The sun disappeared behind heavy clouds.

defines.trans_en: Heavy machines or vehicles that are very large and powerful.

examples.ch: 重型火炮／机械
examples.en: heavy artillery/machinery

defines.trans_en: used to describe something such as a situation that is dangerous or unpleasant

examples.ch: 然后警察来了，事态变得很严重。
examples.en: Then the police arrived and things got really heavy.

phrases.trans_en: sea that is rough with large waves

defines.trans_ch: （受雇保护或恐吓他人的）彪形大汉，身强体壮的打手
defines.trans_en: a large strong man employed to protect someone else or to frighten other people

examples.ch: 弗兰克收债的时候总带着几个身强体壮的打手。
examples.en: Frank always took a couple of heavies along with him when he went collecting his debts.

defines.trans_en: a type of aircraft without wings, that has one or two sets of large blades that go round very fast on top. It can land and take off vertically and can stay in one place in the air

examples.ch: 伤者被用直升机送往了医院。
examples.en: The injured were ferried to hospital by helicopter.

examples.ch: 直升机驾驶员
examples.en: a helicopter pilot

defines.trans_en: to make it possible or easier for someone to do something, by doing part of the work yourself or by providing advice, money, support, etc.

examples.ch: 我如何才能帮你呢？
examples.en: How can I help you?

examples.ch: 不知你能否帮我个忙——我想知道些飞往新西兰的相关航班信息。
examples.en: I wonder if you could help me - I'd like some information about flights to New Zealand.

examples.ch: 我爸爸说他会资助我们买栋房子。
examples.en: My dad said he would help with the costs of (= give part of the cost of) buying a house.

examples.ch: 10000英镑的银行贷款帮助她创办了自己的公司。
examples.en: The $10,000 loan from the bank helped her (to) start her own business.

examples.ch: 我觉得学英语有助于我在工作上获得提升。
examples.en: I feel that learning English will help (= improve) my chances of promotion at work.

examples.ch: 现在没人能帮得了她。
examples.en: Nothing can help her now (= her situation is too bad for anyone to be able to improve it).

defines.trans_en: If something helps a difficult or painful situation, it improves it or makes it easier or less painful.

examples.ch: 吗啡似乎并不能缓解（疼痛）。
examples.en: The morphine didn't seem to help (the pain).

defines.trans_en: If something or someone helps to do something, that thing or person is one of several reasons for it happening.

examples.ch: 干旱让索马里今年祸不单行。
examples.en: The drought has helped (to) make this a disastrous year for Somalia.

defines.trans_en: to give something to someone

examples.ch: 要不要我给你再添点儿汤？
examples.en: Can I help you to some more soup?

phrases.trans_en: If you can't/couldn't help something, such as acting in a particular way or making a particular remark, you are/were not able to control or stop it.

examples.ch: 这真是糟糕，可我还是忍不住大笑起来。
examples.en: It was awful, but I couldn't help laughing.

examples.ch: “别再笑了！”“我忍不住呀！”
examples.en: "Stop giggling!" "I can't help it!"

examples.ch: 我不禁认为如果没有他她会过得更好。
examples.en: I can't help thinking (= my true feeling is that) she'd be better off without him.

phrases.trans_en: to take something for yourself

examples.ch: “我能再吃些面包吗？”“请自便！”
examples.en: "Might I have some more bread?" "Please, help yourself!"

defines.trans_en: the act of helping another person

examples.ch: 你需要人帮忙搬那些箱子吗？
examples.en: Do you need any help with those boxes?

examples.ch: 她父母帮她还了一部分银行贷款。
examples.en: Her parents gave her some help with her bank loan (= paid some of it).

defines.trans_en: something or someone that helps

examples.ch: 有一个卫星导航系统就能帮上忙了。
examples.en: Having a satnav would be a help.

examples.ch: 我丈夫不在的时候他帮了我很大的忙。
examples.en: He was a great help (to me) while my husband was away.

defines.trans_en: someone who is employed to clean and do other small jobs

examples.ch: 家里的女佣
examples.en: a home help

phrases.trans_en: a person or the people employed to work in someone's home doing cleaning, cooking, caring for children, etc.
shouted by a person who is asking for someone to come and save them from a dangerous situation

defines.trans_ch: （指代女性或雌性动物）她，她的
defines.trans_en: used, usually as the object of a verb or preposition, to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal that has just been mentioned or is just about to be mentioned

examples.ch: 如果你姐姐在，带她一起来。
examples.en: If your sister's around, bring her too.

examples.ch: 我把那封信交给了她。
examples.en: I gave her the letter.

examples.ch: 她真是一匹漂亮的马，你拥有她已有多久了？
examples.en: She's a beautiful horse - how long have you had her?

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a country, a boat, or a car

examples.ch: 上帝保佑这艘船和船上所有的人。
examples.en: God bless this ship and all who sail in her.

defines.trans_ch: （指代女性或雌性动物）她，她的
defines.trans_en: belonging to or connected with a woman, girl, or female animal that has just been mentioned or is known about

examples.ch: 我要看看路易莎是否会把她的吉他带到聚会上来。
examples.en: I'll see if Louisa will bring her guitar to the party.

examples.ch: 我不知道她为什么辞职了。
examples.en: I don't know why she quit her job.

examples.ch: 我们看到一只母鸭和她的小鸭子们。
examples.en: We saw a mother duck with her ducklings.

defines.trans_en: belonging to a country, a boat, or a car

examples.ch: 那艘船和她的船员一起沉没了。
examples.en: The boat sank with all her crew.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a female object of a verb, that is the same person or animal as the subject of the verb

examples.ch: 她不断地告诉自己一切都没有问题。
examples.en: She kept telling herself that nothing was wrong.

examples.ch: 如果我母亲知道我在做什么，她一定会担心死的。
examples.en: My mother would worry herself to death if she knew what I was doing.

defines.trans_en: used to emphasize a particular woman, girl, or female animal

examples.ch: 她亲自装点蛋糕。
examples.en: She decorated the cake herself.

examples.ch: 她自己承认那是不对的。
examples.en: She herself admitted that it was wrong.

phrases.trans_en: If a woman or girl does something by herself, she does it alone or without help from anyone else.

examples.ch: 她独自一人住在一所巨大的房子里。
examples.en: She lives by herself in an enormous house.

examples.ch: 霍丽只有3岁，但她完全能自己写自己的名字。
examples.en: Holly's only three but she wrote her name all by herself.

phrases.trans_en: for her use only

examples.ch: 这个周末妈妈独自一人在家。
examples.en: Mum's got the house to herself this weekend.

phrases.trans_en: not to be, seem, or feel as happy or healthy as usual

examples.ch: 米歇尔没事吧？她现在看起来很反常。
examples.en: Is Michelle all right? She doesn't seem quite herself at the moment.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于描述或询问女性生病后的精神状况）
phrases.trans_en: used when describing or asking about a woman's state of mind when she is physically ill

examples.ch: 我知道她又患病了，那她现在怎么样？
examples.en: I know she's got back trouble but how is she in herself?

defines.trans_en: in, at, or to this place

examples.ch: 我在这里住了大约两年了。
examples.en: I've lived here for about two years.

examples.ch: 我喜欢这里。
examples.en: I like it here.

examples.ch: 伦敦离这儿只有50英里。
examples.en: London is only 50 miles from here.

examples.ch: 过来——我给你看些东西。
examples.en: Come here - I've got something to show you.

examples.ch: 你到这个国家多久了？
examples.en: How long are you over here (= in this country)?

defines.trans_ch: （用于句首以介绍某人或某物）这
defines.trans_en: used at the beginning of a statement to introduce someone or something

examples.ch: 这是菲奥娜——我来介绍你认识她。
examples.en: Here's Fiona - let me introduce you to her.

examples.ch: 这就是我说过要借给你的书。
examples.en: Here's the book I said I'd lend you.

defines.trans_en: used to show that someone has arrived or that something has started

examples.ch: 他们来了！我们还以为你们不会来了！
examples.en: Here they are! We thought you'd never come!

examples.ch: 我们到了——我说过开车不超过半个小时就能到。
examples.en: Here we are (= we have arrived) - I said it wouldn't take more than half an hour by car.

examples.ch: 既然圣诞节到了，我还是放弃节食吧。
examples.en: Now that Christmas is here (= has begun), I might as well give up my diet.

defines.trans_ch: （表示在说话人近旁的人或物）这里
defines.trans_en: used to say that someone or something that is near you

examples.ch: 这个我一点儿都不懂，但我相信这里的同事肯定能帮你。
examples.en: I don't know anything about this, but I'm sure my colleague here can help you.

examples.ch: 这里写到她出生于1943年。
examples.en: It says here (= in this piece of writing) that she was born in 1943.

defines.trans_en: now

examples.ch: 现在我们休息一下喝杯咖啡好吗？
examples.en: Shall we break here and have a coffee?

examples.ch: 我们下一步该做什么？
examples.en: Where do we go/Where do we take it from here? (= What should we do next?)

phrases.trans_en: used when giving something to someone

examples.ch: “请把糖递过来好吗？”“给你。”
examples.en: "Could you pass the sugar, please?" "Here you are."

examples.ch: 给你，尝尝这个——味道棒极了！
examples.en: Here, try some of this - it's delicious!

defines.trans_en: the one(s) belonging to or connected with a woman, girl, or female animal that has been mentioned or is known about

examples.ch: 尼基和我头发都是红的，但她的颜色稍浅一些。
examples.en: Nicky and I both have red hair but hers is lighter than mine.

examples.ch: “你认识蒂娜吗？”“是的，我是她的朋友。“
examples.en: "Do you know Tina?" "Yes, I'm a friend of hers."

examples.ch: 她的房子是街角上的一座大屋。
examples.en: Hers is the big house on the corner.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指无生命的东西）高的，有…高的
defines.trans_en: (especially of things that are not living) being a large distance from top to bottom or a long way above the ground, or having the stated distance from top to bottom

examples.ch: 高楼／高山
examples.en: a high building/mountain

examples.ch: 高高的天花板
examples.en: high ceilings

examples.ch: 它有两米半高，一米宽。
examples.en: It's two and a half metres high and one metre wide.

examples.ch: 田里的玉米长到了齐腰的高度。
examples.en: The corn grew waist-high (= as high as a person's waist) in the fields.

defines.trans_en: greater than the usual level or amount

examples.ch: 这项工作需要精神高度集中。
examples.en: The job demands a high level of concentration.

examples.ch: 他患有高血压。
examples.en: He suffers from high blood pressure.

examples.ch: 这段时间古董家具的卖价很高。
examples.en: Antique furniture fetches very high prices these days.

examples.ch: 她的地理考试得分很高。
examples.en: She got very high marks in her geography exam.

examples.ch: 在潮湿的路面上高速驾驶是很危险的。
examples.en: It's very dangerous to drive at high speed when the roads are wet.

examples.ch: 他被关在一处戒备森严的监狱中。
examples.en: He's in a high-security prison.

defines.trans_en: having power, an important position, or great influence

examples.ch: 高级军官
examples.en: an officer of high rank

defines.trans_en: near or at the top of the range of sounds

examples.ch: 这些高音我唱不上去。
examples.en: I can't reach the high notes.

defines.trans_en: (of food) smelling bad and no longer good to eat

examples.ch: 这块肉已经变质了——我去扔掉。
examples.en: This meat is rather high - I'm going to throw it out.

defines.trans_en: not thinking or behaving normally because of taking drugs

examples.ch: 他当时正因吸了海洛因而飘飘欲仙。
examples.en: He was high on heroin at the time.

phrases.trans_en: containing a large quantity of something

examples.ch: 我避免食用含有大量脂肪的食物。
examples.en: I avoid foods that are high in fat.

phrases.trans_ch: 高标准／高度的道德准则
phrases.trans_en: very good or very moral standards

examples.ch: 她是一位道德高尚的女士。
examples.en: She was a woman of high principles.

examples.ch: 她对为她工作的人要求很高。
examples.en: She demands very high standards from the people who work for her.

phrases.trans_en: fast, strong wind

examples.ch: 大风导致渡轮延误。
examples.en: High winds caused delays on the ferries.

defines.trans_en: a higher level than has ever been reached previously

examples.ch: 利率达到了历史最高水平／创纪录的高水平。
examples.en: Interest rates have reached an all-time/record high.

defines.trans_ch: （因获得成功带来的）极度兴奋;（毒品、酒精或宗教体验引起的）快感，极乐
defines.trans_en: a period of extreme excitement or happiness when you feel full of energy, often caused by a feeling of success, or by drugs or alcohol or a religious experience

examples.ch: 运动使人兴奋。
examples.en: Exercise gives you a high.

examples.ch: 自从她的文章在《泰晤士报》上发表以来，她一直情绪高涨。
examples.en: She's been on a high ever since she got her article published in the Times.

examples.ch: 这份工作中有很多快乐也有许多沮丧。
examples.en: There are lots of highs and lows in this job.

defines.trans_ch: （用于中学名称中，high school的非正式说法）
defines.trans_en:
informal for
high school  (when used in the name of a school)

examples.ch: 我在圣安娜高中上学。
examples.en: I go to Santa Ana High.

defines.trans_en: at or to a large distance from the ground

examples.ch: 你必须把球打得相当高，这样它才能过那网。
examples.en: You'll have to hit the ball quite high to get it over that net.

examples.ch: 这种新的喷气式飞机飞得比大多数飞机都高很多。
examples.en: The new jet flew much higher than most planes.

defines.trans_en: an area of land that is higher than the surrounding land

examples.ch: 丘陵不像山脉那样高大。
examples.en: Hills are not as high as mountains.

examples.ch: 他们的房子在小山顶上。
examples.en: Their house is on the top of a hill.

examples.ch: 夏天，牧羊人们把羊群赶到丘陵地带放牧。
examples.en: In the summer, the shepherds move their sheep up into the hills (= an area where there are hills).

defines.trans_en: a slope in a road

examples.ch: 那个坡太陡了，自行车根本骑不上去。
examples.en: That hill's far too steep to cycle up.

phrases.trans_en: Capitol Hill (= the US legislature or the place where it meets)

defines.trans_ch: 他（指男性）;它（指雄性动物）
defines.trans_en: used, usually as the object of a verb or preposition, to refer to a man, boy, or male animal that has just been mentioned or is just about to be mentioned

examples.ch: 如果你见到凯文，替我向他问好。
examples.en: If you see Kevin give him my love.

examples.ch: 特里在捣什么鬼？我好久都没见过他了。
examples.en: What's Terry up to - I haven't seen him for ages.

examples.ch: 你为什么不把他的礼物给他呢？
examples.en: Why don't you give him his present?

examples.ch: 我们有了只刚生下来的小公猫，但还没有给它起名字。
examples.en: We've just got a new cat, but we haven't named him yet.

defines.trans_ch: 他（尤用于正式场合，指代刚提过或就要提到的人或动物，其性别不详或并不重要）
defines.trans_en: used after a verb or preposition to refer to a person or animal that has just been mentioned, or is just about to be mentioned, and whose sex is not known or not considered to be important. Many people consider this use to be offensive and prefer to use him or her or them instead, or it for an animal.

examples.ch: 人可以说话，这使他不同于其他任何动物。
examples.en: A human being's ability to talk makes him unlike any other animal.

examples.ch: 如果有人来找我，就让他等一下。
examples.en: If anyone comes to see me, ask him to wait.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a male object of a verb that is the same person or animal as the subject of the verb

examples.ch: 他在刮胡子的时候划伤了自己。
examples.en: He'd cut himself shaving.

examples.ch: 大多数晚上他都是哭着入睡的。
examples.en: Most nights he would cry himself to sleep.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调或指称）他自己，他本人，它自己
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize a particular man, boy, or male animal

examples.ch: 你想和主席本人谈谈，还是让他的私人助理帮助你？
examples.en: Did you want to talk to the chairman himself, or could his personal assistant help you?

examples.ch: 汤姆本打算买一个书橱，可是最后他还是自己做了一个。
examples.en: Tom was going to buy a bookcase, but in the end he made one himself.

defines.trans_ch: 他（用作动词宾语，与主语所指一致，所指的人或动物性别不明，或不重要）
defines.trans_en: used to refer to an object of a verb that is the same person or animal as the subject of the verb, when referring to a person or animal whose sex is not known or not considered to be important

examples.ch: 连傻子都能自己学会打字。
examples.en: Any fool can teach himself to type.

phrases.trans_en: If a man or boy does something by himself, he does it alone or without help from anyone else.

examples.ch: 小蒂米独自一人堆成了那个雪人。
examples.en: Little Timmy made that snowman all by himself.

examples.ch: 你为什么把你的弟弟丢下不管？
examples.en: Why did you leave your little brother by himself?

phrases.trans_en: for his use only

examples.ch: 约翰尼下周将一个人独享那套公寓。
examples.en: Johnny's got the apartment to himself next week.

phrases.trans_ch: 不太高兴;健康状况不佳
phrases.trans_en: not to be, seem, or feel as happy or as healthy as usual

examples.ch: 汤姆没事吧？他今天早晨看起来不太对劲儿。
examples.en: Is Tom all right? He doesn't seem quite himself this morning.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于描述或询问某人生病后的精神状态）
phrases.trans_en: used when describing or asking about a man's state of mind when he is physically ill

examples.ch: 他精神很好——只不过感冒还没痊愈。
examples.en: He's well enough in himself - he just can't shake this cold off.

defines.trans_ch: 嘻哈音乐（采用说唱形式，主题常涉及政治或社会的一种流行音乐）
defines.trans_en: a type of popular music in which the words are spoken rather than sung and the subject of the songs is often politics or society
belonging to or connected with a man, boy, or male animal that has just been mentioned or is known about

examples.ch: “乔交了个新男友。”“哦，真的吗？他叫什甚名字？”
examples.en: "Jo's got a new boyfriend." "Oh really? What's his name?"

examples.ch: 公牛突然抬起角。
examples.en: The bull tossed his horns.

examples.ch: 克里斯告诉你他买彩票中奖了吗？
examples.en: Did Chris tell you about his winning some money in the lottery?

defines.trans_ch: 他的（指刚提过的人或动物，其性别不详或并不重要）
defines.trans_en: belonging to or connected with a person or animal that has just been mentioned and whose sex is not known or not considered to be important. Many people consider this use to be offensive and prefer to use him or her or their instead, or its for an animal.

examples.ch: 任何驾车达到时速100英里的人都是在自找麻烦。
examples.en: Anyone who drives his car at 100 miles an hour is asking for trouble.

examples.ch: 这条狗真可爱！它叫什么名字？
examples.en: What a cute dog! What's his name?

defines.trans_en: the one(s) belonging to or connected with a man, boy, or male animal that has just been mentioned or is known about

examples.ch: 马克刚才来电话说他的外套落下了。你知道这件是他的吗？
examples.en: Mark just phoned to say he'd left his coat behind. Do you know if this is his?

examples.ch: 他把我们介绍给他的同事。
examples.en: He introduced us to some colleagues of his.

examples.ch: 他的办公室在你前面，走廊的尽头。
examples.en: His is the office directly ahead of you, at the far end of the corridor.

defines.trans_en: to move your hand or an object onto the surface of something so that it touches it, usually with force

examples.ch: 不允许教师打学生。
examples.en: Teachers are not allowed to hit their pupils.

examples.ch: 这种玻璃无论你怎么敲击都不会碎。
examples.en: This type of glass won't shatter no matter how hard you hit it.

examples.ch: 她用锤子砸到自己的拇指。
examples.en: She hit her thumb with the hammer.

defines.trans_en: to touch something with sudden force

examples.ch: 他们的车撞到树上时正以约每小时60公里的车速行驶。
examples.en: They were going about 60 kilometres an hour when their car hit the tree.

examples.ch: 一名记者被流弹击中了腿部。
examples.en: One journalist was hit in the leg by a stray bullet.

examples.ch: 浴室里的那个新架子太低——我的头刚刚撞在上面了。
examples.en: That new shelf in the bathroom is too low - I just hit my head on it.

defines.trans_en: to have an unpleasant or negative effect on a person or thing

examples.ch: 罢工严重影响了生产。
examples.en: Production has been badly hit by the strike.

examples.ch: 由于害怕遭遇恐怖袭击，人们对飞越大西洋航班的需求受到了影响。
examples.en: Demand for transatlantic flights has been hit by fears of terrorist attacks.

defines.trans_en: If an idea or thought hits you, you suddenly think of it.

examples.ch: 那一刻我忽然明白我的人生再也不会和过去一样了。
examples.en: That's when it hit me that my life would never be the same again.

defines.trans_en: to shoot at or bomb a place or person, causing damage or injury

examples.ch: 空袭中有两所学校遭到了轰炸。
examples.en: Two schools were hit during the air raid.

examples.ch: 他被一名狙击手射出的子弹击中了颈部。
examples.en: He was hit in the neck by a bullet from a sniper.

examples.ch: 要尽量打中靶心。
examples.en: Try to hit the middle of the target.

defines.trans_en: to arrive at a place or position

examples.ch: 如果在下一个路口左转弯，走5英里左右后我们就会抵达大路。
examples.en: If we turn left at the next junction, we should hit the main road after five miles or so.

defines.trans_en: to succeed in reaching or achieving something

examples.ch: 去年我们的盈利达到了2000万英镑的最高纪录。
examples.en: Our profits hit an all-time high of $20 million last year.

examples.ch: 我就是不能像过去一样把那些高音唱上去。
examples.en: I just can't hit (= sing) those high notes like I used to.

defines.trans_en: to kill someone

examples.ch: 周末有3名毒贩在该市被击毙。
examples.en: Three drug dealers were hit in the city over the weekend.

phrases.trans_en: to like someone and become friendly immediately

examples.ch: 我和他的朋友们并不怎么合得来。
examples.en: I didn't really hit it off with his friends.

examples.ch: 杰克和苏一见如故。
examples.en: Jake and Sue hit it off immediately.

defines.trans_ch: 非常受欢迎的人（或事）；非常成功的人（或事）
defines.trans_en: a thing or person that is very popular or successful

examples.ch: 20世纪60年代甲壳虫乐队推出了一系列排行榜冠军曲目。
examples.en: The Beatles had a string of number-one hits in the 1960s.

examples.ch: 聚会上你的蛋糕真是棒极了——每个人都在谈论。
examples.en: Your cake was a real hit at the party - everyone commented.

examples.ch: 他们刚刚发行了一张他们的上榜歌曲精选。
examples.en: They've just released an album of their greatest hits (= their most successful songs).

defines.trans_en: a request to use a web page on the internet that is then counted to calculate the number of people looking at the page

examples.ch: 我们的网页本周的点击数为243次。
examples.en: Our page had 243 hits this week.

defines.trans_en: the act of hitting something or someone, or an occasion when something or someone hits you

examples.ch: 她击中了他的头部，打得他眼冒金星。
examples.en: She gave him a hit on the head which knocked him flying.

defines.trans_en: in baseball, when the batter (= person trying to hit the ball) safely reaches first base after hitting the ball
an occasion when something that has been thrown, dropped, shot, etc. at a place or object reaches that place or object

examples.ch: 在这次进攻中，一颗炸弹直接击中了叛军的总部。
examples.en: The rebel headquarters took a direct hit from a bomb during the attack.

examples.ch: 我的第二枪击中了靶心。
examples.en: I scored a hit on my second shot.

defines.trans_en: an act of murder

examples.ch: 他是被黑手党谋杀的。
examples.en: He was the victim of a mafia hit.

defines.trans_en: an activity that someone does for pleasure when they are not working

examples.ch: 安吉拉的业余爱好是修复老爷摩托车。
examples.en: Angela's hobby is restoring vintage motorcycles.

defines.trans_en: a game played on a sports field between two teams of eleven players who each have a curved stick with which they try to put a small, hard ball into the other team's goal

→ 
ice hockey mainly UK
a time when someone does not go to work or school but is free to do what they want, such as travel or relax

examples.ch: 野营／滑雪假期
examples.en: a camping/skiing holiday

examples.ch: 你决定今年到哪里度假了吗？
examples.en: Have you decided where you're going for your holiday(s) this year?

examples.ch: 帕特里夏下星期休假。
examples.en: Patricia is on holiday next week.

examples.ch: 你的新工作有多少天假期？
examples.en: How many days' holiday do you get with your new job?

examples.ch: 我们想去法国过暑假。
examples.en: We thought we'd go to France for our summer holiday.

examples.ch: 想必学校马上就要放假了吧。
examples.en: Surely the school holidays start soon.

defines.trans_en: an official day when you do not have to go to work or school

examples.ch: 公共假日
examples.en: a public holiday

examples.ch: 圣帕特里克节是爱尔兰的一个节日。
examples.en: St Patrick's Day is a holiday in Ireland.

phrases.trans_ch: （十二月底一月初圣诞节、犹太光明节、新年期间的）假期
phrases.trans_en: the time at the end of December and beginning of January each year that includes Christmas, Hanukkah, and New Year

examples.ch: 圣诞新年期间我们在家里。
examples.en: We were at home for the holidays.

defines.trans_en: to take a holiday

examples.ch: 我的父母今年要去西班牙度假。
examples.en: My parents are holidaying in Spain this year.

defines.trans_en: the house, apartment, etc. where you live, especially with your family

examples.ch: 这位参议员有两个家——一个是位于华盛顿的公寓，另一个是科罗拉多的家。
examples.en: The senator has two homes - an apartment in Washington and a house in Colorado.

examples.ch: 他在大街上住了3个月了，他的家就是一个纸板箱。
examples.en: He was living on the streets for three months, and his home was a cardboard box.

examples.ch: 4点之后打家里的电话找我。
examples.en: Call me at home after four o'clock.

examples.ch: 决定留在家里带孩子的妇女
examples.en: women who decide to stay at home and look after their children

examples.ch: 他23岁时离家独立生活。
examples.en: He left home (= stopped living with his parents) when he was 23.

examples.ch: 越来越多的伴侣不结婚就组成家庭。
examples.en: More and more couples are setting up home together without getting married.

defines.trans_en: a house, apartment, etc. when it is considered as property that you can buy or sell

examples.ch: 豪华住宅／作为过渡房而买的第一所小房子
examples.en: luxury/starter homes

defines.trans_en: the type of family you come from

examples.ch: 我们有一个幸福的家庭。
examples.en: We had a happy home.

examples.ch: 来自离异家庭的孩子
examples.en: children from a broken home (= from a family in which the parents had separated)

defines.trans_en: a place where people or animals live and are cared for by people who are not their relations or owners

examples.ch: 孤儿院／养老院／流狼狗收容所
examples.en: a children's home/an old people's home/a dogs' home

examples.ch: 他的幼年时期在孤儿院度过。
examples.en: He spent his early years in a home.

defines.trans_en: someone's or something's place of origin, or the place where a person feels they belong

examples.ch: 我住在伦敦，但我出生在希腊。
examples.en: I live in London, but my home (= where I was born) is in Greece.

examples.ch: 我实际上出生在新西兰，但我在香港住了这么久，现在感觉就像我的故乡一样了。
examples.en: I was actually born in New Zealand, but I've lived in Hong Kong for so long that it feels like home now.

defines.trans_en: your own country or your own area

examples.ch: 她爱法国，但是她想念自己的国家。
examples.en: She loves France, but she misses home.

examples.ch: 在我们国家，这叫做猪油饼。
examples.en: At home we call this "lardy cake".

examples.ch: 我纳闷他们在国内做什么。
examples.en: I wonder what they're doing back at home.

phrases.trans_en: If a sports team are/play at home, they play on their own sports field.

defines.trans_en: at or to your house or the place where you live

examples.ch: 别担心，我很快就回家了。
examples.en: Don't worry, I'll be home soon.

examples.ch: 对不起他现在不在家。
examples.en: I'm sorry, he's not home right now.

examples.ch: 孩子们独自在家。
examples.en: The kids were home alone.

examples.ch: 她决定放弃，回家了。
examples.en: She decided to give up and go home.

examples.ch: 他破晓时回到家。
examples.en: He came home as the dawn was breaking.

examples.ch: 乔西疲倦了，所我我们把他带回了家。
examples.en: Josh was tired so we took him home.

examples.ch: 我带了一两本书回家看。
examples.en: I took home a couple of books to read.

examples.ch: 晚会结束后我会把所有人都带回家。
examples.en: I'll bring everyone home after the party.

examples.ch: 当你回家晚时，就不想还要煮饭了。
examples.en: When you get home late you don't feel like cooking.

examples.ch: 我希望你昨晚回家时一路安全？
examples.en: I hope you made it home safely last night?

examples.ch: 决定留在家里带孩子的妇女
examples.en: women who decide to stay home and care for their children

defines.trans_en: in or to the country or area where you come from

examples.ch: 我们祈祷我们的军队都能平安回国。
examples.en: We pray all our troops will come home safely.

examples.ch: 我纳闷他们在国内在做什么。
examples.en: I wonder what they're doing back home.

examples.ch: 在家乡我们把这叫做果冻。
examples.en: Back home we call this jelly.

defines.trans_en: relating to the house, flat, etc. where someone lives

examples.ch: 住所拥有权
examples.en: home ownership

examples.ch: 居家改善／维护
examples.en: home improvements/maintenance

examples.ch: 住房价格
examples.en: home prices

defines.trans_en: done at home, or intended to be used at home

examples.ch: 家庭烹饪
examples.en: home cooking

examples.ch: 家酿啤酒
examples.en: home-brewed beer

examples.ch: 家庭用计算机
examples.en: a home computer

examples.ch: 家庭电话号码
examples.en: my home telephone number

defines.trans_en: relating to your family or your life at home

examples.ch: 他的家庭生活影响了他的工作。
examples.en: His home life is affecting his work.

examples.ch: 家庭困难的学生
examples.en: students who have a difficult home situation

defines.trans_en: connected with or done in your own country

examples.ch: 他的书在本国市场很畅销，可在国外却没有什么读者。
examples.en: His books were a success in his home country/market, but failed to find an audience abroad.

defines.trans_en: relating to the place where a team is based and plays a lot of its games

examples.ch: 主队／东道主
examples.en: the home team/side

examples.ch: 主场
examples.en: a home ground

examples.ch: 主场比赛
examples.en: a home match/game

examples.ch: 主场队服
examples.en: the home strip (= clothing worn by a team when they play a home match)

examples.ch: 主场优势
examples.en: home advantage (= the improved chance of success that playing at home gives to a team)

defines.trans_en: work that teachers give their students to do at home

examples.ch: 做完家庭作业之后你才能看电视。
examples.en: You can't watch TV until you've done your homework.

examples.ch: 历史／地理家庭作业
examples.en: history/geography homework

defines.trans_en: to want something to happen or to be true, and usually have a good reason to think that it might

examples.ch: 我盼望着下星期有一次面试。
examples.en: I'm hoping for an interview next week.

examples.ch: 她希望她不会离开太久。
examples.en: She's hoping (that) she won't be away too long.

examples.ch: 我希望她能赢。
examples.en: I hope (that) she'll win.

examples.ch: 我们只能祈祷手术顺利。
examples.en: We have to hope and pray (that) the operation will go well.

examples.ch: 他们希望明年能来我们这里作客。
examples.en: They hope to visit us next year.

examples.ch: 我希望是好消息。
examples.en: It's good news, I hope.

examples.ch: “你明天会参加那个会议吗？”“恐怕不行／我想是的。”
examples.en: "Will you be at the meeting tomorrow?" "I hope not/so".

defines.trans_en: something good that you want to happen in the future, or a confident feeling about what will happen in the future

examples.ch: 你对未来有什么希望和梦想？
examples.en: What are your hopes and dreams for the future?

examples.ch: 这个项目有没有希望得到资金上的支持?
examples.en: Is there any hope of getting financial support for the project?

examples.ch: 他们有没有希望及时回到家?
examples.en: Is there any hope that they will be home in time?

examples.ch: 城市里的年轻人在一天天长大，却根本就没有希望找到工作。
examples.en: Young people are growing up in our cities without any hope of finding a job.

examples.ch: 他的回答击碎了我们的希望。
examples.en: His reply dashed (= destroyed) our hopes.

examples.ch: 他们把（所有）希望都寄托在新队员身上了。
examples.en: They have pinned (all) their hopes on (= they are depending for success on) their new player.

examples.ch: 她病得非常重，但是仍有希望／我们觉得仍有希望。
examples.en: She's very ill, but there's still hope/we live in hope (= we think she might be cured).

examples.ch: 现在的情况已经毫无希望了。
examples.en: The situation is now beyond/past hope (= unlikely to produce the desired result).

examples.ch: 我们从未放弃她能够生还的希望。
examples.en: We never gave up hope (= stopped hoping) that she would be found alive.

examples.ch: 这封信给了我们一线希望。
examples.en: The letter offered us a glimmer/ray of (= a little) hope.

examples.ch: 我一直到4点钟才打电话是希望这时你会完成了。
examples.en: I didn't phone until four o'clock in the hope that you'd be finished.

examples.ch: 我对弄到票不抱多大希望。
examples.en: I don't hold out much hope of getting (= I don't expect to be able to get) a ticket.

defines.trans_en: a large animal with four legs that people ride on or use for carrying things or pulling vehicles

examples.ch: 骑马
examples.en: to ride a horse

examples.ch: 一辆马车
examples.en: a horse and cart

defines.trans_en: a tall piece of equipment that people jump over in gymnastics

→ 
heroin

phrases.trans_en: horse races where you try to win money by correctly guessing which horse will win

examples.ch: 他把所有的钱都花在赌马上了。
examples.en: He spends all his money on the horses.

defines.trans_en: a place where people who are ill or injured are treated and taken care of by doctors and nurses

examples.ch: 综合／儿童／妇产医院
examples.en: a general/children's/maternity hospital

examples.ch: 医院的病人／工作人员
examples.en: hospital patients/staff

examples.ch: 我不得不接受手术。
examples.en: I've got to go (in)to hospital (US to the hospital) to have an operation.

examples.ch: 去年她住了一个星期的院。
examples.en: She spent a week in hospital (US in the hospital) last year.

defines.trans_en: having a high temperature

examples.ch: 炎热的晴天
examples.en: a hot, sunny day

examples.ch: 炎热的天气
examples.en: hot weather

examples.ch: 热饮／热饭
examples.en: a hot drink/meal

examples.ch: 这里面太热了，我们能把暖气关小点吗？
examples.en: It's too hot in here, can we turn down the heating?

examples.ch: 把蛋糕放进烤炉里，用大约220摄氏度的温度烤30分钟。
examples.en: Bake the cake in a hot oven, about 220°C, for 30 minutes.

examples.ch: 食物是滚烫的。
examples.en: The food was piping hot (= very hot).

defines.trans_en: used to describe food that causes a burning feeling in the mouth

examples.ch: 辣咖喱
examples.en: a hot curry

examples.ch: 辣味食品
examples.en: hot, spicy food

defines.trans_en: used to describe a subject that causes a lot of disagreement or discussion

examples.ch: 全球气候变暖已成为一个热门话题。
examples.en: Global warming has become a very hot issue.

defines.trans_en: new and exciting

examples.ch: 好莱坞新近最红的女演员
examples.en: Hollywood's hottest new actress

examples.ch: 热门话题
examples.en: hot gossip

examples.ch: 这位21岁的演员已经成了好莱坞最走红的明星。
examples.en: This 21-year-old actor has become Hollywood's hottest property.

defines.trans_ch: 所知甚多的；技艺精湛的
defines.trans_en: knowing a lot or skilful

examples.ch: 我对俄罗斯的历史所知不多。
examples.en: I'm not too hot on Russian history.

defines.trans_en: Hot goods have been recently stolen and are therefore difficult to sell or dangerous to deal with because the police are still looking for them.
sexually attractive, or feeling sexually excited

examples.ch: 她很性感。
examples.en: She's really hot!

examples.ch: 我为你着迷，宝贝儿。
examples.en: I'm hot for you, baby.

examples.ch: 今晚的约会让我欲火中烧。
examples.en: I've got a hot date tonight.

phrases.trans_ch: 对比赛结果的准确猜测
phrases.trans_en: an accurate piece of advice about who will win a race

examples.ch: 今天下午的比赛你拿得准谁会获胜吗？
examples.en: Do you have any hot tips for this afternoon's race?

phrases.trans_ch: 夺冠的大热门，最可能获胜者
phrases.trans_en: the person or animal that is most likely to win a race, competition, election, etc.

examples.ch: 他是最有希望赢得竞选的热门人选。
examples.en: He's the hot favourite to win the election.

phrases.trans_en: to think that a particular thing is very important and to demand that it is done well or correctly

examples.ch: 他们非常注重工作着装，所以她总是穿得非常整洁。
examples.en: They're very hot on dress at work so she always looks very smart for the office.

phrases.trans_en: If someone has a hot temper, they are easily made angry.

defines.trans_en: a building where you pay to have a room to sleep in, and where you can sometimes eat meals

examples.ch: 四星级酒店
examples.en: a four-star hotel

examples.ch: 克拉伦登酒店
examples.en: the Clarendon Hotel

examples.ch: 我们住在一家滨海酒店。
examples.en: We stayed in/at a hotel on the beach.

examples.ch: 宾馆的客人
examples.en: hotel guests

defines.trans_en: a building where alcoholic drinks can be bought and drunk and where food is often available
a restaurant
a period of 60 minutes

examples.ch: 考试持续了一个半小时。
examples.en: The exam lasted an hour and a half.

examples.ch: 1天有24小时。
examples.en: There are 24 hours in a day.

examples.ch: 你需要睡多少个小时？
examples.en: How many hours' sleep do you need?

examples.ch: 我会在一小时／两小时之后回来。
examples.en: I'll be back in an hour's/two hours' time (= after one/two hours).

examples.ch: 我家乡离休斯顿有一小时的路程。
examples.en: My hometown is an hour from Houston/an hour away (= it takes an hour to travel there).

examples.ch: 他拿的是按小时计酬的工资。
examples.en: He gets paid by the hour (= gets a particular amount of money for each hour he works).

examples.ch: 火车每小时整点发车。
examples.en: Trains leave every hour on the hour (= at exactly one o'clock, two o'clock, etc.).

examples.ch: 公共汽车每整点过10分／差10分发一班车。
examples.en: Buses leave at ten minutes past/to the hour (= at ten past/to one o'clock, two o'clock, etc.).

examples.ch: 宣战时间是晚上6点。
examples.en: War was declared at eighteen hundred hours/18.00 hours (= at six o'clock in the evening).

defines.trans_ch: （用于做某事的）时间;（商店或公共场所）开放时间
defines.trans_en: the period of time when a particular activity happens or when a shop or public building is open

examples.ch: 我试着把午餐时间用在步行上。
examples.en: I try to spend my lunch hour walking.

examples.ch: 办公／工作时间
examples.en: office/working hours

examples.ch: 我们的开放时间是8点到6点。
examples.en: Our opening hours are from 8.00 to 6.00.

defines.trans_ch: （白天或夜里的）某个时间，某个时刻
defines.trans_en: a particular time during the day or night

examples.ch: 谁会在夜里这么晚给我们打电话？
examples.en: Who could be calling us at this unearthly/ungodly hour (= so late at night)?

examples.ch: 他凌晨才回来。
examples.en: He returned in the early/small hours (= at night, after midnight).

phrases.text: work long, regular, unsocial, etc. hours
phrases.trans_ch: 长时间工作／工作时间规律／在其他人不上班的时间工作（等等）
phrases.trans_en: used to describe how many hours in the day you work or what part of the day you work

examples.ch: 她是名护士，所以经常要上早班、值夜班。
examples.en: She's a nurse so she often works unsocial hours.

examples.ch: 他薪水很高，可是工作时间也很长。
examples.en: He's paid well but he works long hours.

phrases.trans_en: for a very long time

examples.ch: 我等了他很长时间。
examples.en: I waited for him for hours.

phrases.text: at all hours (of the day and night)
phrases.trans_ch: 整天不断地;昼夜不停地
phrases.trans_en: repeatedly during the day and the night

examples.ch: 他们整天不停地给我打电话。
examples.en: They keep calling me at all hours (of the day and night).

defines.trans_en: a building that people, usually one family, live in

examples.ch: 独立式／半独立式住宅
examples.en: a detached/semi-detached house

examples.ch: 买／租房子
examples.en: to buy/rent a house

examples.ch: 房价
examples.en: house prices

examples.ch: 她住在十字街上的一所小房子里。
examples.en: She lives in a little house in (US on) Cross Street.

defines.trans_ch: 住在一所房子里的人;全家人
defines.trans_en: all the people living in a house

examples.ch: 你进来的时候不要把全家人都吵醒！
examples.en: Try not to wake the whole house when you come in!

defines.trans_en: a building where animals are kept

examples.ch: 动物园里猴子／狮子的笼舍
examples.en: the monkey/lion house at the zoo

examples.ch: 鸡舍
examples.en: a hen house

defines.trans_en: a building or part of a building that is used for a special purpose

examples.ch: 悉尼歌剧院
examples.en: the Sydney Opera House

examples.ch: 广播电台大楼
examples.en: Broadcasting House

defines.trans_ch: （尤指出版图书或设计服装的）公司，机构，商行
defines.trans_en: a company that is involved in a particular area of business

examples.ch: 出版社
examples.en: a publishing house

examples.ch: 时装屋
examples.en: a fashion house

examples.ch: 咖喱屋（或餐厅）
examples.en: a curry house (= a South Asian restaurant)

defines.trans_ch: 豪斯音乐，货仓音乐（电子乐器演奏的一种快节奏的流行音乐）
defines.trans_en: popular dance music with a fast regular beat, usually produced on electronic equipment

examples.ch: 豪斯音乐最早出现于20世纪80年代晚期。
examples.en: House music first appeared in the late 1980s.

defines.trans_ch: （学校里为进行比赛而分成的）组
defines.trans_en: any of a small number of groups that the children in a school are put in for sports and other competitions

examples.ch: 校内小组之间的足球赛
examples.en: an inter-house hockey match

defines.trans_en: an important family, especially a royal one

examples.ch: 英国王室属于温莎家族。
examples.en: The British Royal Family belong to the House of Windsor.

defines.trans_en: an organization that makes laws, or its meeting place
the group of people who suggest a subject for a debate

examples.ch: 今晚的辩题是“正方认为应该废除死刑”。
examples.en: The motion for tonight's debate is, "This house believes that capital punishment should be abolished."

defines.trans_en: the people watching a performance, especially in a theatre

examples.ch: 该歌剧演出时观众爆满。
examples.en: The opera played to a full/packed house.

phrases.trans_en: the members of the organization that makes laws

examples.ch: 议员们于下午3点开始就提案进行辩论。
examples.en: The House began debating the proposal at 3 p.m.

defines.trans_ch: 为…提供住处，收容;为…提供空间
defines.trans_en: to give a person or animal a place to live, or to provide space for something

examples.ch: 收容所有的难民将会很困难。
examples.en: It will be difficult to house all the refugees.

examples.ch: 这家博物馆所收藏的古董玩具是全欧洲最多的。
examples.en: The museum houses the biggest collection of antique toys in Europe.

defines.trans_en: in what way, or by what methods

examples.ch: 我们从这儿怎么去城里？
examples.en: How do we get to the town from here?

examples.ch: 你是怎么知道这场音乐会的？
examples.en: How did you hear about the concert?

examples.ch: 这台机器如何运转？
examples.en: How does this machine work?

examples.ch: 你计划怎样度过你的假期？
examples.en: How do you plan to spend your holiday?

examples.ch: 罗兹不会骑自行车。
examples.en: Roz doesn't know how to ride a bicycle.

examples.ch: 那完全取决于你如何看待它。
examples.en: It all depends on how you look at it.

examples.ch: 我不太在乎时尚，衣服我爱怎么穿就怎么穿。
examples.en: I don't care about fashion, I dress how I please.

examples.ch: 听到她受到如此的对待，我感到十分惊骇。
examples.en: I was horrified to hear about how (= the way) she had been treated.

examples.ch: 他怎么会那么蠢？
examples.en: How can/could he be so stupid?

examples.ch: 我不知道怎么会有人那么想。
examples.en: I don't know how anyone could think that way.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指身体或精神状况）怎么样
defines.trans_en: used to ask about someone's physical or emotional state

examples.ch: 你母亲身体怎么样？
examples.en: How is your mother?

examples.ch: 今天早上你觉得怎么样？
examples.en: How are you feeling this morning?

defines.trans_ch: （用于询问经历或事情）怎么样
defines.trans_en: used in questions that ask what an experience or event was like

examples.ch: 你的空中旅途怎么样？
examples.en: How was your flight?

examples.ch: 你觉得那场演讲怎么样？
examples.en: How did you find the lecture? (= did you think it was good)?

examples.ch: 你觉得这场音乐会怎么样？
examples.en: How did you like the concert (= did you enjoy it)?

examples.ch: 她没说离她家有多远。
examples.en: She didn't say how far it is (= what the distance is) to her house.

examples.ch: 你打算在浴室里呆多久？
examples.en: How long are you going to be (= what amount of time are you going to spend) in the bathroom?

examples.ch: 你知道有多少人要来吗？
examples.en: Do you know how many (= what number of) people are coming?

examples.ch: 这个多少钱？
examples.en: How much does this cost (= what is its price)?

examples.ch: 他女儿多大了？
examples.en: How old is his daughter (= what age is she)?

examples.ch: “你能提起这个箱子吗？”“那要看它有多重。”
examples.en: "Can you lift this case?" "It depends on how heavy it is."

examples.ch: 你还记得我们过去一有新电影上映就马上去看吗？
examples.en: Do you remember how (= the fact that) we used to see every new film as soon as it came out?

defines.trans_en: used for emphasis

examples.ch: 你来了，我真是说不出的高兴。
examples.en: I can't tell you how pleased I am (= I am very pleased) that you came.

examples.ch: 见到你真高兴！
examples.en: How (= it is very) nice to see you!

examples.ch: “她把所有的账都付了。”“她可真大方。”
examples.en: "She paid for everything." "How (= that was very) generous."

phrases.text: how strange, stupid, weird, etc. is that?
phrases.trans_ch: （用于强调）那可真奇怪／愚蠢／古怪（等等）
phrases.trans_en: used to emphasize that something is strange, stupid, etc.
used to ask someone if they are well and happy

examples.ch: “嗨，露西，你好吗？”“挺好的，多谢，你呢？”
examples.en: "Hi, Lucy, how are you?" "Fine, thanks, how are you?"

phrases.trans_en: used as greetings

phrases.trans_ch: （要求某人解释刚说的话）你是什么意思?
phrases.trans_en: used when you want someone to explain what they have just said

examples.ch: “我认为我们应该重新考虑一下我们的立场。”“你是什么意思？”
examples.en: "I think we need to reconsider our position." "How do you mean?"

phrases.trans_ch: （用于为某人做某事之后询问效果）满意吗？怎么样？
phrases.trans_en: used when asking if something you have done for someone is satisfactory

examples.ch: 让我给你背后加一个垫子。舒服吗？
examples.en: Let me put a cushion behind your back. How's that?

phrases.trans_en: used to show that you feel the same way as someone

examples.ch: “这个项目完成了我会很高兴。”“我也是！”
examples.en: "I'll be so glad when this project is finished." "And how!"

defines.trans_en: wanting or needing food

examples.ch: 到4点钟的时候我觉得饿极了。
examples.en: By four o'clock I felt/was really hungry.

examples.ch: 孩子们放学回家时总是饥肠辘辘的。
examples.en: The children are always hungry when they get home from school.

examples.ch: 世界上有太多的人在挨饿。
examples.en: There are too many hungry people (= people without enough to eat) in the world.

examples.ch: 为了让孩子们有足够的吃的，她自己经常挨饿。
examples.en: She often goes hungry herself (= does not eat) so that her children can have enough to eat.

examples.ch: 在园子里挖地真是件让人容易饿的体力活儿。
examples.en: Digging the garden is hungry work (= makes you feel hunger).

defines.trans_en: having a strong wish or desire for something

examples.ch: 她如此地渴望成功，愿意为之做任何事。
examples.en: She was so hungry for success that she'd do anything to achieve it.

examples.ch: 新闻记者非常渴望得知细节。
examples.en: Journalists were hungry for details.

defines.trans_en: having a strong wish or desire for the stated thing

examples.ch: 权力欲极强的政客
examples.en: power-hungry politicians

defines.trans_en: to move or do things more quickly than normal or to make someone do this

examples.ch: 快点儿，要不你就晚了。
examples.en: Hurry or you'll be late.

examples.ch: 她匆忙去接电话。
examples.en: She hurried to answer the phone.

examples.ch: 我不愿在别人催促下匆忙作决定。
examples.en: I refuse to be hurried into a decision (= to be forced to make a decision too quickly).

examples.ch: 利用午饭时间买完东西后，她匆忙赶回去工作。
examples.en: After spending her lunch hour shopping, she hurried back (= returned quickly) to work.

examples.ch: 我不想催你，但是我几分钟之后就得走了。
examples.en: I hate to hurry you, but I have to leave in a few minutes.

examples.ch: 吃东西不要太急。
examples.en: Don't hurry your food (= don't eat it too quickly).

defines.trans_en: the need to move or do things more quickly than normal

examples.ch: 我们走得过于仓促，连票都忘了拿。
examples.en: We left in such a hurry that we forgot our tickets.

examples.ch: “你能等几分钟吗？”“可以，我不急。”
examples.en: "Can you wait a few minutes?" "Yes, I'm not in any hurry/I'm in no hurry (= I can wait)."

examples.ch: 你急着走吗？
examples.en: Are you in a hurry (= wanting) to leave?

examples.ch: 你急什么？
examples.en: What's (all) the hurry (for)/Why (all) the hurry? (= Why are you acting or moving so quickly?)

examples.ch: “我下星期就把这个还你。”“没关系，不用那么急。”
examples.en: "I'll let you have this back next week." "That's all right, there's no (great) hurry/there isn't any (great) hurry (= no need to do it quickly)."

defines.trans_en: to feel pain in a part of your body, or to injure someone or cause them pain

examples.ch: 告诉我哪儿疼。
examples.en: Tell me where it hurts.

examples.ch: 我的头疼。
examples.en: My head hurts.

examples.ch: 她说她的耳朵疼。
examples.en: She says that her ear hurts her.

examples.ch: 埃玛从马上摔下来，背部受了伤。
examples.en: Emma hurt her back when she fell off her horse.

examples.ch: 有数人在这次爆炸中受了重伤。
examples.en: Several people were seriously/badly hurt in the explosion.

defines.trans_en: to cause emotional pain to someone

examples.ch: 她很严厉地批评了我写的东西，让我很伤心。
examples.en: She criticized my writing quite severely and that hurt.

examples.ch: 婚姻的结束深深地伤害了他。
examples.en: He was badly hurt by the end of his marriage.

defines.trans_en: to cause harm or difficulty

examples.ch: 当前的高利率给很多企业造成了不利影响。
examples.en: A lot of businesses are being hurt by the current high interest rates.

examples.ch: 这些指控严重损害了她的名声。
examples.en: These allegations have seriously hurt her reputation.

examples.ch: 努力工作绝不会对任何人有害。
examples.en: Hard work never hurt anyone (= does no one any harm).

examples.ch: 多喝一杯不会有什么害处的。
examples.en: One more drink won't hurt (= won't cause any harm).

defines.trans_en: injured or in pain

examples.ch: 我来扶你起来。你伤到哪儿没有？
examples.en: Let me help you up. Are you hurt?

examples.ch: 把那把刀收起来别伤着人。
examples.en: Put that knife away before someone gets hurt.

defines.trans_en: upset or unhappy

examples.ch: 你说的话让我很伤心。
examples.en: I feel very hurt by what you said.

examples.ch: “那太无情了。”他带着受伤的语调说道。
examples.en: "That was very unkind," he said in a hurt voice.

defines.trans_en: emotional pain

examples.ch: 失恋可能会带来极大的痛苦。
examples.en: The hurt after a relationship breaks up can be awful.

examples.ch: 她勇敢的微笑背后隐藏着深深的痛苦。
examples.en: Her brave smile concealed a deep hurt.

defines.trans_en: the man that you are married to

examples.ch: 我从未见过菲奥娜的丈夫。
examples.en: I've never met Fiona's husband.

defines.trans_en: to use something carefully so that you do not use all of it
water that has frozen and become solid, or pieces of this

examples.ch: 这个池塘整个冬天都结着冰。
examples.en: The pond was covered in ice all winter.

examples.ch: 你的果汁里要加冰块吗？
examples.en: Would you like ice in your juice?

examples.ch: 我已经把几瓶香槟冰镇起来了。
examples.en: I've put a couple of bottles of champagne on ice (= in a container of ice to get cold).

examples.ch: 他在一块冰上滑了一下。
examples.en: He slipped on a patch of ice.

defines.trans_en: an ice cream, especially one bought in a shop

examples.ch: 商店的招牌上写着：“饮料、糕点、冰激凌！”。
examples.en: The shop sign said "Drinks, Cakes, Ices!"

defines.trans_en: jewellery, especially diamonds

defines.trans_ch: （美国）移民及海关执法局（Immigration and Customs Enforcement 的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for Immigration and Customs Enforcement: the US government department that is responsible for making sure that laws on who is allowed to enter, stay in, and work in the US and what is allowed to be brought across US borders are obeyed

examples.ch: 这位参议员呼吁移民及海关执法局不要驱逐这名有四个年幼孩子的妇女。
examples.en: The senator urged ICE not to deport the woman, who has four young children.

examples.ch: 在移民及海关执法局对一家服装厂的突击搜查中，100多名工人因与移民有关的罪行被捕。
examples.en: In a raid by ICE agents on a clothing manufacturer, more than 100 workers were arrested on immigration-related offences.

defines.trans_ch: 紧急情况联系人（In Case of Emergency 的缩写，用作储存在手机上的一个号码的名字，如果手机主人突发疾病或受伤，其他人可以拨打这个号码）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for In Case of Emergency: used as a name for a number stored on a person's mobile phone that other people should call if the person is seriously ill or injured

examples.ch: “紧急情况联系人”这个做法是在伦敦七七爆炸案之后开始广泛使用的。
examples.en: The idea of ICE took off after the 7 July 2005 London bombings.

examples.ch: 有些手机允许在屏幕“锁定”的情况下直接进入紧急情况联系人列表。
examples.en: Some handsets provide access to a list of ICE contacts directly from the "locked" screen.

defines.trans_en: to cover a cake with icing (= a food made mainly with sugar)

examples.ch: 我为她做了一个巧克力蛋糕，现在只需要加上糖衣。
examples.en: I've made her a chocolate cake - now I just need to ice it.

defines.trans_en: to murder someone
a suggestion or plan for doing something

examples.ch: 我有个主意——我们为什么不去海滨呢？
examples.en: I've had an idea - why don't we go to the coast?

examples.ch: “我们去游泳吧。”“好主意！”
examples.en: "Let's go swimming." "That's a good idea!"

examples.ch: 我给杰克买什么东西好，如果你有什么主意请告诉我。
examples.en: If you have any ideas for what I could buy Jack, let me know.

examples.ch: 那是我首次有了自己创业的想法。
examples.en: That's when I first had the idea of starting (= planned to start) my own business.

examples.ch: 我觉得住在乡村的想法很好，但我不肯定是否喜欢这样一种现实。
examples.en: I like the idea of living in the countryside but I'm not sure I'd like the reality.

examples.ch: 她满脑子好点子。
examples.en: She's full of bright (= good) ideas.

examples.ch: 租自行车是凯特的主意。
examples.en: It was Kate's idea to hire bikes.

examples.ch: 连续开车几个小时都不休息不是个好主意。
examples.en: It's not a good idea to drive for hours without a rest.

defines.trans_en: an understanding, thought, or picture in your mind

examples.ch: 你知道他长什么样吗？
examples.en: Do you have any idea of what he looks like?

examples.ch: 你能告诉我费用大致是多少吗？
examples.en: Can you give me an idea of the cost (= can you tell me approximately how it costs)?

examples.ch: 我不喜欢生活在离家这么远的地方。
examples.en: I don't like the idea of living so far away from my family.

examples.ch: 我根本不知道他们去了哪儿。
examples.en: I haven't the slightest/faintest idea where they've gone.

examples.ch: 我很清楚他们为什么早早就离开了。
examples.en: I've got a pretty good idea why they left early.

defines.trans_en: a belief or opinion

examples.ch: 我们对于如何管教孩子看法大不相同。
examples.en: We have very different ideas about disciplining children.

examples.ch: 利奇提出的观点是，宠坏孩子是不可能的。
examples.en: Dr Leach puts forward the idea that it is impossible to spoil a child.

examples.ch: 我没有结婚——你这想法是从哪儿来的？
examples.en: I'm not married - where did you get that idea (= what made you believe that)?

defines.trans_en: a purpose or reason for doing something

examples.ch: 游戏的目的是尽快出完手中的牌。
examples.en: The idea of the game is to get rid of all your cards as soon as you can.

examples.ch: 广告的唯一目的就在于让人买东西。
examples.en: The whole idea (= only purpose) of advertising is to make people buy things.

examples.ch: 发行彩票的目的在于为慈善事业筹款。
examples.en: The idea behind the lottery is to raise money for good causes.

phrases.trans_en: to not know something

defines.trans_en: used to say that a particular thing can or will happen only after something else happens or becomes true

examples.ch: 如果你周五前完工，我付你双倍的报酬。
examples.en: I'll pay you double if you get the work finished by Friday.

examples.ch: 如果天气好的话，我们将在花园里开派对。如果不好，就只好在室内了。
examples.en: We'll have the party in the garden if the weather's good. If not (= if the weather is not good), it'll have to be inside.

examples.ch: 要是有人给我打电话，请告诉他们我4点钟回办公室。
examples.en: If anyone calls, just say I'll be back in the office at four o'clock.

examples.ch: 要不是她打来电话，我还不知道呢。
examples.en: If she hadn't called, I wouldn't have known.

examples.ch: 即使他们付给我的工资是现在的两倍，我也不会为他们干活。
examples.en: I wouldn't work for them (even) if they paid me twice my current salary.

examples.ch: 等到那个问题出现我们再处理。
examples.en: We'll deal with that problem if and when it arises.

examples.ch: 如果受到惊扰，鸟可能会弃巢而去，留下雏鸟，任由它们死亡。
examples.en: If disturbed, the bird may abandon the nest, leaving the chicks to die.

defines.trans_en: although

examples.ch: 虽然他们要求多多，但他们是很好的孩子。
examples.en: They're great kids, even if they can be demanding.

examples.ch: 那天虽然有风，却依然很热。
examples.en: It was a hot, if windy day.

defines.trans_en: every time

examples.ch: 水被加热到100摄氏度时，就会变成蒸汽。
examples.en: If water is heated to 100°C it turns to steam.

examples.ch: 我睡眠不足时就会头疼。
examples.en: If I don't get enough sleep I get a headache.

defines.trans_en: used to mean "if it is true that"

examples.ch: 如果我冒犯了你的话，我很抱歉。
examples.en: I'm very sorry if I've offended you.

defines.trans_ch: （用于引出从句，常为间接引语）是否
defines.trans_en: used to introduce a clause, often in indirect speech, that shows two or more possibilities

examples.ch: 克雷默夫人半小时前来电话问她的蛋糕做好了没有。
examples.en: Mrs Kramer called half an hour ago to ask if her cake was ready.

examples.ch: 我不在乎他乐不乐意，我反正要来！
examples.en: I don't care if he likes it or not - I'm coming!

examples.ch: 不知你今晚想不想与我一起去看电影？
examples.en: I was wondering if you'd like to come to the cinema with me this evening?

defines.trans_ch: （用于礼貌地作出请求或评论）
defines.trans_en: used when you want to make a polite request or remark

examples.ch: 您请先坐一会儿吧，张先生一会儿就过来。
examples.en: If you'd like to take a seat, Mr Chang will be with you in a moment.

examples.ch: 我开窗您介意吗？
examples.en: Would you mind if I open/opened (= can I open) the window?

examples.ch: 恕我冒昧，我觉得这个计划有一两处问题。
examples.en: There are, if you don't mind me saying so, one or two problems with this plan.

defines.trans_ch: 不确定因素;未决之事;疑问
defines.trans_en: something that is not certain or not yet decided

examples.ch: 这个计划能否启动仍然悬而未决。
examples.en: There's a big if hanging over the project (= it is uncertain whether the project will happen).

defines.trans_en: not feeling well, or suffering from a disease

examples.ch: 我感到不舒服，于是就回家了。
examples.en: I felt ill so I went home.

examples.ch: 他得了脑膜炎。
examples.en: He's been ill with meningitis.

examples.ch: 索菲娅在休假时生病了。
examples.en: Sophia fell ill/was taken ill (= became ill) while on holiday.

examples.ch: 他在住院，病得很重。
examples.en: He is critically (= very badly) ill in hospital.

defines.trans_en: bad

examples.ch: 糟糕的健康状况
examples.en: ill health

examples.ch: 你感到治疗有什么副作用吗？
examples.en: Did you experience any ill effects from the treatment?

defines.trans_en: badly

examples.ch: 他对她很不好。
examples.en: He treated her very ill.

phrases.trans_en: to say unkind things about someone

examples.ch: 我认识到不应该说死人的坏话。
examples.en: I realize one shouldn't speak ill of the dead.

phrases.trans_en: to be a sign of bad things in the future

examples.ch: 这种天气对今晚的花园聚会不是好兆头。
examples.en: This weather bodes ill for the garden party tonight.

phrases.trans_ch: 经不起（做…）；一旦…就会遇麻烦
phrases.trans_en: If you can ill afford to do something, it will cause problems for you if you do it.

examples.ch: 我们可经不起再失去一位员工了。
examples.en: We can ill afford to lose another member of staff.

defines.trans_en: harm

examples.ch: 我并不希望她倒霉。
examples.en: I wish her no ill.

defines.trans_en: a problem

examples.ch: 这个国家经济／社会的弊病似乎无药可救。
examples.en: There seems to be no cure for the country's economic/social ills.

defines.trans_en: in a way that is bad or not suitable

examples.ch: 准备得不好的
examples.en: ill-prepared

examples.ch: 判断不当的评论
examples.en: an ill-judged remark

defines.trans_en: now or without waiting or thinking

examples.ch: 我们真的应该马上就走。
examples.en: We really ought to leave immediately.

examples.ch: 会议的目的并不明确。
examples.en: The purpose of the meeting wasn't immediately obvious.

defines.trans_en: close to something or someone in distance or time

examples.ch: 米尔顿大街在左边，一过银行就是。
examples.en: Milton Street is on the left, immediately after the bank.

examples.ch: 他们在圣诞节前不久才搬进来。
examples.en: They moved in immediately before Christmas.

examples.ch: 我们听到从正上方的房间传来了一声巨响。
examples.en: We heard a loud crash from the room immediately above us.

defines.trans_en: closely or directly

examples.ch: 受干旱影响最直接的是农民自身。
examples.en: The people most immediately affected by the drought are the farmers themselves.

defines.trans_en: as soon as

examples.ch: 她一走开，男孩们便闹成一团。
examples.en: Immediately she'd gone, the boys started to mess about.

examples.ch: 我一有什么消息就给你打电话。
examples.en: I'll call you immediately I hear anything.

defines.trans_en: necessary or of great value

examples.ch: 我觉得对他而言，我不如他的事业重要。
examples.en: I think his career is more important to him than I am.

examples.ch: 孩子们必须学会彼此友好相处。
examples.en: It's important for children to learn to get on with each other.

examples.ch: 重要的是热度要低，否则糖就会烧焦。
examples.en: The important thing is to keep the heat low or the sugar will burn.

examples.ch: 他并不十分英俊，但他人很好，那才是更重要的。
examples.en: He's not amazingly handsome, but he's nice and that's more important.

defines.trans_en: having great effect or influence

examples.ch: 他是那个时期最具影响力的作家之一。
examples.en: He was one of the most important writers of that period.

examples.ch: 重要人物／决定
examples.en: an important person/decision

defines.trans_ch: （行动或事件）不可能的，办不到的
defines.trans_en: If an action or event is impossible, it cannot happen or be achieved.

examples.ch: 噪音太大，无法入睡。
examples.en: It was impossible to sleep because of the noise.

examples.ch: 我似乎不太可能走过而没有注意到她。
examples.en: It seems impossible that I could have walked by without noticing her.

examples.ch: 他使我无法说不。
examples.en: He made it impossible for me to say no.

examples.ch: 她吃了三盘意大利面条和一份甜点？那不可能。我不信！
examples.en: She ate three plates of spaghetti and a dessert? That's impossible. I don't believe it!

defines.trans_en: An impossible situation is extremely difficult to deal with or solve.

examples.ch: 这是个极其艰难的处境——她必须离开他，但却舍不得孩子们。
examples.en: It's an impossible situation - she's got to leave him but she can't bear losing her children.

defines.trans_en: An impossible person behaves very badly or is extremely difficult to deal with.

examples.ch: 我得辞职，因为我的老板实在是太差劲了。
examples.en: I had to leave the job because my boss was impossible.

examples.ch: 我侄女累的时候很难相处——你做什么也无法使她高兴。
examples.en: My niece is impossible when she's tired - you can't do anything to please her.

phrases.trans_en: something that cannot be expected to happen or exist

examples.ch: 她想找一个有魅力又风趣的男人，这在我看来是不可能的事。
examples.en: She wants a man who is attractive and funny as well, which is asking the impossible in my opinion.

defines.trans_en: to (cause something to) get better

examples.ch: 他为改善工厂工人的工作条件做了许多工作。
examples.en: He did a lot to improve conditions for factory workers.

examples.ch: 我认为提高我的法语的最好办法是在法国生活。
examples.en: I thought the best way to improve my French was to live in France.

examples.ch: 自从开始这种新的饮食，她的健康状况大为改善。
examples.en: Her health has improved dramatically since she started on this new diet.

defines.trans_en: inside a container, place, or area, or surrounded or closed off by something

examples.ch: 马克还在睡觉吗？
examples.en: Is Mark still in bed?

examples.ch: 我堵车堵了半个小时。
examples.en: I got stuck in a traffic jam for half an hour.

examples.ch: 他们住在一幢可爱的老屋内。
examples.en: They live in a charming old house.

examples.ch: 橱窗内展示的那件大衣多少钱？
examples.en: How much is that coat on display in the window (= in the space behind the window of the shop)?

examples.ch: 我背疼。
examples.en: I've got a pain in my back.

examples.ch: 你手里拿的是什么东西？
examples.en: What's that in your hand?

examples.ch: 我眼睛里进了东西。
examples.en: I've got something in (= on the surface of) my eye.

examples.ch: 他们以前住在巴黎，但现在住在奥地利的某个地方。
examples.en: They used to live in Paris, but now they're somewhere in Austria.

examples.ch: 他老是在镜子前照来照去。
examples.en: He's always looking at himself in the mirror (= at the image of his face produced by the mirror).

examples.ch: 我从来不知道她在想什么。
examples.en: I never know what's going on in her head (= what she's thinking about).

examples.ch: 我女儿在住院切除扁桃体。
examples.en: My daughter's in hospital (US in the hospital) having her tonsils out.

examples.ch: 埃丽卡还上学吗？
examples.en: Is Erika still in school (= does she still go to school)?

defines.trans_en: into something

examples.ch: 快点儿，我们迟到了——快上车。
examples.en: Come on, we're late - get in the car.

examples.ch: 喝完牛奶后把它放回冰箱。
examples.en: Put the milk back in the fridge when you've finished with it.

examples.ch: 他们把他扔进了游泳池。
examples.en: They threw him in the swimming pool.

defines.trans_en: forming a part of something

examples.ch: 他曾是一支摇滚乐队的主唱。
examples.en: He used to be the lead singer in a rock band.

examples.ch: 这篇文章中的拼写错误太多。
examples.en: There are too many spelling mistakes in this essay.

examples.ch: 我在这个队伍里排了很长时间了。
examples.en: I've been waiting in this queue for ages.

examples.ch: 你想从情爱关系中得到什么？
examples.en: What do you look for in a relationship?

examples.ch: 我觉得乔利将来会成为冠军。
examples.en: I can see a future champion in Joely (= I think that Joely might become a champion).

examples.ch: 像她这样年轻又有如此才能者实属罕见。
examples.en: Talent like hers is rare in someone so young.

defines.trans_en: during part or all of a period of time

examples.ch: 我们将在4月去意大利。
examples.en: We're going to Italy in April.

examples.ch: 有些树秋天落叶。
examples.en: Some trees lose their leaves in (the) autumn.

examples.ch: 我从2009年开始在这儿工作。
examples.en: I started working here in 2009.

examples.ch: 19世纪时的生活与现在大不相同。
examples.en: Life in the 19th century was very different from what it is now.

examples.ch: 再见，明早见。
examples.en: Bye, see you in the morning (= tomorrow morning).

examples.ch: 她年轻时是个优秀的体操运动员。
examples.en: She was a brilliant gymnast in her youth (= when she was young).

examples.ch: 越南战争中有多少平民死亡？
examples.en: How many civilians died in the Vietnam War?

examples.ch: 这是我3年来抽的第一支烟。
examples.en: This is the first cigarette I've had in three years.

examples.ch: 我很久没有好好睡过一觉了。
examples.en: I haven't had a decent night's sleep in years/ages (= for a long time).

defines.trans_en: needing or using no more time than a particular amount of time

examples.ch: 你能在两周内完成这项工作吗？
examples.en: Can you finish the job in two weeks?

examples.ch: 如果她真的尽力的话，她可在几小时内完成那篇文章。
examples.en: She could get that essay done in a couple of hours if she really tried.

examples.ch: 他们完成行程耗时之短前所未有。
examples.en: They completed the journey in record time (= faster than ever done before).

defines.trans_ch: 在…结束之前;在…结束之时
defines.trans_en: before or at the end of a particular period

examples.ch: 晚饭将在10分钟后准备好。
examples.en: Dinner will be ready in ten minutes.

examples.ch: 百年后我们都已死去，因此为此担心是没有必要的。
examples.en: We'll all be dead in a hundred years so there's no point worrying about it.

examples.ch: 我正要出发，所以我半小时后应该会到你那里。
examples.en: I'm just setting off, so I should be with you in half an hour.

defines.trans_en: experiencing a situation or condition, or feeling an emotion

examples.ch: 我们惊恐地看着他们把尸体从残骸中拖了出来。
examples.en: We watched in horror as they pulled the bodies from the wreckage.

examples.ch: 他正在法国南部过着奢侈的生活。
examples.en: He's living in luxury in the south of France.

examples.ch: 她离开时有点儿匆忙。
examples.en: She left in a bit of a hurry.

examples.ch: 你很危险。
examples.en: You're in great danger.

examples.ch: 我能私下与你谈谈吗？
examples.en: Could I have a word with you in private?

examples.ch: 你谈过恋爱吗？
examples.en: Have you ever been in love?

examples.ch: 鉴于你的汽车这么旧，车况算是很不错的了。
examples.en: Your car's in very good condition, considering how old it is.

defines.trans_en: expressed or written in a particular way

examples.ch: 支票要用墨水笔填写。
examples.en: Cheques should be written in ink.

examples.ch: 她通常用水彩画画。
examples.en: She usually paints in watercolour.

examples.ch: 他们一直用俄语交谈。
examples.en: They spoke in Russian the whole time.

examples.ch: 他说话时声音总是那么小。
examples.en: He always talks in a whisper.

defines.trans_ch: （表示一事为另一事的结果）作为
defines.trans_en: used when referring to something that is done as a result of something else

examples.ch: 我想为你做些事来报答你为我所做的一切。
examples.en: I'd like to do something for you in return/exchange for everything you've done for me.

examples.ch: 这些变化是应我们顾客的要求而作出的。
examples.en: The changes are in response to demand from our customers.

examples.ch: 他拒绝对记者的提问作任何回答。
examples.en: He refused to say anything in reply to the journalists' questions.

defines.trans_ch: （表示组织或划分方式）以，按照
defines.trans_en: used to show how things or people are arranged or divided

examples.ch: 我们大家围坐成一圈。
examples.en: We all sat down in a circle.

examples.ch: 课桌每10张排成一排。
examples.en: The desks were arranged in rows of ten.

examples.ch: 多人组团旅游享有折扣。
examples.en: Discounts are available to people travelling in large groups.

examples.ch: 有时顾客会一次买两三本书，但很少超过这个数。
examples.en: Sometimes customers buy books in twos and threes, but rarely in larger quantities than that.

examples.ch: 把土豆切成两半。
examples.en: Cut the potatoes in two.

examples.ch: 成千上万的人死于寒冷和饥饿。
examples.en: People are dying in their thousands from cold and starvation.

defines.trans_en: used when referring approximately to someone's age or the weather temperature

examples.ch: 如今许多妇女生第一胎时都已经接近40岁了。
examples.en: Nowadays many women are in their late thirties when they have their first child.

examples.ch: 气温将在25度左右。
examples.en: Temperatures will be in the mid-twenties (= about 25 degrees).

defines.trans_en: involved or connected with a particular subject or activity

examples.ch: 我以前从不知道你在出版界工作。
examples.en: I never knew you were in publishing.

examples.ch: 哲学学位
examples.en: a degree in philosophy

examples.ch: 医学的进步
examples.en: advances in medical science

defines.trans_en: wearing

examples.ch: 你能认出那个穿着灰色西装的男人吗？
examples.en: Do you recognize that man in the grey suit?

examples.ch: 帕特抗拒不了穿制服的男人的魅力。
examples.en: Pat can't resist men in uniform.

examples.ch: 你穿绿色衣服很好看。
examples.en: You look nice in green (= green clothes).

defines.trans_en: used to compare one part of an amount of something with the total amount of it

examples.ch: 据说10个人中有1个阅读有问题。
examples.en: Apparently one in ten people/one person in ten has problems with reading.

examples.ch: 所得税基本税率是每英镑25便士。
examples.en: The basic rate of income tax is 25 pence in (US on) the pound.

defines.trans_en: used to show which characteristic or part of a person or thing is being described

examples.ch: 新版本在各方面都较差——我更喜欢原来的版本。
examples.en: The new version is worse in every respect - I much preferred the original.

examples.ch: 两个包同样重吗？
examples.en: Are the two bags equal in weight?

examples.ch: 她左耳失聪。
examples.en: She's deaf in her left ear.

defines.trans_en: used to show when doing one thing is the cause of another thing happening

examples.ch: 由于拒绝去国外工作，她错过了一个极好的工作机会。
examples.en: In refusing (= because she refused) to work abroad, she missed an excellent job opportunity.

examples.ch: 政府禁止烟草广告，这样做对国民的健康大有裨益。
examples.en: The government banned tobacco advertising and, in doing so (= because of this), contributed greatly to the nation's health.

phrases.trans_en: between the two times mentioned

examples.ch: 我7点30分吃早饭，下午1点吃午饭，有时在这之间吃一点儿零食。
examples.en: I have breakfast at 7.30, lunch at 1.00, and sometimes a snack in between.

phrases.trans_en: because

examples.ch: 这项研究非常重要，因为它证实了攻击行为和酗酒之间的联系。
examples.en: This research is important in that it confirms the link between aggression and alcohol.

defines.trans_en: from outside, or towards the centre

examples.ch: 你能帮我把衣服拿进来吗？
examples.en: Could you bring the clothes in for me?

examples.ch: 他们的屋顶在飓风来袭时坍塌了。
examples.en: The roof of their house caved in during a hurricane.

examples.ch: 把油酥面团切成一个小方块，然后把四角向内叠起。
examples.en: Cut the pastry into a square and turn in the corners.

defines.trans_en: at home or at work

examples.ch: 你是什么时候回家的？我一直就没听见你进来。
examples.en: When did you get home? I never heard you come in.

examples.ch: 埃利斯先生这个星期不工作。
examples.en: Mr Ellis isn't in this week.

defines.trans_ch: 在（某个物体，地区或实物）里面
defines.trans_en: within an object, area, or substance

examples.ch: 我们被关了一整天。
examples.en: We've been shut in all day.

examples.ch: 这汤放盐了吗？
examples.en: Has the soup got any salt in?

defines.trans_en: having arrived at the place where people can get on or off

examples.ch: 罗兹的航班该什么时候到？
examples.en: What time is Roz's flight due in?

defines.trans_en: given or sent to someone official in order to be read

examples.ch: 你的文章要什么时候交？
examples.en: When does your essay have to be in?

examples.ch: 别忘了在周末前递交申请。
examples.en: Remember to get your application in by the end of the week.

defines.trans_ch: 接近，抵达（海岸、沙滩或港口）
defines.trans_en: towards the coast, beach, or harbour

examples.ch: 这儿的潮水涨得很快，马上你就会发现自己被困住了。
examples.en: The tide comes in very quickly here and you can soon find yourself stranded.

examples.ch: 我们站在那儿看船进港。
examples.en: We stood watching the ship come in.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to an activity that makes something complete

examples.ch: 如果对答案不是很确定就先用铅笔填。
examples.en: Just pencil in the answer unless you're sure it's correct.

examples.ch: 文字完成了，但之后还得把图片贴上去。
examples.en: The text is finished, but the pictures will have to be pasted in later.

examples.ch: 请填写一份关于你收看的电视节目的调查问卷好吗？
examples.en: Would you mind filling in a questionnaire about what you watch on television?

defines.trans_en: If the ball is in during a game of tennis or a similar sport, it has not gone outside the edges of the area on which the game is played.

examples.ch: 我敢说，我赢了那一分！球肯定在界内！
examples.en: I won that point, I'm telling you! The ball was definitely in!

defines.trans_en: taking your turn to play, especially taking your turn to hit the ball

examples.ch: 我们队下一个轮到谁？
examples.en: Who's in next for our team?

examples.ch: 刚轮到我们队击球就下起了雨。
examples.en: It started to rain just as our team was going in to bat.

phrases.text: be in and out of somewhere
phrases.trans_en: to often be staying in and receiving treatment in a particular place

examples.ch: 自从那次事故之后，她成了医院的常客。
examples.en: She's been in and out of hospitals ever since the accident.

defines.trans_en: fashionable or popular

examples.ch: 本季高跟鞋很流行。
examples.en: High heels are in this season.

examples.ch: 这家新的爵士乐俱乐部好像是当前的热门去处。
examples.en: The new jazz club seems to be the in place to go at the moment.

defines.trans_en: abbreviation for intranasal: through the nose

examples.ch: 鼻内给药的优点是给药容易效果迅速。
examples.en: IN drug delivery offers advantages such as ease of administration and rapid onset of action.

defines.trans_en:
written abbreviation for 
inch

defines.trans_ch: （加在形容词及由形容词转化而来的词前）不，无，非
defines.trans_en: used to add the meaning "not", "lacking", or "the opposite of" to adjectives and to words formed from adjectives

examples.ch: 不完全的／不完全地
examples.en: incomplete/incompletely

examples.ch: 非法的／非法地
examples.en: illegal/illegally

examples.ch: 不可能的／不可能地
examples.en: impossible/impossibly

examples.ch: 不规则的／不规则地
examples.en: irregular/irregularly

defines.trans_ch: （构成名词，描述某种很多人可以参加的活动）
defines.trans_en: used to form a noun which describes an activity in which many people take part
