examples.ch: 静坐示威／热线电话直播节目
examples.en: a sit-in/phone-in

defines.trans_en: to contain something as a part of something else, or to make something part of something else

examples.ch: 账单包括税款和服务费。
examples.en: The bill includes tax and service.

examples.ch: 税款和服务费包括在账单中。
examples.en: Tax and service are included in the bill.

examples.ch: 你的职责包括替我安排预约。
examples.en: Your responsibilities will include making appointments on my behalf.

defines.trans_en: happening, used, or existing inside a building

examples.ch: 室内运动／活动
examples.en: indoor sports/activities

examples.ch: 室内跑道／游泳池
examples.en: an indoor racetrack/swimming pool

defines.trans_en: into or inside a building

examples.ch: 快进屋，外面很冷。
examples.en: Come indoors, it's cold outside.

examples.ch: 春球茎可在室内培育。
examples.en: Spring bulbs can be grown indoors.

defines.trans_en: facts about a situation, person, event, etc.

examples.ch: 你知道有关火车时刻的信息吗？
examples.en: Do you have any information about/on train times?

examples.ch: 我在报纸上看到一则有趣的消息。
examples.en: I read an interesting bit/piece of information in the newspaper.

examples.ch: 欲知详情，请与当地图书馆联系。
examples.en: For further information (= if you want to know more), please contact your local library.

examples.ch: 我们有可靠消息说下个月将有罢工。
examples.en: We have reliable information that a strike is planned next month.

defines.trans_en: a type of very small animal with six legs, a body divided into three parts and usually two pairs of wings, or, more generally, any similar very small animal

examples.ch: 蚂蚁、甲虫、蝴蝶和苍蝇都是昆虫。
examples.en: Ants, beetles, butterflies, and flies are all insects.

examples.ch: 我腿上被小虫咬了一口。
examples.en: I've got some sort of insect bite on my leg.

defines.trans_en: the part, space, or side of something that is inside

examples.ch: 你把车内部擦干净了吗？
examples.en: Did you clean the inside of the car?

examples.ch: 这家宾馆从街上看去显得很破旧，但里面很好。
examples.en: The hotel looked shabby from the street, but it was fine on the inside.

examples.ch: 人们的房子内部
examples.en: the insides of people's houses

defines.trans_en: The inside of a part of the body such as the arm or leg is the part facing in towards the rest of the body.

examples.ch: 她在手腕内侧搽了香水。
examples.en: She dabbed perfume on the inside of her wrist.

phrases.trans_en: a person's or animal's internal organs, especially the stomach or bowels

examples.ch: 死海豹的内脏散落在雪地上。
examples.en: The dead seal's insides were spread all over the snow.

defines.trans_ch: 在（…）里面，在（…）内部;里面的，内部的
defines.trans_en: in or into a room, building, container, or something similar

examples.ch: “安娜在花园吗？”“不，她在屋里。”
examples.en: "Is Anna in the garden?" "No, she's inside (= in the house)."

examples.ch: 盒子里面是什么？
examples.en: What's inside the box?

examples.ch: 幸运的是，房子倒塌时里面没有人。
examples.en: Luckily, no one was inside the building when it collapsed.

examples.ch: 她无法承受内心的悲伤。
examples.en: She couldn't cope with the grief she felt inside.

examples.ch: 谁知道他脑袋里想的是什么？
examples.en: Who can tell what goes on inside his head?

examples.ch: 他把文件小心翼翼地放进外套内层的口袋里。
examples.en: He put the documents carefully in his inside pocket (= pocket on the inside of a jacket or coat).

phrases.trans_en: If something is inside out, it has the usual inside part on the outside and the usual outside part on the inside.

examples.ch: 她把羊毛衫穿反了。
examples.en: She had her sweater on inside out.

defines.trans_ch: 在（某段时间）内;少于（某时间）
defines.trans_en: If you do something or if something happens inside (of) a particular time or limit, you do it or it happens in less than that amount of time or under the limit.

examples.ch: 新型快速列车两小时内就可跑完全程。
examples.en: The new faster trains can do the journey inside two hours.

examples.ch: 他不到两个钟头就干完了。
examples.en: He finished it inside of two hours.

defines.trans_en: (of information) obtained by someone in a group, organization, or company and therefore involving special or secret knowledge

examples.ch: 内部消息／内情
examples.en: inside information/knowledge

examples.ch: 我将给克莱尔打电话了解内幕。
examples.en: I'll call up Clare and get the inside story (= a true report of the facts).

defines.trans_en: in prison

examples.ch: 她的丈夫因持械抢劫而进了牢房。
examples.en: Her husband's inside for armed robbery.

defines.trans_en: in place of someone or something else

examples.ch: 没有咖啡——来杯茶怎么样？
examples.en: There's no coffee - would you like a cup of tea instead?

defines.trans_en: something that someone tells you to do

examples.ch: 警察破门而入只是奉命行事。
examples.en: The police who broke into the house were only acting on/under instructions.

examples.ch: 他命令我必须在8点以前到达那里。
examples.en: He gave me strict instructions to get there by eight o'clock.

defines.trans_ch: 教授;指导（某种技能／科目）
defines.trans_en: the teaching of a particular skill or subject

examples.ch: 这盘录像教人们如何操作计算机。
examples.en: The video provides instruction on how to operate the computer.

examples.ch: 这门课教授汽车维修方面的基本知识。
examples.en: The course gives you basic instruction in car maintenance.

examples.ch: 你看过洗衣机的操作指南吗？
examples.en: Have you seen the instruction manual for the washing machine?

phrases.trans_en: advice and information about how to do or use something, often written in a book or on the side of a container

examples.ch: 烹调说明书上说烘烤半个小时。
examples.en: The cooking instructions say to bake it for half an hour.

examples.ch: 你显然没有好好看说明书。
examples.en: You obviously didn't read the instructions properly.

examples.ch: 关于下一步该怎么做，他们需要明确的指导。
examples.en: They need clear instructions on what to do next.

defines.trans_en: an object, such as a piano, guitar, or drum, that is played to produce musical sounds

examples.ch: 你演奏哪一种乐器？
examples.en: Which instrument do you play?

defines.trans_en: a tool or other device, especially one without electrical power, used for performing a particular piece of work

examples.ch: 外科手术器械
examples.en: surgical instruments

examples.ch: 刑具
examples.en: instruments of torture

examples.ch: 这人的伤口显然是由钝器所致。
examples.en: The man's injuries had obviously been caused by a blunt instrument.

defines.trans_en: a device used for measuring speed, height, etc. in vehicles, especially aircraft

examples.ch: 仪表板
examples.en: the instrument panel

examples.ch: 闪电击毁了飞机的仪表，上面什么数据都显示不出来。
examples.en: The lightning had damaged the plane's instruments, and they weren't giving any readings.

defines.trans_en: a way of achieving or causing something

examples.ch: 他把戏剧看作变革的手段——一种迫使人们考虑社会及政治问题的方法。
examples.en: He saw the theatre as an instrument of change - a way of forcing people to consider social and political issues.

defines.trans_ch: 可以在金融市场上进行交易的投资（或政府债券）
defines.trans_en: a type of investment in a company or in government debt that can be traded on the financial markets

examples.ch: 他们对发展中国家的债卷进行交易。
examples.en: They trade in the debt instruments of developing countries.

examples.ch: 越来越复杂的财务债券
examples.en: increasingly complex financial instruments

defines.trans_en: an agreement in which you pay a company money and they pay your costs if you have an accident, injury, etc.

examples.ch: 人寿／健康／汽车／旅行保险
examples.en: life/health/car/travel insurance

examples.ch: 我需要为另一名驾车人购买汽车保险。
examples.en: I'll need to take out extra car insurance for another driver.

examples.ch: 这份保险没有包括你的家用物品。
examples.en: The insurance doesn't cover you for (= include) household items.

defines.trans_en: wanting to give your attention to something and discover more about it

examples.ch: 他好像对我的话不怎么感兴趣。
examples.en: He didn't seem very interested in what I was saying.

examples.ch: 她正处于开始对男孩子发生兴趣的年龄。
examples.en: She's at that age where she's starting to get interested in boys.

examples.ch: 我很想更多地了解你的工作。
examples.en: I'd be interested to hear more about your work.

examples.ch: “真的吗？”他说道，脸上呈现出一副关注的神情。
examples.en: "Really?" he said, with an interested look on his face.

examples.ch: 是的，我很想更多地了解贵公司所提供的服务。
examples.en: Yes, I'd be very interested in knowing more about the services your firm offers.

defines.trans_en: relating to a person or group who has a connection with a particular situation, event, business, etc.

examples.ch: 建议有关各方与这个办公室联系。
examples.en: All interested parties (= people who are involved) are advised to contact this office.

defines.trans_en: Someone or something that is interesting keeps your attention because he, she, or it is unusual, exciting, or has a lot of ideas.

examples.ch: 她是一个很有趣的女人。
examples.en: She's quite an interesting woman.

examples.ch: 关于这个主题她有一些很有趣的东西要说。
examples.en: She's got some very interesting things to say on the subject.

examples.ch: 听一听其他人的意见总是很有趣的。
examples.en: It is always interesting to hear other people's point of view.

examples.ch: 哦，我不知道他们结婚了——那挺有意思的。
examples.en: Oh, I didn't know they were married - that's interesting.

defines.trans_en: strange or different

examples.ch: 尼尔，你戴的那顶帽子看上去真怪！
examples.en: That's an interesting looking hat you're wearing, Neil!

defines.trans_en: involving more than one country

examples.ch: 国际政治
examples.en: international politics

examples.ch: 国际科学家小组
examples.en: an international team of scientists

defines.trans_ch: 国际比赛;国际比赛选手
defines.trans_en: a sports event involving more than one country, or a person who competes in it

examples.ch: 为期1天的国际比赛
examples.en: a one-day international

examples.ch: 六名橄榄球运动员被指控为提高成绩服用禁药。
examples.en: Six rugby internationals (= players) were charged with taking drugs to improve their performance.

defines.trans_en: the large system of connected computers around the world that allows people to share information and communicate with each other

examples.ch: 我从互联网上了解到有关爆炸的消息。
examples.en: I found out about the bombings from/on the internet.

defines.trans_en: to the inside or middle of a place, container, area, etc.

examples.ch: 请帮我把罐子放回碗橱里，好吗？
examples.en: Would you put the jar back into the cupboard for me, please?

examples.ch: 我们去花园吧。
examples.en: Let's go into the garden.

examples.ch: 别乱跑了，快上床！
examples.en: Stop running around and get into bed!

examples.ch: 我再也穿不上这些裤子了，它们都太小了。
examples.en: I can't get into these trousers any more. They're far too small for me.

defines.trans_en: used to show when a person or thing is changing from one form or condition to another

examples.ch: 把黄瓜削皮，再切成小方块。
examples.en: Peel the cucumber and chop it into small cubes.

examples.ch: 发生了一系列的爆炸，随后货车开始燃起熊熊大火。
examples.en: There was a series of explosions and the van burst into flames (= started to burn violently).

examples.ch: 她的小说已被译成19种语言。
examples.en: Her novels have been translated into 19 languages.

examples.ch: 我们正计划将最小的卧室改成办公室。
examples.en: We're planning to turn the smallest bedroom into an office.

defines.trans_en: used to show movement that involves something touching something else with a lot of force but without moving inside it

examples.ch: 他不戴眼镜时总是东撞西碰的。
examples.en: He's always walking into things when he doesn't have his glasses on.

defines.trans_en: in the direction of something or someone

examples.ch: 她直视着他的眼睛。
examples.en: She was looking straight into his eyes.

defines.trans_en: involving or about something

examples.ch: 对事故原因的调查
examples.en: an inquiry into the cause of the accident

defines.trans_en: used when referring to the division of one number by another number

examples.ch: 5除125是多少？
examples.en: What's 5 into 125?

defines.trans_en: enthusiastic about or interested in

examples.ch: 杰基非常喜欢古典音乐。
examples.en: Jackie's really into classical music.

defines.trans_en: to ask or request someone to go to an event

examples.ch: 我们受邀参加洛拉的晚会。
examples.en: We're invited to Lola's party.

examples.ch: 笔试通过的候选人将获邀参加面试。
examples.en: Candidates who are successful in the written test will be invited for an interview.

examples.ch: 她家里人邀请我留下住几个星期。
examples.en: Her family invited me to stay with them for a few weeks.

defines.trans_en: to request something, especially formally or politely

examples.ch: 这块地产征求100万英镑左右的出价。
examples.en: Offers in the region of £1,000,000 are invited for the property.

examples.ch: 这家报纸欢迎读者来信发表意见。
examples.en: The newspaper invited readers to write in with their views.

defines.trans_en: to act in a way that causes or encourages something to happen or someone to believe or feel something

examples.ch: 课堂上的挑衅行为只会带来麻烦。
examples.en: Behaving provocatively in class is just inviting trouble.

examples.ch: 展览会办得这么差会招致批评。
examples.en: Such a badly presented exhibition invites criticism.

defines.trans_en: an invitation

examples.ch: 我没有收到他们的婚礼邀请。
examples.en: I didn't get an invite to their wedding.

defines.trans_en: a piece of land completely surrounded by water

examples.ch: 荒岛
examples.en: a desert island

examples.ch: 太平洋岛屿
examples.en: a Pacific island

examples.ch: 他们住在日本的主要岛屿北海道。
examples.en: They live on the large Japanese island of Hokkaido.

defines.trans_ch: 交通岛，安全岛（同 traffic island）
defines.trans_en:
→ 
traffic island

phrases.text: an island of peace, calm, sanity, etc.
phrases.trans_en: a particular place that is peaceful, calm, etc., when other surrounding places are the opposite

defines.trans_ch: （用作主语或宾语）它，这，那（指上文提到的事物、动物或情况）
defines.trans_en: used as the subject of a verb, or the object of a verb or preposition, to refer to a thing, animal, situation, or idea that has already been mentioned

examples.ch: “我的钢笔在哪儿？刚才还在我的桌上。”“你放在电话旁了。”
examples.en: "Where's my pen? It was on my desk a minute ago." "You left it by the phone."

examples.ch: 该公司在亏损，所以不得不裁员。
examples.en: The company was losing money and it had to let people go.

examples.ch: 那场争论使我们大家都心烦——我不想再谈论了。
examples.en: The argument was upsetting for us all - I don't want to talk about it.

examples.ch: 孩子逃学有各种原因。
examples.en: Children who stay away from school do it for different reasons.

defines.trans_ch: （用作主语或宾语）它，这，那（指句末的短语）
defines.trans_en: used as the subject or object of a verb to represent a phrase at the end of the sentence

examples.ch: 她不太可能准时到来。
examples.en: It's unlikely that she'll arrive on time.

examples.ch: 如果你在9点之前开始行程就会比较贵。
examples.en: It costs more if you travel before 9.00.

examples.ch: 我喜欢在苏格兰。
examples.en: I liked it in Scotland.

examples.ch: 我发现电话银行很方便。
examples.en: I find it convenient to be able to do my banking by phone.

defines.trans_ch: （用来指代时间、日期、天气或距离）
defines.trans_en: used to talk about the time, date, weather, or distances

examples.ch: 现在几点？
examples.en: What time is it?

examples.ch: 那时候是十月，所以很冷。
examples.en: It was October, so it was quite cold.

examples.ch: 整天都在下雨。
examples.en: It rained all day.

examples.ch: 距利兹十英里。
examples.en: It's ten miles to Leeds.

defines.trans_ch: 时尚的;流行的（形容能引起普遍兴趣的某物或某人）
defines.trans_en: used for describing things or people that are very fashionable, and everyone is interested in them, wants to have them, etc.

examples.ch: 这款包的设计使它成为了今夏的潮流。
examples.en: The design of this bag makes it the "it-bag" for this summer.

defines.trans_ch: 信息技术（information technology 的缩写）
defines.trans_en:
abbreviation for
information technology
belonging to or relating to something that has already been mentioned

examples.ch: 狗的爪子受伤了。
examples.en: The dog hurt its paw.

examples.ch: 他们的房子带游泳池。
examples.en: Their house has its own swimming pool.

examples.ch: 公司的利润增加了。
examples.en: The company increased its profits.

examples.ch: 我倾向于第2种选择——其优点是简单、便宜。
examples.en: I prefer the second option - its advantages are simplicity and cheapness.

defines.trans_en: used when the subject of the verb is "it" and the object is the same thing, animal, situation, or idea

examples.ch: 猫将自己的身体舔了个遍。
examples.en: The cat licked itself all over.

examples.ch: 你得做点什么了——这个问题不会自行解决的。
examples.en: You have to do something about the problem - it isn't just going to resolve itself.

defines.trans_en: used to emphasize the subject when it is a thing, animal, situation, or idea

examples.ch: 这家商店15年前就开业了，但互联网业务却是新增的。
examples.en: The shop itself (= only the shopand nothing else) started 15 years ago but the internet side of the business is new.

phrases.trans_en: alone or without help

examples.ch: 这个动物被孤零零地留在了房子里一个星期。
examples.en: The animal had been left in the house by itself for a week.

examples.ch: 咳嗽一般自己会好的。
examples.en: A cough will usually get better by itself.

phrases.trans_ch: 只为自己使用地，不公开地
phrases.trans_en: for its use only

examples.ch: 委员会担心会引发不好的公众反应，因此没有公开调查结果。
examples.en: The committee kept the results of the survey to itself (= did not tell anyone), fearing a bad public reaction.

defines.trans_en: a short coat

examples.ch: 皮／牛仔布／粗花呢短上衣
examples.en: a leather/denim/tweed jacket

examples.ch: 钥匙在我的夹克口袋里。
examples.en: The keys are in my jacket pocket.

defines.trans_en:
→ 
dust jacket
a cover to protect something

examples.ch: 你能把唱片放回封套里吗?
examples.en: Can you put the record back in its jacket, please?

defines.trans_en: a sweet, soft food made by cooking fruit with sugar to preserve it. It is eaten on bread.

examples.ch: 草莓／覆盆子酱
examples.en: strawberry/raspberry jam

examples.ch: 果酱三明治
examples.en: jam sandwiches

defines.trans_en:
→ 
traffic jam

examples.ch: 我们堵车堵了两个小时。
examples.en: We were stuck in a jam for two hours.

defines.trans_ch: 堵在机器中的东西;让机器部件无法运动的东西
defines.trans_en: something that is stuck in a machine, or that prevents the parts of a machine from moving

examples.ch: 她把文件送进机器，确保没有纸张把机器卡住。
examples.en: She fed the documents into the machine making sure that there were no paper jams.

defines.trans_en: a difficult situation

examples.ch: 我手头有点儿紧——你能借我点钱到下周再还吗？
examples.en: I'm in a jam - could you lend me some money till next week?

examples.ch: 我们如何才能摆脱这一困境？
examples.en: How are we going to get ourselves out of this jam?

defines.trans_en: a situation in which a lot of people are in a small space

examples.ch: 里面太拥挤了——我用了10分钟才挤到吧台。
examples.en: It's a real jam inside - it took me ten minutes to get to the bar.

defines.trans_en: to be, or make something, unable to move

examples.ch: 我进来后门随即卡住了，我出不去了。
examples.en: The door jammed behind me and I couldn't get out.

examples.ch: 他将窗户打开，用一块木头卡住。
examples.en: He jammed the window open with a piece of wood.

defines.trans_en: to stop radio signals from reaching the people who want to receive them

examples.ch: 外国的无线电广播经常受到干扰。
examples.en: Foreign radio broadcasts were regularly jammed.

defines.trans_ch: （与他人）即兴演奏爵士乐（或摇滚乐）
defines.trans_en: to play jazz or rock music with other people informally without planning it or practising together
to push something forcefully or with difficulty into something else

examples.ch: 他把箱子塞进汽车后面。
examples.en: He jammed the boxes into the back of the car.

defines.trans_en: to fill a place completely

examples.ch: 镇中心堵满了车，移动缓慢。
examples.en: The centre of town was jammed with cars moving at a very slow pace.

examples.ch: 整个上午高速公路都被堵得严严实实。
examples.en: The motorway was jammed solid (= the traffic could not move) all morning.

defines.trans_en: trousers made of denim (= strong blue cotton cloth) that are worn informally

examples.ch: 牛仔裤和T恤衫
examples.en: jeans and a T-shirt

examples.ch: 我从不穿牛仔裤上班。
examples.en: I never wear jeans to work.

defines.trans_en: the regular work that a person does to earn money

examples.ch: 临时的／固定的工作
examples.en: a temporary/permanent job

examples.ch: 大学毕业后她在一家出版公司当编辑。
examples.en: When she left college, she got a job as an editor in a publishing company.

examples.ch: 一边抚育两个孩子一边做全职工作很困难。
examples.en: It's very difficult trying to bring up two children while doing a full-time job.

examples.ch: 他从来没能保住一份稳定的工作。
examples.en: He's never managed to hold down (= keep) a steady (= permanent) job.

examples.ch: 她已向一家保险公司求职。
examples.en: She's applied for a job with an insurance company.

examples.ch: 你有了小孩后会放弃工作吗？
examples.en: Are you going to give up your job when you have your baby?

examples.ch: 由于任职的第一个月表现很糟，许多人开始怀疑新总统是否胜任。
examples.en: After a disastrous first month in office, many people are beginning to wonder if the new president is up to (= able to do) the job.

examples.ch: 成百上千的工人可能会失业。
examples.en: Hundreds of workers could lose their jobs.

defines.trans_en: a particular piece of work

examples.ch: 施工人员打算在月末前将活儿干完。
examples.en: The builders are aiming to get the job done by the end of the month.

examples.ch: 他一下午都在家里干杂活儿。
examples.en: He spent the afternoon doing jobs around the house.

examples.ch: 你能把买来的东西都用自行车带回家吗，是不是还得用汽车？
examples.en: Will you be able to carry all the shopping back home on your bike, or will it have to be a car job (= will you need the car)?

defines.trans_en: something that is your responsibility

examples.ch: 她认为自己身为政治家就是要做自己政党和选民的代言人。
examples.en: She believed her job as a politician was to represent the views of her party and the people who voted for her.

examples.ch: 我知道不该由我来告诉你如何生活，但我的确认为你犯了错。
examples.en: I know it's not my job to tell you how to run your life, but I do think you've made a mistake.

defines.trans_en: a problem or an activity that is difficult

examples.ch: 把自行车轮子卸下来可真费劲儿。
examples.en: It was a real job getting the wheel off the bike.

examples.ch: 我们考试的时间只有1小时，我好不容易才做完。
examples.en: We were only given an hour for the exam, and I had a job finishing it.

defines.trans_en: an example of a particular type

examples.ch: 这是原件，不是仿制品。
examples.en: It's an original, not one of those imitation jobs.

defines.trans_en: a crime in which money or goods are stolen, or an action or activity that is dishonest or unpleasant

examples.ch: 他因抢劫银行被判入狱5年。
examples.en: He was put in prison for five years for doing a bank job.

examples.ch: 他的确耍了她，告诉她自己会永远爱她，后来却和别人一起跑到斐济去了。
examples.en: He really did a job on her, telling her that he would always love her and then moving to Fiji with someone else.

phrases.trans_en: without a job

examples.ch: 你没有工作已有多久了？
examples.en: How long have you been out of a job?

defines.trans_en: to connect or fasten things together

examples.ch: 一座长长的吊桥将两个岛屿连接起来。
examples.en: A long suspension bridge joins the two islands.

examples.ch: 用强力胶把这两片粘起来。
examples.en: Join the two pieces together using strong glue.

examples.ch: 一座公路桥将小岛和大陆连接起来。
examples.en: The island is joined to the mainland by a road bridge.

examples.ch: 如果你将纸上的小点连起来，就会变成一幅画。
examples.en: If you join (up) the dots on the paper, you'll get a picture.

defines.trans_en: If roads or rivers join, they meet at a particular point.

examples.ch: A11 干道在剑桥以南与 M11 高速公路交汇。
examples.en: The A11 joins the M11 south of Cambridge.

examples.ch: 墨累河和达令河在阿德莱德以东汇合。
examples.en: The River Murray and the River Darling join east of Adelaide.

defines.trans_en: to get involved in an activity or journey with another person or group

examples.ch: 我现在没有时间，稍后会和你们一起喝上一杯。
examples.en: I don't have time for a drink now, but I'll join you later.

examples.ch: 为什么不问问你姐姐是否愿意和我们一起吃晚饭？
examples.en: Why don't you ask your sister if she would like to join us for supper?

examples.ch: 我们乘渡船过了英吉利海峡，然后在加来上了去巴黎的火车。
examples.en: We took the ferry across the Channel and then joined (= got on) the Paris train at Calais.

examples.ch: 如果你要买票，请排队。
examples.en: If you're buying tickets, please join the queue (= stand at the end of it).

examples.ch: 我相信大家都会和我一样祝你退休生活愉快。
examples.en: I'm sure everyone will join me in wishing you a very happy retirement (= everyone else will do this too).

examples.ch: 警方和缉毒队联手抓捕大毒贩。
examples.en: The police have joined with (= they have begun to work with) the Drug Enforcement Agency in trying to catch major drug traffickers.

examples.ch: 这家设计公司正计划与一家鞋厂联合推出一系列新鞋。
examples.en: The design company is planning to join up with a shoe manufacturer and create a new line of footwear.

defines.trans_en: to become a member of an organization

examples.ch: 圣诞节后我觉得身体不佳，决定加入一家健身房。
examples.en: I felt so unfit after Christmas that I decided to join a gym.

examples.ch: 这家俱乐部很棒。你为什么不加入呢？
examples.en: It's a great club. Why don't you join?

phrases.trans_en: to become one of a particular large group of people

examples.ch: 我本月底毕业后很可能不得不加入失业大军。
examples.en: When I leave school at the end of this month, I'll probably have to join the ranks of the unemployed.

defines.trans_en: a place where two things meet or are fastened together

examples.ch: 她将两块布非常仔细地缝在了一起，你看不到接缝。
examples.en: She'd stitched the two pieces together really carefully so that you couldn't see the join.

defines.trans_ch: 新闻记者;报纸撰稿人;广播员
defines.trans_en: a person who writes news stories or articles for a newspaper or magazine or broadcasts them on radio or television

examples.ch: 政论文章自由撰稿人
examples.en: a freelance political journalist

defines.trans_ch: （尤指乘交通工具的）旅行，行程
defines.trans_en: the act of travelling from one place to another, especially in a vehicle

examples.ch: 我喜欢长途旅行。
examples.en: I love going on long journeys.

examples.ch: 我们在杰克逊维尔稍作停留，第二天继续踏上旅途去迈阿密。
examples.en: We broke our journey (= stopped for a short time) in Jacksonville before travelling on to Miami the next day.

examples.ch: 祝一路平安！
examples.en: Have a safe journey!

examples.ch: 他将生活视作一种加深其对信仰理解的精神旅程。
examples.en: He views his life as a spiritual journey towards a greater understanding of his faith.

examples.ch: 你旅途愉快吗？
examples.en: Did you have a good journey?

examples.ch: 从约克到伦敦乘火车需要两小时。
examples.en: It's a two-hour train journey from York to London.

defines.trans_en: to travel somewhere

examples.ch: 我们向南旅行时，土地越来越干燥，岩石越来越多。
examples.en: As we journeyed south, the landscape became drier and rockier.

defines.trans_en: the liquid that comes from fruit or vegetables

examples.ch: 橙／柠檬／葡萄／胡萝卜汁
examples.en: orange/lemon/grapefruit/carrot juice

examples.ch: 一盒苹果汁
examples.en: a carton of apple juice

defines.trans_en: power or influence

examples.ch: 我的堂兄吉安尼在这一带很有影响力。
examples.en: My cousin Gianni's got all the juice in this neighborhood.

phrases.trans_en: the liquid in meat

examples.ch: 先把肉煎一煎锁住汁。
examples.en: Fry the meat first to seal in the juices.

phrases.trans_en: energy

examples.ch: 这么一大早很难想出什么好点子。
examples.en: This early in the morning it's hard to get the creative juices flowing (= to start thinking of good ideas).

defines.trans_en: to push yourself suddenly off the ground and into the air using your legs

examples.ch: 孩子们兴奋地跳来跳去。
examples.en: The children were jumping up and down with excitement.

examples.ch: 她跑过草地，跳入水中。
examples.en: She ran across the grass and jumped into the water.

examples.ch: 他不得不从楼上的窗户跳出去逃命。
examples.en: He had to jump out of an upstairs window to escape.

examples.ch: 我们的猫总是跳到家具上。
examples.en: Our cat is always jumping up on/onto the furniture.

defines.trans_en: to push yourself suddenly off the ground in order to go over something

examples.ch: 你能跃过这条小溪吗？
examples.en: Can you jump over/across this stream?

examples.ch: 跃过这最后一道围栏对所有的马匹都很困难。
examples.en: All the horses are finding it difficult to jump the last fence.

defines.trans_ch: 突然（或快速）行动（或移动）
defines.trans_en: to move or act suddenly or quickly

examples.ch: 他霍地一下站起来离开了。
examples.en: He suddenly jumped to his feet/jumped up and left.

examples.ch: 她跳上一辆出租车急匆匆赶往车站。
examples.en: She jumped in/into a taxi and rushed to the station.

defines.trans_ch: （受惊等后）猛地一跳，突然一跳
defines.trans_en: If a noise or action causes you to jump, your body makes a sudden sharp movement because of surprise or fear.

examples.ch: 爆炸的巨响把大家都吓了一跳。
examples.en: The loud explosion made everyone jump.

examples.ch: 听到楼下哐的一声巨响，我几乎吓得灵魂出窍。
examples.en: I almost jumped out of my skin when I heard a loud crash downstairs.

defines.trans_en: to increase suddenly by a large amount

examples.ch: 房价大幅上涨。
examples.en: House prices have jumped dramatically.

examples.ch: 修这条公路的费用猛增了70%。
examples.en: The cost of building the road has jumped by 70 percent.

defines.trans_ch: （故事、电影、戏剧等在不同部分间）突然转换，跳跃
defines.trans_en: If a story, film, play, etc. jumps, it moves suddenly between different parts of it.

examples.ch: 这部电影讲述的是他成年后的生活，但不断跳回到他的孩提时代。
examples.en: The movie is about his adult life, but it keeps jumping (back) to when he was a child.

examples.ch: 很难跟上他讲话的思路，因为他不断从一个话题跳到另一个话题。
examples.en: His talk was hard to follow because he kept jumping from one subject to another.

defines.trans_en: to avoid or leave out a point or stage from the correct order in a series

examples.ch: 你必须严格按说明操作，不能将前面的几步略去。
examples.en: You have to follow the instructions exactly, you can't just jump a few steps ahead.

defines.trans_en: to attack someone suddenly

examples.ch: 他们正往家走，一帮人突然袭击了他们。
examples.en: They were just walking home when a bunch of guys jumped (on) them.

defines.trans_en: to go past or away from something illegally or wrongly

examples.ch: 警方的录像表明她闯了红灯。
examples.en: The police video showed that she had jumped the (traffic) lights.

examples.ch: 几名水手在纽约擅自离船。
examples.en: Several sailors jumped ship (= left their ship without permission) in New York.

phrases.trans_en: to fail to appear for a court trial after being released until the trial in exchange for payment

examples.ch: 我真没想到休会在保释期间潜逃。
examples.en: I'd never have thought Hugh would jump bail.

phrases.trans_en: If a place is jumping, it is crowded and full of life.

examples.ch: 这个娱乐场所今晚可真热闹。
examples.en: This joint (= place of entertainment) is really jumping tonight.

defines.trans_en: a sudden movement off the ground and into the air

examples.ch: 他以8.5米远的一跳赢得了比赛。
examples.en: He won with a jump of 8.5 metres.

examples.ch: 跳伞
examples.en: a parachute jump

examples.ch: 好几匹马在最后一道障碍处跌倒了。
examples.en: Several horses fell at the last jump (= fence or other thing to be jumped over).

defines.trans_ch: （受惊等后）猛地一跳，突然一跳
defines.trans_en: a sudden sharp movement because of surprise or fear

examples.ch: 砰的关门声把丽塔猛地惊醒了。
examples.en: The door slammed and Rita woke up with a jump.

defines.trans_en: a sudden increase

examples.ch: 现在的利率为6.75，上升了差不多2%。
examples.en: Interest rates are now at 6.75 - that's a jump of almost 2 percent.

defines.trans_en: now, very soon, or very recently

examples.ch: “吉姆，你在哪儿？”“我就来。”
examples.en: "Where are you, Jim?" "I'm just coming."

examples.ch: 我马上干完了，然后我们就能走了。
examples.en: I'll just finish this, then we can go.

examples.ch: 他刚进浴室电话就响了。
examples.en: He'd just got into the bath when the phone rang.

examples.ch: 孩子们刚好在铃响时到达了学校。
examples.en: The children arrived at school just as (= at the same moment as) the bell was ringing.

examples.ch: 医生马上就见你。
examples.en: The doctor will be with you in just a minute/moment/second (= very soon).

examples.ch: 现在刚过10点。
examples.en: It's just after/past (UK also gone) ten o'clock.

defines.trans_en: exactly or equally

examples.ch: 这块地毯放在餐厅正合适。
examples.en: This carpet would be just right for the dining room.

examples.ch: 这对双胞胎真是一模一样。
examples.en: The twins look just like each other.

examples.ch: 事情结果正像我预料的一样。
examples.en: Things turned out just as I expected.

examples.ch: 你的玩具和你哥哥的一样多。
examples.en: You've got just as many toys as your brother.

examples.ch: 谢谢你，这正是我一直想要的。
examples.en: Thank you, it's just what I've always wanted.

examples.ch: 这会儿我没法儿帮你。
examples.en: I can't help you just now/yet.

examples.ch: 就在那时，灯灭了。
examples.en: Just then, the lights went out.

examples.ch: 我完全能想象出索菲当警察的样子。
examples.en: I can just imagine Sophie as a police officer.

examples.ch: 那件连衣裙正适合你。
examples.en: That dress is just you (= suits you very well).

defines.trans_en: only; simply

examples.ch: “再喝一杯吗？”“好的，就一杯。”
examples.en: "Would you like another drink?" "OK, just one more."

examples.ch: 那只是个玩笑。
examples.en: It was just a joke.

examples.ch: 他女儿还是个婴儿／只有几周大。
examples.en: His daughter's just a baby/just a few weeks old.

examples.ch: 对将要发生的事情我们只能拭目以待。
examples.en: We'll just have to (= the only thing we can do is) wait and see what happens.

examples.ch: 她就住在这条街上。
examples.en: She lives just down the road (= very near).

examples.ch: 你比我年纪大并不意味着你就可以对我指手画脚。
examples.en: Just because you're older than me doesn't mean you can tell me what to do.

defines.trans_en: used to make a statement or order stronger

examples.ch: 他就是不照着吩咐去做。
examples.en: He just won't do as he's told.

examples.ch: 这个真是太贵了。
examples.en: It's just too expensive.

defines.trans_en: used to reduce the force of a statement and to suggest that it is not very important

examples.ch: 我能借用一下剪刀吗？
examples.en: Can I just borrow the scissors for a second?

examples.ch: 我只是想问你今天下午有没有空。
examples.en: I just wanted to ask you if you're free this afternoon.

defines.trans_en: almost not or almost

examples.ch: 我们到达机场差点儿就没赶上飞机。
examples.en: We arrived at the airport just in time to catch the plane.

examples.ch: 这条连衣裙勉强合身。
examples.en: This dress (only) just fits.

examples.ch: “你能看清舞台吗？”“勉强看得见。”
examples.en: "Can you see the stage?" "Yes, only just/just about."

examples.ch: 我快把客厅粉刷完了。
examples.en: I've just about finished painting the living room.

defines.trans_en: very; completely

examples.ch: 她的遭遇真可怕。
examples.en: It's just dreadful what happened to her.

phrases.trans_en: a very short time ago

examples.ch: 刚才站在门口的是谁？
examples.en: Who was that at the door just now?

phrases.trans_en: at the present time

examples.ch: 约翰这会儿在洗澡——让他过会儿给你回电话好吗？
examples.en: John's in the bath just now - can he call you back?

phrases.trans_en: If something is just possible, there is a slight chance that it will happen.

examples.ch: 那个周末我们不大可能出去。
examples.en: It's just possible that we might be going away that weekend.

defines.trans_en: fair; morally correct

examples.ch: 在这种情况下，法官的判决非常公正。
examples.en: The judge's sentence was perfectly just in the circumstances.

examples.ch: 我认为他没有什么正当的理由抱怨。
examples.en: I don't really think he had just cause to complain.

phrases.trans_ch: 公正的人，有正义感的人
phrases.trans_en: people who behave in a morally correct way

defines.trans_en: to have or continue to have in your possession

examples.ch: 你想要回这张照片，还是我留着它？
examples.en: Do you want this photograph back or can I keep it?

examples.ch: 将药存放在上锁的橱柜里。
examples.en: Keep medicines in a locked cupboard (= store them there).

defines.trans_en: to own and manage a small shop

examples.ch: 我叔叔在格洛斯特开了一家小烟草店。
examples.en: My uncle kept a little tobacconist's in Gloucester.

defines.trans_en: If you keep animals, you own and take care of them, but not in your home as pets.

examples.ch: 养猪／山羊／鸡
examples.en: to keep pigs/goats/chickens

defines.trans_en: to watch and care for someone's children while their parents are away

examples.ch: 我去买东西时，乔迪会照看孩子。
examples.en: Jody will keep the children while I shop.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) stay in a particular place or condition

examples.ch: 我希望你能保持安静。
examples.en: I wish you'd keep quiet.

examples.ch: 我喜欢一直忙忙碌碌的。
examples.en: I like to keep busy.

examples.ch: 到红绿灯处走左边的路。
examples.en: Keep left (= stay on the road to the left) at the traffic lights.

examples.ch: 你能让狗呆在外面吗？
examples.en: Can you keep the dog outside, please?

examples.ch: 关上门让房间保持暖和。
examples.en: Close the door to keep the room warm.

examples.ch: 他们聚会传来的吵闹声使我半夜都没睡着。
examples.en: The noise from their party kept me awake half the night.

defines.trans_en: to continue doing something without stopping, or to do it repeatedly

examples.ch: 他一直想分散我的注意力。
examples.en: He keeps trying to distract me.

examples.ch: 我一直觉得以前在哪儿见过她。
examples.en: I keep on thinking I've seen her before somewhere.

examples.ch: 我一直希望他会给我打电话。
examples.en: I kept hoping that he'd phone me.

defines.trans_en: to delay someone or prevent them from doing something

examples.ch: 他迟到了很久，是什么耽搁了他？
examples.en: He's very late - what's keeping him?

examples.ch: 很抱歉，让你久等了。
examples.en: I'm so sorry to keep you waiting.

examples.ch: 她缠着我在电话里讲了半个小时。
examples.en: She kept me talking on the phone for half an hour.

examples.ch: 希望我没有耽误你睡觉。
examples.en: I hope I'm not keeping you up (= preventing you from going to bed).

defines.trans_en: If you say that news or information for someone can keep, you mean that you can tell it to them later.

examples.ch: “我得跟你说件事”。“能以后再说吗？我现在赶时间。”
examples.en: "I must tell you something." "Can't it keep? I'm in a hurry!"

examples.ch: 不管你有什么新闻，等等再说。
examples.en: Whatever your news is, it will keep.

defines.trans_en: (of food) to stay fresh and in good condition

examples.ch: 牛奶放在冰箱里保鲜时间会长很多。
examples.en: Milk keeps much longer in a fridge.

defines.trans_en: to provide yourself or another person with food, clothing, a home, and other things necessary for basic living

examples.ch: 他需要一份工作来养活全家，让他们过上舒服的生活。
examples.en: He wanted a job that would allow him to keep his family in comfort.

phrases.trans_en: to do what you have told someone that you would do

examples.ch: 我向你作过承诺，我会履行的。
examples.en: I made a promise to you and I intend to keep it.

phrases.trans_en: to go to a meeting or event that has been arranged

examples.ch: 她打电话说她无法守约了。
examples.en: She phoned to say she couldn't keep her appointment.

phrases.text: keep a diary, an account, a record, etc.
phrases.trans_ch: 记日记／记账／作记录（等等）
phrases.trans_en: to make a regular record of events or other information so that you can refer to it later

examples.ch: 到现在我记日记已有12年了。
examples.en: I've kept a diary for twelve years now.

examples.ch: 记下你花多少钱。
examples.en: Keep an account of how much you're spending.

phrases.trans_en: to not tell anyone a secret that you know
(of a watch or clock) to show the correct time

examples.ch: 你的表准吗？
examples.en: Does your watch keep good time?

phrases.trans_en: to be the player who defends your team's goal by trying to prevent players from the other team scoring goals
to not tell people about something

examples.ch: 他们设法把学校的问题保密了一阵子。
examples.en: They managed to keep the school's problems quiet for a while.

examples.ch: 你有滑雪教练资格？你从来没说过！
examples.en: You're a qualified skiing instructor? You kept that quiet!

phrases.trans_en: to continue in the same way as before

examples.ch: 如果情况继续这样的话，我们就不得不关门了。
examples.en: If things keep going like this, we'll have to close the business.

phrases.trans_ch: （在困难的条件下）继续（做）;正常生活
phrases.trans_en: to continue to do something or to live normally in a difficult situation

examples.ch: 有时候很难坚持下去，但是为了孩子我们挺过来了。
examples.en: Sometimes it was hard to keep going, but we did it for the children's sake.

phrases.trans_ch: （尤指在困难的条件下）协助…继续（做）;正常生活
phrases.trans_en: to help someone to continue doing something or living normally, especially in a difficult situation

examples.ch: 是我的朋友们让我坚持下去，度过了这一切。
examples.en: It was my friends that kept me going through all this.

phrases.trans_ch: （在等待吃饭时）使…不至于太饿
phrases.trans_en: to prevent someone from getting too hungry when they have to wait to eat a meal

examples.ch: 吃一点水果，不要太饿。
examples.en: Have a piece of fruit to keep you going.

defines.trans_en: the cost of providing food, heating, and other necessary things for someone

examples.ch: 他现已长大成人，可以自谋生计而不再依靠父母。
examples.en: He's old enough now to earn his keep and stop living off his parents.

defines.trans_en: the strong main tower of a castle
a piece of metal that has been cut into a special shape and is used for opening or closing a lock, starting a car engine, etc.

examples.ch: 车／门钥匙
examples.en: car/door keys

defines.trans_en: any of the set of moving parts that you press with your fingers on a computer keyboard, or musical instrument to produce letters, numbers, symbols, or musical notes
a set of musical notes based on one particular note

examples.ch: 歌曲在中间部分调子变了。
examples.en: The song changes key halfway through.

examples.ch: C小调
examples.en: the key of C minor

defines.trans_en: a list of the symbols used in a map or book with explanations of what they mean
a list of the answers to the questions in an exercise or test

examples.ch: 在176页可以找到测试三的答案。
examples.en: See the key to test 3 on page 176.

defines.trans_en: very important and having a lot of influence on other people or things

examples.ch: 她是国际艺术界的重要人物。
examples.en: She was a key figure in the international art world.

examples.ch: 解决问题的关键因素
examples.en: a key factor in tackling the problem

defines.trans_ch: 故意用钥匙刮花一辆车
defines.trans_en: to intentionally damage a car by scratching its paint using a key

examples.ch: 有人挂花了他的保时捷。
examples.en: Someone keyed his Porsche.

defines.trans_en: the set of keys on a computer or typewriter that you press in order to make it work, or the row of keys on a musical instrument such as a piano
an electronic musical instrument similar to a piano
to put information into a computer using a keyboard
a unit of mass equal to 1,000 grams
a unit of measurement equal to 1,000 metres
generous, helpful, and thinking about other people's feelings

examples.ch: 她是个非常宽容体贴的人。
examples.en: She's a very kind and thoughtful person.

examples.ch: 承蒙惠助，不胜感激。
examples.en: It's very kind of you to help us.

examples.ch: 请对你的妹妹好些！
examples.en: Please be kind to your sister!

examples.ch: 请把门关上好吗？
examples.en: Would you be kind enough to/so kind as to close the door? (= please would you do this)

defines.trans_en: not causing harm or damage

examples.ch: 对环境无害
examples.en: kind to the environment

examples.ch: 这种肥皂对皮肤的损害较小。
examples.en: This soap is kinder to the skin.

defines.trans_en: a group with similar characteristics, or a particular type

examples.ch: 当今的交通工具使用两种燃料——汽油和柴油。
examples.en: Today's vehicles use two kinds of fuel - petrol and diesel.

examples.ch: 你在找什么样的工作？
examples.en: What kind of (a) job are you looking for?

examples.ch: 我确实没有那么多钱。
examples.en: I just don't have that kind of money (= I don't have so much money).

examples.ch: 橱柜里有各种各样稀奇古怪的东西。
examples.en: The cupboard contained all kinds of strange things.

examples.ch: 她的旅游公司是同类中的首家。
examples.en: Her travel company was the first of its kind (= of others that are similar).

defines.trans_en: (the title of) a male ruler of a country, who holds this position because of his royal birth

examples.ch: 理查德二世
examples.en: King Richard II

examples.ch: 英格兰国王和女王
examples.en: the kings and queens of England

defines.trans_ch: （同类动物、事物或人中的）首屈一指者，最重要者
defines.trans_en: the most important, best, or most respected member of a group of animals, things, or people

examples.ch: 狮子经常被称为丛林之王。
examples.en: The lion is often called the king of the jungle.

examples.ch: 他是新的流行音乐天王。
examples.en: He's the new king of pop music.

defines.trans_en: In the game of chess, the king is the most important piece on the board. It can move one square in any direction.
a card with a picture of a king on it, used in games

examples.ch: 红桃K
examples.en: the king of hearts

defines.trans_ch: （作为名称的一部分，指某一种类中）巨型的，较大的
defines.trans_en: used as part of the name of something that is larger than the ordinary type

examples.ch: 宽沟对虾
examples.en: king prawns

examples.ch: 帝王企鹅
examples.en: a king penguin

defines.trans_en: a room where food is kept, prepared, and cooked and where the dishes are washed

examples.ch: 我们通常在厨房吃早饭。
examples.en: We usually eat breakfast in the kitchen.

examples.ch: 厨房用桌
examples.en: the kitchen table

examples.ch: 全新的整体厨房
examples.en: a new fitted kitchen (= cupboards that look the same attached to the walls and floor in the kitchen)

defines.trans_en: a frame covered with cloth or plastic and joined to a long string, that you fly in the air when the weather is windy

examples.ch: 放风筝
examples.en: to fly a kite

defines.trans_en: a large bird of prey (= a bird that eats other birds and small animals)
a tool, usually with a metal blade and a handle, used for cutting and spreading food or other substances, or as a weapon

examples.ch: 切鱼用刀／涂黄油用刀／牛排餐刀
examples.en: a fish/butter/steak knife

examples.ch: 我更愿意用刀叉。
examples.en: I prefer to use a knife and fork.

examples.ch: 他拔出刀，刺中了她。
examples.en: He drew/pulled a knife and stabbed her.

defines.trans_en: to attack someone using a knife

examples.ch: 他用刀砍伤了她的背部。
examples.en: He knifed her in the back.

defines.trans_en: to have information in your mind

examples.ch: “他上哪儿去了？”“我不知道。”
examples.en: "Where did he go?" "I don't know."

examples.ch: “这个要多少钱？”“问凯特，她知道。”
examples.en: "What does it cost?" "Ask Kate. She'll know."

examples.ch: 她知道学校里每个孩子的名字。
examples.en: She knows the name of every kid in the school.

examples.ch: 我对此一无所知。
examples.en: I don't know anything about this.

examples.ch: 我们不知道他什么时候到。
examples.en: We don't know when he's arriving.

examples.ch: 我不明白这么大惊小怪干什么。
examples.en: I don't know (= understand) what all the fuss is about.

examples.ch: 我就知道这会是场灾难。
examples.en: I just knew (that) it was going to be a disaster.

examples.ch: 她知道出错了。
examples.en: She knew (= was aware) (that) something was wrong.

examples.ch: 我们知道这类物质即使是一丁点也会损害皮肤。
examples.en: Even small amounts of these substances are known to cause skin problems.

examples.ch: 当局知道他是个可卡因贩子。
examples.en: The authorities know him to be (= know that he is) a cocaine dealer.

defines.trans_en: used to ask someone to tell you a piece of information

examples.ch: 你知道几点了吗？
examples.en: Do you know the time?

examples.ch: 你知道邮局在哪儿吗？
examples.en: Do you know where the Post Office is?

defines.trans_en: to be certain

examples.ch: 我确信她知道这个消息会很高兴的。
examples.en: I know (that) she'll be really pleased to hear the news.

examples.ch: 我不知道是否该告诉她。
examples.en: I don't know whether I should tell her or not.

examples.ch: 据我所知，聚会在萨拉家举行。
examples.en: The party is at Sarah's house as/so far as I know (= I think but I am not certain).

defines.trans_en: to be familiar with or have experience and understanding of

examples.ch: 从我们一起上学开始我就认识丹尼尔。
examples.en: I've known Daniel since we were at school together.

examples.ch: 她在巴黎长大，对那儿很熟悉。
examples.en: She grew up in Paris so she knows it well.

examples.ch: 电影《卡萨布兰卡》我看过很多遍，对很多情节我都烂熟于心。
examples.en: I've seen the film "Casablanca" so many times that I know a lot of it by heart (= I know it in my memory).

examples.ch: 据我对萨拉的了解，她会干得很好。
examples.en: Knowing Karen (= from my experience of her in the past), she'll have done a good job.

examples.ch: 我的人生中体味过极大的欢乐。
examples.en: I have known (= experienced) great happiness in my life.

defines.trans_en: If you know a subject, you are familiar with it and understand it.

examples.ch: 你懂电脑吗？
examples.en: Do you know about computers?

examples.ch: 她精通自己的学科。
examples.en: She knows her subject inside out (= very well).

defines.trans_en: If you know a language, you can speak and understand it.

examples.ch: 你会法语吗？
examples.en: Do you know any French?

defines.trans_en: to recognize someone or something

examples.ch: 那就是彼得——到哪儿我都能认出他！
examples.en: That's Peter alright - I'd know him anywhere!

examples.ch: 是不是好买卖，我一看就知道。
examples.en: I know a bargain when I see one.

phrases.trans_en: to be able to do something because you have the necessary knowledge

examples.ch: 你会用这台电脑打印吗？
examples.en: Do you know how to print on this computer?

phrases.trans_en: to spend time with someone or something so that you gradually learn more about him, her, or it

examples.ch: 开始的几次会面使医生和病人相互逐渐熟悉。
examples.en: The first couple of meetings are for the doctor and patient to get to know each other.

examples.ch: 我需要几周的时间来熟悉这一系统。
examples.en: I'll need a few weeks to get to know the system.

phrases.trans_en: to have heard the name of a person but not seen or talked to them
If you know someone by sight, that person looks familiar to you, but is not a friend of yours.
to have knowledge about something that most people do not have

examples.ch: 了解情况的人认为，这个度假胜地有着欧洲最理想的滑雪坡道。
examples.en: This resort is considered by those who are in the know to have the best downhill skiing in Europe.

defines.trans_en: a large area of water surrounded by land and not connected to the sea except by rivers or streams

examples.ch: 我们过去常去那个湖里划船。
examples.en: We used to go boating on that lake.

examples.ch: 温德米尔湖
examples.en: Lake Windermere

phrases.trans_ch: （因过量生产而出现的）奶／油／酒（等等）
phrases.trans_en: an amount of a liquid produced that is more than is needed, so that it has to be stored or wasted

examples.ch: 生产过剩导致黄油堆积如山、葡萄酒汇流成河。
examples.en: Overproduction caused butter mountains and wine lakes.

defines.trans_en: a device for giving light, especially one that has a covering or is contained within something

examples.ch: 电／油／煤气灯
examples.en: an electric/oil/gas lamp

examples.ch: 路灯
examples.en: a street lamp

examples.ch: 台／床头灯
examples.en: a table/bedside lamp

defines.trans_en: any of various devices that produce particular types of light

examples.ch: 红外线照射灯
examples.en: an infrared lamp

defines.trans_en: a system of communication consisting of sounds, words, and grammar, or the system of communication used by people in a particular country or type of work

examples.ch: 她研究儿童是如何习得语言的。
examples.en: She does research into how children acquire language.

examples.ch: 你会说外语吗？
examples.en: Do you speak any foreign languages?"

examples.ch: 我根本不是学语言的料。
examples.en: I'm hopeless at learning languages.

examples.ch: 英语
examples.en: the English language

examples.ch: 法律专业用语／术语
examples.en: legal/technical language

examples.ch: 商业用语
examples.en: the language of business

examples.ch: Java 和 Perl 都是重要的计算机编程语言。
examples.en: Java and Perl are both important computer programming languages (= systems of writing instructions for computers).

defines.trans_ch: 手提电脑，便携式电脑，笔记本电脑
defines.trans_en: a computer that is small enough to be carried around easily and is flat when closed
big in size or amount

examples.ch: 大房子
examples.en: a large house

examples.ch: 世界上最大的计算机制造商
examples.en: the world's largest computer manufacturer

examples.ch: 我们需要一辆更大的车。
examples.en: We need a larger car.

examples.ch: 我们没想到会有这么多人来听音乐会。
examples.en: We didn't expect such a large number of people to attend the concert.

examples.ch: 我们已经取得了一些进展，但仍有大量的工作要做。
examples.en: We've made good progress, but there's still a large amount of work to be done.

examples.ch: 上个月的失业人数比预计数字减少了很多。
examples.en: There was a larger-than-expected fall in unemployment last month.

examples.ch: 研究人员刚刚完成了英国历史上最大规模的犯罪行为调查。
examples.en: Researchers have just completed the largest-ever survey of criminal behaviour in the UK

examples.ch: 今年冬天由于没有大规模的紧急食品援助，人们将面临饥荒。
examples.en: The population faces starvation this winter without large-scale emergency food aid.

phrases.trans_en: enjoying yourself very much by dancing and drinking alcohol

examples.ch: 昨晚我们在俱乐部纵情玩乐了一番。
examples.en: We were larging it at a club last night.

defines.trans_en: (the person or thing) after everyone or everything else

examples.ch: 我不愿意开会时最后一个到。
examples.en: I hate being the last one to arrive at a meeting.

examples.ch: 我们家是交通信号灯前左侧的最后一家。
examples.en: Our house is the last one on the left before the traffic lights.

examples.ch: 梅茨队本赛季肯定要垫底了。
examples.en: The Mets will surely finish the season in last place (= at the lowest rank of their division).

examples.ch: 我知道约翰逊在比赛中倒数第一，但谁是倒数第二呢？
examples.en: I know Johnson finished last in the race, but who was second to last (= the one before the one at the end)?

examples.ch: 我不明白他为什么还要去下注——他选的马总是落在最后面。
examples.en: I don't know why he bothers to bet - his horses always come in last.

examples.ch: 在最后一刻他改了主意。
examples.en: At the last moment (= as late as possible) he changed his mind.

examples.ch: 在重大问题上他总要拖到最后一刻才作决定。
examples.en: He always leaves important decisions to the last (possible) moment (= as late as possible).

phrases.trans_en: finally

examples.ch: 我终于把论文写完了！
examples.en: I've finished my essay at last!

examples.ch: 政府最后终于开始关注我们的问题了。
examples.en: At long last the government is starting to listen to our problems.

phrases.trans_ch: 最让人想不到的人／事；最不想见的人／最不愿干的事
phrases.trans_en: the least expected or wanted person or thing

examples.ch: 再多养活3口人——我可受不了！
examples.en: Three extra people to feed - that's the last thing I need!

examples.ch: 我最不愿见到的就是惹你不开心。
examples.en: The last thing I wanted was to make you unhappy.

examples.ch: 我认为马修是最不喜欢跳舞的人。
examples.en: Matthew is the last person I'd expect to be interested in dance.

examples.ch: 我最不放心把钥匙托付给他了。
examples.en: He's the last person I'd trust with my keys.

phrases.trans_en: at the latest time in the day

examples.ch: 晚上睡觉前我会开启洗衣机，这样等我早晨起床后衣服就洗好了。
examples.en: I'll switch on the washing machine last thing so it'll be finished when I get up in the morning.

phrases.trans_en: If you say that it is the last time you will do something, you mean that you will never do it again.

examples.ch: 他甚至从未向我表示过感谢，所以那是我最后一次帮他。
examples.en: He never even thanked me, so that's the last time I do him a favour.

defines.trans_ch: 最后的，最末的;最后的一个（或一部分）
defines.trans_en: (being) the only one or part that is left

examples.ch: 你介意我把最后一块巧克力吃了吗？
examples.en: Do you mind if I have the last chocolate?

examples.ch: 我只剩最后一美元了——我能借点钱吃午饭吗？
examples.en: I'm down to my last dollar - could I borrow some money for lunch?

examples.ch: 恐怕玛莎已经把最后一块冰激凌吃掉了。
examples.en: I'm afraid Martha's eaten the last of the ice cream.

examples.ch: 她是唯一健在的伟大的教育改革家。
examples.en: She was the last of the great educational reformers.

defines.trans_ch: 上一次的;最近的;最后的
defines.trans_en: (being) the most recent or the one before the present one

examples.ch: 你听到昨晚的暴风雨声了吗？
examples.en: Did you hear the storm last night (= during the previous night)?

examples.ch: 昨晚那条电视新闻你看了吗？
examples.en: Did you see the news on TV last night (= yesterday evening)?

examples.ch: 去年11月他们结婚了。
examples.en: They got married last November.

examples.ch: 你上一次吸烟是在什么时候？
examples.en: When was the last time you had a cigarette?

examples.ch: 你最后一次吸烟是在什么时候？
examples.en: When did you last have a cigarette?

examples.ch: 上个月起她一直在那里工作。
examples.en: She's been working there for the last month (= for the four weeks until now).

examples.ch: 你能说说上个星期天你都去什么地方了吗？
examples.en: Could you account for your whereabouts on Sunday last?

examples.ch: 过去的5年他过得非常艰难。
examples.en: The/These last five years have been very difficult for him.

examples.ch: 上一次我们听到她的消息，她是在法国当英语教师。
examples.en: The last we heard of her, she was working as an English teacher in France.

examples.ch: 她的油画作品一幅比一幅有进步。
examples.en: Each of her paintings has been better than the last.

defines.trans_en: to continue to exist

examples.ch: 会议持续了两个小时。
examples.en: The meeting lasted two hours.

examples.ch: 干旱持续了好几个月。
examples.en: The drought lasted for several months.

examples.ch: 他们说这场雪要一直下到下周末。
examples.en: They say the snow will last until the end of next week.

examples.ch: 我认为停火不会持续下去。
examples.en: I can't see the ceasefire lasting.

examples.ch: 他们已经两周没吵架了，但这种状态恐怕持续不了多久。
examples.en: They haven't had an argument for two weeks, but it's too good to last (= they'll have an argument soon).

examples.ch: 我怀疑他们只是一时的心血来潮。
examples.en: I doubt their enthusiasm will last.

examples.ch: 目前他的工作效率很高，但不会持续很久。
examples.en: He's working very efficiently at the moment, but it won't last.

defines.trans_en: to continue being good or suitable

examples.ch: 买些不耐用的东西根本毫无意义。
examples.en: There's no point buying something that isn't going to last.

examples.ch: 比较便宜的洗衣机大约可以使用5年。
examples.en: The cheaper washing machines should last about five years.

examples.ch: 如果注意爱护，这支钢笔可以用上一辈子。
examples.en: This pen should last (you) a lifetime if you take care of it.

examples.ch: 她的前任秘书只干了1个月。
examples.en: Her previous secretary only lasted a month (= left after this period).

defines.trans_ch: 末期的，晚期的；接近终了
defines.trans_en: (happening or being) near the end of a period of time

examples.ch: 夜已经很深了。
examples.en: It was late at night.

examples.ch: 我们一直谈到深夜。
examples.en: We talked late into the night.

examples.ch: 都这时候了！我不知道都这么晚了。
examples.en: Is that the time? I'd no idea it was so late.

examples.ch: 那件事发生在夏末。
examples.en: It was late summer when it happened.

examples.ch: 它建于19世纪晚期。
examples.en: It was built in the late 19th century.

examples.ch: 他很可能快30岁了。
examples.en: He's probably in his late twenties.

examples.ch: 直到20世纪80年代这个农场还在使用马匹。
examples.en: As late (= as recently) as the 1980s they were still using horses on this farm.

defines.trans_en: (happening or arriving) after the planned, expected, usual, or necessary time

examples.ch: 这趟火车总是晚点。
examples.en: This train is always late.

examples.ch: 如果不抓紧时间你会误机的。
examples.en: You'll be late for your flight if you don't hurry up.

examples.ch: 对不起我来晚了。我在路上堵车了。
examples.en: Sorry I'm late. I was held up in the traffic.

examples.ch: 现在才开始抱怨已经晚了。
examples.en: It's too late to start complaining now.

examples.ch: 星期天我们总是很晚才吃早饭。
examples.en: We always have a late breakfast on Sunday mornings.

examples.ch: 刚刚收到最新消息——一枚炸弹在伦敦中心地区爆炸。
examples.en: Some late news (= news of something that happened after the news programme started) has just come in - a bomb has exploded in central London.

examples.ch: 渡轮因罢工而晚点两个小时。
examples.en: Our ferry was two hours late because of the strike.

examples.ch: 凯瑟琳刚才打电话说今天晚上要工作到很晚。
examples.en: Kathryn's just phoned to say she's working late this evening.

defines.trans_ch: （足球比赛中的铲球）迟了（此时球已移动，于是被踢到的不是球而是对方队员）
defines.trans_en: in football, if a tackle is late, it is made after the ball has been moved by another player and the player, not the ball, is kicked

examples.ch: 他在比赛第一分钟就因为铲球迟了而被罚黄牌。
examples.en: He was booked for a late challenge in the first minute.

defines.trans_en: the fact of being late

examples.ch: 时间这么晚了，难怪你感觉很累。
examples.en: It was no great surprise that you were tired given the lateness of the hour.

defines.trans_en: the fact of being late

examples.ch: 时间这么晚了，难怪你感觉很累。
examples.en: It was no great surprise that you were tired given the lateness of the hour.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to someone who has died

examples.ch: 她把丈夫去世后留下的衣服捐给了慈善机构。
examples.en: She gave her late husband's clothes to charity.

defines.trans_en: at a time in the future or after the time you have mentioned

examples.ch: 他过会儿回来。
examples.en: He'll be back later.

examples.ch: 我们总还可以在这个季节的晚些时候去。
examples.en: We could always go later in the season.

examples.ch: 警察询问了他，后来他被逮捕了。
examples.en: Police questioned him and he was later arrested.

phrases.trans_ch: 将来的某个时候;过会儿
phrases.trans_en: at a time in the future, or after the time you have mentioned

examples.ch: 今晚晚些时候你想干什么？
examples.en: What are you doing later on this evening?

examples.ch: 我过一会去接她好吗？
examples.en: Shall I go and fetch her later on?

examples.ch: 你愿意的话，过会儿我们可以一起去吃饭。
examples.en: Later on, we could go and have a meal if you like.

phrases.trans_ch: 早于某个时间;在某时间之前
phrases.trans_en: not after

examples.ch: 她说她希望我们能在9点之前到达。
examples.en: She said she'd prefer us to arrive no later than nine o'clock.

defines.trans_en: happening at a time in the future, or after the time you have mentioned

examples.ch: 我们可以搭乘晚些时候的火车。
examples.en: We could catch a later train.

examples.ch: 你可以在日后任何时间修改你的密码。
examples.en: You can always change your password at a later date.

defines.trans_ch: 在快结束的时候；在（某人）生命的晚期
defines.trans_en: happening towards the end of a period of time or the end of someone's life

examples.ch: 在患病的晚期，他需要全天候的照料。
examples.en: He needed round-the-clock care in the later stages of his illness.

examples.ch: 他的晚年在开普敦度过。
examples.en: During his later years, he lived in Cape Town.

defines.trans_en: more modern or recent

examples.ch: 较新版本的软件要好得多。
examples.en: Later versions of the software are much better.

examples.ch: 近期的型号包括了一部2.5升的引擎。
examples.en: Later models included a 2.5 litre engine.

examples.ch: 我认为她的早期油画作品比晚期的好。
examples.en: I prefer her earlier paintings to her later work.

defines.trans_en: a way of saying goodbye

examples.ch: 迈克，再见。
examples.en: Laters, Mike.

defines.trans_en: to smile while making sounds with your voice that show you think something is funny or you are happy

examples.ch: 听了她讲的笑话他们都笑了。
examples.en: They laughed at her jokes.

examples.ch: 我情不自禁地笑个不停。
examples.en: I couldn't stop laughing.

examples.ch: 我告诉他说他必须发言，他听后紧张地笑了起来。
examples.en: I said he'd have to give a talk and he laughed nervously.

examples.ch: 她太有意思了——真让我笑死了。
examples.en: She's so funny - she really makes me laugh.

examples.ch: 一本能让你笑出声来的好书真是不多见。
examples.en: It's very rare that a book is so good you actually laugh out loud.

examples.ch: 太有意思了，我放声笑了出来。
examples.en: It was so funny, I burst out laughing (= laughed suddenly and loudly).

examples.ch: 我笑得直流眼泪。
examples.en: I laughed till I cried.

defines.trans_en: the act or sound of laughing

examples.ch: 放声大笑／紧张的笑
examples.en: a loud/nervous laugh

examples.ch: 那时我很尴尬，但过后却觉得非常可笑。
examples.en: I was embarrassed at the time, but I had a good laugh about it later.

defines.trans_ch: 令人愉快的活动，好玩的活动
defines.trans_en: an enjoyable or funny activity

examples.ch: “聚会办得怎么样？”“哦，相当好玩。”
examples.en: "How was the party?" "Oh, it was a laugh."

defines.trans_en: someone who is funny

examples.ch: 你会喜欢莎伦的——她这个人很风趣。
examples.en: You'd like Sharon - she's a good laugh.

defines.trans_en: to get knowledge or skill in a new subject or activity

examples.ch: 他们在学校学俄语。
examples.en: They learn Russian at school.

examples.ch: “你会开车吗？”“我正在学。”
examples.en: "Can you drive?" "I'm learning."

examples.ch: 自从到这里工作后我学到了不少计算机知识。
examples.en: I've learned a lot about computers since I started work here.

examples.ch: 我正在学弹钢琴。
examples.en: I'm learning to play the piano.

examples.ch: 首先你要学习（怎样）使用这台机器。
examples.en: First you'll learn (how) to use this machine.

defines.trans_en: to make yourself remember a piece of writing by reading it or repeating it many times

examples.ch: 我不知道演员是怎样记住那么多台词的。
examples.en: I don't know how actors manage to learn all those lines.

examples.ch: 我们被告知家庭作业是熟练背诵鲍西娅的演说。
examples.en: We were told to learn Portia's speech by heart (= be able to say it from memory) for homework.

defines.trans_en: to start to understand that you must change the way you behave

examples.ch: 她必须明白她不可能想要什么就有什么。
examples.en: She'll have to learn that she can't have everything she wants.

examples.ch: 她很快就明白了不能和他对着干。
examples.en: She soon learned not to contradict him.

examples.ch: 他勇于从错误中汲取教训。
examples.en: He's not afraid to learn from his mistakes.

defines.trans_en: to be told facts or information that you did not know

examples.ch: 听到他的死讯我们都很震惊。
examples.en: We were all shocked to learn of his death.

examples.ch: 我后来听说从来就没有收到过那条消息。
examples.en: I later learned (that) the message had never arrived.

examples.ch: 那起事故我只是后来才听说的。
examples.en: I only learned about the accident later.

defines.trans_en: animal skin treated in order to preserve it, and used to make shoes, bags, clothes, equipment, etc.

examples.ch: 皮衣／带／包
examples.en: a leather coat/belt/handbag

defines.trans_en: to go away from someone or something, for a short time or permanently

examples.ch: 我明天早晨5点钟离开。
examples.en: I'll be leaving at five o'clock tomorrow.

examples.ch: 他从房子的后门离开了。
examples.en: He left the house by the back door.

examples.ch: 她离开了人群，走过来和我们说话。
examples.en: She left the group of people she was with and came over to speak to us.

examples.ch: 公共汽车5分钟后发车。
examples.en: The bus leaves in five minutes.

defines.trans_en: to not take something or someone with you when you go, either intentionally or by accident

examples.ch: 喂，你把钥匙落在桌子上了。
examples.en: Hey, you've left your keys on the table.

examples.ch: 我可以给苏留个口信吗？
examples.en: Can I leave a message for Sue?

examples.ch: 周五你干吗不把孩子留给我照看呢?
examples.en: Why don't you leave the kids with me on Friday?

defines.trans_en: If something leaves something else, a part or effect of it stays after it has gone or been used.

examples.ch: 他的鞋在地板上留下了泥印。
examples.en: His shoes left muddy marks on the floor.

examples.ch: 如果我给你50欧元我剩下的钱就不够付账了。
examples.en: If I give you €50 that won't leave me enough cash to pay the bill.

examples.ch: 这项新的法律不仅没有使生活条件得到改善，反而使许多人的境遇更加糟糕了。
examples.en: Far from improving things, the new law has left many people worse off (= they are now in a worse situation) than before.

defines.trans_ch: 使保留；使保持（某种状态）
defines.trans_en: If you leave something in a particular condition, you do not touch it, move it, or act to change it in any way, so that it stays in the same condition.

examples.ch: 把那把椅子留在原处。
examples.en: Leave that chair where it is.

examples.ch: 他的晚饭几乎一点儿也没动。
examples.en: He left most of his dinner (= did not eat much of it).

examples.ch: 一家子人流落街头。
examples.en: The family were left (= became and continued to be) homeless.

examples.ch: 我必须得回去——我觉得好像忘记关电熨斗了。
examples.en: I'll have to go back - I think I've left the iron on.

examples.ch: 你可以让窗户开着。
examples.en: You can leave the window open.

examples.ch: 不要打扰你姐姐。
examples.en: Leave your sister alone (= stop annoying her).

defines.trans_en: If you leave something or someone doing something, he, she, or it is still doing it when you go away.

examples.ch: 我走的时候，孩子们仍在看电视。
examples.en: I left the children watching television.

examples.ch: 他离开的时候没有关闭发动机。
examples.en: He left the engine running.

defines.trans_en: to not eat or use all of something

examples.ch: 他们把蛋糕都吃了，但是留下了一些三明治。
examples.en: They'd eaten all the cake, but they'd left some sandwiches.

examples.ch: 还有饼干剩下吗？
examples.en: Are there any cookies left?

examples.ch: 晚会剩下了一些吃的。
examples.en: There's some food left over from the party.

examples.ch: 保证给我们留下足够的热水。
examples.en: Make sure you leave enough hot water for the rest of us.

defines.trans_en: to stop doing something, or to leave a place because you have finished an activity

examples.ch: 许多孩子16岁上完中学。
examples.en: Many children leave school at 16.

examples.ch: 因健康原因他于6月份辞职了。
examples.en: He left work in June for health reasons.

examples.ch: 她18岁离开家独立生活。
examples.en: She left home (= stopped living with her parents) at 18.

examples.ch: 我们不要再讨论那个题目了，进行议程中的下一项内容好吗？
examples.en: Could we leave that subject (= stop discussing that subject) for the moment and go on to the next item on the agenda?

defines.trans_ch: 结束（与丈夫、妻子或伴侣的）关系并不再同居
defines.trans_en: to end a relationship with a husband, wife, or partner and stop living with them

examples.ch: 我永远不会离开你。
examples.en: I'll never leave you.

examples.ch: 她离开了她丈夫，和一个年轻男人在一起。
examples.en: She left her husband for a younger man.

defines.trans_en: If you leave (doing) something, you wait before you do it.

examples.ch: 这些信我周一再写。
examples.en: I'll leave these letters till Monday (= write them on Monday).

examples.ch: 别拖得太久了。
examples.en: Don't leave it too late (= don't wait too long to do it).

examples.ch: 他们拖到最后才去预订假期旅程。
examples.en: They left booking their holiday till/to the last minute.

defines.trans_en: To leave a wife, husband, or other close family member is to die while these family members are still alive.

examples.ch: 他身后留下了妻子和两个孩子。
examples.en: He left a wife and two children.

defines.trans_ch: 死后将…赠与;给（某人）留下（遗产）
defines.trans_en: If you leave something that you own to someone, you say they should receive it when you die.

examples.ch: 他把所有的钱都留给了他的侄女们。
examples.en: He left his nieces all his money./He left all his money to his nieces.

defines.trans_ch: 让（某人）决定;允许（某人）选择;使（某人）对…负责
defines.trans_en: to allow someone to make a choice or decision about something, or to make someone responsible for something

examples.ch: 我让她来决定这件事情。
examples.en: I left the decision (up) to her.

examples.ch: 我让她来决定这件事情。
examples.en: I left it to her to make the decision.

examples.ch: 把它交给我吧，我来想办法处理。
examples.en: Leave it (= the problem) with me, I'll see what I can do.

examples.ch: 我不管了，随它去吧。
examples.en: I'll leave it to chance (= wait and see what happens without planning).

defines.trans_en: time allowed away from work for a holiday or illness

examples.ch: 你有多少天年假／带薪假期？
examples.en: How much annual/paid leave do you get?

examples.ch: 她去休假了。
examples.en: She's (gone) on leave (= holiday).

examples.ch: 我已经问过能不能请一周不带薪的假。
examples.en: I've asked if I can take a week's unpaid leave.

defines.trans_en: permission or agreement

examples.ch: 他未经我同意就做了这件事。
examples.en: He did it without (my) leave.

examples.ch: 做那件事你得到允许了吗？
examples.en: Did you get leave to do that?

phrases.trans_en: formal permission to be away from work or studies
to say goodbye

examples.ch: 他觉得该是告别家乡的时候了。
examples.en: He decided the time had come to take leave of his home town.

defines.trans_en: on or towards the side of your body that is to the west when you are facing north

examples.ch: 他的左眼被严严实实地包扎了起来。
examples.en: His left eye was heavily bandaged.

examples.ch: 在红绿灯处左转。
examples.en: Turn left at the lights.

defines.trans_en: the left side

examples.ch: 首先我来介绍一下坐在我左边的发言者。
examples.en: First I'll introduce the speaker sitting on my left.

examples.ch: 请选左侧第一／二／三个。
examples.en: Take the first/second/third on the left.

examples.ch: 就是酒馆左侧的那条街。
examples.en: It's the street to the left of the hotel.

examples.ch: 过了杂货店，我向左拐了个弯儿。
examples.en: After the grocery store I made/took/informal hung a left (= turned into the next road on the left side).

phrases.trans_en: the political groups that believe wealth and power should be shared between all parts of society

examples.ch: 这场战争受到左派团体的普遍反对。
examples.en: The war is generally opposed on the left.

defines.trans_en:
past simple and past participle of
leave
relating to political groups that believe wealth and power should be shared between all parts of society

examples.ch: 党内左派对此项立法表示不满。
examples.en: The left wing of the party is unhappy with the legislation.

defines.trans_en: one of the parts of the body of a human or animal that is used for standing or walking

examples.ch: 走了这么远的路，我的腿有些累了。
examples.en: My legs were tired after so much walking.

examples.ch: 他滑雪时摔断了腿。
examples.en: He broke his leg skiing.

examples.ch: 这匹马摔断了前腿。
examples.en: The horse broke its front leg in the fall.

defines.trans_en: the part of a piece of clothing that you put your leg in

examples.ch: 他卷起裤腿趟进水里。
examples.en: He rolled up his trouser legs and waded into the water.

defines.trans_en: one of the thin vertical parts that support an object

examples.ch: 椅子／桌子腿
examples.en: a chair/table leg

defines.trans_en: a particular stage of a journey, competition, or activity

examples.ch: 他有国家大学体育总会男子冰球锦标赛第一轮比赛的门票。
examples.en: He has tickets for the first leg of the NCAA Men's Hockey Championship.

examples.ch: 最后一段赛程是从巴黎到伦敦。
examples.en: The last leg of the race was Paris to London.

phrases.trans_en: to run away in order to escape from something

examples.ch: 他们一看见警察来了，就拐过街角跑了。
examples.en: They legged it round the corner when they saw the police coming.

defines.trans_en: an oval fruit that has a thick, yellow skin and sour juice

examples.ch: 按照这份食谱，你需要两个柠檬的果汁。
examples.en: For this recipe you need the juice of two lemons.

examples.ch: 你的茶里要放一片柠檬吗？
examples.en: Would you like a slice of lemon in your tea?

examples.ch: 柠檬汁
examples.en: lemon juice

defines.trans_en: the juice of a lemon or a drink made from this juice
a pale yellow colour

defines.trans_ch: 有毛病的东西；不成功的东西
defines.trans_en: something that does not work

examples.ch: 在他的几项发明中只有一项没有获得成功。
examples.en: Only one of his inventions turned out to be a lemon.

defines.trans_en: a very silly person

examples.ch: 我发现错过了约会时间，觉得自己真是太傻了。
examples.en: I felt such a lemon when I discovered I'd missed my appointment.

defines.trans_en: of a pale yellow colour
a drink made with the juice of lemons, water, and sugar
a cold, sweet fizzy drink (= one with bubbles) with a lemon flavour
a smaller amount (of), or to a smaller degree

examples.ch: 我们必须尽量少花一些钱。
examples.en: We must try to spend less money.

examples.ch: 要少吃多运动。
examples.en: Exercise more and eat less.

examples.ch: 巧克力和饼干我比以前吃得少了。
examples.en: I eat less chocolate and fewer biscuits than I used to.

examples.ch: 在夏天起床不像在冬天那样困难。
examples.en: Getting out of bed in summer is less difficult than in winter.

phrases.trans_en: used to say that behaviour does not have the good or attractive characteristic that is stated

examples.ch: 我认为他对我不够诚实。
examples.en: I think he was less than honest with me.

phrases.trans_en: If something happens less and less, it becomes gradually smaller in amount or happens less often.

examples.ch: 他越来越不会照顾自己了。
examples.en: He's less and less able to look after himself.

defines.trans_en:
→ 
minus

examples.ch: 除去你已经支付的5英镑定金，你应付的总金额为30英镑。
examples.en: The total is 30 dollars, less the five dollars deposit that you paid.

defines.trans_en: used to form adjectives meaning "without (the thing mentioned)"

examples.ch: 无意义的
examples.en: meaningless

examples.ch: 没有朋友的
examples.en: friendless

defines.trans_en: a period of time in which a person is taught about a subject or how to do something

examples.ch: 我们怎样才能把理科课程讲得更有趣一些呢?
examples.en: How can we make science lessons more interesting?

examples.ch: 她从未上过表演课。
examples.en: She has never had/taken any acting lessons.

examples.ch: 他教法语课。
examples.en: He gives French lessons.

defines.trans_en: an experience that teaches you how to behave better in a similar situation in the future

examples.ch: 所有父母都应该从这起悲剧性事件中吸取教训。
examples.en: There is a lesson for all parents in this tragic accident.

examples.ch: 我父母让我把钱都还了回去，这次教训我永远都不会忘记。
examples.en: My parents made me pay back all the money and it was a lesson I never forgot.

examples.ch: 从这次灾难中我们可以汲取重要教训。
examples.en: We can learn important lessons (= gain new understanding) from this disaster.

defines.trans_en: to allow something to happen or someone to do something by not doing anything to stop an action or by giving your permission

examples.ch: 她想走，但父母不让。
examples.en: She wanted to go but her parents wouldn't let her.

examples.ch: 他决定把头发留起来。
examples.en: He decided to let his hair grow long.

examples.ch: 让鞋子干透以后再穿。
examples.en: Let your shoes dry completely before putting them on.

examples.ch: 我允许你熬夜，但仅此一次。
examples.en: I'm letting you stay up late, just this once.

examples.ch: 不要让它惹你心烦。
examples.en: Don't let it worry you.

examples.ch: 如果他需要钱，就让他去挣吧！
examples.en: If he needs money, let him (= he should) earn it!

defines.trans_en: used to show that you accept what is going to happen, although you do not like it

examples.ch: 随它下吧——下雨不会影响我们下午的活动。
examples.en: Let it rain - it won't spoil our afternoon.

defines.trans_en: used to say that you wish something to happen very much

examples.ch: 噢，让他得到那份工作吧！
examples.en: Oh, please let him get the job!

defines.trans_en: to allow your house or land to be lived in or used by someone else in exchange for a regular payment

examples.ch: 他们准备夏天把房子租出去。
examples.en: They are letting their house (out) for the summer.

examples.ch: 他把公寓房租给了一对年轻夫妇。
examples.en: He's let his flat to a young couple.

examples.ch: 她的房子里有一个房间要出租。
examples.en: She has a room to let in her house.

phrases.trans_en: used to express a suggestion or request that includes you and the other person or people

examples.ch: 我们出去吃晚饭吧。
examples.en: Let's go out to dinner.

examples.ch: 让我们来考虑一下各种可能性吧。
examples.en: Let us consider all the possibilities.

examples.ch: 咱们别争了。
examples.en: Let's not (UK also don't let's) argue.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于否定句后表示强调）当然不会，更不用说
phrases.trans_en: used after a negative statement to emphasize how unlikely a situation is because something much more likely has never happened

examples.ch: 有些人从不看报纸，更不用说读书了。
examples.en: Some people never even read a newspaper, let alone a book.

defines.trans_ch: （网球等运动项目的）发球擦网，发球触网
defines.trans_en: (in tennis or similar games) a situation in which the ball touches the net as it crosses it, so that you have to play the point again
the act of allowing someone to use your house, land, etc. in exchange for regular payments

examples.ch: 为期5年的公寓租赁
examples.en: a five-year let on a flat

phrases.trans_en: without being prevented from doing something

examples.ch: 人们将能够不受任何限制地在各国之间自由往来。
examples.en: People will be able to travel from country to country without let or hindrance.

defines.trans_en: small, not very important

examples.ch: 小猪
examples.en: piglet

defines.trans_en: a written message from one person to another, usually put in an envelope and sent by post

examples.ch: 今天早晨我收到了一封银行的来函。
examples.en: I got a letter from the bank this morning.

defines.trans_en: any of the set of symbols used to write a language, representing a sound in the language

examples.ch: 字母D
examples.en: the letter D

phrases.trans_en: the exact words of the law and not its more important general meaning

defines.trans_ch: （美国）标准信纸（长11英寸，宽8.5英寸）
defines.trans_en: used to refer to a standard size of paper in the US, 8.5 inches by 11 inches

examples.ch: 印传单的纸一般是标准信纸或法律规格纸。
examples.en: Fliers are usually printed either on letter size or legal size paper.

defines.trans_en: the height of something

examples.ch: 暴雨过后这个湖的水位上升了很多。
examples.en: The water level in the lake is much higher after heavy rain.

defines.trans_en: the amount or number of something

examples.ch: 通货膨胀率将比目前上涨2%。
examples.en: Inflation is going to rise two percent from its present level.

examples.ch: 下棋需要注意力高度集中。
examples.en: Chess requires a very high level of concentration.

examples.ch: 存在低剂量辐射的危险。
examples.en: There is some danger of low level (= a continuing small amount of) radiation.

defines.trans_ch: （与他人相比的）能力，水平，级别
defines.trans_en: someone's ability compared to other people

examples.ch: 面向高级别学生的课程
examples.en: a class for advanced level students

examples.ch: 处于这种程度的学生需要大量的帮助。
examples.en: Students at this level require a lot of help.

examples.ch: 这种考试分为3个级别。
examples.en: The exam can be taken at three levels.

defines.trans_en: a floor in a large building

examples.ch: 这个图书馆分三层，在一层有一个会议中心。
examples.en: The library has three levels, with a conference centre at ground level.

examples.ch: 该展览在大厦的三层。
examples.en: The exhibition is on level three of the building.

defines.trans_en: a position within a system in which people are arranged according to their importance

examples.ch: 这些是管理层需要讨论的问题。
examples.en: These are subjects for discussion at management level.

defines.trans_en: a tool that contains a tube of liquid with an air bubble in it, used to show if a surface is level

phrases.trans_en: relating to a particular area of the country/the whole of the country

examples.ch: 这些政策由当地部门制定。
examples.en: These sorts of policies are made at local level.

defines.trans_en: at the same height

examples.ch: 那棵树的树顶和他卧室的窗户处于同一高度。
examples.en: The top of the tree is level with his bedroom window.

defines.trans_en: flat or horizontal

examples.ch: 拍照前要保证相机处于水平位置。
examples.en: Make sure the camera is level before you take the picture.

examples.ch: 在我把钉子敲进去之前，请帮我看看这幅画挂平了没有？
examples.en: Before I bang the nails in, would you say this picture was level?

defines.trans_en: having the same value, amount, number of points, etc.

examples.ch: 佩雷罗必须在此次环法自行车赛后面的3个赛段中取胜才能赶上勒萨热。
examples.en: Pieretti would have to win the next three stages in order to draw level with (= reach the same position as) Le Sage in the Tour de France.

examples.ch: 工会正在争取工资与通货膨胀率保持同步增长。
examples.en: The unions are fighting to keep wages level (US usually even) with inflation.

defines.trans_ch: （说话声或目光）平静的，平稳的
defines.trans_en: If you speak in a level voice or give someone a level look, you do it in a calm and controlled way.

examples.ch: 他语调平静地命令士兵们瞄准射击。
examples.en: In a level voice, he ordered the soldiers to aim and fire.

phrases.trans_ch: （烹饪时用于计量的）一平勺／杯的量
phrases.trans_en: an amount of a liquid or substance that fills a spoon/cup but does not go above the edges, used as a measure in cooking

defines.trans_en: to make a surface flat

examples.ch: 在水泥凝固前把它抹平。
examples.en: Level the wet cement before it sets.

defines.trans_en: to completely destroy a building or area

examples.ch: 那次轰炸已将村庄夷为平地。
examples.en: The bombing levelled the village.

defines.trans_en: a building, room, or organization that has a collection, especially of books, for people to read or borrow, usually without payment

examples.ch: 公共／大学图书馆
examples.en: a public/university library

examples.ch: 图书馆藏书
examples.en: a library book

defines.trans_en: a collection or set of books or other things, all produced in the same style or about the same subject

examples.ch: 企鹅出版社莎士比亚文库
examples.en: the Penguin Shakespeare Library

defines.trans_en: an official document that gives you permission to own, do, or use something, usually after you have paid money and/or taken a test

examples.ch: 养狗牌照
examples.en: a dog licence

examples.ch: 驾驶执照
examples.en: a driving licence (US driver's license)

examples.ch: 电视（收看）许可证
examples.en: a TV licence

defines.trans_en: permission or freedom to do what you want

examples.ch: 作为父母，他们给孩子们的自由很少。
examples.en: As parents, they allowed their children very little licence.

examples.ch: 他获准对该组织实行改革。
examples.en: He was given licence to reform the organization.
