phrases.trans_en: the freedom of artists, writers, etc. to change the facts of the real world when producing art
with special permission from the person or company who has created a product

examples.ch: 这是一种经过授权在英国工厂生产的德国产品。
examples.en: It's a German product, made under licence in British factories.

defines.trans_ch: 寿命;生命;一生，人生;生活;性命
defines.trans_en: the period between birth and death, or the experience or state of being alive

examples.ch: 人生短暂，何必为金钱而烦恼！
examples.en: Life's too short to worry about money!

examples.ch: 我不能肯定自己是否愿意与他共度余生。
examples.en: I'm not sure I want to spend the rest of my life with him.

examples.ch: 不幸的是，意外事故也是生活的一部分。
examples.en: Unfortunately, accidents are part of life.

examples.ch: 他在生命走向终了时疯掉了。
examples.en: He went mad towards the end of his life.

examples.ch: 据说猫有九命。
examples.en: Cats are supposed to have nine lives.

examples.ch: 他不知道自己在生活中真正想要的是什么。
examples.en: He doesn't know what he really wants in/out of life.

examples.ch: 那场事故彻底改变了我对人生的看法。
examples.en: The accident changed my whole outlook on life.

examples.ch: 他在一战中丧生。
examples.en: He lost his life (= died suddenly because of a violent event or accident) in the Great War.

examples.ch: 在世界上很多地方，把葡萄糖和水混合在一起就可以用来拯救人的性命。
examples.en: A simple mixture of glucose and water can save lives in many parts of the world.

examples.ch: 他带着她毕生的积蓄跑掉了。
examples.en: He ran off with her life savings (= all the money she had saved).

defines.trans_ch: 生活方式;生活（的某一部分）
defines.trans_en: a way of living or a particular part of someone's life

examples.ch: 她的家庭／个人／性生活
examples.en: her family/private/sex life

examples.ch: 我的职业生涯
examples.en: my working life

examples.ch: 我们采访了资深政界人士、著名作家等公众人物。
examples.en: We interviewed senior politicians, famous writers, and others in public life.

examples.ch: 毒品和暴力在美国社会生活中已经根深蒂固。
examples.en: Drugs and violence are deeply rooted in American life.

examples.ch: 我16岁离家出去闯荡世界。
examples.en: I left home at 16 to see life (= have different experiences with a lot of people in lots of places).

examples.ch: 教书已成为了她的生命。
examples.en: Teaching has been her life (= the most important and enjoyable thing in her life).

defines.trans_en: the period for which a machine or organization lasts

examples.ch: 新一代电池的寿命要长得多。
examples.en: The newer batteries have a much longer life.

examples.ch: 小心使用会延长机器的寿命。
examples.en: Careful use will prolong the life of your machine.

examples.ch: 该项立法在当前议会的任期内不会获得通过。
examples.en: The legislation won't be passed during the life of the present parliament.

defines.trans_en: the quality that makes people, animals, and plants different from objects, substances, and things that are dead

examples.ch: 医生发现老人已经没有了生命迹象。
examples.en: The doctor could find no sign of life in the old man's body.

examples.ch: 我透过窗子向外望去，却看不到有任何人类活动的迹象。
examples.en: I looked through the window but I couldn't see any signs of life (= people moving).

defines.trans_en: energy or enthusiasm

examples.ch: 她充满了活力。
examples.en: She's so full of life.

defines.trans_en: everything that is alive

examples.ch: 人类／海洋生物／植物
examples.en: human/marine/plant life

defines.trans_en: In art, if you work from life, you paint, draw, etc. real people or objects, usually while they are in front of you rather than from memory.

examples.ch: 写生课
examples.en: life drawing classes

defines.trans_ch: （尤指儿童游戏中的）一次机会;命
defines.trans_en: especially in children's games, one of the limited number of times that you can lose, but still continue playing

examples.ch: 小人儿每被击中一次，你就丢了一条命。
examples.en: Every time the little man gets hit, you lose a life.

phrases.trans_en: to make something more real or exciting

examples.ch: 这段历史总是令人饶有兴味，这部电影对此进行了真实的再现。
examples.en: It's always been an interesting period in history and this film really brought it to life.

phrases.trans_ch: 使更加实在；使更有生机
phrases.trans_en: to become more real or exciting

examples.ch: 比赛下半场有了生机。
examples.en: The game really came to life in the second half.

phrases.trans_en: for the whole of a person's life

examples.ch: 我相信婚姻是一辈子的事情。
examples.en: I believe marriage is for life.

phrases.trans_en: to be willing to die in order to defend or support someone or something

examples.ch: 他们已做好了为国捐躯的准备。
examples.en: They were ready to give their lives for their country.

phrases.trans_en: If you believe in life after death, you believe that people continue to exist in some form after they die.
to completely change how or where you live

examples.ch: 她决定在澳大利亚开始新的生活。
examples.en: She decided to start a new life in Australia.

defines.trans_en: to move something from a lower to a higher position

examples.ch: 你能帮我抬一下桌子吗？
examples.en: Could you help me lift this table, please?

examples.ch: 你能把椅子稍微抬一下吗——我的大衣被压住了。
examples.en: Could you lift your chair a little- I've got my coat caught under it.

examples.ch: 她把香烟举到唇边。
examples.en: She lifted the cigarette (up) to her lips.

examples.ch: 他的目光从报纸上移开，抬起头来怒目而视。
examples.en: He lifted his eyes (= looked up) from the paper and glared.

defines.trans_ch: 把（蔬菜或植物）挖出来，刨出，拔出
defines.trans_en: to dig underground vegetables or plants out of the ground

examples.ch: 他们正在挖土豆。
examples.en: They're lifting potatoes.

defines.trans_en: to take hold of and raise something in order to remove, carry, or move it to a different position

examples.ch: 她把婴儿从椅子上抱起来。
examples.en: She lifted the baby out of her chair.

examples.ch: 他小心地从架子上取下那个盒子。
examples.en: He lifted the box carefully down from the shelf.

defines.trans_en: to make your voice louder, especially when performing

defines.trans_ch: 使更有趣；增加…的趣味性
defines.trans_en: to make something more interesting or enjoyable

examples.ch: 这篇文章的信息量够大，但有些枯燥——我们需要增强它的趣味性。
examples.en: The article is informative enough, but it's a little dull - we need something to lift it.

defines.trans_en: (of mist or fog) to go away until none is left

examples.ch: 晨雾已经散去，太阳开始放出光芒。
examples.en: The morning mist had lifted and the sun was starting to come through.

defines.trans_en: to end a rule or law

examples.ch: 河水的水位已经恢复正常，因此用水限制被取消了。
examples.en: The restrictions on water usage have been lifted now that the river levels are normal.

examples.ch: 最终他们取消了在俱乐部禁止穿牛仔裤的规定。
examples.en: At last they've lifted the ban on jeans at the club.

defines.trans_en: to steal something
to use someone else's writing, music, or idea, pretending that it is your own

examples.ch: 他从网站上整段整段地剽窃文章。
examples.en: He'd lifted whole passages from a website.

phrases.trans_en: to win a race or competition in which the prize is a metal cup

examples.ch: 他是下个月赢得奖杯的大热门。
examples.en: He is the hot favourite to lift the cup again next month.

phrases.trans_en: to make someone happier

examples.ch: 什么都提不起他的兴致，甚至连吃饭也不例外。
examples.en: Nothing - not even the prospect of dinner - could lift his spirits.

defines.trans_en: a device like a box that moves up and down, carrying people or goods from one floor of a building to another or taking people up and down underground in a mine

examples.ch: 乘电梯到7楼。
examples.en: Take the lift to the sixth floor.

defines.trans_en: an act of lifting or raising something

examples.ch: 再抬一下我们就能把它抬到楼梯顶端了。
examples.en: Give it one more lift and we'll have it at the top of the stairs.

defines.trans_en: the force on the wing of a bird or aircraft that keeps it in the air as it moves forward
a free journey in another person's vehicle, especially a car

examples.ch: 如果你愿意，我可以把你捎到车站。
examples.en: I'll give you a lift to the train station if you like.

examples.ch: 他搭便车去了伯明翰。
examples.en: He hitched a lift (= stood by the road and made a signal asking a car to stop and take him) to Birmingham.

phrases.trans_en: to make someone happier

examples.ch: 她一直有些情绪低落，但一听说她得到了那份工作心情便好了起来。
examples.en: She'd been feeling low but hearing that she'd got the job gave her a lift.

defines.trans_en: the brightness that comes from the sun, fire, etc. and from electrical devices, and that allows things to be seen

examples.ch: 明亮的光线
examples.en: a bright light

examples.ch: 荧光／紫外光
examples.en: fluorescent/ultraviolet light

examples.ch: 一道／束光线
examples.en: a beam/ray of light

examples.ch: 光线从敞开的门口倾泻进来。
examples.en: Light was streaming in through the open door.

examples.ch: 房间朝北，所以光线有些不足。
examples.en: It's a north-facing room so it doesn't get much light (= brightness from the sun).

defines.trans_en: a piece of equipment that produces light, such as a lamp or a bulb

examples.ch: 请把灯打开／关上好吗？
examples.en: Could you switch/turn the light on/off, please?

examples.ch: 她能够看到远处城市的灯光。
examples.en: She could see the city lights in the distance.

examples.ch: 灯熄灭后，观众们开始安静下来。
examples.en: As the lights went down, the audience grew quiet.

examples.ch: 我的自行车前灯不亮了。
examples.en: My front bike light isn't working.

phrases.trans_en: something that will produce a flame and cause burning, such as a match or a cigarette lighter

examples.ch: 请问你有打火机吗？
examples.en: Have you got a light, please?

phrases.trans_en: to cause something to start burning

examples.ch: 灯起火了，烧着了窗帘。
examples.en: The lamp caught fire and set light to the curtains.

defines.trans_en: not weighing a lot

examples.ch: 给你，拿着这个袋子——很轻的。
examples.en: Here, take this bag - it's quite light.

examples.ch: 他的体重比以前轻了几磅。
examples.en: He's a few pounds lighter than he used to be.

examples.ch: 艾米，你是怎样把蛋糕做得这么松软的？
examples.en: How do you get your cakes so wonderfully light, Amy?

examples.ch: 正如按摩所要求的那样，他的手法很轻。
examples.en: He has a very light (= gentle) touch, which is what is required in massage.

examples.ch: 她走起路来步态轻盈。
examples.en: She's very light on her feet (= she moves gracefully).

defines.trans_en: Light clothes are made of thin material that allows you to be cool.

examples.ch: 凉爽的夏季长裙
examples.en: a light summer dress

defines.trans_en: lit by the natural light of the day

examples.ch: 大窗户使房间显得特别明亮、通透。
examples.en: The big windows make the room feel wonderfully light and airy.

examples.ch: 在这样的夏日里天亮得很早。
examples.en: It gets light very early these summer mornings.

examples.ch: 夏天快到了，天黑得越来越晚了。
examples.en: Summer is coming and the evenings are getting lighter (= getting dark later).

defines.trans_en: (of colours) pale

examples.ch: 浅蓝色／绿色
examples.en: light blue/green

defines.trans_en: entertaining and easily understood, but not serious and not intended to make you think

examples.ch: 暑假里我想读点轻松的东西——比如言情小说之类的。
examples.en: I want some light reading for the summer holidays - a romance or something.

examples.ch: 两位主要发言者间活跃的争论是一种愉悦轻松的调剂。否则， 会议实在枯燥乏味。
examples.en: A lively argument between the two main speakers provided some light relief (= something enjoyable or amusing) in an otherwise dull conference.

defines.trans_en: not great in strength or amount

examples.ch: 外面有微风。
examples.en: A light wind was blowing.

examples.ch: 路上车不多，所以我们很快就穿过了伦敦。
examples.en: The traffic was quite light so we got through London quickly.

examples.ch: 只是下了点儿小雨——你不必拿雨伞。
examples.en: It's only light rain - you don't need an umbrella.

defines.trans_en: A light meal is small and easy to digest.

examples.ch: 我午饭吃得不多——只吃一点儿小吃。
examples.en: I don't eat much for lunch - just a light snack.

defines.trans_ch: 酒精饮料度数低的，低度的
defines.trans_en: used to describe alcoholic drinks that are not strong in flavour

examples.ch: 标签上写着“浓郁醇香的低度葡萄酒”。
examples.en: It's described on the label as "light, fruity wine".

defines.trans_en: needing only a very small amount of effort

examples.ch: 散步之类轻微的运动
examples.en: light exercise, such as walking

examples.ch: 一点儿家务活儿
examples.en: a little light housework

defines.trans_en: A light sentence in prison is a short one.

examples.ch: 因为是初犯，他得以轻判。
examples.en: He got off with a fairly light sentence because it was his first conviction.

phrases.trans_en: to behave as if a situation, especially a problem, is not serious or important

examples.ch: 忽视他人的问题很容易。
examples.en: It is easy to make light of other people's problems.

phrases.trans_en: someone who eats/drinks/smokes only a little
someone who is easily woken up by noise, etc.

phrases.text: make light work of sth/doing sth
phrases.trans_en: to do something quickly and easily

examples.ch: 希瑟轻而易举地刷完了墙。
examples.en: Heather made light work of painting the walls.

examples.ch: 你三两下就把巧克力蛋糕吃光了！
examples.en: You made light work of that chocolate cake (= you ate it quickly)!

defines.trans_en: to start to burn or to make something start to burn

examples.ch: 点火
examples.en: to light a fire

examples.ch: 我无法点燃煤气灶。
examples.en: I can't get the cooker to light.

examples.ch: 不到半个小时，他已经开始点第5支烟了。
examples.en: He lit his fifth cigarette in half an hour.

defines.trans_en: to produce light that makes an object or area bright or easy to see

examples.ch: 蜡烛照亮了舞台。
examples.en: The stage had been lit with candles.

examples.ch: 焰火点亮了天空。
examples.en: Fireworks lit up the sky (= made the sky bright).

defines.trans_en: to enjoy or approve of something or someone

examples.ch: 我喜欢你的新发型。
examples.en: I like your new haircut.

examples.ch: 你爱吃鱼吗？
examples.en: Do you like fish?

examples.ch: 我喜欢那种碰上好书时手不释卷的感觉。
examples.en: I like it when a book is so good that you can't put it down.

examples.ch: 我很喜欢喝酒，但没有酒我还是可以忍受的。
examples.en: I quite like wine but I could live without it.

examples.ch: 他在单位里人缘相当好。
examples.en: He's very well-liked (= popular) at work.

examples.ch: 他谁的话都听不进去，却以为我们大家都会听他的，对此我非常反感。
examples.en: I like the way he just assumes we'll listen to him when he doesn't take in a word anyone else says! (= I don't like it and it annoys me.)

examples.ch: 我不喜欢搞得别人心烦意乱。
examples.en: I don't like upsetting people.

examples.ch: 他喜欢晚上看电视消磨时间。
examples.en: He likes to spend his evenings in front of the television.

examples.ch: 他喜欢吃熟透的牛排。
examples.en: He likes his steak well-done.

defines.trans_en: to show that you think something is good on a social networking website by clicking on a symbol or the word 'like'

examples.ch: 到脸书上为我们点赞吧！
examples.en: Like us on Facebook!

examples.ch: 超过200人为我的文章点赞了。
examples.en: More than 200 people liked my post.

defines.trans_en: used in requests

examples.ch: 请给我拿一块圆面包。
examples.en: I'd like one of the round loaves, please.

examples.ch: 我想预订一个今晚演出的座位。
examples.en: I'd like to book a seat for tonight's performance.

examples.ch: 请你帮我把这个寄出。
examples.en: I'd like you to send this for me, please.

examples.ch: 我希望这批活儿能在周末前做完。
examples.en: I would like the whole lot finished by the weekend.

phrases.trans_en: used to say politely that you want something

examples.ch: 我想要一份汤做头盘。
examples.en: I think I'd like the soup for my starter.

examples.ch: 我想去莫斯科。
examples.en: I'd like to go to Moscow.

examples.ch: 我想对参与筹备我们婚礼的每一个人表示由衷的感谢，正是你们让这个婚礼如此与众不同！
examples.en: I would like to say a big thank you to everyone who's helped to make our wedding such a special occasion!

defines.trans_en: similar to; in the same way or manner as

examples.ch: 他长得像他哥哥。
examples.en: He looks like his brother.

examples.ch: 她和她母亲非常像。
examples.en: She's very much like her mother (= she is similar in appearance or character).

examples.ch: 日本料理和中餐相似吗？
examples.en: Is Japanese food like Chinese?

examples.ch: 我有一件和那件一模一样的毛衣。
examples.en: I've got a sweater just like that.

examples.ch: 她的头发如丝绸般柔顺。
examples.en: Her hair was so soft it was like silk.

examples.ch: 你的举动像个十足的白痴！
examples.en: You're acting like a complete idiot!

examples.ch: 她的歌声如天使一般！
examples.en: She sings like an angel!

examples.ch: 我说过了，我不用香水。
examples.en: Like I said (= as I have already said), I don't wear perfume.

examples.ch: 和大多数人一样，我喜欢能有足够的钱而不必去工作。
examples.en: Like most people (= as most people would), I'd prefer to have enough money not to work.

examples.ch: 我们好像很久没有说过话了。
examples.en: It feels/seems like (= it seems to me) ages since we last spoke.

examples.ch: 任何东西都比不了一杯好咖啡！
examples.en: There's nothing like a good cup of coffee (= it's better than anything)!

defines.trans_en: in a way that suggests

examples.ch: 看起来我得到深夜才能离开办公室了。
examples.en: It looks like I'm going to be in the office until late tonight.

examples.ch: 我看天要下雨了。
examples.en: It looks like rain (= I think it is going to rain).

examples.ch: 听起来你似乎应该换个工作。
examples.en: It sounds to me like you ought to change jobs.

examples.ch: 你看起来好像刚刚起床！
examples.en: You look like you've just got out of bed!

examples.ch: 她似乎总干傻事！
examples.en: She acts like she's stupid!

defines.trans_ch: 为…所特有的，符合…特点的
defines.trans_en: typical or characteristic of

examples.ch: 梅茜就是这样的人，为她办聚会时她都要拖后半小时才露面！
examples.en: That's just like Maisie to turn up half an hour late to her own party!

examples.ch: 你平时没这么安静呀——亲爱的，你没事吧？
examples.en: It's not like you to be so quiet - are you all right, my love?

defines.trans_en: such as

examples.ch: 她穿鲜亮颜色的衣服最漂亮，如红色和粉色。
examples.en: She looks best in bright, vibrant colours, like red and pink.

defines.trans_ch: （用于引出自己对已发生事件的感觉或想法）
defines.trans_en: used before you describe how you were feeling or what you said when something happened to you

examples.ch: 然后我才明白已经很晚了，因此感觉特别沮丧。
examples.en: Then I saw how late it was and I'm like, so upset.

examples.ch: 他开始朝我大喊大叫起来，于是我就问他：“你怎么回事？我是站在你这边的！”
examples.en: He started shouting at me and I'm like, "What's your problem? I'm on your side!"

defines.trans_ch: （用于对话中表示停顿或强调形容词）
defines.trans_en: used in conversation as a pause or to emphasize an adjective

examples.ch: 他呀，真的非常友善——就是那种可以倾心交谈的人。
examples.en: He's, like, really friendly - someone you can talk to.

examples.ch: 如果你无法改变这种局面，那么干吗去劳这个神呢？
examples.en: If there's nothing you can do to change the situation, it's like - why bother?

defines.trans_en: (on a page on a social networking website) an act of showing that you think something is good by clicking a button

examples.ch: 我的新头像图片得到了100个赞。
examples.en: My new profile picture got 100 likes.

phrases.text: the like of sb/sth; sb's/sth's like
phrases.trans_en: a person, thing, or group similar in character or quality to the one mentioned

examples.ch: 穆罕默德·阿里退役后，拳击运动就再也没有他那样的选手了。
examples.en: Boxing hasn't seen the likes of Muhammad Ali since he retired.

examples.ch: 他是个非常了不起的演员——没有人能达到他那样的水平。
examples.en: He was a very great actor - we won't see his like again.

examples.ch: 他说那顿饭特别美味，他从未吃过如此好吃的饭。
examples.en: He described a superlative meal, the like of which he'd never eaten before.

examples.ch: 他们在跟微软这样的公司竞争。
examples.en: They're competing with the likes of Microsoft.

phrases.trans_en: and similar things

examples.ch: 那里有一个可供网球、羽毛球等比赛用的大型体育馆。
examples.en: There's a big sports hall for tennis and badminton and such like.

phrases.trans_en: the things that someone enjoys

examples.ch: 这个流行歌星说他的最爱是“我的保时捷新车、女友和彻夜狂欢”。
examples.en: The star lists his likes as "my new Porsche, my girlfriend, and staying up all night."

examples.ch: 他们别指望我能容忍他们所有那些愚蠢可笑、无足轻重的个人好恶。
examples.en: They can't expect me to accommodate all their silly little likes and dislikes.

phrases.text: not for the likes of sb
phrases.trans_ch: 不是为…之类的人准备的
phrases.trans_en: not for the type of people mentioned

examples.ch: 头等舱是供上层人士使用的——不是给我们这样的人准备的。
examples.en: First-class travel is for rich people - it's not for the likes of us.

phrases.trans_en: to be likely to do something

defines.trans_en: like the thing mentioned

examples.ch: 该报批评了球迷们的表现，称之为野蛮行径。
examples.en: The paper criticized what it described as the animal-like behaviour of the fans.

examples.ch: 大楼的顶部有一个球型构造物。
examples.en: There was a large, ball-like structure on top of the building.

examples.ch: 像孩子一样天真地信赖某人
examples.en: childlike trust

examples.ch: 一种像卷心菜一样的蔬菜
examples.en: a cabbage-like vegetable

defines.trans_en: a long, thin mark on the surface of something

examples.ch: 直线
examples.en: a straight line

examples.ch: 请在虚线处签名。
examples.en: Sign your name on the dotted line.

examples.ch: 她已非常年迈，脸上布满了皱纹。
examples.en: She was very old and her face was covered with lines.

examples.ch: 我站起来时觉得腿直打颤，走起路来左右摇晃。
examples.en: My legs felt all wobbly when I stood up and I couldn't walk in a straight line (= walk without moving to the side while moving forward).

defines.trans_en: a group of people or things arranged in a row

examples.ch: 一行树
examples.en: a line of trees

examples.ch: 犯人靠墙站成了一排。
examples.en: The prisoners formed a line against the wall.

defines.trans_ch: （一群人排列等候所形成的）队，排
defines.trans_en: a group of people standing one behind the other who are waiting for something

examples.ch: 和别人一样排队等着去。
examples.en: Just get in line and wait your turn like everyone else.

examples.ch: 我排了3个小时的队才买到票。
examples.en: I had to wait/stand in line for three hours to get tickets.

defines.trans_en: a long, thin and sometimes imaginary mark that forms the edge, border, or limit of something

examples.ch: 那个球绝对是界内！离边线还远着呢！
examples.en: That ball was definitely in! It was nowhere near the line!

examples.ch: 警方无法逮捕他，因为他已经逃过了国界。
examples.en: The police couldn't arrest him because he'd fled across the state line.

examples.ch: 在许多电视观众看来，事实与虚构之间的界限已经越来越模糊了。
examples.en: For many television viewers the dividing line between fact and fiction is becoming increasingly blurred.

defines.trans_en: a connection to a phone system

examples.ch: 恐怕你的电话线已经被切断了，因为上次的账单你还没付呢。
examples.en: I'm afraid your line's been disconnected because your last bill hasn't been paid.

examples.ch: 如果你想通过电台广播发表自己的看法，可从8点起拨打电话。
examples.en: If you want to air your opinions live on the radio, the lines will be open (= you can phone) from eight o'clock.

examples.ch: 克丽丝‧福斯特打电话找你。你想现在接电话还是过一会儿给她打回去？
examples.en: I've got Chris Foster on the line for you. Do you want to take it now or call her back later?

examples.ch: 请等一下。我看她在不在。
examples.en: Please hold the line (= wait). I'll see if she's available.

defines.trans_en: (the route followed by) a railway track

examples.ch: 火车晚点了，听说是由于铁路线上的落叶所致。
examples.en: The train was delayed, apparently due to leaves on the line.

examples.ch: 北线是伦敦地铁最糟糕的线路。
examples.en: The Northern Line is the worst on the London Underground.

examples.ch: 乘坐干线火车速度很快，但支线就慢得多了。
examples.en: Mainline services can be very quick, but travelling on the branch lines is much slower.

defines.trans_en: a way of dealing with or thinking about something or someone

examples.ch: 政府的官方立场一贯是拒绝与恐怖分子谈判。
examples.en: The government's official line has always been to refuse to negotiate with terrorists.

examples.ch: 法庭应对性犯罪者实施更加严厉的惩罚。
examples.en: The courts should take a tougher line with (= punish more severely) sex offenders.

examples.ch: 几名工党议员对该党的税收政策持不同意见。
examples.en: Several Labour MPs disagree with their party's line on taxation.

examples.ch: 你认为我们在工资谈判中应采取哪种策略？
examples.en: What sort of line (= method of arguing) do you think we should take in the pay negotiations?

examples.ch: 警方相信采用这种新的调查方法一定会找出凶手。
examples.en: The police are confident that this new line of inquiry will lead them to the murderer.

examples.ch: 那个国家似乎无法避免民族分裂的命运。
examples.en: It seems inevitable that the country will be divided along ethnic lines.

defines.trans_en: a row of positions used to defend against enemy attack, especially the ones closest to enemy positions

examples.ch: 他们是在敌后执行侦察任务时被俘的。
examples.en: They were taken prisoner while on a reconnaissance mission behind enemy lines.

examples.ch: 在足球比赛中，守门员是最后一道防线。
examples.en: In a game of football, the goalkeeper is the last line of defence.

defines.trans_ch: （设计或创造出的）轮廓，外形线条
defines.trans_en: the shape of something that has been designed or created

examples.ch: 他们以设计优雅的流线型汽车而享有盛誉。
examples.en: They have a reputation for designing cars with elegant aerodynamic lines.

defines.trans_en: a long, strong, thin piece of material, such as string, rope, or wire, used to support something

examples.ch: 我会把洗好的衣物晾在晾衣绳上。
examples.en: I'd hung the washing out on the clothes line.

examples.ch: 你能感觉到鱼在钓线上挣扎吗？
examples.en: Can you feel the fish tugging on the line?

defines.trans_en: a company that transports people or goods

examples.ch: 海运公司
examples.en: a shipping line

defines.trans_ch: （为达到逗乐、劝说或欺骗目的而说的）话语，词句，言语
defines.trans_en: a remark that is intended to entertain, persuade, or deceive

examples.ch: 令人难忘的讲话
examples.en: a speech full of memorable lines

examples.ch: 他不停地跟我说因为电脑有问题他没法干活了。
examples.en: He keeps giving me that line about not being able to do any work because his computer is down.

examples.ch: “谎言，可恶的谎言和数据”这句名言是谁说的？
examples.en: Who was it who came up with that famous line about "lies, damned lies and statistics?"

defines.trans_en: a row of words that form part of a text

examples.ch: 如果把字号调小一点，我们就可以在这一页上多加几行字。
examples.en: We could get more lines on the page if we reduced the type size.

examples.ch: 计算机屏幕每行可显示80个字符。
examples.en: The computer screen displays 80 characters per line.

defines.trans_en: the words that an actor speaks when performing in a film, play, etc.

examples.ch: 在整出戏中我只有两句台词。
examples.en: I only had two lines in the whole play.

examples.ch: 我们明天就要进行首次排练了，可她连台词还没记熟呢。
examples.en: She hasn't learned her lines yet, and we've got our first rehearsal tomorrow.

examples.ch: 我特别害怕忘词。
examples.en: I'm terrified of forgetting my lines.

defines.trans_en: a short series of musical notes
the type of job someone does

examples.ch: “你是干哪一行的？”“我是老师。”
examples.en: "What line of work are you in?" "I'm a teacher."

examples.ch: 干我这行可以遇到一些非常有趣的人。
examples.en: You meet some very interesting people in my line of business.

defines.trans_en: a range of similar things that are for sale

examples.ch: 我们这里的很多旧货都打折。
examples.en: There are discounts on many items from our older lines.

examples.ch: 他们给我看了他们所有的新货。
examples.en: I was shown all their new lines.

phrases.trans_en: a series of people or things that follow each other in time

examples.ch: 在一系列颇具争议的领导者中，她是最新的一位。
examples.en: She is the latest in a long line of controversial leaders.

examples.ch: 他出身医生世家。
examples.en: He comes from a long line of doctors (= a lot of his relatives were doctors before him).

phrases.trans_en: a way of thinking about a particular subject

examples.ch: 他们不能同意他们考虑问题的方法。
examples.en: We cannot agree with their line of reasoning.

phrases.trans_ch: （学校里对学生作出的）罚抄写
phrases.trans_en: a punishment for school students in which a sentence has to be written repeatedly

examples.ch: 她因辱骂老师被罚抄写200遍。
examples.en: She got 200 lines for swearing at her teacher.

defines.trans_en: to form a row along the side of something

examples.ch: 数千人站在街道两旁观看总统车队通过。
examples.en: Thousands of people lined the streets to watch the presidential procession pass by.

examples.ch: 警察站在游行路线的两侧。
examples.en: Police lined the route of the demonstration.

examples.ch: 乡村林荫路
examples.en: country lanes lined with trees

defines.trans_en: to cover the inside surface of something

examples.ch: 我用旧墙纸垫抽屉。
examples.en: I lined the drawers with old wallpaper.

examples.ch: 给这件夹克衫做个内衬需要多少钱？
examples.en: How much would it cost to have this jacket lined?

examples.ch: 洗手间的每一面墙上都挂着全身镜。
examples.en: Full-length mirrors lined each wall of the bathroom.

defines.trans_en: a large wild animal of the cat family with yellowish-brown fur that lives in Africa and southern Asia

examples.ch: 狮群
examples.en: a pride (= group) of lions

defines.trans_en: someone who is important, successful, or powerful

examples.ch: 文学大师
examples.en: a literary lion

defines.trans_en: to give attention to someone or something in order to hear him, her, or it

examples.ch: 你听哪一类的音乐？
examples.en: What kind of music do you listen to?

examples.ch: 她一直在说——我只是坐在那里听。
examples.en: She does all the talking - I just sit and listen.

examples.ch: 我说的话你一个字都没听！
examples.en: You haven't listened to a word I've said!

examples.ch: 宣读死者的名字时我们都默默地听着。
examples.en: We listened in silence as the names of the dead were read out.

examples.ch: 听着，我们确实需要在本周末解决我们的保险索赔问题。
examples.en: Listen, we really need to submit our insurance claim this weekend.

examples.ch: 听听这个！只要回答出3个简单的问题你就有可能赢得法国南部双人度假游。
examples.en: Listen to this! You can win a car just by answering three simple questions.

defines.trans_en: a unit for measuring the volume of a liquid or a gas, equal to 1,000 cubic centimetres

examples.ch: 税率上调后每升汽油要涨4个便士。
examples.en: The tax increase will add 4p to a litre of petrol.

defines.trans_en: small in size or amount

examples.ch: 它是装在一个小盒子里送来的。
examples.en: It came in a little box.

examples.ch: 小狗／鼻子／房间
examples.en: a little dog/nose/room

examples.ch: 一个小老头走进了房间。
examples.en: A little old man came into the room.

examples.ch: 他微微笑了笑。
examples.en: He gave a little smile.

examples.ch: 用不了多少时间就能把厨房收拾好。
examples.en: It'll only take a little while to clear up the kitchen.

defines.trans_en: young

examples.ch: 你小的时候头发卷得很厉害。
examples.en: When you were little your hair was really curly.

examples.ch: 她是我妹妹，我负责照顾她。
examples.en: She was my little (= younger) sister and I took care of her.

examples.ch: 她的小儿子身体有些不适。
examples.en: Her little boy (= her young son) isn't well.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调对某人或某物的意见）真，确实
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize an opinion that is being given about something or someone

examples.ch: 她穿的那身套装真的很漂亮。
examples.en: That was a nice little suit she was wearing.

examples.ch: 这家饭馆确实不错，是不是？
examples.en: It's not a bad little restaurant, is it?

examples.ch: 他可真是个讨厌的家伙。
examples.en: He's a nasty little man.

defines.trans_ch: 不太重要的，不很严重的；微小的，轻微的
defines.trans_en: not very important or serious

examples.ch: 我的车有点小毛病，不过现在已经修好了。
examples.en: I had a little problem with my car, but it's been fixed now.

examples.ch: 常常是一些微不足道的东西发挥的作用最大。
examples.en: It's often the little things that count the most.

examples.ch: 我能和你聊几句吗？
examples.en: Can I have a little word (= a short discussion about something not very important) with you?

phrases.trans_en: a small amount of food or drink

examples.ch: 我总喜欢在上午11点左右吃点东西。
examples.en: I always like to have a little something around eleven o'clock in the morning.

phrases.trans_en: a present that is not of great value

examples.ch: 我去医院看瓦尔的时候想给她买个小礼物。
examples.en: I want to buy a little something to give to Val when I visit her in hospital.

defines.trans_en: not much or enough

examples.ch: 看来停火的希望很渺茫了。
examples.en: There seems little hope of a ceasefire.

examples.ch: 他们手头钱很少。
examples.en: They have very little money.

examples.ch: 可选择的余地太小了。
examples.en: There's so little choice.

phrases.trans_en: a small amount of something

examples.ch: 这种酱汁需要加点盐。
examples.en: This sauce needs a little salt.

examples.ch: 只要稍加培训她就能做得很好。
examples.en: With a little training she could do very well.

examples.ch: 我可以给你提一点建议吗？
examples.en: Can I give you a little advice?

defines.trans_en: a small amount

examples.ch: 他们说的话我只能听到一点。
examples.en: I could only hear a little of what they were saying.

examples.ch: 他上班时能偷懒就偷懒。
examples.en: He does as little as possible at work.

examples.ch: 虽然面粉剩得不多了，但你可以随便拿。
examples.en: There's not much flour left but you're welcome to the/what little there is.

defines.trans_en: an amount that is not much or not enough

examples.ch: 星期天我们没有做太多事情。
examples.en: We did very little on Sunday.

examples.ch: 他说的话我几乎一点儿都不明白。
examples.en: Very little of what he said made any sense to me.

examples.ch: 不幸的是，这位画家的作品几乎无一幸存。
examples.en: Unfortunately, little of the artist's work has survived.

examples.ch: 政府几乎没有采取任何举措来帮助国内最贫穷的人们。
examples.en: The government has done little or nothing to help the poorest people in this country.

examples.ch: 我们对那些曾经在这里生活过的人们知之甚少，但可以确定的是他们当时的社会已经相当成熟。
examples.en: The little we do know about the people who lived here suggests they had a very sophisticated society.

defines.trans_en: not much

examples.ch: 她那天晚上睡得很少。
examples.en: She slept very little that night.

examples.ch: 鲜为人知的事实
examples.en: a little-known fact

examples.ch: 他几乎一点儿也不知道等待他的将会是什么。
examples.en: Little did he know what lay in store for him.

phrases.trans_en: slightly

examples.ch: 她的话让我有点担心。
examples.en: I was a little bit worried by what she said.

examples.ch: 我们再稍微等一等，还不来的话我会给他们打电话的。
examples.en: We'll wait a little longer and then I'll phone them.

examples.ch: 再走一会就到了。
examples.en: There's only a little further to go.

phrases.trans_ch: 一点一点地，逐渐地，渐渐地
phrases.trans_en: slowly or gradually

examples.ch: 渐渐地她明白了他为什么会那么做。
examples.en: Little by little she came to understand why he had behaved the way he did.

phrases.trans_en: not much more or better

examples.ch: 他们给我们的葡萄酒比醋好不了多少。
examples.en: The wine they gave us was little better than vinegar.

defines.trans_en: (to continue) to be alive or have life

examples.ch: 出事后他只活了几天就死了。
examples.en: He only lived a few days after the accident.

examples.ch: 我希望我能活到看见我孙辈的那一天。
examples.en: I hope I live to see my grandchildren.

examples.ch: 她奶奶活到了94岁高龄。
examples.en: Her granny lived to the ripe old age of 94.

examples.ch: 人的生存权可以剥夺吗？
examples.en: Can the right to live ever be denied to any human?

examples.ch: 她一直活到了90多岁。
examples.en: She lived on well into her 90s.

defines.trans_en: to be kept usually in a particular place

examples.ch: 刀具放在你厨房的什么地方？
examples.en: Where do the knives live in your kitchen?

examples.ch: 我不知道这只碗该放在哪里。
examples.en: I'm not sure where this bowl lives.

defines.trans_en: to spend your life in a particular way

examples.ch: 过一段时间你会适应一个人生活的。
examples.en: After a while you get used to living alone.

examples.ch: 退休的时候，大家都希望能过上舒适的生活。
examples.en: When you retire, you want to live a comfortable life.

examples.ch: 于是这对情侣结了婚，从此过上了幸福的生活。
examples.en: So the couple got married and lived happily ever after.

examples.ch: 他只想能安度余生。
examples.en: He simply wants to live (out) (= experience) the rest of his days in peace.

examples.ch: 电视机坏了 ——这段时间我们只好不看电视了。
examples.en: The TV's broken - we'll just have to live without (= not have) it for a while.

examples.ch: 她当然活得非常充实。
examples.en: She certainly lived her life to the full (= was always doing something interesting).

examples.ch: 美国人过的是借钱享乐的日子。
examples.en: The US is living beyond its means (= spending more than it earns).

defines.trans_en: to stay alive, especially by getting enough money to pay for food, a place to stay, clothing, etc.

examples.ch: 她以乞讨为生过了好几年。
examples.en: For several years she lived by begging.

examples.ch: 她可以靠遗产生活，不必工作。
examples.en: She has an inheritance to live off (US also live off of) so she doesn't need to work.

examples.ch: 他同意和她结婚只是为了她的钱。
examples.en: He only agreed to marry her so he could live off her (money).

defines.trans_ch: （指逝去的事物）继续存在，留存
defines.trans_en: (of things that are not alive) to exist or continue to exist

examples.ch: 对那些恐怖的日子的记忆挥之不去。
examples.en: The memory of those terrible days lives on.

defines.trans_ch: 享受生活的乐趣，尽情地享受生活
defines.trans_en: to have an interesting life

examples.ch: 在安定下来之前我要好好享受一下生活。
examples.en: I want to live a little before I settle down.

examples.ch: 如果你没到过威尼斯，就等于白活了一场。
examples.en: If you haven't seen Venice, you haven't lived.

phrases.trans_en: to have your home somewhere

examples.ch: 你住在哪里？
examples.en: Where do you live?

examples.ch: 我们住在京士顿。
examples.en: We live in Kingston.

examples.ch: 有些学生住在大学校园里。
examples.en: Some students live on the University campus.

examples.ch: 他和另外4个人同住在一所房子里。
examples.en: He lives with four other people in a shared house.

defines.trans_en: having life

examples.ch: 每年有数百万只动物被运到世界各地。
examples.en: Millions of live animals are shipped around the world each year.

examples.ch: 饭馆里有一箱活龙虾。
examples.en: There was a tank of live lobsters in the restaurant.

defines.trans_ch: 现场直播的，实况转播的
defines.trans_en: (of a performance) broadcast, recorded, or seen while it is happening

examples.ch: 今晚将现场直播这场辩论。
examples.en: This evening there will be a live broadcast of the debate.

examples.ch: 现场录音
examples.en: a live recording

defines.trans_en: (of a wire) carrying or charged with electricity

examples.ch: 火线
examples.en: a live wire

defines.trans_en: able to explode

examples.ch: 数发实弹
examples.en: live rounds of ammunition

examples.ch: 实弹
examples.en: live shells

defines.trans_ch: （火、煤炭或火柴）燃烧的，可燃的
defines.trans_en: (of a fire, coals, or a match) still burning or able to burn

examples.ch: 壁炉里的煤还在燃烧。
examples.en: There are live coals in the fireplace.

defines.trans_en: broadcast as it happens; performing or being performed in front of an audience

examples.ch: 我有两张看他们现场演出的门票。
examples.en: I've got two tickets to see them (perform) live.

phrases.trans_ch: （新系统，尤指电脑系统）开始运行;开始工作
phrases.trans_en: If a new system, especially a computer system, goes live, it starts to operate.

examples.ch: 下个月初我们新的支付系统将开始运行。
examples.en: Our new payments system will go live at the beginning of next month.

defines.trans_en: continuing for a large amount of time

examples.ch: 很长的电影／会议
examples.en: a long film/meeting

examples.ch: 我已经等了很久了。
examples.en: I've been waiting a long time.

examples.ch: 我不在那里工作已经很久了。
examples.en: It's a long time since I worked there.

examples.ch: 显然这些会议都长达1个小时。
examples.en: Apparently the sessions are an hour long.

defines.trans_en: being a distance between two points that is more than average or usual

examples.ch: 长发
examples.en: long hair

examples.ch: 长腿
examples.en: long legs

examples.ch: 长裙
examples.en: a long dress

examples.ch: 邮局里排起了长队。
examples.en: There was a long queue at the post office.

examples.ch: 我们离车站还很远。
examples.en: We're still a long way from the station.

defines.trans_en: used to describe a piece of writing that has a lot of pages or words

examples.ch: 长信／大部头的书／长篇报告
examples.en: a long letter/book/report

defines.trans_ch: （尤用在疑问句和否定句中）长久地，长时间地
defines.trans_en: used to mean "(for) a long time", especially in questions and negative sentences

examples.ch: 你等了很久吗？
examples.en: Have you been waiting (for) long?

examples.ch: 我在写信，很快就写完了。
examples.en: I'm just writing a letter but it won't take long.

examples.ch: 你在英格兰呆多久了？
examples.en: How long have you been in England?

examples.ch: 别着急——慢慢来。
examples.en: Don't rush - take as long as you like.

examples.ch: 我们走了整整一天。
examples.en: We've been walking all day long.

examples.ch: 我认识她的时间比你长。
examples.en: I've known her longer than you have.

examples.ch: 我不会呆很久。
examples.en: I won't be staying much longer.

defines.trans_ch: 在…之前（或之后）的很长一段时间
defines.trans_en: a long period of time before or after something

examples.ch: 在我到达前很久，她就离开这座屋子了。
examples.en: She left the house long before I arrived.

examples.ch: 不久之后他和全家就回来了。
examples.en: It wasn't long before he was back with his family.

examples.ch: 当他们早就吃完时他才加入他们。
examples.en: He did not join them until long after they had eaten.

defines.trans_ch: （与过去分词或动词的 ing 形式连用表示持续了很久的状态或活动）
defines.trans_en: used with the past participle or the -ing form of the verb to mean that a state or activity has continued for a long time

examples.ch: 期盼已久的来信
examples.en: a long-awaited letter

examples.ch: 老雇员
examples.en: long-serving employees

phrases.trans_en: used to say that something must happen before something else can happen

examples.ch: 只要我能在4点钟之前出发，我就能来。
examples.en: I can come as long as I can leave by 4.00.

examples.ch: 一定要把你的朋友们带来——只要让我知道来多少人就行。
examples.en: Bring your friends by all means - just so long as I know how many are coming.

phrases.text: long for sth; long to do sth
phrases.trans_en: to want something very much

examples.ch: 她很想再见到他。
examples.en: She longed to see him again.

examples.ch: 我正在盼望着得到他的消息。
examples.en: I'm longing for news of him.

defines.trans_en:
written abbreviation for
longitude

written abbreviation for 
longitude
to direct your eyes in order to see

examples.ch: 瞧！奶奶在那里。
examples.en: Look! There's grandma.

examples.ch: 他们看了看那幅画，笑了起来。
examples.en: They looked at the picture and laughed.

examples.ch: 瞧瞧地上这些玩具。
examples.en: Look at all these toys on the floor.

examples.ch: 她的视线从书本上移开，抬起头朝我笑了笑。
examples.en: She looked up from her book and smiled at me.

examples.ch: 我朝窗外望去。
examples.en: I looked out (of) the window.

examples.ch: 看那里——有一道彩虹！
examples.en: Look over there - there's a rainbow!

defines.trans_en: to try to find something or someone

examples.ch: 我在找钥匙。
examples.en: I'm looking for my keys.

examples.ch: 我每个地方都找遍了，可就是没找到我的眼镜。
examples.en: I looked everywhere, but I couldn't find my glasses.

examples.ch: 你查字典了吗？
examples.en: Have you looked in the dictionary?

examples.ch: 我查看了名单，但没找到他的名字。
examples.en: I looked down the list but couldn't see his name.

defines.trans_en: to appear or seem

examples.ch: 你看起来气色不错！
examples.en: You look well!

examples.ch: 这些路看起来很滑。
examples.en: The roads look very icy.

examples.ch: 你穿那条裙子很好看。
examples.en: That dress looks nice on you.

examples.ch: 他看上去开始显年纪了。
examples.en: He has started to look his age (= appear as old as he really is).

examples.ch: 事情进展顺利。
examples.en: It's looking good (= things are going well).

examples.ch: 他看起来是那种很友善的人。
examples.en: He looked (like) a friendly sort of person.

examples.ch: 那对双胞胎长得很像他们的母亲。
examples.en: The twins look just like their mother.

examples.ch: 她看起来似乎整晚都没有睡觉。
examples.en: She looked as if/though she hadn't slept all night.

examples.ch: 看起来天要下雨了。
examples.en: It looks like rain (= as if it is going to rain).

defines.trans_en: to face a particular direction

examples.ch: 那个花园朝南。
examples.en: The garden looks south.

examples.ch: 这个窗户俯瞰着湖面。
examples.en: This window looks out onto the lake.

defines.trans_en: used when you are telling someone to be careful or to pay attention

examples.ch: 小心看着点儿路！
examples.en: Look where you're going!

examples.ch: 注意时间——我们已经晚了！
examples.en: Look at the time - we're late!

phrases.trans_en: to be planning to do something

examples.ch: 我计划自己开公司。
examples.en: I'm looking to start my own business.

defines.trans_en: the act of looking at someone or something

examples.ch: 她厌恶地看了他一眼。
examples.en: She gave him a look of real dislike.

examples.ch: 好好看看这张照片，看看能不能认出上面的什么人。
examples.en: Take a (good) look at this picture and see if you recognize anyone.

examples.ch: 我能看看你的字典吗？
examples.en: Can I have a look at your dictionary?

defines.trans_en: the act of trying to find someone or something

examples.ch: 我又找了一遍手表，但没有找到。
examples.en: I had another look for the watch, but couldn't find it.

defines.trans_en: an expression on someone's face

examples.ch: 她一脸焦急的神情。
examples.en: She had a worried look about her.

examples.ch: 她疑惑地看着我。
examples.en: She gave me a questioning look.

defines.trans_en: a style or fashion

examples.ch: 今年的时尚是放松随意。
examples.en: The look this year will be relaxed and casual.

phrases.trans_en: the appearance of someone or something

examples.ch: 他们很喜欢酒店的样子，只是价格太贵了。
examples.en: They liked the look of the hotel, but it was too expensive.

examples.ch: 我不喜欢那道栅栏的样子。
examples.en: I don't like the look of that fence (= it appears to have something wrong with it).

phrases.trans_en: a person's appearance, especially how attractive they are

examples.ch: 我喜欢她的相貌。
examples.en: I like her looks.

examples.ch: 年纪稍大一些后，她变得好看多了。
examples.en: Her looks improved as she grew older.

examples.ch: 他胖了，而且开始长得越来越难看了。
examples.en: He put on weight and started to lose his looks.

defines.trans_ch: 看看吧;瞧（用于表达愤怒）
defines.trans_en: used to express anger

examples.ch: 看吧，我跟你说过这根本不可能。
examples.en: Look, I've already told you it's not possible.

examples.ch: 好了，我已经受够了。
examples.en: Look here, I've had enough of this.

defines.trans_en:
a 
truck

examples.ch: 铰链式卡车
examples.en: an articulated lorry

examples.ch: 长途货车司机
examples.en: a long-distance lorry driver

defines.trans_en: to no longer have something because you do not know where it is

examples.ch: 我丢了票。
examples.en: I've lost my ticket.

examples.ch: 他总是丢汽车钥匙。
examples.en: He's always losing his car keys.

defines.trans_en: to have something or someone taken away from you

examples.ch: 如果公司关闭，至少将有600名员工失去工作。
examples.en: At least 600 staff will lose their jobs if the factory closes.

examples.ch: 他在一场车祸中失去了一条腿。
examples.en: He lost his leg in a car accident.

examples.ch: 去年她母亲去世了。
examples.en: She lost her mother (= her mother died) last year.

defines.trans_en: to stop feeling something

examples.ch: 丧失信心／信念
examples.en: to lose confidence/faith

examples.ch: 这本书我刚读了一半就没了兴趣。
examples.en: I lost interest halfway through the book.

examples.ch: 他哭个没完，让我失去了耐心。
examples.en: He kept on crying and I lost my patience.

defines.trans_en: to have less of something than you had before

examples.ch: 我正在努力减肥。
examples.en: I'm trying to lose weight.

examples.ch: 他在掉头发。
examples.en: He's losing his hair.

examples.ch: 她在事故中流了很多血。
examples.en: She lost a lot of blood in the accident.

examples.ch: 失忆／失明
examples.en: to lose your memory/sight

defines.trans_en: If you lose time, you waste it.

examples.ch: 去年与工作压力相关的疾病导致了400万小时工作时间的损失。
examples.en: Four million hours were lost last year through stress-related illnesses.

examples.ch: 堵车浪费了我们宝贵的时间。
examples.en: We lost valuable time stuck in traffic.

defines.trans_en: If a clock loses time, it goes more slowly than it should.

examples.ch: 我的手表每天慢10分钟。
examples.en: My watch loses ten minutes every day.

defines.trans_en: to get rid of something

examples.ch: 把带子解下来，再看看裙子怎么样。
examples.en: Lose the belt and let's see how the dress looks.

defines.trans_en: to fail to succeed in a game, competition, etc.

examples.ch: 我们如果输掉这场比赛就会在锦标赛中出局。
examples.en: If we lose this game, we're out of the championship.

examples.ch: 他们目前以3-1落后于对手。
examples.en: They're losing 3–1.

examples.ch: 他们输给了辛辛那提队。
examples.en: They lost to Cincinnati.

examples.ch: 谁都不愿意在辩论中输掉。
examples.en: Everyone hates losing an argument.

examples.ch: 在15年当中他们从未在选举中失利。
examples.en: They hadn't lost an election in 15 years.

phrases.trans_en: A business that is losing money is spending more money than it is receiving.

examples.ch: 银行将因新法规的实施而亏损数百万英镑。
examples.en: Banks will lose millions of pounds because of new legislation.

defines.trans_en: an amount or set of things, especially when there are several of these amounts

examples.ch: 我已经洗完了一批衣服。
examples.en: I've already done one lot of washing.

examples.ch: 今天下午还有一批参观者要来这里。
examples.en: Another lot of visitors will be here this afternoon.

defines.trans_en: in an auction (= public sale), an object or set of objects that are being sold

examples.ch: 134号拍卖品是一个精美的老式胡桃木写字台。
examples.en: Lot number 134 is a fine old walnut bureau.

defines.trans_en: an area of land

examples.ch: 一块空地
examples.en: an empty lot

examples.ch: 停车场
examples.en: a parking lot

examples.ch: 他们正计划在35街的一块空地上建一所房子。
examples.en: They're planning to build a house on a vacant lot on 35th Street.

defines.trans_en: a film studio and the land around it

phrases.trans_en: lots (of) a large amount or number of people or things

examples.ch: 她水果吃得很多。
examples.en: She eats lots of fruit.

examples.ch: 那里有很多人。
examples.en: There were a lot of people there.

examples.ch: 他在工作中要跑很多地方。
examples.en: He does a lot of travelling in his job.

examples.ch: 今天我有很多事要做。
examples.en: I've got a lot to do today.

examples.ch: 他挣钱很多。
examples.en: He earns lots of money.

examples.ch: 食物很多。
examples.en: There's lots of food.

phrases.trans_en: very much or very often

examples.ch: 你妹妹长得非常像你。
examples.en: Your sister looks a lot like you.

examples.ch: 今天我感觉好多了。
examples.en: I'm feeling a lot better today.

examples.ch: 他看起来比妻子老很多。
examples.en: He looks a lot older than his wife.

examples.ch: 过去我们经常去那里。
examples.en: We used to go there a lot.

phrases.text: have a lot to answer for
phrases.trans_ch: 是问题的主要原因；应负最大的责任
phrases.trans_en: to be the main cause of a problem or an unpleasant situation

examples.ch: 卖毒品给儿童的人应付重大责任。
examples.en: People who sell drugs to kids have a lot to answer for.

phrases.trans_en: everything

examples.ch: 我准备了够三人吃的咖喱饭，结果都让他一个人吃光了。
examples.en: I made enough curry for three people and he ate the lot.

examples.ch: 都给我了吗？全在这里了吗？
examples.en: Have I got everything? Is that the lot?

examples.ch: 只要出50英镑我就把这些都卖给你。
examples.en: I'll sell you the whole lot for only £50.

examples.ch: 我讨厌他们所有人。
examples.en: I'm sick of the lot of them.

phrases.trans_en: the quality of someone's life and the experiences that they have

examples.ch: 他们应该采取措施改善最低收入工人的生活。
examples.en: They should do something to improve the lot of the lowest-paid workers.

examples.ch: 你认为他对自己的命运满意吗？
examples.en: Do you think he's happy with his lot?

phrases.trans_en: to make a decision by choosing from a set of objects such as pieces of paper or sticks that are all the same except for one

examples.ch: 我们抽签决定谁去。
examples.en: We drew lots to decide who would go.

defines.trans_en: a group of people

examples.ch: 你们这群无知的家伙！
examples.en: You're an ignorant lot!

examples.ch: 你们这伙人来吃午饭吗？
examples.en: Are you lot coming to lunch?

examples.ch: 我们家不吃菠菜。
examples.en: My lot (= children and family generally) won't eat spinach.

defines.trans_en: an amount or set of things, especially when there are several of these amounts

examples.ch: 我已经洗完了一批衣服。
examples.en: I've already done one lot of washing.

examples.ch: 今天下午还有一批参观者要来这里。
examples.en: Another lot of visitors will be here this afternoon.

examples.ch: 134号拍卖品是一个精美的老式胡桃木写字台。

examples.en: a parking lot

examples.ch: 食物很多。

examples.ch: 他看起来比妻子老很多。
examples.en: He looks a lot older than his wife.

examples.ch: 过去我们经常去那里。
examples.en: We used to go there a lot.

phrases.trans_ch: 是问题的主要原因；应负最大的责任
phrases.trans_en: to be the main cause of a problem or an unpleasant situation

examples.ch: 卖毒品给儿童的人应付重大责任。
examples.en: People who sell drugs to kids have a lot to answer for.

examples.ch: 我准备了够三人吃的咖喱饭，结果都让他一个人吃光了。

examples.en: Have I got everything? Is that the lot?

examples.en: I'll sell you the whole lot for only £50.

examples.ch: 我讨厌他们所有人。
examples.en: I'm sick of the lot of them.
