examples.ch: 他们应该采取措施改善最低收入工人的生活。
examples.en: They should do something to improve the lot of the lowest-paid workers.

examples.ch: 你认为他对自己的命运满意吗？
examples.en: Do you think he's happy with his lot?

phrases.trans_en: to make a decision by choosing from a set of objects such as pieces of paper or sticks that are all the same except for one

examples.ch: 我们抽签决定谁去。
examples.en: We drew lots to decide who would go.

defines.trans_en: a group of people

examples.ch: 你们这群无知的家伙！
examples.en: You're an ignorant lot!

examples.ch: 你们这伙人来吃午饭吗？
examples.en: Are you lot coming to lunch?

examples.ch: 我们家不吃菠菜。
examples.en: My lot (= children and family generally) won't eat spinach.

defines.trans_en: making a lot of noise

examples.ch: 巨大的爆炸声／巨大的吵闹声／洪亮的嗓音
examples.en: a loud explosion/noise/voice

examples.ch: 我听到砰的一声巨响，接着就看到了黑烟。
examples.en: I heard a loud bang and then saw black smoke.

examples.ch: 请你说话大声一点，好吗？
examples.en: Could you speak a little louder, please?

defines.trans_ch: （衣服）过于鲜艳的，花哨的;（人）惹人注目的，招摇的
defines.trans_en: (of clothes) having unpleasantly bright colours or too strong patterns, or (of a person) demanding attention and talking and laughing loudly

examples.ch: 你去参加求职面试时不要穿得太花哨。
examples.en: You shouldn't wear anything too loud to a job interview.

examples.ch: 酒吧里的那些男人咋咋呼呼的让人作呕。
examples.en: The men at the bar were loud and obnoxious.

defines.trans_en: to like another adult very much and be romantically and sexually attracted to them, or to have strong feelings of liking a friend or person in your family

examples.ch: 我爱你。
examples.en: I love you.

examples.ch: 昨晚他告诉我说他爱我。
examples.en: Last night he told me he loved me.

examples.ch: 我只爱过一个男人。
examples.en: I've only ever loved one man.

examples.ch: 我确信他爱他的孩子们。
examples.en: I'm sure he loves his kids.

defines.trans_en: to like something very much

examples.ch: 她喜欢动物。
examples.en: She loves animals.

examples.ch: 我特别爱吃巧克力。
examples.en: I absolutely love chocolate.

examples.ch: 他非常喜欢自己的工作。
examples.en: He really loves his job.

examples.ch: 我喜欢滑雪。
examples.en: I love skiing.

examples.ch: 你喜欢也好，讨厌也罢，真人秀电视节目已成了一种气候。
examples.en: Love it or hate it, reality TV is here to stay.

phrases.trans_en: used, often in requests, to say that you would very much like something

examples.ch: 如果你在沏咖啡，我也想要一杯。
examples.en: I'd love a cup of coffee if you're making one.

examples.ch: 她非常想开一家属于自己的公司。
examples.en: She would dearly love to start her own business.

examples.ch: 下星期我想请你来吃晚饭。
examples.en: I'd love you to come to dinner next week.

examples.ch: 下星期我想请你来吃晚饭。
examples.en: I'd love for you to come to dinner next week.

defines.trans_en: the feeling of liking another adult very much and being romantically and sexually attracted to them, or strong feelings of liking a friend or person in your family

examples.ch: “我和他交往一年多了。”“是恋爱吗？”
examples.en: "I've been seeing him over a year now." "Is it love?"

examples.ch: 孩子们需要得到极大的关爱。
examples.en: Children need to be shown lots of love.

examples.ch: “下星期我要去看劳拉。”“喔，请代我向她问好。”
examples.en: "I'm seeing Laura next week." "Oh, please give her my love" (= tell her I am thinking about her with affection).

examples.ch: 玛吉让我问你和孩子们好。
examples.en: Maggie asked me to send her love to you and the kids (= tell you that she is thinking about you with affection).

examples.ch: 最近你的感情生活怎么样？
examples.en: How's your love life (= your romantic and/or sexual relationships) these days?

defines.trans_en: a person that you love and feel attracted to

examples.ch: 他是我一生的挚爱。
examples.en: He was the love of my life.

examples.ch: 她是我的初恋情人。
examples.en: She was my first love.

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示友好的称呼）亲爱的
defines.trans_en: used as a friendly form of address

examples.ch: 你看起来很累，亲爱的。
examples.en: You look tired, love.

examples.ch: 正好4英镑，亲爱的。
examples.en: That'll be four pounds exactly, love.

defines.trans_en: used before your name at the end of letters, cards, etc. to friends or family

examples.ch: 圣诞节见，爱你的凯特。
examples.en: See you at Christmas. Love, Kate.

defines.trans_en: strong liking for

examples.ch: 我不像男友那样喜欢烹饪。
examples.en: I don't share my boyfriend's love of cooking.

defines.trans_en: something that you like very much

examples.ch: 音乐是她最大的爱好之一。
examples.en: Music is one of her greatest loves.

defines.trans_en: (in tennis) the state of having no points

examples.ch: 目前的比分为40比0。
examples.en: The score now stands at 40–love.

phrases.trans_en: to love someone in a romantic and sexual way

examples.ch: 我是第一次谈恋爱，感觉非常奇妙。
examples.en: I'm in love for the first time and it's wonderful.

examples.ch: 他们依然疯狂地爱着对方。
examples.en: They're still madly in love (with each other).

phrases.trans_en: to start to love someone romantically and sexually

examples.ch: 我20岁的时候第一次谈恋爱。
examples.en: I was 20 when I first fell in love.

defines.trans_en: pleasant or enjoyable

examples.ch: 愉快的晚餐／晚上
examples.en: a lovely meal/evening

examples.ch: 我们和他们在一起度过了一段快乐的时光。
examples.en: We had a lovely time with them.

defines.trans_en: beautiful

examples.ch: 她的眼睛很漂亮。
examples.en: She has lovely eyes.

examples.ch: 你穿那条裙子很好看。
examples.en: You look lovely in that dress.

examples.ch: 谢谢你送我这么漂亮的礼物。
examples.en: Thank you for the lovely present.

defines.trans_en: used to describe a person who is kind, friendly, and pleasant to be with

examples.ch: 他是个很友善的人。
examples.en: He's a lovely guy.

defines.trans_en: a sexually attractive woman

examples.ch: 西蒙在那里，身边还是那群美女。
examples.en: Simon was there with the usual bevy of lovelies.

defines.trans_en: not measuring much from the base to the top

examples.ch: 矮栅栏
examples.en: a low fence

defines.trans_en: close to the ground or the bottom of something

examples.ch: 低矮的天花板
examples.en: a low ceiling

examples.ch: 我们去滑雪的时候，我只在较低的山坡上滑。
examples.en: When we went skiing, I only went on the lower slopes.

defines.trans_en: below the usual level

examples.ch: 对于一年中的这个时候来说，现在气温已经很低了。
examples.en: Temperatures are very low for the time of year.

examples.ch: 这家大型超级市场里的商品价格全城最低。
examples.en: The big supermarket offers the lowest prices in town.

examples.ch: 这些人的收入水平相对比较低。
examples.en: These people are living on relatively low incomes.

examples.ch: 平价住宅的需求量很大。
examples.en: There is a tremendous need for more low-cost housing.

examples.ch: 低脂饮食
examples.en: a low-fat diet

examples.ch: 低醇啤酒
examples.en: low-alcohol beer

examples.ch: 通常蔬菜所含的热量比较低。
examples.en: Vegetables are generally low in (= do not contain many) calories.

defines.trans_ch: （声、热或光）低的，暗的，小的，少的
defines.trans_en: producing only a small amount of sound, heat, or light

examples.ch: 他们说话的声音很低，我听不见他们在说什么。
examples.en: They spoke in low voices so I would not hear what they were saying.

examples.ch: 把烤箱调到低火。
examples.en: Turn the oven to a low heat.

examples.ch: 乐声轻柔，灯光昏暗。
examples.en: Soft music was playing and the lights were low.

defines.trans_en: of bad quality, especially when referring to something that is not as good as it should be

examples.ch: 低劣的水准
examples.en: low standards

examples.ch: 我对他评价不高。
examples.en: I have a very low opinion of him.

examples.ch: 她有很强的自卑感。
examples.en: She has very low self-esteem.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指职位或社会地位）低下的，卑微的
defines.trans_en: not considered important because of being at or near the bottom of a range of things, especially jobs or social positions

examples.ch: 低级职位
examples.en: low status jobs

examples.ch: 非紧急的任务
examples.en: a low priority task

defines.trans_en: not honest or fair

examples.ch: 你能堕落到什么程度？
examples.en: How low can you get?

examples.ch: 那是一种很卑鄙的伎俩。
examples.en: That was a pretty low trick to play.

defines.trans_en: (of a sound or voice) near or at the bottom of the range of sounds

examples.ch: 他的嗓音很低沉。
examples.en: He has a very low voice.

examples.ch: 那些低音是由低音提琴演奏的。
examples.en: Those low notes are played by the double bass.

defines.trans_ch: 忧郁的，情绪低落的，消沉的
defines.trans_en: unhappy

examples.ch: 任何疾病都可能使人情绪低落。
examples.en: Illness of any sort can leave you feeling low.

examples.ch: 他情绪似乎有些低落。
examples.en: He seemed in low spirits.

defines.trans_en: close to the ground or the bottom of something

examples.ch: 飞机在敌区飞得很低。
examples.en: The planes fly low across enemy territory.

defines.trans_en: at or to a low level

examples.ch: 低收入工人
examples.en: low-paid workers

examples.ch: 把烤箱调到低火。
examples.en: Turn the oven on low.

phrases.trans_en: to have nearly finished a supply of something

examples.ch: 我们的牛奶快喝完了——你再去买一些来好吗？
examples.en: We're running low on milk - could you buy some more?

examples.ch: 收音机的电池快用完了。
examples.en: The radio batteries are running low.

defines.trans_en: to make the deep, long sound of a cow
a bad time in someone's life

examples.ch: 演艺生涯的起起落落
examples.en: the highs and lows of an acting career

phrases.trans_ch: 新低／有记录以来的最低点
phrases.trans_en: the lowest level

examples.ch: 美元对日元汇率已经降到了最低点。
examples.en: The dollar has hit an all-time low against the Japanese yen.

defines.trans_en: the force that causes things, especially good things, to happen to you by chance and not as a result of your own efforts or abilities

examples.ch: 真是机缘巧合，我刚好在合适的时机开口说想找份工作。
examples.en: It was just luck that I asked for a job at the right time.

examples.ch: 后来我碰到了这个美丽的女人，我不敢相信自己的运气有这么好。
examples.en: Then I met this gorgeous woman and I couldn't believe my luck.

examples.ch: 她戴了一个她认为会给自己带来好运的护身符。
examples.en: She wears a charm that she thinks brings her good luck.

examples.ch: 他生活中似乎遇到了不少倒霉的事情。
examples.en: He seems to have had a lot of bad luck in his life.

examples.ch: 这么说明天你要去面试？祝你好运！
examples.en: So your interview's tomorrow? Good luck!

examples.ch: 祝你考试顺利！
examples.en: The best of luck in/with your exams!

defines.trans_en: success

examples.ch: 你订到飞机票了吗？
examples.en: Have you had any luck with booking your flight?

examples.ch: 他想进教师进修学院，但未能如愿。
examples.en: He tried to get into teacher training college but with no luck.

defines.trans_ch: 幸运的，走运的，运气好的
defines.trans_en: having good things happen to you by chance

examples.ch: “我要去日本了。”“你运气真好！”
examples.en: "I'm going to Japan." "Lucky you!"

examples.ch: 幸运的获胜者可以从3种不同的假日方案中选择一种。
examples.en: The lucky winner will be able to choose from three different holidays.

examples.ch: 他们能在这么好的办公室里工作真走运。
examples.en: They're lucky to have such a nice office to work in.

examples.ch: 他很幸运，没有被解雇。
examples.en: He's lucky that he wasn't fired.

examples.ch: 听起来好像你是侥幸逃脱啊。
examples.en: It sounds as if you had a lucky escape (= by good chance you were able to avoid something dangerous or unpleasant).

examples.ch: 按照这样的速度，我们能在午夜前到达就算幸运了。
examples.en: We'll be lucky if we get there by midnight at this rate (= we might get there by midnight or it might be later).

defines.trans_en: bringing good luck

examples.ch: 带来好运的幸运符
examples.en: a lucky charm

examples.ch: 六是我的幸运数字。
examples.en: Six is my lucky number.

defines.trans_en: the bags, suitcases, etc. that contain your possessions and that you take with you when you are travelling

examples.ch: 我们为旅行买了一些新行李箱。
examples.en: We bought some new luggage for our trip.

examples.ch: 决不要把行李放在没人看管的地方。
examples.en: Never leave your luggage unattended.

examples.ch: （可随身带上飞机的）手提行李
examples.en: hand luggage (= small bags that you take with you onto the plane)

defines.trans_en: a meal that is eaten in the middle of the day

examples.ch: 午饭吃什么？
examples.en: What's for lunch?

examples.ch: 我们在酒馆吃的午饭。
examples.en: We had a pub lunch.

examples.ch: 对不起，乔安娜现在不在，她吃午饭去了。
examples.en: I'm sorry, Joanna isn't here at the moment, she's (gone) out to/gone to lunch.

examples.ch: 哪天我们一定得一起吃个午饭。
examples.en: We must do lunch sometime (= have lunch together).

defines.trans_en: to eat lunch

examples.ch: 我在和贾尔斯吃午饭。
examples.en: I'm lunching with Giles.

defines.trans_en: a piece of equipment with several moving parts that uses power to do a particular type of work

examples.ch: 鸡蛋由机器按大小分捡。
examples.en: The different sizes of eggs are sorted by a machine.

examples.ch: 如打电话时我不在家，请在答录机上留言。
examples.en: If I'm not home when you call, leave a message on the machine (= answering machine).

examples.ch: 出去前别忘了将毛巾放到洗衣机里。
examples.en: Don't forget to put the towels in the machine (= washing machine) before you go out.

examples.ch: 我从自动售货机里买了些巧克力。
examples.en: I got some chocolate from a vending machine.

defines.trans_en: a computer

examples.ch: 你需要一台功能强大的电脑来编辑图像。
examples.en: You'll need a powerful machine for editing videos.

defines.trans_en: a vehicle, often a motorcycle

examples.ch: 比尔，你的摩托车马力可够大的。
examples.en: That's a mean (= powerful) machine you've got there, Bill.

defines.trans_en: a group of people who control and organize something

examples.ch: 丘吉尔的战争机器
examples.en: Churchill's war machine

examples.ch: 政党机器已开始为选举做准备。
examples.en: The party machine has swung into action with its preparation for the election.

examples.ch: 现在要靠政府的宣传机器来修复领导人的形象。
examples.en: It's now up to the government's propaganda machine to restore the leader's image.

defines.trans_en: to sew cloth with a sewing machine

examples.ch: 窗帘我已经做得差不多了——只需用缝纫机缝一下边。
examples.en: I've almost finished making the curtains - I just have to machine the hem.

defines.trans_en: a type of thin book with large pages and a paper cover that contains articles and photographs and is published every week or month

examples.ch: 她为几家女性杂志撰稿。
examples.en: She has written articles for several women's magazines.

examples.ch: 用有光纸印刷的杂志
examples.en: a glossy magazine

examples.ch: 男性杂志
examples.en: men's mags

examples.ch: 期刊架
examples.en: a magazine rack

defines.trans_en: a part of a gun in which cartridges are stored
a building in which explosives, weapons, and supplies are kept
to produce something, often using a particular substance or material

examples.ch: 要我煮些咖啡吗？
examples.en: Do you want me to make some coffee?

examples.ch: 他做了一个巧克力蛋糕。
examples.en: He made a chocolate cake.

examples.ch: 她所有的衣服都是自己做的。
examples.en: She makes all her own clothes.

examples.ch: 他为我们煮了些咖啡。
examples.en: He made us some coffee./He made some coffee for us.

examples.ch: 这个罐子是为能耐高温而制作的。
examples.en: The pot is made to withstand high temperatures.

examples.ch: 他为一家生产庭院家具的公司工作。
examples.en: He works for a company that makes furniture.

examples.ch: 盒子上的标签写着“中国制造”。
examples.en: The label on the box said "made in China".

examples.ch: 黄油由牛奶制成。
examples.en: Butter is made out of/from milk.

examples.ch: 金制的耳环
examples.en: earrings made of gold

examples.ch: 她的新教练许诺将她培养成奥运选手。
examples.en: Her new trainer has promised to make an Olympic athlete of her.

defines.trans_en: To make a film or television programme is to direct, produce it, or act in it.

examples.ch: 约翰•休斯顿执导过一些十分优秀的影片。
examples.en: John Huston made some great movies.

examples.ch: 这部影片是由金冠制片公司出品的。
examples.en: The movie was made by Goldcrest Productions.

examples.ch: 为何嘉宝1941年后就不再拍电影了？
examples.en: So why didn't Garbo make any films after 1941?

defines.trans_en: to cause something

examples.ch: 孩子们将厨房弄得一团糟。
examples.en: The kids made a real mess in the kitchen.

examples.ch: 子弹射穿了他的胸膛。
examples.en: The bullet made a hole right through his chest.

examples.ch: 风吹得我眼睛直流泪。
examples.en: The wind is making my eyes water.

examples.ch: 什么使你改变了想法？
examples.en: What made you change your mind?

examples.ch: 只要看一眼伍迪•艾伦的脸就足以使我发笑。
examples.en: Just seeing Woody Allen's face is enough to make me laugh.

examples.ch: 照片上的我看上去快80岁了！
examples.en: The photograph makes me look about 80!

defines.trans_en: to cause to be, to become, or to appear as

examples.ch: 好天气使西班牙成为旅游胜地。
examples.en: It's the good weather that makes Spain such a popular tourist destination.

examples.ch: 她只有大声喊叫才能盖过音乐声让别人听到她的声音。
examples.en: She had to shout to make herself heard above the sound of the music.

examples.ch: 我说法语别人可以懂，但不流利。
examples.en: I can make myself understood in French, but I'm not fluent.

examples.ch: 他们走到大使跟前，（向她）作了自我介绍。
examples.en: They went up to the Ambassador and made themselves known (to her).

examples.ch: 公司账务至今尚未公开。
examples.en: The company accounts have not yet been made public.

examples.ch: 这本书的广告宣传词是“航海不再难”。
examples.en: The book's advertised as "navigation made easy".

examples.ch: 总统已任命亨利·保尔森为财政部长。
examples.en: The president has made Henry Paulson his Secretary of the Treasury.

examples.ch: 我要一份牛排——不，改成鸡肉。
examples.en: I'll have a steak - no, make that chicken.

defines.trans_en: to perform an action

examples.ch: 我必须打个电话。
examples.en: I have to make a phone call.

examples.ch: 有人向乐施会捐赠了100万英镑。
examples.en: Somebody has made a donation of £1 million to the charity Oxfam.

examples.ch: 我需要约一个时间见医生。
examples.en: I need to make a doctor's appointment.

examples.ch: 靠步行，他们每天只能走20英里左右。
examples.en: On foot they could only make about 20 miles a day.

examples.ch: 到明天为止我们必须作出决定。
examples.en: We must make a decision by tomorrow.

examples.ch: 你一点儿都不努力。
examples.en: You're not making any effort.

examples.ch: 有人犯了错误／出了差错。
examples.en: Someone has made a mistake/an error.

examples.ch: 我们进展顺利。
examples.en: We're making good progress.

examples.ch: 她申请要一辆新汽车。
examples.en: She has made a request for a new car.

examples.ch: 我们出价45万英镑买这座房子。
examples.en: We made an offer of £450,000 for the house.

examples.ch: 她作了简短的发言。
examples.en: She made a short speech.

examples.ch: 我们可以开始工作了吗？
examples.en: Is it time to make a start on the work?

examples.ch: 我能否提个建议？
examples.en: Can I make a suggestion?

examples.ch: 我们开车高速穿过了市区。
examples.en: We made good time getting across town.

examples.ch: 有个醉汉在门口闹事。
examples.en: There's a drunk at the door making trouble.

defines.trans_en: to produce a total when added together

examples.en: 12 and 12 make 24.

examples.ch: 今天的地震是今年以来的第5次。
examples.en: Today's earthquake makes five since the beginning of the year.

examples.ch: 我已经收集了29个各式各样的茶壶——如果买下这个，就有30个了。
examples.en: I have 29 different teapots in my collection - if I buy this one that'll make it 30.

defines.trans_en: to calculate as

examples.ch: 你算出的总数是多少？
examples.en: How much do you make the total?

examples.ch: 我算出的答案是105.6。
examples.en: I make the answer (to be) 105.6.

examples.ch: 你估计现在几点了？
examples.en: What do you make the time?/What time do you make it?

defines.trans_en: to earn or get

examples.ch: 她行医每年收入10万美元。
examples.en: She makes $100,000 a year as a doctor.

examples.ch: 你当画家如何谋生？
examples.en: How do you make a living as a painter?

examples.ch: 公司盈利丰厚／亏损严重。
examples.en: The company has made huge profits/losses.

examples.ch: 他善于结交新朋友。
examples.en: He's very good at making new friends.

defines.trans_en: to arrive at or reach, especially successfully

examples.ch: 她及时赶到机场，搭上了班机。
examples.en: She made it to the airport just in time to catch her plane.

examples.ch: 他走到床边便倒下了。
examples.en: He made it to the bed and then collapsed.

examples.ch: 你能在早上8点碰面吗？
examples.en: Could you make a meeting at 8 a.m.?/Could you make an 8 a.m. meeting?

defines.trans_en: to succeed in getting a place in a team

examples.ch: 她未能加入奥林匹克队。
examples.en: She failed to make the Olympic squad.

defines.trans_en: to appear as a story in the news

examples.ch: 他的故事上了家乡的报纸。
examples.en: His story made the papers back home.

examples.ch: 莫桑比克内战在世界上不是头条新闻。
examples.en: The civil war in Mozambique made few headlines around the globe.

defines.trans_en: to cause to be perfect

examples.ch: 领口的小蝴蝶结确实为这条连衣裙锦上添花！
examples.en: Those little bows around the neck really make the dress!

phrases.trans_en: to take action so that you are certain that something happens, is true, etc.

examples.ch: 我要确认一下是否关掉了烤箱。
examples.en: I'll just make sure I've turned the oven off.

examples.ch: 我们要确保聚会上有足够的饮料。
examples.en: Make certain (that) we have enough food for the party.

examples.ch: 你务必得午夜前到家。
examples.en: Make sure you're home by midnight.

examples.ch: 琼斯以3个漂亮的进球确保了他在队里的位置。
examples.en: Jones made sure of his place on the team with three great goals.

examples.ch: 我想我把门锁上了，但还是要回去检查确认一下。
examples.en: I think I locked the door but I'll go back and check just to make sure.

phrases.trans_en: If you make room/space/way for something or someone, you move your body or move other things, so that there is space for it, him, or her.
to pull up and tidy the covers on a bed after it has been slept in

examples.ch: 她匆忙上楼，飞快地整理了床铺。
examples.en: She hurried upstairs and quickly made the beds.

phrases.trans_en: to force someone or something to do something

examples.ch: 如果他不想去，你不能强迫他去。
examples.en: You can't make him go if he doesn't want to.

examples.ch: 兽医给狗灌了些东西，迫使它呕吐。
examples.en: The vet put something down the dog's throat to make it vomit.

phrases.trans_en: to be forced to do something

examples.ch: 囚犯们被强迫挖洞，然后再把它们填上。
examples.en: The prisoners are made to dig holes and fill them up again.

defines.trans_en: a type of product or the name of the company that made it

examples.ch: 你的笔记本电脑是什么牌子的？
examples.en: What make is your laptop?

defines.trans_en: coloured substances used on your face to improve or change your appearance

examples.ch: 我在眼部上了淡妆。
examples.en: I put on a little eye make-up.

examples.ch: 她化的妆很浓。
examples.en: She wears a lot of make-up.

defines.trans_en: The make-up of something or someone is the combination of things that form it.

examples.ch: 他们争辩说议会的成员结构并未反映出这座城市的种族构成。
examples.en: They argue that the membership of the Council does not reflect the racial make-up of the city.

examples.ch: 组织才能并不是他各项素质中最突出的部分。
examples.en: Organizational ability is not one of the most obvious parts of his make-up.

defines.trans_en: an adult male human being

examples.ch: 年轻／高个男子
examples.en: a young/tall man

examples.ch: 男人和女人
examples.en: men and women

examples.ch: 穿绿夹克的男子
examples.en: the man in the green jacket

examples.ch: 男子400米赛跑冠军
examples.en: the men's champion in the 400 metres

examples.ch: 史蒂夫能解决一切——此人是个天才。
examples.en: Steve can solve anything - the man's a genius.

defines.trans_ch: （未明确职位或头衔的）男性雇员
defines.trans_en: a male employee

examples.ch: 煤气公司说会派人来解决泄漏问题。
examples.en: The gas company said they would send some men to fix the leak.

examples.ch: 报社来的人对影片作了肯定的评价。
examples.en: The man from the newspaper wrote some positive things about the movie.

examples.ch: 我们驻华盛顿的人昨天通过传真发来这条消息。
examples.en: Our man in Washington sent us the news by fax yesterday.

defines.trans_en: a male servant

examples.ch: 我的男仆将领您到门口。
examples.en: My man will show you to the door.

defines.trans_en: a husband or male sexual partner

examples.ch: 我听说她又找了个新男朋友。
examples.en: I hear she's got a new man.

examples.ch: 她有男人吗？
examples.en: Is there a man in her life?

defines.trans_ch: （用于称呼，尤指对男子）老兄，老弟，小伙子，朋友
defines.trans_en: used when talking to someone, especially a man

examples.ch: 嘿，老兄，你好吗？
examples.en: Hey, man, how are you doing?

defines.trans_en: the human race

examples.ch: 人类仍远比最智能的机器人聪明。
examples.en: Man is still far more intelligent than the smartest robot.

examples.ch: 人类正迅速毁灭着地球。
examples.en: Man is rapidly destroying the earth.

examples.ch: 这是人类已知的最危险的物质之一。
examples.en: This is one of the most dangerous substances known to man.

examples.ch: 想象一下1万年前新石器时代人的生活是什么样子。
examples.en: Try to imagine what life must have been like for Neolithic man 10,000 years ago.

defines.trans_en: a person of either sex

examples.ch: 法律面前人人平等。
examples.en: All men are equal in the sight of the law.

defines.trans_en: any of the objects that are moved or played with in games such as chess

phrases.trans_en: male members of the armed forces who are not officers

examples.ch: 军事探险队由100名军官和士兵组成。
examples.en: The military expedition was made up of 100 officers and men.

examples.ch: 他命令手下的士兵开枪。
examples.en: He ordered his men to fire.

examples.ch: 有一个士兵来找你，长官。
examples.en: One of the men is here to see you, sir.

phrases.trans_en: a man typical of or involved in marketing, advertising, etc.
If a man and a woman are man and wife, they are married to each other.
a person or group that has power or authority, for example the police

defines.trans_en: To man something such as a machine or vehicle is to be present in order to operate it.

examples.ch: 电话每天24小时都有人值班。
examples.en: The phones are manned 24 hours a day.

examples.ch: 设置路障以阻挡政府军的前进，并且整夜有人看管。
examples.en: Barricades were erected against the advancing government troops and they were manned throughout the night.

examples.ch: 派人看着抽水机！
examples.en: Man the pumps!

defines.trans_ch: （用作感叹词，尤用于表示强烈的感情）啊，呀，哈，嘿
defines.trans_en: used to express a strong emotion

examples.ch: 嘿，我们昨晚真叫尽兴，喝了一夜的酒！
examples.en: Man, we had a good time - we drank all through the night!

defines.trans_ch: …国人；做…职业的人；（团体）由…人组成的；（交通工具）可载…人的
defines.trans_en: having the nationality or job mentioned, or (of a group or vehicle) containing the number of people mentioned

examples.ch: 爱尔兰人
examples.en: an Irishman

examples.ch: 警察
examples.en: a policeman

examples.ch: 商人
examples.en: businessmen

examples.ch: 5人小组
examples.en: a five-man team

examples.ch: 双人直升机
examples.en: a two-man helicopter

defines.trans_en: the person who is responsible for managing an organization

examples.ch: 银行经理
examples.en: a bank manager

examples.ch: 车站主管
examples.en: a station manager

examples.ch: 商店经理
examples.en: a store manager

examples.ch: 生产部经理
examples.en: the production manager

examples.ch: 我想找经理谈谈。
examples.en: I would like to speak to the manager.

defines.trans_en: the person whose job is to organize and sometimes train a sports team

examples.ch: 足球队主教练
examples.en: a football manager

defines.trans_ch: （歌手、演员或其他娱乐人的）经纪人
defines.trans_en: The manager of a singer, actor, or other performer is a person whose job is to arrange the business part of their work.

defines.trans_ch: 许多（主要用于否定句和疑问句中，或者带有“too”、“so” 和“as” 等词的句子中）
defines.trans_en: used mainly in negative sentences and questions and with "too", "so", and "as" to mean "a large number of"

examples.ch: 我衣服不多。
examples.en: I don't have many clothes.

examples.ch: 听说过他的人不多。
examples.en: Not many people have heard of him.

examples.ch: 从现在到圣诞节没有多少个周末了。
examples.en: There aren't very many weekends between now and Christmas.

examples.ch: 路上车多吗？
examples.en: Were there many cars on the road?

examples.ch: 每班有多少学生？
examples.en: How many students are there in each class?

examples.ch: 许多人会不同意你的想法。
examples.en: Many people would disagree with your ideas.

examples.ch: 雷切尔和她众多的爱慕者一起参加了聚会。
examples.en: Rachel was at the party with her many admirers.

examples.ch: 我见过他多次了，可还是记不住他的名字！
examples.en: I've met him so many times and I still can't remember his name!

examples.ch: 找工作的人太多，而岗位又太少。
examples.en: There are too many people chasing too few jobs.

examples.ch: 如果我们中只有5个人去听音乐会，那我就多订了一张票。
examples.en: If there are only five of us going to the concert, then I've booked one too many seats.

examples.ch: 如果议会中女性人数和男性一样多，情形就会大不相同了。
examples.en: If there were as many women as there are men in parliament, the situation would be very different.

examples.ch: 可能有多达6000人已染上此病。
examples.en: As many as (= the surprisingly large number of) 6,000 people may have been infected with the disease.

examples.ch: 已经有12瓶葡萄酒，如果我再买12瓶，那我们就足够了。
examples.en: There are already twelve bottles of wine, so if I buy as many again (= another twelve bottles) we'll have enough.

examples.ch: 许多在上次选举中投她票的人这次不会那么做了。
examples.en: A good/great many people who voted for her in the last election will not be doing so this time.

examples.ch: 她5年里生了5个孩子，认为已经足够了。
examples.en: She had five children in as many (= in the same number of) years and decided it was enough.

defines.trans_en: a drawing of the earth's surface, or part of that surface, showing the shape and position of different countries, political borders, natural features such as rivers and mountains, and artificial features such as roads and buildings

examples.ch: 世界地图
examples.en: a map of the world

examples.ch: 巴黎地图
examples.en: a map of Paris

examples.ch: 公路图
examples.en: a road map

examples.ch: 我们需要一张大比例尺地图，上面要标出所有能走的小路。
examples.en: We need a large-scale map showing all the footpaths that we can walk along.

examples.ch: 我一点儿也看不懂地图。
examples.en: I'm terrible at map reading (= understanding maps).

defines.trans_ch: （提供特定区域特定信息的）图
defines.trans_en: a drawing that gives you a particular type of information about a particular area

examples.ch: 他买了一张苏格兰人口分布图。
examples.en: He bought a map showing the population distribution of Scotland.

defines.trans_ch: （标明恒星位置或行星表面特征的）天体图
defines.trans_en: something that shows the position of stars in the sky or the features on the surface of planets

examples.ch: 天体图
examples.en: a celestial map

examples.ch: 火星地形图
examples.en: a map of Mars

defines.trans_en: a very simple drawing that shows a direction of travel between one place and another

examples.ch: 如果你担心找不到那家旅馆，我给你画张简单的示意图。
examples.en: I'll draw you a quick map if you're worried about finding the hotel.

defines.trans_ch: 绘制…的地图;在地图上标示出
defines.trans_en: to represent an area of land in the form of a map

examples.ch: 人们还未为这个国家北部的部分山区绘制地图。
examples.en: Parts of the mountainous region in the north of the country have still not been mapped.

defines.trans_en: the people who might want to buy something, or a part of the world where something is sold

examples.ch: 你肯定这种产品有市场吗？
examples.en: Are you sure there's a market for the product?

examples.ch: 我们预计，仅在这个国家新型电话的潜在市场就有100万人左右。
examples.en: We estimate the potential market for the new phones to be around one million people in this country alone.

examples.ch: 国内市场依旧低迷，但国外需求正逐步增加。
examples.en: The domestic market is still depressed, but demand abroad is picking up.

examples.ch: 过去一年他们的市场份额增加了10%。
examples.en: They've increased their share of the market by ten percent over the past year.

defines.trans_ch: （金融等特定产品的）买卖，市场
defines.trans_en: the business or trade in a particular product, including financial products

examples.ch: 咖啡市场
examples.en: the coffee market

examples.ch: 经济市场
examples.en: the economic market

examples.ch: 商品市场
examples.en: the commodities market

examples.ch: 股票市场
examples.en: the stock market

examples.ch: 就业市场
examples.en: the job market

examples.ch: 房产市场
examples.en: the housing market

defines.trans_en: a place or event at which people meet in order to buy and sell things

examples.ch: 集市上的水果和蔬菜比超市新鮮得多。
examples.en: Fruit and vegetables are much fresher from/at the market than in the supermarket.

examples.ch: 她在农民集市上有一个摊位。
examples.en: She runs a stall at the farmer's market.

examples.ch: 花市对旅游者有很大的吸引力。
examples.en: The flower market is a big tourist attraction.

examples.ch: 工艺品市场
examples.en: a craft market

examples.ch: 在集市日到这里访问，感受一下真正的巴黎。
examples.en: Visit the area on market day for a glimpse of the real Paris.

defines.trans_en: a shop that sells mainly food

phrases.trans_en: interested in buying something

examples.ch: 谢谢优惠，但目前我无意再买一辆汽车。
examples.en: Thanks for the offer, but I'm not in the market for another car right now.

phrases.trans_en: available for sale

examples.ch: 房价一涨，我们就卖房子。
examples.en: We put our house on the market as soon as house prices started to rise.

examples.ch: 这是市场上最好的电视机之一。
examples.en: This is one of the best televisions on the market.

examples.ch: 这些画在公开市场上可卖到50万。
examples.en: The pictures would sell for half a million on the open market (= if offered for sale without a fixed price).

defines.trans_en: to make goods available to buyers in a planned way that encourages people to buy more of them, for example by advertising

examples.ch: 他们产品的营销方式很巧妙。
examples.en: Their products are very cleverly marketed.

defines.trans_en: having a wife or husband

examples.ch: 一对夫妻
examples.en: a married couple

examples.ch: 我们已结婚5年，生活幸福。
examples.en: We've been happily married for five years.

examples.ch: 请说明你是单身、同居、已婚、分居、离异还是丧偶。
examples.en: Please state whether you are single, cohabiting, married, separated, divorced or widowed.

examples.ch: 史密斯已婚，有两个孩子。
examples.en: Smith was married with two children.

examples.ch: 那你的婚后生活怎么样？
examples.en: So how are you enjoying married life?

examples.ch: 她和一个有妇之夫有婚外情。
examples.en: She had an affair with a married man.

examples.ch: 调查显示2/3的已婚妇女收入比丈夫低。
examples.en: The survey reveals that two-thirds of married women earn less than their husbands.

examples.ch: 你和尼基结婚多久了？
examples.en: So how long have you been married to Nicky?

examples.ch: 雷切尔现在似乎嫁她的新工作了，所以我们很少见到她。
examples.en: Rachel seems to be married to (= very involved with) her new job at the moment, so we hardly ever see her.

phrases.trans_en: to begin a legal relationship with someone as their husband or wife

examples.ch: 你何时结婚？
examples.en: When are you getting married?

examples.ch: 克里斯和戴比去年夏天结婚了。
examples.en: Chris and Debbie got married last summer.

examples.ch: 杰米将娶劳拉为妻。
examples.en: Jamie's getting married to Laura.

defines.trans_en: a sports competition or event in which two people or teams compete against each other

examples.ch: 网球比赛
examples.en: a tennis match

examples.ch: 足球／板球比赛
examples.en: a football/cricket match

examples.ch: 我们赢／输掉了比赛。
examples.en: We won/lost the match.

examples.ch: 利物浦队下周与布莱克本队有一场比赛。
examples.en: Liverpool have a match with (= against) Blackburn next week.

defines.trans_en: a short, thin stick made of wood or cardboard and covered with a special chemical at one end that burns when rubbed firmly against a rough surface

examples.ch: 一盒火柴
examples.en: a box of matches

examples.ch: 擦火柴时应该离身体远一些。
examples.en: You should always strike a match away from you.

defines.trans_ch: 旗鼓相当的人（或物）；敌手
defines.trans_en: a person or thing that is equal to another person or thing in strength, speed, or quality
something that is similar to or combines well with something else

examples.ch: 窗帘看上去棒极了——正好和沙发相配。
examples.en: The curtains look great - they're a perfect match for the sofa.

defines.trans_ch: 般配的一对；相配的两个人
defines.trans_en: If two people who are having a relationship are a good match, they are very suitable for each other.

examples.ch: 他们是天造地设的一对。
examples.en: Theirs is a match made in heaven (= a very good relationship).

phrases.trans_ch: 比赛中得分最多的人;比赛中表现最出色的人
phrases.trans_en: the person who has scored the most points or played the best in a match
to make something burn
to be less powerful or effective than someone or something else

examples.ch: 吉布森跑得挺快，但远比不上那个年轻的意大利人。
examples.en: Gibson ran well but was no match for the young Italian.

defines.trans_en: to be as good as someone or something else

examples.ch: 很难赶上这家航空公司的乘客服务水平。
examples.en: It would be difficult to match the service this airline gives its customers.

defines.trans_en: If two colours, designs, or objects match, they are similar or look attractive together.

examples.ch: 你认为这两种颜色相配吗？
examples.en: Do you think these two colours match?

examples.ch: 这件衬衫和这条裤子相配吗？
examples.en: Does this shirt match these trousers?

examples.ch: 一张沙发和相配的窗帘
examples.en: a sofa with curtains to match

defines.trans_en: to choose someone or something that is suitable for a particular person, activity, or purpose

examples.ch: 在第一个练习中，你必须把首都和它们所属的国家配对。
examples.en: In the first exercise you have to match each capital city to its country.

defines.trans_en: a situation or subject that is being dealt with or considered

examples.ch: 我能和你谈件私事吗？
examples.en: Could I talk to you about a personal matter?

examples.ch: 艾伦否认对此事知情。
examples.en: Allen denied any knowledge of the matter.

examples.ch: 你能给我回电话吗——有比较重要的事。
examples.en: Please phone me back - it's a matter of some importance.

examples.ch: 谈论世界所面临的问题是一回事，而解决它们却完全是另一回事。
examples.en: Talking about the world's problems is one thing, but solving them is another matter altogether (= is completely different).

defines.trans_en: physical substance in the universe

examples.ch: 有些科学家认为，宇宙中的物质约有天文学家所观测到的10倍之多。
examples.en: Some scientists believe that there is about ten times as much matter in the universe as astronomers have observed.

defines.trans_en: a substance of a particular kind

examples.ch: 绝大部分蔬菜都可以用作堆肥。
examples.en: Most vegetable matter is compostable.

examples.ch: 没有任何浪费的东西剩下。
examples.en: There's no waste matter left over.

defines.trans_en: a substance or things of a particular type

examples.ch: 广告材料／印刷品
examples.en: advertising/printed matter

examples.ch: 你觉得这本书的主题内容有趣吗？
examples.en: Do you find the subject matter of the book (= the subject that the book deals with) interesting?

defines.trans_ch: （表示数量或时间之少）大约，左右
defines.trans_en: used in expressions describing how small an amount or period of time is

examples.ch: 采访约几分钟就结束了。
examples.en: The interview was over in a matter of minutes.

examples.ch: 她说他少找她钱了，其实只差了几便士而已。
examples.en: She complained he had short-changed her, but it was only a matter of a few pence.

phrases.trans_en: the situation being dealt with or being discussed

examples.ch: 她的辞职无助于解决问题。
examples.en: Her resignation is not going to help matters.

phrases.trans_en: used to say that something has made a bad or difficult situation worse

examples.ch: 我们的3名队员病了，更糟的是，主要得分手摔断了脚踝。
examples.en: Three of our players were ill, and to make matters worse, our main scorer had broken his ankle.

phrases.text: be a matter of confidence, luck, waiting, etc.
phrases.trans_en: If something is a matter of confidence, luck, waiting, etc. that is all you need for it to happen.

examples.ch: 烤蛋糕并不难——只需照着烹饪指南做就行。
examples.en: Baking a cake isn't difficult - it's just a matter of following the recipe.

phrases.trans_ch: 需严肃对待的事，不是开玩笑的事
phrases.trans_en: to be very serious and not a situation that people should joke about

examples.ch: 被警方逮捕可不是开玩笑的事。
examples.en: Being arrested by the police is no laughing matter.

phrases.trans_en: the reason for pain, worry, or a problem

examples.ch: 怎么了？你为什么哭？
examples.en: What's the matter? Why are you crying?

examples.ch: 你的手怎么了？都流血了。
examples.en: What's the matter with your hand? It's bleeding.

examples.ch: 有什么麻烦吗？
examples.en: Is anything the matter?

examples.ch: 我不知道这车出了什么毛病，但就是发动不起来。
examples.en: I don't know what the matter is with the car, but it won't start.

defines.trans_en: to be important, or to affect what happens

examples.ch: 我们迟到了，不过看来不要紧。
examples.en: We were late but it didn't seem to matter.

examples.ch: “你说什么？”“哦，没什么要紧的。”
examples.en: "What did you say?" "Oh, it doesn't matter."

examples.ch: 只要你来，穿什么都没关系。
examples.en: It doesn't matter what you wear - just as long as you come.

examples.ch: 我们最好的球员比赛开始10分钟就受伤了——但这无碍大局，我们还是赢了。
examples.en: It didn't matter that our best player was injured after ten minutes - we still won.

examples.ch: 我知道查尔斯并不看重这个项目，但它对我来说很重要。
examples.en: I know Charles doesn't think this project is important, but it matters to me.

defines.trans_en: used to show that something is possible or that something might be true

examples.ch: 或许他们明天会来。
examples.en: Maybe they'll come tomorrow.

examples.ch: 或许还是你对。
examples.en: Maybe you were right after all.

defines.trans_en: used to show that a number or amount is approximate

examples.ch: 船上约有200或300名难民。
examples.en: There were 200, maybe 300, refugees on the boat.

defines.trans_en: used to politely suggest or ask for something

examples.ch: 也许特德愿意去。
examples.en: Maybe Ted would like to go.

examples.ch: 或许我们该重新开始。
examples.en: Maybe we should start again.

defines.trans_ch: （用于不确定的回答）可能，也许
defines.trans_en: used to avoid giving a clear or certain answer to a question

examples.ch: “你去参加凯利的聚会吗？”“也许会去吧。”
examples.en: "Are you coming to Kelly's party?" "Maybe."

defines.trans_en: used to mean that something is a possible explanation for why something else happened

examples.ch: “为什么球队选中了你，而不是我？”“也许是因为我参加训练的次数比你多。”
examples.en: "Why were you chosen for the team and not me?" "Maybe it's because I've been to more practices than you."

defines.trans_en: used, usually as the object of a verb or preposition, to refer to the person speaking or writing

examples.ch: 有我的一份吗？
examples.en: Is there one for me?

examples.ch: 她给了我一些钱。
examples.en: She gave me some money.

examples.ch: 你能把那本书递给我吗？
examples.en: Could you pass me that book?

examples.ch: 不是我主动要去，是夏洛特。
examples.en: It wasn't me who offered to go, it was Charlotte.

defines.trans_en:
the musical note 
mi

defines.trans_ch: 慢性疲劳综合征（myalgic encephalomyelitis的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for myalgic encephalomyelitis: an illness, sometimes lasting for several years, in which a person's muscles and joints (= places where two bones are connected) hurt and they are generally very tired

defines.trans_ch: （美国）缅因州（写地址时Maine的缩写）
defines.trans_en: written abbreviation for the US state of Maine: used in addresses
an occasion when food is eaten, or the food that is eaten on such an occasion

examples.ch: 一顿热饭
examples.en: a hot meal

examples.ch: 有三道菜的一餐
examples.en: a three-course meal

examples.ch: 丰盛的一餐
examples.en: a heavy (= large) meal

examples.ch: 简单的一顿饭
examples.en: a light (= small) meal

examples.ch: 我一天的正餐是在中午。
examples.en: I have my main meal at midday.

examples.ch: 你有空过来吃顿饭好吗。
examples.en: How about coming over for a meal sometime?

defines.trans_en: a substance that has been crushed to make a rough powder, especially plant seeds crushed to make flour or for animal food

examples.ch: 骨粉
examples.en: bone meal

examples.ch: 大豆粉
examples.en: corn meal

defines.trans_en: to express or represent something such as an idea, thought, or fact

examples.ch: 这个词是什么意思？
examples.en: What does this word mean?

examples.ch: 这些数字意味着近6%的劳动人口处于失业状态。
examples.en: These figures mean that almost six percent of the working population is unemployed.

examples.ch: 你那话是什么意思？
examples.en: What do you mean by that remark?

examples.ch: 可是她有点怪。你明白我指什么吗？
examples.en: She's kind of strange though. Do you know what I mean?

examples.ch: “他们都出现了。”“你是说整个家族？”
examples.en: "They all showed up." "You mean the entire family?"

defines.trans_en: used to add emphasis to what you are saying

examples.ch: 我要你午夜前回家，记住是午夜。
examples.en: I want you home by midnight. And I mean midnight.

examples.ch: 现在就把它还了！我是说真的。
examples.en: Give it back now! I mean it.

defines.trans_en: to have a particular result

examples.ch: 成本降低，价格就会下降。
examples.en: Lower costs mean lower prices.

examples.ch: 电子学方面的进步使这项技术已经可供人们利用。
examples.en: Advances in electronics mean that the technology is already available.

examples.ch: 如果想赶上7：30的火车，那就意味着我们要6：00从家中出发。
examples.en: If we want to catch the 7.30 train, that will mean leaving the house at 6.00.

defines.trans_en: to intend

examples.ch: 如果冒犯了你我很抱歉——我并无恶意。
examples.en: I'm sorry if I offended you - I didn't mean any harm.

examples.ch: 这些大字号的书是为视力有障碍的读者准备的。
examples.en: The books with large print are meant for partially sighted readers.

examples.ch: 我整个星期都想着要给你打电话。
examples.en: I've been meaning to call you all week.

examples.ch: 你认为她是想说上午9点而不是晚上9点吗？
examples.en: Do you think she meant to say 9 a.m. instead of 9 p.m.?

examples.ch: 他们并不想让她读那封信。
examples.en: They didn't mean for her to read the letter.

defines.trans_ch: 对…具有意义，对…具有重要影响
defines.trans_en: to have an important emotional effect on someone

examples.ch: 这不是一幅很贵重的画，但对我却很重要。
examples.en: It wasn't a valuable picture but it meant a lot to me.

examples.ch: 财富对他来说毫无意义。
examples.en: Possessions mean nothing to him.

phrases.trans_en: to be intended to

examples.ch: 这些电池应该能用一年。
examples.en: These batteries are meant to last for a year.

examples.ch: 这个练习不会很难。
examples.en: This exercise isn't meant to be difficult.

examples.ch: 这周我们本该走了，但是戴比病了，所以我们走不了了。
examples.en: We were meant to have gone away this week, but Debbie's ill so we couldn't go.

examples.ch: 你应该把药抹在受感染部位，而不是吞服。
examples.en: You are meant to rub the medicine on the affected area, not swallow it.

defines.trans_en: not willing to give or share things, especially money

examples.ch: 他太吝啬了，舍不得给她买一枚戒指。
examples.en: He's too mean to buy her a ring.

examples.ch: 我的房东对使用暖气很吝啬——每天只开两个小时。
examples.en: My landlord's very mean with the heating - it's only on for two hours each day.

defines.trans_en: unkind or unpleasant

examples.ch: 别对我那么刻薄！
examples.en: Stop being so mean to me!

examples.ch: 她那么说就是为了让人不悦。
examples.en: She just said it to be mean.

defines.trans_en: frightening and likely to become violent

examples.ch: 一群气势汹汹、激动愤怒的暴民
examples.en: a mean and angry mob

examples.ch: 一个面相很凶的年轻人
examples.en: a mean-looking youth

defines.trans_en: very good

examples.ch: 她是个出色的钢琴演奏家。
examples.en: She's a mean piano player.

examples.ch: 她钢琴弹得很棒。
examples.en: She plays a mean piano (= she plays very well).

defines.trans_en: poor, dirty, and of bad quality

examples.ch: 他1945年出生在底特律的贫民区。
examples.en: He was born in the mean streets of Detroit in 1945.

defines.trans_en: a mean number is an average number

examples.ch: 平均值
examples.en: a mean value

examples.ch: 他们的平均体重是76.4公斤。
examples.en: Their mean weight was 76.4 kilos.

defines.trans_en: the result you get by adding two or more amounts together and dividing the total by the number of amounts

examples.en: The mean of 5, 4, 10, and 15 is 8.5.

defines.trans_en: a quality or way of doing something that is in the middle of two completely different qualities or ways of doing something

examples.ch: 我们需要出难度适中的考题。
examples.en: We need to find a mean between test questions that are too difficult and those that are too easy.

defines.trans_en: the flesh of an animal when it is used for food

examples.ch: 我不吃肉。
examples.en: I don't eat meat.

examples.ch: 生肉
examples.en: raw meat

examples.ch: 红／白肉
examples.en: red/white meat

defines.trans_en: a type of meat

examples.ch: 冷盘肉及奶酪自助餐
examples.en: a buffet of cold meats and cheeses

defines.trans_ch: 要点，实质;令人感兴趣的内容
defines.trans_en: important, valuable, or interesting ideas or information

examples.ch: 这是篇文笔优美又很有趣的文章，但没什么实质内容。
examples.en: It was a nicely written article and quite amusing but there wasn't much meat to it.

defines.trans_en: someone whose job is repairing the engines of vehicles and other machines

examples.ch: 汽车/自行车修理工
examples.en: a car/garage/bike mechanic

phrases.trans_en: the study of the effect of physical forces on objects and their movement
the way something works or happens

examples.ch: 关于如何管理一所学校，他所知甚多。
examples.en: He knows a lot about the mechanics of running a school.

defines.trans_en: treatment for illness or injury, or the study of this

examples.ch: 儿科／预防医学
examples.en: paediatric/preventative medicine

examples.ch: 正统／西方医学
examples.en: orthodox/Western medicine

examples.ch: 从医生涯
examples.en: a career in medicine

examples.ch: 她是位医生，却不能在自己的国家行医。
examples.en: She is a doctor, but is unable to practise medicine (= work as a doctor) in her own country.

defines.trans_en: a substance, especially in the form of a liquid or a pill, that is a treatment for illness or injury

examples.ch: 止咳药
examples.en: cough medicine

examples.ch: 进餐时服两勺药。
examples.en: Take two spoonfuls of medicine at mealtimes.

examples.ch: 她懂得许多关于草药的知识。
examples.en: She knows a lot about herbal medicines.

defines.trans_en: to see and talk to someone for the first time

examples.ch: 他们是在工作时认识的。
examples.en: They met at work.

examples.ch: 我在夏威夷认识了她。
examples.en: I met her in Hawaii.

examples.ch: 你愿意认识一下我姐姐吗？
examples.en: Would you like to meet my sister?

examples.ch: 来，认识一下我的朋友劳拉。
examples.en: Come and meet (= be introduced to) my friend Laura.

defines.trans_en: to come together with someone intentionally

examples.ch: 我和洛兰每月见一次面吃午饭。
examples.en: Lorraine and I meet for lunch once a month.

examples.ch: 我们同意星期二见面讨论这一项目。
examples.en: We agreed to meet on Tuesday to discuss the project.

examples.ch: 儿童俱乐部每星期四下午集合。
examples.en: The children's club meets every Thursday afternoon.

examples.ch: 他们正与顾问会面来制订一项新计划。
examples.en: They're meeting with their advisers to draw up a new plan.

examples.ch: 总统昨天在伦敦和英国首相会了面。
examples.en: The president met the UK prime minister in London yesterday.

defines.trans_en: to come together with someone without intending to

examples.ch: 遇到你认识的人但却记不起他们的名字总会让人很尴尬。
examples.en: It's always awkward when you meet someone you know but you can't remember their name.

examples.ch: 猜猜今天我在城里遇到了谁。
examples.en: Guess who I met in town today.

examples.ch: 我们在上周六的拍卖会上遇到了老邻居。
examples.en: We met our old neighbours at an auction last Saturday.

defines.trans_en: to fulfil, satisfy, or achieve

examples.ch: 管理层没有满足工人们增加工资的要求。
examples.en: The workers' demands for higher pay were not met by the management.

examples.ch: 我们还没能找到符合我们需要／要求的房子。
examples.en: We haven't yet been able to find a house that meets our needs/requirements.

examples.ch: 只有某些条件得到了满足，他们才会同意签合同。
examples.en: They will only agree to sign the contract if certain conditions are met.

examples.ch: 你认为我们能如期完成／达到目标吗？
examples.en: Do you think we will be able to meet our deadline/target?

defines.trans_en: to pay

examples.ch: 公司已同意支付我们所有的费用。
examples.en: The company has agreed to meet all our expenses.

defines.trans_en: to wait at a place for someone or something to arrive

examples.ch: 你到机场接我好吗？
examples.en: Will you meet me at the airport (= be there when the aircraft arrives)?

defines.trans_en: to touch or join something

examples.ch: 天花板与墙壁相连的地方有个大裂缝。
examples.en: There's a large crack where the ceiling meets the wall.

examples.ch: 窗帘拉不太拢。
examples.en: The curtains don't quite meet.

examples.ch: 地平线是天地相连的那条线。
examples.en: The horizon is the line where the sky meets the earth.

defines.trans_en: to experience something

examples.ch: 我以前从没遇到过那种问题／制度。
examples.en: I've never met that kind of problem/system before.

examples.ch: 他死于南大西洋冰冷的海水中。
examples.en: He met his death (= he died) in the icy waters of the South Atlantic.

defines.trans_en: a sports event

examples.ch: 田径运动会／游泳比赛
examples.en: a track/swim meet

examples.ch: 本赛季的第一场比赛
examples.en: the first meet of the season

defines.trans_en: an occasion when people go fox hunting
a planned occasion when people come together to discuss something

examples.ch: 我们将在周四会面讨论这一问题。
examples.en: We're having a meeting on Thursday to discuss the problem.

examples.ch: 恐怕现在她在开会——稍后我会让她给你回电话。
examples.en: I'm sorry but she's in a meeting - I'll ask her to call you back later.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指事先未安排的）会面，见面
defines.trans_en: an occasion when people meet each other, especially when this was not planned

examples.ch: 飞机上与一位出版商的偶遇使他的事业开始起步。
examples.en: A chance (= not intended) meeting with a publisher on an airplane had launched his career.

examples.ch: 从我们第一次见面我就喜欢上了他。
examples.en: I liked him from our first meeting.

defines.trans_en: a group of people who have met for a particular purpose

examples.ch: 与会者想再次讨论这一提案。
examples.en: The meeting wants to look at the proposal again.

defines.trans_en: a sports competition
a person, animal, or thing that is part of a group

examples.ch: 家庭成员
examples.en: a family member

examples.ch: 老一辈中的一员
examples.en: a member of the older generation

examples.ch: 团体中的男性与女性成员
examples.en: male and female members of the group

examples.ch: 狮子是猫科动物。
examples.en: The lion is a member of the cat family.

examples.ch: 各成员州代表将于下周会晤。
examples.en: Representatives of the member states will be meeting next week.

defines.trans_en: a person who joins a group to take part in a particular activity

examples.ch: 俱乐部新会员
examples.en: a new club member

examples.ch: 停车设施仅供会员使用。
examples.en: The parking area is for members only.

examples.ch: 迈克尔是皇家鸟类保护协会的会员。
examples.en: Michael is a member of the Royal Society for the Protection of Birds.

defines.trans_en: a leg or arm
a penis

examples.ch: 男性性器官
examples.en: the male member

defines.trans_en: a list of the food that you can eat in a restaurant

examples.ch: 服务员拿来了菜单和酒单。
examples.en: The waiter brought the menu and the wine list.

examples.ch: 今天菜单上有什么菜？
examples.en: What's on the menu today?

defines.trans_ch: （计算机屏幕上显示的）菜单，选项单
defines.trans_en: a list of choices that can be made to appear on a computer screen

examples.ch: 选择“编辑”菜单，再选择“复制”。
examples.en: Select the "Edit" menu and then choose "Copy".

defines.trans_en: a short piece of information that you give to a person when you cannot speak to them directly

examples.ch: 如果你打电话时我不在，就留个口信。
examples.en: If I'm not there when you call, leave a message.

examples.ch: 我得到消息，说她会迟到。
examples.en: I got a message that she'll be late.

defines.trans_ch: （书、电影或戏剧的）要旨，寓意，中心思想
defines.trans_en: the most important idea in a book, film, or play, or an idea that you want to tell people about

examples.ch: 这部电影旨在告诉人们富人和穷人是相似的。
examples.en: The movie's message is that rich and poor are alike.

examples.ch: 我们必须发出一个清晰的信息：污染将不会被容忍。
examples.en: We need to send a clear message that pollution will not be tolerated.

phrases.trans_en: to understand what someone is trying to tell you, even if that person is not expressing himself or herself directly

examples.ch: 我从不接他的电话，所以你想他会明白我的意思吧。
examples.en: I never answer his calls, so you'd think he'd get the message.

phrases.trans_en: to make someone understand

examples.ch: 我们需要让人们明白过多的日晒是危险的。
examples.en: We need to get the message across that too much sun is dangerous.

defines.trans_en: to send someone a short message using a mobile phone or computer

examples.ch: 昨天我给他发了短信，但没有回音。
examples.en: I messaged him yesterday but haven't had a reply.

defines.trans_en: a unit of measurement equal to 100 centimetres

examples.ch: 防空洞有厚达3米的混凝土墙。
examples.en: The bomb shelter has concrete walls that are three metres thick.

examples.ch: 15米长的游艇
examples.en: a 15-metre yacht

examples.ch: 她获得了奥运会100米短跑冠军。
examples.en: She won the 100 metres (= a race run over this distance) at the Olympics.

examples.ch: 他身高1.75米。
examples.en: He is 1 m 75 tall.

examples.ch: 水价上涨到每立方米48便士。
examples.en: The price of water rose to 48p per cubic metre (= a unit of volume equal to 1,000 litres).

examples.ch: 这间房间面积为6平方米。
examples.en: The room is six metres square.

defines.trans_en: the regular arrangement of syllables in poetry according to the number and type of beats in a line

examples.ch: 他秉承古典风格并按严格的韵律作诗。
examples.en: He composes poems in a classical style and in strict metre.

examples.ch: 许多教堂圣歌有严格而规则的韵律。
examples.en: Many hymns have a firm, regular metre.

defines.trans_en: the central point, position, or part

examples.ch: 这是我的全班合影——中间的那个是我。
examples.en: This is my class photo - I'm the one in the middle.

examples.ch: 他正站在路中央。
examples.en: He was standing in the middle of the road.

examples.ch: 半夜吵闹声吵醒了我们。
examples.en: The noise woke us up in the middle of the night.

defines.trans_en: waist

examples.ch: 你的裤子看上去腰部有点紧。
examples.en: Those trousers look a bit tight around your middle.

defines.trans_ch: 中部的，中间的；中央的；当中的
defines.trans_en: in a central position

examples.ch: 在a，b，c，d，e 这一组字母中，中间的字母是 c。
examples.en: In the sequence a, b, c, d, e, the middle letter is c.

examples.ch: 简坐在中间的桌子旁，在苏和卡伦之间。
examples.en: Jane sits at the middle desk, between Sue and Karen.

defines.trans_en: neither high nor low in importance, amount, or size

examples.ch: 中等收入家庭
examples.en: middle income families

examples.ch: 中等大小的牧羊犬
examples.en: a middle-sized (= average-sized) sheepdog

defines.trans_ch: （在兄弟姐妹当中）排行居中的
defines.trans_en: A middle child has the same number of older brothers and sisters as younger brothers and sisters.

examples.ch: 她是三个孩子中的老二。
examples.en: She's the middle child of three.

defines.trans_ch: （语言）中古的，介于古代与现代之间的
defines.trans_en: used to refer to a form of a particular language that existed between its earliest known stage and its present form

examples.ch: 14世纪中古英语
examples.en: 14th-century Middle English

examples.ch: 中古法语
examples.en: Middle French

defines.trans_en: twelve o'clock in the middle of the night

examples.ch: 午夜时段电视上会播一部好片子。
examples.en: There's a great film on TV at midnight.

examples.ch: 我们到家时已过午夜。
examples.en: It was after midnight when we got home.

defines.trans_ch: 英里（长度单位，相当于1760码或1.6公里）
defines.trans_en: a unit of distance equal to 1,760 yards or 1.6 kilometres

examples.ch: 10英里的车程
examples.en: a ten-mile drive

examples.ch: 最近的城镇在10英里外。
examples.en: The nearest town is ten miles away.

examples.ch: 限速为每小时30英里。
examples.en: The speed limit is 30 miles an/per hour.

phrases.trans_en: a very long way

examples.ch: 从顶部我们可以环视四周，极目远眺。
examples.en: From the top, we could see for miles in every direction.

examples.ch: 他住在城的另一边，距此很远。
examples.en: He lives miles away on the other side of town.

defines.trans_en: the white liquid produced by cows, goats, and sheep and used by humans as a drink or for making butter, cheese, etc.

examples.ch: 一杯／盒牛奶
examples.en: a glass/carton of milk

examples.ch: 牛／羊奶
examples.en: cow's/goat's milk

examples.ch: 脱脂／经高温杀菌的牛奶
examples.en: skimmed/pasteurized milk

examples.ch: 奶瓶
examples.en: a milk bottle

defines.trans_ch: （女性及雌性哺乳动物的）奶，乳汁
defines.trans_en: the white liquid produced by women and other female mammals as food for their young

examples.ch: 母乳是婴儿最好的营养品。
examples.en: Breast/Mother's milk is the best nourishment for a baby.

defines.trans_en: the white liquid produced by some plants and trees

examples.ch: 椰汁
examples.en: coconut milk

defines.trans_en: to get milk from an animal

examples.ch: 手工挤牛奶是一项技术活。
examples.en: Milking a cow by hand is a skilled process.

examples.ch: 有些山羊似乎比其他羊更容易产奶。
examples.en: Some goats seem to milk (= produce milk) better than others.

defines.trans_en: to get as much money or information out of someone or something as possible, often in an unfair or dishonest way

examples.ch: 报纸拿这个故事做尽了文章。
examples.en: The newspapers milked the story dry.

examples.ch: 几个董事榨取了公司数百万英镑的钱财。
examples.en: The directors milked the company of several million dollars.

defines.trans_en: the number 1,000,000

examples.ch: 这座城市的人口几乎有一百万。
examples.en: The city has a population of almost a/one million.

examples.ch: 她出演那部电影拿到了800万美元的片酬。
examples.en: She got eight million dollars for appearing in that film.

examples.ch: 他的生意价值几百万欧元。
examples.en: His business is worth millions of euros.

phrases.trans_en: a large number

examples.ch: 我一定已经告诉你无数次了，离开房间前要把窗子关好。
examples.en: I must have told you a million times to close the windows when you leave the house.

phrases.trans_en: numbers between 1,000,000 and 1,000,000,000

examples.ch: 在富庶地区，居屋的价格从75万到数百万欧元不等。
examples.en: In wealthy areas, homes cost from €750,000 into the millions.

defines.trans_en: the part of a person that makes it possible for him or her to think, feel emotions, and understand things

examples.ch: 她头脑里满是前一天晚上所发生的事情，根本无法集中精神。
examples.en: Her mind was full of what had happened the night before, and she just wasn't concentrating.

examples.ch: 我当然是在说实话——你太疑神疑鬼了！
examples.en: Of course I'm telling the truth - you have such a suspicious mind!

examples.ch: 我只是想到什么就说什么了。
examples.en: I just said the first thing that came into my mind.

examples.ch: 我不太清楚自己在做什么。
examples.en: I'm not quite clear in my mind about what I'm doing.

defines.trans_en: a very intelligent person

examples.ch: 她是上世纪才智最为出众的人物之一。
examples.en: She was one of the most brilliant minds of the last century.

phrases.trans_ch: 全是心理作用的；只是凭空想象的
phrases.trans_en: If a problem is all in the mind, it does not exist and is only imagined.

examples.ch: 医生努力想让他相信他其实没有生病，只是心理作用罢了。
examples.en: His doctor tried to convince him that he wasn't really ill and that it was all in his mind.

phrases.trans_en: to remember a piece of information when you are making a decision or thinking about a matter

examples.ch: 别忘了她年龄那么小，我认为她做得很棒。
examples.en: Bearing in mind how young she is, I thought she did really well.

examples.ch: 当然，维修费很昂贵，你必须记住这一点。
examples.en: Of course, repair work is expensive and you have to keep that in mind.

phrases.text: go over sth in your mind
phrases.trans_en: to think repeatedly about an event that has happened

examples.ch: 她不断地想起那起事故，希望当时要是能做些什么来避免就好了。
examples.en: She kept going over the accident again and again in her mind, wishing that she could somehow have prevented it.

defines.trans_ch: （用于疑问句和否定句）介意，反对
defines.trans_en: (used in questions and negatives) to be annoyed or worried by something

examples.ch: 你认为他会介意我借他的书吗？
examples.en: Do you think he'd mind if I borrowed his book?

examples.ch: 我不反对房子里有只狗，只要它干净就行了。
examples.en: I don't mind having a dog in the house so long as it's clean.

examples.ch: 其实我不介意吃点东西。
examples.en: I wouldn't mind (= I would like) something to eat, if that's OK.

examples.ch: 请你将收音机的声音调小一些好吗？
examples.en: Would you mind turning (= please turn) your radio down a little please?

examples.ch: 你介意我打开电视吗？
examples.en: Do you mind if I (= may I) put the TV on?

examples.ch: 我抽烟你介意吗？
examples.en: Do you mind me smoking?

examples.ch: 我不介意你穿什么，只要不是那件难看的粉红色衬衫就好。
examples.en: I don't mind what you wear so long as it's not that awful pink shirt.

examples.ch: 如果你不反对，我宁愿今晚呆在家中。
examples.en: I'd rather stay in tonight, if you don't mind.

examples.ch: “你喝茶还是咖啡？”“随便──都可以。”
examples.en: "Would you like tea or coffee?" "I don't mind - either."

defines.trans_en: to be careful of, or give attention to something

examples.ch: 当心那只盒子——盒底不是很牢固。
examples.en: Mind that box - the bottom isn't very strong.

examples.ch: 当心站起来时头别撞到架子上。
examples.en: Mind (that) you don't bang your head on the shelf when you stand up.

examples.ch: 确保一定要带上足够的钱。
examples.en: Mind (= make certain that) you take enough money with you.

examples.ch: 注意你的措辞，小姐！
examples.en: Mind your language (= don't use swear words), young lady!

defines.trans_en: to take care of someone or something

examples.ch: 她问我她去买东西时我能否照看孩子们一个小时。
examples.en: She asked me if I'd mind the children for an hour while she went shopping.

examples.ch: 我去洗手间时你能照看一下我的包吗？
examples.en: Could you mind my bag for a moment while I go to the toilet?

defines.trans_en: to listen to and obey someone

examples.ch: 听你奶奶的话！
examples.en: Mind your grandma!

examples.ch: 这只狗不听话。
examples.en: This dog won't mind.

phrases.trans_ch: （对某人的言行表示恼火）你怎么回事？你别这样好不好？
phrases.trans_en: said to someone when you feel annoyed with that person for what they have just done or said

examples.ch: 你怎么回事？你坐了我的座位！
examples.en: Do you mind? That's my seat you're sitting on!

phrases.trans_en: used to tell someone to move or be careful, or to warn someone of danger

examples.ch: 当心！我们抬着担架过来了。
examples.en: Mind out! We're coming through with the stretcher.

examples.ch: 当她踩到他的脚时，他说：“嘿，当心！”
examples.en: "Hey, mind!" he said when she trod on his foot.

examples.ch: 走这段小路时要当心落石。
examples.en: Mind out for falling rocks on this part of the trail.

phrases.trans_en: said when you say goodbye to someone, meaning "take care"

defines.trans_ch: 我的（所有物）;属于我的（东西）;与我有关的（人）
defines.trans_en: the one(s) belonging to or connected with me

examples.ch: “这是谁的包？”“是我的。”
examples.en: "Whose bag is this?" "It's mine."

examples.ch: 你儿子的年纪和我儿子一样大。
examples.en: Your son is the same age as mine.

examples.ch: 她是我的一个老朋友。
examples.en: She's an old friend of mine.

examples.ch: 我的是这辆银色的，这辆敞篷车。
examples.en: Mine is the silver car, the convertible.

defines.trans_en: a hole or system of holes in the ground where substances such as coal, metal, and salt are removed

examples.ch: 煤／盐／金矿
examples.en: a coal/salt/gold mine

examples.ch: 矿井
examples.en: a mine shaft

examples.ch: 我祖父以前在矿井里工作。
examples.en: My grandfather used to work in (UK also down) the mines.

defines.trans_en: a type of bomb put below the earth or in the sea that explodes when vehicles, ships, or people go over it

examples.ch: 他的坦克触到了地雷，他被炸死了。
examples.en: He was killed when his tank ran over a mine.

examples.ch: 美国部队正在清除周围地区的地雷。
examples.en: The US forces were clearing the surrounding area of mines.

defines.trans_en: to dig coal or another substance out of the ground

examples.ch: 他们在开采盐。
examples.en: They're mining for salt.

examples.ch: 他们在这周围开采出许多铜。
examples.en: They mine a lot of copper around these parts.

defines.trans_en: to place or hide mines in an area of land or sea

examples.ch: 这片沙漠地雷密布。
examples.en: The desert was heavily mined.

defines.trans_ch: 旧时（度用在以元音或h字母开头的名词前，代替my使用）
defines.trans_en: used in the past instead of "my" before nouns that begin with a vowel or h

examples.ch: 我的眼睛
examples.en: mine eyes

examples.ch: 我的主人
examples.en: mine host

defines.trans_en: one of the 60 parts that an hour is divided into, consisting of 60 seconds

examples.ch: 乘公共汽车20分钟的车程
examples.en: a 20-minute bus ride

examples.ch: 我上班路上要花20分钟。
examples.en: It takes me 20 minutes to get to work.

examples.ch: 火车7点57分发车，我们最好提前几分钟到。
examples.en: The train leaves at three minutes to eight, so we'd better get there a few minutes before then.

defines.trans_en: used in spoken English to mean a very short time

examples.ch: 等一下——我去拿我的包。
examples.en: Hang on/Wait a minute - I just have to get my bag.

examples.ch: 稍等一下——我做完这个就来见你。
examples.en: Just a minute - I'll be with you when I've finished this.

examples.ch: 我很快就好了。
examples.en: I won't be a minute (= I will be ready soon).

examples.ch: 等你有空我想和你说句话。
examples.en: When you've got a minute, I'd like a brief word with you.

defines.trans_en: an official message from one person to another in an organization

examples.ch: 我刚从克拉克那里接到一份正式通告，批准再买6台电脑。
examples.en: I've just received a minute from Clark authorizing the purchase of six more computers.

defines.trans_en: any of the 60 parts that the degrees of any angle are divided into

phrases.trans_en: the written record of what was said at a meeting

examples.ch: 你能作一下会议记录吗，丹尼尔？
examples.en: Could you take/do (= write) the minutes, Daniel?

examples.ch: 上次开会的会议记录得到一致认可。
examples.en: The minutes of the last meeting were approved unanimously (= everyone agreed that they were correct).

defines.trans_ch: 把…写进议事录，把…写进会议记录
defines.trans_en: to make a written record of what is said at a meeting

examples.ch: 根据会议记录，董事长说利润已降到历史最低点。
examples.en: The chairman is minuted as having said that profits had fallen to an all-time low.

defines.trans_en: extremely small

examples.ch: 微量／少量
examples.en: a minute amount/quantity

examples.ch: 我从没见过手长得这么小的男人——他的手太小了！
examples.en: I've never seen a man with such tiny hands - they're minute!

examples.ch: 这部纪录片纤毫毕现地展示了一次眼科手术的过程。
examples.en: The documentary showed an eye operation in minute detail (= showing every small detail).

defines.trans_en: a piece of glass with a shiny, metal-covered back that reflects light, producing an image of whatever is in front of it

examples.ch: 浴室镜子
examples.en: the bathroom mirror

examples.ch: 她正看着自己在镜子中的模样。
examples.en: She was looking at her reflection in the mirror.

phrases.trans_ch: 是…的写照；是…的真实反映
phrases.trans_en: to represent or show something honestly

examples.ch: 这部电影真实地反映了战时英国的日常生活。
examples.en: The movie is a mirror of daily life in wartime Britain.

defines.trans_en: to represent something honestly

examples.ch: 我们的报纸旨在反映普通民众的意见。
examples.en: Our newspaper aims to mirror the opinions of ordinary people.

defines.trans_en: to be very similar to something

examples.ch: 她在银幕上的浪漫故事似乎与她的私人经历很相似。
examples.en: Her on-screen romances seem to mirror her experiences in her private life.

defines.trans_ch: 未做到；未体验；避开；幸免于
defines.trans_en: to fail to do or experience something, often something planned or expected, or to avoid doing or experiencing something

examples.ch: 我上课迟到了，因为我坐的公共汽车晚了。
examples.en: I missed the start of the class because my bus was late.

examples.ch: 我经常不吃早餐而早吃午饭。
examples.en: Often I miss (= do not eat) breakfast and have an early lunch instead.

examples.ch: 如果你想避开高峰时间，就该早些出发。
examples.en: You should leave early if you want to miss the rush hour.

examples.ch: 我今早差点被一辆公共汽车撞倒。
examples.en: I only just missed being run over by a bus this morning.

defines.trans_en: to arrive too late to get on a bus, train, or aircraft

examples.ch: 如果你不快点，会误了飞机的。
examples.en: You'll miss your flight if you don't hurry up.

defines.trans_en: to not go to something

examples.ch: 缺课严重的学生会很难赶上。
examples.en: Students who miss a lot of school can find it hard to catch up.

examples.ch: 我正要找个不去办公室聚会的接口。
examples.en: I'm trying to find an excuse for missing the office party.

defines.trans_en: to not see or hear something or someone

examples.ch: 我错过了演出的开头。
examples.en: I missed the beginning of the show.

examples.ch: 她最近的一部电影很好，不容错过。
examples.en: Her latest movie is too good to miss (= it certainly should be seen).

examples.ch: 很遗憾没有在帕特的派对上看到你——我准是在你离开后才到的。
examples.en: I was sorry I missed you at Pat's party - I must have arrived after you left.

defines.trans_en: to not notice someone or something

examples.ch: 你真是明察秋毫，是吧？别人都没有注意到那个错误。
examples.en: You don't miss much, do you? Nobody else noticed that mistake.

examples.ch: 我的办公室是右边的第一间，有一扇鲜红色的门。你不会找不到的。
examples.en: My office is first on the right with a bright red door. You can't miss it (= it is very easy to find).

defines.trans_en: to feel sad that a person or thing is not present

examples.ch: 她离开的时候我非常想念她。
examples.en: I really missed her when she went away.

examples.ch: 所有认识她的人都会很悲伤地怀念她的。
examples.en: She will be sadly missed by all who knew her.

examples.ch: 我仍惦念着我的旧汽车。
examples.en: I still miss my old car.

examples.ch: 你住在法国时最想念家乡的是什么？
examples.en: What did you miss most about home when you were living in France?

examples.ch: 出乎我的预料，我并没有老想着要抽烟。
examples.en: I haven't missed smoking like I expected to.

defines.trans_en: to fail to hit something, or to avoid hitting something

examples.ch: 子弹差几厘米就击中了他的心脏。
examples.en: The bullet missed his heart by a couple of centimetres.

examples.ch: 我为避开另一辆车急忙转向，差一点就撞到树上。
examples.en: I swerved to avoid the other car and only just missed a tree.

examples.ch: 他朝我扔了一本书，但没打中。
examples.en: He threw a book at me, but he/it missed.

defines.trans_ch: 发觉遗失；发觉…不在身边
defines.trans_en: to notice that something is lost or absent

examples.ch: 直到服务员拿来账单，他才发觉丢了钱包。
examples.en: He didn't miss his wallet until the waiter brought the bill.

defines.trans_en: an occasion when something or someone fails to hit something or avoids hitting something

examples.ch: 打得好！你8次击中得分，只有两次失误。
examples.en: Well done! You scored eight hits and only two misses.

defines.trans_en: a girl or young woman, especially one who behaves rudely or shows no respect

examples.ch: 你这个冒失的小姑娘！立刻道歉。
examples.en: You're a cheeky little miss! Apologize at once.

defines.trans_ch: （用在女孩或未婚女子名前作为称呼）小姐
defines.trans_en: a title used before the family name or full name of a single woman who has no other title

examples.ch: 卡特小姐，怀特医生现在就见你。
examples.en: Dr White will see you now, Miss Carter.

examples.ch: 海伦娜‧刘易斯小姐
examples.en: Miss Helena Lewis

defines.trans_ch: （作为对看上去没有结婚的女孩或青年女子的称呼）小姐
defines.trans_en: used as a form of address for a girl or young woman

examples.ch: 打扰了，小姐，你把这个东西掉地上了。
examples.en: Excuse me, Miss, you dropped this.

defines.trans_ch: （孩子有时对女教师的称呼）老师
defines.trans_en: sometimes used by children to address or refer to teachers who are women

examples.ch: 我能去厕所吗，老师？
examples.en: Can I go to the toilet, Miss?

defines.trans_en: a title given to a woman who wins a beauty contest, combined with the name of the place that she represents

examples.ch: 印度／英国小姐
examples.en: Miss India/UK

examples.ch: 世界小姐比赛
examples.en: the Miss World contest

phrases.trans_ch: 避开；对…不予理会；决定不做
phrases.trans_en: to avoid or not do something

examples.ch: 我们通常夏天去法国，但今年我们决定不去了。
examples.en: We usually go to France in the summer, but we've decided to give it a miss this year.

examples.ch: 这家餐馆鱼做得很好，但他们的素菜我不愿意吃。
examples.en: The restaurant's very good for fish, but I'd give their vegetarian options a miss.

phrases.trans_ch: 避开；对…不予理会；决定不做
phrases.trans_en: to avoid or not do something

examples.ch: 我们通常夏天去法国，但今年我们决定不去了。
examples.en: We usually go to France in the summer, but we've decided to give it a miss this year.

examples.ch: 这家餐馆鱼做得很好，但他们的素菜我不愿意吃。
examples.en: The restaurant's very good for fish, but I'd give their vegetarian options a miss.

defines.trans_en: an action, decision, or judgment that produces an unwanted or unintentional result

examples.ch: 我不是在责备你——我们都会犯错。
examples.en: I'm not blaming you - we all make mistakes.

examples.ch: 我们今晚来这儿是个错误。
examples.en: It was a mistake for us to come here tonight.

examples.ch: 这封信满是拼写错误。
examples.en: This letter's full of spelling mistakes.

examples.ch: 我在你的计算中发现了几个错误。
examples.en: I've discovered a few mistakes in your calculations.

examples.ch: 为什么逮捕我？一定是搞错了。
examples.en: Why am I under arrest? There must be some mistake.

phrases.trans_en: by accident

examples.ch: 我弄错了，把这张账单付了两次。
examples.en: I've paid this bill twice by mistake.

defines.trans_en: to be wrong about or to fail to recognize something or someone

examples.ch: 你不会认错他们的房子——正门是鲜黄色的。
examples.en: You can't mistake their house - it has a bright yellow front door.

examples.ch: 我把你的签名认错了，以为信是别人寄来的。
examples.en: I mistook your signature and thought the letter was from someone else.

defines.trans_en: moving or walking around freely

examples.ch: 你摔断了脚脖子，但用不了几个月你就可以行动自如了。
examples.en: You've broken your ankle but you'll be fully mobile within a couple of months.

examples.ch: 在关节痊愈时，保持关节活动是很重要的。
examples.en: It's important to keep the joint mobile while it heals.

defines.trans_en: able to be moved from one place to another

examples.ch: 他使用一个可移动的实验室
examples.en: He uses a mobile laboratory.

examples.ch: 流动医疗单位
examples.en: a mobile medical unit

defines.trans_ch: （服务）可以在手机（或小型计算机）上提供的
defines.trans_en: used to describe a service available on a mobile phone, small computer, etc.

examples.ch: 移动计算
examples.en: mobile computing

defines.trans_ch: 手机，移动电话（同 mobile phone）
defines.trans_en:
a 
mobile phone mainly UK

a 
mobile number mainly UK

examples.en: My mobile's 07796 10253.

defines.trans_ch: 风铃;（可随风摆动的）悬挂饰物
defines.trans_en: a decoration or work of art that has many parts that move freely in the air, for example hanging from threads
designed and made using the most recent ideas and methods

examples.ch: 现代技术／建筑／医学／艺术
examples.en: modern technology/architecture/medicine/art

examples.ch: 我们在车站对面那座非常现代化的大楼里。
examples.en: We're in the very modern-looking building opposite the station.

examples.ch: 考虑到我祖父的年龄的话，他的看法相当新潮。
examples.en: My grandpa's attitudes are very modern, considering his age.

defines.trans_en: of the present or recent times, especially the period of history since around 1500

examples.ch: 你如何看待宗教在现代社会中的角色？
examples.en: What do you think is the role of religion in the modern world?

defines.trans_en: a very short period of time

examples.ch: 你能等一下吗？
examples.en: Can you wait a moment?

examples.ch: 我一会儿就准备好。
examples.en: I'll be ready in just a moment.

examples.ch: 一辆车在门外停了下来，过了一会儿门铃就响了。
examples.en: A car drew up outside and a few moments later the doorbell rang.

examples.ch: 我预计她随时会来。
examples.en: I'm expecting her to come at any moment (= very soon).

examples.ch: 你有空吗？
examples.en: Have you got a moment (= are you busy or do you have time to speak to me)?

defines.trans_en: a particular time or occasion

examples.ch: 什么时候告诉家里人最好？
examples.en: When would be the best moment to tell the family?

examples.ch: 不要拖到最后一刻。
examples.en: Don't leave it to/till the last moment (= the latest time possible).

examples.ch: 如果你想私下和她谈谈，必须选好时机。
examples.en: If you want a private conversation with her you'll have to choose your moment (= find a suitable time).

examples.ch: 我一收到钱就会把票寄出。
examples.en: The moment (that) (= as soon as) I get the money I'll send the ticket.

phrases.trans_en: now

examples.ch: 对不起，她现在不在这儿。
examples.en: Sorry, she's not here at the moment.

phrases.trans_en: If you do something for the moment, you are doing it now, but might do something different in the future.

examples.ch: 我们暂时还是继续按照双方原来议定的去做吧。
examples.en: Let's keep doing what we agreed for the moment.

phrases.trans_en: now

examples.ch: 我现在不能提供任何信息。
examples.en: I can give no information at this precise moment in time.

phrases.trans_en: very important

examples.ch: 重大的决定
examples.en: a decision of great moment

defines.trans_en: coins or notes (= special pieces of paper) that are used to buy things, or an amount of these that a person has

examples.ch: “你带了多少钱？”“一共100欧元纸钞和一些硬币。”
examples.en: "How much money do you have on you?" "€100 in notes and a few coins."

examples.ch: 我们将钱投入到一个高息银行账户。
examples.en: We invested the money in a high-interest bank account.

examples.ch: 我想要买，但太贵了。
examples.en: I wanted to buy it but it cost too much money (= was too expensive).

examples.ch: 我们花了太多的钱重新装修房子，没有余钱去度假了。
examples.en: We spent so much money redecorating the house that we didn't have any left over for a holiday.

examples.ch: 你必须在银行兑换些钱。
examples.en: You'll have to change some money (= buy some foreign money) at the bank.

examples.ch: 你挣多少钱？
examples.en: How much money do you earn?

examples.ch: 他喜爱演戏，但并没有赚多少钱。
examples.en: He enjoyed acting but he wasn't making (= earning) much money.

examples.ch: 她的投资今年没有很大的回报。
examples.en: Her investments haven't made (= produced as profit) much money this year.

examples.ch: 他们做时装生意赚了大钱。
examples.en: They made their money (= became rich) in the fashion business.

examples.ch: 他想说服我投资那家公司。
examples.en: He tried to persuade me to put money into the company (= invest in the company).

examples.ch: 这间学校需要筹资购买操场设备。
examples.en: The school needs to raise (= collect) money for new playground equipment.

examples.ch: 尽量多存些钱以备度假之用。
examples.en: Try to save (= keep) some money for your holiday.

examples.ch: 我们通过使用志愿者来节省开支。
examples.en: We're saving (= not spending as much) money by using volunteers.

examples.ch: 我不喜欢那份工作，不过薪水不错。
examples.en: I didn't like the job, but the money (= amount of pay) was good.

examples.ch: 我们目前手头很紧。
examples.en: Money is tight/short (= we don't have much money) at the moment.

examples.ch: 我最近看牙花费很高，不过花得值，这样就不会有后患了。
examples.en: I had some very expensive dental treatment recently, but it was money well spent - it'll save me problems in the future.

phrases.trans_en: If you say that there is money in something, you mean that the activity will produce a profit.

examples.ch: 目前体育市场有利可图。
examples.en: There's money in sport these days.

examples.ch: 如果你帮助我们，你可以从中获利。
examples.en: If you help us, there's money in it for you.

defines.trans_en: an animal that lives in hot countries, has a long tail, and climbs trees. Monkeys are primates (= the group of animals that are most like humans) .
a child who behaves badly

examples.ch: 他们吃掉了所有的蛋糕，这些捣蛋鬼。
examples.en: They ate all the cakes, the monkeys.

examples.ch: 嘿，放下它，你这个小淘气！
examples.en: Hey, put that down, you little monkey!

defines.trans_en: a period of about four weeks, especially one of the twelve periods into which a year is divided

examples.ch: 我要在6月中旬至7月中旬离开一个月。
examples.en: I'll be away for a month from mid-June to mid-July.

examples.ch: 2月是最短的月份。
examples.en: February is the shortest month.

examples.ch: 两个月大的一只小狗
examples.en: a two-month-old puppy

examples.ch: 这项计划将在接下来的几个月中完成。
examples.en: The project will be finished in the next few months (= quite soon).

examples.ch: 他们已经有几个月没和我联系了。
examples.en: They haven't been in contact with me for months (= a long time).

examples.ch: 学生每年夏天有两个月的假期。
examples.en: Students have two months' vacation during the summer.

defines.trans_ch: 每月（的）;每月一次（的）;按月（的）
defines.trans_en: happening or produced once a month

examples.ch: 每月的付费
examples.en: monthly payments

examples.ch: 这些人大多数按月领薪。
examples.en: Most of these people are paid monthly.

defines.trans_en: a magazine that is published once a month
the shape made by the amount of the moon that you can see at a particular time

examples.ch: 今晚没有月亮。
examples.en: There's no moon (= you cannot see the moon) tonight.

examples.ch: 弦／满／新月
examples.en: a crescent/full/new moon

defines.trans_en: a similar round object that moves around another planet

examples.ch: 木星至少有16颗卫星。
examples.en: Jupiter has at least 16 moons.

phrases.trans_en: the round object that moves in the sky around the earth and can be seen at night

examples.ch: 月亮何时升起／落下？
examples.en: What time does the moon rise/set (= appear/disappear in the sky)?

defines.trans_ch: （为开玩笑或抗议，在公共场合）亮出光屁股
defines.trans_en: to show your naked bottom in public, as a joke or as a protest

examples.ch: 两个青少年男子因在公共场合向一名警察亮出光屁股而被捕，并被控不雅暴露。
examples.en: Two male juveniles were arrested and charged with indecent exposure after they mooned a police officer.

defines.trans_en: a larger or extra number or amount

examples.ch: 你想再要些吃的吗？
examples.en: Would you like some more food?

examples.ch: 医生们无法收治更多的病人了。
examples.en: The doctors can't cope with any more patients.
