examples.ch: 在调味汁里多加些奶油。
examples.en: Add some more cream to the sauce.

examples.ch: 你需要多听，少说！
examples.en: You need to listen more and talk less!

examples.ch: 住在首都的人比住在这个国家其他地区的人加起来还要多。
examples.en: More people live in the capital than in the whole of the rest of the country.

examples.ch: 在上一份工作中我们所花的时间比平时更多。
examples.en: We spent more time on the last job than usual.

examples.ch: 我实在无法忍受那种噪声了。
examples.en: The noise was more than I could bear.

examples.ch: 那比我期待的要有趣百倍。
examples.en: It was a hundred times more fun than I'd expected.

examples.ch: 与其说是小说家，不如说她是诗人。
examples.en: She's more of a poet than a novelist.

examples.ch: 尽可能多带些食物来，越多越好。
examples.en: Bring as much food as you can - the more, the better.

defines.trans_ch: （用以构成形容词和副词的比较级）更
defines.trans_en: used to form the comparative of many adjectives and adverbs

examples.ch: 她非常漂亮。
examples.en: She couldn't be more beautiful.

examples.ch: 让我们找一个更明智的方法来做这件事。
examples.en: Let's find a more sensible way of doing it.

examples.ch: 你大错特错了。
examples.en: You couldn't be more wrong.

examples.ch: 他感到物理比其他理科学科难得多。
examples.en: He finds physics far/much more difficult than other science subjects.

examples.ch: 演奏最后那一部分要更有激情。
examples.en: Play that last section more passionately.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调规模大）更大程度地，更大范围内
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize the large size of something

examples.ch: 两万多示威者涌进了广场。
examples.en: More than 20,000 demonstrators crowded into the square.

phrases.trans_en: increasingly

examples.ch: 越来越弄不懂现在发生的事情了。
examples.en: It gets more and more difficult to understand what is going on.

phrases.trans_en: used to say that when an action or event continues, there will be a particular result

examples.ch: 他喝得越多，就变得越狂暴。
examples.en: The more he drank, the more violent he became.

examples.ch: 他越是坚持自己是无辜的，他们似乎就越不相信他。
examples.en: The more he insisted he was innocent, the less they seemed to believe him.

defines.trans_en: the part of the day from the time when the sun rises or you wake up until the middle of the day or lunch time

examples.ch: 美丽的／阳光明媚的／多雨的上午
examples.en: a beautiful/sunny/wet morning

examples.ch: 我每周在书店工作3个上午。
examples.en: I work three mornings a week at the bookshop.

examples.ch: 她只在上午工作。
examples.en: She only works in the mornings.

examples.ch: 我们今天上午有什么安排？
examples.en: What's our schedule for this morning?

examples.ch: 请把时间约定在明天上午。
examples.en: I'd like an appointment for tomorrow morning, please.

examples.ch: 我星期六上午见你。
examples.en: I'll see you on Saturday morning.

examples.ch: 我在萨拉的聚会上喝得太多，第二天上午觉得很难受。
examples.en: I had too much to drink at Sarah's party, and I felt terrible the morning after.

phrases.trans_en: during the early part of the day

examples.ch: 我早晨听广播。
examples.en: I listen to the radio in the morning.

phrases.trans_en: at some time between twelve o'clock at night and twelve o'clock in the middle of the day

examples.ch: 谋杀发生在凌晨4点。
examples.en: The murder took place at four in the morning.

phrases.trans_en: the next morning

examples.ch: 她说第二天早上见你。
examples.en: She said she would see you in the morning.

defines.trans_en: a friendly way of greeting people when you meet them in the morning

examples.ch: 苏，早上好！你今天好吗？
examples.en: Morning, Sue! How are you today?

defines.trans_en: the biggest number or amount of; more than anything or anyone else

examples.ch: 纸牌游戏中你最多赢过多少？
examples.en: What's the most you've ever won at poker?

examples.ch: 你们中谁赚钱最多？
examples.en: Which of you earns the most money?

examples.ch: 他想用2000美元做尽可能多的好事，所以他把它捐给了慈善机构。
examples.en: He wanted to do the most good he could with the $2,000, so he gave it to charity.

examples.ch: 孩子们喜爱露天游乐场，但他们最喜欢的是碰碰车。
examples.en: The kids loved the fair, but they enjoyed the bumper cars most of all.

defines.trans_ch: （用于构成许多形容词和副词的最高级）最
defines.trans_en: used to form the superlative of many adjectives and adverbs

examples.ch: 乔安妮是我认识的人中最聪明的。
examples.en: Joanne is the most intelligent person I know.

examples.ch: 那个部门如果想使工作效率最大化，还需要添置三台电脑。
examples.en: The department needs three more computers in order to work most effectively (= to work as effectively as possible).

defines.trans_ch: 大多数（的），大部分（的）；几乎全部（的）
defines.trans_en: almost all

examples.ch: 我不吃肉，但几乎所有的鱼都喜欢吃。
examples.en: I don't eat meat, but I like most types of fish.

examples.ch: 在这所学校，大部分孩子来自华人社区。
examples.en: In this school, most of the children are from the Chinese community.

defines.trans_en: very

examples.ch: 那是个十分美丽的早晨。
examples.en: It was a most beautiful morning.

defines.trans_en: almost

examples.ch: 几乎每晚6点左右你都能在酒吧找到她。
examples.en: You'll find her in the bar most every evening about six o'clock.

phrases.trans_en: used when saying what is the largest possible amount or number

examples.ch: 这项工作最多要花一星期时间。
examples.en: At most, the work will take a week.

examples.ch: 应该是20美元左右，最多30美元。
examples.en: It should cost around $20, or $30 at the most.

phrases.trans_en: to take full advantage of something because it may not last long

examples.ch: 今天天气很好——我们一定要尽情享受一下。
examples.en: It's a beautiful day - we should make the most of it.

defines.trans_en: used to mean 'furthest'

examples.ch: 顿耐特亥德是英国大陆最北端。
examples.en: Dunnet Head is the northernmost part of the British mainland (= the part that is farther to the north than any other part).

defines.trans_en: a female parent

examples.ch: 我母亲结婚时21岁。
examples.en: My mother was 21 when she got married.

examples.ch: 所有的父母都被邀请参加期末音乐会。
examples.en: All the mothers and fathers had been invited to the end-of-term concert.

examples.ch: 小猫咪和它们的妈妈在同一个篮子里蜷曲着睡着了。
examples.en: The little kittens and their mother were all curled up asleep in the same basket.

examples.ch: 我能借你的车用用吗，妈妈？
examples.en: May I borrow your car, Mother?

defines.trans_ch: （对女修道院院长或较高职位修女的称呼）
defines.trans_en: the title of a woman who is in charge of, or who has a high rank within, a convent (= house of religious women)

examples.ch: 特雷莎修女
examples.en: Mother Theresa

examples.ch: 女修道院院长
examples.en: a mother superior

examples.ch: 早上好，院长。
examples.en: Good morning, Mother.

defines.trans_ch: 不要脸的家伙，混账东西（同 motherfucker）
defines.trans_en:
→ 
motherfucker
to treat a person with great kindness and love and to try to protect them from anything dangerous or difficult

examples.ch: 别再溺爱她了，她已经40岁了，可以照顾自己了。
examples.en: Stop mothering her - she's 40 years old and can take care of herself.

defines.trans_en: a motorcycle

examples.ch: 她跳上摩托车，沿路疾驶而去。
examples.en: She jumped on her motorbike and raced off down the road.

defines.trans_en: a wide road for fast-moving traffic, especially in the UK, Ireland, and some other countries, with a limited number of places at which drivers can enter and leave it

examples.ch: 由于天气恶劣，今晚在高速公路驾车可能会很危险。
examples.en: Because of the bad weather, motorway (driving) conditions are expected to be hazardous tonight.

defines.trans_en: a raised part of the earth's surface, much larger than a hill, the top of which might be covered in snow

examples.ch: 马特豪恩峰是欧洲最雄伟的山峰之一。
examples.en: The Matterhorn is one of the biggest mountains in Europe.

examples.ch: 落基山脉绵亘于美国西部。
examples.en: The Rockies are a mountain chain/range in the western United States.

examples.ch: 我想去爬山。
examples.en: I'd love to go mountain-climbing.

examples.ch: 我们要去山区度假。
examples.en: We're going to the mountains (= an area where there are mountains) for our holiday.

defines.trans_en: a large amount of food that is stored instead of being sold, so that prices for it do not fall

examples.ch: 大量积压的谷物
examples.en: a grain mountain

phrases.trans_en: a large amount of something

examples.ch: 我有大量的工作要做。
examples.en: I've got a mountain of work to do.

defines.trans_en: a small mammal with short fur, a pointed face, and a long tail

examples.ch: 田鼠
examples.en: a field mouse

examples.ch: 宠物鼠
examples.en: a pet mouse

defines.trans_en: a small device that you move across a surface in order to move a cursor on your computer screen
a shy, quiet, nervous person
the opening in the face of a person or animal, consisting of the lips and the space between them, or the space behind containing the teeth and the tongue

examples.ch: 张大嘴，说“啊”。
examples.en: Open your mouth wide and say "Ah".

examples.ch: 你不该一次把这么多食物塞入口中。
examples.en: You shouldn't put so much food in your mouth at once.

defines.trans_ch: （容器的）口;洞口;（江河的）入海口
defines.trans_en: the opening of a narrow container, the opening of a hole or cave, or the place where a river flows into the sea

examples.ch: 魁北克位于圣劳伦斯河口。
examples.en: Quebec is at the mouth of the St Lawrence River.

defines.trans_ch: 用口型默示;对口型假唱
defines.trans_en: to form words with the lips without making any sound

examples.ch: 在我看来，这些歌手好像只是在对口型假唱。
examples.en: It looks to me as if the singers are only mouthing the words .

examples.ch: “我们可以走了吗？”玛丽用口型默示道。
examples.en: "Can we go?" mouthed Mary.

defines.trans_en: to say something in a way that is not sincere

examples.ch: 我不想站在这儿听你没有诚意的道歉。
examples.en: I don't want to stand here listening to you mouthing apologies.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) change position

examples.ch: 我太冷了，手指都动不了了。
examples.en: I'm so cold I can't move my fingers.

examples.ch: 你能帮我把这张桌子搬到后面的房间里吗？
examples.en: Will you help me move this table to the back room?

examples.ch: 我们能将会议时间由下午两点改到三点半吗？
examples.en: Can we move (= change the time of) the meeting from 2 p.m. to 3.30 p.m. ?

examples.ch: 别动！就呆在那儿。
examples.en: Don't move! Stay right where you are.

examples.ch: 我好像听到楼上有人走动。
examples.en: I thought I could hear someone moving about/around upstairs.

examples.ch: 如果你往边上／往后／往前挪一点儿，特丝就能坐在我旁边了。
examples.en: If you move along/over/up (= go further to the side, back, or front) a little, Tess can sit next to me.

examples.ch: 事故现场的警官让路人走开。
examples.en: Police officers at the scene of the accident were asking people to move along/on (= to go to a different place).

examples.ch: 快点，我们该走了。
examples.en: Come on, it's time we were moving (= time for us to leave).

examples.ch: 我们今晚住这儿吧，明早再继续赶路。
examples.en: Let's stay here tonight, then move on (= continue our journey) tomorrow morning.

defines.trans_ch: （棋盘游戏中）走棋，走子，（棋子）被移动
defines.trans_en: to change the position of one of the pieces used in a board game

examples.ch: 下棋必须按棋规所定的方向走子。
examples.en: In chess, the pieces can only move in certain directions.

defines.trans_en: to go to a different place to live or work

examples.ch: 我们要搬到巴黎去了。
examples.en: We're moving to Paris.

examples.ch: 他们买了套新房子，但搬进去之前还有许多工作要做。
examples.en: They've bought a new house, but it will need a lot of work before they can move into it/move in.

examples.ch: 我听说葆拉搬去和她男朋友住了。
examples.en: I hear Paula has moved in with her boyfriend (= gone to live in his house).

examples.ch: 隔壁的那对夫妇去年搬走了。
examples.en: The couple next door moved away (= went to live somewhere else) last year.

examples.ch: 许多企业因为费用太高而迁出了伦敦。
examples.en: A lot of businesses are moving out of London because it's too expensive.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) progress, change, or happen in a particular way or direction

examples.ch: 法官的决定将使诉讼得以继续进行。
examples.en: The judge's decision will allow the case to move forward.

examples.ch: 如果你想在事业上有所发展，就必须更努力地工作。
examples.en: If you want to move ahead in your career, you'll have to work harder.

examples.ch: 昨天股价缓慢上涨／下跌。
examples.en: Share prices moved up/down slowly yesterday.

examples.ch: 索菲在学校里跳／留了一级。
examples.en: Sophie has been moved up/down a grade at school.

examples.ch: 这家公司该实行数字化了。
examples.en: It's time this company moved into (= started to take advantage of the benefits of) the digital age.

defines.trans_en: to cause someone to take action

examples.ch: 我想象不出是什么促使他说了这种话。
examples.en: I can't imagine what could have moved him to say such a thing.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) change an opinion or the way in which you live or work

examples.ch: 他决心已定，你说什么也不能改变他对这件事的看法。
examples.en: He's made up his mind, and nothing you can say will move him on the issue.

examples.ch: 越来越多的人不再是／正成为素食主义者。
examples.en: More and more people are movingaway from/towards vegetarianism.

defines.trans_en: to cause someone to have strong feelings, such as sadness, sympathy, happiness, or admiration

examples.ch: 她说她被收到的所有慰问信深深打动了。
examples.en: She said that she was deeply moved by all the letters of sympathy she had received.

examples.ch: 这部电影十分伤感，令他落泪。
examples.en: It was such a sad film that it moved him to tears (= made him cry).

defines.trans_en: to sell

examples.ch: 没人想买这些玩具——根本就卖不出去。
examples.en: No one wants to buy these toys - we just can't move them.

examples.ch: 这种新洗发水销得很快。
examples.en: This new shampoo is moving really fast.

defines.trans_en: to spend time with people

examples.ch: 她的社交圈子很小。
examples.en: She moves in/among a very small circle of people.

defines.trans_ch: （在会议上）提出;提议;（向法庭）提出请求，申请
defines.trans_en: to suggest something, especially formally at a meeting or in a law court

examples.ch: 正要开始表决，有人站起来说他们想提出修正案。
examples.en: A vote was just about to be taken when someone stood up and said that they wished to move an amendment.

examples.ch: 我提议接受这项建议。
examples.en: I move that the proposal be accepted.

examples.ch: 尊敬的法官大人，我们请求驳回这些指控。
examples.en: Your Honour, we wish to move for dismissal of the charges.

defines.trans_ch: （尤为医护人员用语）（使）（肠道）排泄粪便
defines.trans_en: (used especially by doctors and nurses) to pass the contents of the bowels out of the body

examples.ch: 医生问他那天是否排过便。
examples.en: The doctor asked him if he'd moved his bowels that day.

phrases.trans_en: to leave your home in order to live in a new one

examples.ch: 我们下周要搬家。
examples.en: We're moving house next week.

defines.trans_en: an act of moving

examples.ch: 她拿着枪对着他的头，说：“动一下你就没命了。”
examples.en: She held the gun to his head and said, "One move and you're dead!"

examples.ch: 我讨厌老板总是监视我的一举一动。
examples.en: I hate the way my boss watches my every move (= watches everything I do).

defines.trans_ch: 一步棋；（按规则）棋的可走方法
defines.trans_en: in some board games, a change of the position of one of the pieces used to play the game, or a change of position that is allowed by the rules, or a player's turn to move their piece

examples.ch: 要学会棋的各种走法需要花很长时间。
examples.en: It takes a long time to learn all the moves in chess.

examples.ch: 该你走棋了。
examples.en: It's your move.

defines.trans_en: an occasion when you go to live or work in a different place

examples.ch: 我们3年里搬了4次家。
examples.en: We've had four moves in three years.

defines.trans_en: an action taken to achieve something

examples.ch: 买那些股票是明智之举。
examples.en: Buying those shares was a good move.

examples.ch: 这项改善保育设施的措施受到广泛欢迎。
examples.en: This move towards improving childcare facilities has been widely welcomed.

examples.ch: 市议会正采取措施改善市区交通状况。
examples.en: The city council is making a move to improve traffic flow in the city.

phrases.trans_en: to be the first to take action

examples.ch: 双方似乎都不愿为达成和平协议而率先迈出一步。
examples.en: Neither side seems prepared to make the first move towards reaching a peace agreement.

phrases.trans_en: to start a romantic or sexual relationship with someone

examples.ch: 她喜欢他很长时间了，但不想主动追求他。
examples.en: She's liked him for a long time, but doesn't want to make the first move.

defines.trans_en: an electronic device or a computer program for playing music that has been stored as MP3 files

defines.trans_ch: （用在男子的姓、姓名或职务之前）先生
defines.trans_en: a title used before the family name or full name of a man who has no other title, or when talking to man who holds a particular official position

examples.ch: 琼斯先生／戴维•琼斯先生
examples.en: Mr Jones/Mr David Jones

examples.ch: 下午好，道森先生。
examples.en: Good afternoon, Mr Dawson.

examples.ch: 我们在找一位名叫乔治•史密斯的先生。
examples.en: We're looking for a Mr (= a man called) George Smith.

examples.ch: 很荣幸您今天能来，总统先生。
examples.en: It's an honour to have you here today, Mr President.

defines.trans_ch: （用以表示某男子是某一品质、活动或地方的典型代表）
defines.trans_en: used when expressing the idea that a man is typical of or represents a quality, activity, or place

examples.ch: 她仍在期待遇到如意郎君。
examples.en: She's still hoping to meet Mr Right (= the perfect man).

examples.ch: 他自认是个大人物。
examples.en: He thinks he's Mr Big (= someone very important).

defines.trans_ch: （用在已婚妇女的姓或姓名之前）夫人，太太
defines.trans_en: a title used before the family name or full name of a married woman who has no other title

examples.ch: 伍德太太／琼•伍德太太
examples.en: Mrs Wood/Mrs Jean Wood

examples.ch: 你好，格兰特夫人，你今天怎么样？
examples.en: Hello, Mrs Grant, how are you today?

defines.trans_ch: （用以表示某已婚女士是某一品质、活动或地方的典型代表）
defines.trans_en: used when expressing the idea that a woman is typical of or represents a quality, activity, or place

examples.ch: 平凡女子
examples.en: Mrs Average (= a woman who is typical of an ordinary woman)

defines.trans_en:
written abbreviation for
manuscript

defines.trans_ch: （用于婚姻状况不明或不愿提及婚姻状况的女子的姓或姓名之前）女士
defines.trans_en: a title used before the family name or full name of a woman, used to avoid saying if she is married or not

examples.ch: 希尔女士／葆拉•希尔女士
examples.en: Ms Hill/Ms Paula Hill

examples.ch: 有什么需要我帮忙吗，伍德女士？
examples.en: What can I do for you, Ms Wood?

defines.trans_ch: 多发性硬化（multiple sclerosis的缩写）
defines.trans_en:
abbreviation for
multiple sclerosis

defines.trans_ch: 理科硕士学位;理科硕士（Master of Science的缩写）
defines.trans_en:
abbreviation for 
Master of Science

defines.trans_ch: （美国）密西西比州（写地址时Mississippi的缩写）
defines.trans_en: written abbreviation for the US state of Mississippi: used in addresses
a large amount or to a large degree

examples.ch: 我赚钱不多。
examples.en: I don't earn much money.

examples.ch: 你说得不多，琼——你怎么想？
examples.en: You haven't said much, Joan - what do you think?

examples.ch: 我非常喜欢她。
examples.en: I like her very much.

examples.ch: 我认为赶更早的航班没什么好处。
examples.en: I don't think there's much to be gained by catching an earlier flight.

examples.ch: 孩子们吃得不多，但他们看上去很健康。
examples.en: The children never eat (very) much, but they seem healthy.

examples.ch: “还有酒吗？”“不多了。”
examples.en: "Is there any wine left?" "Not much."

examples.ch: 这里没太多事可做。
examples.en: There's not/nothing much to do around here.

examples.ch: 你的咖啡里要放多少糖？
examples.en: How much (= what amount of) sugar do you take in your coffee?

examples.ch: 这双鞋子多少钱？
examples.en: How much do these shoes cost?

examples.ch: 我在衣服上花钱太多了。
examples.en: I spend too much on clothes.

examples.ch: 我没有足够的时间拜访朋友。
examples.en: I don't have as much time as (= I have less time than) I would like for visiting my friends.

examples.ch: 因为下雨，我们没能在海滩上呆多久。
examples.en: Because of the rain, we weren't able to spend much of the day on the beach.

examples.ch: 你最近常见到波莉／听到波莉的消息吗？
examples.en: Have you seen much of Polly (= often seen her) recently?

examples.ch: 我真想找个时间去拜访他们。
examples.en: I'd very much like to visit them sometime.

examples.ch: 希望有一天我能报答你。
examples.en: One day I hope I'll be able to do as much (= the same amount) for you as you've done for me.

examples.ch: 这里的情况没什么变化。
examples.en: Things around here are much as always/as usual (= have not changed a lot).

examples.ch: 这两所学校非常相似。
examples.en: The two schools are much the same (= very similar).

examples.ch: 令我们大为惊讶的是，他们接受了我们的出价。
examples.en: Much to our surprise, (= we were very surprised that) they accepted our offer.

examples.ch: 我不太擅长编织。
examples.en: I'm not much good at knitting (= do not do it very well).

examples.ch: 这是个经常讨论的问题。
examples.en: This is a much (= often) discussed issue.

examples.ch: 遭遇车祸后，布赖克好像变成了另一个人。
examples.en: Blake has become a much (= greatly) changed person since his car accident.

examples.ch: 自从开始吃素后，我感觉健康多了。
examples.en: I've been feeling much healthier (= a lot more healthy) since I became a vegetarian.

examples.ch: 修车费比我们预料的贵得多。
examples.en: The repairs to our car cost much more than we were expecting.

examples.ch: 我很清楚这个问题。
examples.en: I'm very much aware of the problem.

examples.ch: 她无疑是这个职位的最佳人选。
examples.en: She's much the best person for the job (= she is certainly better than everyone else).

examples.ch: 我宁愿在家中生孩子，而不是去医院。
examples.en: I would much rather have my baby at home than in hospital.

examples.ch: 她既是我的母亲，又是我的朋友。
examples.en: She is as much a friend to me as a mother (= although she is my mother, she is also a friend).

defines.trans_ch: （用在否定句末表示相反的意思）
defines.trans_en: used at the end of a sentence to emphasize what you have just said

examples.ch: 当他看到我盘子里满满的食物时，问道：不饿了吧？
examples.en: When he saw all the food on my plate, he said "Hungry much?"

phrases.trans_en: a far larger amount of something than you want or need

examples.ch: 你喝得实在太多了，不能驾车。
examples.en: You've drunk much too much to drive.

phrases.trans_en: more than someone can deal with

examples.ch: 我这个年纪照顾不了6个孩子——太多了。
examples.en: I can't take care of six children at my age - it's too much.

phrases.trans_en: too extreme or not reasonable

examples.ch: 想让我把所有清扫的活儿都干了——你是不是太过分了。
examples.en: I think it's a bit much for you to expect me to do all the cleaning.

examples.ch: 她身穿昂贵的外套，戴着钻石首饰，在这样随意的餐馆显得过分了。
examples.en: She wore an expensive suit and diamonds, which was a bit much for such a casual restaurant.

defines.trans_ch: 优秀的事物;了不起，十分出色
defines.trans_en: (something) of good quality

examples.ch: 他长相不怎么好看，但性格很好。
examples.en: He's not much to look at, but he has a wonderful personality.

examples.ch: 我对舞蹈从不在行。
examples.en: I've never been much of a dancer (= good at dancing, or interested in doing it).

examples.ch: 今晚电视上没什么好看的。
examples.en: There's not/nothing much on TV tonight.

defines.trans_en: a mother

examples.ch: 我会问我妈妈我可不可以去。
examples.en: I'll ask my mum if I can go.

examples.ch: “生日快乐，妈妈。”
examples.en: Happy birthday, Mum .

examples.ch: 年末，所有的父母都获邀请到学校看演出。
examples.en: All the mums and dads are invited to the school play at the end of the year.

examples.ch: 她喜欢当妈妈。
examples.en: She loves being a mum.

phrases.trans_en: to say nothing about a subject

examples.ch: 这还不是正式的，所以不要讲出去。
examples.en: It's not official yet, so keep mum .

defines.trans_en: a building where objects of historical, scientific, or artistic interest are kept

examples.ch: 现代艺术博物馆
examples.en: a museum of modern art

examples.ch: 自然历史博物馆
examples.en: the Natural History Museum

defines.trans_en: a pattern of sounds made by musical instruments, voices, or computers, or a combination of these, intended to give pleasure to people listening to it

examples.ch: 古典音乐／流行音乐／舞曲／摇滚音乐
examples.en: classical/pop/dance/rock music

examples.ch: 一曲优美的音乐
examples.en: a beautiful piece of music

examples.ch: 你听什么样的音乐？
examples.en: What kind of music do you listen to?

examples.ch: 这家电台播放的音乐很好听。
examples.en: They play good music on this (radio) station.

examples.ch: 我就是喜欢唱歌奏乐。
examples.en: I just like making music (= playing an instrument or singing).

examples.ch: 我放点音乐好吗？
examples.en: Shall I put on some music (= play a recording)?

defines.trans_en: the art or study of music

examples.ch: 我上大学时学的是音乐。
examples.en: I studied music at college.

examples.ch: 音乐行业／产业
examples.en: the music business/industry

examples.ch: 音乐课
examples.en: music lessons

defines.trans_en: the written system of symbols representing musical notes

examples.ch: 你识乐谱吗？
examples.en: Can you read music?

defines.trans_en: someone who is skilled in playing music, usually as a job

examples.ch: 这场音乐会云集了各国的舞蹈家和音乐家。
examples.en: The concert features dancers and musicians of all nationalities.

defines.trans_en: used to show that it is necessary or very important that something happens in the present or future

examples.ch: 肉必须完全煮熟。
examples.en: Meat must be cooked thoroughly.

examples.ch: 我必须睡会儿觉了。
examples.en: I must get some sleep.

examples.ch: 你不许把这封信给其他人看。
examples.en: You mustn't show this letter to anyone else.

examples.ch: 行李不能无人看管。
examples.en: Luggage must not be left unattended (= it is against the rules).

examples.ch: 你非得走这么早吗？
examples.en: Must you leave so soon?

examples.ch: “我必须在这上面签字吗？”“是的，必须。”
examples.en: "Must I sign this?" "Yes, you must."

defines.trans_en: If you say that you must do something, you mean that you strongly intend to do something in the future.

examples.ch: 我一定要给我妹妹打个电话。
examples.en: I must phone my sister.

examples.ch: 我们一定要找人修修那个轮子。
examples.en: We must get someone to fix that wheel.

examples.ch: 我一定不咬指甲了。
examples.en: I mustn't bite my nails.

defines.trans_en: used for emphasis

examples.ch: 我得说，你看上去好极了。
examples.en: I must say, you look absolutely great.

examples.ch: 我必须承认，我并不是很期待这件事情。
examples.en: I must admit, I wasn't looking forward to it.

defines.trans_en: If you tell someone else that they must do something pleasant, you are emphasizing that you think it is a good idea to do that.

examples.ch: 你一定要来和我们一起度周末。
examples.en: You must come and stay with us one weekend.

examples.ch: 我们一定要快快找个日子相约吃个午饭。
examples.en: We must meet for lunch soon.

defines.trans_en: used to show that something is very likely, probable, or certain to be true

examples.ch: 哈里开了一天车，他一定累了。
examples.en: Harry's been driving all day - he must be tired.

examples.ch: 没剩什么食物了，想必我们全吃光了。
examples.en: There's no food left - we must have eaten it all.

examples.ch: 那天你在森林里迷路了，一定很害怕吧。
examples.en: When you got lost in the forest you must have been very frightened.

examples.ch: “你一定认识弗兰克。”“不，我不认识。”
examples.en: "You must know Frank." "No, I don't."

defines.trans_en: something that is necessary

examples.ch: 如果你住在乡下，汽车是必不可少的。
examples.en: If you live in the country a car is a must.

phrases.trans_en: something that is so good, you must do it, have it, or see it

examples.ch: 羊绒围巾是本季的必备品。
examples.en: The cashmere scarf is this season's must-have.

examples.ch: 这部电影娱乐性还不错，但肯定不是非看不可的。
examples.en: It's a moderately entertaining film but it's certainly not a must-see.

defines.trans_en: of or belonging to me (= the speaker or writer)

examples.ch: 我的父母
examples.en: my parents

examples.ch: 我的脚
examples.en: my feet

examples.ch: 我的名字
examples.en: my name

examples.ch: 我的夹克
examples.en: my jacket

examples.ch: 这不是我的错。
examples.en: It wasn't my fault.

examples.ch: 我要她还书她感到相当惊讶。
examples.en: She was somewhat surprised at my asking (= that I asked) for the book to be returned.

defines.trans_ch: （用于名词前，构成表示爱、礼貌或幽默语气的称呼语）
defines.trans_en: used in front of a noun as a way of expressing love or as a polite or humorous form of address

examples.ch: 我亲爱的！
examples.en: My darling!

examples.ch: 你需要帮助吗，亲爱的？
examples.en: Do you want any help, my dear?

defines.trans_ch: 我的网页的（指网页上可选择的部分，只显示个人认为重要的信息）
defines.trans_en: relating to a part of some websites where you can choose to see only the information that is important to you

phrases.trans_en: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with me and no one else

examples.ch: 我想要一辆我自己的小汽车。
examples.en: I want my own car.

examples.ch: 那是我自己的决定。
examples.en: It was my own decision.

examples.ch: 这个蛋糕完全是我自己做的。
examples.en: This cake is all my own work (= I made it without help).

defines.trans_en: used to express surprise or pleasure

examples.ch: 噢，多么美味的食物啊！
examples.en: My, what delicious food!

examples.ch: 哎呀，天哪，多忙的一天啊！
examples.en: My, oh, my, what a busy day!

defines.trans_en: used when the subject of the verb is "I" and the object is the same person

examples.ch: 我为自己买了一件新外套。
examples.en: I bought myself a new coat.

examples.ch: 我在镜子中瞧见了自己。
examples.en: I caught sight of myself in the mirror.

examples.ch: 是啊，我自己思忖着，是该休个假了。
examples.en: Yes, I thought to myself, it's time to take a holiday.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调主语）我自己，我本人
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize "I" as the subject of a sentence

examples.ch: 我本人不喜欢午饭时吃很多。
examples.en: I myself don't like a heavy meal at lunchtime.

examples.ch: 我自己不喜欢午饭时吃很多。
examples.en: I don't like a heavy meal at lunchtime myself.

defines.trans_en: used instead of "I" or "me"

examples.ch: 我和丈夫收到这份礼物都很高兴。
examples.en: My husband and myself were delighted with the gift.

examples.ch: 他们盛情邀请我姐姐和我参加开幕式。
examples.en: They very kindly invited my sister and myself to the inauguration.

phrases.trans_en: alone or without help from anyone else

examples.ch: 我自己单独住。
examples.en: I live by myself .

examples.ch: 我不得不独立完成所有的工作。
examples.en: I had to do the whole job all by myself .

phrases.trans_en: for my use only

examples.ch: 我从没有属于自己的一个小时的时间。
examples.en: I never get an hour to myself.

phrases.trans_en: not to be, seem, or feel as happy or as healthy as usual

examples.ch: 我最近觉得身体不适，去看了病。
examples.en: I went to see the doctor because I haven't been feeling myself lately.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于身体不适时指自己的精神状态）
phrases.trans_en: used when describing your state of mind when you are physically ill

examples.ch: 我精神状态很好——只是这头痛的毛病一直没好。
examples.en: I'm well enough in myself (= happy) - I've just got this nagging headache.

defines.trans_en: the word or words that a person, thing, or place is known by

examples.ch: “嗨！你叫甚么名字？”“我叫黛安娜。”
examples.en: "Hi, what's your name?" "My name's Diane."

examples.ch: 请在表格上填写全名和地址。
examples.en: Please write your full (= complete) name and address on the form.

examples.ch: 远处那座山叫什么名字？
examples.en: What's the name of that mountain in the distance?

examples.ch: 最终我们一致同意给儿子取名卢卡。
examples.en: We finally agreed on the name Luca for our son.

examples.ch: 学生按照姓名和国籍登记入册。
examples.en: The students were listed by name and by country of origin.

defines.trans_en: the opinion or reputation that someone or something has

examples.ch: 为了澄清名誉，她走上法庭。
examples.en: She went to court to clear her name (= prove that the bad things said about her were not true).

examples.ch: 球迷当时的行为使得我们的球队在青年超级联赛上声名狼藉。
examples.en: The fans' actions gave our team a bad name in the youth league at that time.

examples.ch: 他们在努力挽回制造商的声誉。
examples.en: They're trying to restore the good name of the manufacturer.

defines.trans_en: someone who is famous or has a good reputation

examples.ch: 看来好像足球界的大人物都聚集在那里。
examples.en: It seemed like all the big names in football were there.

phrases.trans_en: called

examples.ch: 我需要和一位叫宾‧赛义德的教授谈谈。
examples.en: I need to talk to a professor by the name of Bin Said.

phrases.text: go by the name of sth
phrases.trans_en: to give yourself a name that is not your real name

examples.ch: 在商界他使用 J‧沃尔特‧福琼这个假名。
examples.en: In the business world he goes by the name of J. Walter Fortune.

phrases.trans_ch: 以（某人）的名义;在（某人）名下
phrases.trans_en: for someone or belonging to someone

examples.ch: 我来取票——昨天我打电话来用特雷敏的名字订的。
examples.en: I'm here to pick up my tickets - I reserved them by phone yesterday in the name of Tremin.

examples.ch: 这房子归于我妻子名下。
examples.en: The house is in my wife's name.

defines.trans_en: to give someone or something a name

examples.ch: 我们给狗分别取名为“尚迪”和“美女”。
examples.en: We named our dogs Shandy and Belle.

examples.ch: 一个名叫丹尼斯的男子来开了门。
examples.en: A man named Dennis answered the door.

defines.trans_en: to say what something or someone's name is

examples.ch: 在第一题中，你必须说出3种猴子的名称。
examples.en: In the first question you had to name three types of monkey.

examples.ch: 他说不出攻击自己的人的名字。
examples.en: He couldn't name his attacker.

defines.trans_en: to choose someone or something

examples.ch: 你说时间好了，我一定准时到那里。
examples.en: Just name the time and I'll be there.

examples.ch: 开出你的条件／条款／价钱。
examples.en: Name your conditions/terms/price.

examples.ch: 马丁内斯女士已被选定为新的民主党候选人。
examples.en: Ms Martinez has been named (as) the new Democratic candidate.

defines.trans_en: relating to or typical of a whole country and its people, rather than to part of that country or to other countries

examples.ch: 全国性假日
examples.en: a national holiday

examples.ch: 英国有十多种全国性报纸。
examples.en: Britain has more than ten national newspapers.

examples.ch: 这家公司国内的总部设在罗马。
examples.en: The company's national headquarters is in Rome.

examples.ch: 孩子们身穿传统的民族服装。
examples.en: The children were wearing traditional national costume/dress.

examples.ch: 政府认为，现在增税对国家不利。
examples.en: The government's view is that raising taxes now would not be in the national interest (= would not be good for the country).

defines.trans_en: someone who officially belongs to a particular country

examples.ch: 在昨天的空难中有30人丧生，包括6名墨西哥公民。
examples.en: 30 people, including six Mexican nationals, were killed in yesterday's plane crash.

examples.ch: 内战爆发后所有外国公民都被建议离开该国。
examples.en: All foreign nationals were advised to leave the country following the outbreak of civil war.

defines.trans_en: the official right to belong to a particular country

examples.ch: 她拥有英国国籍。
examples.en: She has British nationality.

examples.ch: 你是哪国人？
examples.en: What nationality are you?

defines.trans_en: a group of people of the same race, religion, traditions, etc.

examples.ch: 这所国际学校里有来自46个不同民族的学生。
examples.en: At the International School they have pupils of 46 different nationalities.

defines.trans_en: all the animals, plants, rocks, etc. in the world and all the features, forces, and processes that happen or exist independently of people, such as the weather, the sea, mountains, the production of young animals or plants, and growth

examples.ch: 她对自然界的热爱
examples.en: her love of nature

examples.ch: 这种人工培育细胞的新技术是模仿自然界实际发生的现象。
examples.en: This new technique of artificially growing cells copies what actually happens in nature.

examples.ch: 自然类文章／书籍／节目
examples.en: a nature article/book/programme

defines.trans_en: the type or main characteristic of something

examples.ch: 他究竟想问什么？
examples.en: What was the nature of his inquiry?

examples.ch: 赛车本质上是一项危险运动。
examples.en: Motor-racing is by nature a dangerous sport.

defines.trans_en: a person's character

examples.ch: 朱丽安娜小时候性格非常敏感。
examples.en: As a child, Juliana had a very sensitive nature.

examples.ch: 她本性并不好斗。
examples.en: It's not really in her nature to be aggressive.

examples.ch: 他生性懒惰。
examples.en: He is by nature inclined to be lazy.

phrases.trans_en: the force that is responsible for physical life and that is sometimes spoken of as a person

examples.ch: 感觉疲惫不堪是身体在提醒你该休息了。
examples.en: Feeling tired-out is Nature's way of telling you to rest.

examples.ch: 自然赋予这些微生物在食物充足时快速繁殖的能力。
examples.en: Nature gave these tiny creatures the ability to reproduce quickly when food is abundant.

phrases.text: be in the nature of things
phrases.trans_ch: 是正常的，是理所当然的
phrases.trans_en: to be usual and expected

examples.ch: 每段感情都难免会出现问题——这是必然的。
examples.en: There are problems in every relationship - it's in the nature of things.

defines.trans_en: not far away in distance

examples.ch: 这附近有餐馆吗？
examples.en: Is there a restaurant near here?

examples.ch: 请给我一个靠窗的座位。
examples.en: I'd like to sit near a window, please.

examples.ch: 别离我太近——我会把感冒传染给你的。
examples.en: Don't come too near me - you might catch my cold.

examples.ch: 酒店离机场不远。
examples.en: The hotel is near the airport.

examples.ch: 哪个汽车站离你家最近？
examples.en: Which bus stop is nearest (to) your house?

examples.ch: 我站的位置刚好能听清他们在说什么。
examples.en: I was standing just near enough to hear what they were saying.

defines.trans_en: not far away in time

examples.ch: 随着手术日期的日益临近，他变得越来越焦虑了。
examples.en: As the date of his operation drew near, he became more and more anxious.

examples.ch: 到时候我们再决定走哪条路线。
examples.en: We can decide which route to take nearer the time.

defines.trans_en: almost in a particular state, or condition

examples.ch: 赛跑的人看起来快要筋疲力尽了。
examples.en: The runners looked near exhaustion.

examples.ch: 电影演到一个地方时我差点儿哭出来。
examples.en: I was near (to) tears (= almost cried) at one point during the film.

phrases.trans_ch: （距离、时间、数量或质量）远远没有，远非
phrases.trans_en: not close in distance, time, amount, or quality

examples.ch: 这座房子离海边很远。
examples.en: The house was nowhere near the beach.

examples.ch: 离我们走的时间还早呢。
examples.en: It's nowhere near time for us to leave yet.

examples.ch: 我读完这本书还早着呢——我才看完一半。
examples.en: I'm nowhere near finishing the book - I'm only half-way through it.

examples.ch: 他比他姐姐矮多了。
examples.en: He's nowhere near as tall as his sister.

phrases.trans_en: almost

examples.ch: 他们年龄相仿。
examples.en: They're the same age or near enough.

defines.trans_ch: （距离、时间、特性或质量）近的，接近的
defines.trans_en: not far away in distance, time, characteristics, or quality

examples.ch: 最近的邮局在哪里？
examples.en: Where's the nearest post office?

examples.ch: 我的小折刀是我身上最近似武器的东西了。
examples.en: My pocket knife is the nearest thing (= the most similar thing) to a weapon that I have.

examples.ch: 我买不到奶油奶酪，所以就买了能找到的最近似的替代品。
examples.en: I couldn't get any cream cheese so I bought the nearest equivalent (= the most similar thing) that I could find.

defines.trans_en: Your near relatives are people who are closely related to you, such as your parents, brothers, or sisters.

phrases.trans_en: at a time that is not far away

examples.ch: 我们所有的电脑设备在不久的将来会被更换。
examples.en: All our computer equipment will be replaced in the near future.

defines.trans_en: to get close to something in distance, time, or state

examples.ch: 我很高兴地宣布这项工程即将竣工。
examples.en: I'm pleased to say the project is nearing completion.

examples.ch: 随着婚期日益临近，我开始对结婚犹豫起来。
examples.en: As the wedding day neared, I started to have second thoughts about getting married.

examples.ch: 当我们靠近机场时机长打开了安全带信号灯。
examples.en: The captain switched on the seat belt sign as we neared the airport.

defines.trans_ch: （与形容词和名词连用）几乎，差不多
defines.trans_en: combines with adjectives and nouns to mean "almost"

examples.ch: 我们今天上午险些出了车祸！
examples.en: We had a near-disaster this morning in the car!

examples.ch: 我到那儿的时候，她近乎歇斯底里了。
examples.en: She was near-hysterical by the time I arrived there.

defines.trans_en: almost, or not completely

examples.ch: 从我上次理发到现在已经快3个月了。
examples.en: It's been nearly three months since my last haircut.

examples.ch: 你借给我的那本书我快要读完了。
examples.en: I've nearly finished that book you lent me.

examples.ch: 她现在几乎和她父亲一样高了。
examples.en: She's nearly as tall as her father now.

examples.ch: 他们已经把东西吃得所剩无几了。
examples.en: They'd eaten nearly everything.

examples.ch: 太有意思了——我们差点儿笑死。
examples.en: It was so funny - we nearly died laughing.

phrases.trans_en: a lot less

examples.ch: 她远没有你形容的那么漂亮。
examples.en: She's not nearly as beautiful as you said she was.

examples.ch: 我的感冒好多了。
examples.en: My cold isn't nearly so bad as it was.

phrases.trans_en: much less than you want or need

examples.ch: 食物远不够这么多人吃！
examples.en: There's not nearly enough food for all these people!

defines.trans_en: the part of the body that joins the head to the shoulders

examples.ch: 我从没见过他那么粗的脖子。
examples.en: He had the thickest neck I'd ever seen.

examples.ch: 她脖子上戴着一条金链子。
examples.en: She wore a gold chain around her neck.

defines.trans_en: the part of a piece of clothing that goes around a person's neck

examples.ch: 这件毛衣的领口太紧了。
examples.en: This sweater's too tight in the neck.

examples.ch: 他没系领带，衬衫领口敞开着。
examples.en: He wasn't wearing a tie and his shirt was open at the neck.

examples.ch: 低领连衣裙
examples.en: a low-neck dress

defines.trans_en: part of a hollow object that is at the top and is narrower than the part below it

examples.ch: 瓶颈／吉他的琴颈
examples.en: the neck of a bottle/guitar

defines.trans_en: a narrow part of a body part

examples.ch: 宫颈癌
examples.en: cancer of the neck of the uterus

defines.trans_en: to kiss and hold a person in a sexual way

defines.trans_ch: 快速饮用（尤指酒精饮料）
defines.trans_en: to drink something, especially alcohol, very quickly

examples.ch: 他已经很快地清空了两瓶葡萄酒。
examples.en: He's necked two bottles of wine already.

defines.trans_en: to have to have something, or to want something very much

examples.ch: 婴儿时刻都需要人照看。
examples.en: Babies need constant care.

examples.ch: 医生说我需要动手术。
examples.en: The doctor said I needed an operation.

examples.ch: 我要去一下洗手间。
examples.en: I need to go to the toilet.

examples.ch: 大多数人都需要有被爱的感觉。
examples.en: Most people need to feel loved.

examples.ch: 我需要你帮我选一套衣服。
examples.en: I need you to help me choose an outfit.

examples.ch: 我迫切需要抛开这一切休息一下。
examples.en: I badly need (= strongly want) a rest from all this.

examples.ch: 我不想要这些麻烦。
examples.en: I don't need all this hassle.

defines.trans_en: If you say that someone or something needs something else, you mean that they should have it, or would get an advantage from having it.

examples.ch: 你该好好喝上一碗鲜美的热汤。
examples.en: What you need is a nice hot bowl of soup.

examples.ch: 这个房间需要打扫。
examples.en: This room needs cleaning.

examples.ch: 她该把头洗洗。
examples.en: She needs her hair washed.

defines.trans_en: to have (to)

examples.ch: 他必须减轻些体重。
examples.en: He needs to lose some weight.

examples.ch: 我下班回家的路上要买些东西。
examples.en: I need to do some shopping on my way home from work.

examples.ch: 每个人都需要更努力。
examples.en: There needs to be more effort from everyone.

examples.ch: 我觉得我们没必要问他。
examples.en: I don't think we need ask him.

examples.ch: 下周之前在这方面不必做什么。
examples.en: Nothing need be done about this till next week.

examples.ch: “我们要带上你妈妈吗？”“不，不必。”
examples.en: "Need we take your mother?" "No, we needn't."

phrases.trans_en: there is no reason for someone or something to do a particular thing

examples.ch: 你不用担心——我不会向任何人提起这件事的。
examples.en: You needn't worry - I'm not going to mention it to anyone.

examples.ch: 这是游历意大利的好办法，也不需要花很多钱。
examples.en: It's a wonderful way of getting to see Italy, and it needn't cost very much.

phrases.trans_ch: （常用于表示气愤） （某人）不该（或无权）做
phrases.trans_en: used, often when you are angry with someone, to say that they should not do a particular thing or that they have no right to do it

examples.ch: 他别指望我会开车把他一路送到那里！
examples.en: He needn't think I'm driving him all the way there!

examples.ch: 你别笑！下一个就轮到你！
examples.en: You needn't laugh! It'll be your turn next!

phrases.trans_en: used to say either that someone did a particular thing although they did not have to, or that someone did not do it because they did not have to

examples.ch: 我多给了她一些钱——我知道没有必要，但我想表示善意。
examples.en: I gave her some extra money - I know I didn't need to but I thought it would be kind.

examples.ch: “你请索菲娅帮忙了吗？”“没必要——我自己处理得非常好。”
examples.en: "Did you ask Sophia to help?" "I didn't need to - I managed perfectly well on my own."

phrases.trans_en: it was not necessary for someone to have done a particular thing, although they did do it

examples.ch: 你本来不用洗那些碗碟的，你知道——我回家后自己会洗的。
examples.en: You needn't have washed all those dishes, you know - I'd have done them myself when I got home.

examples.ch: 你原本不必为这顿饭担心的——味道棒极了！
examples.en: You needn't have worried about the dinner - it was delicious!

defines.trans_ch: 需求，需要;（尤指）生活需求
defines.trans_en: the state of having to have something that you do not have, especially something that you must have so that you can have a satisfactory life

examples.ch: 你需要帮助吗？
examples.en: Are you in need of help?

examples.ch: 大城市对廉价住房的需求在不断增长。
examples.en: There's a growing need for cheap housing in the larger cities.

defines.trans_en: a feeling or state of strongly wanting something

examples.ch: 他似乎非常渴望得到每个人的喜爱。
examples.en: He seems to have a desperate need to be loved by everyone.

examples.ch: 我不知道你怎么样，但我想要喝一杯。
examples.en: I don't know about you but I'm in need of a drink.

examples.ch: 我们不需要你的同情。
examples.en: We have no need of your sympathy.

defines.trans_en: the state of being necessary

examples.ch: 需要文具的话，你随便用。
examples.en: Help yourself to stationery as the need arises.

examples.ch: 如果需要的话，我们可以再叫辆车，让大家都坐上去。
examples.en: If need/needs be (= if necessary), we can take a second car to fit everyone in.

examples.ch: 我认为我们没有必要全体出席会议。
examples.en: I don't think there's any need for all of us to attend the meeting.

phrases.trans_en: the things that a person must have in order to have a satisfactory life

examples.ch: 住房和教育都是基本需求。
examples.en: Housing and education are basic needs.

examples.ch: 他们没有充足的食物满足需要。
examples.en: They don't have enough food to meet their needs.

phrases.trans_en: not having enough money or food

examples.ch: 你只是希望那些钱会交到最需要的人手里。
examples.en: You just hope that the money goes to those who are most in need.

phrases.text: be no need to do sth
phrases.trans_en: If there is no need to do something, it is not necessary or it is wrong.

examples.ch: 没有必要去买更多的食物——冰箱里有很多。
examples.en: There's no need to buy more food - there's plenty in the fridge.

examples.ch: 我明白她为何生气，但也没必要对他这么粗暴无礼。
examples.en: I understand why she was angry, but there was no need to be so nasty to him.

examples.ch: 别嚷了！安静点儿。
examples.en: There's no need to yell! Just calm down.

defines.trans_en: someone who lives very close to you

examples.ch: 有些邻居已经抱怨过我们的聚会太喧闹。
examples.en: Some of the neighbours have complained about the noise from our party.

examples.ch: 你见过我隔壁的邻居帕特了吗？
examples.en: Have you met Pat, my next-door neighbour?

defines.trans_en: a country that is next to another country

examples.ch: 苏格兰和南方邻邦的关系并非一直很和睦。
examples.en: The relationship between Scotland and its southern neighbour (= England) has not always been peaceful.

defines.trans_en: not at any time or not on any occasion

examples.ch: 我们从未去过澳大利亚。
examples.en: We've never been to Australia.

examples.ch: 我从没听过如此荒谬的事情。
examples.en: I've never heard anything so ridiculous.

examples.ch: 让我们永远记住那些为国捐躯的人。
examples.en: Let us never forget those who gave their lives for their country.

examples.ch: 战争绝不能解决任何问题。
examples.en: Wars never solve anything.

examples.ch: 他威胁说要开枪，但我认为他根本不会那样做。
examples.en: He threatened to shoot, but I never thought (= did not think) he would.

examples.ch: 我从不知道你认识我兄弟。
examples.en: I never realized you knew my brother.

examples.ch: 任何时候开始健康的饮食习惯都不算太晚。
examples.en: It's never too late to start eating a healthy diet.

examples.ch: “真难以相信他61岁了！他看上去那么年轻。”
examples.en: "He's never 61! (= it's difficult to believe he's 61!) He looks so young."

examples.ch: “你偷了我的饮料！”“没有，我没偷。”
examples.en: "You stole my drink!" "No, I never (= I didn't)."

defines.trans_en: recently created or having started to exist recently

examples.ch: 新车
examples.en: a new car

examples.ch: 她极富创造力，总会想出新点子。
examples.en: She's very creative and always coming up with new ideas.

examples.ch: 他们决定给刚出生的宝宝起什么名字？
examples.en: What have they decided to name the new baby?

examples.ch: 时尚界有什么新潮流？
examples.en: What's new in the fashion world?

examples.ch: 如果我们要保持竞争力，就必须投资开发新技术。
examples.en: We have to invest in new technology if we are to remain competitive.

defines.trans_en: different from one that existed earlier

examples.ch: 你见过新秘书了吗？
examples.en: Have you met the new secretary?

examples.ch: 她在找新工作。
examples.en: She's looking for a new job.

examples.ch: 你去过安的新居吗？
examples.en: Have you seen Ann's new house (= where she has just started living)?

examples.ch: 他们刚刚推出了比旧款功能强大许多的新一代计算机。
examples.en: They've just launched a new generation of computers that are much more powerful than earlier models.

defines.trans_en: not yet familiar or experienced

examples.ch: 对这个地区很陌生
examples.en: to be new to the area

examples.ch: 她才刚刚开始做这份工作，因此你不能期望她什么都知道。
examples.en: She's new to the job so you can't expect her to know everything yet.

defines.trans_en: not previously used or owned

examples.ch: 由于新车价格上涨，二手车销售量有所增加。
examples.en: Used car sales have risen because of the increased cost of new cars.

examples.ch: 你买的自行车是新的还是二手货？
examples.en: Did you buy your bike new or second-hand?

defines.trans_en: recently discovered or made known

examples.ch: 这种新型疗法给许多癌症患者带来希望。
examples.en: This new cancer treatment offers hope to many sufferers.

examples.ch: 只有出现新证据才会进行重审。
examples.en: A retrial can only take place when new evidence has emerged.

phrases.trans_en: new things

examples.ch: 除旧迎新
examples.en: Out with the old and in with the new.

defines.trans_en: recent or recently

examples.ch: 政府最近表现出来的对环保问题的热情受到环境保护主义者的欢迎。
examples.en: The government's new-found enthusiasm for green issues has been welcomed by environmentalists.

defines.trans_en: information or reports about recent events

examples.ch: 那是我很长时间以来听到过的最好的消息！
examples.en: That's the best (piece of) news I've heard for a long time!

examples.ch: 自从他们去了澳大利亚之后，我们一直没有他们的消息。
examples.en: We've had no news of them since they left for Australia.

examples.ch: 你听说蒂娜和汤姆的事情了吗？他们要离婚了。
examples.en: Have you heard the news about Tina and Tom? They're getting divorced.

examples.ch: 我真等不及要听听你的近况。
examples.en: I can't wait to hear all your news.

examples.ch: 丹辞职的消息让众人大为震惊。
examples.en: The news that Dan had resigned took everyone by surprise.

examples.ch: 我们有好消息要宣布。我们要结婚了。
examples.en: We've got some good news for you. We're getting married.

phrases.trans_en: a television or radio programme consisting of reports about recent events

examples.ch: 今晚的新闻里有什么趣事吗？
examples.en: Was there anything interesting on the news tonight?

examples.ch: 我在六点钟新闻上看到的。
examples.en: I saw it on the 6 o'clock news.

examples.ch: 我通常收看晚间／午夜新闻。
examples.en: I usually watch the early evening/late night news.

phrases.trans_en: to tell someone about something bad that has just happened and may have an effect on them

examples.ch: 当医生告诉我这个消息时，我简直要崩溃了。
examples.en: I was devastated when the doctor broke the news to me.

examples.ch: 我还记得肯尼迪遇刺的消息传来时自己在什么地方。
examples.en: I remember where I was when the news of Kennedy's assassination broke (= became known).

phrases.trans_en: to be someone or something that will affect a person or situation well/badly

examples.ch: 他对公司没有好处，当初根本不该给他这份工作。
examples.en: He's bad news for the company. He should never have been given the job.

phrases.trans_en: to be reported about

examples.ch: 他们最近由于婚姻问题而频繁出现在新闻报道中。
examples.en: They've been in the news a lot recently because of their marital problems.

defines.trans_en: a shop that sells newspapers and magazines, as well as some foods and things that people often buy such as cigarettes

examples.ch: 除了报纸，你还有什么要在报刊店里买吗？
examples.en: Do you want anything from the newsagent's apart from a paper?

defines.trans_en: a person who owns or manages a newsagent's
a regularly printed document consisting of large sheets of paper that are folded together, or a website, containing news reports, articles, photographs, and advertisements

examples.ch: 你常看报纸吗？
examples.en: Do you read a newspaper regularly?

examples.ch: 日报／周日版报纸
examples.en: a daily/Sunday newspaper

defines.trans_en: an organization that publishes a newspaper

examples.ch: 他毕业后想去报社工作。
examples.en: He wants to work for a newspaper when he graduates.

defines.trans_en: old newspapers

examples.ch: 你最好用旧报纸把那面镜子包一下再放进车里。
examples.en: You'd better wrap that mirror up in newspaper before you put it in the car.

defines.trans_ch: 下一个的；其次的；紧接着的
defines.trans_en: being the first one after the present one or after the one just mentioned

examples.ch: 谁在你隔壁的办公室工作？
examples.en: Who works in the office next to yours?

examples.ch: 在下一个路口向右拐。
examples.en: Take the next street on the right.

examples.ch: 你认为谁将出任下届总统？
examples.en: Who do you think will be the next president?

examples.ch: 这里并没有什么实质性的变化，天天差不多都是一个样儿。
examples.en: Nothing really changes around here. One day is pretty much like the next.

examples.ch: 下次你想借东西的话，请先问问我。
examples.en: (The) next time you want to borrow something, please ask me first.

examples.ch: 我忙得经常记不清下一步该做什么。
examples.en: I'm so busy it's hard to remember what I'm supposed to be doing from one minute to the next.

examples.ch: 接下来几天她休假。
examples.en: She's away for the next few days.

examples.ch: 你得等到下一个生日才会收到新自行车。
examples.en: You'll have to wait until your next birthday for a new bike.

examples.ch: 我们安排下下周开会可以吗？
examples.en: Can we arrange a meeting for the week after next?

examples.ch: 你认为明年这个时候你会在做什么？
examples.en: What do you think you'll be doing this time next year?

examples.ch: 我们发生了激烈的争吵，不过第二天他就打电话向我道歉了。
examples.en: We had a big argument, but he called me the next day (= the day after) to apologize.

examples.ch: 对不起，轮到我了——我是下一个。
examples.en: Excuse me, it's my turn - I was next.

defines.trans_en: immediately after

examples.ch: 那后来怎么样了？
examples.en: So what happened next?

examples.ch: 你还喜欢什么？
examples.en: What would you like next?

examples.ch: 先炒一下大蒜，再加生姜。
examples.en: First, fry the garlic. Next, add the ginger.

defines.trans_en: The time when you next do something is the first time you do it again

examples.ch: 你下次什么时候去多伦多？
examples.en: When are you next going to Toronto?

phrases.trans_en: used when describing two people or things that are very close to each other with nothing between them

examples.ch: 我可以靠窗坐吗？
examples.en: Can I sit next to the window?

examples.ch: 在车站有一个很古怪的男人站在我旁边。
examples.en: There was a really strange man standing next to me at the train station.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于作出选择或比较时）仅次于，在…之后
phrases.trans_en: used to mean `after' when making a choice or a comparison

examples.ch: 奶酪是我最喜欢的食品，其次是巧克力。
examples.en: Cheese is my favourite food and, next to that, chocolate. (= Cheese is the only food that I like more than chocolate.)

phrases.trans_en: almost

examples.ch: 他们没付给我多少钱，但我实在喜欢那工作。
examples.en: They pay me next to nothing (= very little) but I really enjoy the work.

examples.ch: 要在这附近找到廉价的住处极其困难。
examples.en: It's next to impossible (= extremely difficult) to find somewhere cheap to live around here.

examples.ch: 我们很快就到家了。
examples.en: We got home in next to no time (= very little time).

phrases.trans_en: next in order to appear or happen, often in some form of entertainment

examples.ch: 接下来要播出的是总统竞选活动的最新消息。
examples.en: Next up is the latest news from the presidential campaign .

defines.trans_en: pleasant, enjoyable, or satisfactory

examples.ch: 你旅途愉快吗？
examples.en: Did you have a nice trip?

examples.ch: 祝你度过愉快的一天／过得愉快！
examples.en: Have a nice day/time!

examples.ch: 这种牛奶闻起来味道不太好。
examples.en: This milk doesn't smell very nice.

examples.ch: 谢谢你来电话——跟你聊天很开心。
examples.en: Thanks for ringing - it's been nice talking to you.

defines.trans_ch: 好心的;友善的;有礼貌的
defines.trans_en: kind, friendly, or polite

examples.ch: 简的新男友是个很不错的小伙子。
examples.en: Jane's new boyfriend is a really nice guy.

examples.ch: 我希望你会好好对待你弟弟。
examples.en: I wish you'd be nice to your brother.

examples.ch: 她开车送你回家真是好心。
examples.en: It was very nice of her to drive you home.

examples.ch: 嘴里塞满食物时说话是不礼貌的。
examples.en: It's not nice to talk with your mouth full.

defines.trans_en: based on very slight differences

examples.ch: 他所说的关于谎言和不实之间的微妙区别无法让我信服。
examples.en: I wasn't convinced by his nice distinction between a lie and an untruth.

phrases.trans_en: pleasantly

examples.ch: 这橙子真是味美多汁。
examples.en: This orange is nice and juicy.

defines.trans_en: the part of every 24-hour period when it is dark because there is very little light from the sun

examples.ch: 夜间天气转凉。
examples.en: It gets cold at night.

examples.ch: 我昨晚睡得很不好。
examples.en: I slept really badly last night.

examples.ch: 我在特德家里过的夜。
examples.en: I spent the night at Ted's.

examples.ch: 他搭乘了夜班渡轮／火车。
examples.en: He took the night ferry/train.

defines.trans_ch: 晚上（指傍晚至就寝前的时段）
defines.trans_en: the period of time between the late afternoon and going to bed; the evening

examples.ch: 我们周六晚上出去玩好吗？
examples.en: Let's go out on Saturday night.

examples.ch: 我们这个星期每天晚上都出去吃饭。
examples.en: We've eaten out every night this week.

examples.ch: 她晚上在酒吧唱歌，白天则从事秘书工作。
examples.en: She's a singer in a bar by night and a secretary by day.

defines.trans_en: the evening on which a special event happens

examples.ch: 你什么时候演最后一场？
examples.en: When's the last night of your show?

examples.ch: 她的新电影的首映相当成功。
examples.en: The first/opening night of her new movie was a great success.

phrases.trans_ch: （通常为儿语或对孩子说的）晚安
phrases.trans_en: used as another way of saying good night, usually by or to children
on one evening recently

examples.ch: 我前几天晚上在健身房见到了娜奥米。
examples.en: I saw Naomi at the gym the other night.

phrases.trans_en: an evening spent at a restaurant, theatre, etc. rather than staying at home

examples.ch: 我这个周末需要跟女生朋友们出去玩一玩。
examples.en: I need a night out with the girls this weekend.

examples.ch: 我们星期六晚上出去玩吧。
examples.en: Let's have a night out on Saturday.

defines.trans_ch: （晚上与人分别时礼貌地道别用语）晚安
defines.trans_en: a friendly way of saying goodbye when you leave someone in the evening or before going to bed or to sleep

examples.ch: 甜心，晚安！好好睡！
examples.en: Night, sweetheart! Sleep well!

defines.trans_en: not any; not one; not a

examples.ch: 没有黄油了。
examples.en: There's no butter left.

examples.ch: 这些裤子没有裤兜。
examples.en: There are no pockets in these trousers.

examples.ch: 那是我的度假方式——没有电子邮件，没有电话，也没有烦恼。
examples.en: That's my kind of holiday - no email, no phone, and no worries.

examples.ch: 我们不可能在8点之前到达那里。
examples.en: There's no chance (= no possibility) of us getting there by eight.

defines.trans_en: used in signs and on notices to show that something is not allowed

examples.ch: 禁止吸烟／垂钓
examples.en: No smoking/fishing.

defines.trans_en: used to give negative answers

examples.ch: “你喂猫了吗？”“没有，我忘了。”
examples.en: "Did you feed the cat?" "No, I forgot."

examples.ch: “你想再来点蛋糕吗？”“不用，谢谢。”
examples.en: "Would you like any more cake?" "No, thank you."

examples.ch: “你今晚有作业吗？”“没有。”
examples.en: "Do you have any homework tonight?" "No."

defines.trans_en: not; not any

examples.ch: 这次考试并不比你们一直做的课堂测验难。
examples.en: The exam is no more difficult than the tests you've been doing in class.

examples.ch: 我对这些问题不大感兴趣。
examples.en: The issues are of no great interest (= only a little interest) to me.

defines.trans_en: a negative answer or reaction

examples.ch: “关于周末露营，你得到甚么反馈了吗？” “到目前为止，有两人愿意去，一人不去还有一人不确定。”
examples.en: "Did you get any replies about the camping weekend?" "So far we have two yeses, a no, and a maybe."

defines.trans_en: a vote against a suggestion, idea, law, etc., or a person who votes no

examples.ch: 14票赞成，169票反对——反对方胜出。
examples.en: 14 ayes to 169 noes - the noes have it (= have won).

defines.trans_en: written abbreviation for number

examples.ch: 他们住在17号。
examples.en: They live at No. 17.

examples.ch: 第13题到第20题的答案在第21页。
examples.en: The answers to nos 13–20 are on page 21.

phrases.trans_ch: 唐宁街十号，英国首相官邸（Number Ten的缩写）
phrases.trans_en:
written abbreviation for
Number Ten

defines.trans_en: not anyone

examples.ch: 这儿没有人能够回答我的问题吗？
examples.en: Is there nobody here who can answer my question?

examples.ch: 我一早上一个人影儿也没见着。
examples.en: I saw nobody all morning.

examples.ch: 没人同意我的看法。
examples.en: Nobody agreed with me.

defines.trans_en: someone who is not important

examples.ch: 他只不过是个想引起媒体注意的无名之辈。
examples.en: He's just some nobody trying to get noticed by the press.

defines.trans_en: making a lot of noise

examples.ch: 一群喧闹的球迷
examples.en: a noisy crowd of fans

examples.ch: 吵闹的邻居
examples.en: noisy neighbours

defines.trans_ch: （尤指电子设备的）干扰的，干扰讯号的
defines.trans_en: having an unwanted change in signal, especially of an electronic device

examples.ch: 干扰信号
examples.en: a noisy signal

defines.trans_en: twelve o'clock in the middle of the day, or about that time

examples.ch: 我们过去经常在中午之前滑雪，然后慢悠悠地吃午餐。
examples.en: We used to ski before noon and then have a long lunch.

examples.ch: 到中午时，我们已经接了10个电话。
examples.en: By noon, we had had ten phone calls.

defines.trans_ch: 没有一个（人或事物）;全无
defines.trans_en: not one (of a group of people or things), or not any

examples.ch: 我的孩子们都不是金发。
examples.en: None of my children has/have blonde hair.

examples.ch: “我想再来点儿奶酪。”“很抱歉，已经没有了。”
examples.en: "I'd like some more cheese." "I'm sorry there's none left".

examples.ch: “你知道这要花多少钱吗？”“完全不知道。”
examples.en: "Do you have any idea how much this cost?" "None at all/None whatsoever."

defines.trans_en: ordinary or usual; the same as would be expected

examples.ch: 正常工作日
examples.en: a normal working day

examples.ch: 4岁的孩子好动是正常的。
examples.en: Lively behaviour is normal for a four-year-old child.

examples.ch: 夫妻之间偶尔发生口角是很平常的。
examples.en: It's normal for couples to argue now and then.

examples.ch: 他们正半价销售那些商品。
examples.en: They were selling the goods at half the normal cost.

examples.ch: 气温高于／低于往年同期的正常值。
examples.en: The temperature was above/below normal for the time of year.

examples.ch: 我们偿还了所有债务，一切又恢复了正常。
examples.en: Things are back to normal now that we've paid off all our debts.

defines.trans_en: the direction that goes towards the part of the earth above the equator, opposite to the south, or the part of an area or country that is in this direction

examples.ch: 罗盘上的方位点分别为北、南、东和西。
examples.en: The points of the compass are north, south, east, and west.

examples.ch: （该国）北部多山。
examples.en: The landscape is more mountainous in the north (of the country).

examples.ch: 剑桥位于伦敦以北。
examples.en: Cambridge is/lies to the north of London.

examples.ch: 朝北的窗户
examples.en: a north-facing window

phrases.trans_ch: （大多位于北半球的）北方发达国家
phrases.trans_en: the rich industrial countries of the world, most of which are above the equator
the northern states of the middle and eastern part of the US

examples.ch: 美国内战中北方各州战胜了南方各州。
examples.en: The North defeated the South in the American Civil War.

defines.trans_en: in or forming the north part of something

examples.ch: 北美／北非
examples.en: North America/Africa

examples.ch: 冰岛北部海岸
examples.en: the north coast of Iceland

examples.ch: 我们的农场位于村庄以北几英里处。
examples.en: Our farm is a few miles north of the village.

phrases.trans_en: a wind coming from the north

defines.trans_en: towards the north

examples.ch: 往北直走两英里。
examples.en: Go due (= directly) north for two miles.

examples.ch: 花园朝北，冬天没有多少阳光。
examples.en: The garden faces north and doesn't get much sun in the winter.

phrases.trans_en: to or in the north of the country or region

examples.ch: 我住在剑桥，而我的亲戚们住在北部的曼彻斯特。
examples.en: I live in London, but my relatives live up north, in Manchester.

defines.trans_en: the part of the face that sticks out above the mouth, through which you breathe and smell

examples.ch: 大／长／尖鼻子
examples.en: a large/long/pointed nose

examples.ch: 我喉咙痛，还流鼻涕。
examples.en: I had a sore throat and a runny nose (= liquid coming out of the nose).

examples.ch: 好了，别哭了，擤擤鼻涕。
examples.en: Come on now, stop crying and blow your nose .

defines.trans_en: the particular smell of a wine

examples.ch: 因其烟熏味而备受称道的葡萄酒
examples.en: a wine praised for its smoky nose

defines.trans_ch: （车辆的）前端突出部；（尤指飞机）机头
defines.trans_en: the front of a vehicle, especially an aircraft

examples.ch: 飞机机头两侧都绘有这一标志。
examples.en: The symbol was painted on each side of the plane's nose.

defines.trans_ch: 窥探，打探（尤指他人不欲公开的事）；搜寻
defines.trans_en: to look around or search in order to discover something, especially something that other people do not want you to find

examples.ch: 有些记者在四处打探新闻。
examples.en: There were some reporters nosing about/around.

examples.ch: 警方到来后开始搜查抽屉，翻检文件。
examples.en: The police came in and started nosing into drawers and looking through papers.

defines.trans_en: to (make a vehicle) move forwards slowly and carefully

examples.ch: 司机一边紧张地四下张望，一边小心翼翼地把车驶出小路。
examples.en: The car nosed out of the side street, its driver peering anxiously around.

examples.ch: 他小心翼翼地把大卡车开进这个狭窄的空间。
examples.en: He carefully nosed his lorry into the small space.

defines.trans_ch: （用于 be，can，have，will，must 等动词后构成否定表达，在口语中常简略为n't）不
defines.trans_en: used to form a negative phrase after verbs like "be", "can", "have", "will", "must", etc., usually used in the short form "n't" in speech

examples.ch: 他不胖！
examples.en: He's not fat!

examples.ch: 我不会告诉她。
examples.en: I won't tell her.

examples.ch: 我不能去。
examples.en: I can't go.

examples.ch: 你难道不喜欢她吗？
examples.en: Don't you like her?

examples.ch: 这并不难。
examples.en: It isn't hard (= it is easy).

examples.ch: 我只是不感兴趣。
examples.en: I'm just not interested.

examples.ch: 他长得并不难看。
examples.en: He's not bad-looking (= he is fairly attractive).

examples.ch: 他没有他父亲高。
examples.en: He's not as tall as his father.

defines.trans_ch: （用于否定其后的单词或词组）不，没有
defines.trans_en: used to give the next word or group of words a negative meaning

examples.ch: 我告诉过你别那样做。
examples.en: I told you not to do that.

examples.ch: 大部分蔬菜我都喜欢，但卷心菜除外。
examples.en: I like most vegetables but not cabbage.

examples.ch: “来玩呀，爸爸。”“现在不行，杰米。”
examples.en: "Come and play, Dad." "Not now, Jamie."

examples.ch: 说那话的是裕子，不是理查德。
examples.en: It was Yuko who said that, not Richard.

defines.trans_ch: （用于 be afraid， hope， suspect 等动词后构成简略的否定回答）不，没有
defines.trans_en: used after verbs like "be afraid", "hope", "suspect", etc. in short, negative replies

examples.ch: “他会跟我们一起来吗？”“希望不会。”
examples.en: "Is he coming with us?" "I hope not."

examples.ch: “你做完了吗？”“恐怕还没有。”
examples.en: "Are you done?" "I'm afraid not."

defines.trans_ch: （有时用于句末，表示所说非所想）才不是呢
defines.trans_en: sometimes used at the end of a statement to show that you did not mean what you have said

examples.ch: 那是我吃过的最棒的一餐——是才怪呢！
examples.en: That was the best meal I've ever had - not!

phrases.trans_en: used to say what the situation will be if something does not happen

examples.ch: 我希望在那里能见到你，如果没有的话，我会给你打电话的。
examples.en: I hope to see you there but, if not, I'll call you.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于表示某事也许不会发生）否，或许不
phrases.trans_en: used to express the possibility that something might not happen

examples.ch: 你会不会回复？
examples.en: Are you going to reply or not?

examples.ch: 我还不知道她是否会来。
examples.en: I still don't know whether she's coming or not.

defines.trans_en: a short piece of writing

examples.ch: 他留下字条说他会晚点回家。
examples.en: He left a note to say he would be home late.

examples.ch: 门上钉着一张便条，上面写着商店何时将重新开张。
examples.en: There's a note on the door saying when the shop will open again.

defines.trans_ch: （页底）注释，说明;（书的）封底介绍
defines.trans_en: a short explanation or an extra piece of information that is given at the bottom of a page, at the back of a book, etc.

examples.ch: 详细解释参见注释3。
examples.en: For more information see Note 3.

defines.trans_en: a single sound at a particular level, usually in music, or a written symbol that represents this sound

examples.ch: 高／低音
examples.en: high/low notes

examples.ch: 她在钢琴上弹了3个长音。
examples.en: She played three long notes on the piano.

examples.ch: 引擎噪音突然越来越响，变成了尖叫声。
examples.en: The engine noise suddenly changed its note and rose to a whine.

defines.trans_en: an emotion or a way of expressing something

examples.ch: 她的信中带着一丝谨慎。
examples.en: There was a note of caution in her letter.

examples.ch: 他发言的语调恰如其分。
examples.en: His speech struck just the right note.

examples.ch: 这次会议在一片乐观的气氛中结束。
examples.en: The meeting ended on an optimistic note.

defines.trans_en: a piece of paper money

examples.ch: 20欧元的纸币
examples.en: a €20 note

examples.ch: 他从口袋中拿出一叠钞票。
examples.en: He took a wad of notes from his pocket.

defines.trans_en: importance, or the fact that something deserves attention

examples.ch: 最近的这份报告中并无值得关注之处。
examples.en: There was nothing of note in the latest report.

phrases.trans_en: information written on paper

examples.ch: 风把我的笔记吹得满屋子都是。
examples.en: The wind blew my notes all over the room.

examples.ch: 采访过程中记者一直在作笔记。
examples.en: The reporter took notes throughout the interview.

defines.trans_en: to notice something

examples.ch: 他们留意到消费者对便捷服务与日俱增的需求。
examples.en: They noted the consumers' growing demand for quicker service.

examples.ch: 请注意我们周六不营业。
examples.en: Please note (that) we will be closed on Saturday.

examples.ch: 注意看，迅速拉开插销有多么容易。
examples.en: Note how easy it is to release the catch quickly.

defines.trans_en: to give your attention to something by discussing it or making a written record of it

examples.ch: 他说天气超出了我们的掌控范围，并提到去年夏天是有史以来最炎热的一个夏天。
examples.en: He said the weather was beyond our control, noting that last summer was one of the hottest on record.

examples.ch: 在文章中，她提到了几起医疗事故的案例。
examples.en: In the article, she notes several cases of medical incompetence.

defines.trans_en: not anything

examples.ch: 抽屉里什么也没有——我把所有东西都拿出去了。
examples.en: There's nothing in the drawer - I took everything out.

examples.ch: 无论我说什么也没办法让她振作起来。
examples.en: Nothing I could say would cheer her up.

examples.ch: 我没有什么新消息要告诉你。
examples.en: I have nothing new to tell you.

examples.ch: 我们帮不上什么别的忙。
examples.en: There's nothing else (= no other thing) we can do to help.

examples.ch: 在我们镇上没有太多事情可做。
examples.en: There's nothing much (= not very much) to do in our town.

examples.ch: 这种说法纯属谎言。
examples.en: The story was nothing but (= only) lies.

examples.ch: 扬基队得3分，红袜队为0分。
examples.en: The score is Yankees three, Red Sox nothing (= no points).

phrases.text: be/have nothing to do with sb
phrases.trans_en: to be a matter or subject that someone has no good reason to know about or be involved with

examples.ch: 我希望他别对我的婚姻说三道四——这不关他的事。
examples.en: I wish he wouldn't offer advice on my marriage - it's nothing to do with him.

phrases.text: be/have nothing to do with sb/sth
phrases.trans_ch: 与…毫不相干;对…无关紧要
phrases.trans_en: to have no connection or influence with someone or something

examples.ch: 我们与办公室在隔壁的公司毫无关系。
examples.en: We are nothing to do with the firm that has the offices next door.

examples.ch: 晚上，他喜欢读些与工作无关的书和文章。
examples.en: In the evening he likes to read books and articles that have nothing to do with his work.

phrases.trans_en: to have no importance or value

examples.ch: 钱对他来说毫无价值。
examples.en: Money means nothing to him.

phrases.trans_en: free or without paying

examples.ch: 我是从一位朋友那儿得到这幅画的，分文未花。
examples.en: I got this painting for nothing from a friend.

phrases.trans_en: with no good result or for no purpose

examples.ch: 他白白排了两个小时的队——座位已满。
examples.en: He queued for two hours and (all) for nothing - there were no seats left.

examples.ch: 我们绝不会让这些勇士们白白牺牲。
examples.en: Let us make sure that these brave men and women did not die for nothing.

phrases.trans_ch: 未穿衣的，裸体的，一丝不挂的
phrases.trans_en: no clothes on your body

examples.ch: 她裸睡。
examples.en: She sleeps with nothing on.

examples.ch: 我不能去开门——我什么都没穿！
examples.en: I couldn't come to the door - I had nothing on!

phrases.trans_ch: （在某时间段内）没有安排的，有空的
phrases.trans_en: no arrangements for a stated period

examples.ch: 我刚看了日程簿，我星期二下午没有安排。
examples.en: I checked my calendar and I have nothing on on Tuesday afternoon.

examples.ch: 下周五没什么安排——我们可以在那个时候开会。
examples.en: There's nothing on next Friday - we could have the meeting then.

defines.trans_en: in no way

examples.ch: 他收到两封拒绝信后并没有气馁，而是再接再厉。
examples.en: He had two letters of refusal but, nothing daunted (= not discouraged), he tried again.

defines.trans_en: someone of no value or importance

examples.ch: 他是个微不足道的小人物，身份低微，一无是处。
examples.en: He's a nothing, a low-down, useless nobody.

defines.trans_en: at the present time, not in the past or future

examples.ch: 她过去曾是一名教师，但现在从事出版工作。
examples.en: She used to be a teacher, but now she works in publishing.

examples.ch: 我过一会儿可能会想吃点儿什么，可这会儿不饿。
examples.en: I may eat something later, but I'm not hungry now.

examples.ch: 如今许多人都拥有智能手机。
examples.en: Many people now own a smartphone.

defines.trans_en: immediately

examples.ch: 我不想等到明天，我现在就要！
examples.en: I don't want to wait until tomorrow, I want it now!

defines.trans_en: used to express how long something has been happening, from when it began to the present time

examples.ch: 她吃素已经10年了。
examples.en: She's been a vegetarian for ten years now.

defines.trans_ch: （用于描述过去的新情况或新事件）此刻，这时候
defines.trans_en: used in stories or reports of past events to describe a new situation or event

examples.ch: 这时候天越来越黑，我们疲惫不堪。
examples.en: It was getting dark now, and we were tired.

defines.trans_ch: （用于描述刚刚所说或所做之事的结果）这样一来
defines.trans_en: used when describing a situation that is the result of what someone just said or did

examples.ch: 哦，是的，这样一来我就知道你指的是谁了。
examples.en: Oh yes, now I know who you mean.

defines.trans_ch: （用于陈述句和疑问句，引导后面的话或对其加以强调）
defines.trans_en: used in statements and questions to introduce or give emphasis to what you are saying

examples.ch: 唉，我把我的帽子放哪儿了？
examples.en: Now, where did I put my hat?

examples.ch: 有人敲门。简知道妈妈答应过要来，所以认为敲门的是她。
examples.en: There was a knock at the door. Now Jan knew her mother had promised to come by, so she assumed it was her.

examples.ch: 快点，否则你就赶不上公共汽车了！
examples.en: Hurry, now, or you'll miss the bus!

examples.ch: 抱歉，我今天不行。如果你昨天问我的话，我会说行的。
examples.en: Sorry, I can't today. Now if you'd asked me yesterday, I would have said yes.

phrases.trans_en: very soon

examples.ch: 我们的客人马上就要到了，可家里还是乱糟糟的。
examples.en: The guests are coming any minute now, and the house is still a mess.

phrases.trans_en: used to introduce a new subject

examples.ch: 现在我们来讨论一下明天要做什么。
examples.en: And now for what we're going to do tomorrow.

defines.trans_en: the present moment or time

examples.ch: 现在不适合跟他谈话。
examples.en: Now isn't a good time to speak to him.

examples.ch: 我以为你这会儿该弄完了。
examples.en: I thought you'd be finished by now.

examples.ch: 你本该此前就提到它。
examples.en: You should have mentioned it before now.

examples.ch: 暂时就这样吧。
examples.en: That's all for now (= until a future point in time).

phrases.trans_en: from this moment and always in the future

examples.ch: 从现在开始，大门将在午夜上锁。
examples.en: From now on the gates will be locked at midnight.

phrases.trans_en: used to give an explanation of a new situation

examples.ch: 有车之后，我的活动量不如从前大了。
examples.en: Now I have my car, I don't get as much exercise as I used to.

examples.ch: 因为承担了更多的职责，所以她很喜欢这份工作。
examples.en: She's enjoying the job now that she's got more responsibility.

defines.trans_en: in, at, or to no place; not anywhere

examples.ch: 这些年轻人无处可去。
examples.en: These young people have nowhere (else) to go.

examples.ch: 这篇文章中并未提及相关人员的名字。
examples.en: Nowhere does the article mention the names of the people involved.

defines.trans_en: not in a successful or winning position

examples.ch: 我下注的那匹马没有获胜。
examples.en: The horse I bet on finished nowhere.

defines.trans_en: (a sign or symbol representing) a unit that forms part of the system of counting and calculating

examples.ch: 25、300和10亿都是数字。
examples.en: 25, 300, and a billion are all numbers.

examples.ch: 她非常擅长数字运算。
examples.en: She's very good with numbers (= good at adding, subtracting, etc.).

defines.trans_en: a number that is used to mark a particular example of something

examples.ch: 他们住在果园街34号。
examples.en: They live at number 34 Orchard Street.

examples.ch: 请把你的信用卡号写在这张表格上。
examples.en: Please write your credit card number on this form.

examples.ch: 我们的航班号是多少？
examples.en: What's our flight number?

defines.trans_en: a phone number

examples.ch: 我把自己的电话号码给了他。
examples.en: I gave him my number.

defines.trans_en: an amount or total

examples.ch: 上个月，死于交通事故的人数有所下降。
examples.en: The number of people killed in traffic accidents fell last month.

examples.ch: 患这种病的人数持续上升。
examples.en: There has been an increasing number of cases of the disease.

examples.ch: 少数孩子在家接受教育。
examples.en: A small number of children are educated at home.

examples.ch: 大量请柬已经发出。
examples.en: A large number of invitations has been sent.

examples.ch: 投诉信出乎意料地少。
examples.en: Letters of complaint were surprisingly few in number (= there were not many of them).

defines.trans_en: a group of people

examples.ch: 旅行期间，我们当中有个人病倒了。
examples.en: On the trip, one of our number fell ill.

defines.trans_en: a particular copy of a magazine

examples.ch: 你有上周的那期《纽约客》杂志吗？
examples.en: Do you have last week's number of the New Yorker?

examples.ch: 他保存了这本杂志过去的所有刊本。
examples.en: He's got all the back numbers (= previous copies) of the magazine.

defines.trans_ch: （令人欣赏的）衣服，（尤指）连衣裙
defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing, especially a dress, that you admire

examples.ch: 她身穿一条时尚的迪奥长裙。
examples.en: She was wearing a stylish Dior number.

defines.trans_en: a person with a particular characteristic

examples.ch: 他真性感，你不觉得吗？
examples.en: He's a real sexy number, don't you think?

defines.trans_en: a short tune or song

examples.ch: 唱一支那种情歌吧。
examples.en: Sing one of those romantic numbers.

defines.trans_en: something that is often said

examples.ch: 他又故技重施，诉说妻子如何不理解他。
examples.en: He tried the usual/that old number about how his wife didn't understand him.

phrases.trans_en: a number of a particular description

examples.ch: 少数孩子在家接受教育。
examples.en: Small numbers of children are educated at home.

examples.ch: 大量请柬已经发出。
examples.en: Large numbers of invitations were sent.

examples.ch: 报纸发行量巨大。
examples.en: Newspapers are produced in vast numbers.

phrases.trans_en: several of a particular type of thing

examples.ch: 我决定不去，有几个理由。
examples.en: I decided not to go, for a number of reasons.

defines.trans_en: to give something a number in a series and usually to write this number on it

examples.ch: 所有文件夹都被精心编号归档。
examples.en: All the folders have been carefully numbered and filed away.

examples.ch: 从1到10标上页码。
examples.en: Number the pages from one to ten.

defines.trans_en: If people or things number a particular amount, there are this many of them.

examples.ch: 飓风过后，无家可归者总计超过20万人。
examples.en: After the hurricane the homeless numbered over 200,000.

defines.trans_en: (the title given to) a person whose job is to care for people who are ill or injured, especially in a hospital

examples.ch: 他在精神病院当护士。
examples.en: He worked as a nurse in a psychiatric hospital.

examples.ch: 米勒德护士很快会来照顾你。
examples.en: Nurse Millard will be with you shortly.

examples.ch: 谢谢你，护士。
examples.en: Thank you, Nurse.

defines.trans_en: a woman employed to take care of a young child or children

defines.trans_ch: 照顾，照料（患病的人或动物）
defines.trans_en: to care for a person or an animal while they are ill

examples.ch: 他辞去了工作，这样可以在家专心照顾母亲。
examples.en: He gave up his job so that he could nurse his mother at home.

examples.ch: 他们发现一只受伤的猫，于是精心照料直至它恢复健康。
examples.en: They found an injured cat and carefully nursed it back to health (= until it was well again).

defines.trans_en: to spend a lot of time taking care of something as it grows or develops

examples.ch: 这些小树得到了主管园丁的精心培育。
examples.en: These young trees were carefully nursed by the head gardener.

examples.ch: 这个项目在头几个月里必须投入大量精力。
examples.en: The project will have to be nursed through its first few months.

defines.trans_en: If you nurse an illness or injury, you rest until it gets better.

examples.ch: 罗伯特卧床休息，调养背部伤病。
examples.en: Robert's in bed nursing a back injury.

defines.trans_en: to hold a small child in your arms as a way of making them feel better

examples.ch: 她把哭泣的孩子抱到大腿上。
examples.en: She nursed the crying child on her lap.

defines.trans_ch: 给（婴儿）哺乳;给（婴儿）喂奶
defines.trans_en: When a woman nurses a baby, she feeds it with milk from her breasts.
to have a strong feeling or an emotion for a long time

examples.ch: 长期以来她一直对日本艺术满怀热情。
examples.en: She had long nursed a passion for Japanese art.

defines.trans_en: to hold a drink for a long time without drinking it

examples.ch: 马克坐在角落里，手里久久地拿着一只几乎空了的啤酒瓶。
examples.en: Mark was sitting in the corner nursing an almost empty bottle of beer.

defines.trans_en: a person's job

examples.ch: 在“职业”一栏里她写了“警察”。
examples.en: In the space marked "occupation" she wrote "police officer".

defines.trans_en: a regular activity or hobby

examples.ch: 在我看来，他最喜爱的消遣就是吃。
examples.en: It seems to me his favourite occupation is eating.

defines.trans_en: a situation in which an army or group of people moves into and takes control of a place

examples.ch: 意大利对埃塞俄比亚的侵占
examples.en: the Italian occupation of Ethiopia

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示归属或来历）…的，属于
defines.trans_en: used to show possession, belonging, or origin

examples.ch: 我的一位朋友
examples.en: a friend of mine

examples.ch: 美国总统
examples.en: the president of the United States

examples.ch: 这家公司的雇员
examples.en: employees of the company

examples.ch: 他头发的颜色
examples.en: the colour of his hair

examples.ch: 我的一个习惯
examples.en: a habit of mine

examples.ch: 她那条可恶的狗
examples.en: that revolting dog of hers

examples.ch: 一个善良女人的爱
examples.en: the love of a good woman

examples.ch: 洛尔卡戏剧全集
examples.en: the complete plays of (= written by) Lorca

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示数量、数字或某一单位的词或短语之后）
defines.trans_en: used after words or phrases expressing amount, number, or a particular unit

examples.ch: 1公斤苹果
examples.en: a kilo of apples

examples.ch: 许多食物
examples.en: loads of food

examples.ch: 数百人
examples.en: hundreds of people

examples.ch: 他们中的大多数
examples.en: most of them

examples.ch: 他们中没有人
examples.en: none of them

examples.ch: 我们俩
examples.en: both of us

examples.ch: 所有人中的1/3
examples.en: a third of all people

examples.ch: 一粒灰尘
examples.en: a speck of dust

examples.ch: 一滴雨
examples.en: a drop of rain

defines.trans_en: containing

examples.ch: 一袋糖果
examples.en: a bag of sweets
