examples.ch: 一瓶啤酒
examples.en: a bottle of beer

examples.ch: 一本短篇小说集
examples.en: a book of short stories

examples.ch: 一群白痴
examples.en: a class of idiots

defines.trans_en: used in expressions showing position

examples.ch: 他的头顶
examples.en: the top of his head

examples.ch: 你衣服的背部
examples.en: the back of your dress

examples.ch: 在街角
examples.en: on the corner of the street

examples.ch: 队伍的前部
examples.en: the front of the queue

examples.ch: 我从未去过费城以北的地方。
examples.en: I've never been north of Philadelphia.

defines.trans_en: typical or characteristic of

examples.ch: 她有一张天使般的面孔。
examples.en: She has the face of an angel.

examples.ch: 那个男人实在是无聊透顶、麻木不仁。
examples.en: That guy's got the personality of a dead fish!

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a particular date in a month

examples.ch: 3月11日
examples.en: the eleventh of March

examples.ch: 这个月的1号
examples.en: the first of the month

defines.trans_ch: 由…制成的;由…组成的;含有…的
defines.trans_en: made or consisting of; having

examples.ch: 蕾丝和丝绸制成的衣裙
examples.en: dresses of lace and silk

examples.ch: 金银制成的盘子
examples.en: plates of gold and silver

examples.ch: 冰天雪地
examples.en: a land of ice and snow

examples.ch: 极富魅力的女子
examples.en: a woman of great charm

examples.ch: 了无趣味的话题
examples.en: a subject of very little interest

defines.trans_ch: （用于连接特定的形容词和名词）
defines.trans_en: used to connect particular adjectives and verbs with nouns

examples.ch: 喜爱游泳
examples.en: fond of swimming

examples.ch: 厌烦了他的借口
examples.en: sick of his excuses

examples.ch: 害怕蜘蛛
examples.en: scared of spiders

defines.trans_ch: （用于形容词后表示对某人行为的评判）
defines.trans_en: used after an adjective when judging someone's behaviour

examples.ch: 你提到她的体重真是有点太刻薄了。
examples.en: It was mean of you to mention her weight.

examples.ch: 谢谢你给我的礼物。你想得真周到。
examples.en: Thank you so much for my present. How thoughtful of you.

defines.trans_en: about; relating to

examples.ch: 说伊丽莎白，伊丽莎白就到。
examples.en: Speaking of Elizabeth, here she is.

examples.ch: 乘火车旅行的好处之一就是能看书。
examples.en: One of the advantages of travelling by train is being able to read.

examples.ch: 让我们考虑一下过去5个月中发生的事情。
examples.en: Let us consider the events of the last five months.

examples.ch: 我们对她的童年知之甚少。
examples.en: Of her childhood we know very little.

examples.ch: 小阿德里安的情况如何？他好吗？
examples.en: And what of (= tell me about) young Adrian? How is he?

defines.trans_en: that is/are

examples.ch: 无家可归的问题
examples.en: the problem of homelessness

examples.ch: 通货膨胀率上升2%
examples.en: a rise of two percent in inflation

examples.ch: 谈判的技巧
examples.en: the skill of negotiating

examples.ch: 抚养双胞胎的艰难
examples.en: the difficulty of bringing up twins

examples.ch: 分离的痛苦
examples.en: the pain of separation

examples.ch: 6岁时她已能读报。
examples.en: At the age of six she could read a newspaper.

defines.trans_en: done to

examples.ch: 对数以百计无辜百姓的屠杀
examples.en: the massacre of hundreds of innocent people

examples.ch: 对一个民族的压迫
examples.en: the oppression of a nation

examples.ch: 对雨林的破坏
examples.en: the destruction of the rain forest

defines.trans_en: felt or experienced by

examples.ch: 数百万人的苦难
examples.en: the suffering of millions

examples.ch: 被杀孩子的父母的痛苦
examples.en: the anguish of the murdered child's parents

defines.trans_en: through; having as the cause

examples.ch: 他死于癌症。
examples.en: He died of cancer.

examples.ch: 我本不必去那里——我这么做完全出于自愿。
examples.en: I didn't have to go there - I did it of my own free will.

examples.ch: 我想知道它是怎么发生的，因为它肯定不是自己就发生了。
examples.en: I want to know how it happened because it certainly didn't happen of itself.

defines.trans_en: used when comparing related things

examples.ch: 我最喜欢绿色的那个。
examples.en: I liked the green one best of all .

examples.ch: 最差劲的是食物！
examples.en: Worst of all was the food!

examples.ch: 他是三兄弟中长得最帅的一个。
examples.en: He's the best looking of the three brothers.

examples.ch: 我觉得在他所有的书中我最喜欢这一本。
examples.en: I think that of all his books it's my favourite.

defines.trans_en: used in saying what the time is

examples.ch: 5点差10分。
examples.en: It's ten (minutes) of five (= ten minutes before five o'clock).

defines.trans_ch: （表示空间或时间上的距离）离，距
defines.trans_en: used in expressions showing distance from something in place or time

examples.ch: 我们住在距学校不到1英里的地方。
examples.en: We live within a mile of the school.

examples.ch: 她离打破世界纪录差了不到两秒。
examples.en: She came within two seconds of beating the world record.

defines.trans_en: used in expressions showing loss

examples.ch: 他们的全部积蓄都被抢走了。
examples.en: They were robbed of all their savings.

examples.ch: 我感觉我和你在一起的机会全被剥夺了。
examples.en: I feel I've been deprived of your company.

defines.trans_en: during

examples.ch: 我喜欢在晚上抽一斗烟放松放松。
examples.en: I like to relax with a pipe of an evening.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指离开当前所在地点或位置）离开，远离
defines.trans_en: away from a place or position, especially the present place, position, or time

examples.ch: 他以令人难以置信的速度开车走了。
examples.en: He drove off at the most incredible speed.

examples.ch: 牵好狗，不然它就会跑掉的。
examples.en: Keep the dog on the lead or he'll just run off.

examples.ch: 有人拿走了我的钢笔。
examples.en: Someone ran off with (= took) my pen.

examples.ch: 她下周去加拿大。
examples.en: She's off to Canada next week.

examples.ch: 我去火车站为她送行。
examples.en: I saw her off (= said goodbye) at the station.

examples.ch: 决赛还远着呢，我甚至连想都没想过。
examples.en: Finals are so far off that I'm not even thinking about them yet.

examples.ch: 我要走了——明天见。
examples.en: I'm off now - see you tomorrow.

examples.ch: 如果我们明天早上早点出发就能避开交通高峰时段。
examples.en: If we can get off (= leave) early tomorrow morning we'll avoid most of the traffic.

defines.trans_ch: （与表示动作的词连用）去掉，除掉，移开
defines.trans_en: used with actions in which something is removed or removes itself from another thing

examples.ch: 把你的夹克衫脱掉。
examples.en: Take your jacket off.

examples.ch: 我的一粒纽扣掉了。
examples.en: One of my buttons has come off.

examples.ch: 她把头发全剪掉了。
examples.en: She had all her hair cut off.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指机器、电器设备、灯等）切断，停止运转；断电
defines.trans_en: (especially of machines, electrical devices, lights, etc.) not operating because of not being switched on

examples.ch: 回家之前一定要把电脑都关掉。
examples.en: Make sure the computers are all off before you go home.

examples.ch: 关掉灯／发动机／电视。
examples.en: Turn/Switch the light/engine/television off.

defines.trans_en: (of money) taken away from the original price

examples.ch: 如果你付现金的话，可以给你打折。
examples.en: You can get some money off if you pay cash.

examples.ch: 本周冬季外套一律打6折。
examples.en: There's 40 percent off this week on all winter coats.

examples.ch: 这家商店大多数夹克都减价40或50美元。
examples.en: There was $40 or $50 off most jackets in the store.

defines.trans_ch: 没上班（的）； 在家休息（的），在休假（的）
defines.trans_en: not at work; at home or on holiday

examples.ch: 我打算休假一段时间，整修一下我的房子。
examples.en: I'm going to take/have some time off to work on my house.

examples.ch: 她上星期休病假了。
examples.en: She was off sick last week.

examples.ch: 他现在不在——要我叫他给你回电话吗？
examples.en: He's off at the moment - can I get him to call you back?

defines.trans_en: in such a way as to be separated

examples.ch: 警方封闭了所有通往这座城市的道路。
examples.en: The police have shut/closed off all streets leading to the city.

examples.ch: 为安全起见，公园里用围栏把孩子们玩的场所隔开。
examples.en: The area in the park where the kids play is fenced off for safety reasons.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指因为被用完或被杀死而）消失，没有
defines.trans_en: in such a way as to be completely absent, especially because of having been used or killed

examples.ch: 瓶子上说它可以杀灭所有已知的病菌。
examples.en: It says on the bottle that it kills off all known germs.

examples.ch: 她要花一段时间才能偿清所有的债务。
examples.en: It'll take some time before she manages to pay off all her debts.

examples.ch: 锻炼的好处在于能消耗卡路里。
examples.en: The good thing about exercise is that it burns off calories.

examples.ch: 我们俩喝光了好几瓶酒。
examples.en: Between us we managed to finish off several bottles of wine.

defines.trans_en: in such a way as to get rid of something

examples.ch: 我们出去走了走，消化一下晚餐吃的东西。
examples.en: We went out for a while to walk off some of our dinner.

examples.ch: 他头疼，去睡了。
examples.en: He's gone to sleep off a headache.

examples.ch: 犯不着为这些话感到难过——你只需一笑了之。
examples.en: There's no point in getting upset about what he said - you just have to laugh it off.

defines.trans_en: used to form nouns referring to a situation in which two or more people or teams compete against each other to see who is the winner

examples.ch: 英国广播公司的系列节目《大英烘培比赛》。
examples.en: the BBC series, the Great British Bake Off

examples.ch: 观众的掌声决定每场舞蹈比赛的获胜者。
examples.en: Audience applause determines the winner of each dance-off.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指离开当前所在地点或位置）离开，远离
defines.trans_en: down or away from a place, position, or time, especially the present place, position, or time

examples.ch: 有个告示牌上写着“请勿践踏草坪”。
examples.en: There was a "Keep off the grass" sign.

examples.ch: 所有的莓子都从树上掉了下来。
examples.en: All the berries had dropped off the tree.

examples.ch: 他从自行车上摔了下来。
examples.en: He fell off his bike.

examples.ch: 我们离三万美元的目标还差得很远。
examples.en: We're still a long way off our target of $30,000.

examples.ch: 我希望她知道在哪儿下公交车／火车。
examples.en: I hope she knows where to get off (= leave) the bus/train.

examples.ch: 我们距完成这个项目还差多远？
examples.en: How far off finishing the project are we? (= How much more is there to do?)

examples.ch: 到现在我们已经花了6个月的时间整修这套公寓房，但我们离完工还差得很远。
examples.en: We've been working on the flat for six months now but we're still a long way off finishing.

examples.ch: 我们现在离伦敦不远了。
examples.en: We're not far off (= we are quite near) London now.

defines.trans_ch: （与表示动作的词连用）去掉，除掉，移开
defines.trans_en: used with actions in which something is removed or removes itself from another thing

examples.ch: 我取不下这个罐子上的盖子。
examples.en: I can't get the lid off this jar.

examples.ch: 是不是有人从我桌上拿走了一本书？
examples.en: Has anyone taken a book off my desk?

examples.ch: 你能从那一大块白色奶酪上给我切下一小片来吗？
examples.en: Could you cut me a small piece off that big white cheese?

examples.ch: 年轻人，把你的脚从座位上拿开！
examples.en: Take your feet off that seat, young man!

examples.ch: 我不喜欢从你那儿要钱！
examples.en: I don't like taking money off you (= asking you for money)!

examples.ch: 别碰我！
examples.en: Get off me! (= Stop touching me!)

examples.ch: 他逃走前，我夺下了他的刀。
examples.en: I got the knife off of him before he ran away.

defines.trans_en: not liking or taking something or someone

examples.ch: 自从他得了胃病后，就对食物失去了兴趣。
examples.en: He's been off his food ever since he had the stomach upset.

examples.ch: 她现在身体很好，不必吃药了。
examples.en: She's well enough to be off the medicine now.

examples.ch: 至今她已戒毒一年了。
examples.en: She's been off drugs for a year now.

examples.ch: 医生说他可以不吃这些药片了。
examples.en: The doctor says he can come off the tablets.

examples.ch: 我过去喜欢喝咖啡，可是最近不爱喝了。
examples.en: I used to love coffee but I've gone off it (= stopped liking it) recently.

defines.trans_en: near to

examples.ch: 他住得离大路不远。
examples.en: He lives just off the main road.

examples.ch: 它是西班牙东海岸附近的一个岛屿。
examples.en: It's an island off the east coast of Spain.

defines.trans_ch: （安排好的活动）终止的，取消的
defines.trans_en: (of an arranged event) stopped or given up

examples.ch: 婚礼取消了——她觉得自己还太年轻，不想这么早就安定下来。
examples.en: The wedding's off - she's decided she's too young to settle down.

examples.ch: 金和迈克吹了。
examples.en: It's all off (= the relationship is over) between Kim and Mike.

defines.trans_en: having a particular amount or number, especially of money

examples.ch: 安德鲁如今一定很富有了。
examples.en: Andrew must be so well-off (= rich) by now.

examples.ch: 既然戴维丢了工作，我想他们现在经济上很窘迫。
examples.en: I think they're fairly badly-off (= poor) now that David has lost his job.

examples.ch: 我有很多毛衣。
examples.en: I'm quite well off for (= have a lot of) sweaters.

examples.ch: 你有多少钱？
examples.en: How are you off for money? (= do you have enough?)

defines.trans_ch: 低于一般标准（的）;不如平常（的）
defines.trans_en: below the usual standard or rate

examples.ch: 我今天状态不佳——好像什么事都做不好！
examples.en: I'm having an off day today - I just can't seem to do anything right!

defines.trans_ch: （食物和饮料）坏了的，不新鲜的，变质的
defines.trans_en: (of food and drink) no longer fresh or good to eat or drink because of being too old

examples.ch: 这牛奶有馊味了。
examples.en: This milk smells off.

examples.ch: 我最好在这块奶酪变质之前吃了它。
examples.en: I'd better eat this cheese before it goes off.

defines.trans_ch: （餐馆的食物）售完了的，不供应的
defines.trans_en: (of food in a restaurant) not available at that particular time

examples.ch: 先生，很抱歉，鲑鱼卖完了。
examples.en: I'm sorry, sir, the salmon is off.

defines.trans_ch: 漠不关心的，冷漠的，无情的;粗鲁的
defines.trans_en: not thinking or worrying about other people's feelings; rude

examples.ch: 他甚至在她生日那天也没有给她打个电话——我觉得这有点不尽人情。
examples.en: He didn't even call her on her birthday - I thought that was a bit off.

phrases.trans_en: the act of leaving somewhere

examples.ch: 那么，我们准备好要走了吗？
examples.en: Are we ready for the off, then?

defines.trans_en: to kill someone

examples.ch: 他们杀死了他，然后把尸体抛弃在沼泽里。
examples.en: They offed him and dumped his body in the swamp.

defines.trans_en: a room or part of a building in which people work, especially sitting at tables with computers, phones, etc., usually as a part of a business or other organization

examples.ch: 主任办公室
examples.en: the director's office

examples.ch: 昨晚我直到8点钟才离开办公室。
examples.en: I didn't leave the office until eight o'clock last night.

examples.ch: 办公设备
examples.en: office equipment

examples.ch: 办公室工作人员
examples.en: office workers

defines.trans_en: a part of a company

examples.ch: 他们在巴黎、伦敦和马德里都设有办事处。
examples.en: They have offices in Paris, London, and Madrid.

defines.trans_en: a place where you can go to ask advice from or receive treatment from a doctor or dentist

examples.ch: 这位医生不做出诊，你得去她诊所看病。
examples.en: The doctor does not make house calls - you will have to come to her office.

defines.trans_en: a position of authority and responsibility in a government or other organization

examples.ch: 副总统职位
examples.en: the office of vice president

examples.ch: 他担任该协会的主席一职长达20多年。
examples.en: As chairman of the association, he held office for over 20 years.

examples.ch: 社会党执政／在野已近10年了。
examples.en: The Socialist party has been in office (= governing)/out of office (= not governing) for almost ten years.

examples.ch: 她为政府工作期间曾担任不同职务。
examples.en: She's held various offices during her time in government.

examples.ch: 新总统在1月20日就职。
examples.en: The new President takes office on January 20th.

defines.trans_ch: （英国政府或其他政府组织的）部，局
defines.trans_en: a department of the national government in Britain, or an official government organization

examples.ch: 内政部
examples.en: the Home Office

examples.ch: 外交部
examples.en: the Foreign Office

examples.ch: 公平贸易局
examples.en: the Office of Fair Trading

defines.trans_en: many times

examples.ch: 我常见他在花园里。
examples.en: I often see him in the garden.

examples.ch: 你多久洗一次头发？
examples.en: How often do you wash your hair?

examples.ch: 我不常喝啤酒。
examples.en: I don't often drink beer.

examples.ch: 你不会经常遇到一见面就把你吸引住的人。
examples.en: It's not often that you meet someone who you're instantly attracted to.

examples.ch: 我看父母的次数没有我期望的那样多。
examples.en: I don't see my parents as often as I'd like to.

examples.ch: 在这个国家，圣诞节时的气候往往很暖和。
examples.en: Christmas is often mild in this country.

defines.trans_en: petroleum (= the black oil obtained from under the earth's surface from which petrol comes)

examples.ch: 钻探石油
examples.en: drilling for oil

examples.ch: 石油工业
examples.en: the oil industry

defines.trans_en: a thick liquid that comes from petroleum, used as a fuel and for making parts of machines move easily

examples.ch: 柴油／润滑油
examples.en: diesel/lubricating oil

defines.trans_en: a smooth thick liquid produced from plants or animals that is used in cooking

examples.ch: 橄榄／玉米／植物／葵花籽油
examples.en: olive/corn/vegetable/sunflower oil

defines.trans_en: a smooth thick liquid that is used to improve the appearance or quality of the skin or hair

examples.ch: 沐浴润肤油
examples.en: bath oil

phrases.trans_en: thick paints with an oil base, used for painting pictures

examples.ch: 你画油画还是水彩画？
examples.en: Do you paint in oils or watercolours?

defines.trans_ch: 给（尤指机器）上油，给…上润滑油
defines.trans_en: to put oil on something, especially a machine, usually to make it work more easily without sticking

defines.trans_ch: 可以的，同意的；能接受的，可行的
defines.trans_en: used to show that you agree with something or agree to do something

examples.ch: “我明天还你钱。”“行，没问题。”
examples.en: "I'll pay you back tomorrow." "OK, no problem."

examples.ch: “你能来我上班的地方接我吗？”“好的，几点钟？”
examples.en: "Could you pick me up from work?" "OK, what time?"

examples.ch: 我的意思是，我承认，我对他确实不礼貌，不过我觉得我并没有那么粗鲁。
examples.en: I mean, OK (= I accept that), I wasn't exactly polite to him, but I don't think I was that rude!

defines.trans_ch: （用于确认某人是否明白或同意某事）明白吗？好吗？
defines.trans_en: used to check that someone understands something or that they agree to something

examples.ch: 你需要多加点醋，明白吗？
examples.en: You need to add more vinegar, OK?

examples.ch: 我们6点30分见面，好吗？
examples.en: I'll see you at 6.30, okay?

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示打算行动或开始新的活动）行，好吧
defines.trans_en: used as a way of showing that you are going to take action or start something new

examples.ch: 行，我们走吧。
examples.en: Okay, let's go.

examples.ch: 那好吧，如果你准备好了，我们就开始。
examples.en: Okay then, if you're ready we'll start.

defines.trans_en: used in the middle of a sentence as a way of pausing

examples.ch: 我们看见了这些人，就走过去和他们交谈起来。
examples.en: We saw these guys, okay, so we went up to them and started talking.

defines.trans_ch: 可以的，同意的；能接受的，可行的
defines.trans_en: agreed or acceptable

examples.ch: 我带一个朋友来参加聚会行吗？
examples.en: Is it okay if I bring a friend to the party?

examples.ch: 如果你同意的话，我等到明天再来。
examples.en: If it's okay by/with you, I'll come over tomorrow instead.

defines.trans_ch: 令人满意的;可以的;不错的
defines.trans_en: in a satisfactory state or of a satisfactory quality

examples.ch: 葆拉怎么样了？她昨天摔了一跤，现在还好吗？
examples.en: How's Paula? Is she okay after her fall yesterday?

examples.ch: 你没事吧？你看上去脸色有些苍白。
examples.en: Are you OK? You look very pale.

examples.ch: “你一切都好吗？”“是的，我很好。”
examples.en: "Is everything OK with you?" "Yes, fine."

examples.ch: 我要检查一下汽车有没有问题——发动机的声音听起来不妙！
examples.en: I'll just check that the car's okay - that noise from the engine doesn't sound good!

defines.trans_ch: 还可以的，还行的，凑合的
defines.trans_en: not bad but certainly not good

examples.ch: “你昨晚吃得怎么样？”“还可以，不过我吃过更好的。”
examples.en: "Did you have a good dinner out last night?" "It was okay - I've definitely had better."

examples.ch: 她的嗓音还可以，不过没什么特别之处。
examples.en: Her voice is OK, but it's nothing special.

defines.trans_en: in a satisfactory way

examples.ch: 打印机停止工作之前，一切还算顺利。
examples.en: Everything was going OK until the printer stopped working.

examples.ch: 你睡得还好吗？
examples.en: Did you sleep okay?

examples.ch: 我打电话来就是确认一下你是否顺利到达。
examples.en: I just called to make sure that you got there okay.

defines.trans_en: to agree to something

examples.ch: 委员会已批准你的建议了吗？
examples.en: Have the committee OK'd your proposal?

defines.trans_ch: （美国）奥克拉荷马州（写地址时Oklahoma的缩写）
defines.trans_en: written abbreviation for the US state of Oklahoma: used in addresses

phrases.trans_en: permission

examples.ch: 他已获准启动他的方案。
examples.en: He got the OK to go ahead with his project.

defines.trans_en: written abbreviation for the US state of Oklahoma: used in addresses

phrases.trans_en: permission

examples.ch: 他已获准启动他的方案。
examples.en: He got the OK to go ahead with his project.

defines.trans_en: having lived or existed for many years

examples.ch: 老人
examples.en: an old man

examples.ch: 我们都老了。
examples.en: We're all getting older.

examples.ch: 他看上去那么老让我很震惊。
examples.en: I was shocked by how old he looked.

examples.ch: 好，来吧，卡洛斯，你那么大了，该自己系鞋带了。
examples.en: Now come on, you're old enough to tie your own shoelaces, Carlos.

examples.ch: 我老大不小了，不能每晚总在夜总会里胡混。
examples.en: I'm too old to be out in the clubs every night.

examples.ch: 乡下一间漂亮的古老农舍
examples.en: a beautiful old farm house in the country

examples.ch: 残破的旧汽车
examples.en: a battered old car

examples.ch: 那是个老掉牙的笑话——我听过不知多少次了。
examples.en: That's an old joke - I've heard it about a thousand times.

examples.ch: 从气味上判断，我觉得这块奶酪有点陈了。
examples.en: I think this cheese is old, judging by the smell of it.

defines.trans_en: used to describe or ask about someone's age

examples.ch: 你父亲多大年龄了？
examples.en: How old is your father?

examples.ch: 罗茜现在6岁了。
examples.en: Rosie's six years old now.

examples.ch: 对于一个54岁的人来说，这种行为太有失体面了。
examples.en: It's not very dignified behaviour for a 54-year-old man.

examples.ch: 他比我大几岁。
examples.en: He's a couple of years older than me.

defines.trans_ch: 过去的;旧时的，从前的，以前的
defines.trans_en: from a period in the past

examples.ch: 上次我回家时见到了我从前的英语老师。
examples.en: I saw my old English teacher last time I went home.

examples.ch: 他给我买了一个新电话取代了那个旧的。
examples.en: He bought me a new phone to replace my old one.

examples.ch: 她领我参观了她的母校。
examples.en: She showed me her old school.

examples.ch: 我看见了我的一个前男友。
examples.en: I saw an old boyfriend of mine.

examples.ch: 我以前的那份工作职责没有这么多。
examples.en: In my old job I had less responsibility.

defines.trans_en: (especially of a friend) known for a long time

examples.ch: 她是我的老朋友之一——我们上幼儿园时就认识了。
examples.en: She's one of my oldest friends - we met in kindergarten.

defines.trans_ch: （用于人名前表示亲密、熟识的称呼）老…
defines.trans_en: used before someone's name when you are referring to or talking to them, to show that you know that person well and like them

examples.ch: 老萨拉在角落里埋头苦干。
examples.en: There's old Sara working away in the corner.

examples.ch: 我听说可怜的老弗兰克失业了。
examples.en: I hear poor old Frank's lost his job.

phrases.trans_ch: （因目标使用者为年龄更大一些的人而）不适合的
phrases.trans_en: unsuitable because intended for older people

examples.ch: 你不觉得这本书是给年龄大一些的人看的，对你来说不合适吗？
examples.en: Don't you think that book is too old for you?

phrases.trans_en: a language when it was in an early stage in its development
old people considered together as a group

examples.ch: 许多服务项目被取消，这样做对老年人的影响尤其大。
examples.en: These cuts in services will particularly affect the old.

defines.trans_en: a dish made by mixing eggs together and frying them, often with small pieces of other food such as cheese or vegetables

examples.ch: 奶酪／蘑菇煎蛋饼
examples.en: a cheese/mushroom omelette

defines.trans_en: used to show that something is in a position above something else and touching it, or that something is moving into such a position

examples.ch: 看看你书桌上这么多书！
examples.en: Look at all the books on your desk!

examples.ch: 哎哟，你踩着我的脚了！
examples.en: Ow, you're standing on my foot!

examples.ch: 你的手提箱在衣柜顶上。
examples.en: Your suitcase is on top of the wardrobe.

examples.ch: 他们住在山上的那间旧房子里。
examples.en: They live in that old house on the hill.

examples.ch: 我骑上自行车离开了。
examples.en: I got on my bike and left.

defines.trans_en: covering the surface of, being held by, or connected to something

examples.ch: 你的衬衫上沾了血。
examples.en: There's blood on your shirt.

examples.ch: 你把戒指戴在哪个手指上？
examples.en: Which finger do you wear your ring on?

examples.ch: 你会倒立吗？
examples.en: Can you stand on your head?

examples.ch: 我们可以把这幅画挂在门旁边的墙上。
examples.en: We could hang this picture on the wall next to the door.

examples.ch: 狗应该一直用皮带拴着。
examples.en: Dogs should be kept on their leashes at all times.

examples.ch: 我们刚搬了家，还没有接通电话。
examples.en: We've just moved house and we're not on the phone (= not connected to the phone service) yet.

defines.trans_en: used to show when something happens

examples.ch: 发廊通常星期天不开门。
examples.en: Hair salons don't usually open on Sundays.

examples.ch: 星期五你要干什么？
examples.en: What are you doing on Friday?

examples.ch: 我的生日是5月30日。
examples.en: My birthday's on 30 May.

examples.ch: 能否告诉我3月13日星期五下午你在干什么？
examples.en: Would you mind telling me what you were doing on the afternoon of Friday the 13th of March?

examples.ch: 钟楼上的钟每小时整点敲响。
examples.en: The bells in the clock tower ring every hour on the hour (= at exactly one o'clock, two o'clock, etc.).

examples.ch: 在晴天，从这儿可以看到那些山峦。
examples.en: On a clear day you can see the mountains from here.

examples.ch: 她刚到医院就死了。
examples.en: She was dead on arrival (= dead when she arrived) at the hospital.

examples.ch: 离开酒店时请把钥匙交到服务台。
examples.en: Please leave your key at the reception desk on your departure from (= when you leave) the hotel.

defines.trans_en: used to show where something has been written, printed, or drawn

examples.ch: 那道咖喱菜的做法在第几页？
examples.en: Which page is that curry recipe on?

examples.ch: 他姓名的首字母刻在了他手表的后盖上。
examples.en: His initials were engraved on the back of his watch.

examples.ch: 今晚菜单上有什么菜？
examples.en: What's on the menu tonight? (= What food is available?)

defines.trans_en: used for showing some methods of travelling

examples.ch: 我喜欢乘火车旅行。
examples.en: I love travelling on trains.

examples.ch: 她将乘坐5点30分的公共汽车到达。
examples.en: She's coming in on the 5.30 bus.

examples.ch: 我们是乘渡轮去法国的。
examples.en: We went to France on the ferry.

examples.ch: 步行到那里更快些。
examples.en: It'd be quicker to get there on foot.

examples.ch: 马背上的两个身影
examples.en: two figures on horseback

defines.trans_en: used to show that a condition or process is being experienced

examples.ch: 他无意中烧着了自己的床。
examples.en: He accidentally set his bed on fire.

examples.ch: 马丁这星期在度假。
examples.en: Max's on holiday this week.

examples.ch: 长途旅行时我常晕车。
examples.en: I often get carsick when I'm on a long journey.

examples.ch: 犯罪活动又开始抬头了。
examples.en: Crime is on the increase (= is increasing) again.

examples.ch: 他们飞往巴黎的航班目前正在打折。
examples.en: Their flights to Paris are on special offer at the moment.

examples.ch: 下星期我要外出参加一个培训班。
examples.en: I'll be away on a training course next week.

defines.trans_ch: （记录、录制或演出）以…方式，通过，使用
defines.trans_en: used to show the form in which something is recorded or performed

examples.ch: 一张闪存盘上能存储多少数据？
examples.en: How much data can you store on the flash drive?

examples.ch: 这部电影的DVD什么时候出？
examples.en: When's the movie coming out on DVD?

examples.ch: 第一次看到自己上电影时，我觉得很尴尬。
examples.en: I was really embarrassed the first time I saw myself on film.

examples.ch: 今晚电视有什么节目？
examples.en: What's on TV tonight?

examples.ch: 我希望收音机里多播放一些爵士乐。
examples.en: I wish there was more jazz on the radio.

defines.trans_en: used to show what causes pain or injury as a result of being touched

examples.ch: 我站起来的时候，头撞在架子上。
examples.en: I hit my head on the shelf as I was standing up.

examples.ch: 小心不要被那把刀划伤。
examples.en: Be careful not to cut yourself on that knife.

defines.trans_en: to or towards

examples.ch: 我们家是邮局过后靠左第一家。
examples.en: Our house is the first on the left after the post office.

examples.ch: 对该村庄的进攻持续了一整夜。
examples.en: The attack on the village lasted all night.

examples.ch: 我希望你不要那样蹑手蹑脚地靠近我！
examples.en: I wish you wouldn't sneak up on me like that!

defines.trans_en: relating to

examples.ch: 关于妊娠的书
examples.en: a book on pregnancy

examples.ch: 她的论文是关于意大利女性文学的。
examples.en: Her talk is on Italian women's literature.

examples.ch: 部长拒绝对指控作出评论。
examples.en: The minister has refused to comment on the allegations.

examples.ch: 批评对他不起作用。
examples.en: Criticism has no effect on him.

examples.ch: 警方有没有抓住你什么把柄？
examples.en: Do the police have anything on you (= do they have any information about you that can be used against you)?

defines.trans_en: used to show something for which a payment is made

examples.ch: 他花180欧元买了一顶帽子。
examples.en: He spent €180 on a hat.

examples.ch: 我在这辆汽车上浪费了许多钱。
examples.en: I've wasted a lot of money on this car.

examples.ch: 我们在那笔生意上获利颇丰。
examples.en: We made a big profit on that deal.

examples.ch: 这笔贷款你要支付多少利息？
examples.en: How much interest are you paying on the loan?

defines.trans_en: used to show a person or thing that is necessary for something to happen or that is the origin of something

examples.ch: 我们要靠你了。
examples.en: We're relying on you.

examples.ch: 我可能会来——这取决于安德鲁。
examples.en: I might come - it depends on Andrew.

examples.ch: 大多数孩子上大学期间仍然依赖他们的父母。
examples.en: Most children remain dependent on their parents while they are at university.

examples.ch: 他的新电影是根据一个童话故事改编的。
examples.en: His latest movie is based on a fairy tale.

defines.trans_ch: （表示牵涉或参与其中）在从事…
defines.trans_en: used to show when someone is involved or taking part in something

examples.ch: 我正在写一本新书。
examples.en: I'm working on a new book.

examples.ch: “我们进行到哪里了？”“我们讲到第42页了。”
examples.en: "Where had we got up to?" "We were on page 42."

defines.trans_en: used to show what is providing financial support or an income

examples.ch: 目前我每周只靠70美元的收入过活。
examples.en: I only have $70 a week to live on at the moment.

examples.ch: 他退休后靠公司提供的丰厚退休金生活。
examples.en: He retired on a generous pension from the company.

examples.ch: 她的年收入为2.5万英镑。
examples.en: She's on (= earning) £25,000 a year.

defines.trans_en: used to show something that is used as food, fuel, or a drug

examples.ch: 老鼠以什么为食？
examples.en: What do mice live on?

examples.ch: 这台收音机是用电池的吗？
examples.en: Does this radio run on batteries?

examples.ch: 他吸毒吗？
examples.en: Is he on drugs?

defines.trans_en: next to or along the side of

examples.ch: 这是密西西比河上的一座小镇。
examples.en: It's a small town on the Mississippi River.

examples.ch: 我们的房子在斯特顿大街上。
examples.en: Our house was on Sturton Street.

examples.ch: 斯特拉斯堡位于德法边界上。
examples.en: Strasbourg is on the border of France and Germany.

defines.trans_en: used to show when someone is a member of a group or organization

examples.ch: 你参加过陪审团吗？
examples.en: Have you ever served on a jury?

examples.ch: 该委员会没有女性。
examples.en: There are no women on the committee.

examples.ch: 你有多少职员？
examples.en: How many people are on your staff?

examples.ch: 她在一家女性杂志做调查员。
examples.en: She's a researcher on a women's magazine.

defines.trans_en: used when referring to a tool, instrument, or system that is used to do something

examples.ch: 我用电脑来处理全部的家庭账目。
examples.en: I do all my household accounts on the computer.

examples.ch: 克里斯打鼓，迈克弹低音电吉他。
examples.en: Chris is on drums and Mike's on bass guitar.

examples.ch: 我正在打电话。
examples.en: I'm on (= talking on) the phone.

defines.trans_en: used to show when something is repeated one or more times

examples.ch: 本届政府在地方选举中一再受挫。
examples.en: The government suffered defeat on defeat in the local elections.

examples.ch: 一批又一批的难民为躲避战争而越过边境。
examples.en: Wave on wave of refugees has crossed the border to escape the fighting.

defines.trans_en: used when making a comparison

examples.ch: 这是我出的最高价，我不可能再提价了。
examples.en: That's my final offer, and I can't improve on it.

examples.ch: 制造商从未对最早的车型进行改进。
examples.en: The manufacturer has never improved on the earliest model of the car.

examples.ch: 与上周相比生产率下降／上升了。
examples.en: The productivity figures are down/up on last week's.

defines.trans_en: used to show when someone has something in a pocket or in a bag that they are carrying

examples.ch: 你身上有没有多余的笔？
examples.en: Do you have a spare pen on you?

examples.ch: 我没有带驾驶执照。
examples.en: I don't have my driving licence on me.

defines.trans_en: happening after and usually because of

examples.ch: 警方根据匿名者提供的消息采取行动，逮捕了他。
examples.en: Acting on information given to them anonymously, the police arrested him.

examples.ch: 他母亲死后他继承了25万英镑。
examples.en: He inherited a quarter of a million pounds on his mother's death.

examples.ch: 他们回来后发现家里被盗。
examples.en: On their return they discovered that their house had been broken into.

defines.trans_en: used to show who is paying for something

examples.ch: 这顿饭我付钱。
examples.en: Dinner meal is on me.

examples.ch: 她享受国民医疗保健制度免费做了手术。
examples.en: She had her operation done on the National Health Service.

defines.trans_ch: （表示运转出故障时受影响的人）
defines.trans_en: used to show who suffers when something does not operate as it should

examples.ch: 我正在打电话，电话突然断了。
examples.en: The phone suddenly went dead on me.

examples.ch: 他们的汽车在回家的途中抛锚了。
examples.en: Their car broke down on them on the way home.

defines.trans_en: used to show the number of points a person or team has in a competition

examples.ch: 克莱夫所在队得5分，琼所在队得7分。
examples.en: Clive's team is on five points while Joan's is on seven.

defines.trans_en: on your body or someone's body

examples.ch: 天很冷，穿上大衣吧。
examples.en: It's very cold so put a coat on.

examples.ch: 她光着身体在房子里四处走动。
examples.en: She wanders around the house with nothing on.

examples.ch: 你记得他穿什么衣服吗？
examples.en: Can you remember what he had on (= was wearing)?

examples.ch: 我试了好几件夹克衫，可是都不好看。
examples.en: I tried on a few jackets, but none of them looked nice.

defines.trans_en: covering the surface of something or connected to something

examples.ch: 把盖子紧紧地拧上。
examples.en: Screw the lid on tightly.

examples.ch: 外科医生成功地把手指接回去了。
examples.en: Surgeons managed to sew the finger back on.

defines.trans_ch: 开着；在工作中；开始运行
defines.trans_en: used to show when something is operating or starting to operate

examples.ch: 你能把收音机打开吗？
examples.en: Could you switch on the radio?

examples.ch: 请打开电视机好吗？
examples.en: Would you turn the TV on?

examples.ch: 你忘了关卧室的灯了。
examples.en: You left the bedroom light on.

defines.trans_en: continuing or not stopping

examples.ch: 如果她的电话占线，继续打。
examples.en: If her phone's busy, keep on trying.

examples.ch: 别说话了，继续干你们的活。
examples.en: Stop talking and get on with your work.

examples.ch: 要是埃莉斯愿意再多坚持一下，她肯定会得到提升的。
examples.en: If Elise would just hang on (= wait) a little longer she'd definitely get the promotion.

examples.ch: 噪音一直响个不停，我想它永远也不会停的。
examples.en: The noise just went on and on (= continued for a long time), and I thought it would never stop.

defines.trans_ch: 上（公交车、火车、飞机等旅行交通工具）
defines.trans_en: into a bus, train, plane, etc., or in the correct position to start using some other method of travelling

examples.ch: 我上车的时候火车突然开动了。
examples.en: The train suddenly started moving as I was getting on.

examples.ch: 她刚一上马，马就飞奔起来。
examples.en: Her horse galloped off as soon as she was on.

defines.trans_en: performing

examples.ch: 赶快化妆——我10分钟后上场。
examples.en: Hurry up with the make-up - I'm on in ten minutes.

examples.ch: 乐队上台的时候，观众们欢呼起来。
examples.en: The audience cheered as the band came on (= came onto the stage).

defines.trans_en: continuing forward in time or space

examples.ch: 从那天起他们彼此之间再没讲过话。
examples.en: They never spoke to each other from that day on (= after that day).

examples.ch: 你过一会儿要做什么？
examples.en: What are you doing later on?

examples.ch: 你看完后把它传给保罗好吗？
examples.en: When you're done with it, would you pass it on to Paul?

examples.ch: 请往前挪一下，让救护车过去。
examples.en: Move on, please, and let the ambulance through.

examples.ch: 你骑车向前走，我在那儿和你会面。
examples.en: You cycle on and I'll meet you there.

defines.trans_ch: 正在发生；根据预先计划
defines.trans_en: happening or planned

examples.ch: 明天聚会仍然举行吗？
examples.en: Is the party still on for tomorrow?

examples.ch: 我明天很忙，不过后天没什么事。
examples.en: I'm busy tomorrow, but I've got nothing on the day after.

examples.ch: 我这会儿事情很多。
examples.en: I've got a lot on at the moment.

examples.ch: 战时食物必须实行定量配给。
examples.en: Food had to be rationed when the war was on.

examples.ch: 这周电影院有什么好电影吗？
examples.en: Are there any good movies on (= being shown) this week?

defines.trans_en: used when talking about the position of one thing compared with the position of another

examples.ch: 令人惊讶的是两辆车正面相撞，居然没有一个人受伤。
examples.en: It's amazing nobody was injured because the two buses crashed head on (= the front parts of the buses hit each other).

examples.ch: 自行车撞到了我们车的侧面。
examples.en: The bike hit our car side on (= hit the side of the car rather than the front or back).

examples.ch: 如果我们把书柜侧过来，通过门道就比较容易了。
examples.en: It would be easier to get the bookcase through the doorway if we turned it sideways on (= turned it so that one of its sides is at the front).

defines.trans_en: one single time

examples.ch: 我玩过一次帆船，不过我不喜欢。
examples.en: I went sailing once, but I didn't like it.

examples.ch: 我们每个月在一起吃一次午餐。
examples.en: We have lunch together once a month.

defines.trans_en: in the past, but not now

examples.ch: 这所房子曾属于我的祖父。
examples.en: This house once belonged to my grandfather.

examples.ch: 如今计算机要比以前便宜多了。
examples.en: Computers are much cheaper nowadays than they once were.

examples.ch: 昔日繁荣的村庄今遭废弃，满目疮痍。
examples.en: Once-thriving villages stand deserted and in ruins.

phrases.trans_en: at the same time

examples.ch: 他们同时开始讲起话来。
examples.en: They all started talking at once.

phrases.trans_en: used when something happens that does not usually happen

examples.ch: 难得一次公共汽车准点到达。
examples.en: For once, the bus came on time.

phrases.trans_en: used to say that you will only do or request something on this particular occasion

examples.ch: 好吧，我把钱借给你——仅此一回。
examples.en: All right, I'll lend you the money - just this once.

phrases.trans_en: again, as has happened before

examples.ch: 种族主义攻势在整个欧洲又开始抬头。
examples.en: Once again, racist attacks are increasing across Europe.

phrases.trans_en: one more time

examples.ch: 我想在我们离开之前再去参观一下大学。
examples.en: I'd like to visit the campus once more before we leave.

phrases.trans_en: again, as has happened before

examples.ch: 当父亲回到家时，一切又变好了。
examples.en: When my father came home, everything felt right once more.

phrases.trans_en: a few times

examples.ch: 我在城里见过他几次。
examples.en: I've seen him once or twice in town.

phrases.trans_en: sometimes but not often

examples.ch: 我们偶尔见面吃顿午餐。
examples.en: We meet for lunch once in a while.

phrases.trans_ch: 彻底了结地；一劳永逸地
phrases.trans_en: completely and in a way that will finally solve a problem

examples.ch: 我们的目的是彻底摧毁他们的进攻能力。
examples.en: Our intention is to destroy their offensive capability once and for all.

phrases.trans_ch: 一生只有一次；千载难逢地；难得地
phrases.trans_en: only likely to happen once in a person's life

examples.ch: 像这样好的机会可是千载难逢呀。
examples.en: An opportunity as good as this arises once in a lifetime.

phrases.trans_en: on a single occasion

examples.ch: 我只打过一次橄榄球，我再也不想打了。
examples.en: I've only played rugby the once, and I never want to play it again.

defines.trans_en: as soon as, or from the moment when

examples.ch: 我一找到住的地方就把地址告诉你。
examples.en: Once I've found somewhere to live I'll send you my address.

examples.ch: 记住一旦你签了字就不能取消合同了。
examples.en: Remember that you won't be able to cancel the contract once you've signed.

phrases.trans_en: immediately

examples.ch: 我立刻知道我会喜欢这里的。
examples.en: I knew at once that I'd like it here.

defines.trans_en: the number 1

examples.ch: 他有两片，而我只有一片。
examples.en: He had two slices and I only had one.

examples.ch: 明天她就一周岁了。
examples.en: She'll be one year old tomorrow.

defines.trans_ch: （用于指将来某个未确定的时间）某一
defines.trans_en: used to refer to a time in the future that is not yet decided

examples.ch: 我们何不在下周的某一天一起吃顿午饭？
examples.en: Why don't we meet for lunch one day next week?

examples.ch: 我想在某个圣诞节去滑雪。
examples.en: I'd like to go skiing one Christmas.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a particular occasion while avoiding stating the exact moment

examples.ch: 有一天晚上，我们一直聊到天亮。
examples.en: One night we stayed up talking till dawn.

examples.ch: 一天傍晚，他在下班回家的路上遭到了袭击。
examples.en: He was attacked as he was walking home from work late one afternoon.

examples.ch: 他一会儿说爱我，一会儿又要离婚。
examples.en: One moment he says he loves me, the next moment he's asking for a divorce.

examples.ch: 她似乎从不清楚每时每刻自己在干什么。
examples.en: She never seems to know what she's doing from one minute to the next.

defines.trans_en: a single thing; not two or more

examples.ch: 一次吃一个。
examples.en: Eat them one at a time (= separately).

examples.ch: 我觉得我们应该把卧室刷成一种颜色。
examples.en: I think we should paint the bedroom all one (= in a single) colour.

examples.ch: 你觉得我们5个人能够挤进一辆车里吗？
examples.en: Do you think five of us will manage to squeeze into the one car?

defines.trans_en: used when saying there is no other person or thing

examples.ch: 在紧急情况下他是你唯一可以依靠的人。
examples.en: He's the one person you can rely on in an emergency.

examples.ch: 这可能是你见到她的唯一机会。
examples.en: This may be your one and only (= only ever) opportunity to meet her.

examples.ch: 我们今晚节目的最后一位嘉宾无需介绍。请欢迎独一无二的迈克尔‧乔丹！
examples.en: My final guest on tonight's show needs no introduction. Please welcome the one and only Michael Jordan!

defines.trans_ch: （用于不认识的人的名字前）某一个
defines.trans_en: used before the name of someone who is not known

examples.ch: 她的律师是个名叫约翰‧温特斯吉尔的人。
examples.en: Her solicitor is one John Wintersgill.

defines.trans_en: used to emphasize an adjective

examples.ch: 他母亲非常慷慨。
examples.en: His mother is one (= a very) generous woman.

examples.ch: 你那个冰激凌真是好大呀。
examples.en: That's one (= a very) big ice cream cone you have there.

examples.ch: 发现自己已经丢了工作，这实在令我感到震惊。
examples.en: It was one hell of a (= a very great) shock to find out I'd lost my job.

phrases.trans_ch: （一群人或事物）中的一个，之一
phrases.trans_en: a member of a group of people or things

examples.ch: 他们的一个女儿刚生了孩子。
examples.en: One of their daughters has just had a baby.

examples.ch: EMI公司是世界最大的唱片公司之一。
examples.en: EMI is one of the world's largest record companies.

examples.ch: 寻找治疗癌症的方法是医学研究者面临的最大挑战之一。
examples.en: Finding a cure for cancer is one of the biggest challenges facing medical researchers.

examples.ch: 我们的组织只是给这个地区提供饥荒救济的众多慈善组织中的一个。
examples.en: Our organization is just one of many charities that are providing famine relief in the region.

phrases.trans_ch: 集于一体，合为一体;兼具
phrases.trans_en: combined in a single person or object

examples.ch: 这种型号的产品将收音机、CD播放机和MP3播放器接口集于一体。
examples.en: With this model you get a radio, CD player, and MP3 dock all in one.

defines.trans_ch: （一群人或一批东西中的）一个
defines.trans_en: used to refer to a particular thing or person within a group or range of things or people that are possible or available

examples.ch: 我买了几本关于中国菜的书，如果你喜欢可以借一本。
examples.en: I have a few books on Chinese food. You can borrow one if you want.

examples.ch: 你想要哪一个？
examples.en: Which one would you like?

examples.ch: 请你给办公室里每人印一份，再多印几份给来访者。
examples.en: Please make a copy for everybody in the office and a few extra ones for the visitors.

examples.ch: “你想要哪个蛋糕？”“前面的那个。”
examples.en: "Which cake would you like?" "The one in the front."

examples.ch: 法国羊角面包比我们这里的好吃得多。
examples.en: French croissants are so much better than the ones we get here.

examples.ch: 站着旁观的有许多人，却没有一个人主动帮忙。
examples.en: There were lots of people watching, and not one of them offered to help.

examples.ch: 我的求职申请没有任何回复——一个都没有。
examples.en: I've received no replies to my job applications - not a single one (= none).

examples.ch: 克里斯就是那个长着褐色卷发的人。
examples.en: Chris is the one (= the person) with curly brown hair.

defines.trans_ch: （表示与另一类似或相关的人或物相对照的）一个
defines.trans_en: used to talk about one person or thing compared with other similar or related people or things

examples.ch: 它们看上去这么相似，常常很难区分开来。
examples.en: They look so similar it's often difficult to distinguish one from the other.

examples.ch: 这个和那个你可以选一个，但不能都要。
examples.en: You may have one or the other, but not both.

examples.ch: 犯罪和自由如影随形，不可能只取其一。
examples.en: Crime and freedom are inseparable. You can't have one without the other.

defines.trans_en: any person, but not a particular person

examples.ch: 一个人对他的朋友是负有责任的。
examples.en: One has an obligation to one's friends.

examples.ch: 任何人都应该尽量去投票。
examples.en: One ought to make the effort to vote.

defines.trans_ch: （讲话者或笔者用于自称）我，本人
defines.trans_en: the person speaking or writing

examples.ch: 当然，我很乐意与女王一起进餐。
examples.en: Of course, one (= I) would be delighted to dine with the Queen.

phrases.text: not be one to do sth
phrases.trans_en: to never do something

examples.ch: 你知道，我这人从来不批评人。
examples.en: I'm not one to criticize other people, as you know.

phrases.trans_en: to like something very much

examples.ch: 我从不喜欢在外呆到很晚。
examples.en: I've never been one for staying out late.

examples.ch: 他非常喜欢和女士来往。
examples.en: He's a great one for the ladies.

defines.trans_en: a vegetable with a strong smell and flavour, made up of several layers surrounding each other tightly in a round shape, usually brown or red on the outside and white inside

examples.ch: 我切洋葱的时候总是被呛得流眼泪。
examples.en: I always cry when I'm chopping onions.

examples.ch: 把洋葱和大蒜炒大约两分钟。
examples.en: Fry the onion and garlic for about two minutes.

defines.trans_ch: （产品、服务或信息）联网的，在线的，网上的
defines.trans_en: Online products, services, or information can be bought or used on the internet.

examples.ch: 网上报纸／网络杂志／在线词典
examples.en: an online newspaper/magazine/dictionary

examples.ch: 网上银行服务／购物
examples.en: online banking/shopping

defines.trans_ch: 从网上，在网上，利用因特网（购买、获得等）
defines.trans_en: bought, used, etc. using the internet

examples.ch: 你希望在网上购物吗？
examples.en: Do you like to shop online?

examples.ch: 1999年开始提供这部词典的在线服务。
examples.en: This dictionary went online in 1999.

defines.trans_en: connected to a system

examples.ch: 新电站有望在7月份前实现联网。
examples.en: The new power station is expected to be online by July.

examples.ch: 新工厂何时开始生产？
examples.en: When will the new factory come online (= start production)?

phrases.trans_en: to be able to use email or the internet

examples.ch: 我一上网就把我的电子邮箱地址发给你。
examples.en: I'll send you my email address once I'm online.

defines.trans_en: used to show that there is a single one or very few of something, or that there are no others

examples.ch: 我是火车上唯一的乘客。
examples.en: I was the only person on the train.

examples.ch: 这真的是做这件事唯一的方法吗？
examples.en: Is this really the only way to do it?

examples.ch: 唯一要紧的是婴儿身体健康。
examples.en: The only thing that matters is that the baby is healthy.

examples.ch: 在这种情况下这是我唯一能够做的。
examples.en: It was the only thing I could do under the circumstances.

examples.ch: 只有丽塔一人抱怨。
examples.en: Rita was the only person to complain.

defines.trans_en: used to show that something is limited to not more than, or is not anything other than, the people, things, amount, or activity stated

examples.ch: 目前这种电视机只有在日本才能买到。
examples.en: At present these televisions are only available in Japan.

examples.ch: 只有苏和马克当回事，出席了这次会议。
examples.en: Only Sue and Mark bothered to turn up for the meeting.

examples.ch: 这家俱乐部只对会员开放。
examples.en: This club is for members only.

examples.ch: 只有白痴才会做那样的事。
examples.en: Only an idiot would do that.

examples.ch: 这鞋只要50美元。
examples.en: These shoes only cost $50.

examples.ch: 别担心——只是擦破了点皮而已。
examples.en: Don't worry - it's only a scratch.

examples.ch: 我不过是在开玩笑。
examples.en: I was only joking.

examples.ch: 我只不过想帮忙。
examples.en: I was only trying to help.

examples.ch: 我半小时前才到的。
examples.en: I only arrived half an hour ago.

examples.ch: 她就在几分钟前和我通过电话。
examples.en: She spoke to me only a few minutes ago on the phone.

examples.ch: 才4点，天就开始黑了。
examples.en: It's only four o'clock and it's already getting dark.

examples.ch: “谁在那儿？”“是我而已。我把自己关在外面了。”
examples.en: "Who's there?" "It's only me (= it is not someone you should worry about). I've locked myself out."

examples.ch: 你担心自己的孩子，这是很自然的事情。
examples.en: It's only natural that you should worry about your children.

defines.trans_ch: （表示由于某个行动或未能采取行动而导致不好的事情发生）只，只会
defines.trans_en: used when saying that something unpleasant will happen as a result of an action or a failure to act

examples.ch: 如果你现在不做点什么的话，事情只会变得更糟。
examples.en: If you don't do something about it now it will only get worse.

defines.trans_en: used to show that you feel sorry about something that cannot happen when explaining why it cannot happen

examples.ch: 我很想去澳大利亚。我只是希望自己能负担得起就好了。
examples.en: I'd love to go to Australia. I only wish I could afford to.

defines.trans_ch: （表示认为某人做了傻事）不过，只是
defines.trans_en: used to show that you think someone has done something silly

examples.ch: 她只是又一次把自己关在了公寓门外！
examples.en: She's only locked herself out of her flat again!

phrases.trans_en: used to refer to something that happens almost immediately after something else

examples.ch: 人们都要离开了，而我才刚刚到。
examples.en: People were leaving and I'd only just arrived.

examples.ch: 我们才刚刚出发，车就抛锚了。
examples.en: We'd only just set off when the car broke down.

phrases.trans_en: almost not

examples.ch: 食物刚刚够每人一份。
examples.en: There was only just enough food to go round.

examples.ch: 我们及时赶上了班机，差一点就错过了。
examples.en: We got there in time for our flight, but only just (= but we almost did not).

phrases.trans_en: used to say that two related things are true or happened, especially when this is surprising or shocking

examples.ch: 他不但迟到了，还忘了带书。
examples.en: Not only did he turn up late, he also forgot his books.

examples.ch: 如果这个项目失败，不仅会影响到我们部门，还会对整个机构产生影响。
examples.en: If this project fails, it will affect not only our department, but also the whole organization.

phrases.trans_en: If you say you have only (got) to do something, you mean that it is all you need to do in order to achieve something else.

examples.ch: 如果你需要任何帮助，尽管开口。
examples.en: If you want any help, you have only to ask.

examples.ch: 你只要看看她的脸色就知道她不舒服。
examples.en: You only have to look at her face to see that she's not well.

phrases.trans_en: used to emphasize what you are hoping or wishing for

examples.ch: 我只是希望你知道自己在做什么。
examples.en: I only hope you know what you're doing.

examples.ch: 我希望他们能保持更密切的联系。
examples.en: I only wish that they would keep in touch more regularly.

defines.trans_en: used to show what is the single or main reason why something mentioned in the first part of the sentence cannot be performed or is not completely true

examples.ch: 我本想邀请弗朗西丝参加聚会，只是我不想让她的丈夫来，所以也就不邀请她了。
examples.en: I'd invite Frances to the party, only (= but I will not because) I don't want her husband to come.

examples.ch: 我本要亲自给他打电话，可是我一整天都在工作。
examples.en: I'd call him myself, only (= but I cannot because) I'm at work all day.

examples.ch: 我很高兴为你效劳，不过别指望能下星期前完成。
examples.en: I'd be happy to do it for you, only (= but) don't expect it to be done before next week.

examples.ch: 这种布料跟毛料类似，只是价格更便宜。
examples.en: This fabric is similar to wool, only (= except that it is) cheaper.

defines.trans_en: not closed or fastened

examples.ch: 开着的门／窗
examples.en: an open door/window

examples.ch: 一只打开的手提箱摆在她的床上。
examples.en: An open suitcase lay on her bed.

examples.ch: 你没把包装袋口封上。
examples.en: You left the container open.

examples.ch: 有人把窗户敞开着。
examples.en: Someone had left the window wide (= completely) open.

examples.ch: 他有几处严重的未愈合的伤口。
examples.en: He had several nasty open wounds (= those which had not begun to heal).

defines.trans_en: ready to be used or ready to provide a service

examples.ch: 这家超市一直营业到晚上8点。
examples.en: The supermarket is open till 8.00 p.m.

examples.ch: 这条路现在可以通行，不过在冬天它经常被雪封住。
examples.en: The road is open now, but it is often blocked by snow in the winter.

examples.ch: 市长宣布新医院开始启用。
examples.en: The new hospital was declared open by the mayor.

defines.trans_ch: 没有围上的，敞开的;开阔的;无遮盖的
defines.trans_en: not closed in or covered

examples.ch: 在旷野之中宿营可不是个好主意。
examples.en: It's not a good idea to camp in the middle of an open field (= one which is not covered with trees, bushes, etc.).

examples.ch: 忽然我们离开了都市，进入了开阔的乡野。
examples.en: Suddenly we had left the city behind and were out in open country.

examples.ch: 幸存者在外海上漂流。
examples.en: The survivors were adrift on the open sea (= far from land).

defines.trans_ch: （计算机文件或程序）打开的，已启动的
defines.trans_en: If a computer document or program is open, it is ready to be read or used.

examples.ch: 确保你同时打开两个文档。
examples.en: Make sure you have both files open at the same time.

defines.trans_ch: 可利用的；可得到的；没有限制的
defines.trans_en: available; not limited

examples.ch: 你还有几个不同的选择。
examples.en: There are still several possibilities open to you.

examples.ch: 16岁以上的人都可以参加这场竞赛。
examples.en: The competition is open to anyone over the age of 16.

examples.ch: 这座图书馆向公众开放吗？
examples.en: Is the library open to the general public?

examples.ch: 他们对这些谈判的整个态度应该受到批评。
examples.en: Their whole attitude to these negotiations is open to criticism (= can be criticized).

examples.ch: 我认为自己是愿意接受任何合理的建议的。
examples.en: I'd like to think I'm open to (= willing to consider) any reasonable suggestion.

examples.ch: 一起事故会使整个安全问题凸显出来。
examples.en: An accident would lay the whole issue of safety open (= cause it to be considered).

defines.trans_ch: 不保密的；公开的；毫不掩饰的
defines.trans_en: not secret

examples.ch: 自从去年夏天他们发生了那场争吵后，两人就一直处于公开的敌对状态。
examples.en: There has been open hostility between them ever since they had that argument last summer.

defines.trans_ch: 坦诚的;坦率的;毫不隐讳的
defines.trans_en: honest and not trying to keep things secret

examples.ch: 他对自己的弱点毫不隐瞒。
examples.en: He's very open about his weaknesses.

examples.ch: 我希望你对我更坦诚一些，把你的感受告诉我。
examples.en: I wish you'd be more open with me, and tell me what you're feeling.

examples.ch: 她有一张真诚坦率的面孔。
examples.en: She has an honest, open face.

defines.trans_ch: 尚未决定的，正在考虑中的;不确定的
defines.trans_en: not decided or certain

examples.ch: 我们还不必作出明确的决定，先考虑考虑吧。
examples.en: We don't have to make a firm decision yet. Let's leave it open.

examples.ch: 我们可以再给你一周时间考虑我们的出价，不过到时候我们必须知道你的决定。
examples.en: We can leave our offer open for another week, but we have to have your decision by then.

examples.ch: 我想保留我的选择权，所以暂且不作决定。
examples.en: I want to keep my options open, so I'm not committing myself yet.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) begin

examples.ch: 正式开始讲话之前，我想先简短地介绍一下这个主题的背景。
examples.en: I would like to open my talk by giving a brief background to the subject.

examples.ch: 我打算在另一家银行开一个账户。
examples.en: I'm going to open an account with another bank.

examples.ch: 奥运会明天开幕。
examples.en: The Olympic Games open tomorrow.

examples.ch: 一家新电台预定下个月开播。
examples.en: A new radio station is due to open (up) next month.

examples.ch: 这部电影下周将在纽约和洛杉矶开始上映。
examples.en: The film opens (= will be shown for the first time) in New York and Los Angeles next week.

defines.trans_en: to move something to a position that is not closed, or to make something change to a position that is not closed

examples.ch: 请打开窗户好吗？
examples.en: Could you open the window, please?

examples.ch: 你现在可以睁开眼睛了——这是你的礼物。
examples.en: You can open your eyes now - here's your present.

examples.ch: 这种花早上开，但是到了下午又会合拢。
examples.en: The flowers open (out) in the morning but close again in the afternoon.

examples.ch: 有一道门从厨房通向花园。
examples.en: From the kitchen there is a door that opens (out) into the garden.

examples.ch: 那扇门通往露台。
examples.en: That door opens (out) onto the patio.

examples.ch: “开门——警察！”警察一边猛敲门一边喊道。
examples.en: "Open up (= open the door) - it's the police!" shouted the police officer, banging on the door.

defines.trans_ch: 开，开启，打开，揭开（包装或容器）
defines.trans_en: to remove or separate part of a container or parcel so that you can see or use what it contains

examples.ch: 不要为我一个人新开一瓶酒。
examples.en: Don't open a new bottle just for me.

examples.ch: 我迫不及待要把信拆开。
examples.en: I couldn't wait to open the letter.

defines.trans_ch: 开门，开始营业;开始办公
defines.trans_en: If a shop or office opens at a particular time of day, it starts to do business at that time.

examples.ch: 这家咖啡馆10点钟开门。
examples.en: The coffee shop opens at ten o'clock.

examples.ch: 他的咖啡馆10点钟开始营业。
examples.en: He opens (up) his coffee shop at ten o'clock.

defines.trans_ch: （通常指要人）宣布开业，宣布投入运营，为…揭幕
defines.trans_en: If someone, usually someone important, opens a building, event, etc., they officially say that it is ready to be used or to start operating.

examples.ch: 这家新医院将在星期二由市长正式宣布投入使用。
examples.en: The new hospital will be officially opened by the mayor on Tuesday.

defines.trans_ch: 提供；使有…；开放，取消限制
defines.trans_en: to make something available

examples.ch: 这项研究为找到医治这种疾病的方法提供了可能。
examples.en: This research opens (up) the possibility of being able to find a cure for the disease.

examples.ch: 该国正计划开放经济，欢迎外国投资。
examples.en: The country is planning to open (up) its economy to foreign investment.

defines.trans_ch: 打开，启动（计算机文件或程序）
defines.trans_en: If you open a computer document or program, you make it ready to read or use.

examples.ch: 建立新文件时，先点击“文件夹”，然后再点击“新建”。
examples.en: To open a new document, click "File" and then click "New".

examples.ch: 点击桌面图标，打开《剑桥高阶学习词典》。
examples.en: Click the desktop icon to open the Cambridge Advanced Learner's Dictionary.

phrases.trans_en: somewhere outside, rather than in a building

examples.ch: 在办公室里关了一整天后来到户外感觉真好。
examples.en: It's good to be (out) in the open after being cooped up in an office all day.

phrases.text: bring sth out into the open
phrases.trans_ch: 公开（秘密）; 把…公之于众
phrases.trans_en: to tell people information that was secret

examples.ch: 是该把这件事公开的时候了。
examples.en: It's time this issue was brought out into the open.

defines.trans_en: a musical play in which most of the words are sung, or plays and music of this type

examples.ch: 《卡门》是我最喜爱的歌剧。
examples.en: "Carmen" is my favourite opera.

examples.ch: 我对歌剧一向不是很着迷。
examples.en: I've never been a huge fan of opera.

examples.ch: 他一有机会就去看歌剧。
examples.en: He goes to the opera (= to see an opera) whenever he can.

examples.ch: 歌剧演唱家
examples.en: an opera singer

defines.trans_ch: 全然不同的，迥异的，截然相反的
defines.trans_en: completely different

examples.ch: 你怎么也不会知道她们是姐妹——她们各方面都全然不同。
examples.en: You'd never know they're sisters - they're completely opposite to each other in every way.

examples.ch: 警方试图平息暴力活动，却适得其反。
examples.en: Police attempts to calm the violence had the opposite effect.

defines.trans_ch: 另一边的，相反的，对面的
defines.trans_en: being in a position on the other side; facing

examples.ch: 我哥哥和我住在城里两个方向相反的区。
examples.en: My brother and I live on opposite sides of the city.

examples.ch: 对页上的地图表明这些鸟一般在什么地方交配繁衍。
examples.en: The map on the opposite page shows where these birds commonly breed.

examples.ch: 他们坐在桌子的两端，彼此互不搭理。
examples.en: They sat at opposite ends of the table (to/from each other), refusing to talk.

defines.trans_ch: （在说话者、所指的人或物）对面的
defines.trans_en: facing the speaker or stated person or thing

examples.ch: 如果想买票，你得去对面的柜台。
examples.en: If you want to buy tickets, you need to go to the counter opposite.

examples.ch: 对面那栋房子的主人是谁？
examples.en: Who owns that house opposite (= on the other side of the road)?

defines.trans_en: in a position facing someone or something but on the other side

examples.ch: 我们在正对着政府办公楼的大楼里。
examples.en: We're in the building opposite the government offices.

examples.ch: 他们面对面地坐着。
examples.en: They sat opposite each other.

examples.ch: 在你认为正确的答案旁边打个勾。
examples.en: Put a tick opposite (= next to) the answer that you think is correct.

phrases.trans_ch: （在电影或戏剧中）与（某人）联袂出演，与（某人）合演
phrases.trans_en: to act a part in a film or play with someone as a partner

examples.ch: 凯瑟琳‧赫本在许多电影中与亨利‧方达联袂出演。
examples.en: Katharine Hepburn played opposite Henry Fonda in many films.

defines.trans_ch: 对立的物（或人）；对立面；反面
defines.trans_en: something or someone that is completely different from another person or thing

examples.ch: 我父亲是个非常沉着的人，而我母亲则正好相反。
examples.en: My father is a very calm person, but my mother is just the opposite.

examples.ch: 结果表明她是一个和大家的期盼恰恰相反的人。
examples.en: She's turned out to be the exact opposite of what everyone expected.

examples.ch: fast（快）的反义词是 slow（慢）。
examples.en: The opposite of "fast" is "slow".

examples.ch: 他们总是说相异相吸。
examples.en: People say opposites attract.

defines.trans_en: in a position facing someone or something but on the other side

examples.ch: 她问坐在对面的那位男子是否介意她把窗打开。
examples.en: She asked the man sitting opposite whether he'd mind if she opened the window.

examples.ch: 住在马路对面的人总是很闹腾。
examples.en: The people who live opposite (= on the other side of the road) are always making a lot of noise.

defines.trans_ch: （用于连接不同的可能性）或，或者；还是，亦或
defines.trans_en: used to connect different possibilities

examples.ch: 今天是星期二还是星期三？
examples.en: Is it Tuesday or Wednesday today?

examples.ch: 你可以现在付款，也可以等你回来取油漆时再付。
examples.en: You can pay now or when you come back to pick up the paint.

examples.ch: 你有没有在听我说话？
examples.en: Are you listening to me or not?

examples.ch: 该专利是在1962年或1963年授予的——我记不清是哪一年了。
examples.en: The patent was granted in (either) 1962 or 1963 - I can't quite remember which.

examples.ch: 输赢没有关系——重在参与。
examples.en: It doesn't matter whether you win or lose - it's taking part that's important.

examples.ch: 房间里有10个或12个人。
examples.en: There were ten or twelve (= approximately that number of) people in the room.

examples.ch: 他只是在开玩笑——或许他不是？
examples.en: He was just kidding - or was he (= but it is possible that he was not)?

defines.trans_en: used after a negative verb to mean not one thing and also not another

examples.ch: 这孩子从不微笑，也不大笑。
examples.en: The child never smiles or laughs.

defines.trans_en: if not

examples.ch: 你应该多吃点，否则你会生病的。
examples.en: You should eat more, or you'll make yourself ill.

defines.trans_ch: （用于引出同义词、同义短语或解释性、限定性、纠正性词语或短语）或者说，也就是，即
defines.trans_en: used to show that a word or phrase means the same as, or explains, limits, or corrects, another word or phrase

examples.ch: 罗莎琳德，她的朋友们叫她罗兹，首先采取了行动。
examples.en: Rosalind, or Roz to her friends, took the initiative.

examples.ch: 近来事情进展得一直都很顺利。或者说，直到两天以前还一直很顺利。
examples.en: Things have been going very well recently. Or they were, until two days ago.

defines.trans_ch: 手术室（operating room 的缩写）
defines.trans_en:
abbreviation for
operating room US

defines.trans_ch: （美国）俄勒冈州（写地址时Oregon的缩写）
defines.trans_en: written abbreviation for the US state of Oregon: used in addresses
a round sweet fruit that has a thick orange skin and an orange centre divided into many parts

examples.ch: 一杯橙汁
examples.en: a glass of orange juice

defines.trans_en: a colour between red and yellow

examples.ch: 橙色是她最喜欢的颜色。
examples.en: Orange is her favourite colour.

defines.trans_en: of a colour between red and yellow

examples.ch: 落日的余晖将天空染成了橙红色。
examples.en: The setting sun filled the sky with a deep orange glow.

defines.trans_en: a request to make, supply, or deliver food or goods

examples.ch: 侍者问：“现在可以点菜了吗？”
examples.en: "Can I take your order now?" said the waiter.

examples.ch: 我想订制一张大松木桌。
examples.en: I would like to place (= make) an order for a large pine table.

defines.trans_en: a product or a meal that has been asked for by a customer

examples.ch: 我收到电子邮件说订的货已经发出了。
examples.en: I got an email saying that the order has been shipped.

defines.trans_en: the way in which people or things are arranged, either in relation to one another or according to a particular characteristic

examples.ch: 孩子们按照年龄／身高顺序排列成队。
examples.en: The children lined up in order of age/height.

examples.ch: 我找不到我需要的文件，因为它们都给弄乱了。
examples.en: I can't find the file I need because they're all out of order (= they are no longer arranged in the correct way).

examples.ch: 把文件按照字母／时间顺序放好。
examples.en: Put the files in alphabetical/chronological order.

examples.ch: 这是音乐会的节目单。
examples.en: Here's the running order for the concert (= the order in which each item will happen).

defines.trans_en: something that someone tells you you must do

examples.ch: 指挥官一声令下，士兵们立即开火。
examples.en: The soldiers fired as soon as their commander gave the order.

examples.ch: 军人必须服从命令。
examples.en: Soldiers must obey orders.

examples.ch: 你接到了什么指示？
examples.en: What are your orders?

examples.ch: 我接到的命令是搜查每个进来的人的包。
examples.en: My orders are to search everyone's bag as they come in.

examples.ch: 按照警方的命令，这条路全天封闭。
examples.en: The road was closed all day by order of the police.

examples.ch: 立刻清理好这间屋子——这是命令！
examples.en: Clean up this room immediately - and that's an order!

defines.trans_en: an official instruction telling someone what they can or cannot do, or a written instruction to a bank to pay money to a particular person
a situation in which everything is arranged in its correct place

examples.ch: 房子里很乱，她花了一整天的时间想把它收拾得整洁一些。
examples.en: The house was such a mess that she spent the whole day trying to establish some kind of order.

defines.trans_ch: 正常工作状况;良好使用状况
defines.trans_en: the state of working correctly or of being suitable for use

examples.ch: 出售性能良好的电视机。
examples.en: TV for sale in (good) working order.

examples.ch: 你的移民证件是否合法？
examples.en: Are your immigration papers in order (= legally correct)?

examples.ch: 咖啡机坏了。
examples.en: The coffee machine is out of order (= not working).

defines.trans_en: a situation in which rules are obeyed and people do what they are expected to do

examples.ch: 老师发现很难维持课堂秩序。
examples.en: The teacher found it hard to keep her class in order.

examples.ch: 当示威游行开始演变成暴力活动时，警察被召来恢复秩序。
examples.en: As the demonstration began to turn violent, the police were called in to restore order.

examples.ch: 经过一番热烈的讨论后，主席请与会人员安静下来。
examples.en: After some heated discussion, the chairperson called the meeting to order (= told everyone to stop talking so that the meeting could continue).

examples.ch: 我可以把汽车停在大楼外面吗？
examples.en: Is it in order (= allowed) for me to park my car outside the building?

defines.trans_en: a social or political system

examples.ch: 20世纪80年代末，共产主义的瓦解点燃了建立世界新秩序的希望。
examples.en: The collapse of Communism at the end of the 1980s encouraged hopes of a new world order.

defines.trans_ch: （按照一定规范生活的）修道会;会社
defines.trans_en: a group of people who join together for religious or similar reasons and live according to particular rules

examples.ch: 修道会／圣职
examples.en: religious/holy orders

examples.ch: 西多会／方济各会的修道士
examples.en: monks of the Cistercian/Franciscan Order

defines.trans_en: a group that people are made members of as a reward for services they have done for their country

examples.ch: 他被封为嘉德勋爵士。
examples.en: He was made a knight of the Order of the Garter.

defines.trans_en: the type or size of something

examples.ch: 这些问题同我们以前所遇到过的完全不同。
examples.en: These were problems of a completely different order from anything we had faced before.

examples.ch: 没有超群的才能是无法成功经营企业的。
examples.en: No successful business can be run without skills of the highest order (= great skills).

defines.trans_en: (used in the classification of plants and animals) a group of related plants or animals

examples.ch: 目低于纲，高于科。
examples.en: An order is below a class and above a family.

phrases.trans_en: If something is on order, you have asked for it but have not yet received it.

examples.ch: 新的钻探设备已经订购有几星期了。
examples.en: The new drilling equipment has been on order for several weeks.

phrases.trans_en: to do or make something especially for a person who has asked for it

examples.ch: 我们提供订做婚礼蛋糕。
examples.en: We make wedding cakes to order.

phrases.trans_ch: 命令就是命令，命令必须执行
phrases.trans_en: to have been told that you must do something by someone in authority

examples.ch: 我们接到命令不许任何人进入该大楼。
examples.en: We are under orders not to allow anyone into the building.

phrases.text: in order (for sb/sth) to do sth
phrases.trans_en: with the aim of achieving something

examples.ch: 他早回家是为了在孩子们睡觉前看到他们。
examples.en: He came home early in order to see the kids before they went to bed.

examples.ch: 为了不让她伤心，我同意了她的建议。
examples.en: I agreed to her suggestion in order not to upset her.

phrases.trans_ch: 使有条理；把…整理得井井有条
phrases.trans_en: to organize something well

examples.ch: 我回家前整理了我的办公桌。
examples.en: I try to leave my desk in order when I go home.

examples.ch: 他住院之前把自己的事情都安排好了。
examples.en: He put his affairs in order (= made arrangements for his personal and business matters) before he went into the hospital.

phrases.trans_ch: 安静！安静！（用于议会或正式会议中）
phrases.trans_en: an expression used in a parliament or a formal meeting to get people's attention and make them stop talking, so that the meeting or discussion can start or continue
approximately

examples.ch: 费用大约为500美元。
examples.en: The cost will be something in the order of $500.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指在饭店或商店）点（饭菜），订购，订制，订货
defines.trans_en: to ask for something to be made, supplied, or delivered, especially in a restaurant or shop

examples.ch: 我点了意大利面条和一份什锦色拉。
examples.en: I ordered some pasta and a mixed salad.

examples.ch: 这个尺寸的衬衫没有了，不过我们可以给您订购一件。
examples.en: There are no shirts left in this size but we could order one for you/order you one.

defines.trans_en: If a person in authority orders someone to do something, or orders something to be done, they tell someone to do it.

examples.ch: 管理层指示要减少开销。
examples.en: The management has ordered a cutback in spending.

examples.ch: “在那儿等着，”她吩咐道。
examples.en: "Wait over there," she ordered.

examples.ch: 他们命令他离开房间。
examples.en: They ordered him to leave the room.

defines.trans_en: to arrange a group of people or things in a list from first to last

examples.ch: 文件已经按字母顺序排列好了。
examples.en: The documents have been ordered alphabetically.

examples.ch: 我将申请表整理成了3组。
examples.en: I've ordered the application forms into three groups.

defines.trans_en: as well as the thing or person already mentioned

examples.ch: 该产品还有许多其他的省时特性。
examples.en: The product has many other time-saving features.

examples.ch: 眼下没有其他的活儿了。
examples.en: There is no other work available at the moment.

examples.ch: 只有另外一个人可以帮助我们。
examples.en: There is only one other person who could help us.

examples.ch: 另外还有我们应该问的人吗？
examples.en: Are there any other people we should ask?

examples.ch: 我找到了一只耳环——你知道另一只在哪儿吗？
examples.en: I found one earring - do you know where the other one is?

defines.trans_en: used at the end of a list to show that there are more things, without being exact about what they are

examples.ch: 该计划遭到了学校、企业及其他当地组织的反对。
examples.en: The plan has been opposed by schools, businesses and other local organizations.

examples.ch: 这两本书将对编辑、记者及其他使用该语言的专业人士尤为有用。
examples.en: These two books will be especially useful for editors, journalists and other professional users of the language.

defines.trans_en: different from the thing or person already mentioned

examples.ch: 我没有现金——没有其他支付方式吗？
examples.en: Idon't have any cash - is there no other way of paying?

examples.ch: 他喜欢到国外去旅行，并了解其他民族的风俗习惯。
examples.en: He likes travelling abroad and learning about other people's customs and traditions.

phrases.trans_en: the opposite side or end of something

examples.ch: 把椅子放到桌子的另一边去。
examples.en: Put the chair at the other end of the desk.

examples.ch: 那个人在街对面等着。
examples.en: The man was waiting on the other side of the street.

phrases.trans_ch: （指最近某个大概的时间）那天/那个星期（等等）
phrases.trans_en: referring to a day, week, etc. in the recent past without saying exactly when it was

examples.ch: 我那天／那天晚上刚见过他。
examples.en: I saw him just the other day/night.

phrases.trans_en: different from or except

examples.ch: 除了下面列出的乘船游览项目以外，其他项目没有折扣。
examples.en: Cruises other than the ones listed below are not discounted at this time.

examples.ch: 除了你本人，谁也不能在这张表格上签字。
examples.en: The form cannot be signed by anyone other than yourself.

phrases.trans_en: in a negative sentence, used to mean "except"

examples.ch: 今晚的电视除了惯常的垃圾，再没别的了。
examples.en: There's nothing on TV tonight, other than the usual rubbish.

phrases.trans_en: used to introduce an explanation that is simpler than the one given earlier

examples.ch: 他没讲多少实话——换言之，他在撒谎。
examples.en: He was economical with the truth - in other words, he was lying.

phrases.trans_en: used when you cannot or do not want to be exact about the information you are giving

examples.ch: 这个活动是在某个公园举行的。
examples.en: The event was held in some park or other.

examples.ch: 我们会找个人来帮我们的。
examples.en: We'll find someone or other to help us.

defines.trans_ch: （两者中的）另一个，第二个；（一组或一套中的）另一个
defines.trans_en: the second of two things or people, or the thing or person that is left in a group or set of things

examples.ch: 一只手握拍，另一只手持球。
examples.en: Hold the racquet in one hand and the ball in the other.

examples.ch: 有的人偏爱素食，而另一些人偏爱肉食。
examples.en: Some people prefer a vegetarian diet, while others prefer a meat-based diet.

examples.ch: 上周她给了我一本书，并答应周三把其他的书带来。
examples.en: She gave me one book last week and promised to bring the others on Wednesday.

phrases.trans_en: more ones

examples.ch: 我只知道这本书，不过或许还有别的。
examples.en: I only know about this book, but there might be others (= other books).

phrases.trans_en: people in general, not including yourself

examples.ch: 你不应该指望别人替你干活儿。
examples.en: You shouldn't expect others to do your work for you.

defines.trans_en: of or belonging to us

examples.ch: 我们的房子是几年前买的。
examples.en: We bought our house several years ago.

examples.ch: 他拂袖而去，丢下我们不管。
examples.en: He walked off and left us on our own.

examples.ch: 毒品是对我们社会最大的威胁之一。
examples.en: Drugs are one of the greatest threats in our society.

examples.ch: 我们今年买辆新车没有意义。
examples.en: There's no point in our buying a new car this year.

defines.trans_en: the one(s) belonging to or connected with the person who is speaking and one or more other people

examples.ch: 哪张桌子是我们的？
examples.en: Which table is ours?

examples.ch: 他是我们的一个表兄。
examples.en: He's a cousin of ours.

examples.ch: 我们的车是停在那边那辆红色的。
examples.en: Ours is the red car parked over there.

examples.ch: 我们的国家是个大国。
examples.en: Ours is a huge country.

defines.trans_en: used when the subject of the verb is "we" or the speaker and one or more others, and the object is the same group of people

examples.ch: 我们去给自己找了点吃的。
examples.en: We went to get ourselves something to eat.

examples.ch: 约翰和我打算今年一定好好度一次假。
examples.en: John and I promised ourselves a good holiday this year.

defines.trans_ch: （强调主语）我们自己，我们自身，我们亲自
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize the subject "we"

examples.ch: 我们自己意识到这个方案有瑕疵。
examples.en: We ourselves realize that there are flaws in the plan.

phrases.trans_en: alone or without help from anyone else

examples.ch: 饭馆里只有我们自己。
examples.en: We were all by ourselves in the restaurant.

examples.ch: 没有人想和我们同行，于是我们自己去了。
examples.en: Nobody wanted to come with us, so we went by ourselves.

examples.ch: 我们自己不可能干所有的活。
examples.en: We couldn't do all the work by ourselves.

phrases.trans_en: for our use only

examples.ch: 酒店很清静，所以我们独自享用了游泳池。
examples.en: The hotel was very quiet so we had the swimming pool all to ourselves .

defines.trans_en: used to show movement away from the inside of a place or container

examples.ch: 她打开窗户，将头探了出去。
examples.en: She opened the window and stuck her head out.

examples.ch: 袋子裂开了，苹果掉了出来。
examples.en: The bag broke and the apples fell out.

examples.ch: 我跳下床，冲下楼去。
examples.en: I jumped out of bed and ran downstairs.

examples.ch: 他将身子探出窗外。
examples.en: He leaned out the window.

examples.ch: 他打开抽屉，取出一双袜子。
examples.en: He opened the drawer and took out a pair of socks.

examples.ch: 出去！
examples.en: Get out!

examples.ch: 滚出去！
examples.en: Out you go! (= Go out!)

examples.ch: 我的秘书会送你出去。
examples.en: My secretary will see you out (= go with you to the door).

examples.ch: 把裤子翻过来。
examples.en: Turn the trousers inside out (= put the inside on the outside).

defines.trans_en: outside a building or room

examples.ch: 你在这外面等好吗？医生很快会来请你进去的。
examples.en: If you wait out here, we will call you when the doctor is ready.

examples.ch: 危险！不要进来！
examples.en: Danger! Keep out! (= Do not enter!)

examples.ch: 今天外面真冷。
examples.en: It's bitterly cold out, today.

defines.trans_ch: 暂时外出的，暂时不在的
defines.trans_en: absent for a short time from the place where you live or work

examples.ch: 今天上午我来拜访你，可是你不在。
examples.en: I came around to see you this morning, but you were out.

examples.ch: 你出去的时候有人打电话找你。
examples.en: Someone called while you were out.

defines.trans_ch: 出去，外出（参加社交活动）
defines.trans_en: used to refer to a period of time when someone goes away from home for a social activity

examples.ch: 今晚我不能出去了——我有活儿要干。
examples.en: I can't go out tonight - I have work to do.

examples.ch: 今晚你想到外面去吃饭吗？
examples.en: Do you want to eat out (= eat in a restaurant) tonight?

examples.ch: 他请我下周和他去看电影。
examples.en: He asked me out (= asked me to go with him) to the cinema next week.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a time when someone is away from the main office in order to do a particular job

examples.ch: 一个正在投递邮件的邮递员发现了小偷。
examples.en: The thieves were spotted by a postman out on his rounds (= as he was delivering the post).

examples.ch: 警方出动了大批警力到示威现场。
examples.en: The police were out in force (= there were a lot of police) at the demonstration.

defines.trans_ch: （图书馆的书）借出的，被借走的
defines.trans_en: In a library, if a book is out, it has been borrowed by someone.

examples.ch: 两本《呼啸山庄》都被借走了。
examples.en: Both copies of "Wuthering Heights" were out.

defines.trans_en: to the point where something is removed or disappears

examples.ch: 这个污渍去不掉。
examples.en: The stain won't come out.

examples.ch: 将单子上没有的词全部划掉。
examples.en: Cross out any words that are not on the list.

examples.ch: 电器失火时，千万不要用水灭火。
examples.en: Never use water to put out fires in electrical equipment.

examples.ch: 我们的时间／钱／耐心耗完了。
examples.en: Our time/money/patience ran out.

defines.trans_en: (in sport) no longer able to play because your turn is over

examples.ch: 10分钟后该队最棒的球员中有两名出局了。
examples.en: Two of the best players on the team were out after ten minutes.

examples.ch: 新西兰队全部出局，得分246分。
examples.en: New Zealand were all out for 246 (= the team finished with a score of 246).

defines.trans_en: (in politics) no longer able to govern because you have lost an election

examples.ch: 社会民主党在执政15年后被选下了台。
examples.en: The Social Democrats were voted out after 15 years in power.

defines.trans_en: to many people

examples.ch: 老师把测验用书分发给所有的学生。
examples.en: The teacher gave out test books to all the students.

examples.ch: 绿色和平组织给所有的支持者都发了一封信。
examples.en: Greenpeace sent a letter out to all its supporters.

defines.trans_en: spreading out from a central point over a wider area

examples.ch: 警方的搜索队在田野里四处散开。
examples.en: The police search party spread out across the fields.

defines.trans_ch: （书、杂志、电影、音乐带等）出版，问世
defines.trans_en: When a book, magazine, film, or musical recording is out, it is available to the public.

examples.ch: 她的新书出版了吗？
examples.en: Is her new book out yet?

examples.ch: 新片8月份上映。
examples.en: The new movie comes out in August.

defines.trans_en: able to be seen

examples.ch: 今晚看得见星星。
examples.en: The stars are out tonight.

examples.ch: 雨停了，太阳出来了。
examples.en: The rain stopped and the sun came out (= appeared).

examples.ch: 春天里百花盛开。
examples.en: In spring all the flowers came out (= their petals opened).

defines.trans_ch: （用于增强词义）完全地，彻底地
defines.trans_en: used to make the meaning of a word stronger

examples.ch: 我们走了一整天，回到家时累得筋疲力尽。
examples.en: We walked all day and were tired out (= very tired) by the time we got home.

examples.ch: 要靠你来彻底解决它了。
examples.en: It's up to you to sort this out (= deal with it completely).

defines.trans_en: used with verbs describing sounds to emphasize the loudness of the sound

examples.ch: 他撞到了头，痛得大叫。
examples.en: He cried out in pain as he hit his head.

examples.ch: 查利‧卓别林的电影总能让我笑破肚皮。
examples.en: Charlie Chaplin films always make me laugh out loud.

defines.trans_ch: 离（大陆、城市或祖国）很远，遥远地
defines.trans_en: a long distance away from land, a town, or your own country

examples.ch: 渔船出海3天了。
examples.en: The fishing boats were out at sea for three days.

examples.ch: 他们住在偏远的乡下，离哪儿都很远。
examples.en: They live out in the country, miles from anywhere.

examples.ch: 他在赞比亚侨居了7年。
examples.en: He lived out in Zambia for seven years.

examples.ch: 西部边远地区的天气比较好。
examples.en: The weather's better out west (= a long distance away in the west of the country).

defines.trans_en: If a light or fire is out, it is no longer shining or burning.

examples.ch: 等我们到家的时候，所有的灯都灭了。
examples.en: When we got home, all the lights were out.

examples.ch: 那火全都扑灭了吗？
examples.en: Is that fire completely out?

defines.trans_en: away from the coast or beach

examples.ch: 潮水是在涨还是在退？
examples.en: Is the tide coming in or going out?

examples.ch: 只有在退潮后才能看到海滩。
examples.en: You can only see the beach when the tide is out.

defines.trans_en: (of information) no longer kept secret

examples.ch: 你无法再隐瞒自己赌博的事了——这个秘密已经泄露出去了。
examples.en: You can't hide your gambling any longer - the secret's out.

defines.trans_en: If a gay person comes out, they tell people that they are gay, and do not keep it a secret.

examples.ch: 她公开自己是同性恋已经有3年了。
examples.en: She came out three years ago.

examples.ch: 他还没有告诉家人自己是同性恋。
examples.en: He hasn't come out to his family yet.

defines.trans_en: (of a ball in a sport such as tennis) landing outside one of the lines that mark the area where the game is played

examples.ch: 他认为球落在线上，但裁判说球出界了。
examples.en: He thought the ball had bounced on the line, but the umpire said it was out.
