defines.trans_ch: 不省人事的（地），昏迷的（地）;熟睡的（地）
defines.trans_en: unconscious or sleeping

examples.ch: 他一看到血就会昏过去。
examples.en: He passes out (= loses consciousness) at the sight of blood.

examples.ch: 我头上挨了一下，肯定昏迷了10分钟左右。
examples.en: I was hit on the head, and I must have been out cold (= completely unconscious) for about ten minutes.

defines.trans_ch: 不准确的，错误的，有出入的
defines.trans_en: not accurate

examples.ch: 我们的估算只有几美元的偏差。
examples.en: Our estimates were only out by a few dollars.

examples.ch: 你的测量差了一英寸。
examples.en: You were an inch out in your measurements.

examples.ch: 那些销售数据完全不准确。
examples.en: Those sales figures were way out (= completely wrong).

examples.ch: 我这次旅行的花费超出预算25美元。
examples.en: I'm out $25 on this trip (= it cost me $25 more than expected).

defines.trans_ch: （用于最高级后）可用地，现有地
defines.trans_en: (used with superlatives) available or in existence

examples.ch: 这是现有的最好的自动照相机。
examples.en: This is the best automatic camera out.

examples.ch: 我认为他是目前最伟大的足球运动员。
examples.en: I think he's the greatest football player out.

defines.trans_en: used to show that a period of time is finished

examples.ch: 我觉得我在这个月结束之前能完成这个项目。
examples.en: I think I can finish this project before the month's out.

defines.trans_en: not acceptable or not possible

examples.ch: 在我的朋友中，吸烟是绝对不允许的。
examples.en: Smoking is definitely out among my friends.

examples.ch: 雇用更多职员这一选择目前并不可行。
examples.en: The option of taking on more staff is out for the moment.

defines.trans_ch: 不再流行的（地）;不再时髦的（地）;过时的（地）
defines.trans_en: no longer fashionable or popular

examples.ch: 每个月这份杂志都会列出什么过时及什么流行。
examples.en: Every month the magazine lists what's out and what's in (= fashionable).

examples.ch: 像那样的裤子在70年代就过时了。
examples.en: Trousers like that went out (= stopped being fashionable) in the 70s.

phrases.trans_en: used to say that no more of something is available

examples.ch: 我们快没汽油了。
examples.en: We're nearly out of petrol.

examples.ch: 我快没有耐心／时间／钱了。
examples.en: I'm running out of patience/time/money.

phrases.trans_ch: （常出于自私或令人不快的动机）做，意图做（或得到)，蓄意
phrases.trans_en: doing something, or intending to do something, for an unpleasant reason or only because it is good for you and not others

examples.ch: 她一般不资助慈善事业——她只是为了给自己扬名。
examples.en: She doesn't usually help the charity - she's only out for the publicity.

examples.ch: 他总是存心在我俩之间制造麻烦。
examples.en: He's always been out to cause trouble between us.

defines.trans_ch: 公开（名人）的同性恋身份
defines.trans_en: to publish the fact that a famous person is gay, especially when that person does not want it to be known

examples.ch: 几乎每一周都有一个名人被揭露出是同性恋。
examples.en: Hardly a week went by without someone famous being outed.

defines.trans_en: an excuse or reason for avoiding an unpleasant situation

examples.ch: 我们必须安排好谈判，这样一旦需要我们就能有个借口。
examples.en: We must arrange the negotiations so we have an out if we need it.

phrases.trans_en: People who are on the outs have argued and are not now friendly with each other.

examples.ch: 莉齐和泰勒又闹别扭了。
examples.en: Lizzie and Tyler are on the outs again.

defines.trans_ch: （用于给名词和形容词加上“非中心的”之意）
defines.trans_en: used to add the meaning "not central" to nouns and adjectives

examples.ch: 市郊
examples.en: the outskirts of town (= the areas that form the edge of the town)

defines.trans_ch: （用于给动词加上“超越”或“胜过”之意）
defines.trans_en: used to add the meaning "going further" or "being better than" to verbs

examples.ch: 她烟酒不沾，我想她肯定比我们都要活得长久。
examples.en: She doesn't drink or smoke and I'm sure she'll outlive (= live longer than) us all.

defines.trans_ch: （用于给名词和形容词加上“向外”或“离开”之意）
defines.trans_en: used to add the meaning "out of" or "away from" to nouns and adjectives

examples.ch: 她转身不理睬他们伸出的手。
examples.en: She turned away from their outstretched hands (= hands held out).

defines.trans_en: existing, happening, or done outside, rather than inside a building

examples.ch: 室外游泳池／庆典
examples.en: an outdoor swimming pool/festival

examples.ch: 户外穿的衣服
examples.en: outdoor clothes

defines.trans_ch: 喜欢户外活动的;户外活动的
defines.trans_en: liking or relating to outdoor activities, such as walking and climbing

examples.ch: 萨拉算不上是那种真正热衷于户外运动的人。
examples.en: Sara's not really the outdoor type.

defines.trans_en: outside

examples.ch: 如果天气好，我们将在室外用餐。
examples.en: If the weather's good, we'll eat outdoors (= not in a building).

examples.ch: 他每年休一个月假到野外徒步旅行。
examples.en: Every year he takes a month off work to go hiking in the great outdoors (= in the countryside, far away from towns).

defines.trans_ch: 在外面（的），在室外（的）;在…外面（的）
defines.trans_en: not inside a building

examples.ch: 外面的天气真好。
examples.en: It was a sunny day outside.

examples.ch: 既然天气这么好，我们去外面吃饭／坐坐／走走好吗？
examples.en: Since it's such a nice day, let's eat/sit/go outside.

examples.ch: 室外灯／厕所
examples.en: an outside light/toilet

defines.trans_ch: 外来（的）;来自外地（或组织外）（的）;…以外（的）
defines.trans_en: coming from another place or organization

examples.ch: 公司已外请专家。
examples.en: The company has called in outside experts.

defines.trans_ch: 最大限度的；最高限度的
defines.trans_en: the most that would be accepted or possible

examples.ch: 最大限度／最高价格会达到350美元。
examples.en: The outside limit/figure would be $350.

phrases.trans_en: a phone call or connection going outside the place where you are

defines.trans_en: not in a particular building or room, but near it

examples.ch: 她在他房间外的地上坐了两个小时。
examples.en: She sat for two hours on the floor outside his room.

defines.trans_en: not in a particular place

examples.ch: 除了这间屋子里的人，决不能让任何人知道我们讨论过的内容。
examples.en: Nobody outside this room must ever know what we have discussed.

defines.trans_en: not within or part of something

examples.ch: 恐怕这超出了我的职责范围。
examples.en: I'm afraid that would be outside my job description.

phrases.trans_en: except for

examples.ch: 除了我们3个，别人对这个问题都还毫不知情。
examples.en: Outside of us three, no one knows anything about the problem, yet.

defines.trans_en: the outer part or side of something

examples.ch: 房子的外部需要粉刷一下。
examples.en: The outside of the house needs painting.

examples.ch: 这幢房子从外面看显得更大些。
examples.en: The house looks larger when looked at from the outside.

examples.ch: 公司需要获得外界的帮助。
examples.en: The company needs to get help from outside (= from people who work for other organizations).

phrases.trans_en: used to say that an amount is the most possible in a situation

examples.ch: 这活儿顶多需要10天左右。
examples.en: The job will take about ten days at the outside.

defines.trans_en: slight

examples.ch: 苏格兰队进入世界杯决赛圈仍有一线希望。
examples.en: There's still an outside chance/possibility that Scotland will make it into the World Cup.

defines.trans_en: above or higher than something else, sometimes so that one thing covers the other; above

examples.ch: 门上方的牌子上写着“出口”。
examples.en: The sign over the door said "Exit".

examples.ch: 她撑着伞，为我们两人挡雨。
examples.en: She held the umbrella over both of us.

examples.ch: 直升机在城市上空散发传单。
examples.en: Helicopters dropped leaflets over the city.

examples.ch: 我用手捂住眼睛／耳朵，因为我看／听不下去。
examples.en: I put my hands over my eyes/ears because I couldn't bear to watch/listen.

examples.ch: 因为飞机起飞时噪声太大，我听不清她在说什么。
examples.en: I couldn't hear what she was saying over the noise of the planes taking off (= the planes were louder than her voice).

defines.trans_en: in a position that is covering something

examples.ch: 在蛋糕变凉的时候，放一块干净的布在上面。
examples.en: Put a clean cloth over the cakes while they cool.

examples.ch: 我在肩上披了条披肩。
examples.en: I put a shawl over my shoulders.

defines.trans_en: across from one side to the other, especially by going up and then down

examples.ch: 她跃过大门。
examples.en: She jumped over the gate.

examples.ch: 这条路并不是穿过隧道，而是翻山而过。
examples.en: The road goes over the mountains, not through a tunnel.

examples.ch: 她总是和邻居隔着花园的篱笆闲聊。
examples.en: She is always chatting with her neighbour over the garden fence.

examples.ch: 在塔顶上你能俯瞰这个城市，可以看到好几英里远。
examples.en: From the top of the tower you could see for miles over the city.

examples.ch: 坦克能在最难通行的道路上行驶。
examples.en: Tanks travel over the most difficult ground.

defines.trans_en: falling down from somewhere

examples.ch: 硬币从桌边滚了下来。
examples.en: The coin rolled over the edge of the table.

examples.ch: 就在汽车从悬崖边翻落下去之前，哈罗德从车里跳了出来。
examples.en: Harold jumped out of the car just before it went over the cliff.

defines.trans_en: falling because of stepping on something

examples.ch: 她被小径上的一个玩具绊倒了。
examples.en: She tripped over a toy lying on the path.

defines.trans_en: more than

examples.ch: 这些地毯价格大多在5000美元以上。
examples.en: Most of the carpets cost/are over $5,000.

examples.ch: 12岁以上的孩子必须买全票。
examples.en: Children over the age of twelve (= older than twelve) pay the full price.

examples.ch: 我把生活质量看得比金钱更重要。
examples.en: I value quality of life over money.

defines.trans_en: increasing to further than a particular limit or point

examples.ch: 他们的花费已经超过预算2500万美元了。
examples.en: They are already $25 million over budget.

defines.trans_en: on the other side of

examples.ch: 我们可以去路那边的一家酒吧。
examples.en: There's a bar over the road we could go to.

examples.ch: 故事转下一页。
examples.en: The story continues over the page.

defines.trans_en: (referring to a cause of interest, worry, discussion, etc.) connected with or about

examples.ch: 争论这样的小事毫无意义。
examples.en: There's no point in arguing over something so unimportant.

examples.ch: 我需要时间谈谈／考虑考虑你的提议。
examples.en: I need time to talk/think over your proposal (= to discuss/consider it carefully).

examples.ch: 这场法律之争是关于谁应该获得这个孩子的监护权。
examples.en: The legal battle was over who should have custody of the child.

defines.trans_en: during something, or while doing something

examples.ch: 整个夏天我都在西雅图。
examples.en: I was in Seattle over the summer.

examples.ch: 我们边吃午饭／边喝点什么边讨论这个问题好吗？
examples.en: Shall we discuss it over lunch/over a drink?

examples.ch: 他们吃午饭花了一个小时。
examples.en: They took/spent an hour over lunch (= their meal lasted an hour).

examples.ch: 看着一个婴儿随着时间流逝而成长真是件奇妙的事。
examples.en: It's fascinating to watch how a baby changes and develops over time (= as time passes).

defines.trans_ch: （表示控制或管教）在…之上，高于
defines.trans_en: in control of or teaching someone or something

examples.ch: 出色的老师轻而易举就能让一个班的学生听话。
examples.en: A good teacher has an easy authority over a class.

examples.ch: 她是位销售经理，可是她上面还有一位地区销售主管。
examples.en: She's a sales manager but she has a regional sales director over (= with a higher rank than) her.

examples.ch: 在滑铁卢打败法军是威灵顿最大的胜利。
examples.en: The victory over the French at Waterloo was Wellington's greatest triumph.

defines.trans_en: using

examples.ch: 他们在电话里交谈。
examples.en: They spoke over the phone.

examples.ch: 我们是从收音机里听到这个消息的。
examples.en: We heard the news over the radio.

defines.trans_en: sometimes used when talking about a calculation in which one number is divided by another number

examples.ch: 40除以7约等于6。
examples.en: 40 over 7 is roughly 6.

phrases.trans_en: in addition to

examples.ch: 除了通常的福利费以外，他们还收到一笔额外的补助。
examples.en: They receive extra money over and above the usual welfare payments.

phrases.trans_ch: 从（疾病或不愉快的经历中）恢复过来
phrases.trans_en: to feel physically or mentally better after an illness or an upsetting experience

examples.ch: 得那样的病需要一段时间才能恢复过来。
examples.en: It takes you a while to get over an illness like that.

examples.ch: 去年他女朋友就跟他分手了，但他仍难以释怀。
examples.en: His girlfriend broke up with him last year and he's not over her yet.

examples.ch: 他还没有痊愈，不过已经度过了最危险的阶段。
examples.en: He's not fully recovered, but he's over the worst (= has experienced the worst stage of the illness and is now improving).

defines.trans_en: from a higher to a lower position; down

examples.ch: 灯掉下来，摔坏了。
examples.en: The lamp fell over and broke.

examples.ch: 他被一辆出租车撞倒了。
examples.en: He was run/knocked over by a taxi.

examples.ch: 小男孩摔倒后哭了起来。
examples.en: The little boy fell over and started to cry.

defines.trans_ch: 越过;从一边（或一地）到另一边（或另一地）
defines.trans_en: across; from one side or place to another

examples.ch: 她俯身过来吻了我。
examples.en: She leaned over and kissed me.

examples.ch: 一架战斗机在空中掠过。
examples.en: A fighter plane flew over.

examples.ch: 星期四过来吃晚餐如何？
examples.en: Why don't you come over (= come to my house) for dinner on Thursday?

examples.ch: 这周有个从加拿大来的朋友住在我这儿。
examples.en: A friend of mine from France is over visiting us this week (= a friend came from France and is staying with us).

examples.ch: 现在我们来听听来自温布利体育场的关于杯赛决赛的实况报道。
examples.en: Now we're going over to (= there will be a broadcast from) Wembley for commentary on the Cup Final.

examples.ch: 过来——这儿暖和些。
examples.en: Come over here - it's warmer.

examples.ch: 那边那个男人是谁？
examples.en: Who's that man over there?

defines.trans_en: used to describe the way an object moves or is moved so that a different part of it is facing up

examples.ch: 她又翻了一页。
examples.en: She turned another page over.

examples.ch: 狗翻过身仰面躺着。
examples.en: The dog rolled over onto its back.

examples.ch: 孩子们在缓坡上一次次地滚下来玩。
examples.en: The children rolled over and over (= turned over many times) down the gentle slope.

defines.trans_en: changing or exchanging position

examples.ch: 把那些盘子调换一下位置可以吗？
examples.en: Would you mind changing/swapping those plates over?

examples.ch: 她不做营销，改当编辑了。
examples.en: She changed over to editing from marketing.

examples.ch: 为什么我们要把钱交给他们？
examples.en: Why should we hand over the money to them?

examples.ch: 我能做的都做了——现在该看你的了。
examples.en: I've done everything I can - now it's over to you (= it's your turn to take action).

defines.trans_en: above or higher than something else, sometimes so that one thing covers the other

examples.ch: 一架战斗机在空中掠过。
examples.en: A fighter plane flew over.

examples.ch: 来了一个人用油漆涂盖墙上的裂缝。
examples.en: A man came to paint over (= cover with paint) the cracks in the wall.

defines.trans_en: more than a particular amount or level

examples.ch: 65岁及以上人群可半价购票。
examples.en: People who are 65 years old and over can get half-price tickets.

defines.trans_en: (especially of an event) finished

examples.ch: 竞赛结束我会很高兴。
examples.en: I'll be glad when the competition is over.

examples.ch: 我曾经生意红火婚姻幸福，但现在全都完了。
examples.en: I used to have a thriving business and a happy marriage, but that's all over now.

defines.trans_en: extra; not used

examples.ch: 上回我去法国还剩了些欧元。
examples.en: I have some euros left over from the last time I was in France.

examples.ch: 客人都走了以后，我们发现还剩了很多吃的。
examples.en: When all the guests had gone, we realized there was lots of food over.

defines.trans_en: again or repeatedly

examples.ch: 你把它弄砸了——现在我得再做一遍！
examples.en: You ruined it - now I'll have to do it over!

defines.trans_ch: （用于无线电通话）完毕，请回话
defines.trans_en: said when you are talking to someone by radio, to mean that you have finished speaking and will wait for their answer

examples.ch: “这里是595X航班。你听到了吗？完毕。”
examples.en: "This is flight 595X. Do you read me? Over."

phrases.trans_en: completely finished

examples.ch: 她会尽快把棘手的任务处理掉。
examples.en: She gets unpleasant tasks over and done with as quickly as possible.

phrases.trans_en: said when you are talking to someone by radio in order to end the conversation

examples.ch: “谢谢，控制塔。通话完毕。”
examples.en: "Thank you, control tower. Over and out."

defines.trans_en: (in cricket) a set of six bowls (= throws) from the same end of the field
too much or more than usual

examples.ch: 孩子们兴奋过头了。
examples.en: The children got over-excited (= too excited).

defines.trans_en: more than

examples.ch: 50岁以上人士参加的俱乐部
examples.en: a club for the over-50s

defines.trans_en: across

examples.ch: 当然，走陆路比坐飞机要慢多了。
examples.en: Of course, the overland route is much slower than going by air.

defines.trans_en: above

examples.ch: 她被一根垂下来的树枝撞下了自行车。
examples.en: She was knocked off her bicycle by an overhanging branch.

defines.trans_en: belonging to or done by a particular person or thing

examples.ch: 纽约的每个居民区都有自己的特点。
examples.en: Each neighbourhood in New York has its own characteristics.

examples.ch: 我想有自己的公寓。
examples.en: I'd like to have my very own apartment.

examples.ch: 他想要一套属于自己的公寓。
examples.en: He wanted an apartment of his own.

examples.ch: 她的衣服全都是自己做的。
examples.en: She makes all her own clothes.

examples.ch: 我今晚要出去，所以你得自己做饭了。
examples.en: I'm going to be out tonight, so you'll have to make your own dinner (= prepare it yourself).

examples.ch: 那是你自己的主意还是有人给你出的主意？
examples.en: Was that your own idea or did someone suggest it to you?

examples.ch: 你想做什么得自己拿主意。
examples.en: You'll have to make up your own mind (= decide by yourself) what you want to do.

examples.ch: 要不是亲眼看到／亲耳听到此事，我怎么也不会相信。
examples.en: I'd never have believed it if I hadn't seen it with my own eyes/heard it with my own ears.

examples.ch: “那是你妈妈的车吗？”“不，是我自己的。”
examples.en: "Is that your mum's car?" "No, it's my own (= it belongs to me)."

examples.ch: 詹姆斯•乔伊斯以自己独有的风格写作。
examples.en: James Joyce wrote in a style that was all his own (= that was not like that of anyone else).

examples.ch: 我们关照自己人。
examples.en: We like to take care of our own (= take care of people who are members of our family, or who work for us).

phrases.trans_en: alone

examples.ch: 我喜欢独自一个人生活。
examples.en: I like living on my own.

phrases.trans_en: without any help

examples.ch: 爸爸，我的纽扣全是我自己扣上的。
examples.en: I did my buttons up all on my own, Dad .

phrases.trans_en: If you do something in your own time, you do it at the speed at which you want to work.
during the time when you are not officially working

examples.ch: 你只能在业余时间使用公司的电脑上网。
examples.en: You may only use company computers to access the Web in your own time.

defines.trans_en: to have something that legally belongs to you

examples.ch: 我们拥有自己的房子。
examples.en: We own our house.

examples.ch: 我这辈子从没拥有过一套西装。
examples.en: I've never owned a suit in my life.

defines.trans_en: to admit

examples.ch: 我承认我对集体的决定不是很满意。
examples.en: I own (that) I was not very happy with the group's decision.

defines.trans_en: to defeat someone completely or be much better than him or her; to perform extremely well

examples.ch: 上次交手时，我们彻底打败了他们！
examples.en: Last time we played them, we owned them!

examples.ch: 今晚的舞台完全属于碧昂丝！
examples.en: Beyoncé owned that stage tonight!

defines.trans_en: to put something into a bag, box, etc.

examples.ch: 我们明天一大早就要出发，所以你最好今晚就收拾行李。
examples.en: We're leaving early tomorrow morning, so you'd better pack (= put clothes and other possessions into suitcases or bags) tonight.

examples.ch: 她收拾好一小箱行李准备度周末。
examples.en: She packed a small suitcase for the weekend.

examples.ch: 他打点了行囊抛下妻儿离家出走了。
examples.en: He just packed his bags and walked out on his wife and children.

examples.ch: 我还没收拾衣服呢。
examples.en: I haven't packed my clothes (= put them into a suitcase, etc.) yet.

examples.ch: 请你帮我装上一双备用的鞋子，好吗？
examples.en: Could you pack me a spare pair of shoes, please/pack a spare pair of shoes for me, please?

examples.ch: 这些书得装进箱子里。
examples.en: These books need to be packed in/into a box.

defines.trans_en: to put a material around something before putting it into a bag, box, etc. so that it will not break or be damaged

examples.ch: 她给花瓶裹上绵纸加以保护。
examples.en: She packed the vase in tissue paper to protect it.

defines.trans_en: to come or bring together in large numbers or to fill a space

examples.ch: 体育馆里挤满了数千名球迷。
examples.en: Thousands of fans are packing into the stadium.

examples.ch: 球迷们涌进体育馆观看决赛。
examples.en: Fans packed the stadium to watch the final game.

examples.ch: 公共汽车上的人挤得像沙丁鱼罐头似的。
examples.en: The people on the bus were packed (together) like sardines (= there were many of them very close together) .

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) form into a solid mass

examples.ch: 风把雪吹到车库门口，积成了厚厚的一堆。
examples.en: The wind has packed the snow against the garage door.

examples.ch: 雪积得很厚实，走在街上很容易出危险。
examples.en: The snow has packed down tightly, making the streets dangerous to walk on.

defines.trans_en: to carry something, especially a gun

examples.ch: 携带枪支
examples.en: to pack a gun

examples.ch: 每一枚导弹都带有好几个弹头。
examples.en: Each missile packs several warheads.

examples.ch: 这支枪火力很强。
examples.en: This gun packs (= has) a lot of firepower.

defines.trans_en: a group, set, or collection of something

examples.ch: 那套资料包括一本小册子和一张地图。
examples.en: The information pack consists of a brochure and a map.

defines.trans_ch: （一同生活和／或猎食的）一群（动物）
defines.trans_en: a group of animals, such as dogs, that live and/or hunt together

examples.ch: 狼群
examples.en: a wolf pack

examples.ch: 一群野狗
examples.en: a pack of wild dogs

defines.trans_en: an organized group of children who are brownies or cubs

examples.ch: 我叔叔曾经是我所在的幼童军小队的队长。
examples.en: My uncle was the leader of my Cub pack.

defines.trans_en: a set of playing cards

examples.ch: 一副纸牌
examples.en: a pack of cards

defines.trans_ch: （尤指行为不受人欢迎的）一伙人，一帮人
defines.trans_en: a group of similar people, especially one that contains people whose activities you do not approve of

examples.ch: 一伙窃贼
examples.en: a pack of thieves

examples.ch: 一帮记者正在白宫外等候。
examples.en: A pack of journalists was waiting outside the White House.

defines.trans_en: a small paper or cardboard container in which a number of small objects are sold

examples.ch: 一包香烟／口香糖
examples.en: a pack of cigarettes/gum

defines.trans_en: a type of bag that you usually carry on your back when you are travelling
a thick mass of a substance, often like clay, that is used as a beauty treatment for the face

defines.trans_ch: （放在伤口上止血或消肿的）裹布;敷料
defines.trans_en: a thick mass of cloth, etc. that can be put on an injury to stop any bleeding or swelling

examples.ch: 把这个冰袋放在头上消肿。
examples.en: Hold this ice pack to your head to stop the bruising.

defines.trans_en: used in combination with an amount to show that that many of a particular type of goods have been wrapped and are being sold together

examples.ch: 6罐装啤酒
examples.en: a six-pack of beer

examples.ch: 两块装肥皂
examples.en: a twin-pack of soap

examples.ch: 多卷装卫生纸
examples.en: a multi-pack of toilet paper

defines.trans_en: a side of one of the pieces of paper in a book, newspaper, or magazine, usually with a number printed on it

examples.ch: 关于如何参加比赛的细则，请参见134页。
examples.en: For details on how to enter the competition, see page 134.

examples.ch: 这篇文章刊登在《纽约时报》的头版。
examples.en: The article appeared on the front page of the New York Times.

defines.trans_ch: （书或报纸、杂志中纸的）一页，一张
defines.trans_en: one of the sheets of paper in a book, newspaper, or magazine

examples.ch: 这本书有好几页被撕掉了。
examples.en: Several pages have been torn out of this book.

defines.trans_en: one part of a website
(in the past) a boy who worked as a servant for a knight and who was learning to become a knight

defines.trans_ch: （用扩音器在公共场合）呼叫（某人）
defines.trans_en: to call a person using a loudspeaker (= an electric device for making sounds louder) in a public place

examples.ch: 机场扩音器传出了呼叫他的广播，叫他立刻回家。
examples.en: He was paged at the airport and told to return home immediately.

defines.trans_ch: 给某人的传呼机留口信
defines.trans_en: to send a message to someone's pager (= small electronic device that receives signals)

examples.ch: 你试过给他打传呼吗？
examples.en: Have you tried to page him?

defines.trans_en: a feeling of physical suffering caused by injury or illness

examples.ch: 她的症状包括腹痛和呕吐。
examples.en: Her symptoms included abdominal pain and vomiting.

examples.ch: 你疼吗？
examples.en: Are you in (= suffering from) pain?

examples.ch: 她一直疼个不停。
examples.en: She was in constant pain.

examples.ch: 这些药片会有助于缓解疼痛。
examples.en: These tablets should help to ease the pain.

examples.ch: 我感到脚上一阵剧痛。
examples.en: I felt a sharp pain in my foot.

examples.ch: 他多年来一直受着各种病痛的折磨。
examples.en: He's been suffering various aches and pains for years.

defines.trans_en: emotional or mental suffering

examples.ch: 这是一部描写为人父母者的酸甜苦辣的影片。
examples.en: It's a film about the pains and pleasures of parenthood.

examples.ch: 这对父母还在为孩子的死而悲痛万分。
examples.en: The parents are still in great pain over the death of their child.

defines.trans_en: If something pains you, it causes you to feel sad and upset.

examples.ch: 看到动物受虐待我很痛心。
examples.en: It pains me to see animals being mistreated.

defines.trans_en: a coloured liquid that is put on a surface such as a wall to decorate it

examples.ch: 一罐漆
examples.en: a tin of paint

examples.ch: 一罐漆
examples.en: a can of paint

examples.ch: 这面墙需要再刷一层漆。
examples.en: This wall needs another coat of paint.

examples.ch: 牌子上写着：“小心，油漆未干！”
examples.en: The sign said "Caution! Wet paint."

examples.ch: 亮光漆
examples.en: gloss paint

examples.ch: 亚光漆
examples.en: matt paint

examples.ch: 亚光漆
examples.en: matte paint

examples.ch: 有这么多种油漆可供选择，我很难决定买哪一种。
examples.en: There were so many paints (= types of paint) to choose from that I couldn't decide which to buy.

phrases.trans_en: tubes of paint or blocks of dried paint used for making pictures

examples.ch: 油画颜料
examples.en: oil paints

defines.trans_en: to cover a surface with paint

examples.ch: 我们把卧室漆成了蓝色。
examples.en: We've painted the bedroom blue.

examples.ch: 我整个早上都在刷油漆。
examples.en: I've been painting all morning.

examples.ch: 我得用油漆遮盖一下墙上这些污迹。
examples.en: I'll need to paint over (= cover with another layer of paint) these dirty marks on the wall.

defines.trans_en: to make a picture using paints

examples.ch: 所有这些画都是当地画家画的。
examples.en: All these pictures were painted by local artists.

defines.trans_en: If you paint your nails or face, you put make-up on that part of your body.

examples.ch: 她把指甲涂成鲜红色。
examples.en: She painted her nails bright red.

defines.trans_en: two things of the same appearance and size that are intended to be used together, or something that consists of two parts joined together

examples.ch: 一双鞋／一副手套
examples.en: a pair of shoes/gloves

examples.ch: 一把剪刀／一副眼镜
examples.en: a pair of scissors/glasses

examples.ch: 我找不到两只成对的袜子。
examples.en: I can't find a matching pair of socks.

examples.ch: 他把两条裤子和四件衬衣放进包里。
examples.en: He packed two pairs of trousers and four shirts.

examples.ch: 我希望你们两人一组来做这个练习。
examples.en: I'd like you to do this exercise in pairs (= in groups of two).

defines.trans_en: two people who have a romantic relationship or are doing something together

examples.ch: 他们像是很幸福的一对。
examples.en: They seem a very happy pair.

examples.ch: 你们俩在搞什么名堂？
examples.en: What have the pair of you been up to?

defines.trans_en: two animals that come together to have sex and produce young

examples.ch: 进行繁殖的一对
examples.en: a breeding pair

examples.ch: 一对天鹅
examples.en: a mated pair of swans

defines.trans_en: to make something one of a pair, or to become one of a pair

examples.ch: 著名的油画作品与桑德伯格和安杰洛等人的诗配成对。
examples.en: Famous paintings have been paired with poems by Sandburg, Angelou, and others.

defines.trans_en: thin, flat material made from crushed wood or cloth, used for writing, printing, or drawing on

examples.ch: 一张纸
examples.en: a piece/sheet of paper

examples.ch: 信纸
examples.en: writing paper

examples.ch: 字典通常用薄纸印刷。
examples.en: Dictionaries are usually printed on thin paper.

examples.ch: 纸袋
examples.en: a paper bag

examples.ch: 这张卡片是用再生纸印的。
examples.en: This card is printed on recycled paper (= paper made from used paper).

examples.ch: 把想法写在纸上以免忘了。
examples.en: Get the idea down on paper (= write it) before you forget it.

examples.ch: 她在纸上写东西，因为她不喜欢用电脑。
examples.en: She works on paper (= writes things on paper) because she hates computers.

defines.trans_en: a newspaper

examples.ch: 日报／周报／地方性报纸／全国性报纸
examples.en: a daily/weekly/local/national paper

examples.ch: 这张照片上了各家报纸的头版。
examples.en: The photo was on the front page of all the papers.

defines.trans_en: a set of printed questions for an exam

examples.ch: 应试者必须回答每张考卷上的两个问题。
examples.en: Candidates must answer two questions from each paper.

examples.ch: 地理试卷下周才能印好。
examples.en: The geography paper is not till next week.

defines.trans_en: a piece of writing on a particular subject written by an expert and usually published in a book or journal, or read aloud to other people

examples.ch: 他将在柏林召开的学术会议上宣读一篇热力学方面的论文。
examples.en: He will give a paper on thermodynamics at a conference in Berlin.

defines.trans_en: a short piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one done by students as part of the work for a course

examples.ch: 琼斯先生认为我的历史课程论文写得好极了。
examples.en: Mr Jones thought my history paper was terrific.

examples.ch: 我想让你们写一篇关于濒危物种的文章作为作业。
examples.en: For homework I want you to write a paper on endangered species.

phrases.trans_en: official documents, especially ones that show who you are

examples.ch: 边防卫兵拦住我要看我的证件。
examples.en: The border guards stopped me and asked to see my papers.

defines.trans_en: to cover a wall, room, etc. with wallpaper

defines.trans_ch: 原谅，宽恕（常用于礼貌的表达方式）
defines.trans_en: to forgive someone for something they have said or done. This word is often used in polite expressions

examples.ch: 请恕我无知，不过人类工程学究竟是怎么回事？
examples.en: Pardon my ignorance, but what exactly is ergonomics?

examples.ch: 对不起打扰一下，有位客户要见你。
examples.en: Pardon me interrupting, but there's a client to see you.

defines.trans_en: If someone who has committed a crime is pardoned, that person is officially forgiven and their punishment is stopped.

examples.ch: 新总统赦免并释放了一大批政治犯。
examples.en: Large numbers of political prisoners have been pardoned and released by the new president.

defines.trans_en: an occasion when someone who has committed a crime is officially forgiven

examples.ch: 他积极寻求总统的赦免。
examples.en: He had actively sought a pardon from the president.

defines.trans_en: used to politely ask someone to repeat something they have said because you did not hear it

defines.trans_ch: 再说一遍（用于对某人的话感到不快时）
defines.trans_en: used to show that someone has said something that offends you

examples.ch: “无论怎么说，女人开车十有八九都不行。”“恕我不敢苟同！”
examples.en: "Women tend to be fairly useless drivers, anyway." "I beg your pardon!"

defines.trans_en: a mother or father of a person or an animal

examples.ch: 我这个周末将第一次见理查德的父母。
examples.en: I'm going to meet Richard's parents for the first time this weekend.

defines.trans_en: a company that owns one or more other companies

examples.ch: 子公司发行的股票由母公司担保。
examples.en: The subsidiary has issued shares that are guaranteed by its parent.

examples.ch: 母公司预计今年会投入5千万美元用于广告。
examples.en: The parent company is expected to spend $50 million in advertising this year.

defines.trans_en: a large area of land with grass and trees, usually surrounded by fences or walls, and specially arranged so that people can walk in it for pleasure or children can play in it

examples.ch: 中央公园
examples.en: Central Park

examples.ch: 海德公园
examples.en: Hyde Park

examples.ch: 我们在公园里看别人慢跑。
examples.en: We watched the joggers in the park.

defines.trans_en: an area of land that is used for a particular purpose

examples.ch: 办公/商业园
examples.en: an office/a business park

defines.trans_en: an area of land for playing sports on
an area of land around a large house in the countryside
to put a vehicle in a place where it can stay for a period of time, usually while you leave it

examples.ch: 你把车停在哪儿了？
examples.en: Where have you parked?

examples.ch: 就把车停在车道上吧。
examples.en: Just park your car in the driveway.

defines.trans_ch: （某人）坐在（某处），站在（某处），把…放在（某处）（常因持续时间过长而令人生厌）
defines.trans_en: to put yourself or something in a particular place for a long time, often annoying other people

examples.ch: 他在电视前一坐就是一下午。
examples.en: He parked himself in front of the TV and stayed there all afternoon.

examples.ch: 她把一大堆文件堆在我桌子上，我根本不知道该拿它们怎么办。
examples.en: She's parked an enormous pile of papers on my desk and I haven't a clue what to do with them.

defines.trans_en: to not deal with something or answer a question immediately but leave it for a later time

examples.ch: 我们可以把那个问题留到会议的最后吗？
examples.en: Can we park that question until the end of the session?

defines.trans_en: a tropical bird with a curved beak, often kept as a pet and trained to copy the human voice

defines.trans_ch: 鹦鹉学舌般地复述，机械地复述
defines.trans_en: to repeat exactly what someone else says, without understanding it or thinking about its meaning

examples.ch: 她脑子里没有什么自己的见解，她只会机械地重复萨拉所说的每句话。
examples.en: She doesn't have an original thought in her head - she just parrots anything that Sara says.

defines.trans_en: some but not all of a thing

examples.ch: 我这块牛排有些部分没做好。
examples.en: Part of my steak isn't cooked properly.

examples.ch: 这份表格有一部分似乎缺失了。
examples.en: Part of this form seems to be missing.

examples.ch: 我认为她的部分问题在于她不去认真听取别人所说的话。
examples.en: I think part of her problem is that she doesn't listen carefully enough to what other people say.

defines.trans_en: a separate piece of something, or a piece that combines with other pieces to form the whole of something

examples.ch: 我们了解到消化系统所有不同的组成部分。
examples.en: We learned about all the different parts of the digestive system.

examples.ch: 她脊柱的下部在事故中给压碎了。
examples.en: The lower part of her spine was crushed in the accident.

examples.ch: 我想你一直多少有点怀疑你在做的事情吧。
examples.en: I think there's always a part of you that doubts what you're doing.

examples.ch: 新鲜的水果和蔬菜是健康饮食的基本／重要组成部分。
examples.en: Fresh fruit and vegetables form an essential/important part of a healthy diet.

examples.ch: 今晚英格兰中部部分地区将有雪。
examples.en: There'll be snow in parts (= particular areas) of the Midlands tonight.

defines.trans_en: one of the pieces that together form a machine or some type of equipment

examples.ch: 他在一家制造飞机零件的公司工作。
examples.en: He works for a company that makes aircraft parts.

defines.trans_ch: （电视连续剧或连播剧的）集，节，段；（小说的）部，篇
defines.trans_en: a single broadcast of a series of television or radio programmes or a division of a story

examples.ch: 下周我们将出版总统日记的第三部分。
examples.en: Next week we publish part three of the president's diaries.

examples.ch: 该节目将分两集播出。
examples.en: The programme will be shown in two parts.

defines.trans_en: one of two or more equal, or almost equal, measures of something

examples.ch: 将一份药与三份水混合。
examples.en: Mix one part of the medicine with three parts water.

defines.trans_en: one of the characters in a film, play, or dance, or the words, actions, or movements that are said or done by that character

examples.ch: 他在学校的演出中得到一个小角色。
examples.en: He has a small part in the school play.

examples.ch: 她扮演那位金发性感女侍者。
examples.en: She plays the part of the sexy blonde waitress.

defines.trans_en: the music that a particular musician plays in a group
involvement in or responsibility for an activity, or action

examples.ch: 他承认自己参与了抢劫。
examples.en: He admitted his part in the robbery.

examples.ch: 我一点也不想参与你那些疯狂的计划！
examples.en: I want no part in/of your crazy plans!

defines.trans_en: a line on someone's head made by brushing the hair in two different directions

examples.ch: 中／偏分
examples.en: a centre/side part

phrases.trans_en: partly, or to some degree

examples.ch: 申请的最后期限延长了，部分原因是邮局发生了罢工。
examples.en: The deadline for applications is being extended, in part because of the postal strike.

phrases.trans_en: to an important degree

examples.ch: 我们能多快完成这个项目很大程度上取决于款项什么时候到位。
examples.en: How quickly we can finish the project depends in (a) large part on when we get the payments through.

phrases.trans_en: mostly or usually

examples.ch: 他通常都很乐于助人。
examples.en: He was, for the most part, quite helpful.

phrases.trans_en: used to refer to an area of the country

examples.ch: 在这些地区我们见不到多少外国人。
examples.en: We don't see many foreigners in these parts.

phrases.trans_en: to be involved in an activity with other people

examples.ch: 她通常不参加任何班级活动。
examples.en: She doesn't usually take part in any of the class activities.

defines.trans_en: to separate or cause something or someone to separate

examples.ch: 幕布拉开，露出灯光转暗的舞台。
examples.en: The curtains parted, revealing a darkened stage.

examples.ch: 就连跟他分开两天都会叫她难过。
examples.en: To be parted from him even for two days made her sad.

defines.trans_en: If you part your hair, you arrange it so that it falls on either side of your head by separating it with a line down the middle or on one side.
If two people part, they leave each other, often at the end of a relationship.

examples.ch: 很遗憾我们最后不欢而散。
examples.en: I'm afraid we parted on very bad terms.

defines.trans_en: partly

examples.ch: 他有部分非洲血统——他父亲出生在索马里。
examples.en: He's part African - his father was born in Somalia.

examples.ch: 考试一部分是口试，一部分是笔试。
examples.en: The exam is part spoken and part written.

defines.trans_en: a social event at which a group of people meet to talk, eat, drink, dance, etc., often in order to celebrate a special occasion

examples.ch: 生日聚会
examples.en: a birthday party

examples.ch: 欢送会
examples.en: a farewell party

examples.ch: 晚宴
examples.en: a dinner party (= a small, sometimes formal party where a meal is eaten)

examples.ch: （美国）化装舞会
examples.en: a fancy-dress (US costume) party (= a party where people wear clothes that make them look like someone or something else)

examples.ch: 彼得举办的聚会很疯狂。
examples.en: Peter has/gives/throws really wild parties.

defines.trans_en: an organization of people with particular political beliefs that competes in elections to try to win positions in local or national government

examples.ch: 民主党
examples.en: the Democratic Party

examples.ch: 绿党
examples.en: the Green party

examples.ch: 保守党
examples.en: the Conservative party

examples.ch: 该党刚选出了一名新领袖。
examples.en: The party has/have just elected a new leader.

examples.ch: 他于2011年当选为该党的领导人。
examples.en: He was elected as party leader in 2011.

examples.ch: 他们联系全国的党员，请求他们支援。
examples.en: They contacted party members from across the nation to ask for their support.

defines.trans_ch: （共同参加活动，尤指参观的）一批人，一组人
defines.trans_en: a group of people who are involved in an activity together, especially a visit

examples.ch: 一批游客
examples.en: a party of tourists

examples.ch: 大多数博物馆对学校的团体参观者打折。
examples.en: Most museums give a discount to school parties.

defines.trans_en: one of the people or groups of people involved in an official argument, arrangement, or similar situation

examples.ch: 联合国呼吁冲突各方对新的和平倡议采取积极姿态。
examples.en: The UN called on all parties in the conflict to take a positive stance towards the new peace initiative.

examples.ch: 发生交通意外后常常很难确定谁是有错的一方。
examples.en: It's often difficult to establish who the guilty party is following a traffic accident.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指在聚会上）吃喝玩乐，狂欢
defines.trans_en: to enjoy yourself by drinking and dancing, especially at a party

examples.ch: 我们尽情玩吧！
examples.en: Let's party!

examples.ch: 他们一直玩到天亮。
examples.en: They partied till dawn.

defines.trans_en: to go past something or someone or move in relation to it, him, or her

examples.ch: 今天早上我在楼梯上与他擦肩而过。
examples.en: I passed him on the stairs this morning.

examples.ch: 只有在安全的情况下，你才应该超越较慢的车辆。
examples.en: You should only pass a slower vehicle if it is safe to do so.

examples.ch: 你若是路过超市的话，帮我买些牛奶好吗？
examples.en: If you pass a supermarket, could you get me some milk?

examples.ch: 我正好路过，所以想进来聊聊。
examples.en: I was just passing by (= going past the place where you are), so I thought I'd drop in for a chat.

examples.ch: 他脸上闪过一丝焦虑的神情。
examples.en: A momentary look of anxiety passed across his face.

examples.ch: 一朵云飘过，遮住了太阳。
examples.en: A cloud passed over the sun.

defines.trans_en: to go past a particular point in time

examples.ch: 不要购买过了销售期限的商品。
examples.en: Don't buy goods that have passed their sell-by date.

defines.trans_en: to go past something by being greater in amount or degree

examples.ch: 公司营业额预计将在今年年底超过一千万美元大关。
examples.en: The company's turnover is expected to pass the $10 million mark by the end of this year.

defines.trans_en: If you say a state or feeling will pass, you mean it will disappear.

examples.ch: 别担心，他的消沉只是暂时的——很快就会过去。
examples.en: Don't worry, his depression is only temporary - it'll soon pass.

defines.trans_en: to be successful in an exam, course, etc.

examples.ch: 你猜怎么着？我通过驾驶考试了！
examples.en: Guess what? I've passed my driving test!

examples.ch: 考试太难了，所有考生中只有5%通过。
examples.en: The exam is so hard that only five percent of all applicants pass.

defines.trans_en: to give something to someone

examples.ch: 你能把盐递给我吗？
examples.en: Could you pass the salt please?

examples.ch: 我问能不能看看那封信，她很不情愿地递给了我。
examples.en: I asked if I could see the letter, so she passed it to me reluctantly.

examples.ch: 杰拉尔德把便条递给了我。
examples.en: Gerald passed me the note./Gerald passed the note to me.

examples.ch: 基因是一系列遗传指令，父母的特征通过它们遗传给子女。
examples.en: Genes are the means by which parents' characteristics are passed on to their children.

defines.trans_en: In sports, if you pass the ball, you kick, throw, or hit it to someone in your team.
If you pass money, you give someone false or stolen money without telling them.

examples.ch: 自从他给了我一张100美元的假钞后我就不信任他了。
examples.en: I haven't trusted him since he passed me a forged $100 bill.

examples.ch: 她因使用偷窃的支票而被捕。
examples.en: She was arrested for passing stolen cheques.

defines.trans_en: When time passes, it goes past.

examples.ch: 百无聊赖时，时间似乎过得很慢。
examples.en: Time seems to pass (by) so slowly when you're bored.

examples.ch: 我有点为晚会担心，但是一晚上过去了，并没出什么大纰漏。
examples.en: I was a little worried about the party, but the evening passed without any great disasters.

defines.trans_en: If you pass a period of time, you do something to stop yourself being bored during that period.

examples.ch: 游客们通过游泳、冲浪和打排球来消磨时间。
examples.en: The visitors pass their days swimming, windsurfing, and playing volleyball.

defines.trans_en: (of an official group of people) to give approval to something, especially by voting to make it law

examples.ch: 政府通过了一项限制枪支买卖的法律。
examples.en: The government passed a law to restrict the sale of guns.

examples.ch: 这种食品添加剂通过了检测，适合食用。
examples.en: The food supplement had been passed as safe for human consumption.

defines.trans_en: to remove waste from the body

examples.ch: 排尿
examples.en: to pass urine

defines.trans_ch: （牌戏中不出牌或竞赛中不回答问题时的用语）过
defines.trans_en: to choose not to play in a part of a game or not to answer a question in a quiz
to change from one state to another

examples.ch: 蜡受热后会从固体变成液体。
examples.en: Wax passes from solid to liquid when you heat it.

phrases.trans_en: to express a judgment or opinion about something, especially someone else's behaviour

examples.ch: 他是已定罪的罪犯，没资格（对我们其他人）品头论足。
examples.en: As a convicted criminal, he's in no position to pass judgment (on the rest of us).

phrases.trans_en: to say officially, as a judge, what a criminal's official punishment will be
to have blood in your urine or faeces (= solid waste)

examples.ch: 如果你便血的话应该去看医生。
examples.en: If you pass blood, you should go and see your doctor.

defines.trans_en: a successful result in an exam

examples.ch: 乔‧希尔在高级证书考试中取得了 A 等成绩。
examples.en: Jon Hill achieved two grade A passes at A-level.

defines.trans_en: a successful result in a course or exam for which the student will not be given a mark

examples.ch: 我修习的文学课程考试及格了。
examples.en: I got a pass in my Literature course.

defines.trans_en: a movement of the ball from one player to another member of the same team in a team sport
an official document or ticket showing that you have the right to go somewhere or use a particular form of transport

examples.ch: 公共汽车乘车证
examples.en: a bus pass

examples.ch: 登机牌
examples.en: a boarding pass

examples.ch: 我有贵宾证，可以免费使用该俱乐部的设施。
examples.en: My guest pass allows me to use the club's facilities free of charge.

defines.trans_ch: 免课证（允许某一学生因为特殊原因离开课堂）
defines.trans_en: a document that allows a student to leave a class for a particular reason

examples.ch: 她得到许可离开课堂去图书馆。
examples.en: She had a pass to go to the library.

defines.trans_en: a path or road between or over mountains

examples.ch: 山口
examples.en: a mountain pass

defines.trans_en: a difficult or unpleasant condition

examples.ch: 我要是知道事情已到了这步田地，早就报警了。
examples.en: If I'd been aware things had reached such a pass, I'd have told the police.

examples.ch: 当你连和几个朋友安静地喝几杯也不行时，处境真是糟透了。
examples.en: It's come to a pretty pass (= it's a bad situation) when you can't even have a few quiet drinks with some friends.

phrases.trans_en: to speak to or touch someone in a way that shows you would like to start a sexual relationship with them

defines.trans_en: a person who is travelling in a vehicle but is not driving it, flying it, or working on it

examples.ch: 飞机／火车／汽车乘客
examples.en: airline/rail/train/car passengers

phrases.trans_en: a train carrying people rather than goods

examples.ch: 这起事故涉及到两列客运火车。
examples.en: Two passenger trains were involved in the accident.

defines.trans_en: an official document containing personal information and usually a photograph that allows a person to travel to foreign countries and to prove who they are

examples.ch: 许多难民到达边境时身上没有护照。
examples.en: Many refugees have arrived at the border without passports.

examples.ch: 他是个德国人，持瑞士护照旅行。
examples.en: He was a German, travelling on a Swiss passport.

examples.ch: 护照检查
examples.en: passport control (= the examining of travellers' passports)

examples.ch: 护照像片
examples.en: a passport photo

phrases.trans_en: a certain way of getting something you want

examples.ch: 许多学生选择学商科仅仅是因为它似乎是找到好工作的一种手段。
examples.en: Many students opt for business studies simply because it sounds like a passport to a good job.

examples.ch: 人们单凭美貌也可能获得成功。
examples.en: Beauty alone can be a passport to success.

defines.trans_en: in or to a position that is further than a particular point

examples.ch: 我住在车站路，就在邮局过去一点。
examples.en: I live on Station Road, just past the post office.

examples.ch: 3个男孩骑着山地车从我们身边经过。
examples.en: Three boys went past us on mountain bikes.

examples.ch: 刚从我们身边慢跑过去、穿亮粉色短裤的人是彼得吗？
examples.en: Was that Peter who just jogged past in those bright pink shorts?

defines.trans_en: used to say what the time is when it is a particular number of minutes after an hour

examples.ch: 现在是3点5分／10分／一刻／20分／25分／半。
examples.en: It's five/ten/a quarter/twenty/twenty-five/half past three.

examples.ch: 在过20的时候我就得走，不然就赶不上火车了。
examples.en: I need to leave at twenty past or I'll miss that train.

defines.trans_en: above a particular age or further than a particular point

examples.ch: 她已经过了需要找人照看的年龄。
examples.en: She's past the age where she needs a babysitter.

examples.ch: 你想干什么就干什么吧，我已经不在乎了。
examples.en: Do what you want, I'm past caring (= I don't care any longer).

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a period of time before and until the present

examples.ch: 在过去的100年内，全世界的平均气温已上升了大约1华氏度。
examples.en: The average temperature worldwide has risen by about one degree Fahrenheit in the past 100 years.

examples.ch: 在过去的30年里我每天都步行3英里。
examples.en: I've been walking three miles a day for the past 30 years.

examples.ch: 他是过去两天内第五个死在这些山上的登山者。
examples.en: He was the fifth climber to die on these mountains over the past two days.

examples.ch: 数个世纪／数年前，连到邻村去都被视为一次长途跋涉。
examples.en: In centuries/years past (= many centuries/years ago) even visiting the next village was considered a long journey.

defines.trans_en: having happened or existed before now

examples.ch: 我凭以往的经验知道不能以貌取人。
examples.en: I know from past experience that you can't judge by appearances.

examples.ch: 首相的家人被吩咐不要和媒体谈及他过去的生活。
examples.en: The prime minister's family have been instructed not to discuss his past life with the press.

defines.trans_en: finished

examples.ch: 冷天过去了，我现在感觉好受多了。
examples.en: I'm feeling much better now that the cold weather is past.

defines.trans_en: of the past tense

examples.ch: must 没有过去式。
examples.en: "Must" does not have a past form.

defines.trans_en: the period before and until, but not including, the present time

examples.ch: 进化能解释过去，但永远无法预知未来。
examples.en: Evolution can explain the past, but it can never predict the future.

examples.ch: 在过去，这种活儿完全是手工完成的。
examples.en: In the past, this sort of work was all done by hand.

examples.ch: 赢得1500米比赛的冠军后，他已经能够与昔日的一些伟大运动员比肩。
examples.en: By winning the 1500 metres, he joins some of the great names of the past.

defines.trans_en: the form of a verb used to describe actions, events, or states that happened or existed before the present time

examples.ch: change 的过去式是 changed。
examples.en: The past of "change" is "changed".

phrases.trans_en: a part of someone's life in which they did unacceptable or dishonest things

examples.ch: 他有一段不光彩的过去。
examples.en: He's a man with a past.

defines.trans_ch: （通常拌以调味汁的）意大利面食
defines.trans_en: a food made from flour, water, and sometimes egg, that is cooked and usually served with a sauce. It is made in various shapes that have different names

examples.ch: 细条实心面、卤汁宽面条、方形饺和塞肉粗通心粉都属于意大利面食。
examples.en: Spaghetti, lasagne, ravioli, and cannelloni are all types of pasta.

defines.trans_en: a route or track between one place and another, or the direction in which something is moving

examples.ch: 花园小路
examples.en: a garden path

examples.ch: 水泥路
examples.en: a concrete path

examples.ch: 经常有人走的小路
examples.en: a well-trodden path

examples.ch: 这条路通向悬崖。
examples.en: This is the path to the cliffs.

examples.ch: 要等几天除雪机才能清出一条通向该村的小路。
examples.en: It will be several days before snowploughs clear a path (through) to the village.

examples.ch: 他们循着这条路来到了一个大门口。
examples.en: They followed the path until they came to a gate.

examples.ch: 烈火仍在森林中肆虐，将沿途的一切都化为灰烬。
examples.en: A fierce fire is still raging through the forest, burning everything in its path (= as it moves forward).

examples.ch: 国家气象局向飓风经过地区的人们发出预警。
examples.en: The Weather Service issues warnings to people in the path of a hurricane (= in the area in which it is moving).

examples.ch: 带电粒子呈螺旋状运动。
examples.en: The charged particles move in spiral paths.

examples.ch: 他的人生之路从未平坦过。
examples.en: His path through life was never easy.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指达到某一目的或结果的）行动步骤，途径
defines.trans_en: a set of actions, especially ones that lead to a goal or result

examples.ch: 成功之路充满艰辛。
examples.en: The path to success is fraught with difficulties.

defines.trans_en: to give money to someone for something you want to buy or for services provided

examples.ch: 你买那些票花了多少钱？
examples.en: How much did you pay for the tickets?

examples.ch: 我缴付税款。
examples.en: I pay my taxes.

examples.ch: 我明天还你那5英镑。
examples.en: I'll pay you the fiver back tomorrow.

examples.ch: 我付给司机现金。
examples.en: I paid the driver (in/with) cash.

examples.ch: 你喜欢用现金、支票还是信用卡支付？
examples.en: Would you prefer to pay with/by cash, cheque, or credit card?

examples.ch: 我想我们得雇个建筑工人来把这面墙推倒。
examples.en: I think we'll need to pay a builder to take this wall down.

examples.ch: 琳达出门时让你替她照看她的猫，有没有付钱给你？
examples.en: Did Linda pay you for looking after her cats while she was away?

examples.ch: 我花了一大笔钱修洗衣机，结果还是不能用！
examples.en: I paid (out) a lot of money to get the washing machine fixed and it still doesn't work!

defines.trans_en: to give money to someone for work that they have done

examples.ch: 这家公司给实习生每个月4千美元的报酬。
examples.en: The company pays its interns $4,000 a month.

examples.ch: 这样的工作我们每天付200欧元。
examples.en: We pay €200 a day for this kind of work.

examples.ch: 当会计可能很乏味，但至少收入可观。
examples.en: Accountancy may be boring but at least it pays well.

examples.ch: 这些妇女大多工资很低，且工作条件恶劣。
examples.en: Most of these women are very poorly paid and work in terrible conditions.

defines.trans_ch: 有收益，有利可图，有好处
defines.trans_en: to give a profit or advantage to someone or something

examples.ch: 凡是涉及人身安全时，冒险决不会有什么好处。
examples.en: It never pays to take risks where human safety is concerned.

defines.trans_en: to give or do something

examples.ch: 司令员高度赞扬了部队官兵的勇敢无畏。
examples.en: The commander paid tribute to the courage of his troops.

examples.ch: 被人赞扬总是件好事。
examples.en: It's always nice to be paid a compliment.

examples.ch: 一群哀悼者聚集在一起向死者告别。
examples.en: A crowd of mourners gathered to pay their respects to the dead man.

phrases.trans_en: If something pays for itself, it works so well that it saves the same amount of money that it cost.

examples.ch: 这则广告所带来的收益应该能够本。
examples.en: The advertising should pay for itself.

phrases.trans_ch: （通过仔细看、听或思考）关注（某事）
phrases.trans_en: to watch, listen to, or think about something carefully

examples.ch: 你没有注意听我的话。
examples.en: You weren't paying attention to what I was saying.

phrases.trans_en: to visit a person or place, usually for a short time

examples.ch: 我到这一带来时会去拜访你的。
examples.en: I'll pay you a call when I'm in the area.

examples.ch: 我以为在里斯本时我们会去参观那家博物馆。
examples.en: We thought we'd pay a visit to the museum while we were in Lisbon.

examples.ch: 如果你留下地址，我到这一带来时会去拜访你的。
examples.en: If you leave your address, I'll pay a call on you when I'm in the area.

defines.trans_en: the money you receive for doing a job

examples.ch: 这份工作不错，但工资低得不像话。
examples.en: It's a nice job but the pay is appalling.

phrases.text: be in the pay of sb
phrases.trans_en: to work for someone, especially secretly

defines.trans_en: a long, thin object used for writing or drawing with ink

examples.ch: 自来水／圆珠／毡头笔
examples.en: a fountain/ballpoint/felt-tip pen

examples.ch: 不要用钢笔写，否则写错就擦不掉了。
examples.en: Don't write in pen (= using a pen), or you won't be able to rub out any mistakes you make.

defines.trans_en: a small area surrounded by a fence, especially one in which animals are kept

examples.ch: 羊／猪圈
examples.en: a sheep/pig pen

defines.trans_en:
slang for
penitentiary US

examples.ch: 他在州立监狱服刑9年。
examples.en: He served nine years in the state pen.

defines.trans_en: to write something

examples.ch: 她给女主人写了一封感谢信。
examples.en: She penned a note of thanks to her hostess.

defines.trans_en: a long, thin object, usually made of wood, for writing or drawing, with a sharp black or coloured point at one end

examples.ch: 一盒彩色铅笔
examples.en: a box of coloured pencils

examples.ch: 钢笔和铅笔
examples.en: pens and pencils

examples.ch: 他坐着，手里拿着铅笔准备记笔记。
examples.en: He sat with his pencil poised, ready to take notes.

examples.ch: 铅笔钝了——你最好削一下。
examples.en: The pencil's blunt - you'd better sharpen it (= make its point sharp).

examples.ch: 把你的意见用铅笔写在页边上。
examples.en: Write your comments in the margin in (= using) pencil.

examples.ch: 削铅笔器，卷笔刀
examples.en: a pencil sharpener

defines.trans_en: the form of some types of make-up

examples.ch: 眉笔
examples.en: an eyebrow pencil

examples.ch: 唇线笔
examples.en: a lip pencil

defines.trans_en: a thin beam of light

examples.ch: 门稍稍开启时，一缕阳光透了进来。
examples.en: A pencil of light showed as the door opened slightly.

defines.trans_en: used to describe something that has been drawn with a pencil

examples.ch: 素描／铅笔画
examples.en: pencil sketches/drawings

examples.ch: 沿着铅笔线或紧贴着线内侧剪裁。
examples.en: Cut on or just inside the pencil line.

defines.trans_en: to write something with a pencil
a small bag for holding pens, pencils, etc., often used at school
someone who you exchange letters with as a hobby, but usually have not met

examples.ch: 我在澳大利亚有个笔友。
examples.en: I've got a pen pal in Australia.

defines.trans_ch: （英国）便士（最小的货币单位，100便士为1英镑，表示币值时用 pence 或在非正式场合也可用 p，而表示硬币本身时用 pennies）
defines.trans_en: the smallest unit of money in the UK, of which there are 100 in a pound, or a small coin worth this much. You use "pence" or, more informally, "p" when you are talking about the units of money and pennies when you are talking about the coins themselves.

examples.ch: 你能借给我50便士吗？
examples.en: Could you lend me 50 pence/50p please?

examples.ch: 我在地上捡到了一枚面值10／20／50便士的硬币。
examples.en: I found a ten/twenty/fifty pence piece (= a coin of this value) on the floor.

examples.ch: 我把便士和其他小硬币放在一个罐子里。
examples.en: I keep pennies and other small coins in a jar.

defines.trans_en: in the US and Canada, a cent or a coin of this value

defines.trans_ch: 便士（英国在1971年以前使用的大硬币，12便士等于1先令）
defines.trans_en: in the UK before 1971, a large coin. There were twelve pennies in a shilling.
used when talking about the smallest amount of money possible

examples.ch: 现在买一台电视，三个月不用付一分钱。
examples.en: Buy a TV now and it won't cost you a penny (= will cost nothing) for three months.

examples.ch: 这顿饭很贵，但每分钱都很值。
examples.en: It was an expensive meal but worth every penny.

defines.trans_en: used in the past with numbers to show how many pence something cost

examples.ch: 一份4便士的冰激凌
examples.en: a fourpenny ice-cream

defines.trans_en: men, women, and children

examples.ch: 许多人从来不做任何运动。
examples.en: Many people never do any exercise.

examples.ch: 我们邀请了30个人来参加聚会。
examples.en: We've invited 30 people to our party.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to everyone, or informally to the group that you are speaking to

examples.ch: 人们会以为你疯了。
examples.en: People will think you've gone mad.

examples.ch: 人们都喜欢被别人看重。
examples.en: People like to be made to feel important.

examples.ch: 我们既已讨论完存在的问题，大家对所作的决定还满意吗？
examples.en: Now that we've discussed our problems, are people happy with the decisions we've made?

defines.trans_en: men and women who are involved in a particular type of work

examples.ch: 我们必须请市政会的人来查看一下这些计划。
examples.en: We'll have to get the people at the city council to look at these plans.

examples.ch: 她的大部分朋友都是传媒界人士。
examples.en: Most of her friends are media people.

phrases.trans_en: the large number of ordinary men and women who do not have positions of power in society

examples.ch: 她自称是老百姓的代言人。
examples.en: She claims to be the voice of the people.

examples.ch: 总统失去了人民的支持。
examples.en: The president has lost the support of the people.

examples.ch: 平民王妃
examples.en: the people's Princess

phrases.trans_en: the people someone is related to

examples.ch: 她家人原籍苏格兰。
examples.en: Her people come from Scotland originally.

defines.trans_en: all the men, women, and children who live in a particular country, or who have the same culture or language

examples.ch: 法国人是众所周知的热爱美食的民族。
examples.en: The French are known as a food-loving people.

defines.trans_en: a society

examples.ch: 类似这样的风俗在世界上的许多民族中都能见到。
examples.en: Customs similar to this one are found among many peoples of the world.

defines.trans_en: a grey or white powder produced by crushing dry peppercorns, used to give a spicy, hot taste to food

examples.ch: 现磨的黑胡椒粉
examples.en: freshly ground black pepper

examples.ch: 盐和胡椒
examples.en: salt and pepper

defines.trans_en: a vegetable that is usually green, red, or yellow, has a rounded shape, and is hollow with seeds in the middle

examples.ch: 红／青菜椒
examples.en: a red/green pepper

examples.ch: 甜椒通常是与其他蔬菜一同烹调或放在色拉里生吃。
examples.en: Peppers are usually cooked with other vegetables or eaten raw in salads.

examples.ch: 红菜椒很适合用烤箱烘烤来吃。
examples.en: Red peppers are ideal for roasting in the oven.

defines.trans_en: used when expressing rates, prices, or measurements to mean "for each"

examples.ch: 这顿饭每人要花20美元。
examples.en: The meal will cost $20 per person.

examples.ch: 那辆车以每小时70英里的速度行驶着。
examples.en: The car was travelling at 70 miles per hour (70 mph).

examples.ch: 该地区每平方英里内的咖啡馆要比该国其他任何一个地方都多。
examples.en: There are more cafés per square mile here than anywhere else in the country.

defines.trans_en: used to show that something is possible or that you are not certain about something

examples.ch: 他最近没给我写信——也许他把我的地址弄丢了。
examples.en: He hasn't written to me recently - perhaps he's lost my address.

examples.ch: 或许还没有人提出最重要的问题。
examples.en: Perhaps the most important question has not been asked.

examples.ch: 我们打算去欧洲旅行，也许去西班牙或意大利。
examples.en: We plan to travel to Europe - to Spain or Italy perhaps.

defines.trans_en: used to show that a number or amount is approximate

examples.ch: 大概有500人出席了会议。
examples.en: There were perhaps 500 people at the meeting.

defines.trans_ch: （用于礼貌地要求或陈述意见）兴许，也许
defines.trans_en: used when making polite requests or statements of opinion

examples.ch: “我从来记不住别人的生日。”“兴许你应该记住。”
examples.en: "I never remember people's birthdays." "Well, perhaps you should."

defines.trans_en: a man, woman, or child

examples.ch: 游过英吉利海峡的第一人是谁？
examples.en: Who was the first person to swim the English Channel?

examples.ch: 在这个饭馆里两个人一顿饭的费用大约为70美元。
examples.en: A meal at the restaurant costs about $70 for two people.

examples.ch: 4人被控犯有谋杀罪。
examples.en: Four persons have been charged with the murder.

defines.trans_ch: （用于描述人的某一品质）…的人
defines.trans_en: used when describing someone's character

examples.ch: 她是那种非常和蔼的人。
examples.en: She's an extremely kind person.

examples.ch: 他是个很好的人，但不适合这份工作。
examples.en: He's nice enough as a person, but he's not the right man for this job.

examples.ch: 我认为他不是个喜欢看书的人。
examples.en: I don't think of him as a book person (= a person who likes books).

defines.trans_ch: 人称（第一人称 I 或 we 指说话人，第二人称 you 指听话的人，第三人称 he， she， it 或 they 指谈到的人或事物）
defines.trans_en: used in grammar to describe the verbs and pronouns that refer to the different people in a conversation. The first person ("I" or "we") refers to the person speaking, the second person ("you") refers to the person being spoken to and the third person ("he", "she", "it", or "they") refers to another person or thing being spoken about or described

examples.ch: 小说是以第一人称写的，因此作者和叙述者好像是同一个人。
examples.en: The novel is written in the first person, so that the author and narrator seem to be the same.

examples.ch: am 是动词 to be 的第一人称单数形式。
examples.en: "Am" is the first person singular of the verb "to be".

phrases.trans_en: If you do something or go somewhere in person, you do it or go there yourself.

examples.ch: 如果你不能亲自到场的话，在电视上观看就是退而求其次的选择了。
examples.en: If you can't be there in person, the next best thing is watching it on TV.

defines.trans_ch: 从事（某项工作）的人（常用来代替以 -man 和 -woman 结尾的名词，以避免不必要提及性别）
defines.trans_en: used to combine with nouns to form new nouns referring to the particular job or duty that someone has. It is often used instead of -man or -woman to avoid making an unnecessary statement about the sex of the particular person

examples.ch: 发言人
examples.en: spokesperson

examples.ch: 主席
examples.en: chairperson

examples.ch: 商人
examples.en: business people

defines.trans_en: an animal that is kept in the home as a companion and treated kindly

examples.ch: 他们有好几只宠物：一只狗、两只兔子和一只豚鼠。
examples.en: They have several pets - a dog, two rabbits, and a guinea pig.

examples.ch: 宠物蛇
examples.en: a pet snake

defines.trans_en: a kind person who is easy to like

examples.ch: 他总是送花给我——他真讨人喜欢！
examples.en: He's always sending me flowers - he's a real pet!

defines.trans_ch: 宝贝，乖乖（尤用于称呼女性或孩子）
defines.trans_en: a friendly way of talking to someone, especially a woman or a child

examples.ch: 谢谢你，宝贝儿。
examples.en: Thank you, pet.

phrases.trans_en: to be the person that someone in authority likes best and treats better than anyone else

examples.ch: 别的孩子都恨她，因为她是老师的宠儿。
examples.en: The other children hated her because she was the teacher's pet.

defines.trans_en: If you pet an animal, child, etc., you touch it, him, or her gently and kindly with your hands.

examples.ch: 我们的狗喜欢人在它耳后抚摸、挠痒。
examples.en: Our dog loves to be petted and tickled behind the ears.

defines.trans_en: If two people are petting, they are kissing and touching each other in a sexual way.

phrases.trans_ch: 特别喜爱的理论／话题／特别讨厌的事物（等等）
phrases.trans_en: a theory, subject, hate, etc. that is special and important to you

examples.ch: 足球是她最讨厌的东西之一。
examples.en: Football is one of her pet hates.

examples.ch: 我最讨厌的事情就是打扫浴室。
examples.en: My pet peeve (= pet hate) is cleaning the bathroom.

defines.trans_ch: 聚对苯二甲酸乙二酯（polyethylene terephthalate 的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for polyethylene terephthalate: a type of plastic used especially to make bottles

examples.ch: 房子半透明的墙壁是用一种叫做PET的塑料制成的，基本上与汽水瓶的材料相同。
examples.en: The house has translucent walls made from a plastic called PET, essentially the same material used in soda bottles.

examples.ch: 大多数装水的瓶子都是由PET塑料制成的。
examples.en: Most water bottles are made from PET plastic.

defines.trans_ch: 正电子发射计算机断层扫描术（positron emission tomography 的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for positron emission tomography: a method of using special rays (= beams of light) to make images of the inside of the body, especially the brain

examples.ch: 他们使用了PET，一种大脑扫描技术。
examples.en: They used PET, a brain-scanning technology.

examples.ch: 志愿者在接受PET扫描的同时，试图在虚拟城镇中的各个地标之间快速追溯路线。
examples.en: Volunteers underwent PET scans while trying to quickly retrace routes between various landmarks in the virtual town.

defines.trans_en: a liquid obtained from petroleum, used especially as a fuel for cars and other vehicles

examples.ch: 油箱／油泵／加油站
examples.en: a petrol tank/pump/station

examples.ch: 无铅汽油／高辛烷值汽油
examples.en: lead-free/unleaded/high-octane petrol

examples.ch: 我车里的汽油不多了。
examples.en: I'm a bit low on (= I don't have much) petrol.

defines.trans_ch: 药店，药房；（商店的）药品部
defines.trans_en: a shop or part of a shop in which medicines are prepared and sold
part of a hospital where medicines are prepared
the activity or study of medicine preparation

a device that uses either a system of wires along which electrical signals are sent or a system of radio signals to make it possible for you to speak to someone in another place who has a similar device

examples.ch: 就在那时，他的电话响了。
examples.en: Just then, his phone rang.

examples.ch: 你能接一下电话吗？
examples.en: Could you answer the phone?

examples.ch: 我们一周大约通两次电话。
examples.en: We speak on the/by phone about twice a week.

examples.ch: 今天早上有3个电话找你。
examples.en: You had three phone calls this morning.

examples.ch: 如果电话占线，请过会儿再打。
examples.en: If the phone lines are busy, please try again later.

examples.ch: 你能帮我把电话听筒拿起来吗——我的手是湿的。
examples.en: Could you pick the phone up for me - my hands are wet.

examples.ch: 我没有挂上电话听筒，所以不会响。
examples.en: I left the phone off the hook, so it wouldn't ring.

examples.ch: 我很生气，就把（她的）电话挂断了。
examples.en: I was so angry I just put/slammed the phone down (on her) (= replaced it before our conversation was finished).

defines.trans_en: a unit of sound at the phonetic level, used when studying speech

phrases.trans_en: to be using the phone

examples.ch: 我的那个儿子一整天都在打电话！
examples.en: That son of mine is on the phone all day!

phrases.trans_en: to have a landline in the home

examples.ch: 米德尔顿家的乡间别墅里装没装电话，你知道吗？
examples.en: Are the Middletons on the phone at their cottage, do you know?

defines.trans_en: to communicate with someone by phone

examples.ch: 刚吃完午饭她就打了电话。
examples.en: She phoned just after lunch.

examples.ch: 这周他每天都给我打电话。
examples.en: He's phoned me (up) every day this week.

defines.trans_en: used to form words referring to a speaker or speakers of a particular language

examples.ch: 一个讲法语的人 （说法语的人）
examples.en: a francophone (= a French speaker)

examples.ch: 在说英语的世界里（世界上说英语的人）
examples.en: the anglophone world (= people in the world who speak English)

defines.trans_en: used to form the names of musical instruments

examples.ch: 弦乐器（弦振动发声的乐器）
examples.en: a chordophone (= an instrument in which sound is produced by the vibration of a string)

examples.ch: 苏萨大号(美国行进乐队用)
examples.en: a sousaphone (= a brass instrument named after J. P. Sousa)

defines.trans_en: a photograph

examples.ch: 她给孩子们照了很多像片。
examples.en: She took lots of photos of the kids.

examples.ch: 假期／婚礼照片
examples.en: holiday/wedding photos

defines.trans_en: relating to or produced by light

examples.ch: 光合作用
examples.en: photosynthesis

defines.trans_en: relating to photography

examples.ch: 摄影新闻
examples.en: photojournalism

defines.trans_en: the activity or job of taking photographs or filming

examples.ch: 她在夜校学摄影。
examples.en: She's taking an evening class in photography.

examples.ch: 该影片获得了一项摄影奖。
examples.en: The film won an award for its photography.

defines.trans_en: a large musical instrument with a row of black and white keys that are pressed to play notes

examples.ch: 我们准备买一架新钢琴。
examples.en: We're buying a new piano.

examples.ch: 我会弹钢琴。
examples.en: I play the piano.

examples.ch: 她以前在一支爵士乐队演奏钢琴。
examples.en: She used to play piano in a jazz band.

examples.ch: 这支曲子是为钢琴谱写的。
examples.en: The music was written for piano.

examples.ch: 我们合唱了那支歌，帕特用钢琴伴奏。
examples.en: We all joined in the song, with Pat at the piano/on piano.

defines.trans_en: an occasion when you have an informal meal of sandwiches, etc. outside, or the food itself

examples.ch: 天气好的话我们就能去公园野餐了。
examples.en: If the weather's nice we could have a picnic in the park.

examples.ch: 你为什么不带上野餐时吃的东西？
examples.en: Why don't you take a picnic with you?

examples.ch: 野餐区域／野外午餐／野餐桌
examples.en: a picnic area/lunch/table

examples.ch: 野餐篮
examples.en: a picnic basket/hamper

defines.trans_en: to have a picnic somewhere

examples.ch: 有几家人在河岸上野餐。
examples.en: There were several families picnicking on the river bank.

defines.trans_en: a drawing, painting, photograph, etc.

examples.ch: 弗雷迪给我的狗画了一张像。
examples.en: Freddy drew/painted a picture of my dog.

examples.ch: 我们拍了一张孩子们骑新自行车的照片.
examples.en: We took a picture of (= photographed) the children on their new bicycles.

examples.ch: 我不喜欢被人拍照。
examples.en: I hate having my picture taken (= being photographed).

defines.trans_en: an image seen on a television or cinema screen

examples.ch: 我们看不到清晰的画面。
examples.en: We can't get a clear picture.

defines.trans_en: a film

examples.ch: 这会是第一部赢得最佳电影奖的动画片吗？
examples.en: Could this be the first animated movie to win a best picture award?

defines.trans_en: something you produce in your mind, by using your imagination or memory

examples.ch: 我清楚地记得第一次遇见埃里克的情景。
examples.en: I have a very vivid picture of the first time I met Erik.

defines.trans_en: (an idea of) a situation

examples.ch: 看完新闻后，我进一步了解了当时发生的情况。
examples.en: After watching the news, I had a clearer picture of what was happening.

examples.ch: 据报道，战场上的局面一片混乱。
examples.en: The picture emerging in reports from the battlefield is one of complete confusion.

defines.trans_en: a situation described in a particular way

examples.ch: 专家们把经济状况描绘得很阴暗／日趋光明／非常乐观。
examples.en: The experts are painting a gloomy/brighter/rosy picture of the state of the economy.

phrases.trans_en: the cinema

examples.ch: 今晚我们去看电影吧。
examples.en: Let's go to the pictures tonight.

defines.trans_en: to imagine something

examples.ch: 想象一下那个场景——拥挤的行人和牲口、喧闹声、尘土。
examples.en: Picture the scene - the crowds of people and animals, the noise, the dirt.

examples.ch: 设想一下自己在炙热的阳光下躺在海滩上。
examples.en: Try to picture yourself lying on a beach in the hot sun.

examples.ch: 你自己想象一下那天有多糟糕。
examples.en: Picture to yourself how terrible that day must have been.

examples.ch: 他被画成一名全身戎装的士兵。
examples.en: He was pictured (= an artist had painted him) as a soldier in full uniform.

defines.trans_en: a part of something

examples.ch: 从她大衣上撕下的一块布
examples.en: a piece of cloth torn from her coat

examples.ch: 他把蛋糕切成了6块。
examples.en: He cut the cake into six pieces.

examples.ch: 这套拼图玩具少了两块。
examples.en: This jigsaw puzzle has two pieces missing.

examples.ch: 花瓶碎片散落一地。
examples.en: The vase lay on the floor in pieces (= broken into small parts).

examples.ch: 她试图从边上撕下一小块。
examples.en: She tried to break/tear a small piece off the edge.

examples.ch: 房子被拆开，又一块块地重新拼搭起来。
examples.en: The building was taken apart and reassembled piece by piece (= one part after another).

defines.trans_ch: （某类事物中的）一件，一个，一条
defines.trans_en: a single object of a particular type

examples.ch: 一件家具／衣服／设备
examples.en: a piece of furniture/clothing/equipment

examples.ch: 一张纸
examples.en: a piece of paper (= a whole sheet)

examples.ch: 一件瓷器
examples.en: a piece of china (= an object made of china)

examples.ch: 一条消息／建议
examples.en: a piece of information/advice

defines.trans_en: an item of clothing, especially one that is expensive, fashionable, or individually made

examples.ch: 她的每件时装都非常独特，因为她所有的作品都是手工编织的。
examples.en: Each piece is quite unique, owing to the fact that all her creations are hand-knitted.

defines.trans_ch: （艺术家、音乐家或作家的）作品；篇，段，首，幅
defines.trans_en: something that has been created by an artist, musician, or writer

examples.ch: 管弦乐／钢琴曲／器乐作品
examples.en: an orchestral/piano/instrumental piece

examples.ch: 一件精巧的作品／一项富有技巧的研究
examples.en: a skilful piece of work/research

examples.ch: 你看报纸上的那篇文章了吗？
examples.en: Did you read that piece (= article) in the newspaper?

defines.trans_en: a single thing that forms part of a set

examples.ch: 一枚棋子
examples.en: a chess piece

defines.trans_en: a coin with a stated value

examples.ch: 你能帮我把一枚50美分的硬币换成两枚25美分的吗？
examples.en: Could you swap me two quarters for a 50 cent piece?

defines.trans_en: a gun

examples.ch: 一门炮
examples.en: an artillery piece

examples.ch: 他被逮捕时身上有一把枪。
examples.en: He was carrying a piece when he was arrested.

defines.trans_en: a sandwich

examples.ch: 一个火腿三明治
examples.en: a ham piece

phrases.trans_en: as a single thing and not divided into smaller pieces

examples.ch: 我们想把公司整个卖掉。
examples.en: We want to sell the business in one piece.

phrases.trans_en: to break apart into smaller parts

examples.ch: 玻璃杯肯定有裂缝——到我手上就碎了。
examples.en: The glass must have been cracked - it just fell to pieces in my hand.

examples.ch: 他的衣服又脏又破。
examples.en: His clothes were dirty and falling to pieces.

defines.trans_en: with the number of pieces mentioned

examples.ch: 5人乐队
examples.en: a five-piece band (= with five players)

defines.trans_en: a rectangular cloth bag filled with soft material, such as feathers or artificial materials, used for resting your head on in bed

examples.ch: 你喜欢羽绒枕头还是海绵枕头？
examples.en: Do you prefer a feather pillow or a foam pillow?

defines.trans_en:
a 
cushion
a person who flies an aircraft

examples.ch: 战斗机／直升机／轰炸机／客机驾驶员
examples.en: a fighter/helicopter/bomber/airline pilot

defines.trans_en: a person with detailed knowledge of an area of water, such as that around a port, who goes onto a ship to direct it safely
a programme that is made to introduce a new radio or television series and test how popular it is

examples.ch: 如果你看了试播节目的话，就会明白他们为什么决定不制作整套节目了。
examples.en: If you'd seen the pilot, you'd know why they decided not to make a complete series of programmes!

defines.trans_en: a small flame that burns all the time in a gas device, such as a cooker or a device for heating water, and that starts the main flame burning when the gas is turned on
A pilot plan, product, or system is used to test how good something is before introducing it.

examples.ch: 如果试验计划成功，会有越来越多的家庭享受到新的电视服务。
examples.en: If the pilot scheme is successful, many more homes will be offered the new television service.

defines.trans_en: to fly an aircraft

examples.ch: 其中一个引擎发生故障后，她将飞机开到了安全的地方。
examples.en: She piloted the aircraft to safety after one of the engines failed.

defines.trans_en: to test a new product before it is sold

examples.ch: 我们将在一些选定的潜在顾客身上试用几种新化妆品。
examples.en: We shall pilot several new cosmetic products to selected potential purchasers.

defines.trans_ch: 使（新的法律或制度）顺利通过
defines.trans_en: to be responsible for introducing a new law or system and making certain it is established

examples.ch: 20年前他力促议会通过了一项有关工作环境的议案。
examples.en: 20 years ago he piloted a bill through Parliament on working conditions.

defines.trans_en: to direct a ship into a port or through an area of water
of a pale red colour

examples.ch: 美丽的粉色花朵
examples.en: pretty pink flowers

examples.ch: 你晒太阳了吗？你的鼻子有点儿发红。
examples.en: Have you been in the sun? Your nose is a bit pink.

defines.trans_ch: （略）倾向于社会主义的;（稍稍）左倾的
defines.trans_en: (slightly) supporting socialist ideas and principles
relating to gay people

examples.ch: 与同性恋者相关的经济的增长
examples.en: the growth in the pink economy

defines.trans_en: a pale red colour

examples.ch: 她很喜欢粉红色。
examples.en: She's very fond of pink.

defines.trans_en: a small garden plant with sweet-smelling pink, white, or red flowers and narrow, grey-green leaves, or one of its flowers

defines.trans_ch: （汽车发动机）咯噔咯噔地响，发爆声，爆震
defines.trans_en: When a car engine pinks, it makes a high knocking sound because the fuel is not burning correctly.
a feeling of sadness or sympathy for someone else's unhappiness or difficult situation

examples.ch: 女孩站在那里，同情地盯着笼子里的老狮子。
examples.en: The girl stood gazing in/with pity at the old lion in the cage.

examples.ch: 她同意和他约会，更多的是出于可怜。
examples.en: She agreed to go out with him more out of pity than anything.

examples.ch: 这些人不要怜悯，他们要的是实际的帮助。
examples.en: These people don't want pity, they want practical help.

defines.trans_en: If something is described as a pity, it is disappointing or not satisfactory.

examples.ch: “你不能参加派对吗？唉，真遗憾。”
examples.en: "Can't you go to the party? Oh, that's (such) a pity."

examples.ch: 现在的孩子在户外花的时间太少了，真遗憾。
examples.en: It's a pity (that) children spend so little time outside nowadays.

examples.ch: 真遗憾你忘了把口信告知我。
examples.en: Pity (that) you didn't remember to give me the message.

examples.ch: “你生病了，太遗憾了！”
examples.en: What a pity you're ill!

examples.ch: “我给餐厅打了电话，但他们今晚关门了。” “真遗憾。”
examples.en: "I called the restaurant, but they're closed tonight." "Pity."

examples.ch: 我们必须早早离开，太遗憾了。
examples.en: We'll have to leave early, more's the pity (= and I am unhappy about it).

examples.ch: 令人遗憾的是没有多少人愿意来。
examples.en: The pity was that so few people bothered to come.

phrases.trans_ch: 同情（某人）并因此作出表示
phrases.trans_en: to feel sorry for someone, and to do something that shows this

examples.ch: 我们同情几个在雨中等公共汽车的人，就让他们搭了车。
examples.en: We took pity on a couple of people waiting in the rain for a bus and gave them a lift.

examples.ch: 我费力地背着包裹上台阶，最后终于有人可怜我帮了我一把。
examples.en: I struggled up the steps with my bags until eventually someone took pity and helped me.

defines.trans_en: to feel sadness or sympathy for someone's unhappiness or bad situation

examples.ch: 我怜悯那些从没有恋爱过的人。
examples.en: I pity anyone who's never been in love.

examples.ch: 他及其不快乐，更应该得到怜悯而不是受批评。
examples.en: He's deeply unhappy, and more to be pitied than criticized.

examples.ch: 你上班时得忍受着她，我同情你。
examples.en: I pity you having to put up with her at work!

defines.trans_en: a large circle of flat bread baked with cheese, tomatoes, and sometimes meat and vegetables spread on top

examples.ch: 一块比萨饼
examples.en: a slice of pizza

examples.ch: 我喜欢好多不同的比萨饼配料。
examples.en: I like lots of different pizza toppings.

examples.ch: 厚比萨饼
examples.en: a deep-pan (US deep-dish) pizza

defines.trans_en: an area, town, building, etc.

examples.ch: 坐在她的花园里真是凉爽宜人。
examples.en: Her garden was a cool pleasant place to sit.

examples.ch: 我们开车去纽约的路上穿过的那个地方叫什么名字？
examples.en: What was the name of that place we drove through on the way to New York?

examples.ch: 他们决定去比萨饼店。
examples.en: They decided to go to a pizza place.

examples.ch: 该地区有一些旅游胜地值得游览。
examples.en: There are several places of interest to visit in the area.

examples.ch: 在工作单位感觉舒心是很重要的。
examples.en: It's important to feel comfortable in your place of work.

defines.trans_en: a home

examples.ch: 我在找个住的地方。
examples.en: I'm looking for a place to live.

examples.ch: 我们将在我家开会。
examples.en: We'll have the meeting at my place.

defines.trans_ch: 适当的地点（或建筑物、场合等）
defines.trans_en: a suitable area, building, situation, or occasion

examples.ch: 大学是结交新朋友的好地方。
examples.en: University is a great place for making new friends.

examples.ch: 恐怕这个会议不是谈论个人私事的场合。
examples.en: This meeting isn't the place to discuss your problems, I'm afraid.

defines.trans_en: a position in relation to other things or people

examples.ch: 他腿上有两处骨折。
examples.en: His leg was broken in two places.

examples.ch: 你看完之后把书放回书架上原来的位置。
examples.en: When you've finished, put the book back in its place on the shelf.

examples.ch: 这株植物需要放在一个温暖而有阳光的地方。
examples.en: This plant needs a warm, sunny place.

examples.ch: 你帮我占着（排队的）位置好吗？
examples.en: Will you keep my place (in the queue) (= allow me to come back to the same position)?

examples.ch: 她和我说话，我忘了书看到哪里了。
examples.en: She spoke to me and I lost my place in the book (= I forgot where I had been reading).

defines.trans_en: the seat you will sit in on a particular occasion, or the seat where you usually sit, in the theatre, a class, a train, etc.

examples.ch: 我的票上印的座位号是6G，但已经有人坐在我的座位上了。
examples.en: My ticket says 6G but there's someone sitting in my place.

examples.ch: 孩子们领了奖品，回到座位上。
examples.en: The children collected their prizes and then went back to their places.

examples.ch: 在靠前面的地方给我留个座位。
examples.en: Save me a place (= keep a seat for me until I arrive) near the front.

defines.trans_en: the space at a table where one person will sit and eat, usually with a plate and knives, forks, and spoons arranged on it
