examples.ch: 军队正继续朝首都挺进。
examples.en: The army is continuing its push (= advance) towards the capital.

defines.trans_ch: （生意上为赢得优势而进行的）努力，攻势
defines.trans_en: a determined attempt to get an advantage over other companies in business

examples.ch: 该公司打算明年春天向欧洲市场大举推进。
examples.en: The company plans to make a big push into the European market next spring.

examples.ch: 这家旅馆正在大搞活动以吸引顾客。
examples.en: The hotel is making a major push to attract customers.

defines.trans_en: encouragement to make someone do something

examples.ch: 我母亲一直想学绘画，她只是需要有人含蓄地鼓励她一下。
examples.en: My mother had always wanted to learn how to paint - she just needed a gentle push.

defines.trans_en: a lot of advertising

examples.ch: 除非在媒体中大作宣传，否则这部电影不大可能吸引大批观众。
examples.en: This film is unlikely to attract large audiences unless it gets/it is given a big push in the media.

defines.trans_en: to move something or someone into the stated place, position, or direction

examples.ch: 你把钥匙放在哪了？
examples.en: Where have you put the keys?

examples.ch: 把你的衣服放在衣橱里。
examples.en: Put your clothes in the cupboard.

examples.ch: 他把盐误放在了糖罐里。
examples.en: He put salt into the sugar bowl by mistake.

examples.ch: 她把包放在桌子上。
examples.en: She put her bag on the table.

examples.ch: 她用双手捂住了眼睛。
examples.en: She put her hands over her eyes.

examples.ch: 我搂住他，给他安慰。
examples.en: I put my arm around him to comfort him.

examples.ch: 我们晚上总是把猫留在屋外。
examples.en: We always put the cat out (= outside the house) at night.

examples.ch: 每天晚上她都把衣服拿出来，准备好第二天穿。
examples.en: Every night, she puts out her clothes (= takes them from where they are kept so that they are ready) for the next day.

examples.ch: 我们把椅子挨近点的话，应该能在桌子边再放下一把。
examples.en: If we put the chairs a little closer together (= move them nearer to each other), we should be able to get another one around the table.

examples.ch: 你把黄色和蓝色的颜料混合就会得到绿色。
examples.en: If you put together (= mix) yellow and blue paint you get green.

examples.ch: 犯人们被带到墙边击毙。
examples.en: The prisoners were put up against (= moved into a position next to) a wall and shot.

defines.trans_en: to write something

examples.ch: 她在她所有的书上都写上了自己的名字。
examples.en: She puts her name in all her books.

examples.ch: 在你想选的候选人姓名旁画个叉。
examples.en: Put an X next to the name of the candidate you want to vote for.

examples.ch: 我已经把聚会的日期记在了我的记事本里。
examples.en: I've put the date of the party down in my diary.

examples.ch: 他让我把反对的理由写下来。
examples.en: He asked me to put my objections (down) on paper.

examples.ch: 这篇文章很有趣，不过他们要是提供了更多有关费用的信息就更好了。
examples.en: It was an interesting article but I wish they'd put in more information (= included more information) about the costs.

defines.trans_en: to express something in words

examples.ch: 她想告诉他再也不想见到他了，但不知如何开口。
examples.en: She wanted to tell him that she didn't want to see him any more, but she didn't know how to put it.

examples.ch: 我们不得不努力工作，就像克里斯十分精辟地指出的那样，不劳则无获。
examples.en: We're going to have to work very hard, but as Chris so succinctly put it, there's no gain without pain.

examples.ch: 你为什么说话总是这么粗鲁？
examples.en: Why do you always have to put things so crudely?

examples.ch: 每个人都有机会发表自己的看法吗？
examples.en: Has everyone had a chance to put their point of view?

defines.trans_ch: 使处于某种状态（或境地、局面）
defines.trans_en: to cause someone or something to be in the stated condition or situation

examples.ch: 你打算要置孩子们于危险境地吗？
examples.en: Are you prepared to put your children at risk?

examples.ch: 这让我处于非常困难的境地。
examples.en: This puts me in a very difficult position.

examples.ch: 是什么让你的心情这么糟糕？
examples.en: What has put you in such a bad mood?

examples.ch: 这次选举是该国选出新政府的一个机会。
examples.en: This election is a chance for the country to put a new government in (= elect a new government).

examples.ch: 已经碎成这么多块了，不可能再修复了。
examples.en: It's broken into so many pieces, it'll be impossible to put it back together again (= repair it).

examples.ch: 让我们给她一个把她的想法付诸实践的机会。
examples.en: Let's give her the chance to put her ideas into practice.

examples.ch: 恐怖分子在爆炸发生6年后受到了审判。
examples.en: The terrorists were put on trial (= their case was judged in a court of law) six years after the bombing.

examples.ch: 威尔森在第2轮被克拉克淘汰出局。
examples.en: Wilson was put out (of the competition) (= was defeated) by Clarke in the second round.

examples.ch: 修好电视机花了多少钱？
examples.en: How much did it cost to have the television put right (= repaired)?

examples.ch: 我原以为他是澳大利亚人，不过很快他就纠正了我，解释说他是新西兰人。
examples.en: I originally thought he was Australian, but he soon put me straight (= corrected me) and explained he was from New Zealand.

examples.ch: 我知道她永远地离开了，但我就是无法忘记她。
examples.en: I know she's gone forever, but I just can't put her out of my mind/head (= forget her).

examples.ch: 他在对我施加压力以使我改变主意。
examples.en: He's putting me under pressure to change my mind.

defines.trans_en: to bring into operation; to cause to be used

examples.ch: 西药不能治好她的病时，她转而相信草药了。
examples.en: When the drugs failed to cure her, she put her faith/trust in herbal medicine.

examples.ch: 学校非常重视对孩子们的读写教育。
examples.en: The school puts a lot of emphasis on teaching children to read and write.

examples.ch: 他正在对我施加压力，想让我改变主意。
examples.en: He's putting pressure on me to change my mind.

examples.ch: 过去几周发生的事让他背负了很大的压力。
examples.en: The events of the last few weeks have put a real strain on him.

examples.ch: 在《睡美人》这个故事中，那个邪恶的仙女对小公主施了魔咒。
examples.en: In the story of Sleeping Beauty, the wicked fairy puts a spell/curse (US hex) on the baby princess.

examples.ch: 你清楚那是你自己的错，所以别想怪罪别人。
examples.en: You know it was your fault, so don't try to put the blame on anyone else.

examples.ch: 预计政府将对汽车开征一项新税。
examples.en: The government is expected to put a new tax on cars.

examples.ch: 新税收将会使燃油价格上涨15%。
examples.en: The new tax will put 15 percent on fuel prices (= increase them by 15 percent).

examples.ch: 她以前从不赌赛马。
examples.en: She's never put a bet/money on a race before.

examples.ch: 他全力投入决赛。
examples.en: He put everything he had into (= he used all his abilities and strength in) the final game.

examples.ch: 你投入越多，收获就越多。
examples.en: The more you put into something, the more you get out of it (= the harder you work at something, the more satisfying it is).

examples.ch: 他们把许多钱投入到家族企业中。
examples.en: They put (= invested) a lot of money into the family business.

examples.ch: 总统正试图对该国的经济体制进行改革。
examples.en: The president is trying to put through (= bring into operation) reforms of the country's economic system.

examples.ch: 他们必须停止争斗。
examples.en: They've got to put an end to/a stop to their fighting (= to stop fighting).

defines.trans_en: to judge something or someone in comparison with other similar things or people

examples.ch: 我会把他列为有史以来最优秀的6位网球选手之一。
examples.en: I'd put him among the top six tennis players of all time.

examples.ch: 剧评家把她和一些伟大的莎剧女演员相提并论。
examples.en: Drama critics have put her on a level/par with the great Shakespearean actresses.

examples.ch: 他总是把家庭的需要放在首位／末位。
examples.en: He always puts the needs of his family first/last (= they are the most/least important thing to him).

defines.trans_en: to travel in a boat or ship across the sea

examples.ch: 我们的桅杆坏了，因此只好掉头向港口返航。
examples.en: Our mast broke, so we had to put about (= turn round) and return to port.

examples.ch: 轮船停靠在开普敦以补充新鲜补给。
examples.en: The ship put in at (= stopped at) Cape Town for fresh supplies.

examples.ch: 我们拂晓启航。
examples.en: We put to sea (= began our journey by sea) at dawn.

phrases.trans_en: to say what you think the price or value of something is

examples.ch: 经纪人估计我们的房子值72万英镑。
examples.en: The agent has put a price of £720,000 on our house.

examples.ch: 友谊是无价的。
examples.en: You can't put a value on friendship (= say what it is worth).

phrases.text: to put it bluntly, simply, mildly, etc.
phrases.trans_ch: 直言不讳／简单地说／简而言之／委婉地说
phrases.trans_en: used to describe the way you are expressing an event or opinion

examples.ch: 恕我直言，你还得改进。
examples.en: To put it bluntly, you're going to have to improve.

examples.ch: 说得好听一点，他有点儿不太高兴。
examples.en: He was annoyed, to put it mildly (= he was very annoyed).

defines.trans_en: one of four equal or almost equal parts of something; ¼

examples.ch: 他把橙子切成了4块。
examples.en: He cut the orange into quarters.

examples.ch: 不到1/4的受访者称他们的婚姻很幸福。
examples.en: Under a quarter of people questioned said that they were happily married.

examples.ch: 我的房子距此1.75英里。
examples.en: My house is situated a mile and three-quarters from here.

defines.trans_en: one of four periods of time into which a year is divided for financial calculations, such as for profits or taxes

examples.ch: 今年第二季度的失业率有所下降。
examples.en: There was a fall in unemployment in the second quarter of the year.

examples.ch: 我每个季度收到一份电费账单。
examples.en: I get an electricity bill every quarter.

defines.trans_ch: （橄榄球赛或其他球赛的）一节，一局
defines.trans_en: one of four periods in a game of American football and other ball sports
in the US and Canada, a coin worth 25 cents
an area of a town where a particular group of people live or work or where a particular activity happens

examples.ch: 这里是该城繁华的商业区。
examples.en: This is the bustling commercial quarter of the city.

defines.trans_ch: （提供帮助、信息或作出反应的）个人，群体
defines.trans_en: one or more people who provide help, information, or a particular reaction to something but who are not usually named

examples.ch: 帮忙的是个没想到的人。
examples.en: Help came from an unexpected quarter.

examples.ch: 有些人认为需要进行一次变革。
examples.en: There is a feeling in certain/some quarters (= some people consider) that a change is needed.

defines.trans_ch: 由公司为雇员提供的房屋（或其他居住场所）
defines.trans_en: a house or other place to live that has been provided by a company for an employee

defines.trans_ch: （对败者的）宽恕，仁慈，（尤指）饶命
defines.trans_en: the fact of being kind towards or forgiving an enemy or opponent

examples.ch: 我们不能指望敌人会放过我们。
examples.en: We can expect no quarter from our enemies.

examples.ch: 他对任何让他失望的人毫不留情。
examples.en: He gave no quarter to anyone that disappointed him.

phrases.trans_en: 15 minutes

examples.ch: 我等了一刻钟然后就回家了。
examples.en: I waited a quarter of an hour and then went home.

examples.ch: 我在那里逗留了3刻钟。
examples.en: I was there three-quarters of an hour.

examples.ch: 1小时45分钟
examples.en: an hour and three-quarters

phrases.text: a quarter to two, three, etc.
phrases.trans_ch: 差一刻两点/三点/四点等
phrases.trans_en: 15 minutes before two, three, etc.

examples.ch: 我离开时差一刻到六点。
examples.en: It was a quarter to six when I left.

phrases.text: a quarter past two, three, etc.
phrases.trans_ch: 两点/三点/四点等过一刻
phrases.trans_en: 15 minutes after two, three, etc.

examples.ch: 我们五点一刻见。
examples.en: I'll meet you at a quarter past five.

phrases.trans_ch: （尤指仆人或部队的）住处;营地
phrases.trans_en: a room or house that has been provided, especially for servants or soldiers and their families, to live in

examples.ch: 已婚军人的营房就在城外不远的地方。
examples.en: The army's married quarters are just outside the town.

defines.trans_en: to cut something into four parts
to send someone, especially soldiers, to live in a place

examples.ch: 在战争期间，士兵们住在当地村民家里。
examples.en: The soldiers were quartered with (= they lived with) local people during the war.

defines.trans_en: a woman who rules a country because she has been born into a royal family, or a woman who is married to a king

examples.ch: 维多利亚女王在位多长时间？
examples.en: How long did Queen Victoria reign?

examples.ch: 今天女王要接见首相。
examples.en: The Queen is meeting the prime minister today.

defines.trans_en: any woman who is considered to be the best at what she does

examples.ch: 她是当今首屈一指的犯罪小说作家。
examples.en: She's the reigning queen of crime writers.

defines.trans_en: the most powerful piece on the board in the game of chess
in a group of insects, a single large female that produces eggs

examples.ch: 蜂王
examples.en: a queen bee

examples.ch: 蚁后
examples.en: a queen ant

examples.ch: 黄蜂王
examples.en: a queen wasp

defines.trans_en: in a set of playing cards, a card with a picture of a queen on it. It is usually worth less than a king.

defines.trans_ch: （举止明显像女人的）同性恋男子，（尤指）老同性恋男子
defines.trans_en: a gay man, especially an older man, whose way of behaving is noticeable and artificial

examples.ch: 詹姆斯是一个老同性恋。
examples.en: James is such an old queen.

defines.trans_en: a sentence or phrase used to find out information

examples.ch: 警察盘问了我一整天。
examples.en: The police asked me questions all day.

examples.ch: 你为什么不回答我的问题？
examples.en: Why won't you answer my question?

examples.ch: “那么丢失的钱在哪儿呢？”“问得好。”
examples.en: "So where is the missing money?" "That's a good question." (= I don't know the answer.)

examples.ch: 演讲结束前有一段问答时间。
examples.en: There will be a question-and-answer session (= a period when people can ask questions) at the end of the talk.

defines.trans_en: in an exam, a problem that tests a person's knowledge or ability

examples.ch: 尽可能多做些题目。
examples.en: Answer/Do as many questions as you can.

defines.trans_en: any matter that needs to be dealt with or considered

examples.ch: 这引出了关于教师薪水的问题。
examples.en: This raises the question of teacher pay.

examples.ch: 你对气候变迁问题有什么看法？
examples.en: What are your views on the climate change question?

defines.trans_en: doubt or confusion

examples.ch: 关于过错在谁这一点毫无疑问。
examples.en: There's no question about (= it is certain) whose fault it is.

examples.ch: 人们怀疑孩子们是否书读得少了。
examples.en: Whether children are reading fewer books is open to question (= there is some doubt about it).

examples.ch: 她的忠诚不容置疑。
examples.en: Her loyalty is beyond question (= there is no doubt about it).

examples.ch: 毫无疑问他是有罪的。
examples.en: There's no question that he's guilty.

phrases.trans_en: the person or thing that is being discussed

examples.ch: 那个晚上我在家里呆着没出去。
examples.en: I stayed at home on the night in question.

defines.trans_en: to ask a person about something, especially officially

examples.ch: 警方昨天就盗窃案审问了几个人。
examples.en: Several men were questioned by police yesterday about the burglary.

examples.ch: 在这次民意测验中有68%受访者认为噪音增大了。
examples.en: 68 percent of those questioned in the poll thought noise levels had increased.

defines.trans_en: to express doubts about the value or truth of something

examples.ch: 我怀疑吃这么多药丸是否明智。
examples.en: I questioned the wisdom of taking so many pills.

examples.ch: 一项研究的结果对使用该药进行治疗是否真的提高了病人存活率提出了质疑。
examples.en: Results from a study questioned whether treatment with the drug really improved survival.

examples.ch: 她用询问的目光看了我一眼。
examples.en: She gave me a questioning look (= as if she wanted an answer from me).

defines.trans_en: happening or done with great speed, or lasting only a short time

examples.ch: 这次行程很短。
examples.en: It's a quick journey.

examples.ch: 我匆匆喝完咖啡，离开了家。
examples.en: I had a quick coffee and left the house.

examples.ch: 今天早上我的时间只够匆匆浏览一下报纸。
examples.en: I only had time for a quick glance at the paper this morning.

examples.ch: 他短时间内连进3个球。
examples.en: He scored three goals in quick succession (= one after the other in a short time).

examples.ch: 我可以简短地跟您说几句话吗？
examples.en: Could I have a quick word (= speak to you for a short time)?

examples.ch: 他闪电般夺走了书，飞快地跑出房间。
examples.en: Quick as lightning (= very quickly), he snatched the book and ran out of the room.

defines.trans_en: doing something fast

examples.ch: 我想抓住他，但是他太快了。
examples.en: I tried to catch him but he was too quick for me.

defines.trans_en: used to describe someone who is clever and understands or notices things quickly

examples.ch: 她马上领会了我们要她做什么。
examples.en: She was quick at understanding what we wanted her to do.

examples.ch: 他思维敏捷。
examples.en: He has a quick mind.

examples.ch: 唐娜的机敏避免了原本可能出现的灾难。
examples.en: Donna's quick thinking (= ability to solve problems with speed) averted what could have been a disaster.

phrases.trans_en: to do something fast, sometimes too fast

examples.ch: 她立刻指出那不是她的错。
examples.en: She was quick to point out that it wasn't her fault.

phrases.trans_en: someone who is able to learn things quickly

examples.ch: 他学东西很快，轻松地掌握住了讨论的每一个细节。
examples.en: He's a quick study and easily grasps all the details of a discussion.

phrases.trans_ch: 粗制滥造的，敷衍了事的
phrases.trans_en: produced quickly and therefore not perfect

examples.ch: 不可否认的是最初的解决方案有些敷衍了事。
examples.en: The original solution was admittedly quick and dirty.

examples.ch: 粗略的投资评估办法
examples.en: a quick and dirty way to evaluate an investment

defines.trans_ch: 快点！（用于督促某人做某事）
defines.trans_en: used for telling someone to do something quickly

examples.ch: 快，把门关上，别让猫进来！
examples.en: Quick! Close the door before the cat comes in!

defines.trans_en: quickly

examples.ch: 我们很快抢在别人面前买下了。
examples.en: We bought it quick, before someone else could.

defines.trans_en: the area of flesh under your nails

examples.ch: 他咬指甲都咬到肉了。
examples.en: He's bitten his nails to the quick.

defines.trans_en: making very little noise

examples.ch: 她轻声说话，以免吵醒他。
examples.en: She spoke in a quiet voice so as not to wake him.

examples.ch: 孩子们不在，这里真安静。
examples.en: It's so quiet without the kids here.

examples.ch: 请安静！
examples.en: Please be quiet (= stop talking)!

examples.ch: 我打电话时你能不出声吗？
examples.en: Could you keep quiet while I'm on the phone, please?

examples.ch: 她安静如鼠，我都没注意到她进门。
examples.en: She was as quiet as a mouse (= very quiet). I didn't even know she'd come in.

defines.trans_en: having little activity or excitement and few people

examples.ch: 宁静太平的小村庄
examples.en: a quiet, peaceful little village

examples.ch: 那是一个平静的婚礼，只有几位朋友和亲戚在场。
examples.en: It was a quiet wedding, with just a few friends and relations.

examples.ch: 节假日期间生意很清淡。
examples.en: Business is quiet during the holidays.

defines.trans_en: A quiet person is one who does not talk much

examples.ch: 他是个文静、几乎不怎么说话的年轻人。
examples.en: He was a quiet, almost taciturn, young man.

phrases.trans_en: to try to stop other people from finding out about a fact

examples.ch: 她设法使得该行动在一段时间内保密。
examples.en: She managed to keep the operation quiet for a while.

examples.ch: 戴维斯对所花的钱款数额守口如瓶。
examples.en: Davies kept quiet about the amount of money being spent.

defines.trans_en: the state of being silent

examples.ch: 让我们安静一会吧！
examples.en: Let's have some quiet!

examples.ch: 我去野营躲清净。
examples.en: I go camping for some peace and quiet (= absence of activity and excitement).

defines.trans_en: to (cause someone to) become calmer or less noisy

examples.ch: 认出我来后，那些吠叫的狗安静了下来。
examples.en: The barking dogs quieted when they recognized me.

defines.trans_en: completely

examples.ch: 两种情况截然不同。
examples.en: The two situations are quite different.

examples.ch: 颜色差不多相配，但不完全协调。
examples.en: The colours almost match but not quite.

examples.ch: 我喜欢她的新书，尽管没有她上一本那么好。
examples.en: I enjoyed her new book though it's not quite as good as her last one.

examples.ch: 你肯定想去吗？
examples.en: Are you quite sure you want to go?

examples.ch: 坦白/坦率地讲，想到它我就害怕。
examples.en: Quite honestly/frankly, the thought of it terrified me.

defines.trans_en: used to show agreement with someone's opinion

examples.ch: “你觉得他能省出些钱来——他并不是真穷。” “是这样的。”
examples.en: "You'd think he could spare some money - he's not exactly poor." "Quite."

phrases.trans_en: used to express that you are not certain about something

examples.ch: 我不太知道该说什么。
examples.en: I don't quite know what to say.

examples.ch: 我没太听懂他说的话。
examples.en: I didn't quite catch what he said.

phrases.trans_ch: （用来强调…的程度或数量）很，挺
phrases.trans_en: used to emphasize the degree or amount of something, or to say that someone or something is impressive, interesting, or unusual

examples.ch: 他们已经在这上面做了很长时间的工作了。
examples.en: They have been working on this for quite some time.

examples.ch: 你留的胡子可真大，年轻人！
examples.en: That's quite a beard you've grown, young man!

phrases.trans_ch: （表示强调）绝对是最好/最糟糕的等
phrases.trans_en: used for emphasis

examples.ch: 那绝对是我吃过的最难吃的饭了。
examples.en: It was quite the worst dinner I have ever had.

defines.trans_en: a little or a lot but not completely

examples.ch: 我有些累，但肯定还能再走一会儿。
examples.en: I'm quite tired but I can certainly walk a little further.

examples.ch: 今天的交通够拥挤的，不过昨天更繁忙。
examples.en: There was quite a lot of traffic today but yesterday was even busier.

examples.ch: 那工作着实难做。
examples.en: It was quite a difficult job.

examples.ch: 他相当有魅力，但称不上我心目中的美男子。
examples.en: He's quite attractive but not what I'd call gorgeous.

examples.ch: 给所有人都写信准是件麻烦事。
examples.en: It would be quite a nuisance to write to everyone.

defines.trans_en: a game or competition in which you answer questions

examples.ch: 历史/体育知识等问答竞赛
examples.en: a history/sport, etc. quiz

examples.ch: 电视上有那么多愚蠢的智力竞赛节目。
examples.en: There are so many inane television quiz shows.

examples.ch: 许多酒吧每周举办一两次智力竞赛夜活动。
examples.en: A lot of pubs have quiz nights once or twice a week.

defines.trans_en: a short informal test

examples.ch: 今天的历史课上进行了突击测验。
examples.en: There was a pop (= surprise) quiz in history at school today.

defines.trans_en: to ask someone questions about something

examples.ch: 她花了1小时时间回答记者的提问。
examples.en: She spent an hour being quizzed by journalists.

defines.trans_en: a competition in which all the competitors try to be the fastest and to finish first

examples.ch: 你知道比赛谁赢／输了吗？
examples.en: Do you know who won/lost the race?

examples.ch: 让我们比一比看谁游得快。
examples.en: Let's have a swimming race.

examples.ch: 他们将参加攀登勃朗峰的比赛。
examples.en: They're taking part in a race to the top of Mont Blanc.

defines.trans_en: an attempt to be the first to do or to get something

examples.ch: 基兰和安德鲁为得到升职的机会而展开竞争。
examples.en: Kieran and Andrew are in a race for promotion.

examples.ch: 三家报纸都争相发表这篇报道。
examples.en: Three newspapers are involved in a race to publish the story.

examples.ch: 另一个候选人现在也加入了竞选总统的行列。
examples.en: Another candidate has now entered the presidential race (= the attempt to be elected as president).

examples.ch: 要在12月之前完成这个工程，那就得分秒必争。
examples.en: Finishing this project by December is going to be a race against time/the clock (= an attempt to finish fast within a time limit).

defines.trans_en: a group, especially of people, with particular similar physical characteristics, who are considered as belonging to the same type, or the fact of belonging to such a group

examples.ch: 许多不同种族的人生活在一起。
examples.en: People of many different races were living side by side.

examples.ch: 不能容忍种族歧视。
examples.en: Discrimination on grounds of race will not be tolerated.

examples.ch: 这个国家人口中混血儿的人数越来越多。
examples.en: An increasing number of people in the country are of mixed race (= with parents of different races).

defines.trans_en: a group of people who share the same language, history, characteristics, etc.

examples.ch: 英国人是个岛国民族。
examples.en: The British are an island race.

phrases.trans_en: a series of horse races in a particular place on one day

examples.ch: 他经常抽出一天时间去看赛马会。
examples.en: He often has a day at the races.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) compete in a race

examples.ch: 他已经有10年多的赛龄了。
examples.en: He has been racing for over ten years.

examples.ch: 小的时候，我就经常和他赛跑。
examples.en: I used to race (against) him when we were boys.

examples.ch: 星期六他将让他的3条狗参加赛狗。
examples.en: He's racing three of his dogs on Saturday.

defines.trans_ch: （使）快速移动（或行进）;（使）疾走（或疾驰）;（使）快速奔跑
defines.trans_en: to move or go fast

examples.ch: 他在街上飞奔。
examples.en: He raced down the street.

examples.ch: 救护车把伤者迅速送到附近的一家医院。
examples.en: The ambulance raced (= quickly took) the injured to a nearby hospital.

examples.ch: 夏天好像转眼就过去了。
examples.en: The summer seems to have raced by (= passed very quickly).

examples.ch: 等候红绿灯时，他不耐烦地坐在车里，让汽车发动机疯狂地空转。
examples.en: He raced the car engine (= made it work faster than it needed to) as he sat impatiently at the traffic lights.

defines.trans_en: an object used for hitting the ball in various sports, consisting of a net fixed tightly to a round frame with a long handle

examples.ch: 网球／壁球／羽毛球球拍
examples.en: a tennis/squash/badminton racket

defines.trans_ch: 喧哗;吵闹声;连续不断的喧嚷
defines.trans_en: an unpleasant loud continuous noise

examples.ch: 他们一直在外面大吵大闹，搅得我根本睡不着。
examples.en: They were making such a racket outside that I couldn't get to sleep.

defines.trans_en: a dishonest or illegal activity that makes money

examples.ch: 他们因为勒索保护费／干拉皮条的勾当而被监禁。
examples.en: They were jailed for running a protection/prostitution racket.

defines.trans_en: a way of making a large unfair profit

examples.ch: 电话聊天热线纯属暴利行当。
examples.en: Phone chat lines are a real racket.

defines.trans_en: a piece of electronic equipment used for listening to radio broadcasts

examples.ch: 车载收音机
examples.en: a car radio

examples.ch: 我打开了收音机。
examples.en: I switched on the radio.

defines.trans_en: the programmes that you hear when you listen to the radio

examples.ch: 昨晚我听到一个很好的广播节目。
examples.en: I heard a good programme on the radio last night.

examples.ch: 我不常听收音机。
examples.en: I don't listen to radio much.

defines.trans_en: the system or work of broadcasting sound programmes for the public to listen to

examples.ch: 地方广播电台
examples.en: a local radio station

examples.ch: 她在广播电台找了份工作。
examples.en: She's got some kind of job in radio.

defines.trans_ch: 无线电收发设备;无线电通讯
defines.trans_en: a piece of electronic equipment that can send and receive spoken messages or signals, or the messages or signals that are sent or received

examples.ch: 我们用无线电发了一条信息。
examples.en: We sent a message over the radio/by radio.

examples.ch: 孩子们在圣诞节得到的礼物是无线电遥控玩具车。
examples.en: The children got radio-controlled toy cars for Christmas.

defines.trans_ch: 用无线电发送（信息）;向…发送无线电报;用无线电通讯
defines.trans_en: to send a message to someone by radio

examples.ch: 我们将不得不通过无线电请求提供更多的补给。
examples.en: We'll have to radio for more supplies.

examples.ch: 他们用无线电报向大本营求援。
examples.en: They radioed their base for help.

defines.trans_en: the metal tracks on which trains run

examples.ch: 我们家离铁道线很近。
examples.en: We live close to the railway line.

examples.ch: 她乘火车沿西伯利亚铁路横穿西伯利亚。
examples.en: She travelled across Siberia on the Trans-Siberian railway.

defines.trans_en: the system of tracks, stations, trains, etc.

examples.ch: 火车站／列车时刻表／铁路专用线等
examples.en: a railway station/timetable/siding

examples.ch: 托马斯‧格兰特在铁路系统工作了50年。
examples.en: Thomas Grant worked on the railway(s) for 50 years.

defines.trans_en: drops of water from clouds

examples.ch: 预报明天会下雨。
examples.en: Rain is forecast for tomorrow.

examples.ch: 进屋来，别在雨里淋着。
examples.en: Come inside out of the rain.

examples.ch: 我们这儿倾盆大雨／毛毛细雨整整下了一天。
examples.en: We had heavy/light rain all day.

examples.ch: 我们既没带雨衣也没带伞，正赶上大雨滂沱，淋成了落汤鸡。
examples.en: We got caught in pouring/torrential (= a lot of) rain without either raincoats or umbrellas.

examples.ch: 东部地区将有阵雨。
examples.en: There will be showers of rain/rain showers (= short periods of rain) in the east.

examples.ch: 天看起来好像要下雨。
examples.en: It looks like rain (= as if rain is going to fall).

phrases.trans_en: the season of the year in tropical countries when there is a lot of rain

examples.ch: 村民们正在等待雨季的到来，那时稻子才能生长。
examples.en: Villagers are now waiting for the rains to come so that the rice will grow.

examples.ch: 这是连续第三个年头雨季没有下雨了。
examples.en: This is the third year in a row that the rains have failed.

defines.trans_en: If it rains, water falls from the sky in small drops.

examples.ch: 我觉得要下雨了。
examples.en: I think it's starting to rain.

examples.ch: 正下着瓢泼大雨。
examples.en: It's raining hard/heavily (= a large amount of rain is falling).

defines.trans_en: a coat that protects the wearer against rain

examples.ch: 塑料雨衣
examples.en: a plastic raincoat

defines.trans_en: a type of popular music with a strong rhythm in which the words are spoken, not sung

examples.ch: 说唱乐艺人／歌星
examples.en: a rap artist/star

defines.trans_en: a statement accusing someone of a crime, or the punishment that someone is given for a crime

examples.ch: 他总说自己坐牢是冤枉的。
examples.en: He always said he was jailed on a bum rap (= false accusation).

examples.ch: 警察抓住了他，但不知怎么他竟设法逃脱了罪责。
examples.en: The police caught him, but somehow he managed to beat the rap (= escape punishment).

examples.ch: 我才不会替你去背黑锅。
examples.en: I'm not going to take the rap for you (= be punished for something you did).

defines.trans_en: a judgment or a reaction

examples.ch: 这个新的节目被各家报纸骂了个狗血喷头。
examples.en: The new show got a bum/bad rap (= was severely criticized) in all the papers.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指击打坚硬表面发出的）敲击（声），叩击（声）
defines.trans_en: a sudden short noise, especially one made by hitting a hard surface

examples.ch: 传来一阵敲窗户的声音。
examples.en: There was a series of raps on the window.

defines.trans_ch: 敲击，急拍;突然大声说，突然厉声说
defines.trans_en: to hit or say something suddenly and forcefully

examples.ch: 她敲了敲桌子，让大家注意。
examples.en: She rapped (on) the table to get everyone's attention.

examples.ch: 上校厉声对他的士兵下命令。
examples.en: The colonel rapped (out) an order to his men.

defines.trans_en: to criticize someone, especially officially

examples.ch: 报道的标题是“法官斥责警方”。
examples.en: The headline read "Judge raps police".

defines.trans_en: to perform rap
quite; to a slight degree

examples.ch: 今天相当冷，是不是？
examples.en: It's rather cold today, isn't it?

examples.ch: 那本书有点儿难——这本对你来说容易些。
examples.en: That's rather a difficult book - here's an easier one for you.

examples.ch: 这趟列车上相当拥挤，旅途不太舒服。
examples.en: The train was rather too crowded for a comfortable journey.

examples.ch: 她睡意朦胧地接电话。
examples.en: She answered the phone rather sleepily.

examples.ch: 我说不太准能不能去参加你的聚会。
examples.en: I rather doubt I'll be able to come to your party.

defines.trans_en: more accurately; more exactly

examples.ch: 她将于周四飞去加州，更确切地说，如果她不得不去的话。
examples.en: She'll fly to California on Thursday, or rather, she will if she has to.

examples.ch: 确切地说，他是我妹妹的朋友，而不是我的。
examples.en: He's my sister's friend really, rather than mine.

defines.trans_en: used to express an opposite opinion

examples.ch: 战争的结束并没有什么好庆祝的，恰恰相反，人们倒是应该为战争的爆发而感到痛惜。
examples.en: The ending of the war is not a cause for celebration, but rather for regret that it ever happened.

examples.ch: 不，不累。恰恰相反，我感觉精力还很充沛。
examples.en: No, I'm not tired. Rather the opposite in fact.

phrases.trans_en: instead of; used especially when you prefer one thing to another

examples.ch: 我觉得我今晚更想呆在家里，而不是出去玩儿。
examples.en: I think I'd like to stay at home this evening rather than go out.

defines.trans_en: very; to a large degree

examples.ch: 实际上我各科考试发挥得很好。
examples.en: Actually, I did rather well in my exams.

examples.ch: 现在我有很多工作要做。
examples.en: I've got rather a lot of work to do at the moment.

defines.trans_en: certainly; yes

examples.ch: “你今天晚上想跟我们一块出去吃饭吗？”“当然！”
examples.en: "Do you want to come out for dinner with us this evening?" "Rather!"

defines.trans_en: to look at words or symbols and understand what they mean

examples.ch: 他一下午都在阅读（报纸／书），过得很开心。
examples.en: He spent a pleasant afternoon reading (the newspaper/a book).

examples.ch: 我在当地报纸上读到了这个家庭的成功经历。
examples.en: I read about the family's success in the local paper.

examples.ch: 天太黑看不清地图，所以我们拐错了弯。
examples.en: It was too dark to read our map and we took a wrong turning.

examples.ch: 你识乐谱吗？
examples.en: Can you read music?

examples.ch: 你笔迹太潦草，我看不懂。
examples.en: Your handwriting is so untidy I can't read it.

examples.ch: 我从报纸上获悉战争可能会爆发。
examples.en: I've read in the newspapers (that) there is a threat of war.

examples.ch: 把你的信用卡插入槽内，机器就会读卡并辨认你的身份。
examples.en: Put your plastic card in the slot, and the machine will read it and identify who you are.

examples.ch: 一些孩子在4岁时就会识字了。
examples.en: Some children can read (= have learned the skill of reading) by the age of four.

defines.trans_en: to say the words that are printed or written

examples.ch: 她小声地慢慢读（这首诗）。
examples.en: She read (the poem) slowly and quietly.

examples.ch: 他们老师在一天课程结束时总是给他们读个故事。
examples.en: Their teacher always reads them a story at the end of the day.

examples.ch: 孩子们喜欢听人给他们（大声／朗）读故事。
examples.en: Children love to have stories read (aloud/out) to them.

defines.trans_ch: 理解;读作;（用于订正讹误）改作，换用
defines.trans_en: to understand and give a particular meaning to written information, a statement, a situation, etc.

examples.ch: 她误了火车，因为她把时间18:30理解成了晚上8点半，而不是傍晚6点半。
examples.en: She missed the train because she read 18.30 p.m. as 8.30 p.m. instead of 6.30 p.m.

examples.ch: 第19页上的 Blitish 应作 British。
examples.en: On page 19, for "Blitish", please read "British".

examples.ch: 如果我对形势的看法正确的话，周末前我们应该可以就合同达成某种一致。
examples.en: If I've read the situation correctly, we should have some agreement on the contract by the end of the week.

defines.trans_ch: 读起来（给人某种印象）;看着好像是…
defines.trans_en: How you read a piece of writing, or how it reads, is how it seems when you read it

examples.ch: 这封信读起来好像是匆匆写就的。
examples.en: The letter reads as if it was written in a hurry.

examples.ch: 她最新出版的一部小说读起来很是引人入胜。
examples.en: Her latest novel reads well (= is written in an attractive way).

defines.trans_ch: （尤指用无线电联络时）听到，收听到
defines.trans_en: (especially when communicating by radio), to hear and understand someone

examples.ch: 你能听到我说话吗？
examples.en: Do you read me?

examples.ch: 我可以清楚地听到你说话。
examples.en: I read you loud and clear.

defines.trans_en: (of something written or printed) to have or give the stated information or meaning

examples.ch: 美国宪法的开头是这样写的：“我们，合众国的人民…”。
examples.en: The start of the US Constitution reads "We, the people of the United States..."

examples.ch: 在背阴处温度计显示为40℃。
examples.en: The thermometer is reading 40°C in the shade.

defines.trans_en: to study at university or to study for a specialized qualification

examples.ch: 他们两个都在剑桥大学攻读历史。
examples.en: They're both reading history at Cambridge.

examples.ch: 她正在攻读法律，以后想成为大律师。
examples.en: She's reading for the Bar (= studying to become a type of lawyer called a barrister).

phrases.trans_ch: 给（某人）读书（或故事）使其入睡
phrases.trans_en: to read aloud to someone until they go to sleep

examples.ch: 童年时，每天晚上父亲都给我读故事哄我入睡。
examples.en: Every night when I was a child my father used to read me to sleep.

defines.trans_en: the act of reading something

examples.ch: 虽说不是特别出色，但它还是值得一读。
examples.en: It's not brilliant but it's worth a read.

examples.ch: 这本书读起来很有意思／不难。
examples.en: The book is a good/easy, etc. read.

examples.ch: 你的报纸能不能让我看一下？
examples.en: Could I have a read of (= can I read) your newspaper?

defines.trans_ch: 准备好的，有准备的；现成的；方便使用的
defines.trans_en: prepared and suitable for fast activity

examples.ch: 你准备好离开了吗？
examples.en: Are you ready to leave?

examples.ch: 现在可以点菜了吗，女士？
examples.en: Are you ready to order, Madam?

examples.ch: 好了，埃薇，我都准备好了，就等你了。
examples.en: Okay, Evie, ready when you are (= I am ready to do what we have arranged).

examples.ch: 可以吃晚饭了！
examples.en: Dinner's ready!

examples.ch: 准备好了吗？快点——我们都晚了。
examples.en: Are you ready? Hurry up - we're late.

examples.ch: 我们8点钟出发，所以你还有半个小时准备。
examples.en: We're leaving at eight o'clock, so you've got half an hour to get ready.

examples.ch: 据说军队已经做好准备随时采取行动。
examples.en: The army are said to be ready for action.

examples.ch: 音乐厅已为这场演出准备妥当。
examples.en: The concert hall was made/got ready (= prepared) for the performance.

defines.trans_en: quick with answers, jokes, solutions, etc.

examples.ch: 他对所有的问题都对答如流。
examples.en: He had a ready reply to every question.

examples.ch: 他很有魅力，而且机智风趣。
examples.en: He was charming, with a ready wit (= the ability to quickly say clever and funny things).

phrases.trans_ch: 准备好并等待着；准备好随时行动
phrases.trans_en: waiting and prepared to act

examples.ch: 由于得到秘密线报，警方布下埋伏，等着劫匪从银行出来自投罗网。
examples.en: Secret information allowed the police to be ready and waiting when the robbers came out of the bank.

phrases.trans_ch: 准备好；可随时使用；可随时采取行动
phrases.trans_en: prepared to be used or to act immediately

examples.ch: 他准备好了铅笔，站在电话旁。
examples.en: He stood by the phone, pencil at the ready.

defines.trans_ch: 实际存在的，现实的；真实的
defines.trans_en: existing in fact and not imaginary

examples.ch: 使病人确信她真的有病，并非杯弓蛇影，这是对她进行治疗的第一步。
examples.en: Assuring the patient that she has a real and not imaginary problem is the first step.

examples.ch: 他的确有失去工作的危险。
examples.en: There is a very real threat that he will lose his job.

defines.trans_en: being what it appears to be and not false

examples.ch: 真皮／真毛皮
examples.en: real leather/fur

examples.ch: 那是把玩具枪还是真枪？
examples.en: Is that a toy gun or the real thing?

defines.trans_ch: （尤指食物）正宗的，用传统手艺做的
defines.trans_en: (especially of foods) produced using traditional methods and without artificial substances

examples.ch: 那家酒馆供应好几种正宗艾尔啤酒。
examples.en: The pub sells several kinds of real ale (= traditional beer).

defines.trans_ch: 最重要的;主要的;真正关键的
defines.trans_en: the most important; the main

examples.ch: 真正的困难是语言问题，因为我的孩子们不会说英语。
examples.en: The real difficulty was the language, because my children don't speak English.

examples.ch: 有创意或许是一个方面，但人们喜欢本报的最主要原因是它讲真话。
examples.en: Novelty value may be a part of it, but the real reason people like our paper is that it speaks the truth.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调名词）真正的，地道的，十足的
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize a noun

examples.ch: 他是位地道的绅士。
examples.en: He's a real gentleman.

examples.ch: 她真是个难得的好帮手。
examples.en: She was a real help.

examples.ch: 真是麻烦透顶。
examples.en: It's a real nuisance.

phrases.trans_ch: （把物价上涨因素考虑在内的）实际收入
phrases.trans_en: the value of earnings, etc. after the effect of rising prices is considered

examples.ch: 去年工资增长了2.9%，但实际收入却仍然下降了1.3%。
examples.en: Wages rose by 2.9 percent last year, but real earnings still fell by 1.3 percent.

phrases.trans_en: after considering things that affect what a number or amount really means, such as the effect of rising prices

examples.ch: 在扣除收入所得税等项之后，平均收入实际增加了5%。
examples.en: Average earnings rose 5 percent in real terms after deducting income tax.

phrases.trans_ch: 真实世界（而非存在于想象、故事和网络中的）
phrases.trans_en: things as they really are, not as they exist in the imagination, in a story, on the internet, etc.

examples.ch: 过度保护孩子并不能带给他们应付真实世界的能力。
examples.en: Over-protecting children does not equip them to deal with the real world.

examples.ch: 为什么要在虚拟世界的友谊上浪费时间？真实世界里就有人愿意和你一起共度时光。
examples.en: Why waste time on virtual friendships, when there are people out there in the real world who want to spend time with you?

phrases.trans_en: real, not pretended

examples.ch: 我还以为是消防演习呢，但显然是真的失火了。
examples.en: I thought it was just a drill but apparently it was for real.

defines.trans_en: very

examples.ch: 我很喜欢喝这种自制柠檬水，真是太棒了！
examples.en: I like this homemade lemonade, it's real good!

examples.ch: 这真的很容易做。
examples.en: It's real easy to do.

defines.trans_en: the standard unit of money used in Brazil

examples.ch: 巴西雷亚尔对美元的价值上涨了83％。
examples.en: The Brazilian real has gained 83 percent in value against the dollar.

defines.trans_en: in fact

examples.ch: 他不是真生气——他只是假装的。
examples.en: He isn't really angry - he's just pretending.

examples.ch: 你实际上并没料到他们会拒绝，是不是？
examples.en: You don't really expect them to refuse, do you?

defines.trans_en: used to say that something is certain

examples.ch: 多谢，但是我真的什么也吃不下了。
examples.en: Thank you, but I really couldn't eat another thing.

examples.ch: 这一次他是真的要去做这件事了。
examples.en: He's really going to do it this time.

defines.trans_en: very or very much

examples.ch: 她人很好。
examples.en: She's really nice.

examples.ch: 这个房间里太热了。
examples.en: This room is really hot.

examples.ch: 那真是太有趣了。
examples.en: That's really interesting.

examples.ch: 这确实是个很难做的决定。
examples.en: It's a really difficult decision.

examples.ch: 你喜欢它吗？ "不太喜欢。"
examples.en: "Did you like it? Not really (= no)."

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示感兴趣、惊奇或恼怒）真的，是吗，真是的
defines.trans_en: used to express interest, surprise, or anger

examples.ch: “我就要和弗雷德结婚了。”“是吗？什么时候？”
examples.en: "I'm getting married to Fred." "Really? When?"

examples.ch: “她已经答应为慈善事业剃掉自己的头发。”“真的吗？你觉得她会做吗？”
examples.en: "She's promised to shave her head for charity." "Really? Do you think she'll do it?"

examples.ch: “他没把书带回来。”“哎呀，真是的！我都跟他说了两次了！”
examples.en: "He hasn't brought the book back." "Oh, really! That's the second time I've asked him!"

defines.trans_en: a person who works in a place such as a hotel, office, or hospital, who welcomes and helps visitors and answers the phone
of the colour of fresh blood

examples.ch: 红色唇膏
examples.en: red lipstick

examples.ch: 这件连衣裙是鲜红色的。
examples.en: The dress was bright red.

defines.trans_en: used to describe hair that is an orange-brown colour

defines.trans_ch: （眼睛）布满血丝的，红肿的，充血的
defines.trans_en: If your eyes are red, the white part of your eyes and the skin around your eyes is red, because of crying, tiredness, too much alcohol, etc.

phrases.trans_ch: （因为愤怒或窘迫）脸涨得通红的
phrases.trans_en: If you go/turn red, your face becomes red because you are angry or embarrassed.

examples.ch: 瞧，你让他很尴尬——他的脸都红了！
examples.en: Look, you've embarrassed him - he's gone bright red!

defines.trans_en: the colour of fresh blood

examples.ch: 她的画作中大量使用红色和粉红色。
examples.en: She uses a lot of reds and pinks in her paintings.

examples.ch: 我一向是穿红色衣服居多。
examples.en: I've always worn a lot of red.

examples.ch: 她穿了一身红。
examples.en: She was dressed all in red.

defines.trans_ch: 社会主义者；共产主义者；赤色分子
defines.trans_en: a person who has socialist or communist political opinions

defines.trans_ch: （源自牙买加的流行音乐）雷盖
defines.trans_en: a type of popular music from Jamaica, with a strong second and fourth beat

defines.trans_ch: 记得，记起，回想起;记住，牢记
defines.trans_en: to be able to bring back a piece of information into your mind, or to keep a piece of information in your memory

examples.ch: “你把车停在哪儿了？”“我不记得了。”
examples.en: "Where did you park the car?" "I can't remember."

examples.ch: 我可以记住人的长相，但记不住人的名字。
examples.en: I can remember people's faces, but not their names.

examples.ch: 她忽然想起她的钥匙放在另一个包里了。
examples.en: She suddenly remembered (that) her keys were in her other bag.

examples.ch: 我不记得曾签过一份合同。
examples.en: I don't remember signing a contract.

examples.ch: 你记得她的电话号码是多少吗？
examples.en: Can you remember what her phone number is?

examples.ch: 在我记忆中，他是个很令人讨厌的人。
examples.en: I remember him as (= I thought he was) a rather annoying man.

defines.trans_en: to hold a special ceremony to honour a past event or someone who has died

examples.ch: 英国人在每年的11月11日纪念两次世界大战中的死难者。
examples.en: On 11 November, the British remember those who died in the two World Wars.

defines.trans_en: to give a present or money to someone you love or who has provided good service to you

examples.ch: 我过生日时我奶奶总是送我礼物。
examples.en: My Granny always remembers me (= sends me a present) on my birthday.

examples.ch: 我表姐在遗嘱中给我留下一笔钱。
examples.en: My cousin remembered me in her will.

phrases.trans_ch: 记住做;牢记着做;不忘记做
phrases.trans_en: to not forget to do something

examples.ch: 你记得去商店买东西了吗？
examples.en: Did you remember to do the shopping?

phrases.trans_ch: 因…而被记住;因…而名垂青史
phrases.trans_en: to be kept in people's memories because of a particular action or quality

examples.ch: 她将因其勇敢而被人们铭记。
examples.en: She will be remembered for her courage.

phrases.trans_en: said when you are talking to someone about something that they used to know but might have forgotten

examples.ch: 我们去了一家小咖啡馆喝茶——你没有忘吧，书店旁边的那家咖啡馆。
examples.en: We went and had tea in that little café - you remember, the one next to the bookshop.

defines.trans_en: a fixed amount of money that you pay regularly for the use of a room, house, car, television, etc. that someone else owns

examples.ch: 我的房租比其他房客高，因为我的房间要大些。
examples.en: I pay a higher rent/more rent than the other tenants because my room is bigger.

examples.ch: 这里的房租高／低得出奇。
examples.en: Rents here are ridiculously high/low.

defines.trans_en: a large hole torn in a piece of material

examples.ch: 他的降落伞上裂了个大口子。
examples.en: There was a large rent in his parachute.

phrases.trans_en: offered by the owner for someone else to use in exchange for money

defines.trans_en: to pay or receive a fixed amount of money for the use of a room, house, car, television, etc.

examples.ch: 我从汽车修理厂租了一辆车，以便能够四处走走。
examples.en: I rented a car from a garage so that I could get about.

examples.ch: 这位老太太以每周200英镑的价格把她一间闲置的卧室租给了我。
examples.en: The old lady rented me her spare bedroom for £200 a week.

examples.ch: 我爸爸有一处乡间小屋出租给游客。
examples.en: My Dad has a villa that he rents (out) to tourists.

defines.trans_en:
past simple and past participle of
rend old use or literary
to put something that is damaged, broken, or not working correctly, back into good condition or make it work again

examples.ch: 修路（面）
examples.en: to repair (the surface of) the road

examples.ch: 暴风雨后修理房顶
examples.en: to repair a roof after a storm

examples.ch: 修车厂的人说这辆车太旧，不值得修了。
examples.en: The garage said the car was so old it wasn't worth repairing.

examples.ch: 这个周末我真得修修自行车了。
examples.en: I really must get my bike repaired this weekend.

defines.trans_en: If you repair something wrong or harmful that has been done, you do something to make it right.

examples.ch: 修复破裂的友情
examples.en: to repair a broken friendship

examples.ch: 现在采取措施挽回我们对地球所造成的破坏已为时太晚了吗？
examples.en: Is it too late to repair the damage we have done to our planet?

defines.trans_en: the act of fixing something that is broken or damaged

examples.ch: 我的车正放在修车厂里维修。
examples.en: My car is in the garage for repairs.

examples.ch: 修理房顶将会花很多钱。
examples.en: The repairs to the roof will be expensive.

examples.ch: 修车工人给我指出车前部修过的地方。
examples.en: The mechanic pointed out the repair (= repaired place) on the front of my car.

defines.trans_en: to (cause someone or something to) stop doing a particular activity or stop being active for a period of time in order to relax and get back your strength

examples.ch: 医生告诉他应该休息几天。
examples.en: The doctor told him that he should rest for a few days.

examples.ch: 他把视线从电脑显示屏上移开，让眼睛休息一下。
examples.en: He looked away from the computer screen to rest his eyes.

examples.ch: 她发誓杀害她儿子的凶手不被捕入狱，她就不会善罢甘休。
examples.en: She promised that she would not rest (= would not stop looking) until the murderer of her son was caught and imprisoned.

defines.trans_en: to lie or lean on something, or to put something on something else so that its weight is supported

examples.ch: 她把头靠在我的肩膀上。
examples.en: She rested her head on my shoulder.

examples.ch: 自行车靠墙放着。
examples.en: The bicycle was resting against the wall.

defines.trans_en: to remain in a particular state or place

examples.ch: 我们不能允许这件事保持现状，一定要继续采取行动。
examples.en: We cannot allow the matter to rest here (= to remain as it is)- further action has to be taken.

phrases.trans_ch: （演员）没有接到戏而呆在家里
phrases.trans_en: to be an actor who does not have any work

examples.ch: 任何时候都有超过90%的职业演员无戏可演。
examples.en: Over 90 percent of professional actors are resting at any given time.

phrases.trans_en: said by lawyers in a law court when they have finished the explanation of their case

defines.trans_en: a period of time in which you relax, do not do anything active, or sleep

examples.ch: 他们把钢琴搬到楼上后，停下来休息了一会儿。
examples.en: After they had carried the piano up the stairs, they stopped for a rest.

examples.ch: 医生开了些药，并嘱咐她休息一周。
examples.en: The doctor prescribed some pills and told her to get/have a week's rest.

defines.trans_en: a period of silence between musical notes, or a symbol that represents this

examples.ch: 二分休止符
examples.en: a minim rest

defines.trans_en: an object that supports the weight of something

examples.ch: 我用一摞书作望远镜支架。
examples.en: I used a pile of books as a rest for my telescope.

phrases.trans_ch: 剩余部分；其余；其余的人
phrases.trans_en: the other things, people, or parts that remain or that have not been mentioned

examples.ch: 我班上有两个特别聪明的学生，但是其他人都表现平平。
examples.en: I've got two bright students, but the rest are average.

examples.ch: 钱我留下1／3，其余的归你。
examples.en: I'll keep a third of the money and the rest is for you.

examples.ch: 这天剩余的时间你安排什么事了吗？
examples.en: Do you have anything planned for the rest of the day?

phrases.trans_en: not doing anything active, or not moving

examples.ch: 她在安静状态下心跳每分钟只有55次。
examples.en: Her heartbeat is only 55 at rest.

phrases.trans_en: used as a polite way to say that someone is dead

examples.ch: 你父亲一生坎坷，但是他现在可以安息了。
examples.en: Your father was a very troubled man, but he's at rest now.

phrases.trans_ch: （通常在某个地方）停止，停下来，静止下来
phrases.trans_en: to stop, usually in a particular place

examples.ch: 汽车撞到马路边石上，翻滚到路沟里停了下来。
examples.en: The car hit the kerb, rolled over and came to rest in a ditch.

defines.trans_en: a place where meals are prepared and served to customers
to come or go back to a previous place

examples.ch: 离家多年后奥德修斯返回了故土。
examples.en: Odysseus returned home/returned to his home after many years of travelling.

examples.ch: 她15岁时离开了南非，再也没有回去过。
examples.en: She left South Africa at the age of 15 and has never returned.

examples.ch: 戴维（下班）回到家后发现房子已被烧毁了。
examples.en: David returned (from work) to find his house had burned down.

defines.trans_en: to give, do, or get something after something similar has been given or done to you

examples.ch: 回请／回应问候
examples.en: to return an invitation/greeting

examples.ch: 我回瞪了他一眼。
examples.en: I returned his stare.

examples.ch: 那天她的车坏了，我顺便搭载了她一程，现在她在投桃报李。
examples.en: I gave her a ride when her car broke down and now she is returning the favour (= doing something to help me in exchange).

examples.ch: 恐怖分子开了火，警方便开枪还击。
examples.en: The terrorists started shooting and the police returned fire (= started shooting back).

defines.trans_en: to give a particular amount of profit

examples.ch: 我的投资获得了很高的收益。
examples.en: My investments return a high rate of interest.

defines.trans_en: to send, take, give, put, etc. something back to where it came from

examples.ch: 新电视机坏了，所以他们把它退还给商店。
examples.en: The new TV broke so they returned it to the shop.

examples.ch: 他把2003年借我的两本书还给了我。
examples.en: He returned two books he had borrowed from me in 2003.

examples.ch: 她小心翼翼地把书放回书架原本的位置上。
examples.en: She carefully returned the book to its place on the shelf.

defines.trans_en: in sports such as tennis, to hit the ball back to your opponent
to happen again

examples.ch: 如果疼痛再次发作，你必须去看医生。
examples.en: You must go to the doctor if the pain returns.

defines.trans_en: to elect someone to be a member of parliament, or to another political job

examples.ch: 预计他会被重新选为总理。
examples.en: It was expected that he would be returned as premier.

phrases.trans_en: If people or things return to a previous condition, they go back to that condition.

examples.ch: 不到1个星期，局势就恢复正常了。
examples.en: Within a week, the situation had returned to normal.

phrases.trans_en: If you return to an activity or subject, you start doing it or talking about it again.

examples.ch: 甘地敦促印度人重新拿起纺车自己动手纺纱。
examples.en: Gandhi urged Indians to return to spinning their own yarn.

examples.ch: 每过5分钟他就会重提同一个话题。
examples.en: Every five minutes, he returned to the same subject.

phrases.trans_en: to decide and say if you think someone is guilty or not guilty, or what punishment the person will be given in a court of law

examples.ch: 陪审团作出了无罪判决。
examples.en: The jury returned a verdict of not guilty.

defines.trans_en: an occasion when someone goes or comes back to a place where they were before

examples.ch: 整个镇上的人都涌上街头庆祝他（从战场上）归来。
examples.en: The whole town came out to celebrate his return (from the war).

examples.ch: 她一回来就直接去了办公室。
examples.en: On her return, she went straight to the office.

defines.trans_en: an occasion when you start to do or have something again

examples.ch: 一些环保主义者主张回归工业化以前的社会。
examples.en: Some environmentalists argue for a return to a pre-industrial society.

examples.ch: 大多数人欢迎她重新掌权／复职。
examples.en: Most people have welcomed her return to power/office.

defines.trans_en: a ticket for travel to a place and back again

examples.ch: 请给我一张去伯明翰的往返票好吗？
examples.en: A return to Birmingham, please.

defines.trans_en: the act of giving, doing, or receiving something in exchange for something

examples.ch: 反击中，数名士兵受伤。
examples.en: Several soldiers were wounded in the return of fire.

defines.trans_en: the profit that you get from an investment

examples.ch: 我们投资获得的收益很低。
examples.en: The return on the money we invested was very low.

defines.trans_ch: 重新出现；再度发生；重新利用
defines.trans_en: an occasion when something starts to happen or be used again

examples.ch: 我们还会看到穿着舒适的时装再次流行吗？
examples.en: Will we ever see the return of/a return to comfortable fashion clothes?

defines.trans_en: the key on a computer keyboard that you press in order to say that the words or numbers on the screen are correct, or that an instruction should be performed, or in order to move down a line on the screen

examples.ch: 按两次回车键留出一行空行。
examples.en: Press return/the return key twice to leave a blank line.

defines.trans_en: the act of giving, putting, or sending something back

examples.ch: 归还被盗货物
examples.en: the return of the stolen goods

defines.trans_ch: （网球等运动中的）回击，回击球
defines.trans_en: the act of hitting the ball back to your opponent in sports such as tennis

examples.ch: 张的回发球非常有力。
examples.en: Chang's return of serve was powerful.

phrases.trans_en: in exchange

examples.ch: 有些租客通过协助大楼管理来获得租金减免。
examples.en: Some tenants get rent reductions in return for help managing the building.

examples.ch: 我会和你一起去，但你得为我做点什么作为回报。
examples.en: I'll come with you, but you have to do something for me in return.

phrases.trans_en: goods that have been taken back to the shop where they were bought by customers because they are damaged or unsuitable
the votes that are returned, or the results of the voting, in an election

examples.ch: 选举结果显示参选各派各有得失，局势扑朔迷离。
examples.en: The election returns produced a confusing picture of gains and losses.

phrases.trans_en: in the first post collection that leaves after you receive a letter

examples.ch: 她收到我的信后立即回了信。
examples.en: She answered my letter by return.

defines.trans_ch: （作为旅行一部分的）回程，返程
defines.trans_en: The return part of a journey is the part in which you go back to the place where you started.

examples.ch: 回程花的时间长一些，因为火车改线了。
examples.en: The return journey took longer because the train was rerouted.

defines.trans_en: the small seeds of a particular type of grass, cooked, and eaten as food

examples.ch: 煮米饭／蒸米饭／炒米饭
examples.en: boiled/steamed/fried rice

examples.ch: 长粒米
examples.en: long-grain rice

examples.ch: 你喜欢吃糙米还是精米？
examples.en: Do you prefer brown rice or white rice?

defines.trans_en: a grass that produces these seeds and grows in warm wet places

defines.trans_ch: （尤指将煮熟的土豆）压成米粒状
defines.trans_en: to separate food, especially cooked potatoes, into very small pieces that look like rice by forcing it through small holes in a special tool

examples.ch: 把土豆削皮，煮熟然后压成米粒状。
examples.en: Peel, boil, and rice the potatoes.

defines.trans_en: having a lot of money or valuable possessions

examples.ch: 他是全国第三大富豪。
examples.en: He's the third richest man in the country.

examples.ch: 他们国家是世界上最富的国家之一。
examples.en: They're one of the world's richest nations.

examples.ch: 他决心尽快致富。
examples.en: He is determined to get rich quickly.

defines.trans_en: containing a large amount of a valuable natural substance such as coal, oil, or wood

examples.ch: 这一地区矿产和煤炭储量丰富。
examples.en: The region is rich in minerals and coal deposits.

examples.ch: 这个国家石油储量巨大，其他矿产资源也非常丰富。
examples.en: The country has vast oil reserves and rich deposits of other minerals.

defines.trans_en: Rich land or soil contains a large amount of substances that help plants to grow.

examples.ch: 该国最肥沃的可耕地
examples.en: the richest arable land in the country

defines.trans_ch: 丰富多彩的;阅历丰富的
defines.trans_en: containing a lot of exciting events or experiences and therefore very interesting

examples.ch: 他写了一本书介绍该岛屿的沧桑历史。
examples.en: He has written a book about the island's rich history.

examples.ch: 她历经沧桑，见过很多著名的、具有传奇色彩的人物。
examples.en: She had a rich and varied life and met many famous and exciting people.

defines.trans_ch: 富丽堂皇的;装饰华丽的
defines.trans_en: If the style of something such as a piece of furniture or a building is rich, it contains a lot of decoration.

examples.ch: 这座庙因其丰富多姿的雕刻而闻名。
examples.en: The temple is noted for its rich carvings.

defines.trans_ch: （颜色）浓重的；（声音）浑厚的，圆润洪亮的；（味道）馥郁的
defines.trans_en: A rich colour, sound, smell, or taste is strong in a pleasing or attractive way.

examples.ch: 这种口红色泽鲜艳持久。
examples.en: This lipstick gives long-lasting rich colour.

examples.ch: 她用单簧管吹奏出的曲调深沉饱满。
examples.en: She produced a rich, deep tone from her clarinet.

examples.ch: 这种葡萄酒味道馥郁浓醇。
examples.en: The wine has a rich aromatic flavour.

defines.trans_en: A rich material is very beautiful and valuable.

examples.ch: 她穿着一条天鹅绒裙子，配一件华丽高档的锦缎上衣。
examples.en: She wore a velvet skirt and a rich brocade jacket.

defines.trans_en: If food is rich, it contains a large amount of oil, butter, eggs, or cream.

examples.ch: 这种巧克力奶油冻对我来说太油腻了。
examples.en: This chocolate mousse is too rich for me.

defines.trans_en: used to describe someone's opinions when that person has the same bad qualities as the person they are criticizing

examples.ch: 教育部长对新考试制度的批评似乎有点荒唐可笑，因为当时正是他要求作出这些改革的。
examples.en: The education minister's criticism of the new exam system seems rich, considering it was he who demanded the changes in the first place.

examples.ch: “他说我看上去很胖。”“他这样说就有点太可笑了。”
examples.en: "He said I looked fat." "That's a bit rich coming from him." (= he himself is fat)

phrases.trans_en: containing a lot of something good or useful

examples.ch: 菠萝汁富含维生素 A 和维生素 B。
examples.en: Pineapple juice is rich in vitamins A and B.

examples.ch: 英语的词汇很丰富。
examples.en: The English language is rich in vocabulary.

phrases.trans_en: used in compounds to say that someone has a lot of a particular thing, or that something contains a lot of a particular substance

examples.ch: 这种养老金计划在拥有自己生意的或是拥有多处房产的人中很受欢迎。
examples.en: This type of pension plan is popular with business owners or property-rich investors.

examples.ch: 我们这个时代的谜团之一是为什么一些盛产石油的国度里生活着这么多穷人。
examples.en: One of the mysteries of our times is why some oil-rich countries have so many poor living in them.

examples.ch: 富含维生素的菜汤食谱
examples.en: a recipe for a vitamin-rich vegetable soup

phrases.trans_en: rich people considered together as a group

examples.ch: 这个旅游胜地是富人名流经常光顾的地方。
examples.en: The resort is frequented by the rich and famous.

defines.trans_en: containing a large amount of a valuable substance

examples.ch: 牛奶以及其他富含钙的食物
examples.en: milk and other calcium-rich food

examples.ch: 盛产石油的国家
examples.en: an oil-rich country

defines.trans_ch: 骑（自行车、摩托车或马等）
defines.trans_en: to sit on something such as a bicycle, motorbike, or horse and travel along on it controlling its movements

examples.ch: 我6岁学会了骑自行车。
examples.en: I learned to ride a bike when I was six.

examples.ch: 我骑机动自行车去上班。
examples.en: I ride my moped to work.

examples.ch: 我骑机动自行车去上班。
examples.en: I ride to work on my moped.

examples.ch: 猎人们骑马飞驰而过。
examples.en: The hunters came riding by/past on their horses.

defines.trans_en: to ride a horse

examples.ch: 你会骑马吗？
examples.en: Can you ride?

examples.ch: 他们的女儿正在学骑马。
examples.en: Their daughter is learning to ride.

examples.ch: 他骑术很好／差。
examples.en: He rides well/badly.

defines.trans_en: to travel in a vehicle, such as a car, bus, or train

examples.ch: 他没有私家车，所以就坐公共汽车去上班。
examples.en: He doesn't have a car so he rides to work on the bus.

examples.ch: 我们从圣地亚哥坐火车到波特兰。
examples.en: We rode the train from San Diego to Portland.

defines.trans_ch: 驾驭，试图控制（某人）并强迫其工作
defines.trans_en: to try to control someone and force them to work

examples.ch: 你的老板现在把你管得太严了。
examples.en: Your boss is riding you much too hard at the moment.

defines.trans_ch: （骑马、骑车或乘坐车辆的）旅行，行程
defines.trans_en: a journey on a horse or bicycle, or in a vehicle

examples.ch: 坐公共汽车去机场很近。
examples.en: It's a short bus ride to the airport.

examples.ch: 上周六我（骑马）去兜了一圈。
examples.en: I went for a (horse) ride last Saturday.

examples.ch: 你想坐我的摩托车去兜兜风吗？
examples.en: Do you want to come for a ride on my bike?

defines.trans_en: a free journey in a car to a place where you want to go

examples.ch: 他请求搭我的便车进城。
examples.en: He asked me for a ride into town.

defines.trans_en: a person who gives you a ride in their car

examples.ch: 好了，我得走了。让我搭车的人已经来了。
examples.en: Well, I have to go - my ride is here.

defines.trans_en: someone's car

examples.ch: 哎，好车。
examples.en: Hey, nice ride.

defines.trans_ch: （游乐园里）供人乘坐的游乐装置
defines.trans_en: a machine in an amusement park that people travel in or are moved around by for entertainment

examples.ch: 我们玩了游乐园里所有的装置。
examples.en: We went on all the rides.

examples.ch: 我最爱坐摩天轮。
examples.en: My favourite ride is the Ferris wheel.

defines.trans_en: correct

examples.ch: 你答对了三道题，错了两道。
examples.en: You got three answers right and two wrong.

examples.ch: 我把表调准了。
examples.en: I set the clock to the right time.

examples.ch: “是克雷默女士吗？”“是的，我就是。”
examples.en: "Is that Ms Kramer?" "Yes, that's right."

examples.ch: 你要去参加会议，是这么回事儿吧？
examples.en: Am I right in thinking (= is it true) that you will be at the conference?

examples.ch: 你生气是理所应当的——你受到的对待及不公平。
examples.en: You're right to be annoyed - you've been treated very badly.

examples.ch: 你必须说出实情，这样事情才会出现转机。
examples.en: You must put matters right (= make the situation better) by telling the truth.

defines.trans_ch: （判断或说法）准确的，确切的，恰当的
defines.trans_en: If you are right about something or someone, you are correct in your judgment or statement about it, him, or her.

examples.ch: 你对皮特的看法没错——他的确只会制造麻烦。
examples.en: You were right about Pete - he's a real troublemaker.

defines.trans_ch: 合适的，恰当的；理想的；符合要求的
defines.trans_en: suitable or correct, or as it should be

examples.ch: 他是做这个工作的合适人选。
examples.en: He's the right person for the job.

examples.ch: 我认为你作出的决定是恰当的。
examples.en: I think you've made the right decision.

examples.ch: 游泳池的水温正合适。
examples.en: The temperature of the swimming pool was just right (= exactly as I wanted it).

examples.ch: 那顶帽子你戴着再合适不过了。
examples.en: That hat looks just right on you.

examples.ch: 他认为公开自己意图的时机已经成熟。
examples.en: He thought the time was right to let his intentions be known.

defines.trans_ch: （人或地方）重要的，显贵的，显赫的
defines.trans_en: used to refer to a person who is considered to be socially important or a place that such people go to

examples.ch: 她认识所有的头面人物。
examples.en: She knows all the right people.

examples.ch: 他喜欢让人看到他出入那些高级俱乐部和餐馆。
examples.en: He likes to be seen in the right clubs and restaurants.

defines.trans_ch: 公正的;正当的;符合道德的;正义的
defines.trans_en: considered fair or morally acceptable by most people

examples.ch: 我觉得他们不应该把他关进监狱，这是不公正的。
examples.en: I don't believe they should have put him in prison. It isn't right.

examples.ch: 在背后批评人不道德。
examples.en: It's not right to criticize people behind their back.

examples.ch: 只有做到男女同工同酬才公正。
examples.en: It is only (= completely) right that men and women should be paid the same for doing the same work.

defines.trans_en: healthy, or working correctly

examples.ch: 昨晚自打我吃了那些东西，就一直感到很难受。
examples.en: I haven't felt right since I ate that meal last night.

examples.ch: 你的自行车车闸不好用了。
examples.en: Something isn't quite right with the brakes on your bike.

defines.trans_en: used for emphasizing when something is bad

examples.ch: 他是个十足的白痴。
examples.en: He's a right idiot.

examples.ch: 他家里乱极了。
examples.en: His house is a right mess.

defines.trans_ch: 右边的，右侧的；向右的；在右边；向右
defines.trans_en: on or towards the side of your body that is to the east when you are facing north

examples.ch: 大多数人用右手写字。
examples.en: Most people write with their right hand.

examples.ch: 他喜欢睡在床的右侧。
examples.en: He likes to sleep on the right side of the bed.

phrases.trans_ch: 在正确的位置;不偏不倚
phrases.trans_en: in the correct position

examples.ch: 盖子得放正，不然的话就盖不严。
examples.en: The lid has to go on the right way round or it won't fit.

examples.ch: 把瓶子放正了。
examples.en: Keep the bottle the right way up.

defines.trans_en: on or towards the side of your body that is to the east when you are facing north

examples.ch: 在第一个红绿灯处向右转。
examples.en: Turn/Go right (= take the road on the right) at the first traffic lights.

defines.trans_en: exactly or all the way

examples.ch: 一个粉刺正好长在我鼻尖上。
examples.en: I've got a pimple right on the end of my nose.

examples.ch: 他们沿着海岸修了一排宾馆。
examples.en: They built a row of hotels right along the sea-front.

defines.trans_en: used for emphasis

examples.ch: 车把汽油彻底用光了。
examples.en: The car ran right (= completely) out of fuel.

examples.ch: 她跟我走了个面对面，可是没有注意到我。
examples.en: She walked right (= all the way) past me without noticing me.

examples.ch: 我马上就回来。
examples.en: I'll be right back/I'll be right with you (= I will return very soon).

defines.trans_en: used as part of the title of particular people, such as bishops and some members of Parliament

examples.ch: 黛安‧阿伯特议员阁下
examples.en: the Right Honourable Diane Abbott, MP

defines.trans_en: correctly

examples.ch: 为什么他老是做什么都做不对？
examples.en: Why does he never do anything right?

phrases.trans_en: immediately

examples.ch: 你最好马上离开。
examples.en: You'd better leave right now.

phrases.trans_en: at the present time

examples.ch: 我们现在很忙。
examples.en: We're very busy right now.

phrases.trans_en: If something goes right, it is successful or happens in a way that you hoped it would.

examples.ch: 最近这几个月，我过得不太顺利。
examples.en: Things haven't been going right for me these past few months.

defines.trans_en: the right side

examples.ch: 英语是从左向右读写的。
examples.en: English is written and read from left to right.

examples.ch: 国王大道是右边的第一条道。
examples.en: King's Avenue is the first right (= the first road on the right side).

examples.ch: 在这张照片里，我妻子就是站在我右边的那个人。
examples.en: In this photo, my wife is the woman standing on/to my right.

examples.ch: 我过桥后向右转。
examples.en: I took/made (informal hung) a right (= turned into the next road on the right side) after crossing the bridge.

defines.trans_en: what is considered to be morally good or acceptable

examples.ch: 凭你的良知应该能够分清是非。
examples.en: Your conscience should tell you the difference between right and wrong.

defines.trans_en: the fact that a person or animal can expect to be treated in a fair, morally acceptable, or legal way, or to have the things that are necessary for life

examples.ch: 20世纪60年代，她参加了争取妇女权利的运动。
examples.en: She campaigned for women's rights during the 1960s.

examples.ch: 人人都享有受教育的权利。
examples.en: Everyone has a right to education.

examples.ch: 她并不比我更有权利要求公司配车。
examples.en: She has no more right to a company car than I have (= she does not deserve one more than I do).

examples.ch: 你又不是我的老板，你有什么资格批评我？
examples.en: You're not my boss, so what right (= authority) do you have to tell me what to do?

examples.ch: 你完全有理由抱怨。
examples.en: You have every right (= you have a good reason) to complain.

phrases.trans_en: political parties or people that have traditional opinions, and that believe in low taxes, property, and industry being privately owned, and less help for the poor

examples.ch: 1979年以后，右派政党上台执政。
examples.en: The right was/were in power after 1979.

examples.ch: 他是一个极右翼分子。
examples.en: He's a man of the far (= extreme) right.

phrases.trans_en: If you are in the right, what you are doing is morally or legally correct.

phrases.trans_ch: 在自身合法范围内;（做某事）是正当的
phrases.trans_en: If you are within your rights to do something, you are legally allowed to do it.

examples.ch: 我认为我完全有权利要求全额退款。
examples.en: I think I'm quite within my rights to demand a full refund.

phrases.trans_en: legal controls over who is allowed to use a book or film

examples.ch: 他已经取得了将这本书拍成电影的制片权。
examples.en: He has acquired the film rights to the book (= he is allowed to make a film of the book).

phrases.trans_en: new shares in a particular company that have become available for people to buy who already own shares

examples.ch: 公司给予每四股现有股份认购一股的权利。
examples.en: The company made a rights issue of one new share for every four held.

phrases.trans_ch: 使走上正轨；使恢复正常；纠正
phrases.trans_en: to improve or correct something

examples.ch: 这家公司需要100多万美元才可以使其财务重回正常轨道。
examples.en: The company needs over a million dollars to set its finances to rights.

defines.trans_ch: （表示同意或听懂别人说的话）好，行，对
defines.trans_en: used to express agreement with someone or to show that you have understood what someone has said

examples.ch: “约翰尼，你打头，第一个爬。”“好的。”
examples.en: "Johnny, you climb up first." "Right."

defines.trans_ch: （尤指为了开始一项活动而引起人们的注意）嗨，喂，好了
defines.trans_en: said when you want to make a group of people notice you, especially so that you can start an activity

examples.ch: 好了，各位。请不要再说话，我们就要开始了。
examples.en: Right, everyone. Could you all stop talking, and then we'll begin.

defines.trans_ch: （用于讲述故事时吸引人注意或者弄清楚听者是否明白）对吧，哎
defines.trans_en: said between parts of a story that you are telling, in order to make certain that people are paying attention and understanding

examples.ch: “好啦，我就在那儿，半夜里，对吧，这家伙向我走了过来……”
examples.en: So there I was right, middle of the night, right, and this guy came up to me...

defines.trans_en: If you right a situation or a mistake, you make it better or correct it.

examples.ch: 这种局面太糟糕了，我们应当尽快使其恢复正常。
examples.en: It's a terrible situation and we should right it as soon as possible.

defines.trans_ch: 将（船）扶正；使（船）翻转（到正常位置）
defines.trans_en: If a boat rights itself, it turns itself back to its correct position in the water.

examples.ch: 独木舟如果翻了，会自己正过来。
examples.en: The canoe will right itself if it capsizes.

defines.trans_en: a natural wide flow of fresh water across the land into the sea, a lake, or another river

examples.ch: 我们顺流而下缓缓航行。
examples.en: We sailed slowly down the river.

defines.trans_ch: （通常用于河流名称前，有时位于河流名称后）河
defines.trans_en: used before or after the name of a river

examples.ch: 泰晤士／赛纳／尼罗河
examples.en: the River Thames/Seine/Nile

examples.ch: 哈德逊河／密西西比河／扬子江
examples.en: the Hudson/Mississippi/Yangzte River

phrases.trans_en: in the opposite direction to the flow of water in the river

examples.ch: 我们逆流而行。
examples.en: We sailed up river.

phrases.trans_en: in the same direction as the flow of water in the river

defines.trans_en: a long, hard surface built for vehicles to travel along

examples.ch: 我们住在一条繁忙／僻静的公路边。
examples.en: We live on a busy/quiet road.

examples.ch: 横过大马路时要小心。
examples.en: Be careful when you cross a main road.

examples.ch: 在马路对面有一家咖啡店。
examples.en: There's a coffee shop on the other side of the road.

examples.ch: 从这儿通往阿德莱德的公路经过一些风景优美的乡村地区。
examples.en: The road from here to Adelaide runs/goes through some beautiful countryside.

examples.ch: 所有进／出城的道路都被大雪封住了。
examples.en: All roads into/out of the town were blocked by the snow.

examples.ch: 我讨厌坐飞机，所以无论去哪我都是坐汽车或者火车。
examples.en: I hate flying so I go everywhere by road or rail.

examples.ch: 我住在米尔路。
examples.en: I live in/on Mill Road.

examples.ch: 我的地址是米尔路82号。
examples.en: My address is 82 Mill Road.

examples.ch: 这是去贝尔法斯特的路吗？
examples.en: Is this the Belfast road (= the road that goes to Belfast)?

examples.ch: 大多数道路交通事故都是由于车速过快引起的。
examples.en: Most road accidents are caused by people driving too fast.

phrases.trans_ch: （指汽车状况良好）可以上路，可以行驶
phrases.trans_en: If a vehicle is on the road, it is working as it should and can be legally used.

examples.ch: 我的小轿车在修车厂修了一个星期，不过现在可以重新上路了。
examples.en: My car was in the garage for a week, but it's now back on the road.

phrases.trans_en: When you are on the road, you are driving or travelling, usually over a long distance.

examples.ch: 他们开了两天车到了海边。
examples.en: After two days on the road, they reached the coast.

phrases.trans_en: If a group of actors or musicians are on the road, they are travelling to different places to perform.

examples.ch: 大多数的摇滚乐团一年有两三个月的时间作巡回演出。
examples.en: Most rock groups spend two or three months a year on the road.

defines.trans_en: to cook food in an oven or over a fire

examples.ch: 直接把鸡放在烤箱里烤，烤时涂上油和柠檬汁。
examples.en: Just roast the chicken in the oven and baste it in oil and lemon.

examples.ch: 我们躺在地中海的沙滩上晒日光浴。
examples.en: We lay on the beach and roasted (= got very hot) in the Mediterranean sun.

defines.trans_en: to heat nuts or coffee beans so that they become drier and browner
to criticize severely or speak angrily to someone

examples.ch: 批评者抨击他利用了刻板的种族成见。
examples.en: Critics roasted him for exploiting racial stereotypes.

defines.trans_en: to humorously criticize and make jokes about a famous person at a public event honouring that person, as a part of the event

examples.ch: 他以在《喜剧中心》的节目上吐槽名人而出名。
examples.en: He's known for roasting big-name celebrities on his Comedy Central shows.

defines.trans_en: Roast meat or vegetables have been cooked in an oven or over a fire

examples.ch: 烤牛肉／鸡／土豆
examples.en: roast beef/chicken/potatoes

examples.ch: 烘焙的辣椒酱
examples.en: roasted red pepper sauce

defines.trans_en: a large piece of roasted meat
an event where a famous person has jokes and humorous criticisms made about them, for entertainment

examples.ch: 比尔·梅尔将主持一场吐槽会，纪念拉里·金在广播电视界从业50周年。
examples.en: There will be a roast hosted by Bill Maher to mark Larry King's 50 years on radio and television.

defines.trans_en: the dry solid part of the earth's surface, or any large piece of this that sticks up out of the ground or the sea

examples.ch: 山和悬崖都是由岩石构成的。
examples.en: Mountains and cliffs are formed from rock.

examples.ch: 船在海湾外撞上了一块礁石，沉没了。
examples.en: The boat struck a rock outside the bay and sank.

defines.trans_en: a piece of rock or stone

examples.ch: 示威者向警察投掷石块。
examples.en: The demonstrators were hurling rocks at the police.

defines.trans_en: slang for a valuable stone used in jewellery, especially a diamond

examples.ch: 你看见他结婚周年纪念时送给她的钻石有多大了吗？
examples.en: Have you seen the size of the rock he gave her for their anniversary?

defines.trans_en: a type of popular music with a strong, loud beat that is usually played with electric guitars and drums

examples.ch: 摇滚乐队
examples.en: a rock group

examples.ch: 摇滚歌星
examples.en: a rock star

phrases.trans_en: a line of large stones sticking up from the sea

examples.ch: 暴风雨致使这艘轮船触礁。
examples.en: The storm forced the ship onto the rocks.

defines.trans_en: to (cause someone or something to) move backwards and forwards or from side to side in a regular way

examples.ch: 他抱起了婴儿轻轻摇着哄她入睡。
examples.en: He picked up the baby and gently rocked her to sleep.

examples.ch: 你坐在那把椅子上要是往后摇，椅子会散架的。
examples.en: If you rock back on that chair, you're going to break it.

defines.trans_ch: 使剧烈震动;使猛烈摇动
defines.trans_en: If a person or place is rocked by something such as an explosion, the force of it makes the person or place shake.

examples.ch: 这次爆炸使整座城市剧烈震动，致使300人丧生。
examples.en: The explosion, which rocked the city, killed 300.

defines.trans_en: If an event rocks a group of people or society, it causes feelings of shock.

examples.ch: 总经理的辞职震惊了整个公司。
examples.en: The managing director's resignation rocked the whole company.

defines.trans_ch: 因穿戴而显得好看（或时髦）
defines.trans_en: to wear a particular style of clothing, etc. and look good or fashionable

examples.ch: 有的名流已经40多岁了，但是刺上一个纹身依然显得时髦。
examples.en: There are celebrities over 40 years old who can still rock a tattoo.

defines.trans_en: the covering that forms the top of a building, vehicle, etc.

examples.ch: 这所房子是斜顶／平顶／石板瓦顶／茅草（等）的。
examples.en: The house has a sloping/flat/tiled/thatched roof.

examples.ch: 把行李放在车顶上。
examples.en: Put the luggage on the roof of the car.

examples.ch: 洞顶距地面有50米高。
examples.en: The roof (= upper surface) of the cave is 50 metres up.

examples.ch: 这蛋糕很干，吃的时候会粘在上颚上。
examples.en: This cake is so dry that it sticks to the roof of your mouth (= upper surface of the mouth).

defines.trans_ch: 给（建筑物）盖屋顶;给（建筑物）装屋顶
defines.trans_en: to put a roof on a building
a part of the inside of a building that is separated from other parts by walls, floor, and ceiling

examples.ch: 我喜欢这个房间——光线非常充足。
examples.en: I like this room - it has plenty of light.

examples.ch: 我能听见隔壁房间里的说话声。
examples.en: I could hear people talking in the next room.

examples.ch: 她在楼上会议室等你。
examples.en: She's waiting for you in the conference room upstairs.

examples.ch: 整个房间里的人都扭过头来看她。
examples.en: The whole room (= all the people in the room) turned and looked at her.

defines.trans_en: a bedroom

examples.ch: 她在楼上自己房间里。
examples.en: She's upstairs in her room.

examples.ch: 去整理你的房间，不然今晚不能看电视。
examples.en: Go tidy your room, or you can't watch TV tonight.

examples.ch: 单／双人房
examples.en: a single/double room (= a bedroom for one person/two people)

defines.trans_en: used as a combining form in the names of particular rooms

examples.ch: 卧室
examples.en: a bedroom

examples.ch: 浴室
examples.en: a bathroom

examples.ch: 餐厅
examples.en: a dining room

examples.ch: 客厅
examples.en: a living room

defines.trans_en: the amount of space that someone or something needs

examples.ch: 那个沙发放在公寓房中太占空间。
examples.en: That sofa would take up too much room in the flat.

examples.ch: 詹姆斯拿走了小桌上的书，腾出地方来放电视。
examples.en: James took the books off the little table to make room for the television.

examples.ch: 他昏倒了！别围在他旁边——给他让出点地方来。
examples.en: He's fainted! Don't crowd him - give him room.

examples.ch: 我还能坐进车里去吗／车里还有我坐的地方吗？
examples.en: Is there (enough/any) room for me in the car?

examples.ch: 这里面挤得几乎动都动不了。
examples.en: There's hardly room to move in here.

defines.trans_en: opportunity for doing something

examples.ch: 我觉得公司几乎没有回旋的余地。
examples.en: I feel the company has little room for/to manoeuvre.

phrases.trans_ch: （尤指大学中租住的）一套房间，住所，寓所
phrases.trans_en: a set of rented rooms, especially in a college or university

defines.trans_en: to rent a room from someone, or share a rented room with someone

examples.ch: 在大学里他和这个来自内布拉斯加州的小伙子是室友。
examples.en: At college he rooms with this guy from Nebraska.

defines.trans_en: in a circular direction or position; around

examples.ch: 月球围绕地球转。
examples.en: The moon goes round the earth.

examples.ch: 我们跑到房子后面去找狗。
examples.en: We ran round (the outside of the house) to the back, looking for the dog.

examples.ch: 这个想法一整天都萦绕在我心头。
examples.en: The idea has been going round and round in my head all day (= I can't stop thinking about it).

examples.ch: 飞机的一台发动机熄火了，我们不得不掉头飞回。
examples.en: When one engine stopped, we had to turn round (= turn to face the opposite direction) and fly home.

examples.ch: 他想绕过守门员但是球被迫射偏了。
examples.en: He tried to go round the keeper (= move with the football past a goalkeeper) but was forced wide.

defines.trans_en: in every part of a place, or in various parts of a place

examples.ch: 房主带我（在房子里）四处看了看。
examples.en: The landlord showed me round (the house).

examples.ch: 我不得不在城中四处寻找还在营业的宾馆。
examples.en: I had to go all round town to find a hotel that was open.

examples.ch: 这种病毒（在学校）四处传播。
examples.en: This virus has been going round (the school) (= many people have had it) .

defines.trans_en: on all or some sides of something

examples.ch: 我们围着火炉坐着。
examples.en: We sat round the fire.

examples.ch: 这座房子四周都是树。
examples.en: The house has trees all round.

examples.ch: 这座金字塔高50米，底部周长100米。
examples.en: The pyramid is 50 metres high and 100 metres round (the base).

examples.ch: 方圆1英里之内的人都听到了爆炸声。
examples.en: Everyone for a mile round (= in the area) heard the explosion.

defines.trans_en: in a particular direction

examples.ch: 花园在（房子）后面。
examples.en: The garden is round the back (of the house).

examples.ch: 我童年时曾住在这一带。
examples.en: I used to live round (= near) here when I was a child.

examples.ch: 你找个时间一定（到我家）来坐坐。
examples.en: You must come round (to my house) sometime soon.

examples.ch: 我们要去酒馆抓紧喝上一杯。
examples.en: We're going round (= to) the pub for a quick drink.

defines.trans_en: shaped like a ball or circle, or curved

examples.ch: 网球和橘子是圆的。
examples.en: Tennis balls and oranges are round.

examples.ch: 圆孔／石／桌／窗
examples.en: a round hole/stone/table/window

examples.ch: 圆脸
examples.en: a round face

examples.ch: 圆眼睛
examples.en: round eyes

defines.trans_ch: 整数的;用整数表示的;用约整数表示的
defines.trans_en: (of a number) whole or complete; given to the nearest 1, 10, 100, etc. and not as exact amounts

examples.ch: 与2.8最接近的整数是3。
examples.en: 2.8 to the nearest round number is 3.

examples.ch: “我这儿有95瓶给你。”“能不能凑个整数，给100瓶怎么样？”
examples.en: "I've got 95 bottles here for you." "Could you make it a round hundred, please?"

defines.trans_ch: 一连串的事情;一系列的事件;一系列活动
defines.trans_en: a number of things or group of events
