examples.ch: 俄罗斯和美国将在下个月举行又一轮会谈。
examples.en: Russia and America will hold another round of talks next month.

examples.ch: 我们年轻时，生活的内容好像就是一个又一个聚会／一件又一件令人开心的事情。
examples.en: When we were young life was just one long round of parties/pleasure.

defines.trans_ch: （某人给大家买的）每人一份（饮料），一巡（饮料）
defines.trans_en: drinks that you buy for a group of people

examples.ch: 该你请大家都喝上一杯了。
examples.en: It's your turn to buy a round.

examples.ch: 他请大家都喝了一杯以表示谢意。
examples.en: He bought a round of drinks to say thank you.

defines.trans_en: a single slice of toast, or a sandwich

defines.trans_ch: （尤指作为送货工作的）例行拜访
defines.trans_en: a set of regular visits that you make to a number of places or people, especially in order to take products as part of your job

examples.ch: 他挨家送奶／报纸。
examples.en: He has a milk/paper round.

defines.trans_en: a song for several singers, who begin singing one after the other at various points in the song
a part of a competition

examples.ch: 她在锦标赛的第三轮被淘汰。
examples.en: She was knocked out of the championship in the third round.

defines.trans_en: one of the periods of time during a boxing or wrestling match when the competitors are fighting

defines.trans_ch: （高尔夫球比赛打完场中所有洞的）一场
defines.trans_en: a complete game in golf
a bullet or other single piece of ammunition

examples.ch: 士兵们只剩下20发子弹了。
examples.en: The soldiers had only 20 rounds left.

defines.trans_en: to go around something

examples.ch: 科林急速拐弯。
examples.en: Colin rounded the corner at high speed.

defines.trans_en: to move around and past another player while keeping the ball

examples.ch: 他把球带过了守门员射门得分。
examples.en: He rounded the keeper and scored.

defines.trans_en: a place where three or more roads join and traffic must go around a circular area in the middle, rather than straight across
a flat, round piece of equipment in play areas on which children sit or stand and are pushed round and round
a large machine at a fair that turns round and has wooden or plastic animals or vehicles on which children ride

defines.trans_ch: 转弯抹角的;绕弯子的;不直接的
defines.trans_en: not in a simple, direct, or quick way

examples.ch: 为了避开那起事故的事发现场，我们绕道而行。
examples.en: We took a roundabout route to avoid the accident.

examples.ch: 他转弯抹角地问我是否可以给他加薪。
examples.en: He asked me, in a roundabout way, if he could have a salary increase.

defines.trans_en: (of people and some animals) to move along, faster than walking, by taking quick steps in which each foot is lifted before the next foot touches the ground

examples.ch: 孩子们得一路跑着才能跟上他们的父亲。
examples.en: The children had to run to keep up with their father.

examples.ch: 我可以在5分钟里跑1英里。
examples.en: I can run a mile in five minutes.

examples.ch: 羊受惊跑掉了。
examples.en: The sheep ran away/off in fright.

examples.ch: 一个小女孩跑到我身边，哭着让我替她找爸爸。
examples.en: A little girl ran up to (= came quickly beside) me, crying for her daddy.

examples.ch: 半决赛中，她将与水平最接近自己的对手一决高下。
examples.en: In the semi-final she will be running against her nearest rival.

examples.ch: 头两个赛跑项目将在20分钟后举行。
examples.en: The first two races will be run (= will happen) in 20 minutes.

defines.trans_ch: 使（狗、马等）参加比赛;赛（狗、马等）
defines.trans_en: If you run an animal in a race, you cause it to take part.

examples.ch: 汤普森赛马训练公司将派出3匹马参加下一场比赛。
examples.en: Thompson Stables are running three horses in the next race.

defines.trans_ch: 赶快;迅速赶往;匆忙跑（到某地方）
defines.trans_en: to go quickly or in a hurry

examples.ch: 你能不能赶快到邮局给我买一些邮票来？
examples.en: Would you run to the post office and get me some stamps?

examples.ch: 你整天不歇脚地跟在小孩们后面转是胖不起来的。
examples.en: You don't put on weight when you spend all day running around after small children.

defines.trans_ch: （使）行进，（使）行驶，（使）移动；（使）持续
defines.trans_en: to (cause something to) travel, move, or continue in a particular way

examples.ch: 尽管下了雪，列车仍在运行。
examples.en: Trains are still running, despite the snow.

examples.ch: 有一趟公共汽车每天3次开往城里。
examples.en: A bus runs (= goes on a particular route at particular times) three times a day into town.

examples.ch: 滑雪板底部打了蜡，这样就能在雪上滑得顺畅自如。
examples.en: Skis are waxed on the bottom so that they run smoothly over the snow.

examples.ch: 这条路线／铁道／公路穿过国界／通向意大利境内／在群山中穿行。
examples.en: The route/railway/road runs (= goes) across the border/into Italy/through the mountains.

examples.ch: 一丛攀缘蔷薇盘绕在门侧。
examples.en: A climbing rose bush runs (= grows) up the side of the door.

examples.ch: 所有的天花板四边都装饰着漂亮的檐口。
examples.en: There's a beautiful cornice running around/round all the ceilings.

examples.ch: 这部电影长两个小时。
examples.en: The film runs (= lasts) for two hours.

examples.ch: 演出／课程／电影播放将再继续一周。
examples.en: The show/course/film runs (= continues) for another week.

examples.ch: 杂志订阅期限通常只能是一年。
examples.en: A magazine subscription usually only runs (= can be used) for one year.

examples.ch: 因为先前的一起车祸，公共汽车的运行晚点一小时。
examples.en: Buses are running an hour late, because of an earlier accident.

examples.ch: 卡车刹车失灵，冲出了马路。
examples.en: The truck's brakes failed and it ran (= went) off the road.

examples.ch: 火车在铁轨上行驶。
examples.en: Trains run on rails (= move along on top of them).

examples.ch: 电流正通过这条电缆。
examples.en: Electricity is running through (= moving along within) this cable.

examples.ch: 人群中传出一阵低沉而愤怒的抱怨声。
examples.en: An angry muttering ran through (= went through) the crowd.

examples.ch: 一阵恐惧的战栗传遍他全身。
examples.en: A shiver of fear ran through his (body).

examples.ch: 她用手指一行行划过那张纸／名单寻找自己的名字。
examples.en: She ran her finger along/down the page/list, looking for her name.

examples.ch: 你可以把磁带／电影／录像带倒回去／向前快进一下吗？
examples.en: Could you run the tape/film/video back/forwards, please?

examples.ch: 你能否开车把我送回家／到车站？
examples.en: Could you possibly run me (= take me in your car) home/to the station?

examples.ch: 他用手梳拢了一下头发，抬头看我。
examples.en: He ran (= pushed) his fingers through his hair and looked up at me.

defines.trans_en: to (cause something to) operate

examples.ch: 机器运转时不要靠近。
examples.en: Keep clear of the machines while they're running.

examples.ch: 政府采取孤注一掷的措施来维持经济的运行。
examples.en: The government took desperate measures to keep the economy running.

examples.ch: 你会操作这种机器吗？
examples.en: Do you know how to run this sort of machinery?

examples.ch: 修车工人让我发动引擎转一分钟。
examples.en: The mechanic asked me to run the engine (= switch it on and allow it to work) for a minute.

examples.ch: 他们一小时之内就使新的计算机系统运行起来了。
examples.en: They had the new computer system up and running (= working) within an hour.

examples.ch: 我们已经运行了这个计算机程序，但是没有起作用。
examples.en: We've run the computer program, but nothing happens.

examples.ch: 我们正在做一个试验。
examples.en: We're running (= doing) an experiment.

defines.trans_en: to be in control of something

examples.ch: 他毕业后就一直在经营自己的饭店／公司。
examples.en: He's been running a restaurant/his own company since he left school.

examples.ch: 当地的一所大学开了一门自我防卫课。
examples.en: The local college runs (= provides) a course in self-defence.

examples.ch: 管理良好／不善的组织；经营良好／很差的公司；设置得很好／差的课程
examples.en: a well-run/badly-run organization/business/course

defines.trans_en: If you run a car, you own one, drive it, and pay for the costs.

examples.ch: 我养不起车。
examples.en: I can't afford to run a car.

defines.trans_en: to organize the way you live or work

examples.ch: 一些人按照星体的运行规律来安排自己的生活。
examples.en: Some people run their lives according to the movements of the stars.

defines.trans_ch: （使）流动;（使）流出;（使）排出;（尤指衣服的颜色）褪色，扩散，渗色
defines.trans_en: to (cause something to) flow or produce liquid

examples.ch: 我可以感觉到津津汗水顺着脖子往下流淌。
examples.en: I can feel trickles of sweat running down my neck.

examples.ch: 别哭了，要不然化的妆就要花了。
examples.en: Don't cry, or your make-up will run (= become liquid and move down your face).

examples.ch: 墙受潮出现了斑斑渍迹。
examples.en: The walls were running with damp.

examples.ch: 这条河流入大海。
examples.en: The river runs (down) to/into the sea.

examples.ch: 热水龙头竟然流出了冷水！
examples.en: The hot tap is running cold (= producing cold water)!

examples.ch: 我打开水龙头用凉水冲被烫伤的地方。
examples.en: I turned the tap on and ran some cold water on the burn.

examples.ch: 我去给你放洗澡水。
examples.en: I'll run you a hot bath (= fill a bath with water for you).

examples.ch: 我得了干草热，一星期都在流鼻涕淌眼泪。
examples.en: My nose and eyes have been running all week because of hay fever.

examples.ch: 她在文字处理机前工作了12小时后，看屏幕上的字都觉得模糊一片了。
examples.en: After twelve hours at her computer, the words began to run into one another (= seem mixed together).

defines.trans_en: (of colours in clothes, etc.) to come out or spread

examples.ch: 我洗这件裙子时用的水肯定太热了，因为都褪色了。
examples.en: I must have washed my dress at too high a temperature, because the colour has run.

examples.ch: 如果第一层没有干就涂上第二层，那两层的颜色就会渗在一起。
examples.en: If the first layer isn't dry before you add the next one, the colours will run into each other (= mix).

defines.trans_en: to be or become

examples.ch: 双方的分歧加剧了。
examples.en: Differences between the two sides run deep (= are serious).

examples.ch: 河水／水库／水井干涸了。
examples.en: The river/reservoir/well ran dry (= its supply of water finished).

examples.ch: 储备所剩无几了。
examples.en: Supplies are running low (= there's not much left).

examples.ch: 我们的钱快花完了／钱快花完了。
examples.en: We're beginning to run short of money/Money is beginning to run short (= there's not much left).

defines.trans_ch: （连裤袜或长筒袜上的）脱线，抽丝
defines.trans_en: If tights (= thin clothing that covers the legs) run, a long, thin hole appears in them.

examples.ch: 哎呀，糟了，我的连裤袜抽丝了！
examples.en: Oh no, my tights have run!

defines.trans_en: to show something in a newspaper or magazine, on television, etc.

examples.ch: 所有报纸都刊登了新一轮和谈的消息。
examples.en: All the newspapers ran (= printed) stories about the new peace talks.

examples.ch: 第四频道正在播出揭露法律体系不公正之处的系列节目。
examples.en: Channel 4 is running a series on the unfairness of the legal system.

defines.trans_en: If a film is running at a particular place, you can see it there.

examples.ch: 这周Metro电影院在放什么电影？
examples.en: What's running at the the Metro this week?

defines.trans_en: to compete as a candidate in an election

examples.ch: 撒切尔夫人想要第四次参加竞选。
examples.en: Mrs Thatcher wanted to run a fourth time.

examples.ch: 他将要和史密斯作为对手进行竞选／竞选总统／竞选连任。
examples.en: He's going to run against Smith/for president/for re-election.

defines.trans_ch: 走私，非法携带（枪支或毒品）
defines.trans_en: to take guns or drugs illegally from one place to another

examples.ch: 他因为越境向美国走私毒品而被捕。
examples.en: He was arrested for running drugs across the border into America.

phrases.trans_ch: 奔跑追赶;赶抢;快跑躲避
phrases.trans_en: to run fast in order to get or avoid something

examples.ch: 我跑着去赶公共汽车，但是车却开走了。
examples.en: I ran for the bus but it drove off.

phrases.trans_en: to move your legs as if running, while you stay in one place

examples.ch: 我在开始训练前原地踏步跑做准备活动。
examples.en: I run on the spot to warm up before I start training.

phrases.trans_ch: 牢牢控制，有效的严格管理
phrases.trans_en: to control a business or other organization firmly and effectively

examples.ch: 露丝执行了有效的严格管理，员工没有办法开小差。
examples.en: Ruth runs a tight ship and has no time for shirkers.

phrases.trans_en: to compete as a candidate in an election for a position of authority and responsibility in a government or other organization

examples.ch: 她正在考虑参加竞选。
examples.en: She is considering running for office.

defines.trans_ch: 跑，奔跑;（尤指为了锻炼而进行的）跑步
defines.trans_en: the action of running, especially for exercise

examples.ch: 我们每天傍晚下班后都会跑上3英里。
examples.en: We go for/do a three-mile run every evening after work.

examples.ch: 如果你一开始就跑，过些时候你就会筋疲力尽的。
examples.en: If you set off at a run (= running), you'll be exhausted later.

defines.trans_en: a journey

examples.ch: 纽约—莫斯科之间的航线正在增加航班。
examples.en: The number of aircraft on the New York-Moscow run is being increased.

examples.ch: 让我们开车到（外面）什么地方兜兜风吧。
examples.en: Let's go for a run (out) in the car somewhere.

examples.ch: 飞机猛然俯冲下来轰炸。
examples.en: The plane swooped in on its bombing run.

defines.trans_en: the period during which a play is performed

examples.ch: 该音乐剧在伦敦的演出彻底失败。
examples.en: The musical's London run was a disaster.

examples.ch: 他们正在多玛仓库剧院进行连续演出。
examples.en: They're doing a run at the Cambridge Playhouse.

defines.trans_en: a situation in which many people suddenly buy a particular product

examples.ch: 就因为这场雨，大家都在抢购雨伞。
examples.en: There's been a run on umbrellas because of all this rain.

defines.trans_en: a situation in which many people suddenly sell a particular product

examples.ch: 突然出现的抛售导致美元贬值。
examples.en: A sudden run on the dollar has lowered its value.

defines.trans_en: an area of ground of limited size for keeping animals

examples.ch: 牧羊场／养鸡场
examples.en: a sheep/chicken/hen run

defines.trans_en: in cricket and baseball, a single point, scored by running from one place to another

examples.ch: 英格兰队需要得到105分才能赢得比赛。
examples.en: England need 105 runs to win the game.

examples.ch: 本垒打
examples.en: a home run

defines.trans_ch: （连裤袜或长筒袜上的）脱线，抽丝
defines.trans_en: a long, vertical hole in tights and stockings

examples.ch: 我的连裤袜被椅子上的钉子刮了一下，抽丝了。
examples.en: I've got a run in my tights from the nail on my chair.

phrases.trans_en: A run of something is a continuous period during which it lasts or is repeated.

examples.ch: 一个又一个的成功／一连串的失败／厄运连连
examples.en: a run of successes/defeats/bad luck

phrases.trans_en: the usual type of something

examples.ch: 他们的饭菜是一般宾馆饭菜的水平。
examples.en: Their food is the general run of hotel cooking.

phrases.trans_en: a condition of the bowels in which the contents are passed out of the body too often and in a form that is too liquid

defines.trans_ch: 伤心的，悲哀的;令人难过的，令人遗憾的
defines.trans_en: unhappy or sorry

examples.ch: 我刚刚得到一些令人伤心的消息。
examples.en: I've just received some very sad news.

examples.ch: 她露出了一丝苦笑。
examples.en: She gave a sad smile.

examples.ch: 很遗憾旅行被迫取消了。
examples.en: It's sad (that) the trip had to be cancelled.

examples.ch: 你不能来，我很遗憾。
examples.en: I'm so sad (that) you can't come.

examples.ch: 今年看到这么多失败的事情真是令人难过。
examples.en: It's sad to see so many failures this year.

examples.ch: 听说他们分手了，我很难过。
examples.en: I was sad to hear that they'd split up.

defines.trans_en: If something looks sad, it looks worse than it should because it is not being cared for.

examples.ch: 给那些花浇点儿水——它们看上去蔫巴巴的。
examples.en: Give those flowers some water - they're looking a little sad.

defines.trans_ch: 令人遗憾的;令人不快的
defines.trans_en: not satisfactory or pleasant

examples.ch: 令人遗憾的事实是，我们无法为所有的人提供住所。
examples.en: The sad fact/truth is we can't afford to provide homes for all.

examples.ch: 十分糟糕的时局
examples.en: a very sad state of affairs

defines.trans_ch: 老土的;乏味的;不受欢迎的
defines.trans_en: showing that you are not fashionable or interesting or have no friends

examples.ch: 你喜欢读时间表？你可真无聊！
examples.en: You enjoy reading timetables? You sad man!

examples.ch: 星期六晚上呆在家里真是无聊。
examples.en: Staying at home on a Saturday night is just sad.

phrases.trans_en: something you say when you are telling someone about something bad that happened

examples.ch: 真可惜，那枚戒指一直没有找到。
examples.en: Sad to say, the ring was never found.

defines.trans_ch: 季节性不适（冬季因日照时间缩短而引发的精力不济，seasonal affective disorder的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for seasonal affective disorder: a medical condition in which a person does not have much energy and enthusiasm during the winter because of the reduced period of natural light
not in danger or likely to be harmed

examples.ch: 在有些城市，夜晚独自外出会觉得不安全。
examples.en: In some cities you don't feel safe going out alone at night.

defines.trans_en: not harmed or damaged

examples.ch: 她说所有的人质都平安无事。
examples.en: She said that all the hostages were safe.

defines.trans_ch: 不会造成危险的；可靠的
defines.trans_en: not dangerous or likely to cause harm

examples.ch: 儿童安全游乐区
examples.en: a safe play area for children

examples.ch: 可靠的司机
examples.en: a safe driver

examples.ch: 那架梯子看起来不安全。
examples.en: That ladder doesn't look safe.

examples.ch: 她祝我们一路平安。
examples.en: She wished us a safe journey.

examples.ch: 儿童使用这种药物安全吗？
examples.en: Is this medicine safe for children?

examples.ch: 现在可以安全过马路了。
examples.en: It's safe to cross the road now.

defines.trans_en: (of a place) where something is not likely to be lost or stolen

examples.ch: 把你的护照放在一个安全的地方。
examples.en: Keep your passport in a safe place.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to things that do not involve any risk

examples.ch: 我认为我们应该选择最保险的方案。
examples.en: I think we should go for the safest option (= the one that involves the least risks).

examples.ch: 他平常从来记不住我的生日，我敢肯定这一次他又忘了！
examples.en: He never remembers my birthday, so it's a safe bet (= I am certain) he'll forget again this time!

defines.trans_en: If an official elected position in is safe, it is likely to be won by the political party that has won it at previous elections.

examples.ch: 一个十拿九稳的保守党议席
examples.en: a safe Conservative seat

phrases.trans_en: completely safe and without injury or damage

examples.ch: 在山里迷路3天后，所有的登山者都安然无恙地回到了家。
examples.en: After three days lost in the mountains, all the climbers arrived home safe and sound.

defines.trans_en: a strong box or cupboard with special locks where valuable things, especially money or jewels (= precious stones), are kept

examples.ch: 盗贼们撬开保险箱，偷走了里面所有的东西。
examples.en: Thieves broke into/cracked (= opened by force) the safe and stole everything in it.

defines.trans_en: When a boat or a ship sails, it travels on the water.

examples.ch: 那艘船沿着海岸航行。
examples.en: The boat sailed along/down the coast.

examples.ch: 战舰驶过时，甲板上所有的人都挥手致意。
examples.en: As the battleship sailed by/past, everyone on deck waved.

examples.ch: 这艘船驶往中国。
examples.en: The ship was sailing to China.

defines.trans_en: to control a boat that has no engine and is pushed by the wind

examples.ch: 他驾驶着小游艇沿河逆流而上。
examples.en: He sailed the dinghy up the river.

examples.ch: 她独自一人驾驶帆船周游了整个世界。
examples.en: She sailed around the world single-handed in her yacht.

defines.trans_en: When a ship sails, it starts travelling, and when people sail from a particular place or at a particular time, they start travelling in a ship.

examples.ch: 他们的船下周五启航去孟买。
examples.en: Their ship sails for Bombay next Friday.

defines.trans_ch: 轻快地移动;（人）自信地行走
defines.trans_en: to move quickly, easily, and (of a person) confidently

examples.ch: 球飞过了花园的围栏。
examples.en: The ball went sailing over the fence.

examples.ch: 他走路时没有注意，和她撞个正着。
examples.en: He wasn't looking where he was going, and just sailed straight into her.

examples.ch: 曼联队很轻松地取得了决赛的胜利。
examples.en: Manchester United sailed on (= continued easily) to victory in the final.

defines.trans_en: a sheet of material attached to a pole on a boat to catch the wind and make the boat move

examples.ch: 扬／收帆
examples.en: to hoist/lower the sails

defines.trans_en: On a windmill, a sail is any of the wide blades that are turned by the wind in order to produce power.
a journey by boat or ship

examples.ch: 从这里坐船到最近的岛屿需要航行两天。
examples.en: It's two days' sail/It's a two-day sail (= a journey of two days by sea) from here to the nearest island.

phrases.trans_en: to begin a boat journey

examples.ch: 我们从科威特启航。
examples.en: We set sail from Kuwait.

examples.ch: 他们启航驶往法国。
examples.en: They set sail for France.

defines.trans_en: the sport or activity of using boats with sails

examples.ch: 帆船运动俱乐部
examples.en: the sailing club

examples.ch: 她喜欢帆船运动。
examples.en: She loves to go sailing.

defines.trans_en: an occasion when a ship leaves a port

examples.ch: 有很多船开往丹顿岛。
examples.en: There are frequent sailings to Staten Island.

defines.trans_ch: （通常用生菜等做成的）蔬菜色拉
defines.trans_en: a mixture of uncooked vegetables, usually including lettuce, eaten either as a separate dish or with other food

examples.ch: 用醋油调味料拌色拉。
examples.en: Toss (= mix) the salad with a vinaigrette dressing.

examples.ch: 用什锦色拉配意大利调味饭。
examples.en: Serve the risotto with a mixed/green salad.

examples.ch: 色拉碗
examples.en: a salad bowl

defines.trans_ch: （用小块生蔬菜或熟蔬菜拌上蛋黄酱做成的）蛋黄酱拌色拉
defines.trans_en: cooked or uncooked vegetables cut into very small pieces and often mixed with mayonnaise

examples.ch: 蛋黄酱土豆色拉
examples.en: potato salad

examples.ch: 蛋黄酱大米／意大利面食色拉
examples.en: rice/pasta salad

phrases.trans_en: a salad made with tuna, cheese, egg, etc. and lettuce or other cold ingredients

examples.ch: 她午餐吃的是金枪鱼色拉。
examples.en: She had a tuna salad for lunch.

phrases.trans_ch: （将金枪鱼／奶酪／鸡蛋等拌上蛋黄酱做三明治时用）
phrases.trans_en: tuna, cheese, egg, etc. mixed with mayonnaise, used to make a sandwich

examples.ch: 请给我一份黑面包鸡蛋三明治。
examples.en: I'll have egg salad on brown (bread), please.

defines.trans_en: an act of exchanging something for money

examples.ch: 禁止出售香烟／酒。
examples.en: The sale of cigarettes/alcohol is forbidden.

examples.ch: 建筑公司每卖一套房子都能获得佣金。
examples.en: The building company gets commission on each house sale.

examples.ch: 我一上午什么都没卖出去。
examples.en: I haven't made a sale all morning.

examples.ch: 他们将下调价格而不是失去这单生意。
examples.en: They'll drop the price rather than lose the sale.

defines.trans_ch: （为筹集资金而进行的）销售活动，义卖活动
defines.trans_en: an occasion when things are sold in order to make money

examples.ch: 慈善／圣诞节／图书售卖
examples.en: a charity/Christmas/book sale

examples.ch: 车库／后院旧货售卖
examples.en: a garage/yard sale

defines.trans_en: an auction (= public sale)

examples.ch: 古董家具拍卖
examples.en: a sale of antique furniture

examples.ch: 牛畜拍卖
examples.en: a cattle sale

defines.trans_en: an occasion when goods are sold at a lower price than usual

examples.ch: 季中／季末大减价
examples.en: a mid-season/end-of-season sale

examples.ch: 清仓／歇业大甩卖
examples.en: a clearance/closing-down sale

examples.ch: 这是我在一月大减价时买的。
examples.en: I bought this in the January sales.

examples.ch: 降价商品／促销价
examples.en: sale goods/prices

phrases.trans_en: available to buy

examples.ch: 这幅画出售吗？
examples.en: Is this painting for sale?

examples.ch: 我们的邻居上周开始登广告出售他们的房子。
examples.en: Our neighbours put their house up for sale (= started to advertise that they want to sell it) last week.

phrases.trans_en: the department of a company that organizes and does the selling of the company's products or services

examples.ch: 他在销售部门工作。
examples.en: He works in Sales.

examples.ch: 销售部／销售部经理
examples.en: the sales department/manager

phrases.trans_en: the number of products sold

examples.ch: 今年的销售量超过了前两年销售量的总和。
examples.en: Sales this year exceeded the total for the two previous years.

phrases.trans_en: available to buy in a shop

examples.ch: 音像店目前有售。
examples.en: On sale at record stores now.

phrases.trans_en: a system by which goods are supplied to shopsand can be returned if they are not sold within a particular period of time

examples.ch: 我们可以按剩货包退的条件供货。
examples.en: We can supply goods on a sale or return basis.

phrases.trans_en: reduced in price

examples.ch: 你能告诉我这条裙子是否降价吗？
examples.en: Can you tell me if this dress is in the sale?

defines.trans_en: a common white substance found in sea water and in the ground, used especially to add flavour to food or to preserve it

examples.ch: 盐和胡椒粉
examples.en: salt and pepper

examples.ch: 请把盐递过来好吗？
examples.en: Can you pass the salt, please?

examples.ch: 往酱汁里加点儿盐。
examples.en: Add a pinch of (= small amount of) salt to the sauce.

defines.trans_en: a chemical substance that is a combination of a metal or a base with an acid

examples.ch: 硝酸钾、氯化钾都是钾盐。
examples.en: Potassium nitrate and potassium chloride are potassium salts.

defines.trans_ch: 言语和语言治疗（speech and language therapy 的缩写）
defines.trans_en:
abbreviation for 
speech and language therapy

defines.trans_ch: 言语和语言治疗（speech and language therapy 的缩写）
defines.trans_en:
abbreviation for 
speech and language therapist
containing or preserved in salt

examples.ch: 盐水
examples.en: salt water

examples.ch: 腌鳕鱼／猪肉
examples.en: salt cod/pork

defines.trans_en: to add salt to or put salt on something

examples.ch: 不要忘了往土豆里加盐。
examples.en: Don't forget to salt the potatoes.

examples.ch: 结冰时，这座城市里的道路上会撒上盐来化冰。
examples.en: When it's icy, the city salts the roads to thaw the ice.

defines.trans_ch: （美苏）限制战略武器会谈（Strategic Arms Limitation Talks的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for Strategic Arms Limitation Talks: a series of discussions between the US and the USSR that took place from 1969 to 1979 and aimed to limit the number of nuclear weapons
not another different place, time, situation, person, or thing

examples.ch: 我弟弟和我睡在同一个房间。
examples.en: My brother and I sleep in the same room.

examples.ch: 蕾切尔还在和同一个男朋友交往。
examples.en: Rachel's still going out with the same boyfriend.

examples.ch: 就在同一天，他听说自己通过了考试。
examples.en: That (very) same day, he heard he'd passed his exams.

examples.ch: 如果有机会，我还会做同样的事情。
examples.en: I would do the same thing again if I had the chance.

examples.ch: 他们每个星期都在同一家餐馆吃饭。
examples.en: They eat at the same restaurant every week.

examples.ch: 我们明天在同一时间见面好吗？
examples.en: Shall we meet up at the same time tomorrow?

phrases.trans_en: exactly like another or each other

examples.ch: 我孪生姐姐的鼻子和我的长得一样。
examples.en: My twin sister and I have the same nose.

examples.ch: 她穿的裙子和我的一模一样。
examples.en: She was wearing exactly the same dress as I was.

examples.ch: 希拉里和我同岁。
examples.en: Hilary's the same age as me.

examples.ch: 她养育孩子的方法和她母亲完全一样。
examples.en: She brought up her children in just (= exactly) the same way her mother did.

phrases.trans_en: exactly like

examples.ch: 人们说我和我姐姐长得一模一样。
examples.en: People say I look just the same as my sister.

examples.ch: 约翰的想法和我一样——那太贵了。
examples.en: John thinks the same as I do - it's just too expensive.

phrases.trans_en: not changed

examples.ch: 这么多年过去了，你看起来还是老样子——一点儿也没变。
examples.en: After all these years you look exactly the same - you haven't changed a bit.

examples.ch: 查尔斯还是老样子。
examples.en: Charles is just the same as always.

phrases.trans_ch: 同样的事物；同样的情况
phrases.trans_en: not another different thing or situation

examples.ch: 我对物理一窍不通，化学也一样——我完全理解不了。
examples.en: I'm terrible at physics, and it's the same with chemistry - I get it all wrong.

phrases.trans_en: not another different person

examples.ch: “接电话的是玛丽昂吗？”“正是。”
examples.en: "Was that Marion on the phone?" "The (very) same."

phrases.trans_en: in the same way

examples.ch: 我们对待自己所有的孩子都一视同仁。
examples.en: We treat all our children the same.

examples.ch: 和别人一样，我也需要一些属于自己的时间。
examples.en: I need some time to myself, the same as anybody else.

defines.trans_en: two pieces of bread with cheese, salad, or meat, usually cold, between them

examples.ch: 金枪鱼／火腿三明治
examples.en: a tuna/ham sandwich

examples.ch: 烤三明治
examples.en: a toasted sandwich

examples.ch: 三明治快餐店／亭
examples.en: a sandwich bar/box

examples.ch: 三明治夹馅
examples.en: sandwich fillings

defines.trans_en: a cake consisting of two thin, round layers with a filling such as cream between them

examples.ch: 果酱奶油夹心饼
examples.en: a jam and cream sandwich

examples.ch: 维多利亚夹心饼
examples.en: a Victoria sandwich

defines.trans_en: to stop someone or something from being killed, injured, or destroyed

examples.ch: 使用安全带挽救了许多人的生命。
examples.en: Wearing seat belts has saved many lives.

examples.ch: 他掉进了河里，不过他的朋友救了他的命。
examples.en: He fell in the river but his friend saved him from drowning.

examples.ch: 他只好借钱挽救自己的企业。
examples.en: He had to borrow money to save his business.

examples.ch: 他拼命努力，试图挽救他们濒临破裂的婚姻。
examples.en: He was desperately trying to save their failing marriage.

examples.ch: 我们都需要为拯救这个星球尽一份力。
examples.en: We all need to do our part to save the planet.

examples.ch: 前网球冠军正在发球争取挽回败局。
examples.en: The former tennis champion was now serving to save the match (= to win the next point so that the other player did not win this part of the competition).

defines.trans_en: to keep something, especially money, for use in the future

examples.ch: 汤姆每周都把自己的零花钱攒起来。
examples.en: Tom's been saving his pocket money every week.

examples.ch: 我们正在攒钱准备买一辆新车。
examples.en: We're saving (up) for a new car.

examples.ch: 我把过去所有的信件都保存了下来，以便再读。
examples.en: I save all my old letters in case I want to read them again.

examples.ch: 你坐的那张桌子给我留个位子好吗？
examples.en: Save me a place at your table, OK?

defines.trans_ch: 将（计算机上的信息）存盘，保存
defines.trans_en: to put information into a computer's memory or onto a computer disk

examples.ch: 不要忘记经常存盘。
examples.en: Don't forget to save your work regularly.

examples.ch: 存盘按Control和S键。
examples.en: To save, press Control S.

defines.trans_en: to prevent time, money, or effort being wasted or spent

examples.ch: 开车会省些时间。
examples.en: You'll save time if you take the car.

examples.ch: 谢谢你的帮助——这省了我很多事。
examples.en: Thanks for your help - it saved me a lot of work.

examples.ch: 我借给你一个旅行包——省得你专门再买一个。
examples.en: I'll lend you a bag for your trip - it'll save you buying one.

examples.ch: 你能等一下（在我不这么忙的时候）再告诉我吗？
examples.en: Can you save it for later (= tell me your news later when I am less busy)?

defines.trans_ch: （足球等球类运动中）救（球），阻止对方得（分）
defines.trans_en: in football and similar games, to stop the ball from going into the goal when a player on the other team has kicked or hit it

phrases.trans_ch: 使（某人）免遭杀害；救（某人）的性命
phrases.trans_en: to stop someone from being killed

phrases.trans_ch: 帮助（某人）脱离困境（或窘境）
phrases.trans_en: to help someone escape from a difficult or unpleasant situation

examples.ch: 谢谢你帮助我完成那个报告——你真是帮了我大忙！
examples.en: Thanks for helping me with that report - you saved my life!

defines.trans_ch: （足球等球类运动中）救（球），阻止对方得（分）
defines.trans_en: in football or similar games, when a player stops the ball from going into the goal when it is hit or kicked by a player from the other team

examples.ch: 守门员在比赛的最后关头有一次精彩的扑救。
examples.en: The goalkeeper made a great save in the last minute of the game.

defines.trans_en: but or except for

examples.ch: 除了其中有一份文件没有找到之外，他们找到了所有丢失的文件。
examples.en: They found all the lost documents save one.

defines.trans_en: to pronounce words or sounds, to express a thought, opinion, or suggestion, or to state a fact or instruction

examples.ch: 小孩子觉得长词不好说。
examples.en: Small children find it difficult to say long words.

examples.ch: 她跟所有的朋友道别后就离开了。
examples.en: She said goodbye to all her friends and left.

examples.ch: 本从来不忘说“请”和“谢谢”。
examples.en: Ben never forgets to say "Please" and "Thank you".

examples.ch: “法语里的‘再见’怎么说？”
examples.en: How do you say "goodbye" in French?

examples.ch: 对不起，你刚才说什么？
examples.en: I'm sorry, what did you say?

examples.ch: 你知道她对他说了什么吗？
examples.en: Do you know what she said to him?

examples.ch: 关于这座房子他们怎么说？
examples.en: What did they say about the house?

examples.ch: “今晚我要出去，”她说。
examples.en: "I'm going out this evening," she said.

examples.ch: 他自言自语道：“这怎么也行不通。”
examples.en: He said to himself (= thought), "This will never work."

examples.ch: 医生说他需要几周时间才能康复。
examples.en: The doctors say (that) it will take him a few weeks to recover.

examples.ch: 她没说来不来。
examples.en: She didn't say whether she was coming.

examples.ch: 她告诉你为什么不来了吗？
examples.en: Did she say (= tell you) why she wasn't coming?

examples.ch: 他说（让我）在这里和他见面。
examples.en: He said (= told me) to meet him here.

examples.ch: 我有些事要跟你讲。
examples.en: I've got something to say to you.

examples.ch: 报价太令人满意了，我无法拒绝。
examples.en: The offer was so good that I couldn't say no (= couldn't refuse).

defines.trans_en: to think or believe

examples.ch: 人们/他们都说他已经100多岁了。
examples.en: People/They say (that) he's over 100.

examples.ch: “今年夏天将会很热。”“大家都这么说。”
examples.en: "It's going to be a very hot summer." "So they say (= that is what people believe)."

examples.ch: 她是一个严格的领导，有人可能会认为她太严格了。
examples.en: She is a firm leader, too firm, some might say (= some people believe that she is too firm).

defines.trans_en: to give (as) an opinion or suggestion about something

examples.ch: “你认为谁会得到这份工作？”“我宁愿不发表意见。”
examples.en: "Who do you think will get the job?" "I'd rather not say."

examples.ch: 你到底是什么意思？
examples.en: What are you saying, exactly? (= What do you mean?)

examples.ch: 我们已经开了一整天车——我觉得我们现在应该找一家汽车旅馆了。
examples.en: We've been driving all day - I say (that) we start looking for a motel now.

examples.ch: 你觉得我们把车卖了怎么样？
examples.en: What do you say we sell the car? (= What do you think about selling it?)

defines.trans_en: to show what you think without using words

examples.ch: 他脸上的表情说明他知道发生了什么事情。
examples.en: The look on his face said (= showed) (that) he knew what had happened.

defines.trans_en: When something or someone is said to be a particular thing, that is what people think or believe about it, him, or her.

examples.ch: 据说拉丁语是一种很难学的语言。
examples.en: It is said (that) Latin is a difficult language to learn.

examples.ch: 据说他100多岁了。
examples.en: He's said to be over 100.

defines.trans_en: to give information in writing, numbers, or signs

examples.ch: 我的表是3点钟。
examples.en: My watch says three o'clock.

examples.ch: 你能看见那个指示牌上写着什么吗？
examples.en: Can you read what that sign says?

examples.ch: 报上说他们找到了做那件事的人。
examples.en: It says in the paper (that) they've found the man who did it.

examples.ch: 瓶子的标签上写着一日服用三片。
examples.en: It says on the bottle to take three tabletsa day.

defines.trans_ch: （用以表示惊讶、惊喜或唤起听话人的注意）哎呀
defines.trans_en: used to express surprise or pleasure, or to attract attention to what you are about to say

examples.ch: 哎呀，你真好！
examples.en: Say, that's really good of you!

examples.ch: 嗨，今晚出去玩吧！
examples.en: Say, how about going out tonight?

examples.ch: 呀，你的帽子真漂亮！
examples.en: I say, what a splendid hat you're wearing!

defines.trans_en: (the right to give) an opinion about something

examples.ch: 你不能安静一会儿让我发表一下意见吗？
examples.en: Keep quiet for a minute and let me have my say.

examples.ch: 法官通常拥有最终的决定权。
examples.en: The judge usually has the final say.

defines.trans_en: a place where children go to be educated

examples.ch: 小／中学
examples.en: a primary/secondary school

examples.ch: 小学／初中／高中
examples.en: an elementary/a middle/a high school

examples.ch: 密尔顿路小学
examples.en: Milton Road School

examples.ch: 他们正在镇里建一座新学校。
examples.en: They're building a new school in the town.

examples.ch: 她每天早上开车送孩子上学。
examples.en: She drives the kids to school every morning.

examples.ch: 我和卢克的弟弟在同一所学校念书。
examples.en: I went to school with (= I went to the same school at the same time as) Luke's brother.

examples.ch: 我和卢克的弟弟在同一所学校念书。
examples.en: I was at school with Luke's brother.

examples.ch: 埃米莉今天上学了吗？还是病还没好？
examples.en: Is Emily in/at school today or is she still ill?

examples.ch: 你今天在学校学了什么？
examples.en: What did you learn at school today

examples.ch: 你在哪所学校上学？
examples.en: Which school do you go to (formal attend)?

examples.ch: 学校餐／校服／建筑
examples.en: school lunches/uniform/buildings

defines.trans_ch: 上学期间，读书阶段;上学
defines.trans_en: the period of your life during which you go to school, or the teaching and learning activities which happen at school

examples.ch: 大部分儿童在5岁开始上学。
examples.en: Most children start/begin school at the age of five.

examples.ch: 你毕业后想做什么？
examples.en: What do you want to do when you leave school (= finish studying at school)?

examples.ch: 我喜欢／讨厌上学。
examples.en: I love/hate school.

examples.ch: 我妹妹在纽约市教书。
examples.en: My sister teaches school (= teaches children in a school) in New York City.

defines.trans_en: the time during the day when children are studying in school

examples.ch: 上学前／放学后
examples.en: before/after school

examples.ch: 学校上午9点开始上课，下午3：30放学。
examples.en: School starts at 9 a.m. and finishes at 3.30 p.m.

defines.trans_en: all the children and teachers at a school

examples.ch: 全校师生都为乔尔在锦标赛中的胜利感到高兴。
examples.en: The whole school is/are delighted about Joel's success in the championships.

defines.trans_en: a part of a college or university specializing in a particular subject or group of subjects

examples.ch: 亚非学院
examples.en: the School of Oriental and African Studies

examples.ch: 她去爱丁堡医学院读书。
examples.en: She went to medical school in Edinburgh.

defines.trans_en: a place where people can study a particular subject either some of the time or all of the time

examples.ch: 驾校／舞蹈训练班
examples.en: a driving/dancing school

examples.ch: 伦敦商学院
examples.en: the London Business School

defines.trans_en: a college or university or the time that a student spends there

examples.ch: 我们第一次见面是在读研究生的时候。
examples.en: We first met in graduate school (= while doing a second or third university degree).

examples.ch: 我们在亚特兰大一起上大学。
examples.en: We went to school together in Atlanta.

defines.trans_en: a group of painters, writers, poets, etc. whose work is similar, especially similar to that of a particular leader

examples.ch: 佛兰芒派
examples.en: the Flemish School

examples.ch: 印象画派
examples.en: the Impressionist school of painting

defines.trans_en: a large number of fish or other sea creatures swimming in a group

examples.ch: 一群海豚／鲸
examples.en: a school of dolphins/whales

defines.trans_en: to train a person or animal to do something

examples.ch: 训练狗／马需要很强的耐心。
examples.en: It takes a lot of patience to school a dog/horse.

examples.ch: 你必须学会宽容。
examples.en: You must school yourself to be tolerant.

defines.trans_en: to teach a child

examples.ch: 她的孩子受到了很好的行为教育。
examples.en: Her children are well schooled in correct behaviour.

defines.trans_en: a flat surface in a cinema, on a television, or as part of a computer, on which pictures or words are shown

examples.ch: 我们的电视屏幕是19英寸的。
examples.en: Our television has a 19-inch screen.

examples.ch: 请马上来电影院观看《罗宾汉历险记》吧。
examples.en: Coming to your screens (= cinemas) shortly, "The Adventures of Robin Hood".

examples.ch: 她的理想是给电影、电视写剧本。
examples.en: Her ambition is to write for the screen (= for television and films).

examples.ch: 在电脑上写信，你可以很容易地在屏幕上作修改。
examples.en: Write the letter on the computer, then you can make changes easily on screen.

defines.trans_en: a vertical structure that is used to separate one area from another, especially to hide something or to protect you from something unpleasant or dangerous

examples.ch: 护士在病人床边拉上了屏风，使医生可以单独为病人检查。
examples.en: The nurse pulled a screen around the bed so that the doctor could examine the patient in private.

examples.ch: 花园尽头的一排树木把工厂难看的外墙遮住了。
examples.en: A screen of trees at the bottom of the garden hid the ugly factory walls.

defines.trans_ch: （危险或不法活动的）庇护（所），掩护（物）
defines.trans_en: an activity that is not dangerous or illegal but is used to hide something that is

examples.ch: 那家咖啡馆不过是用来掩护他们的犯罪活动的。
examples.en: That café's just a screen for their criminal activities.

phrases.trans_en: television

examples.ch: 他已经制作了几部电视电影。
examples.en: He's made several films for the small screen.

phrases.trans_en: cinema

examples.ch: 这是你第一次出演电影角色，是吗？
examples.en: So this is your first appearance on the big screen?

defines.trans_en: to test or examine someone or something to discover if there is anything wrong with him, her, or it

examples.ch: 所有50岁以上的妇女都要作乳腺癌筛查。
examples.en: Women over 50 should be screened for breast cancer.

examples.ch: 完全不合格的求职者在第一轮面试时就被筛选掉了。
examples.en: Completely unsuitable candidates were screened out (= tested and refused) at the first interview.

defines.trans_en: to show or broadcast a film or television programme

examples.ch: 这个节目没有在英国电视上播出过。
examples.en: The programme was not screened on British television.

defines.trans_en: to protect or hide

examples.ch: 她抬手遮住耀眼的亮光。
examples.en: She raised her hand to screen her eyes from the bright light.

defines.trans_en: to protect someone by taking the blame yourself

examples.ch: 丈夫说自己是凶手，但我们认为他妻子才是凶手——他只是在替她掩饰。
examples.en: The husband says he's the murderer but we think it was his wife - he's just screening her.

phrases.trans_ch: 筛选来电（以决定是否接听）
phrases.trans_en: to delay your decision to answer the phone until you know who is calling you

examples.ch: 吃晚饭的时候，来电话我总是先看来电显示再决定是否接听。
examples.en: I always screen my calls while I'm eating dinner.

defines.trans_en: a child's vehicle with two or three small wheels joined to the bottom of a narrow board and a long vertical handle attached to the front wheel. It is ridden by standing with one foot on the board and pushing against the ground with the other foot.

defines.trans_ch: 小型摩托车（同 motor scooter）
defines.trans_en:
a 
motor scooter
the salty water that covers a large part of the surface of the earth, or a large area of salty water, smaller than an ocean, that is partly or completely surrounded by land

examples.ch: 地中海
examples.en: the Mediterranean Sea

examples.ch: 我们去海里游泳。
examples.en: We went swimming in the sea.

examples.ch: 当我们横渡海峡时，海上风平浪静／水平如镜／波浪起伏／波涛汹涌。
examples.en: The sea was calm/smooth/choppy/rough when we crossed the Channel.

examples.ch: 难民在海上度过了40天才到达陆地。
examples.en: The refugees were at sea (= in a boat on the sea a long way from land) for 40 days before reaching land.

examples.ch: 我们移居美国时，把行李海运了过去。
examples.en: When we moved to the US, we sent our things by sea (= in a ship).

examples.ch: 我们今年在海边度过了一周。
examples.en: We spent a week by the sea (= on the coast) this year.

examples.ch: 不一会儿，我们便离开了小艇停靠区，向外海驶去。
examples.en: Soon we had left the marina and were heading towards the open sea (= the part of the sea a long way from land).

defines.trans_ch: 海（指月球表面的广阔平坦地区，过去被认为是海）
defines.trans_en: one of the large, flat areas on the moon that in the past were thought to be seas

phrases.trans_en: a large amount or number of something

examples.ch: 老师向下看去，看到一张张微笑的脸庞。
examples.en: The teacher looked down and saw a sea of smiling faces.

phrases.trans_en: (of a ship) to leave a port and start a journey

examples.ch: 船将在今晚涨潮时启航。
examples.en: The boats will put (out) to sea on this evening's high tide.

defines.trans_en: a piece of furniture or part of a train, plane, etc. that has been designed for someone to sit on

examples.ch: 椅子、沙发和长凳是不同类型的座位。
examples.en: Chairs, sofas and benches are different types of seat.

examples.ch: 请坐。
examples.en: Please have/take a seat (= sit down).

examples.ch: 小轿车通常有一个驾驶座、一个前座／客座和几个后排座。
examples.en: A car usually has a driver's seat, a front/passenger seat and back/rear seats.

examples.ch: 我的票是22D，但已经有人占了那个位子。
examples.en: My ticket says 22D but there's already someone in (= sitting on) that seat.

examples.ch: 这个位子有人吗？
examples.en: Is this seat free/taken (= is anyone using it)?

examples.ch: 我去买东西吃的时候，你能否帮我看着我的座位？
examples.en: Would you keep (= stop anyone else from sitting in) my seat (for me) while I go get some food?

examples.ch: 没叫你们离开之前请不要离开座位。
examples.en: Please stay in/keep your seats (= stay sitting down) until asked to leave.

examples.ch: 我可以预订两张明晚演出的票吗？
examples.en: Could I book/reserve two seats (= arrange for them to be officially kept for me) for tomorrow evening's performance?

defines.trans_en: the part of a piece of furniture or clothing on which a person sits

examples.ch: 我不小心把咖啡洒在了扶手椅的椅面上。
examples.en: I've spilled some coffee on the seat of the armchair.

examples.ch: 那条裤子的臀部有点儿紧绷绷的，你要不要试试大一码的？
examples.en: The seat of those trousers looks a little tight. Do you want to try a larger size?

defines.trans_en: an official position as a politician or member of a group of people who control something

examples.ch: 她是董事会成员。
examples.en: She has a seat on the board of directors.

examples.ch: 在下个月的选举中，他可能会失去自己在市议会的席位。
examples.en: He is expected to lose his seat on the city council in next month's elections.

examples.ch: 她在2004年当选议员。
examples.en: She won her seat in Parliament in 2004.

examples.ch: 他（在选举中）能够稳保席位。
examples.en: He has a very safe seat (= a position that is very unlikely to be lost in an election).

defines.trans_en: the place in an office where a particular person sits

examples.ch: 抱歉，他现在不在他的座位上。
examples.en: I'm sorry - he's not in his seat right now.

defines.trans_en: a place on a course to study something

examples.ch: 当受到学费后，学院会发信确认你在课程内的位置。
examples.en: On receipt of the tuition fees, the college will issue a letter confirming your seat on the course.

defines.trans_en: a place that acts as a base or centre for an important activity

examples.ch: 美国政府所在地是华盛顿。
examples.en: The seat of government in the US is in Washington, DC.

examples.ch: 圣彼得堡是俄国革命的中心。
examples.en: St Petersburg was the seat of the Russian Revolution.

defines.trans_en: to arrange for someone to have a particular seat

examples.ch: 服务员笑容满面地招呼我，并安排我们在窗边坐下。
examples.en: The waiter greeted me with a big smile and seated us by the window.

defines.trans_en: (of a building, room, table, or vehicle) to have enough seats for the stated number of people

examples.ch: 新音乐厅可容纳1500人。
examples.en: The new concert hall seats 1,500 people.

phrases.trans_en: to sit somewhere

examples.ch: “见到你们真是太高兴了！”她边说边在埃莉诺和玛丽安娜中间坐了下来。
examples.en: "I'm so glad to see you!" she said, seating herself between Eleanor and Marianne.

defines.trans_en: with enough seats for the particular number of people

examples.ch: 有2000个座位的剧院
examples.en: a 2,000-seat theatre

defines.trans_en: immediately after the first and before any others

examples.ch: 卡拉是她的第一个还是第二个孩子？
examples.en: Is Carla her first or second child?

examples.ch: 这是今年冬天以来我得的第二场流感。
examples.en: This is the second time I've had flu this winter.

examples.ch: 今天是（三月）二日。
examples.en: Today is the second (of March).

defines.trans_en: the position in which a person finishes a race or competition if they finish immediately behind the winner

examples.ch: 一等奖是巴巴多斯双周游，二等奖是罗马周末游。
examples.en: First prize is two weeks in Barbados and second prize is a weekend in Rome.

examples.ch: 琼斯在跳远比赛中得第二名。
examples.en: Jones took second place in the long jump.

defines.trans_en: Second is used to show that only one thing is better, bigger, etc. than the thing mentioned

examples.ch: 圣彼得堡是俄罗斯第二大城市。
examples.en: St Petersburg is Russia's second (biggest/largest) city.

examples.ch: 伊拉克的石油储量仅次于沙特阿拉伯。
examples.en: Iraq's oil reserves are second only to Saudi Arabia's.

defines.trans_en: another

examples.ch: 她常常被人们称为玛丽莲‧梦露第二。
examples.en: She is often described as a second Marilyn Monroe.

examples.ch: 你真的应该好好珍惜这个机会，因为你不会再有这样的机会了。
examples.en: You really should make the most of the opportunity, because you won't get a second chance.

examples.ch: 理查德和莉兹在山区还有一个家。
examples.en: Richard and Liz have a second home in the mountains.

examples.ch: 注意听她讲，因为她不会再解释第二遍。
examples.en: Pay attention to what she's saying because she won't explain it a second time.

defines.trans_en: happening only once out of every two possible times

examples.ch: 我们已经决定每两年举行一次会议。
examples.en: We've decided to hold the conference every second year.

defines.trans_en: after the first and before any others

examples.ch: 罗伯逊得了赛跑冠军，卡梅伦得了第二名。
examples.en: Robertson won the race and Cameron was/came/finished second.

examples.ch: 在这个行当，钱是第一位的，而原则要次要得多。
examples.en: In this business, money comes first and principles come a very poor second (= they are much less important).

defines.trans_en: used to introduce the second thing in a list of things you want to say or write

examples.ch: 有两个原因可以很好地解释我们为什么不能这样做：第一，我们没有钱；其次，我们没有时间。
examples.en: There are two good reasons why we can't do it. First, we can't afford it, and second, we don't have time.

defines.trans_en: a short unit of time that is equal to a 60th of a minute

examples.ch: 1分钟有60秒。
examples.en: There are 60 seconds in a minute.

examples.ch: 这些电脑每秒钟处理几百万个指令。
examples.en: These computers process millions of instructions per second.

examples.ch: 新系统可以极快地查出来电号码。
examples.en: The new system can trace a phone call in a fraction of a second.

defines.trans_en: a very short period of time

examples.ch: “来呀，赶快！”“等一下，我关一下窗户就好。”
examples.en: "Come on, hurry up!" "I'll just/only be a second - I need to close the window."

examples.ch: 你能抽出点儿时间吗，保罗？我想和你说句话。
examples.en: Do you have a second, Paul? I need to talk to you.

examples.ch: 花不了多少时间。
examples.en: It won't take a second (= it will be very quick).

examples.ch: 等一会儿再试。
examples.en: Wait a couple of/a few seconds before trying again.

defines.trans_en: the second person or thing to do or be something, or the second person or thing mentioned

examples.ch: 这是4场测验中的第二场。
examples.en: This is the second of the four tests.

defines.trans_en: the smallest unit used for measuring an angle

examples.en: There are 3,600 seconds in a degree.

defines.trans_en: a product that is sold cheaply because it is damaged or not in perfect condition

defines.trans_ch: （拳击比赛或旧时决斗中的）助手
defines.trans_en: a person who takes care of someone who is fighting in a boxing competition or, in the past, in a duel (= organized fight)
in a vehicle, the gear that combines power with limited speed and is used when increasing or reducing speed

examples.ch: 你得换二挡。
examples.en: You'll have to change (down/up) into second.

defines.trans_en: an undergraduate degree from a university in the UK and some other countries that is a good degree but not the best possible

→ 
second base

phrases.trans_en: as soon as

examples.ch: 我见他的第一面，就知道他会成为一个明星。
examples.en: The second I saw him, I knew he was going to be a star.

phrases.trans_en: an extra amount of food that is given after the first amount has been eaten

examples.ch: 有人想再来一份冰激凌吗？
examples.en: Would anyone like seconds of ice cream?

defines.trans_en: to make a formal statement of support for a suggestion made by someone else during a meeting so that there can be a discussion or vote

examples.ch: 该动议由俱乐部女主席提出，由干事附议。
examples.en: The motion was proposed by the club's chairwoman and seconded by the secretary.

examples.ch: “我想喝杯饮料。”“我赞成！”
examples.en: "I could use a drink." "I'll second that (= I agree with you)!"

defines.trans_en: to send an employee to work somewhere else temporarily, either to increase the number of workers or to replace other workers, or to exchange experience or skills

examples.ch: 在争端期间，很多警察从交通管理岗位上被抽调出来，派去监狱。
examples.en: During the dispute, many police officers were seconded from traffic duty to the prison service.

defines.trans_en: someone who works in an office, writing letters, making phone calls, and arranging meetings for a person or for an organization

examples.ch: 我的秘书会打电话给你安排会议。
examples.en: My secretary will phone you to arrange a meeting.

defines.trans_en: the member of a committee of an organization, club, etc. who keeps records of meetings, sends letters, emails, etc.

examples.ch: 委员会内有三个通过竞选得到的职位：主席、秘书和财务主管。
examples.en: The three elected members of the committee are the chair, secretary, and treasurer.

defines.trans_ch: （负责机构总体管理的）干事，文书
defines.trans_en: an official who has responsibility for the general management of an organization

examples.ch: 公司的文书已就这个错误向所有股东写信致歉了。
examples.en: The company secretary has written to all the shareholders to apologize for the mistake.

defines.trans_ch: （英国）国务大臣（同 Secretary of State）
defines.trans_en:
a 
Secretary of State

examples.ch: 外交大臣
examples.en: the Foreign Secretary

examples.ch: 内政大臣
examples.en: the Home Secretary

defines.trans_en: the head of a government department, chosen by the president and not a member of a law-making group

examples.ch: 卫生和福利部部长
examples.en: the Secretary of Health and Human Services

defines.trans_en: to be conscious of what is around you by using your eyes

examples.ch: 打开灯，这样我才能看见。
examples.en: Turn the light on so I can see.

examples.ch: “我能看到你！”
examples.en: I can see you!

examples.ch: 老师可以看出，孩子们打过架。
examples.en: The teacher could see (that) the children had been fighting.

examples.ch: 雅基看见那辆汽车开到了警察局门口。
examples.en: Jacqui saw the car drive up outside the police station.

examples.ch: 从窗口看去，我们可以看见孩子们在院子里玩耍。
examples.en: From the window we could see the children playing in the yard.

examples.ch: 他父母观看了他被授予获胜者奖牌。
examples.en: His parents saw him awarded the winner's medal.

examples.ch: 票价与航班的具体情况请见第23页。
examples.en: See (= look at) p. 23 for prices and flight details.

examples.ch: 更多信息见下一页。
examples.en: See over (= look at the next page) for further information.

defines.trans_ch: 看，观看（电影、电视节目等）
defines.trans_en: to watch a film, television programme, etc.

examples.ch: 你昨天晚上看4频道的纪录片了吗？
examples.en: Did you see that documentary on Channel 4 last night?

defines.trans_ch: 是…的发生时间（或地点）;见证
defines.trans_en: to be the time or place when something happens

examples.ch: 由于有了新水库，今年夏天该地区取消了用水限制。
examples.en: This summer has seen the end of water restrictions in the area thanks to a new reservoir.

defines.trans_en: to understand, know, or realize

examples.ch: 我知道下个月俱乐部将组织去看一次戏。
examples.en: I see (that) the club is organizing a theatre trip next month.

examples.ch: 他认为星期五不来星期四来也没什么。
examples.en: He can't see what difference it makes to come (= he doesn't think it is important if he comes) on Thursday instead of Friday.

examples.ch: 他们认为没有必要用书面形式通知其成员相关变化。
examples.en: They didn't see the need/any need (= understand that it was important) to notify their members of the changes in writing.

examples.ch: 他们拒绝帮忙的理由就是太忙，但他似乎觉得其中另有隐情。
examples.en: They refused to help because they're too busy, but he seems to see more in it than that.

examples.ch: “我累了。”“我知道——你整个下午都打哈欠”
examples.en: "I'm tired." "So I see - you've been yawning all afternoon."

examples.ch: 我很惊讶他们无法理解我的观点。
examples.en: I was surprised that they couldn't see my point of view.

examples.ch: 政府不想让人觉得他们在向恐怖分子妥协。
examples.en: The government didn't want to be seen to be making concessions to terrorists.

examples.ch: 她读完他的书之后，开始以另一种／不同的／新的角度看待这个问题。
examples.en: After she read his book she started to see the issue in another/a different/a new light (= differently).

defines.trans_en: to meet or visit someone, or to visit a place

examples.ch: 我们周末要去探望朋友。
examples.en: We're seeing friends this weekend.

examples.ch: 近几个星期我没有看到杰里。
examples.en: I haven't seen Jerry around (= in the places I usually meet him) in the last few weeks.

examples.ch: 自从达里尔结婚以后，大家都没怎么看见他了。
examples.en: No one has seen much of Daryl since he got married.

examples.ch: 他们经常见面。
examples.en: They see a lot of each other (= are often together).

examples.ch: 我妈妈下周又要去看病。
examples.en: My mother is seeing the doctor again next week.

examples.ch: 孩子们想看马戏。
examples.en: The children wanted to see the circus.

examples.ch: 经纪人说他们下午3点可以看房子。
examples.en: The agent said they could see the house (UK also see round the house) at 3 p.m.

defines.trans_en: to have a romantic relationship with someone

examples.ch: 她和他交往有多久了？
examples.en: How long has she been seeing him?

defines.trans_en: to consider or think about, especially to think about someone or something in a particular way, or to imagine someone doing a particular activity

examples.ch: 她不认为自己很勇敢。
examples.en: She didn't see herself as brave.

examples.ch: 这份礼物很容易被当成是一种贿赂。
examples.en: It was easy to see the gift as a kind of bribe.

examples.ch: 我认为在目前情况下她不会接受那份工作。
examples.en: I can't see her accepting (= I don't think she will accept) the job in the present circumstances.

examples.ch: 在我看来，我们得找更多的人帮忙。
examples.en: As I see it/things/the situation, we'll have to get extra help.

examples.ch: 设想一下我的处境——如果你离开，我就孤立无援了。
examples.en: Try and see it my way - I'll be left without any help if you go.

defines.trans_en: to take someone somewhere by going there with them

examples.ch: 他把客人送到门口。
examples.en: He saw his visitors to the door.

examples.ch: 她的朋友们送她回了家。
examples.en: Her friends saw her home.

examples.ch: 保安人员将抗议者赶了出去。
examples.en: The security guard saw the protesters off the premises.

defines.trans_en: to try to discover

examples.ch: 你看能否找一个人帮忙？
examples.en: Will you see if you can get anyone to help?

examples.ch: 我看看我可以做点什么。
examples.en: I'll see what I can do.

defines.trans_en: to make certain that something happens

examples.ch: 接待员说他一定会传话给她。
examples.en: The receptionist said he'd see (that) she got the message.

examples.ch: 你要确保5点前做好准备，否则就会有麻烦。
examples.en: See (that) you're ready by five, or there'll be trouble.

phrases.trans_en: said to mean that more surprising or exciting things are likely to happen

defines.trans_en: a place where there is a cathedral and where a bishop or archbishop has authority

examples.ch: 约克/艾克斯特/林肯主教教区
examples.en: the See of York/Exeter/Lincoln

examples.ch: 主教和他们的教区
examples.en: bishops and their sees

defines.trans_en: to give something to someone else in return for money

examples.ch: 我把车以600美元的价钱卖给了他。
examples.en: I sold him my car/I sold my car to him for $600.

examples.ch: 我们每张票将卖50英镑。
examples.en: We'll be selling the tickets at/for £50 each.

examples.ch: 这个摊位卖饮料和小吃。
examples.en: The stall sells drinks and snacks.

defines.trans_ch: 被以（…方式／数量／价格）购买
defines.trans_en: to be bought in the way or quantities that are mentioned; to be sold at the price mentioned

examples.ch: 这些篮子卖得很好。
examples.en: These baskets sell well (= a lot of them are bought).

examples.ch: 他们的最新唱片卖出了超过10万张。
examples.en: Their last album sold over a hundred thousand copies.

examples.ch: 这部电话卖多少钱？
examples.en: How much does the phone sell for?

defines.trans_en: to persuade someone that an idea or plan is a good one and likely to be successful

examples.ch: 我的上司很守旧，我要费好大的劲才能使他相信偶尔在家里工作是个不错的主意。
examples.en: My boss is very old-fashioned and I'm having a lot of trouble selling the idea of working at home occasionally.

examples.ch: 这位电影人士说服了我，让我相信我的小说可以搬上银幕。
examples.en: The filmmakers sold me on the idea that my book would work on the screen.

examples.ch: 有机会更进一步打入欧洲市场将能说服总统接受这个计划。
examples.en: The chance of greater access to European markets would help sell the president the plan/sell the plan to the president.

examples.ch: 在面试时，你必须想办法打动雇主。
examples.en: In an interview, you have to sell yourself to the employer.

defines.trans_en: to cause something to go from one place to another, especially by post or email

examples.ch: 我下周要给她寄信／发电子邮件／寄包裹／寄明信片。
examples.en: I'll send her a letter/email/parcel/postcard next week.

examples.ch: 我们将用邮寄／航空／海运的方式发送。
examples.en: We'll send it by post/airmail/sea.

examples.ch: 你能否尽快给他们回信？
examples.en: Could you send a reply to them as quickly as possible?

examples.ch: 这份新闻报道是用卫星传送的。
examples.en: The news report was sent by satellite.

examples.ch: 她让约翰捎信说自己不能来了。
examples.en: She sent a message with John to say that she couldn't come.

examples.ch: 他们送花为她庆祝生日。
examples.en: They sent her flowers for her birthday.

examples.ch: 玛吉问候你，希望你早日康复。
examples.en: Maggie sends her love and hopes you'll feel better soon.

defines.trans_en: to cause or order someone to go and do something

examples.ch: 我们要把孩子送去和我的父母住上几个星期。
examples.en: We're sending the kids to stay with my parents for a couple of weeks.

examples.ch: 指挥官要我们派增援部队。
examples.en: The commander has asked us to send reinforcements.

examples.ch: 他们已经把儿子送去寄宿学校上学。
examples.en: They've sent their son (away) to boarding school.

examples.ch: 他试图解释，但她不耐烦起来，把他打发走了。
examples.en: He was trying to explain but she became impatient and sent him away (= told him to leave).

defines.trans_en: to cause someone or something to do a particular thing, or to cause something to happen

examples.ch: 爆炸让人群恐慌起来。
examples.en: The explosion sent the crowd into a panic.

examples.ch: 看电视总会让我睡着。
examples.en: Watching television always sends me to sleep.

examples.ch: 他的邋遢让她大为恼火。
examples.en: His untidiness sends her crazy/mad/wild.

examples.ch: 利润下降的公告使公司的股价大幅下跌。
examples.en: The announcement of the fall in profits sent the company's share price plummeting (= caused it to go down a lot).

examples.ch: 电扇的风吹得文件满屋乱飞。
examples.en: The draught from the fan sent papers flying all over the room.

defines.trans_ch: 特殊教育需求和/或残疾（special educational needs and/or disabilities 的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for special educational needs and/or disabilities: an expression used to refer to special needs (= the needs of people with particular disabilities or problems) relating to education and/or physical or mental conditions that makes it difficult for them to do certain common activities

examples.ch: 该框架确保为有特殊教育需求和/或残疾的儿童所提供的支持切实到位。
examples.en: The framework makes sure that there's support in place for children with SEND.

examples.ch: 我的工作是帮助有特殊教育需求和/或残疾的儿童和青少年了解教育、健康和社会关怀。
examples.en: My job is to help children and young people with SEND navigate education, health, and social care.

defines.trans_en: a group of words, usually containing a verb, that expresses a thought in the form of a statement, question, instruction, or exclamation and starts with a capital letter when written

examples.ch: 他很不耐烦，总是在我说到一半的时候就打断我。
examples.en: He's very impatient and always interrupts me mid-sentence.

examples.ch: 你的结论没错，但最后一句话太长太复杂。
examples.en: Your conclusion is good, but the final sentence is too long and complicated.

defines.trans_en: a punishment given by a judge in court to a person or organization after they have been found guilty of doing something wrong

examples.ch: 他被判以重刑／轻判。
examples.en: He got a heavy/light sentence (= he was severely/not severely punished).

examples.ch: 该违法行为可判监禁／终身监禁／5年徒刑。
examples.en: The offence carries a jail/prison/life/five-year sentence.

examples.ch: 他被判监外执行／缓刑。
examples.en: He was given a non-custodial/suspended sentence.

phrases.trans_en: (of a judge) to say officially what a punishment will be

examples.ch: 今天下午法官将对被告作出宣判。
examples.en: The judge will pronounce sentence on the defendant this afternoon.

defines.trans_en: to decide and say officially what a punishment will be

examples.ch: 他被判终身监禁。
examples.en: He was sentenced to life imprisonment.

defines.trans_en: some; an amount that is not exact but is fewer than many

examples.ch: 我已经看过好几遍《乱世佳人》了。
examples.en: I've seen "Gone with the Wind" several times.

examples.ch: 已经有好几个人抱怨过这项计划了。
examples.en: Several people have complained about the plans.

examples.ch: 我有几个朋友在学英语。
examples.en: Several of my friends are learning English.

defines.trans_en: separate or different

examples.ch: 我们正在努力达成一个能满足有关各方各自利益的协议。
examples.en: We are striving to reach an agreement which will satisfy the several interests of the parties concerned.

defines.trans_ch: （用于在主语为 I 或 we 时替代 will）
defines.trans_en: used instead of "will" when the subject is "I" or "we"

examples.ch: 如果你再那么做，我就要生气了。
examples.en: If you do that one more time, I shall be very angry.

examples.ch: 我永远不会忘记你。
examples.en: I shall never forget you.

examples.ch: 恐怕我不能参加你的聚会了。
examples.en: I'm afraid I shall not/shan't be able to come to your party.

examples.ch: 我盼望着下星期见到你。
examples.en: I shall look forward to meeting you next week.

examples.ch: 那么我们周末会见到你，是吗？
examples.en: So we'll see you at the weekend, shall we (= is that right)?

examples.ch: 一有消息，我们就告诉你。
examples.en: We shall (= intend to) let you know as soon as there's any news.

defines.trans_ch: （与 I 或 we 连用，表示建议）
defines.trans_en: used, with "I" or "we", to make a suggestion

examples.ch: “我觉得冷。”“要我把这扇窗户关上吗？”
examples.en: "I'm cold." "Shall I close this window?"

examples.ch: 我们今晚出去吃饭好吗？
examples.en: Shall we go out for dinner tonight?

examples.ch: 我明天给他打电话好吗？
examples.en: Shall I call him tomorrow?

defines.trans_ch: （表示某事肯定或必须发生，或表示决心）
defines.trans_en: used to say that something certainly will or must happen, or that you are determined that something will happen

examples.ch: 别担心，我会去火车站接你。
examples.en: Don't worry, I shall be there to meet the train.

examples.ch: 学校的纪律规定，除非有大人陪同，小孩白天不得离开学校。
examples.en: The school rules state that no child shall be allowed out of the school during the day, unless accompanied by an adult.

examples.ch: 你一定要去参加舞会，灰姑娘。
examples.en: You shall go to the ball, Cinderella.

defines.trans_en: a liquid used for washing hair, or for washing particular objects or materials

examples.ch: 去头屑洗发剂
examples.en: an anti-dandruff shampoo

examples.ch: 地毯清洗剂
examples.en: a carpet shampoo

examples.ch: 使用说明：润湿头发，涂上香波并轻揉头发至产生丰富的泡沫。
examples.en: Directions: wet hair, apply shampoo, and massage into a rich lather.

defines.trans_ch: （用香波或洗涤剂）洗;（尤指）洗发
defines.trans_en: an act of washing something, especially your hair, with shampoo

examples.ch: 我的头发／地毯／这只狗需要洗一洗。
examples.en: My hair/The rug/The dog needs a shampoo.

examples.ch: 她去理发店洗头并做头发。
examples.en: She went to the hairdressers for a shampoo and set.

defines.trans_en: to wash something with shampoo

examples.ch: 邓肯给我洗了头，然后特蕾西给我剪了头发。
examples.en: Duncan shampooed my hair and then Tracy cut it.

defines.trans_en: used as the subject of a verb to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned

examples.ch: 我问母亲能否借我点钱，她没有答应。
examples.en: I asked my mother if she'd lend me some money, but she said no.

defines.trans_ch: （代替 it，尤用以指代已提及的国家、轮船或车辆）
defines.trans_en: used instead of "it" to refer to a country, ship, or vehicle

examples.ch: 印度独立后，自主选择成为英联邦的成员。
examples.en: After India became independent, she chose to be a member of the Commonwealth.

examples.ch: 看看我的新车——是不是很漂亮？
examples.en: Look at my new car - isn't she beautiful?

defines.trans_en: a female

examples.ch: 这只小猫是母的还是公的？
examples.en: Is this kitten a she or a he?

defines.trans_en: female

examples.ch: 一头母狼
examples.en: a she-wolf

examples.ch: 一头巨大的母熊躲在那里，随时准备扑过来。
examples.en: An enormous she-bear was hiding there, ready to pounce.

defines.trans_en: a large piece of thin cloth used on a bed for sleeping on or under

examples.ch: 我已经给床铺上了干净的床单。
examples.en: I've put clean sheets on the bed.

defines.trans_en: a large, thin, flat, usually rectangular piece of something

examples.ch: 一片玻璃
examples.en: a sheet of glass

examples.ch: 他们在破损的窗户上补上了一块聚乙烯／塑料纸。
examples.en: They fixed a polythene/plastic sheet over the broken window.

defines.trans_en: a piece of paper

examples.ch: 几张包装纸
examples.en: some sheets of wrapping paper

examples.ch: 申请表只有一张纸。
examples.en: The application form was a single sheet of paper.

defines.trans_en: a piece of paper with something printed on it

examples.ch: 旅游办公室每周提供一份有关本市新闻的信息通报。
examples.en: The tourist office provides a weekly information sheet about things that are happening in the town.

phrases.trans_en: a large, wide mass of something such as fire or ice

examples.ch: 爆炸之后，紧接着腾起一片烈焰。
examples.en: A sheet of flame shot up into the air immediately after the explosion.

examples.ch: 水面上结了厚厚的一层冰。
examples.en: A thick sheet of ice had formed over the water.

phrases.trans_en: a large quantity of rain

examples.ch: 大雨如注。
examples.en: The rain was coming down in sheets.

defines.trans_en: to rain very hard

examples.ch: 我们还不能出去，外面正下着倾盆大雨。
examples.en: We can't go out yet, it's sheeting down outside.

examples.ch: 雨水敲打着窗户。
examples.en: Rain sheeted against the windows.

defines.trans_ch: （通常指固定在墙上或橱柜中的）搁板，架子
defines.trans_en: a long, flat board fixed horizontally, usually against a wall or inside a cupboard so that objects can be stored on it

examples.ch: 玻璃架子
examples.en: a glass shelf

examples.ch: 在顶层／底层架子上
examples.en: on the top/bottom shelf

examples.ch: 一面墙是高及天花板的书架，上面塞满了书。
examples.en: One wall had shelves from floor to ceiling, crammed with books.

defines.trans_en: a flat area of rock underwater or on a cliff

phrases.trans_en: If a product can be bought off the shelf, it does not need to be specially made or asked for.

examples.ch: 如果你买现成的墙纸，通常会比订购的要便宜。
examples.en: It's often cheaper if you buy wallpaper off the shelf, rather than having to order it.

examples.ch: 现成的货物／衣服
examples.en: off-the-shelf goods/clothes

phrases.trans_en: When a shop removes something from its shelves, that product stops being available for sale there.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指航海的）大船，海轮，轮船，舰
defines.trans_en: a large boat for travelling on water, especially across the sea

examples.ch: 大帆船
examples.en: a sailing ship

examples.ch: 商船／军舰
examples.en: a merchant/naval ship

examples.ch: 他们登上了一艘第二天启航的船。
examples.en: They boarded (= went on to) a ship that was sailing (= leaving) the next day.

defines.trans_en: to send something, usually a large object or a large quantity of objects or people, to a place far away

examples.ch: 我们每个月都往纽约运书。
examples.en: We ship books out to New York every month.

defines.trans_en: having the rank, position, skill, or relationship of the stated type

examples.ch: 贵族身份
examples.en: lordship

examples.ch: 合伙关系
examples.en: partnership

examples.ch: 手艺
examples.en: craftsmanship

examples.ch: 友谊
examples.en: friendship

defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing worn, especially by men, on the upper part of the body, made of light cloth like cotton and usually having a collar and buttons at the front

examples.ch: 条纹／白衬衣
examples.en: a striped/white shirt

examples.ch: 短袖／长袖衬衫
examples.en: a short-/long-sleeved shirt

examples.ch: 你把什么东西洒在衬衫前襟上了。
examples.en: You've spilled something down your shirt front.

defines.trans_en: one of a pair of coverings for your feet, usually made of a strong material such as leather, with a thick leather or plastic sole (= base) and usually a heel

examples.ch: 平跟／高跟鞋
examples.en: flat/high-heeled shoes

examples.ch: 跑步／网球鞋
examples.en: running/tennis shoes

examples.ch: 他穿上／脱下他那双新鞋。
examples.en: He put on/took off his new pair of shoes.

examples.ch: 快点儿把鞋带系好。
examples.en: Hurry and do up/lace up your shoes.

examples.ch: 鞋店
examples.en: a shoe shop

defines.trans_en:
a 
horseshoe
If you shoe a horse, you nail a horseshoe (= a curved piece of metal) to one or each of its feet.
a place where you can buy goods or services

examples.ch: 书／服装／唱片／糖果店
examples.en: a book/clothes/record/sweet shop

examples.ch: 理发／博彩店
examples.en: a barber's/betting shop

examples.ch: 我得去商店了——家里没有吃的东西了。
examples.en: I need to go to the shops - I've got no food in the house.

defines.trans_ch: 购物；（尤指食品及其他日常用品的）采购
defines.trans_en: the act of shopping, especially of shopping for food and other things needed in the house

examples.ch: 我通常在星期一买一周要用的东西。
examples.en: I usually do the weekly shop on a Monday.

defines.trans_en: a place where a particular type of thing is made or repaired

examples.ch: 他开了一家汽车修理厂。
examples.en: He runs a car repair shop.

defines.trans_en: a business

phrases.trans_en: to be available to buy

examples.ch: 他的最新小说将在圣诞节前面市。
examples.en: His latest novel will be in the shops by Christmas.

defines.trans_en: to buy things in shops

examples.ch: 我喜欢在盖璞买衣服。
examples.en: I like to shop at Gap for clothes.

examples.ch: 如果只是买些食品，我一般会去附近的超市。
examples.en: If I'm just shopping for food, I tend to go to the local supermarket.

defines.trans_en: to give the police information about a criminal

examples.ch: 他的前妻向警方告发了他。
examples.en: His ex-wife shopped him to the police.

defines.trans_en: to offer something for sale, especially to several different companies in the hope that one of them will buy it

examples.ch: 你的剧本会被兜售给文学经纪和电影公司。
examples.en: Your script gets shopped to literary agents and movie studios.

defines.trans_en: small in length, distance, or height

examples.ch: 短裙
examples.en: a short skirt

examples.ch: 她的头发比过去短多了。
examples.en: Her hair is much shorter than it used to be.

examples.ch: 去车站只需走很短一段路程。
examples.en: It's only a short walk to the station.

examples.ch: 我们家人都比较矮，可我弟弟却很高。
examples.en: I'm fairly short but my brother's very tall.

defines.trans_en: used to say that a name is used as a shorter form of another name

examples.ch: 她名叫乔，是约瑟芬的简称。
examples.en: Her name's Jo - it's short for Josephine.

examples.ch: 她名叫约瑟芬，或简称为乔。
examples.en: Her name's Josephine, or Jo for short.

defines.trans_en: being an amount of time that is less than average or usual

examples.ch: 短片／短暂的访问
examples.en: a short film/visit

examples.ch: 他在如此短的时间里长高了这么多。
examples.en: He's grown so much in such a short time.

examples.ch: 如果每小时我都休息一小会儿，我的工作效率会高很多。
examples.en: I work much better if I take a short break every hour or so.

defines.trans_en: Short books, letters, and other examples of writing do not contain many words and do not take much time to read.

examples.ch: 这是一本篇幅很短的书——你1个小时就能读完。
examples.en: It's a very short book - you'll read it in an hour.

defines.trans_en: saying little but showing slight impatience or anger in the few words that you say

examples.ch: 我很抱歉今天早上我在电话里对你有点不耐烦。
examples.en: I'm sorry if I was a bit short with you on the phone this morning.

phrases.trans_en: to not have enough of something

examples.ch: 空间／时间不足
examples.en: to be short of space/time

examples.ch: 我们的咖啡不多了——我最好去再买一些。
examples.en: We're short on coffee - I'd better get some more.

examples.ch: 账单是85英镑，但我们还缺15英镑。
examples.en: The bill comes to £85, but we're £15 short.

examples.ch: 我这星期钱有点儿不够用——能借我10美元吗？
examples.en: I'm a little short (= I do not have much money) this week - could you lend me ten dollars?

phrases.trans_ch: 喘不过气，上气不接下气
phrases.trans_en: unable to breathe very well, for example because you have been running or doing some type of energetic exercise

examples.ch: 她爬楼梯时总是上气不接下气。
examples.en: She's always short of breath when she climbs the stairs.

phrases.trans_en: to be few or not enough in number

examples.ch: 这间办公室里的可用的桌子不够。
examples.en: Free desks are in short supply in this office.

phrases.trans_en: to not have something, especially when it is something you need in order to live

examples.ch: 我父母并没有多少钱，但他们总是确保我们不会缺衣少食。
examples.en: My parents didn't have much money, but they made sure we didn't go short (of anything).

defines.trans_en: a drink of spirits (= type of strong alcohol) without water or any other liquid added

examples.ch: 她只喝纯烈性酒，从不喝葡萄酒或啤酒。
examples.en: She only drinks shorts, never wine or beer.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指正片播映之前播放的）电影短片
defines.trans_en: a short film, especially one made for showing before the main film at a cinema

informal for
short circuit

informal for
short-circuit (short circuit)

examples.ch: 水管工把洗衣机弄短路了。
examples.en: The plumber shorted the washing machine.

defines.trans_en: before the arranged or expected time or place

examples.ch: 我们想完整地介绍这些计划，但是主席提前打断了我们的发言，因为还有其他重要的事情需要讨论。
examples.en: We wanted to explain the plans fully, but the chairman stopped us short, as there were other important matters to discuss.

defines.trans_ch: （与以 -ed 结尾、由名词变化而来的形容词连用）短…的
defines.trans_en: used with adjectives ending in -ed formed from nouns to describe something with a short part

examples.ch: 短毛狗
examples.en: a short-haired dog (= a dog with short hair)

examples.ch: 短袖衬衫
examples.en: a short-sleeved shirt (= a shirt with short sleeves)

defines.trans_ch: （常在热天或运动时穿的）短裤
defines.trans_en: trousers that end above the knee or reach the knee, often worn in hot weather or when playing a sport

examples.ch: 网球短裤
examples.en: tennis shorts

examples.ch: 她穿上短裤和T恤衫。
examples.en: She put on a pair of shorts and a T-shirt.

defines.trans_en: men's underpants
used to say or ask what is the correct or best thing to do

examples.ch: 如果你生他的气，就应该告诉他。
examples.en: If you're annoyed with him, you should tell him.

examples.ch: 你应该坐公共汽车，这是去那儿最容易的办法。
examples.en: You should take the bus - it's the easiest way to get there.

examples.ch: “我应该向他道歉？”“是的，我想你应该道歉。”
examples.en: "Should I apologize to him?" "Yes, I think you should."

examples.ch: 你应该为自己感到羞耻。
examples.en: You should be ashamed of yourselves.

examples.ch: 这台电脑不能正常工作。
examples.en: This computer isn't working as it should.

examples.ch: 应该对这次灾难的起因进行调查。
examples.en: There should be an investigation into the cause of the disaster.

examples.ch: 他说我应该去找医生看看。
examples.en: He said that I should see a doctor.

examples.ch: 我本应该给她写信，可是没有时间。
examples.en: I should have written to her but I haven't had time.

examples.ch: 你本来什么都不该说。
examples.en: You shouldn't have said anything.

examples.ch: 我们今晚应该在哪里见面?
examples.en: Where should (= do you suggest that) we meet tonight?

examples.ch: 这儿比较冷，要我打开暖气吗？
examples.en: It's rather cold in here. Should I (= do you want me to) turn the heating on?

defines.trans_en: used to show when something is likely or expected

examples.ch: 我干洗的衣服今天下午应该洗好了。
examples.en: My dry cleaning should be ready this afternoon.

examples.ch: 你会发现这本指南很有用。
examples.en: You should find this guidebook helpful.

examples.ch: 不知道安妮出什么事了。她本该现在就到这儿的。
examples.en: I wonder what's happened to Annie. She should be (= it was expected that she would be) here by now.

examples.ch: “你能在本周五之前把报告准备好吗？”“我想可以。”
examples.en: "Could you have the report ready by Friday?" "Yes, I should think so (= it is likely that it will be ready)."

examples.ch: 这应该很好。
examples.en: This should be good (= this is likely to be interesting or amusing).

defines.trans_en: used when referring to a possible event in the future

examples.ch: 万一有人找我，我就在经理办公室。
examples.en: If anyone should ask for me, I'll be in the manager's office.

examples.ch: 如果你需要什么，请直接同我联系吧。
examples.en: Should you (= if you) ever need anything, please don't hesitate to contact me.

defines.trans_ch: （用于 that 和表示观点或感情的形容词或名词之后）竟然
defines.trans_en: used after "that" and adjectives or nouns that show an opinion or feeling

examples.ch: 真是怪事，她竟然会认为我还想再见到她。
examples.en: It's odd that she should think I would want to see her again.

examples.ch: 她年纪轻轻就去世了，真是不公平。
examples.en: It's so unfair that she should have died so young.

defines.trans_ch: （用于 that 之后，表示某种情形可能存在或可能出现）可能会
defines.trans_en: used after "that" to suggest that a situation possibly exists or might come into existence

examples.ch: 我们约定在接下来的那个星期见面。
examples.en: We agreed that we should meet the following week.

defines.trans_ch: （用于 so that 和 in order that 之后，表示目的）会，就
defines.trans_en: used after "so that" and "in order that" to show purpose

examples.ch: 他带了雨伞，这样就不会淋湿了。
examples.en: He took his umbrella so that he shouldn't get wet.

defines.trans_ch: （用于 for fear that，in case 和 lest 之后）
defines.trans_en: used after "for fear that", "in case", and "lest"

examples.ch: 他带了雨伞，以防下雨。
examples.en: He took his umbrella in case it should rain.

defines.trans_ch: （给出或询问原因时用于why之后）竟会
defines.trans_en: used after "why" when giving or asking the reason for something

examples.ch: 怎么会有人想吃这么可怕的东西？
examples.en: Why should anyone want to eat something so horrible?

examples.ch: 如果她买得起，怎么不买呢？
examples.en: Why should she not buy it if she can afford it?

defines.trans_ch: （当主语为 I 或 we 时代替 would）
defines.trans_en: used instead of "would" when the subject is "I" or "we"

examples.ch: 我睡觉之前想喝杯茶。
examples.en: I should like a cup of tea before I go to bed.

examples.ch: 我当然不会指望你付钱。
examples.en: I shouldn't expect you to pay, of course.

defines.trans_ch: （用于问句中表示惊讶）竟然，怎么会
defines.trans_en: used to express surprise in sentences that are in the form of questions

examples.ch: 我刚要下车时竟然看到了我的老校友帕特！
examples.en: I was just getting off the bus when who should I see but my old school friend Pat!

defines.trans_ch: （用于 I 之后，表示给出建议）
defines.trans_en: used after "I" when giving advice

examples.ch: 如果我是你，我不会担心这件事。
examples.en: I shouldn't worry about it if I were you.

examples.ch: 我认为你不必担心。
examples.en: I shouldn't (= I advise you not to) let it worry you.

defines.trans_en: to speak with a very loud voice, often as loud as possible, usually when you want to make yourself heard in noisy situations, or when the person you are talking to is a long way away or cannot hear very well

examples.ch: 没有必要大声喊叫，我完全听得见。
examples.en: There's no need to shout, I can hear you.

examples.ch: “明天见，”埃莱尼大声喊道，声音盖过了直升机的轰鸣。
examples.en: "I'll see you tomorrow," shouted Eleni above the noise of the helicopter.

examples.ch: 他在车库里高声喊道，他大约半个小时之内就能完成。
examples.en: He shouted from the garage that he'd be finished in about half an hour.

defines.trans_ch: （因愤怒、恐惧或激动等而）吼叫，大声叫嚷
defines.trans_en: to express strong emotions, such as anger, fear, or excitement, or to express strong opinions, in a loud voice

examples.ch: 我打碎了窗户后，父亲冲我大吼大叫。
examples.en: Dad really shouted at me when I broke the window.

examples.ch: 被判5年监禁之后，他大声辱骂法官。
examples.en: He shouted abuse at the judge after being sentenced to five years' imprisonment.

examples.ch: 歌迷们不住地尖叫着，大声喊着乐队成员的名字。
examples.en: The fans were screaming and shouting out the names of the band members.

examples.ch: 我大叫着要他把枪放下。
examples.en: I shouted at him to put the gun down.

examples.ch: “马上停止这种孩子气的胡说八道！”他怒不可遏地吼道。
examples.en: "Stop this childish nonsense at once!" he shouted furiously.

defines.trans_en: to try to attract attention in a loud voice

examples.ch: 我听见他们呼救，但我真是爱莫能助。
examples.en: I heard them shouting for help, but there was nothing I could do.

examples.ch: 呼吁声最响的慈善团体得到的捐款往往也最多。
examples.en: It's the charities that shout loudest (= attract the most public attention) that often get given the most money.

defines.trans_en: to buy a drink for someone

examples.ch: 我来给你买一杯饮料。
examples.en: I'll shout you a drink.
