defines.trans_en: the act of saying something very loudly or making a very loud sound with your voice

examples.ch: 她的演讲被听众愤怒的喊叫声所打断。
examples.en: Her speech was interrupted by angry shouts from the audience.

defines.trans_ch: 请客的酒;轮到买酒请客
defines.trans_en: a set of drinks for a group of people, or a particular person's turn to buy them

examples.ch: 你还想再来一杯吗?上几杯是你请的，这次我请。
examples.en: Would you like another drink? It's my shout since you bought the last ones.

defines.trans_en: to make it possible for something to be seen

examples.ch: 给你看看我刚买的这本新书。
examples.en: Let me show you this new book I've just bought.

examples.ch: 在这张地图上，城区用灰色表示。
examples.en: On this map, urban areas are shown in grey.

examples.ch: 你应该让医生看看那些皮疹。
examples.en: You ought to show that rash to your doctor.

examples.ch: 为什么不让我看你手里的东西？
examples.en: Why won't you show me what's in your hand?

examples.ch: 秘密拍摄的录像中出现了王子和王妃接吻的画面。
examples.en: The secretly filmed video shows the prince and princess kissing.

examples.ch: 这些照片显示了这种化学品对树木的影响。
examples.en: These photographs show the effects of the chemical on the trees.

examples.ch: 他开始出现了好转的迹象。
examples.en: He began to show signs of recovery.

examples.ch: “我这里有一枚维多利亚时代金币。”“真的吗？让我看看。”
examples.en: "This is a Victorian gold coin." "Is it? Show me (= allow me to see it)."

defines.trans_ch: 记录，显示（数字或测量值）
defines.trans_en: to record or express a number or measurement

examples.ch: 右面的刻度盘显示温度，左面的刻度盘显示气压。
examples.en: The right-hand dial shows the temperature, and the left-hand one shows the air pressure.

examples.ch: 该公司去年亏损了200万英镑。
examples.en: The company showed a loss of $2 million last year.

examples.ch: 最新的犯罪数据表明，入室盗窃案急剧增加。
examples.en: The latest crime figures show a sharp rise in burglaries.

defines.trans_en: to explain something to someone, by doing it or by giving instructions or examples

examples.ch: 你能教我如何设置DVD播放机吗?
examples.en: Can you show me how to set the DVD player?

examples.ch: 这本词典包括许多说明单词实际用法的例子。
examples.en: This dictionary contains many examples that show how words are actually used.

examples.ch: 你能告诉我去公共汽车站怎么走吗？
examples.en: Could you show me the way to the bus station?

defines.trans_en: to prove something or make the truth or existence of something known

examples.ch: 她已经证明了自己是一个非常有能力的管理者。
examples.en: She has shown herself (to be) a highly competent manager.

examples.ch: 他的日记表明他一直是一个极不自信的人。
examples.en: His diaries show him to have been an extremely insecure person.

examples.ch: 日记表明他曾经极不自信。
examples.en: The diaries show (that) he was very insecure.

examples.ch: 证明给我看，让我可以相信你。
examples.en: Show me (that) I can trust you.

examples.ch: 我们的研究表明，我们对这种疾病知之甚少。
examples.en: Our research has shown (us) how little we know about this disease.

defines.trans_en: to express ideas or feelings using actions or words

examples.ch: 他发现表达爱意很难。
examples.en: He finds it difficult to show affection.

examples.ch: 她把他从火里救出来时，表现出了极大的勇气。
examples.en: She showed enormous courage when she rescued him from the fire.

examples.ch: 你应该对你的父母更尊重一些。
examples.en: You should show your parents more respect/show more respect to your parents.

defines.trans_ch: 显眼;容易看到（或注意到）
defines.trans_en: to be easy to see or notice

examples.ch: “啊，不好，我把葡萄酒洒到夹克上了！”“没事儿，看不出来。”
examples.en: "Oh no, I've spilled red wine on my jacket!" "Don't worry, it doesn't show."

examples.ch: 不管她在想什么，她都从不表现出来。
examples.en: Whatever she's thinking, she never lets it show.

examples.ch: 我已把这些涂鸦粉刷过两遍了，可是仍然能看出来。
examples.en: I've painted over the graffiti twice, but it still shows through.

examples.ch: 血液检验不会发现这些药物，因为只需极小的剂量它就能发挥作用。
examples.en: The drug does not show up in blood tests because it is effective in very small quantities.

examples.ch: 我们搬进去时，那房子已有20年没有装修过了，这能看得出来。
examples.en: When we moved in, the house hadn't been decorated for 20 years, and it showed.

defines.trans_ch: 展出，展览，陈列（艺术作品）
defines.trans_en: to make an artist's work available for the public to see

examples.ch: 我们的目的是方便不知名的年轻艺术家展出他们的作品。
examples.en: Our aim is to make it easier for young unknown artists to show their work.

defines.trans_en: If a cinema or television station shows a film or programme, or if a film or programme is showing somewhere, you can see it there.

examples.ch: 这是该电影首次在电视上播出。
examples.en: It's the first time this movie has been shown on television.

examples.ch: 各大影院正在上映！
examples.en: Now showing at a cinema near you!

defines.trans_en:
to 
show up informal
to take someone somewhere by going there with them

examples.ch: 你能领桑切斯博士去起居室吗?
examples.en: Could you show Dr Sanchez into the living room?

examples.ch: 服务员领我们到餐桌前。
examples.en: The waiter showed us to our table.

defines.trans_en: to fail to hide something, or to make it possible to see or know something that is not intended to be seen or known

examples.ch: 你的衬衫太薄，里面的胸罩都透出来了。
examples.en: Your shirt's so thin that it shows your bra.

examples.ch: 浅色地毯不耐脏。
examples.en: Light-coloured carpets show the dirt.

examples.ch: 他考试未获通过，这恰恰表明他的老师们有多么糟糕。
examples.en: His failure in the exams shows (up) just how bad his teachers are.

defines.trans_en: to make someone understand something by directing their attention to it

examples.ch: 你能指给我看哪里疼吗?
examples.en: Can you show me where it hurts?

examples.ch: 指给我看你想要哪一个。
examples.en: Show me which one you want.

phrases.trans_ch: 显出老态;显出真实年龄
phrases.trans_en: to look as old as you really are

examples.ch: 最近，他真的开始显出老态了。
examples.en: Recently, he's really starting to show his age.

defines.trans_en: a theatre performance or a television or radio programme that is entertaining rather than serious

examples.ch: 电台节目／电视节目／舞台演出
examples.en: a radio/television/stage show

examples.ch: 智力竞赛／游戏节目
examples.en: a quiz/game show

examples.ch: 我们星期六为什么不去伦敦看场演出呢？
examples.en: Why don't we go to London on Saturday and see a show?

examples.ch: 我们得筹集6万英镑来上演该剧。
examples.en: We had to raise £60,000 to stage the show.

examples.ch: 我们在杰米的生日聚会上看了一场木偶戏。
examples.en: We had a puppet show for Jamie's birthday party.

defines.trans_en: an event at which a group of related things are available for the public to look at

examples.ch: 时装／花卉展
examples.en: a fashion/flower show

examples.ch: 车展上展出了一些令人惊叹的新车型。
examples.en: There were some amazing new cars at the motor show.

examples.ch: 他们在美国国家艺术博物馆为他举行了一次作品回顾展。
examples.en: They put on a retrospective show of his work at the National Museum of American Art.

defines.trans_en: an action that makes other people know what your feelings, beliefs, or qualities are

examples.ch: 管理层和工人们团结一致，共同反对关闭工厂。
examples.en: In a show of solidarity, the management and workers have joined forces to campaign against the closure of the factory.

examples.ch: 100多辆军车列队驶过首都以展示实力。
examples.en: Over 100 military vehicles paraded through the capital in a show of strength.

defines.trans_en: an appearance of something that is not really sincere or real

examples.ch: 尽管在公众面前表现得很团结，实际上王室和其他家庭一样也存在着分歧。
examples.en: Despite its public show of unity, the royal family had its share of disagreements just like any other.

examples.ch: 他们假装很感兴趣，但我认为其实并非如此。
examples.en: They put on a show of being interested, but I don't think they really were.

defines.trans_en: an activity, business, or organization, considered in relation to who is managing it

examples.ch: 梅格退休后谁来负责此事？
examples.en: Who will run the show when Meg retires?

examples.ch: 婚礼是他们的事——让他们按自己的方式办吧。
examples.en: The wedding is their show - let them do it their way.

defines.trans_en: a small amount of blood and mucus (= thick liquid) that comes out of the vagina at the start of labour (= the process of giving birth)

examples.ch: 见红
examples.en: the bloody show

phrases.trans_en: Something that is on show has been made available for the public to look at.

examples.ch: 她的雕塑作品将会在博物馆中展览至月底。
examples.en: Her sculptures will be on show at the museum until the end of the month.

phrases.trans_en: an activity or piece of work that appears to be done with great, little, etc. effort

examples.ch: 尽管她没有获胜，但的确表现不俗。
examples.en: She may not have won, but she certainly put up a good show.

phrases.trans_en: Something that is for show has no practical value and is used only to improve the appearance of something else.

examples.ch: 电话上的灯是有什么实际用处呢，还是仅仅作为装饰？
examples.en: Do the lights on this phone have any useful function or are they just/only for show?

defines.trans_en: a device that releases drops of water through a lot of very small holes and that you stand under to wash your whole body

examples.ch: 淋浴器坏了——你得用浴缸洗澡了。
examples.en: The shower is broken - you'll have to have a bath.

examples.ch: 英国的许多家庭都在浴缸龙头上安装了淋浴器。
examples.en: Many British homes have a shower attachment fixed to the bath taps.

examples.ch: 浴帘／浴帽
examples.en: a shower curtain/cap

defines.trans_en: an acting of washing using a shower

examples.ch: 我们出去之前我还有时间冲个澡吗？
examples.en: Do I have time to have a shower before we go out?

defines.trans_en: a place, usually in a bathroom, where a shower is situated

examples.ch: 他现在正在冲澡。让他给你回电话好吗？
examples.en: He's in the shower at the moment. Do you want him to call you back?

defines.trans_en: a short period of rain or snow

examples.ch: 一阵阵的雨、冰雹和雨夹雪
examples.en: showers of rain, hail and sleet

examples.ch: 你都湿透了！你赶上那阵雨了吗？
examples.en: You're soaked! Did you get caught in the shower?

examples.ch: 全国大部分地区将有雷阵雨／寒冷的阵雨。
examples.en: There will be thundery/wintry showers over many parts of the country.

examples.ch: 周末将有阵雪。
examples.en: Snow showers are expected at the end of the week.

defines.trans_ch: （为即将结婚或分娩的妇女举行的）送礼会
defines.trans_en: a party held for a woman just before she gets married or gives birth to a child, when she is given presents for her future home or baby

examples.ch: 我买了最漂亮的婴儿服去参加杰西孩子的送礼会。
examples.en: I bought the cutest baby clothes to take to Jacey's baby shower.

examples.ch: 我们昨天去参加了我表妹的新娘送礼会。
examples.en: We went to my cousin's bridal shower yesterday.

phrases.trans_ch: 一大批，一连串（从天而降的小颗粒物或液滴）
phrases.trans_en: a lot of small objects or drops of liquid coming through the air

examples.ch: 一声巨响，闪过一片火花。
examples.en: There was a bang and a shower of sparks.

examples.ch: 管道爆裂了，喷出一阵水花。
examples.en: The pipe burst, sending out a shower of water.

phrases.trans_en: a large amount of something

examples.ch: 她从同事那里得到了大量的赞美。
examples.en: She received a shower of praise from her colleagues.

defines.trans_en: to fall down or come out in a shower, or to make something do this

examples.ch: 我听到了巨大的爆炸声，几秒钟后，玻璃碎片纷纷散落在我们身上。
examples.en: I heard a massive explosion, and seconds later fragments of glass were showering (= falling) down on us.

examples.ch: 她用力晃动酒瓶，向我们喷洒香槟。
examples.en: She shook the bottle violently and showered us with champagne.

defines.trans_en: to take a shower

examples.ch: 我每天早上都要洗个淋浴。
examples.en: I shower every morning.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) close something

examples.ch: 请关上大门。
examples.en: Please shut the gate.

examples.ch: 我要给你一个惊喜！紧紧闭上眼睛，伸出你的手。
examples.en: I've got a surprise for you! Shut your eyes tightly and hold out your hand.

examples.ch: 玛丽合上书，把它放在了桌子上。
examples.en: Mary shut her book and put it down on the table.

examples.ch: 窗户关不上——它卡住了。
examples.en: This window won't shut - it's jammed.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) stop operating or being in service, either temporarily or permanently

examples.ch: 商店每周三晚上8点钟打烊。
examples.en: The shops shut at eight o'clock on Wednesday evenings.

examples.ch: 真可惜，他们关闭了那家工厂。
examples.en: It's such a shame they shut that factory (down).

defines.trans_en: closed

examples.ch: 我发现午饭时间她的窗帘还拉着，就怀疑出了什么事。
examples.en: I suspected something was wrong when I noticed her curtains were still shut at lunchtime.

examples.ch: 政府应该向日本的投资敞开大门而不是让其吃闭门羹。
examples.en: The government ought to have opened the door to Japanese investment instead of slamming it shut.

defines.trans_ch: 生病的，患病的，不舒服的
defines.trans_en: physically or mentally ill; not well or healthy

examples.ch: 生病的孩子
examples.en: a sick child

examples.ch: 病牛
examples.en: a sick cow

examples.ch: 因为生病，我父亲已经很久没有去上班了。
examples.en: My father has been off sick (= not working because of illness) for a long time.

examples.ch: 那样伤害一个孩子的人，脑子一定有毛病。
examples.en: Anyone who could hurt a child like that must be sick (= mentally ill).

examples.ch: 那个老妇人出门在外时生病了，不得不回家。
examples.en: The old woman fell/took/was taken sick (= became ill) while she was away and had to come home.

examples.ch: 萨拉打电话来请了病假。
examples.en: Sarah called in/reported sick (= told her employer that she was unable to go to work because of illness).

examples.ch: 高犯罪率被一些人视为病态社会的标志。
examples.en: High rates of crime are considered by some people to be a sign of a sick society.

defines.trans_en: feeling ill as if you are going to vomit

examples.ch: 露西在聚会后的第二天早上觉得恶心。
examples.en: Lucy felt sick the morning after the party.

examples.ch: 如果再吃一块那个块蛋糕，你会觉得恶心想吐。
examples.en: If you eat any more of that cake, you'll make yourself sick.

defines.trans_en: feeling strong unpleasant emotions, especially anger or disgust

examples.ch: 我对未能得到那份工作感到非常不快。
examples.en: I'm sick at (= unhappy about) not getting that job.

examples.ch: 看到人们穿裘皮大衣，我感到非常愤怒。
examples.en: It makes me sick (= makes me very angry) to see people wearing fur coats.

examples.ch: 她干得那么少却得到那么多的报酬，真让人感到气愤。
examples.en: It's sick-making (= very annoying) that she's being paid so much for doing so little.

examples.ch: 你的表现令我感到很气愤。
examples.en: I'm sick (and tired/to death) of (= very annoyed about) the way you're behaving.

examples.ch: 女儿没有按时回家，她十分担心。
examples.en: She was worried sick (= very worried) when her daughter didn't come home on time.

examples.ch: 听说犯人被殴打，我感到震惊。
examples.en: I felt sick (= felt shocked and disgusted) when I heard about the prisoners being beaten.

defines.trans_en: cruel or offensive

examples.ch: 琼没觉得她兄弟讲的不堪入耳的笑话有什么好笑的。
examples.en: Joan was not amused by the sick joke her brother told.

defines.trans_en: very good, excellent

examples.ch: 单板滑雪者的表演堪称完美
examples.en: snowboarders doing sick tricks

phrases.trans_en: to vomit

examples.ch: 她吃了太多巧克力之后吐了。
examples.en: She was sick after she ate too much chocolate.

defines.trans_en: vomit

examples.ch: 地板上的一滩呕吐物
examples.en: a pool of sick on the floor

phrases.trans_en: people who are ill

examples.ch: 病人在家里照顾要比在医院里更好一些。
examples.en: It's better for the sick to be cared for at home rather than in hospital.

defines.trans_en: a flat outer surface of an object, especially one that is not the top, the bottom, the front, or the back

examples.ch: 船的名字通常漆在船的侧面。
examples.en: The names of ships are usually painted on their sides.

examples.ch: 房子右侧的窗户开着。
examples.en: The window on the right side of the house was open.

examples.ch: 请只在纸的一面书写。
examples.en: Please write on one side of the paper only.

examples.ch: 我的论文已经写了4页纸了。
examples.en: I've already written four sides (= pages of writing) for my essay.

examples.ch: 加拿大硬币的一面有女王的头像。
examples.en: Canadian coins have a picture of the British Queen's head on one side.

examples.ch: 请走侧门。
examples.en: Please use the side entrance.

defines.trans_en: an edge or border of something

examples.ch: 正方形有4条边。
examples.en: A square has four sides.

examples.ch: 公路两旁都有树。
examples.en: There are trees on both sides of the road.

examples.ch: 他们被好奇的孩子们团团围住。
examples.en: They were surrounded on all sides/on every side by curious children.

defines.trans_en: a place next to something

examples.ch: 我的床边有一张小桌子。
examples.en: I have a small table at/by the side of (= next to) my bed.

examples.ch: 在她久病期间，他一直陪伴着她。
examples.en: He stayed at/by her side (= with her) throughout her long illness.

defines.trans_en: in a restaurant, an extra dish of food, for example vegetables or salad, that is served with the main dish, sometimes on a separate plate

examples.ch: 我要一个洋葱圈当配菜。
examples.en: I’ll have a side of onion rings.

defines.trans_en: a part of something, especially in relation to a real or imagined central line

examples.ch: 他喜欢睡在床的右边。
examples.en: He likes to sleep on the right side of the bed.

examples.ch: 在英国，汽车靠左侧行驶。
examples.en: In Britain, cars drive on the left side of the road.

examples.ch: 我娘家那边没有钱。
examples.en: There is no money on my mother's side (of the family).

examples.ch: 我能看见琼在房间的另一边。
examples.en: I could just see Joan on the far/other side of the room.

examples.ch: 孩子们从四面八方跑来。
examples.en: Children came running from all sides (= from all directions).

defines.trans_en: the part of the body from under the arm to the top of the leg

examples.ch: 我的肋部疼痛。
examples.en: I have a pain in my side.

defines.trans_en: a television channel

examples.ch: 哪家电视台在播出《加冕街》？
examples.en: What side is "Coronation Street" on?

defines.trans_en: half of an animal's body, considered as meat

examples.ch: 她从肉店里买了半扇羔羊肉。
examples.en: She bought a side of lamb from the butcher.

defines.trans_ch: （多个相互对立的团队中的）一方
defines.trans_en: one of two or more opposing teams or groups

examples.ch: 这是一场双方都无法打赢的战争。
examples.en: This is a war which neither side can win.

examples.ch: 我们队星期六又输了。
examples.en: Our side (= team) lost again on Saturday.

examples.ch: 你是哪个队的？
examples.en: Which/Whose side are you on (= which team are you playing for/supporting)?

examples.ch: 不要生我的气——我是站在你这边的。
examples.en: Don't be angry with me - I'm on your side (= I want to help you).

defines.trans_en: an opinion held in an argument, or a way of considering something

examples.ch: 每个问题至少有两个方面。
examples.en: There are at least two sides to every question.

examples.ch: 我已经听过你对此事的说法，但我仍然认为你的所作所为是错误的。
examples.en: I've listened to your side of the story, but I still think you were wrong to do what you did.

defines.trans_ch: （某一情形或系统中可单独处理的）一部分
defines.trans_en: a part of a situation, system, etc. that can be considered or dealt with separately

examples.ch: 她负责财务方面的事务。
examples.en: She takes care of the financial side of things.

examples.ch: 还好，我的上司也看到了其中好笑的一面。
examples.en: Fortunately my boss did see the funny side of the situation.

defines.trans_en: a part of someone's character

examples.ch: 她看起来很凶，但实际上她也有温柔的一面。
examples.en: She seems quite fierce, but actually she has a gentle side.

phrases.trans_ch: 肩并肩地;一个挨一个地
phrases.trans_en: next to each other

examples.ch: 孩子们肩并肩地坐在沙发上看电视。
examples.en: The children sat side by side on the sofa watching television.

phrases.trans_en: from left to right and from right to left

examples.ch: 窗帘在微风中来回摆动。
examples.en: The curtains were swinging from side to side in the breeze.

phrases.trans_ch: （在争论或战争中）表明立场，支持一方
phrases.trans_en: to support one person or group rather than another, in an argument or war

examples.ch: 我和弟弟吵架时，我母亲从不偏袒任何一方。
examples.en: My mother never takes sides when my brother and I argue.

phrases.trans_en: to support someone in an argument

examples.ch: 我和父亲争论时，母亲总是站在他一边。
examples.en: My mother always takes my father's side when I argue with him.

defines.trans_en: not in or at the centre or main part of something

examples.ch: 我把汽车停在小道上。
examples.en: We parked the car on a side street/road (= a small road, especially one that joins on to a main road).

examples.ch: 我认为这是个次要问题，我们应该以后再讨论。
examples.en: I think that's a side issue (= a subject which is separate from the main one) which we should talk about later.

examples.ch: 我想要盘土豆作为配菜。
examples.en: I'd like a side dish of potatoes (= some potatoes on a separate plate).

defines.trans_en: a chemical element that is a valuable shiny, white metal, used for making cutlery (= knives, spoons, etc.), jewellery, coins, and decorative objects

examples.ch: 我们送给他们一个纯银盘子作为结婚礼物。
examples.en: We gave them a dish made of solid silver as a wedding present.

examples.ch: 擦洗银器是一件很讨厌的事。
examples.en: Cleaning the silver (= silver objects) is a dirty job.

examples.ch: 今天晚餐要用银餐具吗?
examples.en: Shall we use the silver (= knives, spoons, plates, etc. made of silver) for dinner tonight?

examples.ch: 我需要一些硬币来使用停车场的售票机。
examples.en: I need some silver (= coins made of silver or a metal of similar appearance) for the ticket machine in the car park.

defines.trans_en: a small disc of silver, or a metal that looks like silver, that is given to the person who comes second in a competition, especially in a sport

examples.ch: 英国队在标枪比赛中获得了银牌。
examples.en: Great Britain won (a) silver/a silver medal in the javelin.

defines.trans_en: made of silver, or of the colour of silver

examples.ch: 银戒指
examples.en: a silver ring

examples.ch: 我的祖母一头银发。
examples.en: My grandmother has silver hair.

defines.trans_ch: 给（窗户等）镀上银色物质
defines.trans_en: to cover something, especially glass, with a thin layer of silver-coloured material in order to make a mirror
from a particular time in the past until a later time, or until now

examples.ch: 埃玛一年前去纽约工作了，自那时起我们就没有见过她。
examples.en: Emma went to work in New York a year ago, and we haven't seen her since.

examples.ch: 他1995年就开始为那家公司工作，在此之后就一直在那里。
examples.en: He started working for the company in 1995, and has been there ever since (= and is still there).

examples.ch: 我早就把我学过的那点拉丁语忘光了。
examples.en: I've long since (= long ago) forgotten any Latin I ever learned.

defines.trans_en: from a particular time in the past until a later time, or until now

examples.ch: 他自去年起就再没有赢过比赛。
examples.en: He hasn't won a game since last year.

examples.ch: 这是有史以来最热的十月。
examples.en: It was the hottest October since records began.

defines.trans_en: because; as

examples.ch: 既然等火车还需要几分钟，我们去喝杯咖啡吧。
examples.en: Since we've got a few minutes to wait for the train, let's have a cup of coffee.

defines.trans_en: from a particular time in the past until a later time, or until now

examples.ch: 我度完假回来后就一直很忙。
examples.en: I've been very busy since I came back from holiday.

defines.trans_en: honestly and without pretending or lying

examples.ch: 我衷心地感谢。
examples.en: I'm sincerely grateful.

phrases.trans_en: used to end a formal letter that is sent to a particular person

defines.trans_en: to make musical sounds with the voice, usually a tune with words

examples.ch: 在学校音乐会上，孩子们演唱了舒伯特的两首歌曲。
examples.en: The children sang two songs by Schubert at the school concert.

examples.ch: 我们很早就被鸟儿的鸣唱声唤醒。
examples.en: We were woken early by the sound of the birds singing.

examples.ch: 你祖母想让你给她唱首歌。
examples.en: Your grandmother would like you to sing for/to her.

examples.ch: 你能为我们唱首歌吗?
examples.en: Will you sing us a song/sing a song to us?

examples.ch: 她每天晚上唱歌哄孩子入睡。
examples.en: She sang her baby to sleep every night.

examples.ch: 帕瓦罗蒂本周将在拉斯卡拉剧院扮演歌剧《波希米亚人》中的鲁道夫。
examples.en: Pavarotti is singing Rodolfo (= singing the part of Rodolfo) in "La Bohème" at La Scala this week.

examples.ch: 请你大声点儿唱。
examples.en: You need to sing up (= sing louder).

defines.trans_en: to make or be filled with a (high) ringing sound

examples.ch: 一颗子弹从士兵头顶嗖的一声飞过。
examples.en: A bullet sang past the top of the soldier's head.

defines.trans_en: one only

examples.ch: 他仅用一拳就打倒了对手。
examples.en: He knocked his opponent down with a single blow.

examples.ch: 没有一个人主动出来帮她。
examples.en: Not a single person offered to help her.

examples.ch: 我说的你连一个字都没听进去。
examples.en: You haven't been listening to a single word I've been saying.

defines.trans_en: not married, or not having a romantic relationship with someone

examples.ch: 单身女子／未婚男人／单身者
examples.en: a single woman/man/person

examples.ch: 他这么长时间一直单身，我认为他永远不会结婚了。
examples.en: He's been single for so long now, I don't think he'll ever marry.

examples.ch: 近年来，依靠国家救济的单亲家庭数量急剧增加。
examples.en: The number of single-parent families dependent on the state has risen enormously in recent years.

defines.trans_en: considered on its own and separate from other things

examples.ch: 耐心是这项工作所需最重要的特质。
examples.en: Patience is the single most important quality needed for this job.

examples.ch: 她的房子被烧毁以后，她失去了所有的一切。
examples.en: She lost every single thing when her house burned down.

defines.trans_en: A baseball player singles by hitting a ball that allows him to reach first base.
a record or CD that has a main song and usually a small number of other songs on it

examples.ch: 你听过女神卡卡的最新单曲吗？
examples.en: Have you heard Lady Gaga's new single?

defines.trans_en: in cricket, one run (= point)
in baseball, a hit that allows the player to reach first base

a 
single room

phrases.trans_en: a game, especially in tennis, played between one player on one side and one on the other
people who are not married and do not have a romantic relationship with someone
a ticket for a journey to a place, but not for the return

examples.ch: 请给我一张去伦敦的单程票。
examples.en: May I have a single to London, please.

defines.trans_en: a girl or woman who has the same parents as another person

examples.ch: 索菲和埃米莉是姐妹。
examples.en: Sophie and Emily are sisters.

examples.ch: 埃米莉是索菲的妹妹／姐姐。
examples.en: Emily is Sophie's younger/little/older/big sister.

defines.trans_en: a girl or woman who treats you in the kind way that a sister would

examples.ch: 琳恩真是一个好朋友——她就像我的姐妹一样。
examples.en: Lynn's such a good friend - she's like a sister to me.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指在改善妇女权利方面）志同道合的姐妹
defines.trans_en: a woman who shares an interest with you, especially that of improving women's rights

examples.ch: “我们必须继续战斗，姐妹们！”
examples.en: "We must continue the fight, sisters!"

defines.trans_en: used to address a woman

examples.ch: 好了，大姐，赶紧吧！
examples.en: OK, sister, move it!

defines.trans_en: a female member of a religious group, especially a nun

examples.ch: 贝内迪特修女
examples.en: Sister Bernadette

examples.ch: 上帝保佑你，修女。
examples.en: God bless you, Sister.

defines.trans_en: a female nurse who is in charge of a department of a hospital

examples.ch: 护士长告诉我探病时间已过。
examples.en: The sister told us that visiting hours were over.

examples.ch: 对不起，护士长，能不能给我些水喝？
examples.en: Excuse me, Sister, could I have some water?

defines.trans_en: belonging to a pair or group of similar and related things, such as businesses, usually owned or operated by the same person or organization

examples.ch: 我们在澳大利亚的姊妹公司
examples.en: our sister company in Australia

examples.ch: 美国战列舰密苏里号及其姊妹舰威斯康星号
examples.en: the US battleship Missouri and her sister ship, the Wisconsin

defines.trans_en: to (cause someone to) be in a position in which the lower part of the body is resting on a seat or other type of support, with the upper part of the body vertical

examples.ch: 坐在桌子／书桌旁
examples.en: to sit at a table/desk

examples.ch: 坐在扶手椅上
examples.en: to sit in an armchair

examples.ch: 坐在椅子上／骑在马背上／坐在地上
examples.en: to sit on a chair/a horse/the ground

examples.ch: 他走过来坐在我身边。
examples.en: He came and sat (down) next to me.

examples.ch: 坐下来喝杯冷饮吧。
examples.en: Sit yourself down and have a nice cool drink.

examples.ch: 孩子的父亲把她放在椅子上。
examples.en: The child's father sat her (down) on a chair.

defines.trans_en: to be a model for a painter, photographer, etc.

examples.ch: 莫奈的妻子多次给他做模特。
examples.en: Monet's wife sat for him many times.

defines.trans_en: (of an animal such as a dog) to move into a position with its back legs bent and its tail end on the ground

examples.ch: 我们正在训练我们的狗学蹲坐。
examples.en: We're trying to train our dog to sit.

defines.trans_en: If a bird sits on its eggs, it covers them with its body to keep them warm before they hatch.
to stay in one place for a long time and not be used

examples.ch: 那本百科全书搁在我家的书架上，落满了灰尘。
examples.en: The encyclopedia sits on my shelf at home, gathering dust.

defines.trans_en: to be in a particular position

examples.ch: 村庄位于谷底。
examples.en: The town sits at/in the bottom of a valley.

defines.trans_en: (of clothes) to fit someone in a particular way

examples.ch: 你穿那件外套很合身。
examples.en: That coat sits very well on you.

defines.trans_en: to hold an official meeting of a committee, court, etc.

examples.ch: 法庭将于明天上午开庭。
examples.en: The court will sit tomorrow morning.

examples.ch: 委员会开会听取支持和反对这项计划的意见。
examples.en: The committee sat to hear the arguments for and against the plan.

defines.trans_ch: 成为（官方组织的）成员；（在…中）任职
defines.trans_en: to be a member of an official group

examples.ch: 我将再任一年的委员会委员。
examples.en: I'm going to be sitting on the committee for one more year.

examples.ch: 马里兰州所有的现任联邦法官都来自巴尔的摩。
examples.en: All of the federal judges currently sitting (= in office) in Maryland hail from Baltimore.

defines.trans_en: to take an exam

examples.ch: 考试结束后，我将去度假。
examples.en: After I've sat my exams, I'm going on holiday.

examples.ch: 我今天参加考试了。
examples.en: I sat for my exams today.

defines.trans_ch: 代人临时照管孩子，当临时保姆
defines.trans_en: to babysit

examples.ch: 这个星期六我要替我姐姐看孩子。
examples.en: I'm sitting my sister's kids this Saturday.

defines.trans_en: how large or small something or someone is

examples.ch: 我们为自己的巨额债务担忧。
examples.en: We are concerned about the size of our debt.

examples.ch: 有些树长得很高大。
examples.en: Some kinds of trees grow to a huge size.

examples.ch: 那扇窗户尺寸有多大?
examples.en: What is the size of that window?

examples.ch: 这块地的面积约有10英亩。
examples.en: The field was about ten acres in size.

examples.ch: 他头上有一个鸡蛋大小的包。
examples.en: He had a lump on his head the size of (= the same size as) an egg.

examples.ch: 这婴儿长得可真大。
examples.en: The baby is a good size (= quite large).

examples.ch: 他们家厨房的面积之大令我吃惊。
examples.en: I was amazed at the size of their kitchen (= it was very big).

defines.trans_en: one of the standard measures according to which goods are made or sold

examples.ch: 14号的裙子
examples.en: a size 14 dress

examples.ch: 这些鞋有儿童码的吗?
examples.en: Do these shoes come (= are they made) in children's sizes?

examples.ch: 你穿几号的?
examples.en: What size are you?/What is your size?/What size do you take?

examples.ch: 您想试试这件外套大小合适吗，先生?
examples.en: Would you like to try the coat (on) for size (= see how well it fits you), sir?

examples.ch: 我们需要把那块地毯裁剪得大小正合适。
examples.en: We'll need to get the carpet cut to size (= cut so that it fits).

defines.trans_ch: （使衣服、纸张等坚挺的）浆料，胶料
defines.trans_en: a substance like glue that gives stiffness and a hard, shiny surface to cloth, paper, etc.

defines.trans_ch: 给（衣服、纸张等）上浆，给…涂胶
defines.trans_en: to cover or treat cloth, paper, etc. with size
a special boot with a thin metal bar attached to the bottom that you wear to move quickly on ice, or a boot with four small wheels fixed to the bottom so that you can move over a hard surface

examples.ch: 一双滑冰鞋
examples.en: a pair of ice skates

examples.ch: 一双四轮溜冰鞋
examples.en: a pair of roller skates

defines.trans_ch: 鳐鱼（一种扁体海鱼，可食用）
defines.trans_en: a large, flat sea fish that can be eaten as food
to move, or make a particular movement on a surface, using skates

examples.ch: 河上的冰足够厚，可以在上面滑冰。
examples.en: The ice on the river is thick enough to skate on/across/over.

examples.ch: 我们明天去滑冰吧。
examples.en: Let's go skating tomorrow.

defines.trans_en: a flat, narrow board with two small wheels under each end, which a person stands on and moves forward by pushing one foot on the ground
one of a pair of long, flat narrow pieces of wood or plastic that curve up at the front and are fastened to boots so that the wearer can move quickly and easily over snow

examples.ch: 一副滑雪板
examples.en: a pair of skis

examples.ch: 滑雪鞋
examples.en: ski boots

examples.ch: 滑雪俱乐部／胜地
examples.en: a ski club/resort

defines.trans_en: to move over snow on skis

examples.ch: 他滑雪下山。
examples.en: He skied down the hill.

examples.ch: 我们去滑雪吧。
examples.en: Let's go skiing.

defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing for women and girls that hangs from the waist and does not have legs

examples.ch: 她穿着一条牛仔半身裙和一件白衬衫。
examples.en: She wore a denim skirt and a white shirt.

examples.ch: 长／短裙
examples.en: a long/short skirt

defines.trans_en: an outer covering or part to protect particular machines
beef (= meat from a cow) that is cut from the bottom part of the side of the animal

examples.ch: 市场对像牛腩这种较便宜的牛肉的需求越来越大。
examples.en: There's an increasing market for the cheaper cuts of beef such as skirt.

examples.ch: 牛腩排半熟的最好吃。
examples.en: Skirt steak is best medium-rare.

defines.trans_ch: 位于…的边缘;环绕…的四周;沿…的边缘走
defines.trans_en: to go around the edge of something

examples.ch: 沿镇边的那条路走，不要走穿过镇子的那条路。
examples.en: Take the road which skirts (round) the town, not the one which goes through it.

defines.trans_ch: 避开，绕开（某话题或问题）
defines.trans_en: to avoid discussing a subject or problem, usually because there are difficulties that you do not want to deal with

examples.ch: 政府受到指责，称其避而不谈虐待疑犯的问题。
examples.en: The government has been accused of skirting round the issue of torture.

defines.trans_en: the area above the earth, in which clouds, the sun, etc. can be seen

examples.ch: 蓝色／多云／阴暗的天空
examples.en: a blue/cloudy/dark sky

examples.ch: 你能看到高空的那些鸟吗?
examples.en: Can you see those birds high up in the sky?

examples.ch: 我们听到飞机的声音后抬头仰望天空。
examples.en: We looked up at/into the sky at the sound of the plane.

phrases.trans_ch: （某种天气状况下或某地的）天空
phrases.trans_en: the sky in a particular state or place

examples.ch: 好几个星期以来，我们这里的天空都是晴朗无云，一片湛蓝。
examples.en: For weeks we had cloudless blue skies.

examples.ch: 我们要离开这里去享受佛罗里达晴朗的天空了。
examples.en: We're off to the sunny skies of Florida.

defines.trans_en: the resting state in which the body is not active and the mind is unconscious

examples.ch: 我必须睡一会儿——我太累了。
examples.en: I must get some sleep - I'm exhausted.

defines.trans_en: a period of sleeping

examples.ch: 开了那么长时间的车你一定累了——为什么不睡一小会儿？
examples.en: You must be tired after all that driving - why don't you have a little sleep?

examples.ch: 他睡得很沉。
examples.en: He fell into a deep sleep.

examples.ch: 好好地睡一晚上以后你会感觉好些。
examples.en: You'll feel better after a good night's sleep.

defines.trans_en: a yellowish substance sometimes found in the corners of the eyes after sleeping

phrases.trans_en: to succeed in sleeping

examples.ch: 昨晚我担心得无法入睡。
examples.en: I couldn't get to sleep at all last night I was so worried.

examples.ch: 你会发现你的孩子通常吃饱后就睡了。
examples.en: You'll find that your baby usually goes to sleep after a feed.

defines.trans_en: to be in the state of rest when your eyes are closed, your body is not active, and your mind is unconscious

examples.ch: 隔壁的噪音让我睡不着。
examples.en: I couldn't sleep because of all the noise next door.

examples.ch: 我星期天早上睡懒觉了。
examples.en: I slept late on Sunday morning.

examples.ch: 心头有那么多担心的事，杰恩晚上怎么能睡得着？
examples.en: How can Jayne sleep at night with all those worries on her mind!

examples.ch: 我们与安和查尔斯共进晚餐并在他们家过夜。
examples.en: We had dinner with Ann and Charles and slept the night there (= at their home).

defines.trans_ch: （车辆、帐篷等）躺得下，可供…睡觉
defines.trans_en: If a vehicle, tent, etc. sleeps a particular number of people, it provides enough space or beds for that number of people to be able to sleep in it.

examples.ch: 这顶帐篷足以容纳下四个人。
examples.en: The tent sleeps four comfortably.

phrases.trans_en: to sleep very well

examples.ch: 我早早上了床，睡得很香。
examples.en: I went to bed early and slept like a log.

phrases.trans_ch: 把…留到第二天再作决定，推迟对…作出决定
phrases.trans_en: to delay making a decision about something important until the next day so that you have time to consider it carefully

examples.ch: “我能不能推迟一下作决定，明天再告诉你？”
examples.en: Can I sleep on it, and tell you my decision tomorrow?

phrases.trans_en: to sleep outside because you have no home and no money

examples.ch: 有成百上千的孩子露宿在首都街头。
examples.en: Hundreds of kids are sleeping rough on the streets of the capital.

defines.trans_en: a flat, often thin, piece of food that has been cut from a larger piece

examples.ch: 一片面包／蛋糕
examples.en: a slice of bread/cake

examples.ch: 黄瓜／柠檬片
examples.en: cucumber/lemon slices

examples.ch: 要不要再来一片火腿／牛肉？
examples.en: Would you like another slice of ham/beef?

defines.trans_en: a part of something, such as an amount of money

examples.ch: 成交前，我们商定双方各拿利润的一半。
examples.en: We agreed before we did the deal that we'd both take an equal slice of the profit.

examples.ch: 这部电影向我们展示了一个非常有趣的历史片段。
examples.en: The film presents us with a fascinating slice of history.

defines.trans_en: a kitchen utensil with a wide blade, used for serving pieces of food

examples.ch: 蛋糕刀／煎鱼铲
examples.en: a cake/fish slice

defines.trans_en: in tennis, the action of hitting the bottom of the ball so that it does not bounce very high when it hits the ground

examples.ch: 玛丽亚那一记漂亮的反手削球恰好把球打到了对手够不到的地方。
examples.en: That wonderful backhand slice of Maria's sends the ball where her opponent just can't reach it.

defines.trans_ch: （高尔夫球和棒球运动中）斜切（球），削（球）
defines.trans_en: in the sports of golf and baseball, the action of hitting a ball so that it goes to one side rather than straight in front
to cut something into thin, flat pieces

examples.ch: 把蘑菇切成薄片，用黄油煎一下。
examples.en: Slice the mushrooms thinly and fry in butter.

examples.ch: 你能帮我切一薄片蛋糕吗?
examples.en: Could you slice me a very thin piece of cake/slice a very thin piece of cake for me?

defines.trans_en: to easily cut into or through something with a sharp knife

examples.ch: 刀片切入他的腿时，他发出一声尖叫。
examples.en: He screamed as the blade sliced into his leg.

examples.ch: 她看着他细长结实的身体毫不费力地破水前进。
examples.en: She watched his slim strong body as it sliced effortlessly through the water.

defines.trans_ch: （高尔夫球和棒球运动中）斜切（球），削球
defines.trans_en: in the sports of golf and baseball, to hit a ball so that it goes to one side rather than straight in front

examples.ch: 萨拉打了一个斜切球，将球向左送了100米左右。
examples.en: Sara sliced the ball, sending it a hundred yards or so to the left.

defines.trans_en: If you slice the ball in a game of tennis, you hit the bottom of the ball so that it does not bounce very high when it hits the ground.
moving, happening, or doing something without much speed

examples.ch: 跑步慢的人／开车慢的人／看书慢的人
examples.en: a slow runner/driver/reader

examples.ch: 她吃饭很慢。
examples.en: She's a very slow eater.

examples.ch: 我们这幅画进度缓慢但很平稳。
examples.en: We're making slow but steady progress with the painting.

examples.ch: 政府对这一问题反应迟缓。
examples.en: The government was very slow to react to the problem.

examples.ch: 那几个月生意都很清淡，因为大家都在休假。
examples.en: Business is always slow during those months because everyone's on holiday.

defines.trans_ch: （电影、书籍、戏剧等）情节拖沓的，索然无趣的
defines.trans_en: used to describe a film, book, play, etc. that does not have much excitement and action

examples.ch: 他那些电影情节拖沓，总让我昏昏欲睡。
examples.en: His films are so slow they send me to sleep.

defines.trans_en: A person might be described as slow if they are not very clever and do not understand or notice things quickly.

examples.ch: 和安德鲁在一起时，我感觉自己很迟钝——他比我聪明多了。
examples.en: I feel so slow when I'm with Andrew - he's so much brighter than me.

examples.ch: 我对这一点理解能力较差——完全没听懂他的推理。
examples.en: I was a bit slow on the uptake there - I didn't follow his reasoning at all.

defines.trans_en: If a clock or watch is slow, it shows a time that is earlier than the real time.

examples.ch: 那个钟慢10分钟。
examples.en: That clock is ten minutes slow.

defines.trans_en: to reduce speed or activity, or to make something do this

examples.ch: 因为经济不景气，企业发展减缓了速度。
examples.en: Business development has slowed in response to the recession.

examples.ch: 高峰时期，车辆行驶速度跟蜗牛爬似的。
examples.en: Traffic slows to a crawl (= goes so slowly it almost stops) during rush hour.

examples.ch: 飞行员被要求减速接近跑道。
examples.en: The pilot was asked to slow his approach to the runway.

defines.trans_en: at a slow speed

examples.ch: 我走得已经非常慢了。
examples.en: I can't walk any slower.

examples.ch: 移动缓慢的车流
examples.en: slow-moving traffic

examples.ch: 燃得很慢的蜡烛
examples.en: a slow-burning candle

examples.ch: 他开车太慢了！
examples.en: He drives too slow!

defines.trans_en: little in size or amount when compared with what is typical or average

examples.ch: 小狗／房子／汽车／国
examples.en: a small dog/house/car/country

examples.ch: 我宁愿住在小城镇，也不住在大城市。
examples.en: I'd rather live in a small town than a big city.

examples.ch: 你的汉堡包要配大可乐还是小可乐？
examples.en: Would you like a large or small cola with your burger?

examples.ch: 埃拉是她班上个头最小的女孩。
examples.en: Ella is the smallest girl in her class.

examples.ch: 那件夹克你穿太小了。
examples.en: That jacket's too small for you.

examples.ch: 相对他的年龄来说，他个子小了些。
examples.en: He's small for his age.

examples.ch: 只有一小部分人申请成功了。
examples.en: Only a small number of applicants are successful.

examples.ch: 议会中女性的人数少得可怜。
examples.en: The number of women in parliament is pitifully (= extremely) small.

examples.ch: 利口酒通常都是小口小口地喝。
examples.en: Liqueurs are usually drunk in small quantities.

defines.trans_en: A small child is a very young child that is older than a baby.

examples.ch: 照看幼儿会很累人。
examples.en: Taking care of small children can be very tiring.

defines.trans_en: limited in the amount of an activity

examples.ch: 政府应该给予小企业主更多的帮助。
examples.en: The government should give more help to small businessmen (= people whose businesses are of a limited size).

examples.ch: 克里斯饭量很小，所以他不会要太多。
examples.en: Chris is a small eater so he won't want much.

examples.ch: 如果您能帮我们一个小忙，我们将不胜感激。
examples.en: If you can help us in a small way (= to a limited degree) it would be greatly appreciated.

defines.trans_ch: 不重要的；不会造成麻烦的
defines.trans_en: not very important or not likely to cause problems

examples.ch: 在考试中她只犯了一两个小错。
examples.en: She just made a couple of small mistakes in the test.

examples.ch: 我有件小事想和你商量一下。
examples.en: I have a small problem I would like to discuss with you.

defines.trans_en: ashamed or weak

examples.ch: 和她谈话让我感到自己很卑微。
examples.en: Talking to her makes me feel small.

examples.ch: 他总是想方设法让我在老板面前显得无足轻重。
examples.en: He's always trying to make me look small in front of my boss.

defines.trans_en: Small letters are not capital letters.

examples.ch: 诗人 e. e. cummings（卡明斯）用小写字母写自己的名字，而不用大写。
examples.en: The poet e. e. cummings wrote his name with small letters, not capital letters.

defines.trans_en: in a small size

examples.ch: 说明书的字印刷得很小，我几乎无法看清。
examples.en: The instructions are printed so small I can hardly read them.

phrases.trans_en: the middle of the lower back

examples.ch: 我后腰疼。
examples.en: I have a pain in the small of my back.

phrases.trans_en: underwear, especially when being washed or about to be washed

examples.ch: 你有没有要洗的内衣？
examples.en: Do you have any smalls that need washing?

defines.trans_en: the grey, black, or white mixture of gas and very small pieces of carbon that is produced when something burns

examples.ch: 香烟的烟雾
examples.en: cigarette smoke

examples.ch: 烟雾弥漫的小房间
examples.en: a tiny smoke-filled room

examples.ch: 大火产生的大团烟雾在20英里之外都能看见。
examples.en: The fire produced a pall (= large mass) of smoke visible 20 miles away.

examples.ch: 滚滚浓烟从烟囱里冒出来。
examples.en: Plumes of smoke billowed from the chimney.

examples.ch: 她若有所思地向后靠去，吐出了一口烟。
examples.en: She leaned back thoughtfully and blew a puff of (= a small amount of) smoke into the air.

defines.trans_en: the act of smoking a cigarette

examples.ch: 我很喜欢在饭后抽一支烟。
examples.en: I really enjoy a smoke at the end of a meal.

defines.trans_en: a cigarette

examples.ch: 你出去的时候能帮我买些烟吗？
examples.en: Would you buy me some smokes while you're out?

phrases.trans_en: to be destroyed by burning

examples.ch: 由于这场大火，数百座房屋被烧毁。
examples.en: Because of the fire, hundreds of houses went up in smoke.

phrases.trans_ch: 未达到预期的效果，化为泡影
phrases.trans_en: Something that goes up in smoke fails to produce the result that was wanted.

examples.ch: 公司破产时，20年的苦心经营化为乌有。
examples.en: When the business went bankrupt, 20 years of hard work went up in smoke.

phrases.trans_ch: 大城市（尤指伦敦、悉尼或墨尔本）
phrases.trans_en: any large city, especially London, Sydney, or Melbourne

examples.ch: 他初次来到这座大城市时还是个16岁的小伙子。
examples.en: He was a young lad of 16 when he first came to the big smoke.

defines.trans_en: to breathe smoke into the mouth and usually lungs from a cigarette, pipe, etc.

examples.ch: 我抽根烟你介意吗？
examples.en: Do you mind if I smoke?

examples.ch: 我曾经一天抽一包烟。
examples.en: I used to smoke a packet of cigarettes a day.

defines.trans_en: to produce smoke as a result of industrial activity or of something such as an electrical fault

examples.ch: 地平线上全是工厂冒着烟的烟囱。
examples.en: The skyline is dominated by smoking factory chimneys.

examples.ch: 电视机突然图像全无，开始冒烟。
examples.en: Suddenly the TV went blank and started smoking.

defines.trans_en: to preserve meat, fish, or cheese using smoke from burning wood

examples.ch: 埃及人6000年前就开始进行鱼和肉的腌制、风干和熏制。
examples.en: People in Egypt were salting, drying, and smoking fish and meat 6,000 years ago.

defines.trans_en: a small amount of food that is eaten between meals, or a very small meal

examples.ch: 我午饭吃得很饱，所以晚饭吃些点心就可以了。
examples.en: I had a huge lunch, so I'll only need a snack for dinner.

examples.ch: 新鲜水果或果脯是理想的小吃。
examples.en: Fresh or dried fruit makes an ideal snack.

examples.ch: 很多快餐都是高盐、高糖、高脂肪。
examples.en: Many snack foods are high in salt, sugar, and fat.

defines.trans_en: to eat small amounts of food between meals

examples.ch: 我吃了一天的零食。
examples.en: I've been snacking all day.

examples.ch: 如果你一日三餐好好吃，可能就不会把饼干当零嘴了。
examples.en: If you eat three good meals a day, you're less likely to snack on biscuits.

defines.trans_en: the small, soft, white pieces of ice that sometimes fall from the sky when it is cold, or the white layer on the ground and other surfaces that it forms

examples.ch: 外面开始下雪了。
examples.en: Outside the snow began to fall.

examples.ch: 我们一起去玩雪吧！
examples.en: Let's go and play in the snow!

examples.ch: 地上积着厚厚的一层雪。
examples.en: A blanket of snow lay on the ground.

examples.ch: 她头发乌黑，嘴唇红润如宝石，肌肤洁白如雪。
examples.en: Her hair was jet-black, her lips ruby-red and her skin as white as snow.

defines.trans_en: a single fall of snow

examples.ch: 今年冬天我们这儿没下过几场大雪。
examples.en: We haven't had many heavy snows this winter.

defines.trans_en:
→ 
cocaine
If it snows, snow falls from the sky.

examples.ch: 下雪了。
examples.en: It's snowing.

examples.ch: 开始下雪了。
examples.en: It's starting to snow.

examples.ch: 一晚上都在下雪，地上积了厚厚的一层。
examples.en: It had snowed overnight and a thick white layer covered the ground.

defines.trans_en: to deceive or trick someone by talking a lot or by giving them a lot of information

examples.ch: 她让人觉得是在用统计数据蒙骗我们。
examples.en: It felt like she was snowing us with statistics.

phrases.trans_en: to be unable to travel away from a place because of very heavy snow

examples.ch: 去年冬天，我们被雪困了4天。
examples.en: We were snowed in for four days last winter.

defines.trans_en: to slide on the snow by standing on a specially shaped board

examples.ch: 我目前正在学习单板滑雪。
examples.en: I'm learning to snowboard at the moment.

defines.trans_en: a specially shaped board that you stand on to slide down a snow-covered slope

examples.ch: 单板滑雪公园越来越受欢迎。
examples.en: Snowboard parks (= where you can snowboard) are becoming more popular.

defines.trans_en: the activity or sport of moving over snow using a snowboard
very, extremely, or to such a degree

examples.ch: 这房子太漂亮了！
examples.en: The house is so beautiful.

examples.ch: 谢谢你这么耐心。
examples.en: Thank you for being so patient.

examples.ch: 不要这么傻了！
examples.en: Don't be so stupid!

examples.ch: 我不知道她有这么多孩子！
examples.en: I didn't know she had so many children!

examples.ch: 你只能帮忙到这个地步。
examples.en: You can only do so much to help (= there is a limit to how much you can help).

examples.ch: 她向来这样和蔼可亲。
examples.en: She's ever so kind and nice.

examples.ch: 我太累了，连坐在这椅子上都能睡着！
examples.en: I'm so tired (that) I could sleep in this chair!

examples.ch: 我并不急着非同意不可。
examples.en: I'm not so desperate as to agree to that.

examples.ch: 这个词本身就十分罕见，几乎要被淘汰了。
examples.en: The word itself is so rare as to be almost obsolete.

defines.trans_ch: （用在名词或 not 前表示强调）
defines.trans_en: used before a noun or before "not" to emphasize what is being said

examples.ch: 别穿那个了——去年才流行那个呢，现在早过时了。
examples.en: Don't wear that - it's so last year (= it was fashionable last year but not now).

examples.ch: 对不起，但适合她的尺码绝对要比10号大很多。
examples.en: I'm sorry, but she is so not a size 10 (= she is very much larger than a size 10).

defines.trans_en: used at the end of a sentence to mean to a very great degree

examples.ch: 这就是你如此痛恨他的原因吗？
examples.en: Is that why you hate him so?

examples.ch: 你太多虑了！
examples.en: You worry so!

defines.trans_ch: （通常用于 have，be，do 等助动词前）同样，像这样
defines.trans_en: used usually before the verbs "have", "be", or "do", and other auxiliary verbs to express the meaning "in the same way" or "in a similar way"

examples.ch: “我有很多很多工作要做。”“我也一样。”
examples.en: "I've got an enormous amount of work to do." "So have I."

examples.ch: “我对坚果过敏。”“我弟弟也是。”
examples.en: "I'm allergic to nuts." "So is my brother."

examples.ch: 尼尔午夜刚过就走了，罗兹也走了。
examples.en: Neil left just after midnight and so did Roz.

examples.ch: 就像你喜欢和小伙子晚上出去一样，我偶尔也喜欢和女孩子一起出去。
examples.en: Just as you like to have a night out with the lads, so I like to go out with the girls now and again.

defines.trans_ch: （用于代替先前提到的短语以避免重复）这样，如此
defines.trans_en: used to avoid repeating a phrase mentioned earlier

examples.ch: “我希望他们在一起。”“我也希望如此。”
examples.en: "I hope they stay together." "I hope so too."

examples.ch: “你认为他不高兴了吗？”“我想没有。”
examples.en: "Do you think he's upset?" "I don't think so."

examples.ch: 詹姆斯今晚要来，至少他是这么说的。
examples.en: James is coming tonight, or so he said.

defines.trans_en: used to say that a situation mentioned earlier is correct or true

examples.ch: “我们今年真的不会加薪吗？”“恐怕是这样的。”
examples.en: "Is it true that we're not getting a pay increase this year?" "I'm afraid so."

examples.ch: “安东尼和米娅相处得不怎么好。”“真是那样吗？”
examples.en: "Anthony and Mia don't get along very well." "Is that so?"

examples.ch: “天气预报说可能要下雨。”“如果真是那样的话，我们就在室内聚会。”
examples.en: "The forecast says it might rain." "If so, we'll have the party inside."

defines.trans_en: used to say that a fact that has just been stated is certainly true

examples.ch: “我两眼的颜色略有差别。”“的确如此。”
examples.en: "My eyes are slightly different colours." "So they are."

examples.ch: “那是她弟弟——看上去像詹姆斯•迪恩。”“的确如此。”
examples.en: "That's her brother - he looks like James Dean." "So he does."

defines.trans_ch: （用于代替已提到过的形容词以避免重复）
defines.trans_en: used instead of repeating an adjective that has already been mentioned

examples.ch: 她是个能与之共事的人——比人们告诉我的要好。
examples.en: She's reasonable to work with - more so than I was led to believe.

examples.ch: 他挺聪明的——嗯，绝对比他弟弟聪明。
examples.en: He's fairly bright - well, certainly more so than his brother.

defines.trans_en: used, especially by children, to argue against a negative statement

examples.ch: “你根本没有看过这部电影。”“我就是看过！”
examples.en: "You didn't even see the movie." "I did so!"

defines.trans_en: in this way, or like this

examples.ch: 建筑物外面的柱子如此排列是为了能提供最大的室内空间。
examples.en: The pillars, which are outside the building, are so placed in order to provide the maximum space inside.

examples.ch: 我这样安排自己的旅程就能在星期五晚上到家。
examples.en: I've so arranged my trip that I'll be home on Friday night.

defines.trans_en: used when you are showing how something is done

examples.ch: 把这张纸反折，就这样，在这儿折一条痕。
examples.en: Just fold this piece of paper back, so, and make a crease here.

examples.ch: 就这样轻轻拌入鸡蛋。
examples.en: Gently fold in the eggs like so.

defines.trans_en: used when you are representing the size of something

examples.ch: “他到你哪儿？”“哦，大约这么高。”她在自己的脖子上比划了一下说道。
examples.en: "How tall is he next to you?" "Oh, about so big," she said, indicating the level of her neck.

examples.ch: “我最喜欢的桌子大约有这么宽。”她说着，张开双臂至一米半的间距。
examples.en: "The table that I liked best was about so wide," she said, holding her arms out a metre and a half.

phrases.trans_en: to act in the way mentioned

examples.ch: 父母必须为他们的子女负责，如果不这样的话可能意味着罚款或监禁。
examples.en: Parents must take responsibility for their children. Failure to do so could mean a fine or a jail sentence.

defines.trans_ch: （放在句首，表示和已说过或已发生过的事相联系）如此，这样，那么
defines.trans_en: used at the beginning of a sentence to connect it with something that has been said or has happened previously

examples.ch: 就这样，我站在路边，只穿着内衣……
examples.en: So, there I was standing at the edge of the road with only my underwear on ...

examples.ch: 那么，就把我刚才所说的内容讲完……
examples.en: So, just to finish what I was saying earlier...

defines.trans_en: used as a way of making certain that you or someone else understand something correctly, often when you are repeating the important points of a plan

examples.ch: 这么说，我们星期四出发，下一个星期二回来，对吗？
examples.en: So we leave on the Thursday and get back the next Tuesday, is that right?

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a discovery that you have just made

examples.ch: 那就是我不在的时候他所干的事！
examples.en: So that's what he does when I'm not around!

defines.trans_ch: （表示停顿，有时用于强调所说的内容）
defines.trans_en: used as a short pause, sometimes to emphasize what you are saying

examples.ch: 瞧，我们又在一起了——就你和我。
examples.en: So, here we are again - just you and me.

defines.trans_ch: （表示引出谈话内容，尤用于提问）那么
defines.trans_en: used before you introduce a subject of conversation that is of present interest, especially when you are asking a question

examples.ch: 那么，你认为谁会赢得大选？
examples.en: So, who do you think is going to win the election?

defines.trans_ch: （表示某人所说的内容并不重要）是呀，没错
defines.trans_en: used to show that you agree with something that someone has just said, but you do not think that it is important

examples.ch: 没错，这辆车的确很贵——可我买得起。
examples.en: So the car's expensive - well, I can afford it.

defines.trans_en: and for that reason; therefore

examples.ch: 我的膝盖开始疼痛，因此我停下来不再跑了。
examples.en: My knee started hurting so I stopped running.

examples.ch: 我迷路了，所以买了一张街道地图。
examples.en: I was lost so I bought a street map.

defines.trans_en: used before you give an explanation for the action that you have just mentioned

examples.ch: 我特意没吃午饭，为的就是让自己今晚能感到饿。
examples.en: I deliberately didn't have lunch so (that) I would be hungry tonight.

examples.ch: 把钥匙放在外面，好让我记得带。
examples.en: Leave the keys out so (that) I remember to take them with me.

phrases.trans_en: in order to

examples.ch: 我总是把水果放在冰箱里，以防虫子叮咬。
examples.en: I always keep fruit in the fridge so as to keep flies off it.

phrases.trans_en: in order not to

examples.ch: 为了不打扰她，他没有开灯。
examples.en: He did not switch on the light so as not to disturb her.

phrases.trans_ch: 非常整齐的，井井有条的
phrases.trans_en: perfectly tidy and well arranged

examples.ch: 他是个完美主义者——一切都必须是一丝不乱的。
examples.en: He's a perfectionist - everything has to be just so.

defines.trans_ch: 索（大调音阶的第五音，同 soh）
defines.trans_en:
the musical note 
soh
a substance used for washing the body or other things

examples.ch: 一块肥皂
examples.en: a bar of soap

examples.ch: 肥皂液
examples.en: liquid soap

examples.ch: 肥皂和水
examples.en: soap and water

examples.ch: 肥皂盘／皂液器
examples.en: a soap dish/dispenser

examples.ch: 肥皂泡
examples.en: soap bubbles

examples.ch: 她给我买了一盒气味很好的肥皂。
examples.en: She bought me a box of nice-smelling soaps.

examples.ch: 要洗掉衣服上的油渍的话，先在上面擦一点洗碗液，然后再洗。
examples.en: To get rid of grease spots on clothing, rub a little dish soap on the spot before washing.

defines.trans_ch: 连续剧，肥皂剧（同 soap opera）
defines.trans_en:
a 
soap opera

defines.trans_ch: 在…上涂肥皂；用肥皂擦洗
defines.trans_en: to put soap on something

examples.ch: 你全身都涂肥皂了吗，艾丽斯？
examples.en: Have you soaped yourself all over, Alice?

examples.ch: 我来给你的后背抹肥皂吧。
examples.en: Let me soap your back.

defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing made from soft material that covers your foot and the lower part of your leg

examples.ch: 一双短袜
examples.en: a pair of socks

examples.ch: 尼龙／羊毛／纯棉短袜
examples.en: nylon/woollen/cotton socks

examples.ch: 保暖袜
examples.en: thermal socks

examples.ch: 及脚踝／膝的袜子
examples.en: ankle/knee socks

examples.ch: 穿上你的鞋袜。
examples.en: Put on your shoes and socks.

examples.ch: 小男孩穿着两只不配对的袜子。
examples.en: The little boy was wearing odd socks (= socks of different colours).

defines.trans_en: a powerful hit

examples.ch: 下巴上挨的重重一拳
examples.en: a sock on the jaw

defines.trans_en: to hit someone with your fist (= closed hand)

examples.ch: 他冲着警察的下巴／眼睛就是一拳。
examples.en: He socked the policeman on the jaw/in the eye.

defines.trans_en: in baseball, to hit a ball very powerfully
a long, soft seat with a back and usually arms, on which more than one person can sit at the same time
not hard or firm

examples.ch: 松软的地面
examples.en: soft ground

examples.ch: 软枕头／床垫
examples.en: a soft pillow/mattress

examples.ch: 软奶酪
examples.en: soft cheese

examples.ch: 我喜欢软质夹心巧克力。
examples.en: I like chocolates with soft centres.

examples.ch: X光能穿透肌肉等软组织。
examples.en: Soft tissue, such as flesh, allows X-rays through.

defines.trans_en: Soft things, especially parts of the body, are not hard or rough and feel pleasant and smooth when touched.

examples.ch: 柔润的嘴唇／柔滑的双颊／柔滑的肌肤／柔顺的头发
examples.en: soft lips/cheeks/skin/hair

examples.ch: 柔软的皮革
examples.en: soft leather

defines.trans_en: Someone who is soft is not very healthy and strong

examples.ch: 看看你！你需要多加锻炼，你的身体越来越虚弱了。
examples.en: Look at you! You need more exercise. You're going/getting soft.

defines.trans_en: not forceful, loud, or easily noticed

examples.ch: 柔和的声音
examples.en: a soft voice/sound

examples.ch: 轻柔的音乐／柔和的灯光
examples.en: soft music/lighting

examples.ch: 柔和的光
examples.en: a soft glow

defines.trans_ch: （尤指批评或处罚）力度不够的，不严厉的
defines.trans_en: not severe or forceful enough, especially in criticizing or punishing someone who has done something wrong

examples.ch: 她认为孩子们不守规矩的时候我的态度过于软弱。
examples.en: She thinks I'm too soft on the kids when they misbehave.

examples.ch: 政府不应该对犯罪分子心慈手软。
examples.en: The government can't be seen to be taking a soft line (= not being severe enough) with criminals.

defines.trans_en: not difficult

examples.ch: 他的工作很轻松——似乎整天都没什么事。
examples.en: He's got a pretty soft job - he hardly seems to do anything all day.

defines.trans_ch: （水）软的（含矿物度低、能让肥皂起泡）
defines.trans_en: Soft water contains a low level of minerals and allows soap to make bubbles.

defines.trans_ch: （毒品）不易上瘾的，没什么危害的，软的
defines.trans_en: Soft drugs are illegal drugs that many people think are not dangerous.
In a soft market/economy there are more goods for sale than there are people to buy them, so prices are usually low.
an amount or number of something that is not stated or not known; a part of something

examples.ch: 想吃蛋糕的话，厨房有一些。
examples.en: There's some cake in the kitchen if you'd like it.

examples.ch: 这里有些消息，或许你会感兴趣。
examples.en: Here's some news you might be interested in.

examples.ch: 最近几周我们的电视一直有些问题。
examples.en: We've been having some problems with our TV over the last few weeks.

examples.ch: 你能否告诉我建筑工程何时完工？
examples.en: Could you give me some idea of when the construction work will finish?

examples.ch: 我还要再做完一些工作才能出去。
examples.en: I've got to do some more work before I can go out.

defines.trans_en: a large amount or number of something

examples.ch: 我们要等上相当长的时间才能再见面。
examples.en: It'll be some time before we meet again.

examples.ch: 过了很多年他们才又见面。
examples.en: It was some years later when they next met.

examples.ch: 这个问题我们讨论了很长时间。
examples.en: We discussed the problem at some length.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a particular person or thing without stating exactly which one

examples.ch: 某个幸运者将在比赛中赢得100多万美元的奖金。
examples.en: Some lucky person will win more than $1,000,000 in the competition.

examples.ch: 哪个笨蛋把门锁上了！
examples.en: Some idiot's locked the door!

examples.ch: 你一定有办法缓解疼痛。
examples.en: There must be some way you can relieve the pain.

defines.trans_ch: （用于名词前，尤用于句首，表示恼火或反对）
defines.trans_en: used before a noun, especially at the beginning of a sentence to show anger or disapproval, often by repeating a word that was not accurately used

examples.ch: 有些人就是不知道什么时候该闭上嘴。
examples.en: Some people just don't know when to shut up.

examples.ch: 你这算什么帮忙！你大半个下午都安安稳稳地坐着！
examples.en: Some help you were! You sat on your backside most of the afternoon!

examples.ch: “一个朋友竟卖给我一台坏了的收音机。”“算什么朋友！”
examples.en: "A friend of mine sold me a radio that doesn't work." "Some friend!"

defines.trans_en: used before a noun to show how good something or someone is

examples.ch: 哇，那真是一顿美餐！
examples.en: Wow, that was some dinner!

defines.trans_en: an amount or number of something that is not stated or not known; a part of something

examples.ch: 如果你需要更多的纸，那就再拿一些。
examples.en: If you need more paper then just take some.

examples.ch: “你想和我们一起用餐吗？”“不，谢谢，我已经吃过一些东西了。”
examples.en: "Would you like to have dinner with us?" "No thanks, I've already had some."

examples.ch: 你们这里有些人已经见过伊姆兰了。
examples.en: Some of you here have already met Imran.

examples.ch: 来一点儿这种香槟酒吧——很棒的。
examples.en: Have some of this champagne - it's very good.

defines.trans_en: some people

examples.ch: 一些人把他的作品和毕加索的相提并论。
examples.en: Some have compared his work to Picasso's.

defines.trans_en: used before a number to mean approximately; about

examples.ch: 每天大约有50吨石头从采石场运出。
examples.en: Some 50 tons of rock are taken from the quarry every day.

examples.ch: 水在地下大约20米至30米深的地方。
examples.en: The water is some 20 to 30 metres beneath the ground.

defines.trans_en: by a small amount or degree; a little

examples.ch: 她说她感觉好点儿了。
examples.en: She says she's feeling some better.

examples.ch: 如果把暖气温度调低你觉得更舒服些的话，我们就调低一点儿。
examples.en: We could turn down the heat some if that would make you more comfortable.

defines.trans_en: someone
used to refer to a single person when you do not know who they are or when it is not important who they are

examples.ch: 屋子外面有人。
examples.en: There's someone outside the house.

examples.ch: 肯定有人看见了所发生的一切。
examples.en: Someone must have seen what happened.

examples.ch: 观众里终于有人开口说话了。
examples.en: Eventually someone in the audience spoke.

examples.ch: 你得问问别人。
examples.en: You'll have to ask someone else.

examples.ch: 我们的项目组中需要有个软件工程师之类的人。
examples.en: We'll need a software engineer or someone (= a person with skill of or like the stated type) on the project team.

defines.trans_en: an object, situation, quality, or action that is not exactly known or stated

examples.ch: 我的鞋子里有个尖东西。
examples.en: There's something sharp in my shoe.

examples.ch: 碗柜里什么东西有股怪味。
examples.en: Something in the cupboard smells weird.

examples.ch: 我们没有了你的消息，还以为出了什么事呢。
examples.en: We thought there was something wrong because we hadn't heard from you.

examples.ch: 引擎出了什么问题——它发出奇怪的噪音。
examples.en: There's something wrong with the engine - it's making strange noises.

examples.ch: 一定发生了什么事让他烦躁不安，可我们不知道究竟是什么事。
examples.en: Something's happened to upset him but we don't know what it is.

examples.ch: 今天早上一上班我就听说了一件令人十分担忧的事。
examples.en: I heard something worrying at work this morning.

examples.ch: 你有什么话要说吗？
examples.en: Is there something you'd like to say?

examples.ch: 别在那儿干站着，做点什么吧。
examples.en: Don't just stand there, do something.

examples.ch: 他有什么地方不对劲。
examples.en: There's just something strange about him.

defines.trans_ch: 还算幸运的事；聊以自慰的事
defines.trans_en: a thing for which you are grateful, especially because an unpleasant thing has also happened

examples.ch: 我们得到了500英镑的补偿费，虽然不多，但至少还算幸运。
examples.en: We were given five hundred pounds in compensation which isn't much but at least it's something.

defines.trans_ch: （用于数字后指年龄或某个年龄段的人）…多岁，…多岁的人
defines.trans_en: used after a number like 20, 30, etc. to refer to the age of a person who is between 20 and 29, 30 and 39 years old, etc., or to a person who is of this age

examples.ch: 我猜她三十多岁。
examples.en: I'd guess she's thirty-something.

examples.ch: 这些地方大多数是以二十多岁的人为目标群体的。
examples.en: Most of these places are aimed at twenty-somethings.

defines.trans_en: on some occasions but not always or often

examples.ch: 有时我们自己带食物，有时我们在那儿买。
examples.en: Sometimes we take food with us and sometimes we buy food when we're there.

examples.ch: 有时候，最好是什么话都别说。
examples.en: Sometimes it's best not to say anything.

defines.trans_en: in or at a place having a position that is not stated or not known

examples.ch: 最后一次听到关于他的消息时，说他住在法国南海岸的某地。
examples.en: He was last heard of living somewhere on the south coast of France.

examples.ch: 你一定把他们的信放在什么地方了！
examples.en: You must have put their letter somewhere!

examples.ch: 我在找吃饭／住的地方。
examples.en: I'm looking for somewhere to eat/stay.

examples.ch: 我们能否另找个地方谈话——这里太吵了。
examples.en: Can we go somewhere else to talk - it's very noisy here.

examples.ch: 你不愿意去迪斯尼乐园或类似的什么地方吗？
examples.en: Wouldn't you like to go to Disneyland or somewhere (= or to a similar place)?

phrases.trans_en: approximately; about

examples.ch: 据报道，该城每周大约会发生900到1100起轻微罪案。
examples.en: Somewhere between 900 and 1,100 minor crimes are reported in this city every week.

examples.ch: 我们在回去的路上要花3到4个小时。
examples.en: It will take us somewhere between three and four hours to get back.

examples.ch: 该公司的年营业额约在7070万美元左右。
examples.en: The company's annual turnover is somewhere around $70.7 million.

defines.trans_en: your male child

examples.ch: 这是我们的儿子拉贾。
examples.en: This is our son Raja.

examples.ch: 我们有两个儿子和三个女儿。
examples.en: We have two sons and three daughters.

defines.trans_en: used as an informal form of address by a man to a boy

examples.ch: 快点儿，孩子，我们没有那么多时间。
examples.en: Come on, son, we don't have all day.

phrases.trans_en: a man who was born in a particular place

examples.ch: 那位弗腾堡的著名人物马丁•布莱希特
examples.en: that notable son of Württemberg, Martin Brecht

defines.trans_en: a usually short piece of music with words that are sung

examples.ch: 唱歌
examples.en: to sing a song

examples.ch: 情歌／民歌／流行歌曲
examples.en: a love/folk/pop song

defines.trans_en: the act of singing, or singing when considered generally

examples.ch: 他太高兴了，真想放声歌唱。
examples.en: He was so happy he wanted to burst/break into song (= start singing).

defines.trans_en: the musical sound that a bird makes

examples.ch: 鸟鸣声
examples.en: bird song

examples.ch: 唯有画眉鸟的鸣叫声打破了宁静。
examples.en: A thrush's song was the only sound to break the silence.

defines.trans_en: in or within a short time; before long; quickly

examples.ch: 她很快就到。
examples.en: She'll soon be here./She'll be here soon.

examples.ch: 不久以后，外国人就不能进入这个国家了。
examples.en: It will soon be impossible for foreigners to enter the country.

examples.ch: 我们出发得越早，到那儿也就越早。
examples.en: The sooner we leave, the sooner we'll get there.

examples.ch: 同意去之后不久，她就意识到自己犯了一个错误。
examples.en: Soon after agreeing to go, she realized she'd made a mistake.

examples.ch: 我们什么时候能签订合同？
examples.en: How soon (= when) can we sign the contract?

examples.ch: “你想什么时候见面？”“越快越好。”
examples.en: "When would you like to meet?" "The sooner the better."

examples.ch: 我恨不得马上离开那个地方。
examples.en: I couldn't get out of that place soon enough.

phrases.trans_en: at the same time or a very short time after

examples.ch: 我一看到她就知道出事了。
examples.en: As soon as I saw her, I knew there was something wrong.

phrases.trans_en: If you do something as soon as possible, you do it as quickly as you can.

examples.ch: 我们需要尽快修好。
examples.en: We need the repairs done as soon as possible.

defines.trans_en: feeling sadness, sympathy, or disappointment, especially because something unpleasant has happened or been done

examples.ch: 我为给她带来的所有麻烦而感到抱歉。
examples.en: I'm just sorry about all the trouble I've caused her.

examples.ch: 他确实惹恼了她，但他似乎一点儿也不感到愧疚。
examples.en: He'd really upset her and he didn't seem at all sorry.

examples.ch: 你的行程如此艰辛，我深表同情。
examples.en: I'm sorry (that) you had such a difficult journey.

examples.ch: 听说你又生病了，我们两个都很难过。
examples.en: We were both sorry to hear you've been ill again.

examples.ch: 我为孩子们感到十分难过——对他们而言肯定非常艰难。
examples.en: I feel so sorry for their kids - it must be really hard for them.

defines.trans_en: used to say that you wish you had not done what you have done, especially when you want to be polite to someone you have done something bad to

examples.ch: 哦，很抱歉——我在那儿没看见你。
examples.en: Oh, I'm sorry - I didn't see you there.

examples.ch: 汤姆，我对昨晚的事感到非常抱歉——都是我的错。
examples.en: Tom, I'm so sorry about last night - it was all my fault.

examples.ch: 我已经说对不起了。
examples.en: I've said I'm sorry.

phrases.trans_ch: （对自己的遭遇而感到）愤愤不平
phrases.trans_en: to feel sad because you have a problem and you feel that it is not fair that you are suffering so much

examples.ch: 他在电话里听上去一肚子怨气。
examples.en: He sounded very sorry for himself on the phone.

phrases.trans_en: used to show that something that must be said causes sadness or disappointment

examples.ch: 我很遗憾，项目的资金被取消了。
examples.en: I'm sorry to say that the project's funding has been cancelled.

examples.ch: 我很遗憾，参加这门健身课的大多数人确实在头两周内就放弃了。
examples.en: Most people who start the exercise class do, I'm sorry to say, give up within the first two weeks.

phrases.trans_ch: （婉转地表示拒绝或反对）对不起，抱歉
phrases.trans_en: used to show politeness when refusing something or disagreeing

examples.ch: 对不起，但我认为你犯了一个错误。
examples.en: I'm sorry, but I think you've made a mistake.

examples.ch: 很抱歉，我不能同意。
examples.en: I'm sorry, I can't agree.

phrases.trans_ch: 悲惨的景象／糟糕的状况／糟糕的事情（等等）
phrases.trans_en: a bad condition or situation

examples.ch: 他到家的时候，一副惨兮兮的样子——浑身湿透了，而且都是泥。
examples.en: He was a sorry sight when he got home - soaking and covered in mud.

examples.ch: 家里什么吃的都没有，真是够可怜的。
examples.en: It's a sorry situation when there isn't any food in the house.

defines.trans_en: used when apologizing for something

examples.ch: “你踩了我的脚。”“对不起！”
examples.en: "That's my foot you're stepping on." "Sorry!"

defines.trans_ch: （婉转地表示拒绝或反对）对不起，抱歉
defines.trans_en: used to show politeness when refusing something or disagreeing

examples.ch: 抱歉，你不能到那里面去。
examples.en: Sorry, you can't go in there.

defines.trans_ch: （表示礼貌地请对方重复或打断对方的话）你说什么，没听清楚
defines.trans_en: used when politely asking someone to repeat something or when politely interrupting someone

examples.ch: “他迟到了。”“你说什么？”“我说他迟到了。”
examples.en: "He's late." "Sorry?" "I said he's late."

examples.ch: 我没听清楚，你能否把最后一句话重复一下？
examples.en: Sorry, could you just say that last sentence again please?

defines.trans_en: something that you can hear or that can be heard

examples.ch: 他们能听到远处的钟声。
examples.en: They could hear the sound of a bell tolling in the distance.

examples.ch: 她静静地站在那儿，一声不吭。
examples.en: She stood completely still, not making a sound.

examples.ch: 突然我们听见引擎发出响亮的砰砰声。
examples.en: Suddenly we heard a loud knocking sound from the engine.

examples.ch: 声音在水中能传播得很远。
examples.en: Sound can travel over very large distances in water.

defines.trans_ch: （音乐演出、电影等的）音响录制和播出，音响制作
defines.trans_en: the activity of recording and broadcasting sound such as from a performance of music or for a film

examples.ch: 音响师／录音
examples.en: a sound engineer/recording

defines.trans_en: the volume or quality of the sound of a television or film

examples.ch: 你把电视机的音量调低／高一点好吗？
examples.en: Could you turn the sound down/up on the TV?

defines.trans_ch: （个人或乐队的）音乐特色，音乐风格
defines.trans_en: the particular quality of the music that a musician or a group of musicians produce

examples.ch: 这支乐队结合了乡土爵士乐和说唱乐的音乐风格，很有特色。
examples.en: The band's sound is a distinctive mixture of funk and rap.

defines.trans_en: a passage of sea connecting two larger areas of sea, or an area of sea mostly surrounded by land

examples.ch: 卡尔马海峡
examples.en: the Kalmar Sound

phrases.trans_ch: …给人的印象（或感觉）;…的言外之意
phrases.trans_en: how something seems to be, from what is said or written

examples.ch: 我喜欢牛肉浇红酒汁的感觉。
examples.en: I like the sound of the beef in red wine sauce.

examples.ch: 听上去我认为不是她的错。
examples.en: By/From the sound of it I don't think it was her fault.

examples.ch: 我要和90多个人谈话，是吗？我可不喜欢那样！
examples.en: I'm going to be talking to over 90 people? I don't like the sound of that!

defines.trans_en: to make a noise

examples.ch: 如果警报声响起，马上离开大楼。
examples.en: If the alarm sounds, leave the building immediately.

examples.ch: 听起来像一只鸟。
examples.en: It sounds like a bird.

examples.ch: 他说话很像我以前的一个同事。
examples.en: He sounds (= speaks) just like someone I used to work with.

examples.ch: 她按响汽车喇叭，猛踩油门，飞速穿过熙熙攘攘的大街。
examples.en: Sounding the car's horn, she drove at high speed through the crowded streets.

defines.trans_en: to measure the depth of a mass of water, such as the sea, usually by sonar

phrases.trans_ch: 听起来不错／听上去有意思／似乎很奇怪（等等）
phrases.trans_en: to seem good, interesting, strange, etc. from what is said or written

examples.ch: 你的工作听起来真有趣。
examples.en: Your job sounds really interesting.

examples.ch: 我知道这听起来很傻，但他走了我会想他的。
examples.en: I know it sounds silly, but I'll miss him when he's gone.

phrases.trans_en: to seem like something, from what is said or written

examples.ch: 那听起来像是个不错的主意。
examples.en: That sounds like a good idea.

examples.ch: 你听上去好像喉咙有些发炎。
examples.en: It sounds like you've got a sore throat.

examples.ch: 听起来他们似乎度过了一个愉快的假期。
examples.en: It sounds as if they had a good holiday.

examples.ch: 你要和3个朋友去滑雪？听起来很好玩。
examples.en: You're going skiing with three friends? That sounds like fun.

phrases.trans_ch: 听起来很生气／高兴／无礼（等等）
phrases.trans_en: to seem angry, happy, rude, etc. when you speak

examples.ch: 我们昨天通电话的时候，他听上去很沮丧。
examples.en: He sounded very depressed when we spoke on the phone yesterday.

examples.ch: 新闻发布会上，他听起来十分轻松。
examples.en: At the press conference, he sounded at his most relaxed.

phrases.trans_en: to cause a noise to be made or say or shout a message to warn people about something

examples.ch: 快，拉警报——机房里着火了！
examples.en: Quick, sound the alarm - there's a fire in the machine room!

defines.trans_ch: 无损伤的；完好的；健康的，健全的
defines.trans_en: not broken or damaged; healthy; in good condition

examples.ch: 这是一座老建筑物，但结构依然完好。
examples.en: It's an old building but it's still structurally sound.

examples.ch: 考虑到他的年龄，他的身体异常健康。
examples.en: Considering his age, his body is surprisingly sound.

examples.ch: 事故发生时，她精神没有问题吧？
examples.en: Was she of sound mind (= not mentally ill) at the time of the incident?

defines.trans_en: showing good judgment; able to be trusted

examples.ch: 她给了我一些非常好的建议。
examples.en: She gave me some very sound advice.

examples.ch: 这些杀虫剂是否对环境无害？
examples.en: Are these pesticides environmentally sound (= will they not damage the environment)?

examples.ch: 购买政府债券是一种稳妥的投资。
examples.en: Government bonds are a sound investment.

defines.trans_en: complete

examples.ch: 她对这一学科了解得是否透彻？
examples.en: How sound is her knowledge of the subject?

defines.trans_en: (of sleep) deep and peaceful

examples.ch: 他上床没多久就进入了梦乡。
examples.en: He was sound asleep within moments of getting into bed.

defines.trans_en: a usually hot, liquid food made from vegetables, meat, or fish

examples.ch: 鸡／牛尾／鱼／西红柿汤
examples.en: chicken/oxtail/fish/tomato soup

examples.ch: 你要来碗汤吗？
examples.en: Would you like a bowl of soup?

defines.trans_en: the direction that goes towards the part of the earth below the equator, opposite to the north, or the part of an area or country that is in this direction

examples.ch: 指南针上的四个方位分别是北、南、东、西。
examples.en: The points of the compass are north, south, east, and west.

examples.ch: 最好的海滩位于（岛的）南部。
examples.en: The best beaches are in the south (of the island).

examples.ch: 我们去法国南部度假了。
examples.en: We spent our holiday in the south of France.

examples.ch: 堪培拉在悉尼的南边。
examples.en: Canberra is/lies to the south of Sydney.

phrases.trans_en: the southern states of the US

examples.ch: 美国南北战争在一定程度上是南北之间围绕奴隶制问题展开的战争。
examples.en: The American Civil War was fought between the North and the South partly over the issue of slavery.

phrases.trans_ch: 南方（指发展中国家，因其大多数位于南半球）
phrases.trans_en: the developing countries of the world, most of which are below the equator

defines.trans_en: in or forming the south part of something

examples.ch: 南非
examples.en: South Africa

examples.ch: 南中国海
examples.en: the South China Sea

examples.ch: 这些植物在朝南的墙上长得很好。
examples.en: These plants grow well on a south-facing wall.

phrases.trans_en: a wind coming from the south

defines.trans_en: towards the south

examples.ch: 密西西比河向南流。
examples.en: The Mississippi river flows south.

examples.ch: 他们朝南驶向海岸。
examples.en: They drove south towards the coast.

examples.ch: 他朝正南的沙漠而去。
examples.en: He travelled due (= directly) south, towards the desert.

phrases.trans_en: to or in the south of a country or region

examples.ch: 艾丽斯在南部找到了工作。
examples.en: Alice got a job down south.

phrases.trans_en: (in or to) England, when considered in relation to Scotland

phrases.trans_ch: （关系到美国时）墨西哥及以南国家
phrases.trans_en: (in or to) Mexico and the other countries south of the US border with Mexico, when considered in relation to the US

defines.trans_en: an empty area that is available to be used

examples.ch: 那个衣橱还放得下我的衣服吗？
examples.en: Is there any space for my clothes in that cupboard?

examples.ch: 我得给马克腾点儿地方放他的东西。
examples.en: I need to make (some) space for Mark's things.

examples.ch: 路面湿滑，你必须和前车保持足够的距离。
examples.en: When the roads are wet, you've got to leave plenty of space between you and the car in front.

examples.ch: 表格末端的空白处供你签名。
examples.en: The blank space at the end of the form is for your name.

examples.ch: 我们在博物馆附近找到了一个停车位。
examples.en: We found a parking space close to the museum.

defines.trans_en: the area around everything that exists, continuing in all directions

examples.ch: 他走神了，目光茫然。
examples.en: He was absent-mindedly staring/gazing into space (= looking, but seeing nothing).

examples.ch: 虚拟现实展现了一个正常空间和时间之外的人造世界供我们探索。
examples.en: Virtual reality gives us artificial worlds to explore, outside normal space and time.

defines.trans_ch: （足球、橄榄球等球员与对手之间的）活动空间
defines.trans_en: the distance between a football, rugby, etc. player and any opposing players

examples.ch: 比赛时如果你给优秀球队那么大的活动空间，他们会让你吃苦头的。
examples.en: If you give quality players that much space, they will punish you.

defines.trans_en: the empty area outside Earth's atmosphere, where the planets and the stars are

examples.ch: 太空探索／旅行
examples.en: space exploration/travel

examples.ch: 太空火箭
examples.en: a space rocket

examples.ch: 谁是第一个进入太空的人？
examples.en: Who was the first human being in space/the first to go into space?

phrases.trans_en: land, especially in a town, that has no buildings on it

examples.ch: 我喜欢这个镇子，因为有很多开阔地。
examples.en: What I like about this town is that there's so much open space.

examples.ch: 我喜欢澳大利亚中部广阔的原野。
examples.en: I love the wide open spaces (= large areas of countryside) of central Australia.

phrases.text: in/within a short space of time
phrases.trans_en: very soon

examples.ch: 不久你就会说上一口地道的英语！
examples.en: Within a short space of time you could be speaking perfect English!

phrases.text: in/within the space of six weeks, three hours, etc.
phrases.trans_en: during a period of six weeks, three hours, etc.

examples.ch: 这一切都发生在10分钟之内。
examples.en: It all happened in the space of ten minutes.

defines.trans_ch: 把…以一定间隔排列;在…中留间隔
defines.trans_en: to arrange things or people so that there is some distance or time between them

examples.ch: 那一页版面排得很不均匀。
examples.en: That page looks badly spaced (= there is too much/too little distance between the lines or words).

examples.ch: 小路两旁花团簇生，间隔均匀。
examples.en: The flowers were spaced (out) evenly (= planted at equal distances) beside the path.

examples.ch: 如果经济上有困难，我们可以让你在两年内分期付款。
examples.en: If you're in financial difficulty, we're happy to let you space (out) your payments (= pay in smaller amounts over a longer period of time) over two years.

defines.trans_en: to say words, to use the voice, or to have a conversation with someone

examples.ch: 请你再慢点说，好吗？
examples.en: Would you mind speaking more slowly, please?

examples.ch: “请问丹在吗？”
examples.en: "Can I speak to Dan please?"

examples.ch: “请问斯科特在吗？”
examples.en: "Can I speak with Scott please?"

examples.ch: “我就是。”
examples.en: "Speaking." (= This is Scott.)

examples.ch: 如果他把我说的话告诉朱莉，我就再也不和他说话。
examples.en: If he tells Julie what I said, I'll never speak to him again.

examples.ch: 她谈起了父亲过世带给她的悲伤。
examples.en: She spoke of her sadness over her father's death.

examples.ch: 她对新导演的评价很高。
examples.en: She speaks very highly of (= says good things about) the new director.

examples.ch: 我肯定能来，可我不能确定我妻子能不能来。
examples.en: I can certainly come but I can't speak for my wife (= I can't tell you whether she can or not).

examples.ch: 谁将为被告辩护？
examples.en: Who is going to speak for (= represent in a court of law) the accused?

examples.ch: 他已经到了能发表自己看法的年龄。
examples.en: He's old enough to speak for himself (= to say what he thinks).

examples.ch: 我和艾娃一起去的——说起艾娃，你见过她的新发型了吗？
examples.en: I went with Ava - speaking of (= on the subject of) Ava, have you seen her new haircut?
