examples.ch: 我们应邀参加了雷切尔和杰米的婚礼——说起这个，你知道他们要搬到纽约去吗？
examples.en: We've been invited to Rachel and Jamie's wedding - speaking of which, did you know that they're moving to New York?

examples.ch: 作为4个孩子的母亲，我可以这么说，孩子真会让人筋疲力尽。
examples.en: Speaking as (= with my experience as) a mother of four, I can tell you that children are exhausting.

examples.ch: 苏说话带美国口音。
examples.en: Sue speaks with an American accent.

examples.ch: 你为什么说话这么小声？
examples.en: Why are you speaking in a whisper (= very quietly)?

examples.ch: 足有5分钟的时间，他俩谁都没说话。
examples.en: For five whole minutes, neither of them spoke a word (= they both said nothing).

defines.trans_en: to (be able to) talk in a language

examples.ch: 他法语说得很流利。
examples.en: He speaks fluent French.

examples.ch: 你会说几种外语？
examples.en: How many foreign languages do you speak?

examples.ch: 我初到那里的时候，一句西班牙语都不会说。
examples.en: I couldn't speak a word of (= I did not know any) Spanish when I got there.

examples.ch: 我无法理解他们说的是什么语言。
examples.en: I couldn't figure out what language they were speaking.

defines.trans_en: to give a formal talk to a group of people

examples.ch: 今天晚上的辩论谁发言？
examples.en: Who is speaking in the debate tonight?

examples.ch: 每年圣诞节女王都会在电视上向全国发表讲话。
examples.en: The Queen speaks to the nation on television every Christmas.

examples.ch: 珍妮特发言支持这项动议，而彼得却打算表示反对。
examples.en: Janet is speaking for the motion (= trying to persuade the people listening that the idea is good) and Peter is speaking against (it) (= trying to persuade them that it is bad).

defines.trans_en: to show or express something without using words

examples.ch: 她没有说话，不过她的眼神流露出了对他的真实感情。
examples.en: She was silent, but her eyes spoke her real feelings for him.

examples.ch: 整个抢劫事件表明罪犯掌握了内情。
examples.en: The whole robbery spoke of (= made it seem that there had been) inside knowledge on the part of the criminals.

phrases.trans_ch: （表示看问题的角度）大体上说／从历史的角度看／严格地说（等等）
phrases.trans_en: talking from a particular point of view

examples.ch: 从历史的角度说，那个岛很值得关注。
examples.en: Historically speaking, the island is of great interest.

examples.ch: 总的来说，这是一所不错的学校。
examples.en: Generally speaking, it's a good school.

examples.ch: 严格地说，我应该向警方告发这件事。
examples.en: Strictly speaking (= if I behave according to the rules), I should report it to the police.

phrases.trans_en: to tell someone that they have done something wrong

examples.ch: 经理答应说，她会告诫当事人的。
examples.en: The manager promised that she would speak to the person responsible.

defines.trans_ch: （用于构成名词，指某一领域或行业的特殊用语）…术语，…行话
defines.trans_en: used to form nouns to mean the special language used in a particular subject area or business

examples.ch: 计算机术语
examples.en: computer-speak

examples.ch: 营销术语
examples.en: marketing-speak

defines.trans_ch: 特殊的，特别的；不寻常的
defines.trans_en: not ordinary or usual

examples.ch: 这辆汽车配备有一些特别的安全装置。
examples.en: The car has a number of special safety features.

examples.ch: 今天你有没有什么特别的事要做？
examples.en: Is there anything special that you'd like to do today?

examples.ch: 乘客如有特殊的饮食需要，须事先向航空公司说明。
examples.en: Passengers should tell the airline in advance if they have any special dietary needs.

examples.ch: 我并不指望得到特殊待遇——我只希望能受到公平对待。
examples.en: I don't expect special treatment - I just want to be treated fairly.

examples.ch: 选举结果的详细情况明天将刊登在报纸的特别版上。
examples.en: Full details of the election results will be published in a special edition of tomorrow's newspaper.

examples.ch: 我有一套专门在特殊场合穿的套装。
examples.en: I have a suit for special occasions.

examples.ch: 蜜桃本周降价。
examples.en: There's a special offer on peaches (UK also peaches are on special offer) (= they are being sold at a reduced price) this week.

defines.trans_ch: 格外好的；特别重要的；额外的
defines.trans_en: especially great or important, or having a quality that most similar things or people do not have

examples.ch: 你能另外帮我一个忙吗？
examples.en: Could I ask you a special favour?

examples.ch: 我要为她的生日准备一些别出心裁的菜。
examples.en: I'm cooking something special for her birthday.

defines.trans_en: having a particular purpose

examples.ch: 消防员在烟雾弥漫的建筑物中使用专门的呼吸装置。
examples.en: Firefighters use special breathing equipment in smoky buildings.

examples.ch: 其中一些孩子有特殊的教育需求。
examples.en: Some of the children have special educational needs.

examples.ch: 雪地行车需要专门的轮胎。
examples.en: You need special tyres on your car for snow.

examples.ch: 她是总统的特别顾问。
examples.en: She works as a special adviser to the president.

defines.trans_en: a television programme that is made for a particular reason or occasion and is not part of a series

examples.ch: 3个小时的选举之夜特别节目
examples.en: a three-hour election night special

defines.trans_ch: （餐馆通常只在特定日子供应的）特色菜
defines.trans_en: a dish that is available in a restaurant on a particular day that is not usually available

examples.ch: 今天的特色菜写在布告板上。
examples.en: Today's specials are written on the board.

defines.trans_en: a product that is being sold at a reduced price for a short period

examples.ch: 今天的特价商品包括仅售2.99美元的Ｔ恤衫。
examples.en: Today's specials include T-shirts for only $2.99.

defines.trans_en: to form a word or words with the letters in the correct order

examples.ch: “receive 怎么拼？”“R-E-C-E-I-V-E。”
examples.en: How do you spell receive?

examples.ch: 莎士比亚不总是用同样的拼法拼写自己的名字。
examples.en: Shakespeare did not always spell his own name the same way.

examples.ch: 我们的地址是阿尔布开克大街1520号——要我把它拼出来吗？
examples.en: Our address is 1520 Main Street, Albuquerque. Shall I spell that (out) (= say in the correct order the letters that form the word) for you?

examples.ch: 我认为教孩子们正确地拼写非常重要。
examples.en: I think it's important that children should be taught to spell.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指为让某人休息而）代替做，替换，轮换
defines.trans_en: to do something that someone else would usually be doing, especially in order to allow them to rest

examples.ch: 你开车开了一阵了——需要我替你一会儿吗？
examples.en: You've been driving for a while - do you want me to spell you?

phrases.trans_ch: 意味着灾难／会招致麻烦（等等）
phrases.trans_en: to cause something bad to happen in the future

examples.ch: 新规定对小企业来说可能意味着灾难。
examples.en: The new regulations could spell disaster for small businesses.

examples.ch: 这种寒冷的天气可能会为菜农带来灾难。
examples.en: This cold weather could spell trouble for gardeners.

defines.trans_en: a period of time for which an activity or condition lasts continuously

examples.ch: 我在开罗住过一阵子。
examples.en: I lived in Cairo for a spell.

examples.ch: 她曾当过很短一段时间的球队队长。
examples.en: She had a brief spell as captain of the team.

examples.ch: 我一阵一阵地头晕。
examples.en: I keep having/getting dizzy spells (= periods of feeling as if I'm turning around).

defines.trans_ch: （特定天气的）一段短暂持续时间
defines.trans_en: a short period of a particular type of weather

examples.ch: 一段天气干燥的日子
examples.en: a spell of dry weather

examples.ch: 天气预报说是持续干燥的晴天。
examples.en: The weather forecast is for dry, sunny spells.

defines.trans_en: a period when you do something that someone else would usually be doing, especially in order to allow them to rest

examples.ch: 如果我们轮换着刷油漆，也许干起来不会这么累。
examples.en: If we take spells (with) doing the painting, it won't seem like such hard work.

defines.trans_en: spoken words that are thought to have magical power, or (the condition of being under) the influence or control of such words

examples.ch: 女巫对王子施了魔法，把他变成了青蛙。
examples.en: The witch cast/put a spell on the prince and he turned into a frog.

examples.ch: 要想解除魔法，必须要有一个美丽的姑娘亲吻他。
examples.en: A beautiful girl would have to kiss him to break (= stop) the spell.

examples.ch: 睡美人在邪恶仙子的符咒中倒下沉睡，直到王子吻了她一下才醒来。
examples.en: Sleeping Beauty lay under the wicked fairy's spell until the prince woke her with a kiss.

defines.trans_en: to give money as a payment for something

examples.ch: 你花了多少钱？
examples.en: How much did you spend?

examples.ch: 我不知道昨晚在俱乐部怎么会花了这么多钱。
examples.en: I don't know how I managed to spend so much in the club last night.

examples.ch: 我们在纽约花了一大笔钱。
examples.en: We spent a fortune when we were in New York.

examples.ch: 她在衣服上花销很大。
examples.en: She spends a lot of money on clothes.

examples.ch: 我们刚花了190万美元改进我们的计算机网络系统。
examples.en: We've just spent $1.9 million on improving our computer network.

examples.ch: 我们周六疯狂购物了一番。
examples.en: We went on a spending spree (= we bought a lot of things) on Saturday.

defines.trans_en: to use time doing something or being somewhere

examples.ch: 我认为我们应该多花些时间在一起。
examples.en: I think we need to spend more time together.

examples.ch: 我花了很长时间打扫那个房间。
examples.en: I spent a lot of time cleaning that room.

examples.ch: 我花了好多年时间搜集藏品。
examples.en: I've spent years building up my collection.

examples.ch: 我在火车站等车等了一个小时。
examples.en: I spent an hour at the station waiting for the train.

examples.ch: 你做家庭作业用多长时间？
examples.en: How long do you spend on your homework?

examples.ch: 我姐姐总是花很长的时间梳洗打扮。
examples.en: My sister always spends ages in the bathroom.

examples.ch: 我们在布宜诺斯艾利斯度过了周末。
examples.en: We spent the weekend in Buenos Aires.

examples.ch: 如果你愿意的话，可以在这里过夜。
examples.en: You can spend the night here if you like.

defines.trans_ch: 消耗，花费（精力等）;（尤指）用尽（全力）
defines.trans_en: to use energy, effort, force, etc., especially until there is no more left

examples.ch: 过去的一个月里，他竭尽全力想找份工作。
examples.en: For the past month he's been spending all his energy trying to find a job.

examples.ch: 他们持续开火，直到弹药全部打光为止。
examples.en: They continued firing until all their ammunition was spent (= there was none of it left).

examples.ch: 飓风抵达该国北部地区时，风势可能已减弱了大半。
examples.en: The hurricane will probably have spent most of its force (= most of its force will have gone) by the time it reaches the northern parts of the country.

examples.ch: 她的怒气很快就烟消云散了。
examples.en: Her anger soon spent itself (= stopped).

defines.trans_en: the amount of money that is spent on something

examples.ch: 这个项目的花费总计接近100万英镑。
examples.en: The total spend on the project was almost a million pounds.

defines.trans_en: an object consisting of a round, hollow part and a handle, used for mixing, serving, and eating food
(used as a combining form)

examples.ch: 汤匙
examples.en: a soup spoon

examples.ch: 茶匙
examples.en: a teaspoon

defines.trans_en: an amount held in a particular spoon

examples.ch: 几匙酱汁
examples.en: a couple of spoons of sauce

defines.trans_en: to move something, especially food, using a spoon

examples.ch: 他用勺舀了玉米粥喂到婴儿张开的嘴里。
examples.en: He spooned the mush into the baby's open mouth.

examples.ch: 用调羹舀一点调味汁淋到鱼上。
examples.en: Spoon a little sauce over the fish.

defines.trans_ch: 体育运动；体育比赛；体育竞技项目
defines.trans_en: a game, competition, or activity needing physical effort and skill that is played or done according to rules, for enjoyment and/or as a job

examples.ch: 足球、棒球和曲棍球都是团队运动。
examples.en: Football, basketball, and hockey are all team sports.

examples.ch: 我喜欢滑雪、滑冰之类的冬季运动。
examples.en: I enjoy winter sports like skiing and skating.

defines.trans_en: all types of physical activity that people do to keep healthy or for enjoyment

examples.ch: 她年轻时经常参加体育运动。
examples.en: She used to do/play a lot of sport when she was younger.

defines.trans_en: enjoyment in doing things

defines.trans_ch: 乐观大度的人;有风度的人;输得起的人
defines.trans_en: a pleasant, positive, generous person who does not complain about things they are asked to do or about games that they lose

examples.ch: 噢，道格拉斯——拿出点风度来，让我搭车去车站吧。
examples.en: Oh, Douglas - be a (good) sport and give me a lift to the station.

defines.trans_en: a friendly way of talking to a man or boy

examples.ch: 嘿，老兄——你好吗？
examples.en: Hello sport - how are you?

defines.trans_en: to wear or be decorated with something

examples.ch: 20世纪60年代，他那时穿喇叭裤、厚底鞋，蓄着披肩长发。
examples.en: Back in the 1960s he sported platform heels and hair down past his shoulders.

examples.ch: 汽车前部都插着一面德国国旗。
examples.en: The front of the car sported a German flag.

defines.trans_en: the season of the year between winter and summer, lasting from March to June north of the equator, and from September to December south of the equator, when the weather becomes warmer, leaves and plants start to grow again and flowers appear

examples.ch: 很多球茎植物春天开花。
examples.en: Many bulbs bloom in (the) spring.

examples.ch: 珍妮特明年春天要来这儿呆几个星期。
examples.en: Janet's coming over for a couple of weeks next spring.

examples.ch: 今年春天雨很多。
examples.en: It's been a very wet spring.

examples.ch: 春日白天／早晨
examples.en: a spring day/morning

examples.ch: 春花／春日天气
examples.en: spring flowers/weather

defines.trans_en: a piece of curved or bent metal that can be pressed into a smaller space but then returns to its usual shape

examples.ch: 孩子们老是在沙发上跳来跳去的，把弹簧都弄坏了。
examples.en: The children have jumped on the couch so much that they've ruined the springs.

defines.trans_en: something's ability to return to its usual shape after it has been pressed

examples.ch: 几年下来，床垫失去了弹性。
examples.en: Over the years the mattress has lost its spring.

defines.trans_en: a place where water naturally flows out from the ground

examples.ch: 汩汩冒泡的泉／温泉
examples.en: bubbling/hot springs

defines.trans_en: to move quickly and suddenly towards a particular place

examples.ch: 我从床上跳起来去开门。
examples.en: I sprang out of bed to answer the door.

examples.ch: 那个组织已准备好了，一得到资金就立即采取行动。
examples.en: The organization is ready to spring into action (= start taking action) the moment it receives its funding.

examples.ch: 她走进房间时，他总是会立即站起来。
examples.en: He always springs to his feet when she walks in the room.

examples.ch: 我注意到，卡罗琳打趣他的穿着时，你立刻就开始为他辩护了。
examples.en: I noticed the way you sprang to his defence when Caroline started joking about his clothes.

examples.ch: 盒盖啪的一下关上了。
examples.en: The lid of the box sprang shut.

defines.trans_en: to appear suddenly

examples.ch: “你从那儿冒出来的？——我都没见你进来！”
examples.en: "Where did you spring from? - I didn't see you come in!"

defines.trans_ch: （家具）装有弹簧的，有弹簧支撑的
defines.trans_en: (of furniture) using springs (= curved pieces of metal) to give support
a flat shape with four sides of equal length and four angles of 90°

examples.ch: 首先画一个正方形。
examples.en: First draw a square.

examples.ch: 这是个正方形的房间。
examples.en: It's a square-shaped room.

defines.trans_en: any square-shaped object

examples.ch: 冷却之后，将巧克力蛋糕切成四方块。
examples.en: When cooled, cut the chocolate brownies into squares.

defines.trans_ch: （城镇中的）广场（常包括周围的建筑）
defines.trans_en: an area of approximately square-shaped land in a city or a town, often including the buildings that surround it

examples.ch: 他们还住在伊顿广场6号吗？
examples.en: Are they still living at 6 Eaton Square?

examples.ch: 一个乐队当时正在镇广场上演出。
examples.en: A band were playing in the town square.

defines.trans_en: a particular space on a board used for playing games

examples.ch: 她把自己的车向前走了3格。
examples.en: She moved her castle forward three squares.

defines.trans_en: a tool for drawing or testing a right angle
a boring person who does not like new and exciting ideas

examples.ch: 他有点儿古板。
examples.en: He's a bit of a square.

defines.trans_en: the result of multiplying a number by itself

examples.ch: 7的平方是49。
examples.en: The square of 7 is 49.

defines.trans_en: having the shape of a square

examples.ch: 食谱建议使用方形蛋糕烤盘。
examples.en: The recipe recommends that you use a square cake tin.

examples.ch: 他有个刚毅的方下巴，这在许多女人眼中似乎很有吸引力。
examples.en: He's got that square-jawed masculinity that a lot of women seem to find attractive.

defines.trans_en: used with units of measurement of length to express the total size of an area

examples.ch: 房间的地面是3米宽5米长，总面积是15平方米。
examples.en: The floor is 3 m wide by 5 m long, so its total area is 15 sq m.

examples.ch: 该城市占地13平方英里。
examples.en: The city itself covers 13 square miles.

examples.ch: 要确保暴露在外的面积小于2平方厘米。
examples.en: Ensure that the exposed area is less than 2 cm2.

defines.trans_en: Square is used immediately after measurements of length when expressing the length of the four sides of a square-shaped area.

examples.ch: 因此你需要8米见方的室内地毯。
examples.en: So you want carpet for a room that's eight metres square (= eight metres long and eight metres wide).

defines.trans_en: equal or level

examples.ch: 你能不能往后站一些，告诉我这些架子摆得正不正？
examples.en: Could you stand back from these shelves and tell me if they're square (= level)?

defines.trans_en: in a straight line
used to describe a person who is boring and does not like new and exciting things

examples.ch: 你觉得我的新发型是不是让我看上去有点儿古板？
examples.en: Do you think my new haircut makes me look a bit square?

phrases.trans_en: If two people are all square, one of them has paid off a debt to the other and neither now owes or is owed any money.
If two teams or players are (all) square, they have an equal number of goals or points.

examples.ch: 他们打成平局，每个都是30分。
examples.en: They're all square at 30 points each.

defines.trans_en: to multiply a number by itself

examples.ch: 10的平方是100。
examples.en: 10 squared equals a hundred.

examples.ch: 4的二次方就是4的平方，等于16。
examples.en: 42 means four squared, and equals 16.

phrases.trans_ch: （表示决心已定）挺起胸膛，挺直身子
phrases.trans_en: to pull your shoulders up and back because you feel determined to do something

examples.ch: 他挺直肩膀，做了个深呼吸，然后扎进了游泳池。
examples.en: He squared his shoulders and took a deep breath before diving into the pool.

defines.trans_en: a large closed area of land with rows of seats around the sides and often with no roof, used for sports events and musical performances

examples.ch: 成千上万的球迷涌进体育场观看比赛。
examples.en: Thousands of fans packed into the stadium to watch the match.

examples.ch: 新国家体育场的启用
examples.en: the opening of a new national stadium (= where a country's team plays its home games)

defines.trans_en: the group of people who work for an organization

examples.ch: 学校里教职员工和学生的关系很融洽。
examples.en: There is a good relationship between staff and pupils at the school.

examples.ch: 员工们对最近一次加薪不太满意。
examples.en: The staff are not very happy about the latest pay increase.

examples.ch: 公司有100多名员工。
examples.en: There are over a hundred staff in the company.

examples.ch: 他是该杂志的一名编辑人员。
examples.en: He is on (= a member of) the editorial staff of the magazine.

defines.trans_en: a person who works for an organization
a long, strong stick held in the hand that is used as a support when walking, as a weapon, or as a symbol of authority

a 
flagpole
the five lines and four spaces between them on which musical notes are written

defines.trans_ch: 成为员工，（为机构）提供人员
defines.trans_en: to be or provide the people who work for an organization

examples.ch: 英国很多慈善商店的工作人员全都是志愿者。
examples.en: Many charity shops in Britain are staffed by/with volunteers.

defines.trans_en: a part of an activity or a period of development

examples.ch: 这个项目已进入最后阶段，应于8月份完成。
examples.en: The project is in its final stages and should be completed by August.

examples.ch: 他们步行走完了旅途的最后一段路。
examples.en: They did the last stage of their journey on foot.

examples.ch: 目前我们的婚姻正处于一个困难阶段。
examples.en: Our marriage is going through a difficult stage at the moment.

examples.ch: 他们最小的孩子目前所处的阶段是会说单个的词，但还不会说整句话。
examples.en: Their youngest child is at the stage where she can say individual words but not full sentences.

examples.ch: 我现在不累，但在步行过程中的某个时候需要休息一下。
examples.en: I'm not tired at the moment but I will need a rest at some stage (= at some time) during the walk.

examples.ch: 安德鲁的业余时间全花在了玩电脑上，不过这可能只是一个阶段罢了。
examples.en: Andrew spends all his spare time playing with his computer but it's probably just a stage he's going through (= a period of development that will end soon).

defines.trans_en: one of the separate parts of a rocket, each part having its own engine

examples.ch: 每一级在燃料燃尽后，就会从火箭主体上脱落，落回到地球上。
examples.en: Once its fuel supply runs out, each stage separates from the main part of the rocket and falls back to earth.

defines.trans_en: the area in a theatre that is often raised above ground level and on which actors or entertainers perform

examples.ch: 这一幕的大部分时间哈姆雷特都出场。
examples.en: Hamlet is on stage for most of the act.

examples.ch: 管弦乐队在雷鸣般的掌声中登场／走下舞台。
examples.en: The orchestra went on/off stage to great applause.

examples.ch: 这部戏是根据威廉‧戈尔丁的小说改编的舞台剧。
examples.en: The play is a stage adaptation of William Golding's novel.

examples.ch: 那位歌手今夏将重返奥斯陆舞台。
examples.en: The singer returns to the Oslo stage (= will perform again in Oslo) this summer.

defines.trans_en: a particular area of public life

examples.ch: 总统在世界舞台上极受欢迎，但在本国却不受拥戴。
examples.en: The president was extremely popular on the world stage but was disliked in his own country.

phrases.trans_en: If you do something in stages, you divide the activity into parts and complete each part separately.

examples.ch: 我们在逐步装修房子，所以还得几个月才能就绪。
examples.en: We're decorating the house in stages so it won't be ready for another couple of months.

phrases.trans_en: to go onto the stage and start to perform

defines.trans_en: to arrange and perform a play or show

examples.ch: 当地剧团正在演出音乐剧《油脂》。
examples.en: The local drama group is staging a production of the musical "Grease".

defines.trans_en: to organize an event

examples.ch: 伦敦于2012年举办了奥运会。
examples.en: London staged the Olympic Games in 2012.

defines.trans_en: one of the steps in a set of steps that lead from one level of a building to another

examples.ch: 她上楼时最上面一级楼梯咯吱一响，吵醒了她母亲。
examples.en: The top stair creaked as she went upstairs and the noise woke up her mother.

defines.trans_en: a set of stairs

examples.ch: 他爬上木楼梯，敲了敲祖父的房门。
examples.en: He climbed the wooden stair and knocked on his grandfather's door.

phrases.trans_en: a set of steps that lead from one level of a building to another

examples.ch: 上楼后，她的办公室在右手边。
examples.en: Go up the stairs and her office is on the right.

examples.ch: 我只得爬一段很陡的楼梯才到了她的前门。
examples.en: I had to climb a steep flight (= set) of stairs to her front door.

examples.ch: 他站在楼梯下喊道：“吃早饭了！”
examples.en: He stood at the foot (= bottom) of the stairs and called out, "Breakfast's ready!"

defines.trans_en: a small piece of paper with a picture or pattern on it that is stuck onto a letter or package before it is posted, to show that the cost of sending it has been paid

examples.ch: 我在信封上贴了一枚50便士的邮票。
examples.en: I stuck a 50p stamp on the envelope.

defines.trans_en: a tool for putting a mark on an object either by printing on it or pushing into it, or the mark made in this way

examples.ch: 图书馆藏书封面上的日期戳标明了应还书日期。
examples.en: A date stamp inside the front cover of a library book shows when it should be returned.

defines.trans_en: a small piece of paper worth a particular amount of money that you can buy several of, as a way of paying for something over a period of time

examples.ch: 机动车牌照印花税票
examples.en: vehicle licence stamps

defines.trans_en: a particular quality in something or someone, or a quality in something that shows it was done by a particular person or group of people

examples.ch: 虽然这幅画明显是天才之作，但我们却不知其出自谁手。
examples.en: Although this painting clearly bears the stamp of genius, we don't know who painted it.

examples.ch: 每一位经理都在公司的发展道路上留下了自己的印记。
examples.en: Each manager has left his or her own stamp on the way the company has evolved.

defines.trans_ch: （常指为表示生气）跺（脚）;重踏，重踩
defines.trans_en: an act of putting the foot down on the ground hard, or the noise made in doing so

examples.ch: 她一跺脚，冲了出去。
examples.en: With a stamp of her foot she stormed out.

defines.trans_en: to put a mark on an object either by printing on it or pushing into it with a small tool

examples.ch: 护照上必须盖章。
examples.en: It is necessary to stamp your passport.

examples.ch: 每盒酸奶上都盖有最迟销售日期。
examples.en: Every carton of yogurt is stamped with a sell-by date.

defines.trans_ch: （常指为表示生气）跺（脚）;重踏，重踩
defines.trans_en: to put a foot down on the ground hard and quickly, making a loud noise, often to show anger

examples.ch: 那个小男孩跺着脚不肯吃药。
examples.en: The little boy was stamping his foot and refusing to take his medicine.

examples.ch: 她站在路边，跺着脚让自己暖和些。
examples.en: She stood by the road, stamping her feet to stay warm.

examples.ch: 我希望楼上那些人别再乱跺脚了。
examples.en: I wish those people upstairs would stop stamping (about/around).

examples.ch: 你为什么要踩那只虫子？
examples.en: Why did you stamp on that insect?

defines.trans_en: to mark with a particular quality or show that someone has a particular quality

examples.ch: 我们的新主管似乎想在部门的方方面面都施展她的权威。
examples.en: Our new administrator seems to be trying to stamp her authority on every aspect of the department.

defines.trans_ch: （使）直立；（使）站立；竖放；（尤指）站起来
defines.trans_en: to be in a vertical state or to put into a vertical state, especially (of a person or animal) by making the legs straight

examples.ch: 奶奶说她站久了脚踝会疼。
examples.en: Granny says if she stands for a long time her ankles hurt.

examples.ch: 她进来时你应该站起来以示礼貌。
examples.en: As a sign of politeness you should stand (up) when she comes in.

examples.ch: 站好了，不要出声！
examples.en: Stand still and be quiet!

examples.ch: 地震之后，村子里所有的房子都倒了。
examples.en: After the earthquake not a single building was left standing in the village.

examples.ch: 把瓶子放在那边的桌子上。
examples.en: Stand the bottles on the table over there.

defines.trans_ch: （使）处于，进入（特定状态或境况）
defines.trans_en: to be in, cause to be in, or get into a particular state or situation

examples.ch: 你认为你得到那份工作的机会有多大？
examples.en: How do you think your chances stand (= are) of being offered the job?

examples.ch: 国家债务达550亿美元。
examples.en: The national debt stands at 55 billion dollars.

examples.ch: 这座房子空置多年了。
examples.en: The house stood empty for years.

examples.ch: 玛丁纳目前世界排名第二。
examples.en: Martina is currently standing second in the world listings.

examples.ch: 如果这笔交易不成的话，我们公司会损失一大笔钱。
examples.en: Our firm stands to lose (= will lose) a lot of money if the deal is unsuccessful.

examples.ch: 我们确实不能允许目前的状况再继续下去了。
examples.en: We really can't allow the current situation to stand (= to exist in its current form).

examples.ch: 牛顿力学定律曾在200多年间无人撼动。
examples.en: Newton's laws of mechanics stood (= were thought to be completely true) for over two hundred years.

examples.ch: 将混合物静置15分钟再用。
examples.en: Leave the mixture to stand (= do not touch it) for 15 minutes before use.

examples.ch: 她在聚会上的表现让我对她的印象不能再差／再好了。
examples.en: It would be difficult for her to stand much lower/higher in my opinion (= for me to have a worse/better opinion of her) after the way she behaved at the party.

examples.ch: 她很直接，但是你至少知道她是怎么想的、会怎么做。
examples.en: She's very blunt, but at least you know where you stand with her (= you know what she thinks and how she is likely to behave).

examples.ch: 你被控谋杀，你如何申辩？
examples.en: You stand accused of murder, how do you plead?

defines.trans_en: to be in, cause to be in, or put into a particular place

examples.ch: 房间里除了墙角有个衣柜外，别无他物。
examples.en: The room was empty except for a wardrobe standing in one corner.

examples.ch: 先把画靠墙放好，我们来看看挂在哪里好。
examples.en: Stand the paintings against the wall while we decide where to hang them.

examples.ch: 照片上那对幸福的夫妇站在香蕉树旁。
examples.en: The photograph shows the happy couple standing beside a banana tree.

defines.trans_en: Vehicles that are standing are waiting.

examples.ch: 现在停靠在8站台的是15点17分开往卡迪夫的列车。
examples.en: The train now standing at platform 8 is the 15.17 for Cardiff.

defines.trans_en: to successfully accept or bear something that is unpleasant or difficult

examples.ch: 我受不了她的声音。
examples.en: I can't stand her voice.

examples.ch: 我们的帐篷经受不起像上次那样的风暴了。
examples.en: Our tent won't stand another storm like the last one.

examples.ch: 我听不得她哭。
examples.en: I can't stand hearing her cry.

defines.trans_en: to compete, especially in an election, for an official position

examples.ch: 总统宣布她无意参加竞选谋求连任。
examples.en: The president has announced she does not intend to stand for re-election.

defines.trans_en: to be a stated height

examples.ch: 即便不穿鞋，他身高也超过了两米。
examples.en: Even without his shoes he stood over two metres tall.

defines.trans_en: to buy something, especially a meal or a drink, for someone

examples.ch: 我没法去银行，你能请我吃午饭吗？
examples.en: I couldn't get to the bank, so could you stand me lunch?

defines.trans_en: to have as an opinion

examples.ch: 他在外交政策问题上是什么立场？
examples.en: How/Where does he stand on foreign policy issues?

phrases.trans_en: to be put on trial in a law court

examples.ch: 另外两名男子因涉嫌参与这起爆炸案将于下个月接受审判。
examples.en: Two other men are to stand trial next month for their part in the bombing.

phrases.trans_en: used on signs to mean vehicles are not allowed to park, even for short periods of time

examples.ch: 路边的标志牌上写着“禁止停车”。
examples.en: The sign by the side of the road said "no standing".

phrases.trans_en: to have a chance of success

examples.ch: 她努力学习的话，通过考试的希望很大。
examples.en: She stands a good chance of passing her exam if she works hard.

defines.trans_en: a large structure at a sports ground, usually with a sloping floor and sometimes a roof, where people either stand or sit to watch a sports event
an opinion, especially one that is public

examples.ch: 她对男女平等持什么态度？
examples.en: What's her stand on sexual equality?

defines.trans_en: the place in which a person stands in a law court when they are being asked questions

examples.ch: 目击者出庭作证。
examples.en: The witness took the stand (= went to the place in a court where you stand and answer questions).

defines.trans_en: a small shop or stall or an area where products can be shown, usually outside or in a large public building, at which people can buy things or get information

examples.ch: 热狗摊
examples.en: a hotdog stand

examples.ch: 今年的微电子产品展览会上将会有3000多家公司参展。
examples.en: Over three thousand companies will have stands at this year's microelectronics exhibition.

defines.trans_en: a frame or piece of furniture for supporting or putting things on

examples.ch: 乐谱架
examples.en: a music stand

examples.ch: 衣帽架
examples.en: a hatstand

defines.trans_ch: 反对;抵抗，抵制;（尤指）捍卫
defines.trans_en: an act of opposition, especially in order to defend someone or something

examples.ch: 环保团体正在采取行动，反对修建穿过山谷的新公路。
examples.en: Environmental groups are making a stand against the new road through the valley.

defines.trans_ch: （在某地的）停留演出;停留比赛
defines.trans_en: a particular number or period of performances

examples.ch: 黄鹂队将来城里进行3场比赛。
examples.en: The Orioles will be in town for a three-game stand.

phrases.trans_en: a stand

examples.ch: 比赛结束前5分钟看台上发生了打斗。
examples.en: Fighting broke out in the stands five minutes before the end of the match.

defines.trans_en: a very large ball of burning gas in space that is usually seen from the earth as a point of light in the sky at night

examples.ch: 他们躺在小山上，头顶繁星闪烁。
examples.en: Stars twinkled above them as they lay on the hill.

defines.trans_en: a very famous, successful, and important person, especially a performer such as a musician, actor, or sports player

examples.ch: 摇滚歌星／影星／足球明星
examples.en: a rock/movie/football star

examples.ch: 想当明星的年轻人从美国各地来到好莱坞。
examples.en: Kids wanting to be stars come to Hollywood from all over America.

defines.trans_en: a symbol with five or more points

examples.ch: 星形的
examples.en: star-shaped

examples.ch: 这家饭店是几星级的？
examples.en: How many stars (= symbols showing quality) does this restaurant have?

examples.ch: 老师给了汤姆一颗金星，表扬他的画画得好。
examples.en: The teacher gave Tom a gold star (= a paper symbol rewarding good work) for his drawing.

defines.trans_en: a symbol made of metal or cloth worn by particular officials to show their rank

examples.ch: 治安官的星章
examples.en: a sheriff's star

examples.ch: 四星上将
examples.en: a four-star general

defines.trans_en: an asterisk (= a symbol *)

defines.trans_ch: 星宿，星相，命星（占星术中认为影响个人运气的星体）
defines.trans_en: any planet or other object in the sky thought of in astrology as influencing a person's luck

examples.ch: 她生来命就好／不好。
examples.en: She was born under a lucky/an unlucky star.

phrases.trans_ch: （用来表示餐馆、旅馆等的服务水平）两星/三星（等等）
phrases.trans_en: used to show how good a restaurant, hotel, etc. is

examples.ch: 廉价两星旅馆的价格也在平价旅行者的预算范围内。
examples.en: The cheaper two-star hotels are also within the range of the budget traveller.

phrases.trans_en:
→ 
horoscope

examples.ch: 我总是喜欢看报纸的星相版说些什么。
examples.en: I always like to see what the stars say in the newspaper.

defines.trans_ch: （电影、戏剧等）由（某人）担任主演;主演，担任主角
defines.trans_en: If a film, play, etc. stars someone, or if someone stars in a film, play, etc., they are the main actor in it.

examples.ch: 戴维•奥伊洛沃主演了电影《塞尔玛》。
examples.en: David Oyelowo starred in the movie "Selma".

examples.ch: 苏萨克的小说《偷书贼》被改编成电影，由杰佛里•拉什领衔主演。
examples.en: Zusak's novel "The Book Thief" was turned into a movie starring Geoffrey Rush.

defines.trans_ch: 最好的，最出色的；最重要的
defines.trans_en: best or most important

examples.ch: 毫无疑问，纳塔莉是今年芭蕾班中最出色的学员。
examples.en: Natalie is, without a doubt, the star student in this year's ballet class.

examples.ch: 今天下午控方将传召其最重要的证人。
examples.en: This afternoon the prosecution will call its star witness.

defines.trans_ch: （表示质量等级，一般为一至五星）…星级
defines.trans_en: a measurement of quality, usually in numbers from one to five with one being the lowest

examples.ch: 三星级酒店比二星的要好。
examples.en: A three-star hotel is better than a two-star.

defines.trans_en: to begin doing something

examples.ch: 你什么时候开始你的课程／新工作？
examples.en: When do you start your course/your new job?

examples.ch: 我们将在6点钟开始（议程）。
examples.en: We'll be starting (the session) at six o'clock.

examples.ch: 星期一你能开始工作吗？
examples.en: Can you start (= begin a new job) on Monday?

examples.ch: 他们1月份动工盖这所房子。
examples.en: They started building the house in January.

examples.ch: 我刚开始写信，电话铃就响了。
examples.en: I'd just started to write a letter when the phone rang.

defines.trans_ch: （企业或其他机构）开业，开始运营;创办，开办
defines.trans_en: If a business or other organization starts, or if someone starts one, it is created and starts to operate.

examples.ch: 她创办了自己的软件公司。
examples.en: She started her own software company.

examples.ch: 这个地区有很多家新餐馆开业。
examples.en: A lot of new restaurants have started up in the region.

defines.trans_en: to begin to happen or to make something begin to happen

examples.ch: 一档新的野生动物节目已开始在每周一晚上播出。
examples.en: A new series about wildlife has started on Monday nights.

examples.ch: 警方认为这起火灾是有人蓄意纵火。
examples.en: Police believe the fire was started by arsonists.

defines.trans_en: to begin a set of activities with the thing or person mentioned

examples.ch: 讲演者讲述了她的中国之行作为开场白。
examples.en: The speaker started with a description of her journey to China.

examples.ch: 请一个接一个地回答我的问题，从露西开始。
examples.en: Give me your answers one by one, starting with Lucy.

examples.ch: 你开始时可以先给花坛除草。
examples.en: You could start by weeding the flowerbeds.

examples.ch: 他刚开始工作时是工程师，但后来做了老师。
examples.en: He started his working life as an engineer but later became a teacher.

defines.trans_ch: 开始抱怨;开始惹人厌烦
defines.trans_en: to begin to complain or be annoying in some way

examples.ch: 别烦人——我们不去，没的商量！
examples.en: Don't start with me - we're not going and that's that!

examples.ch: “如果理查德做了些工作就好了。”“噢，别提理查德了，说起来我就生气！”
examples.en: "It would help if Richard did some work." "Oh, don't get me started on Richard!"

defines.trans_ch: 出发;动身，启程;开始，（自…）起
defines.trans_en: to begin at one point and then move to another, in distance or range

examples.ch: 跑步活动的出发地点是公园大门口。
examples.en: The run starts at/from the entrance to the park.

examples.ch: 我们需要早点儿出发，因为路上需要6个小时。
examples.en: We'll need to start (off/out) early because the journey takes six hours.

examples.ch: 告诉我发生了什么事——从头说起。
examples.en: Tell me what happened - start at the beginning.

examples.ch: 票价80欧元起，最高500欧元。
examples.en: Ticket prices start at/from €80 and go up to €500.

defines.trans_en: to move your body suddenly because something has surprised or frightened you

examples.ch: 电话铃声把他吓了一跳。
examples.en: He started at the sound of the phone.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) begin to work or operate

examples.ch: 我的车发动不起来。
examples.en: I'm having trouble starting the car.

examples.ch: 发动机启动不了。
examples.en: The engine won't start.

phrases.trans_en: to begin

examples.ch: 我们什么时候能开始？
examples.en: When can we get started?

phrases.trans_en: to have your first child
to begin an argument or a fight

examples.ch: 看得出这个家伙想挑事，于是我们就走开了。
examples.en: You could tell the guy wanted to start something, so we just walked away.

phrases.trans_en: to begin being employed

examples.ch: 他16岁开始在当地的一家面包房干活。
examples.en: He started work at 16 in a bakery.

phrases.trans_en: at the beginning, or as the first of several things

examples.ch: 起初我们在蒙特利尔只认识两个人，但很快就交到了朋友。
examples.en: We only knew two people in Montreal to start with, but we soon made friends.

examples.ch: 首先，我们需要更好的电脑——其次，我们需要更多的培训。
examples.en: To start with, we need better computers - then we need more training.

defines.trans_en: the beginning of something

examples.ch: 从一开始我们就对这个产品的效用抱有疑问。
examples.en: We were doubtful about the product's usefulness from the start.

examples.ch: 他们宣布创办一个新的企业。
examples.en: They announced the start of a new commercial venture.

examples.ch: 本周初天气不错。
examples.en: The weather was good at the start (= in the first part) of the week.

examples.ch: 活动开局不顺／不利，舞台灯光头几分钟就出了问题。
examples.en: The event got off to a shaky/poor start with the stage lights failing in the first few minutes.

defines.trans_en: the act of beginning to do something

examples.ch: 我们下星期需要开始准备小册子了。
examples.en: We need to make a start on (preparing) the brochure next week.

defines.trans_en: an advantage that you have over someone else when you begin something

examples.ch: 比赛开始时我们给年龄最小的孩子五秒钟让先。
examples.en: We gave the youngest children a five-second start (= in a race).

defines.trans_en: a sudden movement of the body that you make when something has surprised or frightened you

examples.ch: 他抖了一下，惊醒了。
examples.en: He woke with a start.

examples.ch: 我进去时她吓了一跳。
examples.en: She gave a start as I entered.

phrases.trans_en: including all of something, from the beginning to the end

examples.ch: 整个过程自始至终糟糕透了。
examples.en: The whole party was a disaster from start to finish.

phrases.trans_en: first, or as the first in a set of things

examples.ch: 我们先记下名字和电话号码，之后可以获取更多的细节。
examples.en: We'll take names and phone numbers for a start, then later on we can get more details.

phrases.trans_en: used when giving a first example of something

examples.ch: 这本书比她的上一部好。首先它短一些。
examples.en: This book is better than her last one. For a start, it's shorter.

defines.trans_en: a building and the surrounding area where buses or trains stop for people to get on or off

examples.ch: 火车站
examples.en: a railway station

examples.ch: 火车站
examples.en: a railroad station

examples.ch: 火车站／公共汽车站／长途汽车站
examples.en: a train/bus/coach station

examples.ch: 我们的办事处在火车站附近。
examples.en: Our office is near the station.

examples.ch: 我们在地图上找最近的地铁站。
examples.en: We looked on our map to find the nearest underground/tube (US subway/metro) station.

defines.trans_en: a company that broadcasts radio or television programmes

examples.ch: 广播电台／电视台
examples.en: a radio/television station

examples.ch: 商业／外国电台
examples.en: a commercial/foreign station

examples.ch: 接收效果不太好——换一个台试试。
examples.en: The reception is not very good - try to tune in to another station.

examples.ch: 非法电台
examples.en: a pirate (= illegal) station

defines.trans_ch: （提供某种服务或进行某种工作的）站，所，局
defines.trans_en: a building or place used for a particular service or type of work

examples.ch: 加油站
examples.en: a petrol station

examples.ch: 加油站
examples.en: a gas station

examples.ch: 警察局／消防站
examples.en: a police/fire station

examples.ch: 生物研究所
examples.en: a biological research station

defines.trans_ch: （提供某种服务或进行某种工作的）站，所，局
defines.trans_en: a building or place used for a particular service or type of work

examples.ch: 加油站
examples.en: a gas station

examples.ch: 加油站
examples.en: a petrol station

examples.ch: 警察局／消防站
examples.en: a police/fire station

examples.ch: 生物研究所
examples.en: a biological research station

defines.trans_ch: （澳大利亚和新西兰的）大牧场
defines.trans_en: a large farm with animals in Australia and New Zealand

examples.ch: 大牧羊场
examples.en: a sheep station

defines.trans_en: a particular position that someone has been ordered to move into or to stay in

examples.ch: 警察沿路边各就各位，挡住了人群。
examples.en: The police took up their stations at the edge of the road, holding back the crowd.

defines.trans_en: to cause especially soldiers to be in a particular place to do a job

examples.ch: 我听说你儿子在部队——他驻扎在哪里？
examples.en: I hear your son's in the army - where's he stationed?

examples.ch: 这个团在新加坡驻扎了几年。
examples.en: The regiment was stationed in Singapore for several years.

examples.ch: 武装警卫驻扎在机场周围。
examples.en: Armed guards were stationed around the airport.

defines.trans_en: to not move away from or leave a place or situation

examples.ch: 他们需要一位愿意留6个月的助手。
examples.en: They need an assistant who is willing to stay for six months.

examples.ch: 等雨停再走吧。
examples.en: Stay until the rain has stopped.

examples.ch: 你下班后能留下来打网球吗？
examples.en: Can you stay after work to play tennis?

examples.ch: 由于下雪，孩子们被告知要留在家里。
examples.en: Because of the snow, children were told to stay at home.

defines.trans_en: to continue doing something, or to continue to be in a particular state

examples.ch: 不要到悬崖边上去。
examples.en: Stay away from the edge of the cliff.

examples.ch: 他已经决定不再教书／从医／当兵。
examples.en: He decided not to stay in teaching/medicine/the army.

examples.ch: 最终数据显示大部分部门都没有超出预算。
examples.en: The final figures showed that most departments had stayed within budget.

examples.ch: 那天晚上天气很暖和，我们一直在花园里呆到10点钟。
examples.en: It was so warm we stayed (out) in the garden until ten that night.

examples.ch: 盖上锅盖，这样食物就不会凉了。
examples.en: Put a lid on the pan so the food will stay hot.

examples.ch: 商店一直营业到9点。
examples.en: The shops stay open until nine o' clock.

examples.ch: 他们离婚后仍然是朋友。
examples.en: They stayed friends after their divorce.

defines.trans_en: to live or be in a place for a short time as a visitor

examples.ch: 我在蒙特利尔停留了两周，然后乘飞机回家。
examples.en: I stayed in Montreal for two weeks then flew home.

examples.ch: 他们说他们会住在旅馆里。
examples.en: They said they'd stay at/in a hotel.

examples.ch: 夏天孩子们通常到爷爷奶奶那里住上一周。
examples.en: My kids usually stay with their grandparents for a week in the summer.

defines.trans_en: to live somewhere permanently

examples.ch: 我依然和父母住在一起。
examples.en: I still stay with my parents.

phrases.trans_en: to sleep somewhere for one night

examples.ch: 我们商量好在我姐姐家住一宿。
examples.en: We've arranged to stay overnight at my sister's house.

defines.trans_en: a period of time that you spend in a place

examples.ch: 她计划在酒店小住一段时间，庆祝他们的结婚纪念日。
examples.en: She planned a short stay at/in a hotel to celebrate their anniversary.

phrases.trans_ch: 缓期执行死刑／驱逐出境（等等）
phrases.trans_en: an order by a judge that stops a judgment being performed until new information can be considered

defines.trans_ch: 肉排;肉块;鱼排;鱼块;（尤指）牛排
defines.trans_en: a thick, flat piece of meat or fish, especially meat from a cow

examples.ch: Ｔ骨／里脊牛排
examples.en: T-bone/sirloin steaks

examples.ch: 鲑鱼排／火鸡肉排
examples.en: salmon/turkey steaks

examples.ch: 我们晚餐吃牛排好吗？
examples.en: Shall we have steak for dinner?

defines.trans_en: to take something without the permission or knowledge of the owner and keep it

examples.ch: 她承认偷了雇主的钱。
examples.en: She admitted stealing the money from her employers.

examples.ch: 每年失窃车辆的数量在上升。
examples.en: The number of cars which are stolen every year has risen.

examples.ch: 他们非常穷，为了填饱肚子只得去偷。
examples.en: They were so poor they had to steal in order to eat.

defines.trans_en: to do something quickly or without being noticed

examples.ch: 她偷偷瞥了一眼自己的手表。
examples.en: She stole a glance at her watch.

examples.ch: 他趁没人注意，偷偷溜出了房间。
examples.en: He stole out of the room while no one was looking.

defines.trans_en: a product that has a very low price, or a price that is much lower than the original cost

examples.ch: 我在大减价时买了个新熨斗——非常便宜。
examples.en: I picked up a new iron in the sale - it was a steal.

defines.trans_en: continuing to happen or continuing to be done

examples.ch: 我还是很饿。
examples.en: I'm still hungry.

examples.ch: 我还是没有完成我的论文。
examples.en: I still haven't finished writing my essay.

examples.ch: 仍旧没有人质的消息。
examples.en: There is still no news about the hostages.

examples.ch: 你还在为政府工作吗？
examples.en: Do you still work for the government?

examples.ch: 失踪孩子仍活着的可能性越来越渺茫。
examples.en: Hope is fading that the missing child is still alive.

examples.ch: 还有时间，我们能在电影开演之前赶到电影院。
examples.en: There's still time for us to get to the cinema before the film starts.

defines.trans_en: despite that

examples.ch: 你可能不赞成他的所作所为，但他仍然是你的兄弟。
examples.en: You may not approve of what he did, but he's still your brother.

examples.ch: 我知道你不喜欢她，但尽管如此，你也没必要对她那么无礼。
examples.en: I know you don't like her, but you still don't have to be so rude to her.

examples.ch: 尽管她并不是真的有时间，但她仍然主动提出要帮忙。
examples.en: Even though she doesn't really have the time, she still offered to help.

defines.trans_en: to an even greater degree or in an even greater amount

examples.ch: 爆炸中丧生者的人数有可能还会增加。
examples.en: The number of people killed in the explosion is likely to rise still higher.

examples.ch: 公司希望可以进一步拓展市场。
examples.en: The company is hoping to extend its market still further.

examples.ch: 夜里又下了雪。
examples.en: Still more snow fell overnight.

examples.ch: 咱们在戏院碰面。哦不，更好的是，我们先一起喝上一杯。
examples.en: I'll meet you at the theatre. No, better still, let's meet for a drink first.

examples.ch: 我担心他的车坏了，或者，更糟的是，他出了事故。
examples.en: I'm worried that his car has broken down, or worse still, that he's had an accident.

examples.ch: 你为什么还要对我撒谎呢？
examples.en: Why do you have to tell me still (= even) more lies?

defines.trans_en: staying in the same position; not moving

examples.ch: 儿童很难长时间坐着／站着／呆着不动。
examples.en: Children find it difficult to sit/stand/stay still for very long.

examples.ch: 你动来动去的话，我没法给你梳头。
examples.en: I can't brush your hair if you don't keep/hold still.

examples.ch: 我给她拍照的时候，她坐着一动也不动。
examples.en: She sat perfectly still while I took her photograph.

examples.ch: 一点儿风都没有，连树叶都一动不动。
examples.en: The air was so still (= there was so little wind) that not even the leaves were moving.

examples.ch: 她一头扎入了平静的湖水中。
examples.en: She dived into the still (= calm and not flowing) water of the lake.

defines.trans_ch: （饮料）不含碳酸气的，不起泡的
defines.trans_en: A still drink is one that is not fizzy (= with bubbles)

examples.ch: 你要无气的还是有气的水？
examples.en: Would you like still or sparkling water?

defines.trans_en: to make something stop moving or become more calm

examples.ch: 他努力不让吊床晃来晃去。
examples.en: He tried to still the swaying of the hammock.

examples.ch: 她抱着自己的宝宝，哄他不哭。
examples.en: She cuddled her baby to still its cries.

defines.trans_en: a photograph of a piece of action in a film
a time when it is quiet and calm

examples.ch: 夜深人静，万籁俱寂。
examples.en: In the still of the night, nothing moved.

defines.trans_en: a piece of equipment used for making alcohol
an organ in the body where food is digested, or the soft front part of your body just below the chest

examples.ch: 他肚子上挨了一拳。
examples.en: He was punched in the stomach.

examples.ch: 医生让他俯卧。
examples.en: The doctor asked him to lie down on his stomach.

examples.ch: 看见血总会让我反胃。
examples.en: The sight of blood always churns/turns my stomach (= makes me feel as if I am going to vomit).

examples.ch: 她肠胃不好，不能吃辛辣食物。
examples.en: She has a very delicate stomach and doesn't eat spicy food.

examples.ch: 我饿了，肚子开始咕咕叫了。
examples.en: I was hungry and my stomach had started growling/rumbling (= making noises).

examples.ch: 他感到心里一阵紧张。
examples.en: He felt a knot of nervousness in the pit (= bottom) of his stomach.

examples.ch: 我建议她喝杯茶，也许可以缓解她胃部的不适。
examples.en: I suggested that some weak tea might settle (= calm) her stomach.

defines.trans_ch: 能够容忍，承受得住（令人不快的想法或景象）
defines.trans_en: to be able to accept an unpleasant idea or watch something unpleasant

examples.ch: 他一想到彼得可能会出任下届主席就很不舒服。
examples.en: He can't stomach the idea that Peter might be the next chairman.

examples.ch: 她觉得这部电影中的暴力场面令人难以忍受。
examples.en: She found the violence in the film hard to stomach.

defines.trans_en: to finish doing something that you were doing

examples.ch: 我一开始吃巧克力，就停不了嘴了。
examples.en: Once I start eating chocolate, I can't stop.

examples.ch: 别再叫了——你搞得我头都疼了！
examples.en: Stop shouting - you're giving me a headache!

examples.ch: 我忍不住笑个没完。
examples.en: I couldn't stop laughing.

examples.ch: 住手！
examples.en: Stop it!/Stop that!

defines.trans_en: to not continue to operate

examples.ch: 我的表一定是停了。
examples.en: My watch must have stopped.

examples.ch: 空调停了。
examples.en: The air conditioner has stopped working.

defines.trans_en: to not move any more or to make someone or something not move any more

examples.ch: 把车停下，我要下去！
examples.en: Stop the car, I want to get out!

examples.ch: 我听到他大叫：“停下，否则我就开枪了！”
examples.en: I heard him shout, "Stop, or I'll shoot!"

defines.trans_ch: 戒除，停止（常做的事或习惯）
defines.trans_en: to finish doing something that you do regularly or as a habit

examples.ch: 听说她戒酒了。
examples.en: Apparently she's stopped drinking.

examples.ch: 去年我和他分手了。
examples.en: I stopped seeing him last year.

defines.trans_en: to pause for a short time while travelling or during an activity

examples.ch: 本次列车在芬斯伯里公园停吗？
examples.en: Does this train stop at Finsbury Park?

examples.ch: 为什么你不找个地方停一下问问路呢？
examples.en: Why don't you just stop somewhere and ask for directions?

examples.ch: 我停下脚步，捡起我掉在地上的信。
examples.en: I stopped to pick up a letter that I'd dropped.

defines.trans_en: to prevent someone from doing something

examples.ch: 如果她真的想走，我不明白有什么事绊住了她。
examples.en: If she really wants to leave, I don't understand what's stopping her.

examples.ch: 他们筑起了街垒，阻止人们通行。
examples.en: They've put barriers up to stop people (from) getting through.

examples.ch: 必须做点儿什么来制止争斗。
examples.en: Something must be done to stop the fighting.

defines.trans_en: to stay in a place

examples.ch: 你是和我一起走还是就留在这儿？
examples.en: Are you coming with me or are you stopping here?

examples.ch: 我不能再呆了——马克在外面等着我呢。
examples.en: I can't stop - Marc is waiting for me outside.

examples.ch: 既然你已经来了，为什么不留下来喝杯茶呢？
examples.en: Now that you're here, why don't you stop for some tea?

examples.ch: 这个星期我每个晚上都在外面，所以今晚想呆在家里。
examples.en: I've been out every night this week, so I thought I'd stop in (= stay at home) tonight.

examples.ch: 我们昨晚看晚场电影，一直熬到两点才睡。
examples.en: We stopped up (= did not go to bed) until two o'clock last night watching the late film.

defines.trans_en: to block a hole

examples.ch: 我们用些破布塞住了豁口。
examples.en: We stopped (up) the gap with some rags.

phrases.trans_en: to tell your bank not to deal with a cheque that you have written, so that the money is not paid from your bank account

defines.trans_ch: 停止，终止;逗留，停留;停留时间
defines.trans_en: the act of stopping an activity or journey, or a period of time when you stop

examples.ch: 请在飞机停稳前留在自己的座位上。
examples.en: Please remain in your seat until the plane comes to a complete stop.

examples.ch: 我们本来可以早点儿到这儿的，但我们中途停了好几次。
examples.en: We'd have been here sooner, but we made several stops along the way.

examples.ch: 项目开始的时候，有很多磕磕绊绊。
examples.en: At the beginning of the project there were a lot of stops and starts.

defines.trans_en: a place where vehicles, especially buses, stop in order to allow passengers to get off and on

examples.ch: 公交车站
examples.en: a bus stop

examples.ch: 我下一站下车。
examples.en: I'm getting off at the next stop.

examples.ch: 我们是这一站下吗？
examples.en: Is this our stop (= where we must get off)?

defines.trans_en:
short form of
full stop UK

a 
plosive  (= consonant that is made by completely stopping the flow of air)

phrases.trans_en: to stop an unpleasant, unwanted activity or habit from continuing

examples.ch: 我刚认识他的时候，他总是躺在床上抽烟，但我很快就让他改掉了！
examples.en: He used to smoke in bed when I first got to know him, but I soon put a stop to that!

defines.trans_en: a large shop where you can buy many different types of goods

examples.ch: 百货商场
examples.en: a department store

examples.ch: DIY／家具商场
examples.en: a DIY/furniture store

defines.trans_en: any type of shop

examples.ch: 服装店／买酒的店铺
examples.en: a clothing/liquor store

examples.ch: 百货商店
examples.en: a department store

examples.ch: 家具商店
examples.en: a furniture store

examples.ch: 便利店
examples.en: a convenience store

defines.trans_en: an amount of something that is being kept for future use

examples.ch: 他的酒窖里储存了数量惊人的葡萄酒。
examples.en: He has an impressively large store of wine in his cellar.

examples.ch: 据报道，首都的食品储备量很低，形势危急。
examples.en: Food stores are reported to be running dangerously low in the capital.

examples.ch: 晚餐时，奶奶和外婆互相谈起自己关于过去的记忆。
examples.en: My grandmothers store of memories was shared over the dinner table.

defines.trans_en: a building in which things are kept until they are needed

examples.ch: 粮仓／武器库
examples.en: a grain/weapons store

defines.trans_en: to put or keep things in a special place for use in the future

examples.ch: 数据储存在一个硬盘上，并用光盘做了备份。
examples.en: The data is stored on a hard disk and backed up on a CD.

examples.ch: 我在西班牙居住期间，把我的东西放在我母亲那儿了。
examples.en: I stored my possessions in my mother's house while I was living in Spain.

examples.ch: 我把厚毛衣和外套收了起来，等到来年冬天再穿。
examples.en: I've stored my thick sweaters and jackets (away) until next winter.

examples.ch: 松鼠为过冬储藏坚果。
examples.en: Squirrels store (up) nuts for the winter.

defines.trans_en: an extreme weather condition with very strong wind, heavy rain, and often thunder and lightning

examples.ch: 在最近的暴风雨中许多树木被刮倒。
examples.en: A lot of trees were blown down in the recent storms.

examples.ch: 他们还在清理风暴留下的残局。
examples.en: They're still cleaning up the storm damage.

defines.trans_en: a very angry reaction from a lot of people

examples.ch: 新税种的宣布引发了抗议风潮。
examples.en: There was a storm of protest when the new tax was announced.

phrases.trans_ch: 在（某处）大获成功；完全征服（一群人）
phrases.trans_en: to be suddenly extremely successful in a place or with a group of people

examples.ch: 她的表演完全征服了评论界。
examples.en: Her performance has taken the critics by storm.

defines.trans_en: to attack a place or building by entering suddenly in great numbers

examples.ch: 数百名士兵强行攻占了堡垒。
examples.en: The fortress was stormed by hundreds of soldiers.

defines.trans_en: to express anger in a loud and often uncontrolled way

examples.ch: “滚出去，再也不准回来！”他咆哮道。
examples.en: "Get out and never come back!" he stormed.

phrases.trans_en: to enter or leave a place in a way that shows that you are angry

examples.ch: 他气呼呼地冲出房子，砰地关上了门。
examples.en: He stormed out of the house, slamming the door as he went.

defines.trans_ch: …风暴的（用于构词，表示特殊类型的暴烈天气）
defines.trans_en: used to form words for particular types of violent weather

examples.ch: 暴风雨
examples.en: a rainstorm

examples.ch: 沙暴
examples.en: a sandstorm

examples.ch: 暴风雪
examples.en: a snowstorm

examples.ch: 雷暴
examples.en: a thunderstorm

examples.ch: 风暴
examples.en: a windstorm

defines.trans_ch: （真实或虚构的）故事;叙述，描述;小说
defines.trans_en: a description, either true or imagined, of a connected series of events

examples.ch: 爸爸，能给我读／讲个故事吗？
examples.en: Will you read/tell me a story, daddy?

examples.ch: 玛莎挑了她最喜欢的睡前故事书。
examples.en: Martha chose her favourite book of bedtime stories.

examples.ch: 他写童话故事。
examples.en: He writes children's stories.

examples.ch: 我不知道那是否是真实的，不过却是个有趣的故事。
examples.en: I don't know if it's true but it's a good story (= entertaining to listen to although probably not true).

examples.ch: 她从她的角度告诉了我发生了什么事情，不过听听他的说法也是很有意思的。
examples.en: She gave me her version of what had happened, but it would be interesting to hear his half/side of the story (= the events as described by him).

examples.ch: 据说他对她说的第一句话就是“你愿意嫁给我吗？”，传说就是这样的。
examples.en: Apparently his first words to her were "Will you marry me?" or so the story goes (= that is what people say happened).

defines.trans_en: a report in a newspaper or on a news broadcast of something that has happened

examples.ch: 今天报纸上的主要报道是总统的演讲。
examples.en: The main story in the papers today is the president's speech.

defines.trans_en: a lie

examples.ch: 他编了一通谎话，说什么必须去参加他姨妈的结婚周年纪念。
examples.en: He made up some story about having to be at his aunt's wedding anniversary.

defines.trans_en: a level of a building

examples.ch: 3层高的房子
examples.en: a three-story house

examples.ch: 他们的新房子包括阁楼一共有4层。
examples.en: Their new house has four stories including the attic.

defines.trans_en: continuing in one direction without bending or curving

examples.ch: 直线
examples.en: a straight line

examples.ch: 她有一头金色的直发。
examples.en: She has straight blonde hair.

examples.ch: 今夏的裙装流行长长的直筒裙。
examples.en: Skirts this summer are long and straight.

examples.ch: 难道你看不见吗？——就在（你）正前面！
examples.en: Can't you see it? - it's straight ahead (of you)!

examples.ch: 那条狗似乎是径直朝我奔过来的。
examples.en: The dog seemed to be coming straight at/for me.

examples.ch: 沿着这条路一直走，到了红绿灯那儿向左转。
examples.en: Go straight along this road and turn left at the traffic lights.

defines.trans_en: honest

examples.ch: 对她坦诚一些，告诉她你的感觉。
examples.en: Just be straight with her and tell her how you feel.

examples.ch: 请坦白告诉我，你是不是希望我们今天晚上不去？
examples.en: Tell me straight, would you rather we didn't go tonight?

phrases.trans_ch: 直截了当地;不拐弯抹角地
phrases.trans_en: If you tell someone something straight out, you say it directly and honestly, without trying to make what you are saying more pleasant.

examples.ch: 我直截了当地告诉她我不再爱她了。
examples.en: I told her straight out that I didn't love her any more.

defines.trans_en: immediately

examples.ch: 我回到家就径直上床睡了。
examples.en: I got home and went straight to bed.

examples.ch: 晚饭后我们直接去参加聚会。
examples.en: We'll go straight to the party after dinner.

examples.ch: 时间不多，所以我就开门见山了。
examples.en: Time is short so I'll get straight to the point (= explain the matter immediately).

defines.trans_en: clearly

examples.ch: 如果你眼都花了，那你就知道自己喝得太多了。
examples.en: You know you've had too much to drink when you can't see straight.

examples.ch: 我累坏了，头脑都不清楚了。
examples.en: I'm so tired I can't think straight any more.

phrases.trans_en: immediately

examples.ch: 我立刻就知道你在想什么了。
examples.en: I knew straight away what you were thinking.

examples.ch: 我们用不着马上就走——我们可以呆一会儿。
examples.en: We don't need to go straight off - we can stay for a little while.

defines.trans_en: clear or not complicated

examples.ch: 你的选择很简单——要么离开他，要么留下。
examples.en: It's a straight choice - either you leave him or you stay.

examples.ch: 我们把这个弄清楚——你周一要去法兰克福，周二去布鲁塞尔，对吗？
examples.en: Let's get this straight - you're travelling to Frankfurt on Monday and Brussels on Tuesday, is that correct?

defines.trans_en: level and not sloping to either side

examples.ch: 这幅画不正。
examples.en: This picture's not straight.

examples.ch: 架子不平——中间陷下去了。
examples.en: The shelf isn't straight - it sags in the middle.

defines.trans_en: plain and basic, or without anything added

examples.ch: 请不要给我加奎宁水，我喜欢喝纯伏特加。
examples.en: No tonic for me, please, I like my vodka straight.

examples.ch: 什么佐料也不加的意大利面条没什么味道——你需要加些酱汁儿才会有滋味。
examples.en: Straight pasta is very bland - you need some kind of sauce to make it interesting.

defines.trans_en: following one after another without an interruption

examples.ch: 他们是这个赛季唯一一支连赢10场比赛的球队。
examples.en: They're the only team to have won ten straight games this season.

defines.trans_ch: 整齐的，整洁的;井井有条的
defines.trans_en: tidy, or arranged in order

examples.ch: 聚会之后只用了一个钟头就把公寓收拾得整整齐齐。
examples.en: It only took an hour to get the flat straight after the party.

examples.ch: 你有镜子吗？——我要把头发梳理整齐。
examples.en: Do you have a mirror? - I'll just put my hair straight.

defines.trans_ch: 传统的，正统的;规矩的;严肃的
defines.trans_en: traditional or serious

examples.ch: 他是个不错的家伙，不过太严肃了——我总是觉得我和他在一起必须得规规矩矩的。
examples.en: He was a nice enough guy, but he was so straight - I always felt I had to be on my best behaviour with him.

examples.ch: 戏剧节上有许多正统的戏剧作品，也有不少比较新、更有实验性的剧目。
examples.en: There's a lot of straight theatre at the festival as well as the newer, more experimental stuff.

defines.trans_en: not gay
not using illegal drugs or alcohol

examples.ch: 他戒毒已经有5个月了。
examples.en: He's been straight for five months.

defines.trans_en: neither owing nor owed any money

examples.ch: 你买的票，因此如果我出打车的钱，我们就扯平了。
examples.en: You bought the tickets, so if I pay for the taxi, we'll be straight.

defines.trans_en: the straight part of a racetrack (= the track on which competitors race)

examples.ch: 选手们刚跑上最后一个直道。
examples.en: And the runners are just coming up to the finishing straight.

defines.trans_en: a person who is not gay

defines.trans_ch: 不寻常的；奇怪的；不可思议的
defines.trans_en: unusual and unexpected, or difficult to understand

examples.ch: 他对女性有一些非常古怪的看法！
examples.en: He has some very strange ideas about women!

examples.ch: 有时候你说的话非常奇怪。
examples.en: You say the strangest things sometimes.

examples.ch: 有个奇怪的感觉，觉得我们以前见过面。
examples.en: I had a strange feeling that we'd met before.

examples.ch: 不可思议的是，游客几乎从来不到这个村子来。
examples.en: It's strange that tourists almost never visit this village.

examples.ch: 太奇怪了——我肯定我把眼镜放进了包里，但不见了。
examples.en: That's strange - I'm sure I put my glasses in my bag, but they're not there.

defines.trans_en: not known or familiar

examples.ch: 我不会搭陌生男人的车。
examples.en: I don't accept rides from strange men.

examples.ch: 看到周围有这么多的陌生面孔，婴儿开始哭了起来。
examples.en: With so many strange faces around her, the baby started to cry.

examples.ch: 我以前也没来过这里，因此对我来说这也是完全陌生的。
examples.en: I've never been here before either, so it's all strange to me too.

phrases.trans_ch: 感觉不舒服；感觉不正常
phrases.trans_en: to feel uncomfortable and not normal or correct

examples.ch: 我希望那条鱼没问题——我的肚子感觉有点儿不舒服。
examples.en: I hope that fish was all right - my stomach feels a little strange .

defines.trans_en: a road in a city or town that has buildings that are usually close together along one or both sides

examples.ch: 狂欢节过后，街上到处是垃圾。
examples.en: The streets were strewn with rubbish after the parade.

examples.ch: 街道图
examples.en: a street map

examples.ch: 我们的女儿就住在我们家街对面。
examples.en: Our daughter lives just across the street from us.

examples.ch: 黛安的房子在切里街上。
examples.en: Diane's house is in/on Cherry Street.

examples.ch: 即便我们只是从街上走过，男人们也会向我们吹口哨。
examples.en: Men whistle at us when we're just walking down the street.

examples.ch: 过马路时一定要看两边。
examples.en: Make sure you look both ways when you cross the street.

examples.ch: 夜幕降临时，镇子的街上便空无一人了。
examples.en: The town's streets were deserted by dusk.

examples.ch: 清晨5点，仍有人群在街头游荡。
examples.en: At five in the morning, there were still crowds of people roaming the streets.

examples.ch: 我在佛罗伦萨从一个街头小贩那儿买了这副太阳镜。
examples.en: I bought these sunglasses from a street vendor in Florence.

phrases.trans_ch: 上街游行示威，走上街头
phrases.trans_en: When people take to the streets, they express their opposition to something in public and often violently.

examples.ch: 数千人走上街头抗议军事政变。
examples.en: Thousands of people have taken to the streets to protest against the military coup.

defines.trans_ch: 强有力的，强劲的；强壮的；强烈的
defines.trans_en: powerful; having or using great force or control

examples.ch: 能把这么重的东西背在背上，她一定非常强健。
examples.en: She must be very strong to carry such a weight on her back.

examples.ch: 任何社会中帮助弱者都是强者不可推卸的责任。
examples.en: It is surely the duty of the stronger members in a society to help those who are weak.

examples.ch: 我祖母在我的幼年对我影响很大。
examples.en: My grandmother had a strong influence/effect on my early childhood.

examples.ch: 预计未来几天这一地区将有大风。
examples.en: Strong winds are forecast in the area for the next few days.

examples.ch: 一张像片可以引起如此深刻的记忆，实在令人惊讶。
examples.en: It's surprising what strong memories a photograph can produce.

examples.ch: 让卡尔来提吧——他像牛一样壮。
examples.en: Get Carl to lift it - he's as strong as an ox (= very strong).

defines.trans_en: effective; of a good quality or level and likely to be successful

examples.ch: 要解决我们的经济问题，需要采取强有力的政策。
examples.en: We will need strong policies if our economic problems are to be solved.

examples.ch: 如果这些止痛药药力不够的话，我可以给你一些药效更强的。
examples.en: I can give you stronger pain-killing drugs if these aren't strong enough.

examples.ch: 我们已和许多南美洲国家建立了牢固的贸易关系。
examples.en: Strong trading links exist between us and many South American countries.

defines.trans_en: skilled or good at doing something

examples.ch: 毫无疑问，在我们所面试的这个职位的求职者中，她是能力最强的。
examples.en: Without a doubt, she's the strongest candidate we've interviewed for the job.

examples.ch: 作为一名吉他手，他的演奏技法很娴熟，不过也许在演奏某些曲子时缺乏感情。
examples.en: As a guitarist, he's strong on (= good at) technique but lacks feeling in some pieces.

defines.trans_ch: 坚决的，坚定的，不动摇的
defines.trans_en: difficult to argue with; firm and determined

examples.ch: 她有非常坚定的宗教主张。
examples.en: She has strong opinions about religion.

examples.ch: 他个性很强，但别让他欺侮你。
examples.en: He has a strong personality, but don't let him bully you.

examples.ch: 大部分小组成员对于离婚的看法非常固执。
examples.en: Most of the group have strong views on the subject of divorce.

defines.trans_ch: （味道、气味等）浓的，重的，强烈的
defines.trans_en: If a taste, smell, etc. is strong, it is very noticeable or powerful.

examples.ch: 一道强光直刺进我的眼里。
examples.en: A strong light was shining straight in my eyes.

examples.ch: 走廊里有一股极为刺鼻的漂白粉味。
examples.en: There's a really strong smell of bleach in the corridor.

examples.ch: 这种咖啡对我来说太浓了。
examples.en: This coffee is too strong for me.

examples.ch: 房间装饰的色调非常亮丽。
examples.en: The room was decorated in very strong colours.

examples.ch: 兄弟俩长得真像。
examples.en: What a strong likeness there is between the brothers!

defines.trans_ch: 牢固的，强健的；结实的；坚固的
defines.trans_en: difficult to break, destroy, or make sick, or able to support a heavy weight or force

examples.ch: 结实的盒子／椅子
examples.en: a strong box/chair

examples.ch: 窗户用的是强化玻璃——不会碎。
examples.en: The window is made from very strong glass - it won't shatter.

examples.ch: 他的病情严重，但是他很强壮——我相信他能挺过来的。
examples.en: It's a serious disease, but he's very strong - I think he'll pull through.

defines.trans_ch: 可能性很大的，很有可能的
defines.trans_en: very likely to happen

examples.ch: 很有可能在随后的几个小时内找到孩子。
examples.en: There's a strong possibility/likelihood of finding the child within the next few hours.

examples.ch: 该病确诊后如果马上接受治疗，治愈的可能性会大很多。
examples.en: The treatment's chances of success are stronger if it is started as soon as the disease is diagnosed.

defines.trans_en: having the stated number of people, members, etc.

examples.ch: 人群数量已经增加到几百人。
examples.en: The crowd had grown to be several hundred strong.

defines.trans_ch: 强的（酸、碱或某种化学成分）
defines.trans_en: A strong acid, alkali, or chemical base produces many ions (= atoms with an electrical charge) when it is dissolved in water.

phrases.trans_ch: 露骨地调情，挑逗;言行过分，过于苛刻
phrases.trans_en: to behave towards another person in a way that is too severe, or that shows a strong sexual interest that the other person does not want

examples.ch: 你当时有些太过分了——又不是她的错。
examples.en: I think you came on a bit strong - it wasn't her fault.

examples.ch: 他老是挑逗我——我真希望他别这么做了。
examples.en: He's always coming on strong to me - I wish he'd stop.

phrases.trans_ch: （为了成功或控制局面而）额外努力
phrases.trans_en: to make an extra effort in order to be successful or to have control in a situation

examples.ch: 他在前几轮特别努力，希望能击溃对手。
examples.en: He came on strong in the early rounds to annihilate the competition.

defines.trans_en: a person who is learning at a college or university

examples.ch: 法律／哲学／医学专业的学生
examples.en: a law/philosophy/medical student

examples.ch: 研究生
examples.en: a graduate/postgraduate student (= one who has completed a first degree)

examples.ch: 全职／兼职学生
examples.en: a full-time/part-time student

examples.ch: 师范生／学生护士／医学生
examples.en: a student teacher/nurse/doctor (= a person training to become a teacher, nurse, etc.)

examples.ch: 他是芝加哥大学的学生。
examples.en: He was a student at the University of Chicago.

defines.trans_en: someone who is learning at a school

examples.ch: 教师用各种材料来激发学生的学习热情。
examples.en: Teachers use a variety of materials to inspire their students.

examples.ch: 学生不允许把手机带到考场来。
examples.en: Students are not allowed to bring mobile phones in to the test.

examples.ch: 学校的幼儿园有24个孩子。
examples.en: The school has 24 students in kindergarten.

defines.trans_en: If someone is a student of a particular subject, they know about it and are interested in it.

examples.ch: 当护士的，一定得对人性有一点儿认识。
examples.en: As a nurse, you have to be a student of (= to know and learn about) human nature.

defines.trans_en: to learn about a subject, especially in an educational course or by reading books

examples.ch: 攻读生物学／化学
examples.en: to study biology/chemistry

examples.ch: 下个学期我们将学习植物及其生长过程。
examples.en: Next term we will study plants and how they grow.

examples.ch: 她攻读博士学位已经有3年了。
examples.en: She's been studying for her doctorate for three years already.

defines.trans_en: to examine something very carefully

examples.ch: 签字之前，我需要时间把这份合同彻底研究一下。
examples.en: I want time to study this contract thoroughly before signing it.

examples.ch: 研究人员一直在研究人们在压力之下是如何作决定的。
examples.en: Researchers have been studying how people under stress make decisions.

defines.trans_en: the activity of examining a subject in detail in order to discover new information

examples.ch: 5年来对野生动物和农牧业关系的研究
examples.en: a five-year study of the relationship between wildlife and farming

examples.ch: 一些研究显示某些人造甜味剂可能会致癌。
examples.en: Some studies have suggested a link between certain types of artificial sweetener and cancer.

defines.trans_ch: （画家作画前测试自己想法的）试作，试画
defines.trans_en: a drawing that an artist makes in order to test ideas before starting a painting of the same subject
the act of learning about a subject, usually at school or university

examples.ch: 研读英国文学
examples.en: the study of English literature

defines.trans_en: a room, especially in a house, used for quiet work such as reading or writing

phrases.trans_en: studying or work involving studying

examples.ch: 亚当在学业上花的时间不够。
examples.en: Adam doesn't spend enough time on his studies.

phrases.trans_en: used in the names of some educational subjects and courses

examples.ch: 商学／传媒学系
examples.en: the department of business/media studies

defines.trans_en: to learn about a subject, especially in an educational course or by reading books

examples.ch: 攻读生物学／化学
examples.en: to study biology/chemistry

examples.ch: 下个学期我们将学习植物及其生长过程。
examples.en: Next term we will study plants and how they grow.

examples.ch: 她攻读博士学位已经有3年了。
examples.en: She's been studying for her doctorate for three years already.

defines.trans_en: to examine something very carefully

examples.ch: 签字之前，我需要时间把这份合同彻底研究一下。
examples.en: I want time to study this contract thoroughly before signing it.

examples.ch: 研究人员一直在研究人们在压力之下是如何作决定的。
examples.en: Researchers have been studying how people under stress make decisions.

defines.trans_en: the activity of examining a subject in detail in order to discover new information

examples.ch: 5年来对野生动物和农牧业关系的研究
examples.en: a five-year study of the relationship between wildlife and farming

examples.ch: 一些研究显示某些人造甜味剂可能会致癌。
examples.en: Some studies have suggested a link between certain types of artificial sweetener and cancer.

defines.trans_ch: （画家作画前测试自己想法的）试作，试画
defines.trans_en: a drawing that an artist makes in order to test ideas before starting a painting of the same subject
the act of learning about a subject, usually at school or university

examples.ch: 研读英国文学
examples.en: the study of English literature

defines.trans_en: a room, especially in a house, used for quiet work such as reading or writing

phrases.trans_en: studying or work involving studying

examples.ch: 亚当在学业上花的时间不够。
examples.en: Adam doesn't spend enough time on his studies.

phrases.trans_en: used in the names of some educational subjects and courses

examples.ch: 商学／传媒学系
examples.en: the department of business/media studies

defines.trans_ch: （讨论、考虑或研究的）主题，话题;问题;题目
defines.trans_en: the thing that is being discussed, considered, or studied

examples.ch: 我们讨论的话题是无家可归问题。
examples.en: Our subject for discussion is homelessness.

examples.ch: 她拍摄了一系列以家庭关系为题材的纪录片。
examples.en: She has made a series of documentaries on the subject of family relationships.

examples.ch: 特邀演讲人演讲的题目是“现代社会的刑罚与监禁”。
examples.en: The guest lecturer took as her subject (= decided to speak about) "punishment and imprisonment in modern society".

examples.ch: 自去年夏天开始，从小镇上空飞过的飞机数量一直让人们忐忑不安。
examples.en: The number of planes flying over the town has been the subject of (= has caused) concern since last summer.

defines.trans_ch: （中小学或大学的）学科;科目;专业
defines.trans_en: an area of knowledge that is studied in school, college, or university

examples.ch: 上学时我最喜欢的科目是历史和地理。
examples.en: My favourite subjects at school were history and English.

examples.ch: 她的专业是低温物理学。
examples.en: Her subject (= special area of study) is low-temperature physics.

defines.trans_en: a person, thing, or situation that is written about in a book, article, etc. or shown in a picture, etc.

examples.ch: 桥边磨坊是特纳一副未完成油画的主题。
examples.en: The mill by the bridge was the subject of an unfinished painting by J. M. W. Turner.

defines.trans_en: the person or thing that performs the action of a verb, or is joined to a description by a verb

examples.ch: Bob 是句子 Bob threw the ball 的主语。
examples.en: "Bob" is the subject of the sentence "Bob threw the ball."

defines.trans_ch: （尤指君主制国家的）臣民，国民
defines.trans_en: a person who lives in or who has the right to live in a particular country, especially a country with a king or queen

examples.ch: 他是英国臣民。
examples.en: He is a British subject.

phrases.trans_en: to start talking about a different subject

examples.ch: 我想把情况解释清楚，他却岔开了话题。
examples.en: I'd tried to explain the situation, but he just changed the subject.

defines.trans_en: to defeat people or a country and then control them against their wishes and limit their freedom

examples.ch: 入侵者很快就征服了当地的部落。
examples.en: The invaders quickly subjected the local tribes.

defines.trans_en: under the political control of another country or state

examples.ch: 被征服的民族／国家
examples.en: subject peoples/states

phrases.trans_en: to have or experience a particular thing, especially something unpleasant

examples.ch: 买汽车要交很高的国内税。
examples.en: Cars are subject to a high domestic tax.

examples.ch: 近年来，她一直饱受抑郁症的折磨。
examples.en: In recent years, she has been subject to attacks of depression.

phrases.trans_en: only able to happen if something else happens

examples.ch: 如果你同意，我们打算周三走。
examples.en: We plan to go on Wednesday, subject to your approval.

examples.ch: 如果有足够的人手，把所有的书都搬走花不了多少时间。
examples.en: Moving all the books should not take long, subject to there being (= if there are) enough helpers.

defines.trans_en: the achieving of the results wanted or hoped for

examples.ch: 几乎所有项目的成功很大程度上都取决于管理者的能力。
examples.en: The success of almost any project depends largely on its manager.

examples.ch: 我一直在劝她再雇些人，不过到目前为止都没成功。
examples.en: I've been trying to persuade her to take on more people, but so far without success.

examples.ch: 目前我还没有联系上他。
examples.en: I'm not having much success in communicating with him at the moment.

examples.ch: 这种手术的成功率非常低。
examples.en: The success rate for this operation is very low.

defines.trans_en: something that achieves positive results

examples.ch: 两部电影都获得了巨大的票房成功。
examples.en: Both films have been a big box-office success.

examples.ch: 她下定决心要让这个项目大获成功。
examples.en: She's determined to make a success of this project.

examples.ch: 那盘鲑鱼烧得好极了，不是吗？
examples.en: That salmon dish was a success, wasn't it?

defines.trans_ch: （用于名词或名词短语前表示强调）如此，这么
defines.trans_en: used before a noun or noun phrase to add emphasis

examples.ch: 那部电影真不错。
examples.en: That's such a good film.

examples.ch: 一天之内要开这么远的路好像不太可能。
examples.en: It seems like such a long way to drive for just one day.

examples.ch: 你真是个白痴！
examples.en: You're such an idiot!

examples.ch: 如此残忍真是让我无法理解。
examples.en: Such cruelty really is beyond my comprehension.

examples.ch: 那个房间实在太小了，刚够放进去一张床。
examples.en: It was such a small room that the bed only just fit.

defines.trans_en: of a particular or similar type

examples.ch: 像我们这样的小公司在经济不景气的时候非常容易受影响。
examples.en: Small companies such as ours are very vulnerable in a recession.

examples.ch: 我在找擦银器的布。你有这样的东西吗？
examples.en: I'm looking for a cloth for cleaning silver. Do you have such a thing?

examples.ch: 出席这次盛大典礼的有安德鲁‧戴维斯、梅利莎‧彼得斯等大牌明星。
examples.en: Present on this grand occasion were Andrew Davies, Melissa Peters, and other such stars.

examples.ch: 我尽量用一种不得罪她的方式告诉她。
examples.en: I tried to tell her in such a way that she wouldn't get offended.

examples.ch: 他说那是一个爱德华时代的盥洗盆之类的东西——我记不清了。
examples.en: He said it was an Edwardian washstand or some such thing - I can't remember exactly.

examples.ch: 我只买了一两样东西——面包、牛奶之类的。
examples.en: I just bought one or two things - bread and milk and such (also suchlike).

examples.ch: 我们午饭大吃了一顿，都不怎么需要再吃晚饭了。
examples.en: Our lunch was such (= of a type) that we don't really need dinner.

phrases.trans_en: for example

examples.ch: 那笔钱是用来支付交通费和住宿费的。
examples.en: That money is to cover costs such as travel and accommodation.

phrases.trans_ch: 从字面意义来看，严格地说
phrases.trans_en: in the true or exact meaning of the word or phrase

examples.ch: 尽管有几种不同的奶酪，但严格意义上的素食没有多少。
examples.en: There wasn't much vegetarian food as such, although there were several different types of cheese.

examples.ch: 我们没有真正意义上的秘书，不过确实有个学生来做些文件整理工作。
examples.en: We don't have a secretary as such, but we do have a student who comes in to do some filing.

defines.trans_en: quickly and unexpectedly

examples.ch: “你还记得事故是怎么回事吗？”“不记得了，事情发生得太突然了。”
examples.en: "Do you remember much about the accident?" "No, it all happened so suddenly."

examples.ch: 我正昏昏欲睡的时候，突然间听到外面一声尖叫。
examples.en: I was just dozing off when suddenly I heard a scream from outside.

examples.ch: 我突然意识到自己说了什么，不过为时已晚。
examples.en: I suddenly realized what I'd said, but it was too late.

defines.trans_en: a sweet substance especially from the plants sugar cane and sugar beet, used to make food and drinks sweet

examples.ch: 我的咖啡不加糖，谢谢。
examples.en: I don't take sugar in my coffee, thanks.

examples.ch: 将黄油和棕糖一起搅打，直到变成稀薄的奶油状。
examples.en: Beat together the butter and brown sugar until light and creamy.

examples.ch: 请给我一杯茶，加牛奶和两勺糖。
examples.en: Tea with milk and two sugars (= spoonfuls or lumps of sugar), please.

defines.trans_ch: 糖（总称，指溶于水的碳水化合物）
defines.trans_en: any of several types of simple carbohydrate that dissolves in water

examples.ch: 葡萄糖和乳糖都是糖类。
examples.en: Glucose and lactose are sugars.

defines.trans_en: a friendly way of talking to someone that you know

examples.ch: 嗨，宝贝儿，你今天在学校过得好吗？
examples.en: Hi, sugar, did you have a good day at school?

defines.trans_ch: （代替 shit，用于表示懊恼）糟糕，哎呀
defines.trans_en:
polite word for
shit , used when something annoying happens

examples.ch: 噢，真讨厌，我把咖啡溅得外套上到处都是。
examples.en: Oh sugar, I've just spilled coffee all down my jacket!

defines.trans_en: to put sugar in or on something

examples.ch: 他在盛马提尼的酒杯杯沿上缀以糖粒。
examples.en: He sugared the rims of the martini glasses.

examples.ch: 撒糖甜甜圈
examples.en: sugared donuts

defines.trans_en: a jacket and trousers or a jacket and skirt that are made from the same material

examples.ch: 所有的商人都穿着细条纹的套装。
examples.en: All the businessmen were wearing pinstripe suits.

examples.ch: 她穿着一套深蓝色的衣服。
examples.en: She wore a dark blue suit.

defines.trans_en: a set of clothes or a piece of clothing to be worn in a particular situation or while doing a particular activity

examples.ch: 潜水衣／防护服／滑雪服（等等）
examples.en: a diving/protective/ski, etc. suit

examples.ch: 泳装
examples.en: a swimsuit

examples.ch: 太空服
examples.en: a spacesuit

examples.ch: 甲胄，盔甲
examples.en: a suit of armour

defines.trans_ch: （由普通人或警方以外的机构提起的）诉讼，讼案
defines.trans_en: a problem taken to a law court by an ordinary person or an organization rather than the police in order to obtain a legal decision

examples.ch: 他对这家报纸提起了名誉侵权诉讼，称其报道损害了自己的声誉，要求索赔1200万美元。
examples.en: He brought (US also filed) a $12 million libel suit against the newspaper, claiming his reputation had been damaged.

examples.ch: 渎职／过失／生父确认诉讼
examples.en: a malpractice/negligence/paternity suit

defines.trans_en: any of the four types of card in a set of playing cards, each having a different shape printed on it

examples.ch: 一副纸牌中的4种花色为红桃、黑桃、梅花和方块。
