examples.en: The four suits in a pack of cards are hearts, spades, clubs, and diamonds.

defines.trans_ch: 穿套装的办公室男职员，（尤指没有人情味、缺乏思想的）公司高级管理人员
defines.trans_en: a man who works in an office and wears a suit, especially a man with a high position in a company who is considered not to have human feelings and good ideas
to be right for a particular person, situation, or occasion

examples.ch: 这个地方种的玉米很多——看来这里的土壤非常适合玉米生长。
examples.en: A lot of corn is grown in this area - the soil seems to suit it very well.

examples.ch: 城市的生活方式似乎很适合她——她看起来气色非常好。
examples.en: The city lifestyle seems to suit her - she looks great.

defines.trans_ch: （通常指颜色或衣服式样）适合，与…相称
defines.trans_en: (usually of a colour or style of clothes) to make someone look more attractive

examples.ch: 你应该多穿红色的衣服——这个颜色很适合你。
examples.en: You should wear more red - it suits you.

examples.ch: 我不太适合穿短裙——我的腿不好看。
examples.en: Short skirts don't really suit me - I don't have the legs for them.

defines.trans_en: to be convenient and cause the least difficulty for someone

examples.ch: 我们可以现在去或者下午去——看你什么时候最方便。
examples.en: We could go now or this afternoon - whatever time suits you best.

examples.ch: “8点钟在电影院外面见怎么样?”“我没问题。”
examples.en: "How about eight o'clock at the cinema?" "That suits me fine."

defines.trans_en: a large, rectangular container with a handle, for carrying clothes and possessions while travelling

examples.ch: 你把衣物都放进手提箱了吗／从手提箱里拿出来了吗?
examples.en: Have you packed/unpacked your suitcase yet?

defines.trans_en: the season of the year between spring and autumn when the weather is warmest, lasting from June to September north of the equator and from December to March south of the equator

examples.ch: 夏天，我们在阳台上吃早饭。
examples.en: We have breakfast on the balcony in (the) summer.

examples.ch: 去年夏天他们去了澳大利亚，前年夏天他们去了巴西。
examples.en: Last summer they went to Australia, and two summers ago they went to Brazil.

examples.ch: 去年夏天又热又干燥。
examples.en: That year it was a hot, dry summer.

examples.ch: 夏日的天气／太阳
examples.en: summer weather/sun

examples.ch: 一个夏日
examples.en: a summer/summer's day

defines.trans_en: to spend the summer in a particular place

examples.ch: 如果你的仙人掌夏天放在室外，当夜间温度降至华氏65度以下时，把它移到车库或屋内。
examples.en: If your cactus has summered outdoors, move it into the garage or house when overnight temperatures drop below 65°F.

defines.trans_en: the star that provides light and heat for the earth and around which the earth moves

examples.ch: 太阳东升西落。
examples.en: The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.

examples.ch: 正午时分阳光最强烈。
examples.en: The sun's rays are at their most powerful at midday.

examples.ch: 我们想我们应该趁着阳光好的时候出去散散步。
examples.en: We thought we'd go out for a walk while the sun was shining.

defines.trans_ch: 太阳的光和热;阳光，日光
defines.trans_en: the light or heat that the earth receives from the sun

examples.ch: 我想我今天晒太阳晒得有点多了——我觉得头痛。
examples.en: I think I've had too much sun today - I have a headache.

examples.ch: 我们到外面阳光下坐坐好吗?
examples.en: Let's go and sit out in the sun.

phrases.trans_ch: （尤指为了使皮肤变黑而）晒太阳，沐日光浴
phrases.trans_en: to lie or sit somewhere where there is a lot of sun, especially in order to make your skin darker

examples.ch: 我坐在阳台上晒太阳。
examples.en: I sat on the balcony sunning myself.

defines.trans_ch: 阳光明媚的，阳光充足的
defines.trans_en: bright because of light from the sun

examples.ch: 我们要在花园里举行聚会，所以我正祈祷那天会阳光明媚。
examples.en: We're having the party in the garden, so I'm praying it'll be sunny.

defines.trans_ch: （人）乐观开朗的，快乐的，阳光的
defines.trans_en: A sunny person is usually happy and relaxed and does not usually get worried or angry.

examples.ch: 她性情非常开朗。
examples.en: She has a very sunny disposition.

defines.trans_en: a large shopwhich sells most types of food and other goods needed in the home
a main meal eaten in the evening

examples.ch: 你今天来吃晚饭好吗?
examples.en: Why don't you come to/for supper tonight?

examples.ch: 他们早早地吃完晚饭，去看电影了。
examples.en: They had an early supper before going to the theatre.

defines.trans_en: a small meal eaten in the late evening

examples.ch: 我们通常会在下午5点半吃晚饭，然后在睡觉前再吃些夜宵。
examples.en: We usually have tea at about 5.30 p.m. , then supper before we go to bed.

defines.trans_en: to think that something is likely to be true

examples.ch: 丹没有接我的电话，所以我想他应该很忙。
examples.en: Dan didn't answer his phone, so I suppose (that) he's busy.

examples.ch: 他发现找工作比他想象的要难多了。
examples.en: He found it a lot more difficult to get a job than he supposed it would be.

examples.ch: 你认为吉莉恩会嫁给他吗?
examples.en: Do you suppose (that) Gillian will marry him?

examples.ch: 很多人都猜测总裁会被迫辞职。
examples.en: It is widely supposed (that) the CEO will be forced to resign.

examples.ch: 我们都以为他是德国人，可事实上他是瑞士人。
examples.en: We all supposed him to be German, but in fact he was Swiss.

examples.ch: 很多人都认为她的新书写得非常好。
examples.en: Her new book is supposed to be (= generally people think it is) very good.

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示与愿望相反的估计）猜，推测
defines.trans_en: used to show that you think something is true, although you wish that it were not

examples.ch: 我想现在所有的票恐怕都已经卖完了。
examples.en: I suppose (that) all the tickets will be sold by now.

defines.trans_en: used when you are annoyed

examples.ch: 我看你又要迟到了。
examples.en: I suppose (that) you're going to be late again.

examples.ch: 我想你会认为这很有趣。但我一点儿也不这么认为。
examples.en: I suppose (that) you think that's funny. Well, I certainly don't.

defines.trans_en: used to show unwillingness to agree

examples.ch: “我今晚能出去吗?”“哦，行吧。”
examples.en: "Can I go out tonight?" "Oh, I suppose so."

examples.ch: 我对此并不赞同，但我想这也是最好的办法了。
examples.en: I don't agree with it, but I suppose (that) it's for the best.

defines.trans_en: used in making polite requests

examples.ch: 您能借给我5英镑，我明天还给您吗？
examples.en: I don't suppose (that) you could lend me £5 till tomorrow?

defines.trans_en: to expect and need

examples.ch: 公司今年的利润要有增长才能进行这样的投资。
examples.en: Investment of this kind supposes (= would not be possible without) an increase in the company's profits this year.

defines.trans_en: used at the beginning of a sentence or clause to mean 'what would happen if'

examples.ch: 假设我们错过了火车——那我们该怎么办?
examples.en: Suppose we miss the train - what will we do then?

examples.ch: 如果我星期六不用上班的话，我们会来看你。
examples.en: We'd love to come and see you on Saturday, supposing (= if) I don't have to work that day.

defines.trans_ch: 确定的，肯定的，毫无疑问的
defines.trans_en: certain; without any doubt

examples.ch: “他怎么啦？”“我不太清楚。”
examples.en: "What's wrong with him?" "I'm not really sure."

examples.ch: 我肯定我把钥匙放在桌上了。
examples.en: I'm sure (that) I left my keys on the table.

examples.ch: 我完全确信你的决定是正确的。
examples.en: I feel absolutely sure (that) you've made the right decision.

examples.ch: 现在看来，这次选举无疑又会以政府的胜利而告终。
examples.en: It now seems sure (that) the election will result in another victory for the government.

examples.ch: 肖恩不太确定他能否参加这次聚会。
examples.en: Shaun isn't sure whether/if he'll be able to come to the party or not.

examples.ch: 还有不清楚的地方吗?
examples.en: Is there anything you're not sure of/about?

examples.ch: 我们早到一些，保证能找到好座位。
examples.en: We arrive early to be sure of getting a good seat.

examples.ch: 只有一种方法能够确保弄清真相。
examples.en: There is only one sure way (= one way that can be trusted) of finding out the truth.

defines.trans_ch: 非常清楚的，十分了解的
defines.trans_en: If you have a sure knowledge or understanding of something, you know or understand it very well.

examples.ch: 我想他还不是十分了解情况。
examples.en: I don't think he has a very sure understanding of the situation.

phrases.trans_ch: 肯定的（地），确定的（地），无疑的（地）
phrases.trans_en: certain or certainly

examples.ch: 我非常肯定自己不能参加这个晚会。
examples.en: I know for sure that I won't be able to go to the party.

examples.ch: 有一点是肯定的——一旦孩子出生，生活就完全不一样了。
examples.en: One thing's for sure - once the baby's born, your lives will never be the same again.

phrases.trans_en: to be very or too confident

examples.ch: 她找到工作以后自信多了。
examples.en: She's become much more sure of herself since she got a job.

phrases.trans_en: be confident that something is true

examples.ch: 他说他还不能完全肯定自己掌握的情况是否属实。
examples.en: He said that he wasn't completely sure of his facts.

phrases.trans_en: to have confidence in and trust someone

examples.ch: 亨利才为我们工作了很短的一段时间，我们对他还不是很了解。
examples.en: Henry has only been working for us for a short while, and we're not really sure about him yet.

examples.ch: 你完全可以信任凯。
examples.en: You can always be sure of Kay.

phrases.trans_en: to be certain to

examples.ch: 她肯定会赢。
examples.en: She's sure to win.

examples.ch: 我想去一个肯定有好天气的地方。
examples.en: I want to go somewhere where we're sure to have good weather.

phrases.trans_en: to look and/or take action to be certain that something happens, is true, etc.

examples.ch: 出门的时候一定要锁好门。
examples.en: Make sure you lock the door when you go out.

defines.trans_en: certainly

examples.ch: “你想来跟我们一起游泳吗？”“当然。”
examples.en: "Do you want to come swimming with us?" "Sure."

examples.ch: “能帮我拿一下这个吗？”“当然可以。”
examples.en: "Will you help me with this?" "Sure I will."

examples.ch: 我当然饿了。
examples.en: I sure am hungry.

examples.ch: “我干不了！”“你当然干得了。我会帮你。”
examples.en: "I can't do it!" "Sure you can. I'll help you."

defines.trans_ch: （对别人表示感谢时的回应）没问题
defines.trans_en: said when someone has thanked you

examples.ch: “谢谢你帮我们。”“没问题，随时叫我。”
examples.en: "Thanks for helping us out." "Sure, any time."

defines.trans_en: a long, narrow board made of wood or plastic, used for riding on waves as they come in towards the beach
the sport of riding on a wave on a special board
the activity of spending time visiting different websites on the internet

examples.ch: 网上冲浪
examples.en: internet surfing

defines.trans_en: the name that you share with other members of your family; last name

examples.ch: 她名叫萨拉，但是我不知道她姓什么。
examples.en: Her first name is Sarah but I don't know her surname.

defines.trans_en: an unexpected event

examples.ch: 不要告诉安妮我们为她安排了一个聚会——我想给她一个惊喜。
examples.en: Don't tell Anne we've arranged a party for her - I want it to be a surprise.

examples.ch: 回到家就意外地看到这封信，真是太好了／糟糕透了。
examples.en: It was a wonderful/nasty surprise to get home and find the letter.

examples.ch: 昨晚的那场大雪下得太突然了。
examples.en: Last night's heavy snow came as a complete surprise.

examples.ch: 你总是做些出人意料的事。
examples.en: You're always full of surprises (= doing unexpected things).

examples.ch: 我希望你不要总是让我感到吃惊意外。
examples.en: I wish you wouldn't keep springing surprises on me (= telling me unexpected things or causing unexpected things to happen).

examples.ch: 他们在拂晓时分发动了突然袭击。
examples.en: They mounted a surprise attack at dawn.

examples.ch: 昨天我叔叔突然来看我们了。
examples.en: My uncle paid us a surprise visit yesterday.

defines.trans_en: the feeling caused by something unexpected happening

examples.ch: 他惊讶地看着她。
examples.en: He looked at her in/with surprise.

examples.ch: 让我非常惊讶的是，他们答应了我们所有的要求。
examples.en: To my great surprise, they agreed to all our demands.

defines.trans_ch: 使诧异，使惊奇，使感到意外
defines.trans_en: to make someone feel surprise

examples.ch: 这条消息让所有的人都感到意外。
examples.en: The news surprised everyone.

examples.ch: 他们的父母不想让他们俩结婚，我并不感到意外。
examples.en: It doesn't surprise me that their parents don't want them to get married.

examples.ch: 这项提议遭到否决，谁也不会感到意外。
examples.en: It will not surprise anyone to learn that the offer has been rejected.

examples.ch: 珍妮特惊讶地发现时间竟然过得如此之快。
examples.en: Janet was surprised how quickly the time passed.

defines.trans_ch: 意外发现；当场抓获；突然袭击
defines.trans_en: to find, catch, or attack someone when they are not expecting it

examples.ch: 抢匪们刚打开保险箱就被警察当场抓获了。
examples.en: The robbers had just opened the safe when they were surprised by the police.

examples.ch: 他偷喝母亲的杜松子酒时被母亲逮了个正着。
examples.en: His mother surprised him helping himself to her gin.

defines.trans_en: feeling or showing surprise because something has happened that you did not expect

examples.ch: 这个结果让我们觉得很意外。
examples.en: We were very surprised at the result.

examples.ch: 艾丽斯，这太不像你的所作所为了——你真让我感到意外！
examples.en: It's not like you to behave like this, Alice - I'm surprised at you (= I feel disappointed with you)!

examples.ch: 果然不出我所料，他没有遵守他的诺言。
examples.en: I'm not surprised (that) he didn't keep his promise.

examples.ch: 我真没想到会在这里看到你。
examples.en: I'm surprised to see you here.

examples.ch: 眼下我算是把你的车修好了，但如果它再出什么毛病，你也别觉得惊讶。
examples.en: I've managed to fix your car for now, but don't be surprised if it breaks down again (= it probably will stop working again).

examples.ch: 她满脸惊诧地看着他。
examples.en: She looked at him with a surprised expression on her face.

defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing, typically with long sleeves and made from wool, that is worn on the upper part of the body

examples.ch: 如果你觉得冷就穿件毛线衫吧。
examples.en: Put a sweater on if you're cold.

examples.ch: V字领针织衫
examples.en: a V-necked sweater

defines.trans_en: (especially of food or drink) having a taste similar to that of sugar; not bitter or salty

examples.ch: 这个菠萝甜而多汁。
examples.en: The pineapple was sweet and juicy.

examples.ch: 我更喜欢咸味零食，而不是甜的。
examples.en: I prefer salty snacks to sweet ones.

defines.trans_ch: 愉快的，惬意的，令人满意的
defines.trans_en: If an emotion or event is sweet, it is very pleasant and satisfying.

examples.ch: 她沉浸在成功的喜悦中。
examples.en: She was enjoying the sweet smell of success.

defines.trans_en: If a sound is sweet, it is pleasant and easy to like.

examples.ch: 她的歌声非常甜美。
examples.en: She has a sweet singing voice.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指小东西或小孩子）迷人的，漂亮的，吸引人的
defines.trans_en: (especially of something or someone small) pleasant and attractive

examples.ch: 他们住在一座漂亮的小房子里。
examples.en: They live in a sweet little house.

examples.ch: 多漂亮的小宝宝啊！
examples.en: What a sweet baby!

defines.trans_ch: 温和的，和蔼的，讨人喜欢的
defines.trans_en: kind and pleasant

examples.ch: 我觉得亚历克斯人真好。
examples.en: I think Alex is really sweet.

examples.ch: 您肯帮我真是太好了。
examples.en: It was sweet of you to help me.

defines.trans_en: a small piece of sweet food, made of sugar

examples.ch: 她买了一包糖果在路上吃。
examples.en: She bought a packet of sweets to suck on the way.

defines.trans_en: any food with a lot of sugar in it

examples.ch: 我不想吃蛋糕，谢谢。我正尝试避免吃甜食。
examples.en: No cake, thanks. I'm trying to avoid sweets.

defines.trans_en: sweet food eaten at the end of a meal

examples.ch: 菜单上只有一种甜点——巧克力奶油蛋糕。
examples.en: There was only one sweet on the menu - chocolate cake with cream.

defines.trans_ch: （用来表示对…很高兴或认为很好）好
defines.trans_en: used to show that you are happy about something or think it is good

examples.ch: “我有演出的免费票。”“太好了！”
examples.en: "I got free tickets to the gig." "Sweet!"

defines.trans_en: to move through water by moving the body or parts of the body

examples.ch: 我们一整天都呆在海滩上，但天气太冷，不能游泳。
examples.en: We spent the day on the beach but it was too cold to go swimming.

examples.ch: 她的目标是横渡英吉利海峡。
examples.en: Her ambition is to swim (across) the English Channel.

examples.ch: 我今天早上游了两英里。
examples.en: I swam two miles this morning.

defines.trans_en: (of an object) to seem to move around

examples.ch: 因为起身太猛，她一时间觉得整个房子似乎都在旋转。
examples.en: Getting up too suddenly made the room swim before her eyes.

defines.trans_en: If your head swims, you feel confused and are unable to think or see clearly.

examples.ch: 两三杯酒下肚之后，我就开始觉得头晕了。
examples.en: After the second or third drink, my head began to swim.

phrases.trans_en: If food is swimming in/with a liquid, it has too much of that liquid in it or on it.

examples.ch: 色拉里的油太多了。
examples.en: The salad was swimming in oil.

defines.trans_en: a time when you swim

examples.ch: 我们今天下午去游泳吧。
examples.en: Let's go for/have a swim this afternoon.

defines.trans_en: a flat surface, usually supported by four legs, used for putting things on
the people sitting at a table

examples.ch: 我们后面的一桌人在给人庆祝生日，吵吵闹闹的。
examples.en: There was a really noisy table behind us celebrating someone's birthday.

defines.trans_en: a table that you work at in an office
an arrangement of facts and numbers in rows or blocks, especially in printed material

a 
multiplication table

phrases.trans_en: to put a cloth, knives, and forks, etc. on the table in preparation for a meal

examples.ch: 你来摆下餐桌准备吃午饭好吗？
examples.en: Could you set the table for lunch, please?

phrases.trans_en: a list of the information that is contained in a book

defines.trans_en: to suggest something for discussion

examples.ch: 该项提案的修正案是詹姆斯夫人提交讨论的。
examples.en: An amendment to the proposal was tabled by Mrs James.

defines.trans_en: to delay discussion of a subject

examples.ch: 这一提议被留待日后讨论。
examples.en: The suggestion was tabled for discussion at a later date.

defines.trans_en: a game that is played on a large table where two or four players hit a ball over a low net using small, round bats
to remove something, especially without permission

examples.ch: 丢了什么东西吗？
examples.en: Has anything been taken (= stolen)?

examples.ch: 你的笔在这里，我拿错了。
examples.en: Here's your pen - I took it by mistake.

examples.ch: 她所有的财产都被剥夺了。
examples.en: All her possessions had been taken from her.

defines.trans_en: to subtract a number (= remove it from another number)

examples.en: If you take 4 (away) from 12 you get 8.

defines.trans_en: to move something or someone from one place to another

examples.ch: 天气预报说有雨，所以外出时记得带伞。
examples.en: The weather forecast said rain, so take your umbrella (with you) when you go out.

examples.ch: 由于疏忽，手提箱被带到了马德里。
examples.en: The suitcases were taken to San Antonio by mistake.

examples.ch: 把书拿到图书馆的3层。
examples.en: Take the book up/down to the third floor of the library.

examples.ch: 我建议他给她带些巧克力。
examples.en: I suggested that he should take her some chocolates/take some chocolates to her (= bring them to her as a present).

defines.trans_en: to accept or have

examples.ch: 他们这儿可以刷信用卡吗？
examples.en: Do they take credit cards here?

examples.ch: 你茶里要放牛奶吗？
examples.en: Do you take milk in your coffee?

examples.ch: 这种容器容量为6升。
examples.en: This container will take (= has room for) six litres.

examples.ch: 你常买哪种报纸？
examples.en: Which newspaper do you take (= regularly buy)?

examples.ch: 他不断地辱骂她，而她只是坐在那里默默忍受。
examples.en: He continually abuses her, and she just sits there and takes it.

examples.ch: 如果你认为我会甘心忍受一切，那你就大错特错了。
examples.en: If you think I'm going to take that lying down (= accept it without complaining), you're very much mistaken.

examples.ch: 我接受你的辩解，可我还是认为你原本就不应该去。
examples.en: I take the/your point (= accept the argument), but I still don't think you should have gone.

defines.trans_en: used when you want to mention something as a particular example of what you are talking about

examples.ch: 我最近忙得不亦乐乎。就拿上星期来说，除了星期五，我每天晚上下班以后都要开会。
examples.en: I've been very busy recently. Take last week, I had meetings every night after work, except Friday.

defines.trans_en: to move in order to hold something in the hand(s)

examples.ch: 我开门的时候你帮我拿一下包，好吗？
examples.en: Can you take this bag while I open the door?

examples.ch: 他拉住我的手臂，领我到门外。
examples.en: He took my arm and led me outside.

examples.ch: 拿一个鸡蛋打在碗里。
examples.en: Take an egg and break it into the bowl.

examples.ch: 他抓住植物的根部往上拔。
examples.en: He took hold of the plant's root and pulled.

defines.trans_en: to go somewhere with someone, often paying for that person or being responsible for them

examples.ch: 星期六我们要带孩子们去动物园。
examples.en: We're taking the kids to the zoo on Saturday.

examples.ch: 我带着年迈的父母看了一些新盖的房子。
examples.en: I took my elderly parents to look at some new houses.

examples.ch: 你明天带我去游泳好吗？
examples.en: Will you take me swimming tomorrow?

defines.trans_en: to show someone how to get to somewhere by going there with them

examples.ch: 我带你去你的房间吧。
examples.en: Let me take you to your room.

defines.trans_en: to go to a social event with someone

examples.ch: 谁带你去参加舞会？
examples.en: Who's taking you to the dance?

defines.trans_en: to travel somewhere by using a particular form of transport or a particular vehicle, route, etc.

examples.ch: 我总是乘火车——乘火车比开车省事。
examples.en: I always take the train - it's less hassle than a car.

examples.ch: 她乘10点半的飞机去了爱丁堡。
examples.en: She took the 10.30 flight to Edinburgh.

examples.ch: 走左边的路就能到邮局。
examples.en: If you take the road on the left, you'll come to the post office.

defines.trans_en: to need

examples.ch: 跳伞需要很大的勇气。
examples.en: Parachuting takes a lot of nerve.

examples.ch: 及物动词带直接宾语。
examples.en: Transitive verbs take a direct object.

examples.ch: 他的故事令人难以置信。
examples.en: His story took some believing (= was difficult to believe).

defines.trans_ch: 穿（特定尺寸的衣服或鞋）
defines.trans_en: to wear a particular size of clothes or shoes

examples.ch: 你穿多大的鞋？
examples.en: What size shoes do you take?

defines.trans_en: If something takes a particular time, that period is needed in order to complete it.

examples.ch: 烹饪过程只需10分钟。
examples.en: The cooking process only takes ten minutes.

examples.ch: 这种油漆要多久才能干？
examples.en: How long does this paint take to dry?

examples.ch: 我们开车回家花了一整天的时间。
examples.en: It took us all day to drive home.

defines.trans_en: to measure something

examples.ch: 护士测了我的体温和血压。
examples.en: Nurses took my temperature and blood pressure.

defines.trans_en: to swallow or use a medicine or drug, especially in a regular way

examples.ch: 这种药每天服3次。
examples.en: Take this medicine three times a day.

examples.ch: 你认为她吸毒吗？
examples.en: Do you think she takes drugs?

defines.trans_en: to do or perform

examples.ch: 谢莉在大学里读经济学。
examples.en: Shelley is taking (= studying) economics at university.

examples.ch: 大主教为我们主持了感恩祈祷仪式。
examples.en: The Archbishop took our service of thanksgiving.

examples.ch: 马歇尔先生教我们物理。
examples.en: Mr Marshall takes us for (= teaches us) physics.

defines.trans_ch: （后接名词形成动宾结构词组，其意思相当于相应动词）
defines.trans_en: used with many nouns to make a verb phrase that is equal in meaning to the related verb

examples.ch: 我想我们将在那儿休息一会儿。
examples.en: I think we'll take a break (= we'll stop for a break) there.

examples.ch: 如果累了，你就应该休息一下。
examples.en: If you're tired you should take a rest (= you should rest).

examples.ch: 午饭后我总喜欢散散步。
examples.en: I always like to take a walk (= to walk) after lunch.

defines.trans_ch: （以某一种特殊方式）思考，考虑
defines.trans_en: to think about something or someone in a particular way

examples.ch: 我们对炸弹恐吓事件非常重视。
examples.en: We're taking the bomb threats very seriously.

defines.trans_en: to understand something in a particular way

examples.ch: 我不过是逗逗他，但他却领会错了。
examples.en: I was just teasing him, but he took it the wrong way.

examples.ch: 我不知道应该把这当作是恭维呢还是羞辱。
examples.en: I'm not sure whether to take that as a compliment or an insult.

examples.ch: 她点了一下头，我们认为这就是说她同意了。
examples.en: She gave a nod, which we took to mean that she agreed.

defines.trans_en: to have or come to have a particular feeling or opinion

examples.ch: 他对孩子们一点也不关心。
examples.en: He doesn't take any interest in his children.

examples.ch: 不要理会照相机。
examples.en: Don't take any notice of the cameras.

examples.ch: 她很容易生气。
examples.en: She takes offence too easily.

examples.ch: 他们可怜那只流浪猫，就给了它些吃的。
examples.en: They took pity on the stray cat and fed it.

examples.ch: 我认为应该对燃料课以重税，以减少公路上的车辆。
examples.en: I take the view that fuel should be heavily taxed to reduce road use.

defines.trans_en: to receive money from sales or as payment for entrance to an event

examples.ch: 这场演出第一个星期的收入就高达10万美元。
examples.en: The show took an astonishing $100,000 in its first week.

defines.trans_en: to get possession of something or someone

examples.ch: 叛乱者伏击了火车，俘虏了一些人。
examples.en: Rebels ambushed the train and took several prisoners.

examples.ch: 自由党只需再获得200票，就可以从工党手中夺过该席位。
examples.en: The Liberals need just 200 more votes to take the seat from Labour.

examples.ch: 在赢得这些席位之后，民主党从共和党手中把议会控制权夺了回来。
examples.en: With these wins, the Democrats have now taken the House back from the Republicans.

examples.ch: 中间偏左的党派看来很可能要掌权。
examples.en: Centre-left parties look set to take power.

examples.ch: 亚当，我想现在让你来操控飞机。
examples.en: Adam, I'd like you to take control of the aircraft now.

defines.trans_en: to write

examples.ch: 我希望你们都在记笔记。
examples.en: I hope you're all taking notes.

defines.trans_en: to work or perform as expected

examples.ch: 这些新植物长得不好——它们不适应这种干燥的土壤。
examples.en: These new plants haven't taken - they don't like this dry soil.

phrases.trans_en: If you take someone or something to be something, or if you take someone or something for something, you accept or believe that they are that thing.

examples.ch: 这些生物通常被认为是从原始鱼类演变而来的。
examples.en: These creatures are generally taken to be descended from primitive fishes.

examples.ch: 我差点把他当成了你的兄弟。
examples.en: I could have taken him for (= believed that he was) your brother.

examples.ch: 我不会帮你伪造他的签名的！你把我当成什么人了？
examples.en: I'm not going to forge his signature for you! What do you take me for? (= You should not believe I could do a thing like that.)

phrases.trans_en: to not be able to deal with an unpleasant situation

examples.ch: 我再也无法忍受。我要走了。
examples.en: I can't take it any more. I'm leaving.

phrases.trans_ch: 接不接受由你，要不要随你的便
phrases.trans_en: accept or refuse the offer completely

examples.ch: 那是我最后的报价了——接不接受由你。
examples.en: That's my final offer - you can take it or leave it.

phrases.trans_en: to act or happen over a short period of time

examples.ch: 我只是去商店买点东西——不会花太长时间的。
examples.en: I'm just going to the shops - I won't take long.

phrases.trans_en: to need a long time

examples.ch: 骨折总是要很长时间才能痊愈。
examples.en: Broken bones always take time to heal.

phrases.trans_en: to surprise someone

examples.ch: 突然闹出那么大动静吓了她一跳。
examples.en: The sudden noise took her by surprise.

defines.trans_en: money that is received from sales or as payment for entrance to an event

examples.ch: 这次新演出的票房收入很可观。
examples.en: The box office take was huge for the new show.

defines.trans_en: the filming of a scene (= small part of a film)

examples.ch: 电影里的这个镜头我们拍了10次才感到满意。
examples.en: This scene needed ten takes before we felt it was right.

phrases.trans_en: an opinion about something

examples.ch: 我们很想听听您对这个问题的看法。
examples.en: We'd love to hear your take on this issue.

defines.trans_en: to say words aloud; to speak to someone

examples.ch: 我们刚才在谈论加雷斯的新女友。
examples.en: We were just talking about Gareth's new girlfriend.

examples.ch: 我的小女儿刚开始说话。
examples.en: My little girl has just started to talk.

examples.ch: 她每周都跟母亲通电话。
examples.en: She talks to her mother on the phone every week.

defines.trans_ch: （为了寻求解决分歧的途径而）与…会谈
defines.trans_en: to discuss something with someone, often to try to find a solution to a disagreement

examples.ch: 双方同意会谈。
examples.en: The two sides have agreed to talk.

defines.trans_en: to give a lecture on a subject

examples.ch: 下一位讲者将就濒危昆虫作报告。
examples.en: The next speaker will be talking about endangered insects.

phrases.trans_en: to discuss a particular subject

examples.ch: 他们一到一起就谈论政治。
examples.en: Whenever they're together, they talk politics.

defines.trans_en: a conversation between two people, often about a particular subject

examples.ch: 我叫他跟他母亲谈谈他的计划。
examples.en: I asked him to have a talk with his mother about his plan.

defines.trans_en: a speech given to a group of people to teach or tell them about a particular subject

examples.ch: 他就他的马来西亚之行办了一个讲座。
examples.en: He gave a talk about/on his visit to Malaysia.

defines.trans_en: the action of talking about what might happen or be true, or the subject people are talking about

examples.ch: 闲谈对我们毫无益处。
examples.en: Talk won't get us anywhere.

examples.ch: 那次谈话／她所说的全都是关于婚礼的事。
examples.en: The talk/Her talk was all about the wedding.

phrases.trans_en: serious and formal discussions on an important subject, usually intended to produce decisions or agreements

examples.ch: 有关燃料危机的会谈在马德里召开。
examples.en: Talks were held in Madrid about the fuel crisis.

defines.trans_en: of more than average height, or of a particular height

examples.ch: 高个子女孩
examples.en: a tall girl

examples.ch: 高层建筑
examples.en: a tall building

examples.ch: 他身高6英尺。
examples.en: He's six feet tall.

examples.ch: 她比我高得多。
examples.en: She's much taller than me.

defines.trans_en: a car with a driver who you pay to take you somewhere

examples.ch: 我从车站乘出租车去了旅馆。
examples.en: I took a taxi from the station to the hotel.

examples.ch: 出租车司机
examples.en: a taxi driver

defines.trans_en: (of an aircraft) to move slowly on the ground
(a drink made by pouring hot water onto) dried and cut leaves and sometimes flowers, especially the leaves of the tea plant

examples.ch: 中国／印度茶
examples.en: China/Indian tea

examples.ch: 冰茶／柠檬茶
examples.en: iced/lemon tea

examples.ch: 多种花草茶
examples.en: a selection of herbal teas

examples.ch: 女招待给我们送来了两杯热气腾腾的茶。
examples.en: The waitress brought us two steaming cups of tea.

examples.ch: “要我把茶倒上吗？”“不用，再泡一会儿。”
examples.en: "Shall I pour the tea?" "No, let it brew (= get stronger) a while."

examples.ch: 你喜欢喝什么样的茶——浓的还是淡的？
examples.en: How do you like your tea - strong or weak?

examples.ch: 我们坐在树阴下，边品茶边吃烤饼。
examples.en: We sat in the shade of a tree, sipping tea and eating scones.

examples.ch: 我不怎么喝茶。
examples.en: I'm not much of a tea drinker.

examples.ch: 11点钟会提供茶点。
examples.en: Tea and biscuits will be provided at eleven o'clock.

examples.ch: 来杯好茶怎么样？喝完了你会感觉好些的。
examples.en: How about a nice cup of tea? That'll make you feel better.

defines.trans_en: a cup of tea

examples.ch: 请来两杯茶。
examples.en: Two teas, please.

defines.trans_en: a small meal eaten in the late afternoon, usually including cake and a cup of tea
a meal that is eaten in the early evening and is usually cooked
to give someone knowledge or to train someone; to instruct

examples.ch: 她给外国学生讲授英语。
examples.en: She taught English to foreign students.

examples.ch: 谁教你做饭的？
examples.en: Who taught you to cook?

phrases.trans_en: to be a teacher in a school

examples.ch: 我们搬去了一个小镇，妈妈在学校教书，爸爸在一家地产公司工作。
examples.en: We moved to a small town where my mother taught school and my father worked in real estate.

defines.trans_en: a number of people or animals who do something together as a group

examples.ch: 篮球队／曲棍球队／无挡板篮球队
examples.en: a basketball/hockey/netball team

examples.ch: 调查组
examples.en: a team of investigators

examples.ch: 英国代表队
examples.en: Team GB (= the athletes representing Great Britain in a sport)

defines.trans_en: used in a number of phrases that refer to people working together as a group in order to achieve something

examples.ch: 这完全是集体努力的结果——每个人都为这个项目的成功作出了贡献。
examples.en: It was a real team effort - everyone contributed something to the success of the project.

defines.trans_ch: 支持某人或某观点的一群人
defines.trans_en: used to refer to a group of people who support a particular person or a particular point of view

examples.ch: 在这个讨论中，我们支持玛丽莎。
examples.en: In this discussion, we're on Team Marisa.

defines.trans_en: to act together to achieve something

examples.ch: 郎和德瑞普组成团队开发疫苗。
examples.en: Lang teamed with Draper to develop the vaccine.

defines.trans_en: a young person between 13 and 19 years old

examples.ch: 这份杂志的读者对象是青少年和二十来岁的年轻人。
examples.en: The magazine is aimed at teenagers and young adults.

defines.trans_en:
a 
phone
to use a phone

defines.trans_ch: 电视机;电视;电视广播业
defines.trans_en: a device shaped like a box with a screen that receives electrical signals and changes them into moving images and sound, or the method or business of sending images and sound by electrical signals

examples.ch: 3D／高清电视
examples.en: a 3D/an HD television

examples.ch: 你把电视声音调小点好吗？
examples.en: Could you turn the television down?

examples.ch: 这是我一直坚持看的少数几个电视节目之一。
examples.en: It's one of the few television programmes that I still watch.

examples.ch: 今晚有什么好看的电视节目吗？
examples.en: Is there anything good on television tonight?

examples.ch: 克莱尔大学毕业后一直在电视业界工作。
examples.en: Clare has worked in television since she left college.

examples.ch: 你的问题在于电视看得太多。
examples.en: Your problem is that you watch too much television.

defines.trans_en: to say something to someone, often giving them information or instructions

examples.ch: 那么跟我说说你的假期吧。
examples.en: Tell me about your holiday then.

examples.ch: 请问去图书馆怎么走？
examples.en: Can you tell me how to get to the library?

examples.ch: 你有没有跟任何人说起要来看我？
examples.en: Did you tell anyone (that) you were coming to see me?

examples.ch: “我要离开你，”她跟他说。
examples.en: "I'm leaving you," she told him.

examples.ch: 我叫她回家。
examples.en: I told her to go home.

examples.ch: 他给我们讲述了他不寻常的童年。
examples.en: He told us of his extraordinary childhood.

examples.ch: 我对你的帮助感激不尽。
examples.en: I can't tell you how grateful I am for your help (= I am extremely grateful).

defines.trans_en: to know, recognize, or be certain

examples.ch: “他是荷兰人。”“你怎么知道？”
examples.en: "He's Dutch." "How can you tell?"

examples.ch: 我看得出你当时很不高兴。
examples.en: I could tell (that) you were unhappy.

defines.trans_en: If something tells you something, it gives you information.

examples.ch: 这次调查给我们提供了有关青少年生活的什么信息？
examples.en: What does the survey tell us about the lives of teenagers?

defines.trans_en: to have an effect

examples.ch: 她最近压力很大，而且这已经开始让她吃不消了。
examples.en: She's been under a lot of stress recently and it's starting to tell.

phrases.trans_en: to say something/things that are not true

examples.ch: 她老是说谎。
examples.en: She's always telling lies.

phrases.trans_en: to tell the facts without hiding anything
If someone, usually a child, tells tales, they tell someone such as a teacher about something bad that someone else has done.

examples.ch: 阿尔文，如果你老是打小报告，你的同学会不信任你的。
examples.en: Your classmates won't trust you if you're always telling tales, Alvin.

phrases.trans_en: to speak honestly

examples.ch: 你怎么知道她讲的是实话？
examples.en: How do you know she's telling the truth?

phrases.trans_en: to be honest

examples.ch: 说实话，他说的我一点儿也听不懂。
examples.en: To tell (you) the truth, I didn't understand a word of what he was saying.

phrases.trans_en: to notice a difference in quality between two things

examples.ch: 这种咖啡的价格差不多是那种的一半，而你根本分辨不出它们有什么不同。
examples.en: This coffee is about half the price of that one and yet you really can't tell the difference.

phrases.trans_en: to say what will happen in someone's future

examples.ch: 集市上有一个算命的女人。
examples.en: At the fair, there was a lady who told your fortune.

phrases.trans_en: to be able to understand a clock

examples.ch: 我女儿刚刚学会看时间。
examples.en: My daughter has just learned to tell the time.

phrases.trans_en: there is no way of knowing

examples.ch: 不知道他们的未来会怎么样。
examples.en: There is no telling what the future will hold for them.

phrases.trans_en: said to mean that you can never know or be certain

examples.ch: 谁知道彼得和我将来会怎么样呢——谁也无法预料。
examples.en: Who knows what will happen to Peter and me in the future - you can never tell.

defines.trans_en: the measured amount of heat in a place or in the body

examples.ch: 把炉子预热到200摄氏度。
examples.en: Preheat the oven to a temperature of 200 degrees Celsius.

examples.ch: 最近几天气温突然上升了。
examples.en: Temperatures have risen over the past few days (= the weather has become warmer).

examples.ch: 医生给他做了检查，并量了他的体温。
examples.en: The doctor examined him and took his temperature (= measured it).

defines.trans_en: If you say that the temperature in a particular situation is rising, you mean that it is likely to become violent because people have become angry.

examples.ch: 由于讨论双方各执一词，气氛开始变得紧张起来。
examples.en: The temperature of the discussion started to rise as each side added its own arguments.

phrases.trans_en: to have a higher body temperature than normal and to be ill

defines.trans_en: a game played between two or four people on a special playing area that involves hitting a small ball across a central net using a racket
a shelter made of canvas or a similar material and supported by poles and ropes, that you can fold up and carry with you
the fixed period of time that something lasts for

examples.ch: 他因酒后开车而短期入狱。
examples.en: He served a short term for drunk driving.

examples.ch: 他因诈骗几千人的积蓄而被判入狱150年。
examples.en: He was sentenced to a 150-year prison term for cheating thousands of ordinary people out of their savings.

examples.ch: 这届政府的任期年底届满。
examples.en: The government's term of office (= the period in which they have power) expires at the end of the year.

defines.trans_en: one of the periods into which a year is divided at school, college, or university

examples.ch: 在英国，春季学期从一月份开始，到复活节前夕结束。
examples.en: In Britain, the spring term starts in January and ends just before Easter.

examples.ch: 我们的大学有三个学期，我们称之为三学期制。
examples.en: Our college has three terms that we call trimesters.

examples.ch: 学期里我们很忙。
examples.en: We're very busy in term-time (= during the term).

defines.trans_en: the period of time that a legal agreement lasts for

examples.ch: 我们房子的租赁期快满了。
examples.en: The lease on our house is near the end of its term.

defines.trans_en: the end of a pregnancy when a baby is expected to be born

examples.ch: 她上次怀孕是足月生的。
examples.en: Her last pregnancy went to term (= the baby was born after the expected number of weeks).

examples.ch: 足月妊娠
examples.en: a full-term pregnancy

defines.trans_en: a word or expression used in relation to a particular subject, often to describe something official or technical

examples.ch: “毫无阻碍地”是法律用语，意思为“自由地”。
examples.en: "Without let or hindrance" is a legal term that means "freely".

phrases.trans_en: for a long, medium, or short period of time in the future

examples.ch: 这一决定短期来说我们的代价会较大，但从长期看是有益处的。
examples.en: This decision will cost us more in the short term, but will be beneficial in the long term.

phrases.trans_en: an unkind or unpleasant name to call someone
a kind or friendly name to call someone

phrases.trans_ch: 在…方面;从…方面来说;根据…来看
phrases.trans_en: used to describe which particular area of a subject you are discussing

examples.ch: 从经济方面来说，这个项目并不成功。
examples.en: In financial terms, the project was not a success.

examples.ch: 就挣钱而言，我上一份工作挣得更多。
examples.en: In terms of money, I was better off in my last job.

phrases.trans_ch: 毫不含糊地，直截了当地
phrases.trans_en: in a very clear way

examples.ch: 她直截了当地告诉了他自己对他的行为有何看法。
examples.en: She told him what she thought of his behaviour in no uncertain terms (= she made her disapproval very clear).

phrases.trans_en: using language that clearly shows your feelings

examples.ch: 他以极其强烈的措词表达了自己的不满。
examples.en: He complained in the strongest terms.

examples.ch: 谈到他的成就，她赞不绝口。
examples.en: She spoke of his achievements in glowing terms (= in a very approving way).

phrases.trans_en: the conditions that control an agreement, arrangement, or activity

examples.ch: 雇佣条款
examples.en: terms of employment

examples.ch: 根据合同条款，雇员离职必须提前3个月通知公司。
examples.en: Under the terms of their contract, employees must give three months' notice if they leave.

phrases.trans_en: If you buy something on easy terms, you pay for it over a period of time.
having the same rights, treatment, etc.

examples.ch: 所有公司将平等竞争政府的合同。
examples.en: All companies will compete for the government contract on equal terms.

phrases.trans_en: the matters to which a study or report is limited

defines.trans_en: to give something a name or to describe it with a particular expression

examples.ch: 严格地说，肩高低于1.5米的马称为矮种马。
examples.en: Technically, a horse that is smaller than 1.5 metres at the shoulder is termed a pony.

phrases.trans_en: lasting a long/medium/short time

examples.ch: 这个项目将带来长期的好处。
examples.en: The project will have long-term benefits.

defines.trans_ch: 糟糕的;可怕的;严重的;低劣的
defines.trans_en: very unpleasant or serious or of low quality

examples.ch: 天气糟透了。
examples.en: The weather was terrible.

examples.ch: 我们刚刚收到一些可怕的消息。
examples.en: We have just received some terrible news.

defines.trans_en: very bad at doing something

examples.ch: 你真不擅长说谎。
examples.en: You're a terrible liar.

examples.ch: 我不擅长滑雪／游泳／跳舞。
examples.en: I'm a terrible skier/swimmer/dancer.

defines.trans_ch: 极度的;厉害的;剧烈的;非常严重的
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize the great degree of something

examples.ch: 这个项目完全是在浪费钱财。
examples.en: This project is a terrible waste of money.

examples.ch: 她是个极讨厌的人。
examples.en: She's a terrible nuisance.

defines.trans_en: a way of discovering, by questions or practical activities, what someone knows, or what someone or something can do or is like

examples.ch: 今天班里有一个拼写测验。
examples.en: The class are doing/having a spelling test today.

examples.ch: 她先接受了能力测试后才得到这份工作。
examples.en: She had to take/do an aptitude test before she got the job.

defines.trans_en: a medical examination of part of your body in order to find out how healthy it is or what is happening with it

examples.ch: 验血／尿检
examples.en: a blood/urine test

examples.ch: 视力检查
examples.en: an eye test

examples.ch: 妊娠检查
examples.en: a pregnancy test

examples.ch: 医生做了一些检查，想查出她的问题出在哪儿。
examples.en: The doctors have done some tests to try and find out what's wrong with her.

defines.trans_en: an act of using something to find out if it is working correctly or how effective it is

examples.ch: 新导弹目前正在进行试验。
examples.en: The new missiles are currently undergoing tests.

defines.trans_en: a situation that shows how good something is

examples.ch: 在那条结了冰的路上驾车是对我驾驶技术的一次真正考验。
examples.en: Driving on that icy road was a real test of my skill.

defines.trans_ch: （板球，橄榄球等的）国际锦标赛（同 test match）
defines.trans_en:
a 
test match

examples.ch: 澳大利亚以197分赢得了这次锦标赛。
examples.en: Australia won the test by 197 runs.

defines.trans_en: to do something in order to discover if something is safe, works correctly, etc., or if something is present

examples.ch: 生产厂家目前正在试验这种新的引擎。
examples.en: The manufacturers are currently testing the new engine.

examples.ch: 他们验了她的血，看是否有感染的迹象。
examples.en: They tested her blood for signs of the infection.

defines.trans_en: to give someone a set of questions, in order to measure their knowledge or ability

examples.ch: 你要考一考我一直在学的化学吗？
examples.en: Will you test me on the chemistry I've been learning?

defines.trans_en: If a situation tests someone, it proves how good, strong, etc. they are.

examples.ch: 那个讲座简直是在考验我的忍耐力，实在太枯燥了。
examples.en: That lecture really tested my powers of endurance, it was so boring.

defines.trans_en: to do a medical examination of part of someone's body or of a particular physical ability

defines.trans_ch: （书、杂志等中区别于图片的）正文，文字材料
defines.trans_en: the written words in a book, magazine, etc., not the pictures

examples.ch: 这本书正文有500页。
examples.en: The book has 500 pages of text.

defines.trans_ch: （移动电话或传呼机发送的）短消息，短信（同 text message）
defines.trans_en:
a 
text message

examples.ch: 我一得到任何消息，就立刻给你发短信。
examples.en: I'll send you a text as soon as I have any news.

defines.trans_ch: （学习某课程必读的）课本，教科书，书目
defines.trans_en: a book or piece of writing that you study as part of a course

examples.ch: 《尤利西斯》为考试指定的必读书。
examples.en: "Ulysses" is a set text for the exam.

defines.trans_ch: （教堂神父诵读或引用的）《圣经》经文
defines.trans_en: a sentence or piece of writing from the Bible that a priest or minister reads aloud in church and talks about

phrases.trans_en: the exact words of a speech, etc.

examples.ch: 我们能在周二前看到你演讲的全文吗？
examples.en: Can we see the full text of your speech before Tuesday?

defines.trans_en: to send someone a text message by phone

examples.ch: 我给她发了短信，和她约好见面时间。
examples.en: I texted her to arrange a time to meet.

defines.trans_en: used to join two parts of a comparison

examples.ch: 我的儿子比女儿高得多。
examples.en: My son is a lot taller than my daughter.

examples.ch: 你总是走得比我快！
examples.en: You always walk faster than I do!

examples.ch: 你比平时早。
examples.en: You're earlier than usual.

defines.trans_ch: （与 more 或 less 连用，比较数量）
defines.trans_en: used with "more" or "less" to compare numbers or amounts

examples.ch: 我花的比我原打算的要多。
examples.en: I spent more than I intended to.

examples.ch: 它比我预计的便宜。
examples.en: It cost less than I expected.

defines.trans_en: to express to someone that you are pleased about or are grateful for something that they have done

examples.ch: 他感谢我送他回家。
examples.en: He thanked me for taking him home.

defines.trans_ch: （用于名词前，指听者或读者已知的事物或人，尤指已提到的或能被领会的事物或人）
defines.trans_en: used before nouns to refer to particular things or people that have already been talked about or are already known or that are in a situation where it is clear what is happening

examples.ch: 我刚买了一件新衬衫和几双新鞋。衬衫很贵，但鞋子不贵。
examples.en: I just bought a new shirt and some new shoes. The shirt was pretty expensive, but the shoes weren't.

examples.ch: 请你把盐递给我。
examples.en: Please would you pass the salt.

examples.ch: 我会开车到机场接你。
examples.en: I'll pick you up at the airport.

defines.trans_ch: （用于某些名词前，表示泛指一类地方）
defines.trans_en: used before some nouns that refer to place when you want to mention that type of place, without showing exactly which example of the place you mean

examples.ch: 我们在海滩上呆了一整天。
examples.en: We spent all day at the beach.

examples.ch: 我们今晚去看电影吧。
examples.en: Let's go to the movies this evening.

examples.ch: 我得去银行兑换些欧元。
examples.en: I have to go to the bank and get some Euros.

defines.trans_ch: （用在带有限制性定语的名词短语前）
defines.trans_en: used before noun phrases in which the range of meaning of the noun is limited in some way

examples.ch: 我真的很喜欢我刚读完的那本书。
examples.en: I really enjoyed the book I've just finished reading.

examples.ch: 你喜欢你们班的其他同学吗？
examples.en: Do you like the other kids in your class?

defines.trans_en: used to refer to things or people when only one exists at any one time

examples.ch: 未来会发生什么事？
examples.en: What will happen in the future?

examples.ch: 大学毕业后，我想环游世界。
examples.en: After I leave college, I want to travel around the world.

examples.ch: 他们住在西班牙北部。
examples.en: They live in the north of Spain.

examples.ch: 埃德‧科克做了多年的纽约市长。
examples.en: Ed Koch was for many years the mayor of New York.

examples.ch: 我们到巴黎时去了埃菲尔铁塔。
examples.en: When we went to Paris, we went up the Eiffel Tower.

defines.trans_ch: （用于形容词或副词最高级及表示排名的词前）
defines.trans_en: used before superlatives and other words, such as "first" or "only" or numbers showing something's position in a list, to refer to only one thing or person

examples.ch: 那是我看过的最好的电影之一。
examples.en: That was one of the best films I've ever seen.

examples.ch: 亚洲最高的山是哪一座？
examples.en: What's the highest mountain in Asia?

examples.ch: 我永远也忘不了我们第一次见面的情形。
examples.en: I will never forget the first time we met.

examples.ch: 你是第5个问我那个问题的人。
examples.en: You're the fifth person to ask me that question.

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示“最…的”，此时 the 应重读）
defines.trans_en: used to say that the particular person or thing being mentioned is the best, most famous, etc. In this use, "the" is usually given strong pronunciation

examples.ch: 哈里酒吧是最值得一去的。
examples.en: Harry's Bar is the place to go.

examples.ch: 你不是说你见到了威尔‧史密斯本人吧？
examples.en: You don't mean you met the Will Smith (= the film star), do you?

defines.trans_ch: （用在形容词前，指特定的人或事物）
defines.trans_en: used before some adjectives to turn the adjectives into nouns that refer to one particular person or thing described by the adjective

examples.ch: 看来死者没有健在的亲属。
examples.en: It seems that the deceased (= this particular dead person) had no living relatives.

examples.ch: 看来我们只好坐等那不可避免的事情发生。
examples.en: I suppose we'll just have to wait for the inevitable (= the particular thing that is certain to happen).

defines.trans_ch: （用在形容词前构成名词，泛指一类人或事物）
defines.trans_en: used before some adjectives to turn the adjectives into nouns that refer to people or things in general that can be described by the adjective

examples.ch: 她住在养老院。
examples.en: She lives in a special home for the elderly.

examples.ch: 1815年法军在滑铁卢被击败。
examples.en: The French were defeated at Waterloo in 1815.

defines.trans_ch: （用在单数名词前，指该类事物或人）
defines.trans_en: used before a singular noun to refer to all the things or people represented by that noun

examples.ch: 熊猫这种动物数量越来越稀少了。
examples.en: The panda is becoming an increasingly rare animal.

examples.ch: 汽车对我们的环境造成了严重破坏。
examples.en: The car is responsible for causing a lot of damage to our environment.

defines.trans_ch: （用在姓氏前表示某夫妇或一家人）
defines.trans_en: used before a family name to refer to two people who are married or to a whole family

examples.ch: 杰克逊一家周六要来看我们。
examples.en: The Jacksons are coming to visit on Saturday.

defines.trans_ch: （用在乐器或舞蹈的名称前表泛指）
defines.trans_en: used before some nouns referring to musical instruments or dances to mean the type of instrument or dance in general

examples.ch: 尼科在学弹钢琴。
examples.en: Nico is learning to play the piano.

examples.ch: 你会跳华尔兹吗？
examples.en: Can you do the waltz?

defines.trans_ch: （用在名词前表示与名词有关的活动）
defines.trans_en: used before a noun to represent the activity connected with that noun

examples.ch: 我下周要接受外科手术。
examples.en: I'm going under the knife (= having a medical operation) next week.

examples.ch: 连续驾车3个多小时不是个好主意。
examples.en: It's not a good idea to spend more than three hours at the wheel (= driving a vehicle) without a break.

defines.trans_en: used before numbers that refer to periods of ten years

examples.ch: 60年代
examples.en: the 60s

defines.trans_ch: （用在两个形容词或副词比较级前，表示“越…越…”）
defines.trans_en: used before each of two comparative adjectives or adverbs when you want to show how one amount gets bigger or smaller in relation to the other

examples.ch: 我越快完成这项工作，就能越早回家。
examples.en: The sooner I get this piece of work done, the sooner I can go home.

defines.trans_ch: （用在形容词或副词比较级前，表示某人或事物的特定状态的变化）
defines.trans_en: used before comparative adjectives or adverbs when you want to show that someone or something has become more or less of a particular state

examples.ch: 她看来丝毫没有因为悲惨的经历而沮丧。
examples.en: She doesn't seem to be any the worse for her bad experience.

defines.trans_en: used for emphasis when you are expressing a strong opinion about someone or something

examples.ch: 安德烈有了新工作，这个幸运的家伙。
examples.en: André's got a new job, the lucky devil.

defines.trans_en: used instead of a possessive adjective such as your, her, or my

examples.ch: 他抓着女儿的胳膊。
examples.en: He held his daughter by the arm (= her arm).

examples.ch: 我不记得把车停在哪儿了。
examples.en: I can't remember where I parked the (= my) car.

defines.trans_en: enough

examples.ch: 我倒是想今晚出去玩，但又觉得自己没那个精力。
examples.en: I'd like to go out tonight, but I don't think I have the energy.

examples.ch: 我现在没有时间和你谈话。
examples.en: I don't have the time to talk to you now.

defines.trans_en: each; every

examples.ch: 这辆车每加仑汽油能跑30英里。
examples.en: It does 30 miles to the gallon.

defines.trans_en: a building, room, or outside structure with rows of seats, each row usually higher than the one in front, from which people can watch a performance or other activity

examples.ch: 兰心剧院
examples.en: the Lyceum Theatre

examples.ch: 报告厅
examples.en: a lecture theatre

defines.trans_en:
→ 
operating theatre UK
(the writing or performance of) plays, opera, etc., written to be performed in public

examples.ch: 观众和戏剧评论家都很喜欢他最新的剧作。
examples.en: His latest play has delighted theatre audiences and theatre critics alike.

examples.ch: 她从事戏剧事业。
examples.en: She made her career in the theatre.

defines.trans_en: behaviour that is not sincere and is intended just to produce a particular effect or to attract attention

examples.ch: 她流眼泪纯粹是在做戏。
examples.en: Her tears were pure theatre.

defines.trans_en: an area or place in which important military events happen

examples.ch: 战场
examples.en: a theatre of war

defines.trans_en: of or belonging to them

examples.ch: 他把他们的外衣交给了他们。
examples.en: He gave them their coats.

defines.trans_ch: （用来指某个人，以代替 his 或 her）
defines.trans_en: used to refer to one person in order to avoid saying "his or her"

examples.ch: 有个学生遗忘了一本书。
examples.en: One of the students has left their book behind.

defines.trans_ch: 他们的，她们的，它们的（所有物）
defines.trans_en: the one(s) belonging to or connected with them

examples.ch: 那些孩子是他们的？
examples.en: Which children are theirs?

examples.ch: 我想她是他们的亲戚。
examples.en: I think she's a relation of theirs.

examples.ch: 他们的家是那栋屋外有棵大树的小屋。
examples.en: Theirs is that little house with the big tree outside.

defines.trans_en: used, usually as the object of a verb or preposition, to refer to people, things, animals, situations, or ideas that have already been mentioned

examples.ch: 我的钥匙丢了，到处都找不着。
examples.en: I've lost my keys. I can't find them anywhere.

examples.ch: 是他们，他们来了。
examples.en: It's them. They're here.

defines.trans_ch: ﹙用来指性别不详的人，以代替 him 或 her﹚
defines.trans_en: used to refer to one person whose sex is not known instead of saying "him" or "her"

examples.ch: 每位旅客到达后，我们请他们填表。
examples.en: When each passenger arrives, we ask them to fill in a form.

defines.trans_ch: （不规则用法，相当于 those）那些
defines.trans_en:
not standard for
those

examples.ch: 谁给你的那些小甜饼？
examples.en: Who gave you them cookies?

defines.trans_ch: （they 的反身形式）他们自己，她们自己，它们自己
defines.trans_en: used when the subject of the verb is "they" or a group of people, and the object is the same group of people

examples.ch: 他们在反省自己哪儿出错了。
examples.en: They asked themselves where they had gone wrong.

examples.ch: 孩子们在派对上开心吗？
examples.en: Did the children enjoy themselves at the party?

defines.trans_en: used for emphasis when the subject is "they"

examples.ch: 他们自己对于正在发生的事一无所知。
examples.en: They themselves had no knowledge of what was happening.

phrases.trans_en: alone or without help from anyone else

examples.ch: 年龄小的孩子不应该没人看管。
examples.en: Young children should not be left by themselves.

examples.ch: 他们完全靠他们自己收集的证据。
examples.en: They collected the evidence all by themselves .

phrases.trans_en: for their use only

examples.ch: 整个宿营地就只有他们自己。
examples.en: They had the whole campsite to themselves.

defines.trans_ch: 在当时（过去或未来）（的）;在那时（的）
defines.trans_en: (at) that time (in the past or in the future)

examples.ch: 那时我在城里工作。
examples.en: I was working in the city then.

examples.ch: 我希望住在城里，可我当时的丈夫想住在乡下。
examples.en: I wanted to live in the city, but my then husband (= the man who was my husband at that time) preferred the country.

examples.ch: 下周给我吧——我只有到那时才有时间看。
examples.en: Give it to me next week - I won't have time to read it before/until then.

examples.ch: 我明天会给你打电话——到那时我应该知道详情了。
examples.en: I'll call you tomorrow - I should have the details by then.

defines.trans_en: next or after that

examples.ch: 让我把这工作做完，我们再走。
examples.en: Let me finish this job, then we'll go.

examples.ch: 把那封信给她看，然后她就会明白了。
examples.en: Give her the letter to read, then she'll understand.

defines.trans_en: in addition

examples.ch: 这是普通版，另外还有价钱比较贵的豪华版。
examples.en: This is the standard model - then there's the deluxe version which costs more.

defines.trans_ch: 这么说来，那么，既然如此
defines.trans_en: as a result; in that case; also used as a way of joining a statement to an earlier piece of conversation

examples.ch: 现在休息一会儿，这样的话今晚你就不会那么累了。
examples.en: Have a rest now, and then you won't be so tired tonight.

examples.ch: 这么说你要卖掉你的房子？
examples.en: You'll be selling your house, then?

defines.trans_en: (to, at, or in) that place

examples.ch: 把椅子放在那儿。
examples.en: Put the chair there.

examples.ch: 博物馆今天关门了，我们明天再去。
examples.en: The museum is closed today. We'll go there tomorrow.

examples.ch: 你要找的那本书在那儿。
examples.en: There's that book you were looking for.

examples.ch: 我只好让你在那儿打住，我们已经没有时间了。
examples.en: I'll have to stop you there - we've run out of time.

examples.ch: 我把盒子放在那边了。
examples.en: I left the boxes over/out/under there.

defines.trans_ch: （用于引出句子，尤用于动词 be，seem 和 appear 前）
defines.trans_en: used to introduce the subject of a sentence, especially before the verbs be, seem, and appear

examples.ch: 有你的电话。
examples.en: There's someone on the phone for you.

examples.ch: 谁是最佳候选人毋庸置疑。
examples.en: There's no doubt who is the best candidate.

examples.ch: 我拿出钱包，发现一分钱都没有。
examples.en: I took out my wallet but there was no money in it.

examples.ch: 等我回来时，吃的都没有了。
examples.en: By the time I got back, there was no food left.

examples.ch: 看来要定下会议的日期有些困难。
examples.en: There appeared/seemed to be a problem with finding a date for the meeting.

examples.ch: 人命关天，我们可不能冒险。
examples.en: There's (= there are) lives at stake and we can't afford to take any risks.

defines.trans_en: used to begin some children's stories written in a traditional style

examples.ch: 从前有一个穷寡妇，她有个漂亮的女儿。
examples.en: There once was/lived a poor widow who had a beautiful daughter.

phrases.trans_en: to arrive somewhere

examples.ch: 我们绝对不可能及时赶到那里。
examples.en: We'll never get there in time.

phrases.trans_en: to succeed

examples.ch: 再试一次——最终你会成功的。
examples.en: Try again - you'll get there in the end.

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示同情或满足）你瞧，好啦
defines.trans_en: used to express sympathy or satisfaction

examples.ch: 你瞧，我终于把它弄好了。
examples.en: There, I've finally got it working.

defines.trans_en:
→ 
this
used as the subject of a verb to refer to people, animals, or things already mentioned or, more generally, to a group of people not clearly described

examples.ch: 我认识布朗一家已经很久了。他们都很友善。
examples.en: I've known the Browns for a long time. They're very nice people.

examples.ch: 我的眼镜哪儿去了？刚才还在桌子上。
examples.en: Where are my glasses? They were on the table a minute ago.

examples.ch: 他们说新的一年里情况会好转的。
examples.en: They (= people who know) say things will be better in the new year.

defines.trans_ch: （用于代替 he 或 she）他／她
defines.trans_en: used to avoid saying "he or she"

examples.ch: “有人给你打电话。”“他／她有什么事？”
examples.en: "There's someone on the phone for you." "What do they want?"

defines.trans_en: having a small distance between two opposite sides

examples.ch: 薄薄的书
examples.en: a thin book

examples.ch: 细黑线
examples.en: thin black lines

examples.ch: 薄夹克
examples.en: a thin jacket (= made from thin material)

defines.trans_en: (of the body) with little flesh on the bones

examples.ch: 你注意到她的手腕有多细了吗？
examples.en: Did you notice how thin her wrists were?

examples.ch: 瘦瘦的饿狗们在街上遛来遛去。
examples.en: Thin, hungry dogs roamed the streets.

defines.trans_en: not difficult to see through

examples.ch: 薄雾／云
examples.en: thin mist/cloud

defines.trans_en: having only a small number of people or a small amount of something

examples.ch: 到会者寥寥无几。
examples.en: Attendance at the meeting was rather thin.

defines.trans_en: (of a liquid) flowing easily

examples.ch: 稀汤
examples.en: a thin soup

defines.trans_en: weak or of poor quality

examples.ch: 牵强的借口
examples.en: a thin excuse

examples.ch: 容易识破的伪装
examples.en: a thin disguise

examples.ch: 淡淡一笑
examples.en: a thin smile

phrases.text: be as thin as a rake
phrases.trans_en: to be very thin

examples.ch: 他象马一样吃得多，却骨瘦如柴。
examples.en: He eats like a horse and yet he's as thin as a rake.

defines.trans_en: to make a substance less thick, often by adding a liquid to it

examples.ch: 加少量汤汁把调料弄稀一点。
examples.en: Thin the sauce down with a little stock.

defines.trans_en: When a crowd or a group thins (out), it becomes fewer in number, and when you thin (out) a group of plants or other things, you remove some to make them fewer.

examples.ch: 交通高峰期过后车流量将减少。
examples.en: The traffic will thin out after the rush hour.

defines.trans_en: used to refer in an approximate way to an object or to avoid naming it

examples.ch: 那边的是什么东西？
examples.en: What's that thing over there?

examples.ch: 今年夏天商店里有些好东西。
examples.en: There are some nice things in the shops this summer.

examples.ch: 我不吃甜食。
examples.en: I don't eat sweet things (= sweet food).

examples.ch: 这鬼东西怎么用？
examples.en: How does this stupid thing work?

defines.trans_en: used to refer in an approximate way to an idea, subject, event, action, etc.

examples.ch: 那样说是不友好的。
examples.en: That was an unkind thing to say.

examples.ch: 我有许多事情要做，都不知道从何下手。
examples.en: I've got so many things to do I don't know where to start.

examples.ch: 你的消息是正确的，不过你遗漏了一件事。
examples.en: Your information is correct but you left out one thing.

examples.ch: “怎么回事？”“是保险这事。我真的很担心。”
examples.en: "What's the matter?" "It's this insurance thing. I'm really worried about it."

defines.trans_ch: 人，家伙，东西（指人或动物，带有疼爱或怜悯的感情色彩）
defines.trans_en: used after an adjective to refer to a person or animal with love or sympathy

examples.ch: 这些可怜的东西都被关在小笼子里，连动一动的空间都没有。
examples.en: The poor things were kept in small cages without room to move.

examples.ch: 我真不敢相信你赢了——你这走运的家伙。
examples.en: I can't believe you won - you lucky thing!

phrases.trans_ch: 财产;（个人的）所有物，用具
phrases.trans_en: your possessions or a particular set of your possessions

examples.ch: 他们所有的东西都被大火烧掉了。
examples.en: All their things were destroyed in the fire.

examples.ch: 如果天气好，带上你的游泳用品。
examples.en: Bring your swimming things if the weather's nice.

phrases.trans_en: a particular set of objects

examples.ch: 我来帮你收拾茶具。
examples.en: Let me help you clear away the tea things (= cups, plates, etc. that are used for having tea).

phrases.trans_ch: 事实（东西、想法、事件等）本身
phrases.trans_en: the exact fact, object, idea, event, etc.

examples.ch: 这篇文章正好是我研究需要的东西。
examples.en: The article was exactly the thing I needed for my research.

phrases.trans_en: something that is not false or a copy

examples.ch: 火灾报警器常常瞎响，到时候真的着火时发警报也没有人会注意了。
examples.en: The fire alarm goes off accidentally so often that when it's the real thing (= when it really does happen) nobody will take any notice.

phrases.trans_en: the same

examples.ch: 培训与教育并不一样。
examples.en: Training isn't the same thing as education.

phrases.trans_ch: 一切（计划或讨论过的）事情
phrases.trans_en: everything that has been planned or discussed

examples.ch: 此事就此作罢吧。
examples.en: Let's call the whole thing off.

examples.ch: 我想忘掉这一切。
examples.en: I want to forget the whole thing.

phrases.trans_ch: 比其他任何事情都重要
phrases.trans_en: more than everything else

examples.ch: 我把自由看得比什么都重要。
examples.en: I value my freedom above all things.

phrases.trans_ch: 在一切事情上；在各种情况下
phrases.trans_en: in every situation or subject; in everything

examples.ch: 任何时候都要坚持按自己的想法做。
examples.en: Be true to yourself in all things.

phrases.text: if there's one thing I want to know, find out, etc.
phrases.trans_en: said before describing what it is that you especially want to know

examples.ch: 有一件事我想知道，就是他每个星期四下午都到哪里去了。
examples.en: If there's one thing I want to know, it's where he goes on Thursday afternoons.

phrases.trans_en: used to refer to the general situation

examples.ch: 最近情况很好。
examples.en: Things have been going very well recently.

phrases.trans_en: If it's a good thing that something happened, it is lucky that it happened.

examples.ch: 幸好我们早订了票。
examples.en: It's a good thing (that) we booked our tickets early.

phrases.trans_en: in the present situation

examples.ch: 从目前情况来看，6月份前我绝对无法把这一切准备好。
examples.en: The way things are, I'll never have this ready by June.

phrases.trans_en: used instead of "anything" or "everything" to emphasize what you are saying

examples.ch: 什么事情也不要操心，我会料理好一切的。
examples.en: Don't worry about a thing (= anything). I'll take care of it.

phrases.trans_en: not anything

examples.ch: 客人走后，吃的东西一点都没剩。
examples.en: After the guests had gone, there wasn't a thing left to eat.

phrases.text: not have a thing to wear
phrases.trans_en: to have no clothes that are suitable for an occasion

examples.ch: 我周六要去参加一个婚礼，可没有合适的衣服可穿。
examples.en: I'm going to a wedding on Saturday and I don't have a thing to wear.

phrases.text: there isn't a thing you can do
phrases.trans_en: you cannot do anything

examples.ch: 他不履行诺言，对此我们无计可施。
examples.en: He broke his promise and there wasn't a thing we could do about it.

phrases.trans_en: used to talk about a particular action, agreement, etc.

examples.ch: 我是乘飞机去的——我很少这样。
examples.en: I went by plane, a thing I hardly ever do.

examples.ch: 有件你必须同意的事，就是你得在晚上工作。
examples.en: One thing you'll have to agree to is working in the evenings.

phrases.trans_ch: （构成带有特定形容词和副词的名词短语）
phrases.trans_en: used to make noun phrases with particular adjectives and adverbs

examples.ch: 首先要做的就是把你的名字写在这一页的上方。
examples.en: The first thing (to do) is to write your name at the top of the paper.

phrases.trans_en: used to introduce a reason for something

examples.ch: “你为什么不跟我到纽约来？”“首先，我不喜欢坐飞机;再者，我买不起机票。”
examples.en: "Why won't you come to New York with me?" "For one thing, I don't like flying, and for another, I can't afford it."

defines.trans_en: to believe something or have an opinion or idea

examples.ch: 我觉得以前见过你。
examples.en: I think (that) I've met you before.

examples.ch: 我认为埃玛不会获得这份工作。
examples.en: I don't think Emma will get the job.

examples.ch: 你进城的时候帮我买些邮票好吗？
examples.en: "Do you think (that) you could get me some stamps while you're in town?"

examples.ch: 据信他已在纽约上了飞机。
examples.en: He was thought to have boarded the plane in New York.

examples.ch: 你觉得这部电影怎么样？
examples.en: What did you think of the film?

examples.ch: 鲑鱼一度被认为是昂贵的／是奢侈品。
examples.en: Salmon used to be thought of as expensive/a luxury.

examples.ch: 你觉得这个改善地铁系统的最新计划怎么样？
examples.en: What do you think about the latest plans for improving the underground system?

examples.ch: 我认为学英语是很重要的。
examples.en: I think it is important to learn English.

defines.trans_en: to consider a person's needs or wishes

examples.ch: 她总是替他人着想。
examples.en: She's always thinking of others.

defines.trans_ch: 思考，考虑（动脑筋决定做某事）
defines.trans_en: to use the brain to decide to do something

examples.ch: 我在考虑开始跑步。
examples.en: I'm thinking of taking up running.

examples.ch: 我想午饭后去游泳。
examples.en: I think (that) I'll go swimming after lunch.

examples.ch: 我在考虑买辆新车。
examples.en: I'm thinking about buying a new car.

defines.trans_en: to use the brain to plan something, solve a problem, understand a situation, etc.

examples.ch: 彼得，你在想什么呢？
examples.en: What are you thinking, Peter?

examples.ch: 他做这些没有经过仔细考虑，结果弄得一团糟。
examples.en: He just does these things without thinking and he gets himself into trouble.

examples.ch: 你想得太多——这是你的问题。
examples.en: You think too much - that's your problem.

examples.ch: 对不起，我忘了提你的名字。我真糊涂。
examples.en: I'm sorry I forgot to mention your name. I just wasn't thinking.

defines.trans_en: to remember or imagine

examples.ch: 你打来电话时我正在想你。
examples.en: I was just thinking about you when you called.

examples.ch: 她实在是太忙了，没有想起要告诉我这件事。
examples.en: She was so busy she didn't think to tell me about it.

phrases.trans_en: to have a low opinion of someone or something

examples.ch: 我觉得她最新出版的书不怎么样。
examples.en: I didn't think much of her latest book.

phrases.trans_en: to think very carefully about something

examples.ch: 在你作出重要决定之前要深思熟虑。
examples.en: Think long and hard before you make any important decisions.

examples.ch: 我知道这很让人兴奋，但是在假期上花那么多钱之前要仔细考虑一下。
examples.en: I know it's exciting, but you should think twice before you spend that much money on a vacation.

phrases.trans_en: to automatically say what you are thinking

examples.ch: “你说什么了？”“啊，没什么，我只是在自言自语。”
examples.en: "What did you say?" "Oh, nothing, I was just thinking aloud."

phrases.trans_en: to consider something for some time

examples.ch: 在我作出决定前先让我考虑考虑。
examples.en: Let me have a think about it before I decide.

examples.ch: 周末先好好想想，再告诉我你的决定。
examples.en: Have a think over the weekend and tell me what you've decided.

defines.trans_en: needing to drink

examples.ch: 篮球比赛后我又热又渴。
examples.en: I felt/was hot and thirsty after the basketball game.

defines.trans_en: Someone who is thirsty for power, knowledge, etc. wants to have it very much.
used for a person, object, idea, etc. to show which one is referred to

examples.ch: 请你在这个表上签个名好吗？
examples.en: Can you sign this form here for me?

examples.ch: 这些书太重了，我拿不动。
examples.en: These books are too heavy for me to carry.

examples.ch: 我们在旅馆里遇到这姑娘。
examples.en: We met this girl (= the girl I am going to tell you about) in the hotel.

examples.ch: 这就是我要的那个。
examples.en: This is the one I want.

examples.ch: 这是什么？这是你要找的吗？
examples.en: What's this? Is this what you're looking for?

examples.ch: 我听说你要移居到苏格兰，是怎么回事？
examples.en: What's this I hear about you moving to Scotland?

phrases.trans_en: used when you introduce someone to someone else

examples.ch: 哈里，这位是琼。
examples.en: Harry, this is Joan.

phrases.trans_en: already

examples.ch: 我以为你这之前已经完成了。
examples.en: I thought you'd be done by this time.

defines.trans_en: as much as shown or to a particular degree

examples.ch: 它离地面只有这么高。
examples.en: It was only about this high off the ground.

examples.ch: 她以前上学从没有迟到过这么久。
examples.en: She has never been this late for school before.

defines.trans_en:
→ 
that
from one end or side of something to the other

examples.ch: 他们缓步穿过树林。
examples.en: They walked slowly through the woods.

examples.ch: 男孩涉水来到他的船上。
examples.en: The boy waded through the water to reach his boat.

examples.ch: 他挤过人群来到前面。
examples.en: He struggled through the crowd till he reached the front.

examples.ch: 旅程要花多长时间将取决于穿过车流要花多长时间。
examples.en: How long the journey takes will depend on how long it takes to get through the traffic.

examples.ch: 她的话一直在我脑海里回荡。
examples.en: Her words kept running through my mind/head (= I kept hearing her words in my imagination).

examples.ch: 我们开车穿过隧道。
examples.en: We drove through the tunnel.

examples.ch: 我看见他开车闯红灯。
examples.en: I saw him drive through a red light (= he did not stop at the red traffic light).

examples.ch: 我给你接通（销售部的）电话。
examples.en: I'll put you through (= connect you by phone) (to the sales department).

defines.trans_en: from the beginning to the end of a period of time

examples.ch: 整个6月和7月的上半月一直在下雨。
examples.en: It rained all/right through June and into the first half of July.

examples.ch: 我们听完整整两个讲话，然后就离开了。
examples.en: We sat through two of the speeches and then left.

examples.ch: 她硬撑着坚持了一天。
examples.en: She had just enough energy to get through the day.

examples.ch: 她周一到周四工作。
examples.en: She works Monday through Thursday (= from Monday to Thursday).

defines.trans_en: as a result of

examples.ch: 该公司由于生产延误失去了订单。
examples.en: The company lost the order through production delays.

defines.trans_en: by; using

examples.ch: 我通过在汽车修理厂工作的兄弟买的车。
examples.en: I got my car through my brother who works in a garage.

examples.ch: 我们通过在地方报纸上登广告卖掉了自行车。
examples.en: We sold the bike through advertising in the local paper.

defines.trans_en: having finished using or doing something

examples.ch: 我还有些工作要做，不过1小时内应该可以完成，你看能不能等一下。
examples.en: I've got some work to do but I should be through in an hour if you can wait.

examples.ch: 你看完那本地图册了吗？
examples.en: Are you through with that atlas?

defines.trans_ch: （火车或公共汽车）直达的，中途不停的
defines.trans_en: A through train or bus goes all the way from one place to another place without the passenger having to change trains or buses.

phrases.trans_en: to achieve success in an exam, competition, etc. and progress to the next stage or a higher level

examples.ch: 她通过了，可参加下一轮面试。
examples.en: She's through to the next round of interviews.

examples.ch: “她知道入学考试的成绩了吗？”“知道，她通过了。”
examples.en: "Has she heard about her entrance exams yet?" "Yes, she's through."

defines.trans_en: to send something through the air with force, especially by a sudden movement of the arm

examples.ch: 我朋友把球从围栏上掷了回去。
examples.en: My friend threw the ball back over the fence.

examples.ch: 大衣丢在椅背上。
examples.en: The coat was thrown over the back of the chair.

examples.ch: 她筋疲力尽地倒在椅子上。
examples.en: She threw herself into a chair, exhausted.

examples.ch: 马跳过栅栏时骑手被甩了下来。
examples.en: The rider was thrown as the horse jumped the fence.

examples.ch: 他向攻击他的人猛击了一拳。
examples.en: He threw a punch at (= hit) his attacker.

defines.trans_en: to cause to move or act quickly or carelessly

examples.ch: 她把头发往后甩了甩。
examples.en: She threw back her hair.

defines.trans_en: to confuse or shock someone or cause difficulty for them

examples.ch: 我没想到会有人来，我真是措手不及。
examples.en: I wasn't expecting a visitor. I was really thrown.

examples.ch: 政变的消息使他们陷入了恐慌。
examples.en: The news of the coup threw them into a state of panic.

defines.trans_en: to shape clay on a special round table that spins

phrases.trans_en: to look quickly or suddenly

examples.ch: 男孩朝房子那边惊恐地看了一眼。
examples.en: The boy threw a frightened look in the direction of the house.

phrases.trans_en: to open something that was closed, usually suddenly and completely

examples.ch: 她拉开窗帘，把所有窗户都打开。
examples.en: She drew back the curtains and threw open all the windows.

phrases.trans_en: to allow people to enter or become involved in an event

examples.ch: 这项竞赛已经对公众开放了。
examples.en: The competition has been thrown open to the public.

phrases.trans_en: to have a party

examples.ch: 弗拉维亚为庆祝柯林的50岁生日举办了聚会。
examples.en: Flavio threw a party for Colin's 50th birthday.

phrases.trans_en: to experience and show a strong feeling of anger, especially suddenly

examples.ch: 我母亲看到我们把厨房弄得一团糟时，她大发脾气。
examples.en: My mother threw a fit when she saw what a mess we'd made of her kitchen.

defines.trans_en: an act of throwing something

examples.ch: 掷骰子
examples.en: a throw of the dice

defines.trans_en: a large piece of cloth that you use to cover a chair, sofa, etc. to make it look attractive

examples.ch: 一条薄毯可以用来保护新沙发或是让老旧的沙发面貌一新。
examples.en: A throw can protect a new sofa or enhance the appearance of an old, tired one.

phrases.trans_en: used to mean each thing or for each time

examples.ch: 我们可以在那里买到咖啡，不过他们每份要卖三英镑。
examples.en: We could get a coffee in there but they charge three quid a throw.

defines.trans_en: a storm with thunder and lightning and usually heavy rain
a small piece of paper or card given to someone, usually to show that they have paid for an event, journey, or activity

examples.ch: 音乐会票
examples.en: a concert ticket

examples.ch: 火车／汽车／飞机票
examples.en: a train/bus/plane ticket

examples.ch: 彩票／奖券
examples.en: a lottery/raffle ticket

examples.ch: 售票处
examples.en: a ticket office

examples.ch: 检票员
examples.en: a ticket collector

defines.trans_ch: （货物上标明价目、尺码等的）标签，签条
defines.trans_en: a piece of card or paper that is put on an object to show its size or price

examples.ch: 价格标签
examples.en: a price ticket

defines.trans_en: a note telling you that you must pay some money as a punishment for not obeying a rule or law

examples.ch: 违法停车罚单
examples.en: a parking ticket

defines.trans_ch: （选举中某政党的）候选人名单
defines.trans_en: a number of people representing a particular political party in an election

examples.ch: 共和党／民主党候选人名单
examples.en: the Republican/Democratic ticket

defines.trans_en: to sell tickets for an event; to provide someone with a ticket

examples.ch: 只有购买了该航班机票的乘客才能获得退款。
examples.en: Only passengers who were ticketed on that particular flight will receive a refund.

examples.ch: 这场比赛必须购票入场观看。
examples.en: It's an all-ticketed game.

defines.trans_en: to give a ticket to someone who has broken a traffic law

examples.ch: 查尔斯因超速被开了罚单。
examples.en: Charles was ticketed for speeding.

defines.trans_ch: 整齐的;整洁的，有条理的
defines.trans_en: having everything ordered and arranged in the right place, or liking to keep things like this

examples.ch: 房子干净整洁。
examples.en: The house was clean and tidy.

examples.ch: 我的室友不怎么爱整洁。
examples.en: My flatmate isn't very tidy.

examples.ch: 整整齐齐
examples.en: neat and tidy

examples.ch: 条理分明的解决方法
examples.en: a tidy solution

defines.trans_en: (of amounts of money) large

examples.ch: 他做生意赚了一大笔钱。
examples.en: His business deals make him a tidy sum.

phrases.text: a desk, car, sink, etc. tidy
phrases.trans_ch: 写字台杂物箱／汽车杂物箱／洗涤槽的过滤网罩（等等）
phrases.trans_en: a small container for a few objects, that makes it easier for you to keep your desk, car, etc. tidy

defines.trans_en: to make a place or a collection of things tidy

examples.ch: 请把这些文件整理好再走。
examples.en: Tidy (up) these papers before you leave, please.

examples.ch: 老是叫你收拾房间，我都厌烦了。
examples.en: I'm tired of asking you to tidy your room (up).

examples.ch: 孩子们，你们收拾好了吗？
examples.en: Have you tidied up yet, kids?

defines.trans_en: an act of making a place or a collection of things tidy

examples.ch: 我们在妈妈回家前快快收拾一下吧。
examples.en: Let's have/do a quick tidy-up before Mum gets home.

examples.ch: 把卧室、走廊和客厅简单整理一下，可以营造出空间变大的感觉。
examples.en: A basic tidy-up of bedrooms, hallways, and living rooms can create the impression of more space.

defines.trans_en: a large wild animal of the cat family with yellowish-orange fur with black lines that lives in parts of Asia

defines.trans_ch: 强悍的人;劲头十足的人;虎将
defines.trans_en: used to refer to someone who is very determined and strong

examples.ch: 在现今最温顺听话的妻子，以她祖母的标准来看，都称得上是母老虎。
examples.en: The meekest, most submissive wife of today is a tiger by her grandmother's standards.

defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing made of very thin material that tightly covers the feet, legs, and lower part of the body below the waist, often worn under skirts and dresses

examples.ch: 她买了一双新的连裤袜。
examples.en: She bought a new pair of tights.

examples.ch: 啊，糟了，我的连裤袜上有一处抽丝／一个洞。
examples.en: Oh no, I've got a ladder/hole in my tights.

defines.trans_ch: （舞蹈演员和健身者穿的）紧身衣
defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing made of material that tightly covers the body from the waist to the ankles or the feet, worn for dancing, under skirts and dresses, or when exercising
up to (the time that); until

examples.ch: 我们一直等你到6点半。
examples.en: We waited till six thirty for you.

examples.ch: 在1918年以前，英国不允许妇女参加选举。
examples.en: Up till 1918, women in Britain were not allowed to vote.

examples.ch: 你还有多久生孩子？
examples.en: How long is it till the baby is due?

defines.trans_en: the drawer in a cash register (= a machine which records sales in a shop, and in which money is kept) or the cash register itself

examples.ch: 下次打开收银机时，你给我些零钱好吗？
examples.en: Next time you have the till open, could you give me some change?

examples.ch: 我想这些商品在收银机上记错了。
examples.en: I think these items have been rung up wrongly on the till.

defines.trans_en: to prepare and use land for growing crops

examples.ch: 这块土地已经被耕耘了几百年。
examples.en: This piece of land has been tilled for hundreds of years.

defines.trans_en: the part of existence that is measured in minutes, days, years, etc., or this process considered as a whole

examples.ch: 他想多花时间陪家人。
examples.en: He wants to spend more time with his family.

examples.ch: 玩得高兴时，时间过得特别快。
examples.en: Time passes so quickly when you're having fun.

examples.ch: 随着时间的推移，她对这门学科越来越着迷。
examples.en: She grew more and more fascinated by the subject as time went on/by.

examples.ch: 年深日久，窗帘已经褪色了。
examples.en: The curtains have faded over/with time (= as years have gone past).

examples.ch: 你迟早会忘记她的。
examples.en: You'll forget her in time (= in the future).

examples.ch: 随着岁月的流逝，岩石上出现了洞眼。
examples.en: Over the course of time (= as years have gone past), holes have formed in the rock.

examples.ch: 葆拉生病时，我给她带去一些杂志帮她消磨时间。
examples.en: When Paula was ill, I took her some magazines to help her pass the time.

examples.ch: 如果你在这篇文章上多花些时间，本可以写得好得多。
examples.en: If you'd taken more time with/over (= spent more time doing) this essay, you could have done it much better.

examples.ch: 从伦敦到悉尼要花很长时间。
examples.en: It takes a long time (= many hours are needed) to get from London to Sydney.

examples.ch: 如果我们坐火车去，就会在旅程上节约时间。
examples.en: We'd save time on our journey (= it would be quicker) if we went by train.

examples.ch: 我只在那儿工作过很短一段时间。
examples.en: I only worked there for a short period of time.

examples.ch: 厨房的钟快／慢了。
examples.en: The kitchen clock is gaining/losing time (= is going fast/slow).

examples.ch: 我的手表从来都不准。
examples.en: My watch has never kept very good time (= been correct).

defines.trans_en: the system of recording hours used in different parts of the world

examples.ch: 格林尼治标准时间
examples.en: Greenwich Mean Time

examples.ch: 夏令时
examples.en: daylight saving time

defines.trans_en: an amount of time that you have available to do something

examples.ch: 我不知道你是怎么抽出时间做所有这些事情的。
examples.en: I don't know how you find time to do all the things you do.

examples.ch: 我原以为我们会多给她一点儿时间完成工作。
examples.en: I thought we'd give her a little more time (= allow her more time) to get the job done.

examples.ch: 所有的博物馆我都想参观，可时间不够。
examples.en: I'd like to visit all the museums but time is short (= there is little time left).

defines.trans_en: a particular period of time for which something has been happening, or that is needed for something

examples.ch: 过了一阵子，情况变得很明显，没有人想来参加会议。
examples.en: After a time, it became clear that nobody was interested in coming to the meetings.

examples.ch: 他们跟我们住了很短一段时间。
examples.en: They stayed with us for a short time.
