examples.ch: 那是我很长一段时间以来去过的最好的饭店。
examples.en: That was the best restaurant I've been to for/in a long time (= a long period has gone past since I went to such a good restaurant).

examples.ch: 我最后一次收到她的信已有一段时间了。
examples.en: It was some time ago that I last heard from her.

examples.ch: 我们过两周要去度假。
examples.en: We're going on holiday in two weeks' time (= after two weeks have passed).

examples.ch: 首相在执政期间推行了多项改革。
examples.en: During her time (= while she was) in office, the prime minister introduced a large number of changes.

examples.ch: 你业余时间喜欢做什么？
examples.en: What do you like doing in your spare/free time (= when you are not working)?

defines.trans_en: a particular point in the day, as expressed in hours and minutes or shown on a clock, or a particular point in time

examples.ch: 现在几点了？
examples.en: What time is it?

examples.ch: “现在什么时间？”“10点钟。”
examples.en: "What's the time?" "It's ten o'clock."

examples.ch: 你什么时候完成工作？
examples.en: What time do you finishwork?

examples.ch: 你知道几点了吗？
examples.en: Have you got the time? (= Do you know what time it is?)

examples.ch: 他在教女儿看钟表。
examples.en: He's teaching his daughter to tell the time (= to recognize what time it is by looking at a clock).

examples.ch: 你查到去基辅的火车的发车时间了吗？
examples.en: Did you find out the times of the trains to Kiev?

examples.ch: 这次航班估计在11点15分到达／起飞。
examples.en: The estimated time of arrival/departure of this flight is 11.15.

examples.ch: 哦，天哪，有这么晚了吗？
examples.en: Oh dear, is that the (right) time? (= is it really so late?)

examples.ch: 我们每天总是在同一时间吃晚饭。
examples.en: We always have dinner at the same time every day.

examples.ch: 我到家时已经筋疲力尽了。
examples.en: I was exhausted by the time (= when) I got home.

examples.ch: 我什么时候给你打电话合适？
examples.en: When would be a good time for me to call you?

examples.ch: “我们什么时候送桌子最合适？”“哦，什么时候都行。”
examples.en: "What would be the best time of day for us to deliver the table?" "Oh, any time will be OK."

examples.ch: 今天的气温会和往年此时的平均气温一样。
examples.en: Today's temperatures will be normal for the time of year (= will be as they are expected to be in this season).

examples.ch: 想想吧，下星期这个时候我们就在阿鲁巴岛了。
examples.en: Just think, this time (= at the same particular point during) next week we'll be in Aruba.

examples.ch: 很遗憾，我们现在无法供应您订的货。
examples.en: We regret that at the present time (US also at this time) we are unable to supply the products you ordered.

examples.ch: 我们必须下决心的时刻很快就要到了。
examples.en: The time is fast drawing near/approaching (= it will soon be the time) when we'll have to make a decision.

defines.trans_ch: （从事特定活动或某事应该发生的）时间，时候
defines.trans_en: a particular point of the day, year, etc. that is suitable for a particular activity, or at which something is expected to happen

examples.ch: 假期
examples.en: holiday time

examples.ch: 聚会时间
examples.en: party time

examples.ch: 现在收拾好玩具，该睡觉了。
examples.en: Put your toys away now - it's time for bed.

examples.ch: 我该动身了。
examples.en: It's time (that) I was leaving.

examples.ch: 该回家了吗？
examples.en: Is it time (for us) to go home yet?

examples.ch: 现在不是考虑买房子的时候。
examples.en: This is not the time (= not a suitable moment) to be thinking about buying a house.

examples.ch: 现在不是你改变主意的时候。
examples.en: This is no time (= not a suitable moment) to change your mind.

examples.ch: 我觉得是我离开的时候了。
examples.en: I feel that the time has come (= now is a suitable moment) for me to move on.

examples.ch: 道路维修工程提前两星期完成了。
examples.en: The repairs to the road were finished two weeks ahead of time (= sooner than was expected).

examples.ch: 为什么公交车从不准点？
examples.en: Why is it that the buses never run on time (= make their journeys in the expected number of hours, etc.)?

examples.ch: 她过早地衰老了。
examples.en: She's grown old before her time (= sooner than she might have been expected to have done).

defines.trans_en: an occasion when something happens, or the experience connected with it

examples.ch: 上一次我们去巴黎的时候，每天都下雨。
examples.en: The last time we went to Paris, it rained every day.

examples.ch: 每次我叫你做事，你都说太忙。
examples.en: Every time/Each time I ask you to do something you say you're busy.

examples.ch: 他们每周去游泳三四次。
examples.en: They go swimming three or four times a week.

examples.ch: 有时我真希望我不是住在现在的地方。
examples.en: There are times when I wish I didn't live where I do.

examples.ch: 这名曾4度夺冠的选手在比赛的第二轮就被打败了。
examples.en: The four-times champion (= the champion on four occasions in the past) was defeated in the second round.

examples.ch: 我当时要是知道她是他前妻的话，我就不会那样说了。
examples.en: If I'd known at the time (= then) that she was his former wife, I'd never have said what I did.

examples.ch: 有时我很喜欢英语课，但有时也感觉很枯燥。
examples.en: Sometimes I enjoy my English classes, but at other times I find them really boring.

examples.ch: 我无数次／上百次／上千次告诉过你，别再戏弄你妹妹了。
examples.en: For the umpteenth/hundredth/thousandth time, (= I've told you on many occasions to) stop teasing your sister.

examples.ch: 你会开得好／不好吗？
examples.en: Did you have a bad/good time (= an unpleasant/enjoyable experience) at the conference?

examples.ch: 她生第二个孩子时很顺利／艰难。
examples.en: She had an easy/hard time of it (= a comfortable/uncomfortable experience) with the birth of her second baby.

defines.trans_en: a period in history

examples.ch: 小说《双城记》是以法国大革命时期为背景的。
examples.en: "A Tale of Two Cities" is set at the time of the French Revolution.

examples.ch: 中世纪时期，人们把被认为是女巫的女人烧死在火刑柱上。
examples.en: In/During medieval times, women thought to be witches were burned at the stake.

examples.ch: 在过去的时代里，所有的农作物都是手工收割的。
examples.en: In times gone by, all crops were harvested by hand.

examples.ch: 我小时候日子很艰难。
examples.en: Times were hard (= living conditions were not good) when I was a boy.

examples.ch: 人们普遍认为他是现代／我们这个时代最优秀的作家之一。
examples.en: He is widely regarded as one of the best writers of modern/our times (= the present or very recent past).

examples.ch: 我怎么也想不到这会在我有生之年发生。
examples.en: I never thought it would happen in my time (= before I died).

examples.ch: 我们坐下来谈论往事。
examples.en: We sat and talked about old times (= things that had happened to us in the past.)

examples.ch: 时代已经变了，置身高级管理职位的女性数量比过去多得多了。
examples.en: Times have changed and many more women now have executive jobs than in the past.

defines.trans_en: Your time in a race is the number of minutes, hours, etc. you take to complete it.

examples.ch: 她的马拉松成绩略低于3小时。
examples.en: Her time for the marathon was just under three hours.

examples.ch: 他以创纪录的成绩完成了100米赛跑。
examples.en: He ran the 100 metres in record time.

defines.trans_en: the number of beats in a bar of music, or the speed at which a piece of music is intended to be played

examples.ch: 这支曲子是四四拍的。
examples.en: This piece is written in 4/4 time.

examples.ch: 幼儿唱歌时常常难以与音乐合拍。
examples.en: Small children often have difficulty singing in time with the music (= at the same speed at which the music is being played).

examples.ch: 我觉得小提琴似乎不合拍。
examples.en: It seemed to me as if the violins were playing out of time (= at a different speed from the other instruments playing the same piece of music).

examples.ch: 打拍子就是跟着音乐的节奏制造出一系列有规律的声响。
examples.en: To beat time is to make a regular series of sounds at the same speed as a piece of music is played.

examples.ch: 用脚轻叩有助于你跟上节拍。
examples.en: Tapping your foot will help you to keep time (= to play the music at the correct speed).

defines.trans_en: the particular point in the day at which people who are drinking in a bar in the UK have to finish their drinks and leave

examples.ch: “对不起，要打烊了，”店主叫道。
examples.en: "Time, please!" called the landlord.

examples.ch: 已经到打烊的时间了吗？
examples.en: Is it time already?

phrases.trans_en: continuously

examples.ch: 我希望你别再没完没了地批评我了。
examples.en: I wish you'd stop criticizing me all the time.

phrases.trans_en: very quickly or very soon

examples.ch: 孩子们很快吃完了饭。
examples.en: The kids ate their dinner in no time.

examples.ch: 我们很快就能回到家。
examples.en: We'll be home in next to no time.

phrases.trans_en: If you say there is or that you have no time to lose, it means that you must do quickly whatever it is that you want to do.

examples.ch: 赶快，没有时间耽搁了，我们必须在约翰发现之前赶到家。
examples.en: Come on, there's no time to lose, we have to get home before John finds out.

phrases.trans_en: always

examples.ch: 我会永远爱你。
examples.en: I will love you for all time.

phrases.trans_en: that has ever lived or existed

examples.ch: 她被称为有史以来最伟大的演唱家。
examples.en: She's been called the greatest singer of all time.

phrases.trans_en: If you have time, you have enough time to do something.

examples.ch: 在火车发车之前我们的时间不多了。
examples.en: We don't have much time before the train leaves.

examples.ch: 下班后你有没有时间小酌一杯？
examples.en: Do you have time for a quick drink after work?

examples.ch: 我想学驾帆船，可我没时间。
examples.en: I'd like to learn to sail, but I don't have the time (= I am too busy).

examples.ch: 我今天没有时间去商店购物。
examples.en: I don't have time to go to the shops today.

phrases.trans_en: to not make good use of the hours, etc. that you have available

examples.ch: 如果你当时继续工作而不是浪费时间玩手机，你现在已经完成任务了。
examples.en: If you'd done your work instead of wasting time on your phone, you'd be finished by now.

phrases.trans_en: to not have enough hours, etc. available to finish something you are trying to do

examples.ch: 她时间不够，最后一道题没有答完。
examples.en: She ran out of time and didn't finish the last question.

phrases.trans_en: to not have enough minutes, etc. available

examples.ch: 我很想继续讨论，但我们的时间不够。
examples.en: I'd like to continue this discussion but we're all out of time.

phrases.trans_en: there are no more minutes, hours, etc. available

examples.ch: 好了，各位，这星期的就到这里。
examples.en: OK, everyone, time's up for this week.

phrases.trans_en: a period of time added to the end of a football match because play was stopped during the game, usually to take care of players who were hurt

examples.ch: 他在比赛伤停补时阶段的第三分钟射进一球，决定了比赛的胜利。
examples.en: His goal in the third minute of time added on sealed the match.

phrases.trans_en: to stop work, in order to do something else

examples.ch: 我问老板我能不能请一会儿假去看牙医。
examples.en: I asked my boss if I could have some time off (from work) to go to the dentist.

phrases.trans_en: for a short period

examples.ch: 我们一度都认为希拉和弗兰克会结婚。
examples.en: For a time, we all thought that Sheila and Frank would get married.

phrases.trans_en: for a fairly long period of time

examples.ch: 我做瑜伽已有一段时间。
examples.en: I've been doing yoga for some time.

phrases.trans_en: for a limited period

examples.ch: 暂且先别烫衣服——我晚些时候来做。
examples.en: Leave the ironing for the time being - I'll do it later.

phrases.trans_en: at the particular point when something was thought of or done

examples.ch: 在当时这似乎是个好主意。
examples.en: It seemed like a good idea at the time.

phrases.trans_en: If two things happen at the same time, they happen together.

examples.ch: 我们同时到达。
examples.en: We arrived at the same time.

phrases.trans_en: at a person's present age

examples.ch: 他这样年纪应该享享清福了。
examples.en: At his time of life, he ought to be taking things easy.

phrases.trans_en: early enough

examples.ch: 我正好及时赶到家——随后就开始下雨了。
examples.en: I got home just in time - it's starting to rain.

examples.ch: 如果我们不赶快，就不能及时赶上火车了。
examples.en: If we don't hurry up, we won't be in time to catch the train.

examples.ch: 我们比赛前早早地就到了。
examples.en: We got there in plenty of time (= we arrived early) for the beginning of the game.

phrases.trans_en: happening or done at the particular moment that it was expected to happen or be done

examples.ch: 我父母极为准时地到家。
examples.en: My parents go to the house right on time.

phrases.trans_en: earlier than a particular moment

examples.ch: 我们见面吃个午饭吧。我会提前打电话跟你定时间和地点。
examples.en: Let's meet for lunch. I'll call you ahead of time to decide exactly when and where.

phrases.trans_ch: 差不多是时候了；早该（做某事）了
phrases.trans_en: If it is about time/high time that someone did something, it should have been done sooner or a long time ago.

examples.ch: 学校早该改善膳食服务了。
examples.en: It's about time (that) the school improved its food service.

examples.ch: 是到了批评者们对新做法采取开放态度的时候了。
examples.en: It is high time for the critics to open their minds to a new approach.

phrases.trans_ch: （表示某人早该做某事了或某事早该发生了）早该如此
phrases.trans_en: said when someone does something or something happens that you think should have been done or have happened much sooner

examples.ch: “这么说，本终于找到工作了。”“对，早就该找到了。”
examples.en: "So Ben's finally found a job." "Yeah, it's about time."

phrases.trans_en: it is the most suitable moment to do something or for something to happen

examples.ch: 我目前还没有告诉他，时机成熟的时候我会的。
examples.en: I haven't told him yet, but I will when the time is right.

examples.ch: 她觉得是时候该离开了。
examples.en: She felt the time was right to leave.

examples.ch: 投资新技术的时机成熟了。
examples.en: The time is ripe for investing in new technology.

phrases.trans_en: sometimes, but not often

examples.ch: 我偶尔还会想起她。
examples.en: From time to time I still think of her.

phrases.trans_en: again and again

examples.ch: 她一次次地与不般配的男人陷入情感纠葛。
examples.en: Time after time she gets involved in relationships with the wrong men.

phrases.trans_en: very often

examples.ch: 我多次跟你说过——过马路之前要先看一看。
examples.en: I've told you time and time again - look before you cross the road.

phrases.trans_en: continuously

examples.ch: 在机场，要把行李一直带在你身边。
examples.en: When you're at the airport, you should make sure you have your luggage with you at all times.

phrases.trans_en: at or during any particular point or moment in the day

examples.ch: 该建筑任何时候都只允许一定数量的人员进入。
examples.en: Only a certain number of people are allowed in the building at any one time.

examples.ch: 对不起，我现在太忙了，不能帮你——我一次只能做一件事。
examples.en: I'm sorry, but I'm too busy to help you now - I can only do one thing at a time.

phrases.trans_en: sometimes

examples.ch: 要知道，你有时很令人恼火。
examples.en: You can be really annoying at times, you know.

phrases.trans_en: ever

examples.ch: 这里任何时候都不得停车。
examples.en: Parking is not allowed here at any time.

phrases.trans_en: on many occasions

examples.ch: 我已经告诉你许多次了，在借用我的衣服之前要先问一声。
examples.en: The times I've told you, ask before you borrow my clothes.

phrases.trans_en: in the past

examples.ch: 乔治‧艾略特曾一度住在这里。
examples.en: At one time, George Eliot lived here.

phrases.trans_ch: 领先时代的，超越时代的
phrases.trans_en: having new ideas, opinions, or ways of living long before most other people do
If something is before your time, it happened or existed before you were born or were old enough to remember it.

examples.ch: 我对甲壳虫乐队没有什么印象——那是我出生前的事。
examples.en: I don't remember the Beatles - they were before my time.

phrases.trans_en: said to mean that there was a period in the past when something used to happen or be true

examples.ch: 过去，你花6便士就能买到一条面包。
examples.en: Time was (when) you could buy a loaf of bread for sixpence.

phrases.trans_en: to spend a period of time in prison

examples.ch: 出狱后要找到工作可不容易。
examples.en: It's not always easy to find a job after you've done time.

defines.trans_ch: 确定…的时间，为…安排时间
defines.trans_en: to decide that something will happen at a particular time

examples.ch: 我们把旅行安排在表哥结婚的时候。
examples.en: We timed our trip to coincide with my cousin's wedding.

defines.trans_en: to arrange something so that it happens at the best possible time

examples.ch: 如果精心安排好出发的时间，你应该能够避开交通堵塞最严重的时段。
examples.en: If you time your departure carefully, you should be able to miss the worst of the traffic.

examples.ch: 女子少年篮球队完美地掌握时机，在比赛结束哨响前一刻投篮进球，赢得了这场比赛。
examples.en: The girls' basketball team won the game with a perfectly timed shot (= one played at exactly the right moment), just before the buzzer.

defines.trans_ch: 为…计时，测定…所需的时间
defines.trans_en: to measure how long it takes for something to happen or for someone to do something

examples.ch: 请你给我测一下游一个单程要花多少时间好吗？
examples.en: Will you time me to see how long it takes me to swim a length?

defines.trans_en: the stated period of time during the year, day, etc.

examples.ch: 春季
examples.en: springtime

examples.ch: 圣诞节的时候
examples.en: Christmas-time

examples.ch: 白天
examples.en: daytime

examples.ch: 夜晚
examples.en: night-time

defines.trans_en: in need of rest or sleep

examples.ch: 我昨晚下班回家后很累，就小睡了一会儿。
examples.en: I was so tired when I got home from work last night that I had a quick nap.

examples.ch: 我的腿酸了。
examples.en: My legs are tired.

examples.ch: 她说话有气无力的。
examples.en: She spoke in a tired voice.

defines.trans_ch: （人、想法或话题）老套乏味的，令人生厌的
defines.trans_en: used to describe people, ideas, or subjects that are not interesting because they are very familiar

examples.ch: 在这些会上总是些不变的令人生厌的老面孔。
examples.en: It's always the same tired old faces at these meetings.

defines.trans_en: feeling or showing a need to rest or sleep

phrases.trans_en: to be bored with an activity or person

examples.ch: 我厌倦了日复一日地做同样的工作。
examples.en: I'm so tired of doing the same job, day after day.

examples.ch: 老吵架你们不觉得累吗？
examples.en: Don't you get tired of arguing all the time?

examples.ch: 我很烦你老是对我该做什么指手画脚。
examples.en: I'm sick and tired of you telling me what to do all the time.

defines.trans_en: feeling or showing a need to rest or sleep
used before a verb to show that it is in the infinitive

defines.trans_ch: （用于某些动词后，尤其是不定式所描述的动作将会随后发生时）
defines.trans_en: used after some verbs, especially when the action described in the infinitive will happen later

examples.ch: 她答应帮忙。
examples.en: She agreed to help.

examples.ch: 我得告诉他。
examples.en: I'll have to tell him.

examples.ch: 令人伤心的是，她没有活到孙辈出生的那一天。
examples.en: Sadly, she didn't live to see her grandchildren.

defines.trans_ch: （用于许多表示赞成、需要和想要的动词后）
defines.trans_en: used after many verbs of agreeing, needing, and wanting

examples.ch: 我首先得吃点东西。
examples.en: I need to eat something first.

examples.ch: 我想要住在纽约。
examples.en: I'd love to live in New York.

examples.ch: 那个孩子应该上床睡觉。
examples.en: That child ought to be in bed.

defines.trans_ch: （用于代替动词分句，以免重复）
defines.trans_en: used instead of repeating a verb clause

examples.ch: “你今晚要走吗？”“我当然希望走。”
examples.en: "Are you going tonight?" "I'm certainly hoping to."

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示间接命令、要求的短语中）
defines.trans_en: used in phrases where there are reported orders and requests

examples.ch: 他叫我等。
examples.en: He told me to wait.

examples.ch: 有人要丹尼尔订房间了吗？
examples.en: Did anyone ask Daniel to reserve the room?

defines.trans_en: used after some adjectives

examples.ch: 这事不大可能发生。
examples.en: It's not likely to happen.

examples.ch: 等3个月太久了。
examples.en: Three months is too long to wait.

examples.ch: 她身体不够壮，登不上山。
examples.en: She's not strong enough to go hiking up mountains.

defines.trans_en: used after some nouns

examples.ch: 他有这种令人羡慕的本事，能够不去理睬生活中的种种不快。
examples.en: He has this enviable ability to ignore everything that's unpleasant in life.

examples.ch: 这将是我第二次尝试制作薄馅饼皮。
examples.en: This will be my second attempt to make flaky pastry.

defines.trans_ch: （含有带 to 的不定式的分句可用作句子主语）
defines.trans_en: A clause containing to + infinitive can be used as the subject of a sentence

examples.ch: 只身去国外，真勇敢。
examples.en: To go overseas on your own is very brave.

examples.ch: 我的计划是先把一切都安排好再告诉别人。
examples.en: My plan was to get it all arranged before I told anyone.

defines.trans_en: used after question words

examples.ch: 我不知道该怎么办。
examples.en: I don't know what to do.

examples.ch: 你能告诉我怎样去那儿吗？
examples.en: Can you tell me how to get there?

defines.trans_ch: （与不定式连用，表示用途或目的）
defines.trans_en: used with an infinitive to express use or purpose

examples.ch: 我要去那儿看望我的姐姐。
examples.en: I'm going there to see my sister.

examples.ch: 这个工具是用来在皮革上打眼的。
examples.en: This tool is used to make holes in leather.

examples.ch: 做这个蛋糕，你需要两个鸡蛋、175克糖和175克面粉。
examples.en: To make this cake, you'll need two eggs, 175 grams of sugar, and 175 grams of flour.

examples.ch: 他工作是为了挣钱，而不是因为喜欢工作。
examples.en: He works to get paid, not because he enjoys it.

defines.trans_ch: （含有带 to 的不定式的短语可引出分句）
defines.trans_en: You can introduce a clause with a phrase containing to + infinitive

examples.ch: 说实话，贝姬，我更喜欢那件灰色的衬衫。
examples.en: To be honest (= speaking honestly), Becky, I like thegrey shirt better.

examples.ch: 坦率地跟你说，我从未真正地喜欢过这个男人。
examples.en: To tell you the truth, I never really liked the man.

defines.trans_ch: （与不定式连用，用于 there be + 名词这种结构后）
defines.trans_en: used with an infinitive after 'there is' or 'there are' and a noun

examples.ch: 有许许多多的工作要做。
examples.en: There's an awful lot of work to be done.

defines.trans_en: in the direction of

examples.ch: 我们坐公共汽车去城里，好吗？
examples.en: We're going to town on the bus, okay?

examples.ch: 我们去年去了布拉格。
examples.en: We went to Prague last year.

examples.ch: 我向人问了去市中心的路。
examples.en: I asked someone the way to the town centre.

examples.ch: 你可以从这儿走到学校，用不了10分钟。
examples.en: You can walk from here to the school in under ten minutes.

examples.ch: 我邀请了柯尔斯滕和卡伊下星期来吃饭。
examples.en: I asked Kirsten and Kai to dinner (= invited them to come and eat dinner with me) next week.

examples.ch: 今天上午我们又收到了一份参加婚礼的请柬。
examples.en: We received another invitation to a wedding this morning.

examples.ch: 我背对着他们，所以看不见他们在做什么。
examples.en: I had my back to them, so I couldn't see what they were doing.

examples.ch: 她走到窗边来。
examples.en: She walked over to the window.

examples.ch: 他走到一个完全陌生的人跟前，开始和对方交谈起来。
examples.en: He went up to a complete stranger and started talking.

examples.ch: 你的毛衣前后穿反了。
examples.en: You've got your sweater on back to front (= with the back of the sweater on the chest).

defines.trans_en: used for showing who receives something or who experiences an action

examples.ch: 我把自行车借给了我哥哥。
examples.en: I lent my bike to my brother.

examples.ch: 我把那件事告诉了阿历克斯，他笑了。
examples.en: I told that to Alex and he just laughed.

examples.ch: 这封信是寄给谁的？
examples.en: Who's the letter addressed to?

defines.trans_ch: （与许多可接双宾语的动词连用，用于间接宾语前）
defines.trans_en: With many verbs that have two objects, 'to' can be used before the indirect object

examples.ch: 给我那把枪／把那把枪给我。
examples.en: Give me that gun./Give that gun to me.

defines.trans_en: until a particular time, state, or level is reached

examples.ch: 离圣诞节只有两星期了。
examples.en: It's only two weeks to Christmas.

examples.ch: 失业人数已经上升到了差不多800万。
examples.en: Unemployment has risen to almost eight million.

examples.ch: 他酗酒而死。
examples.en: He drank himself to death.

examples.ch: 她护理我直到康复。
examples.en: She nursed me back to health.

defines.trans_en: used when saying the time, to mean before the stated hour

examples.ch: 差20分到6点。
examples.en: It's twenty to six.

defines.trans_en: used to suggest an extreme state

examples.ch: 看看你的衬衫——都成碎片了！
examples.en: Look at your shirt - it's torn to shreds!

examples.ch: 她激动得不行。
examples.en: She was thrilled to bits.

examples.ch: 我感到无聊极了。
examples.en: I was bored to tears.

defines.trans_en: in connection with

examples.ch: 他们对你的询问作何反应？
examples.en: What was their response to your query?

examples.ch: 她对我很粗暴。
examples.en: She was so mean to me.

examples.ch: 任何事物都有其滑稽的一面。
examples.en: There's a funny side to everything.

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示被系住或连接的地方）
defines.trans_en: used to say where something is fastened or connected

examples.ch: 纸张被用胶带贴在了墙上。
examples.en: The paper was stuck to the wall with tape.

examples.ch: 快速铁路把我们和城市连接了起来。
examples.en: A fast rail service connects us to the city.

defines.trans_ch: （用于不定式前，通常和 be 连用，构成将来时）
defines.trans_en: used before an infinitive, usually with 'be', to indicate a future action

examples.ch: 今天政府宣布明年要削减对艺术的资助。
examples.en: The government announced today that it is to cut funding for the arts for next year.

defines.trans_ch: （表示命令或指出某人应该做什么）
defines.trans_en: used in this pattern to say what someone should do or to give an order

examples.ch: 你不准那样咬指甲。
examples.en: You're not to (= you must not) bite your nails like that.

defines.trans_ch: （报纸标题中常用 to + 不定式这种结构，前面不加 be，表示未来计划中的事）
defines.trans_en: Newspapers often use to + infinitive without 'be' in their headlines (= titles of articles) when reporting planned future events

examples.ch: 俄罗斯即将派兵。
examples.en: Russia to send troops in.

defines.trans_en: causing a particular feeling in a particular person

examples.ch: 令我惊讶的是，那时候我得知她正要到这里来。
examples.en: That's when I found out, to my amazement, that she was coming here.

defines.trans_en: considered by

examples.ch: 我意识到对你而言这听上去可能很奇怪。
examples.en: I realize it may sound strange to you.

examples.ch: 我的意思是，50英镑对他而言算不了什么。
examples.en: I mean, £50 is nothing to him (= he would not consider it a large amount).

examples.ch: “我听说你在和艾拉谈恋爱。”“哟，这和你有什么关系？”
examples.en: "I hear you've been going out with Ella." "Yeah, so? What's it to you?" (= It should not interest you, and you have no right to ask about it.)

defines.trans_en: serving

examples.ch: 他做富人和名流的私人教练一年挣100多万美元。
examples.en: As a personal trainer to the rich and famous, he earns over a million dollars a year.

defines.trans_en: against or very near

examples.ch: 背靠背站着。
examples.en: Stand back to back.

examples.ch: 他们在跳贴面舞。
examples.en: They were dancing cheek to cheek.

defines.trans_en: matching or belonging to

examples.ch: 爸爸把他的车钥匙给了我。
examples.en: My dad gave me the keys to his car.

examples.ch: 我把和这件夹克相配的裤子弄丢了。
examples.en: I've lost the trousers to this jacket.

defines.trans_en: having as a characteristic feature

examples.ch: 她性格中有刻薄的一面。
examples.en: She has a mean side to her.

examples.ch: 这本书很有道德教育的意味。
examples.en: There is a very moral tone to this book.

defines.trans_en: used to show the position of something or someone in comparison with something or someone else

examples.ch: 照片中约翰站在阿德里安的左边。
examples.en: John's standing to the left of Adrian in the photo.

examples.ch: 约克郡山谷位于这个城市以北20英里处。
examples.en: The Yorkshire Dales are twenty miles to the north of the city.

defines.trans_ch: 为向…表示敬意;为了纪念
defines.trans_en: in honour or memory of

examples.ch: 我提议为新娘新郎干杯。
examples.en: I proposed a toast to the bride and the groom.

examples.ch: 这张唱片是献给她不久前去世的母亲的。
examples.en: The record is dedicated to her mother, who died recently.

defines.trans_en: for each

examples.ch: 1英镑等于多少美元？
examples.en: How many dollars are there to the pound?

examples.ch: 这辆车每加仑汽油可行驶大约40英里。
examples.en: This car does about 40 miles to the gallon.

examples.ch: 如果我们一起去游泳，她每游12个来回而我只能游6个。
examples.en: When we go swimming together I do six lengths to her twelve.

defines.trans_en: used in phrases that show a range

examples.ch: 那儿可能有30到35个人。
examples.en: There were probably 30 to 35 (= a number between 30 and 35) people there.

defines.trans_ch: 与（音乐或其他声音）同时，伴随
defines.trans_en: at the same time as music or other sound

examples.ch: 我喜欢跟着音乐做运动。
examples.en: I like exercising to music.

examples.ch: 他在一片嘘声中离开了舞台。
examples.en: He left the stage to the sound of booing.

defines.trans_en: relating to a positive reaction or result

examples.ch: 把意大利面煮到你认为合适的程度时，倒掉水。
examples.en: When the pasta is done to your liking, drain the water.

examples.ch: 我认为出席会议会对你有利。
examples.en: I think being at the meeting would be to your advantage.

defines.trans_en: compared with

examples.ch: 她的收入还可以，但如果她在私营企业工作收入会高得多。
examples.en: She's earning a reasonable wage, but nothing to what she could if she was in the private sector.

examples.ch: 保罗以3比2打败了我。
examples.en: Paul beat me by three games to two (= he won three and I won two).

examples.ch: 他老得可以当她的爸爸——她看上去约30岁，而他有60岁。
examples.en: He was old enough to be her father - she looked about 30 to his 60.

phrases.trans_en: To be going on with means in order to continue with the present activity or situation

examples.ch: 继续下去我们的油漆够用吗，我是不是该外出时再买一些？
examples.en: Do we have enough paint to be going on with, or should I get some more while I'm out?

defines.trans_en: into a closed position

examples.ch: 我只是要把门推上。
examples.en: I'll just push the door to.

defines.trans_en: (on) the present day

examples.ch: 今天几号？
examples.en: What's the date today?

examples.ch: 他今天某个时候要给你打电话。
examples.en: He's going to call you at some point today.

examples.ch: 今天甚至比昨天还热！
examples.en: Today is even hotter than yesterday!

examples.ch: 那是今天的报纸吗？
examples.en: Is that today's paper?

examples.ch: 他一个星期后的今天回来。
examples.en: He should be back today a week today (= one week from today).

defines.trans_en: used more generally to mean the present time

examples.ch: 现在人们比过去更关注自己的健康。
examples.en: Today, people are much more concerned about their health than they were in the past.

examples.ch: 有了今天的技术，似乎一切皆有可能。
examples.en: With today's technology almost anything seems possible.

examples.ch: 如今的年轻人不知道他们有多幸运。
examples.en: The youth of today don't know how lucky they are.

defines.trans_en: with each other

examples.ch: 我们过去常常一起去做瑜伽。
examples.en: We used to go to yoga together.

examples.ch: 几年前我们一起做过项目。
examples.en: We worked together on a project a couple of years back.

examples.ch: 你能替我把这些数字加在一起吗？
examples.en: Could you add these numbers together for me?

examples.ch: 你把所有干料混在一起后再加牛奶。
examples.en: You mix all the dry ingredients together before you add the milk.

examples.ch: 这两种味道我都喜欢，但我不喜欢把它们混在一起后的味道。
examples.en: I like both flavours separately but I don't like them together.

examples.ch: 你可以用一点儿胶水把它再粘合到一起。
examples.en: You could stick that back together (= join the separate parts to each other) with some glue.

examples.ch: 她说：“永远不要相信两只眼睛距离太近的男人！”
examples.en: She said, "Never trust a man whose eyes are so close together!"

examples.ch: 服务员问我们是不是一起的，我解释说我们是两拨人。
examples.en: The waiter asked if we were all together, so I explained that we were two separate parties.

examples.ch: 我们应该找个时候聚一聚，喝一杯。
examples.en: We should get together (= meet each other socially) some time and have a drink.

defines.trans_en: If two people are described as together, they have a close romantic and often sexual relationship with each other.

examples.ch: 米拉和埃利斯在一起至今已差不多有5年了。
examples.en: Mira and Ellis have been together now for almost five years.

defines.trans_en: at the same time

examples.ch: 这些包裹是分别寄出的，但是都一起到了。
examples.en: The packages were sent separately, but they all came together.

examples.ch: 我们能同时处理清单上的下面两项。
examples.en: We can deal with the next two items on the list together.

defines.trans_en: combined

examples.ch: 合起来他们一年肯定能挣30多万美元。
examples.en: Together they must earn over $300,000 a year.

examples.ch: 你们合在一起也不如她聪明。
examples.en: She's got more sense than the rest of you put together.

defines.trans_en: in one place

examples.ch: 我只要把我的东西收拾在一起，然后我们就可以离开。
examples.en: I'll just gather my stuff together, and then we can go.

phrases.trans_en: If two people get together or get it together, they start a sexual relationship with each other.

examples.ch: 我们在一群人一起时见过一两次面，但直到瑞秋的聚会后才真正好上。
examples.en: We'd seen each other a few times as part of a group, but we didn't really get it together till Rachel's party.

phrases.trans_en: in addition to; and also

examples.ch: 我欠你的电话费加上房租一共是300英镑。
examples.en: The money that I owe you for the phone together with the rent equals £300.

examples.ch: 那瓶香槟酒连同那些巧克力会是一份很好的礼物。
examples.en: That bottle of champagne together with those chocolates will make a nice present.

defines.trans_ch: 自信而有条理的；沉稳的
defines.trans_en: organized, confident of your abilities, and able to use them to achieve what you want

examples.ch: 作为一个16岁的年轻人，他给人的感觉是相当沉稳。
examples.en: For a sixteen-year-old, he seems pretty together.

phrases.trans_en: to get something organized

examples.ch: 我们原打算圣诞节去滑雪，可是却总没有成行。
examples.en: We were going to go skiing over Christmas but we never got it together.

defines.trans_en: a bowl-shaped device with a seat that you sit on or stand near when emptying the body of urine or solid waste, or another device used for this purpose

examples.ch: 电话铃响时我正在上厕所。
examples.en: I was on (= using) the toilet when the phone rang.

examples.ch: 别忘了冲马桶。
examples.en: Don't forget to flush the toilet.

examples.ch: 对不起，刘易斯小姐，我要去一下洗手间。
examples.en: Excuse me, Miss Lewis, I need/want (to go to) the toilet.

examples.ch: 马桶座圈裂了，卫生纸也没有了。
examples.en: The toilet seat was cracked and there was no paper.

defines.trans_en: a room with a toilet in it

examples.ch: 卫生间里有人。
examples.en: Someone's in the toilet.

defines.trans_en: the process of washing and dressing yourself

examples.ch: 那天晚上弗吉尼娅梳洗打扮的时间比平时要久，效果很好。
examples.en: Virginia had spent longer than usual over her toilet that evening, with pleasing results.

phrases.trans_en: to empty the body of urine or solid waste, usually using a toilet to do so

examples.ch: 孩子们，我们要作长途旅行，所以如果要上厕所现在就去。
examples.en: It's going to be a long drive, kids, so if you want to go to the toilet, do so now.

phrases.trans_en: a room or small building in a public place in which there are several toilets

examples.ch: 你知道女厕所在哪儿吗？
examples.en: Do you know where the ladies' toilets are?

defines.trans_en: a round, red fruit with a lot of seeds, eaten cooked or uncooked as a vegetable, for example in salads or sauces

examples.ch: 西红柿切片
examples.en: a sliced tomato

examples.ch: 番茄沙拉／汤
examples.en: tomato salad/soup

examples.ch: 番茄酱意大利面
examples.en: pasta with a tomato sauce

defines.trans_en: (on) the day after today

examples.ch: 我明天晚上跟瑞秋共进晚餐。
examples.en: I'm having dinner with Rachel tomorrow night.

examples.ch: 哦，把它留到明天吧。
examples.en: Oh, leave it till tomorrow.

examples.ch: 约翰来参加明天的会议吗？
examples.en: Is John coming to tomorrow's meeting?

examples.ch: 他将在八天后回来。
examples.en: He'll be back tomorrow week/a week tomorrow (= a week from tomorrow).

examples.ch: 他将在八天后回来。
examples.en: He'll be back a week from tomorrow.

defines.trans_en: used more generally to mean the future

examples.ch: 今天的问题儿童可能会成为明天的罪犯。
examples.en: Today's problem child may be tomorrow's criminal.

examples.ch: 我们现在作些牺牲是为了给我们的孩子一个更加美好的未来。
examples.en: We make sacrifices now to give our children a better tomorrow.

defines.trans_en: (during) the night of the present day

examples.ch: 今晚将是我与她见面的第一次机会。
examples.en: Tonight will be my first chance to meet her.

examples.ch: 今晚的会议将在学校的大礼堂举行。
examples.en: Tonight's meeting will take place in the school hall.

defines.trans_en: more than is needed or wanted; more than is suitable or enough

examples.ch: 我太胖了。
examples.en: I'm too fat.

examples.ch: 我够不着书架——它（有点儿）太高了。
examples.en: I can't reach the shelf - it's (a bit) too high.

examples.ch: 这么小的房间人太多了。
examples.en: There were (far) too many people for such a small room.

examples.ch: 这太难了，（我）无法解释。
examples.en: It's too hard (for me) to explain.

examples.ch: 作为孩子房间的书桌，这个太贵了。
examples.en: It was too expensive a desk for a child's room.

examples.ch: 这太过分了，我受不了。
examples.en: It's (all) too much (= more than I can deal with) - I can't stand it.

defines.trans_en: (especially at the end of a sentence) in addition, also

examples.ch: 我也想来。
examples.en: I'd like to come too.

examples.ch: “我喜欢巧克力。”“我也喜欢。”
examples.en: "I love chocolate." "Me too."

defines.trans_en: used to show surprise

examples.ch: 这张阳光穿过树林的照片很漂亮——还是一个孩子拍的！
examples.en: It's a wonderful picture of light shining through trees - and by a child too!

defines.trans_en: very, or completely

examples.ch: 我告诉他这个错误时，他不太高兴。
examples.en: He wasn't too pleased/happy when I told him about the mistake.

examples.ch: 我妈妈最近身体不太好。
examples.en: My mother hasn't been too well recently.

examples.ch: 谢谢，你太好了。
examples.en: Thank you, you're too kind.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调对否定陈述的肯定回答）
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize a positive answer to a negative statement

examples.ch: “我今天不想上学。”“你必须上！”
examples.en: "I'm not going to school today." "You are too!"

phrases.trans_ch: 太，过于（用于形容词或副词前，强调不好的意味）
phrases.trans_en: used before an adjective or adverb to emphasize a negative meaning

examples.ch: 假期过得太快了。
examples.en: The holidays flew by all too quickly.

phrases.trans_ch: 太，非常（用于形容词前，强调积极的意味）
phrases.trans_en: used before an adjective to emphasize a positive meaning

examples.ch: “你想捐助吗？”“我非常乐意。”
examples.en: "Would you like to make a donation?" "I'd be only too pleased."

defines.trans_en: one of the hard, white objects in the mouth that are used for biting and chewing (= crushing food)

examples.ch: 破损／掉了的牙齿
examples.en: a broken/missing tooth

examples.ch: 前／后牙
examples.en: front/back teeth

examples.ch: 假牙
examples.en: false teeth

examples.ch: 早晚要好好刷牙。
examples.en: Brush/Clean your teeth thoroughly morning and night.

examples.ch: 我不得不拔了颗牙。
examples.en: I had to have a tooth out (US pulled) (= removed).

defines.trans_ch: （工具边缘、梳子、锯、拉链等的）齿状物，齿
defines.trans_en: any of the row of points that stick out from the edge of a tool or piece of equipment, such as a comb, saw, or zip

phrases.trans_en: effective force or power

examples.ch: 这个委员会可以提出建议，但没有实权。
examples.en: This committee can make recommendations but it has no real teeth.

defines.trans_en: a small brush with a long handle that you use to clean your teeth
the highest place or part

examples.ch: 她在楼梯梯顶位置等我。
examples.en: She waited for me at the top of the stairs.

examples.ch: 许多大楼的楼顶都有旗子。
examples.en: There were flags on the tops of many of the buildings.

examples.ch: 桌上有一堆书。
examples.en: There was a pile of books on top of (= on) the table.

defines.trans_en: the flat upper surface of something

examples.ch: 桌面／课桌面被划得很厉害。
examples.en: The top of the table/desk was badly scratched.

defines.trans_en: any piece of light clothing worn on the part of the body above the waist

examples.ch: 暴露的上装
examples.en: a skimpy top

examples.ch: 睡衣上装
examples.en: a pyjama top

examples.ch: 我需要一件上衣配这条裤子。
examples.en: I need a top to go with these trousers.

defines.trans_en: the cover or lid used to close a container or pen

examples.ch: 螺旋盖
examples.en: a screw-on top

examples.ch: 瓶盖
examples.en: a bottle top

examples.ch: 笔帽
examples.en: a pen top

defines.trans_en:
a 
spinning top
a piece of jewellery, usually one of a pair, worn in a hole in the ear or fastened to the ear by a clip; an earring

phrases.trans_ch: 最重要的职位；最高的地位
phrases.trans_en: the most important position in a group or organization

examples.ch: 40岁时，他处于职场生涯的顶峰。
examples.en: At 40, he was at the top of his profession.

examples.ch: 身居高位压力很大。
examples.en: Life at the top is stressful.

phrases.trans_en: the leaves of a vegetable plant grown mainly for its roots

examples.ch: 我们拿一些甜菜叶子喂这只兔子。
examples.en: We fed the rabbit some beetroot tops.

examples.ch: 胡萝卜叶子放在水中就会生长。
examples.en: If you put carrot tops in water they start to grow.

defines.trans_en: at the highest part of something

examples.ch: 照片的左上角有一处污迹。
examples.en: There's a dirty mark on the top left-hand corner of the picture.

examples.ch: 办公室在大楼的顶层。
examples.en: The offices are on the top floor of the building.

examples.ch: 他站在梯子的最高一级。
examples.en: He was standing on the top rung of a ladder.

examples.ch: 球沿着一条弧线飞进了球门上角。
examples.en: The ball curled into the top corner of the net.

defines.trans_en: in the part nearest to the highest part; in the upper part

examples.ch: 最上面几级梯级受损断了。
examples.en: The top few steps were damaged and broken.

defines.trans_ch: 最重要的（地）；最成功的（地）；最好的（地）
defines.trans_en: (in the position of being) most important or successful; best

examples.ch: 那么你度假的首选地是哪里？
examples.en: So what would be your top choice of a place to go on holiday?

examples.ch: 他的国际象棋水平居该国前10%之列。
examples.en: As a chess player he's among the top ten percent in the country.

defines.trans_ch: （人、机构、活动）最重要的，最成功的
defines.trans_en: Top people, organizations, or activities are the most important or successful ones.

examples.ch: 头号选手／顶级经理人
examples.en: top athletes/executives

examples.ch: 高级职位
examples.en: top jobs

examples.ch: 一流学校
examples.en: top schools

phrases.trans_en: as fast as possible

examples.ch: 火车全速隆隆地驶过车站。
examples.en: The train thundered through the station at top speed.

phrases.trans_en: to be the student with the best results

examples.ch: 她在班里英语成绩最好。
examples.en: She came top (of the class) in English.

examples.ch: 萨姆自然课考了第一。
examples.en: Sam was top at/in Science.

phrases.trans_en: feeling or doing things as well as possible

examples.ch: 保罗病愈后又恢复到了最佳状态。
examples.en: Paul's back on top form after his illness.

defines.trans_en: excellent

examples.ch: “你的聚会怎么样？”“好得很，老兄。”
examples.en: "How was your party?" "Top, mate."

examples.ch: “这么说，你要来？”“是的，太好了！”
examples.en: "You coming, then? " "Yeah, top!"

defines.trans_en: to be on the upper surface of something, especially as a decoration

examples.ch: 这份甜点上涂了泡沫状奶油，放了几块水果。
examples.en: The dessert was topped off with whipped cream and pieces of fruit.

defines.trans_en: to be the most important, most successful, etc.

examples.ch: 这首歌5周以来一直位居销售排行榜之首。
examples.en: The song topped the charts (= sold the largest number of recordings) for five weeks.

examples.ch: 她是主演。
examples.en: She topped the bill (= was the most important act in the show).

defines.trans_en: to do, pay, etc. more or better than anyone else

examples.ch: “他们给我开价1000英镑。”“恐怕我们开不出比这再高的价。”
examples.en: "They've offered me £1,000." "I'm afraid we can't top that."

examples.ch: 她自己提出了一个建议，甚至比我的还好。
examples.en: She topped my suggestion with an even better one of her own.

phrases.trans_en: to kill yourself

defines.trans_ch: （与许多单词连用）最好的，一流的
defines.trans_en: used with many different words to mean "best"

examples.ch: 一流运动员
examples.en: a top-class athlete

examples.ch: 高级官员
examples.en: top-ranking officers

defines.trans_en: the amount you get when several smaller amounts are added together

examples.ch: 一天中的那个时候，只有一人乘坐的汽车几乎占车辆总数的80%。
examples.en: At that time of day, cars with only one occupant accounted for almost 80 percent of the total.

examples.ch: 总共有21匹马报名参加了比赛。
examples.en: A total of 21 horses were entered in the race.

examples.ch: 在3天的交易中，我们一共赚了1000美元。
examples.en: We made $1,000 in total, over three days of trading.

defines.trans_en: including everything

examples.ch: 全部费用
examples.en: the total cost

examples.ch: 总损失为800美元。
examples.en: Total losses were $800.

defines.trans_en: very great or of the largest degree possible

examples.ch: 绝密
examples.en: total secrecy

examples.ch: 对他们的感受全然不顾
examples.en: a total disregard for their feelings

examples.ch: 万籁俱寂
examples.en: total silence

examples.ch: 这次活动的组织工作糟糕透了。
examples.en: The organization of the event was a total shambles (= very bad).

examples.ch: 这种崩溃一旦来临，便无可救药。
examples.en: The collapse, when it came, was total.

defines.trans_en: to have as a complete amount, or to calculate this

examples.ch: 该丛书总共有21册，这是第8册。
examples.en: This is the eighth volume in the series, which totals 21 volumes in all.

examples.ch: 我们把每个人赚的钱加起来，然后我们三个人平分这笔钱。
examples.en: We totalled (up) the money we had each earned, and then shared it equally between the three of us.

defines.trans_en: to damage a vehicle so badly that it cannot be repaired

examples.ch: 这辆皮卡买了十个月就被他儿子完全弄坏了。
examples.en: His son totaled the pickup when it was ten months old.

defines.trans_en: to damage something extremely badly

examples.ch: 大众汽车的名誉受到的不是一点小小的损失，而是可能完全被毁掉了。
examples.en: Volkswagen hasn't just put a few dings in its brand; it may have totaled it.

defines.trans_en: a visit to a place or area, especially one during which you look around the place or area and learn about it

examples.ch: 我们在导游的带领下参观了大教堂／博物馆／工厂。
examples.en: We went on a guided tour of the cathedral/museum/factory.

examples.ch: 一辆公共汽车载着我们游览了这座城市。
examples.en: A bus took us on a sightseeing tour of the city.

examples.ch: 导游
examples.en: a tour guide

defines.trans_en: a journey made for pleasure, especially as a holiday, visiting several different places in an area

examples.ch: 在普罗旺斯骑自行车旅游
examples.en: a cycling tour of Provence

examples.ch: 他们刚从加州的酿酒区旅行回来。
examples.en: They've just come back from a tour of (UK also round) California's wine country.

examples.ch: 旅行社称预订旅游的人数减少了。
examples.en: Tour operators (= companies which arrange holidays for people) have reported a drop in sales.

defines.trans_ch: （政治家、运动队、演出团体等的）巡视，巡回比赛，巡回演出
defines.trans_en: a planned visit to several places in a country or area made for a special purpose, such as one made by a politician, sports team, or group of performers

examples.ch: 巡回演讲／音乐会
examples.en: a lecture/concert tour

examples.ch: 女王将到澳大利亚进行为期两周的巡访。
examples.en: The Queen is making a two-week tour of Australia.

examples.ch: 她今晚将在伯明翰演出，这是她全国性巡回演出的第3站。
examples.en: She is performing in Birmingham tonight, on the third leg of (= stage of) her nationwide tour.

examples.ch: 英格兰板球队正在巴基斯坦打巡回比赛。
examples.en: The England cricket team is on tour in Pakistan.

defines.trans_ch: 任期;执勤期（同 tour of duty）
defines.trans_en:
a 
tour of duty

defines.trans_ch: （到…）旅行，游历；（到…）巡回比赛，巡视
defines.trans_en: to go on a tour somewhere

examples.ch: 我们在肯尼亚各地游玩了一个月。
examples.en: We spent a month touring (around/round/in) Kenya.

examples.ch: 今年冬天新西兰队将去欧洲参加一系列巡回赛。
examples.en: The New Zealand team will be touring (in) Europe this winter.

examples.ch: 总统昨天巡视了美国军事基地。
examples.en: The president toured US military bases yesterday.

examples.ch: 该乐队目前正在各地巡回，推广他们的新唱片。
examples.en: The band is currently touring to promote the new album.

defines.trans_en: If a play tours a particular area, it is performed in several places there.

examples.ch: 这出戏将在首都首演，然后到国内其他地方巡回演出。
examples.en: The play will be performed first in the capital, and will then tour the rest of the country.

defines.trans_en: someone who visits a place for pleasure and interest, usually while on holiday

examples.ch: 每年有数百万游客来到罗马。
examples.en: Millions of tourists visit Rome every year.

examples.ch: 每年都有潮水般的游客涌向地中海。
examples.en: Hordes (= very large groups) of tourists flock to the Mediterranean each year.

examples.ch: 迪斯尼乐园是佛罗里达州的主要旅游景点之一。
examples.en: Disneyworld is one of Florida's major tourist attractions.

examples.ch: 这个岛在旅游旺季很繁忙。
examples.en: The island is very busy during the tourist season.

defines.trans_en: a member of a sports team who is travelling from place to place in a foreign country, playing games

examples.ch: 西印度群岛队轻而易举地打败了前来打巡回比赛的对手。
examples.en: The West Indies easily defeated the tourists.

defines.trans_en: a piece of cloth or paper used for drying someone or something that is wet

examples.ch: 她淋浴后裹着毛巾走下楼来。
examples.en: She came downstairs after her shower, wrapped in a towel.

examples.ch: 他用纸巾将撒出的水擦干。
examples.en: He used a paper towel to mop up the spill.

defines.trans_en: to rub something with a towel to dry it

examples.ch: 她用毛巾把头发擦干。
examples.en: She towelled her hair dry.

examples.ch: 游完泳，我们很快用毛巾擦干身体。
examples.en: After our swim, we quickly towelled ourselves down.

defines.trans_en: a place where people live and work, containing many houses, shops, places of work, places of entertainment, etc., and usually larger than a village but smaller than a city

examples.ch: 海滨城镇
examples.en: a seaside/coastal town

examples.ch: 渔业／矿业／工业城镇
examples.en: a fishing/mining/industrial town

examples.ch: 他出生于约克郡的卡斯尔福德小镇。
examples.en: He was born in the small town of Castleford, in Yorkshire.

examples.ch: 我们住在镇上最好的旅馆里。
examples.en: We stayed in the best hotel in town.

examples.ch: 进／出城的主要公路
examples.en: the main road into/out of town

defines.trans_en: the part of a town where most of the businesses are

examples.ch: 午饭时我要到商业区去买些东西。
examples.en: I'm going into/to town at lunchtime to do some shopping.

examples.ch: 我在城里的商业区遇见了查尔斯。
examples.en: I met Charles while I was in town.

defines.trans_ch: （某国或某地区的）中心城市，都会
defines.trans_en: the most important city or town in a country or area

examples.ch: 我们进城去看戏。
examples.en: We went up to town to see a play.

examples.ch: 许多人从埃塞克斯到伦敦城里去上班。
examples.en: Many people commute into town (= London) from Essex.

defines.trans_en: the place where you live or work

examples.ch: 我要离开这里几天。
examples.en: I'm leaving town for a few days.

examples.ch: 芭芭拉本周出差了。
examples.en: Barbara is out of town on business this week.

phrases.trans_en: the people who live in the town

examples.ch: 全镇的人都希望本镇的足球队在明天的决赛中获胜。
examples.en: The whole town is/are hoping that their team will win the final tomorrow.

phrases.trans_en: a town or city, rather than the countryside

examples.ch: 我一直住在城里。
examples.en: I've always lived in the town.

defines.trans_en: an object for children to play with

examples.ch: 装有发条的玩具
examples.en: a clockwork/wind-up toy

examples.ch: 可爱的／柔软的／填充玩具
examples.en: a cuddly/soft/stuffed toy

examples.ch: 玩具火车／农场／士兵
examples.en: a toy train/farm/soldier

examples.ch: 现在把玩具收拾好——该睡觉了。
examples.en: Put your toys away now - it's time for bed.

examples.ch: 别碰爸爸的照相机——它不是玩具！
examples.en: Leave daddy's camera alone - it isn't a toy!

defines.trans_en: an object that is used by an adult for pleasure rather than for serious use

examples.ch: 他的新玩意儿是一台水下摄影机。
examples.en: His latest toy is an underwater camera.

examples.ch: 她桌上有几件行政人员用的小东西。
examples.en: She has several executive toys on her desk.

defines.trans_en: belonging or relating to a very small breed of dog that is kept as a pet

examples.ch: 小卷毛狗／小长毛垂耳猎犬
examples.en: a toy poodle/spaniel

defines.trans_en: the number of vehicles moving along roads, or the amount of aircraft, trains, or ships moving along a route

examples.ch: 今天早晨道路上车流量很大。
examples.en: There was heavy/a lot of traffic on the roads this morning.

examples.ch: 我们碰上交通阻塞被堵了好几个小时。
examples.en: We got stuck in traffic for several hours.

examples.ch: 这个城市已经采取了新措施，试图缓解交通拥堵。
examples.en: New measures have been introduced to try and ease traffic congestion in the city.

examples.ch: 有5人在交通事故中受伤。
examples.en: Five people were injured in a traffic accident (= one involving vehicles).

examples.ch: 我在今早电台的交通节目中听到了这起事故。
examples.en: I heard about the accident on the traffic report on the radio this morning.

examples.ch: 在过去的10年里，空中交通量增加了30%。
examples.en: Air traffic has increased 30 percent in the last decade.

defines.trans_en: people or goods transported by road, air, train, or ship, as a business

examples.ch: 该航空公司因运输量骤降而削减了一半的海外业务。
examples.en: The airline halved its overseas service because of a sharp reduction in traffic.

examples.ch: 环保团体想要把更多的客运和货运业务从公路转移到铁路上。
examples.en: Environmental groups want more passenger and freight traffic moved off the roads and onto trains.

defines.trans_en: illegal trade

examples.ch: 打击毒品买卖
examples.en: to cut down the traffic in drugs/the drug traffic

examples.ch: 警方正在想方设法遏制非法枪支交易。
examples.en: Police are looking for ways of curbing the traffic in guns.

defines.trans_en: the activity of data and messages passing through an online communication system or the number of visits to a particular website

examples.ch: 网络流量
examples.en: internet traffic

examples.ch: 推特的流量
examples.en: Twitter traffic

examples.ch: 网络/网站/站点的流量
examples.en: web/website/site traffic

examples.ch: 我们可以为您提供有关如何增加网站流量和提升销售量的建议。
examples.en: We can give you advice on how to improve your site traffic and generate sales.

defines.trans_en: to buy and sell goods illegally

examples.ch: 他们因非法交易国家保护鸟类所产的蛋而被捕。
examples.en: They were arrested for trafficking in the eggs of protected species of birds.

defines.trans_en: to illegally buy or sell people, or make money from work they are forced to do, such as sex work

examples.ch: 据估计全球每年有70至200万妇女儿童被贩卖。
examples.en: It is estimated that between 700,000 and 2 million women and children are trafficked globally each year.

defines.trans_en: a railway engine connected to carriages for carrying people or to wheeled containers for carrying goods

examples.ch: 一列货运／客运列车
examples.en: a goods/freight/passenger train

examples.ch: 开往／发自布里斯托尔的列车
examples.en: the train to/from Bristol

examples.ch: 乘火车旅行／火车站
examples.en: a train journey/station

examples.ch: 你是乘火车来的吗？
examples.en: Did you come by train?

examples.ch: 她赶上了去爱丁堡的火车／她乘火车去爱丁堡。
examples.en: She caught/took the train to Edinburgh.

examples.ch: 快点，不然我们就赶不上火车了。
examples.en: Hurry up, or we'll miss (= arrive too late for) the train.

defines.trans_en: a line of animals, people, or things moving along together

examples.ch: 马车队
examples.en: a wagon train

examples.ch: 骡／骆驼队
examples.en: a mule/camel train

defines.trans_en: the part of a long dress that spreads out onto the floor behind the person wearing it

examples.ch: 拖着长长的裙裾且做工精细的婚纱
examples.en: an elaborate wedding dress with a long train

phrases.trans_en: a series of connected thoughts or events

examples.ch: 是怎样的思路使你从拿破仑想到全球变暖？
examples.en: What amazing train of thought led you from Napoleon to global warming?

examples.ch: 这本书描述了导致暗杀的一连串事件。
examples.en: The book describes the train of events that led up to the assassination.

defines.trans_en: to prepare someone or yourself for a job, activity, or sport, by learning skills and/or by mental or physical exercise

examples.ch: 她接受过飞行训练。
examples.en: She trained as a pilot.

examples.ch: 约翰接受训练成为一名会计。
examples.en: John trained to be an accountant.

examples.ch: 我必须锻炼自己，使自己在工作中更加自信。
examples.en: I had to train myself to be more assertive at work.

examples.ch: 她为参加赛跑比赛而刻苦训练，有时一周能跑60英里。
examples.en: She trained hard for the race, sometimes running as much as 60 miles a week.

examples.ch: 我正尝试着训练我的孩子自己收拾东西。
examples.en: I'm trying to train my kids to pick up after themselves.

defines.trans_ch: 把（枪、相机、光等）对准，将…瞄准
defines.trans_en: to aim or point a gun, camera, light, etc. at someone or something

examples.ch: 5把枪突然对准他时，他感到紧张也就不足为奇了。
examples.en: With five guns suddenly trained on him, he was understandably nervous.

defines.trans_ch: （通过修剪、捆扎）使（植物）朝特定方向生长;修整
defines.trans_en: to direct the growth of a plant in a particular direction by cutting it and tying it

examples.ch: 葡萄藤被修整得在拱门上方生长，不仅结出果实，还能遮阴。
examples.en: The vines were trained over an arch, providing shade as well as fruit.

defines.trans_ch: 教员，教练;培训师;驯兽师
defines.trans_en: a person who teaches skills to people or animals and prepares them for a job, activity, or sport

examples.ch: 他们展示了这匹马和驯马师的照片。
examples.en: They showed pictures of the horse and its trainer (= the person who prepared it for its races).

examples.ch: 许多富人都有自己的私人健身教练。
examples.en: A lot of wealthy people have their own personal trainer (= a person they employ to help them exercise).

defines.trans_en: a type of light, comfortable shoe that can be worn for sport

defines.trans_ch: （通常在市内运营的）有轨电车
defines.trans_en: an electric vehicle that transports people, usually in cities, and goes along metal tracks in the road
to make a journey, usually over a long distance

examples.ch: 中学毕业后，她在上大学以前花了1年时间旅行，主要是在非洲和亚洲。
examples.en: Between school and university, she spent a year travelling, mostly in Africa and Asia.

examples.ch: 我乘火车上班。
examples.en: I travel to work by train.

examples.ch: 他从1000多英里外过来参加婚礼。
examples.en: He travelled over 1,000 miles to be at the wedding.

examples.ch: 他年轻时周游过世界。
examples.en: As a young man he had travelled (= been to many parts of) the world.

defines.trans_en: to move or go from one place to another

examples.ch: 超音速飞机的速度比音速快。
examples.en: Supersonic planes can travel faster than the speed of sound.

defines.trans_en: If something such as food travels well/badly, it does/does not stay in good condition if it is moved long distances.

examples.ch: 一些葡萄酒经不起长途运输。
examples.en: Some wines don't travel well.

phrases.trans_en: to move very fast

examples.ch: 那辆自行车可以骑得很快！
examples.en: That bike can really travel!

phrases.trans_en: to make a journey without taking a lot of heavy things with you

examples.ch: 我总是尽可能轻装旅行。
examples.en: I always try to travel light.

defines.trans_en: the activity of travelling

examples.ch: 航空／航天旅行
examples.en: air/space travel

examples.ch: 出差
examples.en: business travel

examples.ch: 我们都爱好文学、美食和旅游。
examples.en: We share a love of literature, food and travel.

examples.ch: 我从旅游新闻中得知发生了一起事故。
examples.en: I heard on the travel news that there'd been an accident.

phrases.trans_en: journeys

examples.ch: 她在远东游历的记录
examples.en: a record of her travels in/around the Far East

defines.trans_en: a tall plant that has a wooden trunk and branches that grow from its upper part

examples.ch: 李子／苹果／栗子树
examples.en: a plum/apple/chestnut tree

examples.ch: 橡／榆／枫树
examples.en: an oak/elm/maple tree

examples.ch: 我们坐在树下乘凉。
examples.en: We sat under a tree for shade.

defines.trans_en: another type of tall plant, without a wooden trunk

examples.ch: 棕榈树
examples.en: palm trees

defines.trans_en: a journey in which you go somewhere, usually for a short time, and come back again

examples.ch: 乘火车从约克到纽卡斯尔大约要花1个小时。
examples.en: The trip from York to Newcastle takes about an hour by train.

examples.ch: 我们今年夏天去挪威旅行。
examples.en: We're going on a trip to Norway this summer.

examples.ch: 我觉得我们可以租一艘汽艇，绕着海湾兜一圈。
examples.en: I thought we might hire a motorboat and take a trip round/around the bay.

examples.ch: 今年我们没钱再次去国外旅行。
examples.en: We can't afford another trip abroad this year.

examples.ch: 从机场到市中心有10英里路。
examples.en: It's a ten-mile trip from the airport to the hotel.

examples.ch: 她出差了，下周才回来。
examples.en: She's away on a business trip and won't be back until next week.

examples.ch: 今年你想参加学校的法国旅行活动吗？
examples.en: Do you want to go on the school trip to France this year?

examples.ch: 我在想我们周末可以去纽约购物。
examples.en: I was thinking we could go on a shopping trip to New York this weekend.

defines.trans_en: an occasion when you knock your foot against something and fall or lose your balance, or someone causes you to do this, when you are walking or running

examples.ch: 她在楼梯上重重地绊了一跤，把脚踝摔断了。
examples.en: She broke her ankle when she had a nasty trip on the stairs.

defines.trans_en: an experience in which someone sees, hears, or feels things that do not exist as a result of taking an illegal drug

examples.ch: 如果你心情沮丧时服用这种东西，会产生一种特别不舒服的幻觉。
examples.en: If you take this stuff when you're depressed, you'll have a really bad trip.

defines.trans_ch: 奇怪的，有娱乐性的，令人激动的人（或经历）
defines.trans_en: a person or experience that is strange or entertaining and exciting

examples.ch: 我的科学课老师真有娱乐性，他会说一些最奇怪的事情。
examples.en: My science teacher is such a trip - he says the most bizarre things.

phrases.trans_ch: 强烈的内疚／拥有权力的快感／极度自负心理
phrases.trans_en: a period of time when you experience a particular feeling strongly

examples.ch: 自从成为办公室主管后，她就一直陶醉在拥有权力的喜悦之中。
examples.en: She's been on a real power trip since she became the office manager.

examples.ch: 我像众多有工作的妈妈一样，对孩子深感歉疚。
examples.en: I suffer from the classic working mother's guilt trip.

defines.trans_en: to lose your balance after knocking your foot against something when you are walking or running, or to cause someone to do this

examples.ch: 他绊了个跟头，擦伤了膝盖。
examples.en: He tripped and fell down, grazing his knee.

examples.ch: 那根电缆很危险，可能会绊到人。
examples.en: That cable is dangerous. Someone might trip over it.

examples.ch: 他因故意绊倒正要起脚射门得分的罗布森而被罚下场。
examples.en: He was sent off for deliberately tripping Robson when he was about to score.

defines.trans_en: to move with quick, gentle steps

examples.ch: 她身着晚礼服轻盈地走下楼梯，显得光彩照人。
examples.en: She looked stunning as she tripped down the stairs in her ball gown.

defines.trans_ch: 转动（开关）;转动开关开动（或关掉）
defines.trans_en: to move a switch that operates an electrical system, or to cause such a system to start or stop working by moving a switch

examples.ch: 有一种特殊系统防止电路因电力激增或闪电而被意外切断。
examples.en: A special system prevents the circuitry from being tripped accidentally by a power surge or lightning strike.

defines.trans_en: to experience the effects of taking an illegal drug that causes the user to see, hear, or feel things that do not exist

examples.ch: 他在学生时代经常服用迷幻药，成天晕晕乎乎。
examples.en: As a student he spent a lot of time tripping out on LSD.

defines.trans_en: problems or difficulties

examples.ch: 这张税务表格十分复杂，我填起来很费劲。
examples.en: The tax forms were complicated and I had a lot of trouble with them.

examples.ch: 问题眼下看起来是过去了，但以后可能会有更多的麻烦。
examples.en: Their problems seem to be over for the moment, but there could be more trouble ahead.

examples.ch: 父亲来和我们一起住之后，麻烦就开始了。
examples.en: The trouble started/began when my father came to live with us.

examples.ch: 做父母的常常难以找到好的看护者照顾小孩子。
examples.en: Parents often have trouble finding good carers for their children.

examples.ch: 我们开始召开电话会议，因为进出城市都很麻烦。
examples.en: We started holding meetings by phone, as travelling in and out of the city became too much trouble.

examples.ch: 我周末应该可以不费太大力气就能完成它。
examples.en: I should get it finished over the weekend without too much trouble.

examples.ch: 如果你现在不去看牙医，就是在给将来找麻烦。
examples.en: You'll only be storing up trouble for the future if you don't go to the dentist now.

examples.ch: 她原以为一旦离了婚她的麻烦就会结束。
examples.en: She thought her troubles would be over once she'd got divorced.

examples.ch: 眼下我根本顾不上他的生日——我连付租金的钱都不够。
examples.en: His birthday is the least of my troubles at the moment - I don't even have enough money to pay the rent.

examples.ch: 目前大部分的问题源自于我们的新计算机系统。
examples.en: Most of the current troubles stem from (= are caused by) our new computer system.

defines.trans_en: a situation in which you experience problems, usually because of something you have done wrong or badly

examples.ch: 他以前从来没有受过老师的批评。
examples.en: He's never been in trouble with his teachers before.

examples.ch: 如果刮坏了萨姆的汽车她就会倒大霉。
examples.en: She'll be in big trouble if she scratches Sam's car.

examples.ch: 离婚后，他在经济上陷入了困境。
examples.en: He got into financial trouble after his divorce.

examples.ch: 我希望你不会因我对你爸爸说了那些话而受罚。
examples.en: I hope you won't get into trouble because of what I said to your dad.

examples.ch: 让小孩子去度假营是个很好的办法，这样可以让他们远离街头，不会惹是生非。
examples.en: The camp is a great way of getting kids off the street and keeping them out of trouble.

examples.ch: 我希望你没有因为我而受到老板的训斥。
examples.en: I hope I haven't landed you in trouble with your boss.

examples.ch: 由于丈夫酗酒，她的婚姻陷入了危机。
examples.en: The marriage ran into trouble because of her husband's heavy drinking.

examples.ch: 如果我们失去这份合同，公司将陷入严重的困境。
examples.en: The company will be in serious/real trouble if we lose this contract.

examples.ch: 他自去年出狱以来一直没有再惹麻烦。
examples.en: He's stayed out of trouble since he was released from jail last year.

defines.trans_en: a characteristic of someone or something that is considered a disadvantage or problem

examples.ch: 这种地毯的缺点是易脏。
examples.en: The trouble with this carpet is that it gets dirty very easily.

examples.ch: 这个想法非常好。唯一的问题是我们不知道这样要花多少钱。
examples.en: It's a brilliant idea. The only trouble is that we don't know how much it will cost.

examples.ch: 罗恩的缺点是太没有耐心。
examples.en: Ron's trouble is that he's too impatient.

defines.trans_en: problems or difficulties caused by something failing to operate as it should

examples.ch: 飞机起飞不久引擎就出现了故障。
examples.en: The plane developed engine trouble shortly after take-off.

examples.ch: 他们制造的汽车耐用、无故障，口碑很好。
examples.en: They have a good reputation for building reliable trouble-free cars.

examples.ch: 由于膝伤，她可能无法参加本赛季余下的比赛。
examples.en: Her knee trouble is expected to keep her out of the game for the rest of the season.

defines.trans_en: problems in the form of arguments, fighting, or violence

examples.ch: 听着，我可不想这儿出什么乱子，请你赶快喝完走人。
examples.en: Listen, I don't want any trouble in here, so please just finish your drink and leave.

examples.ch: 我父母说一看见出了乱子就马上离开。
examples.en: My parents said we had to leave at the first sign of trouble.

examples.ch: 我的小弟总是想挑起我和男朋友之间的争吵。
examples.en: My little brother's always trying to stir up (= create) trouble between me and my boyfriend.

defines.trans_en: slight problems or effort

examples.ch: 我并不想给你添任何麻烦。
examples.en: I didn't mean to cause you any trouble.

examples.ch: “如果不太麻烦的话，我还想要些咖啡。”“噢，一点也不麻烦。”
examples.en: "I'd love some more coffee, if it isn't too much trouble." "Oh, it's no trouble at all."

examples.ch: 我不想给你添任何麻烦。
examples.en: I don't want to put you to any trouble (= create any work for you).

examples.ch: 如果你用心听我讲了，你就会明白我讲的是什么。
examples.en: If you took the trouble to listen to what I was saying, you'd know what I was talking about.

examples.ch: 他们费了很大的劲准备晚宴，可是竟有半数的客人没来。
examples.en: They went to a lot of trouble (= made a lot of effort) for their dinner party, but half the guests didn't bother to turn up.

examples.ch: 这太烦人了，可我觉得我不会费劲去提出正式投诉。
examples.en: It's annoying, but I don't think I'll go to the trouble of making an official complaint.

defines.trans_en: to cause someone to be worried or nervous

examples.ch: 我问她是不是有什么烦心事，但是她不想说。
examples.en: I asked her what was troubling her, but she didn't want to talk.

examples.ch: 我们许多人对主席的决定深感不安。
examples.en: Many of us are deeply troubled by the chairman's decision.

examples.ch: 你没有早点与我讨论你的问题，这使我感到不安。
examples.en: It troubles me (that) you didn't discuss your problems with me earlier.

defines.trans_en: to cause someone to have a problem or difficulties

examples.ch: 本赛季的大部分时间里，他都受到膝伤的困扰。
examples.en: He has been troubled by a knee injury for most of the season.

defines.trans_en: to cause someone a small amount of effort

examples.ch: 麻烦您再给我些葡萄酒好吗？
examples.en: May I trouble you for (= please give me) some more wine, please?

examples.ch: 麻烦你把那扇窗户打开好吗？恐怕我够不着。
examples.en: Could I trouble you to open that window? I can't reach it.

examples.ch: 我们目前不要费神去考虑细节问题。
examples.en: Let's not trouble ourselves (= make the effort to think) about the details at the moment.

defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing that covers the lower part of the body from the waist to the feet, consisting of two cylinder-shaped parts, one for each leg, that are joined at the top

examples.ch: 我需要一条新裤子来配这件夹克。
examples.en: I need a new pair of trousers to go with this jacket.

examples.ch: 戴维德，你为什么不穿长裤呢？
examples.en: Why aren't you wearing any trousers, David?

defines.trans_en: to attempt to do something

examples.ch: 不断努力，你最终会找到工作的。
examples.en: Keep trying and you'll find a job eventually.

examples.ch: 如果今年进不了这所专科学校，我明年还会努力的。
examples.en: If I don't get into the academy this year, I'll try again next year.

examples.ch: 尽管我很努力地劝他，但他就是不来。
examples.en: I've tried really hard but I can't convince him to come.

examples.ch: 我在尽最大努力，可就是做不来。
examples.en: I'm trying my best/hardest, but I just can't do it.

examples.ch: 我试着想打开窗户。
examples.en: I tried to open the window.

examples.ch: 也许早晨你应该早点起床。
examples.en: Maybe you should try getting up (= you should get up) earlier.

defines.trans_en: to test something to see if it is suitable or useful or if it works

examples.ch: 我昨晚尝试了你给我的那个食谱。
examples.en: I tried that recipe you gave me last night.

examples.ch: 我们不卖报纸，你去拐角处的那家商店问过吗？
examples.en: We don't sell newspapers - have you tried the coffee shop on the corner?

examples.ch: 试着用一下另一种洗发香波。
examples.en: Try using a different shampoo.

examples.ch: 我想我可能会尝试一下跳伞。
examples.en: I'd like to try parachuting.

examples.ch: 我忘了带门钥匙——我们最好试试窗户是否开着。
examples.en: I forgot my door-keys - we'd better try the window (= test it to see if it is open).

defines.trans_en: to examine a person accused of committing a crime in a law court by asking them questions and considering known facts, and then decide if they are guilty

examples.ch: 出于安全上的考虑，那些军官受到了秘密审判。
examples.en: Because of security implications the officers were tried in secret.

examples.ch: 他们因谋杀正在被审讯。
examples.en: They are being tried for murder.

defines.trans_en: to worry or annoy someone or upset a person's patience with many, often slight, difficulties

examples.ch: 这项工作的苛刻要求使他深受折磨。
examples.en: The demands of the job have tried him sorely.

examples.ch: 他整个早晨都在不停地问我问题，让我烦透了。
examples.en: He's been trying my patience all morning with his constant questions.

examples.ch: 他无休无止的要求即使一个圣者也会忍无可忍。
examples.en: Her endless demands would try the patience of a saint (= are very annoying).

phrases.trans_ch: 经反复考验证实是有效的
phrases.trans_en: used by many people and proved to be effective

examples.ch: 大多数人都会选择继续使用已经反复验证过的节约方法。
examples.en: Most people would prefer to stick to tried and tested methods of birth control.

defines.trans_en: an attempt to do something

examples.ch: 他们可能还有剩余的票——你为什么不试试呢？
examples.en: They might still have tickets left - why don't you give it a try?

examples.ch: 这将是她第三次尝试跳过横杆。
examples.en: This will be her third try at jumping the bar.

examples.ch: 你可以问他是否愿意——这值得一试。
examples.en: You could ask him if he's willing - it's worth a try.

defines.trans_ch: （橄榄球运动中）在对方球门线后带球触地得分
defines.trans_en: (in the game of rugby) the act of a player putting the ball on the ground behind the opposing team's goal line, which scores points for the player's team
to (cause to) move in a circle around a fixed point or line

examples.ch: 地球每24小时绕地轴自转一周。
examples.en: The earth turns on its axis once every 24 hours.

examples.ch: 她拎起裙摆踮着脚尖旋转。
examples.en: She turned on her toes, holding out her skirt.

examples.ch: 轮子开始转动了。
examples.en: The wheels started to turn (around).

examples.ch: 以最快速度打轮。
examples.en: Turn the steering wheel as quickly as you can.

examples.ch: 她转动门把手，悄悄地开了门。
examples.en: She turned the doorknob and quietly opened the door.

examples.ch: 我慢慢地拧动门把手。
examples.en: Slowly, I turned the door handle.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) change the direction in which you are facing or moving

examples.ch: 在红绿灯处向右拐。
examples.en: Turn right at the traffic lights.

examples.ch: 接下来这条小路有半英里是弯弯曲曲的。
examples.en: The path twists and turns for the next half mile.

examples.ch: 我们必须在下一个路口往右拐。
examples.en: We have to turn down/into/up the next road on the right.

examples.ch: 植物往往朝向光源生长。
examples.en: Plants tend to turn towards the source of light.

examples.ch: 她转过身面对他。
examples.en: She turned to face him.

examples.ch: 他转身向我们招手。
examples.en: He turned round and waved to us.

examples.ch: 他迅速转身离开了房间。
examples.en: He turned on his heel (= turned quickly to face the opposite direction) and left the room.

examples.ch: 我左边的人转向我，耳语道：“可别再来一场演讲！”
examples.en: The person on my left turned to me and whispered "Not another speech!"

examples.ch: 他的妻子想跟他说话，可他却转过身去不予理睬。
examples.en: His wife tried to speak to him, but he turned his back (on her)/turned away (from her) (= moved so that his back, not his face, was towards her to show his anger).

examples.ch: 大约3点钟，潮水开始涌动。
examples.en: At about three o'clock, the tide started to turn (= the sea started to come closer to or move away from the beach).

examples.ch: 他转过头来听我讲话。
examples.en: He turned his head to me to listen.

examples.ch: 我这就调转车头，原路返回。
examples.en: I'll just turn the car round and go back the way we came.

examples.ch: 我们一直看着那辆车子拐弯后才作罢。
examples.en: We watched until the car had turned (= gone around) the corner.

examples.ch: 军队朝抗议者开枪。
examples.en: The army turned their guns on (= pointed them at and started to shoot at) the protesters.

examples.ch: 她会空翻。
examples.en: She can turn (= perform) a somersault.

defines.trans_ch: 翻动（书页）;（使）翻转;（使）翻身
defines.trans_en: to move, or to move an object or page, so that a different side or surface is on the top

examples.ch: 现在请翻到下一页，开始做练习2。
examples.en: Now turn the page, please, and start work on Exercise 2.

examples.ch: 她把花瓶翻过来看价格。
examples.en: She turned the vase over to look for the price.

examples.ch: 他翻了两三页。
examples.en: He turned over two or three pages.

examples.ch: 她熄了灯，翻了个身，就睡着了。
examples.en: She put out the light, turned over (= rolled in order to face in another direction) and went to sleep.

examples.ch: 现在请翻到第23页，看第一段。
examples.en: Now turn to (= open the book at) page 23 and look at the first paragraph.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) become, change into, or come to be something

examples.ch: 天气突然变凉了。
examples.en: The weather has suddenly turned cold.

examples.ch: 当我拒绝付钱时，他的态度变得很恶劣。
examples.en: When I refused to pay, he turned nasty.

examples.ch: 她的脸色变得苍白，身子开始颤抖。
examples.en: She turned pale and started to shiver.

examples.ch: 当问题的严重程度披露后，会议的气氛开始变得严肃起来。
examples.en: The mood of the meeting turned solemn when the extent of the problem became known.

examples.ch: 这些公司一度合作得很好，但最后关系闹僵了。
examples.en: The companies worked well together for a while, but eventually the relationship turned sour (= became bad).

examples.ch: 基尔，从流行音乐歌星摇身成为商业巨子，已经推出了一个新系列的化妆品。
examples.en: Keele, pop star turned business tycoon, has launched a new range of cosmetics.

examples.ch: 干旱天气使土壤板结。
examples.en: The dry weather turned the soil into/to concrete.

examples.ch: 到9月底，叶子就开始变黄。
examples.en: By the end of September, the leaves have started to turn (= become brown).

examples.ch: 在我们谈话期间她的态度发生了转变，先是出于礼貌表示感兴趣，后来就变得很热情。
examples.en: Her attitude turned from politely interested to enthusiastic during the course of our conversation.

defines.trans_ch: 旋动，拧动（操纵装置）;（为升高或降低…而）旋动，拧动
defines.trans_en: to use a control to switch a piece of equipment or a power or water supply on or off, or to increase or reduce what it is producing

examples.ch: 关灯。
examples.en: Turn off/out the light.

examples.ch: 谁开的电视？
examples.en: Who turned the TV on?

examples.ch: 我叫他把暖气关小一点。
examples.en: I asked him to turn down the heating.

examples.ch: 把声音开大一些——我听不清他们在说什么。
examples.en: Turn the sound up - I can't hear what they're saying.

examples.ch: 用这个开关可以关闭暖气。
examples.en: The heater turns off (= can be switched off) using this switch.

defines.trans_en: to shape a piece of wood while it is attached to a machine that spins it

examples.ch: 车成的碗
examples.en: a turned bowl

phrases.trans_en: to become a particular age or time

examples.ch: 她去年满18岁。
examples.en: She turned 18 last year.

examples.ch: 刚到10点。
examples.en: It's just turned ten o'clock.

phrases.trans_en: to damage the muscles in the foot by suddenly twisting it too strongly

examples.ch: 她在石头上崴了脚，不得不蹒跚着走回营地。
examples.en: She turned her ankle on the rocks and had to hobble back to camp.

defines.trans_en: an opportunity or a duty to do something at a particular time or in a particular order, before or after other people

examples.ch: 轮到我了吗？
examples.en: Is it my turn yet?

examples.ch: 我等了很长时间才轮到见就业顾问，结果错过了公共汽车。
examples.en: I waited so long for my turn to see the careers adviser that I missed my bus.

examples.ch: 轮到你洗碗了！
examples.en: It's your turn to do the dishes!

examples.ch: 在这个游戏中，如果你回答错了，就会失去一次机会。
examples.en: In this game if you give the wrong answer you have to miss a turn.

defines.trans_en: an action that causes something to move in a circle round a fixed point

examples.ch: 将螺丝拧几下，确保它上紧了。
examples.en: Give the screw a couple of turns to make sure it's tight.

defines.trans_en: a change in the direction in which you are moving or facing

examples.ch: 当你在左手边看见学校时就立刻右转。
examples.en: When you see the school on the left, make a right turn.

examples.ch: 这条小路弯弯曲曲。
examples.en: The path was full of twists and turns.

defines.trans_en: a stage act or performance

examples.ch: 头几个节目是儿童歌舞。
examples.en: The first couple of turns were children singing and dancing.

defines.trans_ch: 不适感；奇怪的感觉；一惊，一吓
defines.trans_en: a slight illness, a strange feeling, or a nervous shock

examples.ch: 事故后我开始时不时地感到不适。
examples.en: After the accident I started having funny turns.

examples.ch: 这么多年以后再看到他真令我感到意外。
examples.en: It gave me quite a turn to see him after all these years.

phrases.trans_en: When a number of people take turns, they do the same thing one after the other.

examples.ch: 我们轮流接电话。
examples.en: We take turns answering the phone.

phrases.trans_en: one after the other in an agreed order

examples.ch: 我们轮流休息。
examples.en: Each of us takes a break in turn.

phrases.trans_ch: 即将转变的，正要转变的
phrases.trans_en: Something that is on the turn is about to change direction.

examples.ch: 要涨潮了。
examples.en: The tide is on the turn.

phrases.trans_en: the point at which something changes or moves in a different direction

examples.ch: 潮流的转变
examples.en: the turn of the tide

examples.ch: 她出生于世纪之交。
examples.en: She was born around the turn of the century (= around 1900, 2000, etc.).

phrases.trans_en: to develop in a particular way

examples.ch: 控制公司的争夺战今天发生了有趣的变化。
examples.en: The battle for control of the company took an interesting turn today.

examples.ch: 她母亲突然到来，情况发生了意想不到的变化。
examples.en: Events took an unexpected turn when her mother suddenly arrived.

phrases.text: take a turn for the better/worse
phrases.trans_en: to suddenly become better or worse

examples.ch: 他失业后他们的关系变得更糟了。
examples.en: Their relationship took a turn for the worse when he lost his job.

defines.trans_en: two times

examples.ch: 我已经问过他两次了。
examples.en: I've already asked him twice.

examples.ch: 邮件每天来两次。
examples.en: The post comes twice daily (= two times every day).

examples.ch: 这个地区的房屋数量是从前的两倍。
examples.en: There are twice as many houses in this area as there used to be.

examples.ch: 这个州至少是英格兰的两倍大。
examples.en: The state is at least twice as big as England.

examples.ch: 他的块头抵她两个。
examples.en: He's twice her size (= much bigger than she is).

defines.trans_en: a particular group of people or things that share similar characteristics and form a smaller division of a larger set

examples.ch: 面包种类繁多，我不知该买哪一种。
examples.en: There were so many different types of bread that I didn't know which to buy.

examples.ch: 她穿什么类型的衣服？
examples.en: What type of clothes does she wear?

examples.ch: 天太黑，我没有注意到是什么车型。
examples.en: It was dark so I didn't notice what type of car it was.

examples.ch: 他是那种你可以带回家见母亲的男人。
examples.en: He's the type of man you could take home to your mother.

examples.ch: 假如你喜欢白肤金发、爱好运动那一类型的话，他算是很有魅力的。
examples.en: He's very attractive, if you like the blond, athletic type.

examples.ch: 他们卖干花、花篮之类的东西。
examples.en: They sell dried flowers and baskets and that type of thing.

examples.ch: 我们有一系列适合各种肤质的润肤品。
examples.en: We have a range of moisturizers for all different skin types.

examples.ch: 她年龄不大，穿得又像学生，所以我还以为她在这儿上学。
examples.en: She was young and she was wearing student-type clothes, so I assumed she was studying here.

examples.ch: 他带我去了一个酒吧，那里到处是演员一类的人，希望能引起他们的注意。
examples.en: He took me to a bar full of actor types trying to get noticed.

defines.trans_en: a person who seems to represent a particular group of people, having all the qualities that you usually connect with that group

examples.ch: 他在剧中不用个性丰满的人物——他用的是类型化的人物。
examples.en: He doesn't use fully rounded characters in his plays - he uses types.

defines.trans_en: the style and size of printed letters used in a piece of printed writing such as in a newspaper, book, or article

examples.ch: 标题用黑体字。
examples.en: Use bold type for your headings.

examples.ch: 用这种软件有20多种字体可选择。
examples.en: The software allows you to choose from over 20 styles of typeface.

phrases.trans_ch: 是（某人）喜欢的那种类型
phrases.trans_en: to be the type of person that someone thinks is attractive

examples.ch: 他人倒是挺好，只是不是我喜欢的那种类型。
examples.en: He's a nice enough guy - he's just not my type.

examples.ch: 我还以为你会更喜欢本这种类型的人。
examples.en: I would have thought Ben was more your type.

defines.trans_ch: （用电脑键盘或打字机等）打字
defines.trans_en: to write using a machine, either a computer keyboard or a typewriter

examples.ch: 她叫我打几封信。
examples.en: She asked me to type a couple of letters.

examples.ch: 他打字很快。
examples.en: He can type very quickly.

examples.ch: 我打字打到凌晨，就为把事情做完。
examples.en: I was typing away into the early hours of the morning just to get it done.

defines.trans_en: a thick rubber ring, often filled with air, that is fitted around the outer edge of the wheel of a vehicle, allowing the vehicle to stick to the road surface and to travel over the ground more easily

examples.ch: 我的车胎没气了。
examples.en: I've got a flat tyre (= the air has gone out of it).

examples.ch: 他正在高速公路上行驶时，突然轮胎爆了。
examples.en: He was driving along the motorway when his tyre burst.

examples.ch: 我的车后有个备用轮胎。
examples.en: I keep a spare tyre in the back of the car.

defines.trans_en: a device for protection against the rain, consisting of a stick with a folding frame covered in material at one end and usually a handle at the other, or a similar, often larger, device used for protection against the sun

examples.ch: 我感到有几滴雨点，于是便撑起了雨伞。
examples.en: I felt a few drops of rain, so I put my umbrella up.

examples.ch: 我昨天把伞落在公交车上了。
examples.en: I left my umbrella on the bus yesterday.

examples.ch: 折叠伞
examples.en: a folding umbrella

defines.trans_en: something that includes or represents a group or range of similar things

examples.ch: 他经营一组公司，总称为Universal Foods。
examples.en: He runs a group of companies under the umbrella of Universal Foods.

examples.ch: 伊斯兰国家组织是代表57个伊斯兰国家的机构。
examples.en: The Organization of Islamic Conference is an umbrella organization representing 57 Muslim nations.

examples.ch: 存在主义实际上是一个把几位哲学家和作家的作品归并在一起的总称。
