examples.en: Existentialism was really an umbrella term to lump together the works of several philosophers and writers.

defines.trans_ch: 舅父;伯父;叔父;姨父;姑父
defines.trans_en: the brother of someone's mother or father, or the husband of someone's aunt or uncle

examples.ch: 我有很多叔叔、舅舅、姑姑和姨妈。
examples.en: I have lots of uncles and aunts.

examples.ch: 我们邀请了我的叔叔史蒂夫过来。
examples.en: We invited my Uncle Steve over.

examples.ch: 你给我带礼物了吗，杰克叔叔？
examples.en: Did you bring me a present, Uncle Jack?

defines.trans_ch: 叔叔，大叔（任何年纪比自己大的成年男性）
defines.trans_en: any male adult that you know who is older than you

examples.ch: 约翰大叔
examples.en: John Uncle

defines.trans_ch: 在（或到）下面；在（或到）下方
defines.trans_en: in or to a position below or lower than something else, often so that one thing covers the other

examples.ch: 他躲在床底下。
examples.en: He hid under the bed.

examples.ch: 公元79年，庞贝古城被湮没在7米深的火山灰下。
examples.en: In AD 79 the city of Pompei was buried under a layer of ash seven metres deep.

examples.ch: 她把温度计放到我的舌头下面。
examples.en: She put the thermometer under my tongue.

examples.ch: 她腋下夹着一个文件夹。
examples.en: She was holding a folder under her arm (= between her upper arm and the side of her body).

examples.ch: 他们站在树下避雨。
examples.en: They stood under a tree (= below its branches) to avoid getting wet.

defines.trans_en: If a piece of land is under a particular type of plant, that plant is growing on the whole of that area.

examples.ch: 主要的农田都种了麦子。
examples.en: The main fields are under wheat.

defines.trans_ch: （书、文章或信息）属于…类别，在…项下
defines.trans_en: If a book, article, or piece of information is under a particular title, you can find it below or following that title in a list, book, library, etc.

examples.ch: 关于安塞尔·亚当斯的书很可能属于艺术或摄影类。
examples.en: Books on Ansel Adams will probably be under Art or Photography.

examples.ch: 蛋奶甜羹？应该在甜点类中找。
examples.en: Custard? That comes under Desserts.

defines.trans_en: less than

examples.ch: 所有物品价格均低于1英镑。
examples.en: All items cost/are under a pound.

examples.ch: 折扣仅面向10岁以下儿童。
examples.en: The discount applies only to children under (the age of) ten (= younger than ten).

examples.ch: 如果考分低于总分的一半，你就没有及格。
examples.en: If you get under 50 percent, you fail the exam.

defines.trans_en: happening during, as a result of, or according to a particular situation, event, rule, etc.

examples.ch: 这项工作是在极端困难的情况下完成的。
examples.en: The work was completed under very difficult conditions.

examples.ch: 由于最后期限就要到了，我们都感受到了压力。
examples.en: Now that the deadline is approaching we all feel under pressure.

examples.ch: 他太重了，椅子承受不住被压坏了。
examples.en: The chair broke under his weight (= because he was too heavy for it).

examples.ch: 根据现有的规则，你必须取得委员会十位成员中至少六人的同意。
examples.en: Under the current rules, you need the agreement of at least 6 out of 10 committee members.

defines.trans_en: controlled or governed by a particular person, organization, or force

examples.ch: 他是一名上校，手下有数百名士兵。
examples.en: He's a Colonel, with hundreds of soldiers under him (= obeying his orders).

examples.ch: 我想知道英国在罗马人统治时期是什么样子。
examples.en: I wonder what Britain was like under the Romans (= during the time when the Romans controlled Britain).

examples.ch: 有人认为，双鱼座的人爱幻想、有艺术细胞。
examples.en: People born under (= during the period of) the zodiac sign Pisces are supposed to be dreamy and artistic.

defines.trans_en: using a particular name, especially one that is not your real name

examples.ch: 他用约翰•勒•卡雷这个名字创作。
examples.en: He writes under the name (of) John le Carré.

examples.ch: 为了自身安全，他不得不使用假名／化名。
examples.en: For his own safety, he has to operate under a false name/an alias.

phrases.trans_ch: 遭受攻击／正在考虑／正在讨论（等等）
phrases.trans_en: in the process of being attacked, considered, discussed, etc.

examples.ch: 该城正遭受空袭。
examples.en: The town is under fire (= is being attacked) from the air.

examples.ch: 理事会正在考虑这些提议。
examples.en: The proposals are now under consideration by the Board of Governors.

examples.ch: 局势仍然没有得到控制。
examples.en: The situation is still not under control.

phrases.trans_ch: 处于镇静剂／麻醉剂的作用之下
phrases.trans_en: treated in the way mentioned

examples.ch: 病人正处于服药后的深度镇静状态。
examples.en: The patient is being kept under heavy sedation.

examples.ch: 手术前必须给她施行麻醉。
examples.en: She'll have to go under anaesthetic for the operation.

examples.ch: 她因病毒感染接受了医生治疗。
examples.en: She's been under the doctor for a viral infection.

phrases.trans_en: to believe something, often wrongly

examples.ch: 他误以为是我在负责。
examples.en: He was under the mistaken belief that I was in charge.

phrases.trans_en: to have been ordered to do something

examples.ch: 他们被严令不得讨论时局。
examples.en: They're under strict orders not to discuss the situation.

examples.ch: 医生告诫他要在至少半年的时间内少吃油腻食物、滴酒不沾。
examples.en: He's under doctor's orders (= has been told by a doctor) to cut down on fatty food and to drink no alcohol for at least six months.

defines.trans_en: below the surface of something

examples.ch: 因为游泳水平很差，我经常沉到水下，呛很多水。
examples.en: Because I'm a bad swimmer, I often go under and swallow a lot of water.

defines.trans_en: not enough or not done as well or as much as is necessary

examples.ch: 没煮熟的土豆
examples.en: undercooked potatoes

examples.ch: 贫困儿童
examples.en: underprivileged children

examples.ch: 我们全都超时工作，但薪水却很低。
examples.en: We're all overworked and underpaid.

examples.ch: 老板说他在工作中表现欠佳。
examples.en: His boss says he's under-performing (= not doing as well as he should) at work.

defines.trans_en: below

examples.ch: 内衣
examples.en: underwear

examples.ch: 地下通道
examples.en: an underpass

defines.trans_ch: 在地下（的），在地面以下的
defines.trans_en: below the surface of the earth; below ground

examples.ch: 地下洞穴／通道／电缆
examples.en: an underground cave/passage/cable

examples.ch: 鼹鼠生活在地下。
examples.en: Moles live underground.

defines.trans_en: An underground activity is secret and usually illegal.

examples.ch: 地下报纸／运动
examples.en: an underground newspaper/movement

examples.ch: 共产党被迫转为地下活动，其领导人也隐藏了起来。
examples.en: The Communist Party was forced (to go) underground, and its leaders went into hiding.

phrases.trans_ch: （十九世纪在美国用来帮助南方黑奴逃脱至废除了黑奴制度地区的）地下铁路
phrases.trans_en: a secret system, used in the 19th century, by which slaves (= people who had been sold and forced to work) in the southern US were helped to escape to places where there was no slavery

defines.trans_en: people in a society who are trying new and often shocking or illegal ways of living or forms of art

examples.ch: 20世纪70年代，先锋派团体在英国和美国是一支强大的颠覆性力量。
examples.en: In Britain and the USA in the 1970s, the underground was a powerful subversive force.

phrases.trans_en: a railway system in which electric trains travel through tunnels below ground

examples.ch: 伦敦地铁
examples.en: the London Underground

examples.ch: 他们乘地铁去的。
examples.en: They went on the underground.

phrases.trans_en: a group of people who secretly fight against the government

examples.ch: 他是袭扰侵略军的地下组织成员。
examples.en: He was a member of the underground, harassing the invading army.

defines.trans_en: to know the meaning of something that someone says

examples.ch: 她把整个想法又解释了一遍，但我还是不明白。
examples.en: She explained the whole idea again, but I still didn't understand.

examples.ch: 这儿有人懂阿拉伯语吗？
examples.en: Is there anyone here who understands Arabic?

examples.ch: 我想他是在一个夜总会里打的电话——那头太吵了，他说的话我一个字也没听清。
examples.en: I think he was calling from a club - it was so noisy, I couldn't understand a word he said.

defines.trans_en: to know why or how something happens or works

examples.ch: 我们还未完全弄懂大脑是如何工作的。
examples.en: We still don't fully understand how the brain works.

defines.trans_en: to know how someone feels or why someone behaves in a particular way

examples.ch: 我太太不理解我。
examples.en: My wife doesn't understand me.

examples.ch: 有时候我搞不懂詹姆斯。
examples.en: Sometimes I don't understand James.

examples.ch: 你不了解出于无奈才上街乞讨是什么样子／是什么样的感觉。
examples.en: You don't understand what it's like/how it feels to have to beg on the streets.

defines.trans_en: to know or realize something because you have been told it

examples.ch: 我听说你想从我们这里借些钱。
examples.en: I understand (that) you are interested in borrowing some money from us.

examples.ch: 主任跟她说她将会得到提拔。
examples.en: The Director had given her to understand (= told her) that she would be promoted.

examples.ch: 据说，有一位不愿透露姓名的买家花了100万美元买走了那3幅画。
examples.en: A secret buyer is understood to have paid $1 million for the three pictures (= there is unofficial news that this has happened).

defines.trans_ch: （用于询问他人是否明白自己所表达的意思并按要求去做）明白
defines.trans_en: used when making certain that someone knows what you mean and will do as you want

examples.ch: 我不想让你再和那个男孩见面，明白吗？
examples.en: I don't want you to see that boy again. Understand?/Do you understand?/Is that understood?

phrases.trans_ch: （尤指错误地）把（某人）的意思理解为…
phrases.trans_en: to think, especially wrongly, that someone means a particular thing

examples.ch: 他说3点钟时，我误解为是下午。
examples.en: When he said three o'clock, I understood him to mean in the afternoon.

phrases.trans_en: When two people understand one another, they both know what the other means and wants and they have an agreement.

examples.ch: 我想确保我们的目标一致并相互理解对方。
examples.en: I wanted to make sure that we want the same things, that we really understand each other.

phrases.trans_en: used to refer to something such as a rule that everyone knows and accepts

examples.ch: 众所周知，图书馆里禁止大声喧哗。
examples.en: In the library it is understood that people should talk quietly.

defines.trans_en: a particular set of clothes that has to be worn by the members of the same organization or group of people

examples.ch: 军装／校服
examples.en: military/school uniform

examples.ch: 护士服
examples.en: a nurse's uniform

examples.ch: 我喜欢穿制服的男人！
examples.en: I love a man in uniform!

defines.trans_ch: （某一群体的人穿的）典型服装，特有服装
defines.trans_en: a type of clothes that is connected with a particular group of people

examples.ch: 照片上的他穿着T恤衫和破洞牛仔裤，一幅当时学生的典型打扮。
examples.en: Photographs show him wearing the T-shirt and ripped jeans that were the student's uniform of the time.

defines.trans_ch: 相同的；一律的；整齐划一的
defines.trans_en: the same; not changing or different in any way

examples.ch: 办公室的墙壁和家具一律都是灰色的。
examples.en: The office walls and furniture are a uniform grey.

examples.ch: 小企业要求银行给予它们一视同仁的待遇。
examples.en: Small businesses are demanding that they receive uniform treatment from the banks.

defines.trans_en: a place where people people study for an undergraduate (= first) or postgraduate (= higher level) degree

examples.ch: 你曾就读于哪所大学？
examples.en: Which university did you go to/were you at (= did you study at)?

examples.ch: 她任教于康涅狄格大学。
examples.en: She teaches at the University of Connecticut.

examples.ch: 我与2012年从利物浦大学毕业。
examples.en: I graduated from Liverpool University in 2012.

examples.ch: 大学校园／课程／教授
examples.en: a university campus/degree/professor

defines.trans_en: up to (the time that)

examples.ch: 为了完成工作，我一直熬夜干到3点！
examples.en: I was up until three o'clock trying to get it finished!

examples.ch: 我们是不是最好等到安东尼来？
examples.en: Shouldn't we wait until Antony's here?

defines.trans_en: as far as

examples.ch: 你应该坐火车一直坐到曼彻斯特，然后再换车。
examples.en: You should stay on the train until Manchester and then change.

phrases.trans_en: not before a particular time or event

examples.ch: 直到过了午夜我们才吃东西。
examples.en: We didn't eat till past midnight.

examples.ch: 一旦开始油漆房间，他就不会半途而废。
examples.en: Once he starts painting a room he won't stop until it's done.

defines.trans_ch: 向较高处；向上；（价值、数字或水平）加大地；增高地
defines.trans_en: towards a higher position; towards a higher value, number, or level

examples.ch: 把那些书放到书架顶层上去。
examples.en: Put those books up on the top shelf.

examples.ch: 一条砾石铺成的路穿过丛林，向上进入安第斯山。
examples.en: A gravel road leads through the jungle and up into the Andes.

examples.ch: 单位销售数字每个季度都增长的趋势不可能无限期持续下去。
examples.en: Pushing the number of unit sales up every quarter can't be continued indefinitely.

examples.ch: 水已经涨到窗户那么高了。
examples.en: The water was up to/had come up to the level of the windows.

defines.trans_en: out of the ground

examples.ch: 他挖了一下午的胡萝卜。
examples.en: He spent the afternoon digging carrots up.

defines.trans_ch: 处于直立状态地；垂直地
defines.trans_en: in or into a vertical position

examples.ch: 你能站起来一会儿吗，我想看看你有多高。
examples.en: Would you stand up for a minute? I want to see how tall you are.

defines.trans_en: in a high position; at the top

examples.ch: 我们的会议室在上面的23层。
examples.en: Our boardroom is up on the 23rd floor.

examples.ch: 你可以看出板条箱该哪面朝上，因为每个箱子都写有“此面朝上”的字样。
examples.en: You can tell which way up the crates have to be because they all say "TOP".

defines.trans_en: very near

examples.ch: 他拿着枪，走到收银员跟前逼其把钱拿出来。
examples.en: Carrying a gun, he walked up to the cashier and demanded money.

examples.ch: 一辆大型豪华车开过来，停在旅馆外面。
examples.en: A limousine drew up (= parked) outside the hotel.

defines.trans_ch: 由弱到强地；由低到高地
defines.trans_en: to a greater degree; in order to increase

examples.ch: 炉火使房间在几分钟内就暖和起来。
examples.en: The fire heats the room up (= makes it warmer) within minutes.

examples.ch: 奶奶总是把电视音量调得很大，因为她听力不好。
examples.en: Grandma always turns the TV up really loud because she can't hear very well.

examples.ch: 尽量不要激动，我相信我们能解决这个问题。
examples.en: Try not to get worked up (= increasingly excited or angry) - I'm sure we can resolve this.

defines.trans_en: If a level or amount is up, it has increased.

examples.ch: 车辆保险费用有所提高，但增幅不大。
examples.en: The cost of car insurance is up, but not very much.

examples.ch: 去年该公司的营业额是2400亿美元，比前年增加了3%。
examples.en: Last year the company's turnover was $240 billion, up three percent on (= compared with) the previous year.

defines.trans_en: not in bed

examples.ch: 现在该起床啦！
examples.en: It's time to get up now!

examples.ch: 我一夜没睡写完了我的文章。
examples.en: I was up all night, finishing my essay.

defines.trans_ch: （表示出现、发生、看到、给予考虑等）
defines.trans_en: into existence, view, or attention

examples.ch: 成立这间慈善机构的初衷是要帮助城里的孤儿。
examples.en: Originally the charity was set up to help orphans in urban areas.

examples.ch: 对不起，亲爱的，办公室里出了点儿意外，我会晚点回家。
examples.en: I'm sorry, but something unexpected has come up (= has happened) at the office, and I'll be home late.

examples.ch: 休息之后，我们有请一位自称能与鱼交流的人上场。
examples.en: Coming up (= happening next) after the break, we have a man who claims he can communicate with fish.

examples.ch: 现在提薪水的问题合适吗？
examples.en: Would this be a good time to bring up the issue of salary?

defines.trans_ch: （在质量、知识或成就方面）相等，比得上
defines.trans_en: so as to be equal in quality, knowledge, or achievement

examples.ch: 她因病几周不能去上课，但她（的功课）很快就能赶上来。
examples.en: She couldn't go to school for a few weeks because of illness, but she'll be able to catch up (with her work) quickly.

examples.ch: 有那么多的科学研究在进行，要跟上（所有的新进展）几乎是不可能的。
examples.en: So much scientific research is being performed that it's virtually impossible to keep up (with all the new developments).

defines.trans_en: in a state of being together with other similar things

examples.ch: 你有半个小时的时间来收拾旅途中所需的东西。
examples.en: You have half an hour to gather up anything you'll need for the journey.

examples.ch: 在心里把这一列数字加起来，然后告诉我总数。
examples.en: Add up the column of numbers in your head and then tell me what the total is.

defines.trans_en: tightly or firmly in order to keep something safe or in position

examples.ch: 把袋口扎好，这样垃圾不会掉出来。
examples.en: Tie up the top of the bag so the rubbish doesn't fall out.

examples.ch: 你最好穿暖和些——外面很冷。
examples.en: You'd better wrap up (= wear warm clothes) - it's cold outside.

examples.ch: 你能帮我把鞋带系上吗？
examples.en: Can you do my shoelaces up for me?

defines.trans_en: broken or cut into smaller pieces; made smaller in area

examples.ch: 他把信剪得粉粹。
examples.en: He cut the letter up into a hundred pieces.

examples.ch: 她把报纸叠起来放进包里。
examples.en: She folded the newspaper up and put it in her bag.

examples.ch: 当火焰触及油箱时，汽车爆炸了。
examples.en: The car blew up (= exploded) when flames reached its fuel tank.

defines.trans_en: to a greater age

examples.ch: 没有人认为成长很轻松、没有痛苦。
examples.en: No one said that growing up would be easy or painless.

examples.ch: 许多单身父母靠微薄的收入把孩子抚养大。
examples.en: Many single parents struggle to bring their children up on a low income.

defines.trans_ch: （用于谈论或询问发生了甚么事）
defines.trans_en: used when talking or asking about what is happening

examples.ch: 大家都在窃窃私语，我可以断定一定发生了什么不同寻常的事。
examples.en: Everyone was talking in whispers, and I could tell something was up (= something unusual was happening).

examples.ch: 怎么回事？
examples.en: What's up? (= What is happening or what is wrong?)

defines.trans_en: When a period of time is up, it is finished.

examples.ch: 两个小时过去了，没有人回答完所有问题。
examples.en: When the two hours were up nobody had answered all of the questions.

examples.ch: 你的时间到了——现在轮到别人使用训练设备了。
examples.en: Your time is up - it's someone else's turn on the training equipment now.

defines.trans_en: into an improved position or state

examples.ch: 到第26圈，汉密尔顿已上升至第2位。
examples.en: By lap 26, Hamilton had moved up into second position.

examples.ch: 斯坦起跑不好，但到第9圈时，她赶上了领先者。
examples.en: Stein had a bad start to the race, but by the ninth lap she was up with the leaders.

defines.trans_en: to an end, finish, or state of being complete

examples.ch: 先把旧的那个面包吃完，再开始吃新的。
examples.en: Finish up the old loaf of bread before you start a new one.

examples.ch: 犯罪不能解决问题——最终会让你进监狱。
examples.en: Crime won't help - you'll end up in prison.

examples.ch: 在本次会议结束之际，我要感谢所有在这么短的时间里收到通知就赶来出席会议的人。
examples.en: I'd like to round up the meeting by thanking all those who were able to attend at such short notice.

defines.trans_en: towards the north

examples.ch: 周二她将从新奥尔良北上前往亚特兰大。
examples.en: On Tuesday she'll be travelling up to Atlanta from New Orleans.

defines.trans_ch: 往更重要的地方（尤指城市）
defines.trans_en: towards a more important place, especially a city

examples.ch: 你多久去一次伦敦？
examples.en: How often do you go up to London?

examples.ch: 她大约每月乘火车从村里进一趟城。
examples.en: She comes up from her village about once a month on the train.

defines.trans_en: on trial in a court

examples.ch: 如果他不马上交上罚款，就将会被地方法庭传讯。
examples.en: If he doesn't pay the fine soon, he'll be up before the magistrate.

examples.ch: 史密斯被控持械抢劫而出庭受审。
examples.en: Smith is up for armed robbery.

defines.trans_en: When a road is up, it is being repaired and so is unsuitable for use.

examples.ch: 因为下水管道破裂，市政会正在整修道路。
examples.en: The council has got the road up because of a broken sewer.

defines.trans_en: If someone's long hair is up, it is arranged on the top or back of the head.

examples.ch: 你头发向上梳看起来很好看。
examples.en: You look nice with your hair up.

phrases.trans_ch: 起起伏伏地，上上下下地
phrases.trans_en: from a higher to a lower position repeatedly

examples.ch: 我的小女儿在得知她不能去后非常生气，开始不停地跳上跳下。
examples.en: My little girl started jumping up and down with rage when she heard she couldn't go.

phrases.trans_en: to be able to get out of bed and move around again after a period of illness, because your health has improved enough

phrases.trans_ch: 计划要;被建议;正被考虑
phrases.trans_en: intended, suggested, or being considered for something

examples.ch: 我们这条路尽头的那座房子又要出售了。
examples.en: That house at the end of our road is up for sale again.

examples.ch: 你真的会被提升吗？
examples.en: Are you really up for promotion?

phrases.trans_en: willing and able to do or take part in an activity

examples.ch: 工作了一整天之后，我真的不愿意参加什么聚会了。
examples.en: After a long day at work I wasn't really up for a party.

examples.ch: 我们要去游泳。你愿意去吗？
examples.en: We're going swimming. Are you up for it?

examples.ch: 如果没人愿意，我愿意组织这次会议。
examples.en: I'm up for organizing the meeting if nobody else wants to do it.

defines.trans_ch: 在（或向）较高水平（或位置）
defines.trans_en: to or in a higher level or position

examples.ch: 我们跟随她上楼进入一个大会议室。
examples.en: We followed her up the stairs to a large meeting room.

defines.trans_en: at the top of

examples.ch: 沿着这些楼梯向上，你就会看到一个布满灰尘的阁楼。
examples.en: You'll find a dusty attic up these stairs.

examples.ch: 如果你找弗雷德，他就在那个梯子上。
examples.en: If you want Fred, he's up that ladder.

defines.trans_en: (further) along

examples.ch: 车沿着公路飞驰。
examples.en: The car shot off up the road at high speed.

examples.ch: 他们就住在这条路的前面。
examples.en: They live just up the road.

defines.trans_ch: 向起点；（尤指）向上游；向发源地
defines.trans_en: towards the starting point of something, especially a river or stream

examples.ch: 划船逆流而上很费力气。
examples.en: Rowing up (the) river against the current was very hard work.

defines.trans_en: to or at

examples.ch: 今晚你去俱乐部吗?
examples.en: Are you going up the club tonight?

phrases.trans_en: along the surface of something first in one direction and then in the opposite direction, usually repeatedly

examples.ch: 他沿着街道来回跑，大声呼喊。
examples.en: He was running up and down the street, shouting.

defines.trans_en: moving up

examples.ch: 向上的自动扶梯
examples.en: an up escalator

defines.trans_ch: （尤指以正常状态）在运转，在运行
defines.trans_en: When a system, computer, or similar machine is up, it is operating, especially in its usual way.

examples.ch: 安迪，你知道网络什么时候能恢复正常吗?
examples.en: Andy, do you know when the network will be up again?

defines.trans_en: feeling happy

examples.ch: 自从开始新的工作之后，她一直很高兴。
examples.en: She's been really up since she started her new job.

defines.trans_en: to increase something such as a price

examples.ch: 这笔买卖的销售价格不提高，我们就无钱可赚。
examples.en: We won't be able to make a profit on the deal without upping the sale price.

examples.ch: 看来税率又要提高了。
examples.en: It looks like tax rates are going to be upped again.

phrases.trans_ch: （与另一动词连用，强调突然或者出人意料地离开或做某事）
phrases.trans_en: used with another verb to emphasize that someone left a place or did something in a sudden and possibly unexpected way

examples.ch: 吃完饭后他们就突然起身不辞而别。
examples.en: After dinner they just upped and left/went without saying goodbye.

defines.trans_en: higher or improved

examples.ch: 向山上
examples.en: uphill

examples.ch: 提高
examples.en: uplift

defines.trans_en: towards or on the highest floor or floors of a building

examples.ch: 楼上的平台／窗户
examples.en: an upstairs landing/window

examples.ch: 听到玻璃破碎的声音，她跑上楼去看是怎么回事。
examples.en: He heard glass breaking and ran upstairs to see what had caused it.

defines.trans_ch: （用作动词或介词的宾语）我们
defines.trans_en: used as the object of a verb or a preposition to refer to a group that includes the speaker and at least one other person

examples.ch: 谢谢您载我们去车站。
examples.en: Thank you for driving us to the station.

examples.ch: 我们编辑部里大部分人对所进行的变革持反对态度。
examples.en: Many of us in the editorial department disagree with the changes that are happening.

defines.trans_en: (especially used in spoken English) me

examples.ch: 借个火，老兄。
examples.en: Give us a light, mate.

examples.ch: 拿到我这里，看看我能不能修。
examples.en: Give us it here and I'll see if I can mend it.

defines.trans_en: our

examples.ch: 你把我们的车停在哪儿了？
examples.en: Where've you parked us car?

defines.trans_en: abbreviation for the United States (of America)

examples.ch: 对美国教育的一项新研究刚刚发表。
examples.en: A new study of education in the US has just been published.

phrases.trans_en: belonging to or relating to the United States of America or its people

examples.ch: 你什么时候成为美国公民的？
examples.en: When did you become a US citizen?

defines.trans_en: to put something such as a tool, skill, or building to a particular purpose

examples.ch: 这个杯子用过了——请给我拿一个干净的。
examples.en: This glass has been used - could you get me a clean one?

examples.ch: 用剪刀裁剪成形。
examples.en: Use scissors to cut the shapes out.

examples.ch: 出去探险让我有机会把我所接受的培训付诸实践。
examples.en: Going on the expedition gives me a chance to use all the training I've had.

examples.ch: 这家老旧的医院已经关张了。
examples.en: The old hospital isn't used any more.

examples.ch: 这些灯用于比赛场地的照明。
examples.en: These lights are used for illuminating the playing area.

examples.ch: 决不能容忍动用军队镇压抗议者。
examples.en: To use military force against the protesters would be unacceptable.

defines.trans_en: to reduce the amount of or finish something, by eating it, burning it, writing on it, or by a chemical reaction

examples.ch: 我们的面包差不多都吃光了——你能再买一些吗?
examples.en: We've used (up) nearly all of the bread - will you buy some more?

examples.ch: 她还吸毒吗?
examples.en: Does she still use drugs?

examples.ch: 别担心把洗发水用光——明天我要去买一些。
examples.en: Don't worry if you use the shampoo up (= use all of it) - I'll get more tomorrow.

defines.trans_ch: 说或写（特定的单词或词组）
defines.trans_en: to say or write a particular word or phrase

examples.ch: “秋天”在英国英语中是autumn，在美国英语中是fall。
examples.en: "Autumn" is used in British English and "fall" in American English.

examples.ch: 那是一个她经常用来表达自己感受的词。
examples.en: That's an expression she often uses to describe how she feels.

defines.trans_en: to take advantage of a person or situation; to exploit

examples.ch: 他只是在利用你——他会窃取你的想法，然后把功劳都算到自己头上。
examples.en: He's just using you - he'll steal your ideas and then take the credit for them himself.

examples.ch: 也许可以利用他们的失误来获取我们想要的东西。
examples.en: It might be possible to use their mistake to help us get what we want.

phrases.trans_ch: （在否定句和疑问句中，在 did 或 didn't 后 used to 变为 use to）
phrases.trans_en: In negative sentences and questions, "use to" replaces "used to" when it follows "did" or "didn't"

examples.ch: 他曾经在《星际迷航》中扮演过医生吗?
examples.en: Did he use to be the doctor in "Star Trek"?

examples.ch: 冬季我们不常出去。
examples.en: We didn't use to go out much during the winter.

defines.trans_en: a purpose for which something is used

examples.ch: 厨房里的食品加工器有多种用途。
examples.en: A food processor has a variety of uses in the kitchen.

examples.ch: 不要把那块布扔掉，你总有一天会用得着它。
examples.en: Don't throw that cloth away, you'll find a use for it one day.

examples.ch: 不，我不想买船——我买了没用！
examples.en: No, I don't want to buy a boat - I don't have any use for one!

defines.trans_en: the act of using something, or a period of time when something is being used or can be used

examples.ch: 你应该能够把你在电子行业方面的经验（好好）用到你的新工作当中去。
examples.en: You should be able to put your experience in electronics to (good) use in your new job.

examples.ch: 机器运转时不要触碰。
examples.en: Don't touch the machine when it's in use.

examples.ch: 一台不用时会变成镜子的平板电视
examples.en: a flat-screen TV that becomes a mirror when it is not in use

examples.ch: 这是一个几乎没有再用的名字。
examples.en: It's a name that has almost fallen out of use (= is hardly used now ).

examples.ch: 最近几年，雇用移民工人的数量有所增加。
examples.en: There has been an increase in the use of migrant workers in recent years.

examples.ch: 传统耕作方式在很多地区用得越来越少／越来越多。
examples.en: Traditional farming methods are going out of/coming into use (= used less and less/more and more) in many areas.

defines.trans_en: the process of reducing the amount of something by burning it, eating it, involving it in a chemical reaction, etc.

examples.ch: 在无氧呼吸中，糖会在不耗费氧气的情况下，被分解为乳酸。
examples.en: In anaerobic respiration, sugar is broken down to lactic acid without the use of oxygen.

examples.ch: 对资源更有效的利用
examples.en: a more efficient use of resources

defines.trans_ch: （某个词的）意思之一;（某个词的）用法之一
defines.trans_en: one of the meanings of a word, or the way that a particular word is used

examples.ch: 你能列出“point”这个单词的所有用法吗？
examples.en: Can you list all the uses of the word "point"?

phrases.trans_en: to use something that is available

examples.ch: 我们倒不如利用旅馆的设施。
examples.en: We might as well make use of the hotel's facilities.

phrases.trans_ch: 使用…的许可;使用…的能力
phrases.trans_en: permission to use something, or the ability to use something

examples.ch: 他们说他们不在的时候我们可以随时使用他们的海滨小屋。
examples.en: They said we could have the use of their beach house whenever they weren't there.

examples.ch: 她摔倒时伤了胳膊，手指头暂时还不能动。
examples.en: She hurt her arm in the fall and lost the use of her fingers temporarily.

defines.trans_ch: 有用的，有效的；有帮助的
defines.trans_en: effective; helping you to do or achieve something

examples.ch: 一把好刀应该是厨房里最有用的物件之一。
examples.en: A good knife is probably one of the most useful things you can have in a kitchen.

examples.ch: 这些练习有什么用处吗？
examples.en: Do the exercises serve any useful purpose?

defines.trans_en: normal; happening, done, or used most often

examples.ch: 我和平常一样准时上床睡觉。
examples.en: I went to bed at my usual time.

examples.ch: 山区今年夏天的降雨量比往年多。
examples.en: There was more rainfall than usual this summer in the mountain areas.

examples.ch: 你可以在平常放餐具的地方找到刀叉餐具。
examples.en: You'll find the cutlery in its usual place.

examples.ch: 泰瑞一向反应迟钝。
examples.en: Terry was, as usual, slow to respond.

examples.ch: 尽管有雪暴，图书馆还是照常开门。
examples.en: The library is open for business as usual despite the snowstorm.

defines.trans_en: Someone's usual is the drink, especially an alcoholic one, that they most often have, for example when in a bar

examples.ch: 给我爸来杯加奎宁水的杜松子酒，我还是照旧。
examples.en: A gin and tonic for my dad, and I'll have the/my usual.

defines.trans_en: used to say that one team or person is competing against another

examples.ch: 明天的比赛是纽卡斯尔队对阿森纳队。
examples.en: Tomorrow's game is Newcastle versus Arsenal.

defines.trans_en: used when naming the two sides in a legal case

examples.ch: 在罗诉韦德案后，堕胎在美国全国变得合法化。
examples.en: Abortion was legalized nationally in the United States following the Roe versus Wade case.

defines.trans_en: used to compare two things or ideas, especially when you have to choose between them

examples.ch: 私立教育与公共教育相比
examples.en: private education versus state education

defines.trans_en: the characteristic of often changing and being different

examples.ch: 做饭时，你既需要考虑饭菜的营养价值，又需要考虑饭菜的花样和味道。
examples.en: When planning meals, you need to think about variety and taste as well as nutritional value.

examples.ch: 有性繁殖可以使基因多样化。
examples.en: Sexual reproduction serves to create genetic variety.

examples.ch: 在流水线上工作很单调，缺乏变化。
examples.en: Work on the production line is monotonous and lacks variety.

defines.trans_en: a different type of something

examples.ch: 这篇文章讲的是南美洲西班牙语的各种变种。
examples.en: The article was about the different varieties of Spanish spoken in South America.

examples.ch: 这种玫瑰特别耐寒及耐旱。
examples.en: This variety of rose is especially hardy and drought-resistant.

examples.ch: 我们超市有几个不同品种的苹果。
examples.en: Our supermarket stocks apples in several different varieties.

defines.trans_en: many different types of things or people

examples.ch: 她参加各种各样的健身活动。
examples.en: She does a variety of fitness activities.

examples.ch: 这套设备可以用于多种教学活动。
examples.en: The equipment could be used for a variety of educational purposes.

examples.ch: 生产厂家需要极高的销量来证明向出口市场提供种类繁多的产品是值得的。
examples.en: Manufacturers need large sales to justify offering a big variety in export markets.

defines.trans_en: a type of entertainment which includes several separate short performances, such as singing, dancing, magic tricks, and telling jokes

examples.ch: 综艺节目
examples.en: a variety show

defines.trans_en: a plant, root, seed, or pod that is used as food, especially in dishes that are not sweet

examples.ch: 新鲜／冷冻蔬菜
examples.en: fresh/frozen vegetables

examples.ch: 蔬菜汤／炖菜／咖喱什菜
examples.en: vegetable soup/stew/curry

examples.ch: 水果和蔬菜
examples.en: fruit and vegetables

examples.ch: 在这个国家，土豆是最受欢迎的蔬菜。
examples.en: The potato is the most popular vegetable in this country.

examples.ch: 冬天我们往往会吃更多根茎蔬菜，比如胡萝卜和欧洲萝卜。
examples.en: In the winter we tend to eat more root vegetables, such as carrots and parsnips.

examples.ch: 生的蔬菜中所含的钾元素比做熟后的要多。
examples.en: Raw vegetables contain more potassium than cooked ones.

examples.ch: 切菜刀
examples.en: a vegetable knife

defines.trans_ch: 懒散的人;对任何事都毫无兴趣的人
defines.trans_en: a person who does not do anything or has no interest in doing anything

examples.ch: 整天坐在家里看电视，她慢慢地变成了一个懒散的人。
examples.en: Sitting at home all day in front of the TV slowly turned her into a vegetable.

defines.trans_en: a person who is unable to think or move correctly because of severe brain damage
made or obtained from a plant, or growing in the form of a plant

examples.ch: 植物性物质／植物染料
examples.en: vegetable matter/dye

examples.ch: 首先想象一个物体并告诉我们它是动物、植物还是矿物。
examples.en: First think of an object and tell us if it is animal, vegetable or mineral.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调形容词或副词）很，非常
defines.trans_en: (used to add emphasis to an adjective or adverb) to a great degree or extremely

examples.ch: 形势非常严峻。
examples.en: The situation is very serious.

examples.ch: 对所发生的事我们感到非常难过。
examples.en: We're very, very sorry about what's happened.

examples.ch: 作决定之前要仔细考虑。
examples.en: Think about it very carefully before deciding.

examples.ch: 她竟然拒绝跟我说话，多么孩子气呀！
examples.en: How very childish of her to refuse to speak to me!

examples.ch: “你累了吗?”“不，不太累。”
examples.en: "Are you tired?" "No, not very."

examples.ch: 非常感谢。
examples.en: Thank you very much.

examples.ch: “你觉得戏好看吗？”“非常好看。”
examples.en: "Did you enjoy the play?" "Very much so." (= Yes.)

examples.ch: 如果我没做错什么，我可不会去道歉。
examples.en: I can't very well (= it would not be right for me to) say sorry when I didn't do anything wrong.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调形容词最高级或 own，same 等形容词）完全，最，正是
defines.trans_en: used to add force to a superlative adjective or to the adjectives "own" or "same"

examples.ch: 这是我尝过的最好吃的巧克力蛋糕。
examples.en: This is the very best chocolate cake I've ever tasted.

examples.ch: 她总是到最后一刻才写家庭作业。
examples.en: She always leaves her homework to the very last moment.

examples.ch: 现在我们村子真正有了自己的图书馆了。
examples.en: We now have our very own library in the village.

examples.ch: 这就是我们上次来的时候坐过的地方。
examples.en: This is the very same (= exactly the same) place we sat the last time we came.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调名词）同一的，恰好的，正是的
defines.trans_en: (used to add emphasis to a noun) exact or particular

examples.ch: 这正是那本我找了整整一个月的书。
examples.en: This is the very book I've been looking for all month.

examples.ch: 你正是我们这份工作的合适人选。
examples.en: You're the very person we need for the job.

examples.ch: 后来发生的事情正是我们最害怕的。
examples.en: What ended up happening was the very thing we feared the most.

examples.ch: 那封信星期一从柏林寄出，当天／第二天就到了汉堡。
examples.en: The letter was sent on Monday from Berlin and arrived in Hamburg the very same/next day.

examples.ch: 一想到她的朋友们要住下我就心生恐惧。
examples.en: The very idea/thought of having her friends to stay fills me with dread.

defines.trans_en: used to describe or emphasize the furthest point of something

examples.ch: 他在那一大堆东西的最下面找到了自己丢了的那张纸。
examples.en: He found the piece of paper he had lost at the very bottom of the pile.

examples.ch: 我们排在队伍最后面，所以没有买到票。
examples.en: We were at the very end of the queue, so we didn't manage to get any tickets.

defines.trans_en: a recording of moving pictures and sound, especially as a digital file, DVD, etc.

examples.ch: 我的新手提电脑很适合播放录像。
examples.en: My new laptop handles video really well.

examples.ch: 人们可以把自己宠物的录像上传到这个网站。
examples.en: People can upload videos of their pets to this website.

examples.ch: 我们的婚礼录了像。
examples.en: We had a video made of our wedding.

examples.ch: 这个系列现在有录像出售。
examples.en: The series is now available on video.

defines.trans_en: a short film made to go with a popular song

examples.ch: 你看过“疯狂的爱”的音乐视频吗？
examples.en: Have you seen the video for "Crazy in Love"?

defines.trans_en:
a 
videocassette recorder
using video

examples.ch: 录像
examples.en: a video recording

defines.trans_en: connected with or used in the showing of moving pictures by television

examples.ch: 视频
examples.en: video frequencies

defines.trans_en: to record a programme from the television, or to use a video camera to film an event

examples.ch: 我们把学校音乐会录了下来。
examples.en: We videoed the school concert.

defines.trans_en: a group of houses and other buildings that is smaller than a town, usually in the countryside

examples.ch: 渔村
examples.en: a fishing village

examples.ch: 山村
examples.en: a mountain village

examples.ch: 乡村商店
examples.en: a village shop

examples.ch: 乡村绿地
examples.en: a village green (= an area of grass in the middle of a village)

examples.ch: 很多人从周围的乡村来到这座城里工作。
examples.en: Many people come from the outlying/surrounding villages to work in the town.

defines.trans_en: all the people who live in a village

examples.ch: 全体村民正在积极呼吁，要求修建一条旁道。
examples.en: The village is/are campaigning for a by-pass to be built.

defines.trans_en: a wooden musical instrument with four strings that is held against the neck and played by moving a bow across the strings
to go to a place in order to look at it, or to a person in order to spend time with them

examples.ch: 我们在布拉格时参观了几家画廊。
examples.en: We visited a few galleries while we were in Prague.

examples.ch: 我住院你会来看我吗？
examples.en: Will you visit me when I'm in hospital?

examples.ch: 你上一次去看牙医／医生是什么时候？
examples.en: When did you last visit the dentist/doctor?

defines.trans_en: to go to a website on the internet
an occasion when you visit a place or person

examples.ch: 上周督学到我们这里来巡视过。
examples.en: We had a visit from the school inspector last week.

examples.ch: 恐怕我没空坐下来喝杯茶——我只是来短暂拜访一下。
examples.en: I can't stop for a coffee - this is just a flying (= very short) visit.

phrases.trans_en: to visit a person or place, usually for a short time

examples.ch: 我觉得进城时我应该去趟图书馆。
examples.en: I think I'll pay a visit to the library while I'm in town.

defines.trans_en: someone who visits a person or place

examples.ch: 有人来看你了。
examples.en: You have some visitors to see you.

defines.trans_en: someone who goes to a website on the internet
a game in which two teams use their hands to hit a large ball backwards and forwards over a high net without allowing the ball to touch the ground
to allow time to go by, especially while staying in one place without doing very much, until someone comes, until something that you are expecting happens or until you can do something

examples.ch: 她进去看病时我在外面等她。
examples.en: I waited for her outside while she went in to see the doctor.

examples.ch: 牙医让我等了好久。
examples.en: The dentist kept me waiting for ages.

examples.ch: 有很多人在等着打电话。
examples.en: There were a lot of people waiting to use the phone.

defines.trans_en: to be done or to happen at a later time

examples.ch: 会议将不得不推迟到明天，因为我现在太忙了。
examples.en: The meeting will have to wait until tomorrow, because I'm too busy now.

examples.ch: 这些文书工作不能等到明天再做。
examples.en: The paperwork can't wait until tomorrow (= is urgent and must be done now).

phrases.trans_en: used on signs to mean vehicles are not allowed to park, even for short periods of time

examples.ch: 路边的标志牌上写着“禁止停车”。
examples.en: The sign by the side of the road said "no waiting!"

defines.trans_en: a period of time when you stay in one place until someone comes, or something happens, or until you can do something

examples.ch: 我们等了3个小时才看到医生。
examples.en: We had a three-hour wait before we could see the doctor.

examples.ch: 等医生看病等了那么长时间真让我焦急。
examples.en: The long wait for the doctor/to see the doctor really made me anxious.

defines.trans_en: a man whose job is to bring the food to customers at their tables in a restaurant
a woman whose job is to bring the food to customers at their tables in a restaurant
If something that happens is a wake-up call, it should make you realize that you need to take action to change a situation.

examples.ch: 对保险业来说，这些洪水敲响了警钟。
examples.en: For the insurance industry, these floods were a wake-up call.

defines.trans_en: a phone call that you arrange to be made, for example in a hotel, to wake you up at a certain time
to move along by putting one foot in front of the other, allowing each foot to touch the ground before lifting the next

examples.ch: 我走着回家的。
examples.en: I walked home.

examples.ch: 一只猫在篱笆顶上走着。
examples.en: A cat was walking along the top of the fence.

examples.ch: 他每天早晨步行两英里去上班。
examples.en: He walks two miles to work every morning.

defines.trans_en: to go with someone to a particular place, for example because you want to protect them from danger, or show them the way

examples.ch: 他提出陪她走回家／到车站。
examples.en: He offered to walk her home/to the station.

defines.trans_en: to take an animal, especially a dog, for a walk

examples.ch: 她每天下午都遛一小时狗。
examples.en: She walks the dog for an hour every afternoon.

defines.trans_en: to be allowed to leave a court after being found not guilty of a crime

examples.ch: 如果警方找不到合适的证据，他就可以解脱嫌疑。
examples.en: If police don't get the right evidence, he'll walk.

defines.trans_ch: （棒球击球员因投手投出四个坏球而）自由上垒
defines.trans_en: in baseball, to receive four balls outside the hitting area and be allowed to go to first base, or to throw the ball outside the hitting area four times so that the batter is allowed to go to first base

examples.ch: 头几名击球员要么没有击中，要么自由上垒了。
examples.en: The first batters either missed or walked.

examples.ch: 对他来说，这本来可以是一场完美的比赛的，除了在最后一局他让一名击球手自由上垒。
examples.en: He would have had a perfect game, except he walked a batter in the final inning.

defines.trans_ch: 轻松通过（考试）；轻松取得（比赛）的胜利
defines.trans_en: to pass or win something, such as an exam or game, easily

examples.ch: 她会轻松通过面试的——那份工作实际上已经是她的了。
examples.en: She'll walk the interview - the job is practically hers already.

phrases.trans_ch: 活灾难（指带来灾难的人）／活百科全书（等等）
phrases.trans_en: someone who seems to be a human form of disaster, encyclopedia, etc.

examples.ch: 你又摔坏了一副眼镜？——唉，你真是个灾星！
examples.en: You broke another pair of glasses? You're just a walking disaster!

defines.trans_en: a journey that you make by walking, often for enjoyment

examples.ch: 他绕着街区散了散步，呼吸些新鲜空气。
examples.en: He went for/took a walk around the block, to get some air.

examples.ch: 他们徒步走了十英里，为慈善事业募捐。
examples.en: They went on a ten-mile walk to raise money for charity.

examples.ch: 每天下午她都带她的爷爷出去散步。
examples.en: Every afternoon she takes her grandfather out for a walk.

defines.trans_en: a path or route where people can walk for enjoyment

examples.ch: 你知道这附近有什么散步的好地方吗？
examples.en: Do you know any nice walks around here?

defines.trans_en: a way of walking

examples.ch: 他走起路来一摇一摆，非常奇怪。
examples.en: He has a strange waddling sort of walk.

defines.trans_en: walking speed

examples.ch: 她让马放慢速度缓步而行。
examples.en: She slowed the horses to a walk.

defines.trans_ch: （棒球击球员因投手投出四个坏球而）自由上垒
defines.trans_en: in baseball, an occasion when a batter is allowed to go to first base after the pitcher has thrown the ball outside the hitting area four times

phrases.text: a short, five-minute, ten-minute, etc. walk
phrases.trans_ch: 步行很短／5分钟／10分钟（等等）的一段路
phrases.trans_en: a journey that takes a short time, five minutes, ten minutes, etc. when you walk

examples.ch: 学校离这里步行只有5分钟的路。
examples.en: The school is only a five-minute walk away.

defines.trans_en: a vertical structure, often made of stone or brick, that divides or surrounds something

examples.ch: 这间公寓的墙太薄了，甚至隔壁的人说的每一句话你都可以听见。
examples.en: The walls in this apartment are so thin you can hear just about every word the neighbours say.

examples.ch: 这些墙看起来有点光秃秃的——我们能不能挂几幅画呢？
examples.en: The walls look a bit bare - can't we put some pictures up?

examples.ch: 我们不得不翻过一堵10英尺高的墙以进到花园里。
examples.en: We had to climb over a ten-foot wall to get into the garden.

examples.ch: 柏林墙于1989年被推倒。
examples.en: The Berlin Wall came down in 1989.

defines.trans_en: any outer part of a hollow structure in the body

examples.ch: 子宫／胃壁
examples.en: the wall of the uterus/stomach

examples.ch: 动脉血管壁
examples.en: an artery wall

defines.trans_en: a mass of people or things formed in such a way that you cannot get through or past them

examples.ch: 示威者组成一道结实的人墙，不让警察通过。
examples.en: The demonstrators formed a solid wall to stop the police from getting past them.

defines.trans_ch: （足球比赛期间罚任意球前对方球员组成的）人墙
defines.trans_en: in football, a row of players who stand ten yards away from where a free kick is taken in order to make scoring directly from the free kick more difficult

examples.ch: 鲁尼的任意球旋转绕过纽卡斯尔队球员组成的人墙，从远门柱处飞进球门。
examples.en: Rooney curved the free kick past the Newcastle defensive wall and inside the far post.

defines.trans_en: a large, powerful, usually fast moving mass of something

examples.ch: 大雨过后，那些房子被墙一般的泥流／水流冲走了。
examples.en: After the rains, the houses were washed away by a wall of mud/water.

defines.trans_en: a way of feeling or behaving that completely prevents two groups of people from communicating with or understanding each other

examples.ch: 这两个团体互不信任，中间像隔着一道墙。
examples.en: There is a wall of mistrust between the two groups.

defines.trans_en: a small folding case for carrying paper money, credit cards and other flat objects, that can be carried in a pocket and is used especially by men

examples.ch: 他掏出一个塞满钞票的鼓鼓囊囊的大钱包。
examples.en: He pulled out a big, fat wallet stuffed with bank notes.

defines.trans_en: a small container for carrying coins, paper money, and credit cards, used especially by women
a flat, folding bag that is used for holding documents, for example passports

defines.trans_ch: 想要，希望（英国英语中礼貌的请求不用 want）
defines.trans_en: to wish for a particular thing or plan of action. "Want" is not used in polite requests

examples.ch: 我想要些巧克力。
examples.en: I want some chocolate.

examples.ch: 她想跟你见面。
examples.en: She wants a meeting with you.

examples.ch: 他具备你理想中男人的所有特质——聪明、风趣而又有魅力。
examples.en: He's everything you'd ever want in a man - bright, funny and attractive.

examples.ch: 你想吃什么？
examples.en: What do you want to eat?

examples.ch: 你要我送你去机场吗？
examples.en: Do you want me to take you to the airport?

examples.ch: 这个包裹——你想今天寄出吗？
examples.en: This package - do you want it sent today?

examples.ch: 这块馅饼你想要热一下吗？
examples.en: Do you want this pie hot?

examples.ch: 我可不希望你凌晨两点来，吵得我睡不着觉。
examples.en: I don't want you coming in at two a.m., waking me up.

examples.ch: 你等着瞧——明年她就会想要一栋更大的房子了！
examples.en: You wait - by next year she'll be wanting a bigger house!

defines.trans_en: to wish or need someone to be present

examples.ch: 明天的会议要我参加吗？
examples.en: Am I wanted at the meeting tomorrow?

examples.ch: 警方正在通缉他。
examples.en: He is wanted by the police (= they are searching for him).

defines.trans_en: to need something

examples.ch: 你觉得这汤里要不要加点盐？
examples.en: Do you think this soup wants a bit of salt?

examples.ch: 葡萄酒在冰箱里——只需要冰镇几分钟。
examples.en: The wine is in the fridge - it just wants cooling for a couple of minutes.

phrases.trans_en: to want to start or stop being involved in something

examples.ch: 我想在还来得及的时候退出整个经营项目。
examples.en: I want out of the whole venture before it's too late.

phrases.trans_en: used in giving advice to mean that someone should do something

examples.ch: 趁还来得及，她应该现在就告诉他。
examples.en: She wants to tell him now, before it's too late.

examples.ch: 你不应该放太多胡椒。
examples.en: You don't want to put too much pepper in.

defines.trans_en: a lack of something

examples.ch: 由于没有什么更好的事情可做，我就看了一会儿电视。
examples.en: For want of anything better to do I watched television for a while.

examples.ch: 即使我们失败了，我们也曾努过力。
examples.en: If we fail it won't be for want of trying (= we have tried even if we fail).

phrases.trans_en: needing

examples.ch: 他显得很疲惫，胡子也需要刮了。
examples.en: He appeared tired and in want of a shave.

phrases.trans_en: needs

examples.ch: 我们所需要的很少。
examples.en: Our wants are few.

defines.trans_en: having or producing a comfortably high temperature, although not hot

examples.ch: 你暖不暖和，要不要我开暖气？
examples.en: Are you warm enough or do you want me to put the heating on?

examples.ch: 我把手放在衣兜里保暖。
examples.en: I put my hands in my pockets to keep them warm.

defines.trans_en: Warm clothes and covers are made of a material that keeps you warm.

examples.ch: 我连一件暖和的冬衣都没有。
examples.en: I don't have a warm winter coat.

examples.ch: 那些手套看起来又漂亮又暖和。
examples.en: Those gloves look nice and warm.

defines.trans_en: A warm colour is one that is based on or contains a colour such as red, yellow, or orange that suggests warmth.

defines.trans_ch: 亲切友好的;热心的，热情的
defines.trans_en: friendly and loving

examples.ch: 他们一家人非常热情。
examples.en: They're a very warm family.

examples.ch: 他的笑容亲切而迷人。
examples.en: He has a lovely warm smile.

examples.ch: 我谨对今晚的来宾表示热烈的欢迎。
examples.en: I'd like to give a warm welcome to our guests this evening.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指在儿童游戏中）即将猜中的，快要发现的
defines.trans_en: (especially in children's games) almost guessing a correct answer or discovering a hidden object

examples.ch: 你马上要猜中了！
examples.en: You're getting warmer!

phrases.trans_en: a warm place

examples.ch: 站在外边挺冷的——进来暖和暖和吧。
examples.en: It's cold standing out there - come into the warm.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) become warm (= less cold)

examples.ch: 你太冷了——来，到火边暖暖手。
examples.en: You're so cold - come and warm your hands by the fire.

examples.ch: 你的晚餐正在炉子上热着呢。
examples.en: Your supper's just warming through in the oven.

examples.ch: 用这台电炉我们能让房间很快暖和起来。
examples.en: We can warm (up) the room pretty quickly with this electric heater.

defines.trans_en: to clean something using water

examples.ch: 洗你的头／手
examples.en: wash your hair/hands

examples.ch: 洗车／洗衣服／擦洗地板
examples.en: wash the car/clothes/floor

examples.ch: 这些床单需要洗洗。
examples.en: These sheets need washing.

examples.ch: 我要把瓶子洗干净再用。
examples.en: I'll wash the bottle out (= clean its inside) and use it again.

defines.trans_ch: （用水和肥皂）洗（身体的某部分）；洗澡
defines.trans_en: to clean yourself, or a part of yourself, with water and usually soap

examples.ch: 吃饭前我要洗洗手。
examples.en: I'd like to wash before dinner.

defines.trans_en: If water washes somewhere, it flows there, usually repeatedly.

examples.ch: 她站在岸边，任水漫过她疲惫的双脚。
examples.en: She stood on the shore and let the water wash over her tired feet.

phrases.trans_en: If a particular material or piece of clothing washes well, it is not damaged or spoiled by repeated washing.
(of the sea) to carry something or someone to or away from a place

examples.ch: 一夜之间海水将大量垃圾冲上了岸。
examples.en: Overnight the waves had washed up a lot of rubbish.

examples.ch: 400多头死亡的海豚被冲上了岸。
examples.en: More than 400 dead dolphins had been washed ashore.

examples.ch: 风暴中一名西班牙船员从船上被冲到海里。
examples.en: A Spanish crew member had been washed overboard (= carried off a ship into the sea by the force of the water) in the storm.

defines.trans_en: the action of washing something or a part of your body

examples.ch: 那些窗帘需要好好洗一洗了。
examples.en: Those curtains need a good (= careful) wash.

examples.ch: 埃里克在花园里玩过之后需要好好洗个澡。
examples.en: Erik needed a good wash after playing in the garden.

defines.trans_en: a thin layer of water or paint mixed with water, especially one that is brushed lightly over a painting to make the lines softer

examples.ch: 一层蓝漆
examples.en: a blue wash/ a wash of blue

examples.ch: 油漆即将干透时，我又在上面涂上薄薄的一层。
examples.en: Just before the paint dries, I give it a light wash.

defines.trans_en: an event or situation in which positive and negative things balance each other

examples.ch: 假如这里要施行控制污染的措施，那些工厂就会搬到允许污染的地方。因此就空气的清洁而言，这一举措说不上好或坏。
examples.en: If pollution controls are enforced here, the factories will move to where they're allowed to pollute, so it'll be a wash as far as clear air goes.

defines.trans_en: (the sound made) when the sea moves against land, etc.

examples.ch: 在公寓房间外面，她可以听到海浪冲刷沙滩发出的轻柔声响。
examples.en: Outside the house, she could hear the gentle wash of the waves on the beach.

phrases.trans_ch: （尤指用洗衣机一起洗的）所有衣物
phrases.trans_en: all the clothes, sheets, etc. that are washed together, especially in a washing machine

examples.ch: 我能把这件衬衫同白色的衣服一起洗吗？
examples.en: Can I put this shirt in (with) the white wash?

examples.ch: “我的粉红衬衫呢？”“正在洗着呢（或在要洗的衣服堆里）。”
examples.en: "Where's my pink shirt?" "It's in the wash" (= being washed or in a pile of clothes that is going to be washed).

phrases.trans_en:
→ 
washing

phrases.trans_ch: 洗一洗（身体某部分）；洗澡
phrases.trans_en: to wash your body or a part of it

examples.ch: 吃饭前我要洗洗手。
examples.en: I need to have a wash before dinner

phrases.trans_en: to clean clothes, sheets, etc., usually in a washing machine

examples.ch: 你今天晚上要洗衣服吗？
examples.en: Are you doing a wash tonight?

defines.trans_en: to look at something for a period of time, especially something that is changing or moving

examples.ch: 我吃了饭，然后看了几个小时电视。
examples.en: I had dinner and watched TV for a couple of hours.

examples.ch: 他整个下午都在看一场板球比赛。
examples.en: He spent the entire afternoon watching a cricket match.

examples.ch: 我看着他坐上一辆出租车。
examples.en: I watched him get into a cab.

examples.ch: 我有种被人监视的感觉。
examples.en: I got the feeling I was being watched.

examples.ch: 我坐在窗边，看着人来人往。
examples.en: I sit by the window and watch people walking past.

examples.ch: 看看他是多么巧妙地带球越过守门员而入网的。
examples.en: Just watch how he slides that ball in past the goalkeeper.

examples.ch: 邦纳无助地看着他们开着车扬长而去，没有带上他。
examples.en: Bonner watched helplessly as they drove away without him.

examples.ch: 她会假装没看见我们的——你看着吧。
examples.en: She'll pretend that she hasn't seen us - you watch.

defines.trans_en: to stay with someone or something, such as a child, for a short time to make certain that he, she, or it is safe

examples.ch: 如果你想在出门时让我帮忙照看孩子们几个小时，跟我说一声就行了。
examples.en: If you want me to watch the kids for a couple of hours while you go out, just let me know.

examples.ch: 我去一趟卫生间，你帮我看一下这些包好吗？
examples.en: Could you watch my bags for me, while I go to the toilet?

defines.trans_en: to be careful of something

examples.ch: 我必须注意自己的体重，因为我现在不怎么运动。
examples.en: I have to watch my weight (= be careful not to become too heavy) now I'm not exercising so much.

examples.ch: 请注意言语得体，年轻人！
examples.en: Watch your language (= do not use rude words), young man!

examples.ch: 注意别把胶水粘到你的手指上。
examples.en: Watch (that) you don't get glue on your fingers.

examples.ch: 用那把刀时小心点，吉姆，它很锋利的。
examples.en: Watch what you're doing with that knife, Jim, it's sharp.

examples.ch: 你得盯着他——他有点奇怪。
examples.en: You need to watch him - he's a strange character.

defines.trans_en: a small clock that is worn on a strap around the wrist or, sometimes, connected to a piece of clothing by a chain

examples.ch: 我的手表好像停了。
examples.en: My watch seems to have stopped (= stopped working).

examples.ch: 他紧张地瞥了一眼手表。
examples.en: He glanced nervously at his watch.

defines.trans_en: the activity of watching or giving attention to something or someone, especially to make certain nothing bad happens

examples.ch: 警方严密监视着一个帮派成员。
examples.en: The police keep a close watch on gang members.

examples.ch: 夜里除了一个人站岗之外，其他的士兵都睡觉了。
examples.en: The soldiers slept at night, except for one who stayed awake on watch/to keep watch.

defines.trans_ch: 警卫；哨兵警卫队；治安队
defines.trans_en: a person or group of soldiers or guards whose duty is to protect a person, place, or thing from danger or attack

defines.trans_ch: 警戒时间；（警卫或治安队等的）值班时间
defines.trans_en: a particular period of time during which a person or a group of soldiers or guards has the duty of protecting and warning of danger

examples.ch: 值夜班
examples.en: the night watch

defines.trans_en: a clear liquid, without colour or taste, that falls from the sky as rain and is necessary for animal and plant life

examples.ch: 一瓶／份／杯水
examples.en: a bottle/drink/glass of water

examples.ch: 瓶装／矿泉／自来水
examples.en: bottled/mineral/tap water

examples.ch: 热／冷水
examples.en: hot/cold water

examples.ch: 请在我的威士忌里加一点水，好吗？
examples.en: Can I have a drop of water in my whisky, please?

examples.ch: 这水洗澡够不够热？
examples.en: Is there enough hot water for a bath?

examples.ch: 人体约50%是水。
examples.en: The human body is about 50 percent water.

defines.trans_en: an area of water, such as the sea, a lake, or a swimming pool

examples.ch: 水挺暖和的——你来游泳吗？
examples.en: The water's warm - are you coming in?

examples.ch: 我不喜欢把头浸在水里。
examples.en: I don't like getting my head under (= in) water.

examples.ch: 爸爸，我潜泳游完了游泳池的一个全程！
examples.en: Dad, I swam a whole length of the pool under water (= with the whole head and body below the surface of the water)!

defines.trans_en: the level of an area of water

examples.ch: 涨水的时候这条河很难过去。
examples.en: The river is difficult to cross during periods of high water.

phrases.trans_en: the area of sea near to and belonging to a particular country

examples.ch: 圣卢西亚岛的收入靠的是其清洁的近海水域。
examples.en: St Lucia depends on its clean coastal waters for its income.

phrases.trans_ch: （某一湖泊、河流或海洋的）水域
phrases.trans_en: the water contained in a particular lake, river, or part of the sea

examples.ch: 在墨西哥湾的浅海水域，石油钻塔吸引了大量的鱼群。
examples.en: In the shallow waters of the Gulf of Mexico, oil rigs attract fish.

phrases.trans_en: the liquid that surrounds a baby inside a pregnant woman's womb

examples.ch: 凌晨3点，她的羊水破了，婴儿也很快就出生了。
examples.en: At 3 a.m. her waters broke, and the baby was born soon after.

phrases.trans_en: water from a spring, especially when used in the past for drinking or swimming in, in order to improve the health

examples.ch: 人们过去常来这座城市享用这里的泉水。
examples.en: People used to come to this city to take (= drink or swim in) the waters.

defines.trans_en: to pour water on to plants or the soil that they are growing in

examples.ch: 我已经请邻居在我不在的时候帮忙给那些植物浇水。
examples.en: I've asked my neighbour to water the plants while I'm away.

defines.trans_en: to give an animal water to drink

examples.ch: 已经给马喂过饲料饮过水了。
examples.en: The horses had been fed and watered.

defines.trans_en: If your mouth waters, it produces a lot of saliva, usually because you can see or smell some food that you would like to eat.

examples.ch: 那种面包的香味让我直流口水！
examples.en: The smell of that bread is making my mouth water!

defines.trans_en: When your eyes water, they produce tears but not because you are unhappy.

examples.ch: 切洋葱时你是如何让眼睛不流泪的呢？
examples.en: How do you stop your eyes from watering when you're cutting up onions?

defines.trans_en: used to form adjectives

examples.ch: 淡水鱼
examples.en: freshwater fish

examples.ch: 咸水泻湖
examples.en: a saltwater lagoon

defines.trans_en: a route, direction, or path

examples.ch: 你知道去餐馆怎么走吗？
examples.en: Do you know the way to the restaurant?

examples.ch: 我只在马德里住了几个星期，所以还不太认识周围的路。
examples.en: I've only been living in Madrid for a couple of weeks so I don't really know my way around it yet.

examples.ch: 我们得在去机场的路上停下来加油。
examples.en: We'll have to stop for petrol on the way to the airport.

examples.ch: 你自己能找对路走出这栋楼吗？
examples.en: Can you find your own way out of the building?

examples.ch: 他用胳膊肘／手推搡出一条路，挤到了人群前面。
examples.en: He elbowed/pushed his way (= hit/pushed people so that he could go past them) to the front of the crowd.

examples.ch: 长途汽车停下来让我们吃午饭，不过不到半小时，我们又上路了。
examples.en: The bus stopped for us to eat lunch but within half an hour we were on our way/under way (= travelling) again.

examples.ch: 这里没有路通过去——你们得绕行。
examples.en: There's no way through here - you'll have to go round.

examples.ch: 他们途径芝加哥从拉斯维加斯飞到多伦多。
examples.en: They flew from Los Angeles to Toronto by way of Chicago.

examples.ch: 很多人在森林里迷了路。
examples.en: Many people have lost their way (= become lost) in the forest.

examples.ch: 只有本地人才能在迷宫般的狭窄街道中找到路。
examples.en: Only local people could find their way through the maze of narrow streets.

defines.trans_en: used to talk about the direction in which something is facing

examples.ch: “这个房间朝哪个方向？”“朝北。”
examples.en: "Which way does the room face?" "North."

examples.ch: 这个箱子应该哪一面朝上？
examples.en: Which way up should this box be? (= Which side should be on top?)

examples.ch: 那个数字颠倒了——应该是71，不是17。
examples.en: The numbers are the wrong way round - it should be 71, not 17.

defines.trans_en: a distance or a period of time

examples.ch: 昨天我们走了很长的一段路。
examples.en: We walked a long way yesterday.

examples.ch: 假期似乎还很遥远。
examples.en: The holiday seems like it's a long way off.

examples.ch: 我们设法从第12名一直上升到第一名。
examples.en: We managed to pull ourselves all the way from 12th place to first place.

examples.ch: 他们还要走一段路。
examples.en: They still have a ways to go.

defines.trans_en: a particular choice, opinion, belief, or action, especially from among several possibilities

examples.ch: 我喜欢你的发型。
examples.en: I like the way you've done your hair.

examples.ch: 从某些／好多方面来说，我们周一见面要比周三见面好一些。
examples.en: In some/many ways it would be better if we met on Monday rather than Wednesday.

examples.ch: 从某一方面来说，我不太愿意他们来，因为那将意味着要额外操劳。
examples.en: In a way (= partly), I would rather they didn't come because it will mean extra work.

examples.ch: 他可能要被迫辞职或被降职，但不管怎么说，他的事业实际上已经结束了。
examples.en: He might have to resign or he might be demoted, but either way, his career is effectively over.

examples.ch: 他们不像以前那样写歌了。
examples.en: They don't write songs the way (= as) they used to.

defines.trans_ch: （思维）风格；（行事）作风；（某事发生的）方式
defines.trans_en: the manner in which someone behaves or thinks, or in which something happens

examples.ch: 别害怕——他就那样。
examples.en: Don't worry - it's just his way.

examples.ch: 他恶狠狠地看着我。
examples.en: He looked at me in a sinister way.

examples.ch: 她能保持如此镇定真让人惊讶。
examples.en: It's amazing the way she manages to stay so calm.

examples.ch: 看他大喊大叫的样子，还以为他受了重伤。
examples.en: The way he was shouting, you'd have thought he was badly hurt.

examples.ch: 依我看，他们不该修这么多路。
examples.en: To my way of thinking, they shouldn't be building so many roads.

examples.ch: 我工作时总是这样——要么无事可做，要么忙得停不住脚！
examples.en: It's always the way at work - either I have nothing to do or I'm rushed off my feet!

defines.trans_en: an action that can produce the result you want; a method

examples.ch: 解决这个问题有多种方法。
examples.en: There are many ways of solving the problem.

examples.ch: 这样做不对——让我给你示范一下。
examples.en: That's not the way to do it - let me show you.

examples.ch: 那个方法没用，所以让我们试试您的方法。
examples.en: That method hasn't worked, so let's try your way.

defines.trans_en: the space needed for a particular movement or action

examples.ch: 对不起，我挡了您的路吗？我马上让开。
examples.en: "Sorry, am I in your way? I'll move."

examples.ch: 我看不到舞台，因为有一根柱子挡在我和舞台之间。
examples.en: I couldn't see the stage because there was a pillar in the way (= between me and the stage).

examples.ch: 通过清除那些不穿的为新衣服清理出一些空间来。
examples.en: Make way for some new clothes by clearing out ones you never wear.

examples.ch: 你需要给那辆车让开道。
examples.en: You need to get out of the way of that car.

examples.ch: 她下决心要取得成功，她不会让任何事情妨碍她。
examples.en: She's determined to succeed and she won't let anything get/stand in her way (= prevent her).

defines.trans_en: If someone gets or has their way, what they want happens.

examples.ch: 如果一切不是都按她的意愿来，她就会像个四岁小孩一样生气。
examples.en: If she doesn't get/have her (own) way, she sulks like a four-year-old.

defines.trans_en: the bad condition or state of someone or something, especially the state of a person's health

examples.ch: 自从那次手术以来，他一直病得很重。
examples.en: He's been in a bad way (= very ill) ever since the operation.

phrases.trans_en: to travel or move to a place

examples.ch: 我们慢慢地沿河而下。
examples.en: We slowly made our way down the river.

examples.ch: 天晚了——我们应该动身回家了。
examples.en: It's getting late - we should make our way home soon.

phrases.trans_ch: 相反地，倒过来，以相反方式
phrases.trans_en: happening in the opposite way

examples.ch: 我以为那位老人会比年轻人更加生气，结果情况恰恰相反。
examples.en: I thought the older people would be more offended than the young people, but it was the other way round.

phrases.trans_ch: 相反地，倒过来，以相反方式
phrases.trans_en: happening in the opposite way

examples.ch: 我以为那位老人会比年轻人更加生气，结果情况恰恰相反。
examples.en: I thought the older people would be more offended than the young people, but it was the other way around.

phrases.trans_en: used in the names of some roads

examples.ch: 我们的办事处在国王路17号。
examples.en: Our offices are at 17 King's Way.

phrases.trans_en: types of behaviour

examples.ch: 多年来，我们已经习惯了他那些滑稽的举动了。
examples.en: Over the years we've got used to his funny little ways.

defines.trans_ch: 过度，大幅（尤其用于强调时间或空间中的程度或距离）
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize degree or separation, especially in space or time

examples.ch: 跑过第三圈后，她已远远落后其他运动员。
examples.en: After the third lap, she was way behind the other runners.

examples.ch: 她花太多的钱买衣服。
examples.en: She spends way too much money on clothes.

defines.trans_en: in the direction of

examples.ch: 我认为他们住在伯明翰那一带。
examples.en: I think they live Birmingham way.

defines.trans_en: used as the subject of a verb to refer to a group including the speaker and at least one other person

examples.ch: 我们今天下午能都去游泳吗？
examples.en: Can we all go to the swimming pool this afternoon?

examples.ch: 你不抓紧的话我们就要迟到了。
examples.en: If you don't hurry up we'll be late.

defines.trans_ch: （讲话者或作者用来指代自己与听众或读者）我们
defines.trans_en: used by a speaker or a writer to refer to themselves and the people listening or reading

examples.ch: 在今天的讲座上，我们要探讨世界经济形势。
examples.en: In today's lecture, we will be exploring the world economic situation.

defines.trans_ch: （用作动词的主语）所有人;（尤指作为一个整体的）我们
defines.trans_en: used as the subject of a verb to refer to all people, especially when considered as a group

examples.ch: 我们生活的这个星球应该受到珍爱，而不该被掠夺。
examples.en: This planet on which we all live should be cherished and not exploited.

defines.trans_ch: （用作动词的主语，用于对孩子或病人说话时）你，你们
defines.trans_en: used as the subject of a verb to mean "you", especially when talking to a child or someone who is ill

examples.ch: 你不想上学迟到，对不对？
examples.en: We don't want to be late for school, do we?

examples.ch: “你今天上午感觉怎么样，弗拉纳根太太?”医生说道。
examples.en: "How are we this morning, Mrs Flanagan?" said the doctor.

defines.trans_ch: （女王或国王在正式场合使用）朕，寡人
defines.trans_en: used by a queen or king when speaking officially to mean "I"
to have clothing, jewellery, etc. on your body

examples.ch: 特蕾西身着一袭素净的黑色长裙。
examples.en: Tracey is wearing a simple black dress.

examples.ch: 卡罗琳的婚礼上你准备穿什么？
examples.en: What are you wearing to Caroline's wedding?

examples.ch: 有的音乐家不喜欢在演奏时戴戒指。
examples.en: Some musicians don't like to wear rings when they're playing.

examples.ch: 他阅读时戴眼镜。
examples.en: He wears glasses for reading.

examples.ch: 她基本上不化妆。
examples.en: She wears very little make-up.

defines.trans_en: to show a particular emotion on your face

examples.ch: 这位政治家在整个采访过程中都面带自信的微笑。
examples.en: The politician wore a confident smile throughout the interview.

defines.trans_en: to arrange your hair in a particular way

examples.ch: 工作时，她把头发梳成一个马尾辫。
examples.en: When she's working she wears her hair in a ponytail.

examples.ch: 你应当更多地把头发梳起来——那很适合你。
examples.en: You should wear your hair up (= so that it does not hang down) more often - it suits you.

defines.trans_en: to become weaker, damaged, or thinner because of continuous use

examples.ch: 我非常喜欢这件衬衫，但是它的领子已经有些磨破了。
examples.en: I really like this shirt but it's starting to wear at the collar.

examples.ch: 轮子的轴承多年来已经磨损，这就是产生噪声的原因。
examples.en: The wheel bearings have worn over the years, which is what's causing the noise.

defines.trans_en: to produce something such as a hole or loss of material by continuous use, rubbing, or movement

examples.ch: 我似乎老是会把毛线衫的左肘处磨出洞来。
examples.en: I always seem to wear a hole in the left elbow of my sweaters.

examples.ch: 多年之后，流水在岩石上冲刷出一道道深深的凹槽。
examples.en: Over many years, flowing water wore deep grooves into the rock.

examples.ch: 风和水慢慢地磨平了这座山的棱角。
examples.en: Wind and water slowly wore down the mountain's jagged edges.

defines.trans_en: to allow or accept something

examples.ch: 我想向老板请一段时间的假，但我觉得她可能不会批准。
examples.en: I'd ask my boss for some time off but I don't think she'd wear it.

defines.trans_ch: （有某种特定用途或某一类型的）衣服
defines.trans_en: clothes suitable for a particular use or clothes of a particular type

examples.ch: 便装
examples.en: casual wear

examples.ch: 休闲服
examples.en: leisure wear

examples.ch: 针织品
examples.en: knitwear

defines.trans_en: the amount or type of use an object has had or can be expected to have, especially before showing damage

examples.ch: 这双靴子我穿了很久——都有5年了。
examples.en: I've had a lot of wear out of these boots - I've had them for five years.

examples.ch: 那件衬衫我只穿了几次就开始显得有些破旧了。
examples.en: I've only worn the shirt a couple of times and it's already showing signs of wear (= damage).

defines.trans_en: the conditions in the air above the earth such as wind, rain, or temperature, especially at a particular time over a particular area

examples.ch: 坏／好／冷的／干燥的／炎热的／暴风雨／温暖的／潮湿的天气（等等）
examples.en: bad/good/cold/dry/hot/stormy/warm/wet/etc. weather

examples.ch: 山里的天气瞬息万变，所以要带上合适的衣服。
examples.en: The weather in the mountains can change very quickly, so take appropriate clothing.

examples.ch: 如果天气好的话，我们打算去野餐。
examples.en: We're going to have a picnic, weather permitting (= if the weather is good enough).

defines.trans_en: to deal successfully with a difficult situation or a problem

examples.ch: 作为一家新成立的小公司，他们成功地度过了经济衰退期。
examples.en: As a small new company they did well to weather the recession.

defines.trans_ch: （使）因风吹日晒而褪色，（使）受到风雨侵蚀，（使）风化
defines.trans_en: to change in colour or form over a period of time because of the effects of sun, wind, or other weather conditions

examples.ch: 冰的作用和温度的变化使得岩石受到了侵蚀。
examples.en: Rock is weathered by the action of ice and changes in temperature.

examples.ch: 外墙上的油漆风吹日晒褪色得很厉害。
examples.en: The paint on the outside walls has weathered badly (= has changed and been damaged by the weather).

defines.trans_en: a set of pages of information on the internet about a particular subject, published by a single person or organization

examples.ch: 欲知剑桥大学出版社其他图书及课程详情，请访问我们的网站 www.cambridge.org。
examples.en: For more information about other Cambridge publications and courses, visit our website at www.cambridge.org.

defines.trans_en: a marriage ceremony and any celebrations such as a meal or a party that follow it

examples.ch: 婚礼蛋糕／礼服／请柬／礼物／招待会
examples.en: a wedding cake/dress/invitation/present/reception

examples.ch: 你知道卡罗琳和马修的婚礼哪天举行吗？
examples.en: Do you know the date of Caroline and Matthew's wedding?

examples.ch: 上周是他们结婚25周年纪念。
examples.en: It was their 25th wedding anniversary last week.

defines.trans_ch: 星期，周（尤指从星期一到星期日或从星期日到星期六）
defines.trans_en: a period of seven days, especially either from Monday to Sunday or from Sunday to Saturday

examples.ch: 上／本／下周
examples.en: last/this/next week

examples.ch: 我们大约一周去看一次电影。
examples.en: We go to the cinema about once a week.

examples.ch: 你下周去上课吗？
examples.en: Will you be going to next week's class?

examples.ch: 处理这些表格通常需要4周左右的时间。
examples.en: It usually takes about four weeks to get the forms processed.

examples.ch: 一两周之内不要干任何重活儿。
examples.en: Don't do anything strenuous for a week or two.

examples.ch: 清理洪水造成的破坏要好几周时间。
examples.en: It'll be weeks (= several weeks) before the flood damage is cleaned up.

defines.trans_ch: 工作周（星期一到星期五）
defines.trans_en: the five days from Monday to Friday, the usual working period for many people

examples.ch: 工作日期间我们通常很累，没有精力去参加太多的社交活动。
examples.en: We're usually too tired to go out much during the week.

defines.trans_en: one week after the day mentioned

examples.ch: 这出戏的首演将在从今天／明天算起的一周后举行。
examples.en: The first performance of the play is a week (from) today/tomorrow.

examples.ch: 我们的假期将从下周六开始。
examples.en: Our holiday starts a week on Saturday.

examples.ch: 她得在下周五去复诊。
examples.en: She has to go back to see the doctor Friday week.

defines.trans_en: one week before the day mentioned

examples.ch: 上星期五是他的生日。
examples.en: It was his birthday a week ago last Friday.

examples.ch: 从上星期一开始电视就出问题了。
examples.en: The problems with the TV started a week last Monday.

defines.trans_ch: 每周的工作小时数；每周的工作天数
defines.trans_en: the amount of hours spent working during a week or the number of days on which a person works

examples.ch: 很多农场的工人每周工作6天。
examples.en: A lot of farm workers work a six-day week.

phrases.trans_en: each week during a period of time

examples.ch: 每一周我们都能看到他的健康状况在恶化。
examples.en: We could see his health deteriorate week by week.

phrases.trans_ch: 一周又一周地;一连数周
phrases.trans_en: regularly or continuously for many weeks

examples.ch: 我一连几个星期每星期都去做三次有氧健身操。
examples.en: I go to aerobics three times a week, week in, week out.

defines.trans_en: any day of the week except Sunday and Saturday

examples.ch: 工作日期间我通常10点前上床睡觉。
examples.en: On weekdays I'm usually in bed by ten o'clock.

defines.trans_ch: 周末（周六和周日，有时也包括周五晚上）
defines.trans_en: Saturday and Sunday, or Friday evening until Sunday night; the part of the week in which many people living in the West do not go to work

examples.ch: 本／下周末我们要去拜访一些朋友。
examples.en: This/Next weekend we're going to see some friends.

examples.ch: 我周末有很多作业要做。
examples.en: I have a lot of homework to do over the weekend.

examples.ch: 他周末跟哥哥一起去钓鱼了。
examples.en: He spent the weekend fishing with his brother.

examples.ch: 你周末有什么安排吗？
examples.en: Do you have anything planned for the weekend?

defines.trans_en: a trip or a visit at a weekend

examples.ch: 两个人去纽约度周末要花多少钱？
examples.en: How much would a weekend for two in New York cost?

examples.ch: 他们在乡下有一栋周末度假小屋。
examples.en: They own a weekend retreat in the country.

phrases.trans_en: on Saturday or Sunday, or on both Saturday and Sunday

examples.ch: 你周末做什么了？
examples.en: What did you do at the weekend?

examples.ch: 下班后和周末时，我们偶尔会出去玩。
examples.en: We go out once in a while after work and at the weekend.

phrases.trans_en: usually or often between Friday evening and Sunday night, or on Saturdays and Sundays

examples.ch: 他们周末通常去玩帆板冲浪。
examples.en: They go windsurfing at weekends.

defines.trans_en: happening once a week or every week

examples.ch: 周刊杂志／每周报告
examples.en: a weekly magazine/report

examples.ch: 每周两次的会议
examples.en: a twice-weekly meeting

examples.ch: 每周都要对火警系统进行检测。
examples.en: The fire alarm has a weekly test/is tested weekly.

defines.trans_en: a newspaper or magazine that is published once every week

defines.trans_ch: 乐于接受;欢迎;鼓励;支持
defines.trans_en: to be pleased about and encourage or support something

examples.ch: 这一新的任命受到了广泛的欢迎。
examples.en: The new appointment has been widely welcomed.

defines.trans_en: to meet and speak to someone in a friendly way when they arrive

examples.ch: 来访人士受到系主任的热烈欢迎。
examples.en: The visitors were warmly welcomed by the head of the department.

examples.ch: 布朗宁站在门口，面带灿烂的笑容迎接新来的人，还会拍拍他们的胳膊。
examples.en: Browning stood at the door, welcoming newcomers with a large smile and a pat on the arm.

examples.ch: 请鼓掌欢迎我们尊贵的客人乔治‧泰勒。
examples.en: Please welcome (= please clap for) our guest of honour, George Taylor.

defines.trans_en: If someone is welcome, you are pleased when they visit you.

examples.ch: 要是进城就过来看看我们——什么时候来都欢迎。
examples.en: Come and see us whenever you're in town - you're always welcome/you'll always be welcome.

examples.ch: 他们的传统是把旅行者作为客人来欢迎。
examples.en: Their tradition is that the traveller is a welcome guest.

defines.trans_en: If something is welcome, you are pleased to have or do it.

examples.ch: 这个假期是一次令人愉快的改变／休息／放松。
examples.en: The holiday was a welcome change/break/relief.

examples.ch: 她为他提供了那次不错的机会，可以做些不同的事。
examples.en: She offered him the welcome chance/opportunity to do something different.

examples.ch: 能喝一杯好茶就再好不过了。
examples.en: A nice cup of tea would be very welcome.

phrases.trans_en: to show someone that you are pleased that they are with you

examples.ch: 那家餐馆让孩子们感觉自己很受欢迎。
examples.en: The restaurant makes children very welcome.

phrases.trans_en: used to tell someone that they can certainly do something

examples.ch: 任何感兴趣的人都请尽管来。
examples.en: Anyone who is interested is welcome to come along.

defines.trans_en: the way in which someone is met and spoken to when they arrive in a place

examples.ch: 他们受到了热烈欢迎。
examples.en: They were given a warm (= very friendly) welcome.

examples.ch: 反对党领导人在经历了7年的流亡生涯后，归来时受到了英雄般的欢迎。
examples.en: The leader of the political protests returned to a hero's/heroine's welcome after seven years in exile.

examples.ch: 她在欢迎词中提到了他上一次的来访。
examples.en: She referred to his previous visit in her speech of welcome/welcome speech.

defines.trans_en: a reaction to a decision or suggestion

examples.ch: 他们的支持者有所保留地／谨慎地接受了这个决定。
examples.en: Their supporters gave the decision a guarded/cautious welcome.

phrases.trans_ch: 呆得太久而不再受欢迎
phrases.trans_en: to stay too long

examples.ch: 我两天之后就离开了——我可不想呆得太久讨人嫌。
examples.en: I left after two days - I didn't want to outstay my welcome.

defines.trans_en: said as a greeting to someone arriving at a place

examples.ch: 欢迎——请进。
examples.en: Welcome - please come in.

examples.ch: 欢迎回家／回来——我们很想念你！
examples.en: Welcome home/back - we've missed you!

examples.ch: 欢迎到剑桥来。
examples.en: Welcome to Cambridge.

defines.trans_en: in a good way, to a high or satisfactory standard

examples.ch: 这部纪录片很好地展示了问题的两个方面。
examples.en: The documentary presented both sides of the problem very well.

examples.ch: 这场音乐会的宣传搞得很不错，但是票房却不好。
examples.en: The concert was advertised well enough but ticket sales were poor.

examples.ch: 剪裁合身的西服
examples.en: a well-cut suit

examples.ch: 薪酬优厚的工作
examples.en: a well-paid job

examples.ch: 她的观点表达得很巧妙。
examples.en: Her points were well put (= expressed in a good or intelligent way).

examples.ch: 他关于有必要减少浪费的观点得到了认同。
examples.en: His point about the need to reduce waste was well taken (= it was accepted as a good criticism).

examples.ch: 他们花了两个小时讨论这些计划，并且认为时间花得很值。
examples.en: They took two hours to discuss the plans and considered it time well spent (= it had been a useful discussion).

examples.ch: 我无法做得像玛丽那样好。
examples.en: I can't do it as well as Marie can.

defines.trans_en: very much, to a great degree, or completely

examples.ch: 充分揉捏面团，然后将它分成4块。
examples.en: Knead the dough well, then divide it into four pieces.

examples.ch: 他完全能想象出他要为自己的诺言付出多大的代价。
examples.en: He could well imagine how much his promise was going to cost him.

examples.ch: 我没法坐公共汽车——午夜过后就没有公共汽车了，你很清楚这一点。
examples.en: I can't catch the bus - there are no buses after midnight, as you well know.

examples.ch: 他钢琴弹得非常好。
examples.en: He plays the piano well enough (= to a satisfactory standard).

defines.trans_en: used to emphasize some prepositions

examples.ch: 结果比我们预想的要好／差得多。
examples.en: The results are well above/below what we expected.

examples.ch: 离悬崖边远远的。
examples.en: Keep well away from the edge of the cliff.

examples.ch: 它的价格远远高于100英镑。
examples.en: It cost well over £100.

examples.ch: 离门远点！
examples.en: Stand well clear of the doors!

defines.trans_en: used to emphasize some adjectives

examples.ch: 警方非常清楚形势。
examples.en: The police are well aware of the situation.

examples.ch: 那家博物馆很值得参观。
examples.en: The museum is well worth a visit.

examples.ch: 有些机器看着更像那种廉价的塑料玩具——千万别去碰它们。
examples.en: Some machines look more like cheap, plastic toys - leave these well alone.

defines.trans_en: very

examples.ch: 那部电影非常不错。
examples.en: The film was well good.

examples.ch: 小心那两个人——他们都不好惹。
examples.en: Watch out for those two - they're well hard (= strong and willing to use violence).

defines.trans_en: with good reason

examples.ch: 问她可能最合适。
examples.en: She might well be the best person to ask.

examples.ch: 我没有理由拒绝他们慷慨的提议。
examples.en: I can't very well (= it would not be acceptable to) refuse their generous offer.

phrases.trans_en: in addition (to)

examples.ch: 邀请埃米莉——还有斯科特。
examples.en: Invite Emily - and Scott as well.

examples.ch: 我想去拜访安德鲁，还有马丁。
examples.en: I want to visit Andrew as well as Martin.

defines.trans_en: healthy; not ill

examples.ch: 他最近身体不太好。
examples.en: He hasn't been very well lately.

examples.ch: 她从学校回到家里时气色看起来真不好。
examples.en: When she came home from school she really didn't look well.

examples.ch: 你生病了我很难过——希望你尽快好起来。
examples.en: I'm sorry you're ill - I hope you get well soon.

examples.ch: 他们寄了一张祝愿早日康复的慰问卡。
examples.en: They sent a get well card.

defines.trans_ch: （用于引出要说的话题，常用来表示惊讶、怀疑、不太同意或生气，也用来继续讲故事）啊，哎呀，哟，那么，好吧
defines.trans_en: used to introduce something you are going to say, often to show surprise, doubt, slight disagreement, or anger, or to continue a story

examples.ch: 那么，我们现在该做什么？
examples.en: Well, what shall we do now?

examples.ch: 那么，现在我们该怎样安排呢？
examples.en: Well now/then, how are we going to arrange things?

examples.ch: “那人是谁呀啊？”“嗯，我记不起她的名字了。”
examples.en: "Who was that?" "Well, I can't remember her name."

examples.ch: “他已经决定放弃自己的工作同她一起搬到西雅图去了。”“嗯，嗯——这就是爱情的力量。”
examples.en: "He's decided to give up his job and move to Seattle with her." "Well, well - that's what love does for you."

examples.ch: 唉，说真的，他真是太轻率了！
examples.en: Well, really, that was thoughtless of him!

examples.ch: 嗯？你接下来做了什么？
examples.en: Well? What did you do next?

examples.ch: 唔，那之后我们就去山里露营了。
examples.en: Well, after that we went camping in the mountains.

examples.ch: 哦，没关系——我可以再买一个。
examples.en: Well/Oh well, it doesn't matter - I can always buy another one.
