phrases.trans_ch: 前后弄反的（地），颠倒的（地）
phrases.trans_en: If something is the wrong way around, the part that should be at the front is at the back.

examples.ch: 你把裙子穿反了。
examples.en: You've got your skirt on the wrong way round.

defines.trans_en: in a way that is not correct

examples.ch: 你把我的名字拼写错了。
examples.en: You've spelled my name wrong.

phrases.trans_en: to make a mistake in the way you answer or understand something

examples.ch: 我花了好几个小时解那道计算题，但还是做错了。
examples.en: I spent hours doing that problem and I still got the answer wrong.

examples.ch: 你完全理解错了——让她生气的是你们老板，而不是你！
examples.en: You've got it all wrong - it was your boss that she was annoyed with and not you!

phrases.trans_en: If a situation or event goes wrong, it becomes unpleasant and is not a success.

examples.ch: 我们在有了第一个孩子之后婚姻开始出现问题。
examples.en: Our marriage began to go wrong after we had our first child.

phrases.trans_en: to make a mistake

examples.ch: 这些架子很容易组装——你不会弄错的。
examples.en: These shelves are very easy to put together - you can't go wrong.

examples.ch: 我以为自己这样做是对的，我就是不明白错在哪里。
examples.en: I thought I'd done this correctly - I just can't understand where I went wrong.

phrases.trans_en: If a machine goes wrong, it stops working correctly.

examples.ch: 我们的电视一直有毛病。
examples.en: Our TV keeps going wrong.

defines.trans_en: what is considered to be morally unacceptable

examples.ch: 他没有什么是非感。
examples.en: He has no sense of right and wrong.

examples.ch: 我从小就受教育要讲真话、明辨是非。
examples.en: I was brought up to tell the truth and know right from wrong.

examples.ch: 在她父母眼中，她是完美无瑕的。
examples.en: As far as her parents are concerned, she can do no wrong (= she is perfect in every way).

defines.trans_en: an unfair action

examples.ch: 他大大冤枉了我们。
examples.en: He has done us a great wrong.

examples.ch: 她试图纠正过去的冤屈。
examples.en: She was trying to right (= do something to make better) the wrongs of the past.

phrases.trans_en: If someone is in the wrong, they have made a mistake or done something that is bad or illegal.

examples.ch: 毫无疑问是那个司机不对。
examples.en: The driver was unquestionably in the wrong.

defines.trans_en: to treat someone in an unfair or unacceptable way

examples.ch: 他的指控使她觉得深受冤枉。
examples.en: She felt deeply wronged by his accusations.

defines.trans_ch: 年，年份;（尤指1月1日至12月31日间的）一年时间
defines.trans_en: a period of twelve months, especially from 1 January to 31 December

examples.ch: 安妮特在意大利工作了两年。
examples.en: Annette worked in Italy for two years.

examples.ch: 2005年是我生命中最糟糕的年份之一。
examples.en: 2005 was one of the worst years of my life.

examples.ch: 我们去年去埃及度假了。
examples.en: We went to Egypt on holiday last year.

examples.ch: 一年之中的这个时候，海滩几乎空寂无人。
examples.en: At this time of year the beaches are almost deserted.

examples.ch: 这一品种常年不落叶。
examples.en: This species keeps its leaves all year (round) (= through the year).

defines.trans_ch: （与某一活动有关的）一年，年度
defines.trans_en: a period of twelve months relating to a particular activity

examples.ch: 财政／纳税年度从4月份开始。
examples.en: The financial/tax year begins in April.

defines.trans_en: the part of the year, in a school or university, during which courses are taught

examples.ch: 学年
examples.en: the academic/school year

examples.ch: 她眼下在曼彻斯特大学读毕业班／一年级／二年级。
examples.en: She's now in her final/first/second year at Manchester University.

examples.ch: 我女儿现在读大学一年级／二年级／三年级／四年级。
examples.en: My daughter is in her freshman/sophomore/junior/senior year.

defines.trans_en: a group of students who start school, college, university, or a course together

examples.ch: 上大学时凯西比我高一届。
examples.en: Kathy was in the year above me at college.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a student in a particular year group at a school, college, or university

examples.ch: 我喜欢教一年级的学生，而二年级的学生可能比较难应付。
examples.en: I like teaching the first-years, but the second-years can be difficult.

examples.ch: 一年级的学生
examples.en: a first-year student

defines.trans_en: a colour like that of a lemon or gold or the sun

examples.ch: 正值初秋时节，树叶开始转黄。
examples.en: It was early autumn and the leaves were turning yellow.

examples.ch: 你应该多穿些黄色的衣服——很适合你。
examples.en: You should wear more yellow - it suits you.

defines.trans_en: of a colour like that of a lemon or gold or the sun

examples.ch: 亮黄色的花／T恤衫
examples.en: a bright yellow flower/T-shirt

defines.trans_en: belonging to a race that has pale yellowish-brown skin
easily frightened and not brave
to become yellow, or to make something become yellow

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示接受、愿意或赞同）好的，是的
defines.trans_en: used to express willingness or agreement

examples.ch: “你想要来杯葡萄酒吗？”“好的，谢谢。”
examples.en: "Would you like a glass of wine?" "Yes, thanks."

examples.ch: “你喜欢泰国菜吗？”“是的，我喜欢。”
examples.en: "Do you like Thai food?" "Yes, I love it."

examples.ch: “他是个很不错的人。”“是的，没错。”
examples.en: "He's a really nice guy." "Yes, he is."

examples.ch: “明天早晨９点向我汇报。”“好的，先生。”
examples.en: "Report to me at nine o'clock tomorrow morning." "Yes, sir."

examples.ch: “你吃饱了吗？”“是的，谢谢。”
examples.en: "Have you had enough to eat?" "Yes, thank you."

examples.ch: 如果你同意这项要求，会省去很多麻烦。
examples.en: If you'd say yes (= agree) to the request you'd avoid a lot of trouble.

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示正在听某人说话，或准备听并作出回答或提供信息）
defines.trans_en: used to show that you are listening to someone, or that you are ready to listen and to give them an answer or information

examples.ch: “爸爸。”“怎么了，你想要什么，宝贝儿？”
examples.en: "Dad." "Yes, what do you want, honey?"

examples.ch: 来了，能帮您什么忙吗？
examples.en: Yes, can I help you?

defines.trans_en: used when you are disagreeing with a negative statement

examples.ch: “不过我不是一个很好的厨师。”“不，你是，你做的东西非常好吃！”
examples.en: "I'm not a very good cook, though." "Yes, you are - you make wonderful food!"

phrases.trans_en: used for emphasis

examples.ch: 我们访问了所有50个州，是的，所有50个。
examples.en: We visited all 50 states, yes sir, all 50.

defines.trans_en: a vote supporting a particular plan of action or a reply accepting an invitation

examples.ch: “你收到答复了吗？”“到目前为止，6人赞成，2人反对。”
examples.en: "Have you had any replies yet?" "Six yeses and two noes so far."

defines.trans_en: on the day before today

examples.ch: 昨天你外出时他打电话来了。
examples.en: He called yesterday while you were out.

examples.ch: 我昨天下午见到她了。
examples.en: I saw her yesterday afternoon.

defines.trans_en: the day before today

examples.ch: “那是今天的报纸吗？”“不，是昨天的。”
examples.en: "Is that today's paper?" "No, it's yesterday's."

defines.trans_en: the recent past

examples.ch: 没人对过气明星感兴趣。
examples.en: Nobody's interested in yesterday's pop stars.

examples.ch: 这些歌曲是我们所有往事的一部分。
examples.en: These songs are a part of all our yesterdays.

phrases.trans_en: two days ago

examples.ch: 我前天给她打了电话。
examples.en: I called her the day before yesterday.

defines.trans_en: still; until the present time

examples.ch: 我还没和她谈过。
examples.en: I haven't spoken to her yet.

examples.ch: 他还没完成。
examples.en: He hasn't finished yet.

examples.ch: “你准备好了吗？”“还没呢──稍等。”
examples.en: "Are you ready?" "Not yet - wait a minute."

defines.trans_ch: 从现在起至将来某个时间，还
defines.trans_en: from now and for a particular period of time in the future

examples.ch: 她很长一段时间都不会回来的。
examples.en: She won't be back for a long time yet.

examples.ch: 我们的假期还远着呢。
examples.en: Our holiday isn't for weeks yet.

defines.trans_en: even at this stage or time

examples.ch: 我们仍然有可能成功——谁也说不好。
examples.en: We could yet succeed - you never know.

examples.ch: 你也许还会证明我是错的。
examples.en: You might yet prove me wrong.

examples.ch: 他仍有可能胜出。
examples.en: He may win yet.

defines.trans_ch: 再，还（用于强调 another 或 again 之类的词，尤指数量增加或某事发生频繁）
defines.trans_en: used to add emphasis to words such as another and again, especially to show an increase in amount or the number of times something happens

examples.ch: 雷切尔已经有那么多鞋，居然又买了一双。
examples.en: Rachel bought yet another pair of shoes to add to her collection.

examples.ch: 我很抱歉又来麻烦你。
examples.en: I'm sorry to bother you yet again.

examples.ch: 他又给我们布置了很多工作。
examples.en: He's given us yet more work to do.

phrases.trans_ch: 迄今最好的／最差的（等等）
phrases.trans_en: the best, worst, etc. until now

examples.ch: 在我今晚听到的所有歌中，那首是最好的。
examples.en: Of all the songs I've heard tonight, that's the best yet.

phrases.trans_en: until and including this time

examples.ch: 到目前为止，我们尚不需要增加员工，但将来也许会需要。
examples.en: We haven't needed extra staff as yet, but we may in the future.

examples.ch: 到目前为止还没有救护车顺利过河。
examples.en: No ambulances had as yet managed to get across the river.

phrases.trans_en: If you have yet to do something, you have not done it.

examples.ch: 他们还没有作出决定。
examples.en: They have yet to make a decision.

defines.trans_en: (and) despite that; used to add something that seems surprising because of what you have just said

examples.ch: 简单而又高效
examples.en: simple yet effective

examples.ch: 他肥胖且秃头，然而不知为何却很有魅力。
examples.en: He's overweight and bald, (and) yet somehow, he's attractive.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to the person or people being spoken or written to

examples.ch: 你看起来不错。
examples.en: You look nice.

examples.ch: 我爱你。
examples.en: I love you.

examples.ch: 你说过我可以和你一起去。
examples.en: You said I could go with you.

examples.ch: 你今晚会过来，对吗?
examples.en: You're coming tonight, aren't you?

examples.ch: 你俩准备好了吗？
examples.en: Are you two ready?

examples.ch: 那个是你自己画的？太棒了！
examples.en: You painted that yourself? That's great!

defines.trans_en: people in general

examples.ch: 年纪大些之后，你开始学会接受这些事情。
examples.en: You learn to accept these things as you get older.

examples.ch: 在这个国家，17岁以下人士不能获得驾驶执照。
examples.en: You can't get a driving licence till you're 17 in this country.

examples.ch: 饮酒过量对身体有害。
examples.en: Too much alcohol is bad for you.

examples.ch: 怎样才能让这东西启动？
examples.en: How do you get this thing to start?

defines.trans_en: having lived or existed for only a short time and not old

examples.ch: 年轻人／幼儿
examples.en: young adults/children

examples.ch: 他的女朋友非常年轻。
examples.en: His girlfriend's very young.

examples.ch: 森林中的这一片树木还没长大。
examples.en: The trees in this part of the forest are still fairly young.

examples.ch: 菲莉帕是家里最小的。
examples.en: Philippa is the youngest person in the family.

examples.ch: 安杰拉比克莱尔小两岁。
examples.en: Angela is two years younger than Clare.

defines.trans_en: suitable for young people

examples.ch: 年轻人的时尚／观念
examples.en: young fashion/ideas

examples.ch: 说实话——你觉不觉得这件衣服对我来说有点／太年轻了？
examples.en: Be honest now - do you think this dress is a bit/too young for me (= is more suitable for someone younger)?

phrases.trans_en: to look younger than you really are

defines.trans_en: the babies of an animal

examples.ch: 其间，母鸟会飞回巢中给雏鸟喂食。
examples.en: Meanwhile, the mother flies back to the nest to feed her young.

phrases.trans_en: young people considered together as a group

examples.ch: 我并不反对穿超短裙，但我认为它们只适合年轻人。
examples.en: I have nothing against miniskirts, but I think they're strictly for the young.

defines.trans_en: belonging or relating to the person or group of people being spoken or written to

examples.ch: 这是你的包吗？
examples.en: Is this your bag?

examples.ch: 这不是你的错。
examples.en: It's not your fault.

examples.ch: 你母亲快把我逼疯了。
examples.en: Your mother is driving me crazy.

examples.ch: 你怎么了？
examples.en: What's your problem?

defines.trans_en: belonging or relating to people generally

examples.ch: 当然人人都希望给自己的孩子们最好的。
examples.en: Of course you want the best for your children.

examples.ch: 大蒜对血液有益。
examples.en: Garlic is good for your blood.

defines.trans_ch: （用在典型事例前）（你们）常说的
defines.trans_en: said before a typical example of something is given

examples.ch: 这并非我们常说的科幻小说，而布尔克沃思也不完全是我们说的那种典型作家。
examples.en: This isn't your usual science fiction novel, but then Brinkworth isn't exactly your typical author.

defines.trans_en: the one(s) belonging to or connected with the person or group of people being spoken or written to

examples.ch: 这支钢笔是你的吗？
examples.en: Is this pen yours?

examples.ch: 可惜我的腿不如你的长。
examples.en: Unfortunately my legs aren't as long as yours.

examples.ch: 我有一些你的东西。
examples.en: I've got something of yours (= that belongs to you).

examples.ch: 你的房间在顶层，左手边。
examples.en: Yours is the room on the top floor, on the left.

defines.trans_en: used at the beginning of some phrases written at the end of a letter, before giving a name

examples.ch: 你的，杰克
examples.en: Yours, Jack

examples.ch: 你忠实的／真诚的，K.马克斯韦尔。
examples.en: Yours faithfully/sincerely, K. Maxwell.

defines.trans_en: used to show that something belongs to or is connected with people generally

examples.ch: 别人的孩子总是看起来比自己的更乖。
examples.en: Other people's children always seem to be better behaved than yours.

defines.trans_en: used when the subject of the verb is "you" or the person being spoken to, and the object is the same person

examples.ch: 用那把刀要当心，否则你会弄伤自己的！
examples.en: Be careful with that knife or you'll cut yourself!

examples.ch: 凯蒂，控制下自己！
examples.en: Katie, control yourself!

defines.trans_ch: 你本人，你亲自，您本人，您亲自（用于强调句子主语）
defines.trans_en: used for emphasis when the subject is "you"

examples.ch: 那件衣服是你自己做的吗？
examples.en: Did you make the dress yourself?

examples.ch: 你可以自己做那件事。
examples.en: You can do that yourself.

defines.trans_en: used when both the subject and object of the verb are "you" and "you" is also being used to refer to people generally

examples.ch: 你自己对自己说一切都好，但你知道事实并非如此。
examples.en: You tell yourself everything's all right but you know it's not really.

phrases.trans_en: to behave in your usual manner, rather than behaving in a way you think other people might like

examples.ch: 你最明智的选择就是进去面试时自自然然地表现自己。
examples.en: The best thing you can do is to go into the interview and just be yourself.

phrases.trans_en: alone or without help from anyone else

examples.ch: 你居然能一个人搬动那些箱子，真让我吃惊。
examples.en: I'm amazed you managed to move those boxes all by yourself.

examples.ch: 你喜欢有时候一个人独处，还是你会觉得孤单？
examples.en: Do you like being by yourself sometimes or do you get lonely?

phrases.trans_en: for your use only

examples.ch: 那么，本周末整个房子就是你一个人的天下了？
examples.en: So you have the whole house to yourself this weekend?

phrases.trans_en: not to be, seem, or feel as happy or healthy as usual

examples.ch: 你要是不太舒服的话，为什么不早些回家呢？
examples.en: Why don't you go home early if you're not feeling yourself?

phrases.trans_ch: （用于询问某人身体抱恙时的自我感觉）
phrases.trans_en: used when asking someone about their state of mind when they are physically ill

examples.ch: 我知道你肯定还是不舒服，不过你自己感觉怎么样？
examples.en: I know you must still be uncomfortable, but how are you in yourself?

defines.trans_en: (the number) 0; nothing

examples.en: Five, four, three, two, one, zero.

examples.ch: 数字100万要写一个1和六个0。
examples.en: The number one million is written with a one and six zeros.

examples.ch: 大雨已使能见度降到了最低。
examples.en: Heavy rain has reduced visibility almost to zero (= its lowest point).

defines.trans_en: on a set of numbers for comparing temperature in degrees Celsius, the level of temperature at which water freezes

examples.ch: 今晚气温预计会降至零下10度。
examples.en: The temperature is expected to drop to ten degrees below zero tonight.

defines.trans_en: not any or no

examples.ch: 零增长／通货膨胀
examples.en: zero growth/inflation

examples.ch: 他说他得到这份工作的可能性为零。
examples.en: He said that his chances of getting the job were zero (= he had no chance).

defines.trans_en: an area in which animals, especially wild animals, are kept so that people can go and look at them or study them
a place where there are a lot of people and their behaviour is not well organized or controlled

examples.ch: 学校的餐厅简直一片混乱。
examples.en: The school cafeteria is a zoo.
